translation: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to begin all actions with the remembrance of God, who is the source of all mercy and grace. It signifies humility, seeking guidance, and acknowledging one's dependence on the Divine before undertaking any task or endeavor.
orig: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms the praise and gratitude that is due to Allah, who is the Sustainer and Cherisher of all the worlds and everything that exists in the universe. It emphasizes Allah's sovereignty, power, and worthiness of worship as the sole Creator and Nurturer of all creation.
orig: الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: The Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate
interpretation: These are two of the most beautiful names and attributes of Allah. They highlight His infinite mercy and compassion towards all of His creation. "The Most Merciful" refers to Allah's general mercy that extends to all beings, while "The Most Compassionate" refers to His special and enduring mercy towards the believers.
orig: الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Master of the Day of Recompense
interpretation: This verse means that Allah alone is the Sovereign Master on the Day of Judgment when all people will be judged for their deeds and held accountable. It signifies Allah's absolute authority and control over the final reckoning of humanity.
orig: مالك يوم الدين

translation: You alone we worship and You alone we ask for help
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core principles of Islamic faith: worshipping Allah alone and seeking help only from Him. It teaches Muslims to devote all acts of worship solely to Allah and to rely on Him for assistance in all affairs, rejecting any form of polytheism or seeking help from false deities.
orig: إياك نعبد وإياك نستعين

translation: Guide us to the straight path
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for guidance towards the path of righteousness, truth, and salvation. It acknowledges our need for divine guidance to stay on the right course in life and avoid deviating into misguidance or wrongdoing. The "straight path" represents the way of living according to Allah's commands and seeking His pleasure.
orig: اهدنا الصراط المستقيم

translation: The path of those upon whom You have bestowed favor, not of those who have evoked [Your] anger or of those who are astray.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is guiding the believers to follow the straight path, which is the path of those whom Allah has blessed with His favors, such as the Prophets, the truthful, the martyrs, and the righteous. This path is distinct from the path of those who have earned Allah's anger, like the disbelievers, and those who have gone astray, like the hypocrites and misguided people. It is a prayer to Allah to guide the believers to the path of truth and righteousness.
orig: صراط الذين أنعمت عليهم غير المغضوب عليهم ولا الضالين

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
interpretation: These are some of the unique, abbreviated letters (Al-Muqatta'aat) found at the beginning of certain chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meanings are known only to Allah. However, scholars have offered interpretations suggesting they may serve as an introduction to draw attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an, or as an oath emphasizing the truthfulness of the revelations that follow.
orig: الم

translation: That is the Book about which there is no doubt, a guidance for those conscious of Allah.
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine origin and authority of the Qur'an, stating that it is a book free from any doubt or falsehood. It serves as a guide for those who have taqwa (consciousness of Allah), leading them to the straight path and providing them with wisdom and guidance in all aspects of life.
orig: ذلك الكتاب لا ريب فيه هدى للمتقين

translation: Those who believe in the unseen, establish prayer, and spend out of what We have provided for them
interpretation: This verse describes the characteristics of the believers (al-mu'minun). They have faith in the unseen realities, such as Allah, the angels, the revealed books, and the Day of Judgment ("believe in the unseen"). They are steadfast in performing the obligatory prayers ("establish prayer"). And they spend from the provisions Allah has granted them in charitable ways ("spend out of what We have provided for them"). This verse highlights three essential qualities of true believers: faith, worship, and charity.
orig: الذين يؤمنون بالغيب ويقيمون الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And those who believe in what has been revealed to you [Muhammad] and what was revealed before you, and they are certain of the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse refers to the true believers who have faith in the Qur'an revealed to Prophet Muhammad, as well as the previous scriptures revealed to earlier Prophets. They also firmly believe in the existence of the Hereafter or the life after death, where they will be held accountable for their deeds and receive the ultimate reward or punishment.
orig: والذين يؤمنون بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك وبالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: Those are upon guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who follow the guidance from their Lord, Allah, are the ones who have attained true success and felicity in this life and the Hereafter. They are rightly guided and will be rewarded for their faith and righteous deeds.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who have rejected faith and disbelieved in God and His revelations will not benefit from being warned or advised, as their hearts are sealed against guidance. Their stubborn rejection of the truth renders them unable to accept faith, regardless of the efforts made to guide them. Their disbelief has become entrenched, and no amount of warning or exhortation will change their stance. The interpretation emphasizes the futility of trying to convince those whose minds are closed to the message of truth.
orig: إن الذين كفروا سواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Allah has set a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil. And for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has sealed the hearts, hearing, and vision of those who persistently reject faith and truth. Their spiritual faculties are impaired, leaving them unable to comprehend or accept guidance. As a consequence of their willful rejection, they will face a severe punishment.
orig: ختم الله على قلوبهم وعلى سمعهم وعلى أبصارهم غشاوة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: And among the people are those who say, 'We believe in Allah and the Last Day,' but they are not believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly profess belief in Allah and the Day of Resurrection, but their faith is merely lip service and not a sincere conviction. Their words do not match their actions, and their supposed "belief" is merely a facade to blend in with the Muslim community. True faith requires sincere belief accompanied by righteous deeds, which these hypocrites lack.
orig: ومن الناس من يقول آمنا بالله وباليوم الآخر وما هم بمؤمنين

translation: They seek to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they deceive none but themselves, though they perceive it not.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith but inwardly harbor disbelief and deception. They think they can fool Allah and the believers, but in reality, they are only deceiving themselves. Their deception is futile, as Allah knows what is in their hearts, and they are only harming themselves by adopting this hypocritical stance. The verse warns against such insincerity and self-deception, emphasizing the importance of having true faith and sincerity in one's beliefs and actions.
orig: يخادعون الله والذين آمنوا وما يخدعون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: In their hearts is a disease, and Allah has increased them in disease; and for them is a painful punishment because they used to lie.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly professed faith but inwardly harbored doubts and disbelief. Their hearts were diseased with hypocrisy and denial of the truth. As a result of their persistent rejection of faith, Allah increased their spiritual sickness and misguidance. They will face a painful punishment in the Hereafter for their lies and false claims of belief.
orig: في قلوبهم مرض فزادهم الله مرضا ولهم عذاب أليم بما كانوا يكذبون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Do not cause corruption on the earth,' they say, 'We are but reformers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites and wrongdoers who claim to be righteous and working for the betterment of society, when in reality their actions spread mischief and corruption on earth. They delude themselves into thinking that their misguided ways are justified and that they are "reformers," while in truth, they are the opposite of what they claim to be.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم لا تفسدوا في الأرض قالوا إنما نحن مصلحون

translation: Unquestionably, it is they who are the corrupters, but they are not aware.
interpretation: This verse highlights the irony of those who spread corruption and mischief on earth, yet they fail to recognize their own destructive behavior. It implies that their actions are driven by ignorance or a lack of self-awareness, causing them to remain oblivious to the harm they inflict upon themselves and others. The verse serves as a reminder to reflect on one's deeds and strive for righteousness, lest one becomes a source of corruption without even realizing it.
orig: ألا إنهم هم المفسدون ولكن لا يشعرون

translation: And when it is said to them, "Believe as the people have believed," they say, "Should we believe as the foolish have believed?" Unquestionably, it is they who are the foolish, but they do not know.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the arrogant attitude of those who refuse to believe despite clear evidence. They mock the believers, considering them foolish, while in reality it is they who lack understanding and wisdom. Their arrogance and closed-mindedness prevent them from recognizing the truth, even when it is presented to them clearly. The verse highlights the irony of their situation, where they consider themselves wise but are actually the foolish ones.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا كما آمن الناس قالوا أنؤمن كما آمن السفهاء ألا إنهم هم السفهاء ولكن لا يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say, "We believe"; but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, "Indeed, we are with you; we were only mockers."
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith when in the company of believers, but inwardly reject it and mock it when alone with their disbelieving associates. It highlights their duplicitous nature and lack of sincerity in their claimed belief, as they are merely mocking and ridiculing the believers behind their backs.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلوا إلى شياطينهم قالوا إنا معكم إنما نحن مستهزئون

translation: Allah mocks at them and prolongs them in their transgression, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah allows the disbelievers to persist in their arrogance and sinful ways, while they remain heedless and oblivious to the truth. Their continued defiance and rejection of faith is a form of mockery from Allah, as He gives them respite to indulge in their transgressions, yet they remain spiritually blind and lost in misguidance.
orig: الله يستهزئ بهم ويمدهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: Those are the ones who have bought error in exchange for guidance, so their transaction has brought no profit, nor were they guided.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have chosen misguidance over the true guidance revealed by Allah. They have exchanged the truth for falsehood, and this "trade" has brought them no benefit or profit in the Hereafter. Instead of being rightly guided, they have gone astray due to their choice of disbelief over faith.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الضلالة بالهدى فما ربحت تجارتهم وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: Their example is like one who kindled a fire, and when it illuminated what was around him, Allah took away their light and left them in darkness, unable to see.
interpretation: This verse compares the disbelievers to someone who lights a fire to gain light and warmth. However, as soon as the fire illuminates the surroundings, Allah takes away the light, leaving them in utter darkness, unable to perceive anything. This metaphor signifies that the disbelievers initially received guidance from Allah, but when they rejected it, Allah took away that light of guidance, leaving them in spiritual blindness and ignorance.
orig: مثلهم كمثل الذي استوقد نارا فلما أضاءت ما حوله ذهب الله بنورهم وتركهم في ظلمات لا يبصرون

translation: Deaf, dumb, and blind - so they will not return [to the right path].
interpretation: This verse describes the spiritual state of those who reject faith and guidance. They are metaphorically deaf, unable to hear the truth; dumb, unable to speak the truth; and blind, unable to see the truth. As a result, they will not return to the right path or embrace faith.
orig: صم بكم عمي فهم لا يرجعون

translation: Or [they are] like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps in dread of death. But Allah is encompassing of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse uses a vivid metaphor to describe the state of the disbelievers when faced with the truth of Islam. They are likened to people caught in a terrifying rainstorm with darkness, thunder, and lightning. Just as people instinctively cover their ears to protect themselves from the deafening thunderclaps out of fear of death, the disbelievers reject the message of Islam and turn away from it due to their arrogance and stubbornness. However, Allah encompasses and has full knowledge of the disbelievers, and they cannot escape His plan and justice.
orig: أو كصيب من السماء فيه ظلمات ورعد وبرق يجعلون أصابعهم في آذانهم من الصواعق حذر الموت والله محيط بالكافرين

translation: The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it flashes for them, they walk therein, and when darkness covers them, they stand still. And if Allah willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the disbelievers who are confused and unable to find the right path. The lightning symbolizes the brief moments of guidance that come to them, but they are unable to benefit from it due to their arrogance and stubbornness. When the light of guidance comes, they try to walk in it, but when it disappears, they stand still, unable to move forward. The verse emphasizes that Allah has complete power over their senses and could have taken them away if He willed, leaving them in complete darkness and confusion. It serves as a warning to those who reject faith and guidance.
orig: يكاد البرق يخطف أبصارهم كلما أضاء لهم مشوا فيه وإذا أظلم عليهم قاموا ولو شاء الله لذهب بسمعهم وأبصارهم إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O mankind! Worship your Lord, who created you and those before you, so that you may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse commands all people to worship and obey Allah alone, who created them and all the previous generations. The purpose of worshipping Allah is to attain righteousness and piety, which means having consciousness of Allah, following His commands, and avoiding His prohibitions.
orig: يا أيها الناس اعبدوا ربكم الذي خلقكم والذين من قبلكم لعلكم تتقون

translation: It is He who has made the earth a resting place for you and the sky a canopy, and has sent down water from the sky and thereby brought forth fruits for your sustenance. So do not set up rivals to Allah, while you know [there is nothing similar to Him].
interpretation: Allah reminds us of His favors upon us by creating the earth as a resting place, the sky as a protective ceiling, and sending down rain to produce fruits for our sustenance. He warns us against associating partners with Him in worship, since we know that He is the sole Creator and Sustainer deserving of worship.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض فراشا والسماء بناء وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرج به من الثمرات رزقا لكم فلا تجعلوا لله أندادا وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And if you are in doubt about what We have sent down upon Our Servant [Muhammad], then produce a surah the like thereof and call upon your witnesses other than Allah, if you should be truthful.
interpretation: This verse challenges the disbelievers to produce a chapter like the Qur'an if they doubt its divine origin. It emphasizes the inimitable nature of the Qur'an and that it is beyond human capability to produce something similar, even with the help of others besides Allah. This establishes the Qur'an as a miracle and proof of the truthfulness of Prophet Muhammad's message.
orig: وإن كنتم في ريب مما نزلنا على عبدنا فأتوا بسورة من مثله وادعوا شهداءكم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But if you do not - and you will never be able to - then guard yourselves against the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, prepared for the disbelievers.
interpretation: If you do not believe in Allah's Oneness and obey His commands, which you will never be able to fulfill completely, then fear the punishment of Hellfire which is fueled by men and stones, and was prepared for those who disbelieve in Allah and reject His revelations.
orig: فإن لم تفعلوا ولن تفعلوا فاتقوا النار التي وقودها الناس والحجارة أعدت للكافرين

translation: And give good tidings to those who believe and do righteous deeds that they will have gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow. Whenever they are provided with a provision of fruit therefrom, they will say, "This is what we were provided with before," and it is given to them in likeness. And they will have therein purified spouses, and they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: Cet verset promet aux croyants et à ceux qui font de bonnes œuvres qu'ils auront des jardins paradisiaques traversés par des rivières. Chaque fois qu'ils recevront des fruits de ces jardins, ils diront : "C'est ce que nous avons déjà reçu auparavant", car les fruits seront identiques à ceux qu'ils connaissaient sur Terre. Ils auront également des épouses pures et demeureront éternellement dans ce paradis.
orig: وبشر الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أن لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار كلما رزقوا منها من ثمرة رزقا قالوا هذا الذي رزقنا من قبل وأتوا به متشابها ولهم فيها أزواج مطهرة وهم فيها خالدون

translation: Indeed, Allah is not timid to present an example - that of a mosquito or what is smaller than it. And those who have believed know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say, 'What did Allah intend by this example?' He misleads many thereby and guides many thereby. And He misleads not except the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: هذه الآية تبين أن الله تعالى لا يتحرج أو يستنكف من ضرب الأمثال، حتى لو كانت بأبسط المخلوقات كالبعوضة أو أصغر منها. والمؤمنون يدركون أن هذه الأمثال حق من الله وحكمة منه. أما الكافرون فيستهزئون بها ويقولون: ما الغرض من هذه الأمثال البسيطة؟ لكن الله بهذه الأمثال يضل من يريد ويهدي من يريد، ولا يضل بها إلا الفاسقين الخارجين عن طاعته.
orig: إن الله لا يستحيي أن يضرب مثلا ما بعوضة فما فوقها فأما الذين آمنوا فيعلمون أنه الحق من ربهم وأما الذين كفروا فيقولون ماذا أراد الله بهذا مثلا يضل به كثيرا ويهدي به كثيرا وما يضل به إلا الفاسقين

translation: Those who break the covenant of Allah after its ratification, and sever what Allah has commanded to be joined, and spread corruption on earth - it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who violate the covenants and commandments of Allah after affirming them. They sever the ties that Allah has ordained to be maintained, such as family relations and treaties. Moreover, they spread mischief and corruption on earth through their sinful actions. These individuals are ultimately the losers, as they have forsaken the path of righteousness and will face severe consequences in the Hereafter.
orig: الذين ينقضون عهد الله من بعد ميثاقه ويقطعون ما أمر الله به أن يوصل ويفسدون في الأرض أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: How can you disbelieve in Allah? You were dead and He gave you life. Then He will cause you to die, then He will bring you [back] to life, and then to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse is reminding people of the clear signs of Allah's power and existence. It questions how one can deny Allah when He is the one who brought them to life after being lifeless, and will cause them to die and then resurrect them on the Day of Judgment. The cycle of life and death points to a greater reality beyond this world, where all will ultimately return to their Creator.
orig: كيف تكفرون بالله وكنتم أمواتا فأحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: It is He who created for you all of that which is on the earth. Then He directed Himself to the heaven, [His being above all creation], and made them seven heavens, and He is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah alone is the Creator of everything in the universe, including the earth and the seven heavens. He is All-Knowing and All-Aware of His creation. This verse highlights Allah's absolute power, knowledge, and authority over all that exists.
orig: هو الذي خلق لكم ما في الأرض جميعا ثم استوى إلى السماء فسواهن سبع سماوات وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I will make upon the earth a successive authority." They said, "Will You place upon it one who causes corruption therein and sheds blood, while we exalt You with praise and sanctify You?" He said, "Indeed, I know that which you do not know."
interpretation: Allah is stating that He will appoint a vicegerent, or khalifah, on earth who will have authority over it. The angels questioned this decision, wondering if this khalifah would cause corruption and bloodshed, while they praise and glorify Allah. Allah then responded that He has knowledge that the angels do not possess, implying that there is wisdom behind His decision to appoint a khalifah that the angels cannot comprehend.
orig: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني جاعل في الأرض خليفة قالوا أتجعل فيها من يفسد فيها ويسفك الدماء ونحن نسبح بحمدك ونقدس لك قال إني أعلم ما لا تعلمون

translation: And He taught Adam the names of all things; then He placed them before the angels, and said: "Tell Me the names of these things if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse highlights the superiority of knowledge bestowed upon Adam over the angels. God taught Adam the names and realities of all things, granting him a profound understanding. When God presented these named things to the angels and challenged them to name them, they were unable to do so, demonstrating that Adam's knowledge surpassed theirs. This verse affirms the honor and elevated status God granted to Adam through the blessing of knowledge.
orig: وعلم آدم الأسماء كلها ثم عرضهم على الملائكة فقال أنبئوني بأسماء هؤلاء إن كنتم صادقين

translation: They said: "Glory be to You! We have no knowledge except what You have taught us. Verily, it is You, the All-Knower, the All-Wise."
interpretation: This verse reflects the humility and recognition of human limitations in knowledge. The angels acknowledge that they have no knowledge except what Allah has bestowed upon them, affirming that true knowledge comes from the Divine source. It highlights Allah's attributes of being All-Knowing and All-Wise, emphasizing the vastness of His knowledge and wisdom compared to human comprehension.
orig: قالوا سبحانك لا علم لنا إلا ما علمتنا إنك أنت العليم الحكيم

translation: He said: 'O Adam! Inform them of their names.' And when he had informed them of their names, He said: 'Did I not tell you that I know the unseen of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you have been hiding?'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Allah commanded Adam to inform the angels of the names of things, demonstrating Adam's knowledge and superiority over them. Allah then affirms His infinite knowledge, encompassing what is unseen as well as what is manifest, and what people reveal or conceal in their hearts.
orig: قال يا آدم أنبئهم بأسمائهم فلما أنبأهم بأسمائهم قال ألم أقل لكم إني أعلم غيب السماوات والأرض وأعلم ما تبدون وما كنتم تكتمون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate before Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event when Allah commanded the angels to prostrate before Adam as a sign of respect and obedience, and all of them obeyed except Iblees (Satan). Iblees disobeyed out of arrogance and pride, considering himself superior to Adam, and thus became one of the disbelievers by rejecting Allah's command.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى واستكبر وكان من الكافرين

translation: And We said, "O Adam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise and eat therefrom in [ease and] abundance from wherever you will but do not approach this tree, lest you be among the wrongdoers."
interpretation: This verse describes Allah's command to Adam and his wife to live in Paradise and enjoy its provisions freely, except for the forbidden tree. It teaches that obedience to Allah's commands is crucial, and disobedience leads to wrongdoing and loss of blessings.
orig: وقلنا يا آدم اسكن أنت وزوجك الجنة وكلا منها رغدا حيث شئتما ولا تقربا هذه الشجرة فتكونا من الظالمين

translation: Then Satan made them slip from the (garden), and got them out from that in which they had been. And We said: "Get you down, with enmity between yourselves. On earth will be a dwelling place for you and an enjoyment for a time."
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Adam and Eve being tempted by Satan to eat from the forbidden tree in Paradise, leading to their expulsion from it. The interpretation is that Satan deceived them and caused them to disobey Allah's command, resulting in their removal from the blissful state they were in. Allah then decreed that they, along with their progeny, would live on Earth in a state of enmity and conflict with Satan, who is their eternal enemy. However, the Earth would also provide them with provisions and enjoyment for a temporary period until the appointed time of their return to Allah.
orig: فأزلهما الشيطان عنها فأخرجهما مما كانا فيه وقلنا اهبطوا بعضكم لبعض عدو ولكم في الأرض مستقر ومتاع إلى حين

translation: Then Adam received from his Lord [some] words, and He accepted his repentance. Indeed, it is He who is the Perpetual Acceptor of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when Adam and Eve disobeyed Allah's command by eating from the forbidden tree in Paradise. After realizing their mistake, they repented sincerely to Allah. Allah then taught Adam certain words or prayers to seek forgiveness, which Adam recited. As a result, Allah accepted Adam's repentance because He is the "Oft-Returning, the Most Merciful" - meaning He always accepts sincere repentance and forgives those who turn to Him with remorse.
orig: فتلقى آدم من ربه كلمات فتاب عليه إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: We said, "Go down from it, all of you. And when guidance comes to you from Me, then whoever follows My guidance - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve."
interpretation: "This verse indicates that God commanded Adam, Eve, and Satan to descend from Paradise to the earth. However, God promises that He will send guidance, likely referring to prophets and scriptures. Those who follow this divine guidance will be free from fear and grief in the Hereafter."
orig: قلنا اهبطوا منها جميعا فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن تبع هداي فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding therein forever.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who reject faith and deny the revelations of God. It states that the ultimate consequence for such disbelievers is to become inhabitants of the Hellfire, where they will remain eternally. This is a stern warning against persisting in disbelief and highlights the grave spiritual and eternal ramifications of denying God's signs and guidance.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: O Children of Israel! Remember My favor which I bestowed upon you, and fulfill My covenant, I shall fulfill your covenant, and fear Me alone.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Children of Israel, reminding them of the favors and blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them. It commands them to fulfill their covenant with Allah, as He will fulfill His covenant with them. It also instructs them to fear and revere Allah alone, without associating any partners with Him.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأوفوا بعهدي أوف بعهدكم وإياي فارهبون

translation: And believe in what I have sent down confirming that which is with you, and be not the first to disbelieve therein, and purchase not with My verses a small price, and Me, fear Me.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to have faith in the Qur'an, which confirms the previous scriptures. It warns them against being the first to reject it and against exchanging Allah's revelations for a small, worldly gain. Instead, it instructs them to fear and obey Allah alone.
orig: وآمنوا بما أنزلت مصدقا لما معكم ولا تكونوا أول كافر به ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا وإياي فاتقون

translation: And do not mix the truth with falsehood or conceal the truth while you know [it].
interpretation: This verse commands Muslims not to confuse or mix the truth with falsehood, nor to conceal the truth knowingly. It emphasizes the importance of upholding the truth, being truthful, and avoiding any form of deception or concealment of the truth. It calls for honesty, integrity, and transparency in all matters.
orig: ولا تلبسوا الحق بالباطل وتكتموا الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and bow with those who bow [in worship].
interpretation: This verse commands believers to perform the obligatory prayers regularly, to pay the obligatory charity (zakah) from their wealth, and to join the community of believers in acts of worship and humility before Allah. It emphasizes the importance of fulfilling religious duties, both individual and communal, as a means of strengthening one's faith and connection with Allah and the Muslim community.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واركعوا مع الراكعين

translation: Do you enjoin righteousness upon people and forget yourselves while you recite the Scripture? Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrisy of those who preach righteousness to others but do not practice it themselves. It highlights the importance of being consistent between one's words and actions, and calls upon people to reflect and use their intellect to understand the contradictions in their behavior. The verse serves as a reminder to embody the teachings one preaches and to hold oneself accountable before advising others.
orig: أتأمرون الناس بالبر وتنسون أنفسكم وأنتم تتلون الكتاب أفلا تعقلون

translation: And seek help through patience and prayer, and indeed, it is difficult except for the humbly obedient [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to seek assistance and strength through patience and prayer, as these are powerful means to overcome difficulties and challenges. However, it acknowledges that maintaining patience and being consistent in prayer is indeed a great matter, except for those who are truly humble and submissive to Allah. The verse implies that those who have a deep sense of humility and fear of Allah will find it easier to persevere in patience and prayer, as they recognize their utter dependence on Allah and turn to Him sincerely.
orig: واستعينوا بالصبر والصلاة وإنها لكبيرة إلا على الخاشعين

translation: Those who are certain that they will meet their Lord, and that they will return to Him.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have firm faith in the existence of God and the Day of Resurrection. They are certain that they will stand before God on the Day of Judgment and be held accountable for their deeds. This belief instills a sense of responsibility and motivates them to lead a righteous life in preparation for their ultimate return to God.
orig: الذين يظنون أنهم ملاقو ربهم وأنهم إليه راجعون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I have bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Children of Israel, reminding them of the great favor that Allah has bestowed upon them by choosing them over all other nations and peoples of their time. It emphasizes the special status and privilege granted to them, and calls upon them to be grateful and appreciative of this divine blessing.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأني فضلتكم على العالمين

translation: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will any compensation be accepted from it, nor will any intercession benefit it, nor will they be aided.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers to have fear of the Day of Judgment, when no soul will be able to help another in any way. On that Day, no ransom or compensation will be accepted from anyone, no intercession will benefit them, and no one will be able to provide them any aid or support. It emphasizes the absolute justice and accountability of each individual before Allah on that tremendous Day.
orig: واتقوا يوما لا تجزي نفس عن نفس شيئا ولا يقبل منها شفاعة ولا يؤخذ منها عدل ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We saved you from the people of Pharaoh, who afflicted you with the worst torment - killing your sons and keeping your women alive. And in that was a great trial from your Lord.
interpretation: This verse refers to the oppression and persecution faced by the Children of Israel at the hands of Pharaoh and his people. It reminds the believers of Allah's favor upon them by delivering them from Pharaoh's tyranny, which included killing their sons and sparing their women alive in a humiliating manner. This was a severe trial from Allah, testing their faith and patience.
orig: وإذ نجيناكم من آل فرعون يسومونكم سوء العذاب يذبحون أبناءكم ويستحيون نساءكم وفي ذلكم بلاء من ربكم عظيم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We parted the sea for you and saved you and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous event of the parting of the Red Sea by Allah to save the Children of Israel from Pharaoh's army. It highlights Allah's power and mercy in protecting the believers and punishing the oppressors. The interpretation is that Allah will always aid those who put their trust in Him and deliver them from difficulties, while punishing the arrogant and unjust.
orig: وإذ فرقنا بكم البحر فأنجيناكم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وأنتم تنظرون

translation: And [recall] when We appointed for Moses thirty nights and perfected them by [the addition of] ten; so the term of his Lord was completed as forty nights. And Moses said to his brother Aaron, "Take my place among my people, do right [by them], and do not follow the way of the corrupters."
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when Prophet Moses went to Mount Sinai to receive the Torah from Allah. He was called for a period of 40 days and nights. During his absence, his people started worshipping a calf made of gold, which was a grave sin. The verse reminds the people of this incident as a lesson to remain steadfast on the path of righteousness and not deviate towards polytheism or corruption.
orig: وإذ واعدنا موسى أربعين ليلة ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: Then We pardoned you after that so that you might be grateful.
interpretation: Allah pardoned the sins and errors of the believers after their repentance, giving them another chance to obey Him and show gratitude for His mercy and forgiveness. This verse reminds us of Allah's infinite compassion and emphasizes the importance of being thankful for His blessings and forgiveness.
orig: ثم عفونا عنكم من بعد ذلك لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We gave Moses the Scripture and the Criterion that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah bestowing upon Prophet Moses the Torah (the Scripture) and the Furqan (the Criterion to distinguish between right and wrong). The purpose of this divine revelation was to guide the people to the straight path and provide them with a means to discern truth from falsehood. The mention of this event serves as a reminder of Allah's favor upon the previous nations and His continuous guidance through His messengers and revealed scriptures.
orig: وإذ آتينا موسى الكتاب والفرقان لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, indeed you have wronged yourselves by your taking of the calf [for worship]. So repent to your Creator and kill yourselves. That is best for [all of] you in the sight of your Creator." Then He accepted your repentance; indeed, He is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when the Israelites worshipped the golden calf in the absence of Moses. Moses admonished them for this grave sin and instructed them to repent sincerely by "killing" their egos and desires that led them to commit idolatry. He assured them that sincere repentance was the best course for them in the sight of God. God then accepted their repentance, as He is Most Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم إنكم ظلمتم أنفسكم باتخاذكم العجل فتوبوا إلى بارئكم فاقتلوا أنفسكم ذلكم خير لكم عند بارئكم فتاب عليكم إنه هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And [recall] when you said, 'O Moses, we will never believe you until we see Allah outright'; so the thunderbolt struck you while you were looking on.
interpretation: "This verse refers to the incident when the Children of Israel demanded from Prophet Moses to see Allah directly and outright, which is an impossible request as Allah is beyond human perception and comprehension. As a result of their disbelief and arrogance, they were struck by a thunderbolt or a blast as a punishment while they were witnessing this event."
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نؤمن لك حتى نرى الله جهرة فأخذتكم الصاعقة وأنتم تنظرون

translation: Then We revived you after your death, so that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the resurrection after death on the Day of Judgment. It implies that just as Allah has the power to bring people back to life after death in this world, He also has the ability to resurrect them on the Day of Resurrection. The purpose of this resurrection is so that people may be grateful to Allah for giving them another chance to account for their deeds and receive their ultimate reward or punishment.
orig: ثم بعثناكم من بعد موتكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We shaded you with clouds and sent down to you manna and quails, [saying], 'Eat from the good things with which We have provided you.' And they wronged Us not - but they were [only] wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of Allah's favors upon the Children of Israel during their journey in the wilderness. Allah provided them with shade from the scorching heat through clouds, and nourished them with manna and quails as sustenance. However, despite these blessings, they were ungrateful and disobedient. Their wrongdoing did not harm Allah, but rather harmed themselves by depriving themselves of further blessings and incurring Allah's displeasure.
orig: وظللنا عليكم الغمام وأنزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم وما ظلمونا ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We said, "Enter this city and eat from it wherever you will in [ease and] abundance, and enter the gate in prostration and say, 'Relieve us of the burden,' We will [then] forgive you your sins, and We will increase the doers of good [in reward]."
interpretation: This verse refers to when God commanded the Israelites to enter a certain town and enjoy its provisions freely, but to enter it humbly, prostrating and asking for forgiveness. It promises forgiveness for their sins and an increase in reward for those who do good deeds. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of obedience, humility, and seeking forgiveness from God, as well as the promise of reward for righteous conduct.
orig: وإذ قلنا ادخلوا هذه القرية فكلوا منها حيث شئتم رغدا وادخلوا الباب سجدا وقولوا حطة نغفر لكم خطاياكم وسنزيد المحسنين

translation: But those who did wrong changed the word from that which had been said to them, so We sent down upon the wrongdoers a punishment from the heaven for their defiantly disobeying.
interpretation: "This verse refers to the Jews who deliberately altered and distorted the words of Allah revealed to them in the Torah. As a consequence of their transgression and defiance, Allah punished them by sending down a severe torment or affliction upon them from the heavens."
orig: فبدل الذين ظلموا قولا غير الذي قيل لهم فأنزلنا على الذين ظلموا رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And [recall] when Moses prayed for water for his people, so We said, "Strike with your staff the rock," and there gushed forth from it twelve springs - each tribe knew its watering place. "Eat and drink from the provision of Allah, and do not act corruptly on the earth, spreading mischief."
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Moses and the Children of Israel when they were thirsty in the desert. Allah commanded Moses to strike a rock with his staff, and miraculously, twelve springs gushed forth, one for each of the twelve tribes, providing them with water to drink and sustain themselves. The verse emphasizes that this water was a provision from Allah, and the people should consume it gratefully without causing corruption or mischief on the earth.
orig: وإذ استسقى موسى لقومه فقلنا اضرب بعصاك الحجر فانفجرت منه اثنتا عشرة عينا قد علم كل أناس مشربهم كلوا واشربوا من رزق الله ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: And [recall] when you said, 'O Moses, we can never endure one [kind of] food. So call upon your Lord to bring forth for us from the earth its green herbs and its cucumbers and its garlic and its lentils and its onions.' He said, 'Would you exchange what is better for what is less? Go into [any] settlement and indeed, you will have what you have asked.' And they were covered with humiliation and poverty and returned with anger from Allah [upon them]. That was because they used to disbelieve in the signs of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That was because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of the ingratitude and lack of contentment shown by the Israelites during their journey in the wilderness after being liberated from slavery in Egypt. Despite witnessing God's miracles and provisions, they demanded a variety of foods instead of being grateful for the simple sustenance they received. Their lack of faith and obedience led to God's displeasure, resulting in humiliation, poverty, and anger upon them. The verse emphasizes the consequences of disbelief, disobedience, and transgression against God's commandments and signs.
orig: وإذ قلتم يا موسى لن نصبر على طعام واحد فادع لنا ربك يخرج لنا مما تنبت الأرض من بقلها وقثائها وفومها وعدسها وبصلها قال أتستبدلون الذي هو أدنى بالذي هو خير اهبطوا مصرا فإن لكم ما سألتم وضربت عليهم الذلة والمسكنة وباءوا بغضب من الله ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير الحق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: Indeed, those who believed and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabians - those who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteousness - will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true faith and righteous deeds are the criteria for salvation, regardless of one's religious affiliation. It affirms that those who sincerely believe in God and the Day of Judgment, and lead a righteous life, will be rewarded by God. Their reward is not based on their religious label, but on their genuine faith and good actions. This verse promotes religious tolerance and highlights the universality of divine mercy for all who follow the path of righteousness.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والنصارى والصابئين من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلهم أجرهم عند ربهم ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and remember what is in it that perhaps you may become righteous."
interpretation: "This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from the Children of Israel at Mount Sinai. He raised the mountain over them as a warning and commanded them to adhere strictly to the Torah and its teachings. The phrase 'take what We have given you with determination' emphasizes the importance of holding firmly to the divine revelations and following them with resolve. The command to 'remember what is in it' is a call to reflect deeply on the teachings and injunctions contained within the Scripture, so that they may attain righteousness and become conscious of Allah."
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واذكروا ما فيه لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then you turned away after that. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have been among the losers.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers of Allah's immense favor and mercy upon them. Despite their initial disobedience and turning away from the truth, Allah guided them back through His grace. It emphasizes that without Allah's guidance and forgiveness, they would have remained among the losers, deprived of faith and its blessings. The verse encourages gratitude and obedience to Allah for His infinite blessings.
orig: ثم توليتم من بعد ذلك فلولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته لكنتم من الخاسرين

translation: And you certainly knew about those who transgressed among you concerning the sabbath, and We said to them, 'Be apes, despised.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of Jews who lived during the time of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and violated the sanctity of the Sabbath (Saturday). As a punishment for their disobedience, God transformed them into apes or ape-like creatures, despised and disgraced. This transformation was a symbolic punishment, serving as a lesson and warning against defying God's commandments.
orig: ولقد علمتم الذين اعتدوا منكم في السبت فقلنا لهم كونوا قردة خاسئين

translation: So We made it a lesson for those before them and those after, and an admonition for the God-fearing.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah made the destruction of the people who rejected the message of the Prophet a lesson and a warning for those who came before them and those who will come after them. It serves as an admonition and reminder for those who fear Allah and strive to obey His commands.
orig: فجعلناها نكالا لما بين يديها وما خلفها وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "Indeed, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow." They said, "Do you take us in ridicule?" He said, "I seek refuge with Allah from being among the ignorant."
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where Allah commanded the Israelites through Moses to slaughter a cow. The people initially thought Moses was mocking them, but he clarified that he was simply conveying Allah's command and sought refuge from being among the ignorant who would doubt or question Allah's wisdom.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه إن الله يأمركم أن تذبحوا بقرة قالوا أتتخذنا هزوا قال أعوذ بالله أن أكون من الجاهلين

translation: They said: "Call upon your Lord for us that He may make clear to us what she is." He said: "He says, 'She is a cow neither too old nor too young, middle-aged between the two states; so do what you are commanded.'"
interpretation: "Allah commands that the cow to be slaughtered should be neither too old nor too young, but of middle age. This indicates that the cow should be in its prime, neither lacking in strength nor in excessive vigor. The verse highlights the importance of following Allah's commands precisely, without deviating from them."
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا فارض ولا بكر عوان بين ذلك فافعلوا ما تؤمرون

translation: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what is her color.' He said, 'He says, 'It is a yellow cow, bright in its color - pleasing to the observers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of following divine commands precisely and without questioning. The people were commanded to sacrifice a cow, but they kept asking unnecessary questions, leading to more specific details being revealed. The cow's color is described as a bright, pleasing yellow, suggesting that even seemingly trivial details have significance when it comes to obeying Allah's commands.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما لونها قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة صفراء فاقع لونها تسر الناظرين

translation: They said, 'Call upon your Lord to make clear to us what the cow is. Indeed, all cows look alike to us, and indeed we, if Allah wills, will be guided.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that the people were asking Moses to supplicate to Allah and seek clarification on the specific type or characteristics of the cow that they were commanded to sacrifice. They admitted that all cows appeared similar to them, and expressed their willingness to follow the right guidance from Allah if He willed.
orig: قالوا ادع لنا ربك يبين لنا ما هي إن البقر تشابه علينا وإنا إن شاء الله لمهتدون

translation: He said: 'He says, it is a cow neither too old nor too young, of middle age between those (extremes); so do what you are commanded.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Israelites who were commanded to sacrifice a cow as an atonement for a murder they committed. The interpretation is that Allah commanded them to sacrifice a specific type of cow, one that is neither too old nor too young, but of middle age. This was a test for them to follow Allah's command precisely without questioning or hesitation.
orig: قال إنه يقول إنها بقرة لا ذلول تثير الأرض ولا تسقي الحرث مسلمة لا شية فيها قالوا الآن جئت بالحق فذبحوها وما كادوا يفعلون

translation: And [recall] when you killed a soul and then disputed over it, but Allah was to expose what you were concealing.
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where a person was killed, and there was a dispute among the people regarding who was responsible for the killing. Allah exposed the truth about what they were trying to conceal or hide regarding this incident.
orig: وإذ قتلتم نفسا فادارأتم فيها والله مخرج ما كنتم تكتمون

translation: So We said, 'Strike the dead body with a part of the sacrificed cow.' Thus Allah brings the dead to life, and shows you His signs so that you may understand.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Israelites who were commanded to sacrifice a cow, and then strike the dead body with a part of it. Allah uses this incident to illustrate His power to give life to the dead and revive nations. It serves as a sign of Allah's might and an invitation to ponder over the evidence of His existence and ability to resurrect on the Day of Judgment. The interpretation highlights Allah's control over life and death, and encourages reflection on His signs to attain understanding and faith.
orig: فقلنا اضربوه ببعضها كذلك يحيي الله الموتى ويريكم آياته لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Then your hearts became hardened after that, being like stones or even harder, for indeed, there are stones from which rivers burst forth, and there are some of them that split open and water comes out, and there are some of them that fall down for fear of Allah . And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: Allah is describing the hardness of the hearts of some people, which is likened to stones or even harder. However, Allah mentions that not all stones are alike - some have rivers gushing from them, some split open allowing water to come out, and some fall down in awe and fear of Allah. This verse highlights that while some hearts are hardened, others are soft and receptive to the signs of Allah. It serves as a reminder to have a humble and God-fearing heart, and not to be among those whose hearts are hardened and heedless of Allah's signs.
orig: ثم قست قلوبكم من بعد ذلك فهي كالحجارة أو أشد قسوة وإن من الحجارة لما يتفجر منه الأنهار وإن منها لما يشقق فيخرج منه الماء وإن منها لما يهبط من خشية الله وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Do you covet [the hope, O believers], that they would believe for you while a party of them used to hear the words of Allah and then distort the Torah after they had understood it while they were knowing?
interpretation: This verse condemns the distortion of Allah's revealed scriptures by those who had knowledge of them. It criticizes the Jews who altered the Torah, even after understanding its true teachings, to suit their desires and interests. The verse implies that such people cannot be expected to believe in the Qur'an since they had already corrupted the previous scripture knowingly.
orig: أفتطمعون أن يؤمنوا لكم وقد كان فريق منهم يسمعون كلام الله ثم يحرفونه من بعد ما عقلوه وهم يعلمون

translation: And when they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe,' but when they are alone with their evil ones, they say, 'Do you talk to them about what Allah has revealed to you so that they can argue with you before your Lord?' Do you not understand?
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne l'hypocrisie de certains individus qui prétendent être croyants en public mais se moquent en privé des enseignements révélés aux véritables croyants. Ils remettent en question la sagesse de partager les révélations divines avec les croyants, craignant que cela ne soulève des arguments contre eux devant Dieu. Le verset condamne cette attitude hypocrite et appelle à la réflexion et à la compréhension de la vérité.
orig: وإذا لقوا الذين آمنوا قالوا آمنا وإذا خلا بعضهم إلى بعض قالوا أتحدثونهم بما فتح الله عليكم ليحاجوكم به عند ربكم أفلا تعقلون

translation: Do they not know that Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal?
interpretation: This verse warns those who conceal their disbelief or hypocrisy that Allah is fully aware of what they hide in their hearts and what they outwardly reveal. It emphasizes Allah's perfect knowledge of the innermost thoughts and intentions of people, reminding them that nothing can be hidden from Him.
orig: أولا يعلمون أن الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون

translation: And among them are unlettered ones who do not know the Scripture except for myths, and they do nothing but speculate.
interpretation: This verse refers to the ignorant among the People of the Book who do not have true knowledge of their scriptures. They rely on myths, fables, and baseless assumptions rather than the actual teachings. Their beliefs are based on speculation and conjecture rather than facts and guidance from God.
orig: ومنهم أميون لا يعلمون الكتاب إلا أماني وإن هم إلا يظنون

translation: So woe to those who write the scripture with their own hands, then say, 'This is from Allah,' in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who distort religious scriptures for personal gain or worldly interests. It warns against falsely attributing words to Allah to justify their own fabrications. The phrase "woe to them" expresses severe condemnation for such deceitful behavior, as it involves altering the words of Allah for a paltry worldly gain. The verse emphasizes the gravity of this sin and the deserved punishment for those who engage in such corruption of divine revelations.
orig: فويل للذين يكتبون الكتاب بأيديهم ثم يقولون هذا من عند الله ليشتروا به ثمنا قليلا فويل لهم مما كتبت أيديهم وويل لهم مما يكسبون

translation: And they say, 'The Fire will never touch us except for a few numbered days.' Say, 'Have you taken a covenant with Allah? For Allah will never break His covenant. Or are you saying about Allah that which you do not know?'
interpretation: This verse addresses the false claim made by some disbelievers that the punishment of Hell will only last for a few numbered days. The Qur'an refutes this claim by stating that they have no covenant or promise from Allah regarding the duration of their punishment. It is a grave sin to make such claims about Allah without any knowledge or evidence. The verse emphasizes that Allah never breaks His promises, and warns against attributing false statements to Him out of ignorance.
orig: وقالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودة قل أتخذتم عند الله عهدا فلن يخلف الله عهده أم تقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Yes, whoever earns evil and his sin has encompassed him - those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the grave consequences of committing evil deeds and persisting in sin. Those who earn evil through their actions and are engulfed by their sins will be among the dwellers of Hellfire, condemned to eternal punishment. It serves as a stern warning against indulging in sinful behavior and highlights the importance of repentance and seeking forgiveness from Allah.
orig: بلى من كسب سيئة وأحاطت به خطيئته فأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - they are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse promises eternal Paradise for those who have faith and perform good deeds. It highlights that true belief must be accompanied by righteous actions to attain the ultimate reward of everlasting bliss in the Gardens of Paradise.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: And [recall] when We took the covenant from the Children of Israel, [enjoining upon them], 'Do not worship except Allah; and to parents do good and to relatives, orphans, and the needy. And speak to people good [words] and establish prayer and give zakah.' Then you turned away, except a few of you, and you were refusing.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Children of Israel of the covenant they made with Allah, in which they were commanded to worship only Allah, treat parents and relatives with kindness, help the orphans and the needy, speak kindly to others, establish prayer, and pay the obligatory charity (zakah). However, most of them turned away from fulfilling this covenant, except for a few who remained steadfast.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل لا تعبدون إلا الله وبالوالدين إحسانا وذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وقولوا للناس حسنا وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة ثم توليتم إلا قليلا منكم وأنتم معرضون

translation: And [recall] when We took your covenant, [saying], 'Do not shed each other's blood or evict yourselves from your homes.' Then you acknowledged and bore witness.
interpretation: "This verse reminds the believers of the sacred covenant they made with Allah not to unjustly kill one another or expel each other from their homes. It emphasizes the sanctity of human life and the prohibition of oppression and injustice towards fellow believers. The verse serves as a reminder of the moral and ethical principles that should govern the conduct of the Muslim community."
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم لا تسفكون دماءكم ولا تخرجون أنفسكم من دياركم ثم أقررتم وأنتم تشهدون

translation: Then you are those who kill yourselves and evict a party of your people from their homes, cooperating against them in sin and aggression. And if they come to you as captives, you ransom them, although their eviction was forbidden to you. So do you believe in part of the Scripture and disbelieve in part? Then what is the recompense for those who do that among you except disgrace in worldly life; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be sent back to the severest punishment. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne l'hypocrisie des gens qui prétendent suivre une partie du Livre saint tout en en rejetant d'autres parties. Ils commettent des actes répréhensibles comme tuer leurs propres gens, les expulser de leurs foyers et coopérer dans le péché et l'agression. Pourtant, lorsque certains d'entre eux sont capturés, ils les rachètent alors que l'expulsion était interdite. Dieu condamne cette hypocrisie et cette partialité envers les enseignements divins. Ceux qui agissent ainsi subiront la honte dans cette vie et un châtiment sévère le Jour de la Résurrection, car Dieu est parfaitement conscient de leurs actions.
orig: ثم أنتم هؤلاء تقتلون أنفسكم وتخرجون فريقا منكم من ديارهم تظاهرون عليهم بالإثم والعدوان وإن يأتوكم أسارى تفادوهم وهو محرم عليكم إخراجهم أفتؤمنون ببعض الكتاب وتكفرون ببعض فما جزاء من يفعل ذلك منكم إلا خزي في الحياة الدنيا ويوم القيامة يردون إلى أشد العذاب وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: Those are the ones who have bought the present life in exchange for the Hereafter, so the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be aided.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who prioritized and pursued the temporary pleasures and material gains of this worldly life over the everlasting rewards of the Hereafter. They chose to disbelieve and disobey God's commands in order to indulge in worldly desires. As a consequence, their punishment in the Hereafter will not be reduced or alleviated, and they will not receive any help or support to escape their deserved recompense.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة فلا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And We did certainly give Moses the Scripture and followed up after him with messengers. And We gave Jesus, the son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the Pure Spirit. But is it [not] that every time a messenger came to you, [O Children of Israel], with what your souls did not desire, you were arrogant? And a party [of messengers] you denied and another party you killed.
interpretation: Cette vérité éternelle souligne que Dieu a toujours envoyé des messagers et des livres pour guider l'humanité, mais les gens ont souvent rejeté ces messagers par arrogance et orgueil, refusant d'accepter ce qui contrariait leurs désirs égoïstes. Cela met en garde contre le rejet arrogant de la vérité et appelle à l'humilité et à l'acceptation des messagers divins.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب وقفينا من بعده بالرسل وآتينا عيسى ابن مريم البينات وأيدناه بروح القدس أفكلما جاءكم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسكم استكبرتم ففريقا كذبتم وفريقا تقتلون

translation: And they say, 'Our hearts are wrapped.' Rather, Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so little is it that they believe.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who claimed that their hearts were covered or wrapped, preventing them from understanding the truth. However, Allah clarifies that it is not their hearts that are covered, but rather Allah has cursed them due to their disbelief and rejection of faith. As a result, they have little belief or understanding of the truth.
orig: وقالوا قلوبنا غلف بل لعنهم الله بكفرهم فقليلا ما يؤمنون

translation: And when there came to them a Book from Allah confirming that which is with them, although before they used to pray for victory against those who disbelieved - but when there came to them that which they recognized, they disbelieved in it; so the curse of Allah will be upon the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Jews who were awaiting the coming of a final Prophet and a new scripture to confirm the Torah. When the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad, which confirmed the truthfulness of their existing scriptures, they rejected it out of envy and arrogance. Thus, they incurred the curse of Allah for their disbelief and obstinacy.
orig: ولما جاءهم كتاب من عند الله مصدق لما معهم وكانوا من قبل يستفتحون على الذين كفروا فلما جاءهم ما عرفوا كفروا به فلعنة الله على الكافرين

translation: How wretched is that for which they sold themselves - that they would disbelieve in what Allah has revealed through insolent envy because Allah sends down His favor upon whom He wills from among His servants. So they have drawn upon themselves wrath upon wrath. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns the disbelievers who rejected the revelations of Allah out of envy and arrogance, unwilling to accept that Allah bestows His favor on whomever He wills from among His servants. Their disbelief and rejection of faith has earned them Allah's wrath compounded upon wrath, and they will face a humiliating punishment for their obstinate denial.
orig: بئسما اشتروا به أنفسهم أن يكفروا بما أنزل الله بغيا أن ينزل الله من فضله على من يشاء من عباده فباءوا بغضب على غضب وللكافرين عذاب مهين

translation: And when it is said to them, "Believe in what Allah has revealed," they say, "We believe in what was revealed to us." And they disbelieve in what came after it, while it is the truth confirming that which is with them. Say, "Then why did you kill the prophets of Allah before, if you were [truly] believers?"
interpretation: هذه الآية تعنف اليهود الذين آمنوا ببعض الكتب السماوية وكفروا ببعضها الآخر، فهم يؤمنون بما أنزل عليهم من التوراة ويكفرون بما جاء بعدها من القرآن والإنجيل، مع أن هذه الكتب جميعها من عند الله وتصدق بعضها بعضًا. ولو كانوا مؤمنين حقًا لما قتلوا الأنبياء الذين جاءوا من بعد موسى عليه السلام.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم آمنوا بما أنزل الله قالوا نؤمن بما أنزل علينا ويكفرون بما وراءه وهو الحق مصدقا لما معهم قل فلم تقتلون أنبياء الله من قبل إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And indeed, Moses came to you with clear proofs, yet you worshipped the calf after that, and you were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse is reminding the people of the time when Moses brought them clear signs and miracles from Allah, yet after his departure, they disobeyed by worshipping the calf idol, which was a grave act of wrongdoing and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: ولقد جاءكم موسى بالبينات ثم اتخذتم العجل من بعده وأنتم ظالمون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took your covenant and raised over you the mount, [saying], "Take what We have given you with determination and listen." They said, "We hear and disobey." And they were made to imbibe the calf into their hearts because of their disbelief. Say, "How wretched is that which your faith enjoins upon you, if you should be believers."
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when Allah took a covenant from the Children of Israel at Mount Sinai, commanding them to follow the Torah with determination. However, they disobeyed and worshipped the golden calf, showing their disbelief and lack of faith. The verse condemns their actions and questions the validity of their faith if it leads them to such wretched acts.
orig: وإذ أخذنا ميثاقكم ورفعنا فوقكم الطور خذوا ما آتيناكم بقوة واسمعوا قالوا سمعنا وعصينا وأشربوا في قلوبهم العجل بكفرهم قل بئسما يأمركم به إيمانكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Say, 'If the final abode with Allah is yours alone, excluding all others, then wish for death, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse challenges the claims of those who believe that Paradise is exclusively for them. If they truly believe that the eternal life in the Hereafter belongs only to them, then they should wish for death to reach that desired state. However, their unwillingness to do so exposes the falsehood of their claims and their lack of conviction in their beliefs.
orig: قل إن كانت لكم الدار الآخرة عند الله خالصة من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But they will never wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have sent ahead. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers and wrongdoers will never wish for death or the Hereafter, no matter how difficult their situation becomes in this world. This is because they know that their evil deeds have preceded them, and they will face the consequences in the Hereafter. Allah is fully aware of those who commit injustice and wrongdoing, and they will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: ولن يتمنوه أبدا بما قدمت أيديهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: And you will surely find them the most greedy of people for life - [even] more than those who associate others with Allah. One of them wishes that he could be granted life a thousand years. But it should not be that the grant of such life will save the disbeliever from the punishment. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the intense desire of disbelievers to prolong their worldly life, even more than those who associate partners with Allah. It emphasizes their greed for a long life, to the extent that one of them wishes to live for a thousand years. However, the verse clarifies that this extended lifespan will not save them from the punishment of Allah. It serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions.
orig: ولتجدنهم أحرص الناس على حياة ومن الذين أشركوا يود أحدهم لو يعمر ألف سنة وما هو بمزحزحه من العذاب أن يعمر والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Say, "Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - it is he who has brought it down upon your heart, by Allah's permission, confirming that which was before it and as guidance and good tidings for the believers."
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad by the Angel Gabriel, by the command of Allah. It confirms the truth of previous scriptures and serves as a guide and glad tidings for the believers. The interpretation emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and its continuity with previous revelations, while also highlighting its role as a source of guidance and good news for the faithful.
orig: قل من كان عدوا لجبريل فإنه نزله على قلبك بإذن الله مصدقا لما بين يديه وهدى وبشرى للمؤمنين

translation: Whoever is an enemy to Allah and His angels and His messengers and Gabriel and Michael - then indeed, Allah is an enemy to the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse warns against being an enemy or opponent to Allah, His angels who are His obedient servants, His messengers who conveyed His message, and the two great angels Gabriel and Michael. It declares that whoever takes such an enmity towards these beings, then Allah will be an enemy and opponent to them, which is a severe warning and threat. It emphasizes the importance of having faith and submission to Allah, His angels, and His messengers.
orig: من كان عدوا لله وملائكته ورسله وجبريل وميكال فإن الله عدو للكافرين

translation: And We have certainly revealed to you verses [which are] clear proofs, and no one disbelieves in them except the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse implies that the Qur'anic verses are clear and self-evident proofs of their divine origin. Only those who are stubbornly rebellious and disobedient to Allah would reject or disbelieve them. The clarity and undeniable truth of the Qur'anic teachings leave no excuse for disbelief, except for those who willfully turn away from faith due to their own moral corruption and defiance.
orig: ولقد أنزلنا إليك آيات بينات وما يكفر بها إلا الفاسقون

translation: Every time they made a covenant, a party of them cast it aside. In fact, most of them do not believe.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the insincerity and lack of faith among those who repeatedly broke their covenants and agreements. It suggests that their actions stem from a fundamental disbelief or lack of true faith, as most of them do not genuinely believe in the principles they claim to uphold.
orig: أوكلما عاهدوا عهدا نبذه فريق منهم بل أكثرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And when there came to them a Messenger from Allah confirming that which is with them, a party of those who were given the Scripture threw away the Scripture of Allah behind their backs as if they did not know.
interpretation: This verse refers to the rejection of Prophet Muhammad's message by some Jews and Christians who had knowledge of previous scriptures foretelling his coming. Despite recognizing the truth, they arrogantly disregarded and turned away from the Qur'an, as if they were ignorant of the prophecies about the final Messenger of God.
orig: ولما جاءهم رسول من عند الله مصدق لما معهم نبذ فريق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب كتاب الله وراء ظهورهم كأنهم لا يعلمون

translation: And they followed what the shayatin (devils) recited over the kingdom of Sulaiman (Solomon). And Sulaiman did not disbelieve, but the shayatin disbelieved, teaching mankind sorcery and that which was sent down upon the two angels in Babylon, Harut and Marut - although they did not teach anyone until they had said: 'We are only a trial, so do not disbelieve.' Yet they learned from them that by which they caused separation between a man and his wife. But they could not harm anyone with it except by Allah's permission. And they learned what harmed them and did not profit them. And they certainly knew that he who buys it (sorcery) will have no share in the Hereafter. And indeed, evil is that for which they sold their souls, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse clarifies that Sulaiman (peace be upon him) was not involved in sorcery or disbelief. Rather, it was the devils who taught people sorcery and magic, which causes separation between spouses. The verse warns against learning and practicing sorcery, as it has no benefit in the Hereafter and is a means of harming oneself.
orig: واتبعوا ما تتلو الشياطين على ملك سليمان وما كفر سليمان ولكن الشياطين كفروا يعلمون الناس السحر وما أنزل على الملكين ببابل هاروت وماروت وما يعلمان من أحد حتى يقولا إنما نحن فتنة فلا تكفر فيتعلمون منهما ما يفرقون به بين المرء وزوجه وما هم بضارين به من أحد إلا بإذن الله ويتعلمون ما يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ولقد علموا لمن اشتراه ما له في الآخرة من خلاق ولبئس ما شروا به أنفسهم لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And if they had believed and feared Allah, then the reward from Allah would have been better, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith (Iman) and God-consciousness (Taqwa). It implies that if the people had truly believed in Allah and His revelations, and had maintained a state of piety and righteousness, they would have attained a far greater reward from Allah than any worldly gains. However, their lack of understanding and spiritual insight prevents them from realizing the immense blessings that come with faith and God-consciousness.
orig: ولو أنهم آمنوا واتقوا لمثوبة من عند الله خير لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: O you who believe! Do not say 'Ra'ina' but say 'Unzurna' and listen. And for the disbelievers there is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to avoid using the word "Ra'ina", which has a double meaning of obedience and disobedience in Hebrew. Instead, they should use the word "Unzurna", which means "wait for us" or "give us time to understand". This is to prevent any misunderstanding or disrespect towards the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). The verse also warns the disbelievers of a painful punishment for their rejection of faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقولوا راعنا وقولوا انظرنا واسمعوا وللكافرين عذاب أليم

translation: Neither those who disbelieve from among the People of the Book nor the idolaters wish that any good should be sent down to you from your Lord. But Allah selects for His mercy whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers, whether from the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) or the idolaters, do not desire any good or blessing to be bestowed upon the Muslims by Allah. However, Allah bestows His mercy and favors upon whomever He wills, and He is the One who possesses immense grace and bounty.
orig: ما يود الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب ولا المشركين أن ينزل عليكم من خير من ربكم والله يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: Whatever verse We abrogate or cause to be forgotten, We bring one better than it or one similar to it. Do you not know that Allah has power over everything?
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has the power to abrogate or replace certain rulings from previous revelations with new ones that are better suited or similar. It affirms Allah's absolute authority and wisdom in legislating what is best for humanity at different times and circumstances. The abrogation of verses does not diminish the Qur'an's divine origin, but rather demonstrates Allah's perfect knowledge and ability to provide guidance that meets the evolving needs of people.
orig: ما ننسخ من آية أو ننسها نأت بخير منها أو مثلها ألم تعلم أن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and that you have not besides Allah any protector or any helper?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth, and that no one has any power or control except Allah. It reminds us that we have no protector or helper besides Allah, so we should put our trust and reliance solely in Him.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Or do you intend to ask your Messenger as Moses was asked before? And whoever exchanges faith for disbelief has certainly strayed from the right way.
interpretation: This verse warns against questioning the Prophet Muhammad in the same way that the Israelites questioned Moses, which was out of stubbornness and disbelief. It also emphasizes that rejecting faith after having believed is a grave error that leads one astray from the straight path.
orig: أم تريدون أن تسألوا رسولكم كما سئل موسى من قبل ومن يتبدل الكفر بالإيمان فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: Many of the People of the Book wish they could turn you back into disbelievers after you have believed, out of envy from themselves, even after the truth has become clear to them. So pardon and overlook until Allah delivers His command. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse highlights the envy and resentment that some People of the Book (Jews and Christians) harbored towards the Muslim believers. Despite the truth being evident to them, their jealousy led them to wish that the Muslims would revert to disbelief. However, the Qur'an instructs the believers to pardon their ill-will, overlook their hostility, and remain patient until Allah's command is revealed, for He has power over all things.
orig: ود كثير من أهل الكتاب لو يردونكم من بعد إيمانكم كفارا حسدا من عند أنفسهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الحق فاعفوا واصفحوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah, and whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. Indeed, Allah of what you do, is Seeing.
