interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of performing the obligatory acts of worship, such as prayer (salah) and giving obligatory charity (zakah), as well as doing good deeds in general. It promises that any good deed done sincerely for the sake of Allah will be rewarded by Him, as He is All-Aware of our actions and intentions.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وما تقدموا لأنفسكم من خير تجدوه عند الله إن الله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And they say, 'None will enter Paradise except one who is a Jew or a Christian.' That is [merely] their wishful thinking. Say, 'Produce your proof, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the claim of Jews and Christians that only their followers will attain Paradise. It challenges them to provide evidence for this assertion, as it is merely their desire and wishful thinking without any basis in truth. The verse emphasizes that salvation is not exclusive to any particular group, but rather depends on one's faith and righteous deeds, as per the guidance revealed by God.
orig: وقالوا لن يدخل الجنة إلا من كان هودا أو نصارى تلك أمانيهم قل هاتوا برهانكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Yes, whoever submits his face to Allah while being a good-doer, he will have his reward with his Lord, and there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse promises a great reward and peace of mind for those who sincerely submit themselves to Allah and do good deeds. The phrase "submits his face to Allah" refers to complete devotion and sincerity in one's faith. The "good-doers" are those who not only believe but also put their faith into practice through righteous actions. For such people, there is the promise of an immense reward from Allah, as well as freedom from fear and grief in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: بلى من أسلم وجهه لله وهو محسن فله أجره عند ربه ولا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: The Jews say: 'The Christians have nothing to stand upon,' and the Christians say: 'The Jews have nothing to stand upon,' although both recite the Scripture. Those who do not know speak words similar to theirs. God will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning their differences.
interpretation: Allah is describing the enmity and disagreement between the Jews and Christians, despite both groups claiming to follow divine scripture. Their mutual rejection of each other's beliefs is based on ignorance. Allah states that He will settle this dispute on the Day of Judgment by judging between them regarding the matters they differed over.
orig: وقالت اليهود ليست النصارى على شيء وقالت النصارى ليست اليهود على شيء وهم يتلون الكتاب كذلك قال الذين لا يعلمون مثل قولهم فالله يحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: And who is more unjust than he who prevents the masajid of Allah from His name being mentioned therein, and strives for their ruin? It was not proper for such men to enter them except in fear. For them is disgrace in this world, and for them is a great punishment in the Hereafter.
interpretation: Cette verse condamne fermement ceux qui empêchent les gens d'adorer Allah dans les mosquées et qui cherchent à détruire ces lieux de culte. Cet acte est considéré comme une grande injustice et une oppression. Ceux qui commettent de tels actes n'ont pas le droit d'entrer dans les mosquées, sauf avec crainte et humilité. Ils subiront l'humiliation dans cette vie et un châtiment sévère dans l'au-delà pour leur impiété.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن منع مساجد الله أن يذكر فيها اسمه وسعى في خرابها أولئك ما كان لهم أن يدخلوها إلا خائفين لهم في الدنيا خزي ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: And to Allah belongs the east and the west. So wherever you turn, there is the Face of Allah. Indeed, Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the omnipresence and omniscience of Allah. It states that the east and west belong to Him, indicating His sovereignty over all directions and the entire universe. Wherever a person turns, they will find the presence of Allah, as His knowledge and power encompass everything. This verse encourages the believers to recognize Allah's vastness and to turn to Him with sincere devotion, regardless of their physical orientation or location.
orig: ولله المشرق والمغرب فأينما تولوا فثم وجه الله إن الله واسع عليم

translation: And they say, "Allah has taken a son." Glory be to Him! Rather, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him.
interpretation: This verse refutes the blasphemous claim of those who attributed a son to Allah, who is far exalted above such a notion. It affirms that everything in the heavens and earth belongs to Him and is subservient to His will and commands. The claim of Allah having a son contradicts His absolute Oneness and Perfection.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الله ولدا سبحانه بل له ما في السماوات والأرض كل له قانتون

translation: The Originator of the heavens and the earth. And when He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and authority as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It emphasizes that when Allah wills something, it comes into existence simply by His command, 'Be,' without any effort or difficulty on His part. This underscores Allah's omnipotence and the ease with which He creates and controls all things.
orig: بديع السماوات والأرض وإذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And those who have no knowledge say, 'Why does Allah not speak to us or a sign not come to us?' Thus spoke those before them similar to their words. Their hearts are alike. We have certainly made the signs clear for a people who are certain.
interpretation: This verse addresses the ignorant people who demand a direct revelation or miracle from Allah, just as previous nations had demanded before them. Their hearts are alike in stubbornness and rejection of the truth. However, Allah has made the signs and evidences clear for those who have certainty in their faith and are willing to reflect and understand.
orig: وقال الذين لا يعلمون لولا يكلمنا الله أو تأتينا آية كذلك قال الذين من قبلهم مثل قولهم تشابهت قلوبهم قد بينا الآيات لقوم يوقنون

translation: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And you will not be asked about the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: "The verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent by Allah as a messenger to convey the truth, give glad tidings to those who believe and follow the guidance, and warn those who disbelieve and disobey. He is not responsible for the fate of those who reject his message and end up in Hellfire, as their accountability rests solely with Allah."
orig: إنا أرسلناك بالحق بشيرا ونذيرا ولا تسأل عن أصحاب الجحيم

translation: But they will not be pleased with you, neither the Jews nor the Christians, until you follow their religion. Say: 'Verily, the Guidance of Allah is the only Guidance. And if you were to follow their desires after the knowledge that has come to you, you would have against Allah neither any protector nor any helper.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) will never be satisfied with the Muslims unless they abandon their faith and follow the religion of the former. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare that Allah's guidance, as revealed in the Qur'an, is the only true guidance. If one were to follow the whims and desires of others after receiving the knowledge of truth, one would find no protector or helper against Allah's punishment.
orig: ولن ترضى عنك اليهود ولا النصارى حتى تتبع ملتهم قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى ولئن اتبعت أهواءهم بعد الذي جاءك من العلم ما لك من الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Those to whom We gave the Scripture recite it with its true recital. They [are the ones who] believe in it. And whoever disbelieves in it - it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the People of the Book, primarily Jews and Christians, who were given divine scriptures before the revelation of the Qur'an. Those among them who recite and follow their scriptures sincerely and accurately are considered true believers. However, those who reject the Qur'an after its revelation are the real losers, as they have turned away from the final message of God.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يتلونه حق تلاوته أولئك يؤمنون به ومن يكفر به فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: O Children of Israel, remember My favor which I bestowed upon you and that I preferred you over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder from Allah to the Children of Israel to be grateful for the favors He has bestowed upon them. He reminds them that He chose them over all other nations and peoples of their time, and granted them special privileges and blessings. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of recognizing and appreciating Allah's favors, and not taking them for granted or becoming arrogant. It is a call to humility and gratitude towards the Divine.
orig: يا بني إسرائيل اذكروا نعمتي التي أنعمت عليكم وأني فضلتكم على العالمين

translation: And fear a Day when no soul will suffice for another soul at all, nor will intercession be accepted from it, nor will compensation be taken from it, nor will they be aided.
interpretation: "This verse warns people to be mindful of the Day of Judgment, when no soul will be able to help or benefit another. On that Day, no ransom or intercession will be accepted, and no one will be able to assist anyone else. Each person will be held accountable for their own deeds and will face the consequences alone."
orig: واتقوا يوما لا تجزي نفس عن نفس شيئا ولا يقبل منها عدل ولا تنفعها شفاعة ولا هم ينصرون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was tried by his Lord with commands and he fulfilled them. [Allah] said, 'Indeed, I will make you a leader for the people.' [Abraham] said, 'And of my descendants?' [Allah] said, 'My covenant does not include the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the trial of Prophet Abraham by Allah with certain commands, which he fulfilled obediently. As a reward, Allah promised to make him a leader for humanity. However, when Abraham asked if this leadership would extend to his descendants, Allah clarified that His covenant of guidance and prophethood would not include the wrongdoers among his progeny. This underscores the principle that spiritual ranks and divine favors are earned through righteousness and obedience, not merely inherited through lineage.
orig: وإذ ابتلى إبراهيم ربه بكلمات فأتمهن قال إني جاعلك للناس إماما قال ومن ذريتي قال لا ينال عهدي الظالمين

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We made the House a place of return for the people and [a place of] security. And take, [O believers], from the standing place of Abraham a place of prayer. And We charged Abraham and Ishmael, [saying], 'Purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who are staying [there] for worship and those who bow and prostrate [in prayer].'
interpretation: Allah reminds the believers of the honor He bestowed upon the Ka'bah by making it a sanctuary and place of spiritual return for all people. He commanded the believers to take the standing place of Prophet Abraham as a place of prayer, following his example. Allah also instructed Prophets Abraham and Ishmael to purify and sanctify the Ka'bah for those who circumambulate it, stay there for worship, and perform prayers involving bowing and prostration.
orig: وإذ جعلنا البيت مثابة للناس وأمنا واتخذوا من مقام إبراهيم مصلى وعهدنا إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل أن طهرا بيتي للطائفين والعاكفين والركع السجود

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this a secure city and provide its people with fruits - whoever of them believes in Allah and the Last Day." [Allah] said, "And whoever disbelieves - I will grant him enjoyment for a little; then I will force him to the punishment of the Fire, and wretched is the destination."
interpretation: This verse refers to the supplication of Prophet Abraham for the city of Makkah to be a secure and peaceful place, and for its inhabitants who believe in Allah and the Last Day to be provided with sustenance. Allah's response is that those who disbelieve will be granted temporary enjoyment in this world, but ultimately they will be subjected to the punishment of Hellfire, which is a terrible destination.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب اجعل هذا بلدا آمنا وارزق أهله من الثمرات من آمن منهم بالله واليوم الآخر قال ومن كفر فأمتعه قليلا ثم أضطره إلى عذاب النار وبئس المصير

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham was raising the foundations of the House and [with him] Ishmael, [saying], 'Our Lord, accept [this] from us. Indeed You are the Hearing, the Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the construction of the Ka'bah in Makkah by Prophet Abraham and his son Ishmael. They prayed to Allah to accept their efforts, acknowledging that He is All-Hearing and All-Knowing of their sincere intentions and actions.
orig: وإذ يرفع إبراهيم القواعد من البيت وإسماعيل ربنا تقبل منا إنك أنت السميع العليم

translation: Our Lord, and make us Muslims [in submission] to You and from our descendants a Muslim nation [in submission] to You. And show us our rites and accept our repentance. Indeed, You are the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: "In this verse, the believers are supplicating to Allah to make them and their descendants steadfast in submitting to Him and following the religion of Islam. They ask Allah to guide them to the correct rituals and practices of their faith, and to accept their repentance for any shortcomings or sins. It highlights the importance of seeking guidance from Allah, passing down the teachings of Islam to future generations, and the mercy and forgiveness of Allah for those who sincerely repent."
orig: ربنا واجعلنا مسلمين لك ومن ذريتنا أمة مسلمة لك وأرنا مناسكنا وتب علينا إنك أنت التواب الرحيم

translation: Our Lord, and raise up among them a messenger from themselves who will recite to them Your verses and teach them the Book and wisdom and purify them. Indeed, You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication from the believers, asking Allah to send a messenger from among themselves to recite the verses of the Qur'an, teach them the divine scripture and wisdom, and purify their souls from evil qualities. It emphasizes the need for spiritual guidance and moral upliftment through the teachings of a prophet who can connect with the people and lead them towards righteousness. The verse also affirms Allah's might and wisdom in choosing and sending messengers.
orig: ربنا وابعث فيهم رسولا منهم يتلو عليهم آياتك ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة ويزكيهم إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: And who would be averse to the religion of Abraham except one who makes a fool of himself? And We had chosen him in this world, and indeed he, in the Hereafter, will be among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the excellence of Prophet Abraham's religion and faith. It states that only a foolish person would turn away from the pure and upright way of life taught by Abraham. God had chosen Abraham in this world to be a guide and leader, and in the Hereafter, he will be among the righteous who have attained salvation due to their faith and good deeds.
orig: ومن يرغب عن ملة إبراهيم إلا من سفه نفسه ولقد اصطفيناه في الدنيا وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: When his Lord said to him, "Submit", he said "I have submitted to the Lord of the Worlds."
interpretation: This verse refers to the submission of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) to the command of Allah. It signifies the complete obedience and devotion of Ibrahim to the One True God, the Lord of all the worlds. His declaration of "I have submitted" indicates his willing acceptance of Allah's command without any hesitation or reservation. It is a powerful statement of faith and a recognition of Allah's sovereignty over all creation.
orig: إذ قال له ربه أسلم قال أسلمت لرب العالمين

translation: And Abraham instructed his sons with it, and so did Jacob, 'O my sons, Allah has chosen for you the religion, so do not die except as Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of holding firmly to the true religion of Islam, which was the religion of Prophet Abraham and his descendants. It emphasizes that Allah has chosen Islam as the true religion for humanity, and that one should remain steadfast in this religion until the end of one's life. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain faith and submission to Allah, and to strive to live according to the teachings of Islam.
orig: ووصى بها إبراهيم بنيه ويعقوب يا بني إن الله اصطفى لكم الدين فلا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون

translation: Or were you witnesses when death approached Jacob, when he said to his sons, 'What will you worship after me?' They said, 'We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Abraham, Ishmael and Isaac - one God. And we are Muslims [in submission] to Him.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when the Prophet Jacob was on his deathbed and asked his sons what they would worship after him. Their response affirmed their belief in the One God worshipped by Jacob and his forefathers Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac. It emphasizes the continuity of the message of monotheism (Tawheed) passed down through the Prophets and their adherents" submission to the One True God.
orig: أم كنتم شهداء إذ حضر يعقوب الموت إذ قال لبنيه ما تعبدون من بعدي قالوا نعبد إلهك وإله آبائك إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق إلها واحدا ونحن له مسلمون

translation: That is a nation which has passed away. Theirs is that which they earned, and yours is that which you have earned. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse signifies that every nation or community is accountable for its own deeds. The previous nations have passed away, and they will be rewarded or punished based on their actions. Similarly, the present generation will be judged solely based on their own deeds, and not held responsible for the actions of previous nations. The principle of individual accountability is emphasized, where each person will face the consequences of their own choices and actions, without being questioned about what others have done.
orig: تلك أمة قد خلت لها ما كسبت ولكم ما كسبتم ولا تسألون عما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they say, "Be Jews or Christians, you will be guided." Say, "Rather, the religion of Abraham, the upright; and he was not of those who associated others with Allah."
interpretation: This verse refutes the claims of Jews and Christians that true guidance lies only in following their respective religions. It asserts that the true religion is the pure monotheistic faith of Prophet Abraham, who shunned all forms of polytheism and idol worship. The verse affirms that the straight path is to follow Abraham's unwavering devotion to the One True God, rejecting any association of partners with Allah.
orig: وقالوا كونوا هودا أو نصارى تهتدوا قل بل ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Say, 'We have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims in submission to Him.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of faith in Allah and His revelations to all prophets. It calls upon believers to declare their faith in Allah, the Qur'an, and all previous scriptures revealed to prophets like Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, Moses, Jesus, and others. It stresses that true believers make no distinction between any of the prophets and submit themselves completely to Allah.
orig: قولوا آمنا بالله وما أنزل إلينا وما أنزل إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وما أوتي موسى وعيسى وما أوتي النبيون من ربهم لا نفرق بين أحد منهم ونحن له مسلمون

translation: But if they believe in the same that you believe in, then they have been [rightly] guided; but if they turn away, they are only in dissension, and Allah will be sufficient for you against them. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
interpretation: "Si creen en lo mismo que tú crees, entonces han sido guiados rectamente; pero si se apartan, simplemente están en disensión. Dios te bastará contra ellos. Él es el Omnioído, el Omnisciente". Esta interpretación sugiere que si los incrédulos aceptan el mismo mensaje que los creyentes, serán guiados correctamente. Sin embargo, si rechazan el mensaje, estarán en desacuerdo y disensión. En ese caso, Dios protegerá y ayudará a los creyentes contra los incrédulos, ya que Él todo lo oye y todo lo sabe.
orig: فإن آمنوا بمثل ما آمنتم به فقد اهتدوا وإن تولوا فإنما هم في شقاق فسيكفيكهم الله وهو السميع العليم

translation: The dye of Allah, and who is better than Allah at dyeing? And we are worshippers of Him.
interpretation: This verse refers to the natural state of submission to Allah, which is inherent in all of creation. The "dye" or "color" of Allah is a metaphor for the innate inclination towards worshipping and submitting to the Creator. No one can provide a better "dye" or guidance than Allah Himself. The believers affirm that they are devoted worshippers of Allah, following His guidance and living according to His commands.
orig: صبغة الله ومن أحسن من الله صبغة ونحن له عابدون

translation: Say, "Do you argue with us about Allah while He is our Lord and your Lord? For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. And we are sincere to Him in worship."
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes that belief in Allah should be based on sincere faith and not mere argumentation. It affirms that Allah is the Lord of all, and that each person is accountable for their own deeds. The believers should dedicate their worship purely and sincerely to Allah alone, without associating any partners with Him."
orig: قل أتحاجوننا في الله وهو ربنا وربكم ولنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم ونحن له مخلصون

translation: Or do you say that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob and the Descendants were Jews or Christians? Say, "Are you more knowing or is Allah?" And who is more unjust than one who conceals a testimony he has from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse questions the claim of Jews and Christians that the Prophets Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the twelve tribes were followers of their respective religions. It rhetorically asks if they are more knowledgeable than Allah about the religion of these Prophets. It condemns those who conceal the truth about the religion of these Prophets, which is the pure monotheistic faith of Islam, as a great injustice. The verse asserts that Allah is fully aware of their actions and beliefs.
orig: أم تقولون إن إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط كانوا هودا أو نصارى قل أأنتم أعلم أم الله ومن أظلم ممن كتم شهادة عنده من الله وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: That is a nation which has passed away. Theirs is that which they earned, and yours is that which you earn. And you will not be asked about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability before God. Each person is responsible for their own deeds and will be judged accordingly on the Day of Resurrection. The actions and beliefs of previous nations or individuals will not affect one's own judgment. One cannot rely on the faith or good deeds of others, nor will one be held accountable for the misdeeds of others. The emphasis is on personal responsibility and the consequences of one's choices and actions.
orig: تلك أمة قد خلت لها ما كسبت ولكم ما كسبتم ولا تسألون عما كانوا يعملون

translation: The foolish among the people will say, 'What has turned them away from their qiblah which they used to face?' Say, 'To Allah belongs the east and the west. He guides whom He wills to a straight path.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the change of qiblah (direction of prayer) from Jerusalem to the Ka'bah in Makkah. The "foolish" ones questioned this change, but Allah reminds that He is the Owner and Lord of all directions, and He guides whomever He wills to the straight path. The change of qiblah was a test of faith for the believers to follow Allah's command without questioning.
orig: سيقول السفهاء من الناس ما ولاهم عن قبلتهم التي كانوا عليها قل لله المشرق والمغرب يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And thus We have made you a moderate community that you will be witnesses over the people and the Messenger will be a witness over you. And We did not make the qiblah which you used to face except that We might make evident who follows the Messenger from who turns back on his heels. And indeed, it is difficult except for those whom Allah has guided. And never would Allah have caused you to lose your faith. Indeed Allah is, to the people, Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: Allah made the Muslim community a moderate and justly balanced nation to serve as witnesses over humanity on the Day of Judgment, while the Prophet Muhammad will be a witness over them. The change of the qiblah (direction of prayer) from Jerusalem to the Ka'bah in Makkah was a test to distinguish those who sincerely follow the Prophet from those who turn back on their faith. This change, though difficult, was easy for those guided by Allah. He would never let their faith go to waste, for He is Most Kind and Merciful to humanity.
orig: وكذلك جعلناكم أمة وسطا لتكونوا شهداء على الناس ويكون الرسول عليكم شهيدا وما جعلنا القبلة التي كنت عليها إلا لنعلم من يتبع الرسول ممن ينقلب على عقبيه وإن كانت لكبيرة إلا على الذين هدى الله وما كان الله ليضيع إيمانكم إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم

translation: We have certainly seen the turning of your face, [O Muhammad], toward the heaven, and We will surely turn you to a qiblah with which you will be pleased. So turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [in prayer]. Indeed, those who have been given the Scripture well know that it is the truth from their Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the changing of the qiblah (direction faced in prayer) from Jerusalem to the Ka'bah in Makkah. Allah says that He has seen the Prophet's desire to face the Ka'bah during prayer, and that He will fulfill this wish. The believers are commanded to face the Sacred Mosque in Makkah wherever they are during prayer. The People of the Book know that this command is the truth from their Lord, and Allah is aware of their deeds.
orig: قد نرى تقلب وجهك في السماء فلنولينك قبلة ترضاها فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وحيث ما كنتم فولوا وجوهكم شطره وإن الذين أوتوا الكتاب ليعلمون أنه الحق من ربهم وما الله بغافل عما يعملون

translation: And even if you were to bring to those who were given the Book every sign, they would not follow your qiblah, nor would you be a follower of their qiblah. Nor would they be followers of one another's qiblah. And if you were to follow their desires after what has come to you of knowledge, you would then be among the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of trying to please everyone, especially those who have deviated from the truth. It teaches that one should adhere to the guidance received from God, regardless of the opposition or desires of others. Following the whims of people after receiving divine knowledge is considered a form of wrongdoing. The verse encourages steadfastness in following the truth and not compromising one's principles to appease others.
orig: ولئن أتيت الذين أوتوا الكتاب بكل آية ما تبعوا قبلتك وما أنت بتابع قبلتهم وما بعضهم بتابع قبلة بعض ولئن اتبعت أهواءهم من بعد ما جاءك من العلم إنك إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: Those to whom We have given the Book, recognize it as they recognize their sons. But verily, a party of them conceal the truth while they know it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who recognize the truth of the Qur'an and the prophethood of Muhammad, just as they recognize their own sons. However, some of them deliberately conceal this truth out of envy, arrogance, or desire to maintain their position and status, even though they are fully aware of the truth.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعرفونه كما يعرفون أبناءهم وإن فريقا منهم ليكتمون الحق وهم يعلمون

translation: The truth is from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
interpretation: Allah is commanding the believers to have firm faith and certainty in the truth that has come from Him, and not to doubt or hesitate in accepting it. This verse emphasizes the importance of having unwavering belief in the revelations and teachings of Islam, and warns against being among those who doubt or question the divine truth.
orig: الحق من ربك فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And for every nation there is a direction to which they turn their faces; so strive to be foremost in good deeds. Wherever you are, Allah will bring you all together. Surely, Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that each nation or community has its own direction or way of life, but the ultimate goal should be to compete in doing good deeds and righteous actions. No matter where a person is located, Allah will gather all people together on the Day of Judgment. The verse reminds us of Allah's absolute power and ability to bring about the resurrection and recompense for everyone's deeds.
orig: ولكل وجهة هو موليها فاستبقوا الخيرات أين ما تكونوا يأت بكم الله جميعا إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And from wherever you start forth, turn your face in the direction of the Sacred Mosque, and verily, this is the truth from your Lord. And Allah is not unaware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse commands Muslims to face the direction of the Ka'bah in Makkah during their prayers, regardless of where they are. It emphasizes that this command comes from Allah, and that He is fully aware of our actions. The verse affirms the truth and significance of the Qibla (direction of prayer) towards the Sacred Mosque in Makkah.
orig: ومن حيث خرجت فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وإنه للحق من ربك وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: And from wherever you go out [for prayer], turn your face toward al-Masjid al-Haram. And wherever you [believers] are, turn your faces toward it [when you pray] so that the people will not have any argument against you except those of them who are wrongdoers, so fear them not but fear Me. And [it is] so I may complete My favor upon you and that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse instructs Muslims to face the direction of the Kaaba in Makkah during their prayers, no matter where they are in the world. It establishes the qiblah (direction of prayer) as a unifying symbol for Muslims. The verse also states that only wrongdoers will object to this command, and Muslims should not fear them but fear Allah alone. It emphasizes that this command is part of Allah's favor upon the believers to guide them to the right path.
orig: ومن حيث خرجت فول وجهك شطر المسجد الحرام وحيث ما كنتم فولوا وجوهكم شطره لئلا يكون للناس عليكم حجة إلا الذين ظلموا منهم فلا تخشوهم واخشوني ولأتم نعمتي عليكم ولعلكم تهتدون

translation: As We have sent among you a Messenger from yourselves reciting to you Our verses and purifying you and teaching you the Book and wisdom and teaching you that which you did not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad as a teacher and guide sent by Allah to the people. He recited the verses of the Qur'an, purified their souls from evil and ignorance, taught them the divine scripture (the Qur'an) and wisdom, and imparted knowledge they did not previously possess. The Prophet's mission was to elevate the spiritual, moral, and intellectual state of the people.
orig: كما أرسلنا فيكم رسولا منكم يتلو عليكم آياتنا ويزكيكم ويعلمكم الكتاب والحكمة ويعلمكم ما لم تكونوا تعلمون

translation: So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me, and do not deny Me.
interpretation: Allah commands us to remember Him through worship, obedience, and contemplation of His signs and bounties. In return, He will remember us by granting us success, guidance, and reward. Additionally, He instructs us to be grateful to Him by acknowledging His favors and using them in ways that please Him, and to not commit acts of disbelief or ingratitude towards Him.
orig: فاذكروني أذكركم واشكروا لي ولا تكفرون

translation: O you who believe, seek help through patience and prayer. Indeed, Allah is with the patient.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and prayer in the life of a believer. It encourages the believers to seek help and strength through being patient and steadfast in the face of difficulties, as well as through the regular practice of prayer. The verse promises that Allah is with those who are patient and persevere, providing them with His support and guidance. It highlights that patience and prayer are essential means for believers to overcome challenges and maintain their faith and connection with Allah.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا استعينوا بالصبر والصلاة إن الله مع الصابرين

translation: And do not say about those who are killed in the way of Allah, 'They are dead.' Rather, they are alive, but you do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who sacrifice their lives for the cause of Allah are not truly dead, but rather alive in the eyes of Allah. Their souls continue to live on, though we may not comprehend this reality with our limited human perception. It encourages the believers to have faith in the eternal life promised by Allah and not to grieve over those who are martyred, as they are being rewarded in the Hereafter.
orig: ولا تقولوا لمن يقتل في سبيل الله أموات بل أحياء ولكن لا تشعرون

translation: And We will surely test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruits, but give good tidings to the patient
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah tests people with various trials and difficulties in life, such as fear, hunger, loss of wealth, loss of loved ones, and lack of provisions. However, these tests are a means for believers to demonstrate patience and steadfastness. Those who endure these trials with patience and trust in Allah will be rewarded and given glad tidings of His pleasure and reward in the Hereafter.
orig: ولنبلونكم بشيء من الخوف والجوع ونقص من الأموال والأنفس والثمرات وبشر الصابرين

translation: Those who, when afflicted with calamity, say: "We belong to Allah and to Him we shall return."
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who remain steadfast and patient when faced with difficulties or calamities in life. They recognize that everything belongs to Allah and that they will ultimately return to Him. Their faith and trust in Allah's wisdom and decree helps them accept the trials with patience and perseverance, knowing that these challenges are a test from Allah and that He will reward them for their steadfastness.
orig: الذين إذا أصابتهم مصيبة قالوا إنا لله وإنا إليه راجعون

translation: Those, upon them are blessings from their Lord and mercy. And it is those who are the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the people described previously, who have faith and do good deeds, receive Allah's blessings and mercy. They are the ones who are truly guided to the straight path and salvation.
orig: أولئك عليهم صلوات من ربهم ورحمة وأولئك هم المهتدون

translation: Indeed, As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the symbols of Allah. So whoever makes Hajj to the House or performs 'umrah - there is no blame upon him for walking between them. And whoever volunteers good - then indeed, Allah is Appreciative and All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse establishes that the rites of Sa'i (walking) between As-Safa and Al-Marwah are among the sacred symbols and rites prescribed by Allah for those performing Hajj or Umrah. It declares that there is no sin or blame upon the pilgrims for performing this ritual. Moreover, it encourages voluntary good deeds, stating that Allah appreciates and has full knowledge of such deeds.
orig: إن الصفا والمروة من شعائر الله فمن حج البيت أو اعتمر فلا جناح عليه أن يطوف بهما ومن تطوع خيرا فإن الله شاكر عليم

translation: Indeed, those who conceal what We sent down of clear proofs and guidance after We made it clear for the people in the Scripture - those are cursed by Allah and cursed by those who curse.
interpretation: This verse warns against concealing or hiding the clear revelations and guidance revealed by Allah in the Scripture (the Qur'an). Those who intentionally conceal or distort this guidance after it has been made clear to them are condemned and cursed by Allah and by all those who have the authority to curse. This emphasizes the grave sin of knowingly hiding or twisting the truth after it has been made evident.
orig: إن الذين يكتمون ما أنزلنا من البينات والهدى من بعد ما بيناه للناس في الكتاب أولئك يلعنهم الله ويلعنهم اللاعنون

translation: Except those who repent, reform themselves, and openly declare the truth; for them, I will accept their repentance, for I am the Acceptor of Repentance, the Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the infinite mercy of Allah. It emphasizes that even those who have committed sins, if they sincerely repent, reform their ways, and openly declare the truth, Allah will forgive them and accept their repentance. The interpretation underscores Allah's attribute as the One who accepts repentance and bestows mercy upon those who turn to Him with sincere remorse and a commitment to change."
orig: إلا الذين تابوا وأصلحوا وبينوا فأولئك أتوب عليهم وأنا التواب الرحيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers - upon them will be the curse of Allah and of the angels and the people, all together
interpretation: This verse states that those who reject faith in Allah and die in a state of disbelief will be cursed by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity. It emphasizes the grave consequence of rejecting faith and dying as a disbeliever, which is being cursed and rejected by Allah, His angels, and all people.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وماتوا وهم كفار أولئك عليهم لعنة الله والملائكة والناس أجمعين

translation: Abiding eternally therein, the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse indicates the permanence and severity of the punishment for those in Hell. They will remain there forever, without any reduction or respite from the torment. It emphasizes the gravity of their situation and the finality of their fate.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And your God is One God, there is no god but He, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse affirms the fundamental Islamic belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed). It states that there is only one true God, who is the Most Gracious and Most Merciful. This emphasizes that God is the sole object of worship, and that He alone deserves our devotion and submission. The attributes of being "Most Gracious" and "Most Merciful" highlight God's infinite mercy and compassion towards His creation.
orig: وإلهكم إله واحد لا إله إلا هو الرحمن الرحيم

translation: Verily, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of night and day, and the ships that sail through the sea with that which benefits mankind, and the water that Allah sends down from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its death, and disperses therein all kinds of creatures, and in the turning about of the winds and the clouds subjugated between the heaven and the earth, are signs for a people who understand.
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's existence and power in the creation of the universe, the alternation of day and night, the ships sailing in the seas carrying provisions for people, the rain that revives the dead earth, the dispersal of all creatures on earth, and the winds and clouds moving between the heavens and earth. These phenomena are clear evidences for those who use their intellect and contemplate the greatness of the Creator.
orig: إن في خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف الليل والنهار والفلك التي تجري في البحر بما ينفع الناس وما أنزل الله من السماء من ماء فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها وبث فيها من كل دابة وتصريف الرياح والسحاب المسخر بين السماء والأرض لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And among the people are those who take for worship others besides Allah, loving them as they should love Allah. But those who have believed are more intense in their love for Allah. If only the wrongdoers could see, when they will see the punishment, that all power belongs to Allah, and that Allah is severe in punishment.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the practice of idolatry, where people worship others besides Allah and love them as intensely as they should love Allah alone. It contrasts this with the true believers, who have an intense and devoted love for Allah. The verse warns the wrongdoers that when they witness the punishment on the Day of Judgment, they will realize that all power and authority belongs to Allah, and that His punishment is severe.
orig: ومن الناس من يتخذ من دون الله أندادا يحبونهم كحب الله والذين آمنوا أشد حبا لله ولو يرى الذين ظلموا إذ يرون العذاب أن القوة لله جميعا وأن الله شديد العذاب

translation: When those who were followed disassociate themselves from those who followed them, and they see the punishment, and all their ties are severed.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when those who were blindly followed and misled others will disown and disassociate themselves from their followers. They will see the punishment that awaits them, and all ties and relationships between them will be cut off, leaving them in utter despair and separation.
orig: إذ تبرأ الذين اتبعوا من الذين اتبعوا ورأوا العذاب وتقطعت بهم الأسباب

translation: And those who followed will say, 'If only we had another chance, we would disassociate ourselves from them as they have disassociated themselves from us.' Thus will Allah show them their deeds as regrets upon them. And they will not leave the Fire.
interpretation: This verse describes the regret and remorse that the followers will feel on the Day of Judgment. They will wish for another opportunity to disassociate themselves from those who misled them, just as the misguided disassociated themselves from the followers in this world. However, it will be too late for such regrets. Allah will make their deeds appear as a source of intense regret and sorrow for them, and they will not be able to escape the punishment of the Fire.
orig: وقال الذين اتبعوا لو أن لنا كرة فنتبرأ منهم كما تبرءوا منا كذلك يريهم الله أعمالهم حسرات عليهم وما هم بخارجين من النار

translation: O mankind, eat from whatever is on earth [that is] lawful and good and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: "This verse commands people to consume only what is permissible and pure, and not to follow the evil ways of Satan, who is an avowed enemy leading people astray."
orig: يا أيها الناس كلوا مما في الأرض حلالا طيبا ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: He only enjoins you with evil and lewdness, and that you should say about Allah what you do not know.
interpretation: This verse warns against following the commands of Satan, who tempts people to commit evil deeds, engage in immorality, and make false claims about Allah without knowledge or proof. The interpretation is that we should resist Satan's whispers and avoid succumbing to his evil suggestions, as they lead us away from the straight path and into misguidance.
orig: إنما يأمركم بالسوء والفحشاء وأن تقولوا على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Follow what Allah has revealed,' they say, 'Rather, we will follow that upon which we found our fathers,' even though their fathers did not understand anything, nor were they guided?
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who blindly follow the traditions and practices of their forefathers without questioning or using their intellect. It highlights the importance of following the guidance revealed by Allah instead of adhering to inherited customs that may lack wisdom or divine guidance. The verse emphasizes the need to use one's reasoning abilities and seek true guidance, rather than clinging to inherited beliefs or practices that lack substance or divine sanction.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتبعوا ما أنزل الله قالوا بل نتبع ما ألفينا عليه آباءنا أولو كان آباؤهم لا يعقلون شيئا ولا يهتدون

translation: And the example of those who disbelieved is like that of one who shouts at what hears nothing but calls and cries; deaf, dumb, and blind, so they do not understand.
interpretation: This verse compares the disbelievers to someone who shouts at something that cannot hear or respond, like shouting at animals. Just as animals cannot comprehend human speech, the disbelievers are spiritually deaf, dumb, and blind, unable to comprehend the truth and guidance of God"s revelations.
orig: ومثل الذين كفروا كمثل الذي ينعق بما لا يسمع إلا دعاء ونداء صم بكم عمي فهم لا يعقلون

translation: O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you and be grateful to Allah if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to consume only the pure and lawful provisions that Allah has bestowed upon them, and to express gratitude to Him if they truly worship and obey Him alone. It emphasizes the importance of being thankful for Allah's blessings and maintaining a pure and permissible lifestyle in accordance with one's faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم واشكروا لله إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: Prohibited to you are dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah . But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], there is no sin upon him. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse outlines the prohibited foods for Muslims: carrion, blood, pork, and animals slaughtered in the name of any deity other than Allah. However, if one is compelled by necessity and does not intend to violate the prohibition or exceed the limits, then consuming the prohibited items is permissible and not considered a sin. This is because Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards those in dire need.
orig: إنما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل به لغير الله فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فلا إثم عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who conceal what Allah has sent down of the Book and exchange it for a small price - those consume not into their bellies except the Fire. And Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them. And they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against concealing or distorting the teachings of Allah's Book (the Qur'an) for worldly gains. Those who do so will be consuming nothing but the Fire of Hell. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will not speak to them or purify them, and they will face a painful punishment. It emphasizes the grave sin of tampering with Allah's revelations for personal interests or worldly benefits.
orig: إن الذين يكتمون ما أنزل الله من الكتاب ويشترون به ثمنا قليلا أولئك ما يأكلون في بطونهم إلا النار ولا يكلمهم الله يوم القيامة ولا يزكيهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Those are the ones who have bought error in exchange for guidance, and punishment in exchange for forgiveness. How patient they will be in [enduring] the Fire!
interpretation: This verse refers to those who rejected faith and chose misguidance over guidance from Allah. They preferred disbelief and disobedience, which leads to punishment, over seeking forgiveness and following the truth. Their choice will result in them being subjected to the torment of Hellfire, which they will have to endure patiently since they opted for it over Allah's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: أولئك الذين اشتروا الضلالة بالهدى والعذاب بالمغفرة فما أصبرهم على النار

translation: That is because Allah has sent down the Book in truth; and indeed, those who differed over the Book are in extreme dissension.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the reason for the differences and disputes among people regarding the Book (the Qur'an) is because some have deviated from the truth that Allah has revealed in it. Those who differ from the clear teachings of the Qur'an and argue against it are in extreme opposition and divergence from the straight path.
orig: ذلك بأن الله نزل الكتاب بالحق وإن الذين اختلفوا في الكتاب لفي شقاق بعيد

translation: It is not righteousness that you turn your faces toward the east or the west, but true righteousness is in one who believes in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Book, and the prophets and gives wealth, in spite of love for it, to relatives, orphans, the needy, the traveler, and those who ask, and [freed] those in bondage; [and who] establishes prayer and gives zakah; [those who] fulfill their promise when they promise; and [those who] are patient in poverty and hardship and during battle. Those are the ones who have been true, and it is those who are the righteous.
interpretation: La verdadera rectitud y piedad no radica en voltear el rostro hacia el oriente u occidente durante la oración, sino en tener fe en Dios, el Día del Juicio Final, los ángeles, los libros revelados y los profetas. Además, implica dar de los bienes propios, a pesar del amor por ellos, a los parientes, huérfanos, necesitados, viajeros y mendigos; liberar a los cautivos y esclavos; realizar la oración y pagar el zakat. También significa cumplir las promesas, ser paciente en la pobreza, adversidad y durante la batalla. Estas son las cualidades de los verdaderamente piadosos y temerosos de Dios.
orig: ليس البر أن تولوا وجوهكم قبل المشرق والمغرب ولكن البر من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر والملائكة والكتاب والنبيين وآتى المال على حبه ذوي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل والسائلين وفي الرقاب وأقام الصلاة وآتى الزكاة والموفون بعهدهم إذا عاهدوا والصابرين في البأساء والضراء وحين البأس أولئك الذين صدقوا وأولئك هم المتقون

translation: O you who have believed, prescribed for you is legal retribution for those murdered - the free for the free, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female. But whoever is pardoned by his brother anything, then there should be a suitable follow-up and payment to him with good conduct. This is an alleviation from your Lord and a mercy. But whoever transgresses after that will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of equal retaliation (qisas) for murder, where a free person is executed for killing a free person, a slave for killing a slave, and a woman for killing a woman. However, the victim's heir has the option to forgive and accept blood money instead. This allowance for forgiveness and financial compensation is described as a "mercy from God." The verse warns that anyone who exceeds these limits after forgiveness is granted will face a severe punishment.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كتب عليكم القصاص في القتلى الحر بالحر والعبد بالعبد والأنثى بالأنثى فمن عفي له من أخيه شيء فاتباع بالمعروف وأداء إليه بإحسان ذلك تخفيف من ربكم ورحمة فمن اعتدى بعد ذلك فله عذاب أليم

translation: And there is life for you in legal retribution, O people of understanding, that you may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom behind the law of retribution (qisas) in Islamic law. It states that preserving this law leads to life and safety for society. By implementing just punishment for crimes, it serves as a deterrent against further violence and chaos. The verse addresses those with sound intellect, urging them to contemplate the benefits of this law in promoting righteousness, security, and preventing oppression.
orig: ولكم في القصاص حياة يا أولي الألباب لعلكم تتقون

translation: It is prescribed for you, when death approaches any of you, if he leaves wealth, that he makes a bequest to parents and near relatives according to what is acceptable - a duty upon the righteous.
interpretation: This verse enjoins Muslims to make a will or testament when death approaches, leaving a portion of their wealth to their parents and close relatives in accordance with Islamic teachings and principles. It emphasizes the importance of fulfilling this obligation as a duty upon those who fear Allah and strive to obey His commands.
orig: كتب عليكم إذا حضر أحدكم الموت إن ترك خيرا الوصية للوالدين والأقربين بالمعروف حقا على المتقين

translation: So whoever changes it after having heard it, the sin for that falls only upon those who change it. Surely Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse warns against distorting or altering the words of Allah after receiving them. It states that the sin of changing or misinterpreting the divine revelation lies solely upon those who deliberately alter it after hearing and understanding it correctly. Allah is All-Hearing, being aware of any attempt to distort His words, and All-Knowing, cognizant of the intentions behind such alterations.
orig: فمن بدله بعدما سمعه فإنما إثمه على الذين يبدلونه إن الله سميع عليم

translation: But if one fears from the testator some injustice or sin, and brings about a settlement among them, there is no blame on him. Truly, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reconciliation and settlement in cases where there is a concern of injustice or sin from the testator (the person leaving a will). It encourages resolving disputes amicably, and states that there is no blame on the one who facilitates such a settlement. The verse highlights Allah's forgiveness and mercy, indicating that seeking a just resolution is in line with divine principles.
orig: فمن خاف من موص جنفا أو إثما فأصلح بينهم فلا إثم عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who believe! Observing As-Saum (the fasting) is prescribed for you as it was prescribed for those before you, that you may become Al-Muttaqun (the pious).
interpretation: "The interpretation is that fasting has been made obligatory upon the believers, just as it was obligated upon the previous nations before them. The wisdom behind this obligation is to attain piety and God-consciousness by restraining one's desires and strengthening one's willpower."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كتب عليكم الصيام كما كتب على الذين من قبلكم لعلكم تتقون

translation: For a few days. So whoever among you is ill or on a journey [during them] - then an equal number of days [are to be made up]. And upon those who are able [to fast, but did not] - a ransom of feeding a poor person [each day]. And whoever volunteers good [by way of charity] - it is better for him. But to fast is best for you, if only you knew.
interpretation: Selon cette interprétation, les musulmans en bonne santé qui ne jeûnent pas pendant le mois de Ramadan sans raison valable doivent expier en nourrissant un pauvre pour chaque jour manqué. Cependant, s'ils le peuvent, il est préférable de jeûner car c'est une meilleure action. Le verset encourage à faire preuve de piété et de bienfaisance envers les pauvres, tout en soulignant l'importance du jeûne pour les musulmans en bonne santé.
orig: أياما معدودات فمن كان منكم مريضا أو على سفر فعدة من أيام أخر وعلى الذين يطيقونه فدية طعام مسكين فمن تطوع خيرا فهو خير له وأن تصوموا خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: The month of Ramadan is that in which the Qur'an was revealed, a guidance for mankind and clear proofs for the guidance and the criterion. So whoever of you sights the month, let him fast it; and whoever is ill or on a journey - then an equal number of other days. Allah intends for you ease and does not intend for you hardship and [wants] for you to complete the period and to glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and perhaps you will be grateful.
interpretation: Allah decreed fasting in Ramadan as an act of worship and obedience to Him, to develop God-consciousness and self-restraint. It is a means of spiritual purification and an opportunity to express gratitude for the guidance of the Qur'an. The concessions for travelers and the ill reflect Allah's mercy and ease in religious obligations.
orig: شهر رمضان الذي أنزل فيه القرآن هدى للناس وبينات من الهدى والفرقان فمن شهد منكم الشهر فليصمه ومن كان مريضا أو على سفر فعدة من أيام أخر يريد الله بكم اليسر ولا يريد بكم العسر ولتكملوا العدة ولتكبروا الله على ما هداكم ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And when My servants ask you concerning Me, then surely I am near. I answer the call of the caller when he calls on Me, so they should answer My call and believe in Me that they may be led aright.
interpretation: This verse highlights the closeness of Allah to His servants and His readiness to respond to their supplications. It encourages the believers to turn to Allah in prayer and have faith in Him, as this is the path to guidance and righteousness. The verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining a strong connection with Allah through worship and supplication, and promises that those who do so will be guided towards the right path.
orig: وإذا سألك عبادي عني فإني قريب أجيب دعوة الداع إذا دعان فليستجيبوا لي وليؤمنوا بي لعلهم يرشدون

translation: On the night of the fasts it is permitted for you to go in unto your wives. They are as a garment for you and you are as a garment for them. Allah is aware that you have been betraying yourselves, so He has turned towards you and pardoned you. Now you can lie with them and seek what Allah has ordained for you, and eat and drink until the white thread becomes distinct from the black thread of the dawn. Then resume the fast until night and do not touch them while you are in retreat in the mosques. Those are the limits set by Allah, so do not come near them. Thus does Allah make clear His revelations to the people, that they may guard themselves against evil.
interpretation: Allah permits intimacy between spouses during the nights of fasting, as they are a source of comfort and protection for each other. He is aware of the difficulties people face in abstaining from desires, so He pardons them and allows them to seek intimacy at night. However, they must stop intimacy at dawn and resume fasting until night. This verse establishes the boundaries of permissible behavior during fasting and emphasizes the importance of following Allah's commands to attain piety.
orig: أحل لكم ليلة الصيام الرفث إلى نسائكم هن لباس لكم وأنتم لباس لهن علم الله أنكم كنتم تختانون أنفسكم فتاب عليكم وعفا عنكم فالآن باشروهن وابتغوا ما كتب الله لكم وكلوا واشربوا حتى يتبين لكم الخيط الأبيض من الخيط الأسود من الفجر ثم أتموا الصيام إلى الليل ولا تباشروهن وأنتم عاكفون في المساجد تلك حدود الله فلا تقربوها كذلك يبين الله آياته للناس لعلهم يتقون

translation: And do not consume one another's wealth unjustly or send it [in bribery] to the rulers in order that [they might aid] you [to] consume a portion of the wealth of the people in sin, while you know [it is unlawful].
interpretation: This verse prohibits acquiring wealth through unlawful means such as bribery, corruption, fraud, or any form of injustice. It warns against giving bribes to rulers or officials to gain an unfair advantage or to wrongfully consume others' wealth. Such actions are considered sinful and a violation of Islamic principles of justice and fairness.
orig: ولا تأكلوا أموالكم بينكم بالباطل وتدلوا بها إلى الحكام لتأكلوا فريقا من أموال الناس بالإثم وأنتم تعلمون

translation: They ask you about the new moons. Say, 'They are measures of time for the people and for Hajj.' And it is not righteousness to enter houses from the back; but righteousness is [in] one who fears Allah. And enter houses from their doors. And fear Allah that you may succeed.
interpretation: This verse is addressing questions about the significance of the new moons. It states that the new moons mark the timings for various practices and rituals, including the Hajj pilgrimage. However, righteousness is not defined by superficial actions like entering houses from the back. True righteousness comes from having consciousness of Allah and fearing Him. The verse instructs people to enter houses through their proper doors as a metaphor for following the right path ordained by Allah in order to attain success and salvation.
orig: يسألونك عن الأهلة قل هي مواقيت للناس والحج وليس البر بأن تأتوا البيوت من ظهورها ولكن البر من اتقى وأتوا البيوت من أبوابها واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And fight in the cause of Allah those who fight you, but do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to fight against those who fight them in the cause of Allah, but it prohibits transgression and oppression. It emphasizes that Allah does not love those who exceed the limits and transgress against others. The interpretation is that Muslims are permitted to engage in defensive warfare, but they must adhere to the principles of justice and avoid any form of aggression or oppression against their enemies. The verse promotes moderation and restraint, even in the midst of conflict.
orig: وقاتلوا في سبيل الله الذين يقاتلونكم ولا تعتدوا إن الله لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And kill them wherever you overtake them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you, and fitnah is worse than killing. And do not fight them at al-Masjid al- Haram until they fight you there. But if they fight you, then kill them. Such is the recompense of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is referring to a specific historical context of fighting against the pagan Meccans who had expelled Muslims from their homes. It allows defensive fighting against the aggressors, but prohibits initiating hostilities at the sacred mosque in Mecca. The interpretation emphasizes that this is not a blanket command for violence, but a contextual permission for self-defense against persecution and oppression. The "fitnah" mentioned is the oppression and persecution inflicted on believers for their faith.
orig: واقتلوهم حيث ثقفتموهم وأخرجوهم من حيث أخرجوكم والفتنة أشد من القتل ولا تقاتلوهم عند المسجد الحرام حتى يقاتلوكم فيه فإن قاتلوكم فاقتلوهم كذلك جزاء الكافرين

translation: But if they cease, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness. It suggests that if those who have strayed from the right path repent and cease their wrongdoings, Allah will forgive them and shower them with His boundless mercy. The verse emphasizes Allah's willingness to pardon those who sincerely repent and turn back to Him, regardless of the severity of their sins. It serves as a reminder of Allah's compassionate nature and encourages people to seek forgiveness and reform themselves, as Allah's mercy knows no bounds.
orig: فإن انتهوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion [i.e. worship] is for Allah. But if they cease, then there is to be no aggression except against the oppressors.
interpretation: This verse instructs Muslims to fight against those who wage war against them or oppress them for their faith, until there is no more persecution (fitnah) and the religion of Islam can be practiced freely. However, if the aggressors cease their hostilities, then Muslims should not continue fighting, except against those who persist in oppression and injustice.
orig: وقاتلوهم حتى لا تكون فتنة ويكون الدين لله فإن انتهوا فلا عدوان إلا على الظالمين

translation: The sacred month for the sacred month, and violations are punished in kind. If anyone aggresses against you, you may aggress against them to an equal extent, and be mindful of God, and know that God is with the God-revering.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of proportional retaliation in the case of violations committed during the sacred months. It allows Muslims to reciprocate against aggressors to the same degree, but no more. However, it also reminds believers to maintain consciousness of God and act with restraint, as God is with those who are mindful of Him.
orig: الشهر الحرام بالشهر الحرام والحرمات قصاص فمن اعتدى عليكم فاعتدوا عليه بمثل ما اعتدى عليكم واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: And spend in the way of Allah and do not throw [yourselves] with your [own] hands into destruction. And do good; indeed, Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse encourages spending and giving in the cause of Allah, which includes all good deeds and acts of worship. It also prohibits destructive behavior that could lead to harm or ruin. The verse emphasizes the importance of doing good and being virtuous, as Allah loves those who do good deeds and strive for righteousness.
orig: وأنفقوا في سبيل الله ولا تلقوا بأيديكم إلى التهلكة وأحسنوا إن الله يحب المحسنين

translation: And complete the Hajj and 'Umrah for Allah. But if you are prevented, then [offer] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal has reached its place of slaughter. And whoever among you is ill or has an ailment of the head [making shaving required], then [he must offer] a ransom of fasting or charity or sacrifice. And when you are secure, then whoever performs 'Umrah [during the Hajj months] followed by Hajj [offers] what can be obtained with ease of sacrificial animals. And whoever cannot find [or afford such an animal] - then a fast of three days during Hajj and of seven when you have returned [home]. Those are ten complete [days]. This is for those whose family does not reside near al-Masjid al-Haraam. And fear Allah and know that Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse outlines the rites and obligations of Hajj and 'Umrah. It instructs the believers to complete these rituals for the sake of Allah. If they are prevented from doing so due to circumstances beyond their control, they should offer a sacrificial animal if possible. If they cannot afford it, they should fast, give charity, or offer a sacrifice as an alternative. The verse also covers the rules regarding shaving one's head during Hajj and the penalties for violating these rules. It emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and being mindful of His severe punishment for those who disobey His commands.
orig: وأتموا الحج والعمرة لله فإن أحصرتم فما استيسر من الهدي ولا تحلقوا رءوسكم حتى يبلغ الهدي محله فمن كان منكم مريضا أو به أذى من رأسه ففدية من صيام أو صدقة أو نسك فإذا أمنتم فمن تمتع بالعمرة إلى الحج فما استيسر من الهدي فمن لم يجد فصيام ثلاثة أيام في الحج وسبعة إذا رجعتم تلك عشرة كاملة ذلك لمن لم يكن أهله حاضري المسجد الحرام واتقوا الله واعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب

translation: The Hajj is [during] well-known months, so whoever has made Hajj obligatory upon himself therein [by entering the state of ihram], there is [to be for him] no sexual relations and no disobedience and no disputing during Hajj. And whatever good you do - Allah knows it. And take provisions, but indeed, the best provision is fear of Allah. And fear Me, O you of understanding.
interpretation: This verse outlines the rules and etiquette for performing the Hajj pilgrimage. It specifies that the Hajj must be performed during the well-known sacred months. During this period, those undertaking the Hajj must abstain from sexual relations, disobedience to Allah, and arguing or quarreling. Any good deeds performed during this time are known to Allah. The verse also advises taking provisions for the journey, but emphasizes that the best provision is piety and consciousness of Allah. It is a call to those of understanding to fear Allah and follow His commands.
orig: الحج أشهر معلومات فمن فرض فيهن الحج فلا رفث ولا فسوق ولا جدال في الحج وما تفعلوا من خير يعلمه الله وتزودوا فإن خير الزاد التقوى واتقون يا أولي الألباب

translation: There is no blame upon you for seeking bounty from your Lord. But when you depart from 'Arafat, then remember Allah at al-Mash'ar al-Haraam. And remember Him as He has guided you, although before you were among those astray.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the pilgrims performing Hajj. It tells them that there is no sin in seeking provision and bounties from Allah during Hajj. After they leave 'Arafat, which is a key ritual in Hajj, they should remember Allah and glorify Him at al-Mash'ar al-Haraam, which is a sacred place. They should praise Allah for guiding them to the truth, as before embracing Islam, they were among those who were misguided.
orig: ليس عليكم جناح أن تبتغوا فضلا من ربكم فإذا أفضتم من عرفات فاذكروا الله عند المشعر الحرام واذكروه كما هداكم وإن كنتم من قبله لمن الضالين

translation: Then depart from the place whence the people depart, and ask Allah's forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to leave the sacred sites of pilgrimage in the same manner as others, without lingering or performing any rituals not prescribed by Allah. It also encourages them to seek forgiveness from Allah, acknowledging His infinite mercy and willingness to pardon those who repent sincerely.
orig: ثم أفيضوا من حيث أفاض الناس واستغفروا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: So when you have completed your rites, then remember Allah as you used to remember your fathers or with [much] greater remembrance. Among the people is he who says, 'Our Lord, give us in this world,' and he will have in the Hereafter no share.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to remember and glorify Allah after completing their Hajj rituals, just as they used to remember and glorify their forefathers or even more fervently. However, it also warns against those who are solely focused on worldly gains and have no concern for the Hereafter, as they will have no share in the rewards of the Afterlife.
orig: فإذا قضيتم مناسككم فاذكروا الله كذكركم آباءكم أو أشد ذكرا فمن الناس من يقول ربنا آتنا في الدنيا وما له في الآخرة من خلاق

translation: And among them is he who says, 'Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who seek both worldly and spiritual goodness. They ask Allah for a good life in this world by being granted provisions, health, and security. At the same time, they seek a good life in the Hereafter by attaining Paradise and being saved from the punishment of Hellfire. It highlights the balanced approach of seeking both material and spiritual well-being while prioritizing the Hereafter.
orig: ومنهم من يقول ربنا آتنا في الدنيا حسنة وفي الآخرة حسنة وقنا عذاب النار

translation: Those will have a share of what they have earned, and Allah is swift in reckoning.
interpretation: This verse indicates that each person will be held accountable for their deeds and will receive a fair recompense based on their actions. The phrase "Allah is swift in reckoning" suggests that the judgment and reward or punishment will be administered swiftly and justly by God.
orig: أولئك لهم نصيب مما كسبوا والله سريع الحساب

translation: And remember Allah during [specific] numbered days. Then whoever hurries [his departure] in two days - there is no sin upon him, and whoever delays [until the third] - there is no sin upon him - for him who maintains taqwa. And be mindful of Allah, and know that unto Him you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse is instructing the believers to remember and glorify Allah during the specific days of Tashreeq, which are the three days following Eid al-Adha. It allows those performing Hajj to hasten their departure from Mina after two days, or to delay their departure until the third day, without incurring any sin, as long as they maintain taqwa (piety and consciousness of Allah). The verse emphasizes the importance of being mindful of Allah and reminds the believers that they will ultimately be gathered before Him for judgment.
orig: واذكروا الله في أيام معدودات فمن تعجل في يومين فلا إثم عليه ومن تأخر فلا إثم عليه لمن اتقى واتقوا الله واعلموا أنكم إليه تحشرون

translation: And of the people is he whose speech pleases you in worldly life, and he calls Allah as witness upon what is in his heart, yet he is the fiercest of opponents.
interpretation: This verse refers to hypocrites who outwardly say pleasing words and claim to be believers, but inwardly harbor animosity and opposition. They use Allah's name to swear and claim truthfulness, but their hearts are filled with stubbornness and enmity towards the truth. They are described as the "fiercest of opponents" due to their intense hostility and relentless efforts to undermine the believers.
orig: ومن الناس من يعجبك قوله في الحياة الدنيا ويشهد الله على ما في قلبه وهو ألد الخصام

translation: And when he goes away, he strives throughout the land to cause corruption therein and destroy crops and animals. And Allah does not like corruption.
interpretation: This verse refers to the destructive nature of those who reject faith and truth. When they turn away from guidance, they actively work to spread corruption and ruin in the world, harming agriculture, livestock, and the means of sustenance for people. Their actions are driven by a desire to undermine order and create chaos. Allah condemns such corruption and does not approve of those who engage in destructive behavior that harms society and the environment.
orig: وإذا تولى سعى في الأرض ليفسد فيها ويهلك الحرث والنسل والله لا يحب الفساد

translation: And when it is said to him, 'Fear Allah,' pride in sin entices him. So sufficient for him is Hellfire, and worst indeed is that resting place.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant and sinful person who, when advised to fear Allah and refrain from sin, is overcome by pride and persists in disobedience. The interpretation is that such a person's arrogance and attachment to sin will lead him to Hellfire, which is a terrible abode and an unfit "resting place" for any soul.
orig: وإذا قيل له اتق الله أخذته العزة بالإثم فحسبه جهنم ولبئس المهاد

translation: And among the people is he who sells himself, seeking the pleasure of Allah. And Allah is Kind to the servants.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who sacrifice their lives and wealth in the cause of Allah, seeking His pleasure and reward. They sell their souls and possessions for the sake of Allah, putting their faith above all worldly gains. It praises their sincerity and devotion, and affirms that Allah is Merciful and Compassionate towards such devoted believers.
orig: ومن الناس من يشري نفسه ابتغاء مرضات الله والله رءوف بالعباد

translation: O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse is a call for the believers to fully embrace Islam and submit themselves completely to Allah's commands. It warns them against following the footsteps of Satan, who is an avowed enemy seeking to misguide them. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of firm faith, obedience to Allah, and rejecting the evil whispers and temptations of Satan.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ادخلوا في السلم كافة ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: But if you slip after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: "If you deviate from the right path and commit sins after the clear signs and proofs have come to you from Allah, then know that Allah is Mighty, able to punish you, and Wise in His legislation and commands."
orig: فإن زللتم من بعد ما جاءتكم البينات فاعلموا أن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: Do they await but that Allah should come to them in covers of clouds with angels and the matter is already decided? And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers are arrogantly awaiting for Allah to come to them with clear evidence, surrounded by angels, so that they may believe. However, the verse emphasizes that when the matter is decided by Allah, all matters will ultimately return to Him for judgment and reckoning.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن يأتيهم الله في ظلل من الغمام والملائكة وقضي الأمر وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: Ask the Children of Israel how many clear signs We have given them. And whoever changes the favor of Allah after it has come to him - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse is a call to reflect on the numerous favors and clear signs that Allah has bestowed upon the Children of Israel throughout history. It serves as a reminder of Allah's blessings and a warning against ingratitude and altering His favors after receiving them. The verse emphasizes that whoever changes or distorts the favors of Allah after they have been granted to them will face severe punishment from Allah.
orig: سل بني إسرائيل كم آتيناهم من آية بينة ومن يبدل نعمة الله من بعد ما جاءته فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: Beautified is the life of this world for those who disbelieve, and they ridicule those who believe. But those who fear Allah are above them on the Day of Resurrection. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.
interpretation: This verse highlights the temporary nature of the worldly life for those who disbelieve and mock the believers. It contrasts their arrogant attitude with the elevated status of the righteous on the Day of Resurrection. It also emphasizes that true provision and sustenance come from Allah alone, without any limits or conditions.
orig: زين للذين كفروا الحياة الدنيا ويسخرون من الذين آمنوا والذين اتقوا فوقهم يوم القيامة والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: Mankind was one community, and Allah sent Prophets as bearers of good tidings and warners, and sent down with them the Book with truth to judge between people concerning that in which they differed. And none differed over it except those who were given it after the clear proofs had come to them, out of jealous animosity among themselves. And Allah guided those who believed to the truth of that over which they had differed, by His permission. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unity of humanity and the purpose of sending prophets with divine scriptures, which is to guide people to the truth and resolve their disputes. Initially, all people were one community, but differences arose due to jealousy and animosity towards the truth. Allah guided the believers to the truth concerning the matters they differed upon, by His grace and permission. Ultimately, Allah guides whomever He wills to the straight path.
orig: كان الناس أمة واحدة فبعث الله النبيين مبشرين ومنذرين وأنزل معهم الكتاب بالحق ليحكم بين الناس فيما اختلفوا فيه وما اختلف فيه إلا الذين أوتوه من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات بغيا بينهم فهدى الله الذين آمنوا لما اختلفوا فيه من الحق بإذنه والله يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trial] has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even] the Messenger and those who believed with him said, 'When is the help of Allah?' Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that trials and difficulties are a natural part of the path towards Paradise. It highlights that previous nations also faced adversity and hardship before achieving success.
