orig: فإن حاجوك فقل أسلمت وجهي لله ومن اتبعن وقل للذين أوتوا الكتاب والأميين أأسلمتم فإن أسلموا فقد اهتدوا وإن تولوا فإنما عليك البلاغ والله بصير بالعباد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who reject Allah's revelations, kill the prophets unjustly, and murder people who uphold justice and equity. It warns such transgressors of a severe and agonizing punishment for their grave sins of disbelief, oppression, and spreading corruption on earth.
orig: إن الذين يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون النبيين بغير حق ويقتلون الذين يأمرون بالقسط من الناس فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: Those are the ones whose works are nullified in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse refers to those whose deeds and efforts have been rendered futile and worthless in this life and the Hereafter due to their disbelief, disobedience, and rejection of faith. They will have no one to help, support, or save them from Allah's punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: أولئك الذين حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Book of Allah that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are averse.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocritical behavior of some People of the Scripture who were given knowledge of the divine revelations but refused to submit to the teachings of the Qur'an when called upon to do so. Despite being invited to accept the Qur'an as the final arbiter of truth, a group among them arrogantly turned away, rejecting its guidance due to their stubborn opposition.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يدعون إلى كتاب الله ليحكم بينهم ثم يتولى فريق منهم وهم معرضون

translation: That is because they said, 'The Fire will never touch us except for a few numbered days,' and they were deluded in their religion by what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse explains the reason behind the disbelievers' arrogance and denial of the truth. They falsely believed that even if the Fire of Hell exists, it would only touch them for a few numbered days and then they would be free from it. This erroneous belief misguided them in their religion, leading them to invent lies and falsehoods about Allah's laws and the Hereafter.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا لن تمسنا النار إلا أياما معدودات وغرهم في دينهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: So how will it be when We gather them for a Day about which there is no doubt, and each soul will be fully compensated for what it earned, and they will not be wronged?
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be gathered before Allah. It emphasizes that on that Day, there will be no doubt or uncertainty, and each person will be fully recompensed for their deeds in this world, whether good or bad. No one will be wronged or treated unjustly; rather, everyone will receive their just recompense according to their actions.
orig: فكيف إذا جمعناهم ليوم لا ريب فيه ووفيت كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say, "O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and power over all affairs. He alone is the true owner and bestower of authority, honor, and dignity. Whatever a person possesses of power, wealth, or status is only by Allah's will and decree. He gives it to whomever He wills and takes it away from whomever He wills, according to His perfect wisdom and justice. The verse reminds us to be humble, to recognize that all good is in Allah's hands, and to trust in His might over all things.
orig: قل اللهم مالك الملك تؤتي الملك من تشاء وتنزع الملك ممن تشاء وتعز من تشاء وتذل من تشاء بيدك الخير إنك على كل شيء قدير

translation: He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night. And He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living. And He gives provision to whom He wills without measure.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and control over the universe. The merging of night and day refers to the continuous cycle of darkness and light, symbolizing the alternation of life and death. Allah has the ability to bring forth life from death, such as plants growing from seeds, and to bring about death from life, as all living beings eventually perish. Moreover, He provides sustenance to whomever He wills without limit, demonstrating His infinite mercy and generosity.
orig: تولج الليل في النهار وتولج النهار في الليل وتخرج الحي من الميت وتخرج الميت من الحي وترزق من تشاء بغير حساب

translation: Let not the believers take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. And whoever does that has no relation with Allah, unless you but guard yourselves against them, guarding carefully. And Allah cautions you against His punishment. And to Allah is the final return.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers not to take disbelievers as close allies or protectors instead of other believers. It warns that whoever forms such an alliance with disbelievers has severed their relationship with Allah, unless it is done out of prudence and caution to protect oneself from harm. The verse reminds the believers that Allah warns them against disobeying Him and that ultimately, everyone will return to Allah for judgment.
orig: لا يتخذ المؤمنون الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين ومن يفعل ذلك فليس من الله في شيء إلا أن تتقوا منهم تقاة ويحذركم الله نفسه وإلى الله المصير

translation: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knows it. And He knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent."
interpretation: Allah knows all the secrets that people conceal in their hearts, as well as what they reveal openly. His knowledge encompasses everything in the heavens and the earth. He is All-Powerful and has complete authority over all things.
orig: قل إن تخفوا ما في صدوركم أو تبدوه يعلمه الله ويعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: On the Day when every soul will find itself confronted with all the good it has done, and all the evil it has done, [every soul] will wish there were a great distance between it and that [evil]. And Allah warns you of Himself, and Allah is Kind to [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment, when each person will be confronted with all their deeds, both good and evil. They will wish for a great distance between themselves and their evil deeds, regretting and wanting to be dissociated from them. Allah warns people against disobeying Him, as He has perfect knowledge of all their actions. However, Allah is also Merciful and Kind to those who repent and turn to Him.
orig: يوم تجد كل نفس ما عملت من خير محضرا وما عملت من سوء تود لو أن بينها وبينه أمدا بعيدا ويحذركم الله نفسه والله رءوف بالعباد

translation: Say, "If you love Allah, then follow me, Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad as a manifestation of love for Allah. It promises that those who follow the Prophet will be loved by Allah and will have their sins forgiven, as Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards the believers.
orig: قل إن كنتم تحبون الله فاتبعوني يحببكم الله ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Say, 'Obey Allah and the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Allah rests only what is laid upon Him, and upon you rests what is laid upon you. And if you obey him, you will be guided. And there is nothing upon the Messenger except to convey clearly.'
interpretation: This verse commands obedience to Allah and His Messenger. It warns that if people turn away from this obedience, Allah does not love the disbelievers. The Messenger's duty is only to convey the message clearly, and it is up to people to accept guidance or face the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: قل أطيعوا الله والرسول فإن تولوا فإن الله لا يحب الكافرين

translation: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of Imran over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's selection and preference of certain individuals and families over others. It highlights the honor and status bestowed upon Adam, Noah, the family of Abraham (which includes prophets like Ismail, Isaac, and Jacob), and the family of Imran (which includes figures like Maryam and Isa). This selection is based on their piety, righteousness, and their role in conveying Allah's message to humanity. It emphasizes that Allah's favor is not indiscriminate but rather based on spiritual excellence and obedience to His commands.
orig: إن الله اصطفى آدم ونوحا وآل إبراهيم وآل عمران على العالمين

translation: Offspring, some of them from others. And Allah is All-Hearer, All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse refers to the continuity of human generations, where one generation descends from the previous one. It emphasizes that all human beings are interconnected, originating from the same source. Additionally, it highlights Allah's attributes of being All-Hearing and All-Knowing, reminding us that He is aware of all His creations and their relationships.
orig: ذرية بعضها من بعض والله سميع عليم

translation: When the wife of 'Imran said: 'O my Lord! I have vowed to You what is in my womb to be dedicated for Your services, so accept this from me. Verily, You are the All-Hearer, the All-Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the vow made by the mother of Mary, the wife of 'Imran, dedicating her unborn child to the service of God. It shows her sincere devotion and trust in God, as she humbly asks Him to accept her offering. The verse highlights God's attributes of being the All-Hearer, who hears all supplications, and the All-Knowing, who knows the intentions behind every action.
orig: إذ قالت امرأت عمران رب إني نذرت لك ما في بطني محررا فتقبل مني إنك أنت السميع العليم

translation: So when she delivered her, she said, 'My Lord, I have delivered a female' - and Allah knew better what she had delivered, and the male is not like the female, 'And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah].'
interpretation: Cette interprétation exprime la reconnaissance de la mère envers Dieu pour cette naissance, même si elle a accouché d'une fille plutôt que d'un garçon comme elle l'espérait peut-être. Elle reconnaît la supériorité de la connaissance de Dieu et demande Sa protection pour sa fille Marie et sa descendance contre Satan le maudit.
orig: فلما وضعتها قالت رب إني وضعتها أنثى والله أعلم بما وضعت وليس الذكر كالأنثى وإني سميتها مريم وإني أعيذها بك وذريتها من الشيطان الرجيم

translation: So her Lord accepted her with a gracious acceptance, and facilitated her growth into a good upbringing; and entrusted her to the care of Zechariah. Whenever Zechariah visited her in the sanctuary, he found her provisioned with food. He said, 'O Mary, from where does this come for you?' She said, 'It is from God. Truly, God provides for whomever He wills without reckoning.'
interpretation: This verse highlights God's grace and favor upon Mary, who was accepted and nurtured by Him in the best way. He entrusted her care to the Prophet Zechariah, who was amazed to find her miraculously provided with sustenance. This demonstrates God's power to provide for His servants without measure or accounting, emphasizing His infinite mercy and wisdom.
orig: فتقبلها ربها بقبول حسن وأنبتها نباتا حسنا وكفلها زكريا كلما دخل عليها زكريا المحراب وجد عندها رزقا قال يا مريم أنى لك هذا قالت هو من عند الله إن الله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: There Zakariya invoked his Lord, saying: 'Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the supplication of Prophet Zakariya (Zechariah), who asked Allah to grant him a righteous child despite his old age and his wife's barrenness. He recognized Allah's ability to answer his prayer, describing Him as "the Hearer of supplication." This shows Zakariya's firm faith in Allah's power and his humble submission to Him.
orig: هنالك دعا زكريا ربه قال رب هب لي من لدنك ذرية طيبة إنك سميع الدعاء

translation: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, 'Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah, and [who will be] honorable, abstinent and a prophet from among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse signifies that while Zakariya was praying in the chamber, the angels gave him the glad tidings of a son named Yahya (John). This son would be a confirmation of Allah's word, an honorable and chaste person, and a prophet from among the righteous people. The interpretation highlights Allah's power to grant children even to those who are old and barren, as a mercy and favor from Him.
orig: فنادته الملائكة وهو قائم يصلي في المحراب أن الله يبشرك بيحيى مصدقا بكلمة من الله وسيدا وحصورا ونبيا من الصالحين

translation: He said: "O my Lord! How can I have a son when old age has overtaken me, and my wife is barren?" He said: "So (it will be), Allah does what He wills."
interpretation: "This verse refers to the conversation between Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) and Allah when he was granted a son despite his old age and his wife's barrenness. It highlights Allah's absolute power and ability to do whatever He wills, even that which seems impossible according to human understanding. It affirms that nothing is impossible for Allah and that His will prevails over all circumstances."
orig: قال رب أنى يكون لي غلام وقد بلغني الكبر وامرأتي عاقر قال كذلك الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: He said, 'My Lord, appoint for me a sign.' He said, 'Your sign is that you will not speak to people for three nights, [being] sound.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Prophet Zakariya asked Allah for a sign to confirm that he will be blessed with a child despite his old age and his wife's barrenness. Allah commanded him that the sign will be that he will not be able to speak to people for three days and nights, except through gestures. During this period, he was instructed to remember Allah frequently and glorify Him in the evenings and mornings.
orig: قال رب اجعل لي آية قال آيتك ألا تكلم الناس ثلاثة أيام إلا رمزا واذكر ربك كثيرا وسبح بالعشي والإبكار

translation: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds."
interpretation: "This verse highlights the special status of Mary in Islam. It indicates that God chose her, purified her from any impurities or sins, and elevated her above all other women of her time due to her piety, chastity, and devotion to God. This selection and purification prepared her for the great honor of giving birth to Jesus, a mighty prophet and messenger of God."
orig: وإذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله اصطفاك وطهرك واصطفاك على نساء العالمين

translation: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer].
interpretation: This verse is an instruction to Mary, the mother of Jesus, to worship Allah sincerely and humbly. It encourages her to prostrate and bow in prayer along with the believers. The verse highlights the importance of obedience, humility, and joining the community of believers in acts of worship.
orig: يا مريم اقنتي لربك واسجدي واركعي مع الراكعين

translation: This is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they were disputing.
interpretation: This story of Mary and the birth of Jesus is from the knowledge of the unseen, which Allah has revealed to you, O Prophet. You were not present when the priests cast their pens to decide which of them would be responsible for taking care of the infant Mary. Nor were you present when they were disputing over who should take charge of her upbringing.
orig: ذلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيه إليك وما كنت لديهم إذ يلقون أقلامهم أيهم يكفل مريم وما كنت لديهم إذ يختصمون

translation: When the angels said, 'O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].'
interpretation: This verse speaks of the glad tidings given to Mary by the angels, that she would bear a son who would be the Messiah, Jesus. It highlights his honored status in this world and the Hereafter, and that he would be among those close to Allah. The verse affirms Jesus" exalted position as a prophet and messenger of Allah.
orig: إذ قالت الملائكة يا مريم إن الله يبشرك بكلمة منه اسمه المسيح عيسى ابن مريم وجيها في الدنيا والآخرة ومن المقربين

translation: And he shall speak unto mankind in his cradle and in his manhood, and he is of the righteous ones.
interpretation: This verse refers to Jesus, peace be upon him, and highlights three of his miracles: speaking as a newborn in the cradle, speaking with wisdom in his adulthood, and being one of the righteous servants of God. It affirms Jesus' prophethood and his ability to perform miracles by the will of God, which distinguished him as a blessed and pious messenger.
orig: ويكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا ومن الصالحين

translation: She said: 'O my Lord! How shall I have a son when no man has touched me?' He said: 'Even so, Allah creates what He wills. When He decrees a thing, He only says to it 'Be' and it is.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah has the power to create anything He wills without the usual means. When He decides to create something, He simply says "Be" and it comes into existence. This shows Allah's absolute and unlimited power as the Creator of all things.
orig: قالت رب أنى يكون لي ولد ولم يمسسني بشر قال كذلك الله يخلق ما يشاء إذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: And He teaches him the Book and Wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah teaching Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) the Qur'an, which is the Book, as well as the wisdom and deeper understanding of religious teachings. It also mentions that Allah taught him the essence of the previous scriptures, the Torah and the Gospel, which were revealed to Prophet Moses and Prophet Jesus (peace be upon them), respectively. This highlights the continuity and unity of the divine message across different prophets and scriptures, and establishes the Qur'an as the final and complete revelation from Allah.
orig: ويعلمه الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل

translation: And (appoint him) a messenger to the Children of Israel, (with this message): 'I have come to you with a sign from your Lord. I design for you out of clay the figure of a bird, then I breathe into it, and it becomes a bird by Allah's permission. I heal the blind and the leprous, and I revive the dead by Allah's permission. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Surely, in this is a sign for you, if you are believers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the miracles granted to Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) as a sign of his prophethood from Allah. He was able to create a bird from clay and breathe life into it, heal the blind and those with leprosy, and even bring the dead back to life - all by Allah's permission. He could also inform people of what they had eaten and stored in their houses, which was a miracle of knowledge. These miracles were clear signs for the Children of Israel to believe in his message and prophethood if they were true believers.
orig: ورسولا إلى بني إسرائيل أني قد جئتكم بآية من ربكم أني أخلق لكم من الطين كهيئة الطير فأنفخ فيه فيكون طيرا بإذن الله وأبرئ الأكمه والأبرص وأحيي الموتى بإذن الله وأنبئكم بما تأكلون وما تدخرون في بيوتكم إن في ذلك لآية لكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.
interpretation: This verse refers to Jesus confirming the truth of the Torah that was revealed before him, and allowing some things that were forbidden in the previous scriptures. He also brings a sign or miracle from God as proof of his prophethood. The verse calls on people to have fear and obedience towards God.
orig: ومصدقا لما بين يدي من التوراة ولأحل لكم بعض الذي حرم عليكم وجئتكم بآية من ربكم فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of God (Allah) as the sole object of worship for all humanity. It emphasizes that Allah is the Lord and Sustainer of the Prophet Muhammad and all people. The phrase "a straight path" refers to the clear and correct way of life prescribed by Allah, which is the path of monotheism, obedience, and righteousness. The verse calls upon all people to worship Allah alone and follow His straight path, rejecting all forms of polytheism, idolatry, and deviation.
orig: إن الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: But when Jesus felt disbelief from them, he said, 'Who will be my helpers for God?' The disciples said, 'We are the helpers of God. We have believed in God, and bear witness that we have submitted.'
interpretation: This verse depicts the unwavering faith of Jesus' disciples in the face of disbelief from others. When Jesus sensed disbelief around him, he called upon his followers to stand firm in their support for God's cause. The disciples responded with a resounding declaration of their belief in God and their submission to Him, affirming their role as helpers in spreading God's message.
orig: فلما أحس عيسى منهم الكفر قال من أنصاري إلى الله قال الحواريون نحن أنصار الله آمنا بالله واشهد بأنا مسلمون

translation: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the Messenger, so register us among the witnesses.
interpretation: This verse expresses the believers' sincere desire to be counted among those who bear witness to the truth of Allah's revelation and the prophethood of Muhammad. It signifies their firm faith in the message sent down by Allah and their readiness to follow the teachings of the Prophet. The believers humbly ask Allah to accept their faith and obedience, and to include them among those who will testify to the truth on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ربنا آمنا بما أنزلت واتبعنا الرسول فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And they planned, and Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners.
interpretation: This verse refers to the plotting and scheming of the disbelievers against the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims. However, it emphasizes that Allah is the supreme planner, and His plan will ultimately prevail over the plots of the disbelievers. It serves as a reminder that while the enemies of Islam may devise schemes, Allah's wisdom and power surpass all human plotting, and He will protect His religion and His followers.
orig: ومكروا ومكر الله والله خير الماكرين

translation: When Allah said: 'O Jesus, I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.'
interpretation: This verse speaks of Allah's promise to Jesus that He will cause him to die a natural death, raise him up to Himself, purify him from the disbelievers, and make his followers superior over the disbelievers until the Day of Resurrection. It also indicates that all will ultimately return to Allah, who will judge between them regarding the matters they differed over.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى إني متوفيك ورافعك إلي ومطهرك من الذين كفروا وجاعل الذين اتبعوك فوق الذين كفروا إلى يوم القيامة ثم إلي مرجعكم فأحكم بينكم فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: As for those who disbelieved, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who reject faith and disbelieve in Allah and His revelations will face a severe punishment, both in this life and in the Hereafter. They will have no one to help or support them against Allah's punishment. The phrase "severe punishment" suggests the intensity and magnitude of the consequences for disbelief, while the mention of "this world and the Hereafter" highlights that the punishment will extend beyond this temporary life into the eternal life after death. The lack of "helpers" emphasizes their utter helplessness and inability to escape or mitigate this punishment.
orig: فأما الذين كفروا فأعذبهم عذابا شديدا في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse promises that those who have faith and perform good deeds will receive their full reward from Allah. It emphasizes that Allah does not love or support those who are unjust or oppressive, indicating that righteous conduct is essential for earning Allah's pleasure and reward.
orig: وأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيوفيهم أجورهم والله لا يحب الظالمين

translation: That is what We recite to you of the verses and the wise reminder.
interpretation: "This refers to the Qur'an, which Allah recites and reveals to the Prophet Muhammad through the angel Gabriel. It is described as 'verses' because it consists of clear signs and evidences, and a 'wise reminder' because it contains wisdom, guidance, and admonition for those who reflect upon it."
orig: ذلك نتلوه عليك من الآيات والذكر الحكيم

translation: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.
interpretation: This verse draws a parallel between the creation of Jesus and Adam. Just as Adam was created directly by Allah's command without a father, similarly Jesus was created by Allah's command "Be" without a father. This emphasizes the miraculous nature of Jesus' birth and his status as a servant and messenger of Allah, not a divine being or son of God.
orig: إن مثل عيسى عند الله كمثل آدم خلقه من تراب ثم قال له كن فيكون

translation: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an and its teachings are the absolute truth revealed by Allah. It advises the believers not to have any doubts or hesitations about the divine origin and veracity of the Qur'anic message. The believers should have firm faith and unwavering conviction in the revelations from their Lord.
orig: الحق من ربك فلا تكن من الممترين

translation: So whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, 'Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars.'
interpretation: This verse proposes a way to settle disputes over the truth of the Prophet Muhammad's message. It invites those who argue against him to gather with their families and the Prophet's family, and earnestly pray to God to curse the liars among them. This 'mutual cursing' would reveal who is truthful and who is lying, as God would not allow the truthful party to be cursed. The verse demonstrates the Prophet's confidence in his message and his willingness to put his life and family at stake to prove its truth.
orig: فمن حاجك فيه من بعد ما جاءك من العلم فقل تعالوا ندع أبناءنا وأبناءكم ونساءنا ونساءكم وأنفسنا وأنفسكم ثم نبتهل فنجعل لعنت الله على الكاذبين

translation: Indeed, this is the true narrative, and there is no deity except Allah. And indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms the truthfulness and authenticity of the stories mentioned in the Qur'an, emphasizing that they are not mere fables or legends. It also establishes the fundamental Islamic belief in the Oneness of God (Tawhid) by declaring that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah. Additionally, it highlights two of Allah's sublime attributes: Al-'Azeez (the Exalted in Might) and Al-Hakeem (the Wise), indicating His absolute power and perfect wisdom in all His actions and decrees.
orig: إن هذا لهو القصص الحق وما من إله إلا الله وإن الله لهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: But if they turn away, then indeed Allah is Aware of the corrupters.
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in their rejection and corruption, Allah is fully aware of their evil deeds and intentions, and He will hold them accountable. This verse serves as a warning that their actions do not go unnoticed by Allah, who has perfect knowledge of all things.
orig: فإن تولوا فإن الله عليم بالمفسدين

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."
interpretation: This verse calls for unity between Muslims and People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) on the fundamental principle of worshipping One God alone and not associating partners with Him. It urges them to abandon the worship of anything besides Allah and not take religious leaders as lords besides Allah. If they reject this call, Muslims are instructed to bear witness that they have submitted themselves to Allah alone.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب تعالوا إلى كلمة سواء بيننا وبينكم ألا نعبد إلا الله ولا نشرك به شيئا ولا يتخذ بعضنا بعضا أربابا من دون الله فإن تولوا فقولوا اشهدوا بأنا مسلمون

translation: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse questions the reasoning of the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) for arguing about Abraham, when the Torah and the Gospel were revealed after his time. It implies that they should use their intellect and understand that Abraham lived before the revelation of their scriptures, and therefore, their arguments about him lack a proper basis.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تحاجون في إبراهيم وما أنزلت التوراة والإنجيل إلا من بعده أفلا تعقلون

translation: Here you are - you have disputed about what you have [some] knowledge of, but why do you dispute about what you have no knowledge of? And Allah knows, while you know not.
interpretation: This verse admonishes those who argue about matters they have no knowledge of. It emphasizes that we should refrain from debating or disputing topics that are beyond our understanding, as Allah alone possesses complete knowledge. It encourages humility and reliance on divine wisdom rather than making baseless claims or engaging in fruitless arguments about the unknown.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء حاججتم فيما لكم به علم فلم تحاجون فيما ليس لكم به علم والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was an upright man, a Muslim, and he was not one of the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Prophet Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but rather a monotheist who submitted himself completely to the One God ("hanif" and "muslim"). He rejected all forms of polytheism and idol worship. This verse establishes that the religion of Islam, which calls for pure monotheism and submission to God, is the original religion of Abraham, and not an innovation.
orig: ما كان إبراهيم يهوديا ولا نصرانيا ولكن كان حنيفا مسلما وما كان من المشركين

translation: Indeed, the closest of people to Abraham are those who followed him and this prophet, and those who believe. And Allah is the ally of the believers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the spiritual connection between Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), his followers, and the followers of Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him). It emphasizes that the true inheritors of Abraham's legacy are those who follow the teachings of Prophet Muhammad and have faith in Allah. The verse affirms that Allah is the protector and helper of the believers.
orig: إن أولى الناس بإبراهيم للذين اتبعوه وهذا النبي والذين آمنوا والله ولي المؤمنين

translation: A party of the People of the Book wish they could mislead you, but they only mislead themselves, and they do not perceive it.
interpretation: This verse refers to some people from the previous scriptures, such as Jews and Christians, who wished to lead the Muslims astray from their faith. However, their attempts to mislead the believers would only harm themselves, as they would be the ones deviating from the truth. They were unaware of the consequences of their actions, blinded by their own prejudices and desires.
orig: ودت طائفة من أهل الكتاب لو يضلونكم وما يضلون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while you witness [to their truth]?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) as to why they reject the signs and revelations of Allah when they themselves are witnesses to their truth. It implies that they have knowledge of the previous scriptures which testify to the truth of the Qur'an and the prophethood of Muhammad, yet they choose to deny it out of arrogance or stubbornness.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله وأنتم تشهدون

translation: O People of the Scripture, why do you confuse the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?
interpretation: This verse condemns the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) for deliberately mixing truth with falsehood and concealing the truth about the prophethood of Muhammad, despite having knowledge of it from their own scriptures. It criticizes their dishonest behavior of distorting religious teachings for worldly gains or to maintain their position of authority.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لم تلبسون الحق بالباطل وتكتمون الحق وأنتم تعلمون

translation: And a faction of the People of the Scripture said, 'Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end, that perhaps they will abandon their religion.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a deceitful tactic employed by some People of the Book (Jews and Christians) against the Muslims. They would pretend to believe in the Qur'an in the morning but reject it by the evening, hoping that the Muslims would become confused and abandon their faith. This shows the extent of their opposition and dishonesty towards the truth revealed in the Qur'an.
orig: وقالت طائفة من أهل الكتاب آمنوا بالذي أنزل على الذين آمنوا وجه النهار واكفروا آخره لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And do not believe except for those who follow your religion. Say, "Indeed, the [right] guidance is the guidance of Allah that one will be given like that which was given to you, or they would [merely] argue with you before your Lord." Say, "Indeed, the bounty is in the hand of Allah - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Wise."
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers not to trust or have faith in anyone except those who follow their religion (Islam). It emphasizes that true guidance comes from Allah alone, and anyone who receives guidance similar to what the believers have received should not be a cause for doubt or argument. The verse reminds that Allah's bounty and favor are bestowed upon whomever He wills, and He is All-Encompassing and Wise in His decisions.
orig: ولا تؤمنوا إلا لمن تبع دينكم قل إن الهدى هدى الله أن يؤتى أحد مثل ما أوتيتم أو يحاجوكم عند ربكم قل إن الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: He bestows His mercy upon whom He wills, and Allah is the Possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and His infinite mercy. It means that Allah bestows His mercy and favors upon whomever He wills, according to His divine wisdom and justice. No one can dictate or impose conditions on Allah's mercy, for He is the "Possessor of great bounty," whose grace and blessings are boundless and beyond human comprehension.
orig: يختص برحمته من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: Among the People of the Book are some who, if you entrust them with a great amount [of wealth], will return it to you. And among them are some who, if you entrust them with a single coin, will not return it to you unless you constantly keep an eye on them. That is because they say, "We are not obligated in the case of the unlettered people." And they speak an untruth about Allah while they know [it].
interpretation: This verse criticizes the dishonest behavior of some People of the Book (Jews and Christians) and their false claim that they are not accountable for cheating the "unlettered" (non-Jews and non-Christians). It exposes their hypocrisy of claiming to follow divine scripture while lying and betraying trusts. The verse condemns their double standards and dishonesty towards Muslims, whom they considered "unlettered".
orig: ومن أهل الكتاب من إن تأمنه بقنطار يؤده إليك ومنهم من إن تأمنه بدينار لا يؤده إليك إلا ما دمت عليه قائما ذلك بأنهم قالوا ليس علينا في الأميين سبيل ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: Yes, whoever fulfills his covenant and fears Allah - then indeed, Allah loves the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's promises and covenants, as well as having taqwa (fear and consciousness of Allah). It states that those who keep their word and remain mindful of Allah will be loved by Him. The verse encourages truthfulness, trustworthiness, and piety as qualities that are beloved to Allah.
orig: بلى من أوفى بعهده واتقى فإن الله يحب المتقين

translation: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who break their covenants with Allah and their oaths for a small worldly gain. It warns that such people will be deprived of any reward in the Hereafter. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will neither speak to them, nor look at them with mercy, nor will He purify them from their sins. Instead, they will face a painful punishment.
orig: إن الذين يشترون بعهد الله وأيمانهم ثمنا قليلا أولئك لا خلاق لهم في الآخرة ولا يكلمهم الله ولا ينظر إليهم يوم القيامة ولا يزكيهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And indeed, there is among them a party who distort the Book with their tongues so you may think it is from the Book, but it is not from the Book. And they say, 'This is from Allah,' but it is not from Allah. And they tell a lie against Allah while they know.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who deliberately distort and misinterpret the words of the Qur'an to suit their own desires and agendas. They twist the meanings of verses to make it appear as if their interpretations are from the Qur'an itself, when in reality they are fabricating lies and attributing them falsely to Allah. This is a grave sin, as they are knowingly deceiving people and leading them astray from the true teachings of Islam.
orig: وإن منهم لفريقا يلوون ألسنتهم بالكتاب لتحسبوه من الكتاب وما هو من الكتاب ويقولون هو من عند الله وما هو من عند الله ويقولون على الله الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: It is not for any human that Allah should give him the Book, the Wisdom, and the Prophethood, then he would say to the people: 'Be worshippers of me instead of Allah,' but (he would say): 'Be you devoted to the Lord for your teaching the Book and for your studying it.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no true Prophet would ever claim divinity or ask people to worship him instead of Allah. Rather, the role of the Prophets is to guide people to worship Allah alone and follow the teachings of the revealed Books they were given. They call people to be devoted servants of Allah, teaching and studying the divine scriptures revealed to them.
orig: ما كان لبشر أن يؤتيه الله الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ثم يقول للناس كونوا عبادا لي من دون الله ولكن كونوا ربانيين بما كنتم تعلمون الكتاب وبما كنتم تدرسون

translation: And he does not command you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he command you with disbelief after you were Muslims?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core Islamic belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed) and rejects associating partners with Him. It refutes the notion that God would command people to worship angels or prophets as deities, as this would contradict the fundamental teachings of Islam and lead to disbelief (kufr) after having accepted the faith. The verse affirms that true Islam does not permit the worship of any beings other than the One God.
orig: ولا يأمركم أن تتخذوا الملائكة والنبيين أربابا أيأمركم بالكفر بعد إذ أنتم مسلمون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allah] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from all the Prophets, that whenever a new Prophet comes confirming the previous Scriptures and teachings, they must believe in him and support him. The Prophets acknowledged this covenant with Allah. Allah then tells them that He will be a witness over them regarding this covenant.
orig: وإذ أخذ الله ميثاق النبيين لما آتيتكم من كتاب وحكمة ثم جاءكم رسول مصدق لما معكم لتؤمنن به ولتنصرنه قال أأقررتم وأخذتم على ذلكم إصري قالوا أقررنا قال فاشهدوا وأنا معكم من الشاهدين

translation: Then whoever turns away after that - they are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse warns that those who turn away from the guidance and commands of Allah after they have been made clear to them are considered defiantly disobedient sinners. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to the truth and not deviating from the straight path once it has been shown. The interpretation highlights the grave consequences of knowingly rejecting the truth and disobeying Allah's commands.
orig: فمن تولى بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Do they seek a religion other than Allah's, while to Him submits whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly or unwillingly, and to Him they will be returned?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sovereignty and supremacy of Allah over all creation. It questions why anyone would seek a religion other than the one prescribed by Allah, when everything in the heavens and earth submits to His will, whether voluntarily or involuntarily. Ultimately, all beings will return to Allah for judgment and accountability.
orig: أفغير دين الله يبغون وله أسلم من في السماوات والأرض طوعا وكرها وإليه يرجعون

translation: Say, "We have believed in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what has been revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and what was given to Moses and Jesus and what was given to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to declare their faith in Allah, and in all the revelations sent down to the prophets, without making any distinction between them. It emphasizes the unity of the divine message and the continuity of prophethood. The believers are called to submit themselves completely to Allah, following the path of Islam.
orig: قل آمنا بالله وما أنزل علينا وما أنزل على إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وما أوتي موسى وعيسى والنبيون من ربهم لا نفرق بين أحد منهم ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And whoever desires other than Islam as a religion, it will never be accepted from him, and in the Hereafter he will be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the exclusivity of Islam as the only religion accepted by Allah. It declares that anyone who consciously rejects Islam and seeks a different way of life will be considered a loser in the Hereafter. The verse highlights the importance of embracing Islam wholeheartedly and rejecting any alternative paths that contradict its teachings.
orig: ومن يبتغ غير الإسلام دينا فلن يقبل منه وهو في الآخرة من الخاسرين

translation: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear proofs had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن الله لا يهدي أولئك الذين كفروا بعد إيمانهم وشهادتهم بصدق الرسول وبعد أن جاءتهم البراهين الواضحة. فالكفر بعد الإيمان والشهادة بالحق هو ظلم للنفس، والله لا يهدي الظالمين الذين يصرون على الكفر والضلال.
orig: كيف يهدي الله قوما كفروا بعد إيمانهم وشهدوا أن الرسول حق وجاءهم البينات والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have incurred the wrath of Allah and earned His curse, as well as the curse of the angels and all of humanity. The interpretation is that those who persistently reject faith, commit grave sins, and spread corruption on earth will be condemned and rejected by Allah, the angels, and all righteous people. Their punishment will be severe and inescapable, as they have turned away from the truth and embraced falsehood and evil.
orig: أولئك جزاؤهم أن عليهم لعنة الله والملائكة والناس أجمعين

translation: They will abide therein forever, the punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse indicates the eternal and unrelenting nature of the punishment for those who reject faith and commit evil deeds. Their torment in the Hellfire will never be reduced or alleviated, nor will they ever be given respite or relief from it. This emphasizes the severity and finality of the punishment awaiting the disbelievers in the Hereafter.
orig: خالدين فيها لا يخفف عنهم العذاب ولا هم ينظرون

translation: Except those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the infinite mercy of Allah. It serves as a reassurance that even those who have committed sins can be forgiven by Allah if they sincerely repent and mend their ways. The door to Allah's forgiveness is always open for those who genuinely seek it through repentance and reform. This verse instills hope and encourages people to turn back to the right path, as Allah is both Forgiving and Merciful to those who repent.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved after their belief and then increased in disbelief - never will their repentance be accepted, and it is those who are truly astray.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who initially embraced faith but later rejected it and increased in their disbelief. For such individuals, Allah declares that their repentance will not be accepted, as they have willfully turned away from the truth after recognizing it. They have strayed far from the right path and are considered among those who are truly misguided.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بعد إيمانهم ثم ازدادوا كفرا لن تقبل توبتهم وأولئك هم الضالون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers - never would be accepted from one of them the earth's full of gold, even if he offered it for ransom. Those will have a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severe punishment awaiting the disbelievers in the Hereafter. No amount of wealth or ransom can save them from Allah's punishment if they reject faith and die in a state of disbelief. Their rejection of the truth will subject them to an excruciating torment, and they will find no one to aid or support them against Allah's decree.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وماتوا وهم كفار فلن يقبل من أحدهم ملء الأرض ذهبا ولو افتدى به أولئك لهم عذاب أليم وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: You will never attain righteousness until you spend from what you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of spending in the way of Allah from what is most beloved to a person. True righteousness and piety cannot be achieved without sacrificing one's wealth for the sake of Allah. It encourages selflessness and prioritizing spiritual pursuits over material possessions. The verse also reminds us that Allah is fully aware of our intentions and actions, and that spending for His cause will be rewarded accordingly.
orig: لن تنالوا البر حتى تنفقوا مما تحبون وما تنفقوا من شيء فإن الله به عليم

translation: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel, except what Israel made unlawful for himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, 'So bring the Torah and recite it, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that before the revelation of the Torah, all foods were permissible for the Children of Israel, except for those that the Prophet Jacob (peace be upon him) had forbidden upon himself. The verse challenges those who claim certain foods were prohibited before the Torah, to bring forth the Torah as evidence if they are truthful in their claim.
orig: كل الطعام كان حلا لبني إسرائيل إلا ما حرم إسرائيل على نفسه من قبل أن تنزل التوراة قل فأتوا بالتوراة فاتلوها إن كنتم صادقين

translation: So whoever invents a lie against Allah after that - then those are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against fabricating lies and attributing them to Allah. It emphasizes that those who intentionally invent falsehoods and attribute them to God after receiving clear guidance are the true wrongdoers and transgressors. This is considered a grave sin as it involves distorting the truth and misrepresenting the teachings of Allah.
orig: فمن افترى على الله الكذب من بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, "Allah has told the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate others with Allah."
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad to declare that Allah has spoken the truth, and to follow the upright religion of Abraham, who was a monotheist and did not associate any partners with Allah. The phrase "inclining toward truth" (hanifan) refers to Abraham's pure monotheism and rejection of polytheism and idol worship. Muslims are instructed to follow Abraham's example of complete devotion to the One True God.
orig: قل صدق الله فاتبعوا ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Bakkah - blessed and a guidance for the worlds
interpretation: This verse refers to the Ka'bah in Makkah, which was the first house of worship built for the purpose of worshipping the One True God. It is described as "blessed" because it is a sacred place blessed by Allah, and a "guidance for the worlds" because it serves as a spiritual center and a symbol of guidance for all of humanity towards the path of truth and righteousness.
orig: إن أول بيت وضع للناس للذي ببكة مباركا وهدى للعالمين

translation: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to Allah from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves - then indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse mentions the clear signs in the Sacred Mosque in Makkah, including the Station of Ibrahim, which is a place of great spiritual significance. It declares that whoever enters the Sacred Mosque shall be safe and secure. The verse then emphasizes the obligation of pilgrimage to the Sacred House (the Ka'bah) for those who are able, as it is one of the pillars of Islam. However, for those who disbelieve and reject this obligation, Allah is not in need of their faith or worship, for He is Self-Sufficient and free from need of all the worlds.
orig: فيه آيات بينات مقام إبراهيم ومن دخله كان آمنا ولله على الناس حج البيت من استطاع إليه سبيلا ومن كفر فإن الله غني عن العالمين

translation: Say, 'O People of the Book, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah, and Allah is Witness over what you do?'
interpretation: This verse is addressing the People of the Book, referring to the Jews and Christians, questioning their rejection of the clear signs and revelations from Allah despite witnessing their truth. It implies that their disbelief is unjustified and that Allah is fully aware of their actions and will hold them accountable.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تكفرون بآيات الله والله شهيد على ما تعملون

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the way of Allah, seeking to make it crooked, while you are witnesses? And Allah is not unaware of what you do."
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) who rejected the message of Islam despite having knowledge of it from their own scriptures. It questions their rejection of Allah's path and their attempts to distort it, even though they themselves are witnesses to its truth. The verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of their actions and their deliberate attempts to mislead others away from the straight path.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لم تصدون عن سبيل الله من آمن تبغونها عوجا وأنتم شهداء وما الله بغافل عما تعملون

translation: O you who believe! If you obey a group of those who were given the Scripture, they would render you disbelievers after your belief.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against following or obeying the misguided views and practices of some People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who have deviated from the true teachings of their scriptures. It cautions that if the believers were to comply with such deviant groups, it would lead them to disbelief after having accepted faith. The verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the guidance of the Qur'an and the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad, and not being misled by those who have strayed from the straight path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تطيعوا فريقا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب يردوكم بعد إيمانكم كافرين

translation: And how could you disbelieve, while unto you are recited the Verses of Allah, and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allah, then he is indeed guided to a Straight Path.
interpretation: This verse questions how one could deny faith when the clear signs and revelations of Allah are being recited to them, and the Prophet Muhammad is among them as a living example. It emphasizes that whoever sincerely holds fast to Allah and His guidance will be led to the straight and unwavering path of truth and righteousness.
orig: وكيف تكفرون وأنتم تتلى عليكم آيات الله وفيكم رسوله ومن يعتصم بالله فقد هدي إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to have taqwa (consciousness and fear) of Allah in the truest and most complete sense. It emphasizes maintaining a state of sincere faith and obedience until the end of one's life. The phrase "do not die except as Muslims" means to remain steadfast in submission to Allah until death. It is a call to persistently uphold beliefs, fulfill obligations, and avoid that which Allah has prohibited.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله حق تقاته ولا تموتن إلا وأنتم مسلمون

translation: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity and holding firmly to the teachings of Islam. It reminds believers of the favor Allah bestowed upon them by guiding them to the truth and uniting their hearts after being enemies. It serves as a reminder to remain grateful and avoid division, as division can lead to disbelief and punishment, just as they were saved from the 'pit of Fire' through Allah's guidance.
orig: واعتصموا بحبل الله جميعا ولا تفرقوا واذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ كنتم أعداء فألف بين قلوبكم فأصبحتم بنعمته إخوانا وكنتم على شفا حفرة من النار فأنقذكم منها كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having a group within the Muslim community that actively promotes righteousness and virtue, while discouraging evil and wrongdoing. It calls for the existence of an exemplary group that guides others towards goodness through their words and actions. The verse promises success and prosperity to those who fulfill this vital role of enjoining good and forbidding evil.
orig: ولتكن منكم أمة يدعون إلى الخير ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And do not be like those who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against disunity, sectarianism, and division among Muslims after the truth has become evident to them. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining unity, avoiding disagreements and conflicts over religious matters, and adhering to the clear teachings of Islam. Those who cause division and disunity among Muslims will face a severe punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين تفرقوا واختلفوا من بعد ما جاءهم البينات وأولئك لهم عذاب عظيم

translation: The Day when some faces will turn white and some faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [they will be told], 'Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment, when people's faces will turn either white (for the believers) or black (for the disbelievers). Those whose faces turn black will be questioned about their disbelief after having accepted faith, and they will be punished for their rejection of the truth.
orig: يوم تبيض وجوه وتسود وجوه فأما الذين اسودت وجوههم أكفرتم بعد إيمانكم فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: And as for those whose faces become white, they will be in the mercy of Allah, abiding therein forever.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of the righteous believers on the Day of Judgment. Their faces will be radiant and white, indicating their purity and acceptance into Allah's mercy and Paradise, where they will dwell eternally. This symbolizes their spiritual enlightenment and the reward they will receive for their faith and good deeds.
orig: وأما الذين ابيضت وجوههم ففي رحمة الله هم فيها خالدون

translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. And Allah does not intend any injustice to the worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'anic verses are from Allah and are being recited to the Prophet Muhammad truthfully and without any alteration or distortion. It also emphasizes Allah's justice and that He does not desire any wrongdoing or oppression for His creation in this world or in the Hereafter.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق وما الله يريد ظلما للعالمين

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and to Allah return all matters.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and ownership over the entire universe and all that exists within it. It emphasizes that everything in the heavens and on the earth belongs to Allah alone, and that ultimately all affairs and matters will return to Him for judgment and accountability. This instills a sense of humility, accountability, and recognition of Allah's supreme authority over all creation.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the distinguished status of the Muslim community as the best nation raised for the benefit of humanity. Their role is to promote righteousness, prohibit evil, and have unwavering faith in Allah. However, the verse also critiques the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) for their lack of belief, stating that if they had truly believed, it would have been better for them. While acknowledging that some among them are believers, the verse condemns most of them as disobedient transgressors.
orig: كنتم خير أمة أخرجت للناس تأمرون بالمعروف وتنهون عن المنكر وتؤمنون بالله ولو آمن أهل الكتاب لكان خيرا لهم منهم المؤمنون وأكثرهم الفاسقون

translation: They will not harm you except for some annoyance; and if they fight you, they will turn their backs to you, then they will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers' attempts to harm the believers will be insignificant and ineffective. Even if they engage in combat, they will ultimately flee in defeat and find no assistance or support. This emphasizes the weakness and futility of the disbelievers' opposition to the truth and the divine support granted to the believers.
orig: لن يضروكم إلا أذى وإن يقاتلوكم يولوكم الأدبار ثم لا ينصرون

translation: Debasement has been struck upon them wherever they are encountered, except with a rope from Allah and a rope from the people, and they became deserving of wrath from Allah, and destitution was struck upon them. That is because they used to disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
interpretation: This verse describes the humiliation and misery that befell the disbelievers among the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) as a punishment for their rejection of Allah's signs, killing of prophets unjustly, disobedience, and transgression. They were debased and faced disgrace wherever they went, except for those who held onto a covenant with Allah or a treaty with the believers. They earned Allah's wrath and lived in poverty due to their disbelief, oppression, and violations.
orig: ضربت عليهم الذلة أين ما ثقفوا إلا بحبل من الله وحبل من الناس وباءوا بغضب من الله وضربت عليهم المسكنة ذلك بأنهم كانوا يكفرون بآيات الله ويقتلون الأنبياء بغير حق ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: Not all of the People of the Book are alike. There is an upright community among them who recite God's revelations throughout the night, bowing down in worship.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity among the People of the Book (Jews and Christians). It states that there is a group among them who are upright and sincere in their faith. They devote themselves to reciting and studying God's revelations, even during the night, and they prostrate themselves in worship. This indicates their sincerity, humility, and commitment to their faith. The verse implies that not all People of the Book are misguided or astray, and that there are those who truly follow the teachings of their scriptures.
orig: ليسوا سواء من أهل الكتاب أمة قائمة يتلون آيات الله آناء الليل وهم يسجدون

translation: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and hasten to do good deeds. And those are among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the key characteristics of righteous believers. They have faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment, promote virtuous conduct and discourage evil, and eagerly engage in good deeds. These qualities define them as among the truly righteous people.
orig: يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ويأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويسارعون في الخيرات وأولئك من الصالحين

translation: And whatever good they do, never will it be rejected from them. And Allah is All-Aware of the pious.
interpretation: This verse signifies that any righteous deed performed by a believer, no matter how small, will be accepted and rewarded by Allah. It emphasizes Allah's knowledge of those who have taqwa (consciousness of Allah) and strive to obey Him. The implication is that one should not underestimate the value of good actions, as Allah recognizes and appreciates even the smallest efforts made sincerely for His sake.
orig: وما يفعلوا من خير فلن يكفروه والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that material wealth and offspring will be of no benefit to the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. Their riches and progeny, which they took pride in during their worldly life, will not help them against Allah's punishment or ransom them from the Hellfire. Rather, they will be the eternal dwellers of Hell, suffering its torment forever as a consequence of their disbelief and rejection of faith.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا وأولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves, and destroys it. And Allah has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.
interpretation: This verse compares the deeds and wealth spent by disbelievers in this life to a cold, destructive wind that ruins the crops of people who have wronged themselves by disbelieving. Their efforts are in vain and bring no lasting benefit, just as the crops are destroyed. Allah does not wrong them; rather, they wrong themselves by rejecting faith and doing deeds that bear no fruit.
orig: مثل ما ينفقون في هذه الحياة الدنيا كمثل ريح فيها صر أصابت حرث قوم ظلموا أنفسهم فأهلكته وما ظلمهم الله ولكن أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: O you who believe! Do not take as intimates those other than your own people; they will spare no pains to corrupt you; they wish you to suffer. Hatred has already been revealed from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater still. We have made the Signs plain for you if you will understand.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against taking non-believers as close companions or confidants, as they harbor enmity towards the believers and wish to see them suffer. Their hatred is evident from their speech, and their hearts conceal even greater malice. Allah has made His signs and guidance clear, if only the believers use their intellect to understand.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا بطانة من دونكم لا يألونكم خبالا ودوا ما عنتم قد بدت البغضاء من أفواههم وما تخفي صدورهم أكبر قد بينا لكم الآيات إن كنتم تعقلون

translation: There you are - you love them but they do not love you, although you believe in all the Scripture. And when they meet you, they say, 'We believe.' But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, 'Die in your rage. Allah is truly Aware of what is in the hearts.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the hypocritical behavior of some people towards the believers. It criticizes those who claim to believe when meeting the believers, but harbor hatred and rage towards them in private. The interpretation highlights Allah's knowledge of the true intentions in people's hearts, despite their outward claims of faith. It advises the believers to remain steadfast in their belief and not be swayed by the hypocrites' rage and resentment.
orig: ها أنتم أولاء تحبونهم ولا يحبونكم وتؤمنون بالكتاب كله وإذا لقوكم قالوا آمنا وإذا خلوا عضوا عليكم الأنامل من الغيظ قل موتوا بغيظكم إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: If a good befalls you, it grieves them; but if an evil afflicts you, they rejoice at it. Yet if you remain patient and God-fearing, their plots cannot harm you at all; for God encompasses whatever they do.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the attitude of the disbelievers towards the believers. If good befalls the believers, the disbelievers are grieved by it, but if any harm or misfortune afflicts the believers, the disbelievers rejoice over it. However, the verse advises the believers to be patient and God-fearing, for if they do so, the plots and schemes of the disbelievers cannot harm them in any way. This is because Allah encompasses and has full knowledge of all their actions and plots.
orig: إن تمسسكم حسنة تسؤهم وإن تصبكم سيئة يفرحوا بها وإن تصبروا وتتقوا لا يضركم كيدهم شيئا إن الله بما يعملون محيط

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when you set out from your family in the morning to position the believers for the battle - and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Uhud, when the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was positioning and arranging the Muslim army for the impending battle against the Quraysh. It highlights Allah's knowledge and awareness of the situation, as He is "Hearing and Knowing" of all that transpires.
orig: وإذ غدوت من أهلك تبوئ المؤمنين مقاعد للقتال والله سميع عليم

translation: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but Allah was their protector; and upon Allah the believers should put their trust.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Uhud, when a group of Muslim fighters disobeyed the Prophet's orders and left their positions, which led to a temporary setback. However, Allah was their protector and supporter. The lesson is that true believers should put their trust in Allah alone, even in difficult circumstances.
orig: إذ همت طائفتان منكم أن تفشلا والله وليهما وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And indeed, Allah gave you victory at Badr while you were weak. So fear Allah, that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of Allah's favor upon them when He granted them victory at the Battle of Badr, despite their weakness and small numbers compared to the disbelievers. It encourages them to maintain piety and gratitude towards Allah for His help and support.
orig: ولقد نصركم الله ببدر وأنتم أذلة فاتقوا الله لعلكم تشكرون

translation: When you said to the believers, 'Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Badr, where the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) reassured the believers that Allah would send down angels to support them, despite their small number and lack of resources compared to the disbelieving army. The interpretation highlights Allah's support for the believers and His ability to grant victory, even against overwhelming odds, for those who put their trust in Him.
orig: إذ تقول للمؤمنين ألن يكفيكم أن يمدكم ربكم بثلاثة آلاف من الملائكة منزلين

translation: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allah, and they come upon you at once, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction].
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to be patient, have taqwa (consciousness of Allah), and remain steadfast in the face of adversity. If they do so and the enemy attacks them suddenly, Allah promises to aid them with 5,000 angels who are distinctly marked. This divine assistance is a reward for their faith and perseverance, and a manifestation of Allah's power to support His believing servants against their enemies.
orig: بلى إن تصبروا وتتقوا ويأتوكم من فورهم هذا يمددكم ربكم بخمسة آلاف من الملائكة مسومين

translation: And Allah made it not but good tidings for you, and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not but from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the dream or vision mentioned earlier was a glad tiding from Allah to reassure the believers and strengthen their hearts. It also reminds them that true victory comes only from Allah, Who is Almighty and Wise in His decisions and plans.
orig: وما جعله الله إلا بشرى لكم ولتطمئن قلوبكم به وما النصر إلا من عند الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: That He may cut off a portion of those who disbelieve, or suppress them so that they turn back, frustrated.
interpretation: This verse suggests that one of Allah's purposes in allowing battles and wars is to weaken and defeat the disbelievers, either by killing some of them or by suppressing their power and influence. This would lead them to retreat in a state of disappointment and failure, realizing the futility of their opposition to the truth.
orig: ليقطع طرفا من الذين كفروا أو يكبتهم فينقلبوا خائبين

translation: Not for you is the command at all; whether He should forgive them, or punish them, for indeed they are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) had no authority or control over whether Allah would forgive or punish the wrongdoers. The decision to forgive or punish rests solely with Allah, as He is the Supreme Judge and the only One with the power to hold people accountable for their actions. The Prophet's role was to convey the message and guide people to the right path, but the ultimate outcome for individuals lies in Allah's hands based on their deeds and intentions.
orig: ليس لك من الأمر شيء أو يتوب عليهم أو يعذبهم فإنهم ظالمون

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over the entire universe. It emphasizes that forgiveness and punishment are solely determined by Allah's will, as He is the Most Merciful and the source of all mercy and forgiveness. However, His forgiveness is not unconditional; it is granted to those who sincerely repent and mend their ways, while punishment awaits those who persist in disbelief and disobedience. Ultimately, this verse reminds us of our utter dependence on Allah's grace and mercy.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who believe! Do not consume interest, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allah that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse prohibits dealing with interest or usury (riba) in any form, whether it is a small amount compounded over time or a large sum taken all at once. It commands the believers to have taqwa (consciousness of Allah) and abstain from riba in order to attain true success and prosperity in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تأكلوا الربا أضعافا مضاعفة واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse warns believers to be mindful of Allah's punishment and to avoid disbelief, which leads to the Hellfire that was created for those who reject faith. It serves as a reminder of the grave consequences of denying Allah and His revelations, and encourages maintaining faith and righteous conduct to escape this terrible fate.
orig: واتقوا النار التي أعدت للكافرين

translation: And obey Allah and the Messenger, so that you may be shown mercy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and following the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It promises that those who adhere to this command will be granted mercy and forgiveness from Allah. The verse highlights the central role of obedience to divine guidance in attaining spiritual salvation and Allah's mercy.
orig: وأطيعوا الله والرسول لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and the earth, prepared for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to earnestly seek forgiveness from Allah and strive for Paradise, which is described as vast and expansive, encompassing the heavens and the earth. It is promised to those who are righteous and conscious of Allah, implying that forgiveness and Paradise are attainable through piety, righteousness, and seeking Allah's mercy.
orig: وسارعوا إلى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها السماوات والأرض أعدت للمتقين

translation: Those who spend [in the cause of Allah ] in ease and adversity, and those who restrain anger and pardon the people - and Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse praises those who spend in the way of Allah, whether in times of prosperity or adversity. It also commends those who control their anger and forgive others. Such qualities are pleasing to Allah, who loves those who do good deeds and strive to be righteous.
orig: الذين ينفقون في السراء والضراء والكاظمين الغيظ والعافين عن الناس والله يحب المحسنين

translation: And those who, when they have committed fahishah (immoral sin) or wronged themselves with evil, remember Allah and ask forgiveness for their sins; - and none can forgive sins but Allah - And do not persist in what (wrong) they have done, while they know.
interpretation: This verse encourages repentance and seeking forgiveness from Allah when one commits a sin or wrongdoing. It highlights that only Allah can forgive sins, and emphasizes the importance of not persisting in sinful behavior after recognizing one's mistake. The key to forgiveness is sincere repentance, seeking Allah's pardon, and resolving not to repeat the wrongdoing knowingly.
orig: والذين إذا فعلوا فاحشة أو ظلموا أنفسهم ذكروا الله فاستغفروا لذنوبهم ومن يغفر الذنوب إلا الله ولم يصروا على ما فعلوا وهم يعلمون

translation: For them is forgiveness from their Lord, and gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally; and excellent is the reward of the workers.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness and an eternal reward of Paradise for those who do righteous deeds and have faith. The "gardens beneath which rivers flow" is a metaphorical description of the blissful Gardens of Paradise, where the believers will live forever in perfect joy and contentment. The phrase "excellent is the reward of the workers" emphasizes that those who strive in the path of God will receive an incomparable reward that far exceeds any worldly gains.
orig: أولئك جزاؤهم مغفرة من ربهم وجنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ونعم أجر العاملين

translation: Indeed, there have been examples before you, so travel through the land and observe how was the end of those who denied.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to reflect on the fate of previous nations who rejected the messengers of God.
