By traveling and observing the remnants of those civilizations, one can learn valuable lessons about the consequences of denying God's signs and messengers. It serves as a warning against arrogance and disbelief, and highlights the importance of heeding God's guidance to avoid a similar disastrous end.
orig: قد خلت من قبلكم سنن فسيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: This is a clear evidence for the people, a guidance and an admonition for those who are pious.
interpretation: The Qur'an is a clear proof and explanation for all of humanity, providing guidance and valuable advice, especially for those who have consciousness of Allah and strive to obey Him.
orig: هذا بيان للناس وهدى وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And do not falter or grieve, and you will be superior if you are true believers.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to remain steadfast, hopeful, and not lose courage or become disheartened in the face of difficulties or challenges. It promises that if they truly have faith and trust in Allah, they will ultimately prevail and be victorious over their adversaries or obstacles. The verse instills a spirit of resilience, optimism, and confidence in the divine promise of success for those who maintain their faith and perseverance.
orig: ولا تهنوا ولا تحزنوا وأنتم الأعلون إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: If a wound hath touched you, be sure a similar wound hath touched the others. Such days (of varying fortunes) We give to men and men by turns: that Allah may know those that believe, and that He may take to Himself from your ranks Martyr-witnesses (to Truth). And Allah loveth not those that do wrong.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne que les difficultés et les épreuves sont une partie inévitable de la vie, et que les croyants ne sont pas exemptés de ces défis. Cependant, ces épreuves servent à distinguer les vrais croyants des autres, et ceux qui endurent avec patience et persévérance seront récompensés par Allah. De plus, le verset indique qu'Allah permet ces jours alternés de succès et de revers pour tester la foi des gens, et que ceux qui meurent en martyrs pour la cause d'Allah seront honorés et aimés par Lui.
orig: إن يمسسكم قرح فقد مس القوم قرح مثله وتلك الأيام نداولها بين الناس وليعلم الله الذين آمنوا ويتخذ منكم شهداء والله لا يحب الظالمين

translation: That Allah may distinguish the believers from the disbelievers,
interpretation: This verse suggests that one of Allah's purposes is to test and distinguish the true believers from the disbelievers through trials and challenges. This serves to purify the faith of the believers and expose the disbelief of those who reject Allah's guidance. The difficulties faced act as a means of separating the sincere from the insincere.
orig: وليمحص الله الذين آمنوا ويمحق الكافرين

translation: Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while Allah has not yet made evident those of you who fight in His cause and made evident those who are steadfast?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that entering Paradise requires striving in the cause of Allah and exhibiting patience and steadfastness. It suggests that true believers will be tested through struggles and difficulties to prove their faith and sincerity before attaining the reward of Paradise.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تدخلوا الجنة ولما يعلم الله الذين جاهدوا منكم ويعلم الصابرين

translation: And you did wish for death before you met it, and you have certainly seen it while you were looking on.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who wished for martyrdom before the Battle of Uhud, thinking it would be a great honor. However, when they faced the reality of death on the battlefield, some of them turned away. It reminds them that they had eagerly desired martyrdom, but when confronted with it, their determination wavered. The verse highlights the difference between merely wishing for something and actually experiencing it.
orig: ولقد كنتم تمنون الموت من قبل أن تلقوه فقد رأيتموه وأنتم تنظرون

translation: And Muhammad is not but a messenger. [Other] messengers have passed on before him. So if he was to die or be killed, would you turn back on your heels [to unbelief]? And he who turns back on his heels will never harm Allah at all; but Allah will reward the grateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Prophet Muhammad is a human messenger like the messengers before him, and that his death or martyrdom should not cause the believers to turn away from faith. It reminds them that rejecting faith after accepting it will not harm Allah, but He will reward those who remain grateful and steadfast in their belief.
orig: وما محمد إلا رسول قد خلت من قبله الرسل أفإن مات أو قتل انقلبتم على أعقابكم ومن ينقلب على عقبيه فلن يضر الله شيئا وسيجزي الله الشاكرين

translation: And it is not for a soul to die except by permission of Allah at a decree determined. And whoever desires the reward of this world - We shall give him thereof; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter - We shall give him thereof. And We will reward the grateful.
interpretation: Allah décide quand une âme doit mourir, selon un délai fixé. Celui qui désire la récompense de ce monde, Il la lui accordera. Et celui qui désire la récompense de l'au-delà, Il la lui accordera également. Allah récompensera ceux qui Lui sont reconnaissants.
orig: وما كان لنفس أن تموت إلا بإذن الله كتابا مؤجلا ومن يرد ثواب الدنيا نؤته منها ومن يرد ثواب الآخرة نؤته منها وسنجزي الشاكرين

translation: And how many a prophet has fought with many devotees alongside him. They did not falter for what afflicted them in the cause of Allah, nor did they weaken, nor did they surrender. And Allah loves the steadfast.
interpretation: This verse encourages steadfastness and perseverance in the face of adversity and hardship when striving in the cause of Allah. It reminds believers of the many prophets who fought alongside their devoted companions, and despite facing immense difficulties and afflictions, they did not waver, weaken, or surrender. Instead, they remained firm and steadfast, for which Allah loves and rewards such persevering believers.
orig: وكأين من نبي قاتل معه ربيون كثير فما وهنوا لما أصابهم في سبيل الله وما ضعفوا وما استكانوا والله يحب الصابرين

translation: And their words were not but that they said, 'Our Lord, forgive us our sins and the excess [committed] in our affairs and plant firmly our feet and give us victory over the disbelieving people.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble supplication of the believers, seeking forgiveness from Allah for their sins and transgressions. They acknowledge their human weaknesses and ask Allah to forgive their shortcomings and guide them towards steadfastness and victory over the disbelievers. It emphasizes the importance of repentance, seeking Allah's forgiveness, and relying on Him for strength and success against adversity.
orig: وما كان قولهم إلا أن قالوا ربنا اغفر لنا ذنوبنا وإسرافنا في أمرنا وثبت أقدامنا وانصرنا على القوم الكافرين

translation: So Allah gave them the reward of this world and the good reward of the Hereafter. And Allah loves the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who do good deeds will be rewarded by Allah both in this life and in the Hereafter. The "reward of this world" refers to the blessings and provisions Allah grants the believers in their worldly lives. The "good reward of the Hereafter" refers to the eternal bliss of Paradise that awaits the righteous in the next life. The verse also emphasizes that Allah loves those who do good deeds and act righteously, indicating that good conduct pleases Allah and earns His love and favor.
orig: فآتاهم الله ثواب الدنيا وحسن ثواب الآخرة والله يحب المحسنين

translation: O you who have believed, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will turn you back on your heels, and you will turn back as losers.
interpretation: "This verse warns the believers against following or obeying the disbelievers. If the believers obey the disbelievers, it will lead them astray from the right path and cause them to lose their faith and become losers in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the importance of staying firm in one's beliefs and not being influenced by those who reject the truth."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تطيعوا الذين كفروا يردوكم على أعقابكم فتنقلبوا خاسرين

translation: Rather, Allah is your protector, and He is the best of helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah alone is the true Protector and Helper of the believers. It rejects the notion of seeking help or protection from anyone or anything other than Allah. The interpretation is that the believers should put their complete trust and reliance in Allah, Who is the most Powerful and the Best in providing aid, support, and victory.
orig: بل الله مولاكم وهو خير الناصرين

translation: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who disbelieved, because they associated with Allah that for which He did not send down authority. And their refuge will be the Fire, and wretched is the residence of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that Allah will instill fear and terror in their hearts as a punishment for associating partners with Him without any divine authority. Their ultimate abode will be the Hellfire, which is a terrible destination for the wrongdoers who persist in their disbelief and polytheism.
orig: سنلقي في قلوب الذين كفروا الرعب بما أشركوا بالله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا ومأواهم النار وبئس مثوى الظالمين

translation: And Allah had certainly fulfilled His promise to you when you were killing the enemy by His permission until [the time] when you lost courage and fell into dispute over the order and disobeyed after He had shown you that which you love. Among you are some who desire this world, and among you are some who desire the Hereafter. Then he turned you back from them [defeated] that He might test you. And He has already pardoned you, and Allah is the possessor of bounty for the believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Uhud, where the Muslims initially gained the upper hand but then disobeyed orders, leading to their defeat. Allah reminds them that He had fulfilled His promise of victory initially, but their disobedience and disputes led to their loss. Some were more interested in worldly gains, while others desired the Hereafter. Ultimately, Allah pardoned them and tested their faith, as He is Most Gracious to the believers.
orig: ولقد صدقكم الله وعده إذ تحسونهم بإذنه حتى إذا فشلتم وتنازعتم في الأمر وعصيتم من بعد ما أراكم ما تحبون منكم من يريد الدنيا ومنكم من يريد الآخرة ثم صرفكم عنهم ليبتليكم ولقد عفا عنكم والله ذو فضل على المؤمنين

translation: When you were going up, paying no attention to anyone, while the Messenger was calling you from your rear, He rewarded you with distress upon distress so that you would not grieve for what had escaped you, nor for what had befallen you. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Hunain, where the Muslims initially fled in panic despite their large numbers, until Allah sent tranquility upon the Prophet and the believers stood firm. It teaches that one should not grieve over missed opportunities or calamities, as Allah is aware of our deeds and will reward or test us accordingly. The "distress upon distress" was a lesson to remain steadfast and trust in Allah's plan.
orig: إذ تصعدون ولا تلوون على أحد والرسول يدعوكم في أخراكم فأثابكم غما بغم لكيلا تحزنوا على ما فاتكم ولا ما أصابكم والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Then He sent down upon you after the distress, security, slumber overtaking a party of you, while another party cared only for themselves, thinking wrongly of Allah - the thought of ignorance - saying, 'Do we have any say in the matter?' Say, 'The matter entirely belongs to Allah.' They conceal within themselves what they would not reveal to you. They say, 'If we had anything to do with the matter, we would not have been killed here.' Say, 'Even if you had been inside your homes, those decreed to be killed would have gone forth towards their death beds,' so that Allah might test what is in your breasts and purify what is in your hearts. And Allah is All-Aware of what is in the hearts.
interpretation: This verse discusses the state of the believers during the Battle of Uhud. After the initial distress, Allah sent down security and a slumber upon a group of believers. However, another group was preoccupied with their own selfish interests, harboring ignorant thoughts about Allah's decree. They questioned whether they had any say in the matter, to which Allah's response is that all affairs belong to Him alone. They concealed their true thoughts from the Prophet. They claimed that if they had a role, they would not have been killed, but Allah clarifies that those destined to die would have met their fate regardless of their location. This was a test from Allah to purify the hearts of the believers and distinguish their true faith. The interpretation highlights Allah's complete sovereignty, the believers' varying responses during adversity, and the wisdom behind trials as a means of purification.
orig: ثم أنزل عليكم من بعد الغم أمنة نعاسا يغشى طائفة منكم وطائفة قد أهمتهم أنفسهم يظنون بالله غير الحق ظن الجاهلية يقولون هل لنا من الأمر من شيء قل إن الأمر كله لله يخفون في أنفسهم ما لا يبدون لك يقولون لو كان لنا من الأمر شيء ما قتلنا هاهنا قل لو كنتم في بيوتكم لبرز الذين كتب عليهم القتل إلى مضاجعهم وليبتلي الله ما في صدوركم وليمحص ما في قلوبكم والله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Indeed, those of you who turned back on the day the two armies met, it was Satan who caused them to slip because of some [blame] they had earned. But Allah has already pardoned them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Muslims who retreated during the Battle of Uhud. It states that Satan caused them to slip and retreat due to some sins they had committed. However, Allah has pardoned them because He is Forgiving and Forbearing towards His servants' weaknesses.
orig: إن الذين تولوا منكم يوم التقى الجمعان إنما استزلهم الشيطان ببعض ما كسبوا ولقد عفا الله عنهم إن الله غفور حليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brothers when they traveled through the land or went out to battle, 'If they had been with us, they would not have died or been killed,' so Allah makes that [misconception] a regret within their hearts. And it is Allah who gives life and causes death, and Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse admonishes the believers not to be like the disbelievers who, when their friends or relatives died while traveling or fighting, expressed regret saying that if they had been with them, they would not have died. Allah tells the believers that this is a false notion born out of ignorance, for it is Allah alone who gives life and causes death. He sees all our actions, and we should submit to His decree with patience and faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تكونوا كالذين كفروا وقالوا لإخوانهم إذا ضربوا في الأرض أو كانوا غزى لو كانوا عندنا ما ماتوا وما قتلوا ليجعل الله ذلك حسرة في قلوبهم والله يحيي ويميت والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And if you are killed in the cause of Allah or die - then forgiveness from Allah and mercy are better than whatever they accumulate [in this world].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that for believers, achieving martyrdom or death in the path of Allah is far superior to accumulating worldly gains and wealth. It promises forgiveness from Allah and His everlasting mercy, which are greater blessings than any material possessions one could amass in this temporary life.
orig: ولئن قتلتم في سبيل الله أو متم لمغفرة من الله ورحمة خير مما يجمعون

translation: And if you die or are killed, it is to Allah that you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that death is inevitable, whether it comes naturally or through martyrdom in the cause of Allah. Ultimately, all souls will be resurrected and gathered before Allah on the Day of Judgment to account for their deeds in this world. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of this life and the eternal reality of the Hereafter, encouraging believers to remain steadfast in their faith and righteous conduct.
orig: ولئن متم أو قتلتم لإلى الله تحشرون

translation: So by mercy from Allah, [O Muhammad], you were lenient with them. And if you had been rude [in speech] and harsh in heart, they would have disbanded from about you. So pardon them and ask forgiveness for them and consult them in the matter. And when you have decided, then rely upon Allah. Indeed, Allah loves those who rely [upon Him].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of compassion, gentleness, and consultation in leadership. It advises the Prophet Muhammad to deal with his followers with kindness and mercy, as this will keep them united and loyal. It also instructs him to pardon their mistakes, seek forgiveness for them, and consult them in important matters. However, after consultation and deliberation, he should then put his trust in Allah and make a firm decision, as Allah loves those who rely upon Him.
orig: فبما رحمة من الله لنت لهم ولو كنت فظا غليظ القلب لانفضوا من حولك فاعف عنهم واستغفر لهم وشاورهم في الأمر فإذا عزمت فتوكل على الله إن الله يحب المتوكلين

translation: If Allah helps you, none can overcome you; but if He forsakes you, who is there after Him that can help you? And in Allah (alone) let the believers put their trust.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of relying solely on Allah for help and support. It states that if Allah helps the believers, no one can overcome or defeat them. However, if Allah forsakes them, no one else can provide aid or assistance after Him. Therefore, the true believers should put their complete trust and reliance in Allah alone, as He is the only one capable of providing real help and support.
orig: إن ينصركم الله فلا غالب لكم وإن يخذلكم فمن ذا الذي ينصركم من بعده وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: It is not for a Prophet to act dishonestly; and whoever acts dishonestly will bring with them that about which they acted dishonestly on the Day of Resurrection. Then every soul will be paid in full what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honesty and trustworthiness, especially for Prophets who are meant to be role models. It warns that anyone who acts dishonestly or embezzles will be held accountable on the Day of Judgment and will have to bear the consequences of their actions. On that Day, everyone will be justly recompensed for their deeds, without any injustice or wrong-doing.
orig: وما كان لنبي أن يغل ومن يغلل يأت بما غل يوم القيامة ثم توفى كل نفس ما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Is one who pursues the pleasure of Allah like one who draws upon himself the wrath of Allah, and whose abode will be Hell? And what an evil destination!
interpretation: This verse contrasts those who follow the path that pleases Allah with those who incur His wrath through disobedience. The former attain Allah's pleasure and reward, while the latter face a dreadful fate in Hellfire, which is depicted as the worst possible destination.
orig: أفمن اتبع رضوان الله كمن باء بسخط من الله ومأواه جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: For them are degrees [of reward] with Allah, and Allah is Seeing of whatever they do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that believers will attain different levels or ranks in Paradise based on their faith and good deeds. The more righteous and obedient they are, the higher their degree or station will be. Allah is fully aware of everyone's actions and will reward them accordingly.
orig: هم درجات عند الله والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Indeed, Allah conferred a great favor on the believers when He sent among them a Messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom, although they had been before in manifest error.
interpretation: Allah has bestowed a great blessing upon the believers by sending them a Messenger from among themselves, who recites to them the verses of the Qur'an, purifies their souls from evil qualities, teaches them the Qur'an and the wisdom it contains, and guides them to the straight path, after they had been in a state of clear misguidance and ignorance.
orig: لقد من الله على المؤمنين إذ بعث فيهم رسولا من أنفسهم يتلو عليهم آياته ويزكيهم ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة وإن كانوا من قبل لفي ضلال مبين

translation: And if a calamity befalls you, after you had afflicted [the enemy] with twice as much, you would say, 'From where is this?' Say, 'It is from yourselves.' Verily, Allah is over all things Omnipotent.
interpretation: "This verse reminds believers that when they face adversity after previously having success, they should not question Allah's wisdom. It teaches that both good and bad come from within ourselves based on our actions, and that Allah has complete power and control over all things."
orig: أولما أصابتكم مصيبة قد أصبتم مثليها قلتم أنى هذا قل هو من عند أنفسكم إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And whatever afflicted you on the day when the two hosts met, was by Allah's permission, and that He might know the believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Uhud, where the Muslims faced a setback. It teaches that whatever happens, whether victory or defeat, is by Allah's permission and wisdom. The trial was a test for the believers to distinguish those who were truly steadfast in faith from those who were not.
orig: وما أصابكم يوم التقى الجمعان فبإذن الله وليعلم المؤمنين

translation: And let those who disbelieve know that if they cease not, they will be smitten with a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the hypocrites and disbelievers that if they do not desist from their disbelief and hypocrisy, they will face a severe punishment from Allah. It exposes their false claims of being believers, as their words contradict their actions. The verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of what they conceal in their hearts, despite their outward claims of faith.
orig: وليعلم الذين نافقوا وقيل لهم تعالوا قاتلوا في سبيل الله أو ادفعوا قالوا لو نعلم قتالا لاتبعناكم هم للكفر يومئذ أقرب منهم للإيمان يقولون بأفواههم ما ليس في قلوبهم والله أعلم بما يكتمون

translation: Those who said to their brothers while they themselves sat back, 'If they had obeyed us, they would not have been killed.' Say, 'Then avert death from yourselves, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who made excuses for not joining the battle and blamed the martyrs for their own deaths, claiming that if they had listened to the hypocrites, they would still be alive. The interpretation is that if they truly believed their own words, they should have been able to avert death from themselves as well, which is impossible. This exposes the falsehood of their claims and their lack of faith.
orig: الذين قالوا لإخوانهم وقعدوا لو أطاعونا ما قتلوا قل فادرءوا عن أنفسكم الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And never think of those who have been killed in the cause of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who sacrifice their lives for the sake of Allah are not truly dead, but rather alive and receiving sustenance from their Lord. It highlights the eternal life and reward that awaits the martyrs who fought and died for the cause of Allah. Their sacrifice is not in vain, as they continue to live a blessed existence in the presence of their Lord.
orig: ولا تحسبن الذين قتلوا في سبيل الله أمواتا بل أحياء عند ربهم يرزقون

translation: Rejoicing in what Allah has bestowed upon them of His Bounty and rejoicing for the sake of those who have not joined them but are left behind, that on them too there shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the believers who have attained Paradise will rejoice in the blessings bestowed upon them by Allah, and they will also rejoice for those believers who have not yet joined them, knowing that they too will be granted Paradise and will have no fear or grief.
orig: فرحين بما آتاهم الله من فضله ويستبشرون بالذين لم يلحقوا بهم من خلفهم ألا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: They rejoice in favor from Allah and bounty, and [by the fact] that Allah does not allow the reward of the believers to be lost.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the believers rejoice in the blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah, and they are assured that Allah will not allow their good deeds to go unrewarded. It emphasizes Allah's mercy and justice towards the believers who have faith in Him and do righteous deeds.
orig: يستبشرون بنعمة من الله وفضل وأن الله لا يضيع أجر المؤمنين

translation: Those who responded to Allah and the Messenger after injury had struck them - for those among them who did good and feared Allah is a great reward.
interpretation: This verse praises the believers who remained steadfast and responded obediently to Allah and His Messenger after facing difficulties and hardships. It promises a great reward from Allah for those among them who persevered, did righteous deeds, and maintained piety and consciousness of Allah.
orig: الذين استجابوا لله والرسول من بعد ما أصابهم القرح للذين أحسنوا منهم واتقوا أجر عظيم

translation: Those to whom the people said, 'Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them.' But it [merely] increased them in faith, and they said, 'Sufficient for us is Allah, and [He is] the best Disposer of affairs.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who remained steadfast in their faith when faced with threats and intimidation from their enemies. Instead of being afraid, their trust in Allah increased, and they declared that Allah alone is sufficient for them and the best guardian and disposer of affairs. The interpretation highlights the importance of having unwavering faith in Allah and relying on Him, even in the face of adversity and opposition.
orig: الذين قال لهم الناس إن الناس قد جمعوا لكم فاخشوهم فزادهم إيمانا وقالوا حسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل

translation: So they returned with favor from Allah and bounty, no harm having touched them. And they pursued the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who participated in the battle and returned safely with Allah's blessings and favors, without any harm befalling them. They pursued the pleasure of Allah through their obedience and striving in His cause. Allah is the One who bestows immense favors and bounties upon His servants.
orig: فانقلبوا بنعمة من الله وفضل لم يمسسهم سوء واتبعوا رضوان الله والله ذو فضل عظيم

translation: It is only Satan who inspires fear in his friends, so do not fear them, but fear Me if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that fear and anxiety about worldly matters are caused by Satan's influence. True believers should not fear Satan or his allies, but should fear Allah alone, who has complete authority over all affairs.
orig: إنما ذلكم الشيطان يخوف أولياءه فلا تخافوهم وخافون إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And let not grieve you those who race into disbelief. Indeed, they will never harm Allah at all. Allah intends that He should render them no portion in the Hereafter, and they will have a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse is a consolation for the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and a warning to the disbelievers. It states that the disbelievers who hasten towards disbelief and rejection of faith cannot harm Allah in any way. Their disbelief will not diminish Allah's power or glory. Instead, Allah wills that they will have no share in the rewards of the Hereafter, and they will face a severe punishment for their rejection of faith.
orig: ولا يحزنك الذين يسارعون في الكفر إنهم لن يضروا الله شيئا يريد الله ألا يجعل لهم حظا في الآخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: Indeed, those who exchange belief for disbelief will never harm Allah at all, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject faith and embrace disbelief cannot harm Allah in any way, as He is beyond being affected by the actions of His creation. Instead, they only harm themselves by incurring a severe punishment for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: إن الذين اشتروا الكفر بالإيمان لن يضروا الله شيئا ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And let not those who disbelieve think that Our giving them respite is good for them. We only give them respite so that they may increase in sin, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: Allah is warning the disbelievers not to think that the delay in punishing them is good for them. Rather, it is a respite allowing them to increase in sins and disobedience, which will ultimately lead to a humiliating punishment in the Hereafter. The postponement of punishment is not a sign of Allah's approval or negligence, but a wise test and an opportunity for repentance.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين كفروا أنما نملي لهم خير لأنفسهم إنما نملي لهم ليزدادوا إثما ولهم عذاب مهين

translation: Allah would not leave the believers in the condition you are in until He separates the evil from the good. Nor would Allah disclose to you the unseen. But Allah chooses from His messengers whom He wills. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And if you believe and have taqwa, you will have a great reward.
interpretation: Allah ne laissera pas les croyants dans l'état où vous êtes jusqu'à ce qu'Il sépare le mauvais du bon. Allah ne vous révélera pas l'inconnu, mais Il choisit parmi Ses messagers qui Il veut. Croyez donc en Allah et en Ses messagers. Et si vous croyez et avez la piété, vous aurez une grande récompense.
orig: ما كان الله ليذر المؤمنين على ما أنتم عليه حتى يميز الخبيث من الطيب وما كان الله ليطلعكم على الغيب ولكن الله يجتبي من رسله من يشاء فآمنوا بالله ورسله وإن تؤمنوا وتتقوا فلكم أجر عظيم

translation: And let not those who covetously withhold what Allah has bestowed on them of His Bounty think that it is good for them. Nay, it will be worse for them; the things which they covetously withheld shall be tied to their necks like a collar on the Day of Resurrection. And to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Well-Acquainted with all that you do.
interpretation: "This verse warns against being miserly and withholding one's wealth from those in need. It states that those who withhold out of greed what Allah has bestowed upon them should not consider it beneficial, for it will only bring them harm. On the Day of Resurrection, their miserly deeds will hang around their necks like a heavy collar. The verse reminds us that all wealth belongs to Allah, and He is fully aware of our actions. It encourages generosity and condemns miserliness."
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين يبخلون بما آتاهم الله من فضله هو خيرا لهم بل هو شر لهم سيطوقون ما بخلوا به يوم القيامة ولله ميراث السماوات والأرض والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: Indeed, Allah has heard the statement of those who said, 'Indeed, Allah is poor, and we are rich.' We will record what they said and their killing of the prophets unjustly, and We will say, 'Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire.'
interpretation: This verse condemns the arrogant and blasphemous statement made by some disbelievers who claimed that Allah is poor while they are rich. It warns them that Allah has heard their statement and will record their words and their unjust killing of prophets. They will be punished in the Hellfire for their disbelief, arrogance, and crimes against the prophets.
orig: لقد سمع الله قول الذين قالوا إن الله فقير ونحن أغنياء سنكتب ما قالوا وقتلهم الأنبياء بغير حق ونقول ذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: That is for what your hands have sent forth, and verily, Allah is not a tyrant to His slaves.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the hardships and difficulties people face in life are a consequence of their own actions and choices. It emphasizes that Allah is just and does not wrong His servants or treat them unjustly. The verse serves as a reminder that individuals are accountable for their deeds and that their circumstances are a result of their own conduct.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت أيديكم وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: Those who said: 'Indeed, Allah has instructed us not to believe in a messenger until he brings us an offering consumed by fire.' Say: 'There have already come to you messengers before me with clear proofs, and with that which you speak of; so why did you kill them, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: This verse addresses those who made an unreasonable demand from the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They claimed that Allah had instructed them not to believe in any messenger unless he brought an offering that would be consumed by fire as a miracle. The verse refutes their claim by stating that previous messengers had come with clear proofs and miracles, yet these people rejected and killed them. It challenges their truthfulness and exposes the weakness of their argument.
orig: الذين قالوا إن الله عهد إلينا ألا نؤمن لرسول حتى يأتينا بقربان تأكله النار قل قد جاءكم رسل من قبلي بالبينات وبالذي قلتم فلم قتلتموهم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so were messengers denied before you. They came with clear proofs and written ordinances and the enlightening Scripture.
interpretation: If the people reject your message, O Muhammad, do not be distressed, for many messengers before you were also rejected by their people, despite bringing clear signs, scriptures containing laws and commandments, and enlightening scriptures that guide people to the truth.
orig: فإن كذبوك فقد كذب رسل من قبلك جاءوا بالبينات والزبر والكتاب المنير

translation: Every soul will taste death, and you will only be given your [full] compensation on the Day of Resurrection. So he who is drawn away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has attained [his desire]. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.
interpretation: هذه الآية تذكرنا بحقيقة الموت الذي لا مفر منه لكل نفس، وأن الثواب الحقيقي سيكون في الآخرة يوم القيامة. فمن نجا من عذاب النار ودخل الجنة فقد فاز بالفوز العظيم، أما الحياة الدنيا فهي متاع زائل وغرور خادع لا يستحق أن يشغل الإنسان عن طلب الآخرة الباقية.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت وإنما توفون أجوركم يوم القيامة فمن زحزح عن النار وأدخل الجنة فقد فاز وما الحياة الدنيا إلا متاع الغرور

translation: You shall certainly be tried in your possessions and your persons, and you shall hear from those who were given the Book before you and from those who are idolaters much hurt; but if you are patient and God-fearing, that indeed is true constancy.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that the believers will face trials and difficulties in their wealth and lives, as well as verbal abuse and harm from those who were given the previous scriptures (Jews and Christians) and from idolaters. However, it encourages them to be patient and God-fearing, as this is a sign of true determination and resolve in the face of adversity.
orig: لتبلون في أموالكم وأنفسكم ولتسمعن من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم ومن الذين أشركوا أذى كثيرا وإن تصبروا وتتقوا فإن ذلك من عزم الأمور

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took a covenant from those who were given the Scripture, [saying], 'You must make it clear to the people and not conceal it.' But they threw it away behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price - wretched is that which they purchased.
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from the People of the Book, particularly the Jews and Christians, to convey the teachings of their scriptures truthfully to people and not conceal any part of it. However, they broke this covenant by concealing or distorting parts of their scriptures for worldly gains, thus exchanging the truth for a "small price" of this world, which is indeed a wretched bargain.
orig: وإذ أخذ الله ميثاق الذين أوتوا الكتاب لتبيننه للناس ولا تكتمونه فنبذوه وراء ظهورهم واشتروا به ثمنا قليلا فبئس ما يشترون

translation: Think not of those who exult in what they have given, and love to be praised for what they have not done. So do not think them secure from the punishment, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against being self-congratulatory or seeking praise for good deeds that one has not actually done. It condemns those who take pride in their charitable acts and desire to be praised for them, while inwardly they have not given with a sincere intention for the sake of Allah. Such people should not consider themselves safe from Allah's punishment, for they will face a painful torment.
orig: لا تحسبن الذين يفرحون بما أتوا ويحبون أن يحمدوا بما لم يفعلوا فلا تحسبنهم بمفازة من العذاب ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and dominion over the entire universe. It emphasizes that Allah alone holds supreme power and authority over the heavens and the earth, and that He is capable of doing anything. This verse instills a sense of humility and submission to Allah's will, as He is the All-Powerful and All-Encompassing Lord of all creation.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Verily, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of night and day, there are indeed signs for people of understanding.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the signs of Allah's existence and power that are evident in the creation of the heavens and the earth, as well as the alternation of night and day. It invites those with sound intellect and wisdom ("people of understanding") to ponder over these natural phenomena and recognize the greatness of the Creator.
orig: إن في خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف الليل والنهار لآيات لأولي الألباب

translation: Those who remember Allah while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying]: 'Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تصف المؤمنين الذين يذكرون الله في كل أحوالهم، قياماً وقعوداً ومضطجعين على جنوبهم. وهم يتأملون ويتفكرون في خلق السماوات والأرض العظيمة، ويعترفون بوحدانية الله وقدرته، قائلين: "ربنا ما خلقت هذا باطلاً بل بحكمة وغاية سامية، سبحانك عن العبث والباطل، فقنا عذاب النار بفضلك ورحمتك".
orig: الذين يذكرون الله قياما وقعودا وعلى جنوبهم ويتفكرون في خلق السماوات والأرض ربنا ما خلقت هذا باطلا سبحانك فقنا عذاب النار

translation: Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humiliation and lack of support for those who are admitted to Hellfire for their wrongdoings. It emphasizes that entering Hellfire is a great disgrace, and those who commit injustice will find no one to help or support them against Allah's punishment. This serves as a warning to stay away from wrongdoing and injustice, as the consequences are severe and inescapable.
orig: ربنا إنك من تدخل النار فقد أخزيته وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse expresses the sincere belief and supplication of the believers. They acknowledge hearing the call to faith and responding positively by believing in Allah. They then humbly ask Allah to forgive their sins, remove their misdeeds, and grant them a righteous end by allowing them to die in a state of righteousness, among the virtuous people.
orig: ربنا إننا سمعنا مناديا ينادي للإيمان أن آمنوا بربكم فآمنا ربنا فاغفر لنا ذنوبنا وكفر عنا سيئاتنا وتوفنا مع الأبرار

translation: Our Lord, and give us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise.
interpretation: "We ask You, our Lord, to grant us the reward and blessings that You promised us through Your messengers for our faith and good deeds. And protect us from humiliation and disgrace on the Day of Resurrection when everyone will be held accountable. Surely, You never fail to fulfill Your promises."
orig: ربنا وآتنا ما وعدتنا على رسلك ولا تخزنا يوم القيامة إنك لا تخلف الميعاد

translation: Their Lord responded to them: 'I will not waste the work of any worker among you, whether male or female; you are from one another. Those who emigrated and were driven out from their homes, and were persecuted in My cause, and fought and were killed - I will surely absolve them of their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah. And with Allah is the best reward.'
interpretation: This verse promises that Allah will reward those who endure hardship, persecution, and struggle in His cause. Their good deeds will not be wasted, regardless of gender. Those who migrate for the sake of Allah, are expelled from their homes, suffer harm, fight, and are killed - Allah promises to forgive their sins and admit them into Paradise with rivers flowing beneath it. This is a great reward from Allah for their sacrifices and steadfastness on the path of faith.
orig: فاستجاب لهم ربهم أني لا أضيع عمل عامل منكم من ذكر أو أنثى بعضكم من بعض فالذين هاجروا وأخرجوا من ديارهم وأوذوا في سبيلي وقاتلوا وقتلوا لأكفرن عنهم سيئاتهم ولأدخلنهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ثوابا من عند الله والله عنده حسن الثواب

translation: Let not the free disposal of those who disbelieve in the lands deceive you.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers not to be deceived by the apparent freedom and prosperity that the disbelievers enjoy in this world. It reminds us that their temporary success and ability to move about freely in the lands should not make us envy them or doubt the truth of faith. Their worldly gains are fleeting, and their ultimate end will be a painful punishment for rejecting the guidance of Allah.
orig: لا يغرنك تقلب الذين كفروا في البلاد

translation: A brief enjoyment, then their abode is Hell, and an evil resting place.
interpretation: This verse warns about the temporary and fleeting nature of worldly pleasures and luxuries enjoyed by those who disbelieve and disobey Allah. It states that their enjoyment in this life is short-lived and insignificant compared to the eternal punishment awaiting them in Hellfire, which is described as an "evil resting place" - a dreadful and agonizing abode.
orig: متاع قليل ثم مأواهم جهنم وبئس المهاد

translation: But for those who feared their Lord, they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein, as accommodation from Allah . And that which is with Allah is best for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse promises a great reward for the righteous people who had consciousness of Allah and feared His punishment. They will be granted eternal gardens in Paradise, with rivers flowing beneath them. This blissful dwelling is directly from Allah as a gift and hospitality for them. Moreover, the verse emphasizes that whatever reward Allah has in store for the righteous believers is far better and more excellent than anything in this world.
orig: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها نزلا من عند الله وما عند الله خير للأبرار

translation: And indeed, among the People of the Scripture, there are those who believe in Allah and what was revealed to you and what was revealed to them, humbling themselves before Allah. They do not exchange the verses of Allah for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse affirms that among the People of the Book (Jews and Christians), there are those who have sincere faith in Allah, the Qur'an revealed to Prophet Muhammad, and their own scriptures. They humble themselves before Allah and do not trade or sell Allah's revelations for a small worldly gain. These sincere believers among the People of the Book will be rewarded by Allah, Who is swift in reckoning and rewarding good deeds.
orig: وإن من أهل الكتاب لمن يؤمن بالله وما أنزل إليكم وما أنزل إليهم خاشعين لله لا يشترون بآيات الله ثمنا قليلا أولئك لهم أجرهم عند ربهم إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: O you who believe, persevere and endure, remain stationed, and fear Allah, so that you may be successful.
interpretation: "The verse encourages believers to exercise patience, perseverance, and steadfastness in the face of adversities and challenges. It exhorts them to remain vigilant, guard their faith, and maintain a strong connection with Allah through piety and obedience. By doing so, they increase their chances of attaining success and salvation in this life and the Hereafter."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اصبروا وصابروا ورابطوا واتقوا الله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: O mankind! Reverence your Guardian-Lord, who created you from a single person, created, of like nature, his mate, and from them twain scattered countless men and women; reverence Allah, through whom ye demand your mutual (rights), and (reverence) the wombs (that bore you): for Allah ever watches over you.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of mankind, as all humans were created from a single soul (Adam). It commands reverence and obedience to Allah, who created men and women from this single origin. It also stresses the importance of upholding family ties and respecting the mothers who bore us, as Allah is ever watchful over our actions.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم الذي خلقكم من نفس واحدة وخلق منها زوجها وبث منهما رجالا كثيرا ونساء واتقوا الله الذي تساءلون به والأرحام إن الله كان عليكم رقيبا

translation: And give the orphans their properties, and do not substitute the bad for the good, and do not consume their properties by combining them with yours. Surely that is a great sin.
interpretation: This verse instructs Muslims to safeguard the wealth and properties of orphans and not misappropriate or misuse them. It prohibits substituting something inferior for something valuable that belongs to orphans. It also forbids consuming or taking the wealth of orphans by mixing it with one's own wealth, as this would be a grave sin.
orig: وآتوا اليتامى أموالهم ولا تتبدلوا الخبيث بالطيب ولا تأكلوا أموالهم إلى أموالكم إنه كان حوبا كبيرا

translation: And if you fear that you will not deal justly with the orphan girls, then marry those that please you of [other] women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be just, then [marry only] one or those your right hand possesses. That is more suitable that you may not incline [to injustice].
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne l'importance de traiter les orphelins de manière juste et équitable. Si l'on craint de ne pas pouvoir le faire, alors on est autorisé à épouser jusqu'à quatre femmes, à condition de les traiter toutes de manière égale et juste. Cependant, si l'on craint de ne pas pouvoir être juste envers plusieurs épouses, alors il vaut mieux n'en épouser qu'une seule ou s'en tenir aux esclaves concubines. Cela permettra d'éviter l'injustice et l'inclinaison vers le mal.
orig: وإن خفتم ألا تقسطوا في اليتامى فانكحوا ما طاب لكم من النساء مثنى وثلاث ورباع فإن خفتم ألا تعدلوا فواحدة أو ما ملكت أيمانكم ذلك أدنى ألا تعولوا

translation: And give the women their bridal gift willingly. But if they remit to you anything of it, of their own accord, then consume it with wholesome appetite.
interpretation: This verse instructs men to give their wives the dowry or bridal gift willingly and without hesitation. However, if the wives voluntarily and happily choose to return a portion of the dowry to their husbands, then the husbands are permitted to accept and benefit from it with a clear conscience and without any guilt or reluctance.
orig: وآتوا النساء صدقاتهن نحلة فإن طبن لكم عن شيء منه نفسا فكلوه هنيئا مريئا

translation: And do not give the foolish your wealth which Allah has made a means of sustenance for you, but feed and clothe them from it, and speak to them words of appropriate advice.
interpretation: This verse instructs Muslims not to entrust their wealth to those who lack sound judgement and maturity, referred to as "the foolish". Instead, they should use that wealth to provide for the foolish's basic needs of food and clothing. Moreover, when interacting with them, Muslims should offer wise counsel and gentle advice.
orig: ولا تؤتوا السفهاء أموالكم التي جعل الله لكم قياما وارزقوهم فيها واكسوهم وقولوا لهم قولا معروفا

translation: And test the orphans [in their abilities] until they reach marriageable age. Then if you perceive in them sound judgement, release their property to them. And do not consume it excessively and quickly, [anticipating] their growth. And whoever is self-sufficient should refrain [from consuming the orphan's property]. And whoever is poor - so let him eat within reasonable limits. Then when you release their property to them, bring witnesses upon them. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on how to deal with the property of orphans. It instructs to test the orphans' maturity and judgement as they approach marriageable age. If they demonstrate sound reasoning, their property should be handed over to them. However, it warns against consuming their wealth extravagantly or hastily in anticipation of their growth. Those who are financially capable should refrain from using the orphan's wealth, while those in need may consume from it reasonably. When returning the property, witnesses should be present. Ultimately, Allah is the Supreme Reckoner and will hold everyone accountable.
orig: وابتلوا اليتامى حتى إذا بلغوا النكاح فإن آنستم منهم رشدا فادفعوا إليهم أموالهم ولا تأكلوها إسرافا وبدارا أن يكبروا ومن كان غنيا فليستعفف ومن كان فقيرا فليأكل بالمعروف فإذا دفعتم إليهم أموالهم فأشهدوا عليهم وكفى بالله حسيبا

translation: For men there is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, and for women there is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, whether it is little or much - an obligatory share.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of inheritance in Islam, where both men and women have a rightful share in the inheritance left by their parents and close relatives. It emphasizes that this share is obligatory and must be given, whether the inheritance is small or large. The verse highlights the justice and fairness of the Islamic system, which recognizes the rights of both genders to inherit from their deceased relatives.
orig: للرجال نصيب مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون وللنساء نصيب مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون مما قل منه أو كثر نصيبا مفروضا

translation: And when the relatives, the orphans and the needy are present at the division [of inheritance], then provide for them from it and speak to them words of appropriate kindness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being kind and generous towards relatives, orphans, and the poor when distributing inheritance. It encourages providing them with a share from the inheritance and speaking to them with gentle and respectful words. The verse promotes compassion, empathy, and maintaining good relations with those in need.
orig: وإذا حضر القسمة أولو القربى واليتامى والمساكين فارزقوهم منه وقولوا لهم قولا معروفا

translation: And let those fear [to disobey] who, if they left behind them weak offspring, would fear for them. So let them fear Allah and speak appropriate words.
interpretation: This verse advises those who have dependents to be mindful of Allah and say what is right and truthful. It encourages people to be responsible and take care of their families, especially those who are weak and vulnerable. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of having taqwa (consciousness of Allah) and being mindful of one's words and actions, as they can impact the well-being of one's loved ones.
orig: وليخش الذين لو تركوا من خلفهم ذرية ضعافا خافوا عليهم فليتقوا الله وليقولوا قولا سديدا

translation: Indeed, those who devour the property of orphans unjustly are only consuming fire into their bellies, and they will be burned in a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse warns against wrongfully consuming the wealth of orphans, which is considered a grave sin. It metaphorically states that those who do so are essentially filling their stomachs with fire that will burn them in the Hellfire on the Day of Judgment. The verse emphasizes the importance of protecting the rights and wealth of orphans, who are among the most vulnerable members of society.
orig: إن الذين يأكلون أموال اليتامى ظلما إنما يأكلون في بطونهم نارا وسيصلون سعيرا

translation: Allah instructs you concerning your children: for the male, what is equal to the share of two females. But if there are [only] daughters, two or more, for them is two thirds of one's estate. And if there is only one, for her is half. And for one's parents, to each one of them is a sixth of his estate if he left children. But if he had no children and the parents [alone] inherit from him, then for his mother is one third. And if he had brothers [or sisters], for his mother is a sixth, after any bequest he [may have] made or debt. Your parents or your children - you know not which of them are nearest to you in benefit; [these shares are] an obligation [imposed] by Allah. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse provides detailed instructions regarding the distribution of inheritance among children, parents, and siblings. It establishes specific shares for males and females, as well as for parents and siblings in different scenarios. The underlying wisdom is to ensure a fair and balanced distribution of wealth within the family unit, while recognizing the varying responsibilities and needs of different family members. The verse emphasizes that these shares are ordained by Allah, reflecting His infinite knowledge and wisdom.
orig: يوصيكم الله في أولادكم للذكر مثل حظ الأنثيين فإن كن نساء فوق اثنتين فلهن ثلثا ما ترك وإن كانت واحدة فلها النصف ولأبويه لكل واحد منهما السدس مما ترك إن كان له ولد فإن لم يكن له ولد وورثه أبواه فلأمه الثلث فإن كان له إخوة فلأمه السدس من بعد وصية يوصي بها أو دين آباؤكم وأبناؤكم لا تدرون أيهم أقرب لكم نفعا فريضة من الله إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And for you is one half of what your wives leave if they have no child. But if they have a child, then for you is one fourth of what they leave, after any bequest they [may have] made or debt. And for the wives is one fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then for them is one eighth of what you leave, after any bequest you [may have] made or debt. And if a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then for each one of them is a sixth. But if they are more than two, they share a third, after any bequest which was made or debt, as long as there is no detriment [caused]. [This is] an ordinance from Allah, and Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse outlines the shares of inheritance for spouses and siblings in cases where there are no children or parents. It promotes fairness and justice in the distribution of wealth after death, while allowing for bequests and debt repayment. The interpretations emphasize Allah's wisdom in ordaining these rules to maintain social harmony and prevent conflicts over inheritance.
orig: ولكم نصف ما ترك أزواجكم إن لم يكن لهن ولد فإن كان لهن ولد فلكم الربع مما تركن من بعد وصية يوصين بها أو دين ولهن الربع مما تركتم إن لم يكن لكم ولد فإن كان لكم ولد فلهن الثمن مما تركتم من بعد وصية توصون بها أو دين وإن كان رجل يورث كلالة أو امرأة وله أخ أو أخت فلكل واحد منهما السدس فإن كانوا أكثر من ذلك فهم شركاء في الثلث من بعد وصية يوصى بها أو دين غير مضار وصية من الله والله عليم حليم

translation: These are the limits of Allah, and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein; and that is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger. It promises those who obey them entry into Paradise, where rivers flow beneath lush gardens, and they will abide there eternally. This is described as the "great attainment," which is the ultimate success and reward for the believers.
orig: تلك حدود الله ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger and transgresses His limits - He will admit him to a Fire, abiding therein forever; and he will have a disgraceful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against disobeying Allah and His Messenger, and transgressing the limits set by Allah. It states that those who commit such acts will be admitted to the Hellfire, where they will abide forever, suffering a humiliating punishment. The verse emphasizes the grave consequences of defying Allah's commands and the Prophet's teachings, highlighting the importance of obedience and staying within the boundaries prescribed by Islam.
orig: ومن يعص الله ورسوله ويتعد حدوده يدخله نارا خالدا فيها وله عذاب مهين

translation: And those of your women who commit immorality, call four witnesses from among yourselves against them. If they testify, then confine them to their homes until death takes them or Allah ordains a way for them.
interpretation: This verse discusses the punishment for married women who commit adultery. It instructs that four witnesses must testify to the act. If they do testify, the women should be confined to their homes until they die or Allah provides another solution, which could refer to accepting their repentance or prescribing another punishment.
orig: واللاتي يأتين الفاحشة من نسائكم فاستشهدوا عليهن أربعة منكم فإن شهدوا فأمسكوهن في البيوت حتى يتوفاهن الموت أو يجعل الله لهن سبيلا

translation: And the two who commit it among you, dishonor them both. But if they repent and correct themselves, leave them alone. Indeed, Allah is ever Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of homosexual behavior, which was prevalent in pre-Islamic Arabian society. It instructs that those who engage in such acts should be reprimanded and socially boycotted. However, if they repent and reform their ways, they should be forgiven and reintegrated into society. The verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and willingness to accept sincere repentance.
orig: واللذان يأتيانها منكم فآذوهما فإن تابا وأصلحا فأعرضوا عنهما إن الله كان توابا رحيما

translation: The repentance accepted by Allah is only for those who do evil in ignorance, and then repent soon after. It is those to whom Allah will turn in forgiveness, and Allah is Ever All-Knower, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true repentance is only accepted by Allah for those who commit sins out of ignorance or weakness, and then sincerely repent soon after realizing their mistake. It highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in forgiving those who genuinely repent and turn back to Him. The verse encourages people to repent immediately after committing a sin, as delaying repentance may lead to further sins and distance from Allah's forgiveness.
orig: إنما التوبة على الله للذين يعملون السوء بجهالة ثم يتوبون من قريب فأولئك يتوب الله عليهم وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: But repentance is not [accepted] from those who [continue to] do evil deeds up until, when death comes to one of them, he says, 'Indeed, I have repented now,' nor from those who die while they are disbelievers. For them We have prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن التوبة لا تُقبل من الأشخاص الذين يواصلون ارتكاب الأعمال السيئة حتى يحضر أحدهم الموت، فيقول إنه تاب الآن. كما لا تُقبل التوبة من الذين يموتون وهم كفار. لهؤلاء الأشخاص أعد الله عذابًا موجعًا، لأنهم لم يتوبوا بصدق وإخلاص في حياتهم الدنيا.
orig: وليست التوبة للذين يعملون السيئات حتى إذا حضر أحدهم الموت قال إني تبت الآن ولا الذين يموتون وهم كفار أولئك أعتدنا لهم عذابا أليما

translation: O you who have believed, it is not lawful for you to inherit women by compulsion. And do not make difficulties for them in order to take [back] part of what you gave them unless they commit a clear immorality. And live with them in kindness. For if you dislike them - perhaps you dislike a thing and Allah has placed therein much good.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the pre-Islamic practice of inheriting women against their will after the death of their husbands. It commands the believers to treat their wives with kindness, even if they dislike some aspects of their behavior, because Allah may have placed much good in what they dislike.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا يحل لكم أن ترثوا النساء كرها ولا تعضلوهن لتذهبوا ببعض ما آتيتموهن إلا أن يأتين بفاحشة مبينة وعاشروهن بالمعروف فإن كرهتموهن فعسى أن تكرهوا شيئا ويجعل الله فيه خيرا كثيرا

translation: And if you wish to replace a wife with another wife, and you have given one of them a great amount, do not take anything back from it. Would you take it by way of falsehood and manifest sin?
interpretation: Allah prohibits taking back the dowry or gifts given to the wife if the husband wishes to divorce her and marry another woman. This would be an injustice and a manifest sin, as the dowry belongs to the wife and cannot be reclaimed merely because the husband wants to end the marriage.
orig: وإن أردتم استبدال زوج مكان زوج وآتيتم إحداهن قنطارا فلا تأخذوا منه شيئا أتأخذونه بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: And how could you take it while you have gone in unto one another, and they have taken from you a solemn covenant?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sanctity of marriage and the covenant between spouses. It questions how one could break this sacred bond after being intimate with one's spouse and exchanging solemn vows. The interpretation highlights the gravity of violating marital commitments and betraying the trust established through the marital covenant.
orig: وكيف تأخذونه وقد أفضى بعضكم إلى بعض وأخذن منكم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: And do not marry those women whom your fathers married, except what has already occurred. Indeed, it was an immorality and hateful [to Allah] and was evil way.
interpretation: This verse prohibits marrying women who were previously married to one's father, as this is considered an immoral and abhorrent act in Islam. It is seen as a violation of the sanctity of family relationships and a transgression against natural laws. The exception mentioned "except what has already occurred" refers to such marriages that took place before the revelation of this prohibition during the pre-Islamic era of ignorance (Jahiliyyah).
orig: ولا تنكحوا ما نكح آباؤكم من النساء إلا ما قد سلف إنه كان فاحشة ومقتا وساء سبيلا

translation: Prohibited to you [for marriage] are your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your father's sisters, your mother's sisters, your brother's daughters, your sister's daughters, your [milk] mothers who nursed you, your sisters through nursing, your wives' mothers, and your step-daughters under your guardianship [born] of your wives unto whom you have gone in. But if you have not gone in unto them, there is no sin upon you. And [prohibited are] the wives of your sons who are from your [own] loins, and that you take [in marriage] two sisters simultaneously, except for what has already occurred. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse outlines the categories of women who are permanently prohibited for marriage (mahram) due to close blood or marital ties. It establishes boundaries to maintain chastity, preserve lineage, and uphold family values. The interpretation emphasizes the sanctity of familial relationships and the importance of adhering to divine commandments regarding lawful and unlawful relationships.
orig: حرمت عليكم أمهاتكم وبناتكم وأخواتكم وعماتكم وخالاتكم وبنات الأخ وبنات الأخت وأمهاتكم اللاتي أرضعنكم وأخواتكم من الرضاعة وأمهات نسائكم وربائبكم اللاتي في حجوركم من نسائكم اللاتي دخلتم بهن فإن لم تكونوا دخلتم بهن فلا جناح عليكم وحلائل أبنائكم الذين من أصلابكم وأن تجمعوا بين الأختين إلا ما قد سلف إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And [also prohibited to you are all] married women except those your right hands possess. [This is] the decree of Allah upon you. And lawful to you are [all others] beyond these, [provided] that you seek them [in marriage] with [gifts from] your property, desiring chastity, not unlawful sexual intercourse. So for whatever you enjoy [of marriage] from them, give them their due compensation as an obligation. And there is no blame upon you for what you mutually agree to beyond the obligation. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the lawful and unlawful relationships for Muslim men. It prohibits married women except for those who are legally possessed as slaves or prisoners of war. It allows men to seek marriage with other women by providing them with a dowry, emphasizing chastity and lawful relations. The verse instructs men to provide the agreed-upon dowry to their wives and permits additional mutual agreements beyond the obligatory dowry. It highlights Allah's wisdom and knowledge in legislating these laws.
orig: والمحصنات من النساء إلا ما ملكت أيمانكم كتاب الله عليكم وأحل لكم ما وراء ذلكم أن تبتغوا بأموالكم محصنين غير مسافحين فما استمتعتم به منهن فآتوهن أجورهن فريضة ولا جناح عليكم فيما تراضيتم به من بعد الفريضة إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And whoever among you cannot afford to marry free, believing women, then [he may marry] from those which your right hands possess of believing girls. And Allah is most knowing about your faith. You [believers] are of one another. So marry them with the permission of their people and give them their dowries according to what is proper - [after] being chaste, not committing unlawful sexual intercourse or taking [secret] lovers. But once they are sheltered in marriage, if they should commit adultery, then for them is half the punishment for free [unmarried] women. This [allowance] is for him among you who fears financial hardship [in remaining chaste]. But to have patience would be better for you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse provides guidance for those who cannot afford to marry free, believing women due to financial constraints. It allows them to marry believing slave girls with the permission of their owners and to provide them with a proper dowry. The verse emphasizes the importance of chastity and prohibits unlawful sexual relations or taking secret lovers. It also outlines the consequences for adultery, which is a lesser punishment for slave girls compared to free women. However, the verse encourages patience and abstinence as a better path, acknowledging the mercy and forgiveness of Allah.
orig: ومن لم يستطع منكم طولا أن ينكح المحصنات المؤمنات فمن ما ملكت أيمانكم من فتياتكم المؤمنات والله أعلم بإيمانكم بعضكم من بعض فانكحوهن بإذن أهلهن وآتوهن أجورهن بالمعروف محصنات غير مسافحات ولا متخذات أخدان فإذا أحصن فإن أتين بفاحشة فعليهن نصف ما على المحصنات من العذاب ذلك لمن خشي العنت منكم وأن تصبروا خير لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah intends to make clear to you [the lawful from the unlawful] and guide you to the ways of those before you and accept your repentance. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: Allah wants to explain to you the rulings and laws, and guide you to follow the righteous path of the previous nations. He also wants to accept your repentance when you commit sins and then repent. Allah is All-Knowing of what benefits His servants, and He is Perfectly Wise in His legislation and commands.
orig: يريد الله ليبين لكم ويهديكم سنن الذين من قبلكم ويتوب عليكم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And Allah wants to accept your repentance, but those who follow [their] passions want you to digress [into] a great digression.
interpretation: Allah desires to accept your sincere repentance and guide you towards righteousness, but those who indulge in their desires and lusts want you to deviate greatly from the straight path and commit grave sins.
orig: والله يريد أن يتوب عليكم ويريد الذين يتبعون الشهوات أن تميلوا ميلا عظيما

translation: Allah intends to lighten [the burden] for you; and mankind was created weak.
interpretation: Allah desires to make things easy for you and alleviate hardship, for He is Merciful and Compassionate. He understands that human beings were created weak, with limitations and imperfections. This verse reminds us of Allah's mercy and consideration for our frailties as human beings.
orig: يريد الله أن يخفف عنكم وخلق الإنسان ضعيفا

translation: O you who believe! Do not consume one another's wealth unjustly but only [in lawful] business by mutual consent. And do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse prohibits Muslims from wrongfully consuming each other's wealth through illegitimate means like gambling, interest, bribery, or fraud. It emphasizes that financial transactions should be based on mutual consent and lawful business practices. Additionally, it forbids suicide and any actions that could lead to harming oneself or others, as human life is sacred and should be protected. The verse concludes by reminding believers of Allah's infinite mercy towards them."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تأكلوا أموالكم بينكم بالباطل إلا أن تكون تجارة عن تراض منكم ولا تقتلوا أنفسكم إن الله كان بكم رحيما

translation: And whoever commits that through aggression and injustice - We will drive him into a Fire. And that, for Allah, is easy.
interpretation: This verse warns against committing sins out of aggression and injustice towards others. It states that whoever engages in such sinful acts willfully and oppressively, Allah will punish them by admitting them into the Hellfire. The ease with which Allah can carry out this punishment is emphasized, as nothing is difficult for the Almighty.
orig: ومن يفعل ذلك عدوانا وظلما فسوف نصليه نارا وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden, We will remove from you your lesser sins and admit you to a noble entrance.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness and a noble entrance into Paradise for those who avoid committing major sins. It emphasizes the importance of abstaining from grave transgressions, as doing so will lead to the removal of lesser sins and ultimately, entry into a honorable state in the Hereafter.
orig: إن تجتنبوا كبائر ما تنهون عنه نكفر عنكم سيئاتكم وندخلكم مدخلا كريما

translation: And do not covet what Allah has favored some of you over others. For men is a share of what they have earned, and for women is a share of what they have earned. And ask Allah of His bounty. Truly, Allah is Ever All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse teaches that we should not envy the favors that Allah has bestowed upon others, as each person has been granted a share according to their efforts and deeds. Men have a right to what they have earned, and women have a right to what they have earned. Instead of coveting others' possessions, we should turn to Allah and ask Him for His bounties, for He is aware of all our needs and circumstances.
orig: ولا تتمنوا ما فضل الله به بعضكم على بعض للرجال نصيب مما اكتسبوا وللنساء نصيب مما اكتسبن واسألوا الله من فضله إن الله كان بكل شيء عليما

translation: And for all, We have made heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. And to those with whom you have made a covenant, give them their portion. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, a Witness.
interpretation: This verse establishes the laws of inheritance in Islam. It states that Allah has appointed heirs for every person, who will inherit the wealth left behind by their parents, relatives, and those with whom they had made a covenant. The verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling these rights and giving each heir their due share, as Allah is a Witness over all things.
orig: ولكل جعلنا موالي مما ترك الوالدان والأقربون والذين عقدت أيمانكم فآتوهم نصيبهم إن الله كان على كل شيء شهيدا

translation: Men are the protectors and maintainers of women, because Allah has given the one more (strength) than the other, and because they support them from their means. Therefore the righteous women are devoutly obedient, and guard in (the husband's) absence what Allah would have them guard. As to those women on whose part ye fear disloyalty and ill-conduct, admonish them (first), (next) refuse to share their beds, (and last) beat them (lightly); but if they return to obedience, seek not against them means (of annoyance): for Allah is Most High, Great (above you all).
interpretation: This verse establishes the leadership role of men over women in the family unit, based on the natural differences between the genders and the financial responsibility of men. However, this authority is not absolute, but conditional upon the men fulfilling their obligations of maintaining and protecting their wives. The verse outlines a gradual disciplinary approach for dealing with ill-conduct or disloyalty from the wife, starting with advice, then abstaining from intimacy, and finally a light, non-injurious beating as a final resort before seeking reconciliation. The overall message is one of mutual rights, responsibilities and respect within the marital relationship.
orig: الرجال قوامون على النساء بما فضل الله بعضهم على بعض وبما أنفقوا من أموالهم فالصالحات قانتات حافظات للغيب بما حفظ الله واللاتي تخافون نشوزهن فعظوهن واهجروهن في المضاجع واضربوهن فإن أطعنكم فلا تبغوا عليهن سبيلا إن الله كان عليا كبيرا

translation: And if you fear dissension between the two, send an arbitrator from his people and an arbitrator from her people. If they both desire reconciliation, Allah will cause them to be reconciled. Indeed, Allah is Ever All-Knower, Well-Acquainted with all things.
interpretation: If a husband and wife are having serious marital disputes and there is a risk of separation or divorce, then appoint two arbitrators - one from the husband's family and one from the wife's family. If these arbitrators are sincere in wanting to resolve the conflict and reconcile the couple, Allah will guide them to a solution that preserves the marriage. Allah is fully aware of all circumstances and knows what is best for the couple.
orig: وإن خفتم شقاق بينهما فابعثوا حكما من أهله وحكما من أهلها إن يريدا إصلاحا يوفق الله بينهما إن الله كان عليما خبيرا

translation: Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, and do good to parents, relatives, orphans, the needy, the near neighbor, the neighbor farther away, the companion by your side, the traveler, and those your right hands possess. Indeed, Allah does not like those who are self-deluding and boastful.
interpretation: This verse commands the worship of Allah alone without associating any partners with Him. It also enjoins kindness and good treatment towards parents, relatives, orphans, the poor, neighbors both near and far, companions, travelers, and slaves. The verse concludes with a warning that Allah does not love those who are arrogant, boastful, and conceited.
orig: واعبدوا الله ولا تشركوا به شيئا وبالوالدين إحسانا وبذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين والجار ذي القربى والجار الجنب والصاحب بالجنب وابن السبيل وما ملكت أيمانكم إن الله لا يحب من كان مختالا فخورا

translation: Those who are miserly and enjoin others to be miserly and conceal what Allah has given them of His bounty - and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns the miserly behavior of those who are stingy themselves, encourage others to be stingy as well, and hide the blessings and provisions that Allah has bestowed upon them. It warns that for such ungrateful and selfish conduct, Allah has prepared a humiliating punishment for the disbelievers in the Hereafter.
orig: الذين يبخلون ويأمرون الناس بالبخل ويكتمون ما آتاهم الله من فضله وأعتدنا للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: And those who spend their wealth to be seen by people and do not believe in Allah and the Last Day - whoever has Satan as a companion, then he is the worst companion.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who spend their wealth only to show off and gain praise from others, rather than out of sincere faith and belief in Allah and the Day of Judgment. It warns that whoever associates with Satan and follows his evil ways has chosen the worst possible companion, who will lead them to ruin in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: والذين ينفقون أموالهم رئاء الناس ولا يؤمنون بالله ولا باليوم الآخر ومن يكن الشيطان له قرينا فساء قرينا

translation: And what reason do they have not to believe in Allah and the Last Day and spend out of what Allah has provided for them? And Allah is Ever All-Aware of them.
interpretation: This verse encourages belief in Allah and the Last Day, as well as spending in charity from the provisions granted by Allah. It implies that there is no valid excuse for disbelief or miserliness, as Allah is fully aware of the circumstances and intentions of each individual.
orig: وماذا عليهم لو آمنوا بالله واليوم الآخر وأنفقوا مما رزقهم الله وكان الله بهم عليما

translation: Verily, Allah does not do injustice to even an atom's weight. If there is a good deed, He multiplies it, and gives from Himself a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's perfect justice and generosity. He does not wrong anyone, not even by the weight of an atom. If a person does a good deed, no matter how small, Allah multiplies its reward manifold. Moreover, He bestows an immense reward from His own grace and bounty, which far exceeds what the deed deserves. This highlights Allah's infinite mercy and His desire to greatly reward those who strive to do good deeds.
orig: إن الله لا يظلم مثقال ذرة وإن تك حسنة يضاعفها ويؤت من لدنه أجرا عظيما

translation: And how will it be when We bring from every nation a witness and We bring you as a witness against these people?
interpretation: On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will call a witness from every nation to testify against them regarding their response to the message conveyed by the prophets. Additionally, the Prophet Muhammad will be brought as a witness against his nation, testifying about their acceptance or rejection of the divine message he delivered. This emphasizes the accountability of individuals and nations before Allah on the inevitable Day of Judgment.
orig: فكيف إذا جئنا من كل أمة بشهيد وجئنا بك على هؤلاء شهيدا

translation: On that Day, those who disbelieved and disobeyed the Messenger will wish that they were level with the ground, and they will not be able to hide any fact from Allah.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers and disobedient ones that on the Day of Judgment, they will wish they could be buried in the ground to escape from the severe punishment and humiliation they will face. However, they will not be able to hide anything from Allah, as He knows all their deeds and intentions.
orig: يومئذ يود الذين كفروا وعصوا الرسول لو تسوى بهم الأرض ولا يكتمون الله حديثا

translation: O you who have believed, do not approach prayer while you are intoxicated until you know what you are saying or in a state of janabah, except those passing through [a place of prayer], until you have bathed. And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have touched women and find no water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
