interpretation: This verse outlines the conditions under which one is permitted to perform prayer. It prohibits approaching prayer while intoxicated or in a state of major ritual impurity (janabah), except for those who are merely passing through and not intending to pray. It also allows for dry ablution (tayammum) using clean earth when water is not available due to illness, travel, or after using the restroom or intimacy with one's spouse. The verse emphasizes Allah's forgiveness and pardon for those who observe these guidelines.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقربوا الصلاة وأنتم سكارى حتى تعلموا ما تقولون ولا جنبا إلا عابري سبيل حتى تغتسلوا وإن كنتم مرضى أو على سفر أو جاء أحد منكم من الغائط أو لامستم النساء فلم تجدوا ماء فتيمموا صعيدا طيبا فامسحوا بوجوهكم وأيديكم إن الله كان عفوا غفورا

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They purchase error and desire that you stray from the way.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who were given knowledge from the divine scriptures, but instead of following the truth, they deliberately choose misguidance and want others to go astray as well. They trade the guidance for error, either due to arrogance, envy, or worldly interests. The verse warns against such people who misuse their knowledge to mislead others from the straight path.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يشترون الضلالة ويريدون أن تضلوا السبيل

translation: And Allah is most knowing of your enemies, and sufficient is Allah as an ally, and sufficient is Allah as a helper.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah has perfect knowledge of who our true enemies are, even if we cannot perceive them. It reassures us that having Allah as our ally and helper is sufficient, and we need not fear or rely on anyone else. The verse instills trust in Allah's protection, guidance, and support against all adversities and hostilities we may face.
orig: والله أعلم بأعدائكم وكفى بالله وليا وكفى بالله نصيرا

translation: Among those who are Jewish, there are some who distort the words from their proper places and say, 'We hear and disobey,' and 'Hear without being heard,' and 'Ra'ina,' twisting with their tongues and slandering the religion. Had they said, 'We hear and obey,' and 'Listen,' and 'Unzurna,' it would have been better for them and more upright. But Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, so they do not believe except a little.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the behavior of some Jews who deliberately distort the meanings of words and commands in their scripture, showing disrespect and disobedience. They use wordplay and twisted phrases to mock the religion instead of sincerely listening and obeying. As a result, Allah has cursed them for their disbelief, and only a few among them have true faith.
orig: من الذين هادوا يحرفون الكلم عن مواضعه ويقولون سمعنا وعصينا واسمع غير مسمع وراعنا ليا بألسنتهم وطعنا في الدين ولو أنهم قالوا سمعنا وأطعنا واسمع وانظرنا لكان خيرا لهم وأقوم ولكن لعنهم الله بكفرهم فلا يؤمنون إلا قليلا

translation: O you who have been given the Book! Believe in what We have revealed, confirming what is with you, before We obliterate faces and turn them backwards, or curse them as We cursed the Sabbath-breakers. And the command of Allah is always executed.
interpretation: "This verse is a warning and admonition from Allah to the People of the Book, primarily the Jews and Christians, to believe in the Qur'an which was revealed to Prophet Muhammad as it confirms the previous scriptures they possess. If they reject it, Allah threatens to disfigure their faces or turn them away from guidance, or curse them as He cursed those who disobeyed the commandment of the Sabbath. This serves as a reminder that Allah's command is always carried out, and no one can defy His will."
orig: يا أيها الذين أوتوا الكتاب آمنوا بما نزلنا مصدقا لما معكم من قبل أن نطمس وجوها فنردها على أدبارها أو نلعنهم كما لعنا أصحاب السبت وكان أمر الله مفعولا

translation: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly fabricated a tremendous sin.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the gravity of associating partners with Allah (shirk), which is considered an unforgivable sin. It states that Allah will not pardon those who commit shirk by worshipping or associating others besides Him. However, Allah may forgive lesser sins for whomever He wills. The verse warns that committing shirk is a tremendous sin and a grave falsehood against Allah.
orig: إن الله لا يغفر أن يشرك به ويغفر ما دون ذلك لمن يشاء ومن يشرك بالله فقد افترى إثما عظيما

translation: Have you not seen those who claim self-purity? Nay, Allah purifies whom He wills, and they will not be wronged even the smallest speck on a date-stone.
interpretation: This verse refutes the claim of those who consider themselves pure and righteous based on their own assessment. It emphasizes that true purity comes from Allah alone, Who purifies whomever He wills according to His infinite wisdom and justice. No one has the right to declare themselves pure, as this judgment belongs solely to Allah. The verse also reassures that Allah does not wrong anyone, even to the smallest degree, indicating His perfect fairness and justice.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يزكون أنفسهم بل الله يزكي من يشاء ولا يظلمون فتيلا

translation: See how they fabricate falsehood against Allah, and sufficient is that as a manifest sin.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who attribute lies to Allah, fabricating religious teachings that have no basis in divine revelation. Inventing falsehoods about Allah and ascribing them to Him is a grave sin that clearly goes against the truth. The verse warns against such blatant transgression and deception.
orig: انظر كيف يفترون على الله الكذب وكفى به إثما مبينا

translation: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture, believing in jibt and taghut and saying to those who disbelieved, "These are better guided than the believers in the way?"
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who were given knowledge of the previous scriptures but chose to believe in superstitions and false deities instead of the true faith. It condemns their claim that the disbelievers are better guided than the believers, which is a clear deviation from the truth and a manifestation of their misguided beliefs.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين أوتوا نصيبا من الكتاب يؤمنون بالجبت والطاغوت ويقولون للذين كفروا هؤلاء أهدى من الذين آمنوا سبيلا

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, and whoever Allah curses, you will never find for him a helper.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have been cursed by Allah and deprived of His mercy and guidance. It emphasizes that anyone whom Allah curses will have no one to help or support them, as Allah's curse is a severe punishment that leaves the person utterly helpless and without any means of assistance or deliverance.
orig: أولئك الذين لعنهم الله ومن يلعن الله فلن تجد له نصيرا

translation: Or do they have a share in the Dominion? Then they would not give mankind even a speck on a date-stone.
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' claim to have a share in God's dominion and authority. It argues that if they truly had any part in the sovereignty, they would not deprive people of even the smallest thing, represented by a "speck on a date-stone." This highlights God's absolute control and the falsehood of their claims to any power or authority.
orig: أم لهم نصيب من الملك فإذا لا يؤتون الناس نقيرا

translation: Or do they envy the people for what Allah has given them of His bounty? But We had already given the family of Abraham the Scripture and wisdom, and conferred upon them a great kingdom.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers envy the Muslims because Allah has bestowed upon them His favors and bounties, such as guidance, faith, and knowledge. However, Allah reminds them that He had previously bestowed great favors upon the family of Prophet Abraham, including the Scripture, wisdom, and a great kingdom. The verse implies that just as Allah favored the family of Abraham, He now favors the Muslim community with His bounties, and there is no reason for envy or resentment.
orig: أم يحسدون الناس على ما آتاهم الله من فضله فقد آتينا آل إبراهيم الكتاب والحكمة وآتيناهم ملكا عظيما

translation: But among them is he who believed in it, and among them is he who turned away from it. And sufficient is Hellfire as a blaze.
interpretation: This verse refers to the differing responses of people to the Qur'an. Some believed in it and embraced the truth, while others turned away and rejected it. The latter group is warned that Hellfire will be a sufficient punishment and torment for their disbelief and rejection of God's revelations.
orig: فمنهم من آمن به ومنهم من صد عنه وكفى بجهنم سعيرا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Our verses - We will drive them into a Fire. Every time their skins are roasted through, We will replace them with other skins so they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allah is ever Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of a severe punishment in the Hellfire. Their skins will be continuously burned and replaced with new skins, allowing them to experience the torment repeatedly. This punishment is a manifestation of Allah's Might and Wisdom, as He is capable of inflicting such a severe punishment on those who reject His signs and guidance.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بآياتنا سوف نصليهم نارا كلما نضجت جلودهم بدلناهم جلودا غيرها ليذوقوا العذاب إن الله كان عزيزا حكيما

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. For them therein are purified spouses, and We will admit them to a shaded shade.
interpretation: This verse promises eternal bliss in Paradise for the believers who performed righteous deeds. It describes Paradise as having lush gardens with rivers flowing underneath, where they will dwell forever. They will be joined by purified spouses, and will enjoy a shaded and pleasant environment. This is a reward from Allah for their faith and good actions in this world.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سندخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا لهم فيها أزواج مطهرة وندخلهم ظلا ظليلا

translation: Indeed, Allah commands you to render trusts to whom they are due and when you judge between people to judge with justice. Excellent is that which Allah instructs you. Indeed, Allah is ever Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling trusts and responsibilities, and judging fairly and justly among people. It highlights that being trustworthy, just, and equitable in dealings with others is a command from Allah. The verse also reminds us that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing, aware of our actions and intentions.
orig: إن الله يأمركم أن تؤدوا الأمانات إلى أهلها وإذا حكمتم بين الناس أن تحكموا بالعدل إن الله نعما يعظكم به إن الله كان سميعا بصيرا

translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and those in authority among you. And if you disagree over anything, refer it to Allah and the Messenger, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. That is the best [way] and best in result.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah, His Messenger, and those in authority. It also provides guidance on resolving disputes by referring them to Allah and His Messenger, which is the best way to reach a just and correct resolution, especially for those who truly believe in Allah and the Last Day.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول وأولي الأمر منكم فإن تنازعتم في شيء فردوه إلى الله والرسول إن كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر ذلك خير وأحسن تأويلا

translation: Have you not seen those who claim to have believed in what was revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you? They wish to refer legislation to Taghut, while they were commanded to reject it; and Satan wishes to lead them far astray.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who outwardly professed faith in the Qur'an and previous revelations, but inwardly sought judgment from false authorities and idols (Taghut) instead of the divine laws revealed by Allah. It warns that by doing so, they are being misguided by Satan into deviation and misguidance.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يزعمون أنهم آمنوا بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك يريدون أن يتحاكموا إلى الطاغوت وقد أمروا أن يكفروا به ويريد الشيطان أن يضلهم ضلالا بعيدا

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' you see the hypocrites turning away from you in aversion.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who reject the call to follow the teachings of the Qur'an and the guidance of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They turn away arrogantly from the truth, refusing to submit to Allah's revelations and the Prophet's authority. It highlights their insincerity and opposition to the Islamic faith.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله وإلى الرسول رأيت المنافقين يصدون عنك صدودا

translation: But how [will it be] when a disaster strikes them because of what their hands have put forth? Then they will come to you swearing by Allah, "We intended nothing but good conduct and alliances."
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith but harbor ill intentions. When faced with consequences of their misdeeds, they will swear by Allah that their intentions were pure and good, seeking only harmony and cooperation. However, Allah knows their true motives which are contrary to their claims."
orig: فكيف إذا أصابتهم مصيبة بما قدمت أيديهم ثم جاءوك يحلفون بالله إن أردنا إلا إحسانا وتوفيقا

translation: It is those whose hearts Allah knows what is in them, so turn away from them and admonish them and speak to them a word to reach their very souls.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites whose true intentions and lack of faith Allah knows. The Prophet is instructed to turn away from them and not engage with their disbelief, but to admonish and advise them with effective words that may penetrate their souls and guide them to the truth.
orig: أولئك الذين يعلم الله ما في قلوبهم فأعرض عنهم وعظهم وقل لهم في أنفسهم قولا بليغا

translation: And We did not send any messenger except to be obeyed by Allah's permission. And if they had, when they wronged themselves, come to you and asked forgiveness of Allah, and the Messenger had asked forgiveness for them, they would have found Allah Accepting of repentance and Merciful.
interpretation: Allah sent messengers to be obeyed by His command. If the people who wronged themselves had come to the Prophet, repented, and asked for forgiveness from Allah, and the Prophet had also sought forgiveness for them, they would have found Allah Most Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: وما أرسلنا من رسول إلا ليطاع بإذن الله ولو أنهم إذ ظلموا أنفسهم جاءوك فاستغفروا الله واستغفر لهم الرسول لوجدوا الله توابا رحيما

translation: But no, by your Lord, they can have no Faith, until they make you (O Muhammad) judge in all disputes between them, and find in themselves no resistance against your decisions, and accept (them) with full submission.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the necessity of referring to the Prophet Muhammad's judgments and accepting them wholeheartedly without any hesitation or resistance. True faith requires complete submission to the Prophet's decisions in all matters of dispute or disagreement among the believers. It highlights the authority given to the Prophet by Allah to settle disputes and the obligation upon the believers to obey his judgments without any internal objection or dissent.
orig: فلا وربك لا يؤمنون حتى يحكموك فيما شجر بينهم ثم لا يجدوا في أنفسهم حرجا مما قضيت ويسلموا تسليما

translation: And if We had decreed upon them, 'Kill yourselves' or 'Leave your homes,' they would not have done it, except for a few of them. But if they had done what they were instructed, it would have been better for them and a firmer position [for them in faith].
interpretation: This verse highlights the stubbornness and disobedience of some people towards God's commands. Even if God had commanded them to kill themselves or leave their homes, which are extremely difficult acts, most of them would not have obeyed, except for a few. However, if they had followed the guidance and advice given to them, it would have been better for their spiritual well-being and would have strengthened their faith.
orig: ولو أنا كتبنا عليهم أن اقتلوا أنفسكم أو اخرجوا من دياركم ما فعلوه إلا قليل منهم ولو أنهم فعلوا ما يوعظون به لكان خيرا لهم وأشد تثبيتا

translation: And indeed, We will surely give them from Our presence a great reward.
interpretation: This verse promises a great reward from Allah for those who believe and do righteous deeds. The "great reward" refers to the eternal bliss and pleasure of Paradise, which Allah will bestow upon the believers as a recompense for their faith and good actions in this world. The phrase "from Our presence" indicates that this reward will come directly from Allah, emphasizing its immense value and honor.
orig: وإذا لآتيناهم من لدنا أجرا عظيما

translation: And We would have guided them to a Straight Path.
interpretation: This verse suggests that if people were to follow the guidance of Allah, He would have led them to the straight and righteous path that leads to success in this life and the Hereafter. It implies that Allah provides clear guidance through His revelations and messengers, but it is up to individuals to accept and follow that guidance.
orig: ولهديناهم صراطا مستقيما

translation: And whoever obeys Allah and the Messenger - those will be with the ones upon whom Allah has bestowed favor of the prophets, the steadfast affirmers of truth, the martyrs and the righteous. And excellent are those as companions.
interpretation: This verse promises those who obey Allah and His Messenger the companionship of the most honored and righteous people in the Hereafter - the prophets, those who affirmed the truth with certainty, those who sacrificed their lives for the cause of Allah, and the pious and virtuous. It highlights the immense reward and elevated status that awaits the obedient believers in Paradise, where they will be in the blessed company of the noblest of souls.
orig: ومن يطع الله والرسول فأولئك مع الذين أنعم الله عليهم من النبيين والصديقين والشهداء والصالحين وحسن أولئك رفيقا

translation: That is the Bounty of Allah, and sufficient is Allah as All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense favor and bounty of Allah upon His servants. It emphasizes that the guidance, knowledge, and blessings we receive are from Allah alone, and He is sufficient as the All-Knowing, the One who is fully aware of our circumstances and needs. The verse encourages us to recognize and appreciate Allah's favors and to rely solely on Him, as He is the ultimate source of knowledge and wisdom.
orig: ذلك الفضل من الله وكفى بالله عليما

translation: O you who have believed, take your precaution and [either] go forth in companies or go forth all together.
interpretation: "This verse instructs the believers to be vigilant and take necessary precautions when facing potential danger or conflict. It advises them to either travel in small groups or all together as a unified force, depending on the circumstances. This guidance promotes safety, preparedness, and unity among the believers in challenging situations."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا خذوا حذركم فانفروا ثبات أو انفروا جميعا

translation: And there are certainly among you those who lag behind; then if a misfortune befalls you, he says, 'Indeed, Allah conferred favor upon me when I was not present with them.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who would make excuses and lag behind when called to fight in the cause of Allah. If the Muslims suffered any harm or loss in battle, these hypocrites would say that it was a blessing from Allah that they were not present, thus escaping the misfortune. Their interpretation reveals their cowardice, lack of faith, and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: وإن منكم لمن ليبطئن فإن أصابتكم مصيبة قال قد أنعم الله علي إذ لم أكن معهم شهيدا

translation: And if a bounty comes to you from Allah, he would surely say - as if there had never been any affection between you and him - 'Oh, I wish I had been with them so I could have achieved a great success.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith but inwardly harbor doubts and enmity towards the believers. It warns that if the believers receive any favor or victory from Allah, the hypocrites will express regret and wish they had been with the believers to share in the success, even though they previously showed no sincere affection or loyalty towards the believers. The verse exposes the hypocrites' insincerity and their desire to attain worldly gains without truly believing.
orig: ولئن أصابكم فضل من الله ليقولن كأن لم تكن بينكم وبينه مودة يا ليتني كنت معهم فأفوز فوزا عظيما

translation: So let those fight in the cause of Allah who sell the life of this world for the Hereafter. And whoever fights in the cause of Allah, and is killed or achieves victory - We will bestow upon him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to fight for the cause of Allah, sacrificing the temporary pleasures of this worldly life for the eternal rewards of the Hereafter. It promises a great reward from Allah for those who fight in His cause, whether they are martyred or victorious. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of striving in the path of Allah with sincerity and steadfastness, prioritizing the spiritual over the material.
orig: فليقاتل في سبيل الله الذين يشرون الحياة الدنيا بالآخرة ومن يقاتل في سبيل الله فيقتل أو يغلب فسوف نؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: And what is [the matter] with you that you fight not in the cause of Allah and [for] the oppressed among men, women, and children who say, "Our Lord, take us out of this city of oppressive people and appoint for us from Yourself a protector and appoint for us from Yourself a helper?"
interpretation: This verse is calling upon the believers to strive and fight in the cause of Allah to help the oppressed men, women, and children who are suffering under the oppression of disbelievers or tyrants. It encourages the believers to help liberate these oppressed people from their difficult situation and establish justice and security for them, as they are calling out to Allah for help and protection.
orig: وما لكم لا تقاتلون في سبيل الله والمستضعفين من الرجال والنساء والولدان الذين يقولون ربنا أخرجنا من هذه القرية الظالم أهلها واجعل لنا من لدنك وليا واجعل لنا من لدنك نصيرا

translation: Those who believe fight in the cause of Allah, and those who disbelieve fight in the cause of Taghut. So fight against the allies of Satan. Indeed, the plot of Satan has ever been weak.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fundamental difference between the believers and the disbelievers in their motives and allegiances. The believers fight in the cause of Allah, which means they strive and sacrifice for the sake of truth, justice, and the establishment of God's divine order on earth. On the other hand, the disbelievers fight in the cause of Taghut, which represents falsehood, oppression, and rebellion against God's authority. The verse commands the believers to fight against the allies of Satan, who are those who follow and support the forces of evil and misguidance. It also reassures the believers that Satan's plots and schemes are ultimately weak and bound to fail, as truth and righteousness will prevail in the end.
orig: الذين آمنوا يقاتلون في سبيل الله والذين كفروا يقاتلون في سبيل الطاغوت فقاتلوا أولياء الشيطان إن كيد الشيطان كان ضعيفا

translation: Have you not seen those who were told, "Restrain your hands, establish prayer, and give zakah"? But then when fighting was ordained for them, a group of them feared people as they should have feared Allah, or with greater fear. They said, "Our Lord, why have You ordained fighting for us? If only You had postponed ˹it˺ for us for a little while!" Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ "The enjoyment of this world is little, and the Hereafter is far better for those mindful ˹of Allah˺. And you will not be wronged ˹even by˺ a thread on a date stone."
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of believers who were initially commanded to restrain themselves from fighting, establish prayer, and give zakah (obligatory charity). However, when they were later ordered to fight, some of them became fearful of the enemy, showing more fear towards people than they should have towards Allah. They questioned why fighting was ordained for them and wished for a delay. The interpretation is that the pleasures of this world are fleeting, and the Hereafter is far better for those who fear Allah and obey His commands. They will not be wronged or deprived of any reward, no matter how small, for their obedience and sacrifices.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين قيل لهم كفوا أيديكم وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فلما كتب عليهم القتال إذا فريق منهم يخشون الناس كخشية الله أو أشد خشية وقالوا ربنا لم كتبت علينا القتال لولا أخرتنا إلى أجل قريب قل متاع الدنيا قليل والآخرة خير لمن اتقى ولا تظلمون فتيلا

translation: Wherever you are, death will find you out, even if you are in towers built up strong and high! If some good befalls them, they say, 'This is from Allah'; but if evil befalls them, they say, 'This is from you.' Say: 'All things are from Allah.' So what is the matter with these people that they can hardly understand any word?
interpretation: This verse highlights the inevitability of death and the flawed logic of those who attribute good to Allah but evil to others. It teaches that both good and evil are ultimately from Allah's decree, though evil is not from His essence. The inability to comprehend this simple fact shows the people's lack of understanding.
orig: أينما تكونوا يدرككم الموت ولو كنتم في بروج مشيدة وإن تصبهم حسنة يقولوا هذه من عند الله وإن تصبهم سيئة يقولوا هذه من عندك قل كل من عند الله فمال هؤلاء القوم لا يكادون يفقهون حديثا

translation: Whatever good befalls you is from Allah, and whatever ill befalls you is from yourself. And We have sent you as a Messenger to mankind. And Allah is sufficient as a Witness.
interpretation: This verse affirms that all good and blessings come from Allah alone, while any misfortune or evil that befalls a person is a result of their own actions or shortcomings. It also highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a Messenger sent by Allah to guide all of humanity. Allah's testimony and witnessing of the truth is sufficient and unquestionable.
orig: ما أصابك من حسنة فمن الله وما أصابك من سيئة فمن نفسك وأرسلناك للناس رسولا وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Whoever obeys the Messenger has indeed obeyed Allah; but whoever turns away - We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying the Messenger, Prophet Muhammad, as obedience to him is considered obedience to Allah. Those who disobey and turn away from his teachings will not be forced, as the Prophet's role is to convey the message, not to compel belief. The responsibility lies with individuals to make their own choices, and the Prophet is not a "guardian" over them to ensure their compliance.
orig: من يطع الرسول فقد أطاع الله ومن تولى فما أرسلناك عليهم حفيظا

translation: And they say, 'Obedience,' but when they leave your presence, a party of them spends the night in disobedience to what you say. But Allah records what they intend by night. So turn away from them and put your trust in Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who outwardly professed obedience to the Prophet but secretly disobeyed him. It advises the Prophet to disregard them and rely solely on Allah, Who is fully aware of their intentions and will hold them accountable. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of sincerity in faith and warns against hypocrisy and betrayal.
orig: ويقولون طاعة فإذا برزوا من عندك بيت طائفة منهم غير الذي تقول والله يكتب ما يبيتون فأعرض عنهم وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: Will they not then ponder over the Quran? If it had been from other than Allah, they would have found therein much discrepancy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin and perfection of the Quran. It invites people to reflect deeply upon the Quran. If it had been authored by a human, there would have been many contradictions and discrepancies in it. However, the Quran's consistency, harmony, and lack of contradictions is a clear proof that it is from Allah, the One True God, and not from any human source.
orig: أفلا يتدبرون القرآن ولو كان من عند غير الله لوجدوا فيه اختلافا كثيرا

translation: And when there comes to them information about public security or fear, they spread it around. But if only they had referred it to the Messenger and to those in authority among them, those of them who are able to draw correct conclusions from it would have known about it. And had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, you would have followed Satan, except for a few.
interpretation: هذه الآية تنتقد سلوك المنافقين والذين لا يتبعون هدي النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم. فهم ينشرون الأخبار والشائعات دون التأكد من صحتها، بدلاً من الرجوع إلى النبي والقادة الراشدين الذين يستطيعون تفسير الأمور بشكل صحيح. ولولا فضل الله ورحمته لاتبع هؤلاء الناس الشيطان وضلوا عن الصراط المستقيم، ولكن الله حفظ بعضهم من الانحراف.
orig: وإذا جاءهم أمر من الأمن أو الخوف أذاعوا به ولو ردوه إلى الرسول وإلى أولي الأمر منهم لعلمه الذين يستنبطونه منهم ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته لاتبعتم الشيطان إلا قليلا

translation: So fight in the cause of Allah, you are not responsible except for yourself, and urge on the believers. It may be that Allah will restrain the might of those who disbelieve. And Allah is strongest in might and strongest in punishment.
interpretation: This verse is an exhortation to fight in the cause of Allah with sincerity and determination, without being held responsible for anyone except oneself. It encourages the believers to urge and motivate one another to participate in this struggle. The verse suggests that through such efforts, Allah may restrain the might and power of the disbelievers. It also reminds us of Allah's supreme might and His ability to inflict the severest of punishments upon those who reject His message.
orig: فقاتل في سبيل الله لا تكلف إلا نفسك وحرض المؤمنين عسى الله أن يكف بأس الذين كفروا والله أشد بأسا وأشد تنكيلا

translation: Whoever intercedes for a good cause will have a share in it, and whoever intercedes for an evil cause will bear a portion of it. And Allah is Ever Watchful over all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of interceding or advocating for righteous causes, as one will be rewarded for it. However, if one intercedes for an evil or unjust cause, they will bear the consequences of their advocacy. Allah is All-Aware and will hold everyone accountable for their actions and intentions.
orig: من يشفع شفاعة حسنة يكن له نصيب منها ومن يشفع شفاعة سيئة يكن له كفل منها وكان الله على كل شيء مقيتا

translation: And when you are greeted with a greeting, greet [in return] with one better than it or [at least] return it [in a like manner]. Indeed, Allah is ever, over all things, an Accountant.
interpretation: This verse encourages Muslims to respond to greetings with an even better greeting or at least return it in a similar manner. It emphasizes the importance of politeness, kindness, and good manners in social interactions. The verse also reminds us that Allah is aware of all our actions and will hold us accountable for how we treat others.
orig: وإذا حييتم بتحية فحيوا بأحسن منها أو ردوها إن الله كان على كل شيء حسيبا

translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him. He will surely assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. And who is more truthful than Allah in statement?
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His attribute of being the only true deity worthy of worship. It emphasizes that Allah will resurrect all humans on the Day of Judgment, which is an inevitable reality that no one should doubt. The verse also highlights Allah's truthfulness and the certainty of His words, as no one is more truthful than Him in speech.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو ليجمعنكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه ومن أصدق من الله حديثا

translation: So what is the matter with you that you are divided into two parties about the hypocrites? And Allah has reverted them [to disbelief] for what they earned. Do you wish to guide those whom Allah has sent astray? And he whom Allah sends astray - never will you find for him a way.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the division among the believers regarding the hypocrites. It states that Allah has led the hypocrites astray due to their evil deeds. The believers should not attempt to guide those whom Allah has allowed to go astray, as it is impossible to find a way to guide someone whom Allah has misguided.
orig: فما لكم في المنافقين فئتين والله أركسهم بما كسبوا أتريدون أن تهدوا من أضل الله ومن يضلل الله فلن تجد له سبيلا

translation: They wish that you should disbelieve as they disbelieve, so that you might be on the same level; therefore take not from among them allies until they emigrate in the way of Allah. Then, if they turn away, take them and kill them wherever you find them, and take not from among them a friend or a helper.
interpretation: Cette interprétation met en garde les croyants contre la prise d'alliés parmi les mécréants qui souhaitent que les croyants abandonnent leur foi. Elle ordonne de combattre ces mécréants s'ils refusent d'émigrer et de se joindre à la cause d'Allah, et de ne pas les prendre comme amis ou alliés.
orig: ودوا لو تكفرون كما كفروا فتكونون سواء فلا تتخذوا منهم أولياء حتى يهاجروا في سبيل الله فإن تولوا فخذوهم واقتلوهم حيث وجدتموهم ولا تتخذوا منهم وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: Except for those who join a group between you and whom there is a treaty (of peace), or those who approach you with hearts restraining them from fighting you as well as fighting their own people. If Allah had willed, He could have given them power over you, and they would have fought you. But if they remain neutral, and do not fight you, and offer you peace, then Allah has not granted you a way against them.
interpretation: Cette exception concerne ceux qui rejoignent un groupe avec lequel vous avez un traité de paix, ou ceux qui viennent à vous avec des cœurs empêchés de vous combattre ou de combattre leur propre peuple. Si Allah l'avait voulu, Il leur aurait donné la capacité de vous vaincre et ils vous auraient combattus. Mais s'ils restent neutres, ne vous combattent pas et vous offrent la paix, alors Allah ne vous a pas accordé de moyen de les combattre.
orig: إلا الذين يصلون إلى قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق أو جاءوكم حصرت صدورهم أن يقاتلوكم أو يقاتلوا قومهم ولو شاء الله لسلطهم عليكم فلقاتلوكم فإن اعتزلوكم فلم يقاتلوكم وألقوا إليكم السلم فما جعل الله لكم عليهم سبيلا

translation: You will find others who wish to gain your confidence as well as that of their people. Every time they are sent back to temptation, they plunge into it. If they do not withdraw from you, nor offer you peace, nor restrain their hands, then seize them and kill them wherever you find them. Against these, We have given you clear authority.
interpretation: Cette interprétation suggère que certains groupes chercheront à gagner la confiance des musulmans tout en restant liés à leur propre peuple. S'ils ne se retirent pas de la fitna (tentation ou guerre) et ne font pas la paix avec les musulmans, alors les musulmans ont le droit de les combattre et de les tuer où qu'ils les trouvent. Cela donne aux musulmans une autorité claire pour se défendre contre ces groupes hostiles.
orig: ستجدون آخرين يريدون أن يأمنوكم ويأمنوا قومهم كل ما ردوا إلى الفتنة أركسوا فيها فإن لم يعتزلوكم ويلقوا إليكم السلم ويكفوا أيديهم فخذوهم واقتلوهم حيث ثقفتموهم وأولئكم جعلنا لكم عليهم سلطانا مبينا

translation: And never is it for a believer to kill a believer except by mistake. And whoever kills a believer by mistake - then the freeing of a believing slave and a compensation payment presented to the deceased's family, unless they give [up their right as] charity. But if the deceased was from a people at war with you and he was a believer - then [only] the freeing of a believing slave; and if he was from a people with whom you have a treaty - then a compensation payment presented to his family and the freeing of a believing slave. And whoever does not find [one or cannot afford to buy one] - then [instead], a fast for two months consecutively, [seeking] acceptance of repentance from Allah. And Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the legal and moral consequences for a believer who unintentionally kills another believer. It emphasizes the sanctity of human life and the gravity of taking a life, even accidentally. The prescribed atonement involves freeing a believing slave, paying compensation to the victim's family (unless they forgo it), and fasting for two consecutive months if unable to fulfill the other obligations. The verse distinguishes between cases where the victim belongs to an enemy group or a group with a treaty, with different rulings applying. Ultimately, it highlights Allah's wisdom in establishing a system of justice and repentance for such grave transgressions.
orig: وما كان لمؤمن أن يقتل مؤمنا إلا خطأ ومن قتل مؤمنا خطأ فتحرير رقبة مؤمنة ودية مسلمة إلى أهله إلا أن يصدقوا فإن كان من قوم عدو لكم وهو مؤمن فتحرير رقبة مؤمنة وإن كان من قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق فدية مسلمة إلى أهله وتحرير رقبة مؤمنة فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين توبة من الله وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: But whoever kills a believer intentionally - his recompense is Hell, wherein he will abide eternally, and Allah has become angry with him and has cursed him and has prepared for him a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against intentionally killing a believer, which is considered a grave sin in Islam. It states that the punishment for such an act is eternal residence in Hell, incurring Allah's anger and curse, and facing a tremendous punishment. This underscores the sanctity of human life and the severity of unlawfully taking it, especially for a believer.
orig: ومن يقتل مؤمنا متعمدا فجزاؤه جهنم خالدا فيها وغضب الله عليه ولعنه وأعد له عذابا عظيما

translation: O you who have believed, when you go forth [to fight] in the cause of Allah, investigate; and do not say to one who gives you [greetings of] peace 'You are not a believer,' aspiring for the goods of worldly life; for with Allah are many acquisitions. You [yourselves] were like that before; then Allah conferred His favor upon you, so investigate. Indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to verify information before taking action, and not to accuse someone who greets them with 'peace' of being a non-believer, out of desire for worldly gains. He reminds them that they were once ignorant before Islam, but Allah guided them, so they should investigate matters thoroughly. Allah is aware of all that they do.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا ضربتم في سبيل الله فتبينوا ولا تقولوا لمن ألقى إليكم السلام لست مؤمنا تبتغون عرض الحياة الدنيا فعند الله مغانم كثيرة كذلك كنتم من قبل فمن الله عليكم فتبينوا إن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: Not equal are those believers remaining [at home] - other than the disabled - and the mujahideen, [who strive and fight] in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives. Allah has preferred the mujahideen through their wealth and their lives over those who remain, by degrees. And to both Allah has promised the best [reward]. But Allah has preferred the mujahideen over those who remain [behind] with a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the superiority of those who strive and fight in the cause of Allah over those who stay behind, except for those with valid excuses like disability. The mujahideen who sacrifice their wealth and lives for Allah's cause are given a higher rank and a greater reward by Allah than those who remain passive. However, both groups are promised the best reward from Allah, but the mujahideen are preferred and given a greater reward for their sacrifices and struggles.
orig: لا يستوي القاعدون من المؤمنين غير أولي الضرر والمجاهدون في سبيل الله بأموالهم وأنفسهم فضل الله المجاهدين بأموالهم وأنفسهم على القاعدين درجة وكلا وعد الله الحسنى وفضل الله المجاهدين على القاعدين أجرا عظيما

translation: Degrees [of high position] from Him, and forgiveness and mercy. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense rewards and blessings that Allah has prepared for the believers. It speaks of "degrees" or elevated ranks in Paradise, which will be bestowed upon them according to their faith and good deeds. Additionally, they will receive forgiveness for their sins and shortcomings, as well as Allah's infinite mercy. The verse concludes by emphasizing that Allah is the Most Forgiving and Most Merciful, reminding us of His boundless grace and compassion towards those who strive to follow His path.
orig: درجات منه ومغفرة ورحمة وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: Indeed, those whose souls the angels took while they were wronging themselves, they said, 'In what condition were you?' They said, 'We were oppressed in the land.' They said, 'Was not the earth of Allah spacious enough for you to emigrate therein?' Those - their refuge is Hell, and evil it is as a destination.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who did not migrate from the lands of oppression and disbelief, despite having the ability to do so. They made excuses for staying, claiming they were oppressed, but Allah reminds them that His earth is vast, and they could have emigrated to lands where they could practice their faith freely. Their punishment for failing to migrate and remaining in disbelief is that their abode will be Hell, which is a terrible destination.
orig: إن الذين توفاهم الملائكة ظالمي أنفسهم قالوا فيم كنتم قالوا كنا مستضعفين في الأرض قالوا ألم تكن أرض الله واسعة فتهاجروا فيها فأولئك مأواهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are helpless and unable to migrate or find a way out of oppression, such as the weak, elderly, women, and children. They are excused from the obligation to migrate from lands of oppression, as they lack the means or ability to do so. Allah acknowledges their difficult circumstances and exempts them from this duty.
orig: إلا المستضعفين من الرجال والنساء والولدان لا يستطيعون حيلة ولا يهتدون سبيلا

translation: For those - Allah may pardon them, and Allah is ever Pardoning and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse implies that there is hope for forgiveness from Allah for those who repent and turn back to Him. It highlights Allah's attribute of being the Pardoner (al-'Afuww) and the Oft-Forgiving (al-Ghafoor), suggesting that He may overlook the sins of those who seek His forgiveness sincerely.
orig: فأولئك عسى الله أن يعفو عنهم وكان الله عفوا غفورا

translation: And whoever emigrates for the cause of Allah will find on the earth many locations and abundance. And whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allah and His Messenger and then death overtakes him - his reward has already fallen upon Allah. And Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse encourages migration or emigration for the sake of Allah. It promises that those who migrate for Allah's cause will find many places of refuge and provisions in the land. Additionally, if someone leaves their home intending to migrate for Allah and His Messenger but dies before reaching the destination, Allah will still reward them fully. This highlights Allah's forgiveness and mercy towards those who strive in His path.
orig: ومن يهاجر في سبيل الله يجد في الأرض مراغما كثيرا وسعة ومن يخرج من بيته مهاجرا إلى الله ورسوله ثم يدركه الموت فقد وقع أجره على الله وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: And when you travel in the land, there is no blame upon you for shortening the prayer, if you fear that those who disbelieve may disrupt [or attack] you. Indeed, the disbelievers are ever to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse allows Muslims to shorten their prayers during travel, if they fear being attacked or disrupted by disbelievers. It acknowledges the reality of potential hostility and danger from those who reject Islam, and grants a concession to abbreviate the obligatory prayers in such circumstances. The wisdom behind this allowance is to facilitate the worship of believers while ensuring their safety and security when traveling through regions where they may face threats from hostile disbelievers.
orig: وإذا ضربتم في الأرض فليس عليكم جناح أن تقصروا من الصلاة إن خفتم أن يفتنكم الذين كفروا إن الكافرين كانوا لكم عدوا مبينا

translation: And when you are among them and lead them in prayer, let a group of them stand with you and let them carry their arms. And when they have prostrated, let them take position behind you, and let another group who have not yet prayed come forward and pray with you, being cautious and carrying their arms. Those who disbelieve wish that you would neglect your arms and your baggage so they could attack you in a single charge. But there is no blame upon you for putting your arms down due to trouble from rain or because you are ill. But take your precaution. Indeed, Allah has prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse provides instructions for offering prayers in a state of war and potential danger from the enemy. It allows for dividing the believers into two groups, where one group guards with their weapons while the other prays, then they switch roles. This way, they can fulfill their religious obligation while remaining vigilant against enemy attacks. It also reassures them that if they must put down their arms due to rain or illness, they are not blameworthy, but they should still take precautions. The verse concludes with a warning to the disbelievers of a humiliating punishment from Allah.
orig: وإذا كنت فيهم فأقمت لهم الصلاة فلتقم طائفة منهم معك وليأخذوا أسلحتهم فإذا سجدوا فليكونوا من ورائكم ولتأت طائفة أخرى لم يصلوا فليصلوا معك وليأخذوا حذرهم وأسلحتهم ود الذين كفروا لو تغفلون عن أسلحتكم وأمتعتكم فيميلون عليكم ميلة واحدة ولا جناح عليكم إن كان بكم أذى من مطر أو كنتم مرضى أن تضعوا أسلحتكم وخذوا حذركم إن الله أعد للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: So when you have completed the prayer, then remember Allah standing, sitting, and [lying] on your sides. But when you become secure, re-establish [regular] prayer. Indeed, prayer has been decreed upon the believers a decree of specified times.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of remembering Allah at all times and in all circumstances, whether standing, sitting, or lying down. It also instructs believers to perform the obligatory prayers at their appointed times once they are in a state of security and safety. The verse highlights that prayer is a divinely ordained obligation upon believers, with specific timings prescribed for its performance.
orig: فإذا قضيتم الصلاة فاذكروا الله قياما وقعودا وعلى جنوبكم فإذا اطمأننتم فأقيموا الصلاة إن الصلاة كانت على المؤمنين كتابا موقوتا

translation: And do not falter or grieve, for you will gain mastery if you are true believers. If you have suffered a misfortune, remember that the enemy has also suffered a similar misfortune. We alternate these vicissitudes among people so that God may know the true believers and choose witnesses from among you; and God does not love the unjust.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to remain steadfast and not lose hope in the face of adversity or suffering. It reminds them that the disbelievers also experience hardship, and that God alternates between giving victory and defeat to different groups as a test of faith. The true believers are those who remain patient and trust in God's wisdom and justice, even in difficult times. The verse also emphasizes that God does not love those who are unjust or oppressive.
orig: ولا تهنوا في ابتغاء القوم إن تكونوا تألمون فإنهم يألمون كما تألمون وترجون من الله ما لا يرجون وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book in truth that you may judge between people by that which Allah has shown you. And do not be for the deceitful an advocate.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine revelation of the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad as a source of truth and guidance. It instructs him to judge between people fairly based on what Allah has taught him through this revelation. The verse also warns him against siding with or defending those who are deceitful or treacherous.
orig: إنا أنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق لتحكم بين الناس بما أراك الله ولا تكن للخائنين خصيما

translation: And seek forgiveness from Allah, indeed Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to consistently seek forgiveness from Allah, as He is the Most Forgiving and the Most Merciful. It reminds us of Allah's infinite mercy and His willingness to pardon our sins and shortcomings if we sincerely repent and ask for His forgiveness. The verse emphasizes the importance of humility, acknowledging our human weaknesses, and turning to Allah with a contrite heart, seeking His grace and mercy.
orig: واستغفر الله إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And do not argue on behalf of those who deceive themselves. Indeed, Allah does not like anyone who is a habitual betrayer and sinner.
interpretation: This verse advises against defending or making excuses for those who consciously deceive themselves by rejecting faith and truth. Allah does not love those who habitually betray their covenant with Him and persist in sinful ways.
orig: ولا تجادل عن الذين يختانون أنفسهم إن الله لا يحب من كان خوانا أثيما

translation: They hide from the people but cannot hide from Allah, while He is with them when they plot by night in words that do not please Him. And ever is Allah, of what they do, encompassing.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the hypocrites try to conceal their disbelief and evil intentions from people, but they cannot hide anything from Allah. He is fully aware of their secret plots and conspiracies against the believers, which they devise at night in words that are displeasing to Allah. Allah encompasses and has complete knowledge of all their actions and evil deeds.
orig: يستخفون من الناس ولا يستخفون من الله وهو معهم إذ يبيتون ما لا يرضى من القول وكان الله بما يعملون محيطا

translation: Here you are - those for whom you used to argue in the worldly life. But who will argue with Allah for them on the Day of Resurrection, or who will be a representative for them?
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of defending or advocating for false beliefs and ideologies in this worldly life. On the Day of Resurrection, none will be able to argue with Allah or represent those who persisted in falsehood. It emphasizes the importance of recognizing and adhering to the truth in this life, as no one will be able to intercede or defend those who rejected the truth on that final Day.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء جادلتم عنهم في الحياة الدنيا فمن يجادل الله عنهم يوم القيامة أم من يكون عليهم وكيلا

translation: And whoever does evil or wrongs himself but then seeks forgiveness from Allah, he will find Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the vastness of Allah's mercy and forgiveness. It encourages those who have committed sins or wronged themselves to repent sincerely and seek Allah's forgiveness, as He is ever willing to pardon and have mercy on those who turn to Him in repentance. It highlights Allah's infinite grace and reminds us that no sin is unforgivable as long as one genuinely repents and resolves to mend one's ways.
orig: ومن يعمل سوءا أو يظلم نفسه ثم يستغفر الله يجد الله غفورا رحيما

translation: And whoever commits a sin, commits it only against himself. And Allah is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability in Islam. Each person is responsible for their own actions and will bear the consequences of their sins. The phrase "commits it only against himself" highlights that the harm caused by one's sins ultimately falls upon oneself, even if others are affected. At the same time, Allah is All-Knowing, aware of everyone's deeds, and All-Wise, ensuring that justice is served accordingly.
orig: ومن يكسب إثما فإنما يكسبه على نفسه وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: And whoever commits a sin or an offense, then blames an innocent person for it, has certainly burdened himself with slander and a manifest sin.
interpretation: This verse warns against falsely accusing innocent people of sins or crimes they did not commit. It emphasizes that such an act is a grave sin in itself, as it burdens the accuser with slander and a blatant wrong. The verse highlights the importance of justice, truthfulness, and protecting the rights and dignity of others.
orig: ومن يكسب خطيئة أو إثما ثم يرم به بريئا فقد احتمل بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: Had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, a group of them would have resolved to mislead you, but they mislead none but themselves, and they cannot harm you in any way. And Allah has revealed to you the Book and Wisdom, and He has taught you what you did not know. And Allah's favor upon you has been tremendous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense favor and mercy of Allah upon the Prophet Muhammad. It states that had it not been for Allah's grace and mercy, some people would have misled the Prophet, but they could not harm him in any way because Allah protected him. The verse also mentions that Allah revealed the Quran and wisdom to the Prophet and taught him what he did not know, which was a tremendous blessing upon him.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليك ورحمته لهمت طائفة منهم أن يضلوك وما يضلون إلا أنفسهم وما يضرونك من شيء وأنزل الله عليك الكتاب والحكمة وعلمك ما لم تكن تعلم وكان فضل الله عليك عظيما

translation: There is no good in much of their private conversation, except for those who enjoin charity or that which is right or conciliation between people. And whoever does that seeking the pleasure of Allah - We are going to give him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse discourages engaging in idle talk and secret conversations that do not benefit anyone. However, it makes an exception for those conversations that encourage acts of charity, righteousness, or reconciliation between people. Those who engage in such beneficial conversations solely to please Allah will be greatly rewarded by Him.
orig: لا خير في كثير من نجواهم إلا من أمر بصدقة أو معروف أو إصلاح بين الناس ومن يفعل ذلك ابتغاء مرضات الله فسوف نؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: And whoever opposes the Messenger after guidance has become clear to him and follows other than the way of the believers, We will turn him to what he has turned and cast him into Hell - what an evil destination!
interpretation: This verse warns against opposing the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad after the truth has become evident. It states that those who knowingly reject the path of the believers and follow other ways will face a terrible punishment in the Hereafter. They will be left to their misguided choices and ultimately thrown into Hellfire, which is described as an evil and miserable destination.
orig: ومن يشاقق الرسول من بعد ما تبين له الهدى ويتبع غير سبيل المؤمنين نوله ما تولى ونصله جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: Indeed, Allah does not forgive association with Him, but He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills. And he who associates others with Allah has certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the grave sin of associating partners with Allah (shirk) and states that Allah will never forgive it. However, Allah may forgive other sins, lesser than shirk, for whomever He wills. The verse warns that those who commit shirk have strayed far from the right path and fallen into profound misguidance.
orig: إن الله لا يغفر أن يشرك به ويغفر ما دون ذلك لمن يشاء ومن يشرك بالله فقد ضل ضلالا بعيدا

translation: They call upon none but females, and they call upon none but a rebellious Satan.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan Arabs who worshipped female deities and idols, which were mere figments of their imagination and had no power or authority. Their worship of these false gods was akin to worshipping Satan, who had led them astray and turned them away from the true worship of the One God.
orig: إن يدعون من دونه إلا إناثا وإن يدعون إلا شيطانا مريدا

translation: Allah cursed him and he said, 'I will surely take a predestined share of Your servants.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Satan's arrogance and rebellion against Allah. After being commanded to prostrate to Adam, Satan refused out of pride and arrogance. As a result, Allah cursed him. Satan then vowed to mislead and misguide a portion of Allah's servants, taking advantage of their weaknesses and desires to lead them astray from the straight path. This highlights Satan's enmity towards humanity and his role as the source of evil whisperings and temptations.
orig: لعنه الله وقال لأتخذن من عبادك نصيبا مفروضا

translation: And I will mislead them, and I will arouse in them [sinful] desires, and I will command them so they will slit the ears of cattle, and I will command them so they will change the creation of Allah. And whoever takes Satan as an ally instead of Allah has certainly sustained a clear loss.
interpretation: This verse highlights Satan's evil schemes to misguide people and make them commit sinful acts. Satan promises to arouse sinful desires in people, command them to mutilate animals (by slitting their ears), and encourage them to alter Allah's creation. Those who take Satan as an ally instead of Allah have clearly gone astray and suffered a manifest loss.
orig: ولأضلنهم ولأمنينهم ولآمرنهم فليبتكن آذان الأنعام ولآمرنهم فليغيرن خلق الله ومن يتخذ الشيطان وليا من دون الله فقد خسر خسرانا مبينا

translation: He [Satan] makes promises to them and arouses desire in them. But Satan does not promise them except delusion.
interpretation: This verse warns against the deception of Satan. He makes false promises and entices people with vain desires and temptations, but in reality, he only aims to lead them astray and make them fall into misguidance. His promises are nothing but delusions and falsehoods designed to misguide people from the straight path.
orig: يعدهم ويمنيهم وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا

translation: Those - their refuge is Hell, and they will not find from it any escape.
interpretation: This verse warns that those who reject faith and follow disbelief and evil will have Hell as their final abode, from which they will find no way to escape or be saved. It highlights the grave consequences of rejecting God's guidance and emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: أولئك مأواهم جهنم ولا يجدون عنها محيصا

translation: But those who believe and do righteous good deeds, We shall admit them to the Gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise), abiding therein forever. It is a promise of Allah in truth; and whose words can be truer than those of Allah?
interpretation: This verse promises eternal Paradise to those who have faith and do good deeds. It emphasizes that Allah's promise of admitting the believers to the everlasting Gardens of Paradise is absolutely true and trustworthy, as no one can be more truthful than Allah.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سندخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا وعد الله حقا ومن أصدق من الله قيلا

translation: It is not by your desires, nor the desires of the People of the Book. Whoever does evil will be recompensed for it, and he will not find besides Allah a protector or a helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that salvation and reward in the Hereafter are not based on mere wishful thinking or following one's desires. Rather, it is based on righteous deeds and obedience to Allah. It warns that anyone who commits evil will be held accountable and punished for it, and no one can protect or help them against Allah's judgment.
orig: ليس بأمانيكم ولا أماني أهل الكتاب من يعمل سوءا يجز به ولا يجد له من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: And whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of equality and justice in Islam. It states that anyone, male or female, who performs righteous deeds and has faith will be admitted to Paradise without any injustice or discrimination. The phrase "will not be wronged, [even as much as] the speck on a date seed" highlights that even the smallest good deed will be rewarded and no injustice, no matter how small, will be done to the believers.
orig: ومن يعمل من الصالحات من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فأولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون نقيرا

translation: And who is better in religion than one who submits himself to Allah while being a doer of good and follows the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth? And Allah took Abraham as an intimate friend.
interpretation: This verse highlights the excellence of the religion of Islam and those who sincerely embrace it. It praises those who submit themselves completely to Allah while doing righteous deeds, and follow the upright way of Prophet Abraham, who was a true monotheist and a close friend of Allah. The verse emphasizes that the best way of life is to surrender oneself to Allah, perform good deeds, and follow the pure and straight path of the religion brought by the Prophets, exemplified by the way of Prophet Abraham.
orig: ومن أحسن دينا ممن أسلم وجهه لله وهو محسن واتبع ملة إبراهيم حنيفا واتخذ الله إبراهيم خليلا

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah, over all things, encompassing.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and dominion over the entire universe and everything within it. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the Owner and Controller of all that exists in the heavens and on the earth, and that His knowledge and power encompass all things. This serves as a reminder of our complete dependence on Allah and the importance of submitting to His will and worshipping Him alone.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكان الله بكل شيء محيطا

translation: And they ask you concerning women. Say, "Allah instructs you about them and [about] what is recited to you in the Book concerning orphan women to whom you do not give what is decreed for them - and [yet] you desire to marry them - and concerning the oppressed among children and that you maintain for orphans [their rights] in justice." And whatever you do of good - indeed, Allah is ever Knowing of it.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of orphan women and their rights in marriage and inheritance. It instructs the believers to give orphan women their due share of inheritance and not to marry them solely for the purpose of acquiring their wealth. The verse also emphasizes the importance of upholding justice for orphans and protecting the rights of vulnerable children. It reminds the believers that Allah is aware of all their good deeds and will reward them accordingly.
orig: ويستفتونك في النساء قل الله يفتيكم فيهن وما يتلى عليكم في الكتاب في يتامى النساء اللاتي لا تؤتونهن ما كتب لهن وترغبون أن تنكحوهن والمستضعفين من الولدان وأن تقوموا لليتامى بالقسط وما تفعلوا من خير فإن الله كان به عليما

translation: And if a woman fears ill-treatment or aversion from her husband, there is no sin upon them if they make terms of settlement between themselves, and settlement is better. And souls are swayed by greed. But if you do good and fear Allah, then indeed Allah is ever Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: If a wife fears mistreatment or neglect from her husband, it is permissible for them to mutually agree on terms to resolve their marital issues through negotiation and compromise. Reconciliation and settlement are better than divorce. However, human souls are prone to greed and selfishness. If both spouses act righteously, make compromises, and remain conscious of Allah, then Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions.
orig: وإن امرأة خافت من بعلها نشوزا أو إعراضا فلا جناح عليهما أن يصلحا بينهما صلحا والصلح خير وأحضرت الأنفس الشح وإن تحسنوا وتتقوا فإن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: And you will never be able to deal justly between wives, even if you desire it. So do not incline towards one completely, leaving the other hanging. And if you reconcile and fear Allah, then indeed Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges the difficulty of treating multiple wives with perfect equality, even if one intends to do so. It advises against completely neglecting one wife in favor of another. Instead, it encourages reconciliation, fairness, and consciousness of Allah, promising forgiveness and mercy from Him.
orig: ولن تستطيعوا أن تعدلوا بين النساء ولو حرصتم فلا تميلوا كل الميل فتذروها كالمعلقة وإن تصلحوا وتتقوا فإن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And if they separate, Allah will enrich each from His abundance. And ever is Allah Encompassing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in dealing with marital disputes. If a husband and wife choose to separate after attempting reconciliation, Allah will provide for them from His boundless resources. Each spouse will be granted sufficiency and sustenance from Allah's vast treasures. This interpretation emphasizes Allah's comprehensive knowledge and perfect wisdom in handling such matters.
orig: وإن يتفرقا يغن الله كلا من سعته وكان الله واسعا حكيما

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And We have instructed those who were given the Scripture before you, and yourselves, to fear Allah. But if you disbelieve - then to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And ever is Allah Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute ownership and sovereignty over everything in the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that Allah has commanded all people, including those who received previous scriptures and the Muslims, to have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah). However, if people choose to disbelieve, it does not diminish Allah's ownership or greatness in any way, for He is Self-Sufficient and deserving of all praise.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ولقد وصينا الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم وإياكم أن اتقوا الله وإن تكفروا فإن لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكان الله غنيا حميدا

translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah alone is the Sovereign Owner and Controller of everything in the heavens and the earth. Nothing occurs except by His Will and Power. It emphasizes complete reliance on Allah, for He is sufficient as the Maintainer, Protector, and Disposer of all affairs.
orig: ولله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: If He wills, He can do away with you, O people, and bring others [in your place]. And ever is Allah over this competent.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's absolute power and authority over all creation. He has the ability to replace or remove any people and bring forth others in their place if He so wills. It serves as a reminder of our utter dependence on Allah and the importance of being obedient and grateful to Him, as well as a warning against arrogance and ingratitude towards His favors.
orig: إن يشأ يذهبكم أيها الناس ويأت بآخرين وكان الله على ذلك قديرا

translation: Whoever desires the reward of this world - then with Allah is the reward of this world and the Hereafter. And ever is Allah Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who seek worldly gains and pleasures will be rewarded for them in this life. However, the true and everlasting reward is with Allah in the Hereafter. It reminds us that we should not be solely focused on worldly pursuits, but rather strive for the pleasure of Allah and the rewards of the eternal life to come. Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing, aware of our intentions and actions.
orig: من كان يريد ثواب الدنيا فعند الله ثواب الدنيا والآخرة وكان الله سميعا بصيرا

translation: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to uphold justice at all times, even if it goes against their own interests or the interests of their loved ones. It instructs them to be impartial witnesses for the sake of Allah, regardless of the wealth or poverty of those involved. The verse warns against letting hatred or bias towards any group lead to injustice, as being just is closer to righteousness. It reminds the believers that Allah is aware of all their actions, so they should fear Him and act with justice and fairness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا قوامين بالقسط شهداء لله ولو على أنفسكم أو الوالدين والأقربين إن يكن غنيا أو فقيرا فالله أولى بهما فلا تتبعوا الهوى أن تعدلوا وإن تلووا أو تعرضوا فإن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: O you who have believed, believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Book that He sent down upon His Messenger and the Scripture which He sent down before. And whoever disbelieves in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, and the Last Day has certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to have faith in Allah, His Messenger Muhammad, the Quran revealed to him, and the previous Scriptures like the Torah and the Gospel. It warns against disbelief in Allah, His angels, His Books, His Messengers, and the Day of Resurrection, as that leads to going far astray from the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا آمنوا بالله ورسوله والكتاب الذي نزل على رسوله والكتاب الذي أنزل من قبل ومن يكفر بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله واليوم الآخر فقد ضل ضلالا بعيدا

translation: Indeed, those who have believed then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, and increased in disbelief - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a way.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who repeatedly rejected faith after initially believing. Their persistent rejection of faith and increase in disbelief has made them ineligible for Allah's forgiveness and guidance. It highlights the grave consequences of willfully turning away from faith despite being exposed to the truth.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا ثم كفروا ثم آمنوا ثم كفروا ثم ازدادوا كفرا لم يكن الله ليغفر لهم ولا ليهديهم سبيلا

translation: Give tidings to the hypocrites that they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the hypocrites, those who outwardly profess faith but inwardly conceal disbelief and hypocrisy, that they will face a severe and agonizing punishment from Allah for their deceitful ways. It serves as a stern warning against insincerity in faith and encourages true belief and righteous conduct.
orig: بشر المنافقين بأن لهم عذابا أليما

translation: Those who take disbelievers as allies instead of believers, do they seek with them honor [and power]? But indeed, honor belongs to Allah entirely.
interpretation: This verse warns against taking disbelievers as allies or close associates instead of believers. It emphasizes that true honor and power belong solely to Allah, not to the disbelievers. Seeking honor or might through allying with disbelievers is misguided, as all honor and glory ultimately come from Allah alone.
orig: الذين يتخذون الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين أيبتغون عندهم العزة فإن العزة لله جميعا

translation: And it has already been revealed to you in the Book that when you hear the verses of Allah being denied and mocked at, then do not sit with them until they enter into another conversation. Indeed, you would then be like them. Indeed, Allah will gather the hypocrites and disbelievers in Hell all together.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers not to remain in gatherings where the verses of the Qur'an are mocked or denied. It instructs them to leave such company until the subject is changed, lest they become like the mockers themselves. The verse warns that Allah will ultimately gather the hypocrites and disbelievers together in Hell as a punishment for their rejection of faith.
orig: وقد نزل عليكم في الكتاب أن إذا سمعتم آيات الله يكفر بها ويستهزأ بها فلا تقعدوا معهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره إنكم إذا مثلهم إن الله جامع المنافقين والكافرين في جهنم جميعا

translation: Those who await your misfortune. If you gain a victory from Allah, they say, 'Were we not with you?' But if the disbelievers get a share, they say, 'Did we not gain mastery over you, and protect you from the believers?' Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection, and Allah will never allow the disbelievers a way over the believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who pretended to be Muslims but secretly wished for the defeat of the believers. If the Muslims were victorious, the hypocrites would claim to be on their side. But if the disbelievers had a share of victory, the hypocrites would claim that they had overpowered the believers and protected themselves from them. The verse warns that on the Day of Judgment, Allah will expose the true intentions of the hypocrites and will never allow the disbelievers to overpower the believers.
orig: الذين يتربصون بكم فإن كان لكم فتح من الله قالوا ألم نكن معكم وإن كان للكافرين نصيب قالوا ألم نستحوذ عليكم ونمنعكم من المؤمنين فالله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة ولن يجعل الله للكافرين على المؤمنين سبيلا

translation: Indeed, the hypocrites seek to deceive Allah, but He is the One who deceives them. And when they stand for prayer, they stand lazily, showing off to the people and not remembering Allah except a little.
interpretation: This verse exposes the true nature of the hypocrites, who outwardly claim to be believers but inwardly harbor disbelief and deception. They think they can deceive Allah, but in reality, it is Allah who allows them to be deceived by their own arrogance and insincerity. Their prayer is devoid of humility and sincerity, as they perform it lazily and only to be seen by others, without truly remembering Allah and His greatness.
orig: إن المنافقين يخادعون الله وهو خادعهم وإذا قاموا إلى الصلاة قاموا كسالى يراءون الناس ولا يذكرون الله إلا قليلا

translation: Wavering between that, not towards these, nor towards those. And whomever Allah leaves astray, you will never find for him a way.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of those who are indecisive and wavering in their faith, neither fully embracing the truth nor rejecting it. They are likened to being lost, unable to find the right path. The interpretation emphasizes that those whom Allah allows to go astray will find it impossible to find guidance, as they have rejected the means to attain it.
orig: مذبذبين بين ذلك لا إلى هؤلاء ولا إلى هؤلاء ومن يضلل الله فلن تجد له سبيلا

translation: O you who have believed, do not take the disbelievers as allies instead of the believers. Do you wish to give Allah against yourselves a clear case?
interpretation: This verse forbids the believers from taking disbelievers as close friends or allies instead of believers. It warns that doing so would provide a clear proof against the believers themselves on the Day of Judgment, as they would have preferred the company of disbelievers over the believers.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا الكافرين أولياء من دون المؤمنين أتريدون أن تجعلوا لله عليكم سلطانا مبينا

translation: Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depths of the Fire - and never will you find for them a helper.
interpretation: This verse warns that the hypocrites, those who outwardly professed faith but inwardly concealed disbelief and ill intentions, will be condemned to the lowest and most severe level of Hellfire on the Day of Judgment. They will have no supporter or helper to aid them or alleviate their punishment, as a consequence of their deceitful ways and rejection of true faith.
orig: إن المنافقين في الدرك الأسفل من النار ولن تجد لهم نصيرا

translation: Except those who repent, reform themselves, hold fast to Allah, and are sincere in their religion for Allah, then they will be with the believers. And Allah will grant the believers a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of repentance, self-reform, holding firmly to Allah's guidance, and having sincere faith in Allah. Those who fulfill these conditions will be counted among the believers and will receive a great reward from Allah. It emphasizes that true faith requires not only belief but also righteous actions and a genuine commitment to living according to Allah's teachings.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا وأصلحوا واعتصموا بالله وأخلصوا دينهم لله فأولئك مع المؤمنين وسوف يؤت الله المؤمنين أجرا عظيما

translation: What would Allah do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe? And Allah is Ever All-Appreciative, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the mercy of Allah and His appreciation for those who are grateful and have faith. It suggests that if people embrace gratitude and belief, Allah will not punish them, as He is Appreciative of their efforts and Knowing of their sincere intentions.
orig: ما يفعل الله بعذابكم إن شكرتم وآمنتم وكان الله شاكرا عليما

translation: Allah does not like the public mention of evil words except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah dislikes public utterance of offensive or obscene words, except in cases where one has been wronged or oppressed. In such cases, the wronged person is permitted to speak out against the injustice they have faced. However, even then, moderation and wisdom should be observed. The verse also reminds us that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, so He is aware of all words spoken, whether good or bad.
orig: لا يحب الله الجهر بالسوء من القول إلا من ظلم وكان الله سميعا عليما

translation: If you disclose acts of charity, even so it is well, but if you conceal them, and make them reach those (really) in need, that is best for you: It will remove from you some of your (stains of) evil. And Allah is well-acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse encourages both disclosing and concealing good deeds. Disclosing them publicly is acceptable, but concealing them and giving charity secretly to the needy is better and more virtuous, as it purifies one's soul from sins and misdeeds. Ultimately, Allah is aware of all our actions, whether done publicly or privately.
orig: إن تبدوا خيرا أو تخفوه أو تعفوا عن سوء فإن الله كان عفوا قديرا
