translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, 'We believe in some and disbelieve in others,' and wish to adopt a way in between -
interpretation: This verse condemns the attitude of those who reject the unity of faith in Allah and His messengers. It criticizes those who claim to believe in some messengers while disbelieving in others, attempting to create divisions and distinctions where none should exist. The verse emphasizes the necessity of accepting all of Allah's messengers and revelations without discrimination or picking and choosing. It rejects the notion of adopting a middle path or compromising stance between belief and disbelief.
orig: إن الذين يكفرون بالله ورسله ويريدون أن يفرقوا بين الله ورسله ويقولون نؤمن ببعض ونكفر ببعض ويريدون أن يتخذوا بين ذلك سبيلا

translation: Those are the true disbelievers, and We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the reality that those who reject faith in God and His revelations are truly disbelievers. It also serves as a stern warning that God has prepared a humiliating and painful punishment for such disbelievers in the Hereafter. The verse underscores the gravity of disbelief and its consequences, motivating people to embrace faith and avoid the terrible fate awaiting those who stubbornly reject the truth.
orig: أولئك هم الكافرون حقا وأعتدنا للكافرين عذابا مهينا

translation: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers and make no distinction between any of them - We shall give them their rewards, and Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having complete and unwavering faith in Allah and all of His messengers without discriminating among them. Those who truly believe in Allah and accept all of His messengers with sincerity will be granted their rewards in full by Allah, Who is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful.
orig: والذين آمنوا بالله ورسله ولم يفرقوا بين أحد منهم أولئك سوف يؤتيهم أجورهم وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The People of the Book ask you to bring down upon them a book from the heavens. They had already asked Moses for something even greater than that, saying, 'Show us Allah outright,' and they were struck by a thunderbolt for their wickedness. Then they took up the Calf for worship after the clear proofs had come to them. Yet We pardoned that, and We gave Moses clear authority.
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the stubbornness and arrogance of the People of the Book (Jews and Christians). They demanded miracles from the Prophet Muhammad, just as their ancestors had demanded miracles from Prophet Moses. Their ancestors went so far as to demand to see God directly, which was an impossible and arrogant request. As a result, they were punished by a thunderbolt for their wickedness. Even after witnessing clear miracles from Moses, they still worshipped the Calf idol. Despite their disobedience, God pardoned them and gave Moses clear authority and miracles. This verse serves as a warning against making unreasonable demands from the prophets and a reminder of God's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: يسألك أهل الكتاب أن تنزل عليهم كتابا من السماء فقد سألوا موسى أكبر من ذلك فقالوا أرنا الله جهرة فأخذتهم الصاعقة بظلمهم ثم اتخذوا العجل من بعد ما جاءتهم البينات فعفونا عن ذلك وآتينا موسى سلطانا مبينا

translation: And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, 'Enter the gate bowing humbly', and We said to them, 'Do not transgress on the sabbath' - and We took from them a solemn covenant.
interpretation: Allah reminds the Children of Israel of the favors He bestowed upon them when He raised Mount Sinai over them as a threat to compel them to accept the covenant. He commanded them to enter the holy land in humility and not to violate the sanctity of the Sabbath, but they broke their covenant. This verse serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience and the importance of fulfilling one's covenants with Allah.
orig: ورفعنا فوقهم الطور بميثاقهم وقلنا لهم ادخلوا الباب سجدا وقلنا لهم لا تعدوا في السبت وأخذنا منهم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: Because of their breaking of the covenant, and their disbelieving in the revelations of Allah, and their killing of the prophets unjustly, and their saying: Our hearts are covered; nay, Allah has set a seal upon them for their disbelief, so they believe not but a few.
interpretation: This verse explains the reasons behind Allah's punishment of the Children of Israel. It is due to their violation of the covenant made with Allah, their rejection of His revelations and signs, their unjust killing of prophets, and their arrogant claim that their hearts are sealed and unable to comprehend the truth. As a result of their persistent disbelief, Allah has sealed their hearts, leaving only a few among them to have faith.
orig: فبما نقضهم ميثاقهم وكفرهم بآيات الله وقتلهم الأنبياء بغير حق وقولهم قلوبنا غلف بل طبع الله عليها بكفرهم فلا يؤمنون إلا قليلا

translation: And for their disbelief and their uttering against Mary a grave false charge
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelief of the Jews and their slanderous accusation against the chaste and virtuous Mary, the mother of Jesus. By accusing her of an immoral act, they committed a grave sin and uttered an egregious lie against her.
orig: وبكفرهم وقولهم على مريم بهتانا عظيما

translation: And their saying, "We have killed the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, the messenger of Allah." But they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; rather, it was made to appear so to them. Those who differed about it are in doubt concerning it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. Certainly, they did not kill him.
interpretation: This verse refutes the claim of the Jews that they killed Jesus, the Messiah and messenger of Allah. It clearly states that they neither killed nor crucified him, but it was merely made to appear so to them. Those who differed and argued about this matter were in doubt and had no certain knowledge, only following assumptions and conjectures. The verse emphasizes that they certainly did not kill Jesus.
orig: وقولهم إنا قتلنا المسيح عيسى ابن مريم رسول الله وما قتلوه وما صلبوه ولكن شبه لهم وإن الذين اختلفوا فيه لفي شك منه ما لهم به من علم إلا اتباع الظن وما قتلوه يقينا

translation: Nay, Allah raised him up unto Himself; and Allah is Exalted in Power, Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event of Jesus' ascension to Allah. It affirms that Allah raised Jesus up to Himself, rather than him being killed or crucified as claimed by some. This demonstrates Allah's Power and Wisdom in preserving Jesus and exalting him. The verse establishes Jesus' honorable status before Allah and refutes the claims of those who denied his prophethood or divine mission.
orig: بل رفعه الله إليه وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: And there is none from the People of the Book but that they will surely believe in it before their death, and on the Day of Resurrection he will be a witness against them.
interpretation: This verse suggests that all People of the Book (Jews and Christians) will eventually believe in the Qur'an and the truth of Prophet Muhammad's message before they die. On the Day of Judgment, the Prophet Muhammad will testify against those who rejected his message despite knowing the truth.
orig: وإن من أهل الكتاب إلا ليؤمنن به قبل موته ويوم القيامة يكون عليهم شهيدا

translation: For the wrongdoing of the Jews, We made unlawful for them certain good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allah many [people].
interpretation: This verse indicates that as a punishment for the disobedience and wrongdoing of the Jews, Allah prohibited for them certain pure and lawful foods that were previously permissible. This was a consequence of their rejection of Allah's commandments and their attempts to lead others astray from Allah's path.
orig: فبظلم من الذين هادوا حرمنا عليهم طيبات أحلت لهم وبصدهم عن سبيل الله كثيرا

translation: And for their taking interest despite it being forbidden for them, and for consuming people's wealth unjustly. We have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practices of taking interest (riba) and unlawfully consuming other people's wealth, which were forbidden in Islam. It warns that Allah has prepared a painful punishment for those disbelievers who persist in such sinful acts despite being prohibited from them.
orig: وأخذهم الربا وقد نهوا عنه وأكلهم أموال الناس بالباطل وأعتدنا للكافرين منهم عذابا أليما

translation: But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer and the givers of zakah and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are deeply rooted in knowledge and faith. It praises the believers who accept the revelations given to Prophet Muhammad as well as previous revelations. It highlights the importance of establishing prayer, giving zakah (obligatory charity), and believing in Allah and the Last Day. These qualities are promised a great reward from Allah.
orig: لكن الراسخون في العلم منهم والمؤمنون يؤمنون بما أنزل إليك وما أنزل من قبلك والمقيمين الصلاة والمؤتون الزكاة والمؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر أولئك سنؤتيهم أجرا عظيما

translation: Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And We revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book of Psalms.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad in the same way that previous scriptures were revealed to other prophets. It highlights the continuity of divine revelation and the universal message of Islam, which is a culmination and affirmation of the teachings brought by earlier prophets. The verse emphasizes that God's guidance has been sent to different peoples and nations through a long line of prophets, including Noah, Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, Solomon, and David, who was given the Psalms. This underscores the unity of the prophetic mission and the universality of God's message to humanity.
orig: إنا أوحينا إليك كما أوحينا إلى نوح والنبيين من بعده وأوحينا إلى إبراهيم وإسماعيل وإسحاق ويعقوب والأسباط وعيسى وأيوب ويونس وهارون وسليمان وآتينا داوود زبورا

translation: And there were messengers about whom We have certainly related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses directly.
interpretation: This verse indicates that while Allah has revealed the stories of some messengers in the Qur'an, there were other messengers whose stories were not mentioned. It also affirms that Allah spoke directly to Prophet Moses, which is a great honor bestowed upon him.
orig: ورسلا قد قصصناهم عليك من قبل ورسلا لم نقصصهم عليك وكلم الله موسى تكليما

translation: Messengers as bearers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no plea against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the purpose of sending Messengers, which is to convey the divine message and guidance to humanity, acting as bearers of good news for those who believe and follow the truth, and warners against the consequences of disbelief and disobedience. This eliminates any excuse or justification for people to reject Allah's commandments after the Messengers have delivered their message clearly. Ultimately, Allah is Almighty and Wise in His decisions and actions.
orig: رسلا مبشرين ومنذرين لئلا يكون للناس على الله حجة بعد الرسل وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: But Allah bears witness to that which He has sent down to you; He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness (as well). And sufficient is Allah as a Witness.
interpretation: "This verse affirms the divine origin and truthfulness of the Qur'an. Allah Himself testifies that He has revealed it to the Prophet Muhammad with His perfect knowledge. The angels also bear witness to this fact, as they were present during the revelation. Allah alone is sufficient as a Witness to the truth of the Qur'an, and no further proof is needed."
orig: لكن الله يشهد بما أنزل إليك أنزله بعلمه والملائكة يشهدون وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
interpretation: This verse warns that those who reject faith in Allah and obstruct others from following the path of truth and guidance have strayed far from the right course. Their disbelief and active opposition to the divine message have led them into profound misguidance and error.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله قد ضلوا ضلالا بعيدا

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and wronged themselves, Allah will never forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who reject faith in God and persist in wrongdoing will not receive forgiveness or guidance from Him. It emphasizes the consequences of disbelief and oppression, which is the deprivation of God's mercy and direction towards the right path. The verse highlights the importance of faith and righteous conduct to attain God's forgiveness and guidance.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وظلموا لم يكن الله ليغفر لهم ولا ليهديهم طريقا

translation: Except the path of Hell, wherein they will abide forever. And that is ever easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the eternal punishment of Hell for those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands. The "path of Hell" refers to the destination and fate of the disbelievers, where they will remain forever, without any hope of reprieve or escape. The phrase "And that is ever easy for Allah" highlights Allah's absolute power and authority to carry out this punishment effortlessly, as nothing is difficult for Him.
orig: إلا طريق جهنم خالدين فيها أبدا وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: O people, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe - it is better for you. But if you disbelieve, then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: "This verse is a call to humanity to believe in the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad, which is the truth from their Lord. It encourages people to have faith, as it is better for them. However, if they choose to disbelieve, it reminds them that everything in the heavens and earth belongs to Allah, and He is All-Knowing and All-Wise. The verse emphasizes the importance of accepting the truth and the consequences of rejecting it."
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم الرسول بالحق من ربكم فآمنوا خيرا لكم وإن تكفروا فإن لله ما في السماوات والأرض وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: O People of the Book! Do not exaggerate in your religion, and do not say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was only a Messenger of Allah and His Word which He bestowed upon Mary, and a spirit created by Him. So believe in Allah and His Messengers, and do not say: 'Three.' Desist, it is better for you. Allah is only One God. Glory be to Him! He begets not nor was He begotten. And there is none comparable to Him.
interpretation: Cette vérité révèle que Jésus, le Messie, n'est qu'un messager d'Allah et une parole d'Allah qu'Il a insufflée à Marie. Il n'est pas divin et n'a pas de nature divine. La croyance en la Trinité (Père, Fils et Saint-Esprit) est une exagération et une déformation de la vérité. Allah est Un et Unique, Il n'engendre pas et n'est pas engendré, et rien ne Lui est comparable.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب لا تغلوا في دينكم ولا تقولوا على الله إلا الحق إنما المسيح عيسى ابن مريم رسول الله وكلمته ألقاها إلى مريم وروح منه فآمنوا بالله ورسله ولا تقولوا ثلاثة انتهوا خيرا لكم إنما الله إله واحد سبحانه أن يكون له ولد له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: The Messiah will never disdain to be a servant of Allah, nor will the favored angels. Whoever disdains His worship and is arrogant, He will gather them all to Himself.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humility and submission of the Messiah (Jesus) and the angels to Allah. It states that the Messiah would never consider himself too great to be a servant of Allah, nor would the closest angels. Those who refuse to worship Allah out of arrogance will be gathered before Him on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لن يستنكف المسيح أن يكون عبدا لله ولا الملائكة المقربون ومن يستنكف عن عبادته ويستكبر فسيحشرهم إليه جميعا

translation: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, He will pay them in full their rewards and increase them from His bounty. But as for those who disdain and are arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will find for themselves besides Allah no protector and no helper.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrasting outcomes for believers and disbelievers. The believers who have faith and perform good deeds will be fully rewarded and granted additional favors from Allah's infinite grace. On the other hand, those who reject faith out of arrogance and disdain will face a severe and painful punishment. They will find no one to protect or assist them against Allah's judgment.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيوفيهم أجورهم ويزيدهم من فضله وأما الذين استنكفوا واستكبروا فيعذبهم عذابا أليما ولا يجدون لهم من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: O mankind! There has come to you a convincing proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a manifest light.
interpretation: This verse is addressing all of humanity, calling their attention to the clear proof and guidance that has been revealed to them from their Lord. The "convincing proof" refers to the Qur'an itself, which serves as a strong evidence and argument for the truth of Islam. The "manifest light" refers to the guidance, knowledge, and illumination that the Qur'an brings, dispelling the darkness of ignorance and misguidance. This verse emphasizes the universal message of the Qur'an and its role in providing a clear path for all of mankind.
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم برهان من ربكم وأنزلنا إليكم نورا مبينا

translation: As for those who believed in Allah and held fast to Him, He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.
interpretation: This verse promises great rewards for those who have faith in Allah and hold firmly to His guidance. They will be granted Allah's mercy, favors, and guidance to the straight path that leads to Him. Their belief and commitment to Allah will be rewarded with spiritual and eternal blessings.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا بالله واعتصموا به فسيدخلهم في رحمة منه وفضل ويهديهم إليه صراطا مستقيما

translation: They ask you for a legal ruling. Say, "Allah gives you the ruling concerning al-kalaalah. If a man dies childless but has a sister, she will get half of what he leaves. And he will inherit from her if she is childless. But if there are two sisters, they will get two-thirds of what he leaves. However, if there are brothers and sisters, the male gets twice the share of the female. Allah makes things clear for you, so you won't go astray. And Allah is Aware of everything."
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on the distribution of inheritance in the case of a person who dies without leaving any children, known as al-kalaalah. It outlines the shares that a sister or sisters are entitled to receive from their deceased brother's estate, as well as the shares for male and female siblings. The verse emphasizes the wisdom and justice in Allah's laws of inheritance, which aim to prevent confusion and ensure fairness.
orig: يستفتونك قل الله يفتيكم في الكلالة إن امرؤ هلك ليس له ولد وله أخت فلها نصف ما ترك وهو يرثها إن لم يكن لها ولد فإن كانتا اثنتين فلهما الثلثان مما ترك وإن كانوا إخوة رجالا ونساء فللذكر مثل حظ الأنثيين يبين الله لكم أن تضلوا والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: O you who have believed, fulfill [all] contracts. Permitted to you are the animals of grazing livestock except what is recited to you [in this Qur'an] - hunting not being permitted while you are in the sacred precinct. Indeed, Allah ordains what He intends.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to fulfill all contracts and agreements they make, whether with Allah or with other people. He permits the consumption of grazing livestock, except for those animals specifically prohibited in the Qur'an. Hunting is not allowed while in the sacred precinct of Makkah, as it is a sanctified area. Ultimately, Allah decrees whatever laws and rulings He wills.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أوفوا بالعقود أحلت لكم بهيمة الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم غير محلي الصيد وأنتم حرم إن الله يحكم ما يريد

translation: O you who have believed, do not violate the rites of Allah or [the sanctity of] the sacred months or [neglect the marking of] the sacrificial animals and garlanding [them]. And when you are no longer in the sacred state, then [you may] hunt. And do not let the hatred of a people for having obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram lead you to transgress. And cooperate in righteousness and piety, but do not cooperate in sin and aggression. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers not to violate the sacred rituals and symbols of Islam, such as the sacred months, sacrificial animals, and the sanctity of the Kaaba. It also prohibits transgression and calls for cooperation in righteousness and piety, while warning against cooperating in sin and aggression. The verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah and obeying His commands, as He is severe in punishment for those who disobey.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تحلوا شعائر الله ولا الشهر الحرام ولا الهدي ولا القلائد ولا آمين البيت الحرام يبتغون فضلا من ربهم ورضوانا وإذا حللتم فاصطادوا ولا يجرمنكم شنآن قوم أن صدوكم عن المسجد الحرام أن تعتدوا وتعاونوا على البر والتقوى ولا تعاونوا على الإثم والعدوان واتقوا الله إن الله شديد العقاب

translation: Prohibited for you are carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, what has been offered to other than Allah, the animal killed by strangulation, beaten to death, killed by falling, gored to death, savaged by a beast of prey except what you make lawful by proper slaughtering, and what is sacrificed on altars. And prohibited is your seeking division by the arrows; that is grave disobedience. This day the disbelievers have despaired of overcoming your religion, so do not fear them, but fear Me. This day I have perfected for you your religion, completed My favor upon you, and chosen Islam as your way of life. Whoever is compelled by hunger, not intending any wrongdoing, then Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: This verse lists the prohibited foods and practices for Muslims. It declares carrion, blood, pork, animals sacrificed to other than Allah, strangled animals, beaten to death animals, animals killed by falling, gored to death animals, and animals partially eaten by wild beasts as unlawful to consume, except for the animals that are properly slaughtered according to Islamic rites. It also prohibits divination by arrows, which was a pagan Arab practice. The verse then declares that the disbelievers have lost hope of overpowering Islam, so Muslims should not fear them but fear Allah alone. It affirms that Allah has perfected the religion of Islam and completed His favor upon the believers by choosing Islam as their way of life. However, if one is compelled by extreme hunger and has no intention of wrongdoing, then Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards such a person.
orig: حرمت عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل لغير الله به والمنخنقة والموقوذة والمتردية والنطيحة وما أكل السبع إلا ما ذكيتم وما ذبح على النصب وأن تستقسموا بالأزلام ذلكم فسق اليوم يئس الذين كفروا من دينكم فلا تخشوهم واخشون اليوم أكملت لكم دينكم وأتممت عليكم نعمتي ورضيت لكم الإسلام دينا فمن اضطر في مخمصة غير متجانف لإثم فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: They ask you what is lawful for them. Say, 'Lawful for you are good things and what you have taught the birds and beasts of prey to catch, training them for hunting - teaching them of what Allah has taught you.' So eat of what they have caught for you, and mention Allah's name upon it, and be mindful of Allah. Surely Allah is swift in reckoning.
interpretation: This verse outlines what is permissible (halal) for Muslims to consume. It states that pure and wholesome things are lawful, as well as the game caught by trained hunting animals, as long as Allah's name is mentioned over it. The verse emphasizes being mindful of Allah and His teachings, as He is swift in reckoning and holding accountable.
orig: يسألونك ماذا أحل لهم قل أحل لكم الطيبات وما علمتم من الجوارح مكلبين تعلمونهن مما علمكم الله فكلوا مما أمسكن عليكم واذكروا اسم الله عليه واتقوا الله إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: This day are (all) things good and pure made lawful unto you. The food of the People of the Book is lawful unto you and yours is lawful unto them. (Lawful unto you in marriage) are (not only) chaste women who are believers, but chaste women among the People of the Book, revealed before your time,- when ye give them their due dowers, and desire chastity, not lewdness, nor secret intrigues if any one rejects faith, fruitless is his work, and in the Hereafter he will be in the ranks of those who have lost (all spiritual good).
interpretation: This verse lays down the rules regarding lawful and unlawful foods and marriages. It declares that all good and pure things are made lawful for the believers. It permits the food of the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) for Muslims, and vice versa. It also allows Muslim men to marry chaste believing women as well as chaste women from among the People of the Book, provided they pay their dowers and do not engage in unlawful sexual relations. However, it warns that rejecting faith renders all good deeds fruitless, and such people will be among the losers in the Hereafter.
orig: اليوم أحل لكم الطيبات وطعام الذين أوتوا الكتاب حل لكم وطعامكم حل لهم والمحصنات من المؤمنات والمحصنات من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم إذا آتيتموهن أجورهن محصنين غير مسافحين ولا متخذي أخدان ومن يكفر بالإيمان فقد حبط عمله وهو في الآخرة من الخاسرين

translation: O you who have believed, when you rise to [perform] prayer, wash your faces and your arms to the elbows and wipe over your heads and wash your feet to the ankles. And if you are in a state of janabah, then purify yourselves. But if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women and do not find water, then seek clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands with it. Allah does not intend to make difficulty for you, but He intends to purify you and complete His favor upon you that you may be grateful.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشرح كيفية الوضوء والتيمم للصلاة. فهي توضح أن على المسلمين غسل وجوههم وأيديهم إلى المرافق ومسح رؤوسهم وغسل أرجلهم إلى الكعبين قبل الصلاة. وإذا كانوا في حالة جنابة (بعد الجماع أو الاحتلام)، فعليهم الاغتسال كاملًا. وإذا لم يجدوا الماء، يمكنهم التيمم بالتراب الطاهر بمسح وجوههم وأيديهم به. والله لا يريد إلحاق الضيق بالناس، ولكنه يريد تطهيرهم وإتمام نعمته عليهم لكي يشكروا.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا قمتم إلى الصلاة فاغسلوا وجوهكم وأيديكم إلى المرافق وامسحوا برءوسكم وأرجلكم إلى الكعبين وإن كنتم جنبا فاطهروا وإن كنتم مرضى أو على سفر أو جاء أحد منكم من الغائط أو لامستم النساء فلم تجدوا ماء فتيمموا صعيدا طيبا فامسحوا بوجوهكم وأيديكم منه ما يريد الله ليجعل عليكم من حرج ولكن يريد ليطهركم وليتم نعمته عليكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: And remember the favor of Allah upon you and His covenant with which He bound you when you said, "We hear and we obey." And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to be grateful for Allah's blessings and to keep their covenant with Him, which they affirmed by saying "We hear and we obey." It also instructs them to have taqwa (consciousness and fear) of Allah, Who knows what is in the hearts and minds of people.
orig: واذكروا نعمة الله عليكم وميثاقه الذي واثقكم به إذ قلتم سمعنا وأطعنا واتقوا الله إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: O you who have believed, be persistently standing firm for Allah, witnesses in justice, and do not let the hatred of a people prevent you from being just. Be just; that is nearer to righteousness. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to be upright and just in their testimony for the sake of Allah, regardless of any hatred or animosity they may feel towards others. It emphasizes the importance of being fair and equitable, as that is closer to piety and consciousness of Allah. The verse reminds the believers that Allah is fully aware of their actions, so they should strive to uphold justice at all times.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا قوامين لله شهداء بالقسط ولا يجرمنكم شنآن قوم على ألا تعدلوا اعدلوا هو أقرب للتقوى واتقوا الله إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds, for them is forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers who perform good deeds that they will be rewarded with Allah's forgiveness of their sins and an immense reward in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of both faith and good actions, and highlights Allah's mercy and generosity towards the righteous.
orig: وعد الله الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة وأجر عظيم

translation: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who rejected faith in Allah and denied the clear signs and revelations sent by Him. Such people will be among the dwellers of Hell, suffering its punishment as a consequence of their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when a people intended to extend their hands [in aggression] against you, but He withheld their hands from you, and fear Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to be grateful for Allah's protection and favor upon them when their enemies intended to harm them, but Allah prevented their aggression. It encourages the believers to maintain piety and taqwa (consciousness of Allah), and to place their complete trust and reliance upon Allah alone.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم إذ هم قوم أن يبسطوا إليكم أيديهم فكف أيديهم عنكم واتقوا الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: And indeed, Allah took a covenant from the Children of Israel and appointed from among them twelve leaders. And Allah said, 'I am with you. If you establish prayer and give zakah and believe in My messengers and support them and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely remove from you your misdeeds and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But whoever disbelieves after that has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from the Children of Israel, appointing twelve leaders from among them. Allah promised them that if they fulfill certain conditions - establishing prayer, giving zakah (obligatory charity), believing in His messengers, supporting them, and lending to Allah a goodly loan (spending in His cause) - then He will forgive their sins and admit them to Paradise. However, those who disbelieve after this covenant have strayed from the right path.
orig: ولقد أخذ الله ميثاق بني إسرائيل وبعثنا منهم اثني عشر نقيبا وقال الله إني معكم لئن أقمتم الصلاة وآتيتم الزكاة وآمنتم برسلي وعزرتموهم وأقرضتم الله قرضا حسنا لأكفرن عنكم سيئاتكم ولأدخلنكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار فمن كفر بعد ذلك منكم فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: So for their breaking of the covenant, We cursed them and made their hearts hardened. They distort words from their proper places, and they have forgotten a portion of what they were reminded of. And you will still discover betrayal from all but a few of them. But pardon them, and overlook. Indeed, Allah loves the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the consequences faced by those who broke their covenant with Allah. They were cursed and their hearts were hardened, causing them to distort the words of Allah and forget portions of the guidance they were given. However, a few remained faithful. The verse instructs the Prophet to pardon and overlook their misdeeds, as Allah loves those who do good deeds.
orig: فبما نقضهم ميثاقهم لعناهم وجعلنا قلوبهم قاسية يحرفون الكلم عن مواضعه ونسوا حظا مما ذكروا به ولا تزال تطلع على خائنة منهم إلا قليلا منهم فاعف عنهم واصفح إن الله يحب المحسنين

translation: And from those who said, 'We are Christians,' We took their covenant; but they forgot a portion of that of which they were reminded. So We planted among them enmity and hatred until the Day of Resurrection. And Allah will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Christians who deviated from the true teachings of Jesus and broke their covenant with God. It states that God took a covenant from them, but they forgot and neglected parts of what they were reminded of through the message of Jesus. As a result, God caused enmity, hatred, and divisions to arise among them until the Day of Resurrection. On that Day, God will inform them of their misdeeds and the consequences of deviating from His teachings.
orig: ومن الذين قالوا إنا نصارى أخذنا ميثاقهم فنسوا حظا مما ذكروا به فأغرينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة وسوف ينبئهم الله بما كانوا يصنعون

translation: O People of the Book! There has come to you Our Messenger making clear to you much of what you used to conceal of the Scripture, and overlooking much. There has come to you from Allah a Light and a clear Book.
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Book, referring to the Jews and Christians who received divine scriptures before the advent of Islam. It informs them that a Messenger from God has come to them, clarifying and explaining many of the truths that they had concealed or distorted from their scriptures. This Messenger, Prophet Muhammad, overlooks and pardons much of their previous wrongdoings. Furthermore, a divine Light, representing guidance and enlightenment, and a clear Book, the Qur'an, have been revealed from Allah to guide them to the straight path.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم كثيرا مما كنتم تخفون من الكتاب ويعفو عن كثير قد جاءكم من الله نور وكتاب مبين

translation: Thereby Allah guides those who follow His good pleasure to the ways of peace, and brings them out from darkness into light by His permission, and guides them to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah guides those who sincerely seek His pleasure and follow His commandments towards the path of peace, safety, and tranquility. He takes them out of the darkness of ignorance, misguidance, and doubts into the light of faith, knowledge, and certainty by His grace and permission. Furthermore, He guides them to the straight path that leads to His pleasure and Paradise.
orig: يهدي به الله من اتبع رضوانه سبل السلام ويخرجهم من الظلمات إلى النور بإذنه ويهديهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: Those who say, 'Verily, Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary,' have indeed disbelieved. Say, 'Who then has the least power against Allah, if He wished to destroy the Messiah, son of Mary, and his mother, and everyone on earth?' To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them. He creates what He wills, and Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse refutes the Christian belief that Jesus is God or the son of God. It emphasizes that Jesus and his mother Mary were human beings who had no power against Allah's will. Allah alone is the Creator and Sustainer of all things in the heavens and the earth, with absolute power and dominion over His creation. The verse calls upon the believers to reject the notion of Jesus' divinity and affirm the Oneness of Allah.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم قل فمن يملك من الله شيئا إن أراد أن يهلك المسيح ابن مريم وأمه ومن في الأرض جميعا ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما يخلق ما يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And the Jews and the Christians say: 'We are the children of Allah and His loved ones.' Say: 'Why then does He punish you for your sins? No, you are but human beings of those He has created, He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and to Him is the final return.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the claims of the Jews and Christians that they are the chosen children and beloved of God, and therefore immune from punishment. It states that they are mere human beings like others, subject to God's forgiveness or punishment based on their deeds. It affirms that God alone has sovereignty over the heavens and earth, and that all will ultimately return to Him for judgment.
orig: وقالت اليهود والنصارى نحن أبناء الله وأحباؤه قل فلم يعذبكم بذنوبكم بل أنتم بشر ممن خلق يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وإليه المصير

translation: O People of the Book! Our Messenger has come to you, making things clear to you after an interval between the messengers, lest you say, 'There came to us no bringer of good tidings and no warner.' But indeed, there has come to you a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: Allah addresses the People of the Book, reminding them that His Messenger has come to clarify the truth after a period without any messengers. This is to prevent them from claiming ignorance or lack of guidance. The Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, has brought glad tidings of reward for the believers and a warning of punishment for the disbelievers. Allah emphasizes His power and ability to do all things.
orig: يا أهل الكتاب قد جاءكم رسولنا يبين لكم على فترة من الرسل أن تقولوا ما جاءنا من بشير ولا نذير فقد جاءكم بشير ونذير والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, remember the favor of Allah upon you when He appointed among you prophets and made you possessors of sovereignty and gave you that which He had not given anyone among the worlds."
interpretation: This verse reminds the people of the great favors and blessings that Allah has bestowed upon them. He appointed prophets from among them to guide them, granted them sovereignty and authority over their lands, and gave them privileges that were not given to any other nation at that time. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of being grateful to Allah for His countless blessings and favors.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ جعل فيكم أنبياء وجعلكم ملوكا وآتاكم ما لم يؤت أحدا من العالمين

translation: O my people, enter the holy land which Allah has assigned to you and do not turn back, for then you will become losers.
interpretation: This verse is an exhortation to the Children of Israel to enter the Promised Land (Palestine) without fear or hesitation, as it was ordained for them by Allah. It warns them against retreating or turning back, as that would lead them to failure and loss. The verse emphasizes the importance of having faith in Allah's promise and fulfilling His command, even in the face of difficulties or adversities.
orig: يا قوم ادخلوا الأرض المقدسة التي كتب الله لكم ولا ترتدوا على أدباركم فتنقلبوا خاسرين

translation: They said: 'O Moses! In this land are a people of arrogant power, and we shall never enter it until they leave it; if they leave it, then we will enter it.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the hesitation and lack of faith shown by the Israelites when Moses commanded them to enter the Promised Land. Despite God's promise to grant them victory, they were intimidated by the powerful inhabitants and refused to enter unless those inhabitants left first. This demonstrates their weakness of faith and unwillingness to trust in God's support.
orig: قالوا يا موسى إن فيها قوما جبارين وإنا لن ندخلها حتى يخرجوا منها فإن يخرجوا منها فإنا داخلون

translation: Two men among those who feared (for a righteous cause) on whom Allah had bestowed His Grace said: "Assail them through the gate; when once you have entered it, you will be victorious. And put your trust in Allah if you are believers indeed."
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident when the Israelites were commanded by God to enter the holy land of Canaan. Two God-fearing men among them advised the others to enter through the gate with courage and trust in Allah, assuring them that if they truly believed, they would be victorious over their enemies by Allah's help.
orig: قال رجلان من الذين يخافون أنعم الله عليهما ادخلوا عليهم الباب فإذا دخلتموه فإنكم غالبون وعلى الله فتوكلوا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said: "O Moses! We shall never enter it as long as they are in it. So go you and your Lord and fight you two; we are sitting right here."
interpretation: "This verse refers to the refusal of the Israelites to enter the Promised Land due to their fear of the powerful inhabitants. Despite witnessing God's miracles and being commanded to enter, they lacked faith and courage, preferring to remain in the wilderness. Their cowardice and disobedience displeased God, delaying their entry into the land promised to them."
orig: قالوا يا موسى إنا لن ندخلها أبدا ما داموا فيها فاذهب أنت وربك فقاتلا إنا هاهنا قاعدون

translation: He said, 'My Lord, I have control over none but myself and my brother, so make a separation between us and the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that one should seek Allah's protection and guidance to stay away from those who engage in sinful and disobedient behavior, as their actions can negatively influence others. It emphasizes the importance of surrounding oneself with righteous company and distancing oneself from those who promote immorality and corruption.
orig: قال رب إني لا أملك إلا نفسي وأخي فافرق بيننا وبين القوم الفاسقين

translation: He (Allah) said: 'It (the land) is forbidden to them for forty years in which they will wander throughout the land. So do not grieve over the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah decreed that the Promised Land was forbidden for the Children of Israel to enter for forty years as a punishment for their disobedience and lack of faith. During this period, they would wander aimlessly in the desert, unable to settle in the land that was promised to them. This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) not to grieve over those who persistently disobey Allah and reject His commandments.
orig: قال فإنها محرمة عليهم أربعين سنة يتيهون في الأرض فلا تأس على القوم الفاسقين

translation: And recite to them the story of Adam's two sons, in truth, when they each offered a sacrifice [to Allah], and it was accepted from one of them but was not accepted from the other. Said [the latter], 'I will surely kill you.' Said [the former], 'Indeed, Allah only accepts from the righteous [who fear Him].'
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of the two sons of Adam, where one son's sacrifice was accepted by Allah while the other's was rejected. The son whose sacrifice was rejected became enraged and threatened to kill his brother. However, the righteous brother responded that Allah only accepts from those who have taqwa (righteousness and consciousness of Allah). The interpretation highlights the importance of having taqwa and sincerity in one's worship, as well as condemning envy and aggression, even among close relatives.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ ابني آدم بالحق إذ قربا قربانا فتقبل من أحدهما ولم يتقبل من الآخر قال لأقتلنك قال إنما يتقبل الله من المتقين

translation: If you stretch your hand against me to kill me, I shall not stretch my hand against you to kill you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse teaches the importance of having faith in Allah and avoiding violence, even in self-defense. It emphasizes that one should not retaliate with force, but rather fear Allah and refrain from aggression. The interpretation highlights the virtues of patience, restraint, and trusting in divine justice.
orig: لئن بسطت إلي يدك لتقتلني ما أنا بباسط يدي إليك لأقتلك إني أخاف الله رب العالمين

translation: Indeed, I want you to get a share of my sin and your sin, so you will be among the companions of the Fire, and that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and stubbornness of disbelievers who try to mislead believers and make them share in their sins and disbelief, which will lead them to the punishment of Hellfire. It warns against following the footsteps of the wrongdoers and emphasizes that they will face a severe recompense for their injustice and misguidance.
orig: إني أريد أن تبوء بإثمي وإثمك فتكون من أصحاب النار وذلك جزاء الظالمين

translation: But [Cain's] soul prompted him to kill his brother, so he killed him, and became one of the losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Cain and Abel, the two sons of Adam. It suggests that Cain allowed his evil desires and jealousy to overcome him, leading him to kill his brother Abel out of envy. As a result, Cain became one of the losers in the Hereafter for committing such a grave sin.
orig: فطوعت له نفسه قتل أخيه فقتله فأصبح من الخاسرين

translation: So Allah sent a crow scratching in the ground to show him how to hide the corpse of his brother. He said, 'Woe to me! Am I unable to be like this crow and hide the corpse of my brother?' And he became one of the regretful.
interpretation: This verse narrates the story of Cain and Abel, the two sons of Adam. After Cain killed his brother Abel out of jealousy, he did not know what to do with the corpse. Allah then sent a crow that scratched the ground, burying another dead crow to demonstrate to Cain how to bury his brother's body. Cain regretted his action and wished he could have been like the crow, able to conceal the evidence of his sinful deed. This verse teaches the gravity of murder and the importance of respecting human life.
orig: فبعث الله غرابا يبحث في الأرض ليريه كيف يواري سوءة أخيه قال يا ويلتا أعجزت أن أكون مثل هذا الغراب فأواري سوءة أخي فأصبح من النادمين

translation: On that account We ordained for the Children of Israel that if any one slew a person - unless it be for murder or for spreading mischief in the land - it would be as if he slew the whole people: and if any one saved a life, it would be as if he saved the life of the whole people. Then although there came to them Our messengers with clear signs, yet, even after that, many of them continued to commit excesses in the land.
interpretation: Cette verse souligne l'importance de préserver la vie humaine et condamne sévèrement le meurtre injustifié. Elle établit que tuer une personne innocente est un crime aussi grave que tuer toute l'humanité, et que sauver une vie est aussi méritoire que sauver l'humanité entière. Cela montre la valeur inestimable accordée à la vie humaine dans l'islam. Cependant, malgré ces enseignements clairs apportés par les prophètes, nombreux sont ceux qui persistent dans leurs excès et leurs crimes sur terre.
orig: من أجل ذلك كتبنا على بني إسرائيل أنه من قتل نفسا بغير نفس أو فساد في الأرض فكأنما قتل الناس جميعا ومن أحياها فكأنما أحيا الناس جميعا ولقد جاءتهم رسلنا بالبينات ثم إن كثيرا منهم بعد ذلك في الأرض لمسرفون

translation: The recompense of those who wage war against Allah and His Messenger and strive to spread corruption in the land is that they be killed, or crucified, or have their hands and feet cut off on opposite sides, or be banished from the land. That is a disgrace for them in this world, and in the Hereafter they will suffer a tremendous punishment.
interpretation: This verse outlines the severe punishments prescribed for those who engage in armed rebellion against the Islamic state and spread corruption on earth. The punishments range from execution, crucifixion, amputation of alternate hands and feet, to banishment from the land. These harsh penalties serve as a deterrent and reflect the gravity of such crimes against the society and the Islamic order. However, the interpretation and implementation of these punishments are subject to specific conditions and must be carried out through proper legal channels and judicial processes within an Islamic system of governance.
orig: إنما جزاء الذين يحاربون الله ورسوله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا أن يقتلوا أو يصلبوا أو تقطع أيديهم وأرجلهم من خلاف أو ينفوا من الأرض ذلك لهم خزي في الدنيا ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: Except for those who repent before you overpower them. And know that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and forgiveness towards those who sincerely repent before they are overpowered or apprehended. It encourages repentance and emphasizes that Allah is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful towards those who turn to Him in sincere remorse.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من قبل أن تقدروا عليهم فاعلموا أن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and seek the means [of nearness] to Him and strive in His cause so that you may succeed.
interpretation: "This verse encourages believers to have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah), to seek ways to draw closer to Him through righteous deeds and worship, and to strive and struggle in His cause through various means such as fighting in jihad, preaching, and other efforts to establish His religion. This is the path to true success and salvation in this life and the Hereafter."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وابتغوا إليه الوسيلة وجاهدوا في سبيله لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve - if they should have whatever is on the earth entirely and the like of it with it by which to ransom themselves from the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, it will not be accepted from them, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severe punishment that awaits the disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. It states that even if they possessed all the wealth on earth and an equal amount besides, it would not be accepted as a ransom to save them from the painful torment. Their rejection of faith has sealed their fate, and no amount of material wealth can compensate for their disbelief. The verse highlights the futility of worldly possessions in the face of divine judgment and the importance of embracing faith.
orig: إن الذين كفروا لو أن لهم ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه ليفتدوا به من عذاب يوم القيامة ما تقبل منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: They wish to get out of the Fire, but they will not come out of it, and they will have an enduring punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes the desperate desire of those in Hellfire to escape its torment, but they will not be able to leave it. Their punishment will be eternal and inescapable, a consequence of their disbelief and evil deeds in the worldly life. It serves as a stern warning about the gravity of rejecting faith and highlights the finality of one's fate in the Hereafter based on their choices in this life.
orig: يريدون أن يخرجوا من النار وما هم بخارجين منها ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: As for the thief, male or female, cut off their hands - a recompense for what they have earned, a punishment from Allah. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse prescribes the punishment of cutting off the hands of thieves, male or female, as a just recompense for their crime. This severe penalty serves as a deterrent and a means of maintaining social order and security. It is a punishment ordained by Allah, Who is Almighty and Wise in His legislation.
orig: والسارق والسارقة فاقطعوا أيديهما جزاء بما كسبا نكالا من الله والله عزيز حكيم

translation: But whoever repents after his wrongdoing and reforms, Allah will surely turn to him in forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the infinite mercy and forgiveness of Allah. It encourages those who have committed sins or wrongdoings to sincerely repent and reform themselves. If they do so, Allah promises to forgive them and turn towards them with His mercy and compassion. The verse highlights Allah's attribute of being "Ghafoor" (Forgiving) and "Raheem" (Merciful), assuring believers that no matter how grave their sins may be, the door to repentance and forgiveness is always open to those who genuinely seek it.
orig: فمن تاب من بعد ظلمه وأصلح فإن الله يتوب عليه إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Do you not know that to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth? He punishes whom He wills and forgives whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty over the entire universe. He has the power to punish or forgive anyone according to His wisdom and justice. It emphasizes that Allah is All-Powerful and can do whatever He wills with His creation.
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يعذب من يشاء ويغفر لمن يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: O Messenger, let not those who hasten into disbelief grieve you from among those who say, 'We believe' with their mouths while their hearts do not believe. And from among those who are Jews - they are listeners to falsehood, listening to other people who have not come to you. They distort words from their proper places, saying, 'If you are given this, take it; but if you are not given it, then beware.' But he for whom Allah intends fitnah - you will never possess for him anything against Allah. Those are the ones for whom Allah does not intend to purify their hearts. For them in this world is disgrace, and in the Hereafter a great punishment.
interpretation: Esta aleya advierte al Profeta Muhammad sobre aquellos que profesan la fe con sus palabras pero no con sus corazones. También advierte sobre los judíos que escuchan mentiras y distorsionan las palabras de Allah. Aquellos cuyo corazón no ha sido purificado por Allah sufrirán desgracia en esta vida y un gran castigo en la otra.
orig: يا أيها الرسول لا يحزنك الذين يسارعون في الكفر من الذين قالوا آمنا بأفواههم ولم تؤمن قلوبهم ومن الذين هادوا سماعون للكذب سماعون لقوم آخرين لم يأتوك يحرفون الكلم من بعد مواضعه يقولون إن أوتيتم هذا فخذوه وإن لم تؤتوه فاحذروا ومن يرد الله فتنته فلن تملك له من الله شيئا أولئك الذين لم يرد الله أن يطهر قلوبهم لهم في الدنيا خزي ولهم في الآخرة عذاب عظيم

translation: They are avid listeners to falsehood, devourers of what is unlawful. If they come to you, then judge between them or turn away from them. And if you turn away from them, they cannot harm you at all. And if you judge, judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who eagerly listen to lies and consume unlawful things. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad to either judge fairly between them if they come to him for judgment, or turn away from them. If he turns away, they cannot harm him in any way. However, if he judges between them, he must do so with justice and equity, as Allah loves those who are just and fair.
orig: سماعون للكذب أكالون للسحت فإن جاءوك فاحكم بينهم أو أعرض عنهم وإن تعرض عنهم فلن يضروك شيئا وإن حكمت فاحكم بينهم بالقسط إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: And how is it that they ask you to judge between them, when they have the Torah, in which is the judgment of Allah? Yet even after that they turn away. Those are not believers.
interpretation: This verse questions the sincerity of those who claim to believe in the Torah, yet refuse to abide by its teachings and Allah's commandments contained within it. It implies that true faith requires adherence to divine revelations, and those who reject or turn away from them cannot be considered true believers.
orig: وكيف يحكمونك وعندهم التوراة فيها حكم الله ثم يتولون من بعد ذلك وما أولئك بالمؤمنين

translation: Indeed, We sent down the Torah, in which was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted [to Allah] judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars by that with which they were entrusted of the Scripture of Allah, and they were witnesses thereto. So do not fear the people but fear Me, and do not exchange My verses for a small price. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the disbelievers.
interpretation: Allah révèle dans ce verset qu'Il a fait descendre la Torah (Ancien Testament) contenant des directives et de la lumière. Les prophètes soumis à Allah, ainsi que les rabbins et les savants juifs, jugeaient selon la Torah qui leur avait été confiée par Allah, et ils en étaient les témoins. Le verset exhorte alors à ne pas craindre les gens mais à craindre Allah, et à ne pas échanger les versets d'Allah contre une mince récompense. Ceux qui ne jugent pas selon ce qu'Allah a révélé sont qualifiés de mécréants.
orig: إنا أنزلنا التوراة فيها هدى ونور يحكم بها النبيون الذين أسلموا للذين هادوا والربانيون والأحبار بما استحفظوا من كتاب الله وكانوا عليه شهداء فلا تخشوا الناس واخشون ولا تشتروا بآياتي ثمنا قليلا ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الكافرون

translation: And We ordained for them therein a life for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and for wounds is legal retribution. But whoever remits it by way of charity, it is an expiation for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse outlines the principle of "qisas" or equal retaliation in cases of intentional physical harm. It prescribes that a life should be taken for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, and so on. However, it also allows for forgiveness and accepting compensation as an "expiation" or atonement. Those who do not judge according to what Allah has revealed are considered wrongdoers. The verse promotes justice and deterrence, while also encouraging forgiveness and reconciliation.
orig: وكتبنا عليهم فيها أن النفس بالنفس والعين بالعين والأنف بالأنف والأذن بالأذن والسن بالسن والجروح قصاص فمن تصدق به فهو كفارة له ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: And We sent, following in their footsteps, Jesus, the son of Mary, confirming the Torah that had come before him. And We gave him the Gospel, in which was guidance and light and confirmation of the Torah that had come before it, a guidance and an admonition for the God-fearing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that God sent Jesus, the son of Mary, to confirm the truth of the Torah that was revealed before him. God also gave him the Gospel, which contained guidance, light, and confirmation of the Torah. The Gospel served as a guidance and admonition for those who fear God and follow His commandments.
orig: وقفينا على آثارهم بعيسى ابن مريم مصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وآتيناه الإنجيل فيه هدى ونور ومصدقا لما بين يديه من التوراة وهدى وموعظة للمتقين

translation: And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allah has revealed therein. And whoever does not judge by what Allah has revealed - then it is those who are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the divine revelations and laws sent by Allah. It commands the Christians (People of the Gospel) to judge and rule according to the teachings revealed in their scripture, the Gospel. Those who reject or defy the judgments prescribed by Allah are considered disobedient transgressors (faasiqoon)."
orig: وليحكم أهل الإنجيل بما أنزل الله فيه ومن لم يحكم بما أنزل الله فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: And We have sent down to you (O Muhammad) the Book in truth, confirming the Scripture that came before it and a watcher over it; so judge between them by what Allah has revealed, and follow not their vain desires, diverging away from the truth that has come to you.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن القرآن الكريم هو كتاب حق أنزله الله تعالى على نبيه محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم، مصدقًا للكتب السماوية السابقة ومهيمنًا عليها. فالقرآن هو المرجع الأسمى والحكم النهائي، وعلى المسلمين أن يحكموا بما أنزل الله ولا يتبعوا أهواءهم الشخصية. كما أن الله جعل لكل أمة شريعة ومنهاجًا، ولو شاء لجعل الناس أمة واحدة، ولكنه ابتلاهم باختلاف الشرائع ليبلوهم فيما آتاهم من هدى وضلال. وفي النهاية، سيرجع الجميع إلى الله فيحكم بينهم فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون.
orig: وأنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق مصدقا لما بين يديه من الكتاب ومهيمنا عليه فاحكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم عما جاءك من الحق لكل جعلنا منكم شرعة ومنهاجا ولو شاء الله لجعلكم أمة واحدة ولكن ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم فاستبقوا الخيرات إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And judge between them by what Allah has revealed and do not follow their vain desires, and beware of them lest they divert you from some of what Allah has sent down to you. But if they turn away, then know that Allah only intends to afflict them with some of their sins. And indeed, many among the people are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to judge between people according to what Allah has revealed in the Qur'an, and not follow their vain desires or whims. It warns him to be cautious lest they mislead him from some of what Allah has revealed. If they turn away and refuse to accept the judgment, then they will be afflicted with the consequences of their sins. Many people are defiantly disobedient to Allah's commands.
orig: وأن احكم بينهم بما أنزل الله ولا تتبع أهواءهم واحذرهم أن يفتنوك عن بعض ما أنزل الله إليك فإن تولوا فاعلم أنما يريد الله أن يصيبهم ببعض ذنوبهم وإن كثيرا من الناس لفاسقون

translation: Then is it the judgement of [the time of] ignorance they desire? But who is better than Allah in judgement for a people who are certain [in faith]?
interpretation: This verse questions those who reject the laws and judgments revealed by Allah in the Qur'an and instead desire to follow the ignorant judgments of the pre-Islamic era. It affirms that Allah's laws and judgments are the most perfect and just for those who have firm faith and certainty in Him.
orig: أفحكم الجاهلية يبغون ومن أحسن من الله حكما لقوم يوقنون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take the Jews and the Christians as allies. They are [in fact] allies of one another. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then indeed, he is [one] of them. Indeed, Allah guides not the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers not to take the Jews and Christians as close allies or protectors, because they are allies of one another against the Muslims. If a Muslim allies with them, he is considered one of them. Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people who ally with the disbelievers against the believers.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا اليهود والنصارى أولياء بعضهم أولياء بعض ومن يتولهم منكم فإنه منهم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Then you will see those in whose hearts is disease hastening into [association with] them, saying, "We fear that a misfortune may strike us." But perhaps Allah will bring conquest or a command from Himself, and they will become, over what they have concealed within themselves, regretful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly claimed to be Muslims but inwardly harbored doubts and ill intentions. When faced with difficult situations or challenges, they would rush to join the disbelievers, fearing that misfortune might befall them if they remained with the Muslims. However, the verse suggests that Allah may grant victory to the believers or issue a command that would expose the hypocrites' true intentions, causing them to regret their deceitful ways and feel remorseful for what they had concealed in their hearts.
orig: فترى الذين في قلوبهم مرض يسارعون فيهم يقولون نخشى أن تصيبنا دائرة فعسى الله أن يأتي بالفتح أو أمر من عنده فيصبحوا على ما أسروا في أنفسهم نادمين

translation: And those who believed will say, 'Are these the ones who swore by Allah their strongest oaths that indeed they were with you?' Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly professed faith but inwardly concealed disbelief. The believers will express astonishment at how the hypocrites had sworn their strongest oaths claiming to be with the believers, yet their deeds were rendered futile due to their hypocrisy, causing them to be among the ultimate losers on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا أهؤلاء الذين أقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم إنهم لمعكم حبطت أعمالهم فأصبحوا خاسرين

translation: O you who have believed, whoever of you should revert from his religion - Allah will bring forth [in place of them] a people He will love and who will love Him [who are] humble toward the believers, powerful against the disbelievers; they strive in the cause of Allah and do not fear the blame of a critic. That is the favor of Allah; He bestows it upon whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the believers not to turn away from their faith, otherwise Allah will replace them with a people who are humble towards other believers, stern against the disbelievers, and who strive in Allah's cause without fear of being blamed. It highlights that faith and steadfastness are a great favor from Allah, which He grants to whomever He wills. The verse emphasizes Allah's power, knowledge, and ability to replace any group that deviates from the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا من يرتد منكم عن دينه فسوف يأتي الله بقوم يحبهم ويحبونه أذلة على المؤمنين أعزة على الكافرين يجاهدون في سبيل الله ولا يخافون لومة لائم ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله واسع عليم

translation: Your guardian and protector is none other than Allah, His Messenger, and those who believe - those who establish prayer and give zakah while bowing down in worship.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes that the true guardianship and authority lies with Allah, His Messenger Muhammad, and the believers who are obedient to Allah's commands. It specifically highlights the importance of establishing regular prayer and giving obligatory charity (zakah) with humility and devotion, even while bowing down in prayer. This verse instills a sense of loyalty and allegiance to Allah, His Messenger, and the righteous believers who uphold the principles of faith through their actions.
orig: إنما وليكم الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم راكعون

translation: And whoever is an ally of Allah and His Messenger and those who have believed - indeed, the party of Allah is the prevailing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being allied with Allah, His Messenger, and the believers. It promises that those who are part of "the party of Allah" will ultimately prevail and be victorious. This implies that true success lies in following the path of faith and righteousness, and aligning oneself with the forces of truth and guidance represented by Allah, the Prophet Muhammad, and the believing community.
orig: ومن يتول الله ورسوله والذين آمنوا فإن حزب الله هم الغالبون

translation: O you who have believed, do not take those who have taken your religion in ridicule and amusement among the ones who were given the Scripture before you nor the disbelievers as allies. And fear Allah, if you should be believers.
interpretation: Allah warns the believers against taking as allies or friends those who mock their religion, whether they are from the People of the Scripture who received divine books before the Muslims, or the disbelievers who reject faith entirely. This is because befriending them may lead to being influenced by their disbelief and mockery, which could weaken one's faith. True believers should fear Allah and maintain their allegiance solely to Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا الذين اتخذوا دينكم هزوا ولعبا من الذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبلكم والكفار أولياء واتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And when you call for prayer, they take it in ridicule and amusement. That is because they are a people who do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who mock and make fun of the call to prayer (adhan). Their mocking behavior stems from their lack of understanding and reasoning. They are unable to comprehend the significance and wisdom behind the call to prayer, which is a fundamental act of worship in Islam. Their ridicule reflects their ignorance and lack of spiritual insight.
orig: وإذا ناديتم إلى الصلاة اتخذوها هزوا ولعبا ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعقلون

translation: Say, "O People of the Scripture, do you resent us except for believing in Allah and what has been revealed to us and what was revealed before? And most of you are defiantly disobedient."
interpretation: This verse questions the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) about their resentment towards the Muslims, which stems solely from the fact that the Muslims believe in Allah and the revelations sent to them (the Qur'an) as well as the previous revelations. The verse implies that their resentment has no valid basis, and that their disobedience and deviation from the truth is the real reason behind their animosity.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب هل تنقمون منا إلا أن آمنا بالله وما أنزل إلينا وما أنزل من قبل وأن أكثركم فاسقون

translation: Say, 'Shall I inform you of something worse than that as a recompense from Allah? Those whom Allah has cursed and with whom He became angry, and made of them apes and pigs, and slaves of the Taghut. Such are worse in position and farther astray from the straight path.'
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah and following falsehood. It states that those who earn Allah's curse and anger, are transformed into apes and pigs metaphorically, and become slaves of evil forces (Taghut), are in the worst position and have strayed far from the straight path. This highlights the severe consequences of shirk (associating partners with Allah) and disobedience.
orig: قل هل أنبئكم بشر من ذلك مثوبة عند الله من لعنه الله وغضب عليه وجعل منهم القردة والخنازير وعبد الطاغوت أولئك شر مكانا وأضل عن سواء السبيل

translation: And when they come to you, they say, "We believe." But they had entered with disbelief, and they had departed with it. And Allah is most knowing of what they were concealing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly professed faith but inwardly harbored disbelief. They claimed to be believers when in the presence of the Prophet, but they had entered into Islam with disbelief and departed from it in the same state. Allah knows best the deceit and hypocrisy they concealed in their hearts.
orig: وإذا جاءوكم قالوا آمنا وقد دخلوا بالكفر وهم قد خرجوا به والله أعلم بما كانوا يكتمون

translation: And you see many of them hastening into sin and aggression and their devouring of what is forbidden. Evil indeed is what they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the wrongdoings of certain people who indulge in sinful acts, transgression against others, and consuming unlawful gains. It condemns their evil deeds and warns against following their misguided ways.
orig: وترى كثيرا منهم يسارعون في الإثم والعدوان وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Why do not the rabbis and the priests forbid them from saying what is sinful and devouring what is unlawful? Evil indeed is what they have been working.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the religious scholars (rabbis and priests) for not preventing their followers from engaging in sinful speech and unlawful gains. It condemns their failure to guide people away from evil deeds, suggesting that their inaction makes them complicit in the wrongdoings of their communities.
orig: لولا ينهاهم الربانيون والأحبار عن قولهم الإثم وأكلهم السحت لبئس ما كانوا يصنعون

translation: The Jews say, "Allah's Hand is fettered." Fettered are their hands, and they are cursed for what they have said. Rather, His Hands are outspread; He expendeth how He will. And what has been revealed to you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in rebellion and disbelief; and We have cast among them enmity and hatred till the Day of Resurrection. Whenever they kindle a fire for war, Allah extinguisheth it. They endeavour to work corruption in the earth, and Allah loveth not corrupters.
interpretation: This verse refutes the blasphemous claim of the Jews that Allah is miserly or incapable of bestowing His bounties. It affirms Allah's infinite power, generosity and freedom to do as He wills. It also warns that the Qur'an's revelation will increase many Jews in arrogance and disbelief due to their obstinacy. Moreover, it states that Allah has sown enmity and hatred among them until the Day of Judgment as a punishment for their transgressions. Whenever they instigate wars, Allah frustrates their efforts. They spread corruption on earth, which Allah abhors.
orig: وقالت اليهود يد الله مغلولة غلت أيديهم ولعنوا بما قالوا بل يداه مبسوطتان ينفق كيف يشاء وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا وألقينا بينهم العداوة والبغضاء إلى يوم القيامة كلما أوقدوا نارا للحرب أطفأها الله ويسعون في الأرض فسادا والله لا يحب المفسدين

translation: And if the People of the Book had believed and been God-fearing, We would have removed from them their misdeeds and admitted them to Gardens of Bliss.
interpretation: If the Jews and Christians had truly believed in the message of Islam and feared Allah, Allah would have pardoned their previous sins and admitted them into Paradise. This verse highlights the importance of true faith and righteousness, and that salvation is attainable for all people who sincerely embrace Islam.
orig: ولو أن أهل الكتاب آمنوا واتقوا لكفرنا عنهم سيئاتهم ولأدخلناهم جنات النعيم

translation: And if only they had upheld the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them from their Lord, they would have consumed provision from above them and from beneath their feet. Among them is a moderate community, but many of them - evil is what they do.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of upholding the teachings of the previous scriptures, the Torah and the Gospel, as well as the Qur'an revealed to the Prophet Muhammad. It states that if the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) had truly followed these divine revelations, they would have been blessed with abundant provisions from above and beneath their feet. However, the verse acknowledges that while there is a moderate group among them, many have strayed from the right path and engage in evil deeds.
orig: ولو أنهم أقاموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليهم من ربهم لأكلوا من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم منهم أمة مقتصدة وكثير منهم ساء ما يعملون

translation: O Messenger, announce that which has been revealed to you from your Lord, and if you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. And Allah will protect you from the people. Indeed, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the crucial role of the Prophet Muhammad as a messenger tasked with conveying the divine message without any alteration or omission. It warns him of the grave consequences of failing to fulfill this duty and assures him of Allah's protection against those who oppose him. The verse also highlights that Allah does not guide those who reject faith and choose to disbelieve."
orig: يا أيها الرسول بلغ ما أنزل إليك من ربك وإن لم تفعل فما بلغت رسالته والله يعصمك من الناس إن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: Say, "O People of the Book! You have nothing to stand upon unless you observe the Torah and the Gospel and that which has been sent down unto you from your Lord." And indeed, what has been sent down unto you from your Lord will surely increase many of them in rebellion and disbelief. So do not grieve for the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse addresses the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) and challenges their claim to be on the right path unless they truly follow the teachings of the Torah, the Gospel, and what has been revealed to them by God. It warns that the Qur'an, which has been sent down to the Prophet Muhammad, will increase many of them in rebellion and disbelief due to their arrogance and rejection of the truth. However, the verse instructs the Prophet not to grieve over the disbelieving people.
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لستم على شيء حتى تقيموا التوراة والإنجيل وما أنزل إليكم من ربكم وليزيدن كثيرا منهم ما أنزل إليك من ربك طغيانا وكفرا فلا تأس على القوم الكافرين

translation: Verily, those who have believed, and those who were Jews or Christians or Sabians - those who believed in Allah and the Last Day and did righteous deeds will have their reward with their Lord, and no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that salvation and reward in the Hereafter is not limited to any particular religious community, but is based on true faith in Allah and righteous conduct. It affirms that those from various faiths - Muslims, Jews, Christians, and Sabians - who sincerely believe in Allah and the Day of Judgment, and perform good deeds, will be rewarded by Allah and will have no fear or grief on that Day.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئون والنصارى من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وعمل صالحا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Indeed, We took the covenant from the Children of Israel and sent to them messengers. Whenever there came to them a messenger with what their souls did not desire, a party [of messengers] they denied, and another party they killed.
interpretation: This verse refers to the repeated rejection and mistreatment of prophets by the Children of Israel throughout history. Despite Allah taking a covenant from them to follow His messengers, whenever a prophet came with teachings that did not conform to their desires, some of them denied the message, while others even killed the prophets. This highlights their disobedience and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: لقد أخذنا ميثاق بني إسرائيل وأرسلنا إليهم رسلا كلما جاءهم رسول بما لا تهوى أنفسهم فريقا كذبوا وفريقا يقتلون

translation: And they thought there would be no trial, so they became blind and deaf. Then Allah turned to them in forgiveness, then many of them became blind and deaf again. And Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who pretended to embrace Islam but did not truly believe. They thought that no trials or tribulations would come their way after becoming Muslims. However, they became spiritually blind and deaf, unable to perceive the truth of Islam. Allah then forgave them, giving them another chance, but many of them reverted to their previous state of blindness and deafness, rejecting the guidance. Allah is fully aware of their actions and will hold them accountable.
orig: وحسبوا ألا تكون فتنة فعموا وصموا ثم تاب الله عليهم ثم عموا وصموا كثير منهم والله بصير بما يعملون

translation: Indeed, they have disbelieved who say, 'Allah is the Messiah, the son of Mary.' But the Messiah said, 'O Children of Israel, worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord.' Whoever associates partners with Allah, then Allah has certainly forbidden Paradise for him, and his abode will be the Fire. There are no helpers for the wrongdoers.
