interpretation: This verse refutes the Christian belief that Jesus is God or the son of God. It states that those who make such a claim have disbelieved. The verse then quotes Jesus himself telling the Children of Israel to worship Allah alone, who is his Lord and their Lord. It warns that associating partners with Allah leads to being forbidden from Paradise and being condemned to Hellfire, with no helpers to aid the wrongdoers on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله هو المسيح ابن مريم وقال المسيح يا بني إسرائيل اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم إنه من يشرك بالله فقد حرم الله عليه الجنة ومأواه النار وما للظالمين من أنصار

translation: Certainly they disbelieve who say: 'Allah is the third of three.' There is no god except One God. And if they do not desist from what they are saying, there will surely afflict those who disbelieve among them a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse refutes the Christian belief in the Trinity, which considers God to be three persons in one - the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. The Qur'an firmly establishes that Allah is One and Unique, without any partners or associates. It warns those who ascribe partners to Allah that if they persist in this belief, they will face a severe punishment for their disbelief.
orig: لقد كفر الذين قالوا إن الله ثالث ثلاثة وما من إله إلا إله واحد وإن لم ينتهوا عما يقولون ليمسن الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: Will they not repent to Allah and ask His forgiveness? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to repent sincerely to Allah and seek His forgiveness for their sins and mistakes. It emphasizes that Allah is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful, and He is ready to forgive those who turn to Him in repentance with a sincere heart. The verse urges people not to persist in their wrongdoings but to take the path of repentance, which leads to Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: أفلا يتوبون إلى الله ويستغفرونه والله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messiah, son of Mary, was not but a messenger; [other] messengers have passed on before him. And his mother was a supporter of truth. They both used to eat food. Look how We make clear to them the signs; then look how they are deluded.
interpretation: This verse clarifies the true nature of Jesus, peace be upon him, and refutes the false beliefs held by some regarding his divinity. It states that he was a messenger of God, like the prophets before him, and that his mother Mary was a truthful and virtuous woman. They were both human beings who consumed food, like all other humans. This verse invites people to reflect on the clear signs and evidences presented to them, yet they still turn away from the truth and become deluded.
orig: ما المسيح ابن مريم إلا رسول قد خلت من قبله الرسل وأمه صديقة كانا يأكلان الطعام انظر كيف نبين لهم الآيات ثم انظر أنى يؤفكون

translation: Say, "Do you worship besides Allah that which holds for you no [power of] harm or benefit? But Allah - He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing."
interpretation: This verse questions the futility of worshipping idols or entities other than Allah, who neither possess the ability to benefit nor harm anyone. It emphasizes that only Allah is truly worthy of worship, as He is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, aware of all our actions and supplications.
orig: قل أتعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لكم ضرا ولا نفعا والله هو السميع العليم

translation: Say, 'O People of the Book! Do not exaggerate in your religion beyond the truth, and do not follow the vain desires of people who went astray before and misled many, and strayed from the right way.'
interpretation: "This verse instructs the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) not to go to extremes in their religious beliefs and practices, beyond the truth revealed by God. It warns them against following the misguided desires and innovations of those who have strayed from the straight path before them, leading many others astray as well. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to the true teachings of God and avoiding deviations and exaggerations that lead to misguidance."
orig: قل يا أهل الكتاب لا تغلوا في دينكم غير الحق ولا تتبعوا أهواء قوم قد ضلوا من قبل وأضلوا كثيرا وضلوا عن سواء السبيل

translation: Cursed were those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel by the tongue of David and Jesus, the son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
interpretation: This verse refers to the curse that was pronounced upon those among the Children of Israel who disbelieved, by the prophets David and Jesus. They were cursed because of their disobedience to Allah and their transgression of His commandments. The prophets condemned their actions and declared them accursed due to their persistent rejection of faith and violation of divine laws.
orig: لعن الذين كفروا من بني إسرائيل على لسان داوود وعيسى ابن مريم ذلك بما عصوا وكانوا يعتدون

translation: They did not prevent one another from the wrongdoing they were doing. How evil was what they used to do!
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who witness wrongdoing but do not try to stop it or advise against it. It condemns their passive attitude towards evil actions, implying that they are accomplices by allowing such deeds to continue unchecked. The verse emphasizes the gravity of their failure to enjoin good and forbid evil, describing their behavior as "evil" and reprehensible.
orig: كانوا لا يتناهون عن منكر فعلوه لبئس ما كانوا يفعلون

translation: You will see many of them befriending those who disbelieve. Wretched is what their souls have put forth for them, for Allah's wrath has fallen upon them, and in the punishment they will abide eternally.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who ally themselves with disbelievers, warning that such behavior angers Allah and leads to eternal punishment. It emphasizes the grave consequences of siding with those who reject faith, as it goes against the teachings of Islam and displeases the Almighty. The interpretation highlights the importance of maintaining strong faith and avoiding associations that could weaken one's religious commitment.
orig: ترى كثيرا منهم يتولون الذين كفروا لبئس ما قدمت لهم أنفسهم أن سخط الله عليهم وفي العذاب هم خالدون

translation: If they had believed in Allah and the Prophet and what was revealed to him, they would not have taken them as allies; but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who claim to believe in Allah and the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, but ally themselves with the enemies of Islam. It suggests that their actions contradict their claimed beliefs, and that many of them are sinful and disobedient to Allah's commands.
orig: ولو كانوا يؤمنون بالله والنبي وما أنزل إليه ما اتخذوهم أولياء ولكن كثيرا منهم فاسقون

translation: You will surely find the most intense of the people in animosity toward the believers to be the Jews and those who associate others with Allah. And you will surely find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say, 'We are Christians.' That is because among them are priests and monks and because they are not arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the varying attitudes of different religious groups towards the believers (Muslims). It states that the Jews and polytheists (those who associate partners with Allah) will be the most hostile and antagonistic towards the believers. On the other hand, the Christians will be the closest in affection and goodwill towards the believers. This is attributed to the presence of pious and humble priests and monks among the Christians, who are not arrogant or prideful.
orig: لتجدن أشد الناس عداوة للذين آمنوا اليهود والذين أشركوا ولتجدن أقربهم مودة للذين آمنوا الذين قالوا إنا نصارى ذلك بأن منهم قسيسين ورهبانا وأنهم لا يستكبرون

translation: And when they hear what has been revealed to the Messenger, you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognized of the truth. They say, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so write us down among the witnesses.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound spiritual impact of the Qur'an's revelation on the believers. When they listen to the verses revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, their eyes well up with tears out of recognition and appreciation for the truth contained therein. Their reaction stems from a deep conviction in the divine origin and guidance of the Qur'an. They humbly submit to Allah, professing their faith and pleading to be counted among those who bear witness to the truth.
orig: وإذا سمعوا ما أنزل إلى الرسول ترى أعينهم تفيض من الدمع مما عرفوا من الحق يقولون ربنا آمنا فاكتبنا مع الشاهدين

translation: And why should we not believe in Allah and the truth that has come to us, and hope that our Lord will admit us [to Paradise] with the righteous people?
interpretation: This verse expresses the believers' firm conviction in Allah and their acceptance of the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad. It reflects their hope and aspiration to be admitted into Paradise among the righteous people, as a result of their faith and good deeds. The verse encourages having unwavering belief in Allah and His revelations, while maintaining a positive outlook and striving to attain Allah's pleasure and reward.
orig: وما لنا لا نؤمن بالله وما جاءنا من الحق ونطمع أن يدخلنا ربنا مع القوم الصالحين

translation: So Allah rewarded them for what they said with gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who have faith and do good deeds will be rewarded by Allah with eternal bliss in the gardens of Paradise, where rivers flow beneath them. It emphasizes that this everlasting reward is specifically for those who are "doers of good," meaning those who lead righteous lives, obey Allah's commands, and strive to do beneficial actions for themselves and others.
orig: فأثابهم الله بما قالوا جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those are the companions of Hellfire
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith in God and deny His revelations that they will be among the dwellers of Hell. It emphasizes that denying God's signs and revelations leads to severe punishment in the Hereafter. The phrase "companions of Hellfire" indicates that they will be destined for eternal punishment in Hell as a consequence of their disbelief and rejection of divine truth.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not prohibit the good things which Allah has made lawful for you and do not transgress. Indeed, Allah does not like transgressors.
interpretation: Allah is instructing the believers not to make unlawful the good and pure things that He has permitted for them. This includes foods, drinks, and other permissible pleasures of life. The believers should not exceed the limits set by Allah and prohibit what He has allowed, for indeed Allah does not love those who transgress His limits and prohibit what He has made lawful.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تحرموا طيبات ما أحل الله لكم ولا تعتدوا إن الله لا يحب المعتدين

translation: And eat from whatever Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to consume only what is permissible (halal) and pure (tayyib) from the provisions granted by Allah. It emphasizes maintaining consciousness of Allah (taqwa) and being mindful of Him, as the believers profess faith in Him.
orig: وكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله الذي أنتم به مؤمنون

translation: Allah will not call you to account for thoughtlessness in your oaths, but He will call you to account for your deliberate oaths. Its expiation is feeding ten poor persons with the average of what you feed your own families, or clothing them, or freeing a slave. But whoever cannot find means shall fast for three days. That is the expiation for your oaths when you have sworn. And guard your oaths. Thus Allah makes clear to you His verses that you may be grateful.
interpretation: Allah ne vous imputera pas les serments inconsidérés, mais Il vous imputera les serments que vous avez contractés délibérément. L'expiation pour un tel serment est de nourrir dix pauvres avec une nourriture de qualité moyenne que vous donnez à vos familles, ou de les vêtir, ou d'affranchir un esclave. Celui qui n'en a pas les moyens doit jeûner trois jours. Telle est l'expiation de vos serments lorsque vous les avez prêtés. Et observez vos serments. C'est ainsi qu'Allah vous explique Ses versets, afin que vous soyez reconnaissants.
orig: لا يؤاخذكم الله باللغو في أيمانكم ولكن يؤاخذكم بما عقدتم الأيمان فكفارته إطعام عشرة مساكين من أوسط ما تطعمون أهليكم أو كسوتهم أو تحرير رقبة فمن لم يجد فصيام ثلاثة أيام ذلك كفارة أيمانكم إذا حلفتم واحفظوا أيمانكم كذلك يبين الله لكم آياته لعلكم تشكرون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed, intoxicants, gambling, [sacrificing on] stone alters [to other than Allah], and divining arrows are but defilement from the work of Satan, so avoid it that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the consumption of intoxicants, gambling, pagan rituals involving sacrifices on stone alters, and divination with arrows - all of which are described as "defilement from the work of Satan." Muslims are commanded to avoid these practices in order to attain success and prosperity in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما الخمر والميسر والأنصاب والأزلام رجس من عمل الشيطان فاجتنبوه لعلكم تفلحون

translation: Satan only wants to cause between you animosity and hatred through intoxicants and gambling and to avert you from the remembrance of Allah and from prayer. So will you not desist?
interpretation: This verse warns against the harmful effects of intoxicants and gambling, which are tools used by Satan to create enmity, hatred, and diversion from the remembrance of Allah and prayer. It is a call to abandon these vices and maintain a clear mind and heart focused on obedience to Allah.
orig: إنما يريد الشيطان أن يوقع بينكم العداوة والبغضاء في الخمر والميسر ويصدكم عن ذكر الله وعن الصلاة فهل أنتم منتهون

translation: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and beware. And if you turn away - then know that upon Our Messenger is only clear notification.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger, and warns against turning away from their commands. It states that if one disobeys, they should be aware that the Messenger's duty is merely to convey the message clearly, and the consequences of disbelief lie with the individual.
orig: وأطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول واحذروا فإن توليتم فاعلموا أنما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين

translation: There is no blame upon those who believe and do righteous deeds for what they have eaten [in the past] if they [now] fear Allah and believe and do righteous deeds, and then fear Allah and believe, and then fear Allah and do good; and Allah loves the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse reassures believers that there is no sin upon them for what they consumed before embracing faith, as long as they have truly repented, believed in Allah, performed righteous deeds, maintained piety and continued to do good. It emphasizes the importance of consistent faith, righteousness, and God-consciousness, and affirms that Allah loves those who excel in doing good.
orig: ليس على الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جناح فيما طعموا إذا ما اتقوا وآمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ثم اتقوا وآمنوا ثم اتقوا وأحسنوا والله يحب المحسنين

translation: O you who have believed, Allah will surely test you through something of the game that your hands and spears [can] reach, that Allah may make evident those who fear Him inwardly. But whoever transgresses after that - for him is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to a test from Allah for the believers, where He allows them to hunt certain game animals using their hands or spears. This test is to reveal those who truly fear Allah in their hearts, even when no one is watching. However, those who transgress and exceed the limits set by Allah after this test will face a painful punishment.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ليبلونكم الله بشيء من الصيد تناله أيديكم ورماحكم ليعلم الله من يخافه بالغيب فمن اعتدى بعد ذلك فله عذاب أليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not kill game while you are in the state of ihram. And whoever of you kills it intentionally - the penalty is an equivalent from sacrificial animals to what he killed, as judged by two men of justice among you, as an offering to reach the Ka'bah, or an expiation of feeding the poor or the equivalent of that in fasting, that he may taste the consequence of his matter. Allah has pardoned what is past; but whoever returns [to violation], then Allah will take retribution from him. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the killing of game animals while in the state of ihram (ritual consecration for Hajj or Umrah). It prescribes a penalty for intentionally killing game, which is to offer a sacrificial animal equivalent to the game killed, as determined by two just men. Alternatively, one can feed the poor or fast as an expiation. The verse warns that Allah will punish those who repeat this violation after being pardoned for past transgressions. It emphasizes Allah's might and ability to take retribution.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقتلوا الصيد وأنتم حرم ومن قتله منكم متعمدا فجزاء مثل ما قتل من النعم يحكم به ذوا عدل منكم هديا بالغ الكعبة أو كفارة طعام مساكين أو عدل ذلك صياما ليذوق وبال أمره عفا الله عما سلف ومن عاد فينتقم الله منه والله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: Lawful to you is game from the sea and its food as provision for you and the travelers, but forbidden to you is game from the land as long as you are in the sacred precincts. And fear Allah to whom you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse allows Muslims to hunt and eat seafood, providing sustenance for themselves and travelers. However, it prohibits hunting land animals while in the state of ihram (ritual consecration for Hajj or Umrah). It reminds believers to have consciousness of Allah, to whom they will ultimately return and be accountable.
orig: أحل لكم صيد البحر وطعامه متاعا لكم وللسيارة وحرم عليكم صيد البر ما دمتم حرما واتقوا الله الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: Allah has made the Ka'bah, the Sacred House, a resort for mankind, and the Sacred Month and the offerings and the sacrificial animals with garlands; this is in order that you may know that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and that Allah is the Knower of all things.
interpretation: Allah has designated the Ka'bah as a sacred site and place of pilgrimage for all people. He has also sanctified the Sacred Month (during which fighting is prohibited), the ritual offerings, and the sacrificial animals marked with garlands. These sacred symbols are meant to remind people that Allah has knowledge of everything in the heavens and the earth, and that He is All-Knowing.
orig: جعل الله الكعبة البيت الحرام قياما للناس والشهر الحرام والهدي والقلائد ذلك لتعلموا أن الله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وأن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Know that Allah is severe in punishment, and that Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights two key attributes of Allah: His ability to punish severely those who defy His commands, and His infinite mercy and forgiveness towards those who repent and seek His pardon. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disobedience, while also offering hope and encouragement to turn back to Allah with sincere repentance. The juxtaposition of these two attributes underscores the perfect balance of justice and mercy in Allah's dealings with His creation.
orig: اعلموا أن الله شديد العقاب وأن الله غفور رحيم

translation: The Messenger's duty is only to convey the message, and Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
interpretation: The role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is to simply deliver the message of Islam without forcing anyone to accept it. Allah alone knows the intentions and secrets that people conceal in their hearts, and He will judge them accordingly on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ما على الرسول إلا البلاغ والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

translation: Say, 'The bad and the good are not equal, even if the abundance of the bad may impress you. So fear Allah, O people of understanding, that you may be successful.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of distinguishing between what is good and what is bad or evil. It states that good and evil are not equal, even if the abundance or prevalence of evil might seem impressive or tempting. The verse advises those with understanding and wisdom to fear Allah and avoid being misled by the apparent abundance of evil, as doing so is the path to success and salvation.
orig: قل لا يستوي الخبيث والطيب ولو أعجبك كثرة الخبيث فاتقوا الله يا أولي الألباب لعلكم تفلحون

translation: O you who have believed, do not ask about things which, if they are shown to you, will distress you. But if you ask about them while the Qur'an is being revealed, they will be shown to you. Allah has pardoned it; and Allah is Forgiving and Forbearing.
interpretation: Allah instructs the believers not to inquire about matters that may distress them if revealed. However, if such matters are asked about during the revelation of the Qur'an, they will be clarified. Allah has pardoned and forgiven any mistakes made due to ignorance, as He is Most Forgiving and Forbearing.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تسألوا عن أشياء إن تبد لكم تسؤكم وإن تسألوا عنها حين ينزل القرآن تبد لكم عفا الله عنها والله غفور حليم

translation: Verily, a people before you asked such a question, then they became disbelievers therein.
interpretation: This verse refers to previous nations who demanded signs and miracles from their Prophets, but when these were shown to them, they rejected them and became disbelievers. It warns the people addressed not to follow in the footsteps of those who stubbornly rejected faith despite witnessing clear proofs.
orig: قد سألها قوم من قبلكم ثم أصبحوا بها كافرين

translation: Allah has not appointed anything from bahirah, sa'ibah, wasi'lah or ham. But those who disbelieve fabricate falsehood against Allah, and most of them have no understanding.
interpretation: This verse refutes certain pagan Arab practices involving the mistreatment of animals. Allah did not institute these superstitious customs of dedicating or marking certain animals for idolatrous purposes. Those who engage in such practices are fabricating lies against Allah and lack true understanding of His teachings.
orig: ما جعل الله من بحيرة ولا سائبة ولا وصيلة ولا حام ولكن الذين كفروا يفترون على الله الكذب وأكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger,' they say, 'Sufficient for us is that which we found our fathers upon.' Even though their fathers knew nothing, nor were they guided?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the blind following of ancestral traditions without rational thought or guidance. It highlights the arrogance and ignorance of those who reject divine revelation and the teachings of the Prophet, clinging instead to the misguided ways of their forefathers who lacked true knowledge and were not rightly guided. The verse calls for embracing the truth brought by Allah's revelation and the messenger, rather than stubbornly adhering to inherited falsehoods.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله وإلى الرسول قالوا حسبنا ما وجدنا عليه آباءنا أولو كان آباؤهم لا يعلمون شيئا ولا يهتدون

translation: O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided. To Allah is your return all together; then He will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual responsibility and accountability before God. It tells the believers that they are responsible for their own spiritual well-being and that the misguidance of others should not affect them as long as they remain rightly guided. Ultimately, everyone will return to God, who will then inform them of their deeds and hold them accountable. The interpretation highlights the importance of focusing on one's own faith and actions, rather than being misled by those who have strayed from the right path.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا عليكم أنفسكم لا يضركم من ضل إذا اهتديتم إلى الله مرجعكم جميعا فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, the testimony is established among you when death approaches one of you at the time of bequest - two just men from among you or two others from outside if you are traveling through the land and the calamity of death should strike you.
interpretation: This verse outlines the procedure for establishing testimony in the case of death and inheritance. It instructs believers to have two just witnesses from among themselves or, if traveling, two witnesses from outside their community present when making a will or testament upon the approach of death. The witnesses must swear by Allah that they will not conceal the truth, even if it involves a close relative, and that they are not motivated by any worldly gain. This emphasizes the importance of honesty and impartiality in bearing witness, which is a sacred duty in Islam.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا شهادة بينكم إذا حضر أحدكم الموت حين الوصية اثنان ذوا عدل منكم أو آخران من غيركم إن أنتم ضربتم في الأرض فأصابتكم مصيبة الموت تحبسونهما من بعد الصلاة فيقسمان بالله إن ارتبتم لا نشتري به ثمنا ولو كان ذا قربى ولا نكتم شهادة الله إنا إذا لمن الآثمين

translation: But if it is discovered that those two have been guilty of sin, then two others shall take their place from among those who have a lawful claim against the first two, and they shall swear by Allah: 'Our testimony is truer than their testimony, and we have not transgressed, for then we would be among the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: إذا تبين أن الشاهدين الأولين ارتكبا إثمًا بالكذب في الشهادة، فليشهد شاهدان آخران ممن لهم حق على الشاهدين الأولين، ويقسمان بالله أن شهادتهما أصدق من شهادة الأولين، وأنهما لم يتعدَّ حدود الحق في شهادتهما، فإن فعلا ذلك فهما من الظالمين.
orig: فإن عثر على أنهما استحقا إثما فآخران يقومان مقامهما من الذين استحق عليهم الأوليان فيقسمان بالله لشهادتنا أحق من شهادتهما وما اعتدينا إنا إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: That is more likely that they will give testimony in its true form, or else they would fear that other oaths might be admitted after their oaths. And have taqwa of Allah and listen. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse encourages truthful testimony and warns against false oaths. It suggests that people are more likely to give truthful testimony if they fear that their false oaths may be exposed later. It commands having taqwa (consciousness) of Allah and listening to His commands. Ultimately, Allah does not guide those who defiantly disobey Him.
orig: ذلك أدنى أن يأتوا بالشهادة على وجهها أو يخافوا أن ترد أيمان بعد أيمانهم واتقوا الله واسمعوا والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: The Day when Allah will gather the messengers and say, 'What was the response you received?' They will say, 'We have no knowledge. Indeed, it is You who is the Knower of the unseen.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when Allah will gather all the messengers and question them about the response they received from their people regarding their message. The messengers will humbly respond that they have no knowledge of the unseen, and only Allah knows the reality of people's acceptance or rejection of the message. It highlights the limitation of human knowledge and Allah's absolute knowledge of all that is unseen and hidden.
orig: يوم يجمع الله الرسل فيقول ماذا أجبتم قالوا لا علم لنا إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: When Allah said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My favor upon you and upon your mother, when I supported you with the Holy Spirit. You spoke to people in the cradle and in maturity, and when I taught you the Book and Wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel. And when you designed from clay what was like the form of a bird by My permission, then you breathed into it, and it became a bird by My permission. And you healed the blind and the leper by My permission. And when you brought forth the dead by My permission. And when I restrained the Children of Israel from you when you came to them with clear proofs, and those who disbelieved among them said, 'This is nothing but obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the many miracles and favors that Allah bestowed upon Jesus, peace be upon him, as a sign of his prophethood. These include being supported by the Holy Spirit, speaking from the cradle, being taught the divine scriptures, creating a bird from clay and bringing it to life, healing the blind and lepers, and reviving the dead – all by Allah's permission. However, despite these clear proofs, some among the Children of Israel rejected him, accusing him of practicing mere magic.
orig: إذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم اذكر نعمتي عليك وعلى والدتك إذ أيدتك بروح القدس تكلم الناس في المهد وكهلا وإذ علمتك الكتاب والحكمة والتوراة والإنجيل وإذ تخلق من الطين كهيئة الطير بإذني فتنفخ فيها فتكون طيرا بإذني وتبرئ الأكمه والأبرص بإذني وإذ تخرج الموتى بإذني وإذ كففت بني إسرائيل عنك إذ جئتهم بالبينات فقال الذين كفروا منهم إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And [recall] when I inspired to the disciples, 'Believe in Me and in My messenger.' They said, 'We have believed, so bear witness that indeed we are Muslims [in submission to Allah].'
interpretation: This verse refers to a time when Allah inspired the disciples of Prophet Jesus to believe in Him and in the message brought by Prophet Muhammad, who was to come after Jesus. The disciples responded positively, affirming their belief and declaring their submission to Allah's will as Muslims.
orig: وإذ أوحيت إلى الحواريين أن آمنوا بي وبرسولي قالوا آمنا واشهد بأننا مسلمون

translation: When the disciples said, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, is your Lord able to send down upon us a table spread with food from heaven?' He said, 'Fear Allah, if you are indeed believers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where Jesus' disciples asked him to request a heavenly feast from God as a sign of His power and to strengthen their faith. Jesus' response, "Fear Allah, if you are indeed believers," implies that true believers should have unwavering faith in God without demanding miracles or signs. It teaches the importance of having sincere faith and trust in God's wisdom and plan.
orig: إذ قال الحواريون يا عيسى ابن مريم هل يستطيع ربك أن ينزل علينا مائدة من السماء قال اتقوا الله إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: They said, 'We wish to eat from it and to satisfy our hearts and know that you have indeed spoken the truth to us, and we will be among the witnesses to it.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that the people were asking for a tangible sign from God to prove that Moses was truthful in his message. They wanted to witness this sign with their own eyes and have their hearts assured, so that they could become believers and bear witness to the truth.
orig: قالوا نريد أن نأكل منها وتطمئن قلوبنا ونعلم أن قد صدقتنا ونكون عليها من الشاهدين

translation: Jesus, son of Mary, said: 'O Allah, our Lord, send down upon us a table spread with food from heaven, that it may be a feast for us, for the first of us and for the last of us, and a sign from You; and provide for us, for You are the Best of providers.'
interpretation: This verse narrates the supplication of Prophet Jesus, asking Allah to send down a table spread with food from heaven as a festive occasion and a sign for the believers. It reflects Jesus' faith in Allah's power and provision, and his desire for a divine blessing to strengthen the faith of his followers. The request highlights the importance of seeking spiritual nourishment and divine guidance alongside physical sustenance.
orig: قال عيسى ابن مريم اللهم ربنا أنزل علينا مائدة من السماء تكون لنا عيدا لأولنا وآخرنا وآية منك وارزقنا وأنت خير الرازقين

translation: Allah says: 'Verily, I am going to send it down unto you, and whoso disbelieves hereafter, I will punish him with a punishment wherewith I have not punished anyone among the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse warns against rejecting the revelation sent by Allah after it has been made clear. It emphasizes the severe punishment that awaits those who persist in disbelief after receiving guidance. The punishment is described as unparalleled, implying its intensity and severity beyond what has been inflicted on anyone else in the worlds. This underscores the grave consequence of knowingly denying Allah's revelations.
orig: قال الله إني منزلها عليكم فمن يكفر بعد منكم فإني أعذبه عذابا لا أعذبه أحدا من العالمين

translation: And [behold] when Allah will say, 'O Jesus, son of Mary, didst thou say unto men, 'Worship me and my mother as gods beside Allah?'' He will answer, 'Glory to Thee! It was not possible for me to say what I had no right to [say]. Had I said this, Thou wouldst indeed have known it. Thou knowest all that is within myself, whereas I know not what is in Thy Self. Verily, it is Thou alone who fully knowest all the things that are beyond the reach of a created being's perception.'
interpretation: This verse is about Jesus denying that he ever claimed divinity for himself or his mother Mary. It emphasizes that Jesus was a human messenger of God and did not have any divine attributes. He would never say something that he has no right to say, and he affirms that God knows everything while his knowledge is limited as a created being.
orig: وإذ قال الله يا عيسى ابن مريم أأنت قلت للناس اتخذوني وأمي إلهين من دون الله قال سبحانك ما يكون لي أن أقول ما ليس لي بحق إن كنت قلته فقد علمته تعلم ما في نفسي ولا أعلم ما في نفسك إنك أنت علام الغيوب

translation: I did not say to them except what You commanded me - to worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I remained among them; but when You took me up, You were the Watcher over them, and You are a Witness to all things.
interpretation: In this verse, Prophet Jesus is addressing Allah and affirming that he only conveyed the message of worshipping Allah alone, which was commanded to him. He was a witness over his people as long as he lived among them, but after Allah raised him up, Allah became the Watcher and Witness over them. This verse highlights Jesus' role as a messenger who preached the Oneness of Allah and that after his departure, Allah is the Supreme Witness over all creation.
orig: ما قلت لهم إلا ما أمرتني به أن اعبدوا الله ربي وربكم وكنت عليهم شهيدا ما دمت فيهم فلما توفيتني كنت أنت الرقيب عليهم وأنت على كل شيء شهيد

translation: If You punish them, they are Your servants; and if You forgive them, You are the Almighty, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute authority and wisdom in dealing with His servants. It acknowledges that whether He chooses to punish or forgive them, it is entirely within His right as their Lord and Creator. The phrase "they are Your servants" highlights their complete submission to Allah's will. At the same time, the verse affirms Allah's might and wisdom, describing Him as "the Almighty, the Wise." This implies that any decision He makes regarding punishment or forgiveness is based on His perfect knowledge, justice, and wisdom.
orig: إن تعذبهم فإنهم عبادك وإن تغفر لهم فإنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: Allah says, 'This is a Day [when] the truthful will benefit from their truthfulness. For them are gardens [in Paradise] beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them, and they with Him. That is the great attainment.'
interpretation: This verse describes the great reward awaiting the truthful believers on the Day of Judgment. Their truthfulness and sincerity in faith and deeds will benefit them, and they will be granted eternal gardens in Paradise with rivers flowing beneath them. They will abide therein forever, in a state of complete pleasure and contentment, for Allah will be pleased with them and they with Him. This is the ultimate success and the greatest attainment that a believer can aspire to.
orig: قال الله هذا يوم ينفع الصادقين صدقهم لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them. And He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and dominion over the entire universe. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the true Owner and Ruler of the heavens, the earth, and everything contained within them. Nothing occurs without His knowledge and permission. The verse also highlights Allah's immense power and ability to do anything, as He is "over all things competent."
orig: لله ملك السماوات والأرض وما فيهن وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: Praise be to Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, and made the darkness and the light. Yet those who disbelieve equate [others] with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse praises Allah as the Creator of the heavens, the earth, darkness, and light. It condemns those who associate partners with Allah by equating others with Him, despite His unique qualities as the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe.
orig: الحمد لله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وجعل الظلمات والنور ثم الذين كفروا بربهم يعدلون

translation: It is He who created you from clay and then decreed a term, and there is a specified term with Him; yet you are in doubt.
interpretation: Allah is reminding us that He is the One who created us from a lowly origin (clay), and has appointed a fixed term for our lives in this world, and another term on the Day of Resurrection when we will be held accountable for our deeds. Despite this clear truth, some people still doubt the reality of the Hereafter and Allah's ability to resurrect them after death.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من طين ثم قضى أجلا وأجل مسمى عنده ثم أنتم تمترون

translation: And He is Allah in the heavens and on the earth. He knows your secret and your public affairs, and He knows what you earn.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute knowledge and awareness of everything in the heavens and on earth. It highlights that He knows our innermost secrets as well as our outward actions and deeds. Nothing is hidden from Allah, and He is fully aware of all that we do, think, and earn through our efforts and actions. This serves as a reminder of Allah's all-encompassing knowledge and that we are accountable to Him for our thoughts, intentions, and actions.
orig: وهو الله في السماوات وفي الأرض يعلم سركم وجهركم ويعلم ما تكسبون

translation: And there does not come to them any sign from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it.
interpretation: This verse implies that the disbelievers persistently rejected and turned away from the clear signs and evidences presented to them by Allah, demonstrating their stubborn denial and unwillingness to accept the truth.
orig: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين

translation: Indeed, they have denied the truth when it came to them, so there will surely come to them the news of what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse is warning the disbelievers who rejected the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). They mocked and ridiculed the message of Islam, but soon they will face the consequences of their denial. The "news" refers to the punishment and torment that will befall them, either in this life or in the Hereafter, for their mockery and disbelief.
orig: فقد كذبوا بالحق لما جاءهم فسوف يأتيهم أنباء ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Have they not seen how many generations We have destroyed before them, whom We had firmly established in the land as We have not established you, and showered upon them abundant rains from the sky, and caused rivers to flow beneath them? Yet We destroyed them for their sins, and raised up other generations after them.
interpretation: Allah est soulignant Son pouvoir absolu sur toutes les créatures et Son droit de les détruire pour leurs péchés. Il rappelle aux incroyants les civilisations prospères du passé qu'Il a anéanties à cause de leur mécréance et de leurs péchés, malgré les faveurs et les bienfaits dont elles jouissaient. Cela sert d'avertissement pour qu'ils ne suivent pas la même voie et ne subissent pas le même sort.
orig: ألم يروا كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من قرن مكناهم في الأرض ما لم نمكن لكم وأرسلنا السماء عليهم مدرارا وجعلنا الأنهار تجري من تحتهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: And if We had sent down to you a written scripture on parchment, and they touched it with their hands, those who disbelieved would have said, 'This is nothing but obvious magic.'
interpretation: "This verse highlights the stubbornness and disbelief of those who reject the truth, even when presented with clear evidence. It suggests that even if the Qur'an was revealed in a physical, written form that they could touch and see, the disbelievers would still dismiss it as mere sorcery or magic, refusing to acknowledge its divine origin and message. Their rejection stems from their own prejudices and unwillingness to accept the truth, rather than any lack of proof or evidence."
orig: ولو نزلنا عليك كتابا في قرطاس فلمسوه بأيديهم لقال الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And they say, 'Why was there not sent down to him an angel?' But if We had sent down an angel, the matter would have been decided; then they would not be reprieved.
interpretation: The disbelievers mockingly asked why an angel was not sent down to Muhammad instead of a human messenger. But if an angel had been sent, it would have meant the end for them with no chance for repentance, for angels do not come except to execute God's commands without giving people a chance to believe or reject the message.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه ملك ولو أنزلنا ملكا لقضي الأمر ثم لا ينظرون

translation: And if We had appointed him an angel, We would have made him a man, and We would have certainly confused them as they are now confused.
interpretation: If Allah had sent an angel as a messenger, He would have given him a human form, for people are accustomed to dealing with humans. However, this would have caused confusion and doubt among the disbelievers, just as they are confused about the Prophet Muhammad being a human messenger. The wisdom behind sending human messengers is that people can relate to them better and follow their example more easily.
orig: ولو جعلناه ملكا لجعلناه رجلا وللبسنا عليهم ما يلبسون

translation: And certainly were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad that he is not the first messenger to face mockery and ridicule from disbelievers. Many messengers before him were also mocked and derided by their people. However, those who mocked the messengers ultimately faced the very punishment or consequences that they used to ridicule and make fun of. This serves as a warning to those who reject the message and mock the messenger, for their mockery will not prevent the truth from prevailing, and they will face the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say, "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of the deniers."
interpretation: This verse encourages people to reflect on the fate of previous nations and communities who rejected the message of God's messengers. By traveling and observing the remnants of these civilizations, one can see the consequences of denying the truth and turning away from God's guidance. It serves as a reminder that those who arrogantly reject faith and persist in disbelief will ultimately face a similar end, just as those before them did.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض ثم انظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: Say, "To whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth?" Say, "To Allah." He has prescribed for Himself mercy. He will surely gather you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. Those who have lost themselves will not believe.
interpretation: الله تعالى يأمر نبيه محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم أن يقول للمشركين: لمن تنتمي كل ما في السماوات والأرض؟ فالجواب هو لله وحده. ثم يأمره أن يقول إن الله كتب على نفسه الرحمة، فسيجمع الخلائق يوم القيامة ليحاسبهم وليدخل من آمن الجنة ومن كفر النار. وهذا اليوم لا شك فيه، لكن الذين خسروا أنفسهم بالكفر والمعاصي لن يؤمنوا به.
orig: قل لمن ما في السماوات والأرض قل لله كتب على نفسه الرحمة ليجمعنكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: To Him belongs whatever dwells in the night and the day. And He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete sovereignty and dominion over all of creation. Everything that exists, whether living or non-living, moving or still, during the night or day, is under His ownership and control. Allah is "As-Samee'" (the All-Hearing), aware of the slightest sound or movement, and "Al-'Aleem" (the All-Knowing), possessing perfect and comprehensive knowledge of all things, seen and unseen.
orig: وله ما سكن في الليل والنهار وهو السميع العليم

translation: Say: "Shall I take besides Allah another guardian, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, and He feeds but is not fed?" Say: "I have been commanded to be the first of those who submit." And be not thou of the idolaters.
interpretation: Allah is questioning the idolaters who worship other gods besides Him. He is the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe, so how can they take others as gods besides Him? The Prophet Muhammad is commanded to declare that he has submitted himself completely to Allah alone and to be the first among those who surrender to His will, rejecting all forms of idolatry or associating partners with Allah.
orig: قل أغير الله أتخذ وليا فاطر السماوات والأرض وهو يطعم ولا يطعم قل إني أمرت أن أكون أول من أسلم ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and the fear of His punishment. It encourages the believer to remain steadfast in their faith and avoid disobedience, as the consequences of defying Allah's commands on the Day of Judgment will be severe and overwhelming. The "tremendous Day" refers to the Day of Resurrection, when all humans will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Whoever is spared from it that Day - [Allah] has certainly favoured him. And that is the clear success.
interpretation: Whoever is saved from the punishment and torment of Hell on the Day of Resurrection, Allah has truly shown him mercy and blessed him with His grace. This salvation from Hellfire is the supreme triumph and evident success that every believer aspires for.
orig: من يصرف عنه يومئذ فقد رحمه وذلك الفوز المبين

translation: And if Allah should touch you with affliction, none can remove it but He. And if He touches you with good - then He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and control of Allah over all affairs. It states that if Allah afflicts a person with harm or difficulty, none other than Him can remove or alleviate that affliction. Similarly, if He blesses a person with goodness and favors, it is because He has the complete ability to do so over all things. The verse highlights Allah's Oneness, might, and sovereignty over the universe and human affairs.
orig: وإن يمسسك الله بضر فلا كاشف له إلا هو وإن يمسسك بخير فهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And He is the Irresistible, over His servants, and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's supreme authority and power over His creation, as well as His perfect wisdom and knowledge. He is "Al-Qaahir" (the Irresistible), meaning that none can overpower or resist His will and decree. At the same time, He is "Al-Hakeem" (the Wise), executing everything with profound wisdom and purpose, and "Al-Khabeer" (the Acquainted), possessing complete knowledge of all things, seen and unseen. This highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty, might, and wisdom in governing the affairs of His servants and the entire universe.
orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: Say, "What thing is greatest in testimony?" Say, "Allah is Witness between me and you. And this Qur'an was revealed to me that I may warn you thereby and whomever it reaches. Do you verily bear witness that there are other gods with Allah?" Say, "I bear no witness." Say, "He is but One God, and I am surely free of that which you associate."
interpretation: This verse invites people to reflect on the greatest testimony, which is the testimony of Allah Himself. It emphasizes that the Qur'an was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad to warn people and guide them to the truth. The verse then questions whether people truly believe in the existence of other gods besides Allah. It instructs the Prophet to declare that he does not bear witness to the existence of any other gods and that Allah is One and Unique, free from any partners or associates.
orig: قل أي شيء أكبر شهادة قل الله شهيد بيني وبينكم وأوحي إلي هذا القرآن لأنذركم به ومن بلغ أئنكم لتشهدون أن مع الله آلهة أخرى قل لا أشهد قل إنما هو إله واحد وإنني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Those to whom We have given the Book recognize him as they recognize their own sons. Those who have lost themselves will not believe.
interpretation: This verse refers to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who recognized the truth of the Prophet Muhammad, upon him be peace, and the message he brought, just as they would recognize their own sons. However, those who have lost or ruined themselves by rejecting the truth and following their desires will not believe, despite recognizing the truth.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعرفونه كما يعرفون أبناءهم الذين خسروا أنفسهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who fabricate lies against Allah or reject His revelations. It warns that such unjust individuals who spread falsehood about Allah and His signs will ultimately fail and not attain success or salvation. Their wrongful actions will lead them to ruin and deprivation of Allah's mercy and guidance.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And the Day when We will gather them all together - then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "Where are your 'partners' that you used to claim?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when Allah will gather all people, and question the polytheists about the partners they associated with Him. It emphasizes the futility of their beliefs and the fact that their so-called partners will be unable to help them on that Day. The verse highlights the oneness of Allah and the falsehood of associating others with Him.
orig: ويوم نحشرهم جميعا ثم نقول للذين أشركوا أين شركاؤكم الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: But they had no excuse except that they said, 'By Allah, our Lord, we have never been idolaters.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the disbelievers had no valid justification or excuse for their rejection of faith and association of partners with Allah, except their false claim that they worshipped Allah alone and were not idolaters. However, this claim was a clear lie, as they associated others with Allah in worship, which is the essence of shirk (polytheism).
orig: ثم لم تكن فتنتهم إلا أن قالوا والله ربنا ما كنا مشركين

translation: See how they lied against themselves, and how that which they used to invent has gone away from them.
interpretation: This verse highlights the falsehood and deception that the disbelievers engaged in, rejecting the truth and inventing lies against Allah. It emphasizes that their false claims and fabrications will ultimately be exposed and become worthless, leaving them with nothing but their own self-deception. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance, denial of the truth, and the futility of following one's own whims and desires instead of the guidance from Allah.
orig: انظر كيف كذبوا على أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if they should see every sign, they still would not believe in it. Even when they come to you arguing with you, those who disbelieve say, 'This is not but legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse describes the stubborn disbelief of some people who refuse to accept the truth despite clear signs and proofs. Their hearts are covered, preventing them from understanding the message, and their ears are deaf to it. Even if they witness every miracle, they still would not believe. When they argue with the Prophet, they dismiss the Qur'an as mere fables of ancient peoples, rejecting its divine origin.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإن يروا كل آية لا يؤمنوا بها حتى إذا جاءوك يجادلونك يقول الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: But they keep away from it and go far from it, and they only destroy themselves, though they perceive it not.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who turn away from the guidance of God and reject His revelations are only harming themselves, even though they may not realize it. They distance themselves from the truth and refuse to accept it, leading to their own spiritual and moral destruction. However, they fail to comprehend the consequences of their actions and the harm they inflict upon themselves.
orig: وهم ينهون عنه وينأون عنه وإن يهلكون إلا أنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And if you could but see when they will be held over the Fire and will say, 'Would that we might be returned [to the former world]! Then we would not deny the signs of our Lord, and we would be among the believers.'
interpretation: This verse depicts the regretful state of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they will be brought before the Hellfire. They will wish to be sent back to the worldly life so that they could believe and obey Allah's commands, realizing too late the grave error of their ways. However, this remorse will be of no avail as their opportunity has passed. The verse serves as a stern warning to take heed in this life before it is too late.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على النار فقالوا يا ليتنا نرد ولا نكذب بآيات ربنا ونكون من المؤمنين

translation: Nay, but that which they used to conceal before has become manifest to them. And if they were returned, they would certainly revert to that which they were forbidden. And most certainly they are liars.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers' true nature and real intentions have been exposed. If they were given another chance in this life, they would revert to the same sinful acts that they were prohibited from doing. They are proven liars who have broken their promises and covenants with Allah.
orig: بل بدا لهم ما كانوا يخفون من قبل ولو ردوا لعادوا لما نهوا عنه وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: And they say, 'There is nothing but our worldly life, and we will not be resurrected.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelief of those who deny the Hereafter and the resurrection. They limit their understanding to the physical world and material life, rejecting the idea of a life after death or accountability before God. Their perspective is confined to this temporary worldly existence, failing to recognize the greater spiritual reality and purpose of human existence.
orig: وقالوا إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: And if you could but see when they are made to stand before their Lord, He will say, 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord.' He will then say, 'So taste the punishment for what you used to deny.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will be brought before Allah. Allah will ask them if what they are witnessing is not the truth, and they will be forced to admit that it is indeed the truth. As a consequence of their denial and disbelief in the worldly life, Allah will command them to taste the punishment they deserved.
orig: ولو ترى إذ وقفوا على ربهم قال أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Indeed, they who denied the meeting with Allah will have lost, until, when the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly, they will say, 'Oh, [how great is] our regret over what we neglected concerning it.' And they will bear their burdens on their backs. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the reality of the Hereafter and the accountability before Allah. It states that they will be in a state of loss and regret when the Hour suddenly arrives. At that moment, they will realize their grave mistake in neglecting their duties, but it will be too late. The burdens of their sins will weigh heavily upon them, and what they carried in this life will be a source of immense distress in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the dire consequences of denying the meeting with Allah and highlights the importance of faith and righteous deeds.
orig: قد خسر الذين كذبوا بلقاء الله حتى إذا جاءتهم الساعة بغتة قالوا يا حسرتنا على ما فرطنا فيها وهم يحملون أوزارهم على ظهورهم ألا ساء ما يزرون

translation: And what is the life of this world but play and amusement? But far better is the Abode of the Hereafter for those who are righteous. Will you not then understand?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary and fleeting nature of this worldly life, which is likened to mere play and amusement. It contrasts this with the everlasting life of the Hereafter, which is described as "far better" for those who lead a righteous life by obeying Allah's commands and avoiding His prohibitions. The verse concludes with a rhetorical question, urging people to use their intellect and understand the profound truth that the real, eternal life is the one in the Hereafter, not this transient worldly existence.
orig: وما الحياة الدنيا إلا لعب ولهو وللدار الآخرة خير للذين يتقون أفلا تعقلون

translation: We certainly know that what they say grieves you. But they do not call you a liar; rather, it is the signs of Allah that the wrongdoers reject.
interpretation: This verse is a consolation for the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) regarding the rejection and mockery he faced from the disbelievers. It states that Allah knows the hurt and grief caused by their words, but they are not accusing the Prophet himself of lying. Rather, they are denying and rejecting the clear signs and revelations from Allah out of injustice and wrongdoing.
orig: قد نعلم إنه ليحزنك الذي يقولون فإنهم لا يكذبونك ولكن الظالمين بآيات الله يجحدون

translation: And certainly were messengers denied before you, but they were patient over [the effects of] denial, and they were harmed until Our victory came to them. And none can alter the words of Allah. And there has certainly come to you the news of the [former] messengers.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad that he is not the first messenger to face rejection and persecution. Many messengers before him were also denied and suffered harm from their people, but they remained patient and steadfast until Allah's help and victory came to them. It emphasizes that Allah's words and promises are unchangeable, and that the stories of previous messengers have reached the Prophet as a lesson and consolation.
orig: ولقد كذبت رسل من قبلك فصبروا على ما كذبوا وأوذوا حتى أتاهم نصرنا ولا مبدل لكلمات الله ولقد جاءك من نبإ المرسلين

translation: And if their turning away is hard on you, then if you are able to seek a tunnel into the earth or a stairway into the sky to bring them a sign. And had Allah willed, He could have gathered them to guidance. So do not be among the ignorant.
interpretation: La interprétation de ce verset est que le Prophète ne doit pas se sentir découragé par ceux qui se détournent de la vérité. S'il était possible d'obtenir un miracle évident de la terre ou du ciel pour les convaincre, alors peut-être qu'ils croiraient. Cependant, Allah ne force personne à croire. C'est Son choix de guider ou non les gens. Le Prophète ne doit donc pas être parmi les ignorants qui s'obstinent malgré les preuves évidentes.
orig: وإن كان كبر عليك إعراضهم فإن استطعت أن تبتغي نفقا في الأرض أو سلما في السماء فتأتيهم بآية ولو شاء الله لجمعهم على الهدى فلا تكونن من الجاهلين

translation: It is only those who listen that will respond, but as for the dead, Allah will resurrect them; then to Him they will be returned.
interpretation: This verse implies that only those who are spiritually alive and receptive to the truth will respond positively to God's message. Those who are spiritually "dead" and unwilling to listen will be resurrected on the Day of Judgment and held accountable for their actions. Ultimately, all will return to God for judgment and recompense.
orig: إنما يستجيب الذين يسمعون والموتى يبعثهم الله ثم إليه يرجعون

translation: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'Indeed, Allah is Able to send down a sign, but most of them do not know.'
interpretation: The disbelievers demanded a miracle from the Prophet as proof of his prophethood, but Allah says that He has the power to send down miracles, however, most people are ignorant and would still not believe even if a miracle was shown to them. This verse emphasizes the disbelievers' stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the truth, despite clear signs from Allah.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل عليه آية من ربه قل إن الله قادر على أن ينزل آية ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: There is no creature on earth, nor a bird that flies with its two wings, but they are communities like yourselves. We have not neglected anything in the Book. Then to their Lord they will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse indicates that all creatures, whether on land or in the air, form communities just like humans. They all follow a pattern and a way of life decreed by Allah. Nothing has been left out of Allah's record and decree. Ultimately, all creatures will be gathered before their Lord on the Day of Resurrection to be judged for their actions.
orig: وما من دابة في الأرض ولا طائر يطير بجناحيه إلا أمم أمثالكم ما فرطنا في الكتاب من شيء ثم إلى ربهم يحشرون

translation: But those who deny Our signs are deaf and dumb, in utter darkness. Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray, and whoever He wills He guides to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse highlights the spiritual blindness and deafness of those who reject Allah's revelations. They are likened to being in utter darkness, unable to perceive the truth. It also emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty, where He guides whom He wills to the straight path and leaves whom He wills to stray, based on His divine wisdom and justice.
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا صم وبكم في الظلمات من يشإ الله يضلله ومن يشأ يجعله على صراط مستقيم

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if there came to you the punishment of Allah or there came to you the Hour - is it other than Allah you would invoke, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' beliefs and practices. It asks them to ponder: if Allah's punishment or the Day of Resurrection were to come upon them, would they call upon anyone other than Allah for help and salvation? If they are truthful in their claim of associating partners with Allah, then they should be able to find someone else to call upon during such calamities. However, the implied answer is that they would have no one else to turn to except Allah, thus proving the falsehood of their polytheistic beliefs.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله أو أتتكم الساعة أغير الله تدعون إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Nay, it is He alone Whom you call upon, and He removes that for which you call upon Him if He wills, and you forget whatever partners you ascribed to Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah alone who has the power to answer prayers and remove difficulties. Calling upon any partners or false deities besides Allah is futile, as they have no ability to help or respond. The verse reminds people that they tend to forget their false partners when they are in dire need and sincerely call upon Allah alone for help.
orig: بل إياه تدعون فيكشف ما تدعون إليه إن شاء وتنسون ما تشركون

translation: And We have certainly sent [messengers] to nations before you, [O Muhammad]; then We seized them with poverty and hardship that perhaps they might humble themselves [to Us].
interpretation: Allah sent messengers to nations before the time of Prophet Muhammad to guide them, but when they rejected the message, He punished them with poverty, hardship and calamities so that they may humble themselves before Him and submit to His commands.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا إلى أمم من قبلك فأخذناهم بالبأساء والضراء لعلهم يتضرعون

translation: But then, when Our punishment came upon them, why did they not humble themselves? But their hearts became hardened, and Satan made their deeds seem fair to them.
interpretation: "Allah is questioning why the disbelievers did not humble themselves and turn to Him in repentance when His punishment came upon them. Instead, their hearts became hardened and Satan made their evil deeds seem attractive and justified to them."
orig: فلولا إذ جاءهم بأسنا تضرعوا ولكن قست قلوبهم وزين لهم الشيطان ما كانوا يعملون

translation: But when they forgot what they had been reminded of, We opened unto them the gates of all things until, when they were rejoicing in what they were given, We seized them suddenly, and they were plunged into destruction with deep regret and despair.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that befell a nation that was blessed with knowledge and guidance from Allah, but they became heedless and ungrateful. Despite being reminded, they forgot Allah's favors and indulged in worldly pleasures. As a result, Allah opened for them "the gates of all things," meaning they were given abundant provisions and material comforts. However, when they became arrogant and rejoiced in these worldly gains, Allah seized them suddenly with a severe punishment, leaving them in utter regret and despair.
orig: فلما نسوا ما ذكروا به فتحنا عليهم أبواب كل شيء حتى إذا فرحوا بما أوتوا أخذناهم بغتة فإذا هم مبلسون

translation: So the roots of the people who did wrong were cut off. And all praise is due to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah destroyed and removed the power and influence of the wrongdoers who persisted in disbelief and oppression. Their plans and plots were foiled, and they were utterly defeated. The phrase "cut off" signifies their complete destruction and eradication. The verse concludes by praising Allah, the Lord of all the worlds, for His justice and for establishing truth over falsehood.
orig: فقطع دابر القوم الذين ظلموا والحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah took away your hearing and your sight and set a seal upon your hearts, which deity other than Allah could bring them back to you?" Look how We diversify the verses; then they [still] turn away.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the consequences of rejecting faith and guidance from Allah. It emphasizes Allah's power to deprive them of their faculties of hearing, sight, and understanding, leaving them spiritually blind and deaf. No other deity can restore these blessings if Allah chooses to take them away. The verse also highlights Allah's wisdom in presenting clear signs and evidences, yet the disbelievers persist in turning away from the truth.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أخذ الله سمعكم وأبصاركم وختم على قلوبكم من إله غير الله يأتيكم به انظر كيف نصرف الآيات ثم هم يصدفون

translation: Say, "Have you considered: if the punishment of Allah should come to you unexpectedly or manifestly, will any be destroyed but the wrongdoing people?"
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question, warning the disbelievers that if Allah's punishment were to come upon them suddenly or openly, only the wrongdoers would be destroyed. It serves as a reminder that Allah's punishment is just and befalls those who persist in disbelief and wrongdoing. The verse emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous conduct to avoid such a dire consequence.
orig: قل أرأيتكم إن أتاكم عذاب الله بغتة أو جهرة هل يهلك إلا القوم الظالمون

translation: And We send not the messengers except as bearers of good tidings and warners. So whoever believes and reforms - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the primary roles of prophets and messengers: to deliver glad tidings of reward for those who believe and reform, and to warn of consequences for those who reject faith. It emphasizes that those who have faith and strive to better themselves will be free from fear and grief in the Hereafter."
orig: وما نرسل المرسلين إلا مبشرين ومنذرين فمن آمن وأصلح فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: And those who deny Our signs, the punishment will touch them for their defiantly disobeying.
interpretation: "This verse serves as a warning to those who reject the signs and revelations from God. It indicates that they will face punishment for their defiance and disobedience towards the divine commandments. The phrase 'defiantly disobeying' (كانوا يفسقون) implies a deliberate and persistent rejection of the truth, going against the moral and spiritual guidance provided by God's signs. The verse emphasizes that such denial and transgression will inevitably lead to facing the consequences and divine retribution."
orig: والذين كذبوا بآياتنا يمسهم العذاب بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: Say, 'I do not tell you that I possess the treasures of Allah, nor do I know the unseen, nor do I claim to be an angel. I only follow what is revealed to me.' Say, 'Are the blind and the seeing alike? Then will you not reflect?'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to clarify that he does not possess any supernatural powers or knowledge of the unseen. He is only a human being who follows the revelation sent to him by Allah. The rhetorical question at the end emphasizes that those who can "see" the truth should reflect on it, as opposed to those who are spiritually blind and unable to comprehend the divine message.
orig: قل لا أقول لكم عندي خزائن الله ولا أعلم الغيب ولا أقول لكم إني ملك إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي قل هل يستوي الأعمى والبصير أفلا تتفكرون

translation: And warn by the Qur'an those who fear that they will be gathered to their Lord - for them besides Him there is no protector and no intercessor - that they might become righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the purpose of the Qur'an as a warning to those who fear standing before their Lord on the Day of Resurrection. It highlights that no one can protect or intercede for them except Allah, so they should strive to become righteous and obedient servants of God.
orig: وأنذر به الذين يخافون أن يحشروا إلى ربهم ليس لهم من دونه ولي ولا شفيع لعلهم يتقون

translation: And do not drive away those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His countenance. Not upon you is anything of their account and not upon them is anything of your account. So were you to drive them away, you would then be of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: "La taqra' man yad'u rabbahu bil-ghadati wal-'ashiyyi yuriidu wajhahu": This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, not to turn away or reject those who sincerely worship and call upon Allah, seeking His pleasure, in the morning and evening. It emphasizes the importance of respecting and accommodating those who are devoted to their faith and religious practices. "Ma 'alaika min hisabihim min shai'in wa ma min hisabika 'alaihim min shai'": The verse clarifies that the accountability for their actions lies with Allah alone, and the Prophet is not responsible for judging or holding them accountable, just as they are not responsible for judging or holding him accountable. "Fataturddahum fatakouna minaz-zalimeen": It warns that if the Prophet were to drive away or reject these sincere worshippers, he would be committing an act of wrongdoing and injustice.
orig: ولا تطرد الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ما عليك من حسابهم من شيء وما من حسابك عليهم من شيء فتطردهم فتكون من الظالمين

translation: And thus We have tried some of them with others, that they might say, 'Are these the ones whom Allah has favored among us?' Is not Allah most knowing of those who are grateful?
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah tests people by putting them in different circumstances and situations to distinguish those who are truly grateful and appreciative of His favors from those who are not. The trials and difficulties faced by some people serve as a means for others to reflect on the blessings bestowed upon them by Allah. However, instead of being grateful, some people arrogantly question why others have been favored more than them, failing to recognize that Allah alone knows best who is truly deserving of His bounties based on their gratitude and righteousness.
orig: وكذلك فتنا بعضهم ببعض ليقولوا أهؤلاء من الله عليهم من بيننا أليس الله بأعلم بالشاكرين

translation: And when those who believe in Our verses come to you, say, 'Peace be upon you. Your Lord has prescribed mercy for Himself, that whoever among you does an evil deed out of ignorance, and then repents after it and corrects himself - then He is Forgiving and Merciful.'
interpretation: Allah commands the Prophet to greet the believers with the words of peace when they come to him. He then informs them that He has made mercy incumbent upon Himself, meaning that He will forgive those who commit sins out of ignorance, not defiantly, if they repent sincerely and reform themselves. This highlights Allah's infinite mercy and encouragement for repentance.
orig: وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم كتب ربكم على نفسه الرحمة أنه من عمل منكم سوءا بجهالة ثم تاب من بعده وأصلح فأنه غفور رحيم

translation: And thus do We explain the verses in detail so that the way of the criminals will become evident.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah explains the verses of the Qur'an in detail and with clarity, so that the path of those who commit sins and disobey Allah becomes evident and distinguishable from the path of righteousness. It serves as a warning and guidance, separating truth from falsehood and the way of the believers from the way of the disbelievers and sinners.
orig: وكذلك نفصل الآيات ولتستبين سبيل المجرمين

translation: Say: 'I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah.' Say: 'I will not follow your vain desires, for then I would go astray and would not be among the rightly guided.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare that he has been prohibited from worshipping anything or anyone other than Allah alone. It emphasizes the importance of rejecting polytheism and idol worship. Additionally, it instructs him not to follow the misguided desires of those who associate partners with Allah, as doing so would lead him astray from the straight path and the guidance of Allah.
orig: قل إني نهيت أن أعبد الذين تدعون من دون الله قل لا أتبع أهواءكم قد ضللت إذا وما أنا من المهتدين

translation: Say, "I am on clear evidence from my Lord, and you have denied it. I do not have what you are impatient for. The decision is only for Allah. He relates the truth, and He is the best of judges."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare that he has clear proof and guidance from Allah, while the disbelievers have rejected it. He does not possess the punishment they are demanding to be brought upon them hastily. The decision and judgment belong solely to Allah, Who reveals the truth and is the fairest of judges.
orig: قل إني على بينة من ربي وكذبتم به ما عندي ما تستعجلون به إن الحكم إلا لله يقص الحق وهو خير الفاصلين

translation: Say, 'If I had what you are impatient for, the matter would have been decided between me and you, but Allah is most knowing of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that if the Prophet had the power to bring about the punishment that the disbelievers were demanding, he would have settled the matter between them. However, Allah knows best who the wrongdoers are, and He will deal with them accordingly in His own time and wisdom.
orig: قل لو أن عندي ما تستعجلون به لقضي الأمر بيني وبينكم والله أعلم بالظالمين

translation: And with Him are the keys of the unseen, none knows them except Him. And He knows what is on the land and in the sea. Not a leaf falls but that He knows it. There is not a grain in the darkness of the earth nor anything fresh or dry but that it is written in a clear record.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge of all things, seen and unseen. He alone possesses the keys to the unseen realm, which no one else can access or comprehend. His knowledge encompasses everything that exists on land and in the sea, even the most minute details like a falling leaf or a grain buried in the earth. Nothing, whether fresh or dry, escapes His knowledge, as it is all recorded in a clear and manifest record. This emphasizes Allah's omniscience and that His knowledge is all-encompassing, leaving nothing outside of its scope.
orig: وعنده مفاتح الغيب لا يعلمها إلا هو ويعلم ما في البر والبحر وما تسقط من ورقة إلا يعلمها ولا حبة في ظلمات الأرض ولا رطب ولا يابس إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: And it is He who takes your souls by night and knows what you have committed by day. Then He revives you therein that a specified term may be completed. Then to Him will be your return; then He will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: Allâh subhânahu wa ta'âlâ is the One who causes you to sleep at night, taking back your souls temporarily. He knows everything you do during the day. Then in the morning, He returns your souls to you so that you may live out your appointed term. Ultimately, you will all return to Allâh on the Day of Resurrection, and He will inform you of all your deeds, good and evil, that you committed in this life.
orig: وهو الذي يتوفاكم بالليل ويعلم ما جرحتم بالنهار ثم يبعثكم فيه ليقضى أجل مسمى ثم إليه مرجعكم ثم ينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And He is the subjugator over His servants, and He sends over you guardian-angels until, when death comes to one of you, Our messengers cause him to die, and they do not fail in their duties.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over His creation. He is "Al-Qaahir" (The Subjugator) who has complete control and dominion over all beings. Allah also appoints angels to guard and protect humans throughout their lives. When death approaches, these angels ensure that each soul departs from this world according to Allah's decree, without any error or negligence on their part.
