orig: وهو القاهر فوق عباده ويرسل عليكم حفظة حتى إذا جاء أحدكم الموت توفته رسلنا وهم لا يفرطون

translation: Then they will be returned to Allah, their true Lord. Unquestionably, His is the judgment, and He is the swiftest of accountants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that ultimately, all human beings will return to Allah on the Day of Judgment, who is their true Master and the sole authority to pass judgment. It highlights Allah's perfect justice and swift reckoning, as He is "the swiftest of accountants," leaving no deed unaccounted for.
orig: ثم ردوا إلى الله مولاهم الحق ألا له الحكم وهو أسرع الحاسبين

translation: Say, "Who is it that delivers you from the darknesses of the land and sea [when] you call upon Him imploring aloud and privately, 'If He should deliver us from this [crisis], we will surely be among the thankful.'"
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and mercy in delivering people from difficulties and hardships on land and at sea. It encourages people to call upon Allah sincerely and humbly, whether openly or secretly, seeking His aid during times of distress. The verse implies that if Allah rescues them from their afflictions, they should be truly grateful and thankful to Him, fulfilling their promise of gratitude.
orig: قل من ينجيكم من ظلمات البر والبحر تدعونه تضرعا وخفية لئن أنجانا من هذه لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: Say, 'Allah will deliver you from it and from every distress, yet you associate others with Him.'
interpretation: This verse is a reminder that Allah is the only true Savior and Protector, capable of delivering us from all kinds of difficulties and distress. However, despite this, people still associate partners with Allah in worship, which is a form of ingratitude and rejection of His favors. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of having faith solely in Allah and avoiding the sin of associating partners with Him (shirk).
orig: قل الله ينجيكم منها ومن كل كرب ثم أنتم تشركون

translation: Say, "He is the One who has power to send punishment upon you from above you or from beneath your feet, or to confuse you in factions and make you taste the violence of one another." See how We diversify the signs so that they may understand.
interpretation: Allah est capable d'infliger des châtiments aux incroyants de diverses manières : soit en envoyant une punition du ciel comme les pluies torrentielles, la grêle ou les vents violents, soit en faisant trembler la terre sous leurs pieds, soit en semant la discorde et les conflits entre eux. Dieu montre ainsi Ses signes et preuves de différentes façons afin que les gens puissent les comprendre et se guider vers la vérité.
orig: قل هو القادر على أن يبعث عليكم عذابا من فوقكم أو من تحت أرجلكم أو يلبسكم شيعا ويذيق بعضكم بأس بعض انظر كيف نصرف الآيات لعلهم يفقهون

translation: And your people have denied it while it is the truth. Say, 'I am not a guardian over you.'
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and instructing him not to feel responsible for the disbelief of his people, who denied the truth of the Qur'an. The interpretation is that the Prophet's role was to convey the message, but he was not accountable for whether people accepted or rejected it. His duty was to deliver the message faithfully, and the decision to believe or not was up to each individual.
orig: وكذب به قومك وهو الحق قل لست عليكم بوكيل

translation: For every information there is a destination, and you will come to know.
interpretation: This verse indicates that every piece of information or event has a destined time and place of occurrence. It suggests that the truth about matters will eventually become clear and manifest itself, and people will come to understand the reality of situations they were previously unaware of or uncertain about.
orig: لكل نبإ مستقر وسوف تعلمون

translation: And when you see those who engage in offensive discourse concerning Our verses, then turn away from them until they enter into another conversation. And if Satan causes you to forget, then do not remain after the reminder with the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to avoid engaging with those who mock or insult the verses of the Qur'an. Instead of arguing or retaliating, they are advised to walk away and disengage from such conversations until the subject changes. However, if they forget and find themselves in the company of those who persist in wrongdoing after being reminded, they should remove themselves from that situation. The verse emphasizes the importance of maintaining dignity, avoiding futile arguments, and distancing oneself from those who deliberately disrespect the divine revelations.
orig: وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم حتى يخوضوا في حديث غيره وإما ينسينك الشيطان فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين

translation: And those who are mindful of their Lord will not be called to account for anything, but only as a reminder so that they may be mindful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the pious and God-fearing people will not be held accountable or questioned for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. Their record will not be scrutinized in detail. The reminder here refers to the Qur'an or the teachings of Islam, which serve as a reminder to them to remain conscious of Allah and continue on the path of righteousness.
orig: وما على الذين يتقون من حسابهم من شيء ولكن ذكرى لعلهم يتقون

translation: And leave alone those who take their religion as mere play and amusement, and are deceived by the life of this world. But remind with it lest a soul be given up to destruction for what it earned; it will have no protector or intercessor besides Allah, and if it offered every ransom, it would not be accepted from it. Those are the ones who are given up to destruction for what they earned. For them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to avoid and leave alone those who mock religion and are deceived by the temporary pleasures of this worldly life. Instead, the believers should remind others with the Qur'an, so that no soul is destroyed for its evil deeds. On the Day of Judgment, no ransom or intercession will be accepted for those who disbelieved. They will be punished with a drink of boiling water and a painful torment for rejecting faith.
orig: وذر الذين اتخذوا دينهم لعبا ولهوا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وذكر به أن تبسل نفس بما كسبت ليس لها من دون الله ولي ولا شفيع وإن تعدل كل عدل لا يؤخذ منها أولئك الذين أبسلوا بما كسبوا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: Say, "Shall we invoke instead of Allah that which neither benefits us nor harms us and be sent back, after Allah has guided us, like one whom the devils enticed [to wander] upon the earth confused, [while] he has companions inviting him to guidance, [calling], 'Come to us'?" Say, "Indeed, the guidance of Allah is the [only] guidance; and we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of invoking or worshipping anything other than Allah, as such objects or beings can neither benefit nor harm us. It likens those who do so to someone who is confused and led astray by devils, while having companions calling them to guidance. The verse emphasizes that true guidance comes only from Allah, and that we have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds, rejecting all false deities or objects of worship.
orig: قل أندعو من دون الله ما لا ينفعنا ولا يضرنا ونرد على أعقابنا بعد إذ هدانا الله كالذي استهوته الشياطين في الأرض حيران له أصحاب يدعونه إلى الهدى ائتنا قل إن هدى الله هو الهدى وأمرنا لنسلم لرب العالمين

translation: And to establish prayer and fear Him. And it is He to whom you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of establishing regular prayer as an obligation upon Muslims, as well as having fear and consciousness of Allah. It reminds us that we will ultimately be gathered before Allah on the Day of Judgment to account for our deeds in this life. The interpretation highlights the significance of maintaining a connection with Allah through prayer and righteous conduct, as we will all return to Him.
orig: وأن أقيموا الصلاة واتقوه وهو الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: And it is He who created the heavens and the earth in truth. And the day He says, "Be," and it is, His word is the truth. And His is the dominion on the Day the Horn is blown. [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute power and authority as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It highlights that He created the heavens and the earth with purpose and truth, not in vain. When He wills something, He merely says "Be" and it comes into existence, for His word is the truth and nothing can oppose it. On the Day of Resurrection, when the Horn is blown, all dominion and sovereignty will belong to Him alone. He has complete knowledge of the unseen and the witnessed realms, and He is the Wise, the All-Aware of everything.
orig: وهو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق ويوم يقول كن فيكون قوله الحق وله الملك يوم ينفخ في الصور عالم الغيب والشهادة وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father Azar, 'Do you take idols as deities? Indeed, I see you and your people in manifest error.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the firm stance of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) against idolatry and his efforts to guide his father and people towards the true worship of the One God. Despite their deep-rooted beliefs in idol worship, Ibrahim courageously challenged his father, Azar, and his community, emphasizing that they were clearly misguided in associating partners with Allah. This verse underscores the importance of recognizing the truth and rejecting falsehood, even when it means confronting one's closest relations.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه آزر أتتخذ أصناما آلهة إني أراك وقومك في ضلال مبين

translation: And thus did We show Abraham the realm of the heavens and the earth that he would be among the certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse refers to how Allah showed Prophet Abraham the signs and wonders of the heavens and the earth, allowing him to witness the greatness of Allah's creation. This experience strengthened Abraham's faith and certainty in the Oneness of God, making him among those who firmly believed without any doubt.
orig: وكذلك نري إبراهيم ملكوت السماوات والأرض وليكون من الموقنين

translation: So when the night covered him over, he saw a star. He said, 'This is my lord.' But when it set, he said, 'I do not like those that set.'
interpretation: The verse describes Prophet Abraham's search for the true Lord and his rejection of worshipping celestial objects like stars, which rise and set. It teaches that the true Lord is eternal and does not undergo changes like rising or setting. The verse highlights Abraham's intellectual journey and his reasoning in rejecting the worship of transient celestial bodies.
orig: فلما جن عليه الليل رأى كوكبا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لا أحب الآفلين

translation: So when he saw the moon rising, he said, 'This is my Lord.' But when it set, he said, 'Unless my Lord guides me, I will surely be among the people gone astray.'
interpretation: This verse describes Prophet Abraham's search for the truth about God. When he saw the moon rising, he initially thought it was his Lord, but then realized it would set and could not be the true Lord. This shows his intellectual journey in rejecting the worship of celestial bodies and recognizing the need for divine guidance to find the true God.
orig: فلما رأى القمر بازغا قال هذا ربي فلما أفل قال لئن لم يهدني ربي لأكونن من القوم الضالين

translation: So when he saw the sun rising, he said, 'This is my Lord, this is greater.' But when it set, he said, 'O my people, indeed I am free from what you associate with Allah.'
interpretation: This verse describes Prophet Ibrahim's journey to recognize the true Lord. When he saw the rising sun, he initially thought it was his Lord due to its grandeur. However, upon seeing it set, he realized that it could not be the true, eternal Lord he was seeking. This led him to reject the idolatrous beliefs of his people and affirm his belief in the One True God.
orig: فلما رأى الشمس بازغة قال هذا ربي هذا أكبر فلما أفلت قال يا قوم إني بريء مما تشركون

translation: Verily, I have set my face towards Him Who created the heavens and the earth, inclining towards truth, and I am not of those who associate partners with Allah.
interpretation: This verse expresses the Prophet Muhammad's firm belief in the Oneness of God and his rejection of polytheism. By "setting his face" towards the Creator, he declares his unwavering devotion and submission to the One True God, Who created the heavens and the earth. The term "hanifa" means inclining towards the truth and avoiding falsehood, indicating his commitment to the pure monotheistic faith. His statement "I am not of those who associate partners with Allah" is a clear renunciation of shirk, the association of any partners or equals with God, which is considered the gravest sin in Islam.
orig: إني وجهت وجهي للذي فطر السماوات والأرض حنيفا وما أنا من المشركين

translation: And his people argued with him. He said, 'Do you argue with me concerning Allah while He has guided me? And I do not fear what you associate with Him unless my Lord should will something. My Lord has encompassed all things in knowledge. Then will you not remember?'
interpretation: Nuh's interpretation is that he is guided by Allah and has no fear of what his people associate as partners with Allah, unless Allah wills something to happen. Allah encompasses all things with His knowledge, so his people should reflect and be mindful of this.
orig: وحاجه قومه قال أتحاجوني في الله وقد هدان ولا أخاف ما تشركون به إلا أن يشاء ربي شيئا وسع ربي كل شيء علما أفلا تتذكرون

translation: And how should I fear what you have associated [with Allah] while you do not fear that you have associated with Allah that for which He has sent down to you no authority? So which of the two parties has more right to security, if you should know?
interpretation: In this verse, Allah is questioning the polytheists' mindset of fearing the idols they associate with Him, while they do not fear associating partners with Allah without any authority or proof. Allah is asking which party deserves to feel secure - the believers who worship Allah alone or the polytheists who associate partners with Him without any justification. This verse emphasizes the falsehood of polytheism and the importance of worshipping Allah alone based on evidence and authority revealed by Him.
orig: وكيف أخاف ما أشركتم ولا تخافون أنكم أشركتم بالله ما لم ينزل به عليكم سلطانا فأي الفريقين أحق بالأمن إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: Those who believe and do not mix their belief with wrongdoing - for them there is security, and they are [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse promises security and guidance to those who have sincere faith and do not corrupt their beliefs with injustice, oppression or associating partners with Allah. Their faith is pure, and as a result, they enjoy peace of mind and are guided to the straight path.
orig: الذين آمنوا ولم يلبسوا إيمانهم بظلم أولئك لهم الأمن وهم مهتدون

translation: And that was Our argument which We gave to Abraham against his people. We raise in degrees whom We will. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the wisdom and knowledge of Allah in raising some people in ranks and degrees. The "argument" mentioned is the proofs and evidences that Allah gave to Prophet Abraham to refute the false beliefs of his people. Allah has the power to elevate whom He wills in status and knowledge, as He is the All-Wise and All-Knowing. This highlights Allah's absolute authority and perfect wisdom in His decisions and decrees.
orig: وتلك حجتنا آتيناها إبراهيم على قومه نرفع درجات من نشاء إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, each of them We guided, and Noah We had guided before, and from his descendants, David and Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses and Aaron - thus do We reward the virtuous.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's favor upon the Prophets and their descendants. It mentions that Allah bestowed upon Prophet Abraham the gift of righteous sons, Isaac and Jacob, and guided them to the straight path. Similarly, Allah had guided Prophet Noah before them. From the descendants of Prophet Abraham, Allah raised other Prophets like David, Solomon, Job, Joseph, Moses, and Aaron. This emphasizes that Allah rewards those who do good deeds and remain steadfast on the path of righteousness by granting them guidance and blessings in their progeny.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب كلا هدينا ونوحا هدينا من قبل ومن ذريته داوود وسليمان وأيوب ويوسف وموسى وهارون وكذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: And Zakariya and Yahya and Isa and Ilyas - each were of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the righteousness of several prophets mentioned in the Quran - Zakariya (Zechariah), Yahya (John the Baptist), Isa (Jesus), and Ilyas (Elijah). It affirms that they were all from among the pious and upright individuals who dedicated their lives to the worship of Allah and the guidance of humanity. Their inclusion in this verse signifies their exalted status as role models of virtue and faith.
orig: وزكريا ويحيى وعيسى وإلياس كل من الصالحين

translation: And (mention) Ismail, Al-Yasa, Yunus and Lut - and all of them We favoured over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights that God favoured and granted virtue to certain Prophets like Ismail (Ishmael), Al-Yasa (Elisha), Yunus (Jonah), and Lut (Lot) over the rest of mankind. It emphasizes their elevated status as chosen messengers of God who were bestowed with special honors and blessings.
orig: وإسماعيل واليسع ويونس ولوطا وكلا فضلنا على العالمين

translation: And from among their fathers and their descendants and their brethren, We chose them and guided them to a Straight Path.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's favor upon the Prophets and their followers by selecting them from their forefathers, offspring, and brethren, and guiding them to the straight path of truth and righteousness. It highlights Allah's mercy in choosing certain individuals and nations to receive His guidance and blessings.
orig: ومن آبائهم وذرياتهم وإخوانهم واجتبيناهم وهديناهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whomever He wills of His servants. But if they had associated others with Allah, then surely their deeds would have become worthless.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the guidance mentioned in the previous verses is from Allah alone. He guides whomever He wills from among His servants to the straight path. However, if they had associated partners with Allah in worship, all their good deeds would have been rendered void and fruitless, as shirk (associating others with Allah) nullifies all good deeds.
orig: ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء من عباده ولو أشركوا لحبط عنهم ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Those are the ones to whom We gave the Book and authority and prophethood. But if the disbelievers deny it, then We have entrusted it to a people who are not disbelievers therein.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people who were given divine scriptures, authority, and prophethood by Allah, but if they reject it, Allah will entrust it to others who will not disbelieve in it. This indicates that the message of Allah is not limited to any particular group, and if one nation rejects it, another will be chosen to carry it forward. It emphasizes the universal nature of Allah's guidance and His wisdom in selecting the bearers of His message.
orig: أولئك الذين آتيناهم الكتاب والحكم والنبوة فإن يكفر بها هؤلاء فقد وكلنا بها قوما ليسوا بها بكافرين

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has guided, so follow their guidance. Say: 'I do not ask you any reward for it; it is just a reminder for the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true guidance comes from Allah, and those who have been rightly guided by Him should be followed. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is instructed to convey this message without seeking any worldly reward, as his role is simply to remind and guide humanity towards the truth.
orig: أولئك الذين هدى الله فبهداهم اقتده قل لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إن هو إلا ذكرى للعالمين

translation: And they did not appraise Allah with true appraisal when they said, 'Allah did not reveal to a human being anything.' Say, 'Who revealed the Book that Moses brought as a light and guidance to the people? You make it into scattered parchments, revealing [some of] it and concealing much. And you were taught that which you knew not - neither you nor your fathers.' Say, 'Allah [revealed it].' Then leave them in their [empty] discourse, amusing themselves.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who denied the revelation to Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, by downplaying the ability of God to reveal His message to a human being. It reminds them of the revelation given to Prophet Moses, which was a source of light and guidance. Yet they treat it selectively, revealing parts and concealing others, and were taught knowledge they did not previously possess. It commands the Prophet to affirm that it is God who revealed these scriptures, and to leave those who deny in their idle talk and amusement.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره إذ قالوا ما أنزل الله على بشر من شيء قل من أنزل الكتاب الذي جاء به موسى نورا وهدى للناس تجعلونه قراطيس تبدونها وتخفون كثيرا وعلمتم ما لم تعلموا أنتم ولا آباؤكم قل الله ثم ذرهم في خوضهم يلعبون

translation: This is a blessed Book which We have revealed, confirming what came before it, so that you may warn the Mother of Cities and all those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are constant in guarding their prayers.
interpretation: The Qur'an is describing itself as a blessed book revealed by Allah to confirm the previous scriptures. Its purpose is to warn the people of Makkah (the "Mother of Cities") and surrounding areas about the consequences of disbelief. Those who truly believe in the Hereafter and the accountability on the Day of Judgment will have faith in this Qur'an and will be diligent in performing their prayers.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك مصدق الذي بين يديه ولتنذر أم القرى ومن حولها والذين يؤمنون بالآخرة يؤمنون به وهم على صلاتهم يحافظون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah or says, 'It has been inspired to me,' while nothing has been inspired to him, and one who says, 'I will reveal [something] like what Allah revealed.' And if you could but see when the wrongdoers are in the overwhelming pangs of death while the angels are stretching out their hands, [saying], 'Discharge your souls! Today you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation for what you used to say against Allah other than the truth and [that] you were being arrogant toward His verses.'
interpretation: This verse condemns those who attribute falsehoods to Allah by claiming to receive revelation when they have not, or by claiming to produce something similar to the Qur'an. It warns of the severe punishment awaiting such individuals on the Day of Judgment, when they will be in the throes of death and the angels will extract their souls, subjecting them to a humiliating punishment for their lies against Allah and their arrogance towards His revelations.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو قال أوحي إلي ولم يوح إليه شيء ومن قال سأنزل مثل ما أنزل الله ولو ترى إذ الظالمون في غمرات الموت والملائكة باسطو أيديهم أخرجوا أنفسكم اليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تقولون على الله غير الحق وكنتم عن آياته تستكبرون

translation: And you have certainly come to Us alone as We created you the first time, and you have left whatever We bestowed upon you behind your backs. And We do not see with you your 'intercessors' which you claimed were partners [to Allah] in you. Certainly has [all] relation been severed between you, and lost from you is whatever you used to claim.
interpretation: هذه الآية تصف حالة الناس يوم القيامة، حيث يأتون إلى الله وحدهم كما خلقهم في البداية، تاركين وراءهم كل ما أنعم الله عليهم به في الدنيا من نعم ومتاع. ولا يجدون معهم الشفعاء الذين زعموا أنهم شركاء لله في عبادتهم، فقد انقطعت العلاقة بينهم وبين هؤلاء الشركاء المزعومين، وضاع عنهم كل ما كانوا يدعونه من الباطل.
orig: ولقد جئتمونا فرادى كما خلقناكم أول مرة وتركتم ما خولناكم وراء ظهوركم وما نرى معكم شفعاءكم الذين زعمتم أنهم فيكم شركاء لقد تقطع بينكم وضل عنكم ما كنتم تزعمون

translation: Indeed, Allah is the cleaver of grain and date seeds. He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living. That is Allah; so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power as the Creator and Sustainer of all life. The analogy of bringing forth life from lifeless seeds and vice versa signifies Allah's ability to revive the dead on the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a reminder of His absolute control over life and death, and a refutation of those who deny the possibility of resurrection after death.
orig: إن الله فالق الحب والنوى يخرج الحي من الميت ومخرج الميت من الحي ذلكم الله فأنى تؤفكون

translation: He is the One Who splits the dawn, and has made the night for rest, and the sun and the moon for calculation. That is the determination of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating the natural phenomena that regulate life on Earth. The "splitting of the dawn" refers to the gradual emergence of daylight, signifying the beginning of a new day and a renewal of activity. The night is described as a time of "rest," providing a period of tranquility and rejuvenation. The sun and moon serve as tools for "calculation," enabling the measurement of time and the establishment of calendars. These intricate and precise arrangements are attributed to Allah, the "Almighty" and "All-Knowing," emphasizing His supreme authority and infinite knowledge.
orig: فالق الإصباح وجعل الليل سكنا والشمس والقمر حسبانا ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: And it is He who has made the stars for you, that you may be guided by them in the darkness of the land and sea. We have detailed the signs for people who know.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's wisdom and mercy in creating the stars as a guidance for people on land and sea during the darkness of night. The stars serve as a natural navigation system, allowing travelers to find their way. Allah has clearly explained these signs of His creation for those who possess knowledge and reflect upon them.
orig: وهو الذي جعل لكم النجوم لتهتدوا بها في ظلمات البر والبحر قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: And it is He who created you from a single soul and made from it its mate that he might dwell in tranquility with her; and when he covered her, she carried a light burden and continued to bear it. But when she grew heavy, they both invoked Allah, their Lord, 'If You give us a righteous child, we will surely be among the thankful.'
interpretation: This verse speaks about the process of human creation and procreation. It highlights that Allah created all humans from a single soul, which refers to Adam. From Adam, Allah created his mate, Eve, so that they could find tranquility and companionship in each other. The verse then describes the stages of pregnancy, from the initial light burden to the heaviness felt in the later stages. It emphasizes that during this time, the parents turn to Allah in prayer, seeking a righteous child and expressing their gratitude if their prayer is answered.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأكم من نفس واحدة فمستقر ومستودع قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يفقهون

translation: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby the growth of all things. We extract from it greenery from which We produce grains arranged in layers. And from the palm trees - of its emerging fruit are clusters hanging low. And gardens of grapevines and olives and pomegranates, similar yet dissimilar. Look at [each of] its fruit when it yields and [at] its ripening. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: Cette versets décrit la puissance et la miséricorde d'Allah en faisant descendre la pluie du ciel, permettant ainsi la croissance de toutes les plantes et les cultures. Il souligne la diversité et la beauté de la création d'Allah, des grains disposés en couches aux grappes de fruits suspendues des palmiers, aux jardins de vignes, d'oliviers et de grenadiers. Bien que similaires, ces fruits sont uniques et distincts les uns des autres. Cela constitue un signe évident de l'existence et de la puissance d'Allah pour ceux qui croient et réfléchissent.
orig: وهو الذي أنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به نبات كل شيء فأخرجنا منه خضرا نخرج منه حبا متراكبا ومن النخل من طلعها قنوان دانية وجنات من أعناب والزيتون والرمان مشتبها وغير متشابه انظروا إلى ثمره إذا أثمر وينعه إن في ذلكم لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And they have attributed to Allah partners - the jinn, while He has created them, and they falsely attribute to Him sons and daughters without knowledge. Exalted is He and high above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse condemns the polytheistic belief of attributing partners to Allah, such as the jinn or claiming that He has sons and daughters. It emphasizes that Allah is far exalted above such false descriptions and associations, as He is the sole Creator of all beings, including the jinn. Attributing partners or offspring to Allah is a grave sin done out of ignorance and lack of knowledge about His Oneness and Transcendence.
orig: وجعلوا لله شركاء الجن وخلقهم وخرقوا له بنين وبنات بغير علم سبحانه وتعالى عما يصفون

translation: The Originator of the heavens and the earth - how could He have a son when He has no wife? He created all things, and He is the Knower of all things.
interpretation: This verse denies the notion that God has a son or offspring, as He is the Creator of all things and does not have a spouse or partner. It affirms God's Oneness and His transcendence above any human attributes or relationships. The verse emphasizes that God is the sole Creator and Sustainer of the entire universe, and He has perfect knowledge of all His creation.
orig: بديع السماوات والأرض أنى يكون له ولد ولم تكن له صاحبة وخلق كل شيء وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: That is Allah, your Lord; there is no deity except Him, the Creator of all things, so worship Him. And He is Disposer of all things.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His sole right to be worshipped. It emphasizes that Allah is the Creator of all things, and therefore, He alone deserves to be worshipped and obeyed. The verse also highlights Allah's attribute of being the "Wakil" or Disposer of all affairs, meaning that He is in complete control and authority over all matters.
orig: ذلكم الله ربكم لا إله إلا هو خالق كل شيء فاعبدوه وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: No vision can grasp Him, but His grasp is over all vision. And He is the Most Subtle and Courteous, All-Aware.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the transcendence and incomprehensibility of Allah to human faculties. It states that no physical eye can perceive or encompass Allah's essence, as He is beyond the limitations of human senses and comprehension. However, Allah encompasses and comprehends all vision and perception. The verse also attributes to Allah the qualities of being "Al-Lateef" (The Most Subtle and Courteous) and "Al-Khabeer" (The All-Aware). These attributes highlight Allah's infinite knowledge, wisdom, and subtle dealings with His creation.
orig: لا تدركه الأبصار وهو يدرك الأبصار وهو اللطيف الخبير

translation: There has come to you enlightenment from your Lord. So whoever will see, it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever is blind, it is to its detriment. And I am not a keeper over you.
interpretation: Allah says that clear proofs and guidance have come to humanity from Him. Those who choose to be guided by this enlightenment will benefit themselves, and those who choose to remain blind and reject it will only harm themselves. The Messenger's role is only to convey the message, not to force people to accept it. The choice is theirs, and the consequences lie solely upon them.
orig: قد جاءكم بصائر من ربكم فمن أبصر فلنفسه ومن عمي فعليها وما أنا عليكم بحفيظ

translation: And thus do We explain the verses so that they will say, 'You have studied,' and that We may make it clear for a people who know.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah explains the verses of the Qur'an in different ways and with various examples so that people can understand them clearly. The disbelievers may accuse the Prophet of studying with others to gain knowledge, but Allah clarifies that He is the One who makes the verses clear for those who have knowledge and seek guidance.
orig: وكذلك نصرف الآيات وليقولوا درست ولنبينه لقوم يعلمون

translation: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord - there is no deity except Him - and turn away from those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to follow the divine revelation sent to him by Allah, acknowledging that there is no god worthy of worship except Allah alone. It also commands him to disregard and turn away from those who associate partners with Allah in worship.
orig: اتبع ما أوحي إليك من ربك لا إله إلا هو وأعرض عن المشركين

translation: And if Allah had willed, they would not have associated. And We have not appointed you over them as a guardian, nor are you a wakil over them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and that He alone has the power to guide people to the truth or let them go astray. It states that if Allah had willed, the idolaters would not have associated partners with Him. However, He has given humans free will to choose their path. The Prophet Muhammad is told that he is not a guardian or custodian over them, nor a "wakil" which means a disposer of their affairs or one who has power over them. His role is to convey the message, but their guidance is ultimately up to Allah.
orig: ولو شاء الله ما أشركوا وما جعلناك عليهم حفيظا وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: And do not insult those they invoke other than Allah, lest they insult Allah in enmity without knowledge. Thus We have made pleasing to every community their deeds. Then to their Lord is their return, and He will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse teaches Muslims to avoid insulting the deities or objects of worship of other religions, as that may provoke them to insult Allah in retaliation out of ignorance. Each community has been made to find their own religious practices pleasing, but ultimately all will return to Allah, who will inform them of the reality of their deeds.
orig: ولا تسبوا الذين يدعون من دون الله فيسبوا الله عدوا بغير علم كذلك زينا لكل أمة عملهم ثم إلى ربهم مرجعهم فينبئهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they swore by Allah with their strongest oaths that if a sign came to them, they would surely believe in it. Say, 'The signs are only with Allah, and what will make you perceive that even if it should come, they would not believe?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers. They claimed that if a miracle or sign was shown to them, they would believe. However, Allah knows that even if a sign came to them, they would still reject it due to their arrogance and closed-mindedness. The verse emphasizes that true guidance comes from Allah, and no amount of signs or miracles can guide those who are unwilling to open their hearts and minds to the truth.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن جاءتهم آية ليؤمنن بها قل إنما الآيات عند الله وما يشعركم أنها إذا جاءت لا يؤمنون

translation: And We will turn their hearts and vision upside down as they did not believe in it the first time, and We will leave them wandering blindly in their rebellion.
interpretation: Allah threatens those who rejected faith that He will turn their hearts and vision away from guidance, just as they turned away from believing when it was presented to them initially. They will be left to wander aimlessly in their transgression and misguidance, unable to find the right path.
orig: ونقلب أفئدتهم وأبصارهم كما لم يؤمنوا به أول مرة ونذرهم في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And even if We had sent down to them the angels, and the dead had spoken to them, and We had gathered together all things before them, they still would not have believed unless Allah willed. But most of them are ignorant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that mere miracles and signs are not enough to make someone believe. Even if angels descended, the dead spoke, and all proofs were presented before them, they would still not believe unless Allah willed them to believe and guided them. Their disbelief stems from their own ignorance and stubbornness, not a lack of evidence or proof.
orig: ولو أننا نزلنا إليهم الملائكة وكلمهم الموتى وحشرنا عليهم كل شيء قبلا ما كانوا ليؤمنوا إلا أن يشاء الله ولكن أكثرهم يجهلون

translation: And thus We have made for every prophet an enemy - the devils from mankind and jinn, inspiring to one another decorative speech in delusion. But if your Lord had willed, they would not have done it, so leave them and what they invent.
interpretation: Allah says that He has ordained for every prophet to face opposition and enmity from evil humans and jinn who whisper deceptive words to one another to lead people astray. However, if Allah had willed, they would not have been able to do this. But He allows it as a test for people. Therefore, the Prophet is commanded to ignore them and their fabrications against him.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا لكل نبي عدوا شياطين الإنس والجن يوحي بعضهم إلى بعض زخرف القول غرورا ولو شاء ربك ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And let those who do not believe in the Hereafter listen to it, and let them be pleased with it, and let them commit whatever deeds they are committing.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers should listen to the Qur'an, even though they do not believe in the Hereafter or the accountability on the Day of Judgment. They are being given a chance to accept the truth, but if they reject it, they will be held accountable for their misdeeds and wrongful actions.
orig: ولتصغى إليه أفئدة الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وليرضوه وليقترفوا ما هم مقترفون

translation: Is it other than Allah I should seek as judge when it is He who has revealed to you the Book explained in detail? Those to whom We gave the Scripture know that it is sent down from your Lord in truth, so never be among the doubters.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah alone is the true Judge and Legislator, and that His revelation in the Qur'an is the ultimate source of guidance and truth. It affirms that those who have been given knowledge of previous Scriptures recognize the Qur'an as the truth from their Lord. Therefore, one should not doubt or hesitate in accepting and submitting to Allah's commandments.
orig: أفغير الله أبتغي حكما وهو الذي أنزل إليكم الكتاب مفصلا والذين آتيناهم الكتاب يعلمون أنه منزل من ربك بالحق فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And the Word of your Lord has been fulfilled in truth and justice. None can change His Words. And He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the immutability of Allah's Words and Decrees. It affirms that Allah's Promise and Threat will inevitably come to pass without any alteration or change. His Words are true, just, and infallible, as He is the All-Hearing, who hears all that is said, and the All-Knowing, who knows everything in the most perfect manner.
orig: وتمت كلمت ربك صدقا وعدلا لا مبدل لكلماته وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if you obey most of those on earth, they will mislead you from the way of Allah. They follow not except assumption, and they are not but falsifying.
interpretation: This verse warns against blindly following the majority or the prevalent views and customs of people, as they are often based on mere assumptions, conjectures, and falsehoods rather than the truth revealed by Allah. It emphasizes the importance of seeking guidance from Allah alone and not being misled by the whims and desires of the masses, who mainly follow their own assumptions and make up lies and false claims.
orig: وإن تطع أكثر من في الأرض يضلوك عن سبيل الله إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of those who are guided.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah alone has perfect knowledge of those who deviate from the right path and those who are rightly guided. It emphasizes Allah's absolute and encompassing knowledge, reminding us that He is fully aware of the spiritual condition and choices of every individual. The interpretation highlights Allah's supreme wisdom and authority in judging who is misguided and who is following the true path.
orig: إن ربك هو أعلم من يضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: So eat of that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, if you are believers in His signs.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to eat from the lawful and permissible foods, upon which His name has been invoked during slaughter. This verse emphasizes the importance of acknowledging Allah's blessings and following His commands, as a sign of true faith and belief in His revelations and signs.
orig: فكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه إن كنتم بآياته مؤمنين

translation: And what is [the matter] with you that you do not eat from that upon which the name of Allah has been mentioned, while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled? And indeed do many lead [others] astray by their [own] inclinations without knowledge. Indeed, your Lord - He is most knowing of the transgressors.
interpretation: الله تعالى يعاتب المؤمنين لتركهم أكل ما ذُكر اسم الله عليه من الطعام الحلال، مع أنه قد بين لهم بالتفصيل ما حرم عليهم إلا ما اضطروا إليه من المحرمات. وإن كثيرًا من الناس يضلون غيرهم بأهوائهم الباطلة من غير علم بالحق، فالله تعالى هو أعلم بالمعتدين على حدوده وشرعه.
orig: وما لكم ألا تأكلوا مما ذكر اسم الله عليه وقد فصل لكم ما حرم عليكم إلا ما اضطررتم إليه وإن كثيرا ليضلون بأهوائهم بغير علم إن ربك هو أعلم بالمعتدين

translation: And leave what is outward of sin and what is inward thereof. Surely those who earn sin will be recompensed for what they used to commit.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to avoid all forms of sin, whether apparent or hidden, as those who engage in sinful acts will be held accountable and receive due recompense for their misdeeds. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining purity and righteousness in both outward actions and inward intentions.
orig: وذروا ظاهر الإثم وباطنه إن الذين يكسبون الإثم سيجزون بما كانوا يقترفون

translation: And do not eat of that upon which the name of Allah has not been mentioned, for indeed, it is grave disobedience. And indeed do the shayatin (devils) inspire their allies to dispute with you. But if you were to obey them, indeed you would then be those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse prohibits eating food over which Allah's name has not been pronounced before slaughtering the animal. It warns that doing so is a grave sin and disobedience. The verse also mentions that the devils inspire their allies to argue with believers about this matter, tempting them to disobey this command. If believers obey the devils in this, they would be associating partners with Allah, which is a form of shirk or polytheism.
orig: ولا تأكلوا مما لم يذكر اسم الله عليه وإنه لفسق وإن الشياطين ليوحون إلى أوليائهم ليجادلوكم وإن أطعتموهم إنكم لمشركون

translation: Is one who was dead and We gave him life and made for him light by which to walk among the people like one who is in darkness, never to emerge therefrom? Thus is made pleasing to the disbelievers that which they used to do.
interpretation: This verse draws a metaphorical comparison between the believer who has been guided to faith and the disbeliever who remains in misguidance. The one who was "dead" spiritually and then given life through faith is likened to one who walks with light, while the disbeliever is like one trapped in darkness, unable to find the way out. The pleasing delusions of their misdeeds are made attractive to the disbelievers, just as the light guides the believer.
orig: أومن كان ميتا فأحييناه وجعلنا له نورا يمشي به في الناس كمن مثله في الظلمات ليس بخارج منها كذلك زين للكافرين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And thus We made in every city the great ones its criminals to conspire therein, but they conspire not except against themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
interpretation: Allah states that He has made the leaders and influential people in every society the ones who commit sins and crimes. They plot and scheme against the believers, thinking they are harming them, but in reality they are only harming themselves. However, they are unaware of the consequences of their evil actions.
orig: وكذلك جعلنا في كل قرية أكابر مجرميها ليمكروا فيها وما يمكرون إلا بأنفسهم وما يشعرون

translation: And when a verse comes to them, they say, 'We will not believe until we are given the like of what was given to the messengers of Allah.' Allah is most knowing of where to place His message. There will afflict those who committed crimes debasement before Allah and a severe punishment for what they used to conspire.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers. When presented with evidence from the Qur'an, they arrogantly demand miracles like those given to previous prophets, rejecting faith until their unreasonable demands are met. It warns that those who persist in such defiance and mockery will face humiliation and severe punishment from Allah for their evil plots against the truth.
orig: وإذا جاءتهم آية قالوا لن نؤمن حتى نؤتى مثل ما أوتي رسل الله الله أعلم حيث يجعل رسالته سيصيب الذين أجرموا صغار عند الله وعذاب شديد بما كانوا يمكرون

translation: So whoever Allah wants to guide, He opens his breast to Islam; and whoever He wants to leave astray - He makes his breast tight and constricted as though he were climbing into the sky. Thus does Allah place defilement upon those who do not believe.
interpretation: Allah guides whomever He wills by opening their hearts to Islam, making it easy for them to accept faith. But for those He wills to go astray, He makes their hearts tight and constricted, making it extremely difficult for them to accept guidance - as difficult as ascending to the sky. This is how Allah allows disbelief and wickedness to overcome those who reject faith.
orig: فمن يرد الله أن يهديه يشرح صدره للإسلام ومن يرد أن يضله يجعل صدره ضيقا حرجا كأنما يصعد في السماء كذلك يجعل الله الرجس على الذين لا يؤمنون

translation: And this is the path of your Lord, leading straight. We have certainly explained the verses for a people who will remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the path outlined in the Qur'an is the straight and true path prescribed by Allah. The verses have been explained in detail, leaving no ambiguity, so that those who reflect and ponder upon them may derive guidance and benefit from them. It is a call to follow the clear and unwavering path set forth by the Divine, and to be among those who remember and heed the profound truths revealed in the Qur'anic verses.
orig: وهذا صراط ربك مستقيما قد فصلنا الآيات لقوم يذكرون

translation: For them is the home of peace with their Lord, and He is their Protecting Friend because of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers a state of eternal peace and security in the Hereafter, referred to as "the home of peace" (dār al-salām). This is a reward from Allah for their righteous deeds and obedience to Him in this world. Allah will be their "Protecting Friend" (walī), meaning He will be their Guardian, Helper, and Supporter, because of their good actions and faith.
orig: لهم دار السلام عند ربهم وهو وليهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And the Day He will gather them all together [and say]: 'O company of jinn! You have misled many among mankind.' And their allies among mankind will say: 'Our Lord, we profited from one another, but we have reached our term which You appointed for us.' He will say: 'The Fire is your home; you will abide therein forever, except what Allah wills. Indeed, your Lord is Wise and Knowing.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when Allah will gather all humans and jinn together. He will address the jinn and rebuke them for misleading many humans. The misguided humans will acknowledge that they mutually misled each other, but they have now reached the appointed term. Allah will then decree that the Fire of Hell will be their eternal abode, except for those whom He wills to exempt by His wisdom and knowledge.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم جميعا يا معشر الجن قد استكثرتم من الإنس وقال أولياؤهم من الإنس ربنا استمتع بعضنا ببعض وبلغنا أجلنا الذي أجلت لنا قال النار مثواكم خالدين فيها إلا ما شاء الله إن ربك حكيم عليم

translation: And thus do We make the wrongdoers turn to one another because of what they used to earn.
interpretation: "Allah allows the oppressors to turn against and harm one another as a consequence of their own evil deeds and sins. Their misdeeds bring about enmity, conflict, and punishment upon themselves in this world, before facing the ultimate reckoning in the Hereafter."
orig: وكذلك نولي بعض الظالمين بعضا بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: O company of jinn and humans! Did messengers not come to you from among yourselves, reciting to you My verses and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours? They will say, 'We bear witness against ourselves,' and the life of this world deluded them, and they will testify against themselves that they were disbelievers.
interpretation: Allah addresses the jinn and humans on the Day of Judgment, questioning them if messengers did not come to them from among themselves, reciting the verses of Allah and warning them about the accountability on this Day. They will admit that messengers did come, bearing witness against themselves that they rejected the truth. The temporary delights of the worldly life deluded them, causing them to deny the truth and become disbelievers.
orig: يا معشر الجن والإنس ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يقصون عليكم آياتي وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا شهدنا على أنفسنا وغرتهم الحياة الدنيا وشهدوا على أنفسهم أنهم كانوا كافرين

translation: That is because your Lord would not destroy the towns unjustly, while their people were unaware.
interpretation: Allah does not punish or destroy nations and towns unjustly. Rather, He sends messengers and warners to guide them first. If they persist in disbelief and wrongdoing after being warned, then Allah's punishment befalls them justly for their transgression. Allah's wisdom and justice dictate that He does not destroy people while they are unaware or ignorant of the truth.
orig: ذلك أن لم يكن ربك مهلك القرى بظلم وأهلها غافلون

translation: And for all there will be degrees [i.e., ranks] according to what they did. And your Lord is not unaware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that in the Hereafter, people will be rewarded or punished according to their deeds in this world. Each person's rank and status will be determined by their actions, as Allah is fully aware of everything they do. It emphasizes the principle of divine justice and accountability.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وما ربك بغافل عما يعملون

translation: And your Lord is the Free of need, the Lord of mercy. If He wills, He can destroy you and replace you with whomever He wills, just as He produced you from the seed of another people.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power, self-sufficiency, and mercy. He is not in need of anyone or anything, yet He bestows His mercy upon His creation. If He wills, He can eliminate humanity and replace them with a new creation, just as He brought forth the present generation from the descendants of previous peoples. This serves as a reminder of Allah's authority and our utter dependence upon Him.
orig: وربك الغني ذو الرحمة إن يشأ يذهبكم ويستخلف من بعدكم ما يشاء كما أنشأكم من ذرية قوم آخرين

translation: Indeed, what you are promised is sure to come, and you cannot cause failure.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Resurrection and the fulfillment of Allah's promises. It asserts that the events foretold, such as the resurrection, judgment, and the ultimate consequences for one's deeds, will undoubtedly occur. No one has the power to prevent or impede this inevitable reality from taking place.
orig: إن ما توعدون لآت وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: Say, "O my people, work according to your position; indeed, I am working. You will soon know to whom will be the final home. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed."
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to continue doing good deeds according to their abilities and circumstances, without being deterred by the disbelievers or wrongdoers. It assures them that the ultimate success and eternal abode belongs to those who follow the truth, while the wrongdoers will fail and face the consequences of their misdeeds in the Hereafter. The interpretation emphasizes perseverance, steadfastness, and trust in Allah's promise of reward for the righteous and punishment for the unjust.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون من تكون له عاقبة الدار إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And they assign to Allah a portion of the tilth and cattle which He has created, and they say: 'This is for Allah' by their claim, and 'This is for our partners.' But the portion of their 'partners' does not reach Allah, while the portion of Allah goes to their 'partners.' Evil is the way they judge.
interpretation: This verse condemns the pagan Arabs' practice of assigning a portion of their crops and cattle to Allah, while allocating another portion to their idols or 'partners' associated with Allah. It criticizes their false belief that what they dedicated to their idols would not reach Allah, but what they dedicated to Allah would somehow reach their idols as well. The Qur'an denounces this as an evil judgement on their part, stemming from their ignorance and polytheistic beliefs.
orig: وجعلوا لله مما ذرأ من الحرث والأنعام نصيبا فقالوا هذا لله بزعمهم وهذا لشركائنا فما كان لشركائهم فلا يصل إلى الله وما كان لله فهو يصل إلى شركائهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And thus their partner idols have made the killing of their children seem pleasing to many idolaters, in order to ruin them and confuse them in their religion. Had Allah willed, they would not have done so. So leave them alone with their falsehoods.
interpretation: This verse condemns the pagan practice of child sacrifice, which was made appealing to them by their idolatrous beliefs. It states that had Allah willed, they would not have fallen into such grave misguidance. The verse instructs the believers to leave the idolaters to their false inventions and not be swayed by their misguided ways.
orig: وكذلك زين لكثير من المشركين قتل أولادهم شركاؤهم ليردوهم وليلبسوا عليهم دينهم ولو شاء الله ما فعلوه فذرهم وما يفترون

translation: And they say, 'These animals and crops are forbidden; no one may eat from them except whom we will,' by their claim. And there are animals whose backs are forbidden and animals over which they do not mention the name of Allah - an invention about Him. He will punish them for what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse condemns the pagan Arabs' superstitious beliefs regarding certain animals and crops. They falsely claimed that some were forbidden except for those they permitted. They also prohibited the use of certain animals' backs and neglected to mention Allah's name over some animals when slaughtering them. All of these were baseless fabrications against Allah, for which they will be punished.
orig: وقالوا هذه أنعام وحرث حجر لا يطعمها إلا من نشاء بزعمهم وأنعام حرمت ظهورها وأنعام لا يذكرون اسم الله عليها افتراء عليه سيجزيهم بما كانوا يفترون

translation: And they say, 'What is in the bellies of these animals is exclusively for our males and forbidden to our females. But if it is [born] dead, then all of them have shares therein.' He will punish them for their attribution. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan Arabs' superstitious beliefs and customs regarding livestock. They falsely claimed that the milk and offspring of certain animals were exclusively for men, prohibiting women from partaking. However, if the newborn was stillborn, both men and women could share it. Allah condemns such arbitrary discrimination and declares that He will hold them accountable for their unjust attributions. The verse highlights Allah's wisdom in legislating justice and His knowledge of their misguided practices.
orig: وقالوا ما في بطون هذه الأنعام خالصة لذكورنا ومحرم على أزواجنا وإن يكن ميتة فهم فيه شركاء سيجزيهم وصفهم إنه حكيم عليم

translation: Indeed, those who killed their children in foolishness without knowledge and prohibited what Allah had provided for them, inventing falsehood against Allah, have gone astray and were not guided.
interpretation: This verse condemns the pagan practice of killing children out of ignorance and superstition, as well as prohibiting what Allah has provided as sustenance, based on false beliefs attributed to Allah. It declares that those who commit such acts have strayed from the right path and are not guided by Allah.
orig: قد خسر الذين قتلوا أولادهم سفها بغير علم وحرموا ما رزقهم الله افتراء على الله قد ضلوا وما كانوا مهتدين

translation: And it is He who produces gardens trellised and untrellised, and date palms, and crops of different shape and taste, and olives and pomegranates, similar and dissimilar. Eat of its fruit when it yields, and pay its due on the day of its harvest, and do not be excessive. He does not love the excessive.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power in creating a variety of gardens, crops, and fruits with different tastes, shapes, and appearances. It encourages us to appreciate and consume the fruits when they are ripe, while paying the obligatory charity on the harvest day. However, it warns against wastefulness and extravagance, as Allah does not love those who exceed the proper limits.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأ جنات معروشات وغير معروشات والنخل والزرع مختلفا أكله والزيتون والرمان متشابها وغير متشابه كلوا من ثمره إذا أثمر وآتوا حقه يوم حصاده ولا تسرفوا إنه لا يحب المسرفين

translation: And of the cattle, some for burden and some for meat. Eat of what Allah has provided for you, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings Allah has bestowed upon humankind by providing cattle for various purposes, such as transportation and sustenance. It encourages people to consume the lawful provisions granted by Allah and abstain from following the temptations and evil suggestions of Satan, who is an evident adversary seeking to misguide humans from the straight path.
orig: ومن الأنعام حمولة وفرشا كلوا مما رزقكم الله ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: Eight pairs: two of sheep, and two of goats. Say: 'Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females? Or what the wombs of the two females contain? Tell me with knowledge, if you are truthful.'
interpretation: This verse challenges the pagan Arabs' superstitious beliefs about certain animals being forbidden or sacred based on their gender or pregnancy status. It asks them to provide knowledge-based evidence for such practices, implying that they have no rational basis and are mere unfounded customs.
orig: ثمانية أزواج من الضأن اثنين ومن المعز اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين نبئوني بعلم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And of the camels, two and of the cattle, two. Say: 'Is it the two males He has forbidden or the two females? Or what the wombs of the two females contain? Were you witnesses when Allah ordained this for you? So who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah to mislead men without knowledge? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the pagan Arabs' superstitious beliefs about the lawfulness or unlawfulness of certain animals based on their gender. Allah challenges them to provide evidence for such beliefs, which were mere fabrications against Allah's teachings without any knowledge or divine sanction. The verse establishes that Allah alone has the authority to legislate what is permissible or prohibited, and those who invent lies against Allah's laws are unjust and misguided.
orig: ومن الإبل اثنين ومن البقر اثنين قل آلذكرين حرم أم الأنثيين أما اشتملت عليه أرحام الأنثيين أم كنتم شهداء إذ وصاكم الله بهذا فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا ليضل الناس بغير علم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Say, "I do not find within that which was revealed to me [anything] forbidden to one who would eat it unless it be a dead animal or blood spilled out or the flesh of swine - for indeed, it is impure - or it be [slaughtered in] disobedience, dedicated to other than Allah . But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit], then indeed, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful."
interpretation: This verse clarifies what is permissible and impermissible to consume in terms of food. It states that nothing has been made unlawful except carrion, blood, pork, and that which has been slaughtered in the name of other than Allah. However, if one is compelled by necessity and does not intentionally consume the prohibited items, then Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: قل لا أجد في ما أوحي إلي محرما على طاعم يطعمه إلا أن يكون ميتة أو دما مسفوحا أو لحم خنزير فإنه رجس أو فسقا أهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فإن ربك غفور رحيم

translation: And to those who are Jews We prohibited every animal of uncloven hoof; and of the cattle and the sheep We prohibited to them their fat, except what adheres to their backs or their entrails or what is joined to the bone. Thus We recompensed them for their rebellion. And indeed, We are truthful.
interpretation: Allah prohibited for the Jews the consumption of animals with undivided hoofs, such as camels and donkeys, as well as the fat of cattle and sheep, except for the fat attached to their backs, intestines, or bones. This was a punishment for their disobedience and transgression against Allah's commands. Allah affirms that He is truthful in His words and promises.
orig: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا كل ذي ظفر ومن البقر والغنم حرمنا عليهم شحومهما إلا ما حملت ظهورهما أو الحوايا أو ما اختلط بعظم ذلك جزيناهم ببغيهم وإنا لصادقون

translation: But if they deny you, then say, 'Your Lord is the Lord of vast mercy, but His wrath cannot be averted from the people who are delinquent.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that although Allah is Extremely Merciful, His punishment will inevitably befall those who persist in denial and disobedience. It serves as a warning that one should not be deluded by Allah's mercy into thinking that they can escape accountability for their actions. Allah's mercy is vast, but it does not negate His justice or the consequences for those who knowingly reject the truth.
orig: فإن كذبوك فقل ربكم ذو رحمة واسعة ولا يرد بأسه عن القوم المجرمين

translation: Those who associate partners with Allah will say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have associated partners, nor would our forefathers, nor would we have prohibited anything.' Likewise did those before them deny until they tasted Our punishment. Say, 'Do you have any knowledge that you can produce for us? You follow nothing but assumptions, and you do nothing but conjecture.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the claim of the polytheists that they associated partners with Allah because Allah willed it. The interpretation is that they are making excuses for their polytheism and trying to justify their actions by attributing them to Allah's will. However, the Qur'an rejects this argument and states that they have no knowledge or evidence to support their claims, and that they are merely following assumptions and conjectures.
orig: سيقول الذين أشركوا لو شاء الله ما أشركنا ولا آباؤنا ولا حرمنا من شيء كذلك كذب الذين من قبلهم حتى ذاقوا بأسنا قل هل عندكم من علم فتخرجوه لنا إن تتبعون إلا الظن وإن أنتم إلا تخرصون

translation: Say, 'To Allah belongs the perfect argument. Had He willed, He could have guided you all.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and power. The "perfect argument" refers to Allah's undeniable proofs and evidence of His existence and authority. If Allah had willed, He could have guided all of humanity to the truth, but He has given people free will to choose whether to accept guidance or not. The verse highlights Allah's ability to guide, while also respecting human free choice.
orig: قل فلله الحجة البالغة فلو شاء لهداكم أجمعين

translation: Say, "Bring your witnesses who will testify that Allah has forbidden this. And if they testify, do not testify with them. And do not follow the desires of those who deny Our verses, and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, and they equate others with their Lord."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to challenge the idolaters who forbid certain foods, claiming that Allah has prohibited them. It tells him to ask them for evidence from credible witnesses to support their claim. If they provide such witnesses, the Prophet is instructed not to accept their testimony because it contradicts the teachings of Allah. The verse also warns against following the desires of those who reject Allah's revelations, disbelieve in the Hereafter, and associate partners with Allah.
orig: قل هلم شهداءكم الذين يشهدون أن الله حرم هذا فإن شهدوا فلا تشهد معهم ولا تتبع أهواء الذين كذبوا بآياتنا والذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وهم بربهم يعدلون

translation: Say, "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited to you. [He commands] that you not associate anything with Him, and to parents, good treatment, and do not kill your children out of poverty; We will provide sustenance for you and them. And do not approach immoralities - what is apparent of them and what is concealed. And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed] except by [legal] right. This has He instructed you that you may use reason."
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to worship Allah alone and associate no partners with Him. It also enjoins kindness and good treatment towards parents. It prohibits killing children out of poverty or fear of poverty, as Allah is the Provider for all. It forbids all immoral and shameful deeds, whether apparent or hidden. Additionally, it prohibits taking a life except through legal and justified means prescribed by Allah. These commandments are given so that people may use their reason and intellect to obey Allah's instructions.
orig: قل تعالوا أتل ما حرم ربكم عليكم ألا تشركوا به شيئا وبالوالدين إحسانا ولا تقتلوا أولادكم من إملاق نحن نرزقكم وإياهم ولا تقربوا الفواحش ما ظهر منها وما بطن ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تعقلون

translation: And do not approach the orphan's property except in a way that is best until he reaches maturity. And give full measure and weight in justice. We do not charge any soul except [with that within] its capacity. And when you speak, then be just, even if [it concerns] a near relative. And the covenant of Allah fulfill. That has He instructed you that you may remember.
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on dealing with orphans' wealth, being just in measurements, not burdening anyone beyond their capacity, speaking truthfully even with relatives, and fulfilling one's covenants with Allah. It emphasizes the importance of upholding justice, fairness, and fulfilling one's obligations towards others, especially the vulnerable like orphans, and towards Allah.
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا الكيل والميزان بالقسط لا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها وإذا قلتم فاعدلوا ولو كان ذا قربى وبعهد الله أوفوا ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تذكرون

translation: And this is My straight path, so follow it, and do not follow the other paths, for they will separate you from His path. That is what He has enjoined upon you, so that you may attain righteousness.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of adhering to the straight path prescribed by Allah and avoiding deviation from it. The "straight path" refers to the teachings of Islam and the guidance provided by the Qur'an and the Prophet Muhammad. Allah commands believers to follow this path and not be misled by other paths that may lead them astray. The verse warns that following other paths will separate them from Allah's path and cause division. Ultimately, Allah has given these commandments to guide people towards righteousness and attaining His pleasure.
orig: وأن هذا صراطي مستقيما فاتبعوه ولا تتبعوا السبل فتفرق بكم عن سبيله ذلكم وصاكم به لعلكم تتقون

translation: Then We gave Moses the Book, completing [Our favor] upon the one who did good and as a detailed explanation of all things - a guidance and mercy that perhaps in the meeting with their Lord they would believe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah bestowed the Torah upon Prophet Moses as a complete favor and blessing upon him for his righteousness. The Torah served as a comprehensive and detailed explanation of all religious matters, providing guidance and mercy. The purpose was to inspire belief in the people regarding their ultimate meeting with Allah on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ثم آتينا موسى الكتاب تماما على الذي أحسن وتفصيلا لكل شيء وهدى ورحمة لعلهم بلقاء ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And this is a Book which We have sent down, blessed and confirming what was before it, that you may warn the Mother of Cities and those around it. Those who believe in the Hereafter believe in it, and they are constant in guarding their prayers.
interpretation: The Qur'an is a blessed book revealed by Allah as a guide and mercy for humanity. It confirms the truth of previous scriptures and serves as a warning, particularly to the people of Makkah and its surrounding areas. Those who believe in the Hereafter and the accountability of their deeds will have faith in the Qur'an and will be diligent in performing their prayers.
orig: وهذا كتاب أنزلناه مبارك فاتبعوه واتقوا لعلكم ترحمون

translation: That you say, 'The Book was sent down only upon two groups before us, and we were indeed unaware of their study,'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers' claim that the revelation was only sent down to two groups before them, the Jews and the Christians, and that they were unaware of studying or learning from their scriptures. The interpretation is that the disbelievers were making excuses for their rejection of the Qur'an by claiming ignorance of the previous revelations and attempting to undermine the universality of Allah's message.
orig: أن تقولوا إنما أنزل الكتاب على طائفتين من قبلنا وإن كنا عن دراستهم لغافلين

translation: Or you say, 'If only the Book had been sent down to us, we would have been better guided than they.' So there has come to you a clear evidence from your Lord, and a guidance and mercy. Then who is more unjust than one who denies the verses of Allah and turns away from them? We will recompense those who turn away from Our verses with the worst of punishment for what they used to turn away.
interpretation: هذا تحذير من الله تعالى للمشركين الذين رفضوا الإيمان بالقرآن الكريم، حيث يقول لهم إن كنتم تقولون لو أنزل علينا كتاب لاتبعناه وكنا أهدى من المسلمين، فقد جاءكم بينة واضحة من ربكم وهي القرآن الكريم، وهدى ورحمة، فمن أظلم ممن كذب بآيات الله وأعرض عنها؟ سنجازي هؤلاء الذين يصدفون عن آياتنا ويعرضون عنها بأشد العذاب في الآخرة، جزاء لهم على إعراضهم وتكذيبهم.
orig: أو تقولوا لو أنا أنزل علينا الكتاب لكنا أهدى منهم فقد جاءكم بينة من ربكم وهدى ورحمة فمن أظلم ممن كذب بآيات الله وصدف عنها سنجزي الذين يصدفون عن آياتنا سوء العذاب بما كانوا يصدفون

translation: Do they await but that the angels should come to them, or your Lord should come, or that there come some of the signs of your Lord? The Day that some of the signs of your Lord will come no soul will benefit from its faith as long as it had not believed before or had earned through its faith some good. Say: 'Wait! We too are waiting.'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers against awaiting tangible evidence of God's existence or the Day of Judgment before embracing faith. It states that on the Day when some of God's signs become manifest, belief will be of no avail to those who had rejected faith earlier, unless they had done some good deeds stemming from faith. The believers are instructed to be patient and persevere, as the disbelievers will face the consequences of their denial.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن تأتيهم الملائكة أو يأتي ربك أو يأتي بعض آيات ربك يوم يأتي بعض آيات ربك لا ينفع نفسا إيمانها لم تكن آمنت من قبل أو كسبت في إيمانها خيرا قل انتظروا إنا منتظرون

translation: Indeed, those who divided their religion and became sects - you, [O Muhammad], are not [associated] with them in anything. Their affair is only [left] to Allah; then He will inform them about what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse condemns the act of dividing religion into sects and groups based on personal desires and whims, rather than following the true teachings revealed by Allah. It absolves the Prophet Muhammad from any association with those who engage in such divisive practices. Their ultimate judgment lies with Allah, who will hold them accountable for their actions and inform them of the consequences.
orig: إن الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا لست منهم في شيء إنما أمرهم إلى الله ثم ينبئهم بما كانوا يفعلون

translation: Whoever brings a good deed will have ten times the like thereof [to his credit], and whoever brings an ill deed will not be recompensed but the like thereof; and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense reward for good deeds and the justice in punishment for evil deeds. It emphasizes that Allah multiplies the reward for good deeds tenfold, while evil deeds are recompensed equally without any injustice or wrongdoing. This shows Allah's vast mercy and encouragement for righteous actions, as well as His perfect justice in dealing with sins.
orig: من جاء بالحسنة فله عشر أمثالها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Say, 'Indeed, my Lord has guided me to a straight path - a correct religion, the way of Abraham, inclining toward truth. And he was not among those who associated others with Allah.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the guidance and straight path that Allah has bestowed upon the Prophet Muhammad and his followers. It highlights the pure monotheistic faith of Islam, which is described as the "correct religion" and the "way of Abraham." Abraham (peace be upon him) is mentioned as a role model for his unwavering devotion to the Oneness of God and rejection of polytheism or associating partners with Allah. The verse affirms that true guidance comes from Allah alone, leading to a straight and unwavering path of truth and submission to the One God.
orig: قل إنني هداني ربي إلى صراط مستقيم دينا قيما ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: Say, 'Indeed, my prayer, my rites of sacrifice, my living and my dying are for Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes complete devotion and submission to Allah alone. All acts of worship, rituals, life, and death should be dedicated solely to Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds and creations. It signifies that a believer's entire existence revolves around Allah and should be devoted to His worship and obedience.
orig: قل إن صلاتي ونسكي ومحياي ومماتي لله رب العالمين

translation: He has no partner, and I am commanded this, and I am the first of those who submit.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and that He has no partner or associate in His Lordship and worship. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) declares that he has been commanded to worship Allah alone without any partners, and that he is the first among the Muslims who submit to this command of pure monotheism.
orig: لا شريك له وبذلك أمرت وأنا أول المسلمين

translation: Say, "Shall I seek a lord other than Allah, while He is the Lord of all things? And no soul earns [blame] except against itself, and no bearer of burden will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you concerning that over which you used to differ."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of God and that He alone is worthy of worship and obedience. It affirms that everyone is accountable for their own deeds and will not bear the burden of others' sins. Ultimately, all will return to God, who will judge and inform them about the matters they differed upon in the worldly life.
orig: قل أغير الله أبغي ربا وهو رب كل شيء ولا تكسب كل نفس إلا عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: And it is He who has made you successors upon the earth and has raised some of you above others in degrees [of rank] that He may try you through what He has given you. Indeed, your Lord is swift in penalty; but indeed, He is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has given human beings the role of successors or vicegerents on earth, with some people being elevated above others in rank and status. This difference in ranks and degrees is a trial from Allah to test how people utilize the blessings and favors He has bestowed upon them. It serves as a reminder that while Allah is swift in punishing those who transgress, He is also Forgiving and Merciful towards those who repent and seek His forgiveness.
orig: وهو الذي جعلكم خلائف الأرض ورفع بعضكم فوق بعض درجات ليبلوكم في ما آتاكم إن ربك سريع العقاب وإنه لغفور رحيم

translation: The night
interpretation: This verse refers to the night as a symbol of tranquility, peace, and a time for reflection and contemplation. It suggests that the night provides a respite from the hustle and bustle of daily life, allowing individuals to find solace, recharge, and ponder upon the deeper aspects of existence.
orig: المص

translation: This is a Book which has been revealed to you - so let there be no impediment in your breast concerning it - that you may warn thereby, and (it is) a reminder for the believers.
interpretation: This Qur'an has been revealed to you, O Muhammad, as a guidance and light. So do not let any doubt or hesitation remain in your heart concerning its truth and perfection. Your role is to convey its warnings and remind the believers of its teachings and commandments.
orig: كتاب أنزل إليك فلا يكن في صدرك حرج منه لتنذر به وذكرى للمؤمنين

translation: Follow what has been revealed to you from your Lord and do not follow besides Him any allies. Little do you remember.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to adhere strictly to the teachings and guidance revealed by Allah in the Qur'an, and to refrain from following any other sources or authorities besides Him. It emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah alone and warns against associating partners or allies with Him.
