As a result, they are warned to taste the punishment they deserve for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: وما كان صلاتهم عند البيت إلا مكاء وتصدية فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve spend their wealth to avert [people] from the way of Allah. So they will spend it; then it will become for them a [source of] regret; then they will be overcome. And those who have disbelieved - unto Hell they will be gathered.
interpretation: هذه الآية تحذر من أن الكفار ينفقون أموالهم لصد الناس عن الإيمان بالإسلام، ولكن هذا الإنفاق سيكون مصدر حسرة لهم في نهاية المطاف لأنهم سيُغلبون. والآية تؤكد أيضًا أن الكفار سيُحشرون إلى جهنم يوم القيامة بسبب كفرهم.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينفقون أموالهم ليصدوا عن سبيل الله فسينفقونها ثم تكون عليهم حسرة ثم يغلبون والذين كفروا إلى جهنم يحشرون

translation: That Allah may distinguish the wicked from the good, and place the wicked one upon another and heap them all up and put them into Hell. Those are the losers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that one of Allah's purposes is to separate the evil from the good. The "wicked" or evil people will be piled on top of one another and cast into Hellfire as punishment for their disbelief and wrongdoings. They are described as "the losers" because they have lost the great reward of Paradise due to their rejection of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: ليميز الله الخبيث من الطيب ويجعل الخبيث بعضه على بعض فيركمه جميعا فيجعله في جهنم أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say to those who disbelieve, 'If they cease, what has passed will be forgiven for them; but if they return, then the precedent of the former peoples has already taken place.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to warn the disbelievers that if they cease their disbelief and accept faith, their past sins will be forgiven. However, if they persist in disbelief, they will face the same fate as previous nations who rejected the messengers of God, which was destruction and punishment.
orig: قل للذين كفروا إن ينتهوا يغفر لهم ما قد سلف وإن يعودوا فقد مضت سنت الأولين

translation: And fight them until there is no fitnah and [until] the religion, all of it, is for Allah. And if they cease - then indeed, Allah is Seeing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to fight against those who wage war against them and oppress them for their faith, until there is no more persecution (fitnah) and the religion of Islam can be practiced freely without hindrance. However, if the aggressors cease their hostilities, then the Muslims should stop fighting, for Allah sees their actions and will judge them accordingly. The verse emphasizes the importance of establishing religious freedom and protecting the rights of Muslims to practice their faith without oppression.
orig: وقاتلوهم حتى لا تكون فتنة ويكون الدين كله لله فإن انتهوا فإن الله بما يعملون بصير

translation: But if they turn away, then know that Allah is your Protector - an excellent Protector and an excellent Helper.
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in their rejection and turn away from the truth, know that Allah alone is your Guardian, Protector, and Helper. He is the best Guardian who will protect you, and the best Helper who will aid you against your enemies.
orig: وإن تولوا فاعلموا أن الله مولاكم نعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: And know that whatever you gain as spoils of war, a fifth of it belongs to Allah and the Messenger, and to the near relatives, orphans, the needy, and the wayfarer, if you believe in Allah and what We sent down upon Our servant on the Day of Discrimination, the day when the two forces met; and Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse lays down the Islamic law of distributing war spoils. One-fifth of the spoils are to be given to Allah and His Messenger (for religious and welfare purposes), relatives of the Prophet, orphans, the poor, and travelers in need. The remaining four-fifths go to the soldiers who participated in the battle. This law was revealed after the Battle of Badr, which was a decisive victory for the outnumbered Muslim forces against the pagan Meccans. The verse emphasizes belief in Allah and the divine revelation given to the Prophet on that momentous "Day of Discrimination" between truth and falsehood. It also affirms Allah's complete power and control over all affairs.
orig: واعلموا أنما غنمتم من شيء فأن لله خمسه وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل إن كنتم آمنتم بالله وما أنزلنا على عبدنا يوم الفرقان يوم التقى الجمعان والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: When you were on the near side of the valley, and they were on the farther side, and the caravan was below you. If you had made a mutual appointment, you would have missed the appointment, but this was so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - so that those who were to perish might perish by a clear proof and those who were to live might live by a clear proof. And indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Badr, describing the strategic positioning of the Muslim army and the disbelieving Quraysh army on opposite sides of the valley. It emphasizes that the encounter was destined by Allah to serve as a clear test and proof, allowing those who were destined to perish to do so after witnessing clear evidence, and those destined to live to survive after witnessing clear evidence. It highlights Allah's wisdom, power, and knowledge in orchestrating events according to His divine plan.
orig: إذ أنتم بالعدوة الدنيا وهم بالعدوة القصوى والركب أسفل منكم ولو تواعدتم لاختلفتم في الميعاد ولكن ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا ليهلك من هلك عن بينة ويحيى من حي عن بينة وإن الله لسميع عليم

translation: When Allah showed them to you in your dream as few; and if He had shown them to you as many, you would have faltered and disputed in the matter, but Allah saved you; surely He is Aware of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah showed the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) a vision in his dream, depicting the enemy forces as few in number. This was a divine strategy to instill courage and determination in the hearts of the believers, as seeing a small enemy force would prevent them from faltering or disputing the decision to engage in battle. Had the enemy been shown as numerous, it could have led to hesitation and disagreement among the believers. However, Allah protected them from such doubts, as He is fully aware of the intentions and thoughts within people's hearts.
orig: إذ يريكهم الله في منامك قليلا ولو أراكهم كثيرا لفشلتم ولتنازعتم في الأمر ولكن الله سلم إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And [recall] when He showed them to you, when you met, as few in your eyes, and made you [appear] few in their eyes so that Allah might accomplish a matter already destined - and to Allah are [all] matters returned.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Badr, where Allah made the Muslim army appear few in the eyes of the disbelievers, and vice versa, so that the outcome would be a decisive victory for the believers. It emphasizes that the outcome of events is determined by Allah's will, and all matters ultimately return to Him.
orig: وإذ يريكموهم إذ التقيتم في أعينكم قليلا ويقللكم في أعينهم ليقضي الله أمرا كان مفعولا وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, when you meet a company [from the enemy forces], stand firm and remember Allah much that you may be successful.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to remain steadfast and unwavering in the face of the enemy, and to constantly remember and invoke Allah's name and assistance, for that is the key to achieving victory and success.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا لقيتم فئة فاثبتوا واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And obey Allah and His Messenger, and do not dispute lest you falter and your strength depart; and be patient, for Allah is with the patient.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It warns against disputing and quarreling, as this can lead to failure and the loss of strength and resolve. Instead, it encourages patience, promising that Allah is with those who are patient and steadfast.
orig: وأطيعوا الله ورسوله ولا تنازعوا فتفشلوا وتذهب ريحكم واصبروا إن الله مع الصابرين

translation: And do not be like those who came out of their homes boastfully and to be seen by people, and hindered [others] from the way of Allah, and Allah is encompassing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse warns against being arrogant, boastful, and seeking fame and recognition from people. It condemns those who left their homes with pride and ostentation, showing off their wealth and status, while preventing others from following the path of Allah. The verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of their actions and will hold them accountable.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين خرجوا من ديارهم بطرا ورئاء الناس ويصدون عن سبيل الله والله بما يعملون محيط

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Satan made their deeds pleasing to them and said, 'No one can overcome you today from among the people, and indeed, I am your protector.' But when the two armies sighted one another, he turned on his heels and said, 'Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I see what you do not see; indeed I fear Allah, and Allah is severe in penalty.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Badr, when Satan tried to deceive the disbelievers by making their deeds seem pleasing to them and promising them victory. However, when the two armies faced each other, Satan abandoned the disbelievers, claiming that he could see what they could not and that he feared Allah's punishment. The verse highlights Satan's deception and the ultimate reality that he has no power over those who fear Allah.
orig: وإذ زين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم وقال لا غالب لكم اليوم من الناس وإني جار لكم فلما تراءت الفئتان نكص على عقبيه وقال إني بريء منكم إني أرى ما لا ترون إني أخاف الله والله شديد العقاب

translation: When the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease said, "Their religion has deluded these [Muslims]." But whoever relies upon Allah - then indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites and those with doubts in their hearts mocking the sincere believers, claiming that their religion has deluded them. However, the interpretation emphasizes that those who truly rely on Allah will find that He is Almighty and Wise, implying that the believers' trust in Allah is well-founded, and the doubters are the ones who are misguided.
orig: إذ يقول المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض غر هؤلاء دينهم ومن يتوكل على الله فإن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: And if you could but see when the disbelievers are in the agonies of death, the angels are striking their faces and their backs, [saying], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire."
interpretation: This verse paints a vivid and terrifying picture of the disbelievers' fate in the Hereafter. The angels, who are God's obedient servants, strike the disbelievers on their faces and backs as they are experiencing the agonies of death. This striking is a form of humiliation and punishment for their rejection of faith. The angels then command them to "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire," which is a reference to the eternal torment of Hell that awaits them as a consequence of their disbelief and disobedience to God.
orig: ولو ترى إذ يتوفى الذين كفروا الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: That is for what your hands have sent forth, and verily, Allah is not unjust to His slaves.
interpretation: "This punishment that has befallen you is a consequence of your own misdeeds and sins. Allah does not wrong anyone; rather, it is people who wrong themselves by disobeying Allah's commands. Allah is completely just and fair to His servants."
orig: ذلك بما قدمت أيديكم وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: Like the behavior of Pharaoh's people and those before them. They disbelieved in Allah's signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse draws a parallel between the arrogant rejection of faith by Pharaoh's people and those before them, and the disbelievers of the Prophet's time. Just as the previous nations denied Allah's signs and revelations, they too were guilty of the same transgression. As a consequence, Allah punished them severely for their sins and disobedience, for He is truly Mighty and capable of inflicting a severe punishment upon those who defy Him.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كفروا بآيات الله فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم إن الله قوي شديد العقاب

translation: That is because Allah would not change a favor which He had bestowed upon a people until they change what is within themselves, and because Allah is All-Hearer, All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse explains that Allah does not take away His blessings and favors from a people unless they themselves change their beliefs, attitudes, and actions. Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing, so He is aware of the changes that occur within people's hearts and minds. The continuation or withdrawal of Allah's favors depends on whether people maintain faith and righteousness or deviate from the right path.
orig: ذلك بأن الله لم يك مغيرا نعمة أنعمها على قوم حتى يغيروا ما بأنفسهم وأن الله سميع عليم

translation: Like the custom of Pharaoh's people and those before them. They rejected the signs of their Lord, so We destroyed them for their sins, and We drowned the people of Pharaoh. And all were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse draws a parallel between the disbelief and rejection of the signs of Allah by the people of Pharaoh and previous nations. It serves as a warning that those who deny the clear signs and revelations from their Lord will face a similar fate of destruction due to their sins and wrongdoings, just as Pharaoh and his people were drowned for their oppression and rejection of faith.
orig: كدأب آل فرعون والذين من قبلهم كذبوا بآيات ربهم فأهلكناهم بذنوبهم وأغرقنا آل فرعون وكل كانوا ظالمين

translation: Indeed, the worst of living creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have disbelieved, and they will not [ever] believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the most despicable and vile creatures in the sight of Allah are those who have rejected faith and refuse to believe in Him, despite being presented with clear signs and evidence. Their stubborn disbelief and rejection of the truth makes them the lowest of beings in Allah's estimation. The interpretation highlights the grave consequence of willful disbelief and warns against persisting in such a state.
orig: إن شر الدواب عند الله الذين كفروا فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Those with whom you made a covenant, but they break their covenant every time, and they do not fear Allah.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who repeatedly break their promises and covenants with the Muslims, violating their treaties and agreements without any fear of Allah's punishment. It condemns their treacherous behavior and lack of taqwa (consciousness of Allah). The interpretation emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's promises and warns against betraying trusts and treaties, as such actions are displeasing to Allah.
orig: الذين عاهدت منهم ثم ينقضون عهدهم في كل مرة وهم لا يتقون

translation: So if you gain victory over them in war, deal with them in a way that will disperse those behind them, so that they may take heed.
interpretation: This verse instructs that if the believers gain victory over the disbelievers in battle, they should disperse and scatter the remaining enemy forces in a way that serves as a deterrent and causes them to remember Allah's punishment. The goal is to weaken the enemy's resolve and prevent further aggression, not to seek revenge or inflict unnecessary harm.
orig: فإما تثقفنهم في الحرب فشرد بهم من خلفهم لعلهم يذكرون

translation: But if you fear betrayal from any people, then throw (their treaty) back to them on equal terms. Surely, Allah does not love the betrayers.
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on how to deal with those who violate treaties or agreements. If there is a fear or suspicion that a group may betray their covenant, the Muslims are instructed to dissolve the treaty in a fair and equal manner, without taking advantage or oppressing the other party. The verse emphasizes that betrayal and treachery are disliked by Allah, and Muslims should uphold honesty and fulfill their promises and agreements.
orig: وإما تخافن من قوم خيانة فانبذ إليهم على سواء إن الله لا يحب الخائنين

translation: And let not those who disbelieved think that they will escape. Indeed, they will not cause failure [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers not to think that they can escape from Allah's punishment or cause failure to His plans. It emphasizes that their disbelief and opposition will not prevent Allah's will from being fulfilled. They cannot undermine or frustrate Allah's decree in any way.
orig: ولا يحسبن الذين كفروا سبقوا إنهم لا يعجزون

translation: And prepare against them whatever you are able of power and of steeds of war by which you may terrify the enemy of Allah and your enemy and others besides them whom you do not know [but] whom Allah knows. And whatever you spend in the cause of Allah will be fully repaid to you, and you will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to prepare themselves with all available means of power and military equipment to deter and strike fear into the enemies of Allah and the enemies of the believers. It also indicates that there may be other unknown enemies besides the known ones, but Allah knows them all. Additionally, it promises that any expenditure made in the cause of Allah will be fully recompensed, and no one will be treated unjustly.
orig: وأعدوا لهم ما استطعتم من قوة ومن رباط الخيل ترهبون به عدو الله وعدوكم وآخرين من دونهم لا تعلمونهم الله يعلمهم وما تنفقوا من شيء في سبيل الله يوف إليكم وأنتم لا تظلمون

translation: But if they incline to peace, then incline to it and trust in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: If the opponents show an inclination towards peace and reconciliation, Muslims should respond in a like manner and agree to peaceful terms. However, they should place their trust in Allah alone, for He is All-Hearing, aware of all intentions and circumstances, and All-Knowing, perfectly aware of what is best.
orig: وإن جنحوا للسلم فاجنح لها وتوكل على الله إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, then sufficient for you is Allah. It is He who supported you with His victory and with the believers.
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that if the disbelievers attempt to deceive him, Allah is sufficient for him and will aid him. It emphasizes that Allah granted him victory and supported him through the believers who stood by his side. The interpretation highlights Allah's protection and assistance for the Prophet against any deception or harm intended by his enemies.
orig: وإن يريدوا أن يخدعوك فإن حسبك الله هو الذي أيدك بنصره وبالمؤمنين

translation: And He united their hearts. If you had spent all that is in the earth, you could not have united their hearts, but Allah united them. Indeed, He is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense power and wisdom of Allah in uniting the hearts of believers. Even if all the wealth of the earth was spent, it would not be able to unite hearts the way Allah can. He is the One who brings people together in faith and love, as He is Mighty and Wise. This emphasizes the importance of relying on Allah's guidance and mercy to overcome divisions and achieve true unity.
orig: وألف بين قلوبهم لو أنفقت ما في الأرض جميعا ما ألفت بين قلوبهم ولكن الله ألف بينهم إنه عزيز حكيم

translation: O Prophet, sufficient for you is Allah and those who follow you of the believers.
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, that Allah's support and the support of the believing followers are sufficient for him. It emphasizes that the Prophet should not be disheartened by those who disbelieve or oppose him, as long as he has Allah's aid and the companionship of the sincere believers.
orig: يا أيها النبي حسبك الله ومن اتبعك من المؤمنين

translation: O Prophet, urge the believers to fight. If there are twenty steadfast men among you, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are a hundred of you, they will overcome a thousand of those who disbelieve, for they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: Allah encourages the believers to fight against the disbelievers, even if they are outnumbered. If there are twenty steadfast believers, they can overcome two hundred disbelievers. And if there are a hundred believers, they can overcome a thousand disbelievers. This is because the disbelievers lack true understanding and faith, which gives the believers strength and determination to fight for the cause of Allah.
orig: يا أيها النبي حرض المؤمنين على القتال إن يكن منكم عشرون صابرون يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم مائة يغلبوا ألفا من الذين كفروا بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: Now Allah has lightened [the burden] for you, and He knows that there is weakness in you. So if there are from you one hundred [who are] steadfast, they will overcome two hundred. And if there are among you a thousand, they will overcome two thousand by permission of Allah. And Allah is with the steadfast.
interpretation: This verse is providing reassurance and encouragement to the believers. It acknowledges their weakness and human frailties, and informs them that Allah has lightened their burden. It then states that if they remain steadfast and patient, even a small number of them can overcome a much larger force, by Allah's permission and support. The key message is that steadfastness, patience, and reliance on Allah are crucial for success, even against overwhelming odds.
orig: الآن خفف الله عنكم وعلم أن فيكم ضعفا فإن يكن منكم مائة صابرة يغلبوا مائتين وإن يكن منكم ألف يغلبوا ألفين بإذن الله والله مع الصابرين

translation: It is not for a Prophet to have captives until he has thoroughly subdued the land. You desire the commodities of this world, but Allah desires (for you) the Hereafter. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: The interpretation is that this verse addresses the wisdom behind taking captives in war. It states that a Prophet should not take captives until he has thoroughly subdued the land and established authority. The verse contrasts the temporary desires of this world with the eternal reward of the Hereafter, which Allah desires for the believers. It emphasizes that Allah is Mighty and Wise in His commands and laws.
orig: ما كان لنبي أن يكون له أسرى حتى يثخن في الأرض تريدون عرض الدنيا والله يريد الآخرة والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Had it not been for a decree from Allah that had already gone forth, there would have touched you, for what you took, a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that if it were not for Allah's mercy and pre-existing decree to delay the punishment, the believers would have received a severe punishment for the sin they committed. It emphasizes Allah's forgiveness and that He does not hasten the punishment for His servants, giving them a chance to repent and seek forgiveness.
orig: لولا كتاب من الله سبق لمسكم فيما أخذتم عذاب عظيم

translation: So consume what you have acquired as ghanimah (war booty), lawful and good, and fear Allah. Surely, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to enjoy the lawful and pure spoils of war that they have attained through battle, but to remain conscious of Allah and His commandments. It reminds them that although they have been granted victory and spoils, they should not become arrogant or transgress the limits set by Allah. Instead, they should maintain their piety and seek forgiveness from the Most Merciful, for any shortcomings or excesses.
orig: فكلوا مما غنمتم حلالا طيبا واتقوا الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O Prophet, say to the captives in your hands, 'If Allah knows any good in your hearts, He will give you better than what has been taken from you, and He will forgive you. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) regarding the captives taken during the Battle of Badr. It instructs him to tell the captives that if Allah finds goodness in their hearts, He will compensate them with something better than what they have lost, and He will forgive them. This demonstrates Allah's mercy and willingness to pardon those who have faith and repent, even if they were previously enemies of Islam.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لمن في أيديكم من الأسرى إن يعلم الله في قلوبكم خيرا يؤتكم خيرا مما أخذ منكم ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: And if they intend to deceive you, they have already deceived Allah before. But He enabled you to prevail over them. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse implies that if the disbelievers intend to betray the Prophet Muhammad, they have already betrayed Allah by disbelieving in Him and His messengers before. However, Allah has granted the Prophet victory over them, as He is All-Knowing of their intentions and All-Wise in His plans and decrees.
orig: وإن يريدوا خيانتك فقد خانوا الله من قبل فأمكن منهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and emigrated and fought with their wealth and lives in the cause of Allah and those who gave shelter and aided - they are allies of one another. But those who believed and did not emigrate - for you there is no guardianship of them until they emigrate. And if they seek help of you for the religion, then you must help, except against a people between yourselves and whom is a treaty. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse outlines the relationship and mutual obligations between the Muhajirun (emigrants) and Ansar (helpers) in Medina. It states that those who believed, migrated from Mecca, and strived with their wealth and lives for Allah's cause, as well as those who sheltered and supported them in Medina, are allies to one another. However, those who believed but did not migrate have no such alliance until they migrate. If they seek help for the sake of religion, it is obligatory to help them, except against people with whom there is a treaty. Allah is aware of all actions.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك بعضهم أولياء بعض والذين آمنوا ولم يهاجروا ما لكم من ولايتهم من شيء حتى يهاجروا وإن استنصروكم في الدين فعليكم النصر إلا على قوم بينكم وبينهم ميثاق والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: And those who disbelieved are allies of one another. Unless you do this [disengage from the disbelievers], there will be persecution on earth and great corruption.
interpretation: This verse warns against forming alliances or close relationships with disbelievers, as they will influence and misguide the believers away from the truth. If the believers do not maintain distance from the disbelievers, it will lead to trials, oppression, and widespread moral decay in society. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of preserving one's faith and values by avoiding close ties with those who reject the truth.
orig: والذين كفروا بعضهم أولياء بعض إلا تفعلوه تكن فتنة في الأرض وفساد كبير

translation: And those who believe and emigrate and strive in the cause of Allah, and those who shelter and support them, it is they who are the true believers. For them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: This verse highlights the virtues of those who embraced faith, migrated for the sake of Allah, strived in His cause, and supported and sheltered the believers. It affirms that these individuals are the true believers, and they will be rewarded with forgiveness from Allah and a noble provision in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله والذين آووا ونصروا أولئك هم المؤمنون حقا لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who believed after [the early believers] and emigrated and fought with you - they are of you. But those of blood relation are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse affirms the bond of faith that unites believers, making them like family. However, it also upholds the rights of blood relatives in matters of inheritance, as ordained by Allah, who knows all things.
orig: والذين آمنوا من بعد وهاجروا وجاهدوا معكم فأولئك منكم وأولو الأرحام بعضهم أولى ببعض في كتاب الله إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: A disavowal from Allah and His Messenger to those with whom you made a treaty among the polytheists.
interpretation: This verse announces the nullification of all treaties and covenants made with the polytheists who violated their terms. It signifies that Allah and His Messenger disassociate themselves from those who broke their pledges and betrayed the Muslims, giving them a period of four months to make amends or face the consequences.
orig: براءة من الله ورسوله إلى الذين عاهدتم من المشركين

translation: So travel freely, [O disbelievers], throughout the land for four months, but know that you cannot cause failure to Allah, and that Allah will disgrace the disbelievers.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is giving a period of four months to the disbelievers to roam freely in the land before facing punishment. However, they should understand that they cannot escape Allah's plan or overpower Him, and that Allah will eventually humiliate and disgrace those who reject faith.
orig: فسيحوا في الأرض أربعة أشهر واعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وأن الله مخزي الكافرين

translation: And [it is] an announcement from Allah and His Messenger to the people on the day of the greater pilgrimage that Allah is disassociated from the disbelievers, and [so is] His Messenger. So if you repent, that is best for you; but if you turn away - then know that you will not cause failure to Allah. And give tidings to those who disbelieve of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse announces Allah's disassociation from the polytheists and disbelievers after the period of respite granted to them. It calls them to repent and embrace Islam, promising them good if they do so, but warning them of a painful punishment if they persist in their disbelief and turn away from the truth.
orig: وأذان من الله ورسوله إلى الناس يوم الحج الأكبر أن الله بريء من المشركين ورسوله فإن تبتم فهو خير لكم وإن توليتم فاعلموا أنكم غير معجزي الله وبشر الذين كفروا بعذاب أليم

translation: Except for those with whom you made a covenant among the polytheists; then they have not been deficient toward you in anything and have not supported anyone against you, so complete for them their covenant until their term [has ended]. Indeed, Allah loves the righteous [who fear Him].
interpretation: هذه الآية تتحدث عن استثناء لبعض المشركين الذين كان للمسلمين معاهدة معهم ولم ينقضوها. فالله يأمر المسلمين بالوفاء بالعهود والمواثيق التي أبرموها مع هؤلاء المشركين إلى نهاية مدتها، طالما أنهم لم ينقصوا المسلمين شيئًا ولم يساندوا أحدًا ضدهم. ويختتم الله الآية بالإشارة إلى أنه يحب المتقين الذين يخافونه ويلتزمون بأوامره.
orig: إلا الذين عاهدتم من المشركين ثم لم ينقصوكم شيئا ولم يظاهروا عليكم أحدا فأتموا إليهم عهدهم إلى مدتهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: But when the sacred months have passed, then fight and slay the Pagans wherever ye find them, and seize them, beleaguer them, and lie in wait for them in every stratagem (of war); but if they repent, and establish regular prayers and practise regular charity, then open the way for them: for Allah is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to fight against the idolaters who violated their treaties and persecuted the Muslims after the sacred months have ended. It permits the use of force against them, but also offers amnesty if they repent, establish prayer, and pay the prescribed charity. The interpretation highlights that while fighting is permitted as a last resort, the door to peace remains open if the enemy abandons hostility and embraces Islam.
orig: فإذا انسلخ الأشهر الحرم فاقتلوا المشركين حيث وجدتموهم وخذوهم واحصروهم واقعدوا لهم كل مرصد فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فخلوا سبيلهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And if any one of the polytheists seeks your protection, then protect him so that he may hear the words of Allah. Then deliver him to his place of safety. That is because they are a people who do not know.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to grant protection and safe passage to any polytheist who seeks refuge with them, even if he is an enemy. This is to be done so that the polytheist can hear and understand the teachings of Islam without fear. After hearing the message, he should be escorted to a place of safety, regardless of whether he accepts Islam or not. The reason given is that the polytheists are ignorant of the truth due to their lack of knowledge.
orig: وإن أحد من المشركين استجارك فأجره حتى يسمع كلام الله ثم أبلغه مأمنه ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعلمون

translation: How can there be a covenant of protection with Allah and His Messenger for the polytheists, except for those with whom you made a treaty at the Sacred Mosque? As long as they are upright with you, be upright with them. Verily, Allah loves the pious.
interpretation: This verse addresses the issue of treaties and covenants with the polytheists. It states that there can be no covenant of protection with Allah and His Messenger for the polytheists, except for those with whom the Muslims made a treaty at the Sacred Mosque in Makkah. As long as those polytheists uphold their part of the treaty and remain faithful to it, the Muslims must also honor their commitment. This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling promises and covenants, as Allah loves those who are God-fearing and upright.
orig: كيف يكون للمشركين عهد عند الله وعند رسوله إلا الذين عاهدتم عند المسجد الحرام فما استقاموا لكم فاستقيموا لهم إن الله يحب المتقين

translation: How [can there be a treaty], while if they were to overcome you, they would not leave you any leeway, nor honor any tie with you? They satisfy you with their mouths, but their hearts refuse, and most of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse is warning against making treaties or alliances with those who do not honor their commitments and have ill intentions. It states that even if they appear friendly outwardly, their hearts are opposed to you, and they will not uphold any agreement if they gain the upper hand. Most of them are disobedient to God and will readily violate their promises. The verse cautions against being deceived by outward displays of amity from those whose true intentions are hostile.
orig: كيف وإن يظهروا عليكم لا يرقبوا فيكم إلا ولا ذمة يرضونكم بأفواههم وتأبى قلوبهم وأكثرهم فاسقون

translation: They have bartered away the signs of Allah for a paltry price and have turned others away from His path. Evil indeed is what they have been doing.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who reject or trade away Allah's signs and revelations for temporary worldly gains or pleasures. They disbelieve in Allah's messages and hinder others from following the right path. Their actions are described as evil and displeasing in the sight of Allah.
orig: اشتروا بآيات الله ثمنا قليلا فصدوا عن سبيله إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: They respect not the ties of kinship or covenant in the case of a believer. It is they who are the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who disregard family ties and covenants when dealing with believers. It criticizes their disrespect for the bonds that should unite people, especially with fellow believers. Their transgression lies in violating these sacred ties and failing to uphold moral obligations towards their brethren in faith.
orig: لا يرقبون في مؤمن إلا ولا ذمة وأولئك هم المعتدون

translation: But if they repent, establish prayer and give zakah, then they are your brothers in religion; and We detail the verses for a people who know.
interpretation: If those who previously opposed the truth repent, perform the obligatory prayers, and pay the obligatory charity, then they become part of the Muslim brotherhood. Allah explains the verses of the Qur'an in detail so that those who possess knowledge can understand and benefit from them.
orig: فإن تابوا وأقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة فإخوانكم في الدين ونفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: But if they violate their oaths after their covenant and attack your religion, then fight the leaders of disbelief - indeed, they have no faithfulness; perhaps they will cease.
interpretation: If the disbelievers break their treaties and covenants with you, and insult and attack your religion, then fight their leaders and authorities who are the cause of disbelief and war. They have no regard for oaths or promises, so fight them in the hope that they will stop their aggression and oppression.
orig: وإن نكثوا أيمانهم من بعد عهدهم وطعنوا في دينكم فقاتلوا أئمة الكفر إنهم لا أيمان لهم لعلهم ينتهون

translation: Will you not fight a people who broke their oaths and intended to expel the Messenger, and they had begun [the attack upon] you the first time? Do you fear them? But Allah has more right that you should fear Him, if you are [truly] believers.
interpretation: Allah is questioning the believers, reprimanding them for hesitating to fight the disbelievers who broke their covenants, plotted to expel the Prophet from Makkah, and initiated hostilities against the Muslims first. He reminds them that if they are true believers, they should fear Allah more than fearing these disbelievers, for Allah is more deserving of being feared and obeyed.
orig: ألا تقاتلون قوما نكثوا أيمانهم وهموا بإخراج الرسول وهم بدءوكم أول مرة أتخشونهم فالله أحق أن تخشوه إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: Fight them; Allah will punish them by your hands and will disgrace them and give you victory over them and satisfy the breasts of a believing people.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a command to the believers to fight against the disbelievers and enemies of Islam. It promises that Allah will inflict punishment on them through the hands of the believers, humiliate them, grant victory to the believers, and bring contentment and satisfaction to the hearts of the believing people who have suffered at the hands of the enemies.
orig: قاتلوهم يعذبهم الله بأيديكم ويخزهم وينصركم عليهم ويشف صدور قوم مؤمنين

translation: And the rage departs from their hearts. And Allah pardons whom He wills. And Allah is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that true believers will have their anger and rage removed from their hearts by Allah's grace. It also affirms Allah's attribute of pardoning whomever He wills from among His servants, as He is the All-Knowing and All-Wise who judges perfectly.
orig: ويذهب غيظ قلوبهم ويتوب الله على من يشاء والله عليم حكيم

translation: Or do you think that you would be left alone while Allah has not yet made evident those among you who strive [for His cause] and do not take other than Allah, His Messenger and the believers as allies? And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse is questioning the believers if they thought they would be left at peace without being tested and distinguished from those who are sincere in their faith and struggle for the cause of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah will make evident those who truly strive in His path and do not take allies other than Allah, His Messenger, and the believers. Allah is fully aware of all that they do.
orig: أم حسبتم أن تتركوا ولما يعلم الله الذين جاهدوا منكم ولم يتخذوا من دون الله ولا رسوله ولا المؤمنين وليجة والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: It is not for the polytheists to maintain the mosques of Allah while they witness against themselves with disbelief. For them, their deeds have become worthless, and they will abide eternally in the Fire.
interpretation: This verse denies the polytheists the right to maintain or take care of the mosques of Allah, which are meant for the worship of the One True God. Their deeds of polytheism render all their efforts futile and worthless, and they will be condemned to eternal punishment in the Hellfire for rejecting faith and persisting in disbelief.
orig: ما كان للمشركين أن يعمروا مساجد الله شاهدين على أنفسهم بالكفر أولئك حبطت أعمالهم وفي النار هم خالدون

translation: The mosques of Allah are only to be maintained by those who believe in Allah and the Last Day, establish prayer, and give zakah and do not fear except Allah, for it is expected that those will be of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the true caretakers and maintainers of the mosques are those who have sincere faith in Allah and the Last Day, establish regular prayers, pay the obligatory charity (zakah), and fear none but Allah. Such believers are expected to be among the rightly guided ones who follow the straight path. The verse highlights the importance of faith, worship, charity, and sincere devotion to Allah as essential qualities for those entrusted with the upkeep and sanctity of mosques.
orig: إنما يعمر مساجد الله من آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وأقام الصلاة وآتى الزكاة ولم يخش إلا الله فعسى أولئك أن يكونوا من المهتدين

translation: Have you made the providing of water for the pilgrims and the maintenance of the Sacred Mosque equal to the one who believes in Allah and the Last Day and strives in the cause of Allah? They are not equal in the sight of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that performing good deeds like providing water for pilgrims and maintaining the Sacred Mosque is not equal to having true faith and striving in Allah's cause. True believers who have faith and struggle for Allah's religion are superior in the sight of Allah. The wrongdoers who lack faith and do not strive for Allah's cause will not be guided by Him.
orig: أجعلتم سقاية الحاج وعمارة المسجد الحرام كمن آمن بالله واليوم الآخر وجاهد في سبيل الله لا يستوون عند الله والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Those who have believed and emigrated and fought in the cause of Allah with their wealth and their lives are greater in degree in the sight of Allah, and it is those who are the attainers [of success].
interpretation: This verse highlights the high status and reward for those who have embraced faith, migrated for the sake of Allah, and strived with their wealth and lives in His cause. It emphasizes that such believers hold the greatest rank with Allah and are the true successful ones in the Hereafter. Their sacrifices and struggles for the sake of their faith are highly valued and rewarded by Allah.
orig: الذين آمنوا وهاجروا وجاهدوا في سبيل الله بأموالهم وأنفسهم أعظم درجة عند الله وأولئك هم الفائزون

translation: Their Lord gives them glad tidings of mercy from Him, and His good pleasure, and of gardens for them wherein is enduring pleasure
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah promises the believers a life of eternal bliss in Paradise. They will receive Allah's mercy, be pleased with Him, and dwell in gardens of everlasting delight. The "mercy" refers to Allah's forgiveness and blessings, while His "good pleasure" signifies His acceptance of their faith and deeds. The "gardens" symbolize the reward of Paradise with all its pleasures and comforts that will never end.
orig: يبشرهم ربهم برحمة منه ورضوان وجنات لهم فيها نعيم مقيم

translation: Abiding forever therein. Indeed, Allah has a great reward with Him.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that they will dwell forever in Paradise, which is the ultimate reward and honor granted by Allah to those who have faith and do righteous deeds. It emphasizes that with Allah there is a tremendous reward awaiting the believers, far greater than anything they can imagine in this world. This verse instills hope and encourages the believers to remain steadfast in their faith and good actions, knowing that an everlasting blissful life in the Hereafter awaits them.
orig: خالدين فيها أبدا إن الله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take your fathers or your brothers as allies if they have preferred disbelief over belief. And whoever is an ally to them among you - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers not to take their disbelieving fathers, brothers, or any close relatives as allies if they prefer disbelief over faith. Maintaining allegiance to disbelievers who reject faith is an act of wrongdoing and goes against the principles of Islam. The bond of faith supersedes blood relations when it comes to matters of belief and disbelief.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا آباءكم وإخوانكم أولياء إن استحبوا الكفر على الإيمان ومن يتولهم منكم فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: Say, 'If your fathers, your sons, your brothers, your wives, your relatives, wealth which you have acquired, commerce wherein you fear decline, and dwellings with which you are pleased are more beloved to you than Allah and His Messenger and jihad in His cause, then wait until Allah executes His command. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the supreme importance of faith in Allah and obedience to Him and His Messenger over all worldly attachments and desires. It warns believers that if they prioritize their family ties, wealth, business interests, or comfortable lifestyles over their devotion to Allah, His Messenger, and the struggle for His cause, they should be prepared to face the consequences of Allah's judgment. True guidance comes only from Allah, and those who defiantly disobey His commands will be deprived of His guidance.
orig: قل إن كان آباؤكم وأبناؤكم وإخوانكم وأزواجكم وعشيرتكم وأموال اقترفتموها وتجارة تخشون كسادها ومساكن ترضونها أحب إليكم من الله ورسوله وجهاد في سبيله فتربصوا حتى يأتي الله بأمره والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: Indeed, Allah has already helped you in many situations, including on the Day of Hunayn, when your great number pleased you, but it did not avail you at all, and the earth became constrained for you in spite of its vastness, and you turned your backs in retreat.
interpretation: The verse reminds the believers of Allah's favor upon them in granting them victory despite their weakness and small numbers, as was the case in the Battle of Hunayn. It highlights that relying on one's material strength and numbers alone is futile without faith and trust in Allah. The vastness of the earth could not aid them when they were overcome by fear and began to flee. It serves as a lesson in humility, recognizing one's complete dependence on Allah's support.
orig: لقد نصركم الله في مواطن كثيرة ويوم حنين إذ أعجبتكم كثرتكم فلم تغن عنكم شيئا وضاقت عليكم الأرض بما رحبت ثم وليتم مدبرين

translation: Then Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers, and sent down forces which you could not see, and punished those who disbelieved. And that is the recompense of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of Hunayn, where the Muslims initially faced setback but were ultimately victorious with Allah's help. The "tranquillity" mentioned is the spiritual peace and reassurance that Allah bestowed upon the believers. The "forces" are the angels that Allah sent to aid the Muslims. The disbelievers were punished for their rejection of faith, highlighting that denying Allah's truth has consequences.
orig: ثم أنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وأنزل جنودا لم تروها وعذب الذين كفروا وذلك جزاء الكافرين

translation: Then Allah will accept the repentance of whom He wills; and Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and wisdom. It indicates that after the Day of Judgment, Allah will forgive whomever He wills from among the believers who sincerely repented. The decision of whose repentance to accept lies solely with Allah based on His perfect knowledge and wisdom. This underscores the importance of sincere repentance in this life and Allah's boundless forgiveness and compassion for those who turn to Him.
orig: ثم يتوب الله من بعد ذلك على من يشاء والله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, indeed the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this, their [final] year. And if you fear privation, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse establishes a prohibition for the polytheists to approach the Sacred Mosque in Makkah after the final period granted to them. It signifies the purification of the Sacred Mosque from the filth of polytheism and idolatry. The believers are reassured that if they fear poverty due to the loss of trade with the polytheists, Allah will compensate them through His infinite bounties and provisions, for He is All-Knowing and All-Wise in His decisions and decrees.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إنما المشركون نجس فلا يقربوا المسجد الحرام بعد عامهم هذا وإن خفتم عيلة فسوف يغنيكم الله من فضله إن شاء إن الله عليم حكيم

translation: Fight those who do not believe in Allah nor the Last Day, nor forbid what Allah and His Messenger have forbidden, nor embrace the religion of truth, from among those who were given the Scripture, until they pay the jizyah with willing submission and feel themselves subdued.
interpretation: "This verse instructs Muslims to fight against those who reject faith in Allah and the Last Day, do not follow the prohibitions ordained by Allah and His Messenger, and do not embrace the true religion of Islam - specifically referring to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who were given divine scriptures. However, it allows for peaceful coexistence if they pay the jizyah tax and acknowledge the authority of the Muslim state while living under its protection."
orig: قاتلوا الذين لا يؤمنون بالله ولا باليوم الآخر ولا يحرمون ما حرم الله ورسوله ولا يدينون دين الحق من الذين أوتوا الكتاب حتى يعطوا الجزية عن يد وهم صاغرون

translation: The Jews say, "Ezra is the son of Allah," and the Christians say, "The Messiah is the son of Allah." That is their statement from their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse addresses the false beliefs held by Jews and Christians regarding the status of Ezra and Jesus, peace be upon them, as "sons of God." It condemns such claims as a form of disbelief, likening them to the statements of previous disbelievers. The verse emphasizes that these are mere utterances from their mouths, imitating earlier misguided people. It invokes Allah's curse upon them for their delusion and deviation from the truth.
orig: وقالت اليهود عزير ابن الله وقالت النصارى المسيح ابن الله ذلك قولهم بأفواههم يضاهئون قول الذين كفروا من قبل قاتلهم الله أنى يؤفكون

translation: They have taken their rabbis and monks as lords besides Allah, and the Messiah, son of Mary; though they were commanded to worship but One God, there is no god but He, glorified be He from what they associate!
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who blindly follow religious leaders and give them the status of lords besides Allah. It emphasizes that true worship should be directed solely to Allah, and associating partners with Him is a form of shirk (polytheism) that goes against the core teachings of Islam.
orig: اتخذوا أحبارهم ورهبانهم أربابا من دون الله والمسيح ابن مريم وما أمروا إلا ليعبدوا إلها واحدا لا إله إلا هو سبحانه عما يشركون

translation: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah refuses except to perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: The disbelievers try to extinguish the religion of Islam and the guidance that Allah has revealed by speaking against it and mocking it. However, Allah insists on completing His light and making His religion prevail, despite the disbelievers" opposition and hatred towards it.
orig: يريدون أن يطفئوا نور الله بأفواههم ويأبى الله إلا أن يتم نوره ولو كره الكافرون

translation: It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over all [other] religions, even though the polytheists dislike it.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah sent the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, with the message of Islam - the true religion that guides people to the straight path. The purpose is for Islam to prevail over all other religions and ways of life, despite the opposition and dislike of the polytheists and disbelievers. It signifies the ultimate triumph of the truth over falsehood.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed many of the Jewish scholars and the Christian monks devour the wealth of people unjustly and avert [them] from the way of Allah . And those who hoard gold and silver and spend it not in the way of Allah - give them tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against the corrupt practices of some religious leaders who exploit people's wealth unjustly and misguide them from Allah's path. It also condemns hoarding wealth and not spending it in righteous causes, promising a painful punishment for those who do so.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن كثيرا من الأحبار والرهبان ليأكلون أموال الناس بالباطل ويصدون عن سبيل الله والذين يكنزون الذهب والفضة ولا ينفقونها في سبيل الله فبشرهم بعذاب أليم

translation: The Day they will be dragged into the Fire of Hell on their faces, [it will be said], 'Taste the touch of Hell.'
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits the disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. They will be dragged into the blazing fire of Hell, and their faces, sides, and backs will be seared by its intense heat. This torment is a consequence of their own actions, as they accumulated and hoarded wealth in this world instead of spending it in obedience to Allah. The phrase "Taste the touch of Hell" is a stern rebuke, indicating that they will experience the full intensity of Hell's punishment as a result of their greed and disbelief.
orig: يوم يحمى عليها في نار جهنم فتكوى بها جباههم وجنوبهم وظهورهم هذا ما كنزتم لأنفسكم فذوقوا ما كنتم تكنزون

translation: Indeed, the number of months with Allah is twelve [lunar] months in the register of Allah [from] the day He created the heavens and the earth; of these, four are sacred. That is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them. And fight against the disbelievers collectively as they fight against you collectively. And know that Allah is with the righteous [who fear Him].
interpretation: This verse establishes the Islamic calendar as consisting of twelve lunar months, four of which are sacred months in which fighting is prohibited except in self-defense. It commands the believers to fight against the disbelievers collectively as they fight against the believers collectively, but reminds them that Allah is with the righteous who fear Him.
orig: إن عدة الشهور عند الله اثنا عشر شهرا في كتاب الله يوم خلق السماوات والأرض منها أربعة حرم ذلك الدين القيم فلا تظلموا فيهن أنفسكم وقاتلوا المشركين كافة كما يقاتلونكم كافة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: Verily, the postponing (of the Sacred Months) is an addition to disbelief: thereby the disbelievers are led astray, for they allow it one year and forbid it another year, that they may agree with the number (of months) that Allah has made sacred, thus making allowable what Allah has forbidden.
interpretation: This verse condemns the pagan Arab practice of postponing the sacred months to allow warfare during those months, which was forbidden. It states that this "postponing" is an addition to disbelief that leads the disbelievers further astray. They would sometimes allow warfare during a sacred month one year, then forbid it the next year, violating the sanctity that Allah had decreed for those months. This manipulation to suit their desires made allowable what Allah had forbidden, and their evil deeds were made appealing to them. However, Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
orig: إنما النسيء زيادة في الكفر يضل به الذين كفروا يحلونه عاما ويحرمونه عاما ليواطئوا عدة ما حرم الله فيحلوا ما حرم الله زين لهم سوء أعمالهم والله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: O you who believe! What is the matter with you, that when you are asked to march forth in the Cause of Allah (i.e. Jihad) you cling heavily to the earth? Are you pleased with the life of this world rather than the Hereafter? But little is the enjoyment of the life of this world as compared with the Hereafter.
interpretation: "This verse is addressing the believers, questioning their reluctance to participate in jihad (struggle in the cause of Allah) when called upon. It rebukes those who cling heavily to the worldly life and prefer its temporary pleasures over the everlasting rewards of the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes that the enjoyment of this worldly life is insignificant and short-lived compared to the eternal bliss of the Hereafter. It encourages the believers to prioritize their spiritual pursuits and strive for the sake of Allah, rather than being attached to the fleeting comforts of this world."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا ما لكم إذا قيل لكم انفروا في سبيل الله اثاقلتم إلى الأرض أرضيتم بالحياة الدنيا من الآخرة فما متاع الحياة الدنيا في الآخرة إلا قليل

translation: But if you turn away, He will punish you with a painful punishment and will replace you with another people, and you will not harm Him at all. And Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to the believers to not turn away from obeying Allah and His Messenger. If they do so, Allah will inflict a severe punishment upon them and replace them with another people who will obey Him. The verse emphasizes that no one can cause any harm to Allah, for He is All-Powerful and has absolute control over all affairs.
orig: إلا تنفروا يعذبكم عذابا أليما ويستبدل قوما غيركم ولا تضروه شيئا والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: If you do not aid the Prophet - Allah has already aided him when those who disbelieved had driven him out [of Makkah] as one of two, when they were in the cave and he said to his companion, 'Do not grieve; indeed Allah is with us.' And Allah sent down His tranquillity upon him and supported him with soldiers you did not see and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah - that is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: إن هذه الآية تشير إلى حادثة الهجرة النبوية من مكة إلى المدينة، حيث كان النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم ورفيقه أبو بكر الصديق رضي الله عنه في الغار، ويؤكد الله تعالى أنه معهما ويؤيدهما ويحميهما من الكافرين. كما تشير إلى نصر الله للنبي وإعلاء كلمته على كلمة الكافرين، مهما بلغت قوتهم وكيدهم.
orig: إلا تنصروه فقد نصره الله إذ أخرجه الذين كفروا ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن إن الله معنا فأنزل الله سكينته عليه وأيده بجنود لم تروها وجعل كلمة الذين كفروا السفلى وكلمة الله هي العليا والله عزيز حكيم

translation: Enlist, light and heavy, and strive with your wealth and your lives in the cause of Allah. That is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: This verse encourages Muslims to participate in jihad (struggle) for the cause of Allah with all their resources, whether they are physically capable or not. It emphasizes the importance of striving with one's wealth and life in the path of Allah, as this is beneficial for the believers if they truly understand the reward and virtue in it.
orig: انفروا خفافا وثقالا وجاهدوا بأموالكم وأنفسكم في سبيل الله ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: If it had been a near gain and a short journey, they would have followed you; but the distance was too great for them. Yet they will swear by Allah, 'If we had been able, we would have gone forth with you,' destroying themselves, and Allah knows that they are liars.
interpretation: Allah is describing the hypocrites who make excuses not to join the Prophet in battle. If the gain was easy and the journey short, they would have joined. But since the journey was long and difficult, they made false oaths that they would have joined if they could, when in reality they are lying and have no intention of sacrificing for the cause of Allah.
orig: لو كان عرضا قريبا وسفرا قاصدا لاتبعوك ولكن بعدت عليهم الشقة وسيحلفون بالله لو استطعنا لخرجنا معكم يهلكون أنفسهم والله يعلم إنهم لكاذبون

translation: May Allah pardon you, [O Muhammad]. Why did you give them permission [to remain behind] until became evident to you who were truthful and you knew [who were] the liars?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) regarding an incident where he excused some people from participating in a battle without verifying their claims. The interpretation is that Allah is forgiving the Prophet for granting permission to those who claimed to have excuses without thoroughly investigating the truthfulness of their claims. It serves as a lesson to distinguish between the truthful and the liars before making such decisions.
orig: عفا الله عنك لم أذنت لهم حتى يتبين لك الذين صدقوا وتعلم الكاذبين

translation: Those who believe in Allah and the Last Day would not ask your permission to strive with their wealth and their lives. And Allah is All-Aware of those who have Taqwa (piety).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the strong faith and commitment of true believers. They do not seek permission to make sacrifices and strive in Allah's cause with their wealth and lives, for they are driven by their unwavering belief in Allah and the Day of Judgment. Their actions stem from a deep sense of piety and consciousness of Allah, who is fully aware of those who possess Taqwa.
orig: لا يستأذنك الذين يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم والله عليم بالمتقين

translation: Only those who do not believe in Allah and the Last Day ask your permission [O Muhammad], while their hearts are in doubt, and they waver in their doubt.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the hypocrites who outwardly claimed to be Muslim but inwardly harbored doubts and disbelief. They would make excuses and seek permission from the Prophet to be exempted from certain obligations, revealing their lack of true faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment. Their hearts were filled with doubt and uncertainty, causing them to vacillate in their state of doubt.
orig: إنما يستأذنك الذين لا يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر وارتابت قلوبهم فهم في ريبهم يترددون

translation: And if they had intended to go forth, they would have prepared for it some provision. But Allah disliked their being sent forth, so He made them linger, and it was said, "Remain you with those who remain behind."
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who did not participate in the battle and claimed they would have gone if they were prepared. Allah exposed their insincerity by saying that if they truly intended to go, they would have made the necessary preparations. However, Allah did not want them to join the believers because their presence would have caused harm and discord. So Allah caused them to hesitate and remain behind with those who stayed back from the battle without a valid excuse.
orig: ولو أرادوا الخروج لأعدوا له عدة ولكن كره الله انبعاثهم فثبطهم وقيل اقعدوا مع القاعدين

translation: If they were to go forth among you, they would add to you nothing except trouble, and would hurry to and fro among you, seeking to cause sedition among you; and among you there are some who would listen to them. And Allah is Aware of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers against hypocrites and their malicious intentions. It states that if the hypocrites were to participate in the affairs of the believers, they would only bring harm, mischief, and sedition. They would actively seek to create discord and disunity among the believers, exploiting those who are naive or weak in faith. However, Allah is fully aware of those who spread corruption and act unjustly.
orig: لو خرجوا فيكم ما زادوكم إلا خبالا ولأوضعوا خلالكم يبغونكم الفتنة وفيكم سماعون لهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: They had sought [to cause] dissension before and had upset matters for you until the truth came and the command of Allah became evident, while they were averse.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers and hypocrites who tried to create discord and turmoil among the Muslims. They stirred up troubles and spread rumors to undermine the faith and unity of the believers. However, their plots failed as the truth became manifest, and Allah's command prevailed despite their aversion and opposition.
orig: لقد ابتغوا الفتنة من قبل وقلبوا لك الأمور حتى جاء الحق وظهر أمر الله وهم كارهون

translation: And among them is he who says, "Permit me and do not put me to trial." Unquestionably, they have fallen into trial. And indeed, Hellfire will encompass the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who asked to be excused from participating in jihad, fearing that they would be tempted by the worldly gains of war and thus expose their true lack of faith. However, by seeking exemption, they have already fallen into a trial of their faith. The verse warns that Hellfire awaits those who disbelieve and reject the call to defend the religion.
orig: ومنهم من يقول ائذن لي ولا تفتني ألا في الفتنة سقطوا وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they say, 'We took our matter in advance' and turn away while they are rejoicing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who are displeased when the believers attain any good or blessing, and rejoice and become arrogant when the believers face any harm or difficulty. It exposes their malicious attitude and lack of sincerity towards the believers.
orig: إن تصبك حسنة تسؤهم وإن تصبك مصيبة يقولوا قد أخذنا أمرنا من قبل ويتولوا وهم فرحون

translation: Say, 'Never will we be struck except by what Allah has decreed for us; He is our protector.' And upon Allah let the believers put their trust.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the belief in divine decree (qadar) and encourages the believers to have complete trust in Allah. It teaches that whatever happens to us, good or bad, is predetermined by Allah's will and wisdom. Our role is to accept it with patience and faith, and to rely solely on Allah for protection and guidance. The verse instills a sense of contentment and submission to the divine plan, while motivating the believers to strengthen their trust and dependence on their Lord.
orig: قل لن يصيبنا إلا ما كتب الله لنا هو مولانا وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: Say, "Do you await for us except one of the two best things [i.e., martyrdom or victory], while we await for you that Allah will afflict you with punishment from Himself or at our hands? So await; indeed we, along with you, are awaiting."
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad to tell the disbelievers that the believers are awaiting one of the two best outcomes: either martyrdom in the cause of Allah, which will lead to eternal bliss in Paradise, or victory over their enemies. On the other hand, the disbelievers should expect punishment from Allah or at the hands of the believers. The verse emphasizes that both parties are waiting and watching, but the believers are prepared for either outcome while hoping for Allah's aid and victory.
orig: قل هل تربصون بنا إلا إحدى الحسنيين ونحن نتربص بكم أن يصيبكم الله بعذاب من عنده أو بأيدينا فتربصوا إنا معكم متربصون

translation: Say: 'Spend willingly or unwillingly, it will not be accepted from you. Indeed, you have been a defiantly disobedient people.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true faith and obedience to God must come from a sincere heart, not out of compulsion or mere formality. Charitable spending or any other act of worship done unwillingly or grudgingly will not be accepted by God, as He looks at the intentions behind actions. The verse is addressing those who lacked true faith and were rebellious against God's commands.
orig: قل أنفقوا طوعا أو كرها لن يتقبل منكم إنكم كنتم قوما فاسقين

translation: And what prevented their expenditures from being accepted from them but that they disbelieved in Allah and in His Messenger and they did not approach prayer except while they were lazy and they did not spend except while they were unwilling.
interpretation: This verse explains the reasons why the expenditures and good deeds of some people are not accepted by Allah. It is because they have disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, they perform prayers lazily without devotion, and they spend in charity unwillingly and grudgingly. True faith, sincerity, and willingness are essential for one's deeds to be accepted by Allah.
orig: وما منعهم أن تقبل منهم نفقاتهم إلا أنهم كفروا بالله وبرسوله ولا يأتون الصلاة إلا وهم كسالى ولا ينفقون إلا وهم كارهون

translation: So let not their wealth or their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world, and that their souls should depart while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is warning the believers not to be impressed or misled by the wealth and children of the disbelievers. These worldly possessions are temporary and will ultimately lead to their punishment in this life and the Hereafter. The disbelievers' souls will depart in a state of disbelief, which is the greatest loss.
orig: فلا تعجبك أموالهم ولا أولادهم إنما يريد الله ليعذبهم بها في الحياة الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And they swear by Allah that they are truly of you, yet they are not of you, but they are people who are ever apprehensive.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly claimed to be Muslims but inwardly harbored disbelief and enmity towards the believers. They would swear by Allah that they were part of the Muslim community, but their actions betrayed their true nature. They were in a state of constant fear and apprehension, unable to fully commit to either belief or disbelief.
orig: ويحلفون بالله إنهم لمنكم وما هم منكم ولكنهم قوم يفرقون

translation: If they could find a refuge or some caves or even a crevice, they would turn towards it, still overflowing with rage.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant and obstinate disbelievers who reject the truth. It implies that if they had any opportunity to escape from the truth, such as finding a refuge, cave, or crevice, they would rush towards it while still being in a state of rage and stubbornness. Their rejection of the truth is not due to a lack of understanding, but rather a result of their arrogance and unwillingness to accept it.
orig: لو يجدون ملجأ أو مغارات أو مدخلا لولوا إليه وهم يجمحون

translation: And among them are those who criticize you concerning the [distribution of] charities. If they are given from them, they approve; but if they are not given from them, at once they become enraged.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who were critical of how the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) distributed charity and zakat (obligatory alms). If they received a share, they were pleased, but if they did not receive anything, they became displeased and angry. This exposes their greed and lack of sincere faith, as they were more concerned with worldly gains than pleasing Allah.
orig: ومنهم من يلمزك في الصدقات فإن أعطوا منها رضوا وإن لم يعطوا منها إذا هم يسخطون

translation: But if only they had been satisfied with what Allah and His Messenger gave them and had said, 'Sufficient for us is Allah; Allah will give us of His bounty, and [so will] His Messenger; to Allah we humbly turn our hopes,'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the greed and dissatisfaction of some people who were not content with what Allah and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) had given them. It encourages people to be satisfied with what they have been granted, trust in Allah's provision, and turn to Him with hope and humility, rather than being consumed by greed and worldly desires.
orig: ولو أنهم رضوا ما آتاهم الله ورسوله وقالوا حسبنا الله سيؤتينا الله من فضله ورسوله إنا إلى الله راغبون

translation: Indeed, the charities are only for the poor and the needy, and those who work on [collecting] them, and those whose hearts are to be reconciled, and for [freeing] those in bondage, and for the debt-ridden, and in the cause of Allah, and for the [stranded] traveler - an obligation from Allah. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse outlines the categories of people who are entitled to receive zakat (obligatory charity). It emphasizes that zakat is a religious obligation prescribed by Allah, and its distribution should be carried out with wisdom and knowledge. The verse highlights the importance of supporting the less fortunate, reconciling hearts to Islam, freeing captives, assisting those in debt, funding efforts in the cause of Allah, and helping stranded travelers.
orig: إنما الصدقات للفقراء والمساكين والعاملين عليها والمؤلفة قلوبهم وفي الرقاب والغارمين وفي سبيل الله وابن السبيل فريضة من الله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among them are those who abuse the Prophet and say, 'He is all ear.' Say, 'He listens to what is best for you; he believes in Allah and has faith in the believers; and he is a mercy for those of you who believe.' But those who abuse the Messenger of Allah will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse addresses the mockery of some hypocrites towards the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They claimed he was gullible and would believe anything said to him. However, the Qur'an affirms that the Prophet only listens to what is beneficial and has faith in Allah and the believers. He is a mercy for the true believers. Those who insult the Prophet will face a severe punishment for their disrespect.
orig: ومنهم الذين يؤذون النبي ويقولون هو أذن قل أذن خير لكم يؤمن بالله ويؤمن للمؤمنين ورحمة للذين آمنوا منكم والذين يؤذون رسول الله لهم عذاب أليم

translation: They swear by Allah to you to please you, but Allah and His Messenger have more right that they should please Him, if they are believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who would swear by Allah to please the believers, but their true allegiance should have been to Allah and His Messenger if they were sincere in their faith. It emphasizes the importance of pleasing Allah and following the guidance of the Prophet over pleasing people, if one truly claims to be a believer.
orig: يحلفون بالله لكم ليرضوكم والله ورسوله أحق أن يرضوه إن كانوا مؤمنين

translation: Do they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger, for him is the fire of Hell, abiding therein forever? That is the great disgrace.
interpretation: This verse warns those who defy Allah and reject His Messenger that they will be punished with the eternal torment of Hellfire. It emphasizes the grave consequence of opposing the truth and highlights the disgraceful state of those who persist in disbelief and disobedience to Allah and His Messenger.
orig: ألم يعلموا أنه من يحادد الله ورسوله فأن له نار جهنم خالدا فيها ذلك الخزي العظيم

translation: The hypocrites fear lest a surah be revealed about them, informing them of what is in their hearts. Say, "Mock [as you wish]; indeed, Allah will expose that which you fear."
interpretation: This verse warns the hypocrites, those who outwardly professed faith but inwardly harbored disbelief and ill intentions towards the Prophet and the Muslim community. They feared that a chapter of the Qur'an would expose the reality of their hearts, revealing their true motives and doubts. The verse instructs the Prophet to tell them to mock and ridicule as they wish, for Allah will inevitably bring to light the very things they fear being exposed, their hypocrisy and hidden disbelief.
orig: يحذر المنافقون أن تنزل عليهم سورة تنبئهم بما في قلوبهم قل استهزئوا إن الله مخرج ما تحذرون

translation: And if you ask them, they will surely say, 'We were only conversing and playing.' Say, 'Is it Allah and His verses and His Messenger that you were mocking?'
interpretation: This verse condemns the mocking attitude of the disbelievers towards the teachings of Islam and the Messenger. They would claim that they were just joking or playing around, but the Qur'an asserts that mocking Allah, His revelations, and His Messenger is a grave sin that should not be taken lightly. It warns against making a mockery of sacred things under the pretext of casual conversation or play.
orig: ولئن سألتهم ليقولن إنما كنا نخوض ونلعب قل أبالله وآياته ورسوله كنتم تستهزئون

translation: Make no excuse; you have disbelieved after your belief. If We pardon one faction of you - We will punish another faction because they were criminals.
interpretation: This verse addresses those who renounced their faith after having believed. It warns them that making excuses for their disbelief will not be accepted. If Allah pardons one group of them, He will still punish another group for their crime of rejecting faith after having accepted it. The verse emphasizes the gravity of apostasy and that there will be consequences for such a grave sin.
orig: لا تعتذروا قد كفرتم بعد إيمانكم إن نعف عن طائفة منكم نعذب طائفة بأنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: The hypocrite men and hypocrite women are of one another. They enjoin what is wrong and forbid what is right and withhold their hands. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them. Indeed, the hypocrites - it is they who are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse describes the characteristics and behavior of hypocrites (munafiqun). They encourage each other to do evil deeds and prevent righteousness. They are miserly and withhold spending in the way of Allah. By forgetting Allah's commands, they have been forsaken by Him. Ultimately, the hypocrites are declared to be flagrantly disobedient to Allah.
orig: المنافقون والمنافقات بعضهم من بعض يأمرون بالمنكر وينهون عن المعروف ويقبضون أيديهم نسوا الله فنسيهم إن المنافقين هم الفاسقون

translation: Allah has promised the hypocrites, men and women, and the disbelievers, the fire of Hell, wherein they will abide eternally. It is sufficient for them. And Allah has cursed them, and for them is an enduring punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the hypocrites, both men and women, and the disbelievers that Allah has promised them the punishment of Hell, where they will remain forever. This punishment is a fitting recompense for their disbelief and hypocrisy. Additionally, Allah has cursed them and decreed for them a lasting torment, indicating their severe and eternal punishment.
orig: وعد الله المنافقين والمنافقات والكفار نار جهنم خالدين فيها هي حسبهم ولعنهم الله ولهم عذاب مقيم

translation: Like those before you who were mightier than you in strength, and more abundant in wealth and children. They had enjoyed their portion awhile, so you have enjoyed your portion awhile as those before you enjoyed their portion awhile, and you indulged in idle talk as they indulged in idle talk. These are they whose works have been rendered null in this world and the Hereafter, and it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne que les incroyants de cette époque sont comme ceux des générations précédentes qui étaient plus forts et plus riches qu'eux.
