Ils ont profité de leurs biens terrestres pendant un certain temps, tout comme les incroyants actuels en profitent. Cependant, leurs actions ont été vaines dans cette vie et dans l'au-delà, et ils sont les véritables perdants car ils ont gaspillé leur temps dans des futilités au lieu d'adorer Dieu.
orig: كالذين من قبلكم كانوا أشد منكم قوة وأكثر أموالا وأولادا فاستمتعوا بخلاقهم فاستمتعتم بخلاقكم كما استمتع الذين من قبلكم بخلاقهم وخضتم كالذي خاضوا أولئك حبطت أعمالهم في الدنيا والآخرة وأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Has there not reached them the news of those before them - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and the people of Abraham and the companions of Madyan and the towns overthrown? Their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would never have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.
interpretation: This verse reminds the disbelievers of the fate of previous nations who rejected their messengers and denied the signs of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah does not wrong anyone; rather, people wrong themselves by rejecting faith and disobeying the messengers. The "towns overthrown" refers to the people of Lut whose cities were destroyed due to their sinful practices.
orig: ألم يأتهم نبأ الذين من قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود وقوم إبراهيم وأصحاب مدين والمؤتفكات أتتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: The believing men and believing women are allies of one another. They enjoin what is right and forbid what is evil; they establish prayer and give zakah, and they obey Allah and His Messenger. Those - Allah will have mercy upon them. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse describes the close bond and mutual support between believing men and women. They encourage righteousness, forbid evil, establish prayer, give obligatory charity, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah promises to have mercy on those who possess these qualities, for He is Almighty and Perfectly Wise.
orig: والمؤمنون والمؤمنات بعضهم أولياء بعض يأمرون بالمعروف وينهون عن المنكر ويقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة ويطيعون الله ورسوله أولئك سيرحمهم الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: Allah has promised the believers, men and women, gardens under which rivers flow to dwell therein forever, and beautiful mansions in gardens of everlasting bliss. But the greatest bliss is the good pleasure of Allah: that is the supreme success.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers eternal bliss in Paradise, where they will reside in lush gardens with rivers flowing beneath and beautiful dwellings. However, the greatest reward is attaining the pleasure of Allah, which is the ultimate success and triumph that supersedes all other blessings.
orig: وعد الله المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ومساكن طيبة في جنات عدن ورضوان من الله أكبر ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: O Prophet, strive hard against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh upon them. Their abode is Hell - a hapless journey's end.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to wage jihad, or strive, against the disbelievers and hypocrites through spiritual, intellectual, and physical means. It instructs him to be firm and unyielding towards them, as their ultimate destination is Hellfire - a terrible and miserable end - if they persist in their disbelief and hypocrisy.
orig: يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم ومأواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: They swear by Allah that they did not say [anything against the Prophet] while they had said the word of disbelief and disbelieved after their [pretense of] Islam and intended that which they were not to attain. And they were not resentful except that Allah and His Messenger had enriched them of His bounty. So if they repent, it is better for them; but if they turn away, Allah will punish them with a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And there will not be for them on earth any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly professed Islam but inwardly harbored disbelief and ill intentions towards the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and the Muslim community. They swore falsely that they did not utter words of disbelief, but in reality they had spoken such words after pretending to accept Islam. They intended to act against the Prophet ﷺ and the believers, but were unable to achieve their malicious goals. Their resentment stemmed from the fact that Allah had enriched the Prophet ﷺ and the believers with His bounties. If they repent sincerely, it will be better for them, but if they persist in their hypocrisy and opposition, Allah will subject them to a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no protector or helper against Allah's punishment.
orig: يحلفون بالله ما قالوا ولقد قالوا كلمة الكفر وكفروا بعد إسلامهم وهموا بما لم ينالوا وما نقموا إلا أن أغناهم الله ورسوله من فضله فإن يتوبوا يك خيرا لهم وإن يتولوا يعذبهم الله عذابا أليما في الدنيا والآخرة وما لهم في الأرض من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And among them are those who made a covenant with Allah, [saying], 'If He should give us from His bounty, we will surely spend in charity, and we will surely be among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who made promises to Allah that if He blessed them with wealth, they would spend in charity and become righteous. However, when Allah granted them wealth, they broke their promise and became miserly, failing to fulfill their covenant with Allah. This highlights the importance of keeping one's word, especially when making promises to Allah, and the need to be sincere in one's faith and actions.
orig: ومنهم من عاهد الله لئن آتانا من فضله لنصدقن ولنكونن من الصالحين

translation: But when He gave them out of His Bounty, they became niggardly with it and turned away, averse.
interpretation: This verse is reproaching the disbelievers for their ingratitude towards Allah's favors and blessings. When Allah granted them wealth and provisions out of His grace, instead of being thankful and spending in His cause, they became miserly and stingy. They turned away from obedience to Allah and His commandments, refusing to acknowledge His favors upon them.
orig: فلما آتاهم من فضله بخلوا به وتولوا وهم معرضون

translation: So He penalized them with hypocrisy in their hearts until the Day they will meet Him - because they failed to fulfill the promise they had made to Allah and because they used to lie.
interpretation: Allah punished those who broke their covenant with hypocrisy and doubt in their hearts, which will remain with them until they meet Him on the Day of Resurrection. This is a consequence for going back on their word to Allah and for constantly rejecting the truth and persisting in falsehood.
orig: فأعقبهم نفاقا في قلوبهم إلى يوم يلقونه بما أخلفوا الله ما وعدوه وبما كانوا يكذبون

translation: Do they not know that Allah knows their secret and their private conversations, and that Allah is the All-Knower of the unseen?
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of all secrets and private conversations, even those hidden from others. It emphasizes Allah's infinite knowledge, encompassing even the unseen and the most concealed thoughts and actions. This awareness should instill a sense of accountability and consciousness of Allah's presence in every aspect of one's life.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله يعلم سرهم ونجواهم وأن الله علام الغيوب

translation: Those who criticize the believers who give charity voluntarily, and mock those who find nothing [to spend] except their effort, for them Allah will mock, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who mock or belittle the believers who give charity according to their means. It warns that Allah will mock and punish those who ridicule the sincere efforts of others to do good deeds and give charity, even if their contributions are small due to limited resources. The verse teaches respect for charitable acts, no matter how small, and forbids mocking the efforts of others to please Allah.
orig: الذين يلمزون المطوعين من المؤمنين في الصدقات والذين لا يجدون إلا جهدهم فيسخرون منهم سخر الله منهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them - even if you ask forgiveness for them seventy times - never will Allah forgive them. That is because they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, and Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will not forgive those who disbelieved in Him and His Messenger, even if the Prophet Muhammad asked for forgiveness for them seventy times. Their disbelief and defiance against Allah and His Messenger has made them ineligible for Allah's forgiveness and guidance. It emphasizes the grave sin of disbelief and disobedience towards Allah and His Messenger.
orig: استغفر لهم أو لا تستغفر لهم إن تستغفر لهم سبعين مرة فلن يغفر الله لهم ذلك بأنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: Those who were left behind rejoiced in their staying [at home] after [the departure of] the Messenger of Allah and disliked to strive with their wealth and their lives in the cause of Allah and said, 'Do not go forth in the heat.' Say, 'The fire of Hell is more intense in heat' - if they could but understand.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who refused to join the military expedition and preferred to stay behind in comfort, avoiding striving with their wealth and lives for the cause of Allah. It condemns their excuse of not wanting to march in the heat, stating that the fire of Hell is far hotter - if only they could comprehend the severity of Allah's punishment for their disobedience.
orig: فرح المخلفون بمقعدهم خلاف رسول الله وكرهوا أن يجاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم في سبيل الله وقالوا لا تنفروا في الحر قل نار جهنم أشد حرا لو كانوا يفقهون

translation: So let them laugh a little and weep much as a recompense for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who disbelieved and mocked the truth will have a brief period of enjoyment in this world, but in the Hereafter, they will face immense sorrow and suffering as a consequence of their deeds. The "little laughter" refers to the temporary pleasures they indulged in, while the "much weeping" signifies the eternal punishment they will endure for rejecting faith and engaging in sinful acts.
orig: فليضحكوا قليلا وليبكوا كثيرا جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: But if Allah should return you to a group of them [who had remained behind] and they request your permission to go out [to battle], then say, 'You will never go out with me, ever, and you will never fight any enemy with me. You were satisfied to remain behind the first time, so remain with those who stay behind.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تحذر المنافقين الذين تخلفوا عن الجهاد بعد أن طلبوا الإذن للخروج. يأمر الله نبيه محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم بأن يقول لهم إنهم لن يخرجوا معه أبدًا ولن يقاتلوا معه أي عدو، لأنهم رضوا بالبقاء خلف الجيش في المرة الأولى، فليبقوا مع الخالفين الذين لا يرغبون في الجهاد.
orig: فإن رجعك الله إلى طائفة منهم فاستأذنوك للخروج فقل لن تخرجوا معي أبدا ولن تقاتلوا معي عدوا إنكم رضيتم بالقعود أول مرة فاقعدوا مع الخالفين

translation: And do not pray over any one of them who has died - ever, nor stand at his grave. Indeed, they disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger and died while they were defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the Prophet Muhammad and the believers from praying for the forgiveness of disbelievers or attending their funerals. It emphasizes that those who reject faith in Allah and His Messenger, and die in a state of defiant disobedience, are not worthy of such prayers or honors. The interpretation highlights the severity of disbelief and the consequences it entails in the Hereafter.
orig: ولا تصل على أحد منهم مات أبدا ولا تقم على قبره إنهم كفروا بالله ورسوله وماتوا وهم فاسقون

translation: And let not their wealth and their children impress you. Allah only intends to punish them through them in this world, and that their souls depart while they are disbelievers.
interpretation: "This verse warns the believers not to be impressed or envious of the wealth and children of the disbelievers. It reminds us that these worldly possessions are a means of punishment for them in this life, as they become attached to them and neglect their duty to Allah. Ultimately, their souls will depart from this world while they are in a state of disbelief, having wasted their opportunity to attain true success."
orig: ولا تعجبك أموالهم وأولادهم إنما يريد الله أن يعذبهم بها في الدنيا وتزهق أنفسهم وهم كافرون

translation: And when a surah is revealed [enjoining] to believe in Allah and to strive hard along with His Messenger, the wealthy among them ask your leave and say, 'Leave us to be with those who remain behind.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who, when a chapter of the Qur'an was revealed calling for faith and struggle in the cause of Allah, sought exemption from joining the battle. Their lack of commitment to the cause and their desire to remain with those who stayed behind and avoided striving exposed their hypocrisy and weakness of faith.
orig: وإذا أنزلت سورة أن آمنوا بالله وجاهدوا مع رسوله استأذنك أولو الطول منهم وقالوا ذرنا نكن مع القاعدين

translation: They are content to be with those who lag behind, and their hearts are sealed, so they do not understand.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who choose to remain ignorant and follow the misguided, even though the truth has been made clear to them. Their hearts have become hardened and sealed, preventing them from comprehending the guidance and wisdom presented to them. They willingly remain in a state of ignorance and misguidance, content with their lack of understanding.
orig: رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون

translation: But the Messenger and those who believed with him strive with their wealth and their lives. Those will have the good things, and it is they who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense sacrifices and efforts made by the Prophet Muhammad and his companions in striving for the cause of Islam. It emphasizes that true success and blessings are attained by those who dedicate their wealth and lives to the path of faith, just as the Prophet and his companions did. Their selfless struggle and unwavering commitment are praised, and they are promised the ultimate reward of attaining prosperity and salvation.
orig: لكن الرسول والذين آمنوا معه جاهدوا بأموالهم وأنفسهم وأولئك لهم الخيرات وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: Allah has promised them gardens under which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers eternal bliss in Paradise, which is described as gardens with rivers flowing beneath them. The "great attainment" refers to the ultimate success and reward of entering Jannah (Paradise), which is the highest achievement and the most precious gift that Allah can bestow upon His faithful servants.
orig: أعد الله لهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And the desert Arabs came with excuses to be exempted, while those who denied Allah and His Messenger remained behind. A painful punishment will afflict those of them who disbelieved.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident of the battle of Tabuk, where some desert Arabs came with excuses to be exempted from joining the Muslim army, while the hypocrites who disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger remained behind without any valid excuse. It warns that those who disbelieved and did not join the Muslim forces will face a painful punishment for their disobedience and lack of faith.
orig: وجاء المعذرون من الأعراب ليؤذن لهم وقعد الذين كذبوا الله ورسوله سيصيب الذين كفروا منهم عذاب أليم

translation: There is no blame upon the weak or ill, nor upon those who cannot find anything to spend, if they are sincere to Allah and His Messenger. There is no way against the good-doers. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who are weak, ill, or poor to the extent that they cannot afford to spend in the cause of Allah, are not blameworthy if they are sincere in their faith and commitment to Allah and His Messenger. It emphasizes that there is no burden or obligation upon such individuals, as long as they have good intentions. The verse also affirms that there is no way to reproach or hold accountable those who do good deeds. Ultimately, it highlights Allah's forgiveness and mercy towards His servants.
orig: ليس على الضعفاء ولا على المرضى ولا على الذين لا يجدون ما ينفقون حرج إذا نصحوا لله ورسوله ما على المحسنين من سبيل والله غفور رحيم

translation: Nor (is there blame) on those who came to you to be mounted, and when you had no conveyance for them to ride, they turned back, their eyes overflowing with tears out of grief that they could not find anything to spend.
interpretation: This verse is showing compassion and understanding towards those who came to the Prophet seeking to join him in battle or struggle, but could not due to lack of resources. It highlights that they should not be blamed or criticized for turning back when the Prophet did not have means to provide for their participation. Their tears of sadness upon being unable to contribute reflect their sincere desire to support the cause, despite their limited means.
orig: ولا على الذين إذا ما أتوك لتحملهم قلت لا أجد ما أحملكم عليه تولوا وأعينهم تفيض من الدمع حزنا ألا يجدوا ما ينفقون

translation: The way (blame) is only against those who ask permission of you while they are rich. They are content to be with those who sit back. Allah has sealed their hearts, so they do not know.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the hypocrites who made excuses not to participate in the battle, despite having the means to do so. They were content to stay behind with those who were unable to fight. Allah has sealed their hearts, depriving them of guidance and understanding, because of their hypocrisy and lack of faith.
orig: إنما السبيل على الذين يستأذنونك وهم أغنياء رضوا بأن يكونوا مع الخوالف وطبع الله على قلوبهم فهم لا يعلمون

translation: They will apologize to you when you return to them. Say, "Do not apologize, for we will never believe you. Allah has already informed us of your news. And Allah will observe your deeds, and [so will] His Messenger, then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
interpretation: This verse warns against accepting the insincere apologies of the hypocrites who outwardly claim to be Muslims but inwardly harbor disbelief and enmity towards the believers. It instructs the Prophet ﷺ to reject their apologies, as Allah has already revealed their true intentions. Their deeds are being observed by Allah and His Messenger, and they will ultimately be held accountable for their actions on the Day of Judgment, when all secrets will be exposed.
orig: يعتذرون إليكم إذا رجعتم إليهم قل لا تعتذروا لن نؤمن لكم قد نبأنا الله من أخباركم وسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله ثم تردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: They will swear by Allah to you (Muslims) when you return to them, that you may turn away from them. So turn away from them. Surely, they are impure, and Hell is their abode - a recompense for what they used to earn.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the hypocrites will try to convince the believers with false oaths and promises to overlook their misdeeds when the believers return from a battle or journey. However, Allah commands the believers to turn away from the hypocrites and avoid associating with them, for they are impure in their beliefs and actions. Their ultimate destination is Hell, which is a fitting punishment for their evil deeds and disbelief.
orig: سيحلفون بالله لكم إذا انقلبتم إليهم لتعرضوا عنهم فأعرضوا عنهم إنهم رجس ومأواهم جهنم جزاء بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: They swear to you that you may be pleased with them, but if you are pleased with them, certainly Allah is not pleased with the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse warns against being deceived by the false oaths and insincere words of hypocrites and sinners. Even if their words and actions seem to please people, Allah is not pleased with those who defiantly disobey His commands and persist in sinful ways. True pleasure and satisfaction should be sought from Allah alone, not from the approval of the disobedient.
orig: يحلفون لكم لترضوا عنهم فإن ترضوا عنهم فإن الله لا يرضى عن القوم الفاسقين

translation: The Bedouins are the worst in disbelief and hypocrisy, and more likely not to know the limits of what Allah has revealed to His Messenger. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ignorance and lack of faith among the Bedouin Arabs during the time of the Prophet Muhammad. It suggests that they were more prone to disbelief, hypocrisy, and ignorance of the divine revelations compared to others. However, Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise, fully aware of their condition and capable of guiding them to the right path.
orig: الأعراب أشد كفرا ونفاقا وأجدر ألا يعلموا حدود ما أنزل الله على رسوله والله عليم حكيم

translation: And among the bedouins are some who consider what they spend as a fine and await for you the turns of misfortune. Upon them shall be the evil turn, and Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites among the Arab nomads who begrudgingly spent in the cause of Allah, considering it a loss. They hoped for misfortune to befall the believers. However, the Qur'an warns that it is they who will face misfortune and punishment, as Allah is All-Aware of their ill intentions and actions.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يتخذ ما ينفق مغرما ويتربص بكم الدوائر عليهم دائرة السوء والله سميع عليم

translation: And among the bedouins are those who believe in Allah and the Last Day and consider what they spend as means of nearness to Allah and of [obtaining] invocations of the Messenger. Unquestionably, it is a means of nearness for them. Allah will admit them to His mercy. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the faith of some of the Bedouin Arabs who believed in Allah and the Last Day. It praises their charitable spending as a means of drawing closer to Allah and seeking the prayers of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Their spending is described as a way for them to attain Allah's mercy. Allah promises to admit them into His vast mercy, for He is truly Forgiving and Merciful to those who have faith and do good deeds.
orig: ومن الأعراب من يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ويتخذ ما ينفق قربات عند الله وصلوات الرسول ألا إنها قربة لهم سيدخلهم الله في رحمته إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And the foremost to embrace Islam of the Muhajirun (those who migrated from Makkah) and the Ansar (the citizens of Madinah who helped and gave aid to the Muhajirun) and also those who followed them exactly (in Faith). Allah is well-pleased with them as they are well-pleased with Him. He has prepared for them Gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise), to dwell therein forever. That is the supreme success.
interpretation: This verse praises the early believers who embraced Islam, including the Muhajirun (those who migrated from Makkah) and the Ansar (the helpers in Madinah), as well as those who followed their example sincerely. It states that Allah is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him, and that He has prepared for them the eternal reward of Paradise, which is described as gardens with rivers flowing beneath. This is considered the ultimate success and achievement.
orig: والسابقون الأولون من المهاجرين والأنصار والذين اتبعوهم بإحسان رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه وأعد لهم جنات تجري تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And among the wandering Arabs around you there are hypocrites, and among the residents of Madinah. They have persisted in hypocrisy. You do not know them, [but] We know them. We will punish them twice [in this world]; then they will be returned to a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites among the Arabs living around Madinah as well as the residents of Madinah itself. It warns that although the Prophet and the believers may not recognize them, Allah knows who they are. The hypocrites will be punished twice in this world through hardship and misfortune, and then face a greater punishment in the Hereafter for their hypocrisy and disbelief.
orig: وممن حولكم من الأعراب منافقون ومن أهل المدينة مردوا على النفاق لا تعلمهم نحن نعلمهم سنعذبهم مرتين ثم يردون إلى عذاب عظيم

translation: And others have confessed their sins, having mixed a righteous deed with another that was evil. May Allah turn to them in forgiveness. Surely, Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to a third group of people who have acknowledged their sins and wrongdoings, but their deeds are a mixture of good and evil. It implies that they have repented and sought forgiveness from Allah. The verse expresses hope that Allah, in His infinite mercy and forgiveness, will pardon them and accept their repentance, as He is the Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
orig: وآخرون اعترفوا بذنوبهم خلطوا عملا صالحا وآخر سيئا عسى الله أن يتوب عليهم إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Take, [O, Muhammad], from their wealth a charity by which you purify them and cause them increase, and invoke [Allah's blessings] upon them. Indeed, your invocations are reassurance for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to take a portion of the wealth of the believers as charity, which would purify and bless them. The Prophet's prayers and invocations for them would bring them tranquility and peace, as Allah hears and knows everything.
orig: خذ من أموالهم صدقة تطهرهم وتزكيهم بها وصل عليهم إن صلاتك سكن لهم والله سميع عليم

translation: Do they not know that it is Allah who accepts repentance from His servants and receives charities, and that it is Allah who is the Accepting of repentance, the Merciful?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's readiness to accept the repentance of His servants and receive their charities. It highlights Allah's attribute of being the Acceptor of repentance and the Merciful. The verse encourages people to repent sincerely and engage in charitable acts, as Allah is Ever-Forgiving and Merciful towards those who turn to Him in repentance and perform good deeds.
orig: ألم يعلموا أن الله هو يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويأخذ الصدقات وأن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: And say, "Work, for Allah will see your work and His Messenger and the believers. And you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you of what you used to do."
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to perform righteous deeds sincerely, as their actions are witnessed by Allah, the Prophet Muhammad, and the believers. It reminds them that they will ultimately return to Allah, who knows all that is unseen and seen, and He will inform them of the consequences of their deeds on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وقل اعملوا فسيرى الله عملكم ورسوله والمؤمنون وستردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And others are made to await for the command of Allah. He may punish them or turn to them in forgiveness. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to a third group of people whose fate is undecided and awaits Allah's decree. They may be punished for their misdeeds, or Allah may forgive them out of His mercy and wisdom. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's supreme knowledge and wisdom in dealing with people according to their deeds and spiritual state.
orig: وآخرون مرجون لأمر الله إما يعذبهم وإما يتوب عليهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And those who took a mosque in opposition and disbelief, and to cause division among the believers, and as an outpost for those who warred against Allah and His Messenger before; and they will certainly swear: We meant nothing but good; and Allah bears witness that they are certainly liars.
interpretation: هذه الآية تتحدث عن المنافقين الذين بنوا مسجداً بغرض إيذاء المسلمين والتفريق بينهم، وإيواء من يحاربون الله ورسوله. وسيحلفون أنهم لم يقصدوا إلا الخير، ولكن الله يشهد أنهم كاذبون في دعواهم هذه.
orig: والذين اتخذوا مسجدا ضرارا وكفرا وتفريقا بين المؤمنين وإرصادا لمن حارب الله ورسوله من قبل وليحلفن إن أردنا إلا الحسنى والله يشهد إنهم لكاذبون

translation: In it are men who love to purify themselves; and Allah loves those who purify themselves.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of purification, both physical and spiritual. It praises those who strive to purify themselves and states that Allah loves such people. The desire for purity and cleanliness is a noble quality that brings one closer to Allah. This verse encourages believers to maintain a state of purity and cleanliness in their hearts, minds, and actions.
orig: لا تقم فيه أبدا لمسجد أسس على التقوى من أول يوم أحق أن تقوم فيه فيه رجال يحبون أن يتطهروا والله يحب المطهرين

translation: Is one who laid the foundation of his building on piety to Allah and His good pleasure better or one who laid the foundation of his building on the edge of a crumbling bank which tumbled down with him into the fire of Hell? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse draws a comparison between two types of people: those who build their lives on faith, piety, and seeking Allah's pleasure, and those who build on falsehood and disbelief. The former are likened to one who builds on solid ground, while the latter are like one who builds on a crumbling precipice that will inevitably collapse, leading them to Hell. The verse emphasizes that true guidance and success come from following Allah's path, while wrongdoing and rejection of faith lead to ruin and Allah's displeasure.
orig: أفمن أسس بنيانه على تقوى من الله ورضوان خير أم من أسس بنيانه على شفا جرف هار فانهار به في نار جهنم والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Their building which they built will not cease to be a source of disquiet in their hearts, unless their hearts be torn to pieces. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the idolaters' construction of the Kaaba near the Sacred Mosque, which they built with the intention of rivaling the Ka'bah, will remain a source of doubt and anxiety in their hearts. Their hearts will continue to be disturbed and uneasy until they are torn apart, meaning either until they die or until they embrace Islam and their hearts are purified of disbelief and doubts. Allah is All-Knowing of their intentions and actions, and All-Wise in His decisions and decrees.
orig: لا يزال بنيانهم الذي بنوا ريبة في قلوبهم إلا أن تقطع قلوبهم والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, Allah has purchased from the believers their lives and their properties, for that they will have Paradise. They fight in the cause of Allah, so they kill and are killed. [It is] a true promise [binding] upon Him in the Torah and the Gospel and the Qur'an. And who is truer to his covenant than Allah? So rejoice in your transaction which you have contracted. And it is that which is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse describes the great bargain that Allah has made with the believers. He has purchased their lives and wealth in exchange for Paradise. They strive in His cause, fighting against His enemies, willing to sacrifice their lives. This promise of Paradise is a truthful covenant from Allah, mentioned in the previous Scriptures as well as the Qur'an. No one is more faithful to fulfill their promises than Allah. The believers should rejoice in this transaction they have made with their Lord, for it is the ultimate success and achievement.
orig: إن الله اشترى من المؤمنين أنفسهم وأموالهم بأن لهم الجنة يقاتلون في سبيل الله فيقتلون ويقتلون وعدا عليه حقا في التوراة والإنجيل والقرآن ومن أوفى بعهده من الله فاستبشروا ببيعكم الذي بايعتم به وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: The repentant, the worshippers, the praisers, the travellers, those who bow down, those who prostrate themselves, those who enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong, and those who observe the limits of Allah; and give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: This verse describes the qualities of true believers. The interpretation is that believers should be repentant for their sins, devoted to worship and praise of Allah, humble in prayer by bowing and prostrating, enjoining good and forbidding evil, observing the limits set by Allah, and that such believers deserve glad tidings of Allah's pleasure and rewards.
orig: التائبون العابدون الحامدون السائحون الراكعون الساجدون الآمرون بالمعروف والناهون عن المنكر والحافظون لحدود الله وبشر المؤمنين

translation: It is not for the Prophet and those who believe to ask forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they are close relatives, after it has become clear to them that they are the dwellers of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the Prophet and the believers from seeking forgiveness for the polytheists, even if they are close relatives, once it is clear that they have rejected faith and chosen to remain in disbelief. Their fate in the Hereafter is to dwell in Hellfire as a result of their rejection of faith and association of partners with Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing one's faith over blood ties when it comes to matters of belief and disbelief.
orig: ما كان للنبي والذين آمنوا أن يستغفروا للمشركين ولو كانوا أولي قربى من بعد ما تبين لهم أنهم أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And the prayer of Abraham for the forgiveness of his father was only because of a promise he had made to him. But when it became clear to him that he was an enemy of Allah, he dissociated himself from him. Indeed, Abraham was patient and tender-hearted.
interpretation: This verse explains that Abraham's prayer for his father's forgiveness was based on a promise he had made to him earlier, before realizing his father's enmity towards Allah. Once it became clear that his father was an enemy of Allah, Abraham dissociated himself from him. The verse highlights Abraham's patience and tenderness, despite his father's disbelief.
orig: وما كان استغفار إبراهيم لأبيه إلا عن موعدة وعدها إياه فلما تبين له أنه عدو لله تبرأ منه إن إبراهيم لأواه حليم

translation: And Allah would not let a people go astray after He has guided them until He makes clear to them what they should avoid. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: Allah would not lead a people astray after guiding them, unless He clarifies to them what they should avoid and be cautious of. This indicates that Allah does not withdraw guidance without first making clear the truth and falsehood. If people then choose misguidance after being shown the right path, it is due to their own choice and not because Allah willed it. Allah is All-Knowing of everything, including people's intentions and actions.
orig: وما كان الله ليضل قوما بعد إذ هداهم حتى يبين لهم ما يتقون إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Indeed, to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth. He alone has the power to give life and cause death. No one else has any control or authority besides Allah, nor can anyone protect or help us except Him. We are completely dependent on Allah and should submit to His will and commandments.
orig: إن الله له ملك السماوات والأرض يحيي ويميت وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Indeed, Allah has pardoned the Prophet and the Muhajireen and the Ansar who followed him in the hour of difficulty after the hearts of a party of them had almost inclined [to doubt], then He pardoned them. Indeed, He was to them Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident of the battle of Tabuk, where some of the companions wavered and almost lost faith due to the difficult circumstances. However, Allah pardoned the Prophet, the Muhajireen (emigrants from Makkah), and the Ansar (helpers from Madinah) who remained steadfast in their faith and followed the Prophet during that trying time. It emphasizes Allah's kindness and mercy towards the believers who repented and sought His forgiveness.
orig: لقد تاب الله على النبي والمهاجرين والأنصار الذين اتبعوه في ساعة العسرة من بعد ما كاد يزيغ قلوب فريق منهم ثم تاب عليهم إنه بهم رءوف رحيم

translation: And to the three who were left behind, until when the earth became strait to them notwithstanding its amplitude, and their souls became strait to them and they thought that there was no shelter from Allah except in Him, then He turned to them (mercifully) that they might turn (repentant unto Him). Surely, Allah is the One Who pardons (accepts repentance), the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident of three Companions who stayed behind from the Battle of Tabuk without a valid excuse. It highlights Allah's mercy and acceptance of repentance. Despite their error, when they sincerely repented and realized there is no refuge except with Allah, He pardoned them out of His immense mercy. It teaches that no matter how grave the sin, Allah will forgive those who truly repent and turn to Him wholeheartedly.
orig: وعلى الثلاثة الذين خلفوا حتى إذا ضاقت عليهم الأرض بما رحبت وضاقت عليهم أنفسهم وظنوا أن لا ملجأ من الله إلا إليه ثم تاب عليهم ليتوبوا إن الله هو التواب الرحيم

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and be with those who are true.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to the believers to have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah) and to be truthful and among those who are truthful. It encourages the believers to develop a strong relationship with Allah and to adopt truthfulness and honesty in all aspects of their lives, as these are essential qualities of true faith. The verse emphasizes the importance of being in the company of truthful and sincere people, as their influence can help strengthen one's faith and moral character.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وكونوا مع الصادقين

translation: It was not for the people of Madinah and those around them of the bedouins to remain behind the Messenger of Allah, nor to prefer themselves over him. That is because they are not afflicted by thirst or fatigue or hunger in the cause of Allah, nor do they tread on a path that enrages the disbelievers, nor do they inflict upon an enemy any infliction but that is written for them as a righteous deed. Indeed, Allah does not allow the reward of the doers of good to be lost.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of supporting the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and prioritizing the cause of Allah over personal interests. It praises the believers who endured hardships and sacrificed their comfort for the sake of Allah, without being deterred by thirst, fatigue, or hunger. Their struggles against the disbelievers and enemies of Islam are considered righteous deeds that will be rewarded by Allah. The verse assures that Allah will not neglect or waste the good deeds of those who strive in His cause with sincerity.
orig: ما كان لأهل المدينة ومن حولهم من الأعراب أن يتخلفوا عن رسول الله ولا يرغبوا بأنفسهم عن نفسه ذلك بأنهم لا يصيبهم ظمأ ولا نصب ولا مخمصة في سبيل الله ولا يطئون موطئا يغيظ الكفار ولا ينالون من عدو نيلا إلا كتب لهم به عمل صالح إن الله لا يضيع أجر المحسنين

translation: And they do not spend a small or large expenditure, nor do they cross a valley, but it is recorded for them that Allah may reward them for the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive nature of Allah's reward system. It emphasizes that every good deed, no matter how small or insignificant it may seem, and every hardship endured in the path of righteousness, is recorded and will be rewarded by Allah in the best possible manner. The verse encourages believers to be consistent in their good deeds, charitable spending, and perseverance through difficulties, as nothing goes unnoticed or unrewarded by the All-Knowing and Most Appreciative Lord.
orig: ولا ينفقون نفقة صغيرة ولا كبيرة ولا يقطعون واديا إلا كتب لهم ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: It is not desirable for the believers to march forth altogether. Why should not a party from every section of them go forth to become learned in the religion, and to warn their people when they return to them, so that they may take warning?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge in religion and spreading it among the believers. It suggests that while all believers cannot leave for seeking knowledge, a group from each community should dedicate themselves to learning the religion thoroughly. When they return, they should share their knowledge and warn their people against ignorance and negligence, so that the community remains vigilant and adheres to the teachings of the religion.
orig: وما كان المؤمنون لينفروا كافة فلولا نفر من كل فرقة منهم طائفة ليتفقهوا في الدين ولينذروا قومهم إذا رجعوا إليهم لعلهم يحذرون

translation: O you who have believed, fight those adjacent to you of the disbelievers and let them find in you harshness. And know that Allah is with the righteous.
interpretation: This verse is instructing the believers to fight against the disbelievers who are in close proximity to them, and to display harshness and firmness towards them. It also reminds the believers that Allah is with those who are righteous and conscious of Him.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا قاتلوا الذين يلونكم من الكفار وليجدوا فيكم غلظة واعلموا أن الله مع المتقين

translation: And whenever a surah is revealed, there are among them those who say, 'Which of you has this increased faith?' As for those who believed, it has increased them in faith, while they are rejoicing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the differing responses to the revelation of the Qur'an. While some questioned its impact, doubting its ability to increase faith, the true believers embraced it wholeheartedly, and their faith was strengthened by it. They rejoiced in the guidance and wisdom contained within the revealed verses.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة فمنهم من يقول أيكم زادته هذه إيمانا فأما الذين آمنوا فزادتهم إيمانا وهم يستبشرون

translation: And as for those in whose hearts is disease, it has increased them in defilement over their [already existing] defilement, and they have died while they were disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites whose hearts are diseased with doubts, disbelief, and hypocrisy. The revelation of the Qur'an and the clear signs only increased their impurity, wickedness, and aversion to the truth. They persisted in their state of disbelief until death, failing to embrace faith.
orig: وأما الذين في قلوبهم مرض فزادتهم رجسا إلى رجسهم وماتوا وهم كافرون

translation: Do they not see that they are tried once or twice every year? Yet they do not repent, nor do they take heed.
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to those who persist in disbelief and sin, despite the trials and afflictions they face in life. It suggests that these trials should serve as reminders and opportunities for them to repent and turn back to God, but instead, they remain heedless and unrepentant. The repetition of trials is meant to awaken their consciousness and guide them towards the right path, but their stubborn rejection of faith and lack of remorse indicates their spiritual blindness and unwillingness to learn from their experiences.
orig: أولا يرون أنهم يفتنون في كل عام مرة أو مرتين ثم لا يتوبون ولا هم يذكرون

translation: And when a surah is revealed, some of them look at one another: 'Does anyone see you?' Then they turn away. Allah has turned their hearts away because they are a people who do not comprehend.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who, when a new chapter of the Qur'an was revealed, would look around suspiciously to see if anyone was watching them. They then turned away from listening to or heeding the revelation, as Allah has turned their hearts away from guidance due to their lack of understanding and unwillingness to accept the truth.
orig: وإذا ما أنزلت سورة نظر بعضهم إلى بعض هل يراكم من أحد ثم انصرفوا صرف الله قلوبهم بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: There has certainly come to you a Messenger from among yourselves. Grievous to him is what you suffer; [he is] concerned over you and to the believers is kind and merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the compassionate and caring nature of the Prophet Muhammad towards his people. He was one of them, deeply concerned about their difficulties and sufferings. He was eager to guide them to the right path and alleviate their burdens. The verse emphasizes his kindness and mercy towards the believers, treating them with gentleness and compassion.
orig: لقد جاءكم رسول من أنفسكم عزيز عليه ما عنتم حريص عليكم بالمؤمنين رءوف رحيم

translation: But if they turn away, then say, 'Sufficient for me is Allah; there is no deity except Him. On Him I have relied, and He is the Lord of the Great Throne.'
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in their rejection and turn away from the truth, then put your trust in Allah alone, for He is the only true God worthy of worship and reliance. Declare that Allah is sufficient for you, and place your complete trust and reliance in Him, for He is the Lord and Sustainer of the mighty Throne, which symbolizes His supreme authority and control over all creation.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل حسبي الله لا إله إلا هو عليه توكلت وهو رب العرش العظيم

translation: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the wise Book.
interpretation: This verse consists of three Arabic letters - Alif, Lam, and Ra - known as the 'Muqatta'aat' or 'disjointed letters.' These letters are believed to be a sign of the divine origin and inimitable nature of the Qur'an. The verse then affirms that the verses that follow are from the 'Wise Book,' referring to the Qur'an as a source of wisdom and guidance from Allah.
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: Is it a wonder for mankind that We have revealed to a man from among themselves (saying): 'Warn mankind and give good tidings to those who believe that they shall have a firm standing with their Lord?' The disbelievers say: 'This is indeed an evident sorcerer.'
interpretation: Allah is questioning the disbelievers' astonishment at the fact that He has chosen a man from among themselves, i.e., the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to receive revelation and warn people about the consequences of disbelief and give glad tidings to the believers of their elevated status with their Lord. The disbelievers, out of arrogance and stubbornness, dismiss the Prophet as an "evident sorcerer," accusing him of deception and trickery.
orig: أكان للناس عجبا أن أوحينا إلى رجل منهم أن أنذر الناس وبشر الذين آمنوا أن لهم قدم صدق عند ربهم قال الكافرون إن هذا لساحر مبين

translation: Indeed, your Lord is Allah, who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne, arranging the matter [of His creation]. There is no intercessor except after His permission. That is Allah, your Lord, so worship Him. Then will you not remember?
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It emphasizes that Allah alone is worthy of worship and obedience, as He is the sole source of guidance and authority. The reference to the "six days" of creation is symbolic, indicating the gradual and orderly nature of the creative process. The verse also highlights Allah's transcendence and sovereignty, as He is described as being established on the Throne, controlling and governing all affairs. It warns against associating any partners or intercessors with Allah without His permission, as that would contradict the principle of pure monotheism (Tawheed).
orig: إن ربكم الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش يدبر الأمر ما من شفيع إلا من بعد إذنه ذلكم الله ربكم فاعبدوه أفلا تذكرون

translation: To Him is your return all, truly Allah's promise; indeed, He begins the creation, then He will repeat it, that He may reward those who believed and did righteous deeds, in equity; but they who disbelieved, for them will be a drink of scalding water and a painful punishment because they used to disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the final return of all beings is to Allah on the Day of Resurrection. It emphasizes Allah's power to initiate creation and then repeat it after death. The believers who did good deeds will be justly rewarded, while the disbelievers will suffer a painful punishment of drinking burning water as a consequence of their disbelief.
orig: إليه مرجعكم جميعا وعد الله حقا إنه يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات بالقسط والذين كفروا لهم شراب من حميم وعذاب أليم بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: It is He who made the sun a shining glory and the moon a light and determined for it phases - that you may know the number of years and account [of time]. Allah has not created this except in truth. He details the signs for a people who know.
interpretation: Allah is highlighting His power and wisdom in the creation of the sun and moon, which serve as sources of light and markers for determining the passage of time. The phases of the moon help us calculate years and keep track of time. All of this is created with a purpose and wisdom, not in vain. These signs in the universe point to the existence and greatness of the Creator for those who reflect and understand.
orig: هو الذي جعل الشمس ضياء والقمر نورا وقدره منازل لتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب ما خلق الله ذلك إلا بالحق يفصل الآيات لقوم يعلمون

translation: Indeed, in the alternation of night and day and what Allah has created in the heavens and the earth, there are signs for a people who are mindful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wonders and signs of Allah's creation in the alternation of night and day, and in the heavens and the earth. These signs serve as evidence of Allah's existence and power for those who have taqwa (mindfulness of Allah and consciousness of His commandments). The regular cycle of day and night, and the marvels in the heavens and earth, should lead people to reflect on the greatness of the Creator and submit to His will.
orig: إن في اختلاف الليل والنهار وما خلق الله في السماوات والأرض لآيات لقوم يتقون

translation: Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel reassured by it, and those who are heedless of Our signs,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have no faith in the Hereafter and the accountability before God. They are content with the temporary pleasures of this worldly life and feel secure in their disbelief. They are heedless of God's signs and revelations, ignoring the evidences that point to the truth of faith and the inevitability of the Day of Judgment.
orig: إن الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ورضوا بالحياة الدنيا واطمأنوا بها والذين هم عن آياتنا غافلون

translation: Those - their refuge is the Fire because of what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse is warning about the dreadful consequence of disbelief and disobedience to Allah. It states that those who reject faith and engage in sinful deeds will have the Fire of Hell as their ultimate abode, as a result of their own misguided choices and evil actions in this world. The phrase "because of what they used to earn" indicates that they will be held accountable for their intentional rejection of truth and persistence in wrongdoing.
orig: أولئك مأواهم النار بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - their Lord will guide them because of their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in the Gardens of Pleasure.
interpretation: This verse promises guidance and eternal bliss in the Gardens of Paradise for those who have faith and perform righteous deeds. Their faith and good actions will lead them to be rightly guided by Allah, and they will be rewarded with rivers flowing beneath them in the everlasting Gardens of Delight.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات يهديهم ربهم بإيمانهم تجري من تحتهم الأنهار في جنات النعيم

translation: Their call therein will be, 'Exalted are You, O Allah,' and their greeting therein will be, 'Peace.' And the last of their call will be, 'Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the believers in Paradise. Their invocations and supplications will be filled with glorification of Allah, free from any imperfection or shortcoming. Their greetings will be of peace and security, devoid of any ill-will or animosity. And their ultimate call and supplication will be to praise Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds, acknowledging His immense blessings and favors upon them.
orig: دعواهم فيها سبحانك اللهم وتحيتهم فيها سلام وآخر دعواهم أن الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: And if Allah were to hasten for the people the ill (punishment) as they would hasten for good, their respite would have been settled. But We leave those who do not expect the meeting with Us wandering blindly in their transgression.
interpretation: Allah does not hasten punishment for people as they hasten for good things in this world. If He did so, their term of life would end quickly. Instead, He gives them respite and delays their punishment. As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter and meeting Allah, We leave them wandering blindly in their transgression and misguidance.
orig: ولو يعجل الله للناس الشر استعجالهم بالخير لقضي إليهم أجلهم فنذر الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us, lying on his side or sitting or standing. But when We have removed his adversity from him, he passes on as if he had never called upon Us for an adversity that touched him. Thus is made fair-seeming to the prodigals that which they used to do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and heedlessness of human beings. When afflicted with hardship, they earnestly supplicate to Allah. But once the difficulty is removed, they become arrogant and ungrateful, behaving as if they had never prayed for relief. This attitude of taking Allah's favors for granted and persisting in sinful ways is censured as a quality of the wasteful and extravagant.
orig: وإذا مس الإنسان الضر دعانا لجنبه أو قاعدا أو قائما فلما كشفنا عنه ضره مر كأن لم يدعنا إلى ضر مسه كذلك زين للمسرفين ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have already destroyed the generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.
interpretation: "Allah is stating that He has destroyed previous nations who persisted in wrongdoing and disbelief despite receiving clear signs and messengers from Him. This was a punishment for their crimes and stubborn rejection of faith. Similarly, Allah warns that He will hold accountable those who commit sins and reject the truth."
orig: ولقد أهلكنا القرون من قبلكم لما ظلموا وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وما كانوا ليؤمنوا كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: Then We made you successors in the land after them so that We may observe how you would act.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has made human beings the successors or inheritors of the earth after the previous nations. It implies that humans have been given a privileged position on earth, but with this privilege comes responsibility. Allah is observing how humans conduct themselves and utilize the resources of the earth. This serves as a reminder that people will be held accountable for their actions and how they fulfill the role of being Allah's representatives on earth.
orig: ثم جعلناكم خلائف في الأرض من بعدهم لننظر كيف تعملون

translation: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, 'Bring a Qur'an other than this or change it.' Say, 'It is not for me to change it of my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. If I were to disobey my Lord, I would fear the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تتحدث عن رفض الكافرين للقرآن الكريم، حيث طلبوا من النبي محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم أن يأتي بقرآن آخر غير هذا القرآن أو يغيره. ولكن الله أمر نبيه أن يرد عليهم بأنه لا يستطيع تغيير القرآن من تلقاء نفسه، وإنما يتبع ما يوحى إليه من ربه، وأنه إن عصى ربه فإنه سيخاف عذاب يوم القيامة العظيم.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين لا يرجون لقاءنا ائت بقرآن غير هذا أو بدله قل ما يكون لي أن أبدله من تلقاء نفسي إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Say, 'If Allah had so willed, I would not have recited it to you, nor would He have made it known to you. For I had lived a whole lifetime among you before it. Will you not then understand?'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Qur'an is a divine revelation from Allah, and the Prophet Muhammad did not have any prior knowledge of it before it was revealed to him. The verse implies that if Allah had not willed the Qur'an to be revealed, the Prophet would not have been able to recite it or make it known to the people, despite living among them for a long time before the revelation. It is a call for the people to use their intellect and realize the divine origin of the Qur'an.
orig: قل لو شاء الله ما تلوته عليكم ولا أدراكم به فقد لبثت فيكم عمرا من قبله أفلا تعقلون

translation: So who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah or denies His verses? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who fabricate lies against Allah or reject His clear signs and revelations. It emphasizes that such individuals are engaging in a grave injustice and wrongdoing. The verse warns that those who commit such crimes and persist in disbelief and falsehood will ultimately fail and not attain success or salvation. Their actions are a manifestation of their criminal nature, and they will face the consequences of their misdeeds.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بآياته إنه لا يفلح المجرمون

translation: And they worship besides Allah that which neither harms them nor profits them, and they say: 'These are our intercessors with Allah.' Say: 'Do you inform Allah of something He knows not in the heavens or on the earth?' Glorified and Exalted is He above all that they associate as partners with Him!
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of worshipping idols or false deities besides Allah, as they can neither harm nor benefit anyone. It criticizes those who claim that these idols will intercede for them before Allah, questioning how they can attribute knowledge to Allah that He does not possess. The verse declares Allah to be far above and exalted from all that they associate as partners with Him.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يضرهم ولا ينفعهم ويقولون هؤلاء شفعاؤنا عند الله قل أتنبئون الله بما لا يعلم في السماوات ولا في الأرض سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And mankind was not but one community, then they differed. And had it not been for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them [immediately] concerning that over which they differed.
interpretation: Allah is stating that initially all of humanity was upon one religion and belief system, worshipping Allah alone. However, differences arose among them as some people deviated from the truth. Had it not been for Allah's wisdom and plan to allow people to live with their different beliefs until an appointed time, He would have judged between them immediately regarding the matters over which they differed.
orig: وما كان الناس إلا أمة واحدة فاختلفوا ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم فيما فيه يختلفون

translation: And they say, 'Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'The unseen belongs to Allah, so wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait.'
interpretation: The disbelievers demanded a miraculous sign from the Prophet to prove his prophethood. The interpretation is that Allah instructs the Prophet to respond that only Allah has knowledge of the unseen and when miracles will occur. The Prophet is told to be patient and wait along with the believers, as the truth will eventually become evident.
orig: ويقولون لولا أنزل عليه آية من ربه فقل إنما الغيب لله فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: And when We let the people taste mercy after adversity has touched them, at once they begin to devise against Our verses. Say, "Allah is swifter in devising. Indeed, Our messengers record what you devise."
interpretation: This verse implies that when Allah bestows His mercy and blessings upon people after they have faced difficulties, some of them become arrogant and ungrateful. They start to doubt and reject Allah's signs and revelations. The verse instructs the Prophet to tell such people that Allah is the swiftest in planning and devising, and that His messengers record all their evil plots and schemes, which will be held against them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة من بعد ضراء مستهم إذا لهم مكر في آياتنا قل الله أسرع مكرا إن رسلنا يكتبون ما تمكرون

translation: It is He who enables you to travel through land and sea; so that you are in the ships, and they sail with them by a good wind, and they rejoice therein. Then there strikes them a storm wind, and the waves come upon them from everywhere, and they think that they are surrounded by them. Then they supplicate Allah, being sincere to Him in religion [saying], 'If You should save us from this, we will surely be among the thankful.'
interpretation: Allah contrôle les mouvements des navires sur la mer. Lorsque les conditions sont favorables, les gens se réjouissent. Mais lorsqu'une tempête survient et que les vagues les menacent de tous côtés, ils se tournent sincèrement vers Allah et Lui promettent d'être reconnaissants s'Il les sauve. Cela montre que l'être humain a tendance à oublier Allah dans les bons moments et à se tourner vers Lui dans les moments difficiles.
orig: هو الذي يسيركم في البر والبحر حتى إذا كنتم في الفلك وجرين بهم بريح طيبة وفرحوا بها جاءتها ريح عاصف وجاءهم الموج من كل مكان وظنوا أنهم أحيط بهم دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين لئن أنجيتنا من هذه لنكونن من الشاكرين

translation: But when He delivers them, at once they transgress insolently throughout the earth in defiance of right! O mankind, your insolence is only against yourselves - an enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.
interpretation: Allah is criticizing those who, when saved from hardship, become arrogant and ungrateful, transgressing against His commands. He reminds them that their arrogance and disobedience only harms themselves, as it deprives them of eternal bliss. Their enjoyment of this worldly life is temporary, and they will ultimately return to Allah, who will hold them accountable for their actions.
orig: فلما أنجاهم إذا هم يبغون في الأرض بغير الحق يا أيها الناس إنما بغيكم على أنفسكم متاع الحياة الدنيا ثم إلينا مرجعكم فننبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: The example of the life of this world is but like rain water which We have sent down from the sky, and which the vegetation of the earth has mingled with it, from which men and cattle eat until, when the earth has taken on its ornaments and is beautified, and its people think that they have all the powers of disposal over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it a harvest clean-mown, as though it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain the signs in detail for a people who reflect.
interpretation: This verse uses a powerful metaphor to illustrate the transient and temporary nature of this worldly life. It compares the life of this world to rain water that falls from the sky, causing plants to grow and flourish, providing sustenance for humans and animals. However, this flourishing is short-lived, as when the earth reaches its peak beauty and people think they have control over it, Allah's command comes suddenly, like at night or during the day, and the vegetation is cut down and harvested, as if it had never existed before. This metaphor teaches us that the pleasures and possessions of this world are fleeting and temporary, and that we should not become attached to them or think that we have complete control over them. Instead, we should reflect on the signs of Allah and focus on the everlasting life of the Hereafter.
orig: إنما مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء أنزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الأرض مما يأكل الناس والأنعام حتى إذا أخذت الأرض زخرفها وازينت وظن أهلها أنهم قادرون عليها أتاها أمرنا ليلا أو نهارا فجعلناها حصيدا كأن لم تغن بالأمس كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And Allah invites to the abode of peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path.
interpretation: Allah invites all people to enter Islam, which is the path that leads to peace, security, and contentment in this life and the Hereafter. He guides whomever He wills to the straight path of truth and righteousness, which is the only way to attain salvation and eternal bliss.
orig: والله يدعو إلى دار السلام ويهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: For those who have done good is the best reward and extra. No darkness or disgrace shall cover their faces. They are the companions of Paradise; they will abide therein forever.
interpretation: This verse promises a great reward for the righteous believers. The "best" refers to the highest level of Paradise, and the "extra" implies additional favors from Allah. Their faces will be radiant, showing no anger, sadness, or humiliation. They will dwell eternally in Paradise, which is the ultimate success.
orig: للذين أحسنوا الحسنى وزيادة ولا يرهق وجوههم قتر ولا ذلة أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: But those who have earned evil deeds - the recompense of an evil deed is its equivalent, and humiliating disgrace will cover them. They will have from Allah no protector. It is as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night - so dark [are they]. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment for those who commit evil deeds. Their recompense will be an equivalent evil punishment, and they will be covered in humiliating disgrace with no one to protect them from Allah's punishment. Their state is likened to having their faces covered by the darkness of the night, indicating their spiritual blindness. Such people are the dwellers of Hellfire, where they will abide forever.
orig: والذين كسبوا السيئات جزاء سيئة بمثلها وترهقهم ذلة ما لهم من الله من عاصم كأنما أغشيت وجوههم قطعا من الليل مظلما أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: And the Day We will gather them all together - then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "[Remain in] your place, you and your 'partners.'" Then We will separate them, and their 'partners' will say, "You did not used to worship us"
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will gather all people and their claimed partners or idols they associated with Allah. Allah will command the idolaters to remain in their place along with their claimed partners. Then Allah will separate the idolaters from their partners. The partners will declare that the idolaters were not truly worshipping them, rather they were worshipping their own desires and misconceptions.
orig: ويوم نحشرهم جميعا ثم نقول للذين أشركوا مكانكم أنتم وشركاؤكم فزيلنا بينهم وقال شركاؤهم ما كنتم إيانا تعبدون

translation: But sufficient is Allah as a witness between us and you that we were unaware of your worship.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate witness and judge between the believers and the disbelievers. It suggests that the believers were oblivious to the polytheistic practices of the disbelievers, and they did not participate in their false worship. The verse affirms the believers" trust in Allah as the sole witness and arbiter, rejecting the need for any other witness or judge.
orig: فكفى بالله شهيدا بيننا وبينكم إن كنا عن عبادتكم لغافلين

translation: There every soul will be put to trial for what it had earned, and they will be returned to Allah, their true Lord, and whatever they used to fabricate will be lost from them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the accountability of every soul on the Day of Judgment. Each person will be tested and held responsible for their past deeds and actions. They will return to Allah, their true Lord and Creator, leaving behind all the false beliefs and fabrications they followed in this worldly life. The interpretation highlights the concepts of individual responsibility, Divine justice, and the ultimate reality of returning to Allah while abandoning falsehoods.
orig: هنالك تبلو كل نفس ما أسلفت وردوا إلى الله مولاهم الحق وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Say, 'Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? Or who owns hearing and sight? And who brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living? And who arranges every matter?' They will say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and control over all aspects of creation. It calls upon people to reflect on the signs of Allah's power and wisdom manifested in the sustenance they receive, their ability to hear and see, the cycle of life and death, and the perfect order governing the universe. By recognizing Allah as the sole provider and sustainer, the verse exhorts people to have taqwa (reverence and consciousness) of Him.
orig: قل من يرزقكم من السماء والأرض أمن يملك السمع والأبصار ومن يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ومن يدبر الأمر فسيقولون الله فقل أفلا تتقون

translation: So this is Allah, your true Lord. And what is there after truth except error? So how are you averted?
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah is the true Lord and the only deity worthy of worship. It then questions what could be sought after the truth except misguidance and falsehood. The verse is calling people to reflect on the reality of Allah's Lordship and to avoid being misled away from the straight path after the truth has become evident to them.
orig: فذلكم الله ربكم الحق فماذا بعد الحق إلا الضلال فأنى تصرفون

translation: Thus the Word of your Lord is justified against those who defiantly disobeyed that they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of Allah's punishment for those who persist in disbelief and disobedience. Their rejection of faith is a consequence of their own choices and actions, which ultimately lead them to be deprived of guidance and sealing their disbelief. Allah's decree is fulfilled, and His warning proves true for those who "defiantly disobeyed" and stubbornly refused to believe.
orig: كذلك حقت كلمت ربك على الذين فسقوا أنهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Say, "Is there among your 'partners' any who begins creation and then repeats it?" Say, "Allah begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness of Allah as the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It challenges the polytheists to identify any of their alleged partners with Allah who can initiate creation and then repeat it, as Allah does. The rhetorical question highlights the absurdity of associating partners with Allah, who alone has the power to originate and regenerate creation. The verse aims to dispel any confusion or delusion about the oneness of Allah in His creative abilities.
orig: قل هل من شركائكم من يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده قل الله يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده فأنى تؤفكون

translation: Say, 'Is there any among your associates who guides to the truth?' Say, 'Allah guides to the truth. So is He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed or he who guides not unless he is guided? Then what is the matter with you? How do you judge?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that only Allah has the true guidance and is worthy of being followed. It questions the idolaters who follow false deities that cannot guide them to the truth. The verse asserts that Allah alone guides to the truth, and questions why one would follow those who cannot guide themselves unless they are guided by Allah. It calls upon the idolaters to reflect on their judgment and reasoning.
orig: قل هل من شركائكم من يهدي إلى الحق قل الله يهدي للحق أفمن يهدي إلى الحق أحق أن يتبع أمن لا يهدي إلا أن يهدى فما لكم كيف تحكمون

translation: But most of them follow nothing but conjecture. Surely, conjecture avails nothing against the truth. Indeed, Allah is All-Aware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and truth, rather than relying on mere assumptions or guesswork. It warns against following conjecture or unsubstantiated opinions, as they hold no weight against the absolute truth revealed by Allah. The verse asserts that Allah is fully aware of people's actions and intentions, reminding us to be mindful of our deeds and strive for knowledge and understanding based on divine guidance.
orig: وما يتبع أكثرهم إلا ظنا إن الظن لا يغني من الحق شيئا إن الله عليم بما يفعلون

translation: And this Qur'an could not have been fabricated by anyone besides Allah, but it is a confirmation of what came before it and an explanation of the Book in which there is no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and its role in confirming and elaborating upon previous revelations. It rejects the notion that the Qur'an could have been fabricated by anyone other than Allah, as it is a continuation and affirmation of the truth revealed in earlier scriptures. The Qur'an provides a detailed explanation of the divine teachings, leaving no room for doubt about its source being the Lord of all creation.
orig: وما كان هذا القرآن أن يفترى من دون الله ولكن تصديق الذي بين يديه وتفصيل الكتاب لا ريب فيه من رب العالمين

translation: Or do they say, "He has invented it"? Say, "Then bring a surah like it and call upon whomever you can besides Allah, if you are truthful."
interpretation: Allah challenges those who accuse the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of fabricating the Qur'an to produce something similar to it. Since the Qur'an is the inimitable Word of God, no human can compose anything like it, even if they seek help from all others besides Allah. This verse establishes the divine origin of the Qur'an and its miraculous nature.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل فأتوا بسورة مثله وادعوا من استطعتم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Nay, but they denied that the knowledge whereof they could not compass and whereof the interpretation (in relation to the future) has not yet come unto them, even so did those before them deny. Then see what was the consequence for the deniers!
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who rejected the Qur'an and its teachings because they could not fully comprehend its knowledge and meaning. They denied it without understanding its true interpretation and deeper wisdom. This is similar to how previous nations also denied the truth that came to them from Allah. The verse warns that those who deny the truth will face the same consequences as previous deniers, implying punishment and destruction.
orig: بل كذبوا بما لم يحيطوا بعلمه ولما يأتهم تأويله كذلك كذب الذين من قبلهم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة الظالمين

translation: And among them are those who believe in it, and among them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters.
interpretation: This verse indicates that people have different responses to the divine message. Some embrace it with faith, while others reject it. Ultimately, God is fully aware of those who spread corruption and deviate from the truth.
orig: ومنهم من يؤمن به ومنهم من لا يؤمن به وربك أعلم بالمفسدين

translation: And if they deny you, then say, 'For me are my deeds, and for you are your deeds. You are disassociated from what I do, and I am disassociated from what you do.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual accountability before God. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad to tell the disbelievers that he is not responsible for their actions, just as they are not responsible for his. Each person will be judged based on their own deeds, and no one can bear the burden of another's sins. The verse promotes religious tolerance and freedom of belief, while affirming that ultimate judgment rests with God alone.
orig: وإن كذبوك فقل لي عملي ولكم عملكم أنتم بريئون مما أعمل وأنا بريء مما تعملون

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, but can you cause the deaf to hear, although they will not use reason?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) regarding the disbelievers who refuse to listen to the message of Islam despite being presented with clear evidence and proofs. It rhetorically questions whether the Prophet can make the deaf, who are unwilling to use their intellect and reason, hear and understand the truth. The interpretation is that no matter how convincing the message is presented, those who stubbornly reject it and refuse to use their faculty of reason will not benefit from it.
orig: ومنهم من يستمعون إليك أفأنت تسمع الصم ولو كانوا لا يعقلون

translation: And among them is he who looks at you, but can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and refers to the disbelievers who were unwilling to accept the truth, despite witnessing the clear signs and proofs presented to them. It emphasizes that true guidance comes from Allah, and no matter how clear the message is conveyed, those who deliberately choose to remain blind to the truth cannot be guided. The verse teaches that faith is a matter of personal choice and sincere willingness to accept the truth.
orig: ومنهم من ينظر إليك أفأنت تهدي العمي ولو كانوا لا يبصرون

translation: Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who wrong themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah does not oppress or wrong anyone. Rather, it is human beings themselves who oppress and wrong their own souls through their disbelief, disobedience, and sins. Allah is perfectly Just and does not treat anyone unjustly or deprive them of their due rights. Any harm or misfortune that befalls people is a result of their own actions and choices, not due to any injustice or wrongdoing from Allah.
orig: إن الله لا يظلم الناس شيئا ولكن الناس أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: And on the Day when He will gather them together, it will appear to them as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and they will] recognize each other. Those will have certainly lost who denied the meeting with Allah and were not guided.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Resurrection when all people will be gathered together. To them, it will seem as if they had lived in this world only for a short period of time, like an hour of a day. They will recognize one another, but those who denied the meeting with Allah and rejected His guidance will have lost everything and suffered a great loss.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم كأن لم يلبثوا إلا ساعة من النهار يتعارفون بينهم قد خسر الذين كذبوا بلقاء الله وما كانوا مهتدين
