translation: And whether We show you part of what We have promised them or take you away [in death], upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.
interpretation: This verse implies that whether the Prophet Muhammad sees the punishment of the disbelievers in this life or not, his duty is only to convey the message of Islam. The ultimate accountability and judgment of people's deeds lie with Allah. The Prophet's role is to guide and warn, while Allah is the witness over people's actions and will hold them accountable on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإما نرينك بعض الذي نعدهم أو نتوفينك فإلينا مرجعهم ثم الله شهيد على ما يفعلون

translation: And for every nation there is a messenger. And when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse affirms the universal principle of God sending messengers to every nation to guide them. When the messenger comes to a people, he judges between them fairly and with justice, without any oppression or wrongdoing towards them.
orig: ولكل أمة رسول فإذا جاء رسولهم قضي بينهم بالقسط وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking and questioning the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the believers about the promised punishment or the Day of Resurrection. They are demanding proof and challenging the truthfulness of the Prophet's message, implying that they do not believe in the warnings of a final reckoning or divine judgment.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, 'I have no power to harm or benefit myself, except as Allah wills. For every nation is a [specified] term. When their time has come, they cannot delay it by a single hour, nor could they advance it.'
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the concept of complete submission to the will of Allah. It teaches that human beings have no independent power to benefit or harm themselves, and that everything happens according to Allah's will and decree. It also highlights the fact that each nation or community has a predetermined lifespan or term, and when that appointed time arrives, they cannot delay or hasten it even for a moment. This underscores the absolute sovereignty and power of Allah over all affairs."
orig: قل لا أملك لنفسي ضرا ولا نفعا إلا ما شاء الله لكل أمة أجل إذا جاء أجلهم فلا يستأخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون

translation: Say, "Have you considered: if His punishment should come to you by night or by day - for which [aspect] of it would the criminals be impatient?"
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers and criminals that Allah's punishment can come at any time, whether it is night or day. It questions which part of the punishment they would wish to hasten if it were to come upon them. The implication is that they should not be hasty in mocking the warnings, as the punishment is severe and inescapable when it arrives.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن أتاكم عذابه بياتا أو نهارا ماذا يستعجل منه المجرمون

translation: Is it then the case that when it has actually occurred you will believe in it? [You slackers!] Though you were hastening it on before?
interpretation: This verse is a rebuke to those who denied the truth and mocked the warnings of punishment. They are being questioned about their disbelief even after witnessing the very thing they used to hasten and demand from the Prophet. It highlights their inconsistency and lack of faith, as they chose to believe only after the punishment had befallen them, whereas they should have believed from the beginning and heeded the warnings.
orig: أثم إذا ما وقع آمنتم به آلآن وقد كنتم به تستعجلون

translation: Then it will be said to those who did wrong, 'Taste the torment of eternity. Are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?'
interpretation: This verse warns the wrongdoers and disbelievers that they will be punished eternally in the Hereafter for their misdeeds and rejection of faith. The phrase "Taste the torment of eternity" implies that they will suffer a prolonged and everlasting punishment. The rhetorical question "Are you being recompensed except for what you used to earn?" emphasizes that their punishment is a direct consequence of their own actions and choices in this world. It highlights the principle of justice, where individuals are held accountable for their deeds and face the consequences accordingly.
orig: ثم قيل للذين ظلموا ذوقوا عذاب الخلد هل تجزون إلا بما كنتم تكسبون

translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], whether it is true. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, indeed it is truth; and you will not cause failure [to Allah]."
interpretation: This verse affirms the truthfulness of the Qur'an and the message of Islam. The interpretation is that the disbelievers used to question the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) about the truth of the revelation he received. Allah commanded him to affirm that it is indeed the truth from his Lord, and that they cannot escape or prevent the consequences of denying it.
orig: ويستنبئونك أحق هو قل إي وربي إنه لحق وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: And if every soul that has wronged had everything on earth, it would offer it to ransom itself. They will confide their remorse when they see the punishment; and they will be judged with justice, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse highlights the gravity of wrongdoing and the intense regret that wrongdoers will feel on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes that even if they possessed all the wealth on earth, they would willingly offer it as a ransom to save themselves from the punishment. However, no ransom will be accepted on that Day. The verse also affirms that justice will be served, and no soul will be wronged in the final judgment.
orig: ولو أن لكل نفس ظلمت ما في الأرض لافتدت به وأسروا الندامة لما رأوا العذاب وقضي بينهم بالقسط وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Unquestionably, the promise of Allah is true, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse affirms that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and that His promise of resurrection, accountability and reward is true and inevitable. However, most people are heedless and ignorant of this reality.
orig: ألا إن لله ما في السماوات والأرض ألا إن وعد الله حق ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: It is He who gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and sovereignty of Allah over all life and death. It affirms that Allah alone is the One who grants life and takes it away, and that ultimately all beings will return to Him for judgment and accountability. The verse highlights Allah's control over the cycle of creation and reminds us of our temporary existence in this world and our ultimate return to our Creator.
orig: هو يحيي ويميت وإليه ترجعون

translation: O mankind! There has come to you an exhortation from your Lord, a cure for what is in the hearts, a guidance and a mercy for the believers.
interpretation: This verse addresses all of humanity, emphasizing that the Qur'an is a source of guidance, healing, and mercy specifically for the believers. It highlights the universal message of the Qur'an as a "exhortation" or advice from God that serves as a cure for the spiritual ailments and doubts in people's hearts. For those who have faith, the Qur'an provides clear guidance towards the right path and represents God's infinite mercy.
orig: يا أيها الناس قد جاءتكم موعظة من ربكم وشفاء لما في الصدور وهدى ورحمة للمؤمنين

translation: Say, 'In the bounty of Allah and in His mercy - in that let them rejoice; it is better than what they accumulate.'
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to rejoice in Allah's favors and mercy upon them, as they are far better and more valuable than any worldly gains or wealth that people accumulate. It reminds us to find true happiness and contentment in Allah's blessings, both spiritual and material, rather than pursuing worldly possessions excessively.
orig: قل بفضل الله وبرحمته فبذلك فليفرحوا هو خير مما يجمعون

translation: Say, 'Have you considered what provision Allah has sent down for you, and you have made some of it unlawful and some lawful?' Say, 'Has Allah permitted you, or do you fabricate lies against Allah?'
interpretation: This verse questions the practice of making lawful what Allah has made unlawful, and vice versa, based on one's own whims and desires. It emphasizes that only Allah has the authority to legislate what is permissible and what is prohibited, and that attributing such authority to oneself is a grave lie against Allah.
orig: قل أرأيتم ما أنزل الله لكم من رزق فجعلتم منه حراما وحلالا قل آلله أذن لكم أم على الله تفترون

translation: And what think those who invent a lie against Allah of the Day of Resurrection? Verily, Allah is full of bounty to mankind, but most of them are ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse warns those who fabricate lies against Allah and attribute falsehoods to Him. It emphasizes that on the Day of Resurrection, they will realize the grave error of their ways. Despite Allah's immense favors and blessings upon humanity, most people remain ungrateful and do not appreciate His bounties.
orig: وما ظن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب يوم القيامة إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثرهم لا يشكرون

translation: And you are not occupied with any matter, nor do you recite anything from the Qur'an, nor do you do any deed, but We are witnesses over you when you are engaged in it. Not even an atom's weight escapes your Lord on earth or in heaven, nor anything smaller or greater than that, but it is recorded in a Clear Book.
interpretation: Allah subhanahu wa ta'ala is All-Knowing and Ever-Watchful over all our actions, words, and even thoughts. Nothing, not even the smallest particle, is hidden from His knowledge. Every single deed, whether good or bad, is being recorded meticulously in the Preserved Tablet (al-Lawh al-Mahfudh). This verse instills a sense of accountability and consciousness of Allah's presence at all times, which should motivate us to be mindful of our actions and strive to please Him.
orig: وما تكون في شأن وما تتلو منه من قرآن ولا تعملون من عمل إلا كنا عليكم شهودا إذ تفيضون فيه وما يعزب عن ربك من مثقال ذرة في الأرض ولا في السماء ولا أصغر من ذلك ولا أكبر إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve
interpretation: This verse assures the believers who are the allies and friends of Allah that they will have no fear or grief in this world or the Hereafter. It promises them security, peace of mind, and eternal happiness for being close to Allah and following His guidance. The interpretation emphasizes that those who have a firm faith in Allah and lead a righteous life need not fear any harm or feel distressed, for Allah's protection and mercy will encompass them.
orig: ألا إن أولياء الله لا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those who believe and were righteous,
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have faith and adopt righteousness and God-consciousness in their lives. It implies that true faith should be accompanied by virtuous actions and a mindful attitude of fearing God and avoiding what displeases Him.
orig: الذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون

translation: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words of Allah. That is what is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers glad tidings and good news in this life and in the Hereafter. The "words of Allah" refer to His promises and decrees, which are unchanging and will certainly be fulfilled. Attaining this eternal bliss and the pleasure of Allah is described as the "great attainment" or supreme success.
orig: لهم البشرى في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة لا تبديل لكلمات الله ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor belongs to Allah entirely. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse is a reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and a reminder not to be saddened by the words and rejection of the disbelievers. It emphasizes that true honor and glory belong solely to Allah, Who is All-Hearing and All-Knowing. The believers should not seek honor from people, but rather seek the honor that comes from Allah by obeying Him and following His commandments.
orig: ولا يحزنك قولهم إن العزة لله جميعا هو السميع العليم

translation: No doubt! Verily, to Allah belongs whosoever is in the heavens and whosoever is on the earth. And those who worship and invoke others besides Allah, in fact follow not (Allah's so-called) partners, they follow only a conjecture and they do nothing but lie.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and refutes the polytheists' belief in partners or associates with Allah. It states that everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and those who worship anything besides Allah are merely following conjecture and falsehood, not any real partners worthy of worship. They are lying to themselves by associating others with the One True God.
orig: ألا إن لله من في السماوات ومن في الأرض وما يتبع الذين يدعون من دون الله شركاء إن يتبعون إلا الظن وإن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: It is He who has made the night for you, that you may rest therein, and the day giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that "Allah has created the night for people to rest and find tranquility, and the day for them to see and carry out their activities. This alternation of night and day, with their respective purposes, is a sign of Allah's wisdom and power for those who reflect and listen to the teachings of the Qur'an."
orig: هو الذي جعل لكم الليل لتسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يسمعون

translation: They say, 'Allah has taken a son.' Glory be to Him! He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. You have no proof for this. Do you say about Allah what you do not know?
interpretation: This verse refutes the belief held by some that Allah has a son. It emphasizes Allah's transcendence and self-sufficiency, stating that He is far above the need for offspring. Everything in the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. The verse challenges those who make such claims, asking them to provide evidence, as they are attributing something to Allah without knowledge.
orig: قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا سبحانه هو الغني له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض إن عندكم من سلطان بهذا أتقولون على الله ما لا تعلمون

translation: Say, 'Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.'
interpretation: This verse warns against attributing false statements or lies to Allah. It emphasizes that those who deliberately fabricate lies and falsehoods about Allah and His religion will not achieve success or prosperity in this life or the Hereafter. Their actions are considered a grave sin, and they will face the consequences of their transgressions.
orig: قل إن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون

translation: A brief enjoyment in this world - then to Us is their return, then We shall make them taste the severe punishment because they used to disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers may enjoy some worldly pleasures temporarily, but their final return is to Allah, who will punish them severely for rejecting faith and denying His signs and revelations.
orig: متاع في الدنيا ثم إلينا مرجعهم ثم نذيقهم العذاب الشديد بما كانوا يكفرون

translation: And recite to them the story of Noah when he said to his people: 'O my people! If my stay and my reminding you of the signs of Allah has become burdensome upon you, then I have put my trust in Allah. So resolve your plan and [call upon] your associates. Then let not your plan be obscure to you. Then carry it out upon me and do not give me respite.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah commanded the Prophet Muhammad to recite the story of Prophet Noah to his people. Noah called his people to worship Allah alone, but they rejected his message. He told them that if his preaching and reminding them of Allah's signs was too much for them to bear, he had put his trust in Allah. He challenged them to devise their plan along with their idols and false gods, and then carry it out against him without any delay or respite.
orig: واتل عليهم نبأ نوح إذ قال لقومه يا قوم إن كان كبر عليكم مقامي وتذكيري بآيات الله فعلى الله توكلت فأجمعوا أمركم وشركاءكم ثم لا يكن أمركم عليكم غمة ثم اقضوا إلي ولا تنظرون

translation: But if you turn away [from my advice], then no payment have I asked of you. My reward is only from Allah, and I have been commanded to be of the Muslims.
interpretation: If you reject the message I have conveyed, I do not demand any reward from you for conveying it. My reward comes solely from Allah. I have been commanded to submit to Allah and be among those who have surrendered themselves to His will.
orig: فإن توليتم فما سألتكم من أجر إن أجري إلا على الله وأمرت أن أكون من المسلمين

translation: But they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship. And We made them successors and drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah and his people. Despite Noah's warnings, his people denied his message and refused to believe in God's signs. As a result, God saved Noah and those who believed in him by allowing them to board the ark, while drowning the disbelievers in the flood. The verse highlights that those who heeded the warning were made "successors" or inheritors of the earth, while the disbelievers faced a tragic end. It serves as a lesson to reflect on the consequences of denying God's signs and messengers.
orig: فكذبوه فنجيناه ومن معه في الفلك وجعلناهم خلائف وأغرقنا الذين كذبوا بآياتنا فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين

translation: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus do We seal over the hearts of the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that after rejecting previous messengers, God continued to send more messengers with clear signs and proofs, but those who had rejected the truth before were unlikely to believe due to their hardened hearts. It highlights God's mercy in sending guidance repeatedly, but also the consequence of continuously rejecting it, which leads to spiritual blindness and sealing of the heart against faith.
orig: ثم بعثنا من بعده رسلا إلى قومهم فجاءوهم بالبينات فما كانوا ليؤمنوا بما كذبوا به من قبل كذلك نطبع على قلوب المعتدين

translation: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his chiefs with Our signs, but they were arrogant and were a criminal people.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah sending Moses and Aaron as messengers to Pharaoh and his people with clear signs and miracles, but they rejected the message out of arrogance and obstinacy. They were a people who persisted in their crimes and disobedience to Allah.
orig: ثم بعثنا من بعدهم موسى وهارون إلى فرعون وملئه بآياتنا فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما مجرمين

translation: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'This is indeed a clear sorcery.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that when the clear truth and guidance came to the disbelievers from Allah, in the form of the Qur'an and the message of Islam, they rejected it and dismissed it as mere sorcery or magic. This shows their stubbornness, arrogance, and unwillingness to accept the truth, despite its clarity and evidence.
orig: فلما جاءهم الحق من عندنا قالوا إن هذا لسحر مبين

translation: Musa said: "Will you say for the truth when it has come to you, 'This is magic?' But magicians will not succeed."
interpretation: This verse refers to the confrontation between Prophet Musa (Moses) and the sorcerers of Pharaoh's court. When Musa performed the miracle of turning his staff into a serpent, the sorcerers accused him of practicing magic. However, Musa refuted their claim by stating that what he had brought was the truth from Allah, and that true magic or sorcery can never triumph over the truth and signs of Allah. The verse emphasizes that the truth will always prevail over falsehood and deception.
orig: قال موسى أتقولون للحق لما جاءكم أسحر هذا ولا يفلح الساحرون

translation: They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse reflects the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers who were unwilling to abandon the false beliefs and practices inherited from their forefathers. They challenged the Prophet to bring upon them the punishment he warned them about if he was truthful in his message, refusing to believe in him or his teachings.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لتلفتنا عما وجدنا عليه آباءنا وتكون لكما الكبرياء في الأرض وما نحن لكما بمؤمنين

translation: And Pharaoh said: "Bring me every well-versed sorcerer."
interpretation: Pharaoh, feeling threatened by Moses' miracles, arrogantly demanded that all skilled sorcerers be brought to him, intending to use their magic to challenge and discredit Moses. This verse highlights Pharaoh's prideful rejection of the truth and his reliance on deception and falsehood to maintain his power and authority.
orig: وقال فرعون ائتوني بكل ساحر عليم

translation: So when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them: 'Cast down what you are going to cast.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the confrontation between Moses and the sorcerers of Pharaoh's court. When the sorcerers gathered, Moses challenged them to cast their spells first, showing his confidence in the truth and power of God. This allowed the sorcerers to demonstrate their abilities, only to have their sorcery overcome by the clear miracle from God that Moses was able to perform.
orig: فلما جاء السحرة قال لهم موسى ألقوا ما أنتم ملقون

translation: But when they threw, Moses said: 'What you have brought is magic. Surely, Allah will render it vain. Indeed, Allah does not promote the work of the corrupt.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the contest between Moses and the magicians of Pharaoh's court. When the magicians cast their spells, which appeared to be ropes and snakes, Moses was not deceived. He affirmed that what they had done was mere magic tricks, and that Allah would expose their deception. Moses had faith that Allah would not allow the work of those who spread corruption and disbelief to succeed.
orig: فلما ألقوا قال موسى ما جئتم به السحر إن الله سيبطله إن الله لا يصلح عمل المفسدين

translation: And Allah will establish the truth by His words, even though the criminals dislike it.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah will uphold the truth through His words and teachings revealed in the Qur'an and through His Messenger, regardless of the dislike and opposition of the wrongdoers or criminals who reject the truth.
orig: ويحق الله الحق بكلماته ولو كره المجرمون

translation: But none had believed with Moses, except [some] offspring [i.e., descendants] from among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was among the transgressors.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that only a small group of people from Moses' nation believed in him and his message, while the majority did not believe due to their fear of Pharaoh and his powerful establishment. They were afraid that if they believed in Moses, Pharaoh would persecute and oppress them. The verse also highlights Pharaoh's arrogance and transgression, as he considered himself superior and did not submit to the truth brought by Moses.
orig: فما آمن لموسى إلا ذرية من قومه على خوف من فرعون وملئهم أن يفتنهم وإن فرعون لعال في الأرض وإنه لمن المسرفين

translation: And Moses said: 'O my people! If you have believed in Allah, then put your trust in Him, if you are Muslims.'
interpretation: "This verse encourages the believers to have complete trust and reliance in Allah after having faith in Him. It emphasizes that true faith necessitates putting one's trust in Allah alone, as He is the only One worthy of being depended upon. This trust should be unwavering, especially in times of difficulty or hardship. The verse links tawakkul (trust in Allah) with being a true Muslim, indicating that it is an essential component of the Islamic faith."
orig: وقال موسى يا قوم إن كنتم آمنتم بالله فعليه توكلوا إن كنتم مسلمين

translation: They said: 'In Allah we put our trust. Our Lord! Make us not a trial for the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse expresses the strong faith and reliance on Allah by the believers. They seek refuge in Allah from being a means of trial or temptation for the wrongdoers, as they do not want their faith to be tested or shaken by the oppressive actions of the unjust people.
orig: فقالوا على الله توكلنا ربنا لا تجعلنا فتنة للقوم الظالمين

translation: And deliver us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him to save and protect the believers from the harm and oppression of the disbelievers by His infinite mercy and grace. It reflects the struggle and hardship faced by the early Muslims at the hands of the disbelieving Quraysh in Makkah, and their reliance on Allah for deliverance and salvation.
orig: ونجنا برحمتك من القوم الكافرين

translation: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, 'Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses qiblah and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the command given by Allah to Prophet Moses and his brother Aaron to establish a place of worship and religious practice for the Israelites in Egypt. They were instructed to make their houses face the direction of prayer (qiblah) and to perform the obligatory prayers. Additionally, they were told to give glad tidings to the believers, indicating that they would be granted victory and deliverance from the oppression of Pharaoh.
orig: وأوحينا إلى موسى وأخيه أن تبوآ لقومكما بمصر بيوتا واجعلوا بيوتكم قبلة وأقيموا الصلاة وبشر المؤمنين

translation: And Moses said, 'Our Lord, You have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the present life, our Lord, that they may lead people astray from Your path. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.'
interpretation: في هذه الآية، يدعو موسى ربه ضد فرعون وملئه الذين أغرقوا بالزينة والأموال في الحياة الدنيا، مما جعلهم يضلون الناس عن سبيل الله. فيطلب موسى من ربه أن يطمس على أموالهم ويشدد على قلوبهم حتى لا يؤمنوا إلا بعد رؤية العذاب الأليم، وذلك لإصرارهم على الكفر والضلال.
orig: وقال موسى ربنا إنك آتيت فرعون وملأه زينة وأموالا في الحياة الدنيا ربنا ليضلوا عن سبيلك ربنا اطمس على أموالهم واشدد على قلوبهم فلا يؤمنوا حتى يروا العذاب الأليم

translation: He said, 'Your call has been answered. So remain steadfast, and do not follow the way of those who do not know.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to remain firm and steadfast on the path of truth and guidance, and not to follow the ways of those who lack knowledge and understanding of the divine teachings. It emphasizes the importance of adhering to the righteous path and avoiding the misguidance of ignorance.
orig: قال قد أجيبت دعوتكما فاستقيما ولا تتبعان سبيل الذين لا يعلمون

translation: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in insolence and hostility until, when the drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."
interpretation: This verse refers to the event of the Exodus, when God parted the sea for the Children of Israel to cross, and Pharaoh and his army pursued them arrogantly. When Pharaoh was about to drown, he declared his belief in the God of the Israelites and claimed to be a Muslim (one who submits to God). However, his declaration of faith at that moment was too late and insincere, as he had persisted in disbelief and oppression until the very end.
orig: وجاوزنا ببني إسرائيل البحر فأتبعهم فرعون وجنوده بغيا وعدوا حتى إذا أدركه الغرق قال آمنت أنه لا إله إلا الذي آمنت به بنو إسرائيل وأنا من المسلمين

translation: But I had already disobeyed before that and was one of the misguided.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the speaker had previously disobeyed God's commands and was among those who spread corruption and deviated from the right path. It implies a sense of regret and acknowledgment of past misdeeds.
orig: آلآن وقد عصيت قبل وكنت من المفسدين

translation: So this day We will deliver you with your body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless.
interpretation: "The interpretation is that God saved the body of the Pharaoh as a sign and lesson for future generations, despite many people being heedless and ignoring the signs and proofs of God's existence and power."
orig: فاليوم ننجيك ببدنك لتكون لمن خلفك آية وإن كثيرا من الناس عن آياتنا لغافلون

translation: And We had certainly settled the Children of Israel in a comfortable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: Allah affirms that He granted the Children of Israel a secure and prosperous dwelling place, and provided them with various lawful and wholesome provisions. However, they did not disagree or fall into disputes until after knowledge and guidance had come to them through the revelation and the messengers. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will judge between them regarding the matters over which they differed and disputed.
orig: ولقد بوأنا بني إسرائيل مبوأ صدق ورزقناهم من الطيبات فما اختلفوا حتى جاءهم العلم إن ربك يقضي بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: So if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to you, then ask those who read the Book before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
interpretation: If you have any lingering doubts about the divine origin of the Qur'an revealed to you, then consult those who have studied the previous scriptures, for they will recognize the truth and consistency of this revelation with the earlier ones. The truth has indeed come to you from your Lord, so do not allow yourself to be swayed by the skeptics and doubters.
orig: فإن كنت في شك مما أنزلنا إليك فاسأل الذين يقرءون الكتاب من قبلك لقد جاءك الحق من ربك فلا تكونن من الممترين

translation: And do not be of those who denied the signs of Allah, lest you become of the losers.
interpretation: This verse warns against denying or rejecting the signs and revelations of Allah, as doing so will lead one to be among the losers in this life and the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of believing in and following the guidance provided by Allah through His signs and revelations, and the dire consequences of disbelief and rejection.
orig: ولا تكونن من الذين كذبوا بآيات الله فتكون من الخاسرين

translation: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your Lord has become due will not believe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who have been destined by Allah's decree to be disbelievers and reject faith will not embrace belief, no matter how clear the signs and proofs are presented to them. Their hearts are sealed, and their minds are closed to the truth. Allah knows best who they are, and He has left them to persist in their disbelief as a consequence of their own choices and actions.
orig: إن الذين حقت عليهم كلمت ربك لا يؤمنون

translation: And even if every sign should come to them - until they see the painful punishment...
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no matter how many signs and proofs are presented to the disbelievers, they will not believe until they face the painful punishment of the Hereafter. Their stubbornness and rejection of faith is so severe that even witnessing miracles will not convince them until it is too late and they experience the torment they had been warned about.
orig: ولو جاءتهم كل آية حتى يروا العذاب الأليم

translation: But why was there not a town that believed - so its faith would benefit it - except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith and belief in God. It states that no town benefited from its faith except the people of Jonah, who were saved from a disgraceful punishment in this worldly life when they believed. This shows that faith and belief in God bring blessings and remove hardships, while disbelief leads to punishment and disgrace.
orig: فلولا كانت قرية آمنت فنفعها إيمانها إلا قوم يونس لما آمنوا كشفنا عنهم عذاب الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ومتعناهم إلى حين

translation: And if your Lord had willed, surely all those who are in the earth would have believed, all of them; will you then force people until they become believers?
interpretation: Allah is reminding us that faith is a matter of free will and choice. He has given human beings the ability to reason and the freedom to accept or reject faith. Forcing someone to believe goes against the principle of free will that Allah has bestowed upon us. True faith comes from a sincere conviction in one's heart, not through coercion or compulsion.
orig: ولو شاء ربك لآمن من في الأرض كلهم جميعا أفأنت تكره الناس حتى يكونوا مؤمنين

translation: And it is not for a soul to believe except by permission of Allah, and He will place defilement upon those who will not use reason.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true faith and belief in Allah can only be attained by His permission and guidance. It also warns that those who refuse to use their intellect and reason will have spiritual impurity ("defilement") placed upon them by Allah as a consequence of their willful ignorance and rejection of the truth.
orig: وما كان لنفس أن تؤمن إلا بإذن الله ويجعل الرجس على الذين لا يعقلون

translation: Say, "Observe what is in the heavens and the earth." But of what avail will be signs or warners to a people who do not believe?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that no amount of signs or warnings will benefit those who have chosen not to believe. The disbelievers are heedless to the clear evidence of Allah's existence and power manifest in the heavens and the earth. Their stubborn rejection of faith renders all signs and admonitions ineffective for them. The verse implies that belief requires an open heart and mind, which the disbelievers lack due to their arrogance and obstinacy.
orig: قل انظروا ماذا في السماوات والأرض وما تغني الآيات والنذر عن قوم لا يؤمنون

translation: Do they await except the likes of the days which befell those who were before them? Say: 'Then wait, for I am with you among the waiters.'
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers who stubbornly rejected the message of Islam. It reminds them that they should not expect a fate different from those who denied the truth before them and were consequently punished. The Prophet is instructed to tell them to wait for the punishment if they insist on their ways, for he too is waiting and watching their actions with patience, as decreed by Allah.
orig: فهل ينتظرون إلا مثل أيام الذين خلوا من قبلهم قل فانتظروا إني معكم من المنتظرين

translation: Then We will surely save Our messengers and those who have believed. Thus, it is incumbent upon Us to save the believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will surely save and protect His messengers and those who believe in them from persecution and harm inflicted by the disbelievers. It is a divine obligation upon Allah to deliver the believers from oppression and grant them salvation and victory over their enemies. This promise of divine assistance and deliverance serves as a source of reassurance and hope for the believers in the face of adversity.
orig: ثم ننجي رسلنا والذين آمنوا كذلك حقا علينا ننج المؤمنين

translation: Say, "O people, if you are in doubt about my religion - then I do not worship those you worship besides Allah but I worship Allah, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to address the disbelievers and declare that if they have any doubts about his religion, he does not worship the idols or false deities they worship besides Allah. Rather, he worships Allah alone, who has control over their lives and deaths. The Prophet is commanded to be among the true believers in Allah's Oneness.
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في شك من ديني فلا أعبد الذين تعبدون من دون الله ولكن أعبد الله الذي يتوفاكم وأمرت أن أكون من المؤمنين

translation: And set your face towards the religion, upright, and do not be among those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: "This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, and by extension all believers, to devote themselves sincerely to the religion of Islam and to worship Allah alone, without associating any partners with Him. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining a pure monotheistic belief and rejecting polytheism or the worship of any other deities besides Allah."
orig: وأن أقم وجهك للدين حنيفا ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then you would be of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse prohibits invoking or worshipping anything besides Allah, as doing so brings no benefit and is a form of wrongdoing. It emphasizes the futility of polytheism and idolatry, as only Allah has the power to benefit or harm. By associating partners with Allah, one becomes among the wrongdoers who have strayed from the straight path.
orig: ولا تدع من دون الله ما لا ينفعك ولا يضرك فإن فعلت فإنك إذا من الظالمين

translation: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him. And if He intends for you good, then there is no averter of His bounty. He causes it to reach whomever He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and control over all affairs. It emphasizes that if Allah decrees any adversity or harm upon a person, no one except Allah can remove or alleviate it. Conversely, if Allah intends good and bounty for someone, no one can prevent or repel that either. Allah bestows His favors upon whomever He wills from among His servants. The verse also reminds us of Allah's attributes of being the Forgiving and the Merciful, encouraging us to turn to Him in repentance and seek His forgiveness and mercy."
orig: وإن يمسسك الله بضر فلا كاشف له إلا هو وإن يردك بخير فلا راد لفضله يصيب به من يشاء من عباده وهو الغفور الرحيم

translation: Say, "O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord. Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a guardian."
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the individual responsibility of each person in accepting or rejecting the truth. The Prophet's role is only to convey the message, not to force people to believe. Guidance is a personal choice, and those who accept it benefit themselves, while those who reject it harm only themselves. The Prophet is not accountable for their choices."
orig: قل يا أيها الناس قد جاءكم الحق من ربكم فمن اهتدى فإنما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها وما أنا عليكم بوكيل

translation: And follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah judges, for He is the best of judges.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to adhere to the divine revelations he receives from Allah and to exercise patience in the face of adversity or opposition until Allah passes His judgment. It emphasizes that Allah's judgment is the most just and fair, as He is "the best of judges."
orig: واتبع ما يوحى إليك واصبر حتى يحكم الله وهو خير الحاكمين

translation: Alif Lam Ra. This is a Book whose verses are perfected, then expounded by One who is All-Wise, All-Aware.
interpretation: This verse introduces the Qur'an as a divinely revealed book whose verses have been perfected and then expounded in detail by Allah, who is All-Wise and All-Aware. It emphasizes the Qur'an's divine origin, perfection, and clarity, as well as Allah's wisdom and knowledge in revealing it.
orig: الر كتاب أحكمت آياته ثم فصلت من لدن حكيم خبير

translation: Worship none but Allah. Verily, I am to you from Him a warner and a bringer of glad tidings.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that "The Prophet Muhammad is commanded to call people to worship only Allah, the One True God, and to convey to them the warning of punishment for those who disobey, as well as the glad tidings of reward for those who believe and do righteous deeds. The Prophet's role is to deliver this message clearly, while the choice to accept or reject it lies with the people."
orig: ألا تعبدوا إلا الله إنني لكم منه نذير وبشير

translation: And seek forgiveness from your Lord and repent to Him, He will grant you a good provision until an appointed term, and bestow His abounding grace on every one endowed with grace. But if you turn away, then I fear for you the punishment of a great Day.
interpretation: This verse encourages seeking forgiveness from Allah and repenting sincerely to Him. It promises a good provision and blessings for those who do so until their appointed time. However, it warns that turning away from Allah will bring the fear of a severe punishment on a great Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of seeking Allah's forgiveness, repenting, and being grateful for His grace and favors.
orig: وأن استغفروا ربكم ثم توبوا إليه يمتعكم متاعا حسنا إلى أجل مسمى ويؤت كل ذي فضل فضله وإن تولوا فإني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم كبير

translation: To Allah is your return, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that our ultimate return and accountability is to Allah, who has complete power and control over all things. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of our actions and striving to please Allah, as we will ultimately answer to Him for our deeds. The verse also highlights Allah's omnipotence and ability to carry out whatever He wills, instilling a sense of reverence and reliance on His might and wisdom.
orig: إلى الله مرجعكم وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: No! They fold up their breasts to hide from Him. Surely, even when they cover themselves with their garments, He knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Indeed, He is All-Aware of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: This verse indicates that no matter how hard people try to hide their true intentions and thoughts from Allah, He is fully aware of what is in their hearts and minds. They may attempt to conceal their disbelief or evil plans, but Allah knows their secrets as well as what they reveal openly. His knowledge encompasses everything that is in the depths of people's souls.
orig: ألا إنهم يثنون صدورهم ليستخفوا منه ألا حين يستغشون ثيابهم يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its dwelling place and its deposit. All is in a clear Book.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete knowledge and control over all His creatures. It means that Allah alone provides sustenance for every living being on earth, and He knows exactly where each creature lives and where it stores its provisions. All of this information is recorded in a clear Book, which refers to the Preserved Tablet (al-Lawh al-Mahfudh) containing Allah's complete knowledge of everything.
orig: وما من دابة في الأرض إلا على الله رزقها ويعلم مستقرها ومستودعها كل في كتاب مبين

translation: And He is the One who created the heavens and the earth in six days, and His Throne was upon the water, that He might test you as to which of you is best in deeds. And if you were to say, "You will indeed be resurrected after death," those who disbelieve would say, "This is nothing but obvious magic."
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power as the Creator of the heavens and the earth in six days, with His Throne being upon the water. It states that the purpose of creation is to test humankind and see who excels in good deeds. The verse also addresses the disbelievers' rejection of the concept of resurrection after death, dismissing it as mere "obvious magic," which reflects their lack of faith.
orig: وهو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام وكان عرشه على الماء ليبلوكم أيكم أحسن عملا ولئن قلت إنكم مبعوثون من بعد الموت ليقولن الذين كفروا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And if We delay the punishment from them until a counted term, they will surely say, 'What detains it?' Unquestionably, the Day it comes to them it will not be averted from them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: Allah is warning the disbelievers that if He delays punishing them for their sins in this life, they should not think that the punishment will never come. It will surely come on the Day of Resurrection, and on that Day, they will not be able to escape or avoid it. They will be surrounded by the very punishment that they used to mock and make fun of in this world.
orig: ولئن أخرنا عنهم العذاب إلى أمة معدودة ليقولن ما يحبسه ألا يوم يأتيهم ليس مصروفا عنهم وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and impatience of human beings. When Allah bestows His mercy and blessings upon a person, they enjoy and feel content with it. However, if that mercy is withdrawn or taken away from them, they become despairing, hopeless, and ungrateful for the previous favors they had enjoyed. This shows the weakness of human nature and the importance of being grateful to Allah in all circumstances.
orig: ولئن أذقنا الإنسان منا رحمة ثم نزعناها منه إنه ليئوس كفور

translation: And if We give him a taste of mercy after adversity has touched him, he will surely say, "The evils have departed from me." Indeed, he is exultant and boastful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ungrateful and arrogant nature of some people. When they experience hardship or difficulty, they become distressed and complain. However, when Allah blesses them with favors and comforts after that adversity, they become arrogant and attribute their success to themselves rather than being grateful to Allah. They forget the previous difficulties they faced and boast about their achievements, considering themselves self-sufficient and not in need of Allah's guidance and mercy. This attitude reflects ingratitude towards Allah's blessings and a lack of humility.
orig: ولئن أذقناه نعماء بعد ضراء مسته ليقولن ذهب السيئات عني إنه لفرح فخور

translation: But those who are patient and do righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and righteous actions. It promises forgiveness and a great reward from Allah for those who persevere through difficulties and strive to do good deeds. The interpretation highlights that true faith is not just a matter of belief, but also requires steadfastness and actively working towards righteousness in one's life.
orig: إلا الذين صبروا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك لهم مغفرة وأجر كبير

translation: Then perhaps you would leave out a part of what is revealed to you, and you would feel distressed in your breast from their saying, 'Why has a treasure not been sent down to him, or an angel not come with him?' You are only a warner, and Allah is a Disposer of all things.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It suggests that he may have felt inclined to omit parts of the revelation due to the demands and mockery of the disbelievers, who asked why a treasure or an angel did not accompany him as proof of his prophethood. However, the verse reminds him that his role is solely to deliver the warning, while Allah is the ultimate authority over all matters.
orig: فلعلك تارك بعض ما يوحى إليك وضائق به صدرك أن يقولوا لولا أنزل عليه كنز أو جاء معه ملك إنما أنت نذير والله على كل شيء وكيل

translation: Or do they say, "He has forged it"? Say, "Then bring ten forged surahs like it and call upon whomever you can besides Allah, if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse challenges those who accuse the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of forging the Qur'an. It invites them to produce even ten surahs (chapters) like those of the Qur'an if they claim it is forged. The inability to meet this challenge is evidence that the Qur'an is indeed the Word of Allah, and not a human fabrication. The verse emphasizes the inimitable nature of the Qur'an's linguistic and literary excellence, which proves its divine origin.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل فأتوا بعشر سور مثله مفتريات وادعوا من استطعتم من دون الله إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But if they do not respond to you, then know that it was not sent down except by the knowledge of Allah, and that there is no deity except Him. So, will you be Muslims?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an was revealed by the knowledge and will of Allah alone, and that there is no other true deity worthy of worship besides Him. It calls upon people to submit to Allah by embracing Islam, regardless of whether others respond positively or not.
orig: فإلم يستجيبوا لكم فاعلموا أنما أنزل بعلم الله وأن لا إله إلا هو فهل أنتم مسلمون

translation: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments, We shall pay them in full for their deeds therein, and they will not be deprived.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who desire the worldly life and its material pleasures will be given what they have earned in this world, but they will not receive any reward in the Hereafter. The implication is that one should not be solely focused on the temporary delights of this world, but should also strive for the everlasting rewards of the Hereafter.
orig: من كان يريد الحياة الدنيا وزينتها نوف إليهم أعمالهم فيها وهم فيها لا يبخسون

translation: Those are the ones for whom there is nothing in the Hereafter but the Fire, and lost is what they did therein, and vain is what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers and those who reject faith. It states that in the Hereafter, they will have nothing but the punishment of Hellfire. All their deeds and actions in this worldly life will be rendered futile and worthless, as they were not based on faith and done for the sake of Allah. Their efforts and works will be in vain, as they lacked the essential element of belief in the One True God.
orig: أولئك الذين ليس لهم في الآخرة إلا النار وحبط ما صنعوا فيها وباطل ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Is one who is upon clear evidence from his Lord, and a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Book of Moses - a guide and a mercy? Those believe in it. But whoever disbelieves in it from the factions - the Fire is the promised place for them. So be not in doubt of it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most people do not believe.
interpretation: This verse contrasts the believers who follow the clear evidence and guidance from God with the disbelievers who reject it. The believers have the Qur'an, which is a continuation of previous revelations like the Torah given to Moses, as a guide and mercy. Those who reject the Qur'an from among the various factions will have the Fire as their promised destination. The verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is the truth from God, but most people stubbornly refuse to believe in it.
orig: أفمن كان على بينة من ربه ويتلوه شاهد منه ومن قبله كتاب موسى إماما ورحمة أولئك يؤمنون به ومن يكفر به من الأحزاب فالنار موعده فلا تك في مرية منه إنه الحق من ربك ولكن أكثر الناس لا يؤمنون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie against Allah? Those will be presented before their Lord, and the witnesses will say, 'These are the ones who lied against their Lord.' Unquestionably, the curse of Allah is upon the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against the grave sin of attributing falsehood to Allah. Those who fabricate lies and ascribe them to Allah are considered the most unjust people. On the Day of Judgment, they will be brought before their Lord, and the witnesses will testify against them, confirming that they lied against Allah. The verse emphasizes that Allah's curse will undoubtedly be upon those wrongdoers who dared to attribute lies to Him.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أولئك يعرضون على ربهم ويقول الأشهاد هؤلاء الذين كذبوا على ربهم ألا لعنة الله على الظالمين

translation: Those who hinder (others) from the Path of Allah and seek crookedness therein, and they are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who obstruct others from following Allah's guidance and the straight path. They actively try to mislead people and promote deviation and crookedness in religion. Moreover, they reject the belief in the Hereafter and the accountability on the Day of Judgment. Their disbelief in the life after death is the root cause of their misguided actions.
orig: الذين يصدون عن سبيل الله ويبغونها عوجا وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون

translation: Those were not the ones who were outdone on the earth, nor did they have any protectors besides Allah, for whom the punishment would be multiplied. They could not hear, nor could they see.
interpretation: This verse is referring to those who rejected faith and denied the signs of Allah. It states that they were not able to escape Allah's punishment on earth, nor did they have any helpers or protectors besides Allah who could shield them from the intensified punishment. They were spiritually deaf and blind, unable to comprehend the truth or see the signs of Allah's existence and power.
orig: أولئك لم يكونوا معجزين في الأرض وما كان لهم من دون الله من أولياء يضاعف لهم العذاب ما كانوا يستطيعون السمع وما كانوا يبصرون

translation: Those are the ones who have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who disbelieved and rejected the truth. They have ruined themselves by turning away from faith and following falsehoods. All the lies and fabrications they attributed to Allah have been rendered useless and have no value or benefit for them. They have lost the opportunity to attain salvation and will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: أولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: No doubt, in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject faith and truth in this world will be the ultimate losers in the Hereafter. Their disbelief and arrogance will lead them to a state of immense loss and deprivation in the next life, where they will face the consequences of their actions and miss out on the eternal rewards and bliss promised to the believers.
orig: لا جرم أنهم في الآخرة هم الأخسرون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - it is they who are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.
interpretation: This verse highlights the criteria for attaining eternal Paradise: having faith (iman), performing good deeds, and humbling oneself before God. It promises that those who meet these conditions will be the dwellers of Paradise, where they will reside forever. The emphasis is on the combination of faith, righteous actions, and a humble attitude towards the Divine, leading to the ultimate reward of eternal bliss in Paradise.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وأخبتوا إلى ربهم أولئك أصحاب الجنة هم فيها خالدون

translation: The example of the two groups is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in example? Will you not then take admonition?
interpretation: This verse draws a comparison between two groups: those who are spiritually blind and deaf (the disbelievers), and those who can see and hear the truth (the believers). It emphasizes that these two groups are not equal, just as a blind and deaf person is not equal to one who can see and hear. The verse is calling people to reflect and take a lesson from this clear example, urging them to open their spiritual eyes and ears to the truth of faith.
orig: مثل الفريقين كالأعمى والأصم والبصير والسميع هل يستويان مثلا أفلا تذكرون

translation: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], 'Indeed, I am to you a clear warner'
interpretation: Allah sent Noah as a messenger to his people to warn them clearly against associating partners with Allah and to call them to worship Allah alone. Noah conveyed the message of Tawheed (Oneness of Allah) and warned his people of the consequences of rejecting faith and continuing in their disbelief and polytheistic practices.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه إني لكم نذير مبين

translation: That you worship none but Allah. Verily, I fear for you the torment of a painful Day.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of Islamic monotheism, commanding the worship of Allah alone and warning against the consequences of associating partners with Him. The interpretation is: "The main purpose of this verse is to instruct people to devote their worship solely to Allah, the One True God, and to abstain from idolatry or polytheism. The Prophet is conveying Allah's message, expressing his sincere concern for the people and cautioning them against the severe punishment that awaits those who reject the worship of the One God on the painful Day of Judgment."
orig: أن لا تعبدوا إلا الله إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم أليم

translation: But the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people said, 'We see you only as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest among us, immature in judgement. And we do not see in you all any merit over us; rather, we think you are liars.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant response of the disbelieving leaders of the Prophet's people when he called them to Islam. They arrogantly dismissed him as just an ordinary man like themselves, and mocked his followers as being from the lowest classes and lacking wisdom. They also denied that he had any merit or superiority over them, accusing him of lying about his prophethood.
orig: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما نراك إلا بشرا مثلنا وما نراك اتبعك إلا الذين هم أراذلنا بادي الرأي وما نرى لكم علينا من فضل بل نظنكم كاذبين

translation: He said: 'O my people! What is your opinion? If I am upon clear evidence from my Lord and He has given me mercy from Himself, but it has been obscured from you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?'
interpretation: The Prophet is asking his people, if he has been given clear evidence and guidance from God, and God has bestowed His mercy upon him, but they are unable to perceive it due to their arrogance and stubbornness, should he still try to force them to accept the truth against their will? The verse implies that faith cannot be imposed, and people must be willing to accept the truth with an open heart and mind.
orig: قال يا قوم أرأيتم إن كنت على بينة من ربي وآتاني رحمة من عنده فعميت عليكم أنلزمكموها وأنتم لها كارهون

translation: And O my people, I ask of you no wealth for it. My reward is only from Allah. And I am not going to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.
interpretation: "I do not demand any payment or reward from you for conveying Allah's message. My reward comes solely from Allah. I will not turn away or reject those who have believed in Allah, for they will meet their Lord on the Day of Judgment. However, I perceive that you are a people steeped in ignorance, rejecting the truth and persisting in disbelief."
orig: ويا قوم لا أسألكم عليه مالا إن أجري إلا على الله وما أنا بطارد الذين آمنوا إنهم ملاقو ربهم ولكني أراكم قوما تجهلون

translation: And O my people, who would help me against Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not remember?
interpretation: This verse implies that the Prophet is reminding his people that if he were to drive away or reject the believers, he would essentially be opposing Allah's command. He questions them rhetorically, asking who could then help or protect him from Allah's punishment for such disobedience. The verse calls upon the people to reflect and remember that opposing Allah and His Prophet has grave consequences.
orig: ويا قوم من ينصرني من الله إن طردتهم أفلا تذكرون

translation: Nor do I say to you that I possess the treasures of Allah, nor do I know the unseen, nor do I claim to be an angel. Nor do I say to those whom your eyes look down upon that Allah will not bestow any good upon them. Allah knows best what is in their souls. Indeed, I would then be one of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Prophet's humility and his rejection of any divine attributes or knowledge of the unseen. He clarifies that he does not claim to possess Allah's treasures, know the unseen, or be an angel. He also affirms that he does not look down upon or belittle anyone, as only Allah knows what is in people's souls. The Prophet declares that making such claims or judgments would make him one of the wrongdoers.
orig: ولا أقول لكم عندي خزائن الله ولا أعلم الغيب ولا أقول إني ملك ولا أقول للذين تزدري أعينكم لن يؤتيهم الله خيرا الله أعلم بما في أنفسهم إني إذا لمن الظالمين

translation: They said, 'O Noah, you have disputed with us and prolonged dispute with us, so bring us what you threaten us with, if you are one of the truthful.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking Noah and challenging him to bring the punishment he warned them about, if he was truly a messenger of God. Their tone is one of arrogance and defiance, refusing to believe Noah's message despite his persistent efforts to guide them. The interpretation highlights the disbelievers' stubborn rejection of the truth and their demand for immediate punishment as proof, rather than heeding the warning and repenting.
orig: قالوا يا نوح قد جادلتنا فأكثرت جدالنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said, 'Allah alone can bring it to you, if He wills, and you cannot frustrate it.'
interpretation: This verse implies that the Prophet Muhammad was not the source of revelation, but rather it was Allah who revealed the Qur'an to him through the Angel Gabriel. The Prophet had no control over when or how the revelation would come, as it was entirely dependent on Allah's will. The verse emphasizes the divine origin of the Qur'an and the Prophet's role as a messenger, not an author or inventor of the scripture.
orig: قال إنما يأتيكم به الله إن شاء وما أنتم بمعجزين

translation: But my advice will not benefit you, even if I wished to advise you, if Allah intends to leave you astray. He is your Lord, and to Him you will return.
interpretation: This verse suggests that guidance comes from Allah alone. Even if the Prophet wished to advise or guide someone, it would not benefit them if Allah wills for them to remain misguided. Ultimately, Allah is the Lord and to Him all will return to be judged for their beliefs and actions.
orig: ولا ينفعكم نصحي إن أردت أن أنصح لكم إن كان الله يريد أن يغويكم هو ربكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, then upon me is my guilt, and I am free from what you commit of sins."
interpretation: This verse addresses those who accused the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of fabricating the Qur'an. It instructs him to respond by saying that if he had indeed invented it, then the sin of fabrication would be upon him alone, and he would be innocent of the sins and disbelief that they are committing.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل إن افتريته فعلي إجرامي وأنا بريء مما تجرمون

translation: And it was revealed to Noah that none of your people will believe except those who have already believed, so do not be distressed by what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah revealed to Prophet Noah that only those among his people who had already believed would continue to believe in his message, and that he should not grieve over the disbelief and actions of the others. It suggests that despite Noah's efforts to guide his people, many would persist in their disbelief and wrongdoings, but he should remain steadfast and not be saddened by their rejection.
orig: وأوحي إلى نوح أنه لن يؤمن من قومك إلا من قد آمن فلا تبتئس بما كانوا يفعلون

translation: And construct the ship under Our observation and Our inspiration and do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are [to be] drowned.
interpretation: Allah commanded Prophet Nuh (Noah) to build the Ark under His divine guidance and protection. He was instructed not to plead for the disbelievers who persisted in wrongdoing, as they would inevitably face drowning and destruction for their rejection of faith.
orig: واصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا إنهم مغرقون

translation: And he constructed the ark, and whenever an assembly of his people passed by him, they ridiculed him. He said, "If you ridicule us, then we will ridicule you just as you ridicule."
interpretation: This verse describes the situation of the Prophet Noah (peace be upon him) while he was building the ark. Despite facing mockery and ridicule from his people, he remained steadfast in his mission and warned them that just as they were mocking him, they too would be mocked for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: ويصنع الفلك وكلما مر عليه ملأ من قومه سخروا منه قال إن تسخروا منا فإنا نسخر منكم كما تسخرون

translation: So you will come to know who it is to whom comes a punishment disgracing him, and on whom descends an enduring punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that they will soon realize who will be humiliated by Allah's punishment and who will suffer a lasting torment. It implies that the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and everlasting than any worldly punishment.
orig: فسوف تعلمون من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم

translation: Until, when Our Command came and the oven overflowed, We said: 'Load therein a pair of every kind, and your family - except those against whom the Word has already gone forth - and those who believe.' And none believed with him, except a few.
interpretation: Allah is describing the events surrounding the story of Prophet Nuh (Noah) and the Ark. When the time came for the punishment to strike the disbelieving people, and the oven (referring to the oven that would produce the waters of the flood) "overflowed," Allah commanded Nuh to take aboard the Ark pairs of all creatures, along with the believers from his family and followers. However, only a small number of people believed in Nuh and joined him on the Ark, while the majority rejected his message.
orig: حتى إذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور قلنا احمل فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول ومن آمن وما آمن معه إلا قليل

translation: And he said: 'Embark therein. In the name of Allah will be its course and its mooring. Indeed, my Lord is Forgiving and Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the command given by Allah to Prophet Nuh (Noah) to board the Ark with his followers and the pairs of animals, trusting in Allah's name and His ability to guide the Ark safely through the flood and bring it to rest. It highlights Allah's mercy in saving the believers and giving them a fresh start, as well as His forgiveness for their past sins.
orig: وقال اركبوا فيها بسم الله مجراها ومرساها إن ربي لغفور رحيم

translation: And it sailed with them amidst waves like mountains, and Noah called out to his son, who was apart [from them], 'O my son! Embark with us and be not with the disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse describes the intense scene of the flood and Noah's Ark sailing through massive waves as high as mountains. Despite the perilous situation, Noah calls out to his son, who was separated from them, urging him to embark on the Ark and not remain with the disbelievers who denied the warning and mocked Noah's message.
orig: وهي تجري بهم في موج كالجبال ونادى نوح ابنه وكان في معزل يا بني اركب معنا ولا تكن مع الكافرين

translation: He said, 'I will take refuge on a mountain to protect me from the water.' He said, 'There is no protector today from the decree of Allah except for whoever He gives mercy.' And the waves came between them, and he was among the drowned.
interpretation: This verse describes the conversation between Prophet Nuh (Noah) and his son during the great flood. When the son refused to believe in Allah and board the ark, he thought he could find safety on a mountain. However, Nuh informed him that on that day, no one could be saved from Allah's decree except those whom Allah had mercy upon. The waves separated them, and the son was among those who drowned, as he had rejected faith and refused to embark on the ark of salvation.
orig: قال سآوي إلى جبل يعصمني من الماء قال لا عاصم اليوم من أمر الله إلا من رحم وحال بينهما الموج فكان من المغرقين

translation: And it was said, 'O earth, swallow your water, and O sky, withhold [your rain].' And the water subsided, and the matter was accomplished, and the ship came to rest on [Mount] Judiyy. And it was said, 'Away with the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse describes the culmination of the great flood and the salvation of Prophet Noah and his followers on the Ark. The earth was commanded to swallow up the floodwaters, and the sky was commanded to stop raining. The water subsided, and the Ark settled on Mount Judiyy. The wrongdoers who rejected the message of God and Noah were condemned and perished in the flood.
orig: وقيل يا أرض ابلعي ماءك ويا سماء أقلعي وغيض الماء وقضي الأمر واستوت على الجودي وقيل بعدا للقوم الظالمين

translation: And Noah called out to his Lord and said, 'My Lord, indeed my son is of my family, and Your promise is surely true, and You are the Most Just of judges.'
interpretation: Noah pleaded with Allah to save his son, arguing that he was part of his family and that Allah's promise to save his family was truthful. Noah acknowledged Allah's supreme wisdom and justice in judging matters.
orig: ونادى نوح ربه فقال رب إن ابني من أهلي وإن وعدك الحق وأنت أحكم الحاكمين

translation: He said: 'O Noah! He is not of your family; for his conduct is unrighteous. So ask Me not concerning that whereof thou hast no knowledge. I admonish thee lest thou be among the ignorant.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that even though someone may be a close relative, if they engage in unrighteous conduct, they cannot be considered part of the believing family. It advises against asking about matters beyond one's knowledge and warns against being among the ignorant who lack proper understanding.
orig: قال يا نوح إنه ليس من أهلك إنه عمل غير صالح فلا تسألن ما ليس لك به علم إني أعظك أن تكون من الجاهلين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You from asking You that of which I have no knowledge. And unless You forgive me and have mercy upon me, I will be among the losers.'
interpretation: This verse teaches us to seek refuge in Allah from asking Him for things that we have no knowledge of, as that would be foolish and inappropriate. It also highlights the importance of seeking Allah's forgiveness and mercy, as without them, we would be among the losers in this life and the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes humility, recognizing our limitations, and relying on Allah's guidance and grace.
orig: قال رب إني أعوذ بك أن أسألك ما ليس لي به علم وإلا تغفر لي وترحمني أكن من الخاسرين

translation: It was said, 'O Noah, disembark in peace from Us and blessings upon you and upon nations [descending] from those with you. But other nations We will grant provision, then there will touch them from Us a painful punishment.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the end of Noah's journey on the Ark and the start of a new era for humanity. God commanded Noah to disembark peacefully, bestowing blessings upon him and the believers who were with him. However, God also foretells that there will be other nations who will be granted provisions and enjoyment in this world, but eventually they will face a painful punishment from God if they reject faith and disobey His commands.
orig: قيل يا نوح اهبط بسلام منا وبركات عليك وعلى أمم ممن معك وأمم سنمتعهم ثم يمسهم منا عذاب أليم

translation: These are from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew them not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] consequence is for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the stories and events mentioned in the Qur'an about previous nations and prophets are from the knowledge of the unseen, which Allah revealed to Prophet Muhammad through revelation. Neither he nor his people had any prior knowledge of these events. The verse encourages the Prophet and the believers to be patient in the face of difficulties, as the ultimate good end is for those who are righteous and God-fearing.
orig: تلك من أنباء الغيب نوحيها إليك ما كنت تعلمها أنت ولا قومك من قبل هذا فاصبر إن العاقبة للمتقين

translation: And to the 'Aad (people), (We sent) their brother Hud. He said: 'O my people! Worship Allah! You have no other Ilah (God) but Him. Certainly, you are but forgers of falsehood.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that Prophet Hud was sent to the tribe of 'Aad to call them to worship Allah alone, as He is the only true God worthy of worship. Hud accused them of fabricating lies by worshipping idols and associating partners with Allah.
orig: وإلى عاد أخاهم هودا قال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره إن أنتم إلا مفترون

translation: O my people, I ask you no reward for it. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?
interpretation: In this verse, the Prophet is addressing his people and telling them that he does not seek any worldly reward or compensation from them for conveying the message of Islam. His only reward is from Allah, the One who created him and entrusted him with this noble mission. He is urging them to use their intellect and reason to recognize the truth and embrace the religion of Islam, which is based on pure monotheism and submission to the One True God.
orig: يا قوم لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إن أجري إلا على الذي فطرني أفلا تعقلون

translation: And O my people, ask forgiveness of your Lord and then repent to Him. He will unleash the sky pouring down upon you abundantly and will add strength to your strength. And do not turn away as criminals.
interpretation: This verse encourages the people to seek forgiveness from Allah and repent sincerely. It promises that if they do so, Allah will bless them with abundant rain and increase their strength. It also warns them against turning away from the truth and persisting in sin and disobedience like criminals.
orig: ويا قوم استغفروا ربكم ثم توبوا إليه يرسل السماء عليكم مدرارا ويزدكم قوة إلى قوتكم ولا تتولوا مجرمين

translation: They said: "O Hud! You have not brought us clear evidence, and we shall not leave our gods for your mere word, and we are not going to believe in you."
interpretation: The disbelievers are rejecting the message of Prophet Hud and demanding clear proof or miracles from him. They are arrogantly refusing to abandon the worship of their false gods based solely on Hud's words, as they do not have faith in him as a true messenger of God.
orig: قالوا يا هود ما جئتنا ببينة وما نحن بتاركي آلهتنا عن قولك وما نحن لك بمؤمنين

translation: They said, "We only say that some of our gods have possessed you with evil." He said, "Indeed, I call Allah to witness, and witness yourselves, that I am free from whatever you associate with Allah,"
interpretation: This verse is rejecting the claims of the disbelievers who accused the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of being possessed by their gods or idols, which caused him to preach against them. The Prophet responds by calling upon Allah as a witness that he is completely free and innocent from associating any partners with Allah, which is the essence of shirk (polytheism) that he was preaching against.
orig: إن نقول إلا اعتراك بعض آلهتنا بسوء قال إني أشهد الله واشهدوا أني بريء مما تشركون

translation: But if you turn away, then produce a surah like it and call upon [for assistance] whomever you can besides Allah, if you should be truthful.
interpretation: If you reject the Qur'an and claim it is from other than Allah, then produce a single chapter like it by seeking help from anyone other than Allah, if you are truthful in your claim that the Qur'an is not from Allah.
orig: من دونه فكيدوني جميعا ثم لا تنظرون

translation: Indeed, I have put my trust in Allah, my Lord and your Lord. There is no creature but that He holds its forelock. Indeed, my Lord is on a path that is straight.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes complete trust and reliance in Allah alone. It affirms that Allah is the sole Sustainer and Controller of all creatures, and that He guides whoever He wills to the straight path. The interpretation highlights the importance of having unwavering faith in Allah's power, wisdom and justice.
orig: إني توكلت على الله ربي وربكم ما من دابة إلا هو آخذ بناصيتها إن ربي على صراط مستقيم

translation: But if you turn away, then indeed I have conveyed to you that with which I was sent to you. And my Lord will replace you with a people other than you, and you will not harm Him at all. Indeed, my Lord is over all things an Observer.
interpretation: "Si vous vous détournez, alors j'ai effectivement transmis le message pour lequel j'ai été envoyé vers vous. Et mon Seigneur vous remplacera par un autre peuple, et vous ne Lui causerez aucun préjudice. En vérité, mon Seigneur est le Gardien de toute chose."
orig: فإن تولوا فقد أبلغتكم ما أرسلت به إليكم ويستخلف ربي قوما غيركم ولا تضرونه شيئا إن ربي على كل شيء حفيظ

translation: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him by mercy from Us, and We saved them from a severe punishment.
interpretation: Allah saved the Prophet Hud and his followers who believed in his message by His mercy, and delivered them from a severe and painful punishment that befell the disbelievers.
orig: ولما جاء أمرنا نجينا هودا والذين آمنوا معه برحمة منا ونجيناهم من عذاب غليظ

translation: And that was 'Aad - they rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the command of every obstinate tyrant.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of 'Aad, an ancient Arab tribe who denied the signs and revelations of Allah and defied His messengers. They followed the orders of every stubborn and oppressive leader, rejecting the truth and persisting in disbelief and disobedience. Their arrogance and rebellion against Allah's commands ultimately led to their destruction.
orig: وتلك عاد جحدوا بآيات ربهم وعصوا رسله واتبعوا أمر كل جبار عنيد
