They will be forced to drink a boiling, foul liquid that will scald their insides, yet they will not die from it. Death will surround them from all directions, but it will not come to them, prolonging their agony. Furthermore, an even more severe torment awaits them beyond this initial punishment.
orig: يتجرعه ولا يكاد يسيغه ويأتيه الموت من كل مكان وما هو بميت ومن ورائه عذاب غليظ

translation: The example of those who disbelieved in their Lord is that their deeds are like ashes on which the wind blows furiously on a stormy day. They have no power over anything they have earned. That is the utmost misguidance.
interpretation: This verse compares the deeds of the disbelievers to ashes scattered by a furious wind on a stormy day, indicating that their deeds are utterly worthless and fruitless. It emphasizes that they will not benefit from their actions in the least, as they have strayed far from the right path due to their rejection of their Lord. This serves as a stern warning about the grave consequences of disbelief and the importance of faith and righteous deeds.
orig: مثل الذين كفروا بربهم أعمالهم كرماد اشتدت به الريح في يوم عاصف لا يقدرون مما كسبوا على شيء ذلك هو الضلال البعيد

translation: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can remove you and bring a new creation.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and sovereignty over all creation. It reminds us that Allah created the heavens and the earth with wisdom and purpose ("in truth"). If He wills, He has the power to remove the present creation and bring forth a new one. This verse instills a sense of humility and reverence for the Almighty, reminding us of our complete dependence on Him and the transient nature of this worldly existence.
orig: ألم تر أن الله خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق إن يشأ يذهبكم ويأت بخلق جديد

translation: And that is not difficult for Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the limitless power and ability of Allah. It affirms that nothing is difficult or impossible for Him to accomplish. This implies that Allah has the capacity to fulfill any promise, command, or decree with ease and without any constraints. It serves as a reminder of Allah's absolute sovereignty and omnipotence over all affairs.
orig: وما ذلك على الله بعزيز

translation: And they will come forth before Allah all together, and the weak will say to those who were arrogant, 'Indeed, we were your followers, so will you then avail us anything against the punishment of Allah?' They will say, 'If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is all the same for us whether we show intolerance or are patient: there is no place of refuge for us.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when the weak and oppressed will confront their arrogant leaders and ask them if they can protect them from Allah's punishment, since they followed them in this world. The arrogant ones will reply that if Allah had guided them, they would have guided their followers as well, but now it is too late. They will admit that their impatience or patience makes no difference, as there is no escape from Allah's judgment.
orig: وبرزوا لله جميعا فقال الضعفاء للذين استكبروا إنا كنا لكم تبعا فهل أنتم مغنون عنا من عذاب الله من شيء قالوا لو هدانا الله لهديناكم سواء علينا أجزعنا أم صبرنا ما لنا من محيص

translation: And Satan will say when the matter has been concluded, "Indeed, Allah had promised you the promise of truth. And I promised you, but I betrayed you. But I had no authority over you except that I invited you, and you responded to me. So do not blame me; but blame yourselves. I cannot be called to your aid, nor can you be called to my aid. Indeed, I deny your association of me with Allah before. Indeed, for the wrongdoers is a painful punishment."
interpretation: In this verse, Satan (Shaytan) admits that he deceived and misled people by making false promises to them, but he had no real authority or power over them except that he invited them to disobey Allah and they voluntarily responded to his call. He tells them not to blame him, but to blame themselves for following him. He also declares that he has disassociated himself from their polytheistic beliefs and practices, and warns that the wrongdoers who associated partners with Allah will face a painful punishment.
orig: وقال الشيطان لما قضي الأمر إن الله وعدكم وعد الحق ووعدتكم فأخلفتكم وما كان لي عليكم من سلطان إلا أن دعوتكم فاستجبتم لي فلا تلوموني ولوموا أنفسكم ما أنا بمصرخكم وما أنتم بمصرخي إني كفرت بما أشركتمون من قبل إن الظالمين لهم عذاب أليم

translation: And those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally by permission of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be, "Peace!"
interpretation: This verse promises the believers who do good deeds that they will enter Paradise, described as gardens with rivers flowing beneath them. They will abide there forever by the permission of Allah. The greeting they will receive in Paradise is "Peace," indicating a state of tranquility, security, and freedom from all troubles and distress.
orig: وأدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها بإذن ربهم تحيتهم فيها سلام

translation: Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?
interpretation: This verse uses the metaphor of a good tree to represent a good word or statement of faith. A "good word" refers to the testimony of faith ("There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah") or any words affirming belief in Allah and His teachings. Just as a good tree has deep, firmly rooted origins and branches reaching towards the sky, a sincere declaration of faith is firmly grounded in one's heart and soul, while its effects and rewards extend towards the heavens.
orig: ألم تر كيف ضرب الله مثلا كلمة طيبة كشجرة طيبة أصلها ثابت وفرعها في السماء

translation: It gives its fruit at all times by the permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating fruits that bear continuously with His permission. The example of the ever-fruitful tree is given as a parable for people to contemplate Allah's signs and be reminded of His favors and greatness.
orig: تؤتي أكلها كل حين بإذن ربها ويضرب الله الأمثال للناس لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: And the parable of an evil word is that of an evil tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.
interpretation: This verse uses a metaphor to describe the nature of evil speech or words. Just as an evil tree is uprooted and lacks stability, evil words have no foundation or permanence. They are devoid of truth and virtue, and ultimately lead to destruction and ruin. The verse encourages us to avoid uttering harmful or unethical words, as they are like poisonous plants that cannot take root or bear good fruit.
orig: ومثل كلمة خبيثة كشجرة خبيثة اجتثت من فوق الأرض ما لها من قرار

translation: Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in the present life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah strengthens the believers' faith and steadfastness through the firm and truthful words of the Qur'an and the teachings of Islam. This firmness is granted to them in this world and in the Hereafter. On the other hand, Allah allows the wrongdoers and disbelievers to go astray from the straight path due to their rejection of faith. Ultimately, Allah has the absolute power and authority to do whatever He wills, and His wisdom encompasses all things.
orig: يثبت الله الذين آمنوا بالقول الثابت في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة ويضل الله الظالمين ويفعل الله ما يشاء

translation: Have you not seen those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people in the house of ruin?
interpretation: This verse refers to those who rejected the blessings and guidance from Allah, and instead chose disbelief. They misguided their people and led them to a path of destruction and ruin, both in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين بدلوا نعمت الله كفرا وأحلوا قومهم دار البوار

translation: They will attain Hellfire and an evil destination.
interpretation: This verse warns of the grave consequence of disbelief and sinful actions, which is the punishment of Hellfire - a terribly wretched and miserable abode. It serves as a stern reminder to stay away from anything that could lead one to such a dreadful fate, and to strive for faith and righteous deeds that will lead to Paradise instead.
orig: جهنم يصلونها وبئس القرار

translation: And they set up equals with Allah to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy yourselves, for indeed, your destination is the Fire."
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of associating partners or equals with Allah, which is a form of polytheism (shirk). It warns those who ascribe partners to Allah that they are misguiding others from the straight path. The verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to tell them to enjoy their disbelief for a temporary period, but their ultimate destination will be the Fire of Hell as a consequence of their polytheistic beliefs and actions.
orig: وجعلوا لله أندادا ليضلوا عن سبيله قل تمتعوا فإن مصيركم إلى النار

translation: Say to My servants who have believed that they should establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange, nor any friendships.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to be steadfast in performing the obligatory prayers and to spend from the provisions He has bestowed upon them, whether openly or secretly, before the Day of Judgment arrives. On that Day, no ransom will be accepted, nor will any intercession or close relationships benefit anyone.
orig: قل لعبادي الذين آمنوا يقيموا الصلاة وينفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا بيع فيه ولا خلال

translation: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and blessings upon humanity. It emphasizes that Allah created the heavens, earth, and all provisions for human sustenance, such as rain that enables the growth of fruits. Additionally, Allah has subjected ships to sail through the seas and rivers for human benefit, all by His command and wisdom.
orig: الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وأنزل من السماء ماء فأخرج به من الثمرات رزقا لكم وسخر لكم الفلك لتجري في البحر بأمره وسخر لكم الأنهار

translation: And He has subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in their courses], and has subjected for you the night and the day.
interpretation: Allah has made the sun and the moon subservient to human beings, continuously orbiting and providing light and heat for the benefit of mankind. Similarly, He has made the night and day subservient, allowing for rest and activity respectively, so that humans can utilize them for their sustenance and livelihood.
orig: وسخر لكم الشمس والقمر دائبين وسخر لكم الليل والنهار

translation: And He has given you of all that you asked Him. And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the abundant blessings and favors that Allah has bestowed upon humankind. It reminds us that if we were to attempt to count and enumerate all of Allah's favors and blessings, we would be unable to do so, for they are innumerable. However, despite these countless blessings, many people remain unjust and ungrateful towards Allah, denying His favors and disobeying His commands. The verse serves as a reminder to be grateful, recognize Allah's boundless blessings, and strive to be among those who are thankful and obedient to Him.
orig: وآتاكم من كل ما سألتموه وإن تعدوا نعمت الله لا تحصوها إن الإنسان لظلوم كفار

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said, "My Lord, make this city [Makkah] secure and keep me and my sons away from worshipping idols."
interpretation: "Ibrahim (peace be upon him) prayed to Allah to make the city of Makkah a secure and peaceful place, and to protect him and his descendants from the sin of worshipping idols or associating partners with Allah. This shows Ibrahim's devotion to the Oneness of Allah and his desire to establish a land where the worship of the One True God can be practiced safely."
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم رب اجعل هذا البلد آمنا واجنبني وبني أن نعبد الأصنام

translation: My Lord, they have led many among the people astray. For whoever follows me - he is indeed of me, and whoever disobeyed me - You are indeed Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the responsibility of those in positions of influence, and their ability to lead people astray or guide them. It emphasizes that those who follow the righteous path are considered part of the righteous group, while those who disobey will be judged by Allah's mercy and forgiveness.
orig: رب إنهن أضللن كثيرا من الناس فمن تبعني فإنه مني ومن عصاني فإنك غفور رحيم

translation: Our Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in an uncultivated valley near Your Sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits, that they might be grateful.
interpretation: Ibrahim prayed to Allah to make the hearts of people incline towards his offspring, the inhabitants of Makkah, and provide them with sustenance from fruits so that they may be thankful to Allah. This verse highlights the importance of establishing prayer and being grateful to Allah for His provisions.
orig: ربنا إني أسكنت من ذريتي بواد غير ذي زرع عند بيتك المحرم ربنا ليقيموا الصلاة فاجعل أفئدة من الناس تهوي إليهم وارزقهم من الثمرات لعلهم يشكرون

translation: Our Lord, You know what we conceal and what we reveal, for nothing is hidden from Allah on earth or in the heavens.
interpretation: Allah knows everything, whether it is hidden or apparent. Nothing is concealed from Him, neither on earth nor in the heavens. He is All-Knowing and All-Aware of what we conceal within ourselves and what we reveal through our words and actions.
orig: ربنا إنك تعلم ما نخفي وما نعلن وما يخفى على الله من شيء في الأرض ولا في السماء

translation: Praise be to Allah, who has bestowed upon me, in old age, Ishmael and Isaac. Truly, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.
interpretation: This verse expresses Prophet Abraham's gratitude to Allah for blessing him with two sons, Ishmael and Isaac, in his old age, despite the natural difficulty of conceiving children at that stage of life. It highlights Allah's power and ability to grant children to whomever He wills, even in seemingly impossible circumstances, as well as His responsiveness to sincere supplications and prayers.
orig: الحمد لله الذي وهب لي على الكبر إسماعيل وإسحاق إن ربي لسميع الدعاء

translation: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
interpretation: In this verse, the Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) is making a sincere supplication to Allah. He asks Allah to make him steadfast in performing the obligatory prayers and to grant the same virtue to his descendants. He also requests Allah to accept his prayer and grant his wishes. This verse highlights the importance of prayer in Islam and the desire to raise a righteous family that upholds the teachings of Islam.
orig: رب اجعلني مقيم الصلاة ومن ذريتي ربنا وتقبل دعاء

translation: Our Lord, forgive me and my parents and the believers on the Day when the account will be established.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking for forgiveness for oneself, one's parents, and all believers on the Day of Judgment when everyone's deeds will be accounted for. It highlights the importance of seeking forgiveness from Allah, not only for ourselves but also for our parents and fellow believers, as we all stand in need of Allah's mercy and forgiveness on that momentous Day.
orig: ربنا اغفر لي ولوالدي وللمؤمنين يوم يقوم الحساب

translation: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare in horror.
interpretation: Allah is fully aware of the actions of the wrongdoers and oppressors. He does not punish them immediately, but rather delays their reckoning to a terrifying Day of Judgment when their eyes will be wide open in horror and fear, realizing the grave consequences of their misdeeds.
orig: ولا تحسبن الله غافلا عما يعمل الظالمون إنما يؤخرهم ليوم تشخص فيه الأبصار

translation: Their heads upraised, their glances not returning towards them, and their hearts vacant.
interpretation: This verse describes the arrogant and heedless state of the disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. Their heads will be raised up, looking arrogantly, not turning their gaze towards the truth. Their hearts will be empty and devoid of faith, as they had rejected the signs of Allah in this world.
orig: مهطعين مقنعي رءوسهم لا يرتد إليهم طرفهم وأفئدتهم هواء

translation: And warn the people of a Day when the punishment will come to them, and those who did wrong will say: 'Our Lord! Grant us respite for a little while, we will answer Your Call and follow the Messengers.' (It will be said): 'Did you not swear before that there will be no end for you?'
interpretation: Cette verse met en garde les gens contre le Jour du Jugement lorsque les injustes demanderont un délai pour se repentir et suivre les messagers, mais il leur sera rappelé qu'ils avaient juré auparavant qu'il n'y aurait pas de résurrection. Cela souligne l'importance de croire en l'au-delà et de suivre les enseignements des messagers dès cette vie, car il sera trop tard pour se repentir le Jour du Jugement.
orig: وأنذر الناس يوم يأتيهم العذاب فيقول الذين ظلموا ربنا أخرنا إلى أجل قريب نجب دعوتك ونتبع الرسل أولم تكونوا أقسمتم من قبل ما لكم من زوال

translation: And you dwelt in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, and it became clear to you how We dealt with them, and We presented examples for you.
interpretation: "This verse reminds the believers of how they inherited the lands and dwellings of those who wronged themselves by rejecting faith and disobeying Allah. It serves as a lesson for them to reflect on the consequences of disbelief and wrongdoing, as Allah punished the previous nations for their transgressions. The examples mentioned refer to the stories and lessons from the past that were presented as guidance for the believers."
orig: وسكنتم في مساكن الذين ظلموا أنفسهم وتبين لكم كيف فعلنا بهم وضربنا لكم الأمثال

translation: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is their plan, even if their plan was such that the mountains should be moved by it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the plots and schemes of the disbelievers against the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims. It states that although they devised cunning plans to harm the believers, their plots were known to Allah and ultimately ineffective. Even if their schemes were so formidable that they could move mountains, they were still futile against Allah's will and power.
orig: وقد مكروا مكرهم وعند الله مكرهم وإن كان مكرهم لتزول منه الجبال

translation: So do not think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might, the Lord of Retribution.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes Allah's truthfulness and power. It assures that Allah will never break His promise to support and grant victory to His messengers. Allah is Almighty and capable of punishing those who defy His messengers and reject His message. This serves as a warning against underestimating Allah's ability to fulfill His word and a reminder of His supreme authority."
orig: فلا تحسبن الله مخلف وعده رسله إن الله عزيز ذو انتقام

translation: The Day when the earth will be changed to a different earth, and the heavens [as well], and they will come forth before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when the earth and heavens as we know them will be replaced by a new creation. All beings will be gathered before Allah, the One True God, the Irresistible and Supreme over all things. It signifies the complete transformation of the universe and the manifestation of Allah's absolute power and authority on that tremendous Day.
orig: يوم تبدل الأرض غير الأرض والسماوات وبرزوا لله الواحد القهار

translation: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the criminals on the Day of Judgment. They will be bound together in shackles or chains, indicating their humiliation and punishment for their evil deeds in this world. The shackling represents the consequences of their actions and their inability to escape divine justice.
orig: وترى المجرمين يومئذ مقرنين في الأصفاد

translation: Their garments will be of tar, and fire will cover their faces
interpretation: This verse is describing the punishment of the disbelievers in the Hereafter. Their garments will be made of tar, a thick and sticky substance that will cling to their bodies, causing them extreme discomfort and pain. Additionally, their faces will be covered by the raging fire, inflicting severe torment upon them. This vivid description serves as a warning and a deterrent, emphasizing the grave consequences of rejecting faith and leading an ungodly life.
orig: سرابيلهم من قطران وتغشى وجوههم النار

translation: That Allah may reward every soul according to what it has earned. Surely, Allah is swift in reckoning.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's perfect justice and accountability on the Day of Judgment. Each person will be fully recompensed for their deeds, whether good or bad, without any injustice or delay. It emphasizes that Allah's reckoning is swift, and no deed goes unaccounted for. This serves as a reminder to be mindful of our actions and strive for righteousness, as we will ultimately face the consequences.
orig: ليجزي الله كل نفس ما كسبت إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: This is a proclamation for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but One God and that those of understanding may be reminded.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a clear message and warning for all people, reminding them of the Oneness of God and calling upon those with intellect and wisdom to reflect upon its teachings and guidance.
orig: هذا بلاغ للناس ولينذروا به وليعلموا أنما هو إله واحد وليذكر أولو الألباب

translation: Alif Lam Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Quran.
interpretation: "This verse introduces the Qur'an as a book of divine guidance containing clear and unambiguous verses. The letters 'Alif Lam Ra' are among the disconnected letters (Al-Muqatta'aat) whose meanings are known only to Allah. They serve as a unique symbol of the Qur'an's inimitable linguistic and literary style, emphasizing its divine origin."
orig: الر تلك آيات الكتاب وقرآن مبين

translation: Perhaps those who disbelieved would wish that they had been Muslims.
interpretation: This verse implies that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers will realize the truth of Islam and wish they had embraced it during their worldly life. Their regret will stem from witnessing the rewards of the believers and the punishment they themselves will face for rejecting faith. The verse serves as a warning and an invitation to reflect on one's beliefs before it is too late.
orig: ربما يود الذين كفروا لو كانوا مسلمين

translation: Leave them to eat and enjoy themselves and let (vain) hope beguile them, for they will soon know.
interpretation: This verse is advising patience and restraint towards those who are indulging in worldly pleasures and false hopes. It suggests letting them be for the time being, as they will eventually realize the truth and face the consequences of their actions. The interpretation encourages focusing on one's own spiritual path rather than being distracted by the temporary indulgences of others.
orig: ذرهم يأكلوا ويتمتعوا ويلههم الأمل فسوف يعلمون

translation: And We did not destroy any town but it had a known decree.
interpretation: Allah states that He does not destroy any town or community without a predetermined and well-known decree from Him. This means that the destruction of nations is not arbitrary, but rather based on divine wisdom and justice. Allah gives ample warnings and opportunities for repentance before carrying out His decree. The verse emphasizes Allah's perfect knowledge and that nothing happens without His will and decree.
orig: وما أهلكنا من قرية إلا ولها كتاب معلوم

translation: No nation can outstrip its term, nor can they lag behind.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of predetermined lifespans for nations and communities, just as individuals have appointed terms. No nation can hasten or delay its destined end through its own efforts. The rise and fall of civilizations are governed by divine wisdom and occur according to Allah's plan and timing.
orig: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون

translation: And they say, 'O you upon whom the Reminder has been sent down, indeed you are mad.'
interpretation: The disbelievers mocked and accused the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ of being insane or possessed for conveying the divine revelations and calling people to the worship of One God. This verse highlights their arrogant rejection of the truth and their attempts to discredit the Prophet ﷺ.
orig: وقالوا يا أيها الذي نزل عليه الذكر إنك لمجنون

translation: If you are one of the truthful, then bring us the angels.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the disbelievers were mocking the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and demanding that he bring angels as proof of his prophethood, if he was truly truthful in his claim. This verse highlights their arrogance and stubbornness in rejecting the clear signs and miracles presented to them. It also emphasizes that human beings should not make unreasonable demands from Allah's messengers, as their role is to convey the message, not to fulfill every whim and desire of the people.
orig: لو ما تأتينا بالملائكة إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: We do not send down the angels except with truth, and they would not then be reprieved.
interpretation: Allah mentions that He only sends down the angels with truth and justice, not for oppression or falsehood. When the angels descend upon the disbelievers with punishment, they are not given any respite or delay.
orig: ما ننزل الملائكة إلا بالحق وما كانوا إذا منظرين

translation: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's direct revelation of the Qur'an and His promise to preserve and protect it from any corruption or alteration until the Day of Judgment. It highlights the divine origin and eternal preservation of the Qur'anic text, instilling confidence in its authenticity and emphasizing the responsibility of believers to study, follow, and transmit it accurately.
orig: إنا نحن نزلنا الذكر وإنا له لحافظون

translation: And We have certainly sent among the sects before you, [O Muhammad]
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has sent messengers and prophets to various nations and communities throughout history before the advent of Prophet Muhammad. It emphasizes the universality of Allah's guidance and the continuity of His message being conveyed to different peoples at different times.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك في شيع الأولين

translation: And no Messenger comes to them but they mock at him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers, who mocked and ridiculed every Messenger sent to them by Allah. Their rejection of the truth was not due to lack of evidence or proof, but rather stemmed from their pride, prejudice, and unwillingness to accept guidance. The verse serves as a reminder that rejecting Allah's Messengers and their messages is a grave sin that leads to divine punishment.
orig: وما يأتيهم من رسول إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Thus We cause it to penetrate the hearts of the criminals.
interpretation: Allah instills the Qur'an into the hearts of the disbelievers and criminals, not for guidance, but as a means of punishment and humiliation for their rejection of faith. Their hearts become hardened, and the Qur'an serves as a testimony against them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: كذلك نسلكه في قلوب المجرمين

translation: They do not believe in it, and the way of the former peoples has already preceded.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers' rejection of faith is not new, as it has been the pattern of previous nations who also denied the truth. Their disbelief follows the "way" or tradition of those who came before them and met a terrible fate due to their arrogance and obstinacy. It serves as a warning that denying God's revelations leads to ruin, just as it did for past generations.
orig: لا يؤمنون به وقد خلت سنة الأولين

translation: And if We opened for them a gate from the heaven and they kept ascending through it,
interpretation: This verse is expressing the stubbornness and obstinacy of the disbelievers. Even if an extraordinary miracle was shown to them, like opening a gate from the heaven for them to ascend through, they would still persist in their denial and rejection of faith due to their arrogance and closed-mindedness.
orig: ولو فتحنا عليهم بابا من السماء فظلوا فيه يعرجون

translation: They would say, 'Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers were so blinded by their arrogance and denial that they attributed the clear signs and miracles presented to them as mere illusions or magic tricks. Their refusal to accept the truth was rooted in their stubbornness and unwillingness to acknowledge the divine message, even in the face of overwhelming evidence.
orig: لقالوا إنما سكرت أبصارنا بل نحن قوم مسحورون

translation: And We have certainly made in the heaven great constellations and have adorned it for the observers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the beauty and majesty of the heavens, which God has adorned with constellations for people to observe and contemplate. It highlights the wonders of God's creation and invites human beings to reflect upon the signs of divine wisdom and power manifested in the cosmos.
orig: ولقد جعلنا في السماء بروجا وزيناها للناظرين

translation: And We have guarded it (the Qur'an) from every outcast Shaytan (devil).
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine protection of the Qur'an from any distortion or corruption by the devils or evil forces. It emphasizes the purity and authenticity of the Qur'anic text, which has been preserved in its original form by Allah's guardianship. This preservation ensures that the message of guidance remains intact and accessible to humanity throughout the ages.
orig: وحفظناها من كل شيطان رجيم

translation: Except one who snatches but is pursued by a clear burning flame.
interpretation: This verse refers to the jinn (unseen beings) who attempt to eavesdrop on the conversations of the angels in the heavens. However, they are immediately driven away by a bright, flaming meteor. It emphasizes that the revelations from Allah are protected and cannot be accessed or corrupted by the jinn or any other forces.
orig: إلا من استرق السمع فأتبعه شهاب مبين

translation: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein from all things in due balance.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating the earth and its intricate systems. The interpretation is that "Allah spread out the earth and made it a suitable abode for life. He placed firmly set mountains on it to stabilize it and prevent it from shaking. He also caused to grow on the earth a perfectly balanced variety of plants, fruits, and vegetation, providing sustenance for all living beings."
orig: والأرض مددناها وألقينا فيها رواسي وأنبتنا فيها من كل شيء موزون

translation: And We have provided therein means of living for you and for those for whom you are not providers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has placed on the earth all the necessary provisions and resources for sustaining human life, including food, water, shelter, and other means of livelihood. However, these provisions are not limited only to humans, but they also sustain other creatures whom humans do not provide for or have control over their sustenance. This highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in creating a balanced ecosystem where all living beings can find their means of subsistence.
orig: وجعلنا لكم فيها معايش ومن لستم له برازقين

translation: And there is not a thing but that We have its depositories, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.
interpretation: Allah has complete knowledge and control over all things in the universe. Nothing happens without His permission and decree. He sends down provisions, blessings, and trials in precise measure according to His infinite wisdom.
orig: وإن من شيء إلا عندنا خزائنه وما ننزله إلا بقدر معلوم

translation: And We sent the winds fertilizing, and sent down water from the sky and gave it to you to drink, and you are not the ones to store it.
interpretation: Allah sent the winds to carry the clouds and disperse pollen, facilitating pollination and growth. He then sent down rain from the clouds, providing fresh water for humans and other creatures to drink. However, humans do not have the ability to store or preserve this water themselves; it is a gift from Allah that they cannot control or take credit for.
orig: وأرسلنا الرياح لواقح فأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأسقيناكموه وما أنتم له بخازنين

translation: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and sovereignty over life and death. It affirms that Allah alone has the ability to grant life and take it away, and that ultimately, He is the sole Inheritor of everything in existence. This highlights the temporary nature of our worldly existence and reminds us to focus on pleasing Allah, the Eternal and Ever-Lasting.
orig: وإنا لنحن نحيي ونميت ونحن الوارثون

translation: And We have certainly known the preceding ones among you, and We have certainly known the later ones.
interpretation: Allah knows all people, whether they lived in the past or will come in the future. No one is hidden from His knowledge, and He is fully aware of the deeds and intentions of all human beings, whether they lived before or will come after.
orig: ولقد علمنا المستقدمين منكم ولقد علمنا المستأخرين

translation: And indeed, it is your Lord who will gather them. Indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's wisdom and knowledge in resurrecting and gathering all people on the Day of Judgment. It implies that the process of resurrection and accountability is not a random or chaotic event, but rather a well-planned and organized affair carried out by the All-Wise and All-Knowing Lord. This should instill a sense of awe and reverence in the believers, as they contemplate the majesty and perfection of Allah's arrangements.
orig: وإن ربك هو يحشرهم إنه حكيم عليم

translation: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.
interpretation: This verse indicates that human beings were created from clay, which is a reference to the humble origins of mankind. The clay is described as coming from 'altered black mud,' suggesting that it went through a process of change and refinement before being molded into the human form. This can be seen as a metaphor for the development and evolution of humanity, starting from simple and humble beginnings and gradually becoming more complex and refined over time.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: And the jinn, We created them before from scorching fire.
interpretation: In this verse, Allah informs us that He created the jinn from a scorching fire before He created humans. The jinn are a creation of Allah made from a smokeless flame of fire. They have been granted intelligence and the ability to comprehend, just like humans, but they have a different nature and constitution. This verse highlights the power and ability of Allah as the Creator of all beings, including the unseen world of the jinn.
orig: والجان خلقناه من قبل من نار السموم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay of an altered black mud."
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of the first human being, Adam, by Allah from clay made of altered black mud. It signifies the humble origins of human beings and Allah's power as the Creator. The interpretation emphasizes the unique status of human beings as a special creation of Allah, distinct from the angels who were created from light.
orig: وإذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: So when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down before him prostrating.
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of Adam, the first human being. God fashioned Adam's body from clay and then breathed into him the soul or spirit, which gave him life. After this, God commanded the angels to prostrate before Adam as a sign of respect and obedience to the Creator. The breathing of God's spirit into Adam signifies the unique status given to human beings, who were endowed with intellect, consciousness, and free will.
orig: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين

translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.
interpretation: This verse indicates that all the angels obeyed Allah's command to prostrate before Adam, which signifies their complete submission and obedience to Allah. It highlights the importance of obedience to Allah and humility before the Divine Will.
orig: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون

translation: But Iblis refused to be among those who prostrated.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disobedience of Iblis (Satan) when he refused to prostrate before Adam despite Allah's command. It highlights Iblis' arrogance and rebellion against the divine order, which led to his expulsion from the ranks of the angels and marked the beginning of his enmity towards mankind.
orig: إلا إبليس أبى أن يكون مع الساجدين

translation: He (Allah) said: 'O Iblis! What is your reason for not being among those who prostrated?'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Allah commanded the angels to prostrate to Adam, and Iblis (Satan) refused out of arrogance and disobedience. Allah questions Iblis' defiance and rebellion against His command, highlighting Iblis' sin of pride and ingratitude towards his Creator.
orig: قال يا إبليس ما لك ألا تكون مع الساجدين

translation: He said, 'I am not one to prostrate myself to a human being, whom You created from sounding clay of altered black mud.'
interpretation: In this verse, Satan is expressing his arrogance and refusal to obey Allah's command to prostrate before Adam. He considers himself superior to Adam because he was created from fire, while Adam was created from clay. This attitude of pride and disobedience led to Satan's downfall and expulsion from the mercy of Allah.
orig: قال لم أكن لأسجد لبشر خلقته من صلصال من حمإ مسنون

translation: He (Allah) said: 'Then get out from this (Paradise), for verily, you are outcast.'
interpretation: Allah is expelling Shaytan (Satan) from Paradise as a punishment for his arrogance and disobedience. The word "rajim" means "outcast" or "accursed", indicating that Shaytan has been banished from the mercy and grace of Allah.
orig: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم

translation: And indeed upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: "This verse is addressing Iblis (Satan) after he refused to prostrate to Adam, despite Allah's command. The 'curse' mentioned here refers to Allah's wrath and punishment upon Iblis for his arrogance and disobedience. This curse will continue until the Day of Judgment, indicating that Iblis and his followers will remain accursed and distanced from Allah's mercy until then."
orig: وإن عليك اللعنة إلى يوم الدين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the request made by Iblis (Satan) to Allah after being commanded to prostrate before Adam. Iblis refused out of arrogance and was cursed by Allah. He then asked for respite until the Day of Resurrection so that he could mislead and misguide the descendants of Adam. The interpretation is that Iblis sought to prolong his rebellion against Allah and continue his attempts to lead humanity astray until the final Day.
orig: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, you are of those given respite.'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a warning or threat from Allah to those who persist in disbelief and rejection of the truth. It suggests that they have been granted a temporary reprieve or delay in punishment, but that their ultimate reckoning is inevitable. The interpretation highlights the idea that Allah is granting them time and opportunity to reflect and repent, but if they fail to do so, they will face the consequences of their actions.
orig: قال فإنك من المنظرين

translation: Till the Day of the Time Appointed
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection or Judgement, which is a fixed and appointed time known only to Allah. It implies that the events mentioned in the preceding verses will continue until the ultimate Day when all humanity will be held accountable for their deeds and beliefs.
orig: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم

translation: He (Shaytan) said: 'O my Lord! Because You have put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,'
interpretation: Shaytan (Satan) is seeking Allah's permission to mislead and tempt mankind on earth. He plans to make evil and sinful acts seem attractive and desirable to them, leading them astray from the straight path. His goal is to misguide all of humanity through deception and temptation.
orig: قال رب بما أغويتني لأزينن لهم في الأرض ولأغوينهم أجمعين

translation: Except Your sincere servants among them
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are sincere and devoted servants of Allah, who are exempted from the punishment or trials mentioned in the previous verses. It implies that Allah protects and guides those who are truly devoted to Him and follow His commandments with sincerity and purity of intention.
orig: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين

translation: He said, 'This is a straight path to Me.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has provided a clear and straight path for human beings to follow in order to attain His pleasure and guidance. The "straight path" refers to the teachings of Islam, the Qur'an, and the example of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). By adhering to this path, one can achieve spiritual enlightenment, righteousness, and ultimately salvation.
orig: قال هذا صراط علي مستقيم

translation: Indeed, over My [faithful] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Shaytan (Satan) has no power or control over the sincere and devoted servants of Allah. His influence is limited to those who willingly follow him by indulging in sinful and misguided ways. Allah is the Supreme Authority and Protector, and He alone has control over all affairs.
orig: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان إلا من اتبعك من الغاوين

translation: And indeed, Hellfire is the promised destination for them all.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Hellfire is the ultimate destination for all those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands. It serves as a stern warning that those who persist in disbelief and wrongdoing will inevitably face the punishment of Hell, which has been promised to them. The phrase "for them all" emphasizes that no one will be exempt from this fate if they choose to turn away from the truth.
orig: وإن جهنم لموعدهم أجمعين

translation: For it are seven gates, for each gate is a portion assigned.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the seven gates of Hell, and that each gate has a specific portion or group of people assigned to enter through it. The interpretation suggests that there are different levels or categories of punishment in Hell, and each sinner will be sent to the appropriate gate and level according to the severity of their sins.
orig: لها سبعة أبواب لكل باب منهم جزء مقسوم

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs
interpretation: This verse promises that those who are pious and God-fearing will be rewarded with a blissful life in Paradise, surrounded by beautiful gardens and flowing streams. It highlights the eternal reward awaiting the righteous for their faith and good deeds in this world.
orig: إن المتقين في جنات وعيون

translation: Enter it in peace and security
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers entering Paradise, which is described as a place of eternal peace and security, free from any fear, harm or distress. It signifies the ultimate reward and blissful state that awaits the righteous in the Hereafter.
orig: ادخلوها بسلام آمنين

translation: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of believers in Paradise. Allah will remove any ill feelings, hatred, or resentment that existed between them in the previous life. They will become like brothers, sitting on thrones facing each other, enjoying each other's company in perfect harmony and love.
orig: ونزعنا ما في صدورهم من غل إخوانا على سرر متقابلين

translation: No fatigue shall touch them therein, nor shall they be removed therefrom.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the believers in Paradise will neither experience any weariness or exhaustion, nor will they ever be expelled from it. It emphasizes the eternal state of comfort, rest, and security that the righteous will enjoy in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: لا يمسهم فيها نصب وما هم منها بمخرجين

translation: Give good tidings to My servants that truly I am the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights two of Allah's most prominent attributes: His forgiveness and His mercy. It encourages believers to have hope in Allah's vast forgiveness and to seek His mercy, no matter how grave their sins may be. The verse reassures that Allah is ready to pardon those who sincerely repent and turn back to Him. It also emphasizes Allah's boundless mercy, which encompasses all of creation and is a manifestation of His love and compassion towards His servants.
orig: نبئ عبادي أني أنا الغفور الرحيم

translation: And indeed, My punishment is the painful punishment
interpretation: This verse warns that Allah's punishment for those who disbelieve and disobey is severe and excruciating. It emphasizes the intensity and severity of the punishment that awaits those who reject faith and turn away from Allah's commands. The use of the word "painful" highlights the agonizing nature of this punishment, serving as a stern warning to take faith seriously and follow the right path.
orig: وأن عذابي هو العذاب الأليم

translation: And inform them about the guests of Abraham.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him) when he received guests who were actually angels in human form. It teaches the importance of hospitality towards guests, even strangers, as Abraham welcomed them graciously despite not knowing their true identity. The verse also highlights the virtues of Abraham and how he treated his guests with kindness and respect, setting an example for believers.
orig: ونبئهم عن ضيف إبراهيم

translation: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace," he said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."
interpretation: When the guests (angels in the form of men) came to Prophet Ibrahim, he felt afraid of them initially as he did not know who they were. This shows Ibrahim's humility and caution towards strangers until he realized they were angels sent by Allah.
orig: إذ دخلوا عليه فقالوا سلاما قال إنا منكم وجلون

translation: They said: 'Fear not! We give you the glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the glad tidings given to Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) about the birth of his son, Yahya (John the Baptist). Despite his old age and his wife's barrenness, Allah granted them a son who would be a prophet and a righteous servant of Allah, endowed with knowledge and wisdom.
orig: قالوا لا توجل إنا نبشرك بغلام عليم

translation: He said, 'You have given me good tidings of a boy when old age has overtaken me, so of what do you give me good tidings?'
interpretation: This verse expresses the surprise and doubt of Prophet Abraham when the angels gave him the glad tidings of having a son at an old age. It reflects his humility and submission to God's will, even when faced with something seemingly impossible according to human understanding.
orig: قال أبشرتموني على أن مسني الكبر فبم تبشرون

translation: They said, "We bring you good tidings in truth, so do not be of those who despair."
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his followers that they are being given truthful and joyful news, and encourages them not to lose hope or become despondent in the face of difficulties or adversities. It reminds them to remain steadfast and have faith in Allah's promise of ultimate victory and success.
orig: قالوا بشرناك بالحق فلا تكن من القانطين

translation: And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that only those who have gone astray from the right path despair of Allah's mercy. It implies that true believers should never lose hope in Allah's boundless mercy and forgiveness, no matter how grave their sins may be. The verse encourages repentance and reliance on Allah's compassion.
orig: قال ومن يقنط من رحمة ربه إلا الضالون

translation: He said: 'What is the matter with you, O messengers?'
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah questioning the messengers about their circumstances and the reasons for their presence, indicating His concern and attentiveness towards them.
orig: قال فما خطبكم أيها المرسلون

translation: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people who are criminals"
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels who were sent to the people of Lut (Lot) to punish them for their sinful and deviant behavior of engaging in homosexuality and other immoral acts. The angels are describing the people they were sent to as "criminals" or "guilty ones" due to their grave sins and disobedience against God's commands.
orig: قالوا إنا أرسلنا إلى قوم مجرمين

translation: Except the family of Lut; indeed, We will surely save them all.
interpretation: "Allah exempted the family of Prophet Lut from the punishment that befell the people of Sodom, as He had promised to save them all except Lut's wife, who was among the disbelievers."
orig: إلا آل لوط إنا لمنجوهم أجمعين

translation: Except his wife, for whom We had ordained that she would be among those who remained behind.
interpretation: Allah is stating that Lut's wife was not saved from the punishment that befell the people of Lut because she was a disbeliever like them. Despite being married to the Prophet Lut, she did not follow his teachings and remained among those who denied the message and persisted in their sinful ways.
orig: إلا امرأته قدرنا إنها لمن الغابرين

translation: So when the messengers came to the family of Lot,
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrival of the angels sent by Allah to the people of Lot, who were engaged in the abhorrent practice of homosexuality. The angels came in the form of handsome young men to test the people of Lot and expose their corrupt desires.
orig: فلما جاء آل لوط المرسلون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, you are a people behaving insolently.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people being addressed were engaging in unacceptable or offensive behavior that went against moral or religious norms. The term "منكرون" (munkaron) implies that they were rejecting or denying something, possibly the truth or guidance being presented to them. The interpretation conveys a sense of rebuke or condemnation for their actions or beliefs.
orig: قال إنكم قوم منكرون

translation: They said, "Nay, we have brought thee that (burden) on which they were contradicting one another.
interpretation: This verse refers to the different interpretations and disagreements that existed among the people regarding the true message and teachings of the previous prophets. The angels are stating that they have brought the truth which resolves these contradictions and disputes.
orig: قالوا بل جئناك بما كانوا فيه يمترون

translation: And We have brought you the truth, and indeed, We are truthful.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an and the message revealed to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the truth from Allah, and that Allah is truthful in His promise and warning. It emphasizes the authenticity and veracity of the divine revelation, assuring the Prophet and the believers that what has been conveyed to them is the absolute truth, free from any falsehood or deviation.
orig: وأتيناك بالحق وإنا لصادقون

translation: So travel with your family during a portion of the night, and follow behind them. And let none of you look back, and go on as you are commanded.
interpretation: Allah commands Prophet Musa (Moses) to leave Egypt with the Children of Israel secretly at night, without turning back or looking behind. They must follow Allah's commands without hesitation or regret, putting their trust in Him.
orig: فأسر بأهلك بقطع من الليل واتبع أدبارهم ولا يلتفت منكم أحد وامضوا حيث تؤمرون

translation: And We inspired to him that decree: that the root of those (sinners) will be cut off in the morning.
interpretation: Allah revealed to the Prophet the decree that the disbelievers who opposed him would be destroyed and their power would come to an end by morning. This verse refers to the punishment that befell the disbelieving people of Makkah after their defeat in the Battle of Badr, which marked the beginning of their downfall and the rise of the Muslims.
orig: وقضينا إليه ذلك الأمر أن دابر هؤلاء مقطوع مصبحين

translation: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Medina welcoming the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his companions with joy and happiness upon their arrival in Medina after the migration from Mecca. It signifies the warm reception and support the Muslims received from the people of Medina, known as the Ansar ("helpers"), who embraced them and provided them with shelter and assistance.
orig: وجاء أهل المدينة يستبشرون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, these are my guests, so do not disgrace me.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Prophet Lut (peace be upon him) was pleading with his people not to humiliate him by harming his guests, who were actually angels sent by Allah to test the people. He was urging his people to have respect for guests and not commit the shameful act they intended.
orig: قال إن هؤلاء ضيفي فلا تفضحون

translation: And fear Allah and do not be disgraced
interpretation: "This verse commands believers to have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah) and to avoid anything that would bring disgrace or humiliation upon themselves, both in this life and in the Hereafter. It emphasizes maintaining dignity, honor, and self-respect through obedience to Allah and abstaining from sinful or unethical actions."
orig: واتقوا الله ولا تخزون

translation: They said, "Did we not forbid you from [receiving] the worlds?"
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelievers who questioned and mocked the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) for claiming to be a messenger to all of humanity. They were arrogant and rejected the idea that someone from among them could be chosen as a prophet for all people. The interpretation highlights their narrow-mindedness and rejection of the universal message of Islam.
orig: قالوا أولم ننهك عن العالمين

translation: He said, 'These are my daughters, if you would be doers [of what you intend].'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a reference to the incident where the Prophet Lut (Lot) offered his daughters to the people of his town in an attempt to dissuade them from their abhorrent practice of homosexuality and rape of male guests. It highlights the depravity of the people and Lut's desperate attempt to protect his guests and guide his people towards righteousness.
orig: قال هؤلاء بناتي إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: By your life, they were wandering blindly in their intoxication.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers were so deeply engrossed in their ignorance, misguidance, and denial of the truth that they were behaving like intoxicated people, stumbling blindly without any sense of direction or purpose in their spiritual lives.
orig: لعمرك إنهم لفي سكرتهم يعمهون

translation: But the awful cry overtook them at the time of sunrise.
interpretation: "The interpretation of this verse is that the punishment of Allah in the form of a mighty blast or thunderous cry seized the people who rejected the message of the Prophet Shu'ayb at the time of sunrise when they were preparing to go about their daily activities. This indicates that the punishment came upon them suddenly and unexpectedly, leaving them no chance to escape or make amends."
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة مشرقين

translation: So We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.
interpretation: Allah is describing His punishment on the people of Lut (Lot) for their grave sin of homosexuality. He turned their city upside down, destroying the arrogant and wealthy upper class by bringing down their lofty buildings and homes. He then rained down upon them stones of baked clay as a torment from the sky, leaving none of the wrongdoers alive. This verse serves as a stern warning against defying Allah's commands and indulging in immoral acts.
orig: فجعلنا عاليها سافلها وأمطرنا عليهم حجارة من سجيل

translation: Verily, in that are Signs for those who take omens.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the various phenomena and events happening in the universe serve as signs and evidences for those who reflect and ponder upon them. The word "mutawassimeen" refers to people who seek to derive omens and lessons from the signs around them. The verse encourages contemplation on the marvels of Allah's creation, which point to His existence, power, and wisdom.
orig: إن في ذلك لآيات للمتوسمين

translation: And indeed it is a path that is straight.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an and the religion of Islam provide a clear and unwavering path that leads to righteousness and success in this life and the Hereafter. It is a straight and upright way that does not deviate or falter, guiding humanity towards the truth and away from misguidance and error. The path prescribed by Allah is firm, steadfast, and enduring, offering a consistent and reliable way of living in accordance with divine guidance.
orig: وإنها لبسبيل مقيم

translation: Indeed, in that is a sign for the believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the events or phenomena mentioned previously serve as a clear evidence and reminder for those who have faith in God and His signs. It encourages the believers to reflect upon the signs of God present in the universe and draw lessons from them, strengthening their belief and spiritual connection.
orig: إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين

translation: And indeed, the inhabitants of Al-Aikah were oppressors.
interpretation: This verse refers to a people who were known as the 'Ashaab al-Aikah' or 'Companions of the Wood.' They were oppressors who persecuted the believers and rejected the message of the Prophet. The verse implies that their oppression and rejection of faith led to their ultimate destruction, serving as a warning to others against following their footsteps.
orig: وإن كان أصحاب الأيكة لظالمين

translation: So We inflicted retribution upon them, and indeed, the two [towns] are on an open highway.
interpretation: Allah is indicating that He destroyed the people of the two towns, Sodom and Gomorrah, as a punishment for their wicked deeds and sinful way of life. The phrase "open highway" refers to the fact that the ruins of these towns were located along a well-traveled route, serving as a clear sign and lesson for those who passed by.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم وإنهما لبإمام مبين

translation: And the Companions of the Thicket did indeed deny the messengers.
interpretation: "This verse refers to the people of a town called Al-Hijr, who rejected and disbelieved in the messengers sent to them by Allah. Their denial and rejection of the truth led to their destruction and ruin, as a punishment from Allah for their arrogance and stubbornness."
orig: ولقد كذب أصحاب الحجر المرسلين

translation: And We had given them Our signs, but they turned away from them.
interpretation: "This verse suggests that Allah provided clear signs and evidence of His existence and the truth of Islam, but the disbelievers consciously turned away from them, rejecting the guidance out of arrogance or stubbornness."
orig: وآتيناهم آياتنا فكانوا عنها معرضين

translation: And they used to carve out dwellings from the mountains, feeling secure.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Thamud, an ancient Arab tribe that lived in the region of Al-Hijr in northwestern Arabia. They were skilled in carving homes and dwellings out of the rocky mountains, feeling safe and secure within their solid structures. However, their arrogance and rejection of the message brought by Prophet Salih led to their destruction, as mentioned in other verses of the Qur'an.
orig: وكانوا ينحتون من الجبال بيوتا آمنين

translation: So the awful cry seized them at early morning.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah's punishment came upon the disbelieving people suddenly and unexpectedly in the morning. The "awful cry" refers to a powerful blast or scream that struck them, causing their destruction. This serves as a warning to those who reject faith and persist in disbelief, as Allah's punishment can come at any time without notice.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة مصبحين

translation: But their deeds which they used to do were of no benefit to them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers' deeds and efforts were rendered futile and worthless because they lacked faith in Allah. Their actions, no matter how great or numerous, were devoid of sincerity and did not stem from true belief in the Oneness of God. Thus, on the Day of Judgment, their deeds will not benefit them or save them from Allah's punishment.
orig: فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming, so forgive with gracious forgiveness.
interpretation: Allah is stating that the creation of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between is based on truth, wisdom, and a great purpose, not in vain or for mere play. He then reminds us of the inevitability of the Hour of Resurrection. In light of this reality, Allah instructs the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, and by extension all believers, to forgive people's faults and wrongdoings with a gracious and noble forgiveness, overlooking their mistakes and treating them with kindness and patience.
orig: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وإن الساعة لآتية فاصفح الصفح الجميل

translation: Indeed, your Lord - He is the All-Creator, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah is the sole Creator of all things, and that His knowledge encompasses everything. It highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating the universe and all that exists within it. The interpretation emphasizes that since Allah is the Creator and the All-Knowing, we should submit to Him, obey His commands, and trust in His infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: إن ربك هو الخلاق العليم

translation: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse refers to the seven verses of Surah Al-Fatihah, which were given to the Prophet Muhammad as a great gift and blessing. These verses contain profound meanings and are recited repeatedly in the daily prayers. The Qur'an itself is described as "the great Qur'an," highlighting its immense significance, grandeur, and status as the final revelation from Allah.
orig: ولقد آتيناك سبعا من المثاني والقرآن العظيم

translation: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] among them, [its being but the enjoyment of] worldly life so that We may test them therein. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, not to envy or desire the worldly pleasures and possessions that Allah has granted to some people, as they are temporary and a means of testing them. Instead, he should remain humble and patient, lower his wing (be gentle and kind) towards the believers, and trust in Allah's everlasting rewards, which are far superior to the fleeting delights of this world.
orig: لا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم ولا تحزن عليهم واخفض جناحك للمؤمنين

translation: And say, 'I am the clear warner.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare openly and clearly that he is the one sent by Allah to warn people against disbelief, polytheism, and disobedience to Allah. His role is to convey the message of Islam plainly and unambiguously, without any obscurity or confusion.
orig: وقل إني أنا النذير المبين

translation: As We sent down upon those who divided [their scripture]
interpretation: This verse refers to the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) who divided and differed regarding their scriptures, some believing in parts and rejecting others. It suggests that just as Allah revealed His message to those who divided their scripture, He has now revealed the Qur'an to unite people on the truth.
orig: كما أنزلنا على المقتسمين

translation: Those who have made the Qur'an into shreds.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject the Qur'an and do not follow its teachings as a whole. They pick and choose what suits them, fragmenting and dividing the Qur'an into pieces instead of accepting it in its entirety as the word of Allah. This is condemned as it goes against the principle of the Qur'an being an indivisible, integrated revelation from the Divine.
orig: الذين جعلوا القرآن عضين

translation: But by your Lord, We will surely question them all,
interpretation: Allah swears by Himself that He will certainly hold all people accountable for their deeds and question them about their actions and beliefs on the Day of Judgment. This emphasizes Allah's absolute power, justice, and the inevitability of being called to account.
orig: فوربك لنسألنهم أجمعين

translation: For what they used to do
interpretation: This verse suggests that people will be held accountable and face consequences for their deeds and actions in this world. It implies that one's fate in the Hereafter will be determined by their righteous or sinful conduct during their earthly life.
orig: عما كانوا يعملون

translation: So proclaim openly what you are commanded, and turn away from the polytheists.
interpretation: "This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to convey the message of Islam openly and fearlessly, without being deterred by the opposition of the polytheists. He is instructed to turn away from those who associate partners with Allah and persist in their disbelief, leaving them to face the consequences of their choice."
orig: فاصدع بما تؤمر وأعرض عن المشركين

translation: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers
interpretation: Allah assures the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that He will protect him and support him against those who mock and ridicule him and the message of Islam. The believers should put their trust in Allah and remain steadfast in the face of opposition and mockery from the disbelievers.
orig: إنا كفيناك المستهزئين

translation: Those who set up another god besides Allah will soon know.
interpretation: This verse warns those who associate partners with Allah that they will face the consequences of their polytheistic beliefs. It implies that they will be held accountable for their actions and will come to realize the falsehood of their ways. The verse serves as a stern reminder of the gravity of shirk (associating others with Allah) and the importance of maintaining pure monotheism.
orig: الذين يجعلون مع الله إلها آخر فسوف يعلمون

translation: And We certainly know that your breast is constrained by what they say.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that Allah is aware of the distress and hurt that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) felt due to the mockery, insults, and rejection he faced from the disbelievers. It conveys Allah's acknowledgment of the Prophet's difficult situation and the psychological burden he carried in preaching the message of Islam amidst opposition and ridicule."
orig: ولقد نعلم أنك يضيق صدرك بما يقولون

translation: So glorify with praise of your Lord and be among those who prostrate.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to glorify and praise Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all creation, and to be among those who prostrate themselves in humble submission and worship to Him. Prostration is a physical manifestation of one's humility, gratitude, and devotion to Allah. The verse emphasizes the importance of praising Allah and being among the obedient and devoted worshippers who submit themselves completely to His will.
orig: فسبح بحمد ربك وكن من الساجدين

translation: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty [i.e., death].
interpretation: "This verse commands the believers to persist in worshipping Allah alone, devoting all acts of obedience to Him, until death comes to them. The 'certainty' here refers to the certainty of death, which is the only inevitable reality that every person must face. This instruction emphasizes the importance of maintaining a constant state of worship and devotion to Allah throughout one's life, as death can come at any moment."
orig: واعبد ربك حتى يأتيك اليقين

translation: The Command of Allah has come, so do not seek to hasten it. Glorified and Exalted is He above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: We should not rush or demand the fulfillment of Allah's decrees and promises, as they will occur at their appointed times according to His wisdom. Allah is far above having any partners or equals associated with Him.
orig: أتى أمر الله فلا تستعجلوه سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: He sends down the angels with the revelation by His command upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], 'Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah sends down the angels with divine revelations and commandments to His chosen messengers and prophets. The purpose is to warn people that there is no true deity worthy of worship except Allah, and that they should fear Him by obeying His commands and avoiding His prohibitions.
orig: ينزل الملائكة بالروح من أمره على من يشاء من عباده أن أنذروا أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاتقون

translation: He created the heavens and the earth in truth. Exalted is He above whatever they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His transcendence above any partners or equals. It emphasizes that Allah alone created the heavens and the earth with truth, wisdom, and purpose, and He is far above the polytheistic beliefs of associating partners with Him. This verse establishes Allah's Lordship and calls humanity to worship Him alone, rejecting all forms of idolatry and polytheism.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق تعالى عما يشركون

translation: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once he became a manifest disputer.
interpretation: This verse highlights the humble origins of human beings, created from a mere sperm-drop, yet they become arrogant and argumentative, openly disputing against God"s signs and revelations.
orig: خلق الإنسان من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين

translation: And the cattle, He has created them for you; in them there is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: Allah menciptakan binatang ternak seperti unta, sapi, dan kambing untuk manfaat manusia. Dari binatang-binatang tersebut, manusia mendapatkan kehangatan dari bulu atau wol mereka yang dapat digunakan untuk pakaian atau selimut. Selain itu, manusia juga memperoleh berbagai manfaat lainnya seperti susu, daging, kulit, dan lain-lain. Binatang ternak ini diciptakan sebagai sumber makanan bagi manusia.
orig: والأنعام خلقها لكم فيها دفء ومنافع ومنها تأكلون

translation: And for you there is beauty in them when you bring them home in the evening and when you lead them forth to pasture in the morning.
interpretation: This verse refers to the beauty and blessing of livestock, which were a source of sustenance and livelihood for the Arabs. It highlights the aesthetic pleasure of seeing the animals return home in the evening after grazing, as well as leading them out to pasture in the morning. The verse encourages appreciation for the natural world and God's provisions.
orig: ولكم فيها جمال حين تريحون وحين تسرحون

translation: And it carries your loads to a land you could not have reached except with great trouble to yourselves. Truly your Lord is Kind, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings of Allah in providing means of transportation, such as ships, that allow people to travel and transport goods across long distances with relative ease. It highlights Allah's kindness and mercy towards humanity by facilitating travel and trade, which were difficult undertakings before the advent of such means of transport. The verse encourages gratitude for these provisions that make life more convenient.
orig: وتحمل أثقالكم إلى بلد لم تكونوا بالغيه إلا بشق الأنفس إن ربكم لرءوف رحيم

translation: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's favors upon humanity by providing various means of transportation like horses, mules, and donkeys. It also alludes to Allah's boundless creative power, as He creates things that humans are unaware of or cannot comprehend. The verse encourages gratitude for Allah's provisions and reminds us to reflect on His vast knowledge and wisdom.
orig: والخيل والبغال والحمير لتركبوها وزينة ويخلق ما لا تعلمون

translation: And upon Allah is the straight path, and among them is the deviant. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has shown the straight path to guidance, but some people deviate from it. It emphasizes that guidance is from Allah, and if He willed, He could have guided all of humanity. However, He has given people free will to choose between the straight path and deviation. The responsibility lies with individuals to seek guidance and follow the right path.
orig: وعلى الله قصد السبيل ومنها جائر ولو شاء لهداكم أجمعين

translation: It is He who sends down water from the sky; from it you drink and from it [grows] the vegetation in which you pasture your animals.
interpretation: Allah is the One who sends down rain from the clouds. The rain provides fresh drinking water for humans and also enables the growth of vegetation like trees and plants which serve as pasture for the animals. This verse highlights Allah's mercy and providence in providing sustenance for His creation through the water cycle.
orig: هو الذي أنزل من السماء ماء لكم منه شراب ومنه شجر فيه تسيمون

translation: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings upon humanity by causing vegetation and fruits to grow from the earth. It serves as a sign and evidence of Allah's power and mercy for those who reflect and contemplate upon the creation around them. The diversity and abundance of crops, olives, palm trees, grapes, and all kinds of fruits are a reminder of Allah's provisions and wisdom in sustaining human life.
orig: ينبت لكم به الزرع والزيتون والنخيل والأعناب ومن كل الثمرات إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.
interpretation: Allah has made the night, day, sun, moon, and stars subservient to human beings, operating in perfect harmony by His command and will. This remarkable system that governs the universe and sustains life is a clear proof of Allah's existence and power for those who use their intellect.
orig: وسخر لكم الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر والنجوم مسخرات بأمره إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And what He has dispersed for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for people who remember.
interpretation: The diverse colors of plants, fruits, and minerals found on the earth are signs of Allah's power and wisdom. This diversity reminds those who reflect and contemplate that the Creator is One, yet His creation is filled with wondrous variety, indicating His ability to do whatever He wills.
orig: وما ذرأ لكم في الأرض مختلفا ألوانه إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يذكرون

translation: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne les bienfaits d'Allah en mettant la mer à la disposition des humains. Elle leur permet de se nourrir de sa chair fraîche, d'en extraire des bijoux pour se parer, et de naviguer sur les navires pour chercher Sa grâce et Sa subsistance. Cela devrait les inciter à être reconnaissants envers leur Créateur pour ces innombrables faveurs.
orig: وهو الذي سخر البحر لتأكلوا منه لحما طريا وتستخرجوا منه حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك مواخر فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided
interpretation: Allah menciptakan gunung-gunung yang kokoh di bumi agar bumi tidak bergoncang dan berpindah tempat sehingga manusia dapat hidup dengan tenang dan aman.
