Dia juga menciptakan sungai-sungai dan jalan-jalan agar manusia dapat berpergian dengan mudah dan menemukan petunjuk ke tempat tujuan mereka. Semua ciptaan ini menunjukkan kekuasaan dan kebijaksanaan Allah agar manusia bersyukur dan mengambil pelajaran.
orig: وألقى في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بكم وأنهارا وسبلا لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And by the stars they are guided.
interpretation: This verse refers to the guidance that stars provide to travelers, especially in the desert or on the sea. It highlights the signs and marvels of Allah's creation that aid humanity in navigation and finding their way. The stars are a source of direction and a means to determine one's bearings, reflecting Allah's wisdom and mercy towards His creation.
orig: وعلامات وبالنجم هم يهتدون

translation: Is then the one who creates like the one who does not create? Will you not then take admonition?
interpretation: Allah is questioning whether the Creator (Himself) can be compared to those who do not create anything. This verse highlights the incomparability of Allah and establishes His Oneness and Uniqueness as the sole Creator. It calls upon people to ponder over this reality and take a lesson from it.
orig: أفمن يخلق كمن لا يخلق أفلا تذكرون

translation: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the countless blessings and favors that Allah has bestowed upon us, which are impossible to count or fully appreciate. It emphasizes Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness, encouraging us to be grateful for His blessings and seek His forgiveness for our shortcomings. The verse instills a sense of humility and gratitude towards the Almighty, acknowledging that all favors and provisions come from Him alone.
orig: وإن تعدوا نعمة الله لا تحصوها إن الله لغفور رحيم

translation: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is All-Knowing and nothing is hidden from Him. He is aware of our innermost thoughts, intentions, and secrets, as well as our outward words and actions. It serves as a reminder that we should be mindful of Allah's knowledge and strive for sincerity in our beliefs and conduct, as nothing can be concealed from the Divine.
orig: والله يعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون

translation: And those who call upon other than Allah create nothing, and they themselves are created.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything other than Allah. It states that those who worship idols or deities besides Allah have no power to create anything, while they themselves are created beings. The implication is that only the Creator, Allah, is worthy of worship and supplication, as all other beings are mere creations with no ability to create or sustain existence.
orig: والذين يدعون من دون الله لا يخلقون شيئا وهم يخلقون

translation: Dead, not alive, and they are not aware of when they will be resurrected
interpretation: This verse refers to the state of disbelievers after death. They are described as being dead, without any life or consciousness, unaware of when they will be resurrected and held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. The verse emphasizes the finality of death and the reality of the Hereafter, contrasting the lifeless state of the disbelievers with the promise of resurrection and accountability.
orig: أموات غير أحياء وما يشعرون أيان يبعثون

translation: Your God is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are in denial, and they are arrogant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of God and warns against denying the Hereafter. Those who reject belief in the Afterlife have hearts that are in a state of denial and arrogance, refusing to accept the truth and accountability for their actions.
orig: إلهكم إله واحد فالذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة قلوبهم منكرة وهم مستكبرون

translation: Indeed, Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah is All-Knowing and nothing is hidden from Him. He is aware of people's apparent and hidden actions, words, and intentions. The verse also conveys Allah's dislike for those who are arrogant and haughty, as arrogance is a despicable trait that leads one to reject the truth and disobey Allah's commands.
orig: لا جرم أن الله يعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون إنه لا يحب المستكبرين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'What has your Lord sent down?' They say, 'Legends of the former peoples.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who rejected the revelations of the Qur'an by dismissing it as mere "legends of the former peoples." They mocked and belittled the divine message, attributing it to ancient fables or myths rather than acknowledging its divine origin and profound wisdom. Their response reflects their arrogance, closed-mindedness, and unwillingness to accept the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم ماذا أنزل ربكم قالوا أساطير الأولين

translation: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and also (something) of the burdens of those whom they misled without knowledge. Alas, evil indeed are the burdens they shall bear!
interpretation: This verse warns those who mislead others without proper knowledge that they will bear the full burden of their own sins on the Day of Judgment, as well as a portion of the burden of those whom they misguided. It emphasizes the grave consequences of spreading misguidance and highlights the importance of seeking and conveying knowledge responsibly. The phrase "Alas, evil indeed are the burdens they shall bear!" underscores the severity of this sin and the regrettable state of those who commit it.
orig: ليحملوا أوزارهم كاملة يوم القيامة ومن أوزار الذين يضلونهم بغير علم ألا ساء ما يزرون

translation: Those before them had plotted, but Allah struck at the foundations of their building, and then the roof fell down upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.
interpretation: This verse is warning against plotting and devising evil schemes. It reminds us that those who plotted against the truth before were utterly destroyed by Allah's punishment. Their schemes were like a building with weak foundations that collapsed on top of them, and the punishment came upon them unexpectedly from a source they did not anticipate. The interpretation highlights the futility of plotting against Allah's will and the inevitability of His punishment for those who persist in disbelief and evil deeds.
orig: قد مكر الذين من قبلهم فأتى الله بنيانهم من القواعد فخر عليهم السقف من فوقهم وأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them and say, 'Where are My 'partners' for which you used to oppose [the believers]?' Those who were given knowledge will say, 'Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the disgrace and humiliation they will face on the Day of Resurrection for associating partners with Allah. On that Day, Allah will question them about the false deities they used to worship besides Him, which they arrogantly defended. Those who were given knowledge of the truth will affirm that the disbelievers deserve the disgrace and punishment for their rejection of faith.
orig: ثم يوم القيامة يخزيهم ويقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تشاقون فيهم قال الذين أوتوا العلم إن الخزي اليوم والسوء على الكافرين

translation: Those whose lives the angels take while they are wronging themselves, they will then offer full submission, (saying): 'We did not do any evil.' (The angels will reply): 'Nay, surely Allah knows best what you were doing.'
interpretation: This verse refers to those who die while they are wronging themselves by persisting in disbelief and disobedience. At the time of death, when the angels come to take their souls, they will offer submission and claim innocence, but it will be too late. Allah knows all their deeds, and they will be held accountable for their wrongdoings.
orig: الذين تتوفاهم الملائكة ظالمي أنفسهم فألقوا السلم ما كنا نعمل من سوء بلى إن الله عليم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Then enter the gates of Hell, to abide therein forever. How evil indeed is the dwelling of the arrogant!
interpretation: This verse serves as a stern warning to those who exhibit arrogance and reject faith. It emphasizes that the ultimate consequence of such haughty behavior is eternal damnation in the depths of Hell, which is described as a wretched abode for the arrogant. The verse underscores the grave implications of pride and self-conceit, reminding individuals to embrace humility and submission to God's commands.
orig: فادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فلبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: And it will be said to those who feared Allah, 'What did your Lord send down?' They will say, 'Good.' For those who did good in this world is good, and the home of the Hereafter is better. And excellent indeed is the home of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who feared Allah and did righteous deeds will be rewarded with goodness in this life and an even greater reward in the Hereafter. It highlights the principle that those who live a God-conscious life and perform good deeds will be blessed in both worlds. The "home of the Hereafter" refers to Paradise, which is described as being far superior to any blessing in this temporary worldly life. The verse encourages believers to strive for the eternal abode of Paradise through righteous conduct and God-consciousness.
orig: وقيل للذين اتقوا ماذا أنزل ربكم قالوا خيرا للذين أحسنوا في هذه الدنيا حسنة ولدار الآخرة خير ولنعم دار المتقين

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with rivers flowing beneath them. For them therein is whatever they will - thus does Allah reward the righteous.
interpretation: The verse is describing the reward for the righteous believers in Paradise. It promises them eternal gardens with rivers flowing underneath, where they will have whatever they desire. This is how Allah rewards those who feared Him and obeyed His commands in this world.
orig: جنات عدن يدخلونها تجري من تحتها الأنهار لهم فيها ما يشاءون كذلك يجزي الله المتقين

translation: Those whose lives the angels take while they are in a pious state, saying, 'Peace be upon you; enter Paradise for what you used to do.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who lead a pious life and die in a state of purity and obedience to God. At the time of death, the angels greet them with the words of peace and glad tidings that they will enter Paradise as a reward for their good deeds and righteous conduct in this world.
orig: الذين تتوفاهم الملائكة طيبين يقولون سلام عليكم ادخلوا الجنة بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Do they await except that the angels should come to them or your Lord's command should come? Thus did those before them. And Allah did not wrong them, but they had been wronging themselves.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers are waiting for a clear sign like the angels descending upon them or the punishment of Allah befalling them, just like the previous nations demanded signs before being punished. However, Allah did not wrong them by punishing them without warning; rather, they wronged themselves by rejecting the truth and persisting in disbelief after clear evidences were presented to them.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا أن تأتيهم الملائكة أو يأتي أمر ربك كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم وما ظلمهم الله ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: So the evil consequences of what they did overtook them, and they were afflicted by that which they used to mock.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that befell those who mocked and disbelieved in Allah's revelations and messengers. Their evil deeds resulted in divine retribution, and the very thing they ridiculed - such as the warnings of punishment - became a reality that engulfed them. It serves as a stern warning against denying Allah's signs and making a mockery of His revelations.
orig: فأصابهم سيئات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And those who associate partners with Allah say, 'If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything besides Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than His command.' Thus did those before them argue falsely until they tasted Our punishment. Say, 'Do you have any knowledge that you can produce before us? You follow not except assumption, and you are not but falsifying.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تنتقد حجة المشركين الذين يقولون إنهم لم يعبدوا غير الله إلا لأن الله شاء ذلك. فالله تعالى يرد عليهم بأن هذا مجرد افتراض وظن منهم، وأنهم لا يملكون أي دليل على ما يدعون. كما أن هذه الحجة باطلة لأن الأمم السابقة قالت نفس الشيء ولكنهم عاقبوا على شركهم. فالرسالة واضحة وليس هناك أي عذر لعدم اتباعها.
orig: وقال الذين أشركوا لو شاء الله ما عبدنا من دونه من شيء نحن ولا آباؤنا ولا حرمنا من دونه من شيء كذلك فعل الذين من قبلهم فهل على الرسل إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], 'Worship Allah and avoid the false deities.' And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those destined for error. So travel through the land and observe how was the end of the deniers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah has sent messengers to every nation, commanding them to worship Him alone and shun false deities and idols. Some people accepted the guidance and believed in the messengers, while others strayed into misguidance and error. The verse then exhorts people to travel through the lands and observe the ruined remnants of past nations who rejected the messengers, as a lesson about the inevitable consequences of denying the truth.
orig: ولقد بعثنا في كل أمة رسولا أن اعبدوا الله واجتنبوا الطاغوت فمنهم من هدى الله ومنهم من حقت عليه الضلالة فسيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: If you are eager for their guidance, then surely Allah does not guide those who mislead. And they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance comes from Allah alone. Even if the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was eager to guide those who have gone astray, he cannot do so because Allah does not guide those who choose misguidance. They will have no one to help or support them against Allah's judgment.
orig: إن تحرص على هداهم فإن الله لا يهدي من يضل وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: And they swear by Allah with their strongest oaths that Allah will not resurrect one who dies. Yes, [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse refutes the denial of resurrection by those who disbelieved. It affirms that Allah will indeed resurrect the dead, as He has promised in the Qur'an. However, most people are ignorant of this truth due to their lack of faith and understanding.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لا يبعث الله من يموت بلى وعدا عليه حقا ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: That He may make clear to them that wherein they differ, and that those who disbelieved may know that they were liars.
interpretation: This verse indicates that one of the purposes of the revelation of the Qur'an is to clarify the matters of faith and laws in which people differed, so that the truth becomes evident. It also aims to expose the falsehood of the disbelievers who rejected the message, proving that they were lying in their claims against the Prophet and the divine revelation.
orig: ليبين لهم الذي يختلفون فيه وليعلم الذين كفروا أنهم كانوا كاذبين

translation: Verily, Our Word unto a thing, when We intend it, is only that We say unto it: 'Be' - and it is.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute power and will of Allah. When Allah wills something to exist, He merely commands it to "Be" and it comes into existence immediately, without any difficulty or delay. This highlights Allah's ability to create anything He desires with ease and without any need for means or assistance. It is a manifestation of His complete authority and sovereignty over all of creation.
orig: إنما قولنا لشيء إذا أردناه أن نقول له كن فيكون

translation: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah after they had been wronged, We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse promises a good life and reward in the Hereafter for those who migrated from their homes for the sake of Allah after being persecuted and oppressed. It encourages the believers to be patient and steadfast in the face of hardship, for their sacrifice will be rewarded by Allah in this world and in the Hereafter, which is far greater than any worldly gain if they truly understood its value.
orig: والذين هاجروا في الله من بعد ما ظلموا لنبوئنهم في الدنيا حسنة ولأجر الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Those who are patient and put their trust in their Lord.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of patience (sabr) and trust in God (tawakkul) for believers. It praises those who exercise patience in the face of difficulties and challenges, and who place their complete reliance and trust in their Lord. Patience and trust in God are seen as essential qualities for maintaining faith and persevering through life's trials and tribulations.
orig: الذين صبروا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah has always sent human messengers to convey His message, not angels or other beings. If we have doubts or lack knowledge about the teachings of previous messengers, we should refer to those who possess knowledge, the "people of the message" or scholars.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: With clear proofs and writings. And We have sent down unto you (O Muhammad) the Reminder, that you may explain clearly to men what is sent down to them, and that they may give thought.
interpretation: Allah sent the Prophet Muhammad with clear signs, miracles, and revealed scriptures like the Qur'an. The Qur'an was revealed to the Prophet to explain its teachings clearly to people, so that they may ponder over its guidance and follow the right path.
orig: بالبينات والزبر وأنزلنا إليك الذكر لتبين للناس ما نزل إليهم ولعلهم يتفكرون

translation: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?
interpretation: This verse warns those who scheme evil plans and commit sins that they should not feel secure from Allah's punishment. Allah has the power to cause the earth to swallow them or send a punishment upon them from an unexpected source that they cannot foresee or comprehend. It serves as a reminder that no one is safe from Allah's justice and that wrongdoers will ultimately face the consequences of their actions.
orig: أفأمن الذين مكروا السيئات أن يخسف الله بهم الأرض أو يأتيهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: Or He seizes them while they are wandering around, for then they have no way to escape.
interpretation: Allah warns the disbelievers that He has complete power over them, and that He can seize them with punishment while they are traveling or wandering about, and they will have no way to escape His punishment or find refuge from it.
orig: أو يأخذهم في تقلبهم فما هم بمعجزين

translation: Or He may take them gradually, for your Lord is truly full of kindness and mercy.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah may either punish people swiftly or gradually for their sins and disbelief. However, it emphasizes that regardless of how the punishment comes, Allah is "Raoof" (full of kindness) and "Raheem" (merciful). This implies that even in punishment, there is wisdom and mercy from the Most Compassionate, who gives ample opportunities for repentance and reform before any retribution.
orig: أو يأخذهم على تخوف فإن ربكم لرءوف رحيم

translation: Have they not observed that whatever Allah has created casts shadows, inclining to the right and to the left, in utter submission to Allah, and they are humbled?
interpretation: This verse invites people to reflect on the wonders of Allah's creation and how everything in the universe, even the shadows cast by objects, submits humbly to Allah's commands. The shadows' inclination to the right and left as the sun moves across the sky is a sign of their humble obedience to Allah's natural laws. The verse emphasizes that all created beings, including inanimate objects like shadows, prostrate to Allah in submission, while arrogant human beings remain heedless of their Lord's signs.
orig: أولم يروا إلى ما خلق الله من شيء يتفيأ ظلاله عن اليمين والشمائل سجدا لله وهم داخرون

translation: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universal submission and humility before Allah. All creatures in the heavens and on earth, including the angels who are closest to Allah, prostrate and humble themselves before Him without any arrogance or pride. It highlights the importance of submission, obedience, and recognizing Allah's greatness and authority over all creation.
orig: ولله يسجد ما في السماوات وما في الأرض من دابة والملائكة وهم لا يستكبرون

translation: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
interpretation: This verse refers to the pious believers who have a profound reverence and fear of Allah, recognizing His supremacy and authority over them. They obey His commands without hesitation, fulfilling their religious obligations diligently. The phrase "from above them" signifies Allah's transcendence and sovereignty, while their obedience stems from their unwavering faith and submission to the Divine Will.
orig: يخافون ربهم من فوقهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون

translation: And Allah says, 'Do not take two deities. He is only one God, so fear Me alone.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fundamental Islamic belief in the Oneness of God (Tawhid). It commands the believers not to associate any partners or equals with Allah, as He is the only true God worthy of worship and reverence. The verse stresses the importance of having sincere devotion and awe towards the One and Only God, and rejecting any form of polytheism or idolatry.
orig: وقال الله لا تتخذوا إلهين اثنين إنما هو إله واحد فإياي فارهبون

translation: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due all] worship eternally. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty over the entire universe and that worship is due to Him alone. It questions why anyone would fear anything or anyone other than Allah, the Supreme Lord and Sustainer of all creation.
orig: وله ما في السماوات والأرض وله الدين واصبا أفغير الله تتقون

translation: And whatever blessing you have, it is from Allah. Then, when harm touches you, to Him you groan.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that all blessings and favors we enjoy in life come from Allah alone. However, when we face difficulties or harm, we tend to turn to Him in supplication and seek His aid and relief. It highlights the human tendency to forget Allah during times of ease and prosperity, but remember and call upon Him when faced with hardship or adversity.
orig: وما بكم من نعمة فمن الله ثم إذا مسكم الضر فإليه تجأرون

translation: Then, when He removes the affliction from you, a group of you associates others with their Lord.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the tendency of some people to associate partners with Allah when they are in distress, but then forget Him and return to polytheism when the hardship is removed. It highlights the fickleness and ingratitude of those who turn away from pure monotheism during times of ease, despite calling upon Allah alone during difficulties. The verse serves as a reminder to maintain sincere devotion to Allah at all times, and not to succumb to polytheistic tendencies out of convenience or forgetfulness.
orig: ثم إذا كشف الضر عنكم إذا فريق منكم بربهم يشركون

translation: So that they may disbelieve in what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you will soon know.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject the blessings and guidance bestowed upon them by Allah. It suggests that they should enjoy their temporary pleasures and indulgences, for soon they will realize the consequences of their disbelief and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

translation: Yet they assign a portion of what We have provided them with to what they know not. By Allah, you will indeed be questioned about what you used to fabricate.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of pagan Arabs who would set aside a portion of their wealth, crops, or cattle as offerings to their idols and false deities, which have no knowledge or power to benefit them. It warns them that they will be held accountable by Allah for this act of associating partners with Him and fabricating lies against His religion.
orig: ويجعلون لما لا يعلمون نصيبا مما رزقناهم تالله لتسألن عما كنتم تفترون

translation: And they assign daughters to Allah - exalted is He - while they have what they desire [for themselves]?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan belief of attributing daughters to Allah, which they considered undignified. It highlights the absurdity of their belief, as they desired sons for themselves but assigned daughters to God, whom they claimed to revere. The verse condemns this contradiction and affirms Allah's transcendence above such anthropomorphic attributions.
orig: ويجعلون لله البنات سبحانه ولهم ما يشتهون

translation: And when one of them is given good tidings of a female [child], his face remains darkened, and he suppresses grief.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the practice of some Arabs during the pre-Islamic era who viewed the birth of a daughter as a source of shame and grief. The interpretation is that such an attitude towards female children is wrong and against the teachings of Islam, which values both genders equally.
orig: وإذا بشر أحدهم بالأنثى ظل وجهه مسودا وهو كظيم

translation: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the dust? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan Arab practice of burying newborn daughters alive due to the perceived shame and dishonor associated with having female offspring. It condemns this abhorrent act as an evil judgment stemming from ignorance and misguided cultural norms.
orig: يتوارى من القوم من سوء ما بشر به أيمسكه على هون أم يدسه في التراب ألا ساء ما يحكمون

translation: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is an evil description, and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the stark contrast between the disbelievers' perception of God and the reality of His supreme attributes. The disbelievers, who reject the concept of the Hereafter, have a distorted and "evil" understanding of God, attributing imperfections to Him. However, Allah possesses "the highest attribute," meaning He is free from any deficiency or imperfection. He is "the Exalted in Might," symbolizing His absolute power and dominion over all creation, and "the Wise," signifying His perfect wisdom and flawless judgment in all matters.
orig: للذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة مثل السوء ولله المثل الأعلى وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And if Allah were to seize the people for their wrongdoing, He would not leave upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede it.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne la miséricorde d'Allah envers Ses créatures. Bien qu'ils commettent des péchés et des injustices, Allah ne les punit pas immédiatement. Au lieu de cela, Il leur accorde un délai pour se repentir et s'amender. Cependant, lorsque ce délai arrivera à son terme, le châtiment sera inévitable et aucun répit supplémentaire ne sera accordé, que ce soit une heure de plus ou de moins.
orig: ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بظلمهم ما ترك عليها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم إلى أجل مسمى فإذا جاء أجلهم لا يستأخرون ساعة ولا يستقدمون

translation: And they assign to Allah that which they dislike [themselves], and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Allah]. Assuredly, theirs will be the Fire, and they will be forsaken.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the polytheists who assigned to Allah things they disliked for themselves, such as female offspring or attributing partners to Him. It also condemns their false claims that they will attain Paradise, stating that in reality, Hellfire awaits them for their lies and ingratitude to Allah.
orig: ويجعلون لله ما يكرهون وتصف ألسنتهم الكذب أن لهم الحسنى لا جرم أن لهم النار وأنهم مفرطون

translation: By Allah, We have sent (messengers) to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds seem fair to them. So he is their guardian today, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has sent messengers to nations before the Prophet Muhammad, but Satan (Shaytan) deceived them and made their evil deeds seem attractive to them. As a result, Satan has become their guardian and protector on the Day of Judgment, leading them to a painful torment for rejecting the truth and following Satan's footsteps.
orig: تالله لقد أرسلنا إلى أمم من قبلك فزين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم فهو وليهم اليوم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And We have not sent down the Book to you except that you may make clear to them that wherein they differ, and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.
interpretation: Allah revealed the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad to clarify and explain the matters of faith and law that people differed about, to guide those who believe to the truth, and to be a source of mercy and blessings for them.
orig: وما أنزلنا عليك الكتاب إلا لتبين لهم الذي اختلفوا فيه وهدى ورحمة لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and mercy in reviving the lifeless earth through the rain He sends down from the sky. It serves as a profound sign and reminder for those who are willing to listen and reflect upon the divine wisdom and design behind this natural phenomenon. The revival of the earth after its apparent 'death' symbolizes the greater reality of resurrection after death, encouraging believers to have faith in Allah's ability to bring life back after it has departed.
orig: والله أنزل من السماء ماء فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يسمعون

translation: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to the drinkers.
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of one of His great blessings upon us, which is the provision of pure, wholesome milk from the bellies of grazing animals. Despite milk originating from a mixture of digested food, blood, and waste matter within the animal's body, Allah has made it pure and pleasantly drinkable for human beings. This verse encourages contemplation of Allah's wisdom and appreciation for His favors upon His creation.
orig: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة نسقيكم مما في بطونه من بين فرث ودم لبنا خالصا سائغا للشاربين

translation: And from the fruits of the date-palm and grapevines, you derive intoxicants and wholesome provision. Certainly in that is a sign for people who have wisdom.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the blessings of Allah in providing nourishment and sustenance from the fruits of date-palms and grapevines. While these fruits can be used to produce intoxicants, which are prohibited, they also offer wholesome provisions. The coexistence of potential harm and benefit in these fruits serves as a sign and reminder for those who reflect and use their intellect to discern between what is beneficial and what is harmful."
orig: ومن ثمرات النخيل والأعناب تتخذون منه سكرا ورزقا حسنا إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يعقلون

translation: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct."
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and inspiration that Allah has bestowed upon the bee. It is guided by divine revelation to construct its dwellings in the mountains, trees, and other structures. This serves as a reminder of Allah's meticulous care and guidance for all His creatures, even the smallest ones like bees. It also points to the remarkable abilities and instincts that Allah has granted to these creatures, enabling them to build intricate hives and gather sustenance. The verse invites contemplation on the marvels of Allah's creation and the signs of His wisdom present in the natural world around us.
orig: وأوحى ربك إلى النحل أن اتخذي من الجبال بيوتا ومن الشجر ومما يعرشون

translation: "Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse is instructing the believers to partake of the permissible and lawful provisions that Allah has bestowed upon them from various fruits and foods. It then mentions the amazing phenomenon of honey production by bees, which involves the bees consuming nectar from different flowers and fruits, and then producing honey of varying colors within their bodies. This honey contains healing properties beneficial for humans. The verse concludes by stating that this remarkable process is a sign from Allah for those who ponder and reflect upon His creations and the wisdom behind them.
orig: ثم كلي من كل الثمرات فاسلكي سبل ربك ذللا يخرج من بطونها شراب مختلف ألوانه فيه شفاء للناس إن في ذلك لآية لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And it is Allah who created you and then will cause you to die, and among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after having had knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Ever-Knowing and Omnipotent.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah is the Creator of all beings, and He determines the lifespan of each individual. Some people reach an advanced age where they lose their mental faculties and knowledge, despite having been knowledgeable earlier in life. This serves as a reminder of Allah's complete power and wisdom over the human condition and the cycle of life and death.
orig: والله خلقكم ثم يتوفاكم ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكي لا يعلم بعد علم شيئا إن الله عليم قدير

translation: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal in it. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's wisdom in distributing wealth and provisions unequally among people as a test. It condemns those who are favored with wealth yet refuse to share it with those under their care or authority, thereby rejecting Allah's favor and being ungrateful.
orig: والله فضل بعضكم على بعض في الرزق فما الذين فضلوا برادي رزقهم على ما ملكت أيمانهم فهم فيه سواء أفبنعمة الله يجحدون

translation: And Allah has made for you mates of your own kind, and has made for you, from your mates, sons and grandsons, and has bestowed on you good provisions. Do they then believe in falsehood and deny the favors of Allah?
interpretation: "Allah has blessed humans with spouses from among their own kind, allowing them to have children and grandchildren through these unions. He has also provided them with sustenance and provisions from pure and lawful sources. Despite these evident blessings and favors from Allah, some people choose to believe in falsehood and reject the favors of their Lord, displaying ingratitude."
orig: والله جعل لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا وجعل لكم من أزواجكم بنين وحفدة ورزقكم من الطيبات أفبالباطل يؤمنون وبنعمت الله هم يكفرون

translation: And they worship besides Allah that which has no control over their provision from the heavens and the earth in the least, nor can they ever have any power.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of idolatry and worshipping false deities besides Allah. It emphasizes that these idols have no power or control over providing sustenance or any benefit from the heavens or the earth. They are utterly helpless and incapable of possessing any real authority or influence. The verse highlights the futility of worshipping anything other than the One True God, Allah, who is the sole Sustainer and Controller of the universe.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لا يملك لهم رزقا من السماوات والأرض شيئا ولا يستطيعون

translation: So do not strike similitudes for Allah. Surely, Allah knows and you do not know.
interpretation: Allah is beyond human comprehension and analogies. We should not attempt to describe Him using imperfect comparisons or examples, as our knowledge is limited, while Allah's knowledge is perfect and absolute.
orig: فلا تضربوا لله الأمثال إن الله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: Allah sets forth a parable: a slave owned by another, unable to do anything of his own accord, and one whom We have provided with good sustenance from Us, so he spends from it secretly and openly. Are they equal? Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse uses a parable to illustrate the difference between those who worship Allah alone and those who associate partners with Him. The slave who is owned and controlled by another represents the idols or false gods that have no power or control over anything. The one whom Allah has provided with good sustenance represents the believers who recognize Allah's favors and spend from what He has provided them, openly and secretly in obedience to Him. The rhetorical question "Are they equal?" emphasizes the stark contrast between the two, making it clear that those who worship Allah alone are not equal to those who worship powerless idols or partners besides Allah. The verse concludes by praising Allah and lamenting that most people fail to recognize this truth.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا عبدا مملوكا لا يقدر على شيء ومن رزقناه منا رزقا حسنا فهو ينفق منه سرا وجهرا هل يستوون الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb, unable to do anything, and he is a burden on his master; whichever way he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice and is himself on a straight path?
interpretation: This verse uses an example to illustrate the difference between a believer who follows the truth and guidance, and a disbeliever who is misguided and unable to benefit himself or others. The dumb man who cannot do anything represents the disbeliever who is spiritually deaf and blind, unable to comprehend the truth. He is a burden on his 'master,' meaning he is dependent on others for guidance. Whichever way he is directed, he brings no good. In contrast, the believer commands justice and righteousness, and is himself on the straight path of truth and guidance from Allah.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا رجلين أحدهما أبكم لا يقدر على شيء وهو كل على مولاه أينما يوجهه لا يأت بخير هل يستوي هو ومن يأمر بالعدل وهو على صراط مستقيم

translation: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and the command for the Hour is not but like a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute knowledge and power over all that is unseen in the heavens and the earth. It also highlights the suddenness and unpredictability of the coming of the Day of Resurrection, which will occur in the blink of an eye or even sooner, by Allah's command. The verse affirms that Allah is truly capable of all things.
orig: ولله غيب السماوات والأرض وما أمر الساعة إلا كلمح البصر أو هو أقرب إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And Allah brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers while you knew nothing, and He gave you hearing, vision and hearts so that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's immense favor upon us by bringing us into existence from our mothers' wombs in a state of complete ignorance. He then blessed us with the faculties of hearing, sight, and intellect so that we may use them to acquire knowledge, recognize the truth, and be thankful to Allah for His countless blessings.
orig: والله أخرجكم من بطون أمهاتكم لا تعلمون شيئا وجعل لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة لعلكم تشكرون

translation: Do they not observe the birds held poised in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Verily, in this are signs for people who believe.
interpretation: The verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating and sustaining the birds in flight. It is a sign for those who believe, pointing to the existence of a Supreme Creator who controls all aspects of the universe. The birds' ability to fly and remain suspended in the air is a manifestation of Allah's might and a reminder of His dominion over all creation.
orig: ألم يروا إلى الطير مسخرات في جو السماء ما يمسكهن إلا الله إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals, tents, which you find light on the day you travel and the day you encamp; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: Allah has provided you with homes to dwell in and feel secure, and also provided you with tents made from animal hides that are lightweight and easy to carry when you travel or settle temporarily. He has also given you furnishings and provisions from the wool, fur, and hair of animals to benefit you for a period of time.
orig: والله جعل لكم من بيوتكم سكنا وجعل لكم من جلود الأنعام بيوتا تستخفونها يوم ظعنكم ويوم إقامتكم ومن أصوافها وأوبارها وأشعارها أثاثا ومتاعا إلى حين

translation: And Allah has made for you, from what He has created, shades; and He has made for you from the mountains, shelters, and has made for you garments which protect you from heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].
interpretation: Allah menciptakan naungan bagi manusia dari segala sesuatu yang diciptakan-Nya seperti pepohonan, awan, dan sebagainya. Dia juga menciptakan gunung-gunung sebagai tempat berlindung. Dia juga menciptakan pakaian yang melindungi dari panas dan dingin, serta pakaian yang melindungi dalam peperangan. Semua itu merupakan nikmat Allah kepada manusia agar mereka tunduk dan patuh kepada-Nya.
orig: والله جعل لكم مما خلق ظلالا وجعل لكم من الجبال أكنانا وجعل لكم سرابيل تقيكم الحر وسرابيل تقيكم بأسكم كذلك يتم نعمته عليكم لعلكم تسلمون

translation: But if they turn away, then upon you is only the clear conveyance [of the message]
interpretation: If the people reject the message you have conveyed, do not grieve, for your duty is only to deliver the message clearly and eloquently. Their acceptance or rejection is not your responsibility; you are only a messenger, and Allah will hold them accountable for their choices.
orig: فإن تولوا فإنما عليك البلاغ المبين

translation: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who acknowledge the blessings and favors bestowed upon them by Allah, yet they ungratefully reject and deny them. They recognize Allah's favors through their intellect and conscience, but their arrogance and stubbornness lead them to ingratitude and disbelief. The majority of such people are disbelievers who refuse to submit to Allah despite recognizing His signs and bounties.
orig: يعرفون نعمت الله ثم ينكرونها وأكثرهم الكافرون

translation: And the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness, then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologise or make excuses], nor will they be asked to make amends.
interpretation: On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will bring forth a witness from every community to testify against them regarding their deeds and their response to the message conveyed by the Prophets. At that point, the disbelievers will not be given permission to apologize or make excuses for their rejection of faith, nor will they be allowed to repent and seek forgiveness.
orig: ويوم نبعث من كل أمة شهيدا ثم لا يؤذن للذين كفروا ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: And when those who have wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
interpretation: This verse implies that those who persist in oppression and wrongdoing will face the full consequences of their actions on the Day of Judgment. The punishment they receive will not be reduced or postponed, as they will be held accountable for their transgressions without any leniency or delay. It serves as a stern warning against injustice and a reminder of the inevitability of divine justice.
orig: وإذا رأى الذين ظلموا العذاب فلا يخفف عنهم ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And when those who associated partners with Allah see their partners, they will say, 'Our Lord, these are our partners whom we used to invoke besides You.' But they will throw the statement back at them, 'You are indeed liars.'
interpretation: This verse implies that on the Day of Judgment, the idolaters will disassociate themselves from their false deities and blame them for leading them astray. However, these deities will deny any responsibility and accuse the idolaters of lying about their supposed partnership with Allah.
orig: وإذا رأى الذين أشركوا شركاءهم قالوا ربنا هؤلاء شركاؤنا الذين كنا ندعو من دونك فألقوا إليهم القول إنكم لكاذبون

translation: And they will submit themselves to Allah on that Day, and what they used to fabricate will have gone away from them.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, all beings will surrender themselves to Allah's judgment and authority. Whatever false beliefs, idols, or fabricated deities they used to worship besides Allah will be exposed as falsehoods and will be of no avail to them. All their invented lies and misconceptions about the truth will vanish.
orig: وألقوا إلى الله يومئذ السلم وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and actively prevent others from following the path of Allah. It states that such individuals will face an additional punishment beyond the regular punishment, due to the corruption and harm they spread through their misguided actions and attempts to mislead others away from the truth.
orig: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله زدناهم عذابا فوق العذاب بما كانوا يفسدون

translation: And on the Day when We will raise up from every nation a witness against them from among themselves, and We shall bring you, O Muhammad, as a witness against these. And We have revealed to you the Book as an exposition of everything, and a guidance and a mercy, and glad tidings for those who submit.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the Day of Resurrection when Allah will raise a witness from every nation to testify against them. The Prophet Muhammad will be brought as a witness over his nation. The Qur'an has been revealed to him as a detailed explanation of all things, providing guidance, mercy, and glad tidings for those who submit to Allah.
orig: ويوم نبعث في كل أمة شهيدا عليهم من أنفسهم وجئنا بك شهيدا على هؤلاء ونزلنا عليك الكتاب تبيانا لكل شيء وهدى ورحمة وبشرى للمسلمين

translation: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive moral code prescribed by God in Islam. It emphasizes the virtues of justice, kindness, supporting one's relatives, and abstaining from all forms of immorality, wrongdoing, and oppression. The verse serves as a reminder for people to reflect upon these teachings and strive to uphold these values in their lives.
orig: إن الله يأمر بالعدل والإحسان وإيتاء ذي القربى وينهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر والبغي يعظكم لعلكم تذكرون

translation: And fulfill the Covenant of Allah when you have covenanted, and break not the oaths after you have confirmed them - and indeed you have appointed Allah over you as a Watcher. Surely, Allah knows what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's covenants and oaths made with Allah. It commands believers to honor their pledges and not to break them after confirming them, as Allah is a witness over their actions. The verse reminds us that Allah is fully aware of our deeds, emphasizing the accountability we have towards Him.
orig: وأوفوا بعهد الله إذا عاهدتم ولا تنقضوا الأيمان بعد توكيدها وقد جعلتم الله عليكم كفيلا إن الله يعلم ما تفعلون

translation: And do not be like her who unravels her yarn, breaking it into pieces after it has become strong. You make your oaths a means of deception among yourselves, so that one community may be more numerous than another. God only tries you thereby, and He will make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that wherein you differed.
interpretation: This verse prohibits breaking oaths and covenants after they have been made, which is likened to unraveling a strong yarn. It warns against using oaths as a means of deception or gaining advantage over others. Allah tests people through this to see who upholds their oaths. On the Day of Judgment, the reasons for differing and breaking oaths will become clear.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالتي نقضت غزلها من بعد قوة أنكاثا تتخذون أيمانكم دخلا بينكم أن تكون أمة هي أربى من أمة إنما يبلوكم الله به وليبينن لكم يوم القيامة ما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: If Allah had willed, He could have made you one community, but He lets go astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and wisdom. He has the power to make all of humanity one united community, but He has chosen to create diversity and test people's faith. Some are guided by His mercy, while others are left to stray due to their own choices and desires. Ultimately, each person will be held accountable for their actions on the Day of Judgment."
orig: ولو شاء الله لجعلكم أمة واحدة ولكن يضل من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء ولتسألن عما كنتم تعملون

translation: And do not take your oaths as a means of deception among yourselves, lest a foot should slip after being firmly planted, and you taste evil for having turned away from the path of Allah, and yours will be a great punishment.
interpretation: "This verse warns against making false oaths or breaking oaths, as it leads to instability and deviation from the straight path. It emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and fulfilling one's promises, as breaking them brings about evil consequences and a severe punishment from Allah."
orig: ولا تتخذوا أيمانكم دخلا بينكم فتزل قدم بعد ثبوتها وتذوقوا السوء بما صددتم عن سبيل الله ولكم عذاب عظيم

translation: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small gain. What is with Allah is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: "This verse prohibits breaking one's covenant or promise with Allah for worldly gains or benefits that are insignificant and temporary. It reminds believers that honoring their covenant with Allah and following His commands leads to far greater rewards in the Hereafter, which are everlasting and infinitely more valuable than any fleeting worldly pleasure or material possession."
orig: ولا تشتروا بعهد الله ثمنا قليلا إنما عند الله هو خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: What is with you must vanish: what is with Allah will endure. And We will certainly bestow, on those who patiently persevere, their reward in accordance with the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the temporary nature of worldly possessions and pleasures, while highlighting the everlasting rewards that Allah has promised for those who exercise patience and perseverance. It encourages believers to focus on righteous deeds and steadfastness, as these will be rewarded generously in the Hereafter, far exceeding any worldly gains.
orig: ما عندكم ينفد وما عند الله باق ولنجزين الذين صبروا أجرهم بأحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Whoever does righteous deeds, whether male or female, while being a believer - We will surely cause them to live a good life and will surely reward them their due according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that righteous deeds and faith are the criteria for attaining a good life and reward from Allah, regardless of one's gender. It promises a blessed life in this world and an excellent reward in the Hereafter for those who have faith and perform good deeds. The verse highlights Allah's justice and fairness, as the reward is based solely on one's actions and faith, not on gender or any other worldly distinctions.
orig: من عمل صالحا من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فلنحيينه حياة طيبة ولنجزينهم أجرهم بأحسن ما كانوا يعملون

translation: So when you recite the Qur'an, seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Satan.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to seek protection from Allah against the whisperings and deceptions of Satan before reciting the Qur'an. Satan tries to divert people's minds and create doubts during the recitation of the divine scripture, so seeking refuge in Allah safeguards one from his evil suggestions and enables proper understanding and reflection on the Qur'anic verses.
orig: فإذا قرأت القرآن فاستعذ بالله من الشيطان الرجيم

translation: Indeed, there is no authority for him over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Satan (the one referred to as 'he') has no power or control over the believers who put their trust and reliance solely upon Allah. The faith and dependence on Allah protects the believers from the influence and temptations of Satan.
orig: إنه ليس له سلطان على الذين آمنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who associate others with Allah in worship.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Satan (referred to by the pronoun 'his') has no authority or power over the believers who submit to Allah alone. His influence and temptations only affect those who ally themselves with him by obeying his commands and those who associate partners with Allah in worship, thereby falling into polytheism or shirk.
orig: إنما سلطانه على الذين يتولونه والذين هم به مشركون

translation: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You are but a forger." But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse refers to the phenomenon of abrogation (naskh) in the Qur'an, where Allah replaces certain verses with others. The interpretation is that when Allah abrogates a verse and reveals a new one in its place, the disbelievers accuse the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ of fabricating the new verse himself, since they do not understand the wisdom behind Allah's legislation. However, most of them are ignorant and do not comprehend that Allah is All-Knowing and has complete authority over what He reveals.
orig: وإذا بدلنا آية مكان آية والله أعلم بما ينزل قالوا إنما أنت مفتر بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Say, 'The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe, and as guidance and good tidings for the Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an was revealed by the Pure Spirit (Angel Gabriel) from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad to strengthen the faith of the believers, guide them, and give them glad tidings. The revelation of the Qur'an serves as a source of reassurance, guidance, and hope for the Muslim community.
orig: قل نزله روح القدس من ربك بالحق ليثبت الذين آمنوا وهدى وبشرى للمسلمين

translation: And We certainly know that they say, 'It is only a human being who teaches him.' The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this is [a] clear Arabic tongue.
interpretation: This verse addresses the claim of the disbelievers that the Qur'an was taught to Prophet Muhammad by a foreign human. Allah refutes this by stating that the language of the Qur'an is clear Arabic, whereas the language they accuse him of learning from is a foreign tongue. This affirms that the Qur'an is a divine revelation, not something learned from a human source.
orig: ولقد نعلم أنهم يقولون إنما يعلمه بشر لسان الذي يلحدون إليه أعجمي وهذا لسان عربي مبين

translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of faith in Allah's revelations. Those who reject or disbelieve in the signs and verses revealed by Allah will be deprived of His guidance and will face a severe and painful punishment in the Hereafter. Their disbelief and arrogance will prevent them from attaining true guidance and salvation. The verse serves as a warning against denying Allah's signs and highlights the consequences of such rejection.
orig: إن الذين لا يؤمنون بآيات الله لا يهديهم الله ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: It is only those who do not believe in the verses of Allah who fabricate falsehood, and it is they who are liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that fabricating lies and attributing falsehood to Allah is a trait of those who lack faith in the divine revelations. It condemns the act of intentionally distorting or inventing false narratives about Allah's signs and messages. The verse highlights that such behavior stems from disbelief and is a manifestation of lying and deception.
orig: إنما يفتري الكذب الذين لا يؤمنون بآيات الله وأولئك هم الكاذبون

translation: Whoever disbelieved in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse discusses the situation of those who renounce their faith in Islam after believing. It states that those who disbelieve willingly, without any compulsion, will incur Allah's wrath and a severe punishment. However, it makes an exception for those who are forced to renounce their faith outwardly, while their hearts remain firm in belief. For such people who are compelled to make a verbal rejection of faith due to extreme circumstances, there is no blame as long as their hearts remain secure in faith.
orig: من كفر بالله من بعد إيمانه إلا من أكره وقلبه مطمئن بالإيمان ولكن من شرح بالكفر صدرا فعليهم غضب من الله ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: That is because they preferred the life of this world over the Hereafter, and because Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.
interpretation: This verse explains that the reason for their disbelief and rejection of faith is their preference for the temporary pleasures and comforts of this worldly life over the everlasting rewards of the Hereafter. It also states that Allah does not guide those who willfully reject faith and persist in disbelief.
orig: ذلك بأنهم استحبوا الحياة الدنيا على الآخرة وأن الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين

translation: Those are the ones over whose hearts, hearing, and vision Allah has set a seal, and it is those who are the heedless.
interpretation: This verse refers to those whose hearts have been sealed by Allah, rendering them unable to comprehend the truth or benefit from the guidance. Their spiritual faculties of hearing and sight have been impaired, leaving them in a state of heedlessness and oblivion towards the signs of Allah. This is a consequence of their persistent rejection of faith and their unwillingness to accept the truth, despite being presented with clear evidence and proofs.
orig: أولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم وسمعهم وأبصارهم وأولئك هم الغافلون

translation: No doubt, in the Hereafter they will be the losers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who reject faith and turn away from the guidance of Allah will ultimately be the losers in the Hereafter. Their rejection of the truth and their pursuit of worldly desires will lead them to a state of loss and deprivation in the eternal life to come. The phrase "la jarama" (no doubt) reinforces the certainty of this outcome, leaving no room for doubt or ambiguity. The verse serves as a stern warning and a reminder of the grave consequences of disbelief and disobedience.
orig: لا جرم أنهم في الآخرة هم الخاسرون

translation: Then indeed, your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled to renounce their religion, and thereafter struggled hard and persevered patiently - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: Allah is promising forgiveness and mercy to those who were persecuted for their faith, forced to renounce it outwardly while keeping it in their hearts, and then migrated and strove hard in His cause with patience. Despite their momentary weakness under compulsion, He will pardon them and shower them with His boundless grace.
orig: ثم إن ربك للذين هاجروا من بعد ما فتنوا ثم جاهدوا وصبروا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: The Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse describes the Day of Judgment, when each person will argue for themselves concerning their deeds and beliefs. Each soul will be fully recompensed for its actions, whether good or bad, without any injustice or oppression. It emphasizes the accountability of every individual before God and the fair and just nature of divine judgment.
orig: يوم تأتي كل نفس تجادل عن نفسها وتوفى كل نفس ما عملت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every quarter, but it denied the favors of Allah, so Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.
interpretation: This verse uses the example of a city that was blessed with peace, security, and abundant provision from all directions. However, its people were ungrateful for Allah's favors and denied them. As a result, Allah punished them by making them experience hunger and fear as a consequence of their actions and ingratitude.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا قرية كانت آمنة مطمئنة يأتيها رزقها رغدا من كل مكان فكفرت بأنعم الله فأذاقها الله لباس الجوع والخوف بما كانوا يصنعون

translation: And verily, there came unto them a messenger from among themselves, but they denied him, so the torment seized them while they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the fact that Allah sent messengers from among the people themselves, sharing their language and culture, to guide them to the truth. However, they rejected and denied these messengers, leading to their punishment and affliction while persisting in wrongdoing and disbelief.
orig: ولقد جاءهم رسول منهم فكذبوه فأخذهم العذاب وهم ظالمون

translation: So eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to consume what Allah has made permissible and pure, without indulging in unlawful or impure things. It also reminds them to express gratitude to Allah for His blessings, as gratitude is an essential part of true worship. The verse implies that if one truly worships Allah, one should appreciate and be thankful for His provisions.
orig: فكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واشكروا نعمت الله إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: Prohibited for you are carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, and what has been offered to other than Allah. But whosoever is compelled by necessity, neither craving nor transgressing, then surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.
interpretation: Allah has prohibited the consumption of carrion (dead animals without proper slaughter), blood, pork, and animals sacrificed in the name of anyone other than Allah. However, if one is forced by necessity to consume such prohibited items, without deliberately seeking it or exceeding the bare minimum required, then Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards such a person.
orig: إنما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما أهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And do not say for what your tongues describe as a lie, 'This is lawful, and this is unlawful,' to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse warns against making arbitrary judgments about what is permissible or forbidden without a valid basis from Allah. It prohibits inventing lies and falsely attributing them to Allah. Those who fabricate lies against Allah and distort His commandments will not achieve success or salvation.
orig: ولا تقولوا لما تصف ألسنتكم الكذب هذا حلال وهذا حرام لتفتروا على الله الكذب إن الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون

translation: A brief enjoyment, then for them is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelievers who enjoy the temporary pleasures and luxuries of this worldly life for a brief period, but in the end, they will face a severe and painful punishment in the Hereafter for rejecting the truth and denying Allah's signs and revelations.
orig: متاع قليل ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: And unto those who are Jews, We forbade every animal having claws; and of oxen and sheep forbade We unto them the fat thereof save that upon the backs or the entrails, or that which is mingled with a bone. That is the recompense We awarded them for their rebellion. And verily We are Truthful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the dietary restrictions imposed on the Jews as a consequence of their disobedience and rebellion against Allah's commands. Certain types of animals and their fats were forbidden for them, except for the fat on their backs, entrails, or that which is mixed with bones. This was a punishment or "recompense" from Allah for their transgressions. The verse emphasizes Allah's truthfulness in fulfilling His warnings and promises.
orig: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا ما قصصنا عليك من قبل وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: Then indeed, your Lord, for those who did evil in ignorance, and then repented after that and corrected themselves - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: Allah informs us that He is Forgiving and Merciful towards those who commit sins out of ignorance, not deliberately defying His commands, and then sincerely repent and reform themselves. This verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and encourages people to repent and mend their ways, as He is ready to forgive them and shower them with His grace.
orig: ثم إن ربك للذين عملوا السوء بجهالة ثم تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا إن ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم

translation: Indeed, Abraham was a nation [i.e., leader], devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exemplary qualities of Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him). He was a leader and a role model for an entire nation, dedicating himself completely to the obedience and worship of the One True God. He was upright, inclined towards truth and monotheism, and rejected all forms of polytheism and associating partners with Allah. His life was a testament to unwavering faith and submission to the Almighty.
orig: إن إبراهيم كان أمة قانتا لله حنيفا ولم يك من المشركين

translation: Being grateful for His favors, He chose him and guided him to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's favor upon a chosen servant, whom He selected and guided to the right path. It highlights Allah's grace and guidance bestowed upon those who are grateful for His blessings and strive to follow the straight path of truth and righteousness. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of gratitude, obedience, and seeking divine guidance to remain steadfast on the path that pleases Allah.
orig: شاكرا لأنعمه اجتباه وهداه إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And We gave him good in this world, and in the Hereafter he will surely be among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah bestowed many blessings and favors upon the person being referred to in this worldly life. However, the greater reward awaits him in the Hereafter, where he will be among the righteous and pious people who will enjoy the eternal bliss of Paradise due to their faith and good deeds.
orig: وآتيناه في الدنيا حسنة وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to follow the religion and way of life of Prophet Abraham, who was a monotheist and did not associate any partners with Allah. The phrase "inclining toward truth" (hanifan) refers to the pure monotheistic belief and turning away from polytheism and false beliefs.
orig: ثم أوحينا إليك أن اتبع ملة إبراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين

translation: The Sabbath was appointed only for those who differed about it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: "The strict observance of the Sabbath was made obligatory only upon those Jews who differed about it and violated its sanctity. As for your nation, O Muhammad, Allah has not imposed such an obligation upon you. He will judge between the Jews and settle their disputes regarding the Sabbath on the Day of Resurrection, when they will be held accountable for the differences they had in this matter."
orig: إنما جعل السبت على الذين اختلفوا فيه وإن ربك ليحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: "Preach the message of your Lord with wisdom, using gentle and kind advice. If you must engage in debate or argumentation, do so in the most courteous and effective manner. Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and who is rightly guided."
orig: ادع إلى سبيل ربك بالحكمة والموعظة الحسنة وجادلهم بالتي هي أحسن إن ربك هو أعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on retaliation and punishment. It states that if one is wronged, they may retaliate proportionately to the harm inflicted upon them. However, it encourages patience and restraint, emphasizing that it is better for those who are patient and forgiving. The verse highlights the virtues of forbearance and self-control, even in the face of injustice or harm.
orig: وإن عاقبتم فعاقبوا بمثل ما عوقبتم به ولئن صبرتم لهو خير للصابرين

translation: And be patient, and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not be grieved by them and do not be in distress because of what they conspire.
interpretation: "Allah commands the Prophet to be patient and steadfast in the face of the disbelievers' rejection and hostility. True patience comes only through reliance on Allah and His aid. The Prophet is instructed not to grieve over the disbelievers' obstinacy or feel distressed by their plots and conspiracies against him, for Allah will protect and support him."
orig: واصبر وما صبرك إلا بالله ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تك في ضيق مما يمكرون

translation: Indeed, Allah is with those who are righteous and those who do good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah's support, guidance, and blessings are with those who have taqwa (righteousness, piety, and consciousness of Allah) and those who engage in good deeds and actions. It promises divine companionship and assistance to individuals who lead a virtuous life, abstain from sins, and strive to do what is pleasing to Allah. The verse encourages believers to cultivate taqwa and perform righteous deeds, as this will bring them closer to Allah and earn His favor.
orig: إن الله مع الذين اتقوا والذين هم محسنون

translation: Glorified is He who took His servant for a journey by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque, whose surroundings We have blessed, so that We may show him some of Our signs. Indeed, He alone is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous Night Journey (Al-Isra') of Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, from Makkah to Jerusalem, and his ascension (Al-Miraj) through the heavens. It glorifies Allah for this extraordinary event, which demonstrated His ability to take His servant on a supernatural journey to witness some of His great signs and marvels. The journey affirmed the Prophet's status and validated his message, as only the All-Hearing and All-Seeing God could have facilitated such a miraculous experience.
orig: سبحان الذي أسرى بعبده ليلا من المسجد الحرام إلى المسجد الأقصى الذي باركنا حوله لنريه من آياتنا إنه هو السميع البصير

translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you should not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs
interpretation: Allah is instructing the Children of Israel, through the revelation given to Prophet Moses, to worship and obey only Him. They should not appoint anyone else as a guardian, protector or helper besides Allah, for He alone is capable of guiding and taking care of their affairs.
orig: وآتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلناه هدى لبني إسرائيل ألا تتخذوا من دوني وكيلا

translation: Offspring of those We carried with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.
interpretation: This verse refers to the descendants of those who were saved with Prophet Noah on the Ark. It praises Noah as a grateful servant of God who was thankful for being saved from the great flood.
orig: ذرية من حملنا مع نوح إنه كان عبدا شكورا

translation: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Book that, 'You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely become arrogantly defiant.'
interpretation: "This verse is a warning from Allah to the Children of Israel about their future behavior and consequences. It foretells that they will spread corruption and mischief on the earth twice, and that they will become arrogant and defiant against Allah's commands. This prophecy was fulfilled when they rebelled against the teachings of Allah and His messengers, leading to their exile and suffering."
orig: وقضينا إلى بني إسرائيل في الكتاب لتفسدن في الأرض مرتين ولتعلن علوا كبيرا

translation: So when the promise of the first of the two came, We sent against you servants of Ours possessed of great might who ravaged [your] cities, and the promise was fulfilled.
interpretation: This verse refers to the fulfillment of Allah's promise to send His powerful servants against those who rejected the message. These servants were strong and mighty, and they ravaged the cities of the disbelievers. This was a punishment for their rejection of the truth, and it serves as a reminder that Allah's promises are always fulfilled, whether they are promises of reward or punishment.
orig: فإذا جاء وعد أولاهما بعثنا عليكم عبادا لنا أولي بأس شديد فجاسوا خلال الديار وكان وعدا مفعولا

translation: Then We gave you back the turn to prevail over them, and aided you with wealth and children, and made you more numerous in manpower.
interpretation: This verse refers to the victory and empowerment granted by Allah to the believers after their initial struggle and hardship. It suggests that after a period of difficulty, Allah restored their ability to overcome their opponents and provided them with material resources ("wealth and children") as well as increased their numbers and strength ("made you more numerous in manpower"). The interpretation highlights Allah's support and favor towards the believers, granting them triumph and prosperity after enduring challenges.
orig: ثم رددنا لكم الكرة عليهم وأمددناكم بأموال وبنين وجعلناكم أكثر نفيرا

translation: If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, it is for yourselves. Then, when the second promise comes to pass, they will make your faces gloomy and enter the mosque as they entered it the first time, and destroy whatever they overran with utter destruction.
interpretation: This verse highlights the principle of individual responsibility and accountability. It states that one's good or evil deeds ultimately impact oneself. The interpretation suggests that when the promised Day of Judgment arrives, the disbelievers will face humiliation and punishment for their misdeeds, just as they had previously desecrated and destroyed the sacred mosque.
orig: إن أحسنتم أحسنتم لأنفسكم وإن أسأتم فلها فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة ليسوءوا وجوهكم وليدخلوا المسجد كما دخلوه أول مرة وليتبروا ما علوا تتبيرا

translation: It may be that your Lord will have mercy upon you, but if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed.
interpretation: Allah is saying that He may forgive the believers if they repent sincerely, but if they persist in sin, He will punish them severely. Hell has been prepared as an inescapable prison for the disbelievers who reject faith.
orig: عسى ربكم أن يرحمكم وإن عدتم عدنا وجعلنا جهنم للكافرين حصيرا

translation: Verily, this Qur'an guides to that which is most upright and gives glad tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds, that they shall have a great reward.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an provides guidance towards the straight path and the most upright way of life. It also brings good news to those who have faith and perform righteous deeds, promising them a tremendous reward in the Hereafter for their efforts.
orig: إن هذا القرآن يهدي للتي هي أقوم ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا كبيرا

translation: And indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject the belief in the Hereafter or the life after death, that Allah has prepared a severe and excruciating punishment for them. It emphasizes the grave consequences of disbelieving in the Hereafter, which is a fundamental aspect of faith in Islam. The interpretation highlights the importance of having faith in the Hereafter and living a righteous life in preparation for the ultimate accountability on the Day of Judgment.
