orig: وأن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة أعتدنا لهم عذابا أليما

translation: And man invokes evil as he invokes good, and man is ever hasty.
interpretation: This verse highlights the impatient and hasty nature of human beings. When faced with adversity or difficulties, people are quick to invoke evil and curse their circumstances, just as they invoke good and ask for blessings during times of prosperity. However, this impatience and lack of perseverance is seen as a flaw in human character, as true believers should remain steadfast and trust in God's wisdom, even in challenging times.
orig: ويدع الإنسان بالشر دعاءه بالخير وكان الإنسان عجولا

translation: And We made the night and day two signs. Then We obliterated the sign of the night and made the sign of day visible, that you may seek bounty from your Lord and know the number of years and the reckoning. And We have explained everything with detailed explanations.
interpretation: Allah has made the night and day as signs of His power and wisdom. The darkness of night is removed by the light of day, which enables people to pursue their livelihoods and seek sustenance from Allah. The alternation of night and day also helps in determining the passage of time, years, and calculations. This verse highlights Allah's favors upon humanity by creating this natural system and providing detailed explanations of all things in the Qur'an and through the signs in the universe.
orig: وجعلنا الليل والنهار آيتين فمحونا آية الليل وجعلنا آية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب وكل شيء فصلناه تفصيلا

translation: And We have fastened every human's omen upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.
interpretation: This verse refers to the record of each person's deeds that will be presented to them on the Day of Judgment. The "omen" or "bird" fastened upon one's neck is a metaphor for the deeds, good or bad, that one carries throughout life. On the Day of Resurrection, this record will be laid out openly, leaving no deed unaccounted for. It serves as a reminder of the accountability that every human being will face for their actions in this world.
orig: وكل إنسان ألزمناه طائره في عنقه ونخرج له يوم القيامة كتابا يلقاه منشورا

translation: Read your book. Sufficient is yourself this Day as a reckoner over you.
interpretation: This verse encourages self-accountability and self-evaluation. It emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, each person will be held accountable for their own deeds and actions, without the need for external witnesses or judges. The "book" referred to is a metaphor for one's record of deeds, which will be presented to them on that Day. The verse urges individuals to be mindful of their actions and to hold themselves responsible in this life, as they will ultimately face the consequences of their choices.
orig: اقرأ كتابك كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا

translation: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And We were not punishing [the people] until We had sent a messenger.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability. Each person is responsible for their own choices and actions, and will reap the consequences accordingly. No one can bear the burden or blame of another's sins or wrongdoings. Furthermore, Allah does not punish people without first sending a messenger to guide them and convey His message. This underscores the importance of divine guidance and the mercy of Allah in providing clear guidance before holding people accountable.
orig: من اهتدى فإنما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى وما كنا معذبين حتى نبعث رسولا

translation: And when We intend to destroy a town, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word [deserving of punishment] has come into effect upon it, and We have destroyed it with [complete] destruction.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's justice and wisdom in dealing with nations. When a society becomes corrupt and defiant towards Allah's commands, despite being blessed with wealth and resources, Allah gives them a chance to repent by sending messengers. If they persist in disobedience, the punishment becomes inevitable. The "word" refers to Allah's decree of punishment, which is executed by completely destroying the rebellious nation as a lesson for others.
orig: وإذا أردنا أن نهلك قرية أمرنا مترفيها ففسقوا فيها فحق عليها القول فدمرناها تدميرا

translation: And how many generations have We destroyed after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord as an All-Aware and All-Beholder of the sins of His servants.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's power and justice. He has destroyed many nations after the time of Prophet Noah for their disbelief and disobedience. Allah is fully aware of the sins committed by His servants, and He is All-Seeing, nothing is hidden from Him. He will hold everyone accountable for their deeds.
orig: وكم أهلكنا من القرون من بعد نوح وكفى بربك بذنوب عباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: Whoever desires the present life, We hasten for him therein what We will to whomever We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will burn in, censured and banished.
interpretation: Allah is highlighting that those who desire only the temporary pleasures and gains of this worldly life, He may grant them some of those fleeting desires as a test. However, their ultimate destination will be the Hellfire, where they will be disgraced and rejected for pursuing worldly desires over the eternal bliss of the Hereafter.
orig: من كان يريد العاجلة عجلنا له فيها ما نشاء لمن نريد ثم جعلنا له جهنم يصلاها مذموما مدحورا

translation: But whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it as he ought to strive, being a believer, it is they whose effort shall be appreciated.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of striving for the Hereafter with faith and righteous deeds. It emphasizes that those who sincerely desire the everlasting life in the Hereafter and work diligently towards attaining it while being true believers, their efforts will be accepted, appreciated, and rewarded by Allah.
orig: ومن أراد الآخرة وسعى لها سعيها وهو مؤمن فأولئك كان سعيهم مشكورا

translation: Nay, We aid these as well as those from the bounty of your Lord, and the bounty of your Lord can never be prevented.
interpretation: Allah bestows His favors and provisions upon both the believers and the disbelievers, without discrimination. His bounty is not restricted or withheld from anyone. This verse emphasizes Allah's generosity and mercy towards all of His creation, regardless of their beliefs or actions.
orig: كلا نمد هؤلاء وهؤلاء من عطاء ربك وما كان عطاء ربك محظورا

translation: See how We have favored some over others, and the Hereafter will be greater in degrees and greater in distinction.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's wisdom in creating differences among people in terms of abilities, wealth, status, etc. It reminds us that in the Hereafter, there will be even greater distinctions and levels based on one's faith and deeds. Those who believed and did righteous deeds will attain higher ranks and greater honor from Allah.
orig: انظر كيف فضلنا بعضهم على بعض وللآخرة أكبر درجات وأكبر تفضيلا

translation: Do not set up another god besides Allah, or you will sit condemned and forsaken.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers not to associate any partners with Allah in worship. It warns against committing the grave sin of shirk (associating others with Allah) which would lead to being condemned and abandoned by Allah and all creation on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتقعد مذموما مخذولا

translation: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.
interpretation: Allah commands us to worship Him alone and to treat our parents with utmost kindness and respect, even when they become old and frail. We must not utter a word of disrespect or annoyance towards them, nor mistreat them in any way. Instead, we should speak to them politely and gently, honoring them for the sacrifices they made in raising us.
orig: وقضى ربك ألا تعبدوا إلا إياه وبالوالدين إحسانا إما يبلغن عندك الكبر أحدهما أو كلاهما فلا تقل لهما أف ولا تنهرهما وقل لهما قولا كريما

translation: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, 'My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up when I was small.'
interpretation: This verse instructs us to be humble, kind, and merciful towards our parents, just as they nurtured and cared for us when we were young and helpless. It reminds us to honor our parents, treat them with utmost respect and compassion, and pray for God's mercy upon them as they were the means of our upbringing and guidance in our early years.
orig: واخفض لهما جناح الذل من الرحمة وقل رب ارحمهما كما ربياني صغيرا

translation: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.
interpretation: Allah knows the intentions and thoughts within your hearts and minds. If you strive to be righteous and obedient to Him, then surely He is Most Forgiving to those who frequently turn to Him in repentance and seek His forgiveness.
orig: ربكم أعلم بما في نفوسكم إن تكونوا صالحين فإنه كان للأوابين غفورا

translation: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to fulfill the rights of their relatives by providing for them and maintaining good relations. It also commands giving charity to the poor and needy, as well as assisting travelers who are in need. Additionally, it prohibits wasteful and extravagant spending, urging moderation and balance in one's expenditures.
orig: وآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ولا تبذر تبذيرا

translation: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse warns against being wasteful and extravagant, as it is a trait of the devils. The "brothers of the devils" refers to those who share their qualities of wastefulness and ingratitude towards Allah's blessings. Satan himself was ungrateful to his Lord by disobeying His command, and those who follow in his footsteps by squandering resources and being ungrateful for Allah's favors are likened to him.
orig: إن المبذرين كانوا إخوان الشياطين وكان الشيطان لربه كفورا

translation: And if you turn away from them, seeking mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.
interpretation: If you find it difficult to preach to or advise the disbelievers due to their stubbornness, then turn away from them temporarily while hoping for Allah's mercy and guidance for them. But when you do speak to them, speak gently and politely, avoiding harshness or provocation, as that may further alienate them.
orig: وإما تعرضن عنهم ابتغاء رحمة من ربك ترجوها فقل لهم قولا ميسورا

translation: And do not make your hand chained to your neck, nor outspread it completely, for you will sit reproached and denuded.
interpretation: "This verse teaches moderation in spending. One should neither be miserly nor extravagant, but adopt a balanced approach in one's financial affairs. Excessive frugality can lead to blame and deprivation, while excessive spending can result in poverty and regret."
orig: ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة إلى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط فتقعد ملوما محسورا

translation: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts. Indeed, He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah is the sole Provider and Sustainer of all creation. He grants abundant provision to whomever He wills, and He also restricts provision for whomever He wills, based on His infinite wisdom and knowledge. The verse emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of the circumstances and needs of His servants, and He sees and knows everything about them. Therefore, we should have complete trust in Allah's decree and be content with whatever He has bestowed upon us.
orig: إن ربك يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide sustenance for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.
interpretation: This verse prohibits the practice of infanticide, which was common in pre-Islamic Arabia due to poverty and fear of starvation. It emphasizes that Allah is the Provider and will sustain both children and parents. Killing children is a grave sin and a violation of the sanctity of life bestowed by Allah.
orig: ولا تقتلوا أولادكم خشية إملاق نحن نرزقهم وإياكم إن قتلهم كان خطئا كبيرا

translation: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.
interpretation: This verse prohibits coming near to unlawful sexual relations, which includes not only the act itself but also anything that may lead to it, such as being alone with a non-mahram of the opposite sex, looking at pornographic material, or engaging in flirtatious behavior. It emphasizes that fornication and adultery are grave sins and immoral acts that corrupt society and lead one away from the straight path.
orig: ولا تقربوا الزنا إنه كان فاحشة وساء سبيلا

translation: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except for the requirements of justice. And whoever is killed wrongfully, We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed bounds in killing. Indeed he will be aided.
interpretation: This verse prohibits taking a life unjustly. It states that Allah has forbidden killing except for a just cause, such as legal punishment or self-defense. If someone is wrongfully killed, Allah gives the heir of the victim the authority to seek legal retribution, but within limits and without exceeding bounds. The verse reassures that the one who seeks justice through legal means will be aided and supported by Allah.
orig: ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله إلا بالحق ومن قتل مظلوما فقد جعلنا لوليه سلطانا فلا يسرف في القتل إنه كان منصورا

translation: And do not approach the wealth of the orphan except with that which is best until he reaches maturity. And fulfill the covenant; indeed, the covenant will be inquired about.
interpretation: "This verse commands Muslims to protect the wealth of orphans and not misuse it until they reach maturity and are capable of managing their own affairs. It also emphasizes the importance of fulfilling covenants, agreements, and promises, as they will be held accountable for them."
orig: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم إلا بالتي هي أحسن حتى يبلغ أشده وأوفوا بالعهد إن العهد كان مسئولا

translation: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being fair and just in all dealings, particularly in commercial transactions involving measurements and weights. It instructs believers to give full and accurate measurements without any deception or cheating, and to weigh with a balanced scale that does not favor one party over the other. This promotes honesty, integrity, and fairness in society, which is considered the best and most virtuous way of conducting oneself, leading to the best outcome and results in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: وأوفوا الكيل إذا كلتم وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم ذلك خير وأحسن تأويلا

translation: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those one will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse advises against following or pursuing matters that one has no knowledge or understanding of. It emphasizes that a person will be held accountable for how they used their faculties of hearing, sight, and reasoning (the heart). One should not blindly accept or act upon things without proper knowledge or evidence, as they will ultimately be questioned about their actions and choices.
orig: ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم إن السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل أولئك كان عنه مسئولا

translation: And do not walk upon the earth exultingly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.
interpretation: This verse is advising against arrogance and pride. It warns against walking with an arrogant gait or behaving haughtily, as if one owns the earth or is superior to others. It reminds us that no matter how powerful or wealthy we may become, we can never "tear the earth apart" or "reach the mountains in height." In other words, we should remain humble and grounded, recognizing our limitations as human beings and the greatness of Allah.
orig: ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إنك لن تخرق الأرض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولا

translation: All that is evil and detestable in the sight of your Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all evil deeds, sins, and immoral actions are greatly disliked and condemned by Allah. It serves as a reminder to stay away from anything that displeases Allah and goes against His commandments. The interpretation highlights the importance of leading a righteous life and avoiding anything that is considered sinful or unethical according to the teachings of Islam.
orig: كل ذلك كان سيئه عند ربك مكروها

translation: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah (shirk), which is considered the gravest sin in Islam. The interpretation is: "The teachings mentioned previously are part of the wisdom revealed by Allah to the Prophet Muhammad. Do not set up any other deity besides Allah, for if you commit this sin of shirk, you will be thrown into Hellfire, blameworthy and rejected."
orig: ذلك مما أوحى إليك ربك من الحكمة ولا تجعل مع الله إلها آخر فتلقى في جهنم ملوما مدحورا

translation: Is it that your Lord has favored you with sons, and has taken for Himself females from among the angels? Indeed, you utter a grave saying.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan belief that the angels are daughters of God. It highlights the absurdity of ascribing female offspring to God while considering male offspring as a favor. The interpretation emphasizes that such beliefs are a "grave saying" and a grave transgression against the concept of God's transcendence and perfection.
orig: أفأصفاكم ربكم بالبنين واتخذ من الملائكة إناثا إنكم لتقولون قولا عظيما

translation: And We have indeed expounded in this Qur'an for them to take heed, but it increases them only in aversion.
interpretation: The Qur'an contains clear explanations, parables, and guidance for people to reflect upon and benefit from. However, the disbelievers' aversion towards the truth only increases when they are presented with the clear signs and evidences in the Qur'an, as their hearts are sealed against guidance due to their arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القرآن ليذكروا وما يزيدهم إلا نفورا

translation: Say, 'If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to an authority over the bearers of the Throne.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the polytheistic belief in the existence of multiple gods. It argues that if there were indeed other gods besides Allah, they would have sought to gain authority and control over the bearers of the Divine Throne, which is a symbol of supreme power and authority. However, there is only one God who is the sole possessor of all authority and dominion over the entire creation.
orig: قل لو كان معه آلهة كما يقولون إذا لابتغوا إلى ذي العرش سبيلا

translation: Glorified and Exalted is He above what they say by great sublimity.
interpretation: This verse affirms the transcendence and perfection of Allah, exalting Him above any imperfection or deficiency that the disbelievers attribute to Him. It emphasizes that Allah is far above and beyond what they falsely ascribe to Him, declaring His absolute supremacy and majesty over all creation.
orig: سبحانه وتعالى عما يقولون علوا كبيرا

translation: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the glorification of Allah by all creation. Everything in the heavens and earth, animate or inanimate, glorifies Allah in its own unique way, even though humans cannot comprehend their modes of praise. This indicates the perfection and magnificence of the Creator, Who is worthy of all praise and glory. Despite the inability of humans to fully understand the praises of creation, Allah is Forbearing and Forgiving towards their shortcomings.
orig: تسبح له السماوات السبع والأرض ومن فيهن وإن من شيء إلا يسبح بحمده ولكن لا تفقهون تسبيحهم إنه كان حليما غفورا

translation: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter, a concealed partition.
interpretation: This verse indicates that when the Prophet Muhammad recited the Qur'an, Allah placed an invisible barrier between him and the disbelievers who rejected the idea of the Hereafter. This barrier prevented them from truly understanding and benefiting from the divine message, as their hearts were sealed due to their denial of the afterlife and accountability before God.
orig: وإذا قرأت القرآن جعلنا بينك وبين الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة حجابا مستورا

translation: And We have laid over their hearts coverings lest they should understand it, and in their ears a deafness; and though thou call them to the guidance, they will never be guided, ever.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers whose hearts have been sealed by Allah due to their rejection of faith. Their spiritual insensitivity and deafness to the truth is a consequence of their own arrogance and stubbornness. No matter how clearly the guidance is presented to them, they will turn away from it out of obstinacy.
orig: وجعلنا على قلوبهم أكنة أن يفقهوه وفي آذانهم وقرا وإذا ذكرت ربك في القرآن وحده ولوا على أدبارهم نفورا

translation: We are most knowing of what they listen to when they listen to you and [of] their private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."
interpretation: Allah knows best what the disbelievers intend when they listen to the Prophet Muhammad's recitation of the Qur'an. He also knows their secret conversations when they accuse the Prophet of being under the influence of magic, instead of acknowledging the truth of his message.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يستمعون به إذ يستمعون إليك وإذ هم نجوى إذ يقول الظالمون إن تتبعون إلا رجلا مسحورا

translation: See how they strike similitudes for you, but they have gone astray, so they cannot find a way.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who make false comparisons and analogies to describe Allah. They have deviated from the truth and thus cannot find the right path. It warns against attributing human qualities to Allah, which leads to misguidance and an inability to comprehend His true nature.
orig: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الأمثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا

translation: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we really be resurrected as a new creation?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelief of those who denied the possibility of resurrection after death. They mocked the idea of their bones and decayed remains being brought back to life as new creations. The interpretation highlights their lack of faith in Allah's power to resurrect and recreate human beings on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Say, 'Be stones or iron'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a challenge to those who refuse to believe in God and His revelations. It suggests that even if they were as hard and unyielding as stones or iron, they would eventually submit to the truth and guidance of God. The verse emphasizes the power and authority of God's words, which can penetrate the hardest of hearts and minds.
orig: قل كونوا حجارة أو حديدا

translation: Or [We created] a creature of what is described to you as great within your breasts? Then they will say, 'Who can restore us?' Say, 'He who created you the first time.' Then they will display wryness towards you and say, 'When is that?' Say, 'Perhaps it will be soon.'
interpretation: This verse is addressing the disbelievers who deny the resurrection. Allah is saying that even if He created a being greater than what they can imagine, they would still question who could bring them back to life after death. The response is that the One who created them in the first place has the power to resurrect them. However, the disbelievers will be arrogant and dismissive, asking when this resurrection will occur. The reply is that it may happen sooner than they expect.
orig: أو خلقا مما يكبر في صدوركم فسيقولون من يعيدنا قل الذي فطركم أول مرة فسينغضون إليك رءوسهم ويقولون متى هو قل عسى أن يكون قريبا

translation: The Day He will call you, and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when Allah will call all people to account for their deeds. Despite the apparent length of their worldly lives, people will realize that their time on earth was in fact very short compared to the eternal life of the Hereafter. They will praise Allah for giving them the opportunity to live and be tested in this world, recognizing that their existence was fleeting and that true life lies in the everlasting realm.
orig: يوم يدعوكم فتستجيبون بحمده وتظنون إن لبثتم إلا قليلا

translation: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces discord among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.
interpretation: Allah commands His Messenger to instruct the believers to speak in a gentle and kind manner, avoiding harsh words that may provoke disputes. This is because Satan constantly tries to incite conflicts and enmity among people through offensive speech. Satan is an avowed enemy of humankind, aiming to misguide them and create divisions.
orig: وقل لعبادي يقولوا التي هي أحسن إن الشيطان ينزغ بينهم إن الشيطان كان للإنسان عدوا مبينا

translation: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you over them as a guardian.
interpretation: Allah knows the true state of your souls and intentions. If He wills, He will bestow His mercy upon you by guiding you to faith and obedience. Or if He wills, He will punish you for your disbelief and sins. The Prophet Muhammad's role is only to convey the message; he does not have authority to compel people to believe or punish them for rejecting faith.
orig: ربكم أعلم بكم إن يشأ يرحمكم أو إن يشأ يعذبكم وما أرسلناك عليهم وكيلا

translation: And your Lord is most knowing of who is in the heavens and the earth. And We have favored some of the prophets over others, and We gave David the Psalms.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's perfect knowledge and wisdom. He knows all those in the heavens and the earth, and has favored some prophets over others by granting them special favors and miracles. One such prophet favored by Allah is David, to whom He gave the Psalms, a divine scripture containing wisdom and spiritual guidance.
orig: وربك أعلم بمن في السماوات والأرض ولقد فضلنا بعض النبيين على بعض وآتينا داوود زبورا

translation: Say, "Call upon those you claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the power to remove adversity from you or to shift it [to someone else]."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to challenge the idolaters to call upon their false deities for help, as these deities have no power to remove harm or transfer it from one person to another. It emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything other than the One True God, Allah, who alone has the power to grant relief and make changes in people's circumstances.
orig: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دونه فلا يملكون كشف الضر عنكم ولا تحويلا

translation: Those are the ones who call, seeking the means to their Lord - which of them is closest? And they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Surely, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who sincerely worship Allah and strive to attain closeness to Him through various means of worship and obedience. They seek the "means" or ways to draw nearer to Allah, hoping for His mercy and fearing His punishment. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of having a balanced approach in one's relationship with Allah, combining hope for His mercy with fear of His punishment, as both are essential for maintaining a state of consciousness and humility before Him.
orig: أولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون إلى ربهم الوسيلة أيهم أقرب ويرجون رحمته ويخافون عذابه إن عذاب ربك كان محذورا

translation: And there is no town but We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Written Book.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that Allah has decreed the destruction or severe punishment of all towns and communities that persist in disbelief and disobedience before the Day of Resurrection. This is an inevitable consequence recorded in the Divine Book (the Preserved Tablet), as a manifestation of Allah's justice and wisdom. The verse serves as a warning and reminder for people to embrace faith and righteousness to avoid such a fate."
orig: وإن من قرية إلا نحن مهلكوها قبل يوم القيامة أو معذبوها عذابا شديدا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا

translation: And nothing prevented Us from sending the signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except to warn.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He did not withhold sending clear signs and miracles to previous nations except because they persisted in denying and rejecting them. As an example, He granted the people of Thamud a miraculous she-camel as a clear sign of His power, but they wrongfully killed it. Allah sends such signs not to merely amaze people, but to warn them of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience.
orig: وما منعنا أن نرسل بالآيات إلا أن كذب بها الأولون وآتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها وما نرسل بالآيات إلا تخويفا

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.
interpretation: This verse refers to the vision or dream that the Prophet Muhammad experienced during the Night Journey (al-Isra' wal-Mi'raj). Allah is telling the Prophet that this vision was a test for the people, just like the accursed tree mentioned in the Qur'an was a trial. The 'accursed tree' likely refers to the tree that was forbidden in Paradise. Despite being warned, some people still transgress and persist in their disobedience and disbelief.
orig: وإذ قلنا لك إن ربك أحاط بالناس وما جعلنا الرؤيا التي أريناك إلا فتنة للناس والشجرة الملعونة في القرآن ونخوفهم فما يزيدهم إلا طغيانا كبيرا

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate before Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, 'Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?'
interpretation: This verse describes the incident when Allah commanded the angels to prostrate before Adam as a sign of respect and obedience. All the angels obeyed except Iblees (Satan), who arrogantly refused and questioned why he should bow to a being created from clay (i.e. Adam), considering himself superior. This act of disobedience marked the beginning of Iblees' rebellion against Allah and his enmity towards mankind.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس قال أأسجد لمن خلقت طينا

translation: He (Allah) said, "What is your opinion of this one whom You have honored above me? If You give me respite until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely seize his descendants, except a few."
interpretation: This verse refers to the dialogue between Allah and Iblis (Satan) regarding Adam. Iblis expresses his intention to misguide Adam's descendants, except for those who remain steadfast in their faith and obedience to Allah. It highlights Iblis' arrogance and his determination to lead humanity astray until the Day of Judgment.
orig: قال أرأيتك هذا الذي كرمت علي لئن أخرتن إلى يوم القيامة لأحتنكن ذريته إلا قليلا

translation: He (Allah) said: "Go, and whoever follows you among them - indeed, Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that Allah has prepared for Satan and those who follow him. The interpretation is that Allah commanded Satan to go away from His mercy, and whoever follows Satan's path and obeys him, their recompense will be Hell, which is a complete and sufficient punishment for their disobedience and rejection of the truth.
orig: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فإن جهنم جزاؤكم جزاء موفورا

translation: And incite whoever you can among them with your voice and recruit against them your cavalry and your infantry and share with them in wealth and children, and promise them. But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to use all available means, including speech, military might, and wealth, to confront and challenge the disbelievers and hypocrites. However, it warns that Satan's promises to them are mere deception, leading them astray with false hopes and desires.
orig: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك وأجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم في الأموال والأولاد وعدهم وما يعدهم الشيطان إلا غرورا

translation: Verily, over My servants you have no authority, and sufficient is your Lord as a Guardian.
interpretation: Allah is saying that Shaytan (Satan) has no power or authority over the true servants of Allah who are obedient to Him. Allah Himself is sufficient as a Protector and Helper for the believers against the evil plots and deceptions of Shaytan.
orig: إن عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان وكفى بربك وكيلا

translation: Your Lord is He Who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His Bounty. Truly, He is Ever Most Merciful towards you.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and bounties upon humankind. By enabling ships to sail through the seas, Allah facilitates trade and travel, allowing people to seek His provisions and blessings from different parts of the world. It reminds us to be grateful for Allah's favors and to recognize His compassion towards His creation.
orig: ربكم الذي يزجي لكم الفلك في البحر لتبتغوا من فضله إنه كان بكم رحيما

translation: And when harm touches you at sea, those that you call upon besides Him are lost. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.
interpretation: "When people are faced with difficulties and hardships at sea, they sincerely call upon Allah alone for help and salvation, forgetting all false deities they used to worship. However, when Allah delivers them safely to land, they turn away from Him and become ungrateful, associating others with Allah in worship."
orig: وإذا مسكم الضر في البحر ضل من تدعون إلا إياه فلما نجاكم إلى البر أعرضتم وكان الإنسان كفورا

translation: Do you feel secure that He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you, or send a storm of stones upon you? Then you will find no protector for yourselves.
interpretation: This verse warns against feeling secure from Allah's punishment. It suggests that one should not feel safe from Allah causing the earth to swallow them or sending a severe punishment upon them, leaving them with no helper or protector.
orig: أفأمنتم أن يخسف بكم جانب البر أو يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا

translation: Or do you feel secure that He will not return you to it another time and send against you a hurricane of wind and drown you for your disbelief? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us any advocate.
interpretation: Allah is warning the disbelievers not to feel secure from His punishment, as He has the power to return them to the sea and drown them with a violent storm for their disbelief. On the Day of Judgement, they will have no one to plead their case or defend them against Allah's judgment.
orig: أم أمنتم أن يعيدكم فيه تارة أخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا

translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.
interpretation: This verse highlights the honor and privilege bestowed upon human beings by Allah. It states that Allah has honored and elevated the status of the children of Adam (humankind) above much of His creation. He has provided them with the means of transportation on land and sea, sustenance from pure and wholesome provisions, and favored them with numerous blessings and abilities that distinguish them from other creatures. This indicates Allah's special mercy and grace towards human beings, as well as the immense responsibility they bear as the honored beings of creation.
orig: ولقد كرمنا بني آدم وحملناهم في البر والبحر ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا

translation: The Day We will call every people with their record, then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read it, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, each nation will be summoned with their respective prophet or leader. Those who are given their record of deeds in their right hand are the successful believers who will read their records with joy, and they will not be wronged in the slightest, not even as much as a thread inside a date seed.
orig: يوم ندعو كل أناس بإمامهم فمن أوتي كتابه بيمينه فأولئك يقرءون كتابهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا

translation: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who willfully reject the guidance of faith in this world will suffer the consequences of spiritual blindness and being misguided in the Hereafter. Their rejection of truth has deprived them of the ability to see the right path, leaving them lost and astray from Allah's way.
orig: ومن كان في هذه أعمى فهو في الآخرة أعمى وأضل سبيلا

translation: And indeed they were about to seduce you away from that which We revealed to you, that you may forge something else against Us; and then they would have taken you as a friend.
interpretation: This verse warns the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) about the attempts of the disbelievers to misguide him and make him deviate from the revelation he received from Allah. They tried to tempt him to fabricate something other than the Qur'an and attribute it to Allah. However, if he had done so, they would have accepted him as a friend and ally, indicating their true motive was to distort the pure message of Islam.
orig: وإن كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذي أوحينا إليك لتفتري علينا غيره وإذا لاتخذوك خليلا

translation: And had We not made you stand firm, you would have inclined a little towards them.
interpretation: "Had Allah not strengthened your resolve and guided you to the truth, you would have been inclined to compromise with the disbelievers and make concessions to them, even if only slightly, due to their pressure and temptations."
orig: ولولا أن ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن إليهم شيئا قليلا

translation: If We make you taste twice the life and twice the death, then you will not find for yourself against Us a helper.
interpretation: This verse is a warning from Allah to those who disbelieve and reject His signs. It implies that if Allah were to punish them twice in this life and twice in the afterlife, they would have no one to help or protect them from Allah's punishment. The "twice the life" could refer to difficulties, hardships, and afflictions faced in this worldly life, while "twice the death" could refer to the punishment in the grave and the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. The verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and authority over His creation, and the inability of anyone to escape His justice.
orig: إذا لأذقناك ضعف الحياة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا

translation: And they were almost going to provoke you to drive you out of the land. But in that case, they would not have remained after you except for a little while.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers tried their utmost to provoke the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and expel him from Makkah through persecution and harassment. However, Allah warns them that if they succeeded in driving him out, their stay in Makkah after his departure would be short-lived, as Allah would eventually destroy them for their disbelief and oppression.
orig: وإن كادوا ليستفزونك من الأرض ليخرجوك منها وإذا لا يلبثون خلافك إلا قليلا

translation: This is Our way which We have indeed followed with Our messengers before you, and you will not find any change in Our way.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah's way of dealing with His messengers and their nations is consistent and unchanging. He has established a pattern and tradition (sunnah) that He follows with all His messengers, and this sunnah will not be altered or changed. The verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad that he is treading the same path as the previous messengers, facing similar challenges and opposition from their people. It emphasizes the continuity and uniformity of Allah's guidance and His unwavering support for His messengers.
orig: سنة من قد أرسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا

translation: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night, and the recitation of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of performing the prescribed prayers at their appointed times. The "decline of the sun" refers to the afternoon prayer, while "the darkness of the night" refers to the evening prayer. The "recitation of dawn" is the morning prayer, which is described as being "witnessed" by the angels or by nature itself.
orig: أقم الصلاة لدلوك الشمس إلى غسق الليل وقرآن الفجر إن قرآن الفجر كان مشهودا

translation: And in the night, arise from sleep for Tahajjud (late-night prayer) - for you a supererogatory (prayer) so that your Lord may raise you to a praised station.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to perform the voluntary late-night prayer called Tahajjud. It suggests that by doing so, Allah may elevate the person to a praised and honorable position on the Day of Judgment. The "praised station" refers to the high rank and status that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ will attain as the leader of all humanity on that Day.
orig: ومن الليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى أن يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا

translation: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to enter a true entrance and to exit a true exit and grant me from Yourself a helping authority.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the believer to ask Allah for guidance to enter and exit all situations and affairs in a truthful and upright manner, and to seek His help and support in all matters.
orig: وقل رب أدخلني مدخل صدق وأخرجني مخرج صدق واجعل لي من لدنك سلطانا نصيرا

translation: And say, 'The truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed falsehood, by its nature, is bound to depart.'
interpretation: This verse affirms the ultimate triumph of truth over falsehood. It emphasizes that truth is eternal and victorious, while falsehood is temporary and bound to vanish. The verse encourages believers to declare and uphold the truth, as it is destined to prevail over all forms of falsehood, which are inherently weak and transient.
orig: وقل جاء الحق وزهق الباطل إن الباطل كان زهوقا

translation: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is a healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.
interpretation: This verse highlights the healing and merciful nature of the Qur'an for believers, while indicating that it only increases the loss and misguidance of those who persist in wrongdoing and disbelief. The Qur'an is a source of spiritual nourishment, guidance, and cure for the souls of those with faith, but for the arrogant and stubborn disbelievers, it serves to further their deviation and loss.
orig: وننزل من القرآن ما هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين إلا خسارا

translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and becomes distant; but when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and impatience of human beings. When Allah bestows His favors and blessings upon a person, instead of being grateful, he turns away arrogantly and distances himself from Allah. However, when faced with difficulties or harm, he becomes despondent and loses hope in Allah's mercy. This shows the weakness of human nature and the need to develop gratitude, patience, and trust in Allah during both good and bad times.
orig: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه وإذا مسه الشر كان يئوسا

translation: Say, 'Everyone works according to their way, but your Lord knows best who is truly guided.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that each person is responsible for their own actions and beliefs, and that Allah is the ultimate judge of who is rightly guided. It encourages people to focus on their own spiritual path and leave the judgment of others to Allah, who has perfect knowledge of who is following the straight path. The interpretation highlights the themes of individual accountability, divine wisdom, and humility in the face of Allah's superior knowledge.
orig: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم أعلم بمن هو أهدى سبيلا

translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, 'The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And you have not been given of knowledge except a little.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that the nature of the soul is a profound and complex matter that is known only to Allah. It is part of the realm of the unseen that humans have been granted little knowledge about. The interpretation suggests that we should be humble and acknowledge the limits of our understanding regarding metaphysical realities like the soul, and submit to Allah's infinite wisdom and knowledge.
orig: ويسألونك عن الروح قل الروح من أمر ربي وما أوتيتم من العلم إلا قليلا

translation: And if We willed, We could surely take away that which We have revealed to you, then you would find no protector for yourself against Us.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the revelation of the Qur'an and the prophethood of Muhammad are by the will and grace of Allah. It warns that if Allah willed, He could take away the revelation, leaving the Prophet without any support or helper against Allah's will. This emphasizes the absolute power and authority of Allah over His creation and the complete dependence of the Prophet and all humans on Allah's mercy and sustenance.
orig: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي أوحينا إليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا

translation: But for the mercy from your Lord. Verily, His Grace unto you is ever great.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that whatever blessings, success or good a person achieves in this life is solely by the grace and mercy of Allah. One should never become arrogant or attribute their achievements to themselves, for Allah's favor and bounties upon His servants are immense and beyond measure."
orig: إلا رحمة من ربك إن فضله كان عليك كبيرا

translation: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inimitable and miraculous nature of the Qur'an. It challenges all of humanity and the jinn (supernatural beings) to collectively attempt to produce a book like the Qur'an, but declares that they would utterly fail in doing so, even if they assisted and supported one another. This highlights the divine origin of the Qur'an and its superiority over human and jinn capabilities, as it is the Word of Allah revealed to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).
orig: قل لئن اجتمعت الإنس والجن على أن يأتوا بمثل هذا القرآن لا يأتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا

translation: And We have certainly set forth for the people in this Qur'an every kind of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.
interpretation: This verse highlights the comprehensive nature of the Qur'an, which contains various examples, parables, and lessons for humanity. However, despite the clear guidance provided, most people stubbornly reject it and persist in their disbelief and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: ولقد صرفنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل فأبى أكثر الناس إلا كفورا

translation: And they say, 'We will not believe in you until you make a spring gush forth for us from the earth.'
interpretation: The disbelievers were making unreasonable demands from the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, as proof of his prophethood. They were asking him to perform a miracle by causing a spring to gush forth from the earth, which is beyond human capability. This verse highlights their stubborn rejection of the truth and their insistence on demanding impossible signs, despite the clear evidence and proofs presented to them.
orig: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الأرض ينبوعا

translation: Or you have a garden of palm trees and grapevines and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst abundantly?
interpretation: This verse is posing a rhetorical question to the disbelievers, challenging them to create a garden with palm trees, grapevines, and rivers gushing forth abundantly, if they doubt Allah's ability to create such wonders. It highlights Allah's immense power as the Creator and emphasizes that the disbelievers cannot match His creative abilities.
orig: أو تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الأنهار خلالها تفجيرا

translation: Or you cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, as you have claimed, or you bring Allah and the angels before us face to face.
interpretation: This verse is a challenge to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from the disbelievers, demanding him to perform miracles as proof of his prophethood. They mockingly ask him to either cause the sky to fall upon them in pieces, or to bring Allah and the angels physically before them. The verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers in demanding tangible evidence, despite the clear signs and proofs already presented to them through the Qur'an and the message of Islam.
orig: أو تسقط السماء كما زعمت علينا كسفا أو تأتي بالله والملائكة قبيلا

translation: Or you have a house adorned with gold, or you ascend into the sky. And we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down for us a book that we may read. Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne l'incrédulité des mécréants envers le Prophète Mohammed. Ils exigeaient des miracles extravagants comme avoir une maison en or ou monter au ciel, sinon ils ne croiraient pas en lui. Dieu ordonne au Prophète de répondre qu'il n'est qu'un messager humain envoyé par Dieu, et que seul Dieu est digne de louange et d'adoration.
orig: أو يكون لك بيت من زخرف أو ترقى في السماء ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتابا نقرؤه قل سبحان ربي هل كنت إلا بشرا رسولا

translation: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, 'Has Allah sent a human being as a messenger?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who rejected faith when the clear guidance of Islam was presented to them. Their only objection was that the messenger sent by Allah was a human being like themselves, not an angel or a being of a higher form. This shows their flawed reasoning and lack of understanding that Allah chooses messengers from among humans so that they can relate to and guide their fellow human beings effectively.
orig: وما منع الناس أن يؤمنوا إذ جاءهم الهدى إلا أن قالوا أبعث الله بشرا رسولا

translation: Say, 'If there were angels walking on earth, We would have sent down an angel from heaven as a messenger.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of the human messengers that Allah has chosen to convey His message. If angels were meant to live on earth, then Allah would have sent an angelic messenger. However, since humans inhabit the earth, Allah has chosen human messengers who can relate to and guide their fellow humans more effectively.
orig: قل لو كان في الأرض ملائكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السماء ملكا رسولا

translation: Say, 'Sufficient is Allah as a witness between me and you. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's perfect knowledge of His servants and their actions. He is a witness to everything that happens, and nothing is hidden from Him. Therefore, one should rely on Allah's testimony rather than seeking the approval or validation of others. It also serves as a reminder to be mindful of one's actions, as Allah is fully aware of them.
orig: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم إنه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا

translation: And whomever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whomever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsided We increase for them the blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty over guidance and misguidance. Those guided by Allah are truly guided, while those misguided have no protectors besides Him. On the Day of Judgement, the misguided will be gathered blind, deaf, and mute, unable to perceive reality. Their ultimate abode is Hellfire, where the blazing fire will continually intensify whenever it temporarily subsides.
orig: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم أولياء من دونه ونحشرهم يوم القيامة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما مأواهم جهنم كلما خبت زدناهم سعيرا

translation: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, 'When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we really be resurrected as a new creation?'
interpretation: This verse is a warning and rebuke to those who denied the resurrection and life after death. They mocked the idea of being resurrected after their bones had decayed, considering it impossible. The interpretation is that their disbelief and mockery of Allah's signs and revelations will be met with a punishment or recompense on the Day of Judgment. Their denial of resurrection stems from their limited understanding and inability to comprehend Allah's infinite power to recreate them anew.
orig: ذلك جزاؤهم بأنهم كفروا بآياتنا وقالوا أإذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا أإنا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا

translation: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the like of them? And He has appointed for them a term, there is no doubt about it. Yet the wrongdoers persist in disbelief.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's power to resurrect and re-create human beings on the Day of Judgment, just as He created the heavens and the earth. It highlights that Allah has set an appointed time for the resurrection, which is certain to occur. However, the wrongdoers stubbornly reject this truth and persist in disbelief and ingratitude towards Allah's signs and revelations.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض قادر على أن يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم أجلا لا ريب فيه فأبى الظالمون إلا كفورا

translation: Say, 'If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, you would then withhold out of fear of spending. And man has ever been stingy.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that human beings are inherently stingy and would withhold spending even if they possessed the treasures of Allah's mercy, out of fear of depletion. It highlights the miserly nature of man and his lack of trust in Allah's infinite bounties.
orig: قل لو أنتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي إذا لأمسكتم خشية الإنفاق وكان الإنسان قتورا

translation: And We did certainly give Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, 'Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are effected by magic.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the nine miracles or signs that Allah gave to Prophet Moses to prove his prophethood and divine mission. It then instructs the Prophet Muhammad to ask the Children of Israel about the time when Moses came to them with these clear signs, and Pharaoh accused him of being under the influence of magic or sorcery due to his inability to comprehend or accept the truth.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى تسع آيات بينات فاسأل بني إسرائيل إذ جاءهم فقال له فرعون إني لأظنك يا موسى مسحورا

translation: He said: "Assuredly you know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent down these as enlightening eye-openers, and I think you are one utterly destroyed, O Pharaoh!"
interpretation: This verse indicates that the miracles and signs brought by Moses were clear proofs from the One True God, the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Moses is telling Pharaoh that he is clearly doomed and destroyed because of his arrogance and rejection of the truth.
orig: قال لقد علمت ما أنزل هؤلاء إلا رب السماوات والأرض بصائر وإني لأظنك يا فرعون مثبورا

translation: And he intended to drive them out of the land, but We drowned him and those with him, all together.
interpretation: Allah is describing the arrogance and tyranny of Pharaoh when he intended to persecute and expel the Children of Israel from Egypt. However, Allah punished him by drowning him and his soldiers in the sea when they pursued Moses and the Israelites. This verse highlights Allah's power to protect the oppressed and punish the oppressors.
orig: فأراد أن يستفزهم من الأرض فأغرقناه ومن معه جميعا

translation: And We said after him to the Children of Israel: 'Dwell in the land, and when the promise of the Hereafter comes, We shall bring you forth in one gathering.'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah instructed the Children of Israel to inhabit the land of Palestine after the time of Prophet Moses. However, when the Day of Resurrection arrives, Allah will gather them all together from wherever they are, regardless of their dispersed locations, to account for their deeds.
orig: وقلنا من بعده لبني إسرائيل اسكنوا الأرض فإذا جاء وعد الآخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا

translation: And with the truth We have sent it down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you except as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: Allah sent down the Qur'an with the truth, and it descended from Him with the truth. The Prophet Muhammad was sent as a bearer of good tidings for those who believe and follow the truth, and as a warner for those who disbelieve and deviate from the truth. His mission was to convey the message of guidance and the consequences of accepting or rejecting it.
orig: وبالحق أنزلناه وبالحق نزل وما أرسلناك إلا مبشرا ونذيرا

translation: And (it is) a Qur'an which We have separated (by intervals) that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.
interpretation: "The Qur'an has been revealed in portions and intervals so that you (Prophet Muhammad) can recite it to people in a measured way, allowing them to understand and follow its teachings gradually. It was sent down in stages over a period of time, rather than all at once, to facilitate its comprehension and implementation."
orig: وقرآنا فرقناه لتقرأه على الناس على مكث ونزلناه تنزيلا

translation: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,"
interpretation: This verse encourages belief in the Qur'an and affirms its divine origin. It states that those who have true knowledge from previous scriptures recognize the truth of the Qur'an when it is recited to them, causing them to prostrate out of reverence and submission to God.
orig: قل آمنوا به أو لا تؤمنوا إن الذين أوتوا العلم من قبله إذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للأذقان سجدا

translation: And they say, 'Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has ever been fulfilled.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that the believers praise and glorify Allah, acknowledging His transcendence and perfection. They affirm their belief that Allah's promises are always fulfilled, emphasizing their trust in His words and plans. The verse highlights the believers' unwavering faith in Allah's truthfulness and the certainty of His promises being realized.
orig: ويقولون سبحان ربنا إن كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا

translation: And they fall down upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility.
interpretation: This verse describes the profound humility and reverence that believers feel when they recite or listen to the verses of the Qur'an. Their reaction of falling down in prostration and weeping signifies their deep connection with the divine words and their awe-inspiring impact on their hearts and souls. This intense emotional response further intensifies their sense of humility, submission, and devotion to Allah.
orig: ويخرون للأذقان يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا

translation: Say, 'Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever you call - to Him belong the best names.' And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.
interpretation: This verse teaches us to call upon Allah using any of His beautiful names, as they all refer to the One God. It also guides us to maintain a moderate tone in our prayers, neither excessively loud nor excessively quiet, but to find a middle way that is respectful and focused.
orig: قل ادعوا الله أو ادعوا الرحمن أيا ما تدعوا فله الأسماء الحسنى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا

translation: And say, 'Praise be to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with great glorification.'
interpretation: This verse affirms the transcendence and absolute oneness of Allah. It negates any notion of Allah having offspring, partners in His sovereignty, or need for any assistant due to weakness or deficiency. It commands praising and glorifying Allah in the most exalted manner, befitting His majesty and perfection.
orig: وقل الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك ولم يكن له ولي من الذل وكبره تكبيرا

translation: Praise be to Allah, who has sent down upon His servant the Book and has not placed therein any crookedness.
interpretation: This verse praises Allah for revealing the Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) without any inconsistency, falsehood or contradiction. The Qur'an is a straight and perfect Book that guides humanity to the truth and the right path.
orig: الحمد لله الذي أنزل على عبده الكتاب ولم يجعل له عوجا

translation: A messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures. Containing upright teachings, to warn of severe punishment from Him, and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have an excellent reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad as a messenger sent by Allah to convey the divine message contained in the purified scriptures (the Qur'an). His mission was twofold: to warn people of the severe punishment that awaits those who reject the message, and to give glad tidings to the believers who perform righteous deeds, promising them an excellent reward in the Hereafter.
orig: قيما لينذر بأسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات أن لهم أجرا حسنا

translation: Abiding therein forever
interpretation: This verse indicates the eternal and everlasting nature of Paradise for the believers. It signifies that the reward and bliss promised to the righteous is not temporary or fleeting, but rather a permanent and unending state of existence in the Gardens of Paradise. This emphasizes the ultimate and infinite reward awaiting those who lead a life of faith and obedience to Allah.
orig: ماكثين فيه أبدا

translation: And [for] warning those who say, 'Allah has taken a son.'
interpretation: This verse warns against the blasphemous belief held by some that Allah has a son or offspring. This is a grave error as Allah is One, Unique, and far removed from any notion of having children or partners. The interpretation emphasizes the absolute Oneness and Transcendence of Allah, rejecting any anthropomorphic qualities attributed to Him.
orig: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا

translation: They have no knowledge of it, nor did their forefathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who make false claims or speak without knowledge, especially regarding religious matters. It condemns their lack of true understanding and their uttering of lies and falsehoods. The "grave word" refers to the grievous statements they make without any basis in truth or knowledge, stemming from their own assumptions or inherited misconceptions. The verse emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and speaking with wisdom and truthfulness.
orig: ما لهم به من علم ولا لآبائهم كبرت كلمة تخرج من أفواههم إن يقولون إلا كذبا

translation: So would you, perhaps, kill yourself with grief over their footsteps if they do not believe in this discourse?
interpretation: This verse is advising the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) not to grieve excessively or harm himself if the disbelievers refuse to accept the message of the Qur'an. It emphasizes that one should not become overly distressed by the rejection of others, as guiding them is ultimately in Allah's hands.
orig: فلعلك باخع نفسك على آثارهم إن لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث أسفا

translation: Verily, We have made that which is on the earth as an adornment for it, in order that We may test them as to which of them is best in deeds.
interpretation: Allah has made the adornments and provisions on earth for humans to utilize and appreciate, but the real purpose behind this is to test who among them is best in conduct, faith, and righteous deeds. The worldly adornments are temporary means to an end, and the true success lies in using them in obedience to Allah and striving to please Him.
orig: إنا جعلنا ما على الأرض زينة لها لنبلوهم أيهم أحسن عملا

translation: And indeed, We will make that which is on it [i.e., the earth] a barren ground.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will turn the earth into a barren and lifeless ground on the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a warning about the temporary nature of this worldly life and the inevitability of the Hereafter. The lush and fertile earth as we know it will become a desolate wasteland, devoid of any vegetation or life. This transformation emphasizes the insignificance of worldly attachments and the importance of preparing for the eternal life to come.
orig: وإنا لجاعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا

translation: Or do you think that the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription were, among Our signs, a wonderful thing?
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the young men who took refuge in a cave to escape persecution for their faith. They fell asleep for a long period, and when they awoke, they found that their beliefs had become accepted. The "Inscription" likely refers to a stone inscription that told their story. The verse suggests that their miraculous experience was one of God's signs, meant to inspire wonder and faith.
orig: أم حسبت أن أصحاب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من آياتنا عجبا

translation: When the youths retreated to the cave and said, 'Our Lord, grant us mercy from Yourself and facilitate for us our affair in right course.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the People of the Cave (Ashaab al-Kahf), who were a group of young believers who fled persecution and sought refuge in a cave. They prayed to Allah to grant them mercy and guidance in their difficult situation, showing their strong faith and reliance on Him.
orig: إذ أوى الفتية إلى الكهف فقالوا ربنا آتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من أمرنا رشدا

translation: So We cast a cover of sleep over their ears in the Cave for a number of years.
interpretation: "Allah caused them to fall into a deep slumber for many years in the Cave, in order to preserve their faith and protect them from the persecution of their people. This miraculous sleep was a means of protecting their belief and allowing them to awaken in a different era, free from oppression."
orig: فضربنا على آذانهم في الكهف سنين عددا

translation: Then We resurrected them that We might know which of the two parties would best calculate the period they had remained.
interpretation: Allah resurrected the Companions of the Cave after their long sleep to test which group, the believers or disbelievers, would better estimate the duration of their stay in the cave. This verse highlights Allah's power to resurrect the dead and test people's faith and understanding.
orig: ثم بعثناهم لنعلم أي الحزبين أحصى لما لبثوا أمدا

translation: We relate to you their story in truth. Truly they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the story of the youths mentioned is being truthfully narrated by God. These youths had faith in their Lord and were guided by Him, and He further increased their guidance and steadfastness in their belief.
orig: نحن نقص عليك نبأهم بالحق إنهم فتية آمنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى

translation: And We set a seal upon their hearts when they stood up and said: 'Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will certainly not call upon any deity besides Him, for then we would have uttered an atrocious lie.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن الله سبحانه وتعالى ربط على قلوب المشركين بسبب تكبرهم وإصرارهم على الشرك، فلم يعودوا قادرين على فهم الحقيقة واتباع الهدى. ومع ذلك، فقد اعترفوا بأن الله هو رب السماوات والأرض، وأنه لا ينبغي عليهم عبادة غيره، وإلا فسيكونون قد ارتكبوا كذبًا عظيمًا.
orig: وربطنا على قلوبهم إذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السماوات والأرض لن ندعو من دونه إلها لقد قلنا إذا شططا

translation: These are our people who have taken for worship deities other than Him. Why do they not produce a clear authority in their support? And who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the polytheists who worship deities besides Allah without any clear proof or authority from Him. It condemns those who fabricate lies against Allah by associating partners with Him in worship. The verse emphasizes that such fabrication is a grave injustice and a severe wrong.
orig: هؤلاء قومنا اتخذوا من دونه آلهة لولا يأتون عليهم بسلطان بين فمن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when you departed from your family at night, leaving them behind, to seek the cave. And your Lord inspired to the cave, 'Spread for them a part of My mercy and prepare for them from their affair facility.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the People of the Cave (Ashaab al-Kahf). When they fled from their oppressive society to seek refuge in the cave, Allah commanded the cave to make space for them and provide them with comfort and provisions from His mercy. It signifies Allah's protection and care for those who seek His refuge and turn away from disbelief and oppression.
orig: وإذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون إلا الله فأووا إلى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من أمركم مرفقا

translation: And you would have seen the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were in an open space within. That was from the signs of Allah. Whoever Allah guides is the rightly guided, but whoever He leaves astray - you will never find for him a protecting guide.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous protection Allah provided for the Companions of the Cave. The sun's rays never directly entered their cave, keeping them sheltered and safe. This phenomenon was a sign from Allah, indicating that those whom He guides are truly guided, while those whom He allows to go astray will find no one to guide them to the right path.
orig: وترى الشمس إذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين وإذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم في فجوة منه ذلك من آيات الله من يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا

translation: You would think they were awake, though they were asleep. And We turned them right and left, with their dog stretching out its forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned away from them in flight, and been filled with awe of them.
interpretation: This verse describes the miraculous state of the young men and their dog who took refuge in the cave. Although they appeared to be awake, they were in fact asleep, preserved by Allah's power. Their bodies were turned from side to side, and their dog lay with its forelegs outstretched at the entrance of the cave. The scene was so awe-inspiring that if one were to witness it, they would flee in terror, overwhelmed by the miraculous nature of the event.
orig: وتحسبهم أيقاظا وهم رقود ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال وكلبهم باسط ذراعيه بالوصيد لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا

translation: And similarly, We resurrected them so that they might question one another. A speaker among them said, 'How long have you remained [here]?' They said, 'We remained a day or part of a day.' They said, 'Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this money of yours to the city and let him look to which is the most pure food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.'
interpretation: Allah revived the People of the Cave after their long slumber so that they could engage in a discussion and question one another about the duration of their stay in the cave. One of them asked how long they had remained there, and the others replied that it seemed like a day or part of a day. They acknowledged that Allah knows best how long they had actually stayed. They decided to send one of them to the city with some money to purchase the purest food available, instructing him to be cautious and discreet, so that no one would become aware of their presence.
orig: وكذلك بعثناهم ليتساءلوا بينهم قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم قالوا ربكم أعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا أحدكم بورقكم هذه إلى المدينة فلينظر أيها أزكى طعاما فليأتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم أحدا

translation: Indeed, if they gain dominance over you, they will stone you or force you back into their religion, and you will never succeed, ever.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers of the consequences if the disbelievers gain power over them. It states that the disbelievers will persecute the believers by either stoning them to death or forcibly reverting them to their former religion of disbelief. The verse emphasizes that if this were to happen, the believers would never attain success or victory in their religious life.
orig: إنهم إن يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم أو يعيدوكم في ملتهم ولن تفلحوا إذا أبدا

translation: And similarly, We revived them so that they would know that the promise of Allah is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour, when they were disputing among themselves about their affair. They said, 'Construct a building over them; their Lord is most knowing about them.' Said those who prevailed in the matter, 'We will surely take [for worship] a masjid over them.'
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne la résurrection des gens de la caverne comme un signe de la véracité de la promesse d'Allah et de la certitude du Jour du Jugement. Malgré leur désaccord initial sur la situation, ils ont finalement décidé de construire un lieu de culte sur le site, reconnaissant que leur Seigneur connaît mieux leur histoire. Cela illustre la capacité d'Allah à accomplir des miracles et à guider les gens vers la foi.
orig: وكذلك أعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا أن وعد الله حق وأن الساعة لا ريب فيها إذ يتنازعون بينهم أمرهم فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنيانا ربهم أعلم بهم قال الذين غلبوا على أمرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا

translation: They will say, 'They were three, the fourth of them being their dog,' and they will say, 'Five, the sixth of them being their dog,' guessing at the unseen; and they will say, 'Seven, and the eighth of them was their dog.' Say, 'My Lord is most knowing of their number - none knows them except a few.' So do not argue about them except with an outward argument and do not ask about them among them anyone.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the People of the Cave, where people speculated about the number of people in the cave and their dog. The interpretation is that Allah alone knows the true number, and we should not engage in fruitless arguments or guesswork about matters that are ultimately unknown to us, except with clear evidence. The verse teaches us to avoid baseless speculation and to focus on what is certain and beneficial.
orig: سيقولون ثلاثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم قل ربي أعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم إلا قليل فلا تمار فيهم إلا مراء ظاهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم أحدا

translation: And never say of anything, 'Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,'
interpretation: This verse advises against procrastination and delaying important matters. It warns against making plans for the future without considering the will of Allah. One should not make definite statements about doing something tomorrow because no one knows what will happen in the future. The future is known only to Allah, and one's life could end before tomorrow arrives. Therefore, one should always say 'If Allah wills' when making plans for the future.
orig: ولا تقولن لشيء إني فاعل ذلك غدا

translation: But if Allah wills, and remember your Lord when you forget and say: 'It may be that my Lord will guide me to a nearer way to right conduct.'
interpretation: This verse reminds us that our success and guidance ultimately come from Allah. We should constantly seek His help, especially when we forget or stray from the right path. It encourages us to have hope in Allah's mercy and guidance, and to strive towards righteousness with humility and reliance on Him.
orig: إلا أن يشاء الله واذكر ربك إذا نسيت وقل عسى أن يهدين ربي لأقرب من هذا رشدا

translation: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years, and they added nine more.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the Companions of the Cave (Ashaab al-Kahf) mentioned in the Qur'an. It suggests that they remained in the cave for 309 years, which is a metaphorical reference to the long period they were in a state of sleep or unconsciousness.
