orig: إنما إلهكم الله الذي لا إله إلا هو وسع كل شيء علما

translation: Thus We relate to you, [O Muhammad], from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us a message.
interpretation: Allah relates to the Prophet Muhammad some of the stories of the previous prophets and nations as a reminder and lesson. The Qur'an, which was revealed to the Prophet, contains the message and teachings from Allah to guide humanity.
orig: كذلك نقص عليك من أنباء ما قد سبق وقد آتيناك من لدنا ذكرا

translation: And whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a great burden
interpretation: This verse warns those who turn away from the guidance of the Qur'an that they will bear a heavy burden of sin on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the grave consequences of rejecting or neglecting the divine message, as they will be held accountable for their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: من أعرض عنه فإنه يحمل يوم القيامة وزرا

translation: Abiding therein forever, and evil indeed will be their burden on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and disbelieve in Allah's revelations that they will abide forever in Hellfire, which is a dreadful and miserable abode. On the Day of Resurrection, their burden of sins and disbelief will be an exceedingly heavy and evil load for them to bear.
orig: خالدين فيه وساء لهم يوم القيامة حملا

translation: The Day the Horn will be blown, and We shall gather the sinners on that Day, their eyes turned dull,
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Day of Resurrection, when the Trumpet (or Horn) will be blown to signal the end of this world and the gathering of all people for judgment. The "sinners" mentioned are those who rejected faith and lived in disobedience to God. Their eyes will be "turned dull" or "bluish" with terror and regret on that awesome Day, as they face the consequences of their disbelief and misdeeds.
orig: يوم ينفخ في الصور ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا

translation: They will whisper among themselves, 'You remained not but ten (days).'
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who were in a state of unawareness or oblivion will whisper among themselves, realizing that the time they spent in that state felt like a mere ten days, even though it may have been much longer. It highlights the distorted perception of time and the transient nature of this worldly life.
orig: يتخافتون بينهم إن لبثتم إلا عشرا

translation: We know best what they say when the most devoted of them in way says, 'You have not remained but a day.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who denied the concept of resurrection and life after death. They mocked the believers, claiming that their time in the grave was just a single day, implying that they would never be resurrected. The interpretation is that Allah knows best their words and arguments, which stem from their ignorance and lack of faith in the Hereafter.
orig: نحن أعلم بما يقولون إذ يقول أمثلهم طريقة إن لبثتم إلا يوما

translation: And they ask you about the mountains, so say: 'My Lord will scatter them as scattered dust.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the immense power of Allah on the Day of Resurrection. The mountains, which seem so firm and unshakable to us, will be scattered like dust by Allah's command. This signifies that nothing is permanent except Allah, and everything will perish except His Essence. The verse highlights Allah's absolute authority and ability to transform the entire universe according to His will.
orig: ويسألونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربي نسفا

translation: So leave it [the earth] a level plain,
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a command to leave the earth in a level and smooth state, without any disturbances or upheavals. It suggests that after the events of the Day of Resurrection, the earth will be left barren and desolate, with no signs of life or activity.
orig: فيذرها قاعا صفصفا

translation: You will not see in it any crookedness or curvature.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the perfection and flawlessness of Allah's creation. It indicates that in the universe, one will not find any defect, crookedness, or unevenness. Everything has been created with utmost precision and balance by the Divine Creator.
orig: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا أمتا

translation: On that Day they will follow the Caller in whom there is no crookedness, and voices will be hushed before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear but a faint murmuring.
interpretation: "On the Day of Resurrection, everyone will follow the command of Allah without any deviation or crookedness. All voices will be lowered in humility and submission before the Most Merciful Lord. The scene will be so solemn that only faint murmuring will be heard, indicating the awe and reverence felt by all creatures in the presence of their Creator."
orig: يومئذ يتبعون الداعي لا عوج له وخشعت الأصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع إلا همسا

translation: On that Day, no intercession will avail except from the one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and approved his word.
interpretation: "On the Day of Judgment, no one's intercession or pleading on behalf of another will be accepted, except for those whom Allah the Most Merciful has granted permission and whose words He has approved. This highlights Allah's absolute authority and that no one can intercede without His consent."
orig: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفاعة إلا من أذن له الرحمن ورضي له قولا

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they do not encompass Him in knowledge.
interpretation: Allah knows everything that His creation does, whether it is in the past or the future. His knowledge encompasses all things, but the creation cannot comprehend the full extent of His knowledge.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما

translation: And faces shall turn humbly towards the Ever-Living, the Self-Subsisting, and he who was burdened with wrongdoing will have failed.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the ultimate humility and submission that all faces will show towards Allah, the Ever-Living and Self-Subsisting, on the Day of Judgment. It also warns that those who carried the burden of wrongdoing in this life will be utter failures on that Day, as their wrongdoings will not benefit them in the slightest.
orig: وعنت الوجوه للحي القيوم وقد خاب من حمل ظلما

translation: And whoever does righteous deeds, while he is a believer - no fear will there be concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse promises that those who perform righteous deeds and have faith in God will not be wronged or oppressed in any way, nor will they experience any grief or sorrow. It assures the believers that if they lead a virtuous life and remain steadfast in their faith, they will be secure from all forms of injustice, harm, and distress in this world and the Hereafter.
orig: ومن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما

translation: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid evil or it would cause them remembrance.
interpretation: The Qur'an was revealed in the Arabic language so that its message can be clearly understood by the Arabs, to whom it was initially addressed. The warnings and admonitions contained therein serve as a deterrent against evil deeds and a reminder of Allah's commands and prohibitions, in the hope that people will become God-conscious and obedient.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه قرآنا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون أو يحدث لهم ذكرا

translation: So high is Allah, the True Sovereign. And do not hasten with the Quran before its revelation is completed to you, and say, 'My Lord, increase me in knowledge.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to exalt and glorify Allah, the True King and Sovereign. It also advises him not to rush in reciting the Qur'an before the revelation is completed, as it was being gradually revealed to him. Additionally, it encourages him to supplicate to Allah to increase his knowledge and understanding.
orig: فتعالى الله الملك الحق ولا تعجل بالقرآن من قبل أن يقضى إليك وحيه وقل رب زدني علما

translation: And We had already taken a covenant from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from Adam in Paradise, commanding him not to approach a certain tree. However, Adam disobeyed this command due to forgetfulness or a lapse in determination, not out of deliberate defiance. The verse highlights that even prophets can make mistakes, but it does not diminish their status or the truth of their message. It serves as a reminder of human weakness and the importance of seeking forgiveness and remaining steadfast in faith.
orig: ولقد عهدنا إلى آدم من قبل فنسي ولم نجد له عزما

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We said to the angels, 'Prostrate before Adam,' and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He refused and was arrogant and became of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the event when Allah commanded the angels to prostrate before Adam as a sign of respect and honor for him. All the angels obeyed except Iblees (Satan), who refused out of arrogance and pride. His refusal to obey Allah's command led to his expulsion from Paradise and marked the beginning of his enmity towards humankind.
orig: وإذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لآدم فسجدوا إلا إبليس أبى

translation: Then We said: 'O Adam! Verily, this is an enemy to you and to your wife. So let him not get you both out of Paradise, so that you will be distressed.'
interpretation: Allah is warning Adam and his wife Eve against following the temptations of Satan, who is an avowed enemy trying to misguide them and cause them to be expelled from Paradise, leading to distress and hardship.
orig: فقلنا يا آدم إن هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى

translation: Indeed, you will never be hungry therein nor go unclothed
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that in Paradise, they will never experience hunger or lack of clothing. It indicates the abundant provisions and comforts that Allah has prepared for the righteous in the eternal abode of the Hereafter.
orig: إن لك ألا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى

translation: And [it is] that you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun.
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings of Paradise, indicating that the inhabitants will not experience thirst or excessive heat from the sun. It highlights the perfect and comfortable environment in Paradise, free from any discomfort or hardship.
orig: وأنك لا تظمأ فيها ولا تضحى

translation: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, 'O Adam! Shall I lead you to the tree of immortality and possession that will never deteriorate?'
interpretation: Satan tempted Adam to disobey God's command by suggesting that the forbidden tree would grant him immortality and an everlasting kingdom. This was a deceptive ploy to lure Adam into sin and cause his expulsion from Paradise.
orig: فوسوس إليه الشيطان قال يا آدم هل أدلك على شجرة الخلد وملك لا يبلى

translation: So they both ate of it, and their shame became manifest to them, and they began to cover themselves with leaves from the garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord, so he went astray.
interpretation: This verse describes the consequences of Adam and Eve's act of disobedience in eating from the forbidden tree in Paradise. Their "shame" or private parts became exposed, and they attempted to cover themselves with leaves. Adam disobeyed the command of Allah, and thus "went astray" or deviated from the right path.
orig: فأكلا منها فبدت لهما سوآتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وعصى آدم ربه فغوى

translation: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him with guidance
interpretation: This verse indicates that after Prophet Muhammad's initial encounter with revelation, Allah chose him for the noble mission of prophethood and guided him to the truth and the correct path.
orig: ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى

translation: He said: "Get you down, with enmity between yourselves. On earth will be your dwelling-place and your means of livelihood for a time."
interpretation: Allah is addressing Adam and his wife, Hawwa (Eve), after they disobeyed His command by eating from the forbidden tree. He orders them to descend from Paradise to the earth, where they will face enmity, hardship, and toil. However, Allah promises to send them guidance, and those who follow it will not go astray or become miserable. This verse highlights the consequences of disobedience, but also Allah's mercy in providing guidance for humanity.
orig: قال اهبطا منها جميعا بعضكم لبعض عدو فإما يأتينكم مني هدى فمن اتبع هداي فلا يضل ولا يشقى

translation: But whoever turns away from My reminder, for him is a depressed life, and We will raise him up blind on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse warns those who turn away from the guidance and reminders of Allah that they will face a life of hardship and difficulty in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection, they will be raised up blind, unable to see the truth or find the right path. It emphasizes the importance of heeding Allah's reminders and living according to His guidance in order to attain true contentment in this life and salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن أعرض عن ذكري فإن له معيشة ضنكا ونحشره يوم القيامة أعمى

translation: He will say, 'My Lord, why have you raised me blind, while I was sighted before?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the questioning of disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. They will question why they were resurrected blind, when they had sight in the worldly life. The interpretation is that their spiritual blindness and denial of truth in this world has rendered them blind in the Hereafter, unable to see the realities of the next life.
orig: قال رب لم حشرتني أعمى وقد كنت بصيرا

translation: Thus Our verses came to you, but you forgot them; and thus will you be forgotten today.
interpretation: This verse is a rebuke to those who neglect or disregard the signs and teachings of Allah. It suggests that just as they have forgotten or ignored the clear proofs and guidance provided to them, they too will be forgotten and disregarded on the Day of Judgment. The verse serves as a warning against complacency and heedlessness towards the divine revelations and commands.
orig: قال كذلك أتتك آياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى

translation: And thus do We recompense whoever transgressed and did not believe in the verses of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and enduring.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah rewards those who transgress and disbelieve in His signs with punishment. The torment of the Hereafter is more severe and everlasting compared to the fleeting difficulties of this world. It serves as a warning to have faith and avoid transgression to escape the severe and eternal punishment of the Afterlife.
orig: وكذلك نجزي من أسرف ولم يؤمن بآيات ربه ولعذاب الآخرة أشد وأبقى

translation: Does it not guide them how many generations We have destroyed before them, as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of understanding.
interpretation: This verse is prompting people to reflect on the fate of past nations who were destroyed for their disbelief and disobedience to God. It highlights that there are clear signs and lessons to be learned from their ruined dwellings, which should guide those with sound understanding towards faith and righteousness.
orig: أفلم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم إن في ذلك لآيات لأولي النهى

translation: And were it not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it (punishment) would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [therefore] a specified term [decreed].
interpretation: This verse indicates that if not for Allah's prior decree to delay punishment, it would have been obligatory and immediate for those who disbelieved and committed sins. However, Allah has given them a respite and appointed a specific term, which is the Day of Resurrection, when they will face the consequences of their actions. This shows Allah's mercy in giving people a chance to repent and mend their ways before the inevitable reckoning.
orig: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما وأجل مسمى

translation: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the edges of the day, that you might be satisfied.
interpretation: This verse encourages patience and steadfastness in the face of opposition and mockery from the disbelievers. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to remain patient and continue praising and glorifying Allah at different times of the day and night. The frequent remembrance of Allah and seeking His pleasure is presented as a means of finding contentment and satisfaction amidst difficulties.
orig: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ومن آناء الليل فسبح وأطراف النهار لعلك ترضى

translation: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [merely] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.
interpretation: This verse warns against envying the worldly pleasures and luxuries enjoyed by some people. These are temporary delights given as a test from Allah. One should not be deceived by them, for the everlasting reward from Allah is far greater and more valuable.
orig: ولا تمدن عينيك إلى ما متعنا به أزواجا منهم زهرة الحياة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ورزق ربك خير وأبقى

translation: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be patient over it. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteous fear.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to establish the practice of prayer among his family and followers, and to persevere in performing it consistently. It also reassures him that Allah is the Provider, and that the ultimate success and favorable outcome belongs to those who have taqwa (consciousness of Allah and righteous conduct).
orig: وأمر أهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها لا نسألك رزقا نحن نرزقك والعاقبة للتقوى

translation: And they say, 'Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?' Has there not come to them clear evidence of what was in the former scriptures?
interpretation: The disbelievers are demanding a miracle from the Prophet Muhammad as proof of his prophethood, even though the clear signs and evidence of his truthfulness are present in the previous scriptures like the Torah and the Gospel. This verse highlights their stubbornness and rejection of the truth despite the availability of clear proofs.
orig: وقالوا لولا يأتينا بآية من ربه أولم تأتهم بينة ما في الصحف الأولى

translation: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before it, they would have said, 'Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of sending messengers and revelations from God before inflicting punishment. It suggests that if God were to punish people without first sending them guidance through messengers, they would question why they were not given a chance to follow the right path and avoid humiliation. The verse implies God's mercy and justice in providing guidance before holding people accountable.
orig: ولو أنا أهلكناهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا أرسلت إلينا رسولا فنتبع آياتك من قبل أن نذل ونخزى

translation: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am among the waiting ones with you. Then you will know who are the companions of the Sound Path and who is guided."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to tell the disbelievers who were mocking and doubting him to wait and see what happens, as he is also waiting patiently. It promises that in the end, it will become clear who was truly guided on the Straight Path and who was misguided.
orig: قل كل متربص فتربصوا فستعلمون من أصحاب الصراط السوي ومن اهتدى

translation: Their reckoning has drawn near for the people, yet they turn away in heedlessness.
interpretation: This verse warns that the Day of Judgment is approaching, when all people will be held accountable for their deeds. However, they remain heedless and turn away from this reality, being preoccupied with the temporary pleasures of this worldly life.
orig: اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون

translation: No fresh reminder comes to them from their Lord, but they listen to it while they are at play
interpretation: This verse is highlighting the heedless and indifferent attitude of the disbelievers towards the revelations and reminders from Allah. They do not pay serious attention or reflect upon the divine teachings, instead treating them as mere entertainment or amusement while they remain engrossed in their vain pursuits and worldly pleasures.
orig: ما يأتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث إلا استمعوه وهم يلعبون

translation: Those who have wronged themselves say, 'Are these [believers] except human beings like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of its falsehood]?'
interpretation: The disbelievers are mocking the believers by saying that they are just ordinary human beings like themselves, so how could they believe in the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They accuse the believers of being deluded by magic, even though they are fully aware that it is the truth from God.
orig: لاهية قلوبهم وأسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا إلا بشر مثلكم أفتأتون السحر وأنتم تبصرون

translation: My Lord knows what is said in the heaven and the earth, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge of everything that occurs in the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes His attribute of being All-Hearing, meaning that He hears all sounds and statements uttered by His creation. Additionally, He is described as All-Knowing, indicating that nothing is hidden from His knowledge, and He encompasses everything with His infinite wisdom and understanding.
orig: قال ربي يعلم القول في السماء والأرض وهو السميع العليم

translation: Nay, they say: 'Muddled dreams! Nay, he has but forged it! Nay, he is but a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!'
interpretation: The disbelievers mocked the Qur'an and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), dismissing it as mere confused dreams or fabrications. They accused him of being a poet rather than a Prophet. They demanded that he bring a miracle like those given to previous Prophets, stubbornly rejecting the Qur'an itself as a divine miracle.
orig: بل قالوا أضغاث أحلام بل افتراه بل هو شاعر فليأتنا بآية كما أرسل الأولون

translation: There was no town that believed before them, which We destroyed. Then will they believe?
interpretation: Allah is questioning the disbelievers' stubbornness in rejecting faith despite witnessing the consequences of previous nations who denied the truth. He is emphasizing that their refusal to believe will not prevent the inevitable punishment, just as it did not prevent the destruction of the disbelieving nations before them.
orig: ما آمنت قبلهم من قرية أهلكناها أفهم يؤمنون

translation: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.
interpretation: Allah is saying that all the Messengers sent before Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) were human beings who received revelation from Allah. If the people have any doubts about the truth of the Qur'an or the prophethood of Muhammad, they should consult the scholars of the previous scriptures who have knowledge of the signs of a true Prophet mentioned in their books.
orig: وما أرسلنا قبلك إلا رجالا نوحي إليهم فاسألوا أهل الذكر إن كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And We did not make them bodies not eating food, nor were they immortal.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He did not create human beings as inanimate objects that do not require nourishment, nor did He make them eternal and everlasting in this world. Instead, humans are mortal beings who need sustenance to survive, which highlights their dependence on their Creator and the temporary nature of their existence in this world.
orig: وما جعلناهم جسدا لا يأكلون الطعام وما كانوا خالدين

translation: Then We fulfilled to them the promise, and We saved them and whomever We willed, and We destroyed the transgressors.
interpretation: Allah fulfilled His promise to the believers by granting them victory and saving them from their enemies. He also destroyed those who transgressed and rejected faith, as a punishment for their arrogance and disbelief.
orig: ثم صدقناهم الوعد فأنجيناهم ومن نشاء وأهلكنا المسرفين

translation: We have indeed sent down to you a Book in which is a reminder for you. Will you not then understand?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad and the believers, reminding them that the Qur'an has been revealed as a source of guidance and reminder. It encourages them to ponder upon its teachings and strive to understand its profound wisdom, which will lead them to the right path and elevate their spiritual and moral consciousness. The verse emphasizes the importance of using one's intellect and reasoning to comprehend the divine revelations contained within the Qur'an.
orig: لقد أنزلنا إليكم كتابا فيه ذكركم أفلا تعقلون

translation: And how many a city was insolent that We destroyed, and We produced after it another people.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and justice. He destroyed many towns and civilizations that persisted in wrongdoing and oppression. After their destruction, Allah replaced them with new peoples who were more righteous and obedient to His commands. It serves as a warning against arrogance, injustice, and defiance of divine laws, as well as a reminder of Allah's ability to raise or lower nations as He wills.
orig: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وأنشأنا بعدها قوما آخرين

translation: But when they perceived Our punishment, behold, they began to flee from it.
interpretation: "When the disbelievers witnessed the punishment and torment from Allah, they tried to flee and escape from it in panic and despair, but it was too late for them to find refuge or salvation."
orig: فلما أحسوا بأسنا إذا هم منها يركضون

translation: Do not run, and return to what you were indulged in and your dwellings, so that you may be questioned.
interpretation: "This verse is a metaphorical warning against blindly following desires and luxuries of this worldly life. It advises people to reflect on their actions and return to the path of righteousness, so that they may be held accountable for their choices on the Day of Judgment."
orig: لا تركضوا وارجعوا إلى ما أترفتم فيه ومساكنكم لعلكم تسألون

translation: They will say: 'Woe to us! We were indeed wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse describes the remorseful state of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they realize their grave error in rejecting faith and the truth. They will lament their wrongdoing and oppression against themselves by denying the clear signs and revelations sent by Allah. Their regret will be profound, but it will be too late to change their fate.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: Yet they ceased not to advance that cry until We made them as a reaped crop, extinguished.
interpretation: This verse refers to the persistent rejection and mockery of the disbelievers towards the message of the Prophet. Despite repeated warnings, they continued in their defiance until Allah punished them by destroying them completely, likening them to a harvested crop that has been rendered lifeless and void of any spirit or existence.
orig: فما زالت تلك دعواهم حتى جعلناهم حصيدا خامدين

translation: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between them in play.
interpretation: Allah did not create the universe without purpose or wisdom. The creation of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between is not a frivolous act or mere play. It has profound meaning and wisdom behind it, which points to the Greatness, Power, and Wisdom of the Creator.
orig: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: If We had intended to take a pastime, We could have taken it from Ourselves, if We were to do so.
interpretation: إن كان الله سبحانه وتعالى قد أراد أن يتخذ لهوًا أو لعبًا، لاتخذه من عنده ومن ذاته العلية، وليس من مخلوقاته؛ لأنه المنزه عن كل نقص وعيب، ولا يليق به إلا الكمال المطلق. فإذا كان الله عز وجل لا يتخذ لهوًا من مخلوقاته، فكيف يكون القرآن الكريم لهوًا وهو كلام الله المنزل على رسوله محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم؟ إن القرآن هو الهدى والنور للبشرية، وليس لهوًا أو لعبًا.
orig: لو أردنا أن نتخذ لهوا لاتخذناه من لدنا إن كنا فاعلين

translation: Nay, We cast the truth against the falsehood, so it crushes it, and lo! it vanishes away. And woe unto you for that you utter.
interpretation: Rather, We hurl the truth against falsehood, and the truth utterly destroys falsehood. Falsehood vanishes completely when confronted by the truth. And you will be punished for the false descriptions and claims you make about Allah.
orig: بل نقذف بالحق على الباطل فيدمغه فإذا هو زاهق ولكم الويل مما تصفون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor are they tired.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over all beings in the heavens and the earth. It highlights that those closest to Him, such as the angels, are not arrogant or disdainful towards worshipping Him, nor do they ever grow weary or tired of their worship and servitude to Allah. This underscores the unwavering devotion and humility of the beings nearest to Allah, and serves as a lesson for humans to emulate their example in worshipping the Almighty without arrogance or laziness.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون

translation: They glorify (Allah) night and day, they never slacken.
interpretation: This verse indicates the constant and unwavering praise and glorification of Allah by His creation, whether it is night or day. It emphasizes the continuous nature of their worship and obedience, without any lapse or break. The verse serves as a reminder for believers to follow the example of Allah's creation and maintain a state of constant remembrance and glorification of the Almighty.
orig: يسبحون الليل والنهار لا يفترون

translation: Or have they taken gods from the earth who resurrect?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief in taking gods other than Allah from among created beings on earth, who have no power to resurrect or give life. It criticizes their irrational belief in worshipping powerless entities instead of the One True God, Allah, who is the sole Creator and Sustainer of all life.
orig: أم اتخذوا آلهة من الأرض هم ينشرون

translation: If there were gods besides Allah in the heavens and the earth, they would have been ruined. So glory be to Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and refutes the existence of any other deities besides Him. It states that if there were other gods besides Allah in the heavens and the earth, the entire universe would have been corrupted and thrown into chaos due to conflicting wills and powers. However, the perfect order and harmony in the universe testifies to the absolute Oneness of Allah, the Lord of the mighty Throne, and His transcendence above all the false attributes that are ascribed to Him.
orig: لو كان فيهما آلهة إلا الله لفسدتا فسبحان الله رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty and authority of Allah. He is not accountable to anyone for His actions, as He is the Supreme Creator and Sustainer of all that exists. However, human beings will be held accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. This highlights the importance of submitting to Allah's will and living according to His commands.
orig: لا يسأل عما يفعل وهم يسألون

translation: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, "Bring your proof. This is the reminder for those with me and those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.
interpretation: Allah is questioning whether the disbelievers have taken other gods besides Him. He challenges them to bring forth their proof or evidence for doing so. The Qur'an is a reminder and guidance not only for the Prophet Muhammad but also for the previous prophets and their followers. However, most people do not recognize the truth due to their ignorance, and thus they turn away from it.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دونه آلهة قل هاتوا برهانكم هذا ذكر من معي وذكر من قبلي بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق فهم معرضون

translation: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of Islamic monotheism (tawheed) that was conveyed by all Prophets sent by Allah. It affirms that Allah alone is worthy of worship and that all Messengers were commanded to call people to the sincere worship of the One True God, rejecting all forms of polytheism or idol-worship.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول إلا نوحي إليه أنه لا إله إلا أنا فاعبدون

translation: And they say, 'The Most Merciful has taken a son.' Exalted is He! They are but honored servants.
interpretation: This verse refutes the blasphemous claim that God has a son. It emphasizes God's transcendence and affirms that He is far above such anthropomorphic concepts. The beings referred to as 'honored servants' are the angels, who are God's obedient servants and not His offspring.
orig: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا سبحانه بل عباد مكرمون

translation: They cannot outstrip Him in speech, and they act according to His command.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's supreme authority and power over all creation. No one can surpass or precede Allah in words or actions. All beings act according to His will and command, as He is the sole Sovereign and Controller of the universe. It highlights the submission of all creatures to the Divine will and their inability to act independently of Allah's decree.
orig: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بأمره يعملون

translation: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede except for whom He approves, and they, from His fear, are apprehensive.
interpretation: Allah knows all the deeds and intentions of His creation, whether past or future. No one can intercede on behalf of another except by Allah's permission. The angels, who are constantly engaged in worship and obedience to Allah, are in awe of His Majesty and fear His punishment for disobedience.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون إلا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون

translation: And whoever of them says, 'Indeed, I am a god besides Him' - that one We will recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns against the grave sin of claiming divinity or associating partners with Allah. It states that whoever from among the disbelievers claims to be a god besides Allah, they will be punished with Hellfire. This is the recompense for wrongdoers who transgress by committing shirk (associating others with Allah in His divinity).
orig: ومن يقل منهم إني إله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم كذلك نجزي الظالمين

translation: Have not those who disbelieved known that the heavens and the earth were joined together as one united piece, then We parted them? And We have made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
interpretation: This verse highlights two of Allah's great signs: the creation of the heavens and the earth from a single entity, and the creation of all living beings from water. It invites the disbelievers to reflect on these marvels and believe in the Oneness of Allah, the Almighty Creator. The precise details of how the heavens and the earth were "parted" are not specified, but the verse affirms Allah's power to create the universe in a way that should lead people to faith.
orig: أولم ير الذين كفروا أن السماوات والأرض كانتا رتقا ففتقناهما وجعلنا من الماء كل شيء حي أفلا يؤمنون

translation: And We have placed on the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with them, and We made therein broad pathways that haply they may be guided.
interpretation: Allah mentions His power and wisdom in creating firm mountains on earth to stabilize it and prevent it from shaking excessively. He also created pathways and routes for people to travel and be guided to their destinations and purposes in life.
orig: وجعلنا في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We have made the heaven a preserved roof, yet they turn away from its signs.
interpretation: Allah menciptakan langit sebagai pelindung yang terpelihara dan terjaga dari segala yang membahayakan. Namun, orang-orang kafir mengingkari dan berpaling dari tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah yang terdapat di alam semesta, termasuk langit yang agung ini.
orig: وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا وهم عن آياتها معرضون

translation: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon, each traveling in an orbit.
interpretation: This verse highlights the perfect order and harmony in God's creation. The alternation of night and day, as well as the movement of the sun and moon in their respective orbits, are all part of God's intricate design. It serves as a reminder of His supreme power and wisdom in orchestrating the cosmic system with precision and purpose.
orig: وهو الذي خلق الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر كل في فلك يسبحون

translation: And We did not grant immortality to any human being before you; so if you die, would they then be immortal?
interpretation: Allah is emphasizing that all human beings, including the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), are mortal and will eventually die. This verse refutes the notion that the Prophet or any other human being will live forever in this world. It highlights the temporary nature of human existence and that true eternal life lies in the Hereafter. The verse serves as a reminder of our ultimate fate and the need to prepare for the everlasting life to come.
orig: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد أفإن مت فهم الخالدون

translation: Every soul shall taste death, and We will try you with evil and with good, for a trial. And unto Us you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death for all living beings, and that Allah tests people with both hardships and blessings to evaluate their faith and patience. Ultimately, everyone will return to Allah for judgment on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة وإلينا ترجعون

translation: And when those who disbelieve see you, they treat you not except with ridicule, [saying], 'Is this the one who insults your gods?' And they are disbelievers in the mention of the Most Merciful.
interpretation: "Those who disbelieve mock the Prophet and the believers for worshipping the One True God, instead of their false deities. They ridicule the idea of abandoning the worship of idols in favor of the worship of the Most Merciful, the One True God. Their disbelief stems from their arrogance and stubbornness."
orig: وإذا رآك الذين كفروا إن يتخذونك إلا هزوا أهذا الذي يذكر آلهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كافرون

translation: Man is created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not be impatient.
interpretation: This verse indicates that human beings are naturally inclined towards impatience and haste, seeking immediate gratification. However, Allah reminds us to be patient and not demand to see His signs and proofs immediately, for He will reveal them in due time according to His wisdom.
orig: خلق الإنسان من عجل سأريكم آياتي فلا تستعجلون

translation: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking and challenging the Prophet Muhammad and the believers about the promise of the Day of Resurrection and the punishment for those who reject faith. They are questioning the truthfulness of this promised event, demanding evidence or a specific time for when it will occur. The interpretation highlights their arrogant denial and demand for immediate fulfillment of the warning, despite the clear signs and evidence presented to them.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: If only those who disbelieved knew, [they would panic and wish to avoid] the time when they will not be able to prevent the Fire from their faces or from their backs, and they will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the terrifying reality of the Hereafter when they will face the punishment of Hellfire. It emphasizes that on that Day, they will have no means to protect themselves from the Fire, neither from their faces nor their backs. They will be completely helpless and unable to find any assistance or refuge from the torment. This serves as a stern warning for them to reflect upon their disbelief and turn towards faith before it is too late.
orig: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون

translation: Nay, it will come upon them suddenly and stupefy them, and they will have no power to avert it, nor will they have respite.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the Day of Resurrection or the punishment of Allah will come unexpectedly upon the disbelievers, leaving them stunned and unable to repel it or delay it for a moment. They will be caught completely unaware and powerless against the overwhelming reality of the Hereafter.
orig: بل تأتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون

translation: And certainly were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse reminds the Prophet Muhammad that he is not the first messenger to be mocked or ridiculed by his people. Many messengers before him faced similar rejection and mockery from their nations. However, the verse warns that those who mocked the previous messengers were ultimately overtaken by the very punishment or calamity that they used to mock and make fun of. This serves as a lesson that rejecting God's messengers and making fun of their message leads to severe consequences.
orig: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Say: 'Who can protect you from the Lord of Mercy by night and by day?' But they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.
interpretation: This verse questions those who disbelieve in Allah and associate partners with Him, asking who can protect them from Allah's punishment night and day. It implies that no one can protect them except Allah, yet they turn away from remembering and worshipping Him alone. The verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and sovereignty, and the futility of seeking protection from anyone or anything besides Him.
orig: قل من يكلؤكم بالليل والنهار من الرحمن بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون

translation: Or have they gods that prevent them from Our punishment? They cannot help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.
interpretation: This verse questions the belief of the idolaters in their false gods. It implies that these gods have no power to protect them from Allah's punishment or help themselves or their worshippers. They are utterly helpless and cannot accompany their worshippers or benefit them in any way.
orig: أم لهم آلهة تمنعهم من دوننا لا يستطيعون نصر أنفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون

translation: Nay, We have allowed these and their fathers to enjoy life for a long time. Do they not see that We are gradually reducing the land from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will overcome?
interpretation: Allah is stating that He has allowed the disbelievers and their forefathers to live long lives and enjoy the worldly pleasures, yet they remain ungrateful. He is warning them that He is gradually conquering and taking away the lands they inhabit, reducing their territories from the outlying borders. The verse implies that despite their arrogance, they will not be able to overcome Allah's power and decree.
orig: بل متعنا هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى طال عليهم العمر أفلا يرون أنا نأتي الأرض ننقصها من أطرافها أفهم الغالبون

translation: Say, 'I only warn you by revelation.' But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are not warned.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to convey to the people that he is merely a warner, delivering the message revealed to him through divine revelation. However, those who are spiritually deaf and unwilling to listen will not benefit from this warning, just as a physically deaf person cannot hear a call directed at them.
orig: قل إنما أنذركم بالوحي ولا يسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ما ينذرون

translation: And if a whiff of the punishment of your Lord were to touch them, they would surely say, 'O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse warns that if the disbelievers were to experience even a slight portion of Allah's punishment, they would lament and admit to their wrongdoing. It highlights their arrogance in denying Allah's signs and warnings until they face the consequences of their actions. The verse serves as a reminder of the reality of divine punishment and the importance of repentance and faith before it is too late.
orig: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يا ويلنا إنا كنا ظالمين

translation: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be wronged at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's perfect justice on the Day of Judgment. The "scales of justice" symbolize the precise and fair reckoning of each person's deeds. No soul will be wronged in the slightest, even by an amount as small as a mustard seed. Allah will take into account every single action, no matter how insignificant it may seem. His record-keeping is flawless, and He is sufficient as the Ultimate Judge and Accountant.
orig: ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا وإن كان مثقال حبة من خردل أتينا بها وكفى بنا حاسبين

translation: And We certainly gave Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous,
interpretation: This verse refers to the revelation given to Moses and Aaron, which served as a "criterion" (al-Furqan) to distinguish truth from falsehood, a "light" to guide them, and a "reminder" for those who fear Allah and strive to obey Him. It highlights the divine guidance and wisdom bestowed upon these two great prophets to lead their people towards righteousness.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى وهارون الفرقان وضياء وذكرا للمتقين

translation: Those who fear their Lord inwardly, and they are apprehensive of the Hour.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have a sincere fear and reverence for Allah in their hearts, even when no one is watching them. They are conscious of Allah's presence and watchful over their actions. Additionally, they have a sense of awe and apprehension regarding the Day of Resurrection, motivating them to prepare for it through righteous deeds and avoiding sins.
orig: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون

translation: And this is a blessed Reminder (the Qur'an) which We have sent down, will you then deny it?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine origin and significance of the Qur'an. It is described as a "blessed Reminder" that has been revealed by Allah. The rhetorical question at the end, "will you then deny it?", challenges the disbelievers and urges them to reflect upon the truth and guidance contained within the Qur'an instead of rejecting it.
orig: وهذا ذكر مبارك أنزلناه أفأنتم له منكرون

translation: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were Aware of him.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah had bestowed upon Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him) the ability to reason and make sound judgments from an early age. Allah was fully aware of Abraham's potential and guided him towards the right path. The phrase "his sound judgement" (rushdahu) implies that Allah blessed Abraham with wisdom, understanding, and the capacity to discern truth from falsehood. This allowed him to recognize the futility of idol worship and eventually embrace the belief in the One True God.
orig: ولقد آتينا إبراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What are these statues to which you are devoted?'
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) questioning the practice of idol worship among his people. He challenged the belief system of his father and community, who were devoted to worshipping statues and idols. Ibrahim's questioning aimed to make them realize the futility of their idolatrous beliefs and practices.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التي أنتم لها عاكفون

translation: They said, 'We found our fathers worshipping it.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that the verse refers to the people who blindly followed the traditions and practices of their forefathers without questioning or seeking the truth. They justify their idolatry and worship of false deities by claiming that their ancestors did the same, indicating their unwillingness to accept the message of monotheism and their stubbornness in clinging to their inherited beliefs and customs.
orig: قالوا وجدنا آباءنا لها عابدين

translation: He said, 'You and your forefathers were clearly misguided.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people being addressed, along with their ancestors, had been living in a state of clear misguidance or error, deviating from the true path and guidance of God. It implies that they had been following incorrect beliefs and practices that were contrary to the teachings of the divine revelation.
orig: قال لقد كنتم أنتم وآباؤكم في ضلال مبين

translation: They said, 'Have you come to us with the truth, or are you one of the jesters?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking and questioning the truthfulness of the Prophet Muhammad's message. They are casting doubt on whether he has brought the truth from God or if he is simply jesting and playing games with them. This reflects their arrogance and unwillingness to accept the message, despite the clear proofs and evidence presented to them.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا بالحق أم أنت من اللاعبين

translation: He said: "Nay, but your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them, and I am one of the witnesses thereof."
interpretation: "This verse affirms the Oneness of God as the Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth. The Prophet is called upon as a witness to testify to this fundamental truth of Tawheed (Oneness of God), which is the essence of Islam."
orig: قال بل ربكم رب السماوات والأرض الذي فطرهن وأنا على ذلكم من الشاهدين

translation: By Allah, I will certainly plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away.
interpretation: This verse conveys the firm determination of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to abolish idol worship and false deities after the disbelievers have departed. It signifies his unwavering resolve to eradicate polytheism and establish the worship of the One True God, even in the face of opposition and after the departure of his adversaries. The verse highlights the Prophet's commitment to fulfilling his mission of guiding people towards monotheism and the rejection of all forms of idolatry.
orig: وتالله لأكيدن أصنامكم بعد أن تولوا مدبرين

translation: So He made them like the trampled straw-remnants, except an old [date palm] stump, [leaving it] as a sign for them.
interpretation: Allah destroyed the people of Lut by raining down stones upon them, leaving nothing but the remnants of their homes and a withered old palm trunk as a lesson and warning for those who would come after them. This verse serves as a reminder of Allah's severe punishment for those who persist in sinful behavior and disobedience, and His mercy in leaving signs as guidance for others to take heed.
orig: فجعلهم جذاذا إلا كبيرا لهم لعلهم إليه يرجعون

translation: They said: 'Who has done this to our gods? He is indeed one of the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) broke the idols worshipped by his people, except for the biggest one. When the people returned and saw their idols destroyed, they were outraged and accused the perpetrator of being a wrongdoer. The verse highlights the ignorance and blindness of the idol-worshippers, who attributed partners to Allah and considered the breaking of lifeless idols as a grave offense.
orig: قالوا من فعل هذا بآلهتنا إنه لمن الظالمين

translation: They said, 'We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people of Abraham's time had heard of a young man named Abraham who was spreading a message that challenged their idolatrous beliefs and practices. The interpretation implies that Abraham's teachings were gaining attention and recognition, even though they went against the prevailing norms of his society.
orig: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له إبراهيم

translation: They said, 'Then bring him before the people's eyes, so that they may witness.'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a demand from the disbelievers to present clear and public evidence for the truth of the Prophet's message. They challenged him to perform a miracle in front of everyone, so that they could witness it themselves and be convinced of his prophethood. However, the Qur'an emphasizes that even if such miracles were performed, those who reject faith would still find excuses not to believe.
orig: قالوا فأتوا به على أعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون

translation: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident where Prophet Abraham destroyed the idols worshipped by his people. After smashing the idols, the people confronted him, accusing him of being the one responsible for this act against their deities. The verse highlights the confrontation between the truth of monotheism and the falsehood of idolatry.
orig: قالوا أأنت فعلت هذا بآلهتنا يا إبراهيم

translation: He said: 'Nay, this was done by this one, the biggest of them. So ask them, if they can speak.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) broke the idols worshipped by his people, except for the biggest one. When the people questioned him about it, he replied sarcastically, suggesting that they ask the biggest idol who broke the others, if it could speak. This was to expose the futility of worshipping idols that cannot speak, hear, or benefit anyone.
orig: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فاسألوهم إن كانوا ينطقون

translation: Then they turned to themselves and said, 'Indeed, you yourselves are the wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people realized their own wrongdoing and injustice after reflecting upon their actions. They acknowledged their mistakes and took responsibility for their transgressions, recognizing that they were the ones who had committed wrongs.
orig: فرجعوا إلى أنفسهم فقالوا إنكم أنتم الظالمون

translation: Then they hung their heads in shame. You have indeed known what these (idols) never speak.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of idol worship. When confronted with the truth, the idolaters had no response and hung their heads in shame, realizing that their idols were inanimate objects incapable of speech or comprehension. The verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, was fully aware that these idols could not speak or communicate, highlighting the absurdity of worshipping them.
orig: ثم نكسوا على رءوسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلاء ينطقون

translation: He said, 'Do you worship besides Allah that which does not benefit you at all nor harm you?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything besides Allah, as such objects or idols have no power to benefit or harm anyone. It calls people to abandon the worship of false deities and direct their worship solely to Allah, the true God who has complete control over benefit and harm.
orig: قال أفتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيئا ولا يضركم

translation: Fie upon you and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of idolatry and worshipping anything other than Allah. It criticizes the polytheists for their lack of reason and understanding in associating partners with Allah in worship, which goes against logic and common sense.
orig: أف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله أفلا تعقلون

translation: They said, 'Burn him and support your gods, if you are to act.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident where the disbelievers of Makkah decided to burn the Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) alive for rejecting their idols and calling people to worship the One True God. It highlights their arrogance and stubbornness in clinging to their false deities, challenging Ibrahim to see if his God would save him from the fire they intended to throw him into. The interpretation emphasizes the determination of the disbelievers to punish and eliminate those who opposed their polytheistic beliefs and practices.
orig: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا آلهتكم إن كنتم فاعلين

translation: We said, 'O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham.'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Prophet Abraham was thrown into a blazing fire by the oppressive ruler Nimrod for refusing to worship idols, but Allah commanded the fire to be cool and harmless for Abraham. It is a miracle that demonstrates Allah's power to protect and save His obedient servants from harm.
orig: قلنا يا نار كوني بردا وسلاما على إبراهيم

translation: And they intended for him a plot, but We made them the greatest losers
interpretation: This verse refers to the plot devised by the brothers of Prophet Yusuf (Joseph) against him out of jealousy and ill intentions. However, Allah protected Yusuf and turned their scheme against them, making them the ultimate losers in this situation. It teaches that when people conspire against the righteous with evil intentions, Allah will ultimately frustrate their plans and cause their schemes to backfire upon themselves.
orig: وأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأخسرين

translation: And We delivered him and Lot (and directed them) to the land which We had blessed for the 'Alamin (mankind and jinns).
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's deliverance of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and Prophet Lut (Lot) from the oppressive people who rejected their message and tried to harm them. Allah guided them to the blessed land of Palestine, which He had favored with abundant blessings for the worlds, meaning for all of mankind and the jinns. This land holds great significance as it was the land where many Prophets were sent, and it was blessed with fertile soil, resources, and the revelation of divine scriptures.
orig: ونجيناه ولوطا إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها للعالمين

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We made both of them righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that God bestowed upon Prophet Abraham two sons, Isaac and Jacob, as an additional gift and favor. It also states that God made both of them righteous and guided them to the straight path. This emphasizes that righteousness and guidance are blessings from God, and He bestows them upon whomever He wills from among His servants.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب نافلة وكلا جعلنا صالحين

translation: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command, and We revealed to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah. And they were worshippers of Us.
interpretation: Allah made the prophets and righteous people leaders who guided others by His command and revelation. He inspired them to do good deeds, establish regular prayers, and pay the obligatory charity (zakah). They were devoted servants who worshipped Allah alone.
orig: وجعلناهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا وأوحينا إليهم فعل الخيرات وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة وكانوا لنا عابدين

translation: And to Lot, We gave him judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the story of Prophet Lut (Lot) and how Allah bestowed upon him wisdom, knowledge, and the ability to judge righteously. It also mentions that Allah saved him from the city where the people were engaging in abhorrent and immoral acts. The inhabitants of that city were described as an evil and rebellious people who defied the commands of Allah.
orig: ولوطا آتيناه حكما وعلما ونجيناه من القرية التي كانت تعمل الخبائث إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فاسقين

translation: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the person referred to was admitted into Allah's mercy and forgiveness because he was among the righteous and pious believers who obeyed Allah and followed His commandments. The mercy of Allah is bestowed upon those who have faith and do good deeds.
orig: وأدخلناه في رحمتنا إنه من الصالحين

translation: And (mention) Noah, when he called ˹to Us˺ before. So We answered his call, and delivered him and his family from the great distress.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah and how Allah answered his prayer and saved him and his family from the great flood that engulfed the disbelievers. It highlights Allah's mercy and His response to those who call upon Him with sincerity and faith.
orig: ونوحا إذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs. They were indeed an evil people, so We drowned them all.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's support for Prophet Noah against the disbelieving people who rejected his message and mocked him. Despite Noah's tireless efforts to guide them, they persisted in their denial of Allah's signs and revelations. Consequently, Allah punished them by drowning them all in the great flood, saving only Noah and his followers who believed in Allah's message.
orig: ونصرناه من القوم الذين كذبوا بآياتنا إنهم كانوا قوم سوء فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.
interpretation: This verse refers to the wisdom and sound judgement of the Prophets David and Solomon. It describes a situation where the sheep of some people strayed into a cultivated field at night, causing damage. David and Solomon judged this case fairly and justly, and Allah witnessed their wise judgement.
orig: وداوود وسليمان إذ يحكمان في الحرث إذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين

translation: So We made Solomon understand it, and to each [of them] We gave judgment and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David, and [also] the birds. And We were the Doers [of it all].
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and knowledge bestowed upon Prophet Solomon and Prophet David. It indicates that Allah enabled Solomon to understand the speech of animals and birds. Both prophets were granted sound judgment and profound knowledge. The mountains and birds were subjugated to glorify Allah alongside David. This verse emphasizes Allah's power and ability to make even inanimate objects and creatures obey His commands.
orig: ففهمناها سليمان وكلا آتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فاعلين

translation: And We taught him the making of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah teaching the Prophet David the skill of making armor and protective gear. The interpretation is that Allah bestowed knowledge and skills upon humans to protect themselves from harm and danger in battle and conflict. It is a reminder of Allah's favors upon humankind and a call to be grateful for these blessings.
orig: وعلمناه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من بأسكم فهل أنتم شاكرون

translation: And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, strongly raging, running by his command towards the land which We had blessed. And We are Ever All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's favor upon Prophet Solomon by subjecting the strong winds to his command. The winds would travel swiftly wherever he ordered, even to distant blessed lands. This was a sign of Allah's omnipotence and His knowledge of all things.
orig: ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجري بأمره إلى الأرض التي باركنا فيها وكنا بكل شيء عالمين

translation: And among the evil ones, were those who dived for him and did other work besides that, and We were keeping guard over them.
interpretation: This verse refers to the jinn who worked for Prophet Sulayman (peace be upon him) by Allah's permission. Some of them dived into the sea to retrieve precious objects, while others performed various tasks for him. Allah states that He was protecting and guarding Prophet Sulayman and the jinn who served him, ensuring their safety and success.
orig: ومن الشياطين من يغوصون له ويعملون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حافظين

translation: And (mention) Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful."
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Job (peace be upon him) when he was afflicted with severe trials and difficulties. Despite his plight, he turned to Allah with humility and faith, acknowledging that his Lord is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy. His supplication demonstrates his unwavering trust in Allah's compassion and mercy, even in the midst of hardship.
orig: وأيوب إذ نادى ربه أني مسني الضر وأنت أرحم الراحمين

translation: So We answered his call, and removed the distress that was upon him, and We restored his family to him, and a similar number with them as a mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers.
interpretation: Allah accepted Ayyub's (Job's) supplication and removed the afflictions he was facing. He restored Ayyub's family members who had passed away, and granted him more offspring, as a blessing from Him. This was a reminder for those who worship Allah, that He answers the prayers of those who are patient and steadfast in their faith.
orig: فاستجبنا له فكشفنا ما به من ضر وآتيناه أهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة من عندنا وذكرى للعابدين

translation: And [mention] Ismail and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient ones.
interpretation: This verse mentions the prophets Ismail (Ishmael), Idrees (Enoch), and Dhul-Kifl (believed to be Ezekiel or another prophet) as examples of those who were patient and steadfast in the face of trials and difficulties. It praises their quality of patience and perseverance, which is a highly valued virtue in Islam.
orig: وإسماعيل وإدريس وذا الكفل كل من الصابرين

translation: And We admitted them into Our mercy, indeed they were among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah admitted those who were righteous and followed His commands into His vast mercy and forgiveness. It suggests that those who lead a pious life and do good deeds will be rewarded with Allah's mercy and blessings in the Hereafter.
orig: وأدخلناهم في رحمتنا إنهم من الصالحين

translation: And (mention) the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not straiten him, so he cried out in the darkness (saying), 'There is no God but You, glory be to You! Verily, I have been one of the wrong-doers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) when he was angry at his people for rejecting his message and left them without Allah's permission. He thought Allah would not hold him accountable, but when he found himself in the belly of the whale in utter darkness, he repented and called out to Allah, acknowledging His Oneness and admitting his mistake.
orig: وذا النون إذ ذهب مغاضبا فظن أن لن نقدر عليه فنادى في الظلمات أن لا إله إلا أنت سبحانك إني كنت من الظالمين

translation: So We responded to him and delivered him from the distress. And thus do We deliver the believers.
interpretation: Allah responded to the sincere prayer and faith of the believer by delivering him from the distress and difficulty he was facing. This verse highlights Allah's mercy and how He helps those who have faith in Him and turn to Him in times of hardship. It serves as a reminder that just as Allah delivered this believer, He will also deliver and save the believers who have faith and seek His aid.
orig: فاستجبنا له ونجيناه من الغم وكذلك ننجي المؤمنين

translation: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."
interpretation: "This verse refers to the supplication of Prophet Zechariah, who asked Allah not to leave him without an heir or successor, as Allah is the best to inherit and continue the legacy of the Prophets. It highlights Zechariah's desire for a child to carry on his mission and his trust in Allah's ability to grant him that wish."
orig: وزكريا إذ نادى ربه رب لا تذرني فردا وأنت خير الوارثين

translation: So We responded to him, and We bestowed upon him John, and We cured his wife for him. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were humbly obedient to Us.
interpretation: Allah answered the supplication of Zakariya and granted him a son, John (Yahya), despite his old age and his wife's barrenness. Allah also cured Zakariya's wife, enabling her to bear a child. Zakariya and his family were righteous people who eagerly performed good deeds, prayed to Allah with hope for His mercy and fear of His punishment, and were humble and submissive before Him.
orig: فاستجبنا له ووهبنا له يحيى وأصلحنا له زوجه إنهم كانوا يسارعون في الخيرات ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا وكانوا لنا خاشعين

translation: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her from Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.
interpretation: This verse refers to the virgin birth of Jesus, peace be upon him, to Mary. Allah states that Mary guarded her chastity and remained pure, so He breathed into her from His spirit, meaning He created Jesus miraculously without a father. Allah made Mary and her son Jesus "a sign for the worlds" as evidence of His power and a miracle to guide people to the truth.
orig: والتي أحصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيها من روحنا وجعلناها وابنها آية للعالمين

translation: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of the religion revealed by God and the oneness of the Lord to be worshipped. It affirms that there is only one true religion, which is the submission to the One God. All human beings are called to worship and serve Allah alone, as He is the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe.
orig: إن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاعبدون

translation: And they have broken their religion among themselves into sects, each faction rejoicing in what it has.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who divide their religion into sects and factions, each group arrogantly clinging to its own beliefs and practices, instead of following the true teachings revealed by God. It warns against sectarianism, disunity, and self-righteousness in matters of faith.
orig: وتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم كل إلينا راجعون

translation: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We [i.e., Our angels] will record [it] for him.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the good deeds of believers will not be rejected or denied. Rather, Allah will fully reward them for their righteous actions, as the angels meticulously record all of their good deeds.
orig: فمن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا كفران لسعيه وإنا له كاتبون

translation: And it is forbidden for a town which We have destroyed that they will not return.
interpretation: Allah is stating that it is an established decree and law that the people of a town that has been destroyed by Allah's punishment can never return to this world or their former state. Their destruction is permanent and final, serving as a lesson and warning to others.
orig: وحرام على قرية أهلكناها أنهم لا يرجعون

translation: Until, when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend
interpretation: This verse is referring to a future event when the barrier containing the tribes of Gog and Magog will be opened, and they will spread out across the earth. This is seen as one of the major signs of the Day of Judgment approaching. The phrase "from every elevation, descend" indicates that they will come from all directions and spread out everywhere.
orig: حتى إذا فتحت يأجوج ومأجوج وهم من كل حدب ينسلون

translation: And the true promise draws near, then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will stare in horror. [They will say], 'O woe to us! We were indeed heedless of this. Nay, we were wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse warns of the imminent coming of the Day of Resurrection, when the disbelievers will be struck with terror and regret for their denial and wrongdoing. It emphasizes the reality of the Hereafter and the consequences of disbelief and injustice, urging people to heed the warnings and embrace faith before it is too late.
orig: واقترب الوعد الحق فإذا هي شاخصة أبصار الذين كفروا يا ويلنا قد كنا في غفلة من هذا بل كنا ظالمين

translation: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are but fuel for Hell. You will surely enter it.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that they and the false deities they worship instead of Allah will be the fuel that feeds the Fire of Hell, and that they will inevitably enter it as a punishment for their disbelief and idolatry. It emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything other than the One True God, Allah, and the severe consequences that await those who persist in this grave sin.
orig: إنكم وما تعبدون من دون الله حصب جهنم أنتم لها واردون

translation: If there were gods besides Allah in the heavens and the earth, they would have been ruined. So glory be to Allah, Lord of the Throne, far above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and refutes the existence of any other gods besides Him. If there were indeed other deities, the heavens and the earth would have been corrupted and thrown into chaos due to the conflicting wills and commands of multiple gods. However, the perfect order and harmony in the universe testifies to the Oneness of its Creator and Sustainer, Allah, Who is far exalted above the false claims of associating partners with Him.
orig: لو كان هؤلاء آلهة ما وردوها وكل فيها خالدون

translation: For them therein is violent exhaling and they therein will not hear.
interpretation: This verse refers to the torment that the disbelievers will face in Hell. The "violent exhaling" (zafir) refers to the agonizing sounds of distress and suffering they will make due to the intense punishment. However, despite their cries and wails, they "will not hear" any relief or response, emphasizing the hopelessness of their situation and the severity of their punishment.
orig: لهم فيها زفير وهم فيها لا يسمعون

translation: Indeed, those for whom the good [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who have already attained a high spiritual rank and are far removed from the torment of Hell. They have preceded others in performing good deeds and upholding faith, so they will be spared from the punishment and distress that the disbelievers and evildoers will face.
orig: إن الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى أولئك عنها مبعدون

translation: They will not hear its sound, and they will abide eternally in what their souls desired.
interpretation: This verse suggests that in Paradise, the dwellers will not hear any disturbing or unpleasant sounds, and they will live forever in the blissful state that their souls desired and longed for. It highlights the tranquility and eternal fulfillment that awaits the righteous believers in the Hereafter.
orig: لا يسمعون حسيسها وهم في ما اشتهت أنفسهم خالدون

translation: No fear shall overcome them, nor shall they grieve. The angels will receive them [saying]: 'This is your Day which you were promised.'
interpretation: "This verse refers to the state of the believers on the Day of Resurrection. They will not experience any fear or grief, as they will be welcomed by the angels who will reassure them that this is the promised Day they were told about during their worldly life. The verse highlights the reward and honor that awaits the believers in the Hereafter."
orig: لا يحزنهم الفزع الأكبر وتتلقاهم الملائكة هذا يومكم الذي كنتم توعدون

translation: The Day when We shall roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books, as We originated the first creation, We shall reproduce it; a promise (binding) upon Us, Truly We are ever Able to do.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the Day of Resurrection when Allah will roll up the heavens in the same way that books or scrolls are rolled up. Just as Allah created the universe from nothing in the first instance, He will re-create it again with ease. This is a binding promise from Allah, Who has power over all things.
orig: يوم نطوي السماء كطي السجل للكتب كما بدأنا أول خلق نعيده وعدا علينا إنا كنا فاعلين

translation: And We have already written in the book of Psalms, after the reminder, that the righteous of My servants shall inherit the earth.
interpretation: Allah mentions in this verse that He has decreed in the Psalms, which were revealed to Prophet Dawud (peace be upon him), that the righteous and pious servants of Allah will eventually inherit and prevail over the earth. This is a promise from Allah that those who lead a life of righteousness, obedience to Allah, and doing good deeds will be granted authority and dominance on earth. It serves as an encouragement for believers to remain steadfast on the path of righteousness, as the ultimate victory and inheritance belongs to them.
orig: ولقد كتبنا في الزبور من بعد الذكر أن الأرض يرثها عبادي الصالحون

translation: Indeed, in this is a message for a people who worship [Allah].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an and its teachings contain profound wisdom and guidance for those who are devoted worshippers of Allah. It serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is a source of enlightenment and direction for those who sincerely seek to understand and follow the divine message.
orig: إن في هذا لبلاغا لقوم عابدين

translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.
interpretation: Allah sent the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, as a manifestation of His vast mercy towards all of creation.
