His message of guidance, wisdom, and compassion is a gift for the whole of humanity and even beyond, serving as a source of spiritual nourishment and enlightenment for anyone who embraces it with an open heart and mind.
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا رحمة للعالمين

translation: Say, 'It is only revealed to me that your God is One God. Will you then be Muslims?'
interpretation: This verse calls upon the Prophet Muhammad to convey to the people that the message revealed to him is the belief in the Oneness of God, and to invite them to submit to God as Muslims. The interpretation emphasizes the core message of Islam - the belief in the absolute Oneness of God and the necessity of submitting to His will.
orig: قل إنما يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فهل أنتم مسلمون

translation: But if they turn away, then say, 'I have warned you of a striking calamity like that which struck the 'Aad and Thamud.'
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in rejecting the message, then warn them that they will face a severe punishment similar to what befell the ancient tribes of 'Aad and Thamud who were destroyed for their defiance of Allah's messengers.
orig: فإن تولوا فقل آذنتكم على سواء وإن أدري أقريب أم بعيد ما توعدون

translation: Indeed, He knows what is declared and what you are concealing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah, the Exalted, has complete knowledge of everything that is said openly and everything that is hidden or concealed in people's hearts and minds. Nothing is hidden from Him, and He is fully aware of all intentions, thoughts, and actions, whether they are expressed verbally or kept secret. This emphasizes Allah's perfect knowledge and serves as a reminder to be mindful of one's words and deeds, as nothing can be hidden from the All-Knowing.
orig: إنه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون

translation: And I do not know; perhaps it is a trial for you and an enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is acknowledging that he does not know the wisdom behind the blessings and pleasures given to people in this worldly life. It could be a test from Allah to see how they respond to these favors - whether they become arrogant and ungrateful, or remain humble and thankful. Or it could be a temporary enjoyment that will eventually fade away. The verse reminds us not to become attached to the fleeting pleasures of this world.
orig: وإن أدري لعله فتنة لكم ومتاع إلى حين

translation: He says, 'My Lord, judge with truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against what you describe.'
interpretation: This verse invokes Allah's judgment and justice, seeking His help and mercy against the false claims and accusations made by the disbelievers. It expresses complete trust in Allah's fairness and highlights His attribute of being the Most Merciful, whose assistance is sought in the face of adversity and falsehood.
orig: قال رب احكم بالحق وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون

translation: O mankind! Fear your Lord. Verily, the earthquake of the Hour is a terrible thing.
interpretation: "This verse reminds us of the immense power of God and the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection. It urges us to be mindful of our Creator and to live righteously, for on that great Day, the earth will convulse violently, signaling the end of this world as we know it. The imagery of the 'earthquake' underscores the magnitude of this event and instills a sense of awe and reverence towards the Almighty."
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم إن زلزلة الساعة شيء عظيم

translation: On the Day you see it, every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant female will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.
interpretation: This verse describes the terrifying events that will occur on the Day of Resurrection. The nursing mothers will become so distracted and horrified that they will abandon their infants. Pregnant women will miscarry due to the overwhelming fear. People will appear intoxicated, stumbling around in a daze, even though they are sober. This state is caused by the sheer terror of witnessing Allah's severe punishment unfold before them.
orig: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما أرضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكارى وما هم بسكارى ولكن عذاب الله شديد

translation: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who argue about Allah and His religion without having any real knowledge or evidence. They blindly follow their desires and are misled by the devils who incite them to falsehood and deviation from the straight path.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطان مريد

translation: It is decreed for him that whoever follows him, he will mislead them and guide them to the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse indicates that whoever follows Satan or evil forces, they will be misled and guided towards the torment of Hellfire. It warns against succumbing to temptations and evil influences that lead one astray from the righteous path.
orig: كتب عليه أنه من تولاه فأنه يضله ويهديه إلى عذاب السعير

translation: O people! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then verily We have created you from dust, then from a drop of semen, then from a clot, then from a lump of flesh, some formed and some unformed, that We may manifest to you. And We cause what We will to remain in the wombs for an appointed term, and afterward We bring you forth as infants, then that you may attain your full strength. And among you there is he who dies, and among you there is he who is brought back to the most abject time of life, so that he knows nothing after having known. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down water upon it, it thrills and swells and grows every lovely kind of growth.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne la toute-puissance d'Allah dans la création de l'être humain et la régénération de la vie sur terre après la pluie, comme preuve de la résurrection après la mort. Elle décrit les différentes étapes de la formation de l'embryon dans l'utérus, ainsi que les phases de la vie humaine, de l'enfance à la vieillesse, jusqu'à la mort. La description de la terre aride qui reverdit après la pluie est une métaphore de la résurrection après la mort.
orig: يا أيها الناس إن كنتم في ريب من البعث فإنا خلقناكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ونقر في الأرحام ما نشاء إلى أجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد إلى أرذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيئا وترى الأرض هامدة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت وأنبتت من كل زوج بهيج

translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and because He gives life to the dead, and because He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute truth and reality, His power to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment, and His ability to do anything He wills. It emphasizes Allah's attributes of truthfulness, omnipotence over life and death, and infinite capability. The verse establishes faith in Allah's reality, power of resurrection, and limitless might.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأنه يحيي الموتى وأنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.
interpretation: This verse affirms the certainty of the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be resurrected from their graves to stand before Allah for judgment. It emphasizes that there is no doubt or uncertainty about the coming of this final Hour, and that Allah has the power to bring the dead back to life.
orig: وأن الساعة آتية لا ريب فيها وأن الله يبعث من في القبور

translation: And among the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who argue or debate about Allah without having any true knowledge, guidance, or enlightenment from the revealed scriptures. It criticizes the practice of making claims about Allah based on mere conjecture, whims, or personal opinions, rather than relying on authentic sources of divine guidance.
orig: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير

translation: Whoever turns away from the remembrance of the Most Merciful, We appoint for him a devil to be an intimate companion to him. And indeed, the devils avert them from the way [of guidance] while they think that they are [rightly] guided
interpretation: This verse warns against turning away from the remembrance and guidance of Allah. For those who do so, Allah will assign a devil as a constant companion who will lead them astray while they think they are rightly guided. This highlights the deception of Satan and the importance of seeking Allah's guidance to avoid being misled.
orig: ثاني عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله له في الدنيا خزي ونذيقه يوم القيامة عذاب الحريق

translation: That is for what your hands have put forth and verily, Allah is not unjust to His slaves.
interpretation: This verse indicates that whatever misfortune or suffering one experiences in this life is a consequence of one's own actions and choices. It emphasizes the principle of divine justice, affirming that Allah does not wrong His servants or treat them unjustly. The outcome we face is a direct result of our deeds, as Allah is absolutely fair and just in His dealings with humanity.
orig: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وأن الله ليس بظلام للعبيد

translation: And among the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If good befalls him, he is content with it; but if a trial befalls him, he turns back on his face. He has lost this world and the Hereafter. That is the manifest loss.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have a weak and unstable faith. Their worship of Allah is based on a precarious position, like standing on the edge. If they receive blessings, they are content and grateful. However, if they face difficulties or trials, they lose faith and turn away from Allah completely. Such people have lost both this worldly life and the Hereafter, which is a clear and evident loss.
orig: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف فإن أصابه خير اطمأن به وإن أصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والآخرة ذلك هو الخسران المبين

translation: He calls besides Allah that which can neither harm nor benefit him. That is the extreme misguidance.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of calling upon or worshipping anything besides Allah, which can neither benefit nor harm a person. Such actions are described as "extreme misguidance" because they go against the fundamental purpose of human existence, which is to worship and submit to the One True God.
orig: يدعو من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ذلك هو الضلال البعيد

translation: He calls upon him whose harm is nearer than his benefit - an evil patron indeed, and an evil associate.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who worship false deities or idols instead of Allah. It highlights the foolishness of calling upon beings that cannot benefit them and can only bring harm. The verse emphasizes that such false objects of worship are "an evil patron" and "an evil associate," unworthy of devotion or reliance.
orig: يدعو لمن ضره أقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.
interpretation: This verse promises that those who have faith and perform good deeds will be rewarded by Allah with entry into Paradise, which is described as having rivers flowing beneath it. It emphasizes Allah's absolute power and ability to do as He wills, reminding believers to have trust in His wisdom and justice.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار إن الله يفعل ما يريد

translation: Whoever should think that Allah will not support him in this world and the Hereafter - let him pass a rope through the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and see if his effort will remove that which enrages [him].
interpretation: This verse warns those who deny the help and support of Allah in this life and the Hereafter. It challenges them to try ending their lives if they think Allah will not aid them. But it emphasizes that such an attempt will not remove the rage and anguish they feel, for Allah's decree will inevitably come to pass.
orig: من كان يظن أن لن ينصره الله في الدنيا والآخرة فليمدد بسبب إلى السماء ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ

translation: And thus We have sent it down as verses of clear evidence and because Allah guides whom He intends.
interpretation: Allah has revealed the Qur'an with clear signs and proofs, and He guides whomever He wills to the straight path. Guidance is from Allah alone, and He bestows it upon those who sincerely seek it and have pure intentions.
orig: وكذلك أنزلناه آيات بينات وأن الله يهدي من يريد

translation: Indeed, those who believed and those who were Jews or Sabians or Christians or Magians and those who associated others with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Surely Allah is a Witness over all things.
interpretation: This verse affirms that on the Day of Judgment, Allah will differentiate between and judge all people, regardless of their religious affiliations or beliefs. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate Judge and Witness over all matters, and no one will be treated unjustly. The interpretation highlights Allah's fairness, justice, and authority in judging all people based on their beliefs and deeds.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا والذين هادوا والصابئين والنصارى والمجوس والذين أشركوا إن الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة إن الله على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Seest thou not that to Allah prostrate all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth, the sun, the moon, the stars, the hills, the trees, the beasts, and a great number of mankind, though a great number likewise deserve the chastisement? And whomsoever Allah scorns, there is none who can confer honour upon him. Surely Allah does whatsoever He wills.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and power over all creation. Everything in the heavens and earth, including celestial bodies, mountains, trees, animals, and humans, prostrates and submits to Allah's will and glory. However, many humans deserve punishment for their disobedience. No one can bestow honor upon those whom Allah has scorned or disgraced. Allah does whatever He wills, and His power is unrestrained.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يسجد له من في السماوات ومن في الأرض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس وكثير حق عليه العذاب ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم إن الله يفعل ما يشاء

translation: These are two opponents who have disputed over their Lord. As for those who disbelieved, garments of fire will be cut out for them, and boiling water will be poured over their heads.
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. They will be dressed in garments made of fire, and boiling water will be poured over their heads as a punishment for their rejection of faith and their dispute with the believers over the truth of Allah's message.
orig: هذان خصمان اختصموا في ربهم فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق رءوسهم الحميم

translation: With it will be branded what is within their bellies and their skins.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the punishment of Hell, where the disbelievers will be branded or burned with the Fire. The phrase "what is within their bellies" could refer to the evil intentions, desires, and thoughts they harbored, while "their skins" refers to their physical bodies. The branding or burning is a manifestation of the punishment they will face for their disbelief and sins.
orig: يصهر به ما في بطونهم والجلود

translation: And for them are hooked rods of iron.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a metaphorical description of the severe punishment awaiting the disbelievers in the Hereafter. The "hooked rods of iron" symbolize the instruments of torture and punishment that will be used to inflict pain and suffering upon them as a consequence of their rejection of faith and righteous deeds in this world.
orig: ولهم مقامع من حديد

translation: Every time they wish to get out of it, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the eternal punishment they will face in Hellfire. No matter how much they desire to escape it, they will be returned to endure its torment repeatedly, being told to taste the excruciating punishment of the raging flames.
orig: كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها من غم أعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
interpretation: This verse promises that those who have faith and perform good deeds will be rewarded by Allah with entry into Paradise. The gardens of Paradise have rivers flowing beneath them, and the inhabitants will wear adornments of gold and pearls, as well as garments of silk, indicating the luxurious and blissful nature of Paradise.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

translation: And they are guided to good speech and they are guided to the path of the Praised One.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to use good and virtuous speech, and to follow the path that leads to Allah, who is worthy of all praise. It emphasizes the importance of controlling one's tongue and speaking in a manner that is pleasing to Allah, as well as following the straight path of guidance and righteousness that has been prescribed by Him.
orig: وهدوا إلى الطيب من القول وهدوا إلى صراط الحميد

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident and the visitor in it - and whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [from truth] by wrongdoing, We will make him taste of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against preventing people from the path of Allah and the Sacred Mosque in Makkah, which was designated as a place of worship for all people, whether residents or visitors. It threatens severe punishment for those who intentionally act unjustly or deviate from the truth within the sacred precincts.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذي جعلناه للناس سواء العاكف فيه والباد ومن يرد فيه بإلحاد بظلم نذقه من عذاب أليم

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying]: 'Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's command to Prophet Abraham to establish the Ka'bah as a sanctuary devoted solely to the worship of the One True God, free from any form of idolatry or associating partners with Allah. It emphasizes the sanctity of the Ka'bah and the importance of purifying it from any impurities, both physical and spiritual, so that it remains a sacred place for those who perform the rituals of Tawaf (circumambulation), prayer, bowing, and prostration.
orig: وإذ بوأنا لإبراهيم مكان البيت أن لا تشرك بي شيئا وطهر بيتي للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود

translation: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad to announce the pilgrimage of Hajj to all people, near and far. It emphasizes that people will come from every corner of the world, traveling by any means possible - on foot or riding lean camels - to perform this sacred ritual in Makkah. The verse highlights the universal call of Islam and the importance of Hajj as one of its pillars, which brings together Muslims from diverse backgrounds and locations to worship Allah.
orig: وأذن في الناس بالحج يأتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر يأتين من كل فج عميق

translation: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah during the appointed days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to perform the rituals of Hajj and sacrifice animals in remembrance of Allah's blessings. It emphasizes the spiritual and social aspects of these practices, where one should thank Allah and share the sacrificed meat with the needy. The "appointed days" refer to the days of Eid al-Adha during the Hajj season. By partaking in these rituals, believers witness benefits for themselves spiritually and practically by feeding others.
orig: ليشهدوا منافع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله في أيام معلومات على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فكلوا منها وأطعموا البائس الفقير

translation: Then let them complete the prescribed duties, perform their vows, and circumambulate the Ancient House.
interpretation: This verse instructs the pilgrims to complete their rituals of Hajj or Umrah, fulfill any vows they have made, and perform the ritual of circumambulating the Ka'bah, which is referred to as the "Ancient House." The interpretation is that once the pilgrims have entered the sacred precincts, they must carry out the obligatory rites of Hajj or Umrah with sincerity and devotion, keeping any promises made to Allah, and revere the Ka'bah by walking around it as an act of worship.
orig: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق

translation: That [has been mentioned], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the cattle, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of honoring the sacred ordinances of Allah, which is best for a person in the sight of their Lord. It then declares that cattle are permissible for consumption, except for what is specifically prohibited in the recitation (i.e., the Qur'an). The verse instructs believers to avoid the uncleanliness of idols and false statements, which are associated with polytheistic practices and dishonesty.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمات الله فهو خير له عند ربه وأحلت لكم الأنعام إلا ما يتلى عليكم فاجتنبوا الرجس من الأوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور

translation: Being upright for Allah, not associating partners with Him. And whoever associates partners with Allah is as though he has fallen from the sky and is snatched by birds or blown away by the wind to a far off place.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone without associating any partners with Him. It uses a powerful metaphor to describe the state of those who commit shirk (associating partners with Allah). They are likened to someone who has fallen from the sky, vulnerable to being snatched by birds or blown away by the wind to a remote place. This imagery highlights the perilous and helpless condition of those who deviate from the straight path of Tawheed (Islamic monotheism).
orig: حنفاء لله غير مشركين به ومن يشرك بالله فكأنما خر من السماء فتخطفه الطير أو تهوي به الريح في مكان سحيق

translation: And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of respecting and honoring the symbols and rites prescribed by Allah, as doing so reflects the piety and righteousness present in one's heart. The "symbols of Allah" refer to the rituals and acts of worship ordained by Him, such as prayers, fasting, pilgrimage, and other religious obligations. By fulfilling these duties with sincerity and reverence, a person demonstrates their genuine faith and consciousness of the Divine.
orig: ذلك ومن يعظم شعائر الله فإنها من تقوى القلوب

translation: For you in them are benefits for a specified term, then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.
interpretation: This verse refers to the permissibility of benefiting from certain animals, such as camels, cattle, and sheep, until a specified time. After that, these animals must be taken to the Sacred Mosque in Mecca for sacrifice during the Hajj rituals. The "ancient House" mentioned is the Kaaba, the sacred cube-shaped structure in Mecca towards which Muslims face during their prayers. This verse highlights the significance of the Hajj pilgrimage and the rituals associated with it, including the sacrifice of animals as an act of worship and obedience to Allah.
orig: لكم فيها منافع إلى أجل مسمى ثم محلها إلى البيت العتيق

translation: And for every nation We have appointed a rite [as a way], that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universality of worship and submission to the One God. It states that for every community, God has ordained rituals and sacrifices to commemorate His name. However, the object of worship is the same One God for all people. Therefore, all should submit to Him alone. The verse also instructs the Prophet Muhammad to give glad tidings to those who are humble and obedient before their Lord.
orig: ولكل أمة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الأنعام فإلهكم إله واحد فله أسلموا وبشر المخبتين

translation: Those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are filled with fear, and those who are patient with what has afflicted them, and those who establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them.
interpretation: This verse describes the qualities of the righteous believers. It refers to those whose hearts are filled with awe and reverence when Allah is mentioned, indicating their deep faith and consciousness of Allah. It also praises those who patiently endure difficulties and adversities that come their way, exhibiting steadfastness and trust in Allah's wisdom. Additionally, it commends those who are diligent in performing their prayers and spend from the provisions bestowed upon them by Allah, showing gratitude and charity towards others.
orig: الذين إذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصابرين على ما أصابهم والمقيمي الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And the camels and cattle, We have appointed them among the symbols of Allah for you; in them there is good for you. So mention the Name of Allah over them when they are lined up for sacrifice. Then, when they are down on their sides, eat thereof and feed the contented poor as well as the beggar. Thus have We subjugated them for you, that you may be grateful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the ritual of sacrificing camels and cattle during the Hajj pilgrimage. Allah has made these animals symbols of His religion, and there is benefit in sacrificing them. When they are lined up for sacrifice, the name of Allah should be mentioned over them. After they are sacrificed and lying on their sides, the believers are instructed to eat from the meat and also feed the poor and needy. Allah has made these animals subservient to humans for this purpose, so that people may be grateful to Him.
orig: والبدن جعلناها لكم من شعائر الله لكم فيها خير فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف فإذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها وأطعموا القانع والمعتر كذلك سخرناها لكم لعلكم تشكرون

translation: Neither their meat nor their blood reaches Allah, but it is your piety that reaches Him. Thus He has subjected them to you, that you may glorify Allah for His guidance to you. And give good tidings to the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the essence of sacrifice is not in the physical act itself, but rather in the sincere intention and piety (taqwa) that motivates it. The meat and blood of the sacrificed animals do not reach Allah, but it is the God-consciousness, obedience, and gratitude in the hearts of the believers that truly matter. Allah has made these animals subservient to humans as a means for them to express gratitude and glorify Him for guiding them to the right path. The verse concludes by giving glad tidings to those who perform good deeds with sincerity and righteousness.
orig: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هداكم وبشر المحسنين

translation: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah protects and supports those who have faith and believe in Him. However, He does not love or favor those who are deceitful, disloyal, and ungrateful for His blessings. It encourages believers to remain steadfast in their faith and avoid treacherous or ungrateful behavior, as such traits are displeasing to Allah.
orig: إن الله يدافع عن الذين آمنوا إن الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور

translation: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.
interpretation: This verse gives permission to the oppressed believers to fight in self-defense against their oppressors, as they were wronged and treated unjustly. It also reassures them that Allah has the power and ability to grant them victory over their enemies.
orig: أذن للذين يقاتلون بأنهم ظلموا وإن الله على نصرهم لقدير

translation: Those who have been expelled from their homes unjustly only because they said, 'Our Lord is Allah.' And were it not for Allah's repelling some people by means of others, monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques, wherein the name of Allah is mentioned much, would have been pulled down. And Allah will surely help those who help His cause. Indeed, Allah is All-Strong, Almighty.
interpretation: This verse refers to the oppression and expulsion of Muslims from their homes in Makkah by the disbelievers, solely for professing their faith in the Oneness of Allah. It emphasizes that if Allah did not allow some people to defend against the aggression of others, all places of worship would have been destroyed. The verse promises Allah's help and support to those who strive for His cause, as He is Powerful and Mighty.
orig: الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم بغير حق إلا أن يقولوا ربنا الله ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صوامع وبيع وصلوات ومساجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ولينصرن الله من ينصره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Those who, if We established them in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of [all] matters.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who, if given authority on earth, would uphold the principles of Islam by establishing prayer, giving charity, promoting good and forbidding evil. It emphasizes that the ultimate outcome of all affairs rests with Allah alone.
orig: الذين إن مكناهم في الأرض أقاموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأمروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ولله عاقبة الأمور

translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so were denied before them the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud.
interpretation: If the disbelievers reject your message, O Prophet, do not be distressed, for many messengers before you were also denied by their people, such as the people of Noah, 'Aad, and Thamud. Their denial did not invalidate the truth, and the same applies to the rejection you face.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود

translation: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot
interpretation: This verse refers to the nations or communities to which the Prophets Abraham and Lot were sent to guide. It highlights that just as these Prophets faced rejection and opposition from their people for calling them to worship One God, the Prophet Muhammad also faced similar circumstances from the pagan Arabs of his time.
orig: وقوم إبراهيم وقوم لوط

translation: And the people of Madyan [denied the messenger], and Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
interpretation: The verse refers to the people of Madyan who rejected the message of Prophet Shu'ayb, and the Israelites who denied Prophet Moses. Allah gave the disbelievers a respite and prolonged their enjoyment of life's pleasures. However, He eventually seized them with a severe punishment, indicating the consequences of denying Allah's messengers and persisting in disbelief. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance and a reminder of Allah's might and justice.
orig: وأصحاب مدين وكذب موسى فأمليت للكافرين ثم أخذتهم فكيف كان نكير

translation: So, how many a city did We destroy while it was doing wrong - so it is fallen in upon its roofs, and [how many] an abandoned well and a constructed palace?
interpretation: This verse is a reminder of Allah's punishment upon the wrongdoing nations who persisted in disbelief and disobedience. It highlights how Allah destroyed many cities and civilizations that were unjust and oppressive, leaving them in ruins with their palaces and structures collapsed and abandoned wells left unused. It serves as a warning against arrogance and a call to heed the lessons of history and submit to Allah's commands.
orig: فكأين من قرية أهلكناها وهي ظالمة فهي خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد

translation: Have they not traveled through the land, so that they may have hearts with which to reason, or ears with which to hear? For indeed, it is not the eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' lack of reflection and insight. It encourages them to travel and observe the signs of Allah's power in the universe, which should lead them to reason with their hearts and listen with their ears. However, the real blindness is not physical, but the blindness of the heart that prevents them from recognizing the truth, despite the clear signs surrounding them.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها أو آذان يسمعون بها فإنها لا تعمى الأبصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور

translation: And they ask you to hasten on the punishment, and Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of what you count.
interpretation: The disbelievers are impatient for the punishment to come, but Allah will not break His promise. However, the concept of time is different for Allah than for humans. A day in the sight of Allah is like a thousand years according to human reckoning. This verse reminds us of Allah's power over time and that His plan unfolds according to His wisdom, not human desires.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده وإن يوما عند ربك كألف سنة مما تعدون

translation: And how many a city did I prolong its term while it was doing wrong, then I seized it, and to Me is the return.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's power and justice. He gives ample time and opportunity to people to mend their ways, but when they persist in wrongdoing and transgression, His punishment seizes them inevitably. Ultimately, all will return to Allah for judgment and accountability for their deeds.
orig: وكأين من قرية أمليت لها وهي ظالمة ثم أخذتها وإلي المصير

translation: Say, "O people, indeed I am to you a clear warner."
interpretation: "This verse is a command from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to declare his role as a clear warner to all of humanity. As a messenger of Allah, his duty was to convey the message of Islam and warn people against disbelief and disobedience to Allah, without any ambiguity or confusion. The verse emphasizes the universality of the Prophet's message, which was not limited to a particular group or nation, but rather addressed to all people."
orig: قل يا أيها الناس إنما أنا لكم نذير مبين

translation: So those who believed and did righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness from Allah and an honorable sustenance in the Hereafter for those who have faith and perform righteous deeds in this world. It highlights that true belief must be accompanied by good actions to attain divine forgiveness and a noble reward.
orig: فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our verses to frustrate them - those are the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse warns those who actively oppose and try to undermine the signs and revelations of God. It states that such individuals, who stubbornly reject and attempt to invalidate the divine verses, will be among the dwellers of Hellfire as a consequence of their arrogant disbelief and obstinate rejection of the truth.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he recited [the revelation], Satan insinuated into his recitation. But Allah abolishes what Satan insinuates; then Allah establishes His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that whenever a prophet or messenger recited the revelation given to him by Allah, Satan would try to cast doubts or insinuations into his recitation. However, Allah would immediately abolish and remove Satan's insinuations, and firmly establish His own verses and words. This shows that the revelations received by the prophets were protected by Allah from any corruption or alteration by Satan. Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise in His actions.
orig: وما أرسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبي إلا إذا تمنى ألقى الشيطان في أمنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقي الشيطان ثم يحكم الله آياته والله عليم حكيم

translation: That He may make what is thrown by Satan a trial for those in whose hearts is disease and those harsh of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.
interpretation: Allah allows Satan to tempt and deceive people as a test for those whose hearts are diseased with doubts, hypocrisy or disbelief, and for those whose hearts are hardened against faith. This serves to expose the wrongdoers who are in extreme opposition to the truth and in a state of conflict and division far from guidance.
orig: ليجعل ما يلقي الشيطان فتنة للذين في قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم وإن الظالمين لفي شقاق بعيد

translation: And let those who have been given knowledge know that it is the truth from your Lord, so they may believe in it, and their hearts may humble themselves to it. Surely, Allah guides those who believe to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of knowledge and faith. Those who have been given knowledge, such as scholars and people of understanding, should recognize that the Qur'an is the truth from Allah. This recognition should lead them to believe in it wholeheartedly, with humility and submission. Allah guides those who truly believe in Him to the straight path, which is the path of righteousness, truth, and salvation.
orig: وليعلم الذين أوتوا العلم أنه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم وإن الله لهاد الذين آمنوا إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: But those who disbelieved are in doubt and suspicion concerning it (the Qur'an) until the Hour comes suddenly upon them, or there comes to them the torment of a barren Day.
interpretation: This verse implies that the disbelievers will remain in doubt and denial regarding the truth of the Qur'an until they face either a sudden punishment in the form of death, or the torment of the Day of Resurrection, which is described as "barren" because no good deed will benefit anyone on that Day.
orig: ولا يزال الذين كفروا في مرية منه حتى تأتيهم الساعة بغتة أو يأتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم

translation: Sovereignty that Day will be with Allah. He will judge between them. So those who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, Allah alone will have absolute authority and sovereignty. He will judge between all people justly. Those who had faith and performed good deeds will be rewarded by being admitted into the eternal Gardens of Paradise, where they will experience everlasting bliss and pleasure.
orig: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم فالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في جنات النعيم

translation: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and deny the signs and revelations of Allah that they will face a humiliating and degrading punishment in the Hereafter for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا فأولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.
interpretation: This verse promises a great reward from Allah for those who migrated from their homes for the sake of Allah and His religion, and were then killed or died in that cause. Allah assures that He will provide them with an excellent and everlasting provision in the Hereafter, for He is the Best of those who provide sustenance to His creation.
orig: والذين هاجروا في سبيل الله ثم قتلوا أو ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا وإن الله لهو خير الرازقين

translation: He will surely admit them to a way of entrance that they will be pleased with. And indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will guide the believers to a path and way of life that they will be pleased with, as a result of their faith and good deeds. It also highlights Allah's knowledge of all things and His forbearance and patience with His servants.
orig: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه وإن الله لعليم حليم

translation: That, and whoever is revenged with the like of what he was afflicted, and then is oppressed, Allah will surely aid him. Surely Allah is Pardoning, Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of just retaliation and warns against exceeding limits. It states that if someone is wronged and retaliates proportionately, but then the oppressor persists in aggression, Allah will support the oppressed person. This highlights Allah's justice and mercy - He pardons those who repent and forgives those who seek His forgiveness.
orig: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغي عليه لينصرنه الله إن الله لعفو غفور

translation: That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and because Allah is All-Hearer, All-Seer.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and control over the alternation of night and day, which is a sign of His existence and greatness. It signifies that Allah causes the night to gradually merge into the day, and the day to gradually merge into the night, in a continuous cycle. This phenomenon is a manifestation of Allah's ability to hear and see everything in the universe.
orig: ذلك بأن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وأن الله سميع بصير

translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness and Supremacy of Allah. It states that Allah alone is the Truth, the true object of worship, while all other deities that people associate with Him are false. It emphasizes that Allah is the Most High, transcending all creation, and the Most Great, possessing the utmost majesty and grandeur.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه هو الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير

translation: Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and then the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in sustaining life on earth through the cycle of rain. The descent of rain from the sky causes the earth to become lush and green, a sign of life and growth. It reminds us of Allah's subtle and intricate design in the workings of the universe, as well as His profound knowledge of all things. The verse invites us to reflect on the blessings of rain and vegetation, and to appreciate the Subtle yet Mighty Creator who provides for all His creation.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فتصبح الأرض مخضرة إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and indeed, Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute ownership and sovereignty over all of creation. It emphasizes that everything in the heavens and on earth belongs to Him alone. The phrase "the Self-Sufficient" highlights that Allah is not in need of His creation, rather all beings are in need of Him. "The Praiseworthy" indicates that He alone is worthy of all praise and gratitude for His countless blessings and favors upon His creation.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وإن الله لهو الغني الحميد

translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth, and the ships which sail through the sea by His command? And He withholds the heaven from falling upon the earth except by His permission. Indeed, Allah is Ever Most Courteous and Most Merciful to the people.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's immense favor upon humanity by subjugating everything on earth for their benefit and allowing ships to sail through the seas by His command. It also emphasizes Allah's power in sustaining the heavens and preventing them from falling to the earth, except by His will. The verse concludes by affirming Allah's profound kindness, compassion, and mercy towards all people.
orig: ألم تر أن الله سخر لكم ما في الأرض والفلك تجري في البحر بأمره ويمسك السماء أن تقع على الأرض إلا بإذنه إن الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم

translation: And it is He who gave you life, then He will cause you to die, and then He will give you life again. Indeed, man is ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the cycle of life and death ordained by Allah. It reminds us that just as Allah gave us life, He will eventually cause our death, and then resurrect us on the Day of Judgment. The verse concludes with a profound statement that man is often ungrateful, failing to appreciate the blessings bestowed upon him by his Creator.
orig: وهو الذي أحياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم إن الإنسان لكفور

translation: For every nation We have appointed rites which they must follow. So do not let them dispute with you in this matter, but call them to your Lord. You are indeed on straight guidance.
interpretation: Allah has ordained for every nation certain religious rites and ways of worship according to their circumstances and level of understanding. Muslims should not argue with the followers of other religions about their rites. Instead, the Prophet Muhammad should invite them to the worship of the One True God, for he is on the straight path leading to the truth.
orig: لكل أمة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه فلا ينازعنك في الأمر وادع إلى ربك إنك لعلى هدى مستقيم

translation: And if they argue with you, then say, 'Allah is most knowing of what you do.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, on how to respond when faced with arguments or disputes from those who reject the message of Islam. The interpretation is: "If the disbelievers engage in arguments or debates with you regarding the truth of the message you bring, do not get entangled in prolonged disputes with them. Instead, respond by saying that Allah is fully aware of their deeds and intentions, and He will judge them accordingly. This reminds them that Allah has complete knowledge of all that they do, and they will ultimately be held accountable before Him."
orig: وإن جادلوك فقل الله أعلم بما تعملون

translation: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ.
interpretation: Allah is the Ultimate Judge and the Final Authority. On the Day of Resurrection, He will settle all disputes and differences that people had in their worldly lives regarding matters of faith, beliefs, and religious practices. His judgment will be just and based on truth, putting an end to all disagreements and conflicts.
orig: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون

translation: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and the earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute and comprehensive knowledge of everything in the heavens and the earth. It is all recorded in a preserved Record, which is easy for Allah to maintain and refer to. This highlights Allah's omniscience and the ease with which He governs and controls all affairs of the universe."
orig: ألم تعلم أن الله يعلم ما في السماء والأرض إن ذلك في كتاب إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has sent down no authority, and that of which they have no knowledge; and for the unjust there is no helper.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of worshipping anything besides Allah without any divine sanction or knowledge. It warns that those who engage in such unjust acts of associating partners with Allah will have no helper or supporter on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وما ليس لهم به علم وما للظالمين من نصير

translation: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, you recognize denial on the faces of those who disbelieve. They nearly assault those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Shall I inform you of something worse than that? The Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieved. And wretched is the destination."
interpretation: This verse describes the reaction of the disbelievers when the clear verses of the Qur'an are recited to them. Their faces show signs of denial and rejection, and they almost attack those who recite the verses. The verse then warns them of something worse than their denial, which is the punishment of Hellfire that Allah has promised for those who disbelieve. It emphasizes that the destination of the disbelievers is indeed wretched and miserable.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات تعرف في وجوه الذين كفروا المنكر يكادون يسطون بالذين يتلون عليهم آياتنا قل أفأنبئكم بشر من ذلكم النار وعدها الله الذين كفروا وبئس المصير

translation: O people, a parable is set forth, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create a fly, even if they gathered together for it. And if the fly took away something from them, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the seeker and the sought.
interpretation: Allah is presenting a parable to illustrate the utter powerlessness of the false deities that people worship besides Him. Even if all these deities were to come together, they would be unable to create something as insignificant as a fly. Furthermore, if a fly were to take away something from them, they would be utterly helpless to retrieve it. This parable highlights the weakness and inability of the false objects of worship, contrasted with the supreme power and might of the One True God, Allah.
orig: يا أيها الناس ضرب مثل فاستمعوا له إن الذين تدعون من دون الله لن يخلقوا ذبابا ولو اجتمعوا له وإن يسلبهم الذباب شيئا لا يستنقذوه منه ضعف الطالب والمطلوب

translation: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inability of people to truly comprehend the greatness and majesty of Allah. It highlights that they have failed to appreciate Allah's attributes and power to the fullest extent. The verse affirms that Allah is truly Mighty and Powerful, possessing supreme strength and honor. It serves as a reminder for humans to recognize their limited understanding and to submit to Allah's infinite glory and might.
orig: ما قدروا الله حق قدره إن الله لقوي عزيز

translation: Allah chooses messengers from among the angels and from among the people. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah selects certain individuals from among the angels and humans to be His messengers and convey His message. It emphasizes Allah's attribute of being All-Hearing, meaning He hears all, and All-Seeing, meaning He sees everything. The selection of messengers highlights Allah's wisdom and authority in choosing those whom He deems fit to guide humanity and communicate His commandments.
orig: الله يصطفي من الملائكة رسلا ومن الناس إن الله سميع بصير

translation: He knows what is before them and what is after them, and to Allah all matters will be returned.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has complete and perfect knowledge of everything - the past, present, and future. Nothing is hidden from Him. It also emphasizes that all affairs will ultimately return to Allah for judgment and accountability on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: يعلم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to the believers to perform the ritual acts of worship, such as bowing (ruku') and prostrating (sujud) during prayer. It also instructs them to worship Allah alone and to do good deeds. The purpose of fulfilling these obligations is to attain success and salvation in this life and the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the importance of combining ritual worship with righteous conduct and good deeds as the means to achieve true prosperity and felicity.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اركعوا واسجدوا واعبدوا ربكم وافعلوا الخير لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. He named you 'Muslims' before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the Protector, and excellent is the Helper.
interpretation: This verse calls upon the believers to strive sincerely in the cause of Allah, fulfilling all obligations with utmost dedication. It emphasizes that Allah has chosen them and made the religion easy for them, following the tradition of Prophet Abraham. The name 'Muslims' was given to them in previous scriptures as well. The verse highlights the role of the Prophet Muhammad as a witness over the believers, and their responsibility as witnesses over humanity. It instructs them to establish prayer, give obligatory charity (zakah), and hold fast to Allah, who is their Protector and Helper.
orig: وجاهدوا في الله حق جهاده هو اجتباكم وما جعل عليكم في الدين من حرج ملة أبيكم إبراهيم هو سماكم المسلمين من قبل وفي هذا ليكون الرسول شهيدا عليكم وتكونوا شهداء على الناس فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة واعتصموا بالله هو مولاكم فنعم المولى ونعم النصير

translation: Certainly will the believers have succeeded
interpretation: This verse affirms that true believers who have faith in God and follow His commandments will attain success and salvation in this life and the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous deeds as the means to achieve ultimate felicity and triumph over all difficulties and trials.
orig: قد أفلح المؤمنون

translation: Those who are humble in their prayers,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who perform their prayers with humility, reverence, and sincerity towards Allah. They are focused, attentive, and their hearts are filled with fear and awe of Allah during their prayers. Their humility in prayer reflects their deep connection with their Lord and their recognition of His greatness and their own insignificance before Him.
orig: الذين هم في صلاتهم خاشعون

translation: And those who turn away from ill speech
interpretation: This verse refers to the quality of avoiding vain and useless talk or behavior that lacks purpose or benefit. It encourages believers to distance themselves from engaging in idle conversations, gossip, or any speech that is frivolous or inappropriate. The interpretation highlights the virtue of being mindful of one's words and actions, focusing on what is meaningful, constructive, and in line with moral and spiritual principles.
orig: والذين هم عن اللغو معرضون

translation: And those who are doers of Zakah
interpretation: This verse refers to those who pay the obligatory charity known as Zakah. Zakah is one of the pillars of Islam and a means of purifying one's wealth. By paying Zakah, believers demonstrate their obedience to Allah and their care for the less fortunate members of society. Paying Zakah is a sign of true faith and a way to earn Allah's pleasure and blessings.
orig: والذين هم للزكاة فاعلون

translation: And those who guard their private parts
interpretation: This verse refers to the importance of chastity and guarding one's sexual desires. It praises those who exercise self-control and refrain from engaging in unlawful sexual relations. The preservation of one's chastity is considered a virtuous act and a means of attaining spiritual purity and closeness to Allah.
orig: والذين هم لفروجهم حافظون

translation: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -
interpretation: This verse is referring to the permissibility of intimate relations between spouses and with female slaves legally possessed. It exempts them from blame in this regard, as such relations are lawful and allowed within the bounds of marriage or legal ownership of slaves at that time.
orig: إلا على أزواجهم أو ما ملكت أيمانهم فإنهم غير ملومين

translation: Then whoever seeks beyond that, those are the transgressors
interpretation: This verse warns against going beyond the limits set by Allah in religious matters or seeking desires that contradict Islamic teachings. Those who exceed the boundaries and pursue unlawful or unethical paths are considered transgressors, deviating from the straight path prescribed by Allah.
orig: فمن ابتغى وراء ذلك فأولئك هم العادون

translation: And those who are guardians of their trusts and covenants
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are faithful and honest in fulfilling their trusts, responsibilities, and commitments. It praises individuals who are trustworthy and uphold their promises, covenants, and agreements. This quality is highly valued in Islam as it promotes integrity, reliability, and accountability in one's dealings with others.
orig: والذين هم لأماناتهم وعهدهم راعون

translation: And those who strictly guard their prayers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being consistent and diligent in performing the obligatory prayers at their prescribed times. It praises those who guard and protect their prayers, maintaining focus and humility during the act of worship. The interpretation highlights the discipline and commitment required to establish and maintain the habit of regular prayer, which is a fundamental pillar of Islam.
orig: والذين هم على صلواتهم يحافظون

translation: Those are the inheritors
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who will inherit Paradise and eternal bliss as a reward for their faith and good deeds. It implies that the true inheritors of God's mercy and blessings are those who lead a life of obedience, righteousness, and submission to the divine will.
orig: أولئك هم الوارثون

translation: Those who inherit al-Firdaus - they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse refers to the eternal reward of Paradise, known as al-Firdaus, for the righteous believers. It indicates that those who have earned this ultimate bliss through their faith and good deeds will abide in it forever, never to be expelled or transferred from it. This emphasizes the permanent and everlasting nature of the reward promised to the believers in the Hereafter.
orig: الذين يرثون الفردوس هم فيها خالدون

translation: And We have certainly created man from an extract of clay.
interpretation: This verse suggests that human beings were created from a humble and lowly origin, which is clay or earth. It emphasizes the humble beginnings of human existence and that people should remain humble, as they were created from a simple material like clay. The verse also highlights the power and ability of God to create human beings from such a basic substance.
orig: ولقد خلقنا الإنسان من سلالة من طين

translation: Then We made the Nutfah into a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood), then We made the clot into a little lump of flesh, then We made out of that little lump of flesh bones, then We clothed the bones with flesh, and then We brought it forth as another creation.
interpretation: This verse describes the stages of human embryonic development in a remarkable way that corresponds with modern scientific findings. It highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating human beings from a humble beginning as a Nutfah (a drop of semen). The interpretation points to the miraculous nature of the Qur'an, which contains knowledge that could not have been known to the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, at that time.
orig: ثم جعلناه نطفة في قرار مكين

translation: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed it into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.
interpretation: This verse describes the stages of human embryonic development in a concise and accurate manner. It highlights Allah's power as the Creator who shapes the embryo from a mere drop into a clinging clot, then a lump of flesh, then bones covered with flesh, and finally a new distinct creation. The verse invites us to ponder over this miraculous process and glorify Allah as the most perfect Creator.
orig: ثم خلقنا النطفة علقة فخلقنا العلقة مضغة فخلقنا المضغة عظاما فكسونا العظام لحما ثم أنشأناه خلقا آخر فتبارك الله أحسن الخالقين

translation: Then you will surely die after that.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the inevitability of death, which will come to every human being after their life in this world. It serves as a reminder of our temporary existence and the need to prepare for the eternal life in the Hereafter.
orig: ثم إنكم بعد ذلك لميتون

translation: Then, indeed, you will be resurrected on the Day of Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse affirms the inevitable reality of the Resurrection on the Day of Judgment, when all human beings will be raised from the dead to face accountability for their deeds in this worldly life. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of our existence and the ultimate return to Allah for reckoning and recompense.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة تبعثون

translation: And We have created above you seven celestial orbits, and We have never been neglectful of the creation.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has created seven heavens or celestial realms above us. It suggests the vastness and complexity of Allah's creation, and emphasizes that He has not neglected or overlooked any aspect of His creation. The "seven celestial orbits" may refer to the different celestial spheres or layers in the cosmos, as understood in ancient cosmology. However, the exact nature of these "orbits" is not specified, and the verse serves as a reminder of Allah's immense power and wisdom in creating the universe and all that exists within it.
orig: ولقد خلقنا فوقكم سبع طرائق وما كنا عن الخلق غافلين

translation: And We have sent down water from the sky in due measure, and We lodged it within the earth, and verily, We are Able to take it away.
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of His power and control over the water cycle. The measured rainfall is a blessing from Him that allows life to thrive on Earth. However, He also has the ability to withhold this blessing, indicating that we should be grateful and not take His provisions for granted.
orig: وأنزلنا من السماء ماء بقدر فأسكناه في الأرض وإنا على ذهاب به لقادرون

translation: So We produced for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines wherein for you are abundant fruits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings upon humans by providing them with gardens of palm trees and grapevines that yield abundant fruits for their sustenance and nourishment. It emphasizes the divine favor and providence in creating these fruitful gardens for the benefit of mankind.
orig: فأنشأنا لكم به جنات من نخيل وأعناب لكم فيها فواكه كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and relish for the eaters.
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessed olive tree that grows on Mount Sinai. The olive tree is a source of oil, which is a blessing from Allah. The olive and its oil are also described as a "relish" or condiment for those who consume it, indicating its pleasant taste and nutritional value.
orig: وشجرة تخرج من طور سيناء تنبت بالدهن وصبغ للآكلين

translation: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense benefits and lessons humans can derive from grazing livestock. It emphasizes that Allah has provided nourishment for humans through the milk present in the bellies of these animals. Moreover, livestock offers numerous advantages, including serving as a source of food for humans. This verse encourages contemplation on Allah's blessings manifested in the creation of livestock for the sustenance and benefit of humankind.
orig: وإن لكم في الأنعام لعبرة نسقيكم مما في بطونها ولكم فيها منافع كثيرة ومنها تأكلون

translation: And on it (the earth) and on the ships you are carried.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah upon humankind by providing the means of transportation and sustenance through the earth and ships. It emphasizes that both the land and sea are utilized for human benefit, carrying people and goods across vast distances. The verse encourages gratitude towards the Creator for facilitating travel and trade through these natural resources.
orig: وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون

translation: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, 'O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of monotheism (Tawheed) that was conveyed by Prophet Noah to his people. He called upon them to worship Allah alone, as there is no other true deity worthy of worship besides Him. Noah warned them against associating partners with Allah and urged them to have fear and consciousness of Allah, the One True God.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: But the chiefs of those who disbelieved from his people said, 'This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take superiority over you. And if Allah had willed, He could have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.'
interpretation: The disbelieving leaders of his people mocked Prophet Noah and accused him of seeking superiority over them by claiming to be a messenger of Allah. They argued that if Allah truly wanted to send messengers, He would have sent angels instead of a human being like themselves. They also claimed that this message contradicted the beliefs of their ancestors, implying that they would not accept something new that went against their traditions.
orig: فقال الملأ الذين كفروا من قومه ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يريد أن يتفضل عليكم ولو شاء الله لأنزل ملائكة ما سمعنا بهذا في آبائنا الأولين

translation: He is but a man possessed with madness, so wait for him for a time.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was accused of being insane or possessed by some of his opponents. However, it instructs the believers to be patient and wait, as the truth of his prophethood will become evident with time.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل به جنة فتربصوا به حتى حين

translation: He said: 'My Lord, help me against their calling me a liar.'
interpretation: The Prophet is asking Allah for help and support against those who deny and reject his message, accusing him of falsehood. He seeks Allah's aid in facing the opposition and hostility of the disbelievers.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: So We inspired him, saying: 'Construct the ship under Our Eyes and Our Inspiration. Then, when Our Command comes and the oven gushes forth, take on board a pair from every species, and your family - except those against whom the Word has already gone forth. And do not address Me concerning those who did wrong; they shall be drowned.'
interpretation: Allah commanded Nuh (Noah) to build the ark under His watchful eye and guidance. When the time came for the flood to begin, as signified by the "oven gushing forth," Nuh was instructed to take pairs of every creature onto the ark, along with his family members who believed, except those who had already been decreed as disbelievers and would be drowned. Nuh was also commanded not to plead with Allah for the salvation of the wrongdoers, as their fate had been sealed.
orig: فأوحينا إليه أن اصنع الفلك بأعيننا ووحينا فإذا جاء أمرنا وفار التنور فاسلك فيها من كل زوجين اثنين وأهلك إلا من سبق عليه القول منهم ولا تخاطبني في الذين ظلموا إنهم مغرقون

translation: So when you have embarked upon the ship, you and whoever is with you, then say, 'Praise be to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to praise and thank Allah when they have safely boarded a ship and are ready to set sail, acknowledging that it is through Allah's protection and mercy that they have been saved from the oppressive and unjust people who were persecuting them.
orig: فإذا استويت أنت ومن معك على الفلك فقل الحمد لله الذي نجانا من القوم الظالمين

translation: And say, 'My Lord, cause me to land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best of those who cause to land.'
interpretation: This verse is a prayer for guidance and a safe journey to the destination. It encourages the believer to seek Allah's help in reaching a blessed and prosperous place, and to rely on Him as the best guide and protector during the journey of life.
orig: وقل رب أنزلني منزلا مباركا وأنت خير المنزلين

translation: Verily, in that are Signs, and though We were surely testing.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that the events and situations mentioned previously, whether trials or blessings, contain signs and proofs of Allah's wisdom, power, and divine will. They serve as tests and means of spiritual growth for believers, allowing them to demonstrate patience, gratitude, and trust in Allah."
orig: إن في ذلك لآيات وإن كنا لمبتلين

translation: Then We raised after them another generation.
interpretation: "After the destruction of the previous nations who denied the messengers, Allah created new generations and peoples to succeed them on earth, giving them the chance to believe and follow the guidance."
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرنا آخرين

translation: So We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], 'Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the importance of worshipping Allah alone and rejecting any form of polytheism or idolatry. It highlights that Allah sent messengers from among the people themselves to guide them towards monotheism and the sincere worship of the One True God. The verse serves as a reminder to have consciousness of Allah and to refrain from associating partners with Him out of fear and reverence for His Majesty.
orig: فأرسلنا فيهم رسولا منهم أن اعبدوا الله ما لكم من إله غيره أفلا تتقون

translation: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had bestowed upon them luxury in the worldly life, said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat, and he drinks of what you drink."
interpretation: The interpretation is that the leaders and influential people among the disbelievers mocked the Prophet and rejected the idea of the Hereafter and accountability before God. They pointed out that he was just a human being like themselves, eating and drinking the same things, implying that he could not be a messenger from God. This shows their arrogance, materialism, and lack of faith in the divine message.
orig: وقال الملأ من قومه الذين كفروا وكذبوا بلقاء الآخرة وأترفناهم في الحياة الدنيا ما هذا إلا بشر مثلكم يأكل مما تأكلون منه ويشرب مما تشربون

translation: And if you obey a man like yourselves, you would then indeed be losers.
interpretation: This verse warns against blindly following or obeying human beings who have no divine authority or guidance. It emphasizes that by submitting to the whims and desires of ordinary people like ourselves, we will ultimately suffer loss and deviate from the right path. The verse encourages us to seek guidance from the divine revelation and follow the teachings of the prophets sent by Allah, rather than being misled by those who have no divine knowledge or wisdom.
orig: ولئن أطعتم بشرا مثلكم إنكم إذا لخاسرون

translation: Does He promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones, you shall be brought forth?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers who deny the concept of resurrection after death. It highlights the power of Allah to bring people back to life after they have turned into dust and bones, which seems impossible to the disbelievers. The verse implies that Allah, Who created human beings from nothing, has the ability to resurrect them after their death and physical disintegration.
orig: أيعدكم أنكم إذا متم وكنتم ترابا وعظاما أنكم مخرجون

translation: Away, away from what you are promised!
interpretation: This verse dismisses and denies the promises made to the disbelievers of enjoying eternal bliss in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the futility and falsehood of such promises, as they will never be fulfilled. The repetition of the word "hayhata" (away, away) serves to further emphasize the rejection of their claims and the impossibility of their promised rewards.
orig: هيهات هيهات لما توعدون

translation: It is only our life of this world: We die and we live, and we shall not be raised up again.
interpretation: This verse is denying the concept of resurrection and life after death. It expresses the belief of those who think that this worldly life is the only existence, and that after death, there is no revival or accountability. The interpretation reflects a materialistic and atheistic view that rejects the idea of a Hereafter or any form of spiritual existence beyond the physical world.
orig: إن هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما نحن بمبعوثين

translation: He is not but a man who invents a lie about Allah, and we will not be believers in him.
interpretation: This verse implies that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was falsely accused of fabricating lies and attributing them to Allah. The disbelievers rejected his message, claiming that he was merely a man who had invented falsehoods about Allah, and they declared their refusal to believe in him or his teachings.
orig: إن هو إلا رجل افترى على الله كذبا وما نحن له بمؤمنين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, support me because they have denied me.'
interpretation: This verse is a supplication by a prophet (likely Prophet Muhammad) asking Allah for support and help against those who denied and rejected his message. It reflects the difficulties faced by prophets in conveying the truth and the opposition they encountered from their people. The prophet seeks Allah's assistance and strength to persevere in the face of disbelief and opposition.
orig: قال رب انصرني بما كذبون

translation: He said, "After a little, they will surely become regretful."
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who disbelieve or oppose the truth will eventually come to regret their actions and choices. It implies that a time will come when they will realize the consequences of their disbelief or opposition, leading to remorse and regret. The verse serves as a warning and a reminder that denying the truth has inevitable consequences that one may come to lament later.
orig: قال عما قليل ليصبحن نادمين

translation: Then the blast overtook them in truth, and We made them as rubbish of dead leaves. So away with the people who are wrongdoers.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah inflicted a severe punishment upon the disbelieving people who rejected the message of the Prophet. The "blast" or "cry" refers to a mighty sound or catastrophic event that struck them, destroying them utterly and leaving them like worthless debris or scattered dead leaves. This punishment came upon them justly for their wrongdoing and persistent rejection of the truth. The verse serves as a warning against arrogance, injustice, and disbelief, and highlights Allah's power to punish those who defy His commandments.
orig: فأخذتهم الصيحة بالحق فجعلناهم غثاء فبعدا للقوم الظالمين

translation: Then We raised after them other generations.
interpretation: Allah mentions in this verse that after the destruction of the previous nations due to their disbelief and sins, He created new generations of people to succeed them on earth. This indicates Allah's continuous renewal of life and His wisdom in giving chances to different peoples and civilizations throughout history.
orig: ثم أنشأنا من بعدهم قرونا آخرين

translation: No nation can precede its appointed term, nor can they remain thereafter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the idea that every nation and community has a predetermined lifespan and period of existence determined by Allah. They cannot hasten or delay their appointed time, as it is governed by the divine wisdom and decree of Allah. This serves as a reminder of Allah's absolute control over the fate of nations and the inevitability of their rise and fall according to His plan.
orig: ما تسبق من أمة أجلها وما يستأخرون

translation: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to the Fire], and We made them narrations; so away with a people who do not believe.
interpretation: Allah sent His messengers one after another to guide people, but each time a messenger came to a nation, they rejected and denied him. As a consequence, Allah caused those nations to follow one another in their misguidance and destruction. He made their stories and examples a lesson for those who came after them. This verse condemns those who persistently reject faith and guidance, declaring them as doomed and distanced from Allah's mercy.
orig: ثم أرسلنا رسلنا تترى كل ما جاء أمة رسولها كذبوه فأتبعنا بعضهم بعضا وجعلناهم أحاديث فبعدا لقوم لا يؤمنون

translation: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority
interpretation: Allah sent Moses and Aaron as messengers with clear miracles and proofs to support their message and authority from Allah. This verse highlights the divine support and empowerment given to the prophets to fulfill their mission of conveying Allah's message.
orig: ثم أرسلنا موسى وأخاه هارون بآياتنا وسلطان مبين
