translation: To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they behaved insolently and were an arrogant people.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and haughtiness of Pharaoh and his people when the message of truth was conveyed to them. Despite being presented with clear signs, they rejected the message out of pride and considered themselves superior to others. Their arrogance led them to persist in disbelief and disobedience, which ultimately led to their downfall.
orig: إلى فرعون وملئه فاستكبروا وكانوا قوما عالين

translation: So they said, 'Shall we believe in two human beings like ourselves while their people are subservient to us?'
interpretation: The disbelievers were questioning the idea of believing in two human messengers like themselves, when the people of those messengers were subservient and obedient to the disbelievers. They found it hard to accept guidance from those whom they considered inferior or subordinate to themselves.
orig: فقالوا أنؤمن لبشرين مثلنا وقومهما لنا عابدون

translation: But they denied them, so they were among those who were destroyed.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who rejected the warnings and messages of the Prophets faced destruction and ruin as a consequence of their denial and disbelief. It serves as a lesson that rejecting divine guidance and truth can lead to severe consequences and a tragic end.
orig: فكذبوهما فكانوا من المهلكين

translation: And indeed, We gave Moses the Book, that they might be guided.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah bestowing the Torah upon Prophet Moses as a guidance for the Children of Israel. The "Book" mentioned here is the Torah, which contained laws, commandments, and teachings to guide the Israelites towards righteousness and the worship of the One True God. By providing this divine revelation, Allah aimed to lead them away from misguidance and towards the straight path.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب لعلهم يهتدون

translation: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and We gave them refuge on a high ground having level areas and springs of flowing water.
interpretation: Allah made Isa (Jesus) and his mother Maryam (Mary) a great sign and miracle for humanity, demonstrating His power to create life without a father. He granted them security and provisions on a fertile land with resources and flowing water, protecting them from harm and providing for their needs.
orig: وجعلنا ابن مريم وأمه آية وآويناهما إلى ربوة ذات قرار ومعين

translation: O you Messengers! Eat of the good things and do righteous deeds. Surely, I am All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse is an exhortation to the Messengers of Allah to partake of the lawful and pure provisions, and to perform righteous deeds. It reminds them that Allah is fully aware of all their actions, and that they should strive to please Him through their conduct and deeds.
orig: يا أيها الرسل كلوا من الطيبات واعملوا صالحا إني بما تعملون عليم

translation: And indeed this, your community, is one community, and I am your Lord, so fear Me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unity of the Muslim community (ummah) and their shared belief in the Oneness of God (Allah). It reminds believers that they belong to a single community of faith, united by their submission to the One Lord. The verse calls upon them to maintain consciousness of God and to have reverence and obedience towards Him.
orig: وإن هذه أمتكم أمة واحدة وأنا ربكم فاتقون

translation: But they divided their affair among themselves into portions, [allocating] to each group among them a share of what they had done, so they would rejoice.
interpretation: This verse refers to how the disbelievers divided and differed among themselves regarding their beliefs and practices, each group taking pride and rejoicing in their own portion or share of falsehood and misguidance, without realizing the truth.
orig: فتقطعوا أمرهم بينهم زبرا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: So leave them in their confusion for a time
interpretation: This verse suggests leaving the disbelievers and wrongdoers in their state of misguidance and error for a while, allowing them time to reflect and potentially recognize the truth. It implies giving them a respite before facing the consequences of their actions. However, this respite is temporary, and they will ultimately be held accountable.
orig: فذرهم في غمرتهم حتى حين

translation: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children
interpretation: This verse questions the misguided belief of those who think that the wealth and children Allah has bestowed upon them are a sign of His favor and pleasure with them. It implies that such blessings should not make them arrogant or ungrateful, as they are merely tests and trials from Allah.
orig: أيحسبون أنما نمدهم به من مال وبنين

translation: We hasten for them in good things, but they do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's abundant blessings and favors upon humans, which are bestowed upon them constantly without their full realization or appreciation. Despite Allah's continuous provision of goodness, many people remain unaware or ungrateful for these blessings.
orig: نسارع لهم في الخيرات بل لا يشعرون

translation: Indeed, those who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have a deep reverence and awe for Allah, their Creator, and are constantly mindful of His greatness and their accountability to Him. They live with a sense of trepidation, fearing His displeasure and punishment for any wrongdoing. Their hearts are filled with a profound respect and consciousness of Allah's majesty, which motivates them to obey His commands and refrain from disobedience.
orig: إن الذين هم من خشية ربهم مشفقون

translation: And those who believe in the signs of their Lord,
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have faith in the revelations and signs from Allah. They are the ones who recognize and affirm the divine signs and proofs that Allah has sent down, such as the Qur'an, the miracles of the prophets, and the signs in the universe that point to the existence and greatness of the Creator. Their belief in these signs strengthens their faith and guides them towards righteousness.
orig: والذين هم بآيات ربهم يؤمنون

translation: And those who do not associate anything with their Lord
interpretation: This verse refers to those who maintain pure monotheism and do not associate any partners or equals with Allah in worship or divinity. It praises those who reject polytheism (shirk) and idolatry, dedicating their belief and devotion solely to the One True God.
orig: والذين هم بربهم لا يشركون

translation: And those who give what they give while their hearts tremble because they are returning to their Lord
interpretation: This verse refers to those who give charity with a sincere and humble heart, fearing Allah and hoping for His reward. Their hearts "tremble" out of awe and reverence for Allah, knowing that they will ultimately return to Him and account for their deeds. It highlights the importance of having the right intention and humility when giving charity, rather than doing it for show or self-interest.
orig: والذين يؤتون ما آتوا وقلوبهم وجلة أنهم إلى ربهم راجعون

translation: Those hasten in good deeds, and they outstrip others therein.
interpretation: This verse highlights the eagerness and diligence of the believers in performing righteous deeds. They are not only keen to do good works, but they also strive to excel others in doing so. It emphasizes the importance of being proactive and taking the lead in virtuous actions, rather than being complacent or waiting for others to initiate them.
orig: أولئك يسارعون في الخيرات وهم لها سابقون

translation: And We task not any soul beyond its capacity. And with Us is a record which speaks the truth, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: Allah does not burden any soul with obligations beyond its capacity and ability. With Allah is a preserved record that speaks the truth about everyone's deeds, and no one will be wronged or treated unjustly on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولا نكلف نفسا إلا وسعها ولدينا كتاب ينطق بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: But their hearts are in confused ignorance of this, and there are, besides that, deeds of theirs, which they will [continue to] do,
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers' hearts are in a state of confusion and ignorance regarding the truth of the Qur'an and its teachings. They are engrossed in their own misguided beliefs and practices, and they continue to engage in sinful deeds that contradict the guidance provided by Allah.
orig: بل قلوبهم في غمرة من هذا ولهم أعمال من دون ذلك هم لها عاملون

translation: Until, when We seize those who were indulged in luxury with punishment, they will then be crying for help.
interpretation: This verse implies that those who were living in luxury and indulgence, neglecting their duties towards Allah, will ultimately face punishment. When that punishment seizes them, they will cry out for help and assistance, but it will be too late. The verse serves as a warning to not become heedless and arrogant due to worldly pleasures, as that will lead to a severe reckoning.
orig: حتى إذا أخذنا مترفيهم بالعذاب إذا هم يجأرون

translation: Do not be arrogant today. You will not be helped against Us.
interpretation: This verse is a warning against arrogance and pride. It reminds us that no matter how powerful or successful we may become, we should never become arrogant or boastful, for our success ultimately comes from Allah. We cannot overcome Allah's will or His decree, and on the Day of Judgment, our arrogance will not benefit us in any way. The verse calls for humility, gratitude, and submission to Allah's commands.
orig: لا تجأروا اليوم إنكم منا لا تنصرون

translation: Indeed, My verses used to be recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heels,
interpretation: This verse is a rebuke from Allah to those who rejected faith and turned away from the signs and revelations presented to them. Despite having the opportunity to listen to the verses of the Qur'an being recited to them, they stubbornly rejected them and persisted in their disbelief, turning back on their heels and retreating from the truth.
orig: قد كانت آياتي تتلى عليكم فكنتم على أعقابكم تنكصون

translation: Being arrogant, you spend the night in revelry
interpretation: This verse condemns the arrogant and haughty behavior of those who indulge in sinful and wasteful activities at night, spending their time in revelry and disobedience instead of worshipping Allah and being mindful of Him. It criticizes their arrogance and pride which leads them to such undesirable conduct.
orig: مستكبرين به سامرا تهجرون

translation: Do they not ponder over the Qur'an, or have there come to them something which did not come to their forefathers of old?
interpretation: This verse questions the attitude of those who reject the message of the Qur'an. It asks whether they have genuinely reflected upon and contemplated the words of the Qur'an, or if their rejection stems from the fact that this message is something new and unprecedented, which their ancestors did not receive before.
orig: أفلم يدبروا القول أم جاءهم ما لم يأت آباءهم الأولين

translation: Or do they not recognize their Messenger, so they are rejecting him?
interpretation: This verse implies that those who reject the Messenger are doing so out of arrogance and stubbornness, not because they truly do not recognize him as a Messenger from God. It suggests that deep down they know he is truthful, but they deny it due to their pride and unwillingness to submit to God's guidance.
orig: أم لم يعرفوا رسولهم فهم له منكرون

translation: Or do they say, "He is a madman possessed?" Rather, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers accused the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of being possessed by a jinn or being insane. However, the verse refutes this claim by stating that he has brought them the truth, which is the Qur'an and the message of Islam, but most of them reject it out of hatred, stubbornness, and dislike for the truth.
orig: أم يقولون به جنة بل جاءهم بالحق وأكثرهم للحق كارهون

translation: And if the truth had followed their desires, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their reminder, but they turn away from their reminder.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the truth revealed by Allah, rather than following one's own desires or whims. If the truth were to conform to people's desires and inclinations, it would lead to corruption and chaos in the heavens, the earth, and among all creatures. However, Allah has provided humans with the reminder, which is the guidance and teachings contained in the revealed scriptures. Unfortunately, many people turn away from this reminder and reject it, preferring to follow their own desires instead.
orig: ولو اتبع الحق أهواءهم لفسدت السماوات والأرض ومن فيهن بل أتيناهم بذكرهم فهم عن ذكرهم معرضون

translation: Or is it that you ask them for payment, so the payment of your Lord is better, and He is the best of providers?
interpretation: This verse is addressing the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and questioning whether he is asking for a payment or reward from people in exchange for conveying the message of Islam. It emphasizes that any reward or provision from Allah is far better than what people can offer, as He is the Best of providers who sustains all creation.
orig: أم تسألهم خرجا فخراج ربك خير وهو خير الرازقين

translation: And verily, you (O Muhammad) are indeed guiding (mankind) to the Straight Path (i.e. the way of Allah).
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad was guided by Allah to call people to the Straight Path, which is the true religion of Islam and the way that leads to Allah's pleasure and Paradise. It emphasizes the Prophet's role as a guide and teacher, inviting humanity to the right path and the worship of the One True God.
orig: وإنك لتدعوهم إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the straight path.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of believing in the Hereafter, the life after death. Those who reject this belief are described as "deviating from the straight path," which means they have strayed from the right guidance and the path that leads to salvation and eternal bliss. Their disbelief in the Hereafter has caused them to deviate from the true purpose of life and follow misguided ways that will ultimately lead them to a state of loss and regret.
orig: وإن الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة عن الصراط لناكبون

translation: And if We had mercy upon them and removed the distress that is upon them, they would persist in their insolent behavior, wandering blindly.
interpretation: This verse indicates that if God were to relieve the disbelievers of their difficulties and grant them mercy, they would continue in their arrogance and rebellion against Him, straying aimlessly without guidance, instead of being grateful and submitting to Him.
orig: ولو رحمناهم وكشفنا ما بهم من ضر للجوا في طغيانهم يعمهون

translation: And We had certainly seized them with suffering, but they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor did they supplicate.
interpretation: This verse indicates that despite facing punishment and suffering, the people referred to remained arrogant and did not submit humbly to God, nor did they earnestly implore Him and seek His forgiveness. It highlights their stubborn rejection of guidance and unwillingness to turn to their Lord in humility and repentance, even when afflicted with hardship.
orig: ولقد أخذناهم بالعذاب فما استكانوا لربهم وما يتضرعون

translation: Until, when We open upon them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be in despair within it.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who persist in disbelief and denial of the truth. When Allah opens the door of intense torment upon them, they will find themselves in utter despair, unable to escape or find relief from the punishment they face. It serves as a reminder of the grave consequences of rejecting faith and highlights the importance of heeding the divine guidance before it is too late.
orig: حتى إذا فتحنا عليهم بابا ذا عذاب شديد إذا هم فيه مبلسون

translation: And it is He who has produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's great blessings upon us, by giving us the faculties of hearing, sight, and intellect. However, most people do not appreciate or thank Allah for these immense favors. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of gratitude and recognizing Allah's bounties upon us, which we often take for granted.
orig: وهو الذي أنشأ لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And it is He who has dispersed you on the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse indicates that it is Allah who has spread and dispersed human beings across the vast expanse of the earth. It implies that the presence of humans in different regions and lands is by Allah's will and design. However, the verse also conveys that ultimately, all human beings will be gathered before Allah on the Day of Resurrection to account for their deeds and beliefs. The dispersal and gathering mentioned in this verse signify Allah's supreme power and authority over the creation and the inevitability of being held accountable before Him.
orig: وهو الذي ذرأكم في الأرض وإليه تحشرون

translation: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness and Sovereignty of Allah over all creation. He alone has the power to give life and cause death, and it is He who causes the alternation of night and day, a sign of His great wisdom and might. The verse calls upon human beings to use their intellect and reasoning to recognize the clear signs of Allah's existence and power, and to submit to Him in worship.
orig: وهو الذي يحيي ويميت وله اختلاف الليل والنهار أفلا تعقلون

translation: Rather, they say the like of what the former people said.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers of the Prophet Muhammad's time were repeating the same false arguments and denials that were made by previous nations towards their prophets. It implies that their rejection was not based on sound reasoning, but rather a stubbornness and arrogance similar to those who came before them, dismissing the truth without proper consideration.
orig: بل قالوا مثل ما قال الأولون

translation: They say, "When we have become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected anew?"
interpretation: This verse expresses the disbelief and skepticism of the deniers regarding the concept of resurrection after death. They find it inconceivable that once they have turned into dust and scattered bones, they could be brought back to life again. The verse highlights their limited understanding and inability to grasp the power and capability of Allah to resurrect and recreate them.
orig: قالوا أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون

translation: We have certainly been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking and rejecting the message of the Qur'an and the idea of resurrection and accountability in the Hereafter. They claim that these concepts were merely ancient fables and myths passed down from previous generations, dismissing them as "legends of the former peoples." The interpretation highlights their arrogant rejection of the truth and their stubbornness in clinging to their disbelief.
orig: لقد وعدنا نحن وآباؤنا هذا من قبل إن هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: Say, 'To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?'
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question about the ownership and sovereignty of the earth and all that exists within it. The implied answer is that everything belongs to Allah, the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. This question challenges the listener to reflect on the undeniable reality of Allah's absolute dominion over all of creation, and to recognize their own position as humble servants and vicegerents of the true Owner.
orig: قل لمن الأرض ومن فيها إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: They will say, 'To Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not receive admonition?'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a rhetorical question posed to those who associate partners with Allah. It implies that even though they acknowledge Allah as the Creator, they fail to take heed and worship Him alone. The verse aims to make them reflect on their contradictory beliefs and actions, and to admonish them to abandon polytheism and turn to the sincere worship of the One True God.
orig: سيقولون لله قل أفلا تذكرون

translation: Say: "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the Great Throne?"
interpretation: This verse calls upon the Prophet Muhammad to proclaim that Allah alone is the Lord and Sovereign of the seven heavens and the Great Throne, which represents His supreme authority and dominion over all of creation. It affirms Allah's absolute power and majesty, and emphasizes the importance of recognizing and submitting to His Lordship.
orig: قل من رب السماوات السبع ورب العرش العظيم

translation: They will say, 'It is to Allah.' Say, 'Then will you not fear Him?'
interpretation: This verse suggests that people attribute everything to Allah, yet they do not have the appropriate reverence and fear of Him. It is a call to have taqwa (consciousness of Allah) and to act accordingly, rather than merely paying lip service to the belief in Allah's Lordship.
orig: سيقولون لله قل أفلا تتقون

translation: Say, 'In whose Hand is the sovereignty of all things, and He protects while none can protect against Him, if you should know?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty and power of Allah over all things. It asserts that the dominion and control of everything in existence lies solely in Allah's Hand. He is the Supreme Protector who guards and preserves all, while nothing and no one can offer protection against Him or His decree. This verse invites reflection on Allah's unparalleled might and authority over the entire universe and all that exists within it.
orig: قل من بيده ملكوت كل شيء وهو يجير ولا يجار عليه إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: They will say, 'To Allah,' say, 'Then how are you deluded?'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers will falsely claim that their worship is directed towards Allah, but the Prophet is instructed to question how they can be so deluded when their actions contradict true worship of the One God.
orig: سيقولون لله قل فأنى تسحرون

translation: Nay, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah has sent the truth through His messengers and revelations, but the disbelievers persist in rejecting it and lying against it out of arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: بل أتيناهم بالحق وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. If there had been, then each deity would have taken away what it had created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and refutes the concept of Him having a son or partner. If there were multiple deities, each would try to dominate the others and protect its own creations, leading to chaos and conflict. Allah is far above the polytheistic beliefs that associate partners with Him.
orig: ما اتخذ الله من ولد وما كان معه من إله إذا لذهب كل إله بما خلق ولعلا بعضهم على بعض سبحان الله عما يصفون

translation: The Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so exalted is He above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute knowledge of everything, whether unseen or witnessed. It establishes His transcendence above the polytheistic beliefs of associating partners with Him. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's unique, all-encompassing knowledge and His sublime nature, far removed from any form of shirk (associating others with Him).
orig: عالم الغيب والشهادة فتعالى عما يشركون

translation: Say, 'My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised...'
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is being commanded by Allah to pray and ask Him to show him the punishment that has been promised to the disbelievers, if that is His will. This verse highlights the Prophet's desire to witness the fulfillment of Allah's promises and his trust in Allah's power and wisdom.
orig: قل رب إما تريني ما يوعدون

translation: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people
interpretation: The speaker is humbly asking Allah not to let him become like the wrongdoers and oppressors, who have strayed from the right path. It is a plea for guidance and protection from injustice and misguidance.
orig: رب فلا تجعلني في القوم الظالمين

translation: And indeed, We are Able to show you what We have promised them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has the power and ability to fulfill His promises to the believers regarding the punishment of the disbelievers and the establishment of truth and justice. It emphasizes Allah's capability and control over all affairs, reassuring the believers that His promises will undoubtedly be fulfilled, despite the apparent strength and arrogance of the disbelievers.
orig: وإنا على أن نريك ما نعدهم لقادرون

translation: Repel the evil deed with one which is better, We are Well-Acquainted with the things they attribute (to Us).
interpretation: This verse encourages responding to harm with kindness and patience, rather than retaliation. It advises Muslims to meet evil with good, as Allah is fully aware of the false accusations made against Him and His teachings.
orig: ادفع بالتي هي أحسن السيئة نحن أعلم بما يصفون

translation: And say, 'My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to seek protection from Allah against the evil whispers, insinuations, and provocations of the devils (shayatin), which can lead one astray from the right path. It emphasizes the importance of relying on Allah's guidance and seeking refuge in Him to guard oneself against the deceptive tactics of the devils, who strive to misguide humans.
orig: وقل رب أعوذ بك من همزات الشياطين

translation: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they should be present.
interpretation: The speaker is seeking protection from Allah against the presence or attendance of certain individuals or beings, perhaps those who may cause harm or distress. This could be a supplication for safety and security from any potential threats or undesirable company.
orig: وأعوذ بك رب أن يحضرون

translation: Until, when death comes to one of them, he says: 'My Lord, send me back'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who, upon facing death, will ask to be sent back to the worldly life, realizing the truth but too late. Their request will be denied because it is insincere, stemming from fear of punishment rather than genuine faith. The verse highlights the temporary nature of this world and the inevitability of the Hereafter, urging people to prepare for it while they can.
orig: حتى إذا جاء أحدهم الموت قال رب ارجعون

translation: So that I might do righteous deeds in what I have left behind. No! It is but a word he is to say, and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbeliever will falsely claim that he wants to do good deeds after death, but this is just an empty statement with no weight. There is a barrier between this life and the Hereafter that prevents any further chance after death. One's fate is sealed upon death, and the Day of Resurrection is when all will be judged for their deeds.
orig: لعلي أعمل صالحا فيما تركت كلا إنها كلمة هو قائلها ومن ورائهم برزخ إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: So when the Trumpet is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.
interpretation: On the Day of Resurrection, when the Trumpet is blown to signal the end of this world, all family ties and blood relations will be severed. People will be too preoccupied with their own fate to inquire about or care for their relatives.
orig: فإذا نفخ في الصور فلا أنساب بينهم يومئذ ولا يتساءلون

translation: Then those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds], it is they who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, those whose good deeds outweigh their evil deeds will be the ones who have attained true success and salvation. The weighing of deeds symbolizes the ultimate accountability before God, where one's faith and righteous actions will determine their eternal destiny. The "heavy scales" represent an abundance of virtuous conduct, implying that true success lies in living a life of obedience to God and service to humanity.
orig: فمن ثقلت موازينه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost themselves, [abiding] in Hell eternally.
interpretation: This verse warns of the grave consequence for those whose good deeds are outweighed by their evil deeds on the Day of Judgment. It states that those whose scales are light, meaning their good deeds do not outweigh their sins, are the ones who have ruined themselves and will abide eternally in the torment of Hellfire as a result of their own actions and choices in this worldly life.
orig: ومن خفت موازينه فأولئك الذين خسروا أنفسهم في جهنم خالدون

translation: The Fire will burn their faces, and they will grin with displaced lips.
interpretation: This verse depicts the severe punishment that the disbelievers will face in Hellfire. Their faces will be scorched by the intense flames, causing their lips to be distorted in a grotesque manner, resembling the grimace of a person with protruding teeth. This vivid description highlights the excruciating physical and psychological torment they will endure as a consequence of their rejection of faith and righteous conduct in this worldly life.
orig: تلفح وجوههم النار وهم فيها كالحون

translation: Were not My verses recited to you, but you used to deny them?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question from Allah to the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment, reminding them that clear signs and revelations were sent to them during their worldly life, but they arrogantly rejected and denied them. It implies that they have no excuse for their disbelief, as the truth was made evident to them, yet they chose to turn away from it.
orig: ألم تكن آياتي تتلى عليكم فكنتم بها تكذبون

translation: They will say: 'Our Lord! Our misery overcame us, and we were a people astray.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the regret and remorse that the disbelievers will feel on the Day of Judgment. They will acknowledge that their own wretchedness and misguidance led them to reject faith and follow the path of disbelief. The interpretation highlights the importance of seeking guidance and avoiding arrogance, which can lead one astray from the straight path.
orig: قالوا ربنا غلبت علينا شقوتنا وكنا قوما ضالين

translation: Our Lord, take us out of this; then if we return [to evil], we will indeed be wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse expresses a sincere prayer to Allah, asking Him to guide them away from the path of wrongdoing and help them remain steadfast on the righteous path. It acknowledges that if they were to return to their previous sinful ways after being guided, then they would truly be oppressors against themselves and deserving of punishment.
orig: ربنا أخرجنا منها فإن عدنا فإنا ظالمون

translation: He (Allah) will say, "Be you humiliated therein, and speak not to Me."
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, Allah will command the disbelievers to enter Hell in a state of humiliation and disgrace. They will be silenced and not given the opportunity to make any excuses or pleas, as their fate has already been sealed due to their rejection of faith and righteous deeds in the worldly life.
orig: قال اخسئوا فيها ولا تكلمون

translation: Indeed, there was a group of My servants who used to say, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of sincere believers who humbly turned to Allah, acknowledging their faith and seeking His forgiveness and mercy. It highlights the importance of having a humble attitude, recognizing one's shortcomings, and seeking Allah's forgiveness and compassion, as He is the most Merciful.
orig: إنه كان فريق من عبادي يقولون ربنا آمنا فاغفر لنا وارحمنا وأنت خير الراحمين

translation: So you took them in mockery until they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.
interpretation: This verse is reprimanding those who mock and ridicule the believers. They made fun of the believers to the point that it caused them to forget Allah's remembrance and worship. Instead of taking heed, they laughed at the believers, which is a grave sin.
orig: فاتخذتموهم سخريا حتى أنسوكم ذكري وكنتم منهم تضحكون

translation: Indeed, I have rewarded them today for their patience - they are the attainers of success
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who patiently endured difficulties and persevered in faith have been rewarded by God on this day, making them the ultimate victors and successful ones. It implies that patience in the face of adversity and remaining steadfast in one's beliefs is highly valued by God, and those who exhibit such qualities will be granted triumph and salvation.
orig: إني جزيتهم اليوم بما صبروا أنهم هم الفائزون

translation: He (Allah) said, 'How long did you remain on earth in number of years?'
interpretation: This verse is referring to a dialogue between Allah and the resurrected souls on the Day of Judgment. Allah is asking them about the duration of their worldly life, which was but a brief period compared to the eternal life of the Hereafter. The verse reminds us that our life in this world is temporary and fleeting, and that we should strive to make the most of it by obeying Allah and preparing for the everlasting life to come.
orig: قال كم لبثتم في الأرض عدد سنين

translation: They said, 'We remained a day or part of a day; so ask the enumerators.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who were resurrected after a long period of sleep were uncertain about the duration of their slumber. They could not comprehend the passage of time, indicating that their perception of time was distorted during their state of unconsciousness or dormancy. The verse invites us to seek knowledge from those who have the ability to accurately measure and account for time, implying that our limited human perception may not always align with objective reality.
orig: قالوا لبثنا يوما أو بعض يوم فاسأل العادين

translation: He (Allah) will say, 'You remained not but a little - if only you had known.'
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the brevity of our worldly life and the importance of being mindful of the Hereafter. It suggests that our time on earth is fleeting, and we should make the most of it by living righteously and preparing for the eternal life to come. The verse also implies that if we truly understood the ephemeral nature of this world, we would have acted differently and focused more on the everlasting reward in the Hereafter.
orig: قال إن لبثتم إلا قليلا لو أنكم كنتم تعلمون

translation: Did you think that We created you uselessly, and that you would not be returned to Us?
interpretation: This verse questions the belief that human existence has no purpose and that there is no accountability in the Hereafter. It emphasizes that the creation of humans is not in vain or without a wise purpose, and that everyone will ultimately return to Allah for judgment and recompense.
orig: أفحسبتم أنما خلقناكم عبثا وأنكم إلينا لا ترجعون

translation: So high exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. There is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.
interpretation: This verse glorifies Allah as the one true God, the Sovereign and absolute Truth. It negates the existence of any other deity besides Him, and affirms that He alone is the Lord of the Noble Throne, which represents His supreme authority and majesty.
orig: فتعالى الله الملك الحق لا إله إلا هو رب العرش الكريم

translation: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which there is no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah in worship, as there is no proof or evidence to support the existence of any other deity worthy of worship besides Him. It states that those who commit this sin of shirk (associating others with Allah) will be held accountable before Allah on the Day of Judgment, and the disbelievers who persist in this grave error will ultimately fail and not attain success or salvation.
orig: ومن يدع مع الله إلها آخر لا برهان له به فإنما حسابه عند ربه إنه لا يفلح الكافرون

translation: And say, 'My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for You are the best of the merciful.'
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to humbly seek forgiveness and mercy from Allah, acknowledging His supreme mercy and compassion. It reminds us to turn to Allah in repentance and to trust in His boundless grace and forgiveness, as He is the most Merciful of those who show mercy.
orig: وقل رب اغفر وارحم وأنت خير الراحمين

translation: A Surah which We have sent down and which We have ordained in it clear Ayat in order that you may receive admonition.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah that contains clear and unambiguous signs and commands. Its purpose is to remind people of Allah's guidance and admonish them to follow the right path. The Qur'an serves as a source of enlightenment and a means to attain righteousness by pondering over its verses and adhering to its teachings.
orig: سورة أنزلناها وفرضناها وأنزلنا فيها آيات بينات لعلكم تذكرون

translation: The woman and the man guilty of illegal sexual intercourse, flog each of them with a hundred stripes. Let not pity withhold you in their case, in a punishment prescribed by Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a party of the believers witness their punishment.
interpretation: This verse prescribes the punishment of flogging with 100 lashes for those who commit zina (illegal sexual intercourse). It emphasizes that this punishment should be carried out strictly without being swayed by feelings of pity or sympathy, as it is a command from Allah. The punishment should also be witnessed by a group of believers to ensure transparency and serve as a deterrent.
orig: الزانية والزاني فاجلدوا كل واحد منهما مائة جلدة ولا تأخذكم بهما رأفة في دين الله إن كنتم تؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر وليشهد عذابهما طائفة من المؤمنين

translation: The fornicator does not marry except a fornicatress or an idolatress, and the fornicatress is married only by a fornicator or an idolater. That has been prohibited for the believers.
interpretation: This verse sets moral guidelines for marriage, prohibiting believers from marrying fornicators or idolaters. It suggests that those who engage in immoral acts like fornication or idolatry are more likely to be compatible with others of similar disposition. The verse aims to preserve the moral and spiritual integrity of the Muslim community by discouraging marriages that could lead to further immorality or disbelief.
orig: الزاني لا ينكح إلا زانية أو مشركة والزانية لا ينكحها إلا زان أو مشرك وحرم ذلك على المؤمنين

translation: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not ever accept from them testimony. And those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse establishes the severe punishment of eighty lashes for anyone who falsely accuses a chaste woman of adultery without providing four witnesses to support the claim. It also declares that such accusers are considered "defiantly disobedient" against Allah, and their testimony is to be rejected entirely in any matter. This ruling upholds the honor and dignity of virtuous women and deters slanderous accusations without proper evidence.
orig: والذين يرمون المحصنات ثم لم يأتوا بأربعة شهداء فاجلدوهم ثمانين جلدة ولا تقبلوا لهم شهادة أبدا وأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Except for those who repent after that and reform themselves, for indeed Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness for those who sincerely repent and mend their ways. It emphasizes that no sin is unforgivable as long as one genuinely seeks Allah's pardon, abandons the sinful act, and strives to reform oneself. The door of repentance is always open, and Allah's compassion embraces those who turn back to Him with remorse and a commitment to righteous conduct.
orig: إلا الذين تابوا من بعد ذلك وأصلحوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.
interpretation: This verse discusses the case of a husband accusing his wife of adultery without having witnesses to support his claim. In such a situation, the husband's testimony alone is not sufficient. Instead, he must swear four times by Allah that he is truthful in his accusation. This procedure, known as li'an, allows for the resolution of marital disputes involving allegations of infidelity when there is a lack of external evidence.
orig: والذين يرمون أزواجهم ولم يكن لهم شهداء إلا أنفسهم فشهادة أحدهم أربع شهادات بالله إنه لمن الصادقين

translation: And the fifth (oath) should be that the Curse of Allah be upon him if he is one of the liars.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the case of li'an (mutual cursing) between a husband and wife when the husband accuses his wife of adultery without having four witnesses. It outlines the fifth and final oath the husband must take, invoking Allah's curse upon himself if he is lying in his accusation.
orig: والخامسة أن لعنت الله عليه إن كان من الكاذبين

translation: But she shall avert the punishment from herself if she bears witness four times by Allah that (her husband) is telling a lie.
interpretation: This verse provides a way for a wife to avoid punishment for adultery if she swears four times by Allah that her husband is lying in accusing her of adultery. It establishes a legal process for resolving marital disputes involving accusations of infidelity.
orig: ويدرأ عنها العذاب أن تشهد أربع شهادات بالله إنه لمن الكاذبين

translation: And the fifth (punishment) should be that the Wrath of Allah be upon her if he (her husband) is one of the truthful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment prescribed for a wife who is accused of adultery by her husband, and she denies the accusation. If the husband swears four times and testifies that he is truthful in his accusation, then the fifth oath is that the Wrath of Allah be upon her if he is truthful in his accusation. This verse establishes the gravity of making false accusations and the importance of truthfulness in such serious matters.
orig: والخامسة أن غضب الله عليها إن كان من الصادقين

translation: And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, and that Allah is Oft-Returning (to mercy), All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense grace and mercy of Allah upon the believers. It emphasizes that if it were not for Allah's favor and compassion, as well as His quality of being the Acceptor of repentance and the All-Wise, the believers would have faced severe consequences for their shortcomings. The verse serves as a reminder to be grateful for Allah's boundless forgiveness and wisdom, and to strive to live according to His guidance.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله تواب حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a mighty punishment.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne que même si le mensonge et la calomnie peuvent sembler nuisibles au départ, ils permettent en réalité de distinguer les bons des mauvais croyants. Chacun sera jugé selon ses actes, et ceux qui ont propagé la calomnie recevront un châtiment sévère, proportionnel à leur implication dans ce péché grave.
orig: إن الذين جاءوا بالإفك عصبة منكم لا تحسبوه شرا لكم بل هو خير لكم لكل امرئ منهم ما اكتسب من الإثم والذي تولى كبره منهم له عذاب عظيم

translation: Why did the believing men and believing women not think good of themselves when you heard it and say, 'This is an obvious falsehood?'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the believers for not immediately dismissing the slanderous rumor about Aisha as a blatant lie. It suggests that they should have had more faith in their fellow believers and judged the situation more charitably.
orig: لولا إذ سمعتموه ظن المؤمنون والمؤمنات بأنفسهم خيرا وقالوا هذا إفك مبين

translation: Why did they not produce four witnesses for it? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allah, who are the liars.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of providing evidence and witnesses in cases of accusation. It states that if someone accuses another person of wrongdoing, they must provide four witnesses to support their claim. If they fail to produce the required witnesses, then they are considered liars in the sight of Allah. This verse upholds the principles of justice, truth, and the sanctity of one's honor and reputation in Islam.
orig: لولا جاءوا عليه بأربعة شهداء فإذ لم يأتوا بالشهداء فأولئك عند الله هم الكاذبون

translation: And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, a great punishment would have touched you for what you indulged in.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense grace and mercy of Allah upon the believers. Had it not been for Allah's favor and kindness in this life and the Hereafter, they would have faced severe punishment for the sins and wrongdoings they had engaged in. It serves as a reminder of Allah's infinite forgiveness and compassion towards those who repent and seek His guidance.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته في الدنيا والآخرة لمسكم في ما أفضتم فيه عذاب عظيم

translation: When you were propagating it with your tongues, and uttering with your mouths that whereof you had no knowledge, and you deemed it a light thing, while with Allah it was tremendous.
interpretation: This verse condemns the false allegations made by some people against Aisha, the wife of the Prophet Muhammad, may peace be upon him. It criticizes their spreading of rumors and accusations without any knowledge or proof, considering it a trivial matter, when in reality it is a grave sin in the sight of Allah.
orig: إذ تلقونه بألسنتكم وتقولون بأفواهكم ما ليس لكم به علم وتحسبونه هينا وهو عند الله عظيم

translation: And why, when you heard it, did you not say: 'It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander'?
interpretation: This verse reprimands the believers for not immediately rejecting the slanderous rumor about Aisha, the wife of the Prophet Muhammad. It reminds them that upon hearing such a grave accusation, they should have said: "It is not befitting for us to speak about this matter or spread this rumor. Glory be to You, O Allah, this is a great slander."
orig: ولولا إذ سمعتموه قلتم ما يكون لنا أن نتكلم بهذا سبحانك هذا بهتان عظيم

translation: Allah admonishes you never to repeat the like thereof, if you are believers.
interpretation: This verse warns believers against repeating or engaging in any actions that go against the teachings of Islam. It serves as a reminder to maintain faith and avoid sinful or unethical behavior. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of adhering to Islamic principles and seeking guidance from Allah to stay on the righteous path.
orig: يعظكم الله أن تعودوا لمثله أبدا إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: And Allah makes the Verses clear to you, and Allah is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's wisdom and knowledge in clarifying the verses of the Qur'an for the believers. It emphasizes that Allah, with His infinite wisdom and knowledge, provides clear guidance and explanations for His revelations, enabling the believers to understand the profound meanings and lessons contained within them. The verse serves as a reminder that the Qur'an is a source of enlightenment and understanding, and that Allah's wisdom and knowledge are manifested in the clarity and depth of its verses.
orig: ويبين الله لكم الآيات والله عليم حكيم

translation: Indeed, those who like that immorality should spread among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows, and you do not know.
interpretation: This verse warns against promoting or spreading immorality and indecent behavior among believers. It states that those who desire the spread of such immorality will face a severe punishment in this life and the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes that Allah has complete knowledge, while human beings have limited knowledge. It encourages maintaining moral uprightness and discourages the promotion of indecency within the Muslim community.
orig: إن الذين يحبون أن تشيع الفاحشة في الذين آمنوا لهم عذاب أليم في الدنيا والآخرة والله يعلم وأنتم لا تعلمون

translation: And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy, and that Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers of Allah's immense favor and mercy upon them. It suggests that if it were not for Allah's grace and compassion, and His quality of being Oft-Returning with forgiveness and Most Merciful, the believers would have faced severe consequences for their shortcomings. The verse emphasizes the importance of acknowledging and appreciating Allah's boundless grace, mercy, and forgiveness towards His servants.
orig: ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته وأن الله رءوف رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse warns believers against following the path of Satan, who commands immorality and evil deeds. It emphasizes that without Allah's favor and mercy, no one would be pure or righteous. However, Allah purifies whomever He wills from sin and guides them to the right path. The verse highlights Allah's attributes of being All-Hearing and All-Knowing.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان ومن يتبع خطوات الشيطان فإنه يأمر بالفحشاء والمنكر ولولا فضل الله عليكم ورحمته ما زكى منكم من أحد أبدا ولكن الله يزكي من يشاء والله سميع عليم

translation: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give to their kinsmen, the needy, and those who left their homes in the cause of Allah. Let them pardon and overlook. Would you not love for Allah to forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse encourages those who are financially capable to be generous towards their relatives, the poor, and those who migrated for the cause of Allah. It advises them to forgive any wrongdoings and overlook faults. By doing so, they will earn Allah's forgiveness, for Allah is Most Forgiving and Merciful.
orig: ولا يأتل أولو الفضل منكم والسعة أن يؤتوا أولي القربى والمساكين والمهاجرين في سبيل الله وليعفوا وليصفحوا ألا تحبون أن يغفر الله لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: Those who accuse chaste women who never even think of anything touching their chastity, are cursed in this life and in the Hereafter, and for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns the slanderous accusation of chaste, innocent believing women. It warns that those who make such false accusations are cursed in this world and in the Hereafter, and they will face a severe punishment. The verse highlights the gravity of this sin and emphasizes the importance of protecting the honor and dignity of virtuous women.
orig: إن الذين يرمون المحصنات الغافلات المؤمنات لعنوا في الدنيا والآخرة ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: On the Day when their tongues, their hands, and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the body parts of disbelievers will testify against them for their evil deeds and disobedience to Allah. It emphasizes that nothing will be hidden on that Day, and even one's own body parts will bear witness to the truth of their actions. This serves as a warning to be mindful of one's deeds in this life, as they will be held accountable for them.
orig: يوم تشهد عليهم ألسنتهم وأيديهم وأرجلهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah Who is the Perfect Truth.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will fully recompense people according to their deeds. They will realize that Allah alone is the Absolute Truth, the Manifest Reality, and the Ultimate Source of Justice.
orig: يومئذ يوفيهم الله دينهم الحق ويعلمون أن الله هو الحق المبين

translation: Evil women are for evil men, and evil men are for evil women. And good women are for good men, and good men are for good women. Those are declared innocent of what they say. For them is forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: This verse establishes a principle of compatibility between spouses. It suggests that people of similar moral character and values are naturally attracted to one another. Those who are pure and virtuous will be drawn to others of similar virtue, while those of corrupt character will gravitate towards those who share their moral deficiencies. The verse also affirms that the righteous will be exonerated from any accusations or slander against them, and they will receive forgiveness and a noble provision from Allah.
orig: الخبيثات للخبيثين والخبيثون للخبيثات والطيبات للطيبين والطيبون للطيبات أولئك مبرءون مما يقولون لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.
interpretation: This verse teaches Muslims to respect the privacy of others and not to enter someone else's home without permission. It instructs believers to first announce their arrival and greet the residents before entering. This promotes good manners, mutual respect, and avoids causing discomfort or violating the sanctity of one's home. The verse suggests that following this etiquette is better for believers as it helps them become mindful of proper conduct.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوتا غير بيوتكم حتى تستأنسوا وتسلموا على أهلها ذلكم خير لكم لعلكم تذكرون

translation: But if you find no one in the houses, do not enter them until permission has been given to you. And if it is said to you, "Go back," then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse teaches the importance of respecting privacy and seeking permission before entering someone's home. If there is no one present in a house, one should not enter until granted permission. If asked to leave, one should comply immediately, as this is the more virtuous and pure course of action. Allah is aware of our deeds, so we should strive to act with integrity and respect for others' boundaries.
orig: فإن لم تجدوا فيها أحدا فلا تدخلوها حتى يؤذن لكم وإن قيل لكم ارجعوا فارجعوا هو أزكى لكم والله بما تعملون عليم

translation: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
interpretation: This verse indicates that it is permissible to enter and utilize uninhabited houses or properties for one's needs, as long as no harm or damage is caused. Allah is aware of our intentions, whether they are disclosed or kept hidden.
orig: ليس عليكم جناح أن تدخلوا بيوتا غير مسكونة فيها متاع لكم والله يعلم ما تبدون وما تكتمون

translation: Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and guard their private parts; that will make for greater purity for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.
interpretation: This verse commands believing men to lower their gazes and guard their private parts from unlawful acts, as this leads to greater purity and chastity. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of their actions, reminding them to be mindful of His knowledge and to strive for righteousness.
orig: قل للمؤمنين يغضوا من أبصارهم ويحفظوا فروجهم ذلك أزكى لهم إن الله خبير بما يصنعون

translation: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.
interpretation: This verse instructs believing women to observe modesty in their dress and behavior. It emphasizes lowering the gaze, guarding chastity, covering the adornments except what is apparent, and not revealing their beauty except to specific close male relatives and other women. The verse promotes decency, purity, and morality in society, while also encouraging repentance and seeking Allah's guidance for success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: وقل للمؤمنات يغضضن من أبصارهن ويحفظن فروجهن ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا ما ظهر منها وليضربن بخمرهن على جيوبهن ولا يبدين زينتهن إلا لبعولتهن أو آبائهن أو آباء بعولتهن أو أبنائهن أو أبناء بعولتهن أو إخوانهن أو بني إخوانهن أو بني أخواتهن أو نسائهن أو ما ملكت أيمانهن أو التابعين غير أولي الإربة من الرجال أو الطفل الذين لم يظهروا على عورات النساء ولا يضربن بأرجلهن ليعلم ما يخفين من زينتهن وتوبوا إلى الله جميعا أيه المؤمنون لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse encourages the marriage of unmarried people, including slaves, and promises that Allah will provide for them if they are poor. It emphasizes Allah's generosity and knowledge, and promotes the idea of social responsibility and caring for those in need.
orig: وأنكحوا الأيامى منكم والصالحين من عبادكم وإمائكم إن يكونوا فقراء يغنهم الله من فضله والله واسع عليم

translation: And let those who do not find the means to marry keep themselves chaste until Allah enriches them of His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse addresses several issues related to marriage, slavery, and chastity. It encourages those who cannot afford marriage to remain chaste until Allah provides them with means. It also instructs owners to grant freedom to slaves who desire it and have shown good character, by making a contract of manumission with them and giving them from Allah's wealth. The verse prohibits forcing slave girls into prostitution against their will, even if it brings worldly gains. If they are compelled, Allah will be Forgiving and Merciful to them after their compulsion.
orig: وليستعفف الذين لا يجدون نكاحا حتى يغنيهم الله من فضله والذين يبتغون الكتاب مما ملكت أيمانكم فكاتبوهم إن علمتم فيهم خيرا وآتوهم من مال الله الذي آتاكم ولا تكرهوا فتياتكم على البغاء إن أردن تحصنا لتبتغوا عرض الحياة الدنيا ومن يكرههن فإن الله من بعد إكراههن غفور رحيم

translation: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Quran contains clear and unambiguous verses that serve as proofs and illustrations from the stories of previous nations. These stories and examples act as lessons and reminders for those who fear Allah and strive to obey His commandments.
orig: ولقد أنزلنا إليكم آيات مبينات ومثلا من الذين خلوا من قبلكم وموعظة للمتقين

translation: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His Light is as if there were a niche and within it a lamp, the lamp enclosed in glass, the glass as it were a brilliant star lit from a blessed tree, an olive, neither of the East nor of the West, whose oil would almost glow forth (of itself) though no fire touched it. Light upon Light! Allah guides to His Light whom He wills. And Allah sets forth parables for mankind, and Allah is All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse uses the metaphor of light to describe Allah's guidance and knowledge that illuminates the heavens and the earth. The parable of the niche, lamp, glass, and olive tree represents the purity and brilliance of Allah's light, which shines without any external source. This light guides those whom Allah wills to the right path. The verse emphasizes Allah's infinite wisdom and ability to provide examples and parables to help humanity understand spiritual truths.
orig: الله نور السماوات والأرض مثل نوره كمشكاة فيها مصباح المصباح في زجاجة الزجاجة كأنها كوكب دري يوقد من شجرة مباركة زيتونة لا شرقية ولا غربية يكاد زيتها يضيء ولو لم تمسسه نار نور على نور يهدي الله لنوره من يشاء ويضرب الله الأمثال للناس والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: In houses which Allah has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him, in the mornings and in the afternoons,
interpretation: This verse refers to the mosques, which are houses dedicated to the worship of Allah. Allah has commanded that these houses be built and His name be glorified in them through the remembrance of Allah and the performance of prayers and other acts of worship, both in the mornings and the afternoons or evenings.
orig: في بيوت أذن الله أن ترفع ويذكر فيها اسمه يسبح له فيها بالغدو والآصال

translation: Men whom neither trade nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will be overturned.
interpretation: This verse praises those sincere believers who are not distracted from worshipping Allah and performing their religious obligations by worldly affairs like trade and business. They remain steadfast in remembering Allah, praying, and giving charity. They fear the Day of Judgment when people's hearts and sights will be in a state of utter terror and anguish.
orig: رجال لا تلهيهم تجارة ولا بيع عن ذكر الله وإقام الصلاة وإيتاء الزكاة يخافون يوما تتقلب فيه القلوب والأبصار

translation: That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His grace. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's infinite mercy and generosity towards the believers. He will reward them not only for their good deeds, but will also grant them additional favors from His bounty. It highlights that Allah's provisions are bestowed upon whomever He wills, without limit or measure, as a manifestation of His absolute power and wisdom.
orig: ليجزيهم الله أحسن ما عملوا ويزيدهم من فضله والله يرزق من يشاء بغير حساب

translation: And those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a desert. The thirsty one thinks it is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.
interpretation: This verse uses the analogy of a mirage to describe the deeds of the disbelievers. Just as a mirage appears to be water from a distance but turns out to be nothing when approached, the deeds of the disbelievers seem fruitful to them but will prove to be worthless on the Day of Judgment. They will find Allah waiting to hold them accountable and recompense them fully for their deeds. The verse warns that Allah is swift in reckoning, emphasizing the certainty and swiftness of His judgment.
orig: والذين كفروا أعمالهم كسراب بقيعة يحسبه الظمآن ماء حتى إذا جاءه لم يجده شيئا ووجد الله عنده فوفاه حسابه والله سريع الحساب

translation: Or [they are] like darknesses within a deep sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.
interpretation: This verse is a powerful metaphor describing the state of disbelievers who are lost in layers of spiritual darkness, ignorance, and misguidance. The "deep sea" represents their confusion and bewilderment, the "waves upon waves" symbolize the doubts and misconceptions that overwhelm them, and the "clouds of darkness" signify the veils that obstruct their vision and understanding of truth. When they try to find guidance, it is as if they are stretching out their hands in pitch darkness, unable to see anything clearly. Ultimately, those whom Allah has not granted the light of faith and guidance will remain enveloped in spiritual darkness.
orig: أو كظلمات في بحر لجي يغشاه موج من فوقه موج من فوقه سحاب ظلمات بعضها فوق بعض إذا أخرج يده لم يكد يراها ومن لم يجعل الله له نورا فما له من نور

translation: Have you not seen that Allah is He Whom do glorify whosoever is in the heavens and the earth, and the birds with wings outspread? Each one knows its prayer and glorification. And Allah is Knower of what they do.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal nature of God's glorification by all creatures in the heavens and on earth, including birds in flight. It emphasizes that every living being instinctively knows how to worship and glorify its Creator through its unique way of existence and behavior. Allah is fully aware of the actions and modes of worship of all His creatures.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يسبح له من في السماوات والأرض والطير صافات كل قد علم صلاته وتسبيحه والله عليم بما يفعلون

translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the final return.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah alone is the Sovereign Lord and Master of the heavens and the earth. Everything in the universe is under His absolute control and authority. It also reminds us that ultimately, all beings will return to Allah on the Day of Resurrection to account for their deeds and receive their recompense. This should instill a sense of accountability and consciousness of Allah in our hearts as we go about our lives in this temporary world.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض وإلى الله المصير

translation: Have you not seen that Allah drives clouds? Then He joins them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain drops issuing from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains of hail, afflicting with it whomever He wills and diverting it from whomever He wills. The flash of its lightning almost takes away the sight.
interpretation: This verse describes Allah's power and control over the natural phenomena of clouds, rain, and hail. It invites the reader to reflect on the majesty of Allah's creation and His ability to send rain and hail as He wills, either as a blessing or a punishment. The vivid imagery of the verse highlights the awe-inspiring nature of Allah's signs in the universe.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يزجي سحابا ثم يؤلف بينه ثم يجعله ركاما فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله وينزل من السماء من جبال فيها من برد فيصيب به من يشاء ويصرفه عن من يشاء يكاد سنا برقه يذهب بالأبصار

translation: Allah causes the night and the day to succeed each other. Truly, in this is an instructive example for those who have insight.
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound wisdom and power of Allah in the alternation of night and day, which serves as a reminder and lesson for those who reflect and contemplate on the signs of Allah in the universe. The regular cycle of night and day is a manifestation of Allah's control over the celestial bodies and the intricate workings of the cosmos. This natural phenomenon should inspire awe and reverence in those who possess spiritual insight and recognize the greatness of the Creator behind this remarkable system.
orig: يقلب الله الليل والنهار إن في ذلك لعبرة لأولي الأبصار

translation: And Allah has created every moving creature from water. Of them there are some that creep on their bellies, some that walk on two legs, and some that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Verily, Allah is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's immense power as the Creator of all living beings. It states that Allah created every moving creature from water, emphasizing the common origin of life. The verse then describes different modes of movement among creatures, some crawling on their bellies, some walking on two legs, and others on four legs. This diversity in creation is a manifestation of Allah's infinite wisdom and ability to create whatever He wills. The verse concludes by affirming Allah's absolute power and capability over all things.
orig: والله خلق كل دابة من ماء فمنهم من يمشي على بطنه ومنهم من يمشي على رجلين ومنهم من يمشي على أربع يخلق الله ما يشاء إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Indeed, We have sent down manifest verses, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has revealed clear and evident signs and proofs in the Qur'an that guide people to the right path. However, it is Allah alone who guides whomever He wills to the straight path of truth and righteousness. Guidance is ultimately a gift from Allah, and He bestows it upon those who sincerely seek it and have a pure heart and intention.
orig: لقد أنزلنا آيات مبينات والله يهدي من يشاء إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: And they say, 'We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey,' then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith in Allah and the Messenger, but their actions contradict their claims. It highlights the importance of consistency between one's words and deeds. True belief requires obedience and steadfastness, not merely verbal proclamations that are later abandoned. The verse emphasizes that those who turn away from obedience after claiming belief are not truly believers.
orig: ويقولون آمنا بالله وبالرسول وأطعنا ثم يتولى فريق منهم من بعد ذلك وما أولئك بالمؤمنين

translation: And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, a party of them turns away in aversion.
interpretation: This verse refers to the attitude of some people who refuse to accept the judgment of Allah and His Messenger when disputes arise among them. They turn away arrogantly, rejecting the divine guidance and authority, preferring their own desires or man-made laws over the teachings of Islam. This behavior reflects a lack of faith and submission to the ultimate source of truth and justice.
orig: وإذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم إذا فريق منهم معرضون

translation: And if they are in the right, they come to him in humble obedience.
interpretation: إذا كان الحق مع الآخرين، فإنهم يأتون إلى النبي محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم منقادين خاضعين، لأنهم يعلمون أنه يحكم بالحق والعدل. فالمؤمنون الصادقون لا يتعصبون لآرائهم إذا ثبت لهم الحق، بل يخضعون له ويقبلونه من غير تردد.
orig: وإن يكن لهم الحق يأتوا إليه مذعنين

translation: Is it that there is disease in their hearts, or do they entertain doubt, or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger may be unjust towards them? Nay, it is they themselves who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse questions the motives and state of those who oppose the truth. It implies that their rejection stems from either spiritual sickness in their hearts, doubts about the truth, or a fear that Allah and His Messenger might treat them unjustly, which is an absurd notion. The verse concludes by stating that it is they themselves who are the wrongdoers by opposing the truth without valid justification.
orig: أفي قلوبهم مرض أم ارتابوا أم يخافون أن يحيف الله عليهم ورسوله بل أولئك هم الظالمون

translation: The only statement of the believers, when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, is that they say: 'We hear and we obey.' And such are the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience and submission to Allah and His Messenger. The true believers, when called upon to refer to the judgment of Allah and His Messenger, respond with complete acceptance and obedience, saying "We hear and we obey." This attitude of humility and compliance is a sign of their faith and the key to their success and prosperity in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: إنما كان قول المؤمنين إذا دعوا إلى الله ورسوله ليحكم بينهم أن يقولوا سمعنا وأطعنا وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah, and keeps his duty (to Him), such are the successful ones.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger, having fear and consciousness of Allah, and being mindful of one's duties towards Him. Those who fulfill these requirements are promised success and triumph in this life and the Hereafter. The verse highlights that true success lies in submission to the divine commands and living a righteous life in accordance with the teachings of Islam.
orig: ومن يطع الله ورسوله ويخش الله ويتقه فأولئك هم الفائزون

translation: And they swore by Allah their most binding oaths that if you ordered them, they would certainly go forth. Say, "Do not swear. Obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do."
interpretation: The interpretation is that some hypocrites swore solemn oaths to the Prophet that if he commanded them to go to battle, they would obey. However, Allah instructs the Prophet to tell them not to swear such oaths, as true obedience should be rendered without the need for swearing. Allah is fully aware of their actions and intentions, and they cannot deceive Him with false oaths.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن أمرتهم ليخرجن قل لا تقسموا طاعة معروفة إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the clear notification."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger. It states that if people turn away from obedience, the Messenger is not responsible for their misguidance, as his duty is only to convey the message clearly. However, if they obey, they will be guided to the right path. The verse highlights the Messenger's role as a conveyor of the message, and the responsibility lies with the people to accept or reject it.
orig: قل أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول فإن تولوا فإنما عليه ما حمل وعليكم ما حملتم وإن تطيعوه تهتدوا وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: Allah has promised those among you who believe and do righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieved after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that if they have faith and do good deeds, Allah will grant them authority and power on the earth, just as He granted it to the believers before them. He will establish their religion of Islam firmly and replace their fear with security, allowing them to worship Allah alone without associating any partners with Him. However, those who reject faith after receiving this promise will be considered disobedient sinners.
orig: وعد الله الذين آمنوا منكم وعملوا الصالحات ليستخلفنهم في الأرض كما استخلف الذين من قبلهم وليمكنن لهم دينهم الذي ارتضى لهم وليبدلنهم من بعد خوفهم أمنا يعبدونني لا يشركون بي شيئا ومن كفر بعد ذلك فأولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger, that you may receive mercy.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to perform the obligatory acts of worship, namely prayer and zakah (obligatory charity), and to obey the commands of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It promises that by doing so, they may attain Allah's mercy and forgiveness in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: وأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأطيعوا الرسول لعلكم ترحمون

translation: Think not that those who disbelieve can outstrip (Allah's Plan) on earth. Their abode is the Fire, and worst indeed is that destination!
interpretation: This verse warns the believers not to think that the disbelievers who reject faith can escape the consequences of their actions or outrun Allah's plan. It emphasizes that their ultimate abode will be the Fire of Hell, which is the worst and most terrible destination.
orig: لا تحسبن الذين كفروا معجزين في الأرض ومأواهم النار ولبئس المصير

translation: O vous qui avez cru ! Que ceux que vous possédez de vos mains et ceux parmi vous qui n'ont pas atteint la puberté, vous demandent permission à trois moments : avant la prière de l'aube, quand vous ôtez vos vêtements de l'après-midi, et après la prière du coucher. Trois moments de nudité pour vous. Après cela, il n'y a aucun mal ni pour vous ni pour eux, à ce qu'ils aillent et viennent auprès de vous, les uns auprès des autres. Ainsi Dieu vous explique Ses versets, et Dieu est Omniscient et Sage.
interpretation: Cette verse souligne l'importance de préserver l'intimité et la pudeur au sein de la famille musulmane.
