translation: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said, 'This is nothing but fabricated magic, and we have not heard of this among our forefathers.'
interpretation: "This verse refers to the stubborn rejection of the signs and miracles brought by Prophet Moses by the people of Pharaoh. They dismissed the clear evidence as mere magic or trickery, and claimed that it contradicted the beliefs and traditions passed down from their ancestors. Their arrogance and unwillingness to accept the truth blinded them from recognizing the divine signs."
orig: فلما جاءهم موسى بآياتنا بينات قالوا ما هذا إلا سحر مفترى وما سمعنا بهذا في آبائنا الأولين

translation: And Moses said, 'My Lord is most knowing of who has brought guidance from Him and to whom the final home will be. Indeed, the wrongdoers will not succeed.'
interpretation: In this verse, Moses affirms his trust in Allah's knowledge and wisdom. He acknowledges that Allah knows best who has brought true guidance from Him and who will ultimately attain success in the Hereafter. Moses emphasizes that the wrongdoers, those who reject faith and do evil deeds, will not achieve true success or salvation. This verse highlights the importance of faith, righteousness, and reliance on Allah's guidance to attain ultimate success and a favorable outcome in the eternal life to come.
orig: وقال موسى ربي أعلم بمن جاء بالهدى من عنده ومن تكون له عاقبة الدار إنه لا يفلح الظالمون

translation: And Pharaoh said, "O chiefs, I know not that you have a god other than me, so kindle for me, O Haman, a fire upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses, and indeed, I think he is among the liars."
interpretation: Pharaoh arrogantly claims that he does not know of any god besides himself, and orders his minister Haman to build a tall tower from baked clay so that he can climb it and look for the God that Moses worships, as he thinks Moses is lying about the existence of a God other than Pharaoh.
orig: وقال فرعون يا أيها الملأ ما علمت لكم من إله غيري فأوقد لي يا هامان على الطين فاجعل لي صرحا لعلي أطلع إلى إله موسى وإني لأظنه من الكاذبين

translation: And he and his hosts behaved insolently in the land without right, and thought that they would never be returned to Us.
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh and his people who arrogantly rejected the message of God and oppressed the Israelites in the land of Egypt. They believed that they would not be held accountable for their actions and would not return to God for judgment. This interpretation highlights Pharaoh's arrogance, oppression, and denial of the Hereafter.
orig: واستكبر هو وجنوده في الأرض بغير الحق وظنوا أنهم إلينا لا يرجعون

translation: So We seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah punished Pharaoh and his army for their oppression and disbelief by drowning them in the sea. This serves as a lesson and warning for those who commit wrongdoing and oppression, as their ultimate fate will be a terrible punishment from Allah.
orig: فأخذناه وجنوده فنبذناهم في اليم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة الظالمين

translation: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse refers to the leaders and influential figures who misguide people and call them towards disbelief and evil deeds. They are described as "leaders inviting to the Fire" because their actions and influence lead people away from the straight path and towards the punishment of Hellfire. On the Day of Resurrection, these misleading leaders will find no helper or supporter to save them from Allah's judgment.
orig: وجعلناهم أئمة يدعون إلى النار ويوم القيامة لا ينصرون

translation: And We caused them to be followed in this world by a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the disgraced.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has cursed those who disbelieved and rejected the truth in this worldly life, depriving them of guidance and blessings. Additionally, on the Day of Resurrection, they will be among those who are humiliated and disgraced due to their disbelief and disobedience to Allah's commands.
orig: وأتبعناهم في هذه الدنيا لعنة ويوم القيامة هم من المقبوحين

translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture after We had destroyed the former generations as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that perhaps they would be reminded.
interpretation: This verse refers to the revelation of the Torah to Prophet Moses after Allah had destroyed the previous nations who rejected His messengers. The Torah was given as a source of enlightenment, guidance, and mercy for mankind, in the hope that they would take heed and remember Allah's teachings and avoid the fate of those who came before them and were punished for their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب من بعد ما أهلكنا القرون الأولى بصائر للناس وهدى ورحمة لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: And you were not on the western side [of the Mount] when We ordained for Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was not present at the time when Allah gave the commandments to Prophet Moses on Mount Sinai. It emphasizes that the Prophet Muhammad's knowledge of these events came through divine revelation, not from being an eyewitness. This highlights the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and the Prophet's prophethood, as he had knowledge of past events that he could not have known otherwise.
orig: وما كنت بجانب الغربي إذ قضينا إلى موسى الأمر وما كنت من الشاهدين

translation: But We have produced [numerous] generations, and prolonged for them was their life span. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of messengers].
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has created many generations before and allowed them to live long lives. However, the Prophet Muhammad was not present among the people of Madyan to recite Allah's revelations to them. Instead, Allah sent messengers to convey His message. The verse implies that the Prophet's role was not limited to a specific time or place, but rather, Allah has continuously sent messengers to guide humanity throughout different eras and civilizations.
orig: ولكنا أنشأنا قرونا فتطاول عليهم العمر وما كنت ثاويا في أهل مدين تتلو عليهم آياتنا ولكنا كنا مرسلين

translation: Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when We called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord, to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad was not present at Mount Sinai when God called upon Moses. Rather, he was sent as a mercy from God to warn a people who had not received any warner before him, so that they may be reminded of God's teachings and guidance."
orig: وما كنت بجانب الطور إذ نادينا ولكن رحمة من ربك لتنذر قوما ما أتاهم من نذير من قبلك لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: And if not that a great calamity would afflict them for what their hands have sent forth, they would say, 'Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?'
interpretation: This verse suggests that if Allah did not punish people for their misdeeds and sins through calamities and hardships, they would continue in their disbelief and wrongdoing. However, when faced with difficulties, they would wish that a messenger had been sent to guide them so that they could follow Allah's teachings and become believers. The verse highlights Allah's mercy in sending messengers and revelations to guide humanity, and His wisdom in allowing adversities to befall people as a means of reminding them of their need for faith and guidance.
orig: ولولا أن تصيبهم مصيبة بما قدمت أيديهم فيقولوا ربنا لولا أرسلت إلينا رسولا فنتبع آياتك ونكون من المؤمنين

translation: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'Why was he not given the like of what was given to Moses?' Did they not disbelieve in what was given to Moses before? They said, '[They are but] two magicians supporting each other, and we are disbelievers in both.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelief of the Quraysh tribe when Prophet Muhammad brought them the Qur'an. They rejected it, questioning why he was not given miracles like those given to Prophet Moses. This shows their stubbornness and arrogance, as they had already rejected the previous revelations given to Moses. They accused Moses and Muhammad of being 'two magicians supporting each other' and declared their disbelief in both prophets and their messages.
orig: فلما جاءهم الحق من عندنا قالوا لولا أوتي مثل ما أوتي موسى أولم يكفروا بما أوتي موسى من قبل قالوا سحران تظاهرا وقالوا إنا بكل كافرون

translation: Say, "Then bring a Book from Allah , which is a better guide than either of them, that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."
interpretation: This verse challenges those who reject the Qur'an and the message of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to produce a scripture from Allah that is superior in guidance to the Qur'an. If they claim to be truthful in their rejection, they should present such a Book. However, since no scripture can surpass the Qur'an in its divine wisdom and guidance, this challenge exposes the falsehood of their stance and establishes the truth of the Qur'an as the final revelation from Allah.
orig: قل فأتوا بكتاب من عند الله هو أهدى منهما أتبعه إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But if they do not respond to you, then know that they only follow their own desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of Allah rather than one's own desires and whims. It warns that those who reject the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) are merely following their own desires without any guidance from Allah. The verse states that such people are misguided and astray, as they have deviated from the straight path. It also highlights that Allah does not guide those who are wrongdoers and oppressors, as they have chosen to reject His guidance and follow their own desires instead.
orig: فإن لم يستجيبوا لك فاعلم أنما يتبعون أهواءهم ومن أضل ممن اتبع هواه بغير هدى من الله إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: And We have certainly conveyed to them the Word so that they may remember.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has sent clear guidance and reminders through His revelations and messengers, so that people may be mindful of their purpose in life and accountable for their actions. It emphasizes that humans have been provided with the necessary knowledge and teachings to guide them towards the right path, and it is up to them to reflect upon these teachings and follow them.
orig: ولقد وصلنا لهم القول لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the People of the Book, such as Jews and Christians, who were given previous scriptures like the Torah and the Gospel. It states that those who were given the divine scriptures before the Qur'an, truly believe in the Qur'an because it confirms the fundamental teachings found in their own scriptures.
orig: الذين آتيناهم الكتاب من قبله هم به يؤمنون

translation: And when it is recited to them, they say, 'We believe in it; it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed, we were Muslims before it.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who recognize the truth of the Qur'an when it is recited to them. They affirm their faith in it, acknowledging that it is the truth from their Lord, and they declare that they had already submitted to God's will even before the revelation of the Qur'an. This shows their sincerity and readiness to accept the divine guidance.
orig: وإذا يتلى عليهم قالوا آمنا به إنه الحق من ربنا إنا كنا من قبله مسلمين

translation: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and repel evil with good and spend out of what We have provided them.
interpretation: This verse promises a double reward to those who patiently endure difficulties and trials, respond to harm with kindness and good deeds, and spend from the provisions Allah has granted them in charitable ways. It encourages perseverance, forgiveness, good character and generosity, which will be greatly rewarded by Allah.
orig: أولئك يؤتون أجرهم مرتين بما صبروا ويدرءون بالحسنة السيئة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we do not seek the ignorant."
interpretation: "This verse encourages the believers to avoid engaging with vain or immoral speech and behavior. Instead of responding in kind, they should politely disengage and focus on their own actions and responsibilities. They should maintain peace and not seek interactions with those who embrace ignorance and immorality."
orig: وإذا سمعوا اللغو أعرضوا عنه وقالوا لنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم سلام عليكم لا نبتغي الجاهلين

translation: Indeed, you do not guide whom you love, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that guidance is solely from Allah. The Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) cannot guide whomever he wishes, even his loved ones, because guidance comes from Allah's will and wisdom. Allah alone knows best who is truly guided and worthy of His guidance.
orig: إنك لا تهدي من أحببت ولكن الله يهدي من يشاء وهو أعلم بالمهتدين

translation: And they say, 'If we follow the guidance with you, we will be snatched from our land.' Have We not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers' objection to following the Prophet Muhammad's guidance, claiming that doing so would lead to their expulsion from their land. However, Allah reminds them of the secure sanctuary (Makkah) He has established for them, where provisions from all kinds of fruits are brought as sustenance from Him. Yet, most of them fail to recognize this blessing and remain ungrateful.
orig: وقالوا إن نتبع الهدى معك نتخطف من أرضنا أولم نمكن لهم حرما آمنا يجبى إليه ثمرات كل شيء رزقا من لدنا ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: And how many a town have We destroyed for their insolent way of life? Those are their dwellings, which have hardly been inhabited after them except a little. And it is We who were the inheritors.
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning against arrogance, heedlessness, and indulgence in worldly pleasures. It reminds us that Allah has destroyed many nations who lived in luxury and transgressed against His commands. Their dwellings lie in ruin, a testimony to their downfall. Only a few have inhabited those places after them. Ultimately, Allah is the Inheritor of all things, and nothing belongs to anyone eternally except Him.
orig: وكم أهلكنا من قرية بطرت معيشتها فتلك مساكنهم لم تسكن من بعدهم إلا قليلا وكنا نحن الوارثين

translation: And your Lord would not destroy the towns until He had raised a messenger in their mother town to recite Our verses to them. And We would not destroy the towns except when their people were wrongdoers.
interpretation: Allah does not punish or destroy a nation without first sending a messenger to guide them and warn them of the consequences of their wrongdoing. The destruction of nations is a result of their own injustice and rejection of the truth after being clearly shown the right path. Allah's justice dictates that no one is punished without being given a fair chance to repent and mend their ways.
orig: وما كان ربك مهلك القرى حتى يبعث في أمها رسولا يتلو عليهم آياتنا وما كنا مهلكي القرى إلا وأهلها ظالمون

translation: And whatever you have been given is but a passing enjoyment for this worldly life, but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting. Do you not then reason?
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the worldly pleasures and possessions we have are temporary and fleeting. The true and everlasting joy lies with Allah. It encourages us to use our intellect and reason to recognize the transient nature of this life and strive for the eternal bliss promised by Allah in the Hereafter.
orig: وما أوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وزينتها وما عند الله خير وأبقى أفلا تعقلون

translation: Is one to whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain, like one whom We have provided with the enjoyments of worldly life, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be among those brought forth?
interpretation: This verse draws a contrast between the believers who have been promised a good reward in the Hereafter, and the disbelievers who are only given temporary enjoyments in this worldly life. The interpretation is that the one who believes in God and His promises will attain a far greater and everlasting reward, while the one who disbelieves and indulges only in worldly pleasures will be brought forth on the Day of Judgment to face accountability.
orig: أفمن وعدناه وعدا حسنا فهو لاقيه كمن متعناه متاع الحياة الدنيا ثم هو يوم القيامة من المحضرين

translation: And the Day He will call them and say, 'Where are My 'partners' that you used to claim?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when Allah will call the idolaters and polytheists and question them about the false deities they associated with Him. It serves as a rebuke and reminder that their claims of partners besides Allah were baseless and will be exposed as such on that Day.
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: Those against whom the sentence has become due will say, 'Our Lord, these are the ones whom we misled. We misled them as we were misled. We disown them before You. It was not us that they worshipped.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and misguided people will try to shift blame away from themselves. The leaders or instigators of misguidance will claim innocence by saying that they did not force the misguided ones to worship them, rather it was the misguided ones themselves who chose to worship the leaders instead of Allah. This shows the state of denial and attempt to avoid accountability on that Day.
orig: قال الذين حق عليهم القول ربنا هؤلاء الذين أغوينا أغويناهم كما غوينا تبرأنا إليك ما كانوا إيانا يعبدون

translation: And it will be said (to them): "Call upon your 'partners'" and they will call upon them, but they will not answer them, and they will see the torment. (And it will be said): "If only they had been guided!"
interpretation: This verse highlights the futility of associating partners with Allah. On the Day of Judgment, the idolaters will be commanded to call upon their so-called partners or deities for help, but they will receive no response. This will expose the falsehood of their beliefs and the powerlessness of their supposed partners. They will then witness the punishment, realizing too late the grave error of their ways and wishing they had been rightly guided.
orig: وقيل ادعوا شركاءكم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم ورأوا العذاب لو أنهم كانوا يهتدون

translation: And the Day when He will call them and say, 'What was the answer you gave to the messengers?'
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will call all people and question them about how they responded to the messengers and prophets who were sent to guide them. This verse emphasizes the accountability of individuals for their choices and actions in this life, and the importance of heeding the divine guidance brought by the messengers.
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول ماذا أجبتم المرسلين

translation: Then on that Day, the news will be obscured from them, and they will not question one another.
interpretation: On the Day of Resurrection, the events and realities will be so overwhelming that people will be utterly bewildered and unable to comprehend or inquire about what is happening around them. Their usual curiosity and communication will cease due to the gravity of the situation.
orig: فعميت عليهم الأنباء يومئذ فهم لا يتساءلون

translation: But as for him who repents and believes and does righteous deeds, it may be that he will be among the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of repentance, faith, and righteous deeds. It suggests that those who sincerely repent from their sins, have faith in God, and perform good deeds have the potential to attain success and salvation. The phrase "it may be" indicates hope and possibility, encouraging people to strive for righteousness while acknowledging that their ultimate fate rests with God's mercy and judgment.
orig: فأما من تاب وآمن وعمل صالحا فعسى أن يكون من المفلحين

translation: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and freedom in His creation and choices. He creates whatever He wills without any limitations or external influences. The choice and determination belong solely to Him, not to His creation. This affirms Allah's transcendence and His being far above any partners or equals that people associate with Him.
orig: وربك يخلق ما يشاء ويختار ما كان لهم الخيرة سبحان الله وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they reveal.
interpretation: Allah knows the secrets and intentions hidden in people's hearts, as well as what they outwardly express. He has complete knowledge of everything, both the apparent and the hidden.
orig: وربك يعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون

translation: And He is Allah, there is no deity except Him. To Him is due all praise in the former and the latter [realms]. And His is the decision, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness and Uniqueness of Allah as the only true God worthy of worship. It emphasizes that all praise and gratitude belongs to Him in this world and the Hereafter. It also states that He alone has the ultimate authority and judgment, and that all beings will return to Him on the Day of Resurrection to be judged for their deeds.
orig: وهو الله لا إله إلا هو له الحمد في الأولى والآخرة وله الحكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"
interpretation: This verse invites people to ponder over the absolute power and control of Allah over the universe. It asks them to reflect on what would happen if Allah decided to make the night continuous and prolonged until the Day of Resurrection. In such a scenario, no other deity or being would be able to bring them light or illumination. This verse emphasizes Allah's uniqueness as the sole Creator, Sustainer, and Controller of the entire universe, and questions the polytheists' belief in other deities besides Allah. It urges them to listen, reflect, and recognize the truth of Allah's Oneness.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن جعل الله عليكم الليل سرمدا إلى يوم القيامة من إله غير الله يأتيكم بضياء أفلا تسمعون

translation: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"
interpretation: This verse is asking people to ponder over the power and might of Allah. It questions what other deity could bring them light (day) if Allah were to make the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection. The rhetorical question "Then will you not hear?" is meant to make people reflect and recognize that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, who has complete control over the phenomena of night and day.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن جعل الله عليكم النهار سرمدا إلى يوم القيامة من إله غير الله يأتيكم بليل تسكنون فيه أفلا تبصرون

translation: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day, that you may rest therein, and that you may seek from His Bounty, and that you may give thanks.
interpretation: Allah has created the cycle of night and day as a mercy for human beings. The night allows them to rest and regain their energy, while the day enables them to work and seek sustenance from Allah's bounties. This alternation is a reminder to be grateful to Allah for His countless blessings.
orig: ومن رحمته جعل لكم الليل والنهار لتسكنوا فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' that you used to claim?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when Allah will question the idolaters about the false deities they associated with Him. He will ask them where those alleged "partners" are, exposing the futility of their polytheistic beliefs and practices. The verse highlights the absurdity of ascribing partners to the One True God and serves as a warning against shirk (associating others with Allah).
orig: ويوم يناديهم فيقول أين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون

translation: And We will raise from every nation a witness, and We will say, 'Bring your proof.' Then they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and they will lose whatever they used to fabricate.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will call a witness from every nation to testify regarding the message that was conveyed to them by the prophets. Allah will ask them to present their proof or evidence for rejecting the truth. At that point, they will realize that the truth belongs to Allah alone, and all the falsehoods and fabrications they used to invent will be exposed as worthless.
orig: ونزعنا من كل أمة شهيدا فقلنا هاتوا برهانكم فعلموا أن الحق لله وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون

translation: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he behaved insolently towards them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men. When his people said to him, 'Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.'
interpretation: This verse is a warning against arrogance, greed, and ingratitude towards Allah's blessings. It tells the story of Qarun, who was given immense wealth by Allah but became arrogant and ungrateful. His people advised him not to be exultant and boastful about his wealth, as Allah does not love those who are arrogant and ungrateful. The verse teaches that true richness lies in faith, humility, and gratitude towards the Almighty, not in material possessions.
orig: إن قارون كان من قوم موسى فبغى عليهم وآتيناه من الكنوز ما إن مفاتحه لتنوء بالعصبة أولي القوة إذ قال له قومه لا تفرح إن الله لا يحب الفرحين

translation: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to strive for the eternal life of the Hereafter by utilizing the provisions Allah has granted them in this world, without neglecting their worldly responsibilities. It encourages them to do good deeds and be benevolent, just as Allah has been bountiful towards them. However, it warns against causing corruption or mischief on earth, as Allah does not favor those who spread corruption.
orig: وابتغ فيما آتاك الله الدار الآخرة ولا تنس نصيبك من الدنيا وأحسن كما أحسن الله إليك ولا تبغ الفساد في الأرض إن الله لا يحب المفسدين

translation: He said, 'This wealth has been given to me only because of the knowledge I possess.' Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him generations more powerful and greater in wealth than he? And the criminals will not be asked about their sins.
interpretation: This verse suggests that wealth and power are temporary and can be taken away at any time by Allah. It warns against arrogance and pride in one's possessions, as true knowledge comes from recognizing Allah's power and sovereignty. The verse also implies that those who commit crimes and sins will ultimately be held accountable by Allah, regardless of their worldly status or wealth.
orig: قال إنما أوتيته على علم عندي أولم يعلم أن الله قد أهلك من قبله من القرون من هو أشد منه قوة وأكثر جمعا ولا يسأل عن ذنوبهم المجرمون

translation: So he went forth before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, 'Oh, would that we had the likes of what Qarun has been given! Indeed, he is one of great fortune.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and materialism of Qarun and his people. Despite being blessed with wealth by Allah, Qarun became prideful and ungrateful. The people who were dazzled by his worldly possessions envied him and wished for similar fortune, being blinded by the temporary pleasures of this life and forgetting the eternal rewards of the Hereafter. The verse serves as a reminder to be humble, grateful to Allah, and to focus on the everlasting life after death rather than being consumed by worldly desires.
orig: فخرج على قومه في زينته قال الذين يريدون الحياة الدنيا يا ليت لنا مثل ما أوتي قارون إنه لذو حظ عظيم

translation: And those who were given knowledge said, 'Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteous deeds, and none will obtain it except the patient ones.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of faith, righteous deeds, and patience. Those with true knowledge understand that Allah's reward in the Hereafter is far superior to worldly gains. However, this eternal reward is only attained by those who have sincere belief, perform good actions, and persevere with patience through life's trials and difficulties.
orig: وقال الذين أوتوا العلم ويلكم ثواب الله خير لمن آمن وعمل صالحا ولا يلقاها إلا الصابرون

translation: So We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And he had no group to help him against Allah, nor was he one of those who could save themselves.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah punished the arrogant oppressor by causing the earth to swallow him and his home, leaving no trace of them. He had no supporters or helpers to save him from Allah's punishment, nor could he save himself. This verse emphasizes Allah's supreme power and ability to punish the wrongdoers, no matter how mighty they may seem.
orig: فخسفنا به وبداره الأرض فما كان له من فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان من المنتصرين

translation: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began saying, "Indeed, it is Allah who extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it. If not for Allah's favor upon us, He could have caused the earth to swallow us. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed."
interpretation: This verse highlights the unpredictability of life's circumstances and the importance of relying on Allah's mercy and provisions. Those who had envied the man's position the day before realized that it was only by Allah's grace that they were spared from a similar fate. They acknowledged that Allah alone grants sustenance and bounties to whomever He wills, and that the disbelievers' arrogance and rejection of faith will ultimately lead to their failure and ruin.
orig: وأصبح الذين تمنوا مكانه بالأمس يقولون ويكأن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر لولا أن من الله علينا لخسف بنا ويكأنه لا يفلح الكافرون

translation: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.
interpretation: This verse promises Paradise, the eternal home in the Hereafter, to those who are humble and do not seek superiority or cause corruption on earth. It emphasizes that the ultimate good end and reward is reserved for the pious and God-fearing people who lead a righteous life.
orig: تلك الدار الآخرة نجعلها للذين لا يريدون علوا في الأرض ولا فسادا والعاقبة للمتقين

translation: Whoever brings a good deed will have better than it, and whoever brings an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except for what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of fair recompense in the Hereafter. It states that whoever performs good deeds will be rewarded with something even better than what they did. However, those who commit evil deeds will only be punished in proportion to their misdeeds, without any injustice or excess. The verse highlights Allah's justice and mercy, as good deeds are rewarded abundantly while evil deeds are recompensed fairly.
orig: من جاء بالحسنة فله خير منها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى الذين عملوا السيئات إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: Indeed, He who has made the Qur'an obligatory upon you will surely bring you back to the place of return. Say, 'My Lord is most knowing of who has come with guidance and who is in clear error.'
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah, who has revealed the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad, will ultimately bring everyone back to Him on the Day of Judgment. The Prophet is instructed to say that only Allah knows who is truly guided and who is in manifest error, as He alone has complete knowledge of the hearts and intentions of people.
orig: إن الذي فرض عليك القرآن لرادك إلى معاد قل ربي أعلم من جاء بالهدى ومن هو في ضلال مبين

translation: And you did not expect that the Book would be conveyed to you, except as a mercy from your Lord. So do not be a supporter of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the revelation of the Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad was a great mercy from Allah, and he should not aid or support the disbelievers in any way, as the Qur'an guides to the truth and right path.
orig: وما كنت ترجو أن يلقى إليك الكتاب إلا رحمة من ربك فلا تكونن ظهيرا للكافرين

translation: And let them not avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite to your Lord and do not be of those who associate others with Him.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to remain steadfast in conveying the revelations of Allah and inviting people to worship Him alone, without associating any partners with Him. It warns him not to be deterred or dissuaded from preaching the message of Tawheed (Oneness of God) by those who reject it or associate others with Allah.
orig: ولا يصدنك عن آيات الله بعد إذ أنزلت إليك وادع إلى ربك ولا تكونن من المشركين

translation: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. To Him belongs the decision, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute Oneness of God (Tawheed). It commands the believers not to associate any partners with Allah in worship, for He alone is the true God worthy of worship. It states that everything in existence will perish except Allah's "Face," which means His Essence and Being. The verse affirms that Allah is the sole Sovereign who has the ultimate authority and power of judgment, and that all beings will ultimately return to Him for accountability on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: ولا تدع مع الله إلها آخر لا إله إلا هو كل شيء هالك إلا وجهه له الحكم وإليه ترجعون

translation: Alif Lam Meem
interpretation: These are among the disjointed or abbreviated letters that appear at the beginning of some chapters of the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah. However, scholars have suggested various interpretations, such as: they are an oath sworn by Allah, they represent the names of Allah, or they indicate that the Qur'an is composed of such letters and is thus a miracle.
orig: الم

translation: Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?
interpretation: This verse questions the belief of those who think that merely professing faith is enough, without being tested or tried for the sincerity of their belief. It implies that true faith must be proven through trials and difficulties, which serve as a means of purification and strengthening one's conviction.
orig: أحسب الناس أن يتركوا أن يقولوا آمنا وهم لا يفتنون

translation: And We had tried those before them, so Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah tests people to distinguish between the truthful believers and the liars. Just as previous nations were tested, this nation will also be tested. Through these trials and tests, Allah will make clear who are the truthful ones who remain steadfast in their faith, and who are the liars who abandon their beliefs or act hypocritically.
orig: ولقد فتنا الذين من قبلهم فليعلمن الله الذين صدقوا وليعلمن الكاذبين

translation: Or do those who commit evil deeds think that they can escape Us? How ill they judge!
interpretation: This verse questions the false belief of the evildoers that they can evade the punishment of Allah. It condemns their flawed judgment and warns them against assuming that they can escape the consequences of their misdeeds. The verse emphasizes that Allah is all-aware and no evil deed goes unnoticed or unpunished.
orig: أم حسب الذين يعملون السيئات أن يسبقونا ساء ما يحكمون

translation: Whoever desires the meeting with Allah, then Allah's appointed term is surely coming. And He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to strive for the meeting with Allah on the Day of Judgment by doing righteous deeds. It reminds them that Allah's appointed time for the Day of Resurrection is inevitable, and He is All-Hearing and All-Knowing of our intentions and actions. The interpretation emphasizes having faith in the Hereafter and living a life pleasing to Allah in anticipation of that ultimate meeting.
orig: من كان يرجو لقاء الله فإن أجل الله لآت وهو السميع العليم

translation: And whoever strives, strives only for himself. Surely, Allah is Self-Sufficient, beyond need from the worlds.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of striving and making efforts for one's own benefit and spiritual growth. It states that whoever engages in struggle or strives hard, does so for their own good and betterment. The verse then affirms that Allah is Self-Sufficient and has no need for anything or anyone in the entire universe. He is beyond need from all the worlds and their inhabitants. This highlights that our efforts and struggles are ultimately for our own benefit, as Allah is not in need of our deeds or worship. It encourages us to strive sincerely for our own spiritual elevation and success in the Hereafter.
orig: ومن جاهد فإنما يجاهد لنفسه إن الله لغني عن العالمين

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness and the best reward for those who have faith and perform good deeds. It shows that Allah will erase their sins and recompense them with the finest return for their righteous actions, reflecting His infinite mercy and justice.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنكفرن عنهم سيئاتهم ولنجزينهم أحسن الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, then obey them not. Unto Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being obedient and kind to one's parents, as long as their demands do not contradict Islamic teachings. If parents try to compel their children to associate partners with Allah or engage in polytheistic practices, the children should refuse to obey them in this matter, as it goes against the core belief in the Oneness of God. Ultimately, all humans will return to Allah, who will judge their deeds and intentions.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه حسنا وإن جاهداك لتشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما إلي مرجعكم فأنبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse promises that those who have faith and perform good deeds will be granted entry into Paradise and will be among the righteous and virtuous people. It emphasizes that true belief must be accompanied by righteous actions to attain salvation and a place among the pious in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لندخلنهم في الصالحين

translation: And among the people are those who say, 'We believe in Allah,' but when they are persecuted for the cause of Allah, they consider the persecution by the people as severe as the punishment of Allah. And if victory comes from your Lord, they say, 'Indeed, we were with you.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who claim to have faith but when facing persecution or trials for the sake of Allah, they regard it as a severe punishment, doubting their faith. However, if victory comes from Allah, they claim to have been with the believers all along, even though Allah knows what is truly in their hearts.
orig: ومن الناس من يقول آمنا بالله فإذا أوذي في الله جعل فتنة الناس كعذاب الله ولئن جاء نصر من ربك ليقولن إنا كنا معكم أوليس الله بأعلم بما في صدور العالمين

translation: And Allah will surely make evident those who believed, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will clearly distinguish between the true believers and the hypocrites. The true believers will be recognized for their sincere faith and righteous deeds, while the hypocrites, who outwardly profess faith but inwardly conceal disbelief and ill intentions, will be exposed for their hypocrisy. This serves as a reminder that one's true state of faith or disbelief will ultimately be made manifest before Allah, regardless of outward appearances.
orig: وليعلمن الله الذين آمنوا وليعلمن المنافقين

translation: And those who disbelieved say to those who believed, "Follow our way, and we will carry your sins." But they are not the carriers of anything from their sins. Indeed, they are liars.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and deception of the disbelievers. They falsely claim that they can absolve the believers of their sins if they follow their misguided way. However, the Qur'an emphatically states that they cannot bear any of the believers' sins, for each person is accountable for their own deeds. Their claim is a blatant lie, revealing their attempt to mislead the believers away from the truth.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا اتبعوا سبيلنا ولنحمل خطاياكم وما هم بحاملين من خطاياهم من شيء إنهم لكاذبون

translation: And they shall bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and also of the burdens of those whom they misled without knowledge. Evil indeed is that which they shall bear.
interpretation: This verse warns those who misguide others that they will not only bear the burden of their own sins on the Day of Judgment, but also the burden of those whom they led astray through falsehood and misguidance. It emphasizes the grave responsibility of spreading misinformation and leading others away from the truth, as the consequences of such actions will be compounded on the Day of Reckoning.
orig: وليحملن أثقالهم وأثقالا مع أثقالهم وليسألن يوم القيامة عما كانوا يفترون

translation: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse highlights the patience and perseverance of Prophet Noah in preaching the message of God to his people for an extremely long period of 950 years. Despite his tireless efforts, his people persisted in disbelief and wrongdoing, ultimately leading to their destruction by the great flood as a punishment from God for their transgression and rejection of faith.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا إلى قومه فلبث فيهم ألف سنة إلا خمسين عاما فأخذهم الطوفان وهم ظالمون

translation: So We saved him and the companions of the ship, and made it a sign for the worlds.
interpretation: Allah saved Prophet Nuh (Noah) and his companions who boarded the ark, and made the story of the ark a lesson and sign of Allah's power and mercy for all people and generations to come.
orig: فأنجيناه وأصحاب السفينة وجعلناها آية للعالمين

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his people, 'Worship Allah and fear Him. That is best for you, if you should know.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the call of Prophet Abraham to his people to worship Allah alone and have consciousness of Him. He advised them that this is better for them if they truly understand the reality of things. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of pure monotheism (Tawheed) and God-consciousness (Taqwa) for one's spiritual and worldly well-being.
orig: وإبراهيم إذ قال لقومه اعبدوا الله واتقوه ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: You worship besides Allah only idols, and you produce a falsehood. Indeed, those you worship besides Allah do not possess for you any provision. So seek from Allah provision and worship Him and be grateful to Him. To Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse condemns the worship of idols and false deities besides Allah, as they have no power to provide sustenance or benefit. It commands to seek provision from Allah alone, worship Him sincerely, be grateful to Him, and remember that to Him is the ultimate return on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إنما تعبدون من دون الله أوثانا وتخلقون إفكا إن الذين تعبدون من دون الله لا يملكون لكم رزقا فابتغوا عند الله الرزق واعبدوه واشكروا له إليه ترجعون

translation: And if you deny, then nations before you have also denied. And the Messenger's duty is only to convey the clear message.
interpretation: If you disbelieve in the message brought by the Prophet Muhammad, it is not something new, as many nations before you have denied the truth brought by their respective messengers. The sole responsibility of the Prophet is to clearly convey the divine message, and it is up to people to accept or reject it. The Prophet cannot force people to believe.
orig: وإن تكذبوا فقد كذب أمم من قبلكم وما على الرسول إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: Do they not see how Allah originates the creation, then will repeat it? Indeed, that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's power to resurrect all creation after death, just as He originated it in the first place. The ability to repeat the creation after it has perished is "easy" for Allah, the Almighty Creator. This affirms the reality of the Resurrection and reminds us of Allah's absolute control over all affairs.
orig: أولم يروا كيف يبدئ الله الخلق ثم يعيده إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: Say: "Travel through the earth and observe how Allah began creation. Then Allah will produce the final attainment. Indeed, Allah has power over all things."
interpretation: This verse encourages people to travel and explore the earth, observing the signs of Allah's creation and how He initiated it. It also emphasizes that Allah will bring about the resurrection and the final attainment, as He has power over all things. The verse implies that by observing the wonders of Allah's creation, one can gain a deeper appreciation for His might and ability to resurrect and renew creation in the Hereafter.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف بدأ الخلق ثم الله ينشئ النشأة الآخرة إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over all affairs. He alone decides whom to punish for their sins and whom to forgive based on His perfect wisdom and justice. Ultimately, all human beings will return to Allah on the Day of Judgment to account for their deeds and receive their deserved recompense.
orig: يعذب من يشاء ويرحم من يشاء وإليه تقلبون

translation: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not other than Allah any protector or any helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the utter powerlessness of human beings before Allah. It states that humans have no ability to escape Allah's dominion or evade His authority, whether on earth or in the heavens. They have no protector or helper besides Allah who can shield them from His will or provide them aid against Him. This highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and mankind's complete dependence upon Him.
orig: وما أنتم بمعجزين في الأرض ولا في السماء وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - it is those who have despaired of My mercy, and it is those who will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the dire consequences for those who reject the signs and revelations of Allah and deny the inevitability of meeting Him on the Day of Judgment. Such people have lost all hope of attaining Allah's mercy and forgiveness, and they will face a severe and agonizing punishment for their disbelief and defiance.
orig: والذين كفروا بآيات الله ولقائه أولئك يئسوا من رحمتي وأولئك لهم عذاب أليم

translation: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, 'Kill him or burn him,' but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Ibrahim (Abraham) and his people's rejection of his call to worship one God. Despite Ibrahim's efforts to guide them away from idolatry, his people threatened to kill or burn him. However, Allah protected Ibrahim from the fire they had prepared, demonstrating His power and the truth of Ibrahim's message. This incident serves as a sign and lesson for those who have faith and believe in Allah's ability to support His messengers and protect them from harm.
orig: فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا اقتلوه أو حرقوه فأنجاه الله من النار إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: And he said, 'You took not besides Allah [mere] idols out of affection among you in the worldly life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another and curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the idolaters who took idols as objects of worship out of mutual affection and social bonds in this worldly life. On the Day of Resurrection, they will disown and curse one another, as their idols will be of no benefit to them. Their ultimate abode will be the Fire, and they will have no helper or supporter to save them from Allah's punishment.
orig: وقال إنما اتخذتم من دون الله أوثانا مودة بينكم في الحياة الدنيا ثم يوم القيامة يكفر بعضكم ببعض ويلعن بعضكم بعضا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: So Lut believed in him and said: 'Indeed I am emigrating towards my Lord, for truly He is the Almighty, the Wise.'
interpretation: This verse highlights Lut's unwavering faith in God and his decision to migrate from the sinful society he lived in. His statement "Indeed I am emigrating towards my Lord" signifies his complete devotion and trust in God's wisdom and power. By describing God as "the Almighty, the Wise," Lut acknowledges God's might and perfect judgment, which guided his choice to distance himself from the immorality surrounding him.
orig: فآمن له لوط وقال إني مهاجر إلى ربي إنه هو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We placed among his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.
interpretation: Allah bestowed upon Abraham the gift of two righteous sons, Isaac and Jacob. He also granted prophethood and divine scripture to Abraham's descendants, meaning that many prophets and messengers would come from his lineage. Additionally, Allah rewarded Abraham in this worldly life for his faith and obedience. And in the Hereafter, he will be among the righteous who will attain the highest levels of Paradise due to his unwavering belief and submission to Allah.
orig: ووهبنا له إسحاق ويعقوب وجعلنا في ذريته النبوة والكتاب وآتيناه أجره في الدنيا وإنه في الآخرة لمن الصالحين

translation: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, 'Indeed, you commit such immorality as no one has preceded you with from among the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Prophet Lut (Lot) who warned his people against the grave sin of homosexuality, which was unprecedented in human history at that time. He admonished them for committing such an abhorrent act that none in the world had done before.
orig: ولوطا إذ قال لقومه إنكم لتأتون الفاحشة ما سبقكم بها من أحد من العالمين

translation: Do you indeed approach men, and cut off the way, and commit evil deeds in your meetings? But the answer of his people was only that they said: Bring Allah's torment upon us if you are one of the truthful.
interpretation: This verse is condemning the homosexual behavior and highway robbery practiced by the people of Lut (Lot). It criticizes their shameful gatherings where they would commit evil deeds. When Lut warned them against these sins, they arrogantly challenged him to bring Allah's punishment upon them if he was truthful in his message.
orig: أئنكم لتأتون الرجال وتقطعون السبيل وتأتون في ناديكم المنكر فما كان جواب قومه إلا أن قالوا ائتنا بعذاب الله إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said, 'My Lord, help me against the mischievous people.'
interpretation: This verse is a supplication from a prophet asking Allah for help against those who spread corruption and evil in the land. It signifies the struggle between truth and falsehood, and the need for divine assistance in overcoming the obstacles and challenges posed by those who reject faith and promote immorality.
orig: قال رب انصرني على القوم المفسدين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said: 'Verily, we are going to destroy the people of this town, for indeed its people have been wrongdoers.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the visit of the angels to Prophet Abraham to give him the good news of a son, and to inform him of their mission to destroy the people of Sodom and Gomorrah due to their persistent sinful behavior and rejection of faith despite being warned by Prophet Lot.
orig: ولما جاءت رسلنا إبراهيم بالبشرى قالوا إنا مهلكو أهل هذه القرية إن أهلها كانوا ظالمين

translation: He said: 'Lot is therein.' They said: 'We are better aware of who is therein. We will surely rescue him and his family, except his wife; she is of those who will remain behind.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the conversation between the angels and Prophet Abraham regarding the destruction of the people of Lot. The angels informed Abraham that Lot and his believing family members would be saved from the punishment, except his wife who had chosen disbelief and would remain among those who would be destroyed.
orig: قال إن فيها لوطا قالوا نحن أعلم بمن فيها لننجينه وأهله إلا امرأته كانت من الغابرين

translation: And when Our messengers came to Lut, he was anguished for them and felt for them great discomfort. They said, 'Fear not, nor grieve. Indeed, we will save you and your family, except your wife; she is to be of those who remain behind.
interpretation: This verse describes the situation when the angels came to Prophet Lut (Lot) to deliver the message of Allah and warn him about the impending punishment for his people due to their sinful acts of homosexuality. Lut was distressed to receive the angels, thinking they were men who could be harmed by his people. However, the angels reassured him not to fear or grieve, for they would save him and his family, except his wife who was one of the disbelievers.
orig: ولما أن جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقالوا لا تخف ولا تحزن إنا منجوك وأهلك إلا امرأتك كانت من الغابرين

translation: Indeed, We will send down on the people of this city a punishment from the sky because they have been defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: "This verse refers to Allah's punishment for those who persist in sinful and corrupt behavior. The people of the city mentioned had become defiant in their disobedience to Allah's commands, and as a result, a severe punishment from the heavens would be sent upon them. This serves as a warning against indulging in sinful acts and highlights the consequences of turning away from the path of righteousness."
orig: إنا منزلون على أهل هذه القرية رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون

translation: And We have left thereof an evident Sign, for any people who (earnestly) reflect.
interpretation: This verse refers to the ruins and remnants of the destroyed towns of the people of Lut (Lot), which were left as a clear sign and lesson for those who reflect and ponder. The destruction of these immoral societies serves as evidence of Allah's power and as a warning against disobeying His commands and indulging in sinful behavior.
orig: ولقد تركنا منها آية بينة لقوم يعقلون

translation: And to the Madyan people (We sent) their brother Shu'ayb. He said: 'O my people! Worship Allah, and expect the Last Day, and do not act wickedly on the earth to cause corruption.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone, having faith in the Day of Judgement, and avoiding corruption and mischief on earth. It introduces the story of Prophet Shu'ayb who was sent to the people of Madyan to guide them towards monotheism and righteous conduct.
orig: وإلى مدين أخاهم شعيبا فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله وارجوا اليوم الآخر ولا تعثوا في الأرض مفسدين

translation: But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they lay prostrate in their home.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people of Prophet Shu'ayb who rejected his message and warnings. As a result, Allah punished them with a severe earthquake that caused them to fall down lifeless in their own homes. The interpretation is that Allah's punishment is severe for those who defy His messengers and reject the truth, even if they feel secure in their homes and dwellings.
orig: فكذبوه فأخذتهم الرجفة فأصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين

translation: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with insight.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that Allah destroyed the nations of 'Aad and Thamud, whose ruined dwellings serve as a clear evidence of their destruction. Satan made their evil deeds seem attractive to them, leading them astray from the straight path, despite their intelligence and ability to discern right from wrong.
orig: وعادا وثمود وقد تبين لكم من مساكنهم وزين لهم الشيطان أعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل وكانوا مستبصرين

translation: And Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman: There came to them Moses with clear proofs, but they behaved arrogantly on the earth, and they could not outstrip [Us].
interpretation: "The verse highlights the arrogance and defiance of powerful individuals like Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman, who rejected the clear signs and message brought by Prophet Moses. Despite the evident truth presented to them, they chose to behave arrogantly on the earth, refusing to submit to God's guidance. However, their arrogance and attempts to escape accountability were ultimately futile, as they could not outrun or surpass God's decree and punishment."
orig: وقارون وفرعون وهامان ولقد جاءهم موسى بالبينات فاستكبروا في الأرض وما كانوا سابقين

translation: So We seized each of them for their sin; upon some of them We sent a storm of stones, and some were seized by the Blast, and some We caused the earth to swallow, and some We drowned. And Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne que Dieu a puni chaque communauté en fonction de ses péchés et de sa désobéissance. Certains ont été frappés par une pluie de pierres, d'autres ont été détruits par un cri puissant, d'autres ont été engloutis par la terre, et d'autres encore se sont noyés. Cependant, Dieu ne les a pas punis injustement, car c'est leur propre transgression et leur refus d'obéir qui ont causé leur punition. Dieu est juste et ne fait de tort à personne, mais ce sont les gens eux-mêmes qui se font du tort en désobéissant à Ses commandements.
orig: فكلا أخذنا بذنبه فمنهم من أرسلنا عليه حاصبا ومنهم من أخذته الصيحة ومنهم من خسفنا به الأرض ومنهم من أغرقنا وما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.
interpretation: This verse uses a metaphor to highlight the futility of taking allies other than Allah. It likens those who seek protection from other than Allah to a spider that builds a frail home. Just as a spider's web is weak and fragile, seeking allies besides Allah provides no real protection or security. The verse emphasizes that true security and protection can only come from Allah, and relying on anything or anyone else is a vain effort that offers no genuine support or refuge.
orig: مثل الذين اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء كمثل العنكبوت اتخذت بيتا وإن أوهن البيوت لبيت العنكبوت لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon instead of Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: Allah knows the falsehood of what the polytheists worship besides Him, for none has the right to be worshipped except Allah alone. He is the Almighty, whose Might, Grandeur, and Majesty none can overcome. He is also the All-Wise in His Legislation and Decrees.
orig: إن الله يعلم ما يدعون من دونه من شيء وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: And these examples We present to the people, but none will grasp their meanings except the learned.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the parables and examples given in the Qur'an are meant to help people understand its teachings and guidance, but only those who have knowledge and wisdom can truly comprehend their deeper meanings and implications. It highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and having an open and inquiring mind to fully benefit from the Qur'anic teachings.
orig: وتلك الأمثال نضربها للناس وما يعقلها إلا العالمون

translation: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Verily, in that are signs for those who believe.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah created the entire universe, including the heavens and the earth, with purpose and wisdom, not in vain or for mere play. The creation itself is evidence of Allah's existence, power, and oneness for those who have faith and reflect upon the signs present in the natural world around them.
orig: خلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق إن في ذلك لآية للمؤمنين

translation: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prevents from immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of reciting the Qur'an, establishing regular prayer, and remembering Allah. Prayer is highlighted as a means to prevent immorality and wrongdoing, while the remembrance of Allah is described as the greatest thing. The verse concludes by stating that Allah is aware of all our actions.
orig: اتل ما أوحي إليك من الكتاب وأقم الصلاة إن الصلاة تنهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر ولذكر الله أكبر والله يعلم ما تصنعون

translation: And do not argue with the People of the Scripture except in a way that is best, except for those who commit injustice among them, and say, "We believe in that which has been revealed to us and revealed to you. And our God and your God is one; and we are Muslims [in submission] to Him."
interpretation: "This verse instructs Muslims on how to engage in dialogue with the People of the Book (Jews and Christians). It advises against arguing with them in an offensive or inappropriate manner, except in the case of those who are oppressive. Instead, Muslims should adopt a kind and respectful approach, acknowledging the common ground of belief in the one God and the revealed scriptures. The verse promotes peaceful coexistence, mutual understanding, and respectful dialogue based on shared values and principles."
orig: ولا تجادلوا أهل الكتاب إلا بالتي هي أحسن إلا الذين ظلموا منهم وقولوا آمنا بالذي أنزل إلينا وأنزل إليكم وإلهنا وإلهكم واحد ونحن له مسلمون

translation: And thus We have sent down to you the Book, and those to whom We gave the Scripture believe in it, and of these [people] there are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن القرآن الكريم أنزل على النبي محمد صلى الله عليه وسلم بنفس الطريقة التي أنزلت بها الكتب السماوية السابقة، وأن أهل الكتاب من اليهود والنصارى الذين آمنوا بكتبهم السابقة سيؤمنون بالقرآن أيضًا لأنه من عند الله. ولكن هناك بعض الناس الذين لا يؤمنون بآيات الله ويجحدونها، وهؤلاء هم الكافرون.
orig: وكذلك أنزلنا إليك الكتاب فالذين آتيناهم الكتاب يؤمنون به ومن هؤلاء من يؤمن به وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الكافرون

translation: And you were not reciting any Book before it, nor did you inscribe it with your right hand, for then the falsifiers would have doubted.
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine origin of the Qur'an and the fact that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was unlettered. It emphasizes that the Qur'an was not derived from any previous scripture, nor was it written by the Prophet himself. If he had done so, the disbelievers would have doubted its authenticity, claiming he had written it himself. This verse establishes the Qur'an as a divine revelation from Allah, free from human interference or fabrication.
orig: وما كنت تتلو من قبله من كتاب ولا تخطه بيمينك إذا لارتاب المبطلون

translation: Rather, it is clear verses within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an contains clear and evident signs and proofs that are firmly established in the hearts and minds of those who have been granted knowledge and understanding by Allah. However, those who are unjust and oppressive reject and deny these clear signs and verses due to their arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: بل هو آيات بينات في صدور الذين أوتوا العلم وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا الظالمون

translation: And they say, 'Why are signs not sent down to him from his Lord?' Say, 'The signs are only with Allah, and I am but a clear warner.'
interpretation: The disbelievers demanded miracles from the Prophet Muhammad as proof of his prophethood. However, the verse emphasizes that miracles and signs are entirely up to Allah's will and wisdom. The Prophet's role was to convey the clear warning and message, not to produce miracles on demand.
orig: وقالوا لولا أنزل عليه آيات من ربه قل إنما الآيات عند الله وإنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you the Book which is recited to them? Verily, in this is mercy and a reminder for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the revelation of the Qur'an itself should be sufficient proof for the disbelievers. It is a great mercy and reminder from Allah for those who have faith and believe in Him. The Qur'an guides people to the truth and righteousness, and its recitation should soften their hearts and lead them to belief.
orig: أولم يكفهم أنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب يتلى عليهم إن في ذلك لرحمة وذكرى لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, 'Sufficient is Allah as a witness between me and you. He knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah - it is they who are the losers.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the all-encompassing knowledge and authority of Allah. He is sufficient as a witness between the Prophet Muhammad and the disbelievers. Allah knows everything in the heavens and the earth, so He is fully aware of the truth and falsehood. Those who believe in falsehood and reject Allah are the real losers, as they have deviated from the straight path and will face the consequences of their disbelief.
orig: قل كفى بالله بيني وبينكم شهيدا يعلم ما في السماوات والأرض والذين آمنوا بالباطل وكفروا بالله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And they ask you to hasten on the punishment, and had it not been for a term appointed, the punishment would certainly have come to them. And certainly, it will come to them suddenly while they perceive it not.
interpretation: This verse warns against the arrogance and impatience of the disbelievers who demanded that the punishment be hastened upon them. It emphasizes that if not for a predetermined time decreed by Allah, the punishment would have already come to them. However, it will undoubtedly come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.
orig: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولولا أجل مسمى لجاءهم العذاب وليأتينهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: They ask you to hasten the punishment, but indeed Hellfire will encompass the disbelievers.
interpretation: The disbelievers mockingly demand that the punishment Allah has promised them be brought forth quickly. However, Allah warns that the torment of Hellfire is an inescapable reality that will surely engulf those who reject faith.
orig: يستعجلونك بالعذاب وإن جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين

translation: The Day the torment will cover them from above them and from under their feet, and He will say, "Taste what you used to do."
interpretation: This verse describes a terrifying scene on the Day of Judgment, where the disbelievers will be engulfed by torment from all sides. The "torment" refers to the severe punishment they will face for rejecting faith and committing evil deeds. It will come from above them, possibly in the form of scorching heat or raining flames, and from under their feet, perhaps as a raging fire beneath them. In this state of utter distress, they will be addressed with the words "Taste what you used to do," indicating that they are being recompensed for their misdeeds in this world. The verse serves as a stern warning to humanity, urging them to mend their ways and embrace faith to avoid such a dreadful fate.
orig: يوم يغشاهم العذاب من فوقهم ومن تحت أرجلهم ويقول ذوقوا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.
interpretation: "This verse is an invitation from Allah to His believing servants to devote their worship solely to Him, as He is the only One worthy of worship. Allah reminds them that His earth is vast, providing ample space and opportunities for them to earn a living and fulfill their needs, without associating partners with Him. The verse emphasizes the importance of pure monotheism (Tawheed) and rejecting any form of polytheism or idolatry."
orig: يا عبادي الذين آمنوا إن أرضي واسعة فإياي فاعبدون

translation: Every soul shall taste death, then unto Us you shall be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death for all living beings. It states that every soul, meaning every person, will experience death. However, death is not the end, as the verse affirms that after death, all souls will be returned to Allah for judgment and accountability. This verse serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of this worldly life and the certainty of the Hereafter, where each person will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ثم إلينا ترجعون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide forever. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers and doers of good deeds entry into the everlasting Gardens of Paradise, where rivers flow beneath them. It highlights that the reward for those who have faith and perform righteous actions is an excellent and eternal one in the Hereafter.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنبوئنهم من الجنة غرفا تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها نعم أجر العاملين

translation: Those who are patient and put their trust in their Lord.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who face difficulties and trials with patience and steadfastness, placing their complete trust and reliance upon Allah. It highlights the virtues of patience (sabr) and trust in God (tawakkul) as essential qualities for the believers to cultivate. Patience enables them to endure hardships and challenges without losing hope or faith, while trust in Allah provides them with inner peace, strength, and the assurance that He is the ultimate disposer of affairs and will aid them through their difficulties. The verse encourages the believers to adopt these noble traits, which will ultimately lead them to success and reward.
orig: الذين صبروا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And how many a creature cannot carry its own sustenance? Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's infinite mercy and providence. It teaches us that just as Allah provides sustenance for countless creatures who cannot acquire it themselves, He also provides for us human beings. It emphasizes Allah's attribute of being the All-Hearer, who hears all supplications, and the All-Knower, who knows all our needs. This should instill in us a sense of gratitude, trust, and reliance on Allah as the sole Sustainer.
orig: وكأين من دابة لا تحمل رزقها الله يرزقها وإياكم وهو السميع العليم

translation: And if you asked them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Then how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse highlights the innate belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed) that is ingrained in human nature. Despite the prevalence of polytheism and idolatry, if people are asked about the Creator of the heavens, earth, and the celestial bodies like the sun and moon, they would undoubtedly attribute it to Allah. However, their actions contradict this belief as they associate partners with Allah or worship other deities, which the Qur'an condemns as "deluded" or misguided.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض وسخر الشمس والقمر ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: Allah enlarges the provision for whom He wills of His servants, and straitens it for whom (He wills). Verily, Allah is the All-Knower of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and control over the sustenance and provisions He grants to His servants. He bestows abundance or scarcity upon whomever He wills, based on His infinite wisdom and knowledge. It reminds us to trust in Allah's decree and have faith that He knows what is best for each individual.
orig: الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And if you asked them, 'Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise be to Allah'; but most of them do not reason.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's power and mercy in sending down rain to revive the lifeless earth. It also highlights the ignorance of those who recognize Allah's blessings but fail to truly comprehend and appreciate them. The verse encourages us to praise Allah for His favors and to use our intellect to understand His signs and reflect upon His greatness.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من نزل من السماء ماء فأحيا به الأرض من بعد موتها ليقولن الله قل الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعقلون

translation: And what is the life of this world except diversion and play? And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is truly the eternal life, if only they knew.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the transient nature of this worldly life, describing it as mere amusement and play. It contrasts this with the everlasting life of the Hereafter, which is the true and eternal existence. The verse implies that if people truly understood the reality of the Hereafter, they would not become overly attached to the temporary pleasures of this world.
orig: وما هذه الحياة الدنيا إلا لهو ولعب وإن الدار الآخرة لهي الحيوان لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: But when they embark on a ship, they call upon Allah, sincerely professing faith in Him alone; but when He delivers them safely to land, behold, they associate others with Him.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the insincerity and hypocrisy of those who call upon Allah alone when facing difficulties at sea, but associate partners with Him when they are safely on land. It highlights the human tendency to turn to God in times of distress but forget Him when the hardship passes, reverting to polytheistic beliefs and practices.
orig: فإذا ركبوا في الفلك دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين فلما نجاهم إلى البر إذا هم يشركون

translation: That they may disbelieve in that which We have revealed unto them, and that they may take their portion of pleasure (in this world); but they will come to know.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject the revelation and guidance from Allah, and indulge in the temporary pleasures of this worldly life. It implies that they will eventually realize the consequences of their disbelief and denial of the truth, when it is too late. Their enjoyment of worldly pleasures is short-lived, and they will face the reality of their choices.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم وليتمتعوا فسوف يعلمون

translation: Have they not seen that We have made a safe sanctuary while people are being snatched away around them? Then do they believe in falsehood and deny the favor of Allah?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' failure to recognize the blessings and security provided by Allah, despite witnessing the safety and peace in the sacred territory of Makkah, while people around them are being seized and oppressed. It condemns their belief in falsehood and ingratitude towards Allah's favors.
orig: أولم يروا أنا جعلنا حرما آمنا ويتخطف الناس من حولهم أفبالباطل يؤمنون وبنعمة الله يكفرون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not a home in Hell for the disbelievers?
interpretation: This verse condemns those who falsely attribute lies to Allah or reject the truth after it has been made clear to them. It warns that such individuals, referred to as disbelievers, will have their abode in Hell as a consequence of their grave injustice and rejection of faith.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا أو كذب بالحق لما جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse promises divine guidance and support for those who make sincere efforts and struggle in the cause of Allah. It emphasizes that Allah will guide them to the straight path and facilitate their journey towards righteousness. The verse also affirms that Allah is with those who do good deeds and have a sincere intention, providing them with His assistance and blessings.
orig: والذين جاهدوا فينا لنهدينهم سبلنا وإن الله لمع المحسنين

translation: Alif, Laam, Meem.
interpretation: These are some of the disconnected letters (al-Muqatta'aat) that appear at the beginning of certain chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meanings are known only to Allah.
