However, scholars have suggested that they may serve as symbols representing Allah or represent divine names and attributes. They are meant to draw our attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an and its inimitable linguistic and literary style.
orig: الم

translation: The Romans have been defeated
interpretation: This verse refers to a military defeat suffered by the Byzantine Romans at the hands of the Persians. However, it goes on to predict that the Romans will eventually triumph after their initial defeat, which is interpreted as a divine promise of victory for the persecuted Muslims of Mecca against their pagan opponents.
orig: غلبت الروم

translation: In the lowest part of the land, and they, after their conquest, will be victorious
interpretation: This verse suggests that although the believers may face subjugation and oppression in the present, they will ultimately prevail and attain victory. It implies that their current state of being overpowered is temporary, and their faith and perseverance will lead them to triumph over their adversaries in the end.
orig: في أدنى الأرض وهم من بعد غلبهم سيغلبون

translation: In a few years, to Allah belongs the command before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice
interpretation: This verse indicates that within a few years, Allah's command and decree will prevail, and the true believers will rejoice on that day when Allah's will is fulfilled. It suggests that the believers should have patience and trust in Allah's plan, as the final victory belongs to Him and those who have faith.
orig: في بضع سنين لله الأمر من قبل ومن بعد ويومئذ يفرح المؤمنون

translation: With the help of Allah, He gives victory to whom He wills, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and control over all affairs. It reminds us that victory and success come only through Allah's help and by His will. He alone decides whom to grant victory, based on His infinite wisdom and mercy. The verse highlights two of Allah's attributes - 'Al-Aziz' (the Exalted in Might) and 'Ar-Raheem' (the Merciful). This teaches us to have complete trust in Allah, seek His help sincerely, and submit to His will, as He is the only true source of might and the ultimate bestower of mercy.
orig: بنصر الله ينصر من يشاء وهو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Allah does not fail in His promise, but most people do not know.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of Allah's promises being fulfilled, as He never goes back on His word. However, it also highlights the lack of knowledge or understanding among most people regarding this truth. The interpretation highlights Allah's unwavering commitment to keeping His promises, while simultaneously acknowledging the widespread ignorance or disbelief among humanity concerning this fundamental aspect of His nature.
orig: وعد الله لا يخلف الله وعده ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: They know only the outer appearance of the life of this world, and they are heedless of the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who are preoccupied with the material and superficial aspects of this worldly life, while neglecting or being oblivious to the eternal life of the Hereafter. It implies that they lack true understanding and spiritual awareness, as they are focused solely on the temporary and outward appearances of this world, ignoring the deeper realities and consequences of their actions in the everlasting Hereafter.
orig: يعلمون ظاهرا من الحياة الدنيا وهم عن الآخرة هم غافلون

translation: Have they not contemplated within themselves? Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to ponder and reflect upon themselves and the creation around them. It states that Allah did not create the heavens, the earth, and everything in between without purpose, truth, and wisdom. Rather, there is an appointed time for the existence of this universe. The verse also highlights that many people deny or disbelieve in meeting their Lord on the Day of Resurrection, despite the clear signs of Allah's existence and power.
orig: أولم يتفكروا في أنفسهم ما خلق الله السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى وإن كثيرا من الناس بلقاء ربهم لكافرون

translation: Have they not traveled through the earth and seen how the end of those before them was? They were greater than them in strength, and they plowed the earth and settled it more than they have settled it, and their messengers came to them with clear proofs. And Allah would not ever wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.
interpretation: Cette verse invite les gens à réfléchir sur le sort des nations précédentes qui étaient plus puissantes qu'eux, mais qui ont été détruites à cause de leur mécréance et de leurs péchés. Malgré leur force et leurs réalisations, lorsque les messagers leur ont apporté des preuves claires, ils les ont rejetées. Dieu ne les a pas lésés, mais ce sont eux-mêmes qui se sont lésés en rejetant la vérité. Cela sert d'avertissement pour que les gens ne suivent pas leurs traces et croient en Dieu et en Ses messagers.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا أشد منهم قوة وأثاروا الأرض وعمروها أكثر مما عمروها وجاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا أنفسهم يظلمون

translation: Then the end of those who did evil was the worst because they denied the signs of Allah and used to mock them.
interpretation: This verse warns of the grave consequences awaiting those who persist in denying God's revelations and mocking His signs. Their evil actions will ultimately lead them to the worst possible outcome, which is eternal punishment and deprivation from God's mercy. The verse emphasizes the importance of faith, reverence towards divine signs, and refraining from mockery or disbelief.
orig: ثم كان عاقبة الذين أساءوا السوأى أن كذبوا بآيات الله وكانوا بها يستهزئون

translation: Allah begins the creation, then He will repeat it, then to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse refers to the power of Allah as the Creator and Sustainer of all existence. It affirms that Allah initiated the creation of the universe and all beings, and that He will bring about a new creation after the present one ends on the Day of Resurrection. Ultimately, all souls will return to Allah to be judged and held accountable for their deeds in this worldly life.
orig: الله يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And on the Day when the Hour will be established, the criminals will be struck dumb with despair.
interpretation: On the Day of Resurrection, when the Hour of Judgment arrives, the disbelievers and sinners will be in a state of utter confusion, regret, and speechlessness. They will be unable to offer any excuses or defend themselves against the overwhelming reality of God's judgment and the consequences of their actions.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يبلس المجرمون

translation: And there will be no intercessors for them from among their partners, and they will disbelieve in their partners.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the false deities that the polytheists associated with Allah will not be able to intercede or help them in any way. The polytheists themselves will reject and disown their supposed partners, realizing that they had been utterly misguided in worshipping them besides Allah.
orig: ولم يكن لهم من شركائهم شفعاء وكانوا بشركائهم كافرين

translation: And on the Day when the Hour will be established - that Day they will become separated.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when people will be divided into different groups based on their beliefs and deeds. The "separation" mentioned here implies that the believers will be distinguished from the disbelievers, and each group will face its respective consequence. The pious will be rewarded, while the wicked will be punished. It serves as a reminder of the accountability that awaits every soul on that momentous Day.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يتفرقون

translation: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, they will be in a Garden, delighted.
interpretation: This verse promises a blissful reward in Paradise for the believers who not only had faith, but also performed righteous deeds. It implies that mere belief is not sufficient; one must complement it with good actions to attain the ultimate reward of eternal happiness and pleasure in the Gardens of Paradise.
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فهم في روضة يحبرون

translation: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, they are the ones who will be brought into the punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers who rejected faith and denied Allah's revelations and signs, as well as the reality of the Hereafter and Resurrection, that they will be subjected to a severe punishment on the Day of Judgment. Their denial of the truth and refusal to believe will lead them to be brought forth for punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا ولقاء الآخرة فأولئك في العذاب محضرون

translation: So glorify Allah when you enter the night and when you arise in the morning.
interpretation: This verse commands us to glorify and praise Allah at the beginning and end of each day. It reminds us to start and end our days with the remembrance of Allah, acknowledging His greatness and expressing gratitude for His blessings. The act of glorifying Allah helps us maintain a connection with Him and keeps us mindful of our purpose in life.
orig: فسبحان الله حين تمسون وحين تصبحون

translation: And to Him is due all praise in the heavens and the earth, in the evening and when you reach the morning.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that all praise and gratitude belong to Allah alone, at all times and in all places. It highlights the constant need to praise and thank Allah, the Creator and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth, in the evening and morning, symbolizing all times of the day and night.
orig: وله الحمد في السماوات والأرض وعشيا وحين تظهرون

translation: He brings forth the living from the dead, and brings forth the dead from the living, and revives the earth after its death. And thus shall you be brought forth.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's power to give life and cause death. It speaks of His ability to bring forth living beings from inanimate matter, and vice versa. It also alludes to the resurrection after death, when all will be brought forth from the earth to account for their deeds.
orig: يخرج الحي من الميت ويخرج الميت من الحي ويحيي الأرض بعد موتها وكذلك تخرجون

translation: And among His Signs is this: He created you from dust; and then, behold you are human beings scattered (far and wide)!
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating human beings from a humble origin, which is dust or clay. It reminds us of our humble beginnings and how we were brought into existence from a lifeless matter. Despite our insignificant origins, Allah has bestowed upon us the great honor of being human beings with the ability to spread across the earth and thrive. This verse encourages us to reflect on the miraculous nature of our creation and to be grateful to Allah for the countless blessings He has bestowed upon us.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلقكم من تراب ثم إذا أنتم بشر تنتشرون

translation: And among His signs is that He created for you mates from among yourselves, that you may dwell in tranquility with them, and He has put love and mercy between you. Verily, in that are signs for people who reflect.
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound wisdom behind the creation of spouses from among humankind itself. It emphasizes that the purpose of this creation is to foster a sense of tranquility, love, and mercy within the marital bond. The verse invites contemplation on the deeper spiritual and emotional connections that exist between spouses, which serve as signs of God's mercy and wisdom for those who ponder upon them.
orig: ومن آياته أن خلق لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا لتسكنوا إليها وجعل بينكم مودة ورحمة إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: And among His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your tongues and colors. Surely in this are signs for those of knowledge.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity and wonders found in Allah's creation as a sign of His power and wisdom. The creation of the heavens and earth, along with the diversity of human languages and skin colors, are presented as evidence of Allah's existence and greatness. This diversity is not random, but a purposeful design meant to encourage contemplation and recognition of the Creator by those who possess knowledge and insight.
orig: ومن آياته خلق السماوات والأرض واختلاف ألسنتكم وألوانكم إن في ذلك لآيات للعالمين

translation: And among His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah in providing rest through sleep at night and opportunities to seek sustenance during the day. It invites people to reflect on these favors as signs of Allah's wisdom and mercy for those who are attentive and listen to the message.
orig: ومن آياته منامكم بالليل والنهار وابتغاؤكم من فضله إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يسمعون

translation: And among His signs is that He shows you the lightning, causing fear and hope, and He sends down water from the sky, giving life thereby to the earth after its death. Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights two of Allah's signs that demonstrate His power and mercy: lightning and rain. The lightning, with its fearsome flashes and thunderous sound, instills a sense of fear and awe in people, reminding them of Allah's might. At the same time, it brings hope for the life-giving rain that follows. The rain, sent down from the sky, revives the earth after it has been dry and lifeless, allowing vegetation to grow and sustaining all living beings. These phenomena are clear signs pointing to the existence and greatness of the Creator for those who use their intellect and contemplate the marvels of Allah's creation.
orig: ومن آياته يريكم البرق خوفا وطمعا وينزل من السماء ماء فيحيي به الأرض بعد موتها إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: And among His signs is that the heaven and the earth remain by His command. Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth, at once you will come forth.
interpretation: This verse indicates the absolute power and authority of Allah over the entire universe. The heavens and the earth continue to exist and function perfectly by Allah's command and will. When the Day of Resurrection comes, and Allah calls all human beings with a single call from the earth, they will immediately come out of their graves, obeying His command. This shows that just as Allah has power over creating and sustaining the universe, He also has power over resurrection and gathering all people for judgment.
orig: ومن آياته أن تقوم السماء والأرض بأمره ثم إذا دعاكم دعوة من الأرض إذا أنتم تخرجون

translation: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are devoutly obedient to Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over all creation. Everything in the heavens and the earth, including all creatures, are submissive and obedient to Allah's commands and laws. This implies that nothing occurs without Allah's knowledge and permission, and that He is the sole controller of the universe. The verse instills a sense of humility and reverence towards the Almighty.
orig: وله من في السماوات والأرض كل له قانتون

translation: And He is the One Who begins the creation, then He will repeat it, and that is easy for Him. To Him belongs the highest description in the heavens and the earth. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's ability to initiate creation and then repeat it, which refers to the resurrection after death. It emphasizes that this process is effortless for Allah. The verse also highlights Allah's sublime attributes, stating that the highest and most perfect descriptions belong to Him in the heavens and the earth. Additionally, it describes Allah as the Almighty, who possesses absolute power, and the All-Wise, whose actions are based on perfect wisdom and knowledge.
orig: وهو الذي يبدأ الخلق ثم يعيده وهو أهون عليه وله المثل الأعلى في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He presents to you a parable from your own selves: Do you have partners among those whom your right hands possess who share with you alike in the provision We have bestowed upon you? You hold them equal (in sharing) as you fear one another? Thus do We explain the verses for people who understand.
interpretation: Allah presents a parable to make people understand that it is illogical to associate partners with Him. Just as people do not accept partners from among their slaves in the wealth that Allah has provided them, similarly it is irrational to associate partners with Allah in His Lordship and Divinity. The verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and the absurdity of associating partners with Him.
orig: ضرب لكم مثلا من أنفسكم هل لكم من ما ملكت أيمانكم من شركاء في ما رزقناكم فأنتم فيه سواء تخافونهم كخيفتكم أنفسكم كذلك نفصل الآيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: Nay, but those who do wrong follow their own lusts without knowledge. Who is there to guide him whom Allah has sent astray? And they will have no helpers.
interpretation: This verse warns against following one's desires and whims without knowledge or guidance from Allah. It emphasizes that those who persist in wrongdoing and remain heedless of Allah's guidance will be left to stray, with no one to guide them and no supporters to help them. The verse highlights the importance of seeking knowledge, following the truth, and submitting to Allah's guidance to avoid misguidance and spiritual ruin.
orig: بل اتبع الذين ظلموا أهواءهم بغير علم فمن يهدي من أضل الله وما لهم من ناصرين

translation: So set your face towards the religion uprightly; the nature made by Allah in which He has created mankind. There is no altering Allah's creation; that is the right religion, but most people do not know.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad and the believers to adhere to the pure, upright religion of Islam, which is in accordance with the natural disposition (fitrah) that Allah has instilled in all human beings. This natural disposition is to worship Allah alone and reject all forms of polytheism and idolatry. The verse emphasizes that the religion of Islam is the true and unwavering religion established by Allah, and that most people are unaware of this truth due to their ignorance and misguidance.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين حنيفا فطرت الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Turn to Him in repentance, and fear Him; and establish regular prayers, and do not be among those who join gods with Allah.
interpretation: This verse calls upon believers to turn to Allah in sincere repentance, to have fear and reverence for Him, and to establish regular prayers. It also warns against associating any partners with Allah, which is the grave sin of shirk.
orig: منيبين إليه واتقوه وأقيموا الصلاة ولا تكونوا من المشركين

translation: Among those who have divided their religion and become sects, each party rejoicing in what it has.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who divide their religion into sects and groups, each group arrogantly clinging to its own beliefs and practices, rejoicing in their limited understanding without seeking the complete truth. It condemns sectarianism, factionalism, and blind adherence to one's own group while disregarding the unity of faith.
orig: من الذين فرقوا دينهم وكانوا شيعا كل حزب بما لديهم فرحون

translation: And when affliction touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord
interpretation: This verse highlights the fickleness and ingratitude of human beings. When afflicted with hardship or calamity, they sincerely turn to Allah and implore Him alone. However, once Allah bestows His mercy and relieves them of their difficulties, some of them associate partners with Allah by reverting to polytheism or disobedience, instead of remaining grateful and devoted solely to Him.
orig: وإذا مس الناس ضر دعوا ربهم منيبين إليه ثم إذا أذاقهم منه رحمة إذا فريق منهم بربهم يشركون

translation: That they should disbelieve in that which We have revealed to them; so enjoy yourselves, for soon you will know.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers who reject the revelations of Allah. It implies that they should not take pride in their temporary enjoyment of worldly pleasures, for soon they will face the consequences of their disbelief and come to know the reality of what they denied.
orig: ليكفروا بما آتيناهم فتمتعوا فسوف تعلمون

translation: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they used to associate with Him?
interpretation: Allah is questioning the disbelievers' association of partners with Him. No evidence or authority has been sent down from Allah that justifies their polytheistic beliefs. Their shirk (associating partners with Allah) is based on mere conjecture and whims, without any proof or scriptural support.
orig: أم أنزلنا عليهم سلطانا فهو يتكلم بما كانوا به يشركون

translation: And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have sent forth, behold, they are in despair.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and lack of steadfastness of human beings. When Allah bestows His mercy and blessings upon them, they become joyful and happy. However, when they face adversity as a result of their own misdeeds, they immediately lose hope and fall into despair instead of turning to Allah in repentance and seeking His forgiveness.
orig: وإذا أذقنا الناس رحمة فرحوا بها وإن تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت أيديهم إذا هم يقنطون

translation: Have they not seen that Allah spreads the provision for whom He wills and restricts it? Verily, in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute control over sustenance and provision. He grants abundant provision to whomever He wills and restricts it for whomever He wills, according to His perfect wisdom and justice. This phenomenon serves as a profound sign and evidence of Allah's existence and power for those who truly believe and reflect.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: So give the relative his right, as well as the poor and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the Countenance of Allah, and it is they who will be successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling the rights of relatives, helping the poor and needy, and being generous towards travelers. It encourages these acts as a means of seeking Allah's pleasure and attaining success in this life and the Hereafter. The interpretation is that true believers should prioritize caring for their families, supporting the less fortunate, and showing hospitality to travelers as a manifestation of their faith and desire to please Allah.
orig: فآت ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ذلك خير للذين يريدون وجه الله وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of usury or interest-based transactions, which unjustly enrich the lender at the expense of the borrower. It states that any wealth gained through interest will not increase in the sight of Allah. However, wealth given as zakah (obligatory charity) with the intention of seeking Allah's pleasure will be multiplied and rewarded manifold.
orig: وما آتيتم من ربا ليربو في أموال الناس فلا يربو عند الله وما آتيتم من زكاة تريدون وجه الله فأولئك هم المضعفون

translation: It is Allah Who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, then will give you life again. Is there any of your 'partners' that can do any single one of these things? Glorified and Exalted is He above all that they associate as partners (with Him).
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's Oneness and denies any partners to Him. It highlights that Allah alone is the Creator, the Sustainer, the Giver of death, and the Resurrector. None of the so-called partners that the polytheists associate with Allah can perform any of these actions. Allah is glorified and exalted above all that they associate as partners with Him.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم ثم رزقكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم هل من شركائكم من يفعل من ذلكم من شيء سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: Corruption has appeared on land and sea because of what people's hands have earned, so that He may let them taste some of what they have done, in order that they may return.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the corruption and imbalance seen in the environment, both on land and in the seas, is a result of human actions and misdeeds. Allah allows people to experience some of the consequences of their wrongdoings, so that they may realize the error of their ways and return to the right path of preserving the natural balance and avoiding actions that lead to corruption and harm.
orig: ظهر الفساد في البر والبحر بما كسبت أيدي الناس ليذيقهم بعض الذي عملوا لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Say, "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were polytheists."
interpretation: This verse encourages people to travel and observe the ruins and remnants of past civilizations that were destroyed due to their disbelief and polytheism. It serves as a reminder that those who associate partners with Allah and reject His guidance will ultimately face a similar fate. The verse urges contemplation on the consequences of rejecting faith and highlights the importance of monotheism and obedience to Allah.
orig: قل سيروا في الأرض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبل كان أكثرهم مشركين

translation: So set your face towards the upright religion before a Day comes from Allah which cannot be averted. On that Day they will be separated.
interpretation: The verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and by extension all believers, to dedicate themselves sincerely to the true religion of Islam before the inevitable Day of Judgment arrives, when it will be too late to repent. On that Day, people will be divided into two groups: the believers who will be rewarded, and the disbelievers who will be punished.
orig: فأقم وجهك للدين القيم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا مرد له من الله يومئذ يصدعون

translation: Whoever disbelieves, his disbelief is upon himself, and whoever does good deeds, they are paving the way for themselves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual accountability and responsibility. Each person bears the consequences of their own choices - those who reject faith will be held accountable for their disbelief, while those who perform righteous deeds will benefit themselves and prepare the way for their own success and salvation.
orig: من كفر فعليه كفره ومن عمل صالحا فلأنفسهم يمهدون

translation: So that He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds out of His bounty. Truly, He does not like the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will reward the believers who have faith and perform good deeds out of His infinite grace and favor. However, He does not love or approve of those who reject faith and disbelieve in Him. The interpretation highlights Allah's justice in rewarding the righteous and His displeasure with those who deny His signs and revelations.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات من فضله إنه لا يحب الكافرين

translation: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command, and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah through the winds, which bring the good news of rain and allow ships to sail. It encourages gratitude for Allah's mercy and bounties, reminding us to seek His favors and express thankfulness for His provisions.
orig: ومن آياته أن يرسل الرياح مبشرات وليذيقكم من رحمته ولتجري الفلك بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And We have certainly sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. Then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the continuity and universality of Allah's message through His messengers. Allah has sent messengers to various nations with clear signs and evidence of their truthfulness. Those who rejected the message and persisted in wrongdoing faced divine punishment, as it is Allah's promise to support and aid the believers who have faith in His messengers.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا من قبلك رسلا إلى قومهم فجاءوهم بالبينات فانتقمنا من الذين أجرموا وكان حقا علينا نصر المؤمنين

translation: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the raindrops emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and control over the natural phenomena, specifically the wind and rain. It describes the process of how Allah sends the winds that stir up the clouds, spreading them in the sky as He wills. He then fragments the clouds, causing raindrops to emerge from within them. When Allah causes the rain to fall upon whomever He wills from His servants, they rejoice and feel grateful for this blessing from Allah.
orig: الله الذي يرسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فيبسطه في السماء كيف يشاء ويجعله كسفا فترى الودق يخرج من خلاله فإذا أصاب به من يشاء من عباده إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: And indeed they were, before the Quran was revealed to them, in grave error.
interpretation: This verse indicates that before the revelation of the Qur'an, the people were living in a state of misguidance and confusion, devoid of true knowledge and guidance. The Qur'an brought them out of this darkness and showed them the straight path, removing their doubts and misconceptions.
orig: وإن كانوا من قبل أن ينزل عليهم من قبله لمبلسين

translation: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He revives the earth after its death. Indeed, that [same One] will surely revive the dead, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: "This verse invites us to reflect on the signs of Allah's power and mercy in reviving the dead earth through the rainfall, which causes plants to grow and life to flourish again. This miraculous process is presented as proof of Allah's ability to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment. The revival of the earth after its apparent 'death' is a profound metaphor for the resurrection, reminding us that just as Allah can bring life back to the barren earth, He can also resurrect all beings after their physical death. The verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and capability over all things."
orig: فانظر إلى آثار رحمت الله كيف يحيي الأرض بعد موتها إن ذلك لمحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And if We had sent a wind and they saw it turning things yellow, they would have continued disbelieving thereafter.
interpretation: This verse implies that even if Allah sent a destructive wind that turned vegetation yellow as a sign of His power, the disbelievers would still persist in their denial and ingratitude towards Him. Their stubbornness and rejection of faith is so deeply rooted that no amount of evidence or miracles would convince them to believe. The verse highlights the obstinacy of the disbelievers and their refusal to accept the truth despite witnessing clear signs from Allah.
orig: ولئن أرسلنا ريحا فرأوه مصفرا لظلوا من بعده يكفرون

translation: So verily, you cannot make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn away.
interpretation: This verse teaches that the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, cannot guide those who deliberately turn away from the truth and refuse to listen. Just as a dead person cannot hear, and a deaf person cannot hear the call when they turn away, similarly those who stubbornly reject the message cannot benefit from the Prophet's guidance. It emphasizes the importance of having an open heart and mind to receive the truth.
orig: فإنك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء إذا ولوا مدبرين

translation: And you are not a guide to the blind away from their misguidance. You can only make hear those who believe in Our verses, so they are Muslims.
interpretation: Allah is telling the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that he cannot guide those who are blind to the truth and persist in misguidance. His role is to convey the message, but guidance ultimately comes from Allah. The only ones who will benefit from his teachings are those who have faith in Allah's revelations and submit to Him as Muslims.
orig: وما أنت بهاد العمي عن ضلالتهم إن تسمع إلا من يؤمن بآياتنا فهم مسلمون

translation: It is Allah who created you in a state of weakness, then gave you strength after weakness, then after strength, appointed weakness and old age. He creates what He wills, and He is the All-Knowing, the Almighty.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the different stages of human life and the power of Allah as the Creator. It illustrates how Allah has created us in a state of weakness as infants, then granted us strength in youth, followed by weakness again in old age. This cycle demonstrates Allah's complete authority over His creation, and that He creates whatever He wills according to His infinite knowledge and might.
orig: الله الذي خلقكم من ضعف ثم جعل من بعد ضعف قوة ثم جعل من بعد قوة ضعفا وشيبة يخلق ما يشاء وهو العليم القدير

translation: And on the Day when the Hour will be established, the criminals will swear that they remained not but an hour. Thus were they deluded.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when the disbelievers and sinners will swear that they did not stay in this world except for a short period, like an hour. This indicates their denial of the Hereafter and their lack of preparedness for it, as they were deluded by the life of this world and its temporary pleasures.
orig: ويوم تقوم الساعة يقسم المجرمون ما لبثوا غير ساعة كذلك كانوا يؤفكون

translation: And those who were given knowledge and faith will say, 'You remained [on earth] by Allah's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you were not aware.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who were granted knowledge and faith will testify on the Day of Resurrection that the disbelievers remained on earth by Allah's decree until that Day. They will affirm that this is indeed the Day of Resurrection, but the disbelievers were unaware of it due to their lack of belief and understanding.
orig: وقال الذين أوتوا العلم والإيمان لقد لبثتم في كتاب الله إلى يوم البعث فهذا يوم البعث ولكنكم كنتم لا تعلمون

translation: On that Day, no excuse will benefit those who did wrong, nor will they be allowed to make amends.
interpretation: This verse warns that on the Day of Judgment, those who committed wrongdoings and oppressed others will not be able to offer any justification or apology for their misdeeds. Their excuses and pleas for forgiveness will be of no avail, and they will not be given the opportunity to repent or make amends for their actions. The finality of God's judgment will be absolute, and no one will be able to escape the consequences of their transgressions.
orig: فيومئذ لا ينفع الذين ظلموا معذرتهم ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example - but if you brought to them a sign, those who disbelieved would say, 'You are not but falsifiers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that the Qur'an contains various examples and lessons for humanity, covering different aspects of life. However, even if a clear sign or miracle is presented to the disbelievers, they will still reject it and accuse the believers of being liars or falsifiers. Their disbelief stems from their stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the truth, rather than a lack of evidence or proofs.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل ولئن جئتهم بآية ليقولن الذين كفروا إن أنتم إلا مبطلون

translation: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah seals or closes the hearts of those who lack knowledge and understanding, preventing them from comprehending the truth and guidance. Their ignorance and rejection of knowledge lead to a state where their hearts become hardened and unable to perceive or accept the divine message.
orig: كذلك يطبع الله على قلوب الذين لا يعلمون

translation: So be patient, for the promise of Allah is true. And let them not discourage you who have no certainty of faith.
interpretation: This verse encourages the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to remain patient and steadfast in the face of opposition and mockery from the disbelievers. It reminds him that Allah's promise of victory for the believers is true and will be fulfilled. The disbelievers, who lack certainty in their faith, should not dishearten or discourage him from continuing on his path of preaching the message of Islam.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق ولا يستخفنك الذين لا يوقنون

translation: Alif Lam Meem
interpretation: These are known as the 'broken letters' or 'disjointed letters' in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah. However, scholars suggest they may serve to draw attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an, or they may have a symbolic meaning related to the names of Allah.
orig: الم

translation: These are the verses of the Wise Book.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the following verses are from the Qur'an, which is described as the "Wise Book." This serves as an introduction, emphasizing the divine wisdom and guidance contained within the verses of the Qur'an.
orig: تلك آيات الكتاب الحكيم

translation: A guidance and mercy for the good-doers
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a guide and source of mercy for those who do good deeds and strive to follow the righteous path. It suggests that the teachings of the Qur'an provide spiritual guidance and divine compassion for the believers who lead a virtuous life and perform righteous actions.
orig: هدى ورحمة للمحسنين

translation: Those who establish prayer and give zakah, and they are certain of the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse refers to the true believers who fulfill their religious obligations of performing the obligatory prayers and paying the obligatory charity (zakah). They also have firm faith and conviction in the life after death and the accountability on the Day of Judgment. Their actions stem from their sincere belief in God and the Hereafter, which motivates them to obey God's commands and avoid His prohibitions.
orig: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم بالآخرة هم يوقنون

translation: Those are upon guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who follow the guidance from Allah, their Lord and Creator, are the ones who will attain true success and salvation in this life and the Hereafter. It praises and commends those who embrace faith, adhere to the teachings of the Qur'an, and lead a righteous life according to Allah's commandments. They are promised felicity, prosperity, and the ultimate triumph of entering Paradise.
orig: أولئك على هدى من ربهم وأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who engage in vain talk and frivolous discourse solely for the purpose of misleading people from the path of Allah and making a mockery of the truth. They have no real knowledge or understanding, yet they use their speech as a means of amusement and entertainment, leading others astray. Such individuals will face a humiliating punishment for their arrogant disregard of the truth.
orig: ومن الناس من يشتري لهو الحديث ليضل عن سبيل الله بغير علم ويتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: And when Our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there were deafness in his ears. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the arrogant attitude of those who reject the divine revelations. When the Qur'anic verses are recited to them, they turn away arrogantly, acting as if they have not heard them at all, as if they are deaf. Their rejection stems from pride and stubbornness, not from a genuine lack of understanding. The verse warns such arrogant rejecters of a "painful punishment" as a consequence of their haughty disbelief.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليه آياتنا ولى مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها كأن في أذنيه وقرا فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds, for them will be the Gardens of Pleasure
interpretation: This verse promises the believers who perform good deeds that they will be rewarded with the Gardens of Paradise, which are described as being a place of eternal bliss and delight. It emphasizes that faith alone is not sufficient, but must be accompanied by righteous actions in order to attain this ultimate reward.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم جنات النعيم

translation: Abiding therein forever, the promise of Allah being true, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse signifies the eternal nature of Paradise for the believers, emphasizing that Allah's promise of granting them everlasting bliss in Paradise is true and will be fulfilled. It also highlights two of Allah's attributes: "al-'Azeez" (the Exalted in Might) and "al-Hakeem" (the Wise), affirming His power and wisdom in fulfilling His promises and decrees.
orig: خالدين فيها وعد الله حقا وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: He created the heavens without pillars that you see, and cast firm mountains in the earth lest it should shake with you, and He spread therein all kinds of creatures; and We sent down water from the clouds, then We caused to grow therein (plants) of every joyful kind.
interpretation: Allah menciptakan langit tanpa tiang yang kamu lihat, dan Dia meletakkan gunung-gunung yang kokoh di bumi agar bumi tidak bergoncang bersamamu, dan Dia menyebarkan di bumi itu bermacam-macam jenis makhluk hidup. Dan Kami menurunkan air hujan dari awan, lalu Kami tumbuhkan di bumi itu bermacam-macam tumbuhan yang baik.
orig: خلق السماوات بغير عمد ترونها وألقى في الأرض رواسي أن تميد بكم وبث فيها من كل دابة وأنزلنا من السماء ماء فأنبتنا فيها من كل زوج كريم

translation: This is the creation of Allah. So show me what those besides Him have created. Nay, the wrongdoers are in clear error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the uniqueness of Allah as the sole Creator and challenges those who associate partners with Him to show what their alleged deities have created. It affirms that those who commit shirk (associating partners with Allah) are in manifest misguidance and error by rejecting the clear signs of Allah's Oneness and attributing creation to beings other than the Almighty Creator.
orig: هذا خلق الله فأروني ماذا خلق الذين من دونه بل الظالمون في ضلال مبين

translation: And We had certainly given Luqman wisdom [and said], "Be grateful to Allah." And whoever is grateful is grateful for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever denies [the favor] - then indeed, Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of gratitude to Allah and highlights that being grateful benefits oneself, while ingratitude does not harm Allah in any way, as He is Self-Sufficient and Praiseworthy. It teaches that wisdom is a gift from Allah, and true wisdom lies in recognizing and appreciating His favors with gratitude.
orig: ولقد آتينا لقمان الحكمة أن اشكر لله ومن يشكر فإنما يشكر لنفسه ومن كفر فإن الله غني حميد

translation: And (remember) when Luqman said to his son while he was exhorting him, 'O my son! Do not associate partners with Allah. Verily, associating partners with Him is a tremendous wrongdoing.'
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and avoiding shirk (associating partners with Allah), which is considered a grave sin and a tremendous injustice. Luqman, a wise man, advises his son to remain steadfast in his belief in the Oneness of Allah and not to commit the sin of shirk, as it is a form of oppression against oneself and a violation of the rights of the Creator.
orig: وإذ قال لقمان لابنه وهو يعظه يا بني لا تشرك بالله إن الشرك لظلم عظيم

translation: And We have enjoined on man to be dutiful and good to his parents. His mother bore him with hardship. And she delivered him with hardship. And the bearing of him, and the weaning of him is thirty months, till when he attains full strength and reaches forty years, he says: 'My Lord! Grant me the power and ability that I may be grateful for Your Favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do righteous good deeds, such as please You, and make my offspring good. Truly, I have turned to You in repentance, and truly, I am one of the Muslims.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being dutiful and good to one's parents, especially the mother who endures hardship during pregnancy, childbirth, and nursing. It highlights the sacrifices made by parents and the gratitude owed to them by their children. The verse also encourages seeking guidance from Allah to remain on the righteous path and raise righteous offspring.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه حملته أمه وهنا على وهن وفصاله في عامين أن اشكر لي ولوالديك إلي المصير

translation: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in this world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to be kind and obedient to their parents, except if they try to make them associate partners with Allah, which is a form of shirk (polytheism) and a grave sin in Islam. In such a case, the believers should politely refuse to obey their parents' orders, but continue to treat them with respect and kindness in worldly matters that do not involve disobedience to Allah. The verse also encourages following the path of those who repent and turn back to Allah, as ultimately everyone will return to Him on the Day of Judgment, and He will inform them of their deeds.
orig: وإن جاهداك على أن تشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما وصاحبهما في الدنيا معروفا واتبع سبيل من أناب إلي ثم إلي مرجعكم فأنبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O my son! If it be the weight of a mustard-seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Subtle, Well-Aware.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes Allah's perfect knowledge and ability to account for even the most minute actions, no matter how hidden or insignificant they may seem. It serves as a reminder that nothing escapes Allah's awareness, and that every deed, no matter how small, will be reckoned for on the Day of Judgment. The words 'Subtle' and 'Well-Aware' highlight Allah's intricate knowledge and comprehensive awareness of all things."
orig: يا بني إنها إن تك مثقال حبة من خردل فتكن في صخرة أو في السماوات أو في الأرض يأت بها الله إن الله لطيف خبير

translation: O my son! Establish regular prayer, enjoin what is just, and forbid what is wrong. And bear with patient constancy whatever betide thee, for this is firmness (of purpose) in (the conduct of) affairs.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believer to fulfill certain obligations and maintain a principled stance in life. It emphasizes the importance of performing the obligatory prayers regularly, promoting virtuous and righteous conduct, and prohibiting evil and wrongdoing. Additionally, it encourages patience and perseverance in the face of adversities and challenges, as steadfastness and firmness of purpose are essential qualities for dealing with the affairs of life.
orig: يا بني أقم الصلاة وأمر بالمعروف وانه عن المنكر واصبر على ما أصابك إن ذلك من عزم الأمور

translation: And do not turn your cheek in scorn toward people, nor walk haughtily on earth. Surely Allah does not love any arrogant boaster.
interpretation: "This verse teaches humility, modesty, and good manners. It prohibits arrogance, pride, and looking down upon others with contempt. Walking with an arrogant gait is a manifestation of pride and self-admiration, which Allah dislikes. The believer should be humble, courteous, and treat all people with respect and dignity."
orig: ولا تصعر خدك للناس ولا تمش في الأرض مرحا إن الله لا يحب كل مختال فخور

translation: And be moderate in your walking and lower your voice. Verily, the most disagreeable of voices is the braying of the donkeys.
interpretation: This verse teaches moderation and humility in one's conduct. The instruction to be moderate in walking implies avoiding arrogance or haughtiness in one's gait. Lowering one's voice signifies humility and restraint in speech. The comparison to the braying of donkeys highlights the unpleasant nature of loud, harsh voices devoid of wisdom or decorum. The overarching message is to adopt a balanced, dignified demeanor that reflects virtues like modesty and self-control.
orig: واقصد في مشيك واغضض من صوتك إن أنكر الأصوات لصوت الحمير

translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Scripture.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's countless blessings upon us, both visible and invisible. He has subjugated everything in the heavens and the earth for our benefit. Yet, some people argue against Allah's existence and favors without any true knowledge, guidance, or enlightening scripture. The interpretation calls us to reflect on Allah's boundless favors and to avoid disputing His signs without proper knowledge or guidance.
orig: ألم تروا أن الله سخر لكم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وأسبغ عليكم نعمه ظاهرة وباطنة ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Follow what Allah has revealed,' they say, 'Rather, we will follow that which we found our fathers doing.' Even though their fathers understood nothing, nor were they guided?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the blind following of ancestral traditions without rational thought or divine guidance. It condemns those who reject Allah's revelations and choose to follow the misguided ways of their forefathers, even though their forefathers lacked true understanding and were not rightly guided. The verse warns against succumbing to the call of Satan, who leads people towards the torment of Hellfire by encouraging them to abandon Allah's teachings in favor of ignorant customs and practices.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتبعوا ما أنزل الله قالوا بل نتبع ما وجدنا عليه آباءنا أولو كان الشيطان يدعوهم إلى عذاب السعير

translation: And whoever submits his face to Allah while being a good-doer, then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah belongs the outcome of all affairs.
interpretation: This verse encourages complete submission and devotion to Allah while maintaining righteous conduct. It promises that those who sincerely submit themselves to Allah and do good deeds have grasped the firmest support, which is the religion of Islam. Ultimately, the final outcome and accountability of all matters rests with Allah.
orig: ومن يسلم وجهه إلى الله وهو محسن فقد استمسك بالعروة الوثقى وإلى الله عاقبة الأمور

translation: And for those who disbelieve, do not be distressed by their disbelief. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: "Do not grieve over those who reject the truth, for their ultimate return is to Allah. He will make them fully aware of their deeds. Allah has complete knowledge of what lies within the hearts of people."
orig: ومن كفر فلا يحزنك كفره إلينا مرجعهم فننبئهم بما عملوا إن الله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: We grant them enjoyment for a little while, then We will force them to a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah allows the disbelievers to enjoy the worldly pleasures and luxuries temporarily, but ultimately they will be subjected to a severe and painful punishment for their rejection of faith and disobedience to Allah's commands. It serves as a warning that the fleeting enjoyments of this life should not deceive people from the eternal consequences of their actions in the Hereafter.
orig: نمتعهم قليلا ثم نضطرهم إلى عذاب غليظ

translation: And if you were to ask them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Praise be to Allah,' but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the innate belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed) that is ingrained in human nature. Even those who associate partners with Allah would acknowledge that He is the sole Creator of the heavens and the earth when asked. However, the verse criticizes their lack of true understanding, as most of them do not comprehend the profound implications of this belief and continue to engage in polytheistic practices.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله قل الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Indeed, Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete ownership and sovereignty over all that exists in the heavens and the earth. It highlights His absolute self-sufficiency, indicating that He is not in need of anything or anyone, as He is "al-Ghani" (the Self-Sufficient). Additionally, it describes Him as "al-Hameed" (the Praiseworthy), deserving of all praise and glorification for His perfect attributes and actions.
orig: لله ما في السماوات والأرض إن الله هو الغني الحميد

translation: If all the trees on earth were pens and the ocean (were ink), with seven oceans behind it to add to its (supply), yet would not the Words of Allah be exhausted: for Allah is Exalted in Power, Full of Wisdom.
interpretation: This verse highlights the limitless nature of Allah's Words and Knowledge. It suggests that even if all the trees were transformed into pens and all the oceans were used as ink, supplemented by seven more oceans, it would still be insufficient to record the entirety of Allah's Words and Wisdom. The verse emphasizes Allah's Greatness, Power, and Infinite Wisdom, which transcends human comprehension and any finite means of expression.
orig: ولو أنما في الأرض من شجرة أقلام والبحر يمده من بعده سبعة أبحر ما نفدت كلمات الله إن الله عزيز حكيم

translation: It is not your creation or your resurrection but as that of a single soul; for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness and Power of Allah. It states that the creation and resurrection of all humanity is as easy for Allah as the creation and resurrection of a single soul. This highlights Allah's absolute control over all creation and His ability to resurrect all beings after death with the same ease as He created them initially. The verse also attributes the qualities of being All-Hearing and All-Seeing to Allah, indicating His perfect knowledge and awareness of everything.
orig: ما خلقكم ولا بعثكم إلا كنفس واحدة إن الله سميع بصير

translation: Have you not seen that Allah merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a specified term, and that Allah is Acquainted with what you do?
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in the alternation of night and day, and the precise movements of the sun and moon, which are signs of His control over the universe. It also serves as a reminder that Allah is fully aware of all human actions and deeds, emphasizing the need for accountability and consciousness of His presence.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري إلى أجل مسمى وأن الله بما تعملون خبير

translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they invoke other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness and Supremacy of Allah. It affirms that Allah alone is the Truth, the only real and eternal existence, while all other objects of worship besides Him are false and vain. It also highlights Allah's transcendent attributes of being the Most High, above all creation, and the Most Great, far above any imperfection or deficiency.
orig: ذلك بأن الله هو الحق وأن ما يدعون من دونه الباطل وأن الله هو العلي الكبير

translation: Do you not see that the ships sail through the sea by the grace of Allah, that He may show you some of His signs? Verily, in this are signs for every persevering, grateful person.
interpretation: "This verse encourages contemplation on the wonders of Allah's creation and the signs that point to His existence and power. The smooth sailing of ships across the seas, despite the vastness and depth of the oceans, is a manifestation of Allah's grace and mercy. This phenomenon serves as a sign for those who are patient, persevering in their faith, and grateful to Allah for His countless blessings."
orig: ألم تر أن الفلك تجري في البحر بنعمت الله ليريكم من آياته إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: And when waves cover them like canopies, they call upon Allah, sincere in faith to Him; but when He delivers them to the land, there are some of them who are moderate. And none disbelieves in Our signs except every perfidious ingrate.
interpretation: This verse highlights the human tendency to turn to God in times of distress, but then forget Him in times of ease. When facing perilous situations, like being overwhelmed by waves at sea, people sincerely call upon Allah for help. However, once they are safely back on land, some become moderate in their faith, while others outright disbelieve and reject Allah's signs, being ungrateful and treacherous.
orig: وإذا غشيهم موج كالظلل دعوا الله مخلصين له الدين فلما نجاهم إلى البر فمنهم مقتصد وما يجحد بآياتنا إلا كل ختار كفور

translation: O people! Be mindful of your Lord and fear a day when no parent can avail their child, nor a child can avail their parent in the least. Surely, Allah's promise is true, so do not let the life of this world deceive you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you about Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being mindful of Allah and fearing the Day of Judgment, when no familial relationships will be of any benefit. It warns against being deceived by the temporary pleasures of this worldly life or being misled by Satan regarding one's duties towards Allah. The verse highlights the certainty of Allah's promise and the need to prioritize the Hereafter over the fleeting desires of this world.
orig: يا أيها الناس اتقوا ربكم واخشوا يوما لا يجزي والد عن ولده ولا مولود هو جاز عن والده شيئا إن وعد الله حق فلا تغرنكم الحياة الدنيا ولا يغرنكم بالله الغرور

translation: Verily, Allah alone has the knowledge of the Hour, and it is He Who sends down the rain, and knows what is in the wombs. No soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely, Allah is All-Knowing, All-Aware.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute and exclusive knowledge of certain matters that are beyond human comprehension. It highlights Allah's knowledge of the timing of the Day of Resurrection, His control over sending rain which sustains life, His knowledge of what is in the wombs of mothers, and His knowledge of what each soul will earn or experience in the future and where it will die. The verse affirms that such knowledge belongs solely to Allah, Who is All-Knowing and All-Aware of everything, seen and unseen.
orig: إن الله عنده علم الساعة وينزل الغيث ويعلم ما في الأرحام وما تدري نفس ماذا تكسب غدا وما تدري نفس بأي أرض تموت إن الله عليم خبير

translation: Alif, Lam, Mim.
interpretation: These letters are among the "Muqatta'at" or the disconnected letters that appear at the beginning of several chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah. However, scholars suggest that they may serve as symbols drawing attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an, or they may represent sublime meanings that human minds cannot fully comprehend.
orig: الم

translation: This is the revelation of the Book, there is no doubt in it, from the Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine origin of the Qur'an as a revelation from Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds. It emphasizes that the Qur'an is free from any doubt or uncertainty, as it is a direct communication from the Creator to humanity.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب لا ريب فيه من رب العالمين

translation: Or do they say, "He has invented it"? Rather, it is the truth from your Lord, so you may warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, that they might be guided.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers accuse the Prophet Muhammad of fabricating the Qur'an himself. However, the verse affirms that the Qur'an is the truth revealed by Allah to warn those who have not received a messenger before, so that they may be guided to the right path.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه بل هو الحق من ربك لتنذر قوما ما أتاهم من نذير من قبلك لعلهم يهتدون

translation: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six Days; then He established Himself on the Throne. You have none, besides Him, to protect or intercede for you. Will you not then remember?
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's Oneness and His absolute power and authority over all creation. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the Creator of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between, and that He did so in six Days or periods of time. It then states that after creating the universe, Allah rose above and established Himself on the Throne, which symbolizes His sovereignty and dominion over all that exists. The verse goes on to declare that there is no protector or intercessor besides Allah, emphasizing the futility of seeking help or intercession from any other being or entity. The verse concludes with a call to reflect upon and remember these profound truths, reminding us of our utter dependence on Allah and the need to worship and obey Him alone.
orig: الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض وما بينهما في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش ما لكم من دونه من ولي ولا شفيع أفلا تتذكرون

translation: He regulates the affair from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a Day the measure of which is a thousand years of what you count.
interpretation: This verse speaks of Allah's complete authority and power over the universe. He governs and manages all affairs from the heavens to the earth with ease. The mention of "a Day the measure of which is a thousand years" indicates that Allah is not bound by our human concept of time. What may seem an extremely long period to us is just a single day for Him. This emphasizes His transcendence over the limitations of this world.
orig: يدبر الأمر من السماء إلى الأرض ثم يعرج إليه في يوم كان مقداره ألف سنة مما تعدون

translation: That is the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's perfect knowledge of everything, both the unseen and the witnessed realms. It emphasizes His might and power over all creation, as well as His infinite mercy and compassion towards His servants.
orig: ذلك عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الرحيم

translation: Who made excellent everything that He created, and He began the creation of man from clay.
interpretation: This verse highlights the perfection in Allah's creation, and that He initiated the creation of human beings from clay or dust. It implies that human beings were brought into existence from a humble and lowly origin, yet Allah perfected their creation, granting them an honorable status among His creations. This reminds us of Allah's immense power, wisdom, and artistry in fashioning the entire universe and all creatures in the most excellent manner.
orig: الذي أحسن كل شيء خلقه وبدأ خلق الإنسان من طين

translation: Then He made his progeny from an extract of a liquid disdained.
interpretation: This verse refers to the humble origins of human beings from a despised fluid, which is a reference to the male semen. It highlights the lowly substance from which human life begins, emphasizing the power of Allah in creating such a remarkable being from a seemingly insignificant source. This serves as a reminder of human humility before Allah and the miraculous nature of creation.
orig: ثم جعل نسله من سلالة من ماء مهين

translation: Then He fashioned him and breathed into him of His spirit, and made for you the hearing, the sight and the hearts; little is it that you give thanks.
interpretation: Allah created Adam in the best form and blew into him the soul He created for him. Then He gave human beings the faculties of hearing, sight, and understanding so that they may perceive and comprehend His signs and be grateful to Him. However, most people do not appreciate or thank Allah for these great blessings.
orig: ثم سواه ونفخ فيه من روحه وجعل لكم السمع والأبصار والأفئدة قليلا ما تشكرون

translation: And they say, "When we are lost in the earth, shall we indeed be in a new creation?" Rather, they are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord.
interpretation: The disbelievers express their denial and astonishment at the idea of resurrection after death, considering it an impossibility. However, their disbelief stems from their rejection of meeting their Lord and being held accountable for their actions, not from a lack of Allah's ability to recreate them anew.
orig: وقالوا أإذا ضللنا في الأرض أإنا لفي خلق جديد بل هم بلقاء ربهم كافرون

translation: Say, "The angel of death will take you, who is entrusted with you. Then to your Lord you will be returned."
interpretation: This verse is instructing the Prophet Muhammad to tell the disbelievers that the Angel of Death, who is appointed over them, will eventually seize their souls at the appointed time. After that, they will be returned to their Lord, Allah, for judgment and recompense for their deeds in this world.
orig: قل يتوفاكم ملك الموت الذي وكل بكم ثم إلى ربكم ترجعون

translation: And if you could but see when the criminals hang their heads before their Lord, [saying], 'Our Lord, we have seen and heard, so return us [to the world]; we will work righteousness. Indeed, we are [now] certain.'
interpretation: This verse describes the remorse and regret that the disbelievers and sinners will feel on the Day of Judgment. They will hang their heads in shame before Allah, realizing the truth and begging for a second chance to do good deeds. However, their plea will be rejected, as they had already been given ample opportunities in their worldly life but chose to reject faith and righteousness. The verse emphasizes the importance of embracing faith and doing good deeds in this life before it is too late.
orig: ولو ترى إذ المجرمون ناكسو رءوسهم عند ربهم ربنا أبصرنا وسمعنا فارجعنا نعمل صالحا إنا موقنون

translation: And if We willed, We could have given every soul its guidance, but the Word from Me will come into truth, 'I will surely fill Hell with jinn and people all together.'
interpretation: "Allah has the power to guide all people to the truth, but He has given humans free will to choose between right and wrong. Those who reject faith and guidance will be punished in Hell, as stated in this verse. This emphasizes Allah's justice and the importance of making the right choices in life."
orig: ولو شئنا لآتينا كل نفس هداها ولكن حق القول مني لأملأن جهنم من الجنة والناس أجمعين

translation: So taste [the penalty] for having forgotten the meeting of this Day of yours; indeed We have forgotten you. And taste the punishment of eternity for what you used to do.
interpretation: "This verse warns the disbelievers and wrongdoers about the severe punishment they will face on the Day of Judgment for forgetting and neglecting it. They are told to taste the eternal torment as a consequence of their evil deeds and rejection of faith. The phrase 'We have forgotten you' implies that Allah will disregard them and leave them to suffer the consequences of their choices."
orig: فذوقوا بما نسيتم لقاء يومكم هذا إنا نسيناكم وذوقوا عذاب الخلد بما كنتم تعملون

translation: The ones who truly believe in Our signs are those who, when reminded of them, fall down prostrate and glorify their Lord with praise, and they are not arrogant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the qualities of true believers. They are those who, when reminded of God's signs and revelations, respond with humility and submission by prostrating themselves in worship. They glorify and praise their Lord, free from any arrogance or pride. Their faith manifests in their actions of humble devotion and sincere reverence towards God.
orig: إنما يؤمن بآياتنا الذين إذا ذكروا بها خروا سجدا وسبحوا بحمد ربهم وهم لا يستكبرون

translation: They forsake their beds, calling upon their Lord in fear and hope, and they spend from what We have provided them.
interpretation: This verse describes the qualities of the righteous believers. They spend their nights in worship and supplication to Allah, leaving their beds to pray. They call upon their Lord with a heart filled with reverence and hope for His mercy and forgiveness. Additionally, they are charitable and spend from the provisions that Allah has granted them, indicating their gratitude and desire to please Him.
orig: تتجافى جنوبهم عن المضاجع يدعون ربهم خوفا وطمعا ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: No soul knows what is kept hidden for them of joy as reward for what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse implies that the rewards and pleasures that Allah has prepared for the believers in Paradise are beyond human comprehension. The joys and delights are so immense that no one can truly fathom or imagine them in this worldly life. It serves as a motivation for the believers to continue striving in obedience to Allah, knowing that an indescribable bliss awaits them as a recompense for their righteous deeds.
orig: فلا تعلم نفس ما أخفي لهم من قرة أعين جزاء بما كانوا يعملون

translation: Is one who was a believer like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that a believer who has faith and obeys God's commands is not equal to a defiant disbeliever who disobeys God. It highlights the stark contrast between the two, indicating that their spiritual states, deeds, and ultimate outcomes are vastly different. The verse underscores the importance of faith, obedience, and righteousness in attaining a favorable standing with God.
orig: أفمن كان مؤمنا كمن كان فاسقا لا يستوون

translation: But those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the gardens of refuge, a hospitality for what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse promises eternal bliss in Paradise for the believers who not only had faith but also performed righteous deeds. The "gardens of refuge" refer to the heavenly gardens where they will reside, enjoying God's hospitality as a reward for their good actions in this world. The interpretation emphasizes that mere belief is not enough; it must be accompanied by righteous conduct to attain the ultimate reward in the Hereafter.
orig: أما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فلهم جنات المأوى نزلا بما كانوا يعملون

translation: But as for those who defiantly disobeyed, their refuge is the Fire. Every time they wish to get out of it, they will be returned to it, and it will be said to them, 'Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers and sinners that their ultimate abode will be the Hellfire. Whenever they try to escape from it, they will be forced back into it, and they will be reminded to taste the torment they had denied and rejected in their worldly life.
orig: وأما الذين فسقوا فمأواهم النار كلما أرادوا أن يخرجوا منها أعيدوا فيها وقيل لهم ذوقوا عذاب النار الذي كنتم به تكذبون

translation: And We will surely let them taste the nearer punishment short of the greater punishment that perhaps they will return.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah will make the disbelievers suffer a lesser punishment in this world before the greater punishment of the Hereafter, so that they may realize their error and repent. The "nearer punishment" refers to worldly afflictions like famine, disease, or defeat in battle, while the "greater punishment" is the torment of Hellfire. By experiencing a glimpse of punishment, it is hoped that they will be awakened to the reality of Allah's warnings and return to faith and obedience.
orig: ولنذيقنهم من العذاب الأدنى دون العذاب الأكبر لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them? Indeed We, from the criminals, will take retribution.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who turn away from the signs and revelations of Allah after being reminded of them. It warns that Allah will punish such transgressors who knowingly reject His guidance after it has been made clear to them. The verse emphasizes the grave injustice of denying the truth when it is presented, and promises that Allah will hold the criminals accountable for their willful rejection.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن ذكر بآيات ربه ثم أعرض عنها إنا من المجرمين منتقمون

translation: And We did certainly give Moses the Book, so do not be in doubt over its meeting. And We made it a guidance for the Children of Israel.
interpretation: This verse affirms that God bestowed the Torah upon Prophet Moses as a divine revelation and guidance for the Children of Israel. It emphasizes that there should be no doubt regarding the meeting or encounter with this divine scripture. The Qur'an acknowledges the Torah as a legitimate source of guidance for the Israelites, indicating continuity and respect for previous revelations.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب فلا تكن في مرية من لقائه وجعلناه هدى لبني إسرائيل

translation: And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and [when] they were certain of Our signs.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah raised leaders and guides from among the believers who were patient, steadfast, and had firm faith in Allah's signs and revelations. Their leadership and guidance were by Allah's command and decree, as a reward for their patience and unwavering belief.
orig: وجعلنا منهم أئمة يهدون بأمرنا لما صبروا وكانوا بآياتنا يوقنون

translation: Indeed, it is your Lord who will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah alone has the authority to judge between people on the Day of Resurrection regarding the matters they differed upon in this world. It emphasizes that the ultimate truth and final judgment rests with Allah, and He will settle all disputes and disagreements on that Day. This highlights the importance of seeking the truth and following the right path in this life, as everyone will be held accountable for their beliefs and actions.
orig: إن ربك هو يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Have they not been guided by how many generations We have destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they walk? Indeed in that are signs; then will they not hear?
interpretation: "This verse questions the disbelievers' lack of reflection on the fate of previous nations who were destroyed for their rejection of faith. It reminds them that they walk amidst the ruins of those civilizations, which serve as clear signs of Allah's punishment for those who deny His messengers. The verse prompts them to listen to the lessons of history and heed the warnings before they meet a similar end."
orig: أولم يهد لهم كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم إن في ذلك لآيات أفلا يسمعون

translation: Have they not seen that We drive water to the barren land, and produce thereby crops from which their cattle and they themselves eat? Will they not then see?
interpretation: This verse draws attention to the signs of Allah's power and mercy in providing sustenance for His creation. It invites people to reflect on how Allah causes rain to fall on barren lands, bringing forth vegetation that serves as food for both humans and animals. The rhetorical question at the end, "Will they not then see?" emphasizes the need to observe and appreciate these evident signs of Allah's wisdom and providence, rather than remaining heedless.
orig: أولم يروا أنا نسوق الماء إلى الأرض الجرز فنخرج به زرعا تأكل منه أنعامهم وأنفسهم أفلا يبصرون

translation: And they say, 'When will this victory come, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers mocking and doubting the promise of victory and triumph for the believers. They are questioning the truthfulness of the believers' claim about the impending victory, as a way to cast doubt and undermine their faith. The interpretation highlights the disbelievers' arrogance and lack of belief in the divine promise of success for the believers.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الفتح إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "On the Day of Conquest, faith will not benefit those who disbelieved, nor will they be reprieved."
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, when the truth becomes evident, the disbelievers' acceptance of faith will not benefit them, nor will they be given any respite or delay in facing the consequences of their disbelief. It emphasizes the importance of embracing faith before it is too late.
orig: قل يوم الفتح لا ينفع الذين كفروا إيمانهم ولا هم ينظرون

translation: So turn away from them and wait. Indeed, they are waiting.
interpretation: "This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to disregard those who reject the message of Islam and to be patient with them. It suggests that just as the disbelievers are waiting for the Prophet's downfall or punishment, he should wait patiently for God's decree and judgment upon them. The verse encourages the Prophet to remain steadfast in his mission and not be deterred by the opposition he faces."
orig: فأعرض عنهم وانتظر إنهم منتظرون
