translation: O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to maintain his piety and obedience to Allah, and not to follow or obey the disbelievers and hypocrites who opposed his message. It emphasizes that Allah is All-Knowing of their intentions and actions, and All-Wise in His commandments and decrees.
orig: يا أيها النبي اتق الله ولا تطع الكافرين والمنافقين إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed, Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to follow the revelation sent to him by Allah. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of all his actions and deeds. The interpretation highlights the importance of adhering to the divine guidance and living according to Allah's commandments, as He has complete knowledge of everything we do.
orig: واتبع ما يوحى إليك من ربك إن الله كان بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: And put your trust in Allah, and sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.
interpretation: This verse encourages reliance on Allah alone, as He is sufficient for managing all affairs and taking care of one's needs. It emphasizes complete trust in Allah's wisdom and plan, and letting go of anxiety or fear by submitting one's will to the Divine Will.
orig: وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his interior. And He has not made your wives whom you declare unlawful your mothers. Nor has He made your adopted sons your [true] sons. That is [merely] your saying by your mouths, but Allah says the truth, and He guides to the [right] way.
interpretation: Allah ne permet pas à un homme d'avoir deux cœurs, c'est-à-dire deux croyances contradictoires. De même, Il n'a pas rendu vos épouses illicites comme vos mères par la simple déclaration de "Zihar". Et vos fils adoptifs ne sont pas vos vrais fils par la filiation. Ce ne sont que des paroles prononcées de vos bouches, sans aucun effet réel. Seul Allah dit la vérité et guide vers le droit chemin.
orig: ما جعل الله لرجل من قلبين في جوفه وما جعل أزواجكم اللائي تظاهرون منهن أمهاتكم وما جعل أدعياءكم أبناءكم ذلكم قولكم بأفواهكم والله يقول الحق وهو يهدي السبيل

translation: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more equitable in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers - then they are your brothers in religion and those entrusted to you. And there is no blame upon you for that in which you erred but [only for] what your hearts intended. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse instructs Muslims to address people by their father's name, as this is more just and accurate in the sight of Allah. However, if one does not know a person's father, then they should be considered as brothers in faith and treated as such. The verse reassures believers that they will not be held accountable for unintentional mistakes, but only for what their hearts deliberately intended. It highlights Allah's forgiveness and mercy towards those who err unintentionally.
orig: ادعوهم لآبائهم هو أقسط عند الله فإن لم تعلموا آباءهم فإخوانكم في الدين ومواليكم وليس عليكم جناح فيما أخطأتم به ولكن ما تعمدت قلوبكم وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves, and his wives are [in the position of] mothers. And those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah than the [other] believers and the emigrants, except that you may do to your close associates a suitable good. Ever was that in the Book inscribed.
interpretation: This verse establishes the special status and authority of the Prophet Muhammad over the believers. It states that he has a higher claim over them than they have over themselves, and his wives are to be respected like mothers. It also affirms the laws of inheritance, giving priority to blood relatives over other believers and emigrants, unless one chooses to leave something for close friends or associates. These rulings were already inscribed in God's Book (the Qur'an).
orig: النبي أولى بالمؤمنين من أنفسهم وأزواجه أمهاتهم وأولو الأرحام بعضهم أولى ببعض في كتاب الله من المؤمنين والمهاجرين إلا أن تفعلوا إلى أوليائكم معروفا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant.
interpretation: This verse refers to the covenant that Allah took from all the prophets, including Prophet Muhammad, to convey the message of Islam truthfully and to call people to worship Allah alone. It emphasizes the continuity and unity of the divine message brought by all the prophets, and their shared responsibility to guide humanity towards the straight path. The "solemn covenant" signifies the grave importance and binding nature of this commitment made by the prophets before Allah.
orig: وإذ أخذنا من النبيين ميثاقهم ومنك ومن نوح وإبراهيم وموسى وعيسى ابن مريم وأخذنا منهم ميثاقا غليظا

translation: Let the truthful be asked about their truth, and for the disbelievers is prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of truthfulness and warns against disbelief. The "truthful" refers to those who are sincere in their faith and actions, and they will be questioned about their truthfulness on the Day of Judgment. On the other hand, "the disbelievers" who reject faith and truth will face a severe and painful punishment in the Hereafter. The verse highlights the consequences of one's beliefs and actions, urging people to be truthful and embrace faith to avoid the painful punishment awaiting the disbelievers.
orig: ليسأل الصادقين عن صدقهم وأعد للكافرين عذابا أليما

translation: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when armies came to [attack] you and We sent upon them a wind and armies [of angels] you did not see. And ever is Allah, of what you do, Seeing.
interpretation: This verse reminds the believers to be grateful for Allah's favor and protection during the Battle of al-Ahzab (the Confederates) against the combined forces of disbelievers. Allah sent a fierce wind and invisible armies of angels to terrorize the enemy, allowing the believers to prevail without fighting. It emphasizes that Allah is Ever-Watchful over the believers' actions and faith.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا نعمة الله عليكم إذ جاءتكم جنود فأرسلنا عليهم ريحا وجنودا لم تروها وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا

translation: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when eyes shifted [in fear], and hearts reached the throats, and you assumed about Allah [various] assumptions.
interpretation: This verse describes a terrifying situation the believers faced, likely referring to the Battle of the Trench. It portrays their enemies attacking from all sides ("above you and below you"), causing extreme fear ("eyes shifted, hearts reached the throats"). Despite this, the believers maintained assumptions about Allah's aid and mercy, indicating their firm faith and reliance on Him during adversity.
orig: إذ جاءوكم من فوقكم ومن أسفل منكم وإذ زاغت الأبصار وبلغت القلوب الحناجر وتظنون بالله الظنونا

translation: There, the believers were tried and shaken with a severe shaking.
interpretation: This verse refers to a time when the believers faced a severe trial or test of their faith, causing them to be shaken and unsettled. It implies that their belief and trust in God were put to the test through a difficult situation or circumstance that challenged their resolve and steadfastness. The "severe shaking" could refer to physical hardships, persecution, or emotional turmoil they endured, which tested the depth of their faith and commitment to their beliefs.
orig: هنالك ابتلي المؤمنون وزلزلوا زلزالا شديدا

translation: And [recall] when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease said, "God and His Messenger did not promise us except delusion,"
interpretation: This verse refers to the doubts and criticisms expressed by the hypocrites and those whose faith was weak regarding the promises made by God and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). They accused the Prophet of deceiving them and claimed that the divine promises were mere delusions or false hopes. This reveals their lack of sincere belief and their tendency to question the truthfulness of the Prophet's message whenever they faced difficulties or setbacks.
orig: وإذ يقول المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض ما وعدنا الله ورسوله إلا غرورا

translation: And when a group of them said, 'O people of Yathrib, there is no position for you here, so go back,' and a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying, 'Indeed, our houses are exposed,' while they were not exposed. They did not intend except to flee.
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident during one of the battles when a group of hypocrites tried to abandon the Prophet and the Muslim army. They made excuses that their homes were vulnerable, although this was not true. Their real intention was to flee from the battle out of cowardice and lack of faith.
orig: وإذ قالت طائفة منهم يا أهل يثرب لا مقام لكم فارجعوا ويستأذن فريق منهم النبي يقولون إن بيوتنا عورة وما هي بعورة إن يريدون إلا فرارا

translation: And if they had been entered upon from its diverse openings, then were asked to spread persecution, they would have done so - and not hesitated over it except briefly.
interpretation: This verse is warning against the weakness of faith and resolve that some people have. If the disbelievers had been given access to the believers from different angles and fronts, and were asked to create disorder and mischief (fitnah), they would have readily agreed to do so without much hesitation or delay. This highlights the fragility of their beliefs and their willingness to spread corruption when given the opportunity.
orig: ولو دخلت عليهم من أقطارها ثم سئلوا الفتنة لآتوها وما تلبثوا بها إلا يسيرا

translation: And they had already promised Allah before not to turn their backs, and a promise to Allah must be answered for.
interpretation: This verse refers to the cowardly behavior of some Muslims during the Battle of Uhud, where they broke their solemn promise to Allah not to flee from the battlefield. It emphasizes the grave sin of breaking one's oath to Allah, as every promise made to Him will be accounted for on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ولقد كانوا عاهدوا الله من قبل لا يولون الأدبار وكان عهد الله مسئولا

translation: Say, "Never will flight benefit you if you flee from death or killing. And then you will not be allowed to enjoy but for a little while."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of fleeing from death or combat. It states that even if one tries to escape death or being killed, they will not be able to enjoy life for long afterwards. The interpretation is that one should face challenges bravely, as fleeing from them will not bring any lasting benefit or safety.
orig: قل لن ينفعكم الفرار إن فررتم من الموت أو القتل وإذا لا تمتعون إلا قليلا

translation: Say, "Who is it that can protect you from Allah if He intends for you some adversity or intends for you mercy?" And they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or any helper.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and control over all affairs. No one can protect themselves from Allah's decree or prevent His will, whether it involves hardship or mercy. Human beings are utterly dependent on Allah and cannot find any protector or helper besides Him.
orig: قل من ذا الذي يعصمكم من الله إن أراد بكم سوءا أو أراد بكم رحمة ولا يجدون لهم من دون الله وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: Allah knows those among you who hinder others and those who say to their brethren, 'Come here to us,' and do not go to battle except occasionally.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a criticism of the hypocrites who discouraged others from participating in battle and jihad. They would make excuses and try to dissuade their brethren from joining the fight, only occasionally engaging in battle themselves when it suited their interests.
orig: قد يعلم الله المعوقين منكم والقائلين لإخوانهم هلم إلينا ولا يأتون البأس إلا قليلا

translation: They are niggardly towards you. But when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes rolling like one being overcome by death. But when the fear departs, they assail you with sharp tongues, being niggardly with good things. Those have never believed, so Allah has rendered their deeds worthless, and that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who outwardly claimed to be Muslims but inwardly harbored disbelief and animosity towards the believers. It describes their miserly behavior, their cowardice in the face of danger, their harsh words against the believers after the danger passes, and their lack of true faith which renders their deeds worthless in Allah's sight. The interpretation highlights the insincerity and hypocrisy of such people, and warns against their negative qualities.
orig: أشحة عليكم فإذا جاء الخوف رأيتهم ينظرون إليك تدور أعينهم كالذي يغشى عليه من الموت فإذا ذهب الخوف سلقوكم بألسنة حداد أشحة على الخير أولئك لم يؤمنوا فأحبط الله أعمالهم وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: They think the confederates have not gone. And if the confederates should come, they would wish they were wandering among the bedouins asking about your news. And if they were among you, they would not fight except a little.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the hypocrites who claimed to be believers but lacked true faith. They thought the confederate forces that attacked Medina had not left, and wished they could escape to the desert to avoid fighting. If they had been among the believers, they would not have fought with sincerity, except for a little due to their cowardice and lack of conviction.
orig: يحسبون الأحزاب لم يذهبوا وإن يأت الأحزاب يودوا لو أنهم بادون في الأعراب يسألون عن أنبائكم ولو كانوا فيكم ما قاتلوا إلا قليلا

translation: Indeed in the Messenger of Allah you have an excellent example to follow for whoever hopes in Allah and the Last Day and remembers Allah much.
interpretation: This verse highlights the exemplary character and conduct of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a role model for those who have faith in Allah and the Day of Judgment, and remember Allah frequently. It encourages believers to emulate the Prophet's virtuous behavior, moral excellence, and unwavering devotion to Allah.
orig: لقد كان لكم في رسول الله أسوة حسنة لمن كان يرجو الله واليوم الآخر وذكر الله كثيرا

translation: And when the believers saw the confederate forces, they said: 'This is what Allah and His Messenger had promised us, and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth.' And it increased them only in faith and acceptance.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Battle of the Trench, when the Muslim community in Medina was besieged by a confederation of pagan Arab tribes and the Jewish tribe of Banu Qurayzah. Despite the overwhelming enemy forces, the believers remained steadfast in their faith, seeing this trial as a fulfillment of Allah's promise and the Prophet's words. Their trust in Allah and His Messenger only strengthened their faith and submission to the divine will.
orig: ولما رأى المؤمنون الأحزاب قالوا هذا ما وعدنا الله ورسوله وصدق الله ورسوله وما زادهم إلا إيمانا وتسليما

translation: Among the believers are men true to what they covenanted with Allah. Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death], and among them is he who awaits [his chance]. And they did not alter [the terms of their commitment] by any alteration.
interpretation: This verse praises the sincerity and steadfastness of some believers who remained true to their covenant with Allah. Some fulfilled their pledge by sacrificing their lives, while others were still awaiting their opportunity to do so. They did not waver or change their commitment in any way.
orig: من المؤمنين رجال صدقوا ما عاهدوا الله عليه فمنهم من قضى نحبه ومنهم من ينتظر وما بدلوا تبديلا

translation: That Allah may reward the truthful for their truth and punish the hypocrites if He wills or accept their repentance. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's justice and mercy. The truthful believers who are sincere in their faith and actions will be rewarded for their truthfulness. As for the hypocrites who outwardly profess faith but inwardly harbor disbelief and ill intentions, Allah has the choice to either punish them for their hypocrisy or accept their repentance if they sincerely turn to Him. Ultimately, Allah is the Most Forgiving and Most Merciful, giving opportunities for repentance and forgiveness to those who turn back to Him.
orig: ليجزي الله الصادقين بصدقهم ويعذب المنافقين إن شاء أو يتوب عليهم إن الله كان غفورا رحيما

translation: And Allah repelled those who disbelieved, in their rage, not having obtained any good. And sufficient was Allah for the believers in battle, and ever is Allah Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse signifies Allah's protection and aid for the believers against the disbelievers' rage and hostility. Despite the disbelievers' intense anger and efforts, they could not achieve any good or success. Allah alone was sufficient for the believers in battle, granting them victory through His Might and Power. It emphasizes Allah's unwavering support for the faithful and His ability to thwart the plans of those who oppose His religion.
orig: ورد الله الذين كفروا بغيظهم لم ينالوا خيرا وكفى الله المؤمنين القتال وكان الله قويا عزيزا

translation: And He brought down those who supported them among the People of the Scripture from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts; a party you killed, and you took captive a party.
interpretation: This verse refers to the victory of the Muslims over the Jewish tribes of Banu Qurayzah and Banu Nadir in Medina. Allah helped the Muslims defeat these tribes who had allied with the pagan enemies against them. Some of the Jews were killed in battle, while others were taken as captives. The verse highlights Allah's support for the Muslim community against their hostile opponents.
orig: وأنزل الذين ظاهروهم من أهل الكتاب من صياصيهم وقذف في قلوبهم الرعب فريقا تقتلون وتأسرون فريقا

translation: And He caused you to inherit their land and their dwellings and their properties, and a land which you have not trodden. And ever is Allah, over all things, competent.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He granted the believers victory over their enemies and caused them to inherit the lands, homes, and wealth of those they defeated. This was a reward for their faith and struggle. Additionally, Allah promises them further conquests of lands they have not yet trodden, as He has power over all things.
orig: وأورثكم أرضهم وديارهم وأموالهم وأرضا لم تطئوها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا

translation: O Prophet, say to your wives: 'If you desire the life of this world and its adornments, then come, I will provide for you and release you with a gracious release.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the wives of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It instructs him to give them a choice between remaining with him and embracing a life of simplicity and devotion to Allah, or leaving him and pursuing the worldly pleasures and adornments. The interpretation highlights the importance of prioritizing the Hereafter over the temporary pleasures of this world, and the need to make sacrifices for the sake of one's faith.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لأزواجك إن كنتن تردن الحياة الدنيا وزينتها فتعالين أمتعكن وأسرحكن سراحا جميلا

translation: And if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the abode of the Hereafter, then indeed Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a great reward
interpretation: This verse is addressing believing women, encouraging them to sincerely desire the pleasure of Allah, obedience to the Prophet Muhammad, and success in the Hereafter. It promises that those among them who do good deeds will receive a tremendous reward from Allah in the eternal life to come.
orig: وإن كنتن تردن الله ورسوله والدار الآخرة فإن الله أعد للمحسنات منكن أجرا عظيما

translation: O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you should commit a clear immorality - for her the punishment would be doubled two times over, and ever is that, for Allah, easy.
interpretation: "This verse serves as a stern warning to the wives of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) regarding the grave consequences of committing any immoral act. It emphasizes that if any of them were to engage in blatant indecency or immorality, their punishment would be doubled, making it twice as severe as for others. This heightened accountability is due to their esteemed status and proximity to the Prophet. The verse concludes by affirming that such punishment is effortless for Allah to enact, highlighting His supreme authority and power."
orig: يا نساء النبي من يأت منكن بفاحشة مبينة يضاعف لها العذاب ضعفين وكان ذلك على الله يسيرا

translation: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allah and His Messenger and does righteous deeds, We will give her a double reward, and We have prepared for her a noble provision.
interpretation: This verse promises a double reward and an honorable provision from Allah for the believing women who obey Allah and His Messenger, and perform righteous deeds. The "double reward" signifies an abundant reward in this life and the Hereafter for their faith and good actions. The "noble provision" refers to the blessings, contentment, and honorable life that Allah will bestow upon them.
orig: ومن يقنت منكن لله ورسوله وتعمل صالحا نؤتها أجرها مرتين وأعتدنا لها رزقا كريما

translation: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among women. If you fear Allah, then do not be soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is disease should covet, but speak with appropriate speech.
interpretation: The verse is addressing the wives of the Prophet Muhammad, instructing them to maintain a level of dignity and modesty in their speech and conduct befitting their status as "Mothers of the Believers." It warns them against being overly soft-spoken or behaving in a way that could tempt those with ill intentions or weak faith. Instead, they are advised to speak in a manner that is proper, virtuous, and beyond reproach.
orig: يا نساء النبي لستن كأحد من النساء إن اتقيتن فلا تخضعن بالقول فيطمع الذي في قلبه مرض وقلن قولا معروفا

translation: And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance. And establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin], O people of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you with [extensive] purification.
interpretation: This verse instructs the wives of the Prophet to remain in their houses with dignity and avoid the ostentatious display of their beauty that was prevalent in the pre-Islamic era. It commands them to perform the obligatory prayers, pay the obligatory charity, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah's intention is to purify the members of the Prophet's household from all sins and impurities, and to elevate their spiritual status through a comprehensive purification.
orig: وقرن في بيوتكن ولا تبرجن تبرج الجاهلية الأولى وأقمن الصلاة وآتين الزكاة وأطعن الله ورسوله إنما يريد الله ليذهب عنكم الرجس أهل البيت ويطهركم تطهيرا

translation: And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of Allah and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Subtle and Acquainted [with all things].
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to reflect upon and contemplate the verses of the Qur'an and the wisdom it contains when they are recited in their homes. It reminds them that Allah is Subtle, meaning He is aware of the most intricate details and hidden realities, and Acquainted with all things, having complete knowledge of everything in existence.
orig: واذكرن ما يتلى في بيوتكن من آيات الله والحكمة إن الله كان لطيفا خبيرا

translation: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember Allah often and the women who do so - for them Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the equality and unity of men and women in their spiritual and moral obligations before Allah. It emphasizes that the rewards of faith, obedience, truthfulness, patience, humility, charity, chastity, and remembrance of Allah are not limited to one gender but are equally attainable by both men and women. The verse affirms that those who fulfill these virtues, regardless of their gender, will be granted forgiveness and a great reward from Allah.
orig: إن المسلمين والمسلمات والمؤمنين والمؤمنات والقانتين والقانتات والصادقين والصادقات والصابرين والصابرات والخاشعين والخاشعات والمتصدقين والمتصدقات والصائمين والصائمات والحافظين فروجهم والحافظات والذاكرين الله كثيرا والذاكرات أعد الله لهم مغفرة وأجرا عظيما

translation: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the obligation of complete obedience to Allah and His Messenger for believers. It states that when Allah and His Messenger have decreed a matter, believers do not have the choice to decide otherwise. Disobeying Allah and His Messenger leads to manifest misguidance and deviation from the right path.
orig: وما كان لمؤمن ولا مؤمنة إذا قضى الله ورسوله أمرا أن يكون لهم الخيرة من أمرهم ومن يعص الله ورسوله فقد ضل ضلالا مبينا

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when you said to the one on whom Allah bestowed favor and you bestowed favor, 'Keep your wife and fear Allah,' while concealing within yourself that which Allah is to disclose. And you feared the people, while Allah has more right that you fear Him. So when Zayd had no longer any need for her, We married her to you in order that there not be upon the believers any discomfort concerning the wives of their adopted sons when they no longer have need of them. And ever is the command of Allah accomplished.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Muhammad's marriage to Zaynab, the divorced wife of his adopted son Zayd. The Prophet initially hesitated to marry her out of social norms, but Allah revealed this verse to remove any doubt or discomfort among the believers regarding marrying the divorced wives of adopted sons. The verse emphasizes obeying Allah's commands over societal customs and norms.
orig: وإذ تقول للذي أنعم الله عليه وأنعمت عليه أمسك عليك زوجك واتق الله وتخفي في نفسك ما الله مبديه وتخشى الناس والله أحق أن تخشاه فلما قضى زيد منها وطرا زوجناكها لكي لا يكون على المؤمنين حرج في أزواج أدعيائهم إذا قضوا منهن وطرا وكان أمر الله مفعولا

translation: There is no blame on the Prophet in that which Allah has made legal for him. (This has been) Allah's Way with those who passed on before. And the Command of Allah is a decree determined.
interpretation: This verse absolves the Prophet Muhammad from any blame or wrongdoing in matters that Allah has permitted for him. It affirms that Allah has granted certain exceptions and allowances to the prophets before him, as per His divine wisdom and plan. The verse emphasizes that Allah's command is final and pre-determined, and no one can question His rulings.
orig: ما كان على النبي من حرج فيما فرض الله له سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل وكان أمر الله قدرا مقدورا

translation: Those who convey the messages of Allah and fear Him, and do not fear anyone except Allah. And sufficient is Allah as an Accountant.
interpretation: This verse refers to the true believers who faithfully convey the teachings and commandments of Allah without any alteration or distortion. They have a deep reverence for Allah and do not fear anyone except Him, as He is the only one worthy of being feared and obeyed. Their accountability is to Allah alone, who is sufficient as a Reckoner and Witness over all affairs.
orig: الذين يبلغون رسالات الله ويخشونه ولا يخشون أحدا إلا الله وكفى بالله حسيبا

translation: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the last of the Prophets. And Allah is Ever All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse clarifies the status of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as the final Messenger of Allah and not a biological father to any man. His role was to convey the divine message, and he was the seal of prophethood, meaning there will be no prophet after him. This emphasizes the finality of his prophethood and the universality of the message he brought. It also highlights Allah's perfect knowledge of all things.
orig: ما كان محمد أبا أحد من رجالكم ولكن رسول الله وخاتم النبيين وكان الله بكل شيء عليما

translation: O you who have believed, remember Allah with much remembrance
interpretation: This verse exhorts the believers to engage in frequent and abundant remembrance of Allah. It encourages them to keep Allah in their thoughts and hearts at all times, through various forms of dhikr (remembrance), such as reciting prayers, supplications, and verses from the Qur'an. The remembrance of Allah is a means of attaining inner peace, strengthening one's faith, and maintaining a close connection with the Divine. It serves as a reminder to stay conscious of Allah's presence and to live in accordance with His commands.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اذكروا الله ذكرا كثيرا

translation: And glorify Him in the early morning and late afternoon.
interpretation: This verse commands believers to glorify and praise Allah at the beginning and end of the day. It encourages us to start and end our days with the remembrance of Allah, acknowledging His greatness and expressing gratitude for His blessings. This practice helps us maintain a constant connection with our Creator and reminds us to remain mindful of Him throughout our daily activities.
orig: وسبحوه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: It is He who confers blessing upon you, and His angels [as well] that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the believers, Merciful.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah showers His blessings and mercy upon the believers through the prayers of the angels, guiding them out of the spiritual darkness of ignorance and disbelief into the light of faith and guidance. This verse highlights Allah's immense compassion and care for the believers.
orig: هو الذي يصلي عليكم وملائكته ليخرجكم من الظلمات إلى النور وكان بالمؤمنين رحيما

translation: Their greeting the Day they meet Him will be 'Peace.' And He has prepared for them a noble reward.
interpretation: This verse describes the honorable greeting and reward that the believers will receive from Allah on the Day of Resurrection. The interpretation is: "On the Day when the believers meet Allah, He will greet them with the blessed words 'Peace,' indicating safety, security, and contentment. Additionally, Allah has prepared a noble and generous reward for them in the Hereafter as a result of their faith and righteous deeds in this world."
orig: تحيتهم يوم يلقونه سلام وأعد لهم أجرا كريما

translation: O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the three main roles of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger of God: 1) A witness to the truth of God's message and a living example of how to implement it. 2) A bringer of good tidings of Paradise for those who believe and follow the guidance. 3) A warner against the consequences of disbelief and disobedience to God."
orig: يا أيها النبي إنا أرسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا

translation: And as one who invites to Allah by His permission, and as a lamp spreading light.
interpretation: This verse refers to the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a caller to Allah by His permission and a radiant guide for humanity. He was sent to invite people to worship Allah alone and follow His commandments, with Allah's authority and approval. Additionally, he served as a brilliant lamp, illuminating the path of truth and guidance for those lost in darkness and misguidance.
orig: وداعيا إلى الله بإذنه وسراجا منيرا

translation: And give good tidings to the believers that they will have a great bounty from Allah.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers a great reward and blessing from Allah for their faith and good deeds. It encourages them to remain steadfast in their belief and righteous actions, knowing that they will be rewarded abundantly by Allah's grace and mercy.
orig: وبشر المؤمنين بأن لهم من الله فضلا كبيرا

translation: And obey not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and disregard their hurting, and put your trust in Allah. And sufficient is Allah as a Trustee.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to disobey and disregard the disbelievers and hypocrites who seek to harm him. It instructs him to put his complete trust in Allah alone, for Allah is sufficient as a Protector and Helper against those who wish to cause harm.
orig: ولا تطع الكافرين والمنافقين ودع أذاهم وتوكل على الله وكفى بالله وكيلا

translation: O you who have believed, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is not for you any waiting period to count. So provide for them and release them with a gracious release.
interpretation: This verse addresses the situation where a man marries a believing woman but divorces her before consummating the marriage. In such a case, the woman is not required to observe the waiting period ('iddah') that is typically required for divorced women. Instead, the man is instructed to provide for her financial maintenance ('mut'ah') and release her from the marriage bond in a gracious and honorable manner, without any ill-treatment or humiliation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا نكحتم المؤمنات ثم طلقتموهن من قبل أن تمسوهن فما لكم عليهن من عدة تعتدونها فمتعوهن وسرحوهن سراحا جميلا

translation: O Prophet, We have made lawful for you your wives whose bridal dues you have paid, and those whom your right hand possesses from among the captives of war that Allah has bestowed on you, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who have migrated with you, and a believing woman if she offers herself to the Prophet, and the Prophet desires to marry her - for you exclusively, apart from the believers...
interpretation: Cette révélation accorde au Prophète (paix et bénédictions d'Allah sur lui) des permissions spéciales concernant le mariage, qui ne s'appliquent qu'à lui et non aux autres croyants. Cela inclut la possibilité d'épouser des captives de guerre, ainsi que certaines parentes proches qui ont émigré avec lui. Une femme croyante pouvait également s'offrir en mariage au Prophète, une permission exclusive qui ne s'applique pas aux autres croyants. Ces permissions visaient à faciliter la propagation de l'Islam et la construction d'une communauté unie autour du Messager d'Allah.
orig: يا أيها النبي إنا أحللنا لك أزواجك اللاتي آتيت أجورهن وما ملكت يمينك مما أفاء الله عليك وبنات عمك وبنات عماتك وبنات خالك وبنات خالاتك اللاتي هاجرن معك وامرأة مؤمنة إن وهبت نفسها للنبي إن أراد النبي أن يستنكحها خالصة لك من دون المؤمنين قد علمنا ما فرضنا عليهم في أزواجهم وما ملكت أيمانهم لكيلا يكون عليك حرج وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: You can defer any of them you desire, and admit to yourself she whom you will. And whomever you desire of those you had set aside (temporarily), there is no blame upon you. That is more suitable that they may be comforted and not grieve, and may be satisfied with what you give them - all of them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. And Allah is ever Knowing and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse addresses the Prophet Muhammad's wives and allows him certain privileges in his marital relations. It permits him to defer intimacy with any of his wives temporarily, and to resume relations with any of them he wishes, even those he had set aside before. This was a special concession for the Prophet to maintain harmony and contentment among his wives, as long as he treated them fairly and with kindness. The verse emphasizes that Allah knows the intentions in people's hearts and is All-Knowing and Forbearing.
orig: ترجي من تشاء منهن وتؤوي إليك من تشاء ومن ابتغيت ممن عزلت فلا جناح عليك ذلك أدنى أن تقر أعينهن ولا يحزن ويرضين بما آتيتهن كلهن والله يعلم ما في قلوبكم وكان الله عليما حليما

translation: It is not lawful for you to inherit women's property against their will, nor to treat them harshly so that you may take away some of what you have given them, unless they commit a proven immoral act. Live with them in kindness; even if you dislike them, perhaps you dislike something in which Allah has placed much good.
interpretation: This verse prohibits forced inheritance of women and mistreating them to take back dowries given to them. It commands men to treat their wives with kindness, even if they dislike some traits, as Allah may have placed much good in what they dislike.
orig: لا يحل لك النساء من بعد ولا أن تبدل بهن من أزواج ولو أعجبك حسنهن إلا ما ملكت يمينك وكان الله على كل شيء رقيبا

translation: O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But Allah is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of Allah or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be an enormity in the sight of Allah.
interpretation: This verse outlines etiquettes and guidelines for the believers to follow when interacting with the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his wives. It emphasizes respecting their privacy, seeking permission before entering their homes, and maintaining appropriate boundaries. The verse promotes modesty, humility, and reverence towards the Prophet and his household. It also establishes the prohibition of marrying the Prophet's wives after his passing, as a sign of honor and respect for his status.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تدخلوا بيوت النبي إلا أن يؤذن لكم إلى طعام غير ناظرين إناه ولكن إذا دعيتم فادخلوا فإذا طعمتم فانتشروا ولا مستأنسين لحديث إن ذلكم كان يؤذي النبي فيستحيي منكم والله لا يستحيي من الحق وإذا سألتموهن متاعا فاسألوهن من وراء حجاب ذلكم أطهر لقلوبكم وقلوبهن وما كان لكم أن تؤذوا رسول الله ولا أن تنكحوا أزواجه من بعده أبدا إن ذلكم كان عند الله عظيما

translation: Whether you reveal anything or conceal it, verily, Allah is Ever All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah has complete knowledge of everything, whether it is openly displayed or hidden. It emphasizes Allah's perfect awareness and understanding of all things, both apparent and concealed. We cannot hide anything from Allah, and He is fully cognizant of our actions, intentions, and innermost thoughts. This profound truth should instill a sense of accountability and consciousness of Allah's presence in all aspects of our lives.
orig: إن تبدوا شيئا أو تخفوه فإن الله كان بكل شيء عليما

translation: There is no blame upon them [women] concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess. And fear Allah. Indeed Allah is ever, over all things, Witness.
interpretation: Cette verse souligne qu'il n'y a aucun mal pour les femmes à se devoiler devant leurs proches parents masculins (pères, fils, frères, neveux, etc.), leurs femmes et leurs esclaves. Cependant, elle exhorte à la piété et à la crainte d'Allah, car Il est Témoin de toute chose.
orig: لا جناح عليهن في آبائهن ولا أبنائهن ولا إخوانهن ولا أبناء إخوانهن ولا أبناء أخواتهن ولا نسائهن ولا ما ملكت أيمانهن واتقين الله إن الله كان على كل شيء شهيدا

translation: Indeed, Allah and His angels send blessings upon the Prophet. O you who believe, send blessings upon him and greet him with worthy greetings of peace.
interpretation: This verse highlights the high status and honor bestowed upon Prophet Muhammad by Allah. It encourages believers to invoke blessings upon the Prophet and send greetings of peace to him. This signifies the reverence and respect that Muslims should have for the Prophet and serves as a means of attaining Allah's blessings and mercy.
orig: إن الله وملائكته يصلون على النبي يا أيها الذين آمنوا صلوا عليه وسلموا تسليما

translation: Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns those who insult or harm Allah and His Messenger that they will be cursed by Allah in this life and the Hereafter, and will face a humiliating punishment. It emphasizes the severe consequences of showing disrespect or hostility towards Allah and His Messenger, and highlights the importance of revering and obeying them.
orig: إن الذين يؤذون الله ورسوله لعنهم الله في الدنيا والآخرة وأعد لهم عذابا مهينا

translation: And those who annoy believing men and believing women undeservedly, they bear (on themselves) a calumny and a glaring sin.
interpretation: This verse condemns the act of harming or annoying believers, whether men or women, without any justification. It declares that those who engage in such behavior have committed a grave sin and a blatant falsehood. The verse emphasizes the sanctity of the believers' honor and dignity, forbidding any unjustified harm or annoyance towards them.
orig: والذين يؤذون المؤمنين والمؤمنات بغير ما اكتسبوا فقد احتملوا بهتانا وإثما مبينا

translation: O Prophet! Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to draw their cloaks (veils) all over their bodies. That will be better, that they should be known so as not to be annoyed. And Allah is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of modesty and hijab for Muslim women. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad to tell his wives, daughters, and the believing women to cover themselves properly with their outer garments when going out. This would distinguish them as virtuous women and prevent them from being harassed or annoyed. Allah promises forgiveness and mercy for those who obey this command out of faith and desire to please Him.
orig: يا أيها النبي قل لأزواجك وبناتك ونساء المؤمنين يدنين عليهن من جلابيبهن ذلك أدنى أن يعرفن فلا يؤذين وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and those who spread rumors in al-Madinah do not desist, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little while.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning from Allah to the hypocrites, those whose hearts are filled with doubt and disease, and those who spread rumors and cause discord among the believers in Madinah. If they do not cease their evil ways, Allah threatens to turn the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) against them, and they will be expelled from Madinah, unable to remain as neighbors to the believers except for a short period. This verse highlights Allah's protection of the Prophet and the believers against the harm caused by the hypocrites and troublemakers.
orig: لئن لم ينته المنافقون والذين في قلوبهم مرض والمرجفون في المدينة لنغرينك بهم ثم لا يجاورونك فيها إلا قليلا

translation: Accursed, they shall be seized wherever found and slain with a merciless slaughter.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who wage war against God and His Messenger and strive to spread corruption on earth. It states that such people are accursed and deserve severe punishment. Wherever they are found, they should be seized and killed without mercy. This stern warning emphasizes the gravity of their crimes against peace and justice, and serves as a deterrent against such destructive activities.
orig: ملعونين أينما ثقفوا أخذوا وقتلوا تقتيلا

translation: This is the Way of Allah with those who passed on before, and you will never find any change in the Way of Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unchanging nature of Allah's laws and principles that govern the universe and human life. It states that the same rules and patterns that applied to previous nations and peoples will continue to apply, as Allah's Way (sunnah) is immutable and does not change. This serves as a reminder that Allah's laws are consistent and unwavering, and that one should not expect any alteration or deviation from them.
orig: سنة الله في الذين خلوا من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

translation: People ask you concerning the Hour. Say: 'The knowledge of it is only with Allah. And what will make you comprehend? Perhaps the Hour is near.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that the knowledge of when the Day of Judgment will occur is known only to Allah. No one else, not even the Prophet Muhammad, has been given this knowledge. The verse warns people not to be arrogant or dismissive about the coming of the Hour, as it could happen sooner than they expect. It encourages a sense of preparedness and consciousness of the inevitable reality of the Day of Resurrection.
orig: يسألك الناس عن الساعة قل إنما علمها عند الله وما يدريك لعل الساعة تكون قريبا

translation: Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has rejected and removed His mercy from those who disbelieve in Him and deny His signs and revelations. He has prepared a severe punishment in the form of a raging fire (Hell) for them in the Hereafter as a consequence of their disbelief and rejection of faith.
orig: إن الله لعن الكافرين وأعد لهم سعيرا

translation: They will abide therein forever, never finding a protector or a helper
interpretation: This verse refers to the eternal punishment of those who reject faith and commit evil deeds. They will remain in Hell forever, with no one to protect them or help them escape from their torment. It emphasizes the finality and severity of the punishment for those who turn away from God's guidance.
orig: خالدين فيها أبدا لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say: 'Oh, would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!'
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who disobey Allah and His Messenger on the Day of Judgment. Their faces will be turned about in the Hellfire, and they will express deep regret, wishing they had obeyed Allah's commands and followed the guidance of His Messenger. It emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and His Messenger in this life to avoid such a dreadful fate in the Hereafter.
orig: يوم تقلب وجوههم في النار يقولون يا ليتنا أطعنا الله وأطعنا الرسولا

translation: And they will say: 'Our Lord! We obeyed our leaders and our great ones, and they misled us from the Way.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the grave mistake that many people make by blindly following their leaders and influential figures without questioning or verifying the truth. On the Day of Judgment, they will realize their error and admit that they were led astray by those they obediently followed, who deviated from the straight path ordained by Allah. It serves as a warning against unquestioning obedience to authority figures, and emphasizes the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance directly from authentic sources.
orig: وقالوا ربنا إنا أطعنا سادتنا وكبراءنا فأضلونا السبيلا

translation: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication against the disbelievers and wrongdoers, asking Allah to punish them doubly in this world and the Hereafter for their rejection of faith and oppression. It also asks Allah to curse them with a great curse, which means to expel them from His mercy and grace.
orig: ربنا آتهم ضعفين من العذاب والعنهم لعنا كبيرا

translation: O you who have believed, do not be like those who abused Moses; then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allah, was honorable.
interpretation: "This verse warns believers against imitating those who slandered and verbally abused Prophet Moses. It reminds us that although people may accuse or defame others, Allah will vindicate the truthful and honorable ones. The verse teaches us to be careful with our speech, avoid slander, and trust in Allah's justice."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تكونوا كالذين آذوا موسى فبرأه الله مما قالوا وكان عند الله وجيها

translation: O you who believe! Fear Allah and speak words of appropriate truth.
interpretation: Allah commands the believers to have taqwa (piety, consciousness of Allah) and to speak truthfully and with wisdom. Speaking truthfully and avoiding falsehood, vain talk, and harmful speech is a sign of faith and righteousness. The words we utter should be beneficial, just, and appropriate to the situation.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وقولوا قولا سديدا

translation: He will put you on the straight path for your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger. It promises that those who do so will have their deeds corrected, their sins forgiven, and will attain a great success. It encourages believers to submit to the commands of Allah and follow the guidance of the Prophet Muhammad, which will lead them to righteousness and salvation.
orig: يصلح لكم أعمالكم ويغفر لكم ذنوبكم ومن يطع الله ورسوله فقد فاز فوزا عظيما

translation: Indeed, We offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it and were apprehensive of it; but man bore it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.
interpretation: This verse highlights the honor bestowed upon human beings by Allah, who entrusted them with the responsibility of carrying the "Trust" (Amanah), which represents the moral and spiritual obligations, free will, and accountability that come with being a conscious being. The heavens, earth, and mountains were offered this Trust but declined, recognizing their inability to bear such a weighty responsibility. However, human beings accepted the Trust, albeit being "unjust and ignorant," indicating their potential for both righteousness and wrongdoing due to their free will and limited knowledge.
orig: إنا عرضنا الأمانة على السماوات والأرض والجبال فأبين أن يحملنها وأشفقن منها وحملها الإنسان إنه كان ظلوما جهولا

translation: May Allah punish the hypocritical men and hypocritical women, and the polytheistic men and polytheistic women; and may Allah pardon the believing men and believing women. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's justice and mercy. The hypocrites and polytheists, who outwardly profess faith but inwardly reject it, will be punished for their disbelief and hypocrisy. However, Allah will pardon and forgive the true believers, both men and women, who have sincere faith and righteous deeds. This shows that Allah is infinitely Merciful towards those who sincerely repent and believe, while also being Just in holding the unrepentant disbelievers accountable.
orig: ليعذب الله المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات ويتوب الله على المؤمنين والمؤمنات وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: Praise be to Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.
interpretation: "This verse praises and glorifies Allah, acknowledging His ownership and sovereignty over all that exists in the heavens and the earth. It affirms that all praise is due to Him in this life and in the Hereafter. Moreover, it highlights Allah's divine attributes of being the Wise, whose actions are based on perfect wisdom, and the Acquainted, who has complete knowledge of all things."
orig: الحمد لله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وله الحمد في الآخرة وهو الحكيم الخبير

translation: He knows what goes into the earth and what comes forth from it, what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Most Merciful, the Oft-Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge of everything that occurs in the universe. It emphasizes that nothing is hidden from Him, whether it is something entering or emerging from the earth, or descending from the heavens or ascending towards them. This comprehensive knowledge is a manifestation of His Lordship and Sovereignty over all creation. The verse concludes by affirming Allah's attributes of being the Most Merciful and Oft-Forgiving, reminding us of His infinite mercy and forgiveness towards His servants.
orig: يعلم ما يلج في الأرض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو الرحيم الغفور

translation: And those who disbelieved say, 'The Hour will not come to us.' Say, 'Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. [Allah is] the Knower of the unseen. Not absent from Him is an atom's weight within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear Book.'
interpretation: هذه الآية تؤكد على قدرة الله وعلمه الواسع بكل شيء، حتى الأشياء الصغيرة جدًا أو الكبيرة جدًا، فهو يعلم الغيب ولا يخفى عليه شيء في السماوات أو الأرض. وتحذر الكافرين الذين ينكرون قدوم الساعة (يوم القيامة)، وتؤكد أنها حتمًا ستأتي بإذن الله، وأن كل شيء مسجل في كتاب واضح عند الله.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لا تأتينا الساعة قل بلى وربي لتأتينكم عالم الغيب لا يعزب عنه مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الأرض ولا أصغر من ذلك ولا أكبر إلا في كتاب مبين

translation: That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and a noble provision.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will reward the believers who have faith and perform good deeds. They will attain forgiveness for their sins and an honorable and plentiful provision in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: ليجزي الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات أولئك لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم

translation: And those who strive against Our verses to frustrate them - those will have a punishment of foul abuse.
interpretation: This verse warns those who arrogantly reject and try to undermine the signs and revelations of Allah. They will face a humiliating and painful punishment for their defiance and attempts to frustrate the truth.
orig: والذين سعوا في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: And those who have been given knowledge see that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse affirms that those who have been granted knowledge and deep understanding of the divine revelations recognize that the Qur'an revealed to the Prophet Muhammad is the absolute truth from God. It guides humanity to the straight path that leads to the Almighty, the Praiseworthy, who is worthy of all glory and reverence.
orig: ويرى الذين أوتوا العلم الذي أنزل إليك من ربك هو الحق ويهدي إلى صراط العزيز الحميد

translation: And those who disbelieved say, 'Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you [that] when you have disintegrated in complete disintegration, you will indeed be [recreated] in a new creation?'
interpretation: The disbelievers mockingly ask the Prophet if they should direct him to a man (referring to the Prophet himself) who claims that after they are completely disintegrated and decomposed after death, they will be resurrected in a new creation. They are ridiculing the idea of resurrection and a new life after death.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا هل ندلكم على رجل ينبئكم إذا مزقتم كل ممزق إنكم لفي خلق جديد

translation: Do you invent a lie against Allah, or is there madness in you? Nay, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in the punishment and extreme error.
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers who reject faith and the Hereafter. It condemns them for fabricating lies against Allah and accuses them of being misguided or insane for denying the reality of the Afterlife. It warns that those who do not believe in the Hereafter will face punishment and go far astray.
orig: أفترى على الله كذبا أم به جنة بل الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة في العذاب والضلال البعيد

translation: Do they not see what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse is a warning and a reminder to those who reject faith and deny the signs of Allah. It asks them to reflect on the wonders of the heavens and the earth around them, which are clear proofs of Allah's existence and power. If Allah willed, He could cause the earth to swallow them or send down fragments from the sky to destroy them. This shows that their existence and safety is entirely dependent on Allah's will. The verse emphasizes that in these signs, there is a clear lesson for every servant who turns to Allah in repentance and obedience.
orig: أفلم يروا إلى ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم من السماء والأرض إن نشأ نخسف بهم الأرض أو نسقط عليهم كسفا من السماء إن في ذلك لآية لكل عبد منيب

translation: And We certainly gave to David from Us, bounty. 'O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well].' And We made pliable for him iron
interpretation: This verse highlights the bounties and favors that Allah bestowed upon Prophet David. He was granted the ability to understand the language of mountains and birds, which would glorify Allah along with him. Additionally, Allah made iron malleable for him, allowing him to utilize it for various purposes. This demonstrates Allah's power and His special blessings upon His chosen servants.
orig: ولقد آتينا داوود منا فضلا يا جبال أوبي معه والطير وألنا له الحديد

translation: That you should make Saaghaat and cauldrons and work righteousness. Surely, I am All-Aware of what you do.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to engage in various crafts and professions, such as making "Saaghaat" (perhaps referring to armor or tools) and "cauldrons" (cooking vessels), as a means of earning a livelihood. However, it also emphasizes the importance of doing righteous deeds and maintaining good conduct while pursuing these worldly endeavors. The verse implies that Allah is aware of all our actions, reminding us to be mindful of our deeds and strive for righteousness in all aspects of life.
orig: أن اعمل سابغات وقدر في السرد واعملوا صالحا إني بما تعملون بصير

translation: And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, its morning stride was a month's journey and its afternoon stride was a month's journey. And We caused a fount of molten copper to flow for him, and of the jinn, there were those who worked before him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command, We will make him taste the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the power and blessings bestowed upon Prophet Solomon by Allah. He was granted control over the winds that could transport him vast distances in a short time. A fount of molten copper was made to flow for him, which he could utilize for various purposes. He also had authority over the jinn, who worked for him by Allah's permission. However, any jinn who disobeyed Allah's command would face the severe punishment of the Blaze (Hell).
orig: ولسليمان الريح غدوها شهر ورواحها شهر وأسلنا له عين القطر ومن الجن من يعمل بين يديه بإذن ربه ومن يزغ منهم عن أمرنا نذقه من عذاب السعير

translation: They worked for him as he desired, [constructing] niches, statues, bowls like reservoirs, and stationary cookers. [We said], 'Work, O family of David, in gratitude.' And few of My servants are grateful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings upon Prophet David and his family. They were given the ability to construct remarkable structures and objects like niches, statues, large bowls, and immovable cooking pots. This was a special skill granted to them by Allah. However, the verse ends with a reminder that only a few servants of Allah are truly grateful for His favors, implying that gratitude is a rare and valuable trait.
orig: يعملون له ما يشاء من محاريب وتماثيل وجفان كالجواب وقدور راسيات اعملوا آل داوود شكرا وقليل من عبادي الشكور

translation: But when We decreed for him [i.e., Solomon] death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.
interpretation: Allah is saying that when Solomon died, the jinn who were subjugated to him did not realize he had died until a termite ate through his staff that he was leaning on. When he finally collapsed, the jinn realized that if they had knowledge of the unseen, they would not have continued in the humiliating punishment of hard labor after Solomon's death.
orig: فلما قضينا عليه الموت ما دلهم على موته إلا دابة الأرض تأكل منسأته فلما خر تبينت الجن أن لو كانوا يعلمون الغيب ما لبثوا في العذاب المهين

translation: There was for [the people of] Saba in their dwelling place a sign: two gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], 'Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord.'
interpretation: This verse speaks of the blessings that were bestowed upon the people of Saba (ancient Sheba in Yemen). They had two lush gardens, one on the right and one on the left, which were a sign of God's favor upon them. They were instructed to partake of the provisions granted by their Lord and to be grateful to Him. They lived in a good land, and their Lord was Forgiving, overlooking their shortcomings if they repented.
orig: لقد كان لسبإ في مسكنهم آية جنتان عن يمين وشمال كلوا من رزق ربكم واشكروا له بلدة طيبة ورب غفور

translation: But they turned away, so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisk and something of meager lote trees.
interpretation: "The verse describes the punishment that befell an ungrateful nation who rejected the message of God. Their lush gardens were replaced with gardens bearing bitter, unpalatable fruits like tamarisk and meager lote trees as a consequence of their arrogance and ingratitude towards God's favors."
orig: فأعرضوا فأرسلنا عليهم سيل العرم وبدلناهم بجنتيهم جنتين ذواتي أكل خمط وأثل وشيء من سدر قليل

translation: That is how We reward them for their disbelief. And do We punish anyone except the ungrateful?
interpretation: This verse indicates that the punishment mentioned is a consequence of disbelief and ingratitude towards Allah's favors and signs. It suggests that Allah does not punish anyone except those who are ungrateful and reject faith, implying that punishment is a natural result of one's actions and choices.
orig: ذلك جزيناهم بما كفروا وهل نجازي إلا الكفور

translation: And We placed between them and between the towns which We had blessed, [many] visible towns, and We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], 'Travel between them on safe roads by night and day.'
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's favor upon the Children of Israel during their journey through the desert after being freed from Pharaoh's oppression. Allah placed towns and villages along their path, allowing them to travel safely between these settlements day and night. This facilitated their journey and provided them with places to rest and find provisions. The verse highlights Allah's mercy and care for them during this difficult period.
orig: وجعلنا بينهم وبين القرى التي باركنا فيها قرى ظاهرة وقدرنا فيها السير سيروا فيها ليالي وأياما آمنين

translation: Then they said: 'Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys,' and they wronged themselves, so We made them narrations, and We dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who rejected faith and turned away from the path of Allah. They asked for their journeys to be lengthened, meaning they wanted more time in this world to indulge in their desires. However, by doing so they wronged themselves by straying from the truth. As a result, Allah made them "narrations," meaning stories that serve as lessons for others. They were utterly dispersed and scattered due to their disobedience. This serves as a sign and warning for those who are patient, grateful to Allah, and heed the lessons from the fates of previous nations.
orig: فقالوا ربنا باعد بين أسفارنا وظلموا أنفسهم فجعلناهم أحاديث ومزقناهم كل ممزق إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: And indeed, Iblees had judged them rightly; so they followed him, except for a party of believers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Satan was correct in his assumption that most people would be misguided and follow him, except for a small group of believers who remained steadfast in their faith and resisted Satan's temptations. It highlights the reality that many people succumb to Satan's deceptions and stray from the straight path, while only a minority of true believers remain firm in their commitment to Allah.
orig: ولقد صدق عليهم إبليس ظنه فاتبعوه إلا فريقا من المؤمنين

translation: And he (Shaytan) had no authority over them, except that We might distinguish him who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it. And your Lord is a Preserver over all things.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Satan had no power to force people into disbelief or evil deeds. Rather, Allah allowed Satan's temptations to test people's faith and distinguish between those who truly believe in the Hereafter and those who doubt it. Allah is the Preserver and Watcher over all things, including people's faith and deeds.
orig: وما كان له عليهم من سلطان إلا لنعلم من يؤمن بالآخرة ممن هو منها في شك وربك على كل شيء حفيظ

translation: Say, "Call upon those you claimed [as gods] besides Allah. They do not possess an atom's weight in the heavens or on the earth, nor do they have any share in either, nor does He have any helper from among them."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the utter powerlessness of the false deities that people associate with Allah. It challenges those who worship idols or ascribe partners to Allah to call upon their alleged gods, as they do not possess even an atom's weight of power or authority in the heavens or on the earth. They have no stake or share in the creation or control of the universe. Furthermore, Allah does not have any supporter or helper from among these false gods, as He is the sole Creator and Sustainer of all that exists.
orig: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دون الله لا يملكون مثقال ذرة في السماوات ولا في الأرض وما لهم فيهما من شرك وما له منهم من ظهير

translation: And no intercession will benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [And those wait] until, when terror is removed from their hearts, they will say, 'What has your Lord said?' They will say, 'The truth.' And He is the Most High, the Grand.
interpretation: No one can intercede on behalf of another person on the Day of Resurrection except by Allah's permission. When the fear and terror is removed from the hearts of believers on that Day, they will ask what Allah has decreed. The reply will be that Allah has spoken the truth and commanded justice. He is the Most High, the Supremely Grand and Great, deserving of all praise and obedience.
orig: ولا تنفع الشفاعة عنده إلا لمن أذن له حتى إذا فزع عن قلوبهم قالوا ماذا قال ربكم قالوا الحق وهو العلي الكبير

translation: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah. And indeed, we or you are either upon guidance or in clear error."
interpretation: This verse challenges the disbelievers to reflect on who is the true provider and sustainer of all life in the heavens and the earth. It is Allah alone who provides sustenance and nourishment to all His creation. The verse then poses two possibilities: either the believers are rightly guided by following Allah's teachings, or the disbelievers are in manifest misguidance by rejecting the truth.
orig: قل من يرزقكم من السماوات والأرض قل الله وإنا أو إياكم لعلى هدى أو في ضلال مبين

translation: Say, 'You will not be asked about what we committed, nor will we be asked about what you do.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability before God. Each person is responsible for their own actions and will be judged accordingly on the Day of Judgment. Neither group will be questioned about the deeds of the other, as everyone will bear the consequences of their own choices and actions. It highlights the idea that no one can rely on the good deeds of others or shift blame for their misdeeds onto someone else. Ultimately, each soul is accountable for itself.
orig: قل لا تسألون عما أجرمنا ولا نسأل عما تعملون

translation: Say, "Our Lord will bring us together, then He will judge between us with truth. And He is the All-Knowing Judge."
interpretation: This verse is a call for patience and trust in God's ultimate judgment. It reminds us that all disputes will eventually be resolved by God, who knows the truth of every matter. We should not be hasty in judging others or seeking revenge, but rather leave the final judgment to the All-Wise and All-Knowing Lord.
orig: قل يجمع بيننا ربنا ثم يفتح بيننا بالحق وهو الفتاح العليم

translation: Say, "Show me those whom you have joined with Him as partners. Nay! But He is Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."
interpretation: This verse challenges the polytheists to present their false deities whom they associate as partners with Allah. However, it affirms that there is no true deity except Allah, the Almighty and the Wise, Who alone deserves worship and has no partners.
orig: قل أروني الذين ألحقتم به شركاء كلا بل هو الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the universal nature of Prophet Muhammad's message and mission. He was sent as a mercy to all of mankind, not just a specific group or nation. His role was to bring glad tidings of salvation and reward for those who believed and followed the divine guidance, and to warn of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience. However, the verse laments that most people remain ignorant of this profound truth and its implications."
orig: وما أرسلناك إلا كافة للناس بشيرا ونذيرا ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And they say, 'When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mockingly questioned when the punishment or the Day of Resurrection promised by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) would come to pass, if he was truly truthful in his message. It reflects their arrogance and lack of faith in the divine warnings.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, 'For you is the appointment of a Day which you cannot postpone nor advance by a single hour.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgment, which no one can delay or hasten. It reminds us that this appointed Day will come without fail, and no one has the power to change its timing, even by a single hour. This highlights the absolute control and power of Allah over all events and reinforces the importance of being prepared for this inevitable Day.
orig: قل لكم ميعاد يوم لا تستأخرون عنه ساعة ولا تستقدمون

translation: And those who disbelieved say, 'We will never believe in this Qur'an nor in that which was before it.' But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each other's word - those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, 'If not for you, we would have been believers.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers, who refuse to believe in the Qur'an and the previous revelations. It also depicts the scene on the Day of Judgment, where the oppressed will blame the arrogant for leading them astray, saying that if it weren't for their influence, they would have believed.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لن نؤمن بهذا القرآن ولا بالذي بين يديه ولو ترى إذ الظالمون موقوفون عند ربهم يرجع بعضهم إلى بعض القول يقول الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا لولا أنتم لكنا مؤمنين

translation: The arrogant ones will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we turn you away from the guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you yourselves were criminals."
interpretation: This verse describes a conversation that will take place on the Day of Judgment between the arrogant and oppressive leaders and their oppressed followers. The leaders will claim innocence, suggesting that they did not turn their followers away from the guidance after it had reached them. Instead, they will blame the followers themselves, accusing them of being criminals who willingly chose to reject the truth.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا للذين استضعفوا أنحن صددناكم عن الهدى بعد إذ جاءكم بل كنتم مجرمين

translation: And those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allah and attribute to Him equals." But they will conceal regret when they see the punishment. And We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
interpretation: This verse describes the exchange between the oppressed and the arrogant on the Day of Judgment. The oppressed will blame the arrogant leaders for conspiring day and night to make them disbelieve in Allah and associate partners with Him. However, the arrogant ones will conceal their regret when they see the punishment. Allah will put shackles around the necks of the disbelievers as a recompense for their evil deeds in this world.
orig: وقال الذين استضعفوا للذين استكبروا بل مكر الليل والنهار إذ تأمروننا أن نكفر بالله ونجعل له أندادا وأسروا الندامة لما رأوا العذاب وجعلنا الأغلال في أعناق الذين كفروا هل يجزون إلا ما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We did not send any warner to a town but its affluent ones said, 'Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that whenever a Prophet or Messenger was sent to a town or community to warn them and guide them to the truth, the wealthy and affluent people who were leading a luxurious life of indulgence arrogantly rejected the message and declared their disbelief in what the Prophet was preaching. Their attachment to worldly pleasures made them blind to the truth and prevented them from accepting the divine guidance.
orig: وما أرسلنا في قرية من نذير إلا قال مترفوها إنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: And they say, 'We are more [wealthy] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and pride of the disbelievers who boasted about their wealth and offspring, thinking that these material possessions were a sign of God's favor and that they would not face any punishment for their rejection of faith. The interpretation emphasizes that true success and honor lie not in worldly riches, but in faith, righteousness, and obedience to God.
orig: وقالوا نحن أكثر أموالا وأولادا وما نحن بمعذبين

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."
interpretation: This verse teaches that Allah is the sole Provider and Sustainer of all creation. He grants abundant provision to whomever He wills out of His wisdom and mercy, and He restricts the provision of others according to His perfect knowledge and justice. However, most people lack true understanding of this reality and fail to recognize Allah's absolute control over sustenance.
orig: قل إن ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Ni mali zako wala watoto wako ndio vitakavyokufanya upate ukaribu nasi, isipokuwa yeye aliyeamini na kutenda mema. Hao ndio watakaopalikiwa thawabu mara mbili kwa waliyoyatenda, na wao watakuwa salama katika vyumba vya juu.
interpretation: Mungu (s.w.t.) anawaambia watu kwamba mali na watoto hawatawafanya wawe karibu naye. Ukaribu na Mungu utapatikana tu kwa wale walioamini na kutenda mema. Hao ndio watakaopalikiwa thawabu mara mbili kwa matendo yao mema, na wao watakuwa salama katika Pepo.
orig: وما أموالكم ولا أولادكم بالتي تقربكم عندنا زلفى إلا من آمن وعمل صالحا فأولئك لهم جزاء الضعف بما عملوا وهم في الغرفات آمنون

translation: And those who strive against Our verses to frustrate them - those will be brought into the punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns those who actively oppose and try to undermine the signs and revelations of God. It suggests that such individuals, who stubbornly resist the truth and attempt to belittle or discredit God's verses, will ultimately face punishment. The interpretation emphasizes that rejecting God's guidance and working against His signs will lead to severe consequences.
orig: والذين يسعون في آياتنا معاجزين أولئك في العذاب محضرون

translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts it [also] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah is the sole Provider and Sustainer of all His creation. He bestows His provisions upon whomever He wills, whether abundantly or sparingly, according to His divine wisdom. It also encourages spending in the way of Allah, assuring that whatever one spends will be compensated and replaced by Allah, Who is the Best of providers.
orig: قل إن ربي يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر له وما أنفقتم من شيء فهو يخلفه وهو خير الرازقين

translation: And the Day when He will gather them all together, then He will say to the angels, 'Was it you that these people used to worship?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when Allah will gather all of humanity and the angels together. He will then ask the angels rhetorically if it was them that the people used to worship instead of Allah, exposing the falsehood of idol worship and making it clear that the angels were not worthy of worship.
orig: ويوم يحشرهم جميعا ثم يقول للملائكة أهؤلاء إياكم كانوا يعبدون

translation: They said: 'Glory be to You! You are our Protector instead of them. Nay, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the idolaters worshipped jinn (unseen beings) instead of Allah.
