They attributed their acts of worship to the jinn, believing that the jinn had power and influence over their lives. This shows their deviation from the true worship of the One God and their ignorance in associating partners with Allah.
orig: قالوا سبحانك أنت ولينا من دونهم بل كانوا يعبدون الجن أكثرهم بهم مؤمنون

translation: So today none of you will have any power over one another for benefit or harm, and We will say to those who did wrong, 'Taste the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.'
interpretation: "This verse indicates the complete severance of relationships and transactions on the Day of Judgment. No one will have any authority or influence over others, whether for benefit or harm. The oppressors will be addressed and commanded to taste the punishment of the Fire, which they had denied and rejected in the worldly life."
orig: فاليوم لا يملك بعضكم لبعض نفعا ولا ضرا ونقول للذين ظلموا ذوقوا عذاب النار التي كنتم بها تكذبون

translation: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, they say, 'This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from what your fathers were worshipping.' And they say, 'This is not except a lie invented.' And those who disbelieved say of the truth when it has come to them, 'This is not except obvious magic.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers in rejecting the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ. Despite the clear and undeniable proofs presented in the Qur'anic verses, they dismissed it as mere lies and sorcery, refusing to abandon the pagan beliefs and practices of their forefathers. Their rejection stemmed from a desire to cling to familiar traditions rather than accepting the divine message out of arrogance and closed-mindedness.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قالوا ما هذا إلا رجل يريد أن يصدكم عما كان يعبد آباؤكم وقالوا ما هذا إلا إفك مفترى وقال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: And We did not give them any scriptures to study, nor did We send any warner to them before you.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He did not send any scriptures or messengers to the disbelievers before the Prophet Muhammad. They were left without divine guidance until the final Messenger was sent to them with the Qur'an. This highlights their lack of excuse for rejecting the message, as they had not received any prior revelation or warning.
orig: وما آتيناهم من كتب يدرسونها وما أرسلنا إليهم قبلك من نذير

translation: And those before them denied as well, but they have not attained a tenth of what We had granted them. So they denied My messengers - how then was My recompense?
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to those who reject faith and deny the messengers of God. It highlights that previous nations who were granted blessings and favors from God also denied His messengers, but they were unable to escape God's punishment for their disbelief and arrogance. The verse emphasizes that no matter how much worldly prosperity one may attain, denying God's signs and messengers will ultimately lead to a severe recompense from the Almighty.
orig: وكذب الذين من قبلهم وما بلغوا معشار ما آتيناهم فكذبوا رسلي فكيف كان نكير

translation: Say, 'I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for Allah, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought.' There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to advise people to worship Allah alone, sincerely and wholeheartedly, whether together or individually. It also affirms that the Prophet is not possessed or mad, but rather a warner sent to warn people before a severe punishment from Allah befalls them for rejecting his message.
orig: قل إنما أعظكم بواحدة أن تقوموا لله مثنى وفرادى ثم تتفكروا ما بصاحبكم من جنة إن هو إلا نذير لكم بين يدي عذاب شديد

translation: Say, 'Whatever reward I might have asked of you is yours. My reward is only from Allah, and He is a witness over all things.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to convey to the people that he does not seek any worldly reward or compensation from them for conveying the message of Islam. His reward comes solely from Allah, who is a witness over all things and will recompense him accordingly for his efforts in preaching the truth.
orig: قل ما سألتكم من أجر فهو لكم إن أجري إلا على الله وهو على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Say, 'Indeed, my Lord projects the truth, Knower of the unseen.'
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah is the only One who knows the unseen and the hidden realities. He reveals the truth and spreads the correct knowledge and guidance through His messengers. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's attribute of being the All-Knower of the unseen, and that He alone has the authority to unveil the truth and guide humanity towards it.
orig: قل إن ربي يقذف بالحق علام الغيوب

translation: Say, 'The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin anything nor resurrect.'
interpretation: This verse affirms the absolute truth and supremacy of Islam. It declares that the truth, represented by the message of Islam, has come and prevailed. Falsehood, on the other hand, has no power to initiate or create anything new, nor can it revive or bring back what has become obsolete or extinct. The verse emphasizes the futility and impotence of falsehood in the face of the eternal truth revealed by God.
orig: قل جاء الحق وما يبدئ الباطل وما يعيد

translation: Say, 'If I should err, I would only go astray against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and Near.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual responsibility and accountability before Allah. The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is instructed to declare that if he goes astray, the consequences will be upon himself alone. However, if he is guided, it is by the revelation from Allah, Who is All-Hearing and Ever-Near. This highlights the importance of seeking guidance from Allah and following the divine revelation, as well as the principle that each person is accountable for their own choices and actions.
orig: قل إن ضللت فإنما أضل على نفسي وإن اهتديت فبما يوحي إلي ربي إنه سميع قريب

translation: And if you could but see when they will be terrified with no escape, and they will be seized from a position nearby.
interpretation: This verse describes a terrifying scene on the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will realize the reality of the Hereafter and their grave mistake in rejecting faith. They will be seized from a nearby place, referring to their souls being seized from their bodies or their being brought forth from their graves near the place of Judgment. The interpretation emphasizes the inescapable reality of the Hereafter and the helplessness of the disbelievers on that Day.
orig: ولو ترى إذ فزعوا فلا فوت وأخذوا من مكان قريب

translation: And they say, 'We believe in it,' but how for them to attain [faith] from a distant place?
interpretation: This verse criticizes the insincere claim of belief by some people. They claim to believe in the Qur'an, but their actions and attitudes demonstrate that their claimed faith is not genuine. The phrase "from a distant place" implies that true faith is far from their reach due to their insincerity and lack of commitment.
orig: وقالوا آمنا به وأنى لهم التناوش من مكان بعيد

translation: And they had already disbelieved in it, and they used to cast accusations based on mere conjecture from a far-off place.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who rejected the Qur'an even before it was revealed, and they made baseless accusations against it without any knowledge or evidence, as if they were throwing accusations "blindly" from a distant place without understanding the truth.
orig: وقد كفروا به من قبل ويقذفون بالغيب من مكان بعيد

translation: And a barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with the factions that went before them. They were indeed in grave doubt.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, a barrier will separate the disbelievers from attaining what they desired in this world, just as previous nations who rejected faith were prevented from their desires. They were engulfed in doubts and suspicions regarding the truth, which led them to reject the message of the prophets.
orig: وحيل بينهم وبين ما يشتهون كما فعل بأشياعهم من قبل إنهم كانوا في شك مريب

translation: Praise be to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, Who made the angels messengers with wings, two, three, and four. He increases in creation what He wills. Verily, Allah has power over all things.
interpretation: This verse praises Allah as the Creator of the heavens and the earth, and the One who created angels with different numbers of wings. It emphasizes Allah's absolute power and ability to create anything He wills, as He is capable of all things.
orig: الحمد لله فاطر السماوات والأرض جاعل الملائكة رسلا أولي أجنحة مثنى وثلاث ورباع يزيد في الخلق ما يشاء إن الله على كل شيء قدير

translation: Whatever mercy Allah opens for the people, there is no withholder of it, and whatever He withholds, there is no sender for it after Him, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute control over mercy and provisions. Whatever blessings He grants to people, no one can prevent or withhold them. Conversely, whatever He chooses to withhold, no one can provide or send it after His decision. This emphasizes Allah's sovereignty, power, and wisdom in managing the affairs of His creation according to His perfect knowledge and wisdom.
orig: ما يفتح الله للناس من رحمة فلا ممسك لها وما يمسك فلا مرسل له من بعده وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse reminds humanity of Allah's immense favor upon them by providing sustenance from the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that there is no other creator or sustainer besides Allah, and questions how people can be deluded into believing otherwise or associating partners with Him.
orig: يا أيها الناس اذكروا نعمت الله عليكم هل من خالق غير الله يرزقكم من السماء والأرض لا إله إلا هو فأنى تؤفكون

translation: And if they deny you, so were messengers denied before you. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
interpretation: If the people reject your message, O Muhammad, do not be distressed, for many messengers before you were also denied and rejected by their people. Ultimately, all matters will return to Allah for judgment, and He will hold everyone accountable for their beliefs and actions.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذبت رسل من قبلك وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: O mankind! Verily, the Promise of Allah is true. So do not let this present life deceive you, nor let the chief deceiver (Satan) deceive you about Allah.
interpretation: This verse warns people not to be deceived by the temporary pleasures and distractions of this worldly life, nor to be misled by Satan's deceptions about Allah's commands and promises. It emphasizes that Allah's Promise of the Hereafter is true and real, and that people should not prioritize the fleeting enjoyments of this life over striving for the eternal rewards of the Afterlife.
orig: يا أيها الناس إن وعد الله حق فلا تغرنكم الحياة الدنيا ولا يغرنكم بالله الغرور

translation: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse warns us that Satan is our sworn enemy, and we should treat him as such. His sole objective is to misguide us and lead us to Hell, which is referred to as "the Blaze." He calls upon his followers to join him on the path of misguidance and disobedience to Allah, so that they may end up in the same terrible fate as him.
orig: إن الشيطان لكم عدو فاتخذوه عدوا إنما يدعو حزبه ليكونوا من أصحاب السعير

translation: Those who disbelieved will have a severe punishment, and those who believed and did righteous deeds will have forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrasting fates of disbelievers and believers. The disbelievers, who reject faith, will face a severe punishment for their denial. On the other hand, those who embrace faith and perform righteous deeds will be granted forgiveness for their sins and a great reward in the Hereafter for their good actions.
orig: الذين كفروا لهم عذاب شديد والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة وأجر كبير

translation: Then is one whose evil deed was made attractive to him so he considered it good [the same as one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over their affairs in regret. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.
interpretation: This verse warns against being deceived by the attractiveness of evil deeds. Some people have their evil actions made appealing to them, causing them to perceive those actions as good. However, Allah guides whom He wills and leaves astray whom He wills. The Prophet is advised not to grieve excessively over those who refuse guidance, as Allah is fully aware of their actions.
orig: أفمن زين له سوء عمله فرآه حسنا فإن الله يضل من يشاء ويهدي من يشاء فلا تذهب نفسك عليهم حسرات إن الله عليم بما يصنعون

translation: And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and revive thereby the earth after its death. Thus is the Resurrection.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power in reviving the dead earth through sending winds that stir clouds, which then bring rain to barren lands. It serves as a parable for the resurrection after death, emphasizing that just as Allah can bring life back to a dead land, He can resurrect all creation after death on the Day of Judgment.
orig: والله الذي أرسل الرياح فتثير سحابا فسقناه إلى بلد ميت فأحيينا به الأرض بعد موتها كذلك النشور

translation: Whoever desires honor, then to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that true honor and glory belong to Allah alone. Good words and righteous deeds are elevated to Him, while those who scheme evil will face a severe punishment, and their evil plots will ultimately fail and come to nothing.
orig: من كان يريد العزة فلله العزة جميعا إليه يصعد الكلم الطيب والعمل الصالح يرفعه والذين يمكرون السيئات لهم عذاب شديد ومكر أولئك هو يبور

translation: And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor is delivered except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted a length of days, nor is anything diminished of his life, but it is recorded in a Book. Surely, that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete knowledge and power over all aspects of creation and life. It highlights that Allah alone is the Creator of all beings, from the initial dust to the fertilized egg. Pregnancy, childbirth, lifespan - nothing occurs without Allah's knowledge and decree. Every detail is recorded in the Preserved Tablet, emphasizing Allah's absolute control and wisdom over the affairs of His creation. This should instill a sense of trust and reliance in the believers.
orig: والله خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم جعلكم أزواجا وما تحمل من أنثى ولا تضع إلا بعلمه وما يعمر من معمر ولا ينقص من عمره إلا في كتاب إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: And not alike are the two bodies of water. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and the other is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat, and extract ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, so that you may seek of His Bounty, and that you may be thankful.
interpretation: Cette verse compare les deux types d'eau, l'eau douce et l'eau salée, et décrit leurs différentes utilisations. L'eau douce est agréable à boire, tandis que l'eau salée est amère. Cependant, les deux fournissent de la nourriture sous forme de poissons. De plus, les humains peuvent en tirer des ornements à porter. La verse mentionne également les navires qui naviguent sur les mers, ce qui permet aux gens de commercer et de gagner leur vie. Tout cela est une bénédiction de Dieu, pour laquelle les gens devraient être reconnaissants.
orig: وما يستوي البحران هذا عذب فرات سائغ شرابه وهذا ملح أجاج ومن كل تأكلون لحما طريا وتستخرجون حلية تلبسونها وترى الفلك فيه مواخر لتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: He merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night, and He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those you invoke besides Him do not possess as much as the membrane of a date seed.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's complete sovereignty and power over the entire universe. The alternation of night and day, and the precise movements of the sun and moon, are all under Allah's control and follow His decree for a specific duration. It emphasizes that true Lordship belongs solely to Allah, while those worshipped besides Him have no power or control whatsoever, not even over something as insignificant as the membrane covering a date seed.
orig: يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لأجل مسمى ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك والذين تدعون من دونه ما يملكون من قطمير

translation: If you call them, they will not hear your call; and even if they heard, they could not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will reject your association. And none can inform you like the All-Aware.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of calling upon or worshipping anything other than Allah. It states that even if one were to call upon false deities, they would not hear or respond, for they lack the ability to perceive or act. On the Day of Resurrection, these false objects of worship will disassociate themselves from those who associated partners with Allah. The verse concludes by affirming that none can inform or guide as perfectly as Allah, the All-Aware.
orig: إن تدعوهم لا يسمعوا دعاءكم ولو سمعوا ما استجابوا لكم ويوم القيامة يكفرون بشرككم ولا ينبئك مثل خبير

translation: O mankind! You are the ones in need of Allah, while Allah is the Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that all human beings are in a state of need and dependence upon Allah, the One who is truly Self-Sufficient and deserving of all praise. It emphasizes the relationship between the Creator and the created, where the created beings are in constant need of Allah's sustenance and guidance, while Allah is free from any need or deficiency. This realization should instill humility and gratitude in us towards our Lord, who provides for us despite our utter neediness.
orig: يا أيها الناس أنتم الفقراء إلى الله والله هو الغني الحميد

translation: If He wills, He can remove you and bring a new creation.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has absolute power and authority over His creation. If He wills, He can eliminate the present creation and bring forth an entirely new one. It serves as a reminder of Allah's omnipotence and that the existence of all beings is dependent upon His will. The verse also implies that human beings should be humble and obedient to their Creator, as their very existence is contingent upon His will and pleasure.
orig: إن يشأ يذهبكم ويأت بخلق جديد

translation: And that is not difficult for Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that nothing is difficult or impossible for Allah, the Almighty. It highlights Allah's absolute power and ability to accomplish anything He wills, without any limitations or constraints. The interpretation underscores the notion that Allah's might and capability are boundless, and that no task or decree is too difficult or challenging for Him to fulfill.
orig: وما ذلك على الله بعزيز

translation: And no bearer of burdens shall bear the burden of another. And if one heavily laden calls another to (bear) his load, nothing of it will be lifted even though he be near of kin. You can warn only those who fear their Lord unseen and perform the prayer. And whoever purifies himself, purifies himself only for (the benefit of) his own soul. And to Allah is the final return.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principles of individual responsibility and accountability. Each person bears their own burden of sins and good deeds, and cannot transfer or share that burden with others, even if they are close relatives. The warning of the Qur'an is only effective for those who fear Allah in their hearts and establish regular prayer. Purification and righteousness are for one's own spiritual benefit, as everyone will ultimately return to Allah for judgment.
orig: ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى وإن تدع مثقلة إلى حملها لا يحمل منه شيء ولو كان ذا قربى إنما تنذر الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وأقاموا الصلاة ومن تزكى فإنما يتزكى لنفسه وإلى الله المصير

translation: Not equal are the blind and the seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fundamental difference between those who are spiritually blind, lacking understanding and guidance, and those who can perceive the truth and have insight. It highlights the importance of seeking knowledge and enlightenment, as those who remain blind to the truth will be vastly different from those who can see and comprehend it.
orig: وما يستوي الأعمى والبصير

translation: Nor the depths of darkness, nor the light
interpretation: This verse implies that neither the depths of darkness nor the light of day can conceal one from Allah's knowledge and power. It suggests that Allah's dominion encompasses all realms, both the seen and unseen, and that nothing is hidden from His sight.
orig: ولا الظلمات ولا النور

translation: Nor the shadow nor the heat
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings and comforts that Allah has provided for His servants in Paradise. It indicates that in Paradise, there will be neither the distressing heat of the sun nor any shadows that could bring discomfort or annoyance. Instead, the environment will be perfectly temperate and comfortable, free from any extremes or unpleasantness.
orig: ولا الظل ولا الحرور

translation: And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the living and the dead are not equal in their ability to comprehend and respond. While Allah can cause whomever He wills to hear and understand His message, the Prophet Muhammad cannot make the spiritually dead - those who reject faith - hear and accept the truth, just as he cannot make the physically dead in their graves hear him.
orig: وما يستوي الأحياء ولا الأموات إن الله يسمع من يشاء وما أنت بمسمع من في القبور

translation: You are not but a warner
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the Prophet Muhammad's (peace be upon him) role was to convey the message of Islam and warn people about the consequences of disbelief and disobedience to Allah. He was not responsible for guiding or forcing people to accept the faith, but rather to deliver the message clearly and leave the choice to them. This highlights the concept of free will in Islam and that people have the freedom to accept or reject the message, but they will be held accountable for their choices.
orig: إن أنت إلا نذير

translation: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
interpretation: "This verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad was sent by Allah as a messenger to convey the truth, giving glad tidings of reward for those who believe and warning of punishment for those who disbelieve. It also indicates that every nation in history has been sent a messenger from Allah to guide them and warn them against disbelief and wrongdoing."
orig: إنا أرسلناك بالحق بشيرا ونذيرا وإن من أمة إلا خلا فيها نذير

translation: And if they deny you, those before them also denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs, and with the Scriptures, and with the enlightening Book.
interpretation: If the people reject your message, O Muhammad, do not be distressed, for many messengers before you were also rejected by their people. Those messengers brought clear signs, revealed books, and enlightening scriptures from Allah, yet their people still disbelieved. So, do not be disheartened by those who deny your message, for you are following in the footsteps of the previous prophets.
orig: وإن يكذبوك فقد كذب الذين من قبلهم جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات وبالزبر وبالكتاب المنير

translation: Then I seized those who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
interpretation: This verse indicates that after giving warnings and chances, Allah seized those who persisted in disbelief and rejection of faith with a severe punishment. The phrase "how [terrible] was My reproach" implies that Allah's punishment and rejection of the disbelievers was extremely severe and intense, reflecting the gravity of their sin of rejecting faith despite clear signs and warnings.
orig: ثم أخذت الذين كفروا فكيف كان نكير

translation: Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and We brought forth thereby fruits of different colors? And in the mountains are streaks, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating the diversity found in nature. The different colors of fruits and the varying hues in mountains are signs of Allah's artistry and ability to create in infinite forms and patterns. It invites us to reflect on the beauty and marvels of Allah's creation, which should increase our faith and gratitude towards the Creator.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فأخرجنا به ثمرات مختلفا ألوانها ومن الجبال جدد بيض وحمر مختلف ألوانها وغرابيب سود

translation: And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those among His servants having knowledge truly fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity in Allah's creation, with different colors among humans, animals, and livestock. However, it emphasizes that true reverence and fear of Allah comes from those who possess knowledge. The verse affirms Allah's Might and His quality of being Forgiving towards those who repent and obey Him.
orig: ومن الناس والدواب والأنعام مختلف ألوانه كذلك إنما يخشى الله من عباده العلماء إن الله عزيز غفور

translation: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a transaction [i.e., profit] that will never perish.
interpretation: This verse promises great rewards for those who recite and study the Qur'an, establish the obligatory prayers, and spend in charity from the wealth Allah has bestowed upon them, both privately and publicly. Their good deeds are likened to a profitable trade that will never fail or lose its value in the Hereafter.
orig: إن الذين يتلون كتاب الله وأقاموا الصلاة وأنفقوا مما رزقناهم سرا وعلانية يرجون تجارة لن تبور

translation: That He may pay them their rewards in full, and give them more out of His grace. Surely He is Ever Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
interpretation: This verse highlights two of Allah's sublime attributes: His forgiveness and appreciation. It promises that Allah will fully reward the believers for their good deeds, and out of His infinite grace, He will grant them even more than what they deserve. This underscores Allah's boundless generosity towards His faithful servants. Additionally, it emphasizes that Allah is Ever Forgiving, ready to pardon those who sincerely repent, and Most Appreciative, recognizing and rewarding even the smallest of good deeds. This verse fills the believers' hearts with hope, encouraging them to remain steadfast in their faith and righteous actions.
orig: ليوفيهم أجورهم ويزيدهم من فضله إنه غفور شكور

translation: And the Book which We have revealed to you is the truth, confirming what was before it. Surely Allah is All-Aware of His servants, All-Seeing.
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine origin and truthfulness of the Qur'an, which confirms and preserves the previous revelations from God. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of the circumstances of His servants and witnesses all their actions, reminding believers of His all-encompassing knowledge and wisdom.
orig: والذي أوحينا إليك من الكتاب هو الحق مصدقا لما بين يديه إن الله بعباده لخبير بصير

translation: Then We caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants; and among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allah. That is the great bounty.
interpretation: This verse refers to the inheritance of the divine scripture, which was given to those chosen by Allah from among His servants. It highlights the different responses people have towards this guidance: some wrong themselves by rejecting it, some are moderate in following it, and others are foremost in good deeds by Allah's permission. The last group attains the "great bounty," which is the highest reward and favor from Allah.
orig: ثم أورثنا الكتاب الذين اصطفينا من عبادنا فمنهم ظالم لنفسه ومنهم مقتصد ومنهم سابق بالخيرات بإذن الله ذلك هو الفضل الكبير

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with bracelets of gold and pearl while therein their garments will be of silk.
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings that the believers will enjoy in Paradise. The "Gardens of perpetual residence" refers to the eternal abode in the Gardens of Eden, where the righteous will live forever. They will be adorned with "bracelets of gold and pearl," which symbolizes the honor and luxury they will experience. Their "garments will be of silk," indicating the comfort and elegance that awaits them. This verse paints a vivid picture of the rewards and pleasures that await the believers in the Hereafter as a result of their faith and good deeds.
orig: جنات عدن يدخلونها يحلون فيها من أساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير

translation: And they will say, 'Praise be to Allah, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that in the Hereafter, the believers will praise Allah for removing all sorrow and grief from them, acknowledging that He is Most Forgiving for their sins and Appreciative of their good deeds and patience in this world.
orig: وقالوا الحمد لله الذي أذهب عنا الحزن إن ربنا لغفور شكور

translation: He who, out of His grace, has lodged us in the abode of life everlasting, where no toil shall touch us, neither shall weariness affect us.
interpretation: This verse refers to the eternal bliss and comfort that Allah has promised the believers in Paradise. It emphasizes that in the Hereafter, the believers will be spared from any hardship, fatigue or weariness that they experienced in this world. The phrase "where no toil shall touch us" suggests a state of complete rest and tranquility, free from any physical or mental exertion. The words "neither shall weariness affect us" further reinforce the idea of eternal rejuvenation and the absence of any tiredness or exhaustion. This verse serves as a promise and a source of hope for the believers, motivating them to strive for the eternal abode where they will be rewarded with everlasting peace and comfort.
orig: الذي أحلنا دار المقامة من فضله لا يمسنا فيها نصب ولا يمسنا فيها لغوب

translation: But those who disbelieved - for them is the fire of Hell. They are not judged to death, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ingrate.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the severe punishment awaiting them in Hellfire. They will neither be granted death to escape the torment, nor will their punishment be reduced or lightened in any way. This is how Allah deals with those who persist in ingratitude and rejection of faith, denying His signs and revelations.
orig: والذين كفروا لهم نار جهنم لا يقضى عليهم فيموتوا ولا يخفف عنهم من عذابها كذلك نجزي كل كفور

translation: And they will cry out therein, 'Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!' But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the penalty], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the disbelievers in Hellfire. They will cry out, begging to be taken out, promising to do righteous deeds, unlike their previous evil actions. However, Allah will remind them that they had sufficient time in their worldly life to heed the warnings and guidance, but they neglected it. Their pleas will be rejected, and they will be told to taste the punishment, for there is no helper for the wrongdoers.
orig: وهم يصطرخون فيها ربنا أخرجنا نعمل صالحا غير الذي كنا نعمل أولم نعمركم ما يتذكر فيه من تذكر وجاءكم النذير فذوقوا فما للظالمين من نصير

translation: Indeed, Allah is Knower of the unseen aspects of the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is Aware of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge of everything in the heavens and the earth, including the unseen and the secrets hidden within people's hearts and souls. It highlights Allah's attribute of being the All-Knowing, who has complete awareness of every aspect of His creation, even the most concealed thoughts and intentions that reside within the depths of human consciousness.
orig: إن الله عالم غيب السماوات والأرض إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: He it is Who has made you successors generations after generations in the earth, so whosoever disbelieves (in Islamic Monotheism) on him is his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers adds nothing but hatred of Allah toward them. And the disbelief of the disbelievers adds nothing but loss.
interpretation: Allah has granted humans the authority to inhabit and thrive on earth as successive generations. However, those who reject faith will bear the consequences of their disbelief, which only increases Allah's disdain towards them and leads them to further loss and ruin.
orig: هو الذي جعلكم خلائف في الأرض فمن كفر فعليه كفره ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم عند ربهم إلا مقتا ولا يزيد الكافرين كفرهم إلا خسارا

translation: Say, "Have you considered those partners of yours whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth, or do they have a share in the heavens? Or have We given them a book whose evidence they follow? Rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other anything but delusion."
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief in associating partners with Allah in worship. It challenges them to present evidence for the supposed partners' ability to create anything on earth or have a share in the heavens. It also asks if these partners have been given a divine book to follow as proof. The verse emphasizes that the wrongdoers who associate partners with Allah are merely deluding themselves and others with false promises and have no real evidence to support their beliefs.
orig: قل أرأيتم شركاءكم الذين تدعون من دون الله أروني ماذا خلقوا من الأرض أم لهم شرك في السماوات أم آتيناهم كتابا فهم على بينت منه بل إن يعد الظالمون بعضهم بعضا إلا غرورا

translation: Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they deviate, and if they were to deviate, there is not one that could hold them after Him. Indeed, He is Ever Forbearing and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and control over the entire universe. It states that Allah is the One Who sustains the heavens and the earth, preventing them from deviating from their assigned courses. If they were to deviate, no one else would have the ability to hold them in place or maintain their order. This highlights Allah's unique and unmatched might. The verse also attributes to Allah the qualities of being Forbearing and Forgiving, indicating His patience and willingness to pardon those who turn to Him in repentance.
orig: إن الله يمسك السماوات والأرض أن تزولا ولئن زالتا إن أمسكهما من أحد من بعده إنه كان حليما غفورا

translation: And they swore by Allah their most binding oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be better guided than any one of the nations. But when a warner came to them, it increased them in nothing but aversion,
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers of Makkah. They swore by Allah that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than any other nation. However, when the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) came to them as a warner, instead of accepting his message, it only increased their aversion and hatred towards the truth. This shows their hypocrisy and unwillingness to accept the truth, despite their claims of being receptive to guidance.
orig: وأقسموا بالله جهد أيمانهم لئن جاءهم نذير ليكونن أهدى من إحدى الأمم فلما جاءهم نذير ما زادهم إلا نفورا

translation: Out of arrogance in the land and evil plotting. But the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration.
interpretation: This verse condemns arrogance and evil plotting against others. It warns that those who engage in such evil deeds will only harm themselves, as the consequences of their actions will come back to them. The verse also reminds us that Allah's laws and ways are unchanging, and that the fate of those who reject His guidance will be the same as those who came before them and faced destruction due to their arrogance and disbelief. It emphasizes the consistency and immutability of Allah's laws and ways throughout history.
orig: استكبارا في الأرض ومكر السيئ ولا يحيق المكر السيئ إلا بأهله فهل ينظرون إلا سنت الأولين فلن تجد لسنت الله تبديلا ولن تجد لسنت الله تحويلا

translation: Have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in strength. But Allah is not to be caused failure by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Omnipotent.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to reflect on the fate of previous nations who were more powerful, but were ultimately destroyed by Allah for their disbelief and disobedience. It emphasizes that no matter how strong a nation may seem, Allah is never unable to deal with them, for He is All-Knowing and Omnipotent. The verse urges people to learn from history and not become arrogant or heedless of Allah's power.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم وكانوا أشد منهم قوة وما كان الله ليعجزه من شيء في السماوات ولا في الأرض إنه كان عليما قديرا

translation: And if Allah were to seize the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.
interpretation: Cette interprétation souligne la miséricorde d'Allah envers Ses créatures. Bien que les gens méritent d'être punis pour leurs péchés, Allah, dans Sa miséricorde, leur accorde un délai pour se repentir. Cependant, lorsque le terme fixé arrivera, Allah jugera avec clairvoyance et justice, car Il est Parfaitement Conscient des actions de Ses serviteurs.
orig: ولو يؤاخذ الله الناس بما كسبوا ما ترك على ظهرها من دابة ولكن يؤخرهم إلى أجل مسمى فإذا جاء أجلهم فإن الله كان بعباده بصيرا

translation: Yā Sīn
interpretation: This is one of the unique letter combinations that appear at the beginning of some chapters in the Qur'an. The wisdom behind these letters is known only to Allah. Some scholars suggest that they draw attention to the miraculous nature of the Qur'an and its sublime linguistic style.
orig: يس

translation: And the Qur'an, full of wisdom.
interpretation: The Qur'an is described as "al-Hakim," meaning "full of wisdom." This emphasizes that the Qur'an is a book of profound wisdom and guidance, containing teachings and principles that lead to a righteous and fulfilling life. It is a source of spiritual enlightenment and practical guidance for individuals and societies. The wisdom in the Qur'an encompasses various aspects, including moral teachings, social laws, spiritual insights, and universal truths that are applicable to all times and places.
orig: والقرآن الحكيم

translation: Indeed, you are one of the messengers
interpretation: This verse affirms the status of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a Messenger of God, chosen to convey the divine message and guidance to humanity. It emphasizes that he is not an ordinary person but rather one of the noble messengers sent by Allah to guide people towards the truth and the right path.
orig: إنك لمن المرسلين

translation: On a straight path
interpretation: This verse refers to the guidance provided by Allah to those who follow the straight path, which represents the true religion and righteous conduct. It suggests that those who adhere to Allah's commandments and avoid deviating from the correct way will be guided towards salvation and success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: على صراط مستقيم

translation: A revelation from the Exalted in Might, the Merciful
interpretation: This phrase refers to the Qur'an being revealed by Allah, Who is Almighty and Merciful. It highlights the divine origin and authority of the Qur'an, as well as Allah's attributes of power and mercy.
orig: تنزيل العزيز الرحيم

translation: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Prophet Muhammad was sent to warn and guide a people who had not received divine guidance before him, as their ancestors were not warned by any messenger. They were living in ignorance and heedlessness of Allah's teachings and the purpose of life.
orig: لتنذر قوما ما أنذر آباؤهم فهم غافلون

translation: The Word is true about most of them, for they do not believe.
interpretation: This verse implies that the majority of people have rejected faith and disbelieved in Allah's revelations and messengers. It suggests that despite the clear signs and proofs presented to them, most people remain stubborn in their disbelief due to their arrogance, ignorance, or following their desires instead of guidance. The verse highlights the unfortunate reality that truth has become distasteful to the majority, and they persist in misguidance and rejection of faith.
orig: لقد حق القول على أكثرهم فهم لا يؤمنون

translation: Indeed, We have put shackles around their necks, and they are up to their chins, so they are with heads forced up.
interpretation: This verse is a metaphorical description of the disbelievers' stubborn rejection of faith and guidance. The "shackles around their necks" and "heads forced up" symbolize their arrogance, obstinacy, and unwillingness to accept the truth. They are depicted as being restrained and unable to see or comprehend the reality before them due to their own pride and prejudice.
orig: إنا جعلنا في أعناقهم أغلالا فهي إلى الأذقان فهم مقمحون

translation: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
interpretation: This verse metaphorically refers to the spiritual blindness and inability of the disbelievers to perceive the truth and guidance. The "barrier" symbolizes the obstacles and veils that prevent them from recognizing and accepting the message of Islam. Their hearts and minds are covered, obscuring their vision and understanding of the divine truth.
orig: وجعلنا من بين أيديهم سدا ومن خلفهم سدا فأغشيناهم فهم لا يبصرون

translation: It is the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.
interpretation: This verse indicates that some people are so stubborn and arrogant that they refuse to believe no matter how much warning or advice is given to them. Their disbelief is a result of their own obstinacy and closed-mindedness, not a lack of guidance or warning. The Prophet's role was to convey the message, but the decision to accept or reject it ultimately lies with the people themselves. Allah knows best.
orig: وسواء عليهم أأنذرتهم أم لم تنذرهم لا يؤمنون

translation: You can only warn those who follow the Reminder and fear the Most Merciful unseen. So give them good tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet's warning and message is only effective for those who are willing to follow the guidance of the Qur'an and have fear of Allah in their hearts, even though they cannot see Him. For such people, the Prophet should give glad tidings of forgiveness for their sins and a great reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إنما تنذر من اتبع الذكر وخشي الرحمن بالغيب فبشره بمغفرة وأجر كريم

translation: Verily We give life to the dead, and We record that which they have sent before and their traces, and all things We have recorded with numbers in a Clear Book.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah is the One who resurrects the dead on the Day of Judgment. He also records all the deeds, words, and actions of human beings during their worldly life, as well as the consequences and impacts of their deeds. Nothing is left unrecorded, as everything is preserved in a Clear Book or Record with Allah. This emphasizes Allah's complete knowledge, power, and ability to hold people accountable for their actions on the Day of Reckoning.
orig: إنا نحن نحيي الموتى ونكتب ما قدموا وآثارهم وكل شيء أحصيناه في إمام مبين

translation: And present to them the example of the companions of the city - when the messengers came to it -
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the people of a town who rejected the messengers sent to them by Allah. The interpretation is a warning against denying the truth and the consequences of disbelieving Allah's messengers and their message. It serves as an example for people to reflect upon and learn from the fate of those who turned away from guidance.
orig: واضرب لهم مثلا أصحاب القرية إذ جاءها المرسلون

translation: When We sent to them two, but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, 'Indeed, we are messengers to you.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of the messengers sent to the people of Antioch. God sent two messengers who called the people to worship Him alone, but they rejected their message. So God sent a third messenger to support the first two, and together they declared that they were indeed messengers sent by God to guide the people to the truth.
orig: إذ أرسلنا إليهم اثنين فكذبوهما فعززنا بثالث فقالوا إنا إليكم مرسلون

translation: They said, "You are not but men like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
interpretation: The disbelievers were accusing the prophets of being mere humans like themselves, denying that they received any revelation from God. They claimed that the prophets were simply lying about receiving divine guidance, refusing to acknowledge the truth of their message.
orig: قالوا ما أنتم إلا بشر مثلنا وما أنزل الرحمن من شيء إن أنتم إلا تكذبون

translation: They said: 'Our Lord knows that we are indeed Messengers sent to you.'
interpretation: The verse is referring to the belief of the messengers in the knowledge and wisdom of God. They affirm that God is fully aware of their status as messengers sent to the people, and they have complete trust in God's plan and purpose for their mission. The interpretation highlights the messengers' unwavering faith in God's guidance and their role as divinely appointed bearers of His message.
orig: قالوا ربنا يعلم إنا إليكم لمرسلون

translation: And our duty is only to convey the clear message.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the role of the Prophet and the believers is solely to convey the message of Islam clearly and unambiguously. They are not responsible for whether people accept or reject the message, as that is a matter of personal choice and accountability before Allah. Their obligation is to deliver the message faithfully and without alteration or concealment.
orig: وما علينا إلا البلاغ المبين

translation: They said, 'Indeed we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely afflict you, from us, a painful punishment.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers considered the presence of the believers to be a source of misfortune and bad luck for them. They threatened that if the believers did not stop preaching their message, they would stone them and subject them to a severe punishment.
orig: قالوا إنا تطيرنا بكم لئن لم تنتهوا لنرجمنكم وليمسنكم منا عذاب أليم

translation: They said, 'Your omen is with yourselves. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a people transgressing all bounds.'
interpretation: The disbelievers mocked the Prophet and his companions when they were reminded of Allah's signs and warned of His punishment. Their response showed their arrogance and transgression against the truth.
orig: قالوا طائركم معكم أئن ذكرتم بل أنتم قوم مسرفون

translation: And there came a man, running from the farthest part of the city. He said: 'O my people! Follow the Messengers.'
interpretation: This verse encourages people to follow the guidance of the Messengers sent by God. It implies that the truth often comes from an unexpected source, as the man who urged people to follow the Messengers came from the farthest part of the city. The verse highlights the importance of heeding the call of the Prophets and accepting their message of monotheism and righteousness.
orig: وجاء من أقصى المدينة رجل يسعى قال يا قوم اتبعوا المرسلين

translation: Follow those who ask you not for a reward, and they are rightly guided.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to follow the guidance of those who do not seek any worldly gain or reward for their teachings, as they are sincere and guided by Allah. It implies that true religious leaders and guides should be selfless and not motivated by personal interests or material gains. Their guidance comes from a pure intention to guide others towards the right path, without any ulterior motives.
orig: اتبعوا من لا يسألكم أجرا وهم مهتدون

translation: And why should I not worship the One who created me, and to whom you will be returned?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping and submitting to Allah, the Creator, as He is the One who brought us into existence and to whom we will ultimately return after death. It highlights the logical reasoning behind worshipping Allah alone, as He is the source of our creation and the One who will hold us accountable for our deeds in the Hereafter.
orig: وما لي لا أعبد الذي فطرني وإليه ترجعون

translation: Shall I take besides Him gods whose intercession, if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping false deities besides Allah. It poses the rhetorical question: "Shall I take gods besides Allah, whose intercession will be of no benefit to me if Allah intends any harm for me? They cannot protect me or save me from Allah's decree."
orig: أأتخذ من دونه آلهة إن يردن الرحمن بضر لا تغن عني شفاعتهم شيئا ولا ينقذون

translation: Indeed, I was in manifest error
interpretation: This verse expresses the realization of being in a state of clear misguidance and going astray from the truth. It acknowledges one's previous condition of being lost and deviated from the right path, implying a sense of regret and a desire for guidance and forgiveness.
orig: إني إذا لفي ضلال مبين

translation: Verily, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a call to faith and obedience. The speaker affirms their belief in the Lord of those being addressed, and urges them to listen and follow the guidance being offered. It emphasizes the importance of sincere faith and submission to the divine authority.
orig: إني آمنت بربكم فاسمعون

translation: It will be said (to him), 'Enter Paradise.' He will say, 'Would that my people knew'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the righteous believer will be granted admission to Paradise, and upon entering it, he will express a wish that his people knew the truth and guidance that he followed so that they could also attain the same reward. It reflects the believer's concern for his community and a desire for them to be guided towards the right path.
orig: قيل ادخل الجنة قال يا ليت قومي يعلمون

translation: By the Grace of Allah my Lord, He has forgiven me and made me of the honored ones.
interpretation: This verse expresses gratitude to Allah for His immense mercy and favor. The speaker acknowledges that it is by Allah's grace and forgiveness that he has been honored and elevated in status. It signifies the profound humility and thankfulness one should have towards the blessings bestowed by the Divine.
orig: بما غفر لي ربي وجعلني من المكرمين

translation: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We be sending them down.
interpretation: This verse indicates that after the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, no other prophet or messenger will be sent, nor will there be any heavenly soldiers descending upon people. It signifies the finality of the Prophet's message and that no further divine revelation will come after the Qur'an.
orig: وما أنزلنا على قومه من بعده من جند من السماء وما كنا منزلين

translation: It will not be but one blast, and at once they will all be brought before Us.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the swiftness and inevitability of the Day of Resurrection. It will come suddenly, with just one blast of the Trumpet, and all creatures will be gathered before Allah for judgement. The word 'khamidoon' implies that they will be humbled and subdued, unable to resist or escape the reckoning."
orig: إن كانت إلا صيحة واحدة فإذا هم خامدون

translation: Alas for the servants! There did not come to them any messenger but they used to ridicule him.
interpretation: This verse expresses Allah's regret and disappointment over the disbelievers who persistently mocked and ridiculed the messengers sent to them. It highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who refused to accept the truth brought by Allah's messengers, choosing instead to mock and scorn them. The verse serves as a warning against such behavior and a reminder of the grave consequences of rejecting Allah's guidance.
orig: يا حسرة على العباد ما يأتيهم من رسول إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them, and that they will not return to them?
interpretation: This verse reminds the disbelievers of the fate of previous nations who denied God's messengers. It emphasizes that God destroyed them completely, and they will never return to this world. This serves as a warning to those who reject faith, that they too will face a similar end if they persist in their disbelief.
orig: ألم يروا كم أهلكنا قبلهم من القرون أنهم إليهم لا يرجعون

translation: And indeed, all of them will be brought present before Us.
interpretation: This verse indicates that all people will ultimately stand before God on the Day of Judgment to account for their deeds and beliefs. It emphasizes the inescapable reality of divine reckoning and the certainty that everyone will face God's judgment.
orig: وإن كل لما جميع لدينا محضرون

translation: And a sign for them is the dead earth: We have revived it and brought forth from it grain, so from it they eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and mercy in reviving the lifeless earth and causing plants and crops to grow from it, providing sustenance for humans and all living beings. It serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to bring life out of nothingness and His control over the cycles of life and death. The revival of the dead earth is a sign pointing to the greater reality of resurrection after death.
orig: وآية لهم الأرض الميتة أحييناها وأخرجنا منها حبا فمنه يأكلون

translation: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused springs to gush forth therein.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings and provisions for His creation. The "gardens of palm trees and grapevines" symbolize sustenance and nourishment, while the "springs" represent the life-giving water that allows vegetation to flourish. It serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy and care for humanity, providing the necessities for survival and enjoyment in a lush, fruitful environment.
orig: وجعلنا فيها جنات من نخيل وأعناب وفجرنا فيها من العيون

translation: That they may eat of its fruit, and of what their hands have produced. Will they not then give thanks?
interpretation: This verse encourages gratitude and appreciation for the blessings of Allah, including the fruits and produce that humans can enjoy as a result of their own labor and effort. It reminds people to be thankful for the sustenance provided by Allah and to recognize the role of their own hard work in obtaining these provisions. The verse prompts a sense of humility and thankfulness for the divine favors bestowed upon humanity.
orig: ليأكلوا من ثمره وما عملته أيديهم أفلا يشكرون

translation: Glory be to Him Who created all the pairs: from what the earth produces, from themselves, and from what they do not know.
interpretation: This verse glorifies Allah, the Creator of all things in pairs and opposites. It refers to the pairs found in plants, animals, and even human beings themselves. Allah's creative power extends beyond what we can observe, encompassing things we are unaware of. This highlights Allah's perfect knowledge and wisdom in creating everything with a purpose and balance.
orig: سبحان الذي خلق الأزواج كلها مما تنبت الأرض ومن أنفسهم ومما لا يعلمون

translation: And a sign for them is the night from which We remove the day, and they are left in darkness.
interpretation: This verse highlights the wisdom and power of Allah in the alternation of night and day. The removal of daylight and the onset of darkness serves as a reminder of Allah's control over the universe and the cyclical nature of His creation. It encourages reflection on the temporary nature of worldly affairs and the importance of seeking guidance from the eternal light of faith.
orig: وآية لهم الليل نسلخ منه النهار فإذا هم مظلمون

translation: And the sun runs on its fixed course for a term appointed. That is the Decree of the Exalted in Might, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's complete power and knowledge over the universe. The sun follows a precise orbit and course determined by Allah, the Almighty and All-Knowing. This demonstrates Allah's control over the celestial bodies and the entire cosmos, and His intricate design that allows life to exist and flourish on Earth. It serves as a reminder of Allah's greatness and encourages contemplation of His signs in the natural world."
orig: والشمس تجري لمستقر لها ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
interpretation: Allah has designed the phases of the moon in a precise manner, causing it to wax and wane until it becomes like an old, curved date stalk. This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in regulating the movements of the celestial bodies and the cycles of nature.
orig: والقمر قدرناه منازل حتى عاد كالعرجون القديم

translation: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor does the night outstrip the day. They all float, each in an orbit.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the perfect order and harmony in God's creation. The sun and moon follow their ordained courses and do not transgress their limits. Similarly, the night and day alternate in a precise cycle without clashing or overlapping. Each celestial body moves in its own orbit, following the laws set by the Divine Will. This cosmic order reflects the wisdom, power, and flawless design of the Creator.
orig: لا الشمس ينبغي لها أن تدرك القمر ولا الليل سابق النهار وكل في فلك يسبحون

translation: And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden ship
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Noah and the Ark. Allah saved Noah, his family, and the believers who were with him by carrying them safely in the laden ship (the Ark) during the great flood. This is presented as a sign of Allah's power and mercy, as He saved the believers from destruction and allowed them to continue as the progenitors of future generations.
orig: وآية لهم أنا حملنا ذريتهم في الفلك المشحون

translation: And We have created for them of the like that which they ride.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's creation of animals that can be ridden or used for transportation, such as horses, camels, and other beasts of burden. It highlights Allah's mercy and provision for human beings by creating means of transportation that facilitate their travels and make their lives easier.
orig: وخلقنا لهم من مثله ما يركبون

translation: And if We willed, We could drown them, and there would be no cry for help for them, nor would they be saved.
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah has complete power and control over His creation. If He wills, He can punish and destroy those who disbelieve and disobey Him, and they would have no helper or savior to rescue them from Allah's punishment. It serves as a warning to those who reject faith and highlights Allah's absolute authority and dominance over all affairs.
orig: وإن نشأ نغرقهم فلا صريخ لهم ولا هم ينقذون

translation: Except as a mercy from Us and an enjoyment for a time.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the life of this world and its pleasures are temporary and a means of testing from Allah. The comforts and enjoyments we experience are a mercy from Him, but they are not permanent. They are only given to us for a limited time as a test of our gratitude and obedience. The true and everlasting bliss lies in the Hereafter for those who believe and do righteous deeds.
orig: إلا رحمة منا ومتاعا إلى حين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Fear what is before you and what is behind you, so that you may receive mercy,'
interpretation: This verse encourages people to be mindful of the consequences of their actions, both in this life and the Hereafter. "What is before you" refers to the future consequences of one's deeds, while "what is behind you" refers to the past sins and wrongdoings. By fearing Allah and being conscious of accountability, one may attain His mercy and forgiveness.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اتقوا ما بين أيديكم وما خلفكم لعلكم ترحمون

translation: And there does not come to them any sign from the signs of their Lord except that they turn away from it.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers persistently rejected and turned away from the clear signs and evidences presented by Allah. Despite witnessing the miracles and proofs of Allah's existence and power, they deliberately chose to ignore and disregard them due to their arrogance and stubbornness.
orig: وما تأتيهم من آية من آيات ربهم إلا كانوا عنها معرضين

translation: And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which Allah has provided for you," those who disbelieved say to those who believed, "Should we feed those whom, if Allah had willed, He could have fed? You are not but in clear error."
interpretation: This verse criticizes the arrogant attitude of the disbelievers who refuse to spend in charity and mock the believers for doing so. They argue that if Allah had willed, He could have provided for the needy directly, implying that charity is unnecessary. However, this reasoning is flawed and stems from their disbelief and lack of understanding of Allah's wisdom in testing people's faith through charity and compassion for others.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم أنفقوا مما رزقكم الله قال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا أنطعم من لو يشاء الله أطعمه إن أنتم إلا في ضلال مبين

translation: And they say, 'When is this promise, if you should be truthful?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mockingly questioned the promise of the Day of Resurrection and the life after death. They demanded proof from the believers about when this promised event would occur, implying their disbelief in it. The interpretation highlights their arrogant rejection of the divine warning and their demand for immediate fulfillment of the promise, which they considered unlikely or impossible.
orig: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد إن كنتم صادقين

translation: They await not but a single Shout which will seize them while they are disputing.
interpretation: "This verse warns the disbelievers that they will not have to wait long for the punishment of Allah to strike them. It will come suddenly, like a single blast or cry that will seize them while they are engaged in futile arguments and disputes, denying the truth."
orig: ما ينظرون إلا صيحة واحدة تأخذهم وهم يخصمون

translation: So they will not be able to make a bequest, nor will they return to their families.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers will be in such a state on the Day of Resurrection that they will neither be able to make a will or testament regarding their worldly possessions, nor will they be able to return to their families and loved ones. Their ties with this world will be completely severed, and they will face the consequences of their disbelief and rejection of faith.
orig: فلا يستطيعون توصية ولا إلى أهلهم يرجعون

translation: And the Trumpet will be blown, and behold from the graves they will come out hastening to their Lord.
interpretation: This verse describes the event of resurrection on the Day of Judgment. When the Trumpet is blown, all souls will rise from their graves and hasten towards their Lord for judgment. It emphasizes the reality of the Hereafter and the accountability of every human being before Allah.
orig: ونفخ في الصور فإذا هم من الأجداث إلى ربهم ينسلون

translation: They will say, 'Woe to us! Who has raised us from our resting place? This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers spoke the truth.'
interpretation: This verse describes the state of disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. They will express regret and dismay at being resurrected, realizing that what they had denied - the promise of resurrection and accountability - was indeed true, as foretold by God's messengers.
orig: قالوا يا ويلنا من بعثنا من مرقدنا هذا ما وعد الرحمن وصدق المرسلون

translation: It will not be but one blast, and at once they will all be brought present before Us.
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the abrupt and sudden nature of the Day of Resurrection. It states that it will only take a single blast or cry from the angel Israfil to gather all of humanity before Allah for judgment. There will be no gradual process or warning - it will happen instantaneously with just one powerful sound. This highlights the might and power of Allah, as well as the urgency for humans to be prepared for that momentous occasion.
orig: إن كانت إلا صيحة واحدة فإذا هم جميع لدينا محضرون

translation: So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of divine justice on the Day of Judgment. No one will be wronged or treated unjustly in any way. Instead, each person will be judged solely based on their actions and deeds in this worldly life. The recompense or reward they receive will be a direct consequence of their own choices and behavior. This highlights the importance of living a righteous life and being accountable for one's actions.
orig: فاليوم لا تظلم نفس شيئا ولا تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: Indeed, the companions of Paradise today are amidst [enjoying] a pleasing occupation
interpretation: The verse indicates that those who have earned Paradise are engaged in delightful activities and pleasures on that Day, free from any toil or distress. It highlights the blissful state of the righteous in the Hereafter, indulging in everlasting joy and delight as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: إن أصحاب الجنة اليوم في شغل فاكهون

translation: They and their spouses will be in shades, reclining on thrones.
interpretation: This verse describes the blissful state of the believers in Paradise, where they will be resting comfortably with their spouses, shaded from any discomfort or harm, and reclining on thrones or couches as a sign of honor and luxury.
orig: هم وأزواجهم في ظلال على الأرائك متكئون

translation: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they call for.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers in Paradise abundant fruits and the ability to have whatever they desire. It highlights the boundless blessings and fulfillment of all wishes in the eternal abode of Paradise, symbolizing the ultimate reward for faith and righteous deeds in this world.
orig: لهم فيها فاكهة ولهم ما يدعون

translation: Peace, a Word from a Merciful Lord.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the concept of peace and mercy that Islam promotes. It suggests that the greeting of 'peace' is a word from God, who is described as 'Merciful.' This highlights the importance of spreading peace and kindness, as these qualities stem from the very nature of God. The verse encourages Muslims to adopt an attitude of compassion and mercy in their interactions with others.
orig: سلام قولا من رب رحيم

translation: But you, O criminals, are separated out on this Day.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the disbelievers and wrongdoers on the Day of Judgment. It indicates that on this great Day, they will be separated and distinguished from the believers and the righteous. The interpretation suggests that the criminals, who rejected faith and committed sins, will be isolated and dealt with separately to face the consequences of their actions and disbelief.
orig: وامتازوا اليوم أيها المجرمون

translation: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [shaytan] - indeed, he is to you a clear enemy?
interpretation: Allah reminds the children of Adam that He commanded them not to worship or obey Satan, for Satan is an avowed enemy to mankind who seeks to lead them astray and bring about their ruin and misery. Satan has made it his mission to misguide people and turn them away from the straight path of worshipping Allah alone.
orig: ألم أعهد إليكم يا بني آدم أن لا تعبدوا الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: And worship Me (Alone). This is the Straight Path.
interpretation: This verse commands the worship of Allah alone, without associating any partners with Him. It declares that the true and straight path is to submit completely to Allah and dedicate all acts of worship solely to Him. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining pure monotheism (Tawheed) and avoiding any form of polytheism or idolatry.
orig: وأن اعبدوني هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, He misled a great multitude of you. Did you not then understand?
interpretation: This verse is reminding people that many have been led astray from the truth by following their desires and whims instead of the guidance from God. It is questioning whether they did not use their intellect and reasoning to recognize the truth and follow the right path. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of using one's God-given ability to think and reason in order to avoid being misguided.
orig: ولقد أضل منكم جبلا كثيرا أفلم تكونوا تعقلون

translation: This is Hellfire which you were promised
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to the disbelievers and wrongdoers about the reality of Hellfire. It serves as a reminder that the punishment they were threatened with for their denial and sins is indeed true and inescapable. The use of the demonstrative pronoun "this" emphasizes the tangible and imminent nature of this torment, leaving no room for doubt or denial.
orig: هذه جهنم التي كنتم توعدون

translation: Burn them today for what they used to deny.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. It indicates that they will be punished with burning in the Hellfire as a consequence for their rejection of faith and denial of the truth during their worldly life. The interpretation emphasizes the severe punishment awaiting those who persist in disbelief and ingratitude towards Allah's signs and revelations.
orig: اصلوها اليوم بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will prevent the disbelievers from speaking lies or excuses. Instead, their body parts will bear witness against them for the evil deeds they committed, as if their hands and feet could speak and testify to Allah about their misdeeds and disobedience.
orig: اليوم نختم على أفواههم وتكلمنا أيديهم وتشهد أرجلهم بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And if We willed, We could have blinded their eyes. Then they would race towards the path, but how would they see?
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah has complete control over human perception and guidance. If He willed, He could deprive people of their spiritual insight, leaving them unable to find the straight path and see the truth, no matter how hard they try. It serves as a reminder of our utter dependence on Allah's mercy for guidance and the ability to recognize and follow the right way.
orig: ولو نشاء لطمسنا على أعينهم فاستبقوا الصراط فأنى يبصرون

translation: And if We willed, We could have transformed them in their places, so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.
interpretation: Allah has the power to disfigure or transform people into helpless beings who cannot move forward or go back, as a punishment for their disbelief and disobedience. However, He grants them respite out of His mercy and wisdom.
orig: ولو نشاء لمسخناهم على مكانتهم فما استطاعوا مضيا ولا يرجعون

translation: And whomever We grant long life, We cause him to regress in creation. Will they not then understand?
interpretation: This verse highlights the frailty and weakness that comes with old age. As people grow older, their physical and mental faculties deteriorate, causing them to regress in their abilities. This is a reminder of the temporary nature of human existence and a call to reflect on the purpose of life and the inevitability of death. It encourages people to use their faculties wisely while they are still capable and to prepare for the Hereafter.
orig: ومن نعمره ننكسه في الخلق أفلا يعقلون

translation: And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is not poetry, but a divine revelation from Allah. Poetry is a product of human imagination, while the Qur'an is a clear message and guidance from the Lord of the Worlds. It refutes the claims of the disbelievers who accused the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) of being a poet or a soothsayer. The Qur'an is a unique literary masterpiece that cannot be replicated by human beings, as it is the Word of Allah, free from any errors or contradictions.
orig: وما علمناه الشعر وما ينبغي له إن هو إلا ذكر وقرآن مبين

translation: That it may warn whoever is alive, and that the Word may be justified against the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the primary purpose of the Qur'an is to serve as a warning to those who are spiritually alive and receptive to its message. It also suggests that the Qur'an provides clear evidence and proof against those who reject its teachings and remain in disbelief, leaving them without excuse on the Day of Judgment.
orig: لينذر من كان حيا ويحق القول على الكافرين

translation: Have they not seen that We have created for them, of what Our Hands have made, cattle, so they are their owners?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' lack of gratitude towards Allah. It emphasizes that Allah has created domestic animals like cattle for human benefit and ownership, yet they fail to recognize this blessing and remain ungrateful.
orig: أولم يروا أنا خلقنا لهم مما عملت أيدينا أنعاما فهم لها مالكون

translation: And We have subjugated them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
interpretation: Allah is referring to the domesticated animals that He has subjugated and made beneficial for human beings. Some animals, like camels and horses, are used for transportation and riding. Others, like cattle and sheep, are sources of food as their meat and milk are consumed by humans. This verse highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in creating these animals to serve humankind's needs and facilitate their lives.
orig: وذللناها لهم فمنها ركوبهم ومنها يأكلون

translation: And for them therein are benefits and drinks. Then will they not be grateful?
interpretation: This verse highlights the numerous blessings bestowed upon human beings by Allah, including the benefits and provisions found in animals. It encourages gratitude and appreciation for these favors, reminding us to be thankful for the sustenance and resources Allah has provided for our benefit and survival.
orig: ولهم فيها منافع ومشارب أفلا يشكرون

translation: And they have taken besides Allah [other] deities that perhaps they would be helped.
interpretation: The disbelievers took other beings as objects of worship besides Allah, hoping that these false deities would help them and provide assistance, even though none besides Allah has the power to benefit or harm.
orig: واتخذوا من دون الله آلهة لعلهم ينصرون

translation: They cannot help them, yet they [disbelievers] are soldiers drawn up for them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the false deities that disbelievers worship can neither benefit nor protect them. Despite this, the disbelievers stubbornly cling to these deities and blindly follow them as if they are an army prepared to defend them. The verse highlights the futility of worshipping anything besides Allah and the delusion of those who associate partners with Him.
orig: لا يستطيعون نصرهم وهم لهم جند محضرون

translation: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
interpretation: Do not be saddened by the words and actions of the disbelievers, for We are fully aware of their secret plots and public statements against you and the message of Islam. Their opposition and rejection will not harm you or the truth you preach.
orig: فلا يحزنك قولهم إنا نعلم ما يسرون وما يعلنون

translation: Does not man see that We created him from a sperm-drop? Yet, he is an open quarreler.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and arrogance of man. Despite being created from a humble beginning - a mere sperm-drop, man becomes an "open quarreler," engaged in futile disputes and arguments against his Lord. It serves as a reminder for man to reflect on his origins and remain humble and grateful to his Creator.
orig: أولم ير الإنسان أنا خلقناه من نطفة فإذا هو خصيم مبين
