translation: And he presents for Us a parable and forgets his own creation. He says, 'Who will give life to the bones while they are disintegrated?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who doubted the resurrection and the power of Allah to revive the dead. Despite witnessing Allah's ability to create them from nothing, they questioned how the decayed bones could be brought back to life. The verse highlights their lack of faith and understanding of Allah's infinite might.
orig: وضرب لنا مثلا ونسي خلقه قال من يحيي العظام وهي رميم

translation: Say, 'He will give them life, the One who originated them the first time, and He is fully aware of every creation.'
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's power to resurrect and revive the dead on the Day of Judgment. It states that the same Being who created them in the first place will bring them back to life again, for He has perfect knowledge of all His creation. This emphasizes Allah's omnipotence, omniscience, and ability to resurrect humanity for judgment and accountability.
orig: قل يحييها الذي أنشأها أول مرة وهو بكل خلق عليم

translation: It is He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then you ignite from it.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's power and wisdom in creating fire from green trees. Despite trees being a source of coolness and moisture, Allah has enabled us to produce fire from them for warmth and other purposes. It highlights Allah's ability to bring forth opposites from the same source, reminding us of His might and the wonders in His creation.
orig: الذي جعل لكم من الشجر الأخضر نارا فإذا أنتم منه توقدون

translation: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yes, and He is the Supreme Creator, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's ability to resurrect the dead just as He created the heavens and the earth from nothing. It emphasizes His supreme power as the Creator and His perfect knowledge. The resurrection of souls is no more difficult for Him than the original creation, which testifies to His absolute capability and wisdom.
orig: أوليس الذي خلق السماوات والأرض بقادر على أن يخلق مثلهم بلى وهو الخلاق العليم

translation: His command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it 'Be,' and it comes into being.
interpretation: This verse affirms the absolute power and authority of Allah over all creation. When Allah wills or intends something, He simply commands it to "Be," and it immediately comes into existence without any difficulty or obstacle. This highlights Allah's ability to create and control all things effortlessly by His mere Word. It emphasizes the ease with which Allah can accomplish anything according to His Divine Will and Plan.
orig: إنما أمره إذا أراد شيئا أن يقول له كن فيكون

translation: So glorified is He in Whose Hand is the dominion of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse glorifies and praises Allah, the Almighty, Who has complete control and sovereignty over all things in the universe. It emphasizes that the kingdom and dominion of everything belongs solely to Allah, and that all creatures will ultimately return to Him on the Day of Resurrection to be judged and held accountable for their deeds.
orig: فسبحان الذي بيده ملكوت كل شيء وإليه ترجعون

translation: By those ranged in ranks,
interpretation: This refers to the angels who stand ranged in ranks, obedient to Allah's commands. It indicates their disciplined nature and organization, ready to carry out Allah's orders without question.
orig: والصافات صفا

translation: By the coursers, panting,
interpretation: This verse refers to the horses that run swiftly in battle, breathing heavily. It is an oath, emphasizing the power and strength of these horses. The interpretation is that Allah swears by these magnificent creatures to affirm the truth of the message that follows.
orig: فالزاجرات زجرا

translation: So the following is a reminder
interpretation: This verse suggests that the subsequent verses serve as a reminder or admonition regarding important matters of faith and righteous conduct. It implies that the Qur'an aims to remind people of essential truths and guide them towards the right path.
orig: فالتاليات ذكرا

translation: Indeed, your God is One.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fundamental Islamic belief in the Oneness and Unity of God (Tawheed). It affirms that there is only one true God, who is the sole Creator, Sustainer, and Sovereign of the universe. The verse rejects any form of polytheism or associating partners with God. It calls upon believers to devote their worship and obedience solely to the One True God, without ascribing any equals or rivals to Him.
orig: إن إلهكم لواحد

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, and Lord of the easts.
interpretation: This verse highlights the absolute sovereignty and lordship of Allah over the entire universe, including the heavens, the earth, and everything in between. It also emphasizes His lordship over the various points of sunrise throughout the year, indicating His control over the celestial bodies and the passage of time. The verse affirms Allah's undisputed authority and reminds us of our complete dependence on Him as the Creator and Sustainer of all existence.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما ورب المشارق

translation: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with the adornment of stars
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the beauty and majesty of Allah's creation. By adorning the nearest heaven with stars, Allah has decorated the celestial realm with exquisite ornaments that serve as a reminder of His power and artistry. The stars in the night sky are a manifestation of Allah's infinite wisdom and a sign of His greatness for those who reflect upon His creation.
orig: إنا زينا السماء الدنيا بزينة الكواكب

translation: And protection from every rebellious devil.
interpretation: This verse seeks Allah's protection from the evil whispers and temptations of the rebellious devils who mislead people and incite them towards sin and disobedience.
orig: وحفظا من كل شيطان مارد

translation: They do not listen to the Supreme Council, and they are pelted from every side.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers or wrongdoers are not willing to listen to the guidance and instructions from the highest authority ("the Supreme Council"). As a result, they face punishment and difficulties coming at them from all directions ("pelted from every side"). This could be a metaphorical description of the consequences they face for their rejection of truth and disobedience towards God.
orig: لا يسمعون إلى الملإ الأعلى ويقذفون من كل جانب

translation: They will be overturned, and for them is an enduring punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe consequences for those who reject faith and persist in disbelief. They will be utterly defeated and disgraced in this world and the Hereafter. The phrase "enduring punishment" refers to the eternal torment they will face in the Hellfire as a result of their stubborn rejection of God's guidance.
orig: دحورا ولهم عذاب واصب

translation: Except for the one who snatches but once, and is pursued by a piercing flame.
interpretation: This verse refers to the jinn (unseen beings) who attempt to eavesdrop on the conversations of the angels in the heavens. When they try to steal some information, a bright flame is cast at them to drive them away. The verse emphasizes that no one can obtain knowledge of the unseen except through revelation from Allah.
orig: إلا من خطف الخطفة فأتبعه شهاب ثاقب

translation: So ask them, 'Are they stronger in constitution or those We have created? We created them from sticky clay.'
interpretation: This verse is questioning the idolaters about their belief in the powerlessness of their idols. It is asking them whether their idols, which they worship besides Allah, are stronger in creation or the human beings whom Allah has created from clay. The verse implies that the idols are inanimate objects without any power, while human beings are superior creations of Allah, made from clay which is a living and pliable substance. The interpretation emphasizes the folly of worshipping powerless idols instead of the One True Creator.
orig: فاستفتهم أهم أشد خلقا أم من خلقنا إنا خلقناهم من طين لازب

translation: Rather, they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, 'This is an amazing thing.'
interpretation: The disbelievers are amazed and mock the fact that a warner from among themselves, i.e. the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), has come to them with the message of Islam. They find it strange and unbelievable that someone they know and who is like them would be chosen as a Prophet. Their arrogance and denial of the truth leads them to ridicule and reject the message.
orig: بل عجبت ويسخرون

translation: And when they are reminded, they pay no heed.
interpretation: This verse implies that some people are heedless and do not benefit from the reminders and admonitions given to them. They turn a deaf ear to the guidance and advice offered, failing to reflect upon it or take it to heart. Their indifference and lack of contemplation prevent them from being guided to the truth.
orig: وإذا ذكروا لا يذكرون

translation: And when they see a sign, they ridicule it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mock and make fun of the signs and miracles of Allah, refusing to acknowledge their truth and guidance. It highlights their arrogance and stubbornness in rejecting the clear proofs presented to them, which is a sign of their disbelief and lack of faith.
orig: وإذا رأوا آية يستسخرون

translation: And they say, 'This is not but obvious magic.'
interpretation: The disbelievers accused the Qur'an and the message of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ of being mere sorcery or magic, denying its divine origin and truth. This interpretation highlights their stubborn rejection of the clear signs and miracles presented to them, attributing it to trickery and illusion instead of acknowledging its profound wisdom and guidance.
orig: وقالوا إن هذا إلا سحر مبين

translation: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be resurrected?
interpretation: This verse questions the concept of resurrection after death, when the body has decayed into dust and bones. It implies the disbelief of some people in the idea of being brought back to life after death, considering it an impossibility. The interpretation emphasizes the power of Allah to resurrect and recreate human beings, even after their physical bodies have disintegrated.
orig: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون

translation: Or our forefathers of old?
interpretation: This verse questions the idolaters' belief in following the traditions and practices of their ancestors blindly, without any rational or divine justification. It implies that blindly adhering to ancestral customs is not a valid reason for continuing false beliefs or practices, especially when truth and guidance have been revealed.
orig: أوآباؤنا الأولون

translation: Say, 'Yes, and you will be humbled.'
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers and arrogant people who rejected the message of Islam. The interpretation is that they will eventually be humbled and brought low, despite their arrogance and rejection of the truth. Their pride and arrogance will be shattered, and they will be forced to submit to the will of Allah.
orig: قل نعم وأنتم داخرون

translation: It will not be but one blast, and at once they will be observing.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the swiftness and unexpectedness of the Day of Resurrection. It will occur in an instant, with just one blast of the Trumpet. At that moment, all people will find themselves witnessing and facing the reality of the Hereafter, leaving no room for doubt or denial.
orig: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة فإذا هم ينظرون

translation: And they will say, 'Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will realize the truth and exclaim in regret and anguish, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense." They will be filled with sorrow and remorse for their denial and rejection of the truth, as they witness the reality of the Hereafter and the consequences of their actions.
orig: وقالوا يا ويلنا هذا يوم الدين

translation: This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is: "This refers to the Day of Resurrection and ultimate judgment, which the disbelievers used to deny and reject during their worldly life. On that Day, all people will be held accountable for their beliefs and deeds, and the truth will be made manifest. The verse serves as a warning and reminder of the inevitability of the Day of Judgement."
orig: هذا يوم الفصل الذي كنتم به تكذبون

translation: Gather those who have wronged, along with their spouses and what they used to worship
interpretation: This verse commands the gathering of the wrongdoers, their spouses who may have influenced them or been influenced by them, and the false deities they worshipped instead of Allah. It implies that on the Day of Judgment, people will be held accountable not only for their own actions but also for the company they kept and the influences they were exposed to. The verse highlights the gravity of associating partners with Allah and warns against being misguided by spouses or false objects of worship.
orig: احشروا الذين ظلموا وأزواجهم وما كانوا يعبدون

translation: Those who stray from the path of Allah, guide them to the path of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject Allah's guidance and follow their own desires instead. It instructs the believers to guide such misguided individuals back to the straight path, which is the path of truth and righteousness. However, if they persist in their misguidance, they should be left to face the consequences of their actions, which is the path leading to Hellfire and eternal punishment.
orig: من دون الله فاهدوهم إلى صراط الجحيم

translation: Stop them, for they are to be questioned.
interpretation: This verse suggests holding people accountable for their actions and questioning them about their deeds. It implies that there will be a reckoning or judgment where people will be held responsible and asked to give an account of their conduct.
orig: وقفوهم إنهم مسئولون

translation: What is the matter with you that you do not help one another?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the believers as to why they are not supporting and assisting one another. It emphasizes the importance of unity, cooperation, and mutual support among the Muslim community. The verse encourages believers to stand together, help each other in times of need, and work towards common goals and objectives. It highlights the collective responsibility of Muslims to uplift and strengthen one another.
orig: ما لكم لا تناصرون

translation: Nay, but on that Day they will be subdued.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers and arrogant people who rejected faith will be utterly humbled and subdued before Allah. Their arrogance and defiance will be replaced by submission and helplessness in the face of divine judgment."
orig: بل هم اليوم مستسلمون

translation: And some of them will turn to others, questioning one another.
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, some people will turn towards others and question them, perhaps about their beliefs and actions in the worldly life. It implies a sense of accountability and questioning that will take place among people on that Day.
orig: وأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون

translation: They will say, 'Indeed you used to come at us from the right side.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers accusing the satans or evil companions of coming to them from the right side, which is traditionally associated with righteousness and truth. They are blaming these evil forces for misleading them and causing them to stray from the right path. The interpretation suggests that the disbelievers will realize their mistake on the Day of Judgment and acknowledge the role of evil influences in their disbelief and wrongdoings.
orig: قالوا إنكم كنتم تأتوننا عن اليمين

translation: They will say, 'Nay, you were not believers.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers will be reminded that their lack of faith and rejection of God's signs and messengers was the reason for their unfortunate state. The phrase 'you were not believers' implies that true belief requires not only verbal affirmation but sincere conviction and righteous actions. Their disbelief and disobedience led to their ultimate downfall and punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: قالوا بل لم تكونوا مؤمنين

translation: And we had no authority over you, but you were a transgressing people.
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, the misguided leaders will disclaim any authority over their followers, and will place the blame squarely on the followers themselves for willfully disobeying God's commands. They will say that they had no power to force anyone to go astray, but rather the people chose to transgress and rebel against God of their own free will.
orig: وما كان لنا عليكم من سلطان بل كنتم قوما طاغين

translation: So it has become due upon us the Word of our Lord: 'Surely We shall taste [punishment]'
interpretation: This verse implies that the punishment of Allah has become inevitable for those who denied the truth and persisted in disbelief and wrongdoing. Since they rejected the clear signs and warnings from Allah, they will inevitably face the consequences of their actions and "taste" the punishment that Allah has decreed for them.
orig: فحق علينا قول ربنا إنا لذائقون

translation: So We misled you, for We were indeed misled ones.
interpretation: This verse acknowledges that both the speaker (referring to a group) and the addressee were misguided. It suggests that the speaker is admitting their own misguidance and acknowledging that they led the addressee astray as well. The verse implies a shared responsibility for being misguided and indicates regret or remorse for their actions.
orig: فأغويناكم إنا كنا غاوين

translation: For that Day they will all share in the Punishment.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, all those who rejected faith and committed evil deeds will share in the punishment of Hell. It emphasizes the collective nature of the punishment, where everyone who deserves it will be held accountable and will suffer the consequences of their disbelief and wrongdoings. The interpretation highlights the justice of Allah, where no one will be wronged, and everyone will receive their due recompense based on their actions in this world.
orig: فإنهم يومئذ في العذاب مشتركون

translation: Indeed, We deal thus with the criminals.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that Allah deals strictly and severely with those who persist in sin and disobedience. It serves as a warning that there are consequences for criminal behavior and a reminder of Allah's justice and ability to punish the wrongdoers."
orig: إنا كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين

translation: Indeed, when it was said to them, 'There is no deity but Allah,' they were arrogant.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers when they were invited to accept the Oneness of Allah. Despite being presented with the clear truth that there is no god worthy of worship except Allah, they refused to accept it out of pride and arrogance. Their arrogance prevented them from submitting to the truth and embracing the message of Tawheed (Oneness of God).
orig: إنهم كانوا إذا قيل لهم لا إله إلا الله يستكبرون

translation: And they say, 'Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?'
interpretation: The disbelievers are mocking the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) for calling them to abandon their pagan deities and worship the One True God. They dismiss him as a 'mad poet,' implying that his teachings are mere poetic ramblings of an insane person, rather than divine revelations.
orig: ويقولون أئنا لتاركو آلهتنا لشاعر مجنون

translation: Nay, he has come with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) has brought the truth from Allah, and his message confirms and supports the messages of the previous prophets and messengers. It establishes the continuity and consistency of Allah's revelations throughout history, and the universality of the core message of worshipping One God and following His guidance.
orig: بل جاء بالحق وصدق المرسلين

translation: Indeed, you will surely taste the painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to the disbelievers and wrongdoers that they will inevitably face a severe and agonizing punishment in the Hereafter for their rejection of faith and their evil deeds. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience to Allah's commands, emphasizing the reality of divine justice and accountability.
orig: إنكم لذائقو العذاب الأليم

translation: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability and justice in the Hereafter. It states that each person will be rewarded or held accountable solely based on their own deeds and actions in this worldly life. There will be no injustice or favoritism; everyone will get the fair and proportionate recompense for what they have done, whether good or evil. This highlights the importance of leading a righteous life and performing good deeds, as they will be the basis for one's reward in the Afterlife.
orig: وما تجزون إلا ما كنتم تعملون

translation: Except the sincere servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are truly devoted to Allah, worshipping Him alone with sincere faith and righteous deeds. They are the exception from the punishment or affliction mentioned in the preceding verses. Allah protects and honors His sincere servants who strive to obey Him and avoid associating partners with Him.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: For those, there is a known provision
interpretation: This verse refers to a guaranteed and predetermined sustenance or provision from Allah for those who follow His guidance and obey His commands. It implies that their needs will be taken care of in this life and the Hereafter as a reward for their righteousness and faith.
orig: أولئك لهم رزق معلوم

translation: And fruit, and they will be honored
interpretation: This verse suggests that in Paradise, the believers will be honored and served with delicious fruits as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: فواكه وهم مكرمون

translation: In the Gardens of Delight
interpretation: This verse refers to the eternal Paradise that the righteous believers will be admitted to as a reward for their faith and good deeds. The "Gardens of Delight" symbolize the ultimate bliss, peace, and contentment that they will experience in the Hereafter, free from any suffering or distress.
orig: في جنات النعيم

translation: On thrones facing each other
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers being seated on thrones in Paradise, facing one another. It depicts a scene of comfort, honor, and companionship in the eternal abode promised to the righteous. The "thrones" symbolize a position of dignity and the "facing each other" suggests a sense of community and togetherness that the believers will enjoy in the Hereafter.
orig: على سرر متقابلين

translation: There will be circulated among them a cup from a flowing stream,
interpretation: This verse describes the bounties of Paradise, where the inhabitants will be served a pure and delightful drink from an ever-flowing stream or fountain. It symbolizes the endless bliss and pleasure they will experience in the eternal abode.
orig: يطاف عليهم بكأس من معين

translation: White, a delight for the drinkers.
interpretation: This verse is referring to milk, describing it as white and delightful for those who drink it. It highlights the pure and nourishing nature of milk, which is considered a blessing from Allah.
orig: بيضاء لذة للشاربين

translation: In it there is no futility, nor are they expelled therefrom.
interpretation: This verse indicates that in Paradise, there will be no vain or useless things, nor will the dwellers of Paradise ever be removed or expelled from it. It highlights the perfection and eternal nature of the abode of Paradise, free from any deficiencies or the fear of being expelled.
orig: لا فيها غول ولا هم عنها ينزفون

translation: And with them will be companions of modest gaze, with beautiful eyes.
interpretation: This verse describes the companions promised to the righteous in Paradise. They will have chaste and modest wives who will avert their gazes from everyone except their husbands, as a sign of their purity and devotion. The phrase "beautiful eyes" highlights their beauty and attractiveness.
orig: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف عين

translation: As if they were hidden eggs
interpretation: This verse uses a metaphor to describe the believers in Paradise. Their pure, radiant faces are likened to hidden or concealed eggs, suggesting beauty, purity, and protection. It conveys the idea of their faces shining with serenity and contentment, untouched by the troubles of this world.
orig: كأنهن بيض مكنون

translation: Then some of them will turn to others, questioning one another.
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, people will question one another about their beliefs and actions in the worldly life. It implies a sense of regret, as they will realize the truth and the consequences of their choices. The interpretation highlights the accountability and reckoning that will take place on that Day.
orig: فأقبل بعضهم على بعض يتساءلون

translation: A speaker among them said: 'Indeed, I had a companion'
interpretation: This verse is referring to one of the disbelievers in the Hereafter speaking up and mentioning that he had a companion who used to remind him about the truth and the Day of Resurrection, but he rejected the advice. The "companion" could be referring to a righteous person, an angel, or his own conscience that tried to guide him to the right path.
orig: قال قائل منهم إني كان لي قرين

translation: He says, 'Verily, you are one of the truthful ones.'
interpretation: This verse implies that the person being addressed is recognized as truthful and honest in their words and actions. It is an affirmation of their credibility and trustworthiness, indicating that they are among those who are considered truthful by God or by others.
orig: يقول أإنك لمن المصدقين

translation: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected?
interpretation: This verse raises the question of resurrection and life after death, which is a fundamental belief in Islam. The interpretation is that despite the apparent impossibility of bringing back life after death, Allah has the power to resurrect all human beings on the Day of Judgment. It highlights the need to have faith in Allah's unlimited might and ability to make the impossible possible.
orig: أإذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمدينون

translation: He (Allah) said, 'Are you aware?'
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the listener is truly aware or has knowledge of something. It implies that there is a deeper level of understanding or insight that is being referred to, beyond surface-level awareness.
orig: قال هل أنتم مطلعون

translation: So he looked and saw him in the midst of the Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being referred to was able to witness or observe someone suffering in the depths of Hell. It implies that there is a reality to the punishment of Hell, which can be witnessed or perceived in some way.
orig: فاطلع فرآه في سواء الجحيم

translation: Allah says: 'If you had almost made me incline towards them a little,'
interpretation: This verse is a warning from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) against being influenced or swayed by the disbelievers or those who associate partners with Allah. It emphasizes the importance of remaining steadfast in one's faith and not compromising with falsehood or polytheism, even slightly. The verse highlights the gravity of such an action and serves as a reminder to the Prophet and all believers to remain firm in their devotion to the One True God.
orig: قال تالله إن كدت لتردين

translation: And were it not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been among those brought forth [to punishment].
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of God's favor and mercy upon the Prophet Muhammad. It suggests that without God's grace and guidance, the Prophet could have been among those who are punished or brought forth for reckoning on the Day of Judgment. The verse emphasizes the Prophet's humility and acknowledgment of God's blessings upon him, despite his high status as the final Messenger of God.
orig: ولولا نعمة ربي لكنت من المحضرين

translation: Are We then not to die?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' denial of the resurrection and life after death. It implies that death is inevitable for all human beings, so it is irrational to deny the possibility of being resurrected and held accountable for one's deeds in the Hereafter.
orig: أفما نحن بميتين

translation: It is only our first death, and we shall not be punished
interpretation: This verse suggests that death is merely a temporary transition to the next life, and that the believers will not face punishment or torment after death. It implies that death is not the end, but rather the beginning of a new phase of existence in the Hereafter.
orig: إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمعذبين

translation: Indeed, that is the great attainment
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing that the achievement being referred to, which is likely the attainment of Paradise or the pleasure of Allah, is the ultimate and greatest success one can aspire to. It highlights the incomparable value and significance of this spiritual victory over all worldly gains or pursuits.
orig: إن هذا لهو الفوز العظيم

translation: For the like of this let the workers work.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to strive and work hard for the rewards promised in the Hereafter, which are far greater and more valuable than the fleeting pleasures of this world. It motivates believers to remain focused on their ultimate goal of attaining Allah's pleasure and the eternal bliss of Paradise through their righteous deeds and actions.
orig: لمثل هذا فليعمل العاملون

translation: Is that a better hospitality or the tree of Zaqqum?
interpretation: This verse is questioning whether the punishment of Hell, represented by the tree of Zaqqum which is a bitter and toxic tree, is a better hospitality than the rewards of Paradise. It is a rhetorical question meant to emphasize that the disbelievers have chosen a miserable fate by rejecting faith and embracing disbelief.
orig: أذلك خير نزلا أم شجرة الزقوم

translation: Indeed, We have made it a trial for the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the thing mentioned, which is unclear from the context, has been made a trial or test for those who transgress and commit wrongdoing. It serves as a means of distinguishing between the obedient believers and the disobedient wrongdoers, revealing their true nature through their response to this particular situation or circumstance.
orig: إنا جعلناها فتنة للظالمين

translation: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the tree of Zaqqum, which is a cursed and bitter tree that grows in Hell. It serves as a punishment and torment for the disbelievers and wrongdoers in the Hereafter. The description of this tree highlights the severe consequences of rejecting faith and committing sins, as it is a manifestation of the excruciating torment that awaits those who stray from the path of righteousness.
orig: إنها شجرة تخرج في أصل الجحيم

translation: Its emerging fruit as if it were heads of the devils
interpretation: This verse is a metaphorical description of the repulsive nature of the tree mentioned, likening its fruits to the heads of devils or evil beings. It highlights the unpleasant and unappealing characteristics of this tree, which could symbolize the undesirable consequences of evil deeds or misguided beliefs.
orig: طلعها كأنه رءوس الشياطين

translation: For they will eat from it, and fill their bellies with it.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment of the disbelievers in Hell. They will be forced to consume the bitter fruits and thorny plants of the Hellfire, which will fill their stomachs without providing any nourishment or satisfaction. It serves as a vivid metaphor for the severe torment and unquenchable thirst they will endure as a result of their denial and disobedience.
orig: فإنهم لآكلون منها فمالئون منها البطون

translation: Then indeed, for them is a draught of boiling water.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the punishment that awaits the disbelievers in the Hereafter. The "draught of boiling water" is a metaphor for the intense suffering and torment they will endure in Hell. It highlights the severity of their punishment for rejecting faith and disobeying Allah's commands.
orig: ثم إن لهم عليها لشوبا من حميم

translation: Then indeed, their return will be towards Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and divine guidance that their ultimate destination will be Hellfire, where they will be held accountable for their disbelief and misdeeds. It serves as a stern reminder of the consequences of denying Allah's revelations and highlights the importance of embracing faith and righteousness to attain salvation in the Hereafter.
orig: ثم إن مرجعهم لإلى الجحيم

translation: Indeed, they found their forefathers misguided,
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers have blindly followed the misguided ways of their ancestors without questioning or seeking the truth. It implies that they are perpetuating the cycle of misguidance by adhering to the erroneous beliefs and practices of their forefathers, instead of using their intellect and reason to find the right path.
orig: إنهم ألفوا آباءهم ضالين

translation: So they set out, following in his footsteps in haste.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the people followed the path or example set by the one who went before them, with a sense of urgency or eagerness. It could be interpreted as a metaphor for blindly following someone's lead without questioning or considering the consequences.
orig: فهم على آثارهم يهرعون

translation: And indeed, most of the former peoples had gone astray before them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelief and misguidance of previous nations is not a new phenomenon. Many people before them had deviated from the straight path and strayed from the truth, despite being sent clear signs and messengers from Allah. It serves as a reminder that one should not be misled by the large number of misguided people, but rather seek guidance from the revealed scriptures and the teachings of the prophets.
orig: ولقد ضل قبلهم أكثر الأولين

translation: And We have certainly sent among them warners.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that Allah has sent numerous prophets and messengers to various nations throughout history to warn them against disbelief, polytheism, and disobedience to Allah's commandments. These warners aimed to guide people to the straight path and remind them of their accountability before Allah on the Day of Judgment."
orig: ولقد أرسلنا فيهم منذرين

translation: So observe how was the end of those who were warned.
interpretation: This verse invites the reader to reflect on the consequences faced by those who rejected the warnings and messages of the prophets in the past. It serves as a reminder that denying divine guidance and persisting in wrongdoing ultimately leads to a terrible fate, as witnessed throughout history. The verse encourages contemplation on the destructive outcomes experienced by previous nations who turned away from truth, in order to draw lessons and avoid repeating their mistakes.
orig: فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المنذرين

translation: Except the sincere servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are sincerely devoted to Allah and worship Him alone. They are the exception from those who will be in terror on the Day of Resurrection. The "sincere servants" are those who have purified their faith and actions solely for the sake of Allah, free from any taint of polytheism or showing off. They will be secure and have no fear on that awesome Day.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: And indeed, Noah called Us, and We are the best of responders.
interpretation: This verse suggests that when Prophet Noah called upon Allah for help, Allah responded to his call in the best manner. It highlights Allah's attribute of being the best Responder to those who call upon Him sincerely and seek His assistance.
orig: ولقد نادانا نوح فلنعم المجيبون

translation: And We delivered him and his family from the great distress
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's deliverance of Prophet Lut (Lot) and his believing family members from the great affliction and torment that befell the people of Sodom and Gomorrah, who were punished for their grave sins and transgressions. It highlights Allah's mercy upon those who have faith and obey Him, as He saves them from calamities and destructive punishments.
orig: ونجيناه وأهله من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We made his progeny the survivors.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah preserved the progeny of the person mentioned (likely Prophet Nuh or Prophet Ibrahim) and allowed them to continue after their forefathers. It implies that the descendants were granted survival and continuity as a blessing from Allah.
orig: وجعلنا ذريته هم الباقين

translation: And We left for him [a mention] among the later peoples
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah preserved the memory and legacy of Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, among the later generations after his time. His message and teachings were meant to transcend time and reach all peoples until the Day of Resurrection. The Qur'an and the authentic traditions about his life serve as a lasting reminder of his prophethood and the divine guidance he brought.
orig: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Noah among all beings
interpretation: This verse is a salutation and prayer for peace upon the Prophet Noah, who is revered in Islam as one of the greatest messengers of God. It recognizes Noah's importance and the trials he faced in preaching the message of monotheism and righteousness to his people. The phrase "among all beings" highlights Noah's universal significance as a prophet sent for the guidance of all humanity and creation.
orig: سلام على نوح في العالمين

translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Allah rewards those who do righteous deeds and strive to please Him. It serves as an encouragement for believers to persist in doing good, as their efforts will not go unrewarded. The reward mentioned is not specified, allowing for various interpretations, such as spiritual contentment, entry into Paradise, or other forms of divine recompense.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the person being referred to was one of Allah's sincere and devoted servants who had faith and believed in Him wholeheartedly.
orig: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: Then We drowned the others.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah drowning Pharaoh and his troops who pursued Moses and the Israelites after they had crossed the sea. It signifies Allah's punishment for those who persist in disbelief and transgression, as well as His power to save the believers and destroy the wrongdoers.
orig: ثم أغرقنا الآخرين

translation: And indeed, among the followers of Abraham's religion
interpretation: This verse indicates that among those who followed the religion and way of Prophet Abraham, there were some who were truly guided and steadfast on the right path. It suggests that the followers of Abraham's monotheistic faith were not all alike, and some were more sincere and devoted than others.
orig: وإن من شيعته لإبراهيم

translation: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) coming to Allah with a pure and sincere heart, free from any doubt or polytheism. It highlights the importance of having a sound and untainted heart when seeking the pleasure of Allah. The "sound heart" signifies a heart that is devoted solely to Allah, uncontaminated by any form of disbelief or wrongdoing.
orig: إذ جاء ربه بقلب سليم

translation: When he said to his father and his people, 'What do you worship?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) questioning the idolatrous beliefs and practices of his people. He asked them what they were worshipping, implying that their worship of idols was misguided and illogical. This marked the beginning of Ibrahim's call to his people to abandon idol worship and embrace the worship of the One True God.
orig: إذ قال لأبيه وقومه ماذا تعبدون

translation: Do you desire gods besides Allah?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheistic belief of associating other deities with Allah. It condemns the practice of worshipping false gods or idols besides the One True God, Allah. The rhetorical question highlights the irrationality and falsehood of polytheism, emphasizing the belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed) as the core principle of Islamic faith.
orig: أئفكا آلهة دون الله تريدون

translation: So what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?
interpretation: This verse questions the reader's perception and belief regarding Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds and creations. It prompts the reader to ponder and reflect upon the greatness, power, and authority of the One True God who created and maintains the entire universe.
orig: فما ظنكم برب العالمين

translation: So he cast a look at the stars
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being referred to looked up at the stars, perhaps in contemplation or seeking guidance. It could be interpreted as an invitation to reflect on the wonders of the universe and the signs of God's creation.
orig: فنظر نظرة في النجوم

translation: So he said, "Indeed, I am ill."
interpretation: The verse implies that the speaker is making an excuse or providing a justification for not fulfilling a certain obligation or responsibility. The illness mentioned could be physical or metaphorical, indicating a state of weakness or inability to perform a task or duty.
orig: فقال إني سقيم

translation: So turn away from him and withdraw.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers to disregard and avoid those who mock or reject the divine message. It suggests turning away from such individuals and not engaging with their disbelief or mockery. The interpretation is to maintain patience, avoid confrontation, and focus on one's own spiritual path rather than wasting efforts on those who are unwilling to listen or accept the truth.
orig: فتولوا عنه مدبرين

translation: Then he turned to their gods and said, 'Will you not eat?'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a sarcastic remark by Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) towards the idols worshipped by his people. By asking the idols if they would not eat the food offerings presented to them, he was highlighting their inability to benefit from worship and mocking the futility of idol worship. The verse aims to expose the absurdity of worshipping lifeless objects that lack any power or agency.
orig: فراغ إلى آلهتهم فقال ألا تأكلون

translation: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?
interpretation: This verse is questioning why the addressees are remaining silent and not speaking or responding. It could be interpreted as an exhortation to engage in dialogue, express one's views, or defend one's stance instead of remaining quiet and passive.
orig: ما لكم لا تنطقون

translation: So strike them upon the necks
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a command to fight and subdue the disbelievers and enemies of Islam through force and violence, striking them on their necks or vital areas to defeat them in battle. However, this interpretation is controversial and subject to debate among scholars, as the context and circumstances in which such a command may be applicable are not clearly specified.
orig: فراغ عليهم ضربا باليمين

translation: So they went towards him, hastening.
interpretation: This verse implies that the people approached the Prophet eagerly and quickly when he called them to Islam, without hesitation or delay. It suggests their willingness to receive the message and their interest in what the Prophet had to say.
orig: فأقبلوا إليه يزفون

translation: He said, 'Do you worship what you [yourselves] carve?'
interpretation: This verse questions the absurdity of worshipping idols made by one's own hands. It emphasizes the irrationality of idol worship, as the idols are mere inanimate objects carved or fashioned by human beings themselves, and therefore cannot possess any divine attributes worthy of worship.
orig: قال أتعبدون ما تنحتون

translation: And Allah created you and what you do.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete power and authority as the Creator of all human beings and their actions. It serves as a reminder that every human being and every deed they perform is known to Allah and originates from His creation. The implication is that people should be mindful of their actions and strive to do what is pleasing to their Creator.
orig: والله خلقكم وما تعملون

translation: They said, 'Construct a building for him and throw him into the blazing fire.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a plot by disbelievers to harm and kill a righteous person, likely a prophet. They planned to construct a building or furnace and throw him into the blazing fire, intending to burn him alive. This interpretation highlights the cruelty and oppression faced by messengers of God from those who rejected their message.
orig: قالوا ابنوا له بنيانا فألقوه في الجحيم

translation: But they intended a plot against him, so We made them the lowest.
interpretation: Allah is referring to the intentions of the people who plotted against Prophet Yusuf (Joseph) to harm him, but Allah protected him and humiliated them instead, making them "the lowest" in status and dignity.
orig: فأرادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الأسفلين

translation: And he said, 'Indeed, I am going to my Lord; He will guide me.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) when he left his people who worshipped idols. He was determined to seek the true guidance from Allah alone, expressing his firm belief that Allah would guide him to the straight path. Ibrahim's statement reflects his unwavering trust in Allah's guidance and his rejection of the misguidance of his people.
orig: وقال إني ذاهب إلى ربي سيهدين

translation: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication by Prophet Zakariya (peace be upon him) asking Allah to bless him with a pious child. It expresses his deep desire to have a righteous offspring who will continue the legacy of prophethood and spread the message of Allah. The interpretation highlights Zakariya's profound faith and trust in Allah's power to grant him a child despite his and his wife's old age.
orig: رب هب لي من الصالحين

translation: So We gave him the good tidings of a forbearing boy.
interpretation: This verse refers to the glad tidings given to Prophet Abraham about the birth of his son Ismail, who would grow up to be a patient and forbearing person. The interpretation highlights God's blessing upon Abraham by granting him a righteous son, despite his old age and his wife's barrenness. It also foreshadows Ismail's obedience and submission to God's command of sacrificing him, showcasing his patience and perseverance.
orig: فبشرناه بغلام حليم

translation: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, 'O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think.' He said, 'O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the patient.'
interpretation: This verse describes the great test that Allah put Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) through, commanding him in a dream to sacrifice his son Ismail. Ibrahim's willingness to obey Allah's command, and his son's submission and patience, exemplify their unwavering faith and obedience to Allah. The verse highlights the virtues of trust in Allah, sacrifice for His sake, and steadfastness in the face of immense trials.
orig: فلما بلغ معه السعي قال يا بني إني أرى في المنام أني أذبحك فانظر ماذا ترى قال يا أبت افعل ما تؤمر ستجدني إن شاء الله من الصابرين

translation: So when they had both submitted and he had laid him down upon his forehead,
interpretation: This verse refers to the event of Prophet Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son Ismail as a test from Allah. The phrase "when they had both submitted" indicates their complete submission and obedience to Allah's command. The phrase "he had laid him down upon his forehead" describes Ibrahim laying down his son Ismail, forehead on the ground, ready to sacrifice him. This verse highlights the supreme level of faith and obedience exhibited by both Ibrahim and Ismail towards Allah's decree.
orig: فلما أسلما وتله للجبين

translation: And We called out to him: 'O Abraham!'
interpretation: This verse refers to when Allah called out to the Prophet Abraham, addressing him directly and indicating the special status and honor bestowed upon him as one of Allah's chosen Messengers.
orig: وناديناه أن يا إبراهيم

translation: The vision was indeed true. That is how We reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse affirms the truthfulness of the vision or dream that was previously mentioned. It emphasizes that Allah fulfills His promises and rewards those who do righteous deeds in accordance with His commands. The interpretation highlights Allah's justice and generosity in rewarding the pious believers for their good actions and steadfastness in faith.
orig: قد صدقت الرؤيا إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, this is a clear trial
interpretation: This verse indicates that the situation or event being referred to is a manifest test or trial from Allah, intended to evaluate the faith, patience, and steadfastness of the believers. It suggests that the circumstances they are facing serve as a clear means of distinguishing between those who truly have faith and those who do not, by observing their responses and reactions to the difficult situation.
orig: إن هذا لهو البلاء المبين

translation: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident of Prophet Ibrahim (peace be upon him) being commanded by Allah to sacrifice his son Ismail. However, when Ibrahim was about to carry out this command, Allah substituted Ismail with a ram, which Ibrahim sacrificed instead. The "great sacrifice" mentioned in the verse refers to this ram, which Allah provided as a ransom for Ismail's life. This event demonstrated Ibrahim's unwavering faith and obedience to Allah, as well as Allah's mercy in sparing Ismail's life.
orig: وفديناه بذبح عظيم

translation: And We left for him [a mention] among the later peoples:
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has preserved the memory and legacy of the person being referred to (likely Prophet Muhammad) among the generations that came after him. It implies that his message and teachings will continue to be remembered and passed down, serving as a reminder and guidance for future generations.
orig: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Abraham.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the greeting of peace bestowed upon the Prophet Abraham (peace be upon him). It is an expression of reverence, honor, and respect for this great messenger of God, who is regarded as a role model of unwavering faith, obedience, and submission to the Divine will. The verse highlights Abraham's exalted status as one who was blessed with divine favor and guidance, and serves as a reminder to seek inspiration from his noble example.
orig: سلام على إبراهيم

translation: Thus do We reward the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah rewards those who do good deeds and righteous actions. The reward is not just in the Hereafter, but also in this world through His blessings and favors. It encourages believers to persist in doing good and being virtuous, as their efforts will not go unrewarded by the Most Merciful.
orig: كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the person being referred to was one of Allah's devoted and faithful servants who believed in Him wholeheartedly. It highlights the virtue of faith and obedience to Allah, and suggests that this person was blessed and honored for their sincere belief and righteous conduct.
orig: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: And We gave him the good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.
interpretation: This verse refers to the glad tidings given to Prophet Abraham of having a son named Isaac, who would also become a prophet from among the righteous people. It highlights Allah's blessings upon Abraham by granting him a pious son who would continue the legacy of prophethood and righteousness.
orig: وبشرناه بإسحاق نبيا من الصالحين

translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. Among their progeny are those who are righteous and those who clearly wrong themselves.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's blessings upon Prophet Abraham and his son Isaac, and their descendants. It indicates that among their progeny, there will be those who are righteous and obedient to Allah, as well as those who wrong themselves by disobeying Allah's commands. The phrase "clearly wrong themselves" suggests that their wrongdoing is evident and apparent. This verse highlights the diversity within the progeny of the Prophets, reminding us that even among the descendants of the righteous, there will be those who stray from the path.
orig: وباركنا عليه وعلى إسحاق ومن ذريتهما محسن وظالم لنفسه مبين

translation: And indeed, We conferred a favor upon Moses and Aaron
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah bestowed a great favor and blessing upon Moses and Aaron, the prophets sent to the Pharaoh and his people. It signifies that Allah honored and elevated them by choosing them as His messengers and granting them prophethood and revelation. This favor was not only for their personal benefit but also for the guidance of their people.
orig: ولقد مننا على موسى وهارون

translation: And We delivered him and his people from the great distress
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's mercy and deliverance of a Prophet and his followers from a severe trial or affliction. It highlights Allah's power to remove hardships and difficulties from those who place their trust in Him and remain steadfast in their faith.
orig: ونجيناهما وقومهما من الكرب العظيم

translation: And We helped them, so they became the victors.
interpretation: Allah aided the believers against their enemies, granting them victory and triumph. This verse affirms Allah's promise to support those who believe in Him and follow His guidance, as He is the source of all strength and victory.
orig: ونصرناهم فكانوا هم الغالبين

translation: And We gave them the enlightening Book.
interpretation: This verse refers to the revelation of divine scripture, specifically the Torah and the Gospel, to the prophets Moses and Jesus respectively. It highlights that God blessed them with a clear and enlightening book containing guidance, laws, and teachings for their nations. The "enlightening Book" served as a source of light, wisdom, and direction from the Divine, guiding people towards righteousness and the straight path.
orig: وآتيناهما الكتاب المستبين

translation: And We guided them to the straight path.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah guided the believers to the straight path, which is the path of truth, righteousness, and salvation. The "straight path" is a metaphor for the correct way of life prescribed by Allah, leading to His pleasure and reward in the Hereafter. It signifies adhering to the teachings of Islam and avoiding deviation or misguidance.
orig: وهديناهما الصراط المستقيم

translation: And We left for them among the later generations
interpretation: This verse refers to the legacy and lasting impact that the stories of the previous nations mentioned in the Qur'an have had on future generations. The phrase "We left for them" suggests that Allah has preserved these accounts as a reminder and lesson for those who came after, allowing their stories to endure and serve as a source of guidance and reflection.
orig: وتركنا عليهما في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron.
interpretation: This verse sends greetings of peace upon the two great prophets, Moses and Aaron. It highlights their honored status as messengers of God who were entrusted with the divine revelation and the mission of guiding their people towards the truth. The greeting of peace signifies respect, reverence, and a prayer for their souls to be in a state of tranquility and blessedness.
orig: سلام على موسى وهارون

translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse highlights that Allah rewards those who do good deeds and have faith. It emphasizes that the righteous will be compensated and rewarded for their virtuous actions and sincere belief. The reward from Allah is a manifestation of His justice and mercy towards the believers who strive to please Him.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the individuals mentioned were among Allah's devoted and faithful worshippers who believed in Him and His teachings.
orig: إنهما من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: And indeed, Elias was one of the messengers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the prophet Elias (or Elijah) was one of the messengers sent by God to guide humanity. It highlights the status of Elias as a chosen messenger who received divine revelation and was entrusted with conveying God's message to his people. The verse serves as a reminder of the continuity of prophethood and the universality of God's guidance through His messengers across different nations and eras.
orig: وإن إلياس لمن المرسلين

translation: When he said to his people, 'Will you not fear Allah?'
interpretation: This verse refers to a prophet or messenger who admonished his people to have fear and consciousness of Allah, and to avoid disbelief and disobedience. The interpretation is that the prophet is calling his people to faith and righteousness, warning them against persisting in their wrongful ways that could incur Allah's punishment.
orig: إذ قال لقومه ألا تتقون

translation: Do you call upon Ba'l and forsake the best of creators?
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the idolatrous practice of worshipping false deities like Ba'l, and abandoning the worship of Allah, who is the best and true Creator. It highlights the folly of turning away from the One who created everything in the most perfect manner, in favor of worshipping powerless idols or imaginary gods.
orig: أتدعون بعلا وتذرون أحسن الخالقين

translation: Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of God (Allah) and His Lordship over all creation. It emphasizes that Allah is the sole Lord, Creator, and Sustainer of not only the present generation but also of all their ancestors and predecessors. This establishes the continuity of faith in the One True God throughout human history and negates the worship of any other deities or idols. It invites people to recognize Allah as their true Lord and submit to Him alone.
orig: الله ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: But they denied him, so they will surely be brought [for punishment]
interpretation: This verse warns those who rejected the message of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It indicates that they will face the consequences of their denial and disbelief, and will be brought before Allah for judgment and punishment on the Day of Resurrection. The verse emphasizes the certainty of this outcome using the Arabic phrase "fa-innahum la-muhdaroon," which means "so they will surely be brought."
orig: فكذبوه فإنهم لمحضرون

translation: Except the sincere servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who are completely devoted to Allah, worshipping Him alone with sincere faith and obedience. They are exempted from the punishment and trials mentioned in the preceding verses, for their sincerity and righteousness have made them beloved to Allah.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: And We left for him [a mention] among the later peoples
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has preserved the memory and mention of Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, among the later generations of people until the Day of Resurrection. His name and teachings have been passed down and will continue to be remembered and revered by believers throughout time.
orig: وتركنا عليه في الآخرين

translation: Peace be upon the family of Yaseen.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and his family, who are known as "Aal Yaseen" or the "Family of Yaseen." It is a way of sending blessings and salutations upon them, showing respect and honor. The interpretation highlights the high status and reverence given to the Prophet Muhammad and his household in Islam.
orig: سلام على إل ياسين

translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He rewards those who do righteous deeds and good works in this way, by granting them blessings, favors, and a good life in this world, as well as an immense reward in the Hereafter.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being referred to was a sincere believer and a devoted servant of God. It affirms that he was among those who had true faith and lived according to the teachings of God. The verse implies that such sincere believers and servants of God are honored and recognized by Him.
orig: إنه من عبادنا المؤمنين

translation: And verily, Lut was one of the Messengers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Prophet Lut (Lot), peace be upon him, was one of the noble Messengers sent by Allah to guide his people. He called them to worship Allah alone and abandon their sinful practices, particularly the abominable act of homosexuality which was widespread among them. However, they rejected his message and persisted in their evil ways, leading to their ultimate destruction.
orig: وإن لوطا لمن المرسلين

translation: When We saved him and his family all together
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Noah and how Allah saved him and his family from the great flood that engulfed the disbelievers. It symbolizes Allah's mercy and protection for those who have faith in Him and follow His commandments, even in the face of immense trials and difficulties.
orig: إذ نجيناه وأهله أجمعين

translation: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.
interpretation: This verse is referring to an old woman who was left behind when the rest of the people fled. The interpretation is that even though everyone else had abandoned their homes and fled, there was one elderly woman who stayed behind, likely due to her inability to travel or lack of support. It serves as a reminder that even in times of crisis, there may be vulnerable individuals who are unable to flee and require assistance and compassion.
orig: إلا عجوزا في الغابرين

translation: Then We destroyed the others.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's destruction of the disbelieving nations that rejected the messengers sent to them. It serves as a warning that those who persist in disbelief and transgression will face a similar fate. The "others" mentioned here could refer to various nations such as the people of 'Aad, Thamud, and the nation of Prophet Lut, peace be upon them all. Allah's punishment is a manifestation of His justice and a reminder of the consequences of rejecting His signs and guidance.
orig: ثم دمرنا الآخرين

translation: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the people passing by the remains or dwellings of those who were destroyed for their disbelief and rejection of Allah's messengers. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of arrogance and disobedience, and encourages people to reflect on the transient nature of worldly life and the importance of faith and righteousness.
orig: وإنكم لتمرون عليهم مصبحين

translation: And by the night, will you not then understand?
interpretation: This verse invites people to reflect on the night and its phenomena, such as the darkness, stillness, and tranquility, which should lead them to recognize the power and wisdom of God in the alternation of day and night. It urges human beings to use their intellect and contemplate the signs of God's creation in order to attain a deeper understanding of the truth.
orig: وبالليل أفلا تعقلون

translation: And indeed, Jonah was one of the messengers.
interpretation: This verse confirms that Prophet Jonah (peace be upon him) was one of the messengers sent by Allah to guide people. It emphasizes the truthfulness of his prophethood and the divine origin of his message. The story of Jonah serves as a reminder of Allah's mercy, forgiveness, and ability to rescue those who turn to Him in repentance.
orig: وإن يونس لمن المرسلين

translation: When he ran away to the laden ship,
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Yunus (Jonah) when he fled from his people without Allah's permission, boarding a laden ship. It symbolizes the human tendency to flee from responsibilities or challenges, even for a Prophet. However, Allah teaches that one cannot run away from His decree.
orig: إذ أبق إلى الفلك المشحون

translation: But he was arrogant and became one of the deniers.
interpretation: This verse refers to someone who was arrogant and rejected the truth due to their arrogance and pride. It serves as a warning against arrogance, which can lead one to deny the signs of God and the truth, even when it is clear and evident.
orig: فساهم فكان من المدحضين

translation: Then the whale swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Jonah (Yunus), who was swallowed by a whale after disobeying Allah's command. It serves as a reminder that no one is free from making mistakes, and even prophets faced trials and tribulations. However, Allah forgave Jonah after he repented sincerely, demonstrating Allah's mercy towards those who turn back to Him.
orig: فالتقمه الحوت وهو مليم

translation: Had he not been of those who exalt Allah,
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being referred to was among those who constantly praise and glorify Allah. This saved them from a negative consequence that is implied but not explicitly stated in the verse.
orig: فلولا أنه كان من المسبحين

translation: So that it will remain inside his abdomen until the Day they are resurrected.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment of those who swallow unlawful wealth or gains. Their ill-gotten wealth will remain stuck in their stomachs, causing them immense pain and torment until the Day of Resurrection when they will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: للبث في بطنه إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: Then We cast him forth on the naked shore while he was sick.
interpretation: This verse implies that the person being referred to was abandoned in a barren and desolate place when he was ill or weak, suggesting a state of vulnerability and hardship. The interpretation could be that God tests His servants through difficult circumstances, but those who persevere will ultimately be rewarded or saved.
orig: فنبذناه بالعراء وهو سقيم

translation: And We caused to grow over him a plant of gourd (or pumpkin)
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's mercy and care for His prophet Jonah (Yunus) when he was in distress. After being swallowed by the whale, Allah caused a plant to grow over Jonah, providing him with shade and comfort while he was cast onto the shore. This symbolizes how Allah provides relief and sustenance to those who turn to Him, even in the most difficult circumstances.
orig: وأنبتنا عليه شجرة من يقطين

translation: And We sent him to a hundred thousand or more
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Muhammad being sent as a messenger to a large number of people, described as "a hundred thousand or more." The interpretation is that the message of Islam was not limited to a small group, but rather was intended for a vast multitude of people. This highlights the universal nature of the Prophet's message and the far-reaching impact of his mission.
orig: وأرسلناه إلى مائة ألف أو يزيدون

translation: So they believed, and We granted them enjoyment for a while.
interpretation: "This verse suggests that when a people or nation believes in God and His message, He grants them a period of respite and enjoyment in this world, allowing them to experience the blessings and bounties of life. However, this worldly enjoyment is temporary and finite, as the ultimate reward or punishment lies in the Hereafter based on one's faith and deeds."
orig: فآمنوا فمتعناهم إلى حين

translation: Then ask them: Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief that God has daughters (referring to their belief in goddesses as His partners), while they prefer sons for themselves. It criticizes their illogical and contradictory beliefs, as they attribute to God what they themselves dislike and consider inferior.
orig: فاستفتهم ألربك البنات ولهم البنون

translation: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?
interpretation: This verse questions and refutes the pagan Arabs' belief that the angels were female beings. It emphasizes that Allah, the Creator, did not create the angels as females, as they falsely claimed. The angels witnessed the creation of Allah, and they know that they were not created as females. This verse rejects the notion of attributing gender or any human characteristics to the angels, who are purely spiritual beings created by Allah to serve Him.
orig: أم خلقنا الملائكة إناثا وهم شاهدون

translation: Indeed, they are from their falsehood, saying:
interpretation: This verse highlights the falsehood and lies uttered by the disbelievers, indicating that their statements and claims against the truth are nothing but fabrications stemming from their own delusions and misconceptions.
orig: ألا إنهم من إفكهم ليقولون

translation: Allah has not begotten a son, and they are indeed liars.
interpretation: This verse categorically rejects the notion that Allah has a son or offspring. It refutes the beliefs of those who ascribe children to Allah, declaring them as liars. The Islamic faith emphasizes the Oneness and Uniqueness of Allah, Who is far removed from human characteristics such as procreation. This verse affirms the absolute transcendence of Allah and negates any anthropomorphic attributes being associated with Him.
orig: ولد الله وإنهم لكاذبون

translation: He chooses daughters over sons
interpretation: This verse could be interpreted as a criticism of the cultural bias in some societies that favors sons over daughters. It suggests that God does not share this bias and values both genders equally. The verse may be highlighting the unjust treatment of daughters in certain communities and advocating for gender equality and justice.
orig: أصطفى البنات على البنين

translation: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?
interpretation: This verse questions the mindset and reasoning of those who make judgments or decisions without proper understanding or wisdom. It criticizes the lack of sound judgment and encourages reflecting deeply before forming opinions or passing verdicts.
orig: ما لكم كيف تحكمون

translation: Will you not then be reminded?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to the disbelievers, urging them to reflect and be mindful of the signs of Allah. It serves as a reminder for them to ponder over the evidences and proofs presented to them, and to reconsider their denial of the truth.
orig: أفلا تذكرون

translation: Or do you have a clear authority?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers who deny the revelation and prophethood of Muhammad (peace be upon him). It asks them if they have a clear proof, evidence or authority that allows them to reject the truth that has been conveyed to them. The implication is that they do not have any valid justification for their denial and rejection of the divine message.
orig: أم لكم سلطان مبين

translation: Then bring your scripture, if you are truthful.
interpretation: This verse challenges those who reject the divine message to produce a scripture similar to the Qur'an if they claim it is not from God. It implies that the inimitable eloquence and profound wisdom of the Qur'an is evidence of its divine origin, and that the disbelievers cannot produce anything comparable despite their objections.
orig: فأتوا بكتابكم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And they claimed a blood relationship between Him and the jinn, although the jinn themselves know well that they will be brought before Him.
interpretation: This verse refutes the pagan Arabs' claim that there was a kinship between Allah and the jinn. It emphasizes that the jinn themselves know that they will be held accountable before Allah on the Day of Judgment, thus negating any notion of them being divine or having a special relationship with the Divine. The verse affirms Allah's Oneness and repudiates associating partners with Him.
orig: وجعلوا بينه وبين الجنة نسبا ولقد علمت الجنة إنهم لمحضرون

translation: Glory be to Allah from what they attribute to Him
interpretation: This verse affirms the transcendence and perfection of Allah, declaring Him to be free and far removed from any imperfections or deficiencies that the polytheists and disbelievers associate with Him. It rejects all forms of anthropomorphism and affirms that Allah is beyond any resemblance to His creation.
orig: سبحان الله عما يصفون

translation: Except the sincere servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse is referring to those who are truly devoted to Allah, worshipping Him alone with sincere faith and obedience. They are the exception from those who will be in terror on the Day of Resurrection, as they have purified their souls through righteous deeds and sincerity towards their Lord. Their sincere worship and submission to Allah will save them from the punishment and grant them peace and security.
orig: إلا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: Indeed, you and what you worship
interpretation: This verse is addressing the disbelievers who worship idols and false deities besides Allah. It emphasizes that they, along with the very objects or beings they worship, are all creations of Allah and are powerless before Him. The verse implies that their worship of these false gods is futile and misguided, as none of these entities possess any power or control over their own existence or the existence of others.
orig: فإنكم وما تعبدون

translation: You are not with a madness.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was not afflicted with madness or insanity, as alleged by his opponents. It confirms that he was of sound mind and received the divine revelation from Allah rationally and consciously.
orig: ما أنتم عليه بفاتنين

translation: Except the one who will burn in the great Fire.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who will be destined for Hell and its punishment. The "one who will burn in the great Fire" is a reference to the disbelievers and sinners who reject faith and do evil deeds. Their ultimate fate is to be cast into the blazing Hellfire as a consequence of their rejection of God's guidance and their wicked actions.
orig: إلا من هو صال الجحيم

translation: And there is none of us except that he has a known station.
interpretation: This verse indicates that every person has a specific role, rank, or position assigned to them by Allah. It suggests that everyone has a purpose and a designated place in the divine scheme of things. The interpretation emphasizes the idea of predestination and that Allah has assigned each individual a particular station or status in life according to His wisdom and plan.
orig: وما منا إلا له مقام معلوم

translation: And indeed, it is We who are the arrangers [of the ranks]
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah is the One who arranges and organizes all affairs in the universe with perfect wisdom and order. It emphasizes Allah's complete authority, power, and control over all creation.
orig: وإنا لنحن الصافون

translation: And indeed, it is We who are the Glorifiers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that it is Allah Himself who glorifies and sanctifies His own majesty and perfection. It affirms Allah's transcendence and absolute purity, free from any defects or imperfections. The interpretation highlights that Allah does not need His creation to glorify Him, as He is self-sufficient and perfect in Himself.
orig: وإنا لنحن المسبحون

translation: And indeed, they used to say,
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers would make certain claims or statements, which are not explicitly mentioned here. It implies that their statements or claims were false or misguided, as the Qur'an often refutes the arguments or beliefs of those who rejected the message of Islam.
orig: وإن كانوا ليقولون

translation: If We had a reminder from the former peoples,
interpretation: This verse suggests that if the disbelievers had access to the scriptures or revelations sent to previous nations, they might have believed and avoided punishment. It implies that Allah has sent messengers and revelations to various peoples throughout history, but those who reject the message despite witnessing clear signs and evidence will face consequences.
orig: لو أن عندنا ذكرا من الأولين

translation: But we are the sincere servants of Allah.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sincere devotion and servitude that the believers have towards Allah. It highlights their commitment to worshipping Allah alone, without any partners or associates, and their dedication to following His commands with sincerity and purity of intention.
orig: لكنا عباد الله المخلصين

translation: But they disbelieved in it, so they will come to know.
