interpretation: This verse warns those who reject or disbelieve in the message of the Qur'an. It implies that their disbelief will have consequences, and they will ultimately face the reality of what they have rejected, whether in this life or the Hereafter. The phrase "so they will come to know" suggests that their denial will be exposed, and they will realize the truth they had turned away from, perhaps through divine punishment or the manifestation of the realities they had denied.
orig: فكفروا به فسوف يعلمون

translation: And verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our slaves, - the Messengers,
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has decreed and promised from the very beginning that He will grant victory and support to His Messengers and the believers who follow them against the disbelievers and deniers. This divine promise is a source of reassurance and encouragement for the believers in their struggle against falsehood and oppression.
orig: ولقد سبقت كلمتنا لعبادنا المرسلين

translation: Indeed, they are the ones who will be victorious
interpretation: This verse indicates that the believers who remain steadfast in their faith and righteous conduct will ultimately be granted victory and success by Allah. It serves as a reassurance and encouragement for the faithful, emphasizing that despite any challenges or adversities they may face, their unwavering belief and obedience to Allah will lead them to triumph in the end. The interpretation highlights the divine promise of support and aid for those who uphold their covenant with Allah.
orig: إنهم لهم المنصورون

translation: And indeed, Our soldiers - they will be the prevailing ones.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah's soldiers, referring to the believers who strive in His cause, will ultimately prevail and be victorious against their enemies. It conveys a promise of divine support and triumph for those who remain steadfast in their faith and struggle against oppression and injustice.
orig: وإن جندنا لهم الغالبون

translation: So turn away from them for a time
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to disregard the disbelievers and their rejection of his message for a period of time. It suggests patience and temporary withdrawal from confrontation, as the truth will eventually prevail and the disbelievers will face the consequences of their denial.
orig: فتول عنهم حتى حين

translation: And I will give them respite, for My plan is firm.
interpretation: This verse warns those who disbelieve and reject the truth that Allah is giving them time and opportunity to reflect and repent, but His plan and decree is firm and unwavering. They will face the consequences of their disbelief if they persist in their ways. It implies that Allah is patient and merciful, giving people chances to reform themselves, but ultimately justice will prevail.
orig: وأبصرهم فسوف يبصرون

translation: Do they then seek to hasten on Our punishment?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' impatience and demand for Allah's punishment to be hastened upon them. It implies that their rejection of faith and persistence in disbelief stems from their arrogance and lack of understanding of Allah's wisdom and timing. The verse serves as a warning against such haste and a reminder of the inevitability of divine justice.
orig: أفبعذابنا يستعجلون

translation: So when it descends in their courtyard, then evil will be the morning for those who were warned.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that will befall the disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. The phrase "when it descends in their courtyard" refers to the punishment or torment that will engulf them. The use of "courtyard" metaphorically represents their realm or domain. The "evil morning" signifies the dreadful state they will find themselves in after being warned by the prophets and messengers, but failing to heed the warnings. It emphasizes the regret and anguish they will experience when facing the consequences of their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: فإذا نزل بساحتهم فساء صباح المنذرين

translation: But turn away from them for a while,
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to turn away from the disbelievers and leave them for a period of time, without engaging with them or their rejection of the message. It suggests being patient and not insisting on their acceptance immediately, as their guidance ultimately lies with Allah.
orig: وتول عنهم حتى حين

translation: And watch, for they will soon watch
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that they will soon witness the consequences of their rejection of faith and the truth. It implies that they will eventually see the reality of what they denied, either in this life or in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder that their disbelief and arrogance will not last forever, and that they will ultimately face the consequences of their actions.
orig: وأبصر فسوف يبصرون

translation: Glorified is your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, above what they attribute [to Him].
interpretation: This verse declares the transcendence and absolute perfection of Allah, exalted above any defects or shortcomings that the polytheists attribute to Him by associating partners with Him or describing Him with qualities unbefitting His Majesty.
orig: سبحان ربك رب العزة عما يصفون

translation: And peace be upon the Messengers.
interpretation: This verse sends blessings and peace upon all the Prophets and Messengers of God, who were chosen to convey His message to humanity. It expresses reverence and respect for their noble mission and sacrifices in guiding people towards the truth and righteousness.
orig: وسلام على المرسلين

translation: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms the praise and gratitude due to Allah, who is the Cherisher, Sustainer and Nourisher of all the worlds and creation. It emphasizes the universal Lordship of Allah over all that exists and reminds us to be thankful to Him for His countless blessings.
orig: والحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Saad. By the Qur'an, full of reminding...
interpretation: "This chapter begins with the Arabic letter 'Saad', which is one of the abbreviated letters that only Allah knows their precise meaning. The verse affirms that the Qur'an is a reminder and a source of guidance, containing wisdom and teachings that remind people of Allah's signs, the purpose of life, and the consequences of their deeds."
orig: ص والقرآن ذي الذكر

translation: Rather, those who disbelieved are in arrogance and dissension.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers persist in their arrogance and opposition to the truth, causing division and conflict among themselves and with the believers.
orig: بل الذين كفروا في عزة وشقاق

translation: How many generations before them have We destroyed? They cried out when there was no longer any escape.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's power and justice. It refers to the nations and civilizations that were destroyed for their disobedience and rejection of the truth, despite being warned by the messengers sent to them. When the punishment came, they cried out for help, but it was too late, as there was no escape from Allah's decree. This serves as a lesson for us to heed the guidance and avoid the path of those who were destroyed before us.
orig: كم أهلكنا من قبلهم من قرن فنادوا ولات حين مناص

translation: And they wonder that a warner from among themselves has come to them, and the disbelievers say, 'This is a lying magician.'
interpretation: The disbelievers expressed amazement that a warner, who is one of them (i.e., a human like themselves), has come to guide them. Out of arrogance and stubbornness, they accused him of being a liar and a magician, denying the truth he brought.
orig: وعجبوا أن جاءهم منذر منهم وقال الكافرون هذا ساحر كذاب

translation: Shall I take besides Him gods? If the Most Merciful should intend me harm, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of God and the futility of worshipping any other deities besides Him. It highlights that if God intends harm for someone, no other supposed gods or intercessors can benefit or save that person. The verse rejects the notion of polytheism and affirms that God alone is worthy of worship and capable of providing protection and salvation.
orig: أجعل الآلهة إلها واحدا إن هذا لشيء عجاب

translation: And the eminent among them went forth, (saying): 'Go on, and remain patient over your gods. Indeed, this is something intended.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the leaders and influential people of the disbelieving community who encouraged their people to remain steadfast in their polytheistic beliefs and practices. They dismissed the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as something that was deliberately designed to undermine their way of life and religious traditions. Their interpretation reflects their arrogance and unwillingness to consider the truth of Islam.
orig: وانطلق الملأ منهم أن امشوا واصبروا على آلهتكم إن هذا لشيء يراد

translation: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is nothing but a fabrication.
interpretation: This verse is rejecting the idea of resurrection and life after death, which was being presented by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). The disbelievers are claiming that this concept of an afterlife is something new and unheard of in their religion, and they are dismissing it as a mere "fabrication" or invention.
orig: ما سمعنا بهذا في الملة الآخرة إن هذا إلا اختلاق

translation: Is it that the Reminder is sent down upon him among us? Nay, but they are in doubt concerning My Reminder. Nay, but they have not yet tasted My punishment.
interpretation: The disbelievers express their skepticism and doubt about the Prophet Muhammad being chosen to receive divine revelation, the Qur'an. They question why he, among all people, has been singled out for this honor. However, their doubt stems from their arrogance and unwillingness to accept the truth. Allah warns them that their rejection of His message will lead them to taste His severe punishment.
orig: أأنزل عليه الذكر من بيننا بل هم في شك من ذكري بل لما يذوقوا عذاب

translation: Or do they have the treasures of the Mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Ever-Bestowing?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' arrogance and denial of the truth. It implies that they have no control over the treasures of Allah's mercy and bounties, which He bestows upon whomever He wills. Only Allah, who is Exalted in Might and the Ever-Bestowing, has the authority to grant His mercy and favors. The verse highlights the disbelievers' lack of understanding and their misguided belief that they can dictate the terms of Allah's mercy and blessings.
orig: أم عندهم خزائن رحمة ربك العزيز الوهاب

translation: Or do they have the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend by any means.
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' claim of authority or control over the heavens, the earth, and all that is between them. It challenges them to try and ascend through any means if they truly possess such dominion, implying that they have no power or control whatsoever over the creation, which belongs solely to Allah.
orig: أم لهم ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما فليرتقوا في الأسباب

translation: How many a vanquished host is there.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the numerous armies and forces that have been defeated and vanquished throughout history, despite their apparent strength and power. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of worldly might and the ultimate victory of truth and righteousness over falsehood and oppression. The interpretation highlights that no matter how formidable an enemy may seem, they are bound to face defeat if they stand against the cause of justice and the will of Allah.
orig: جند ما هنالك مهزوم من الأحزاب

translation: Before them the people of Noah and 'Aad and Pharaoh, the lord of stakes, denied (their messengers).
interpretation: This verse reminds us that many nations before the disbelievers of Makkah had rejected the message of their prophets and messengers. It mentions specifically the people of Noah, the tribe of 'Aad, and Pharaoh, who was known for torturing people by tying them to stakes. The verse serves as a warning that denying the truth and persecuting the believers leads to destruction, just as those previous nations were destroyed for their arrogance and disbelief.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وفرعون ذو الأوتاد

translation: And [We destroyed] Thamud and the people of Lot and the inhabitants of the thicket - those are the [different] companies.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the destruction of various nations who defied Allah's messengers and rejected the message of monotheism. It mentions the people of Thamud, the people of Lot (who engaged in homosexuality), and the "inhabitants of the thicket" (a group whose identity is not explicitly stated). Allah destroyed these nations as a consequence of their disbelief and disobedience, serving as a warning for those who stray from the straight path.
orig: وثمود وقوم لوط وأصحاب الأيكة أولئك الأحزاب

translation: Verily, all but the messengers lied, so the punishment was justified.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the truthfulness of the messengers of God and the consequences of rejecting them. It affirms that all people, except the messengers who were sent by God, have lied or gone astray from the truth. Therefore, the punishment that befell those who denied the messengers and their message was justified and deserved, as they rejected the truth brought by the divinely appointed messengers.
orig: إن كل إلا كذب الرسل فحق عقاب

translation: And they await not but one blast which will not have any delay from it.
interpretation: "This verse is referring to the Day of Resurrection, when all of humanity will be resurrected by a single blast of the trumpet blown by the angel Israfil. The verse emphasizes that this event will occur suddenly and without any delay or warning. It serves as a reminder of the certainty and inevitability of the Day of Judgment, encouraging believers to be prepared and live righteously."
orig: وما ينظر هؤلاء إلا صيحة واحدة ما لها من فواق

translation: And they say, 'Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account.'
interpretation: The disbelievers mockingly ask Allah to hasten their punishment before the Day of Judgment, as they do not believe in the Hereafter. This verse shows their arrogance and lack of faith in Allah's warnings.
orig: وقالوا ربنا عجل لنا قطنا قبل يوم الحساب

translation: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse encourages patience in the face of adversity and reminds us of the example of Prophet David, who was steadfast in his devotion to Allah despite facing many challenges. It teaches us to remain firm in our faith and turn to Allah in repentance and submission, just as David did.
orig: اصبر على ما يقولون واذكر عبدنا داوود ذا الأيد إنه أواب

translation: Verily, We subjected the mountains to glorify with him in the evening and at sunrise
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's power over nature and His ability to make even inanimate objects, like mountains, praise and glorify Him. It suggests that the Prophet David was given control over the mountains, which would join him in praising Allah at specific times of the day, evening and morning. This emphasizes the idea that all of creation worships and submits to Allah.
orig: إنا سخرنا الجبال معه يسبحن بالعشي والإشراق

translation: And the birds, having folded wings, each is obedient to Him.
interpretation: This verse speaks about the obedience of all creatures, including birds, to Allah's commands and laws. Birds, despite their ability to fly freely, are still subservient to Allah and follow the natural order He has established for them. The phrase "having folded wings" suggests their state of rest and submission, while "each is obedient to Him" affirms that every single bird follows Allah's will without exception. This emphasizes the complete sovereignty of Allah over all creation.
orig: والطير محشورة كل له أواب

translation: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and decisive speech.
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings Allah bestowed upon Prophet Dawud (David). He was granted a strong kingdom, wisdom to judge between people, and the ability to speak eloquently and decisively, conveying the truth clearly without ambiguity.
orig: وشددنا ملكه وآتيناه الحكمة وفصل الخطاب

translation: And has there reached you the story of the disputants when they climbed over the wall of the private chamber?
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where some people climbed over the wall of Prophet Muhammad's private chamber without permission, violating his privacy. It serves as a lesson on respecting the boundaries and sanctity of others' personal spaces and highlights the importance of seeking proper permission before entering someone's private quarters.
orig: وهل أتاك نبأ الخصم إذ تسوروا المحراب

translation: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them, they said, 'Fear not. We are two disputants, one of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not be unjust and guide us to the straight path.'
interpretation: This verse describes an incident when two people came to Prophet David seeking his judgment in their dispute. Despite being alarmed initially, they assured him that they were merely disputants seeking a fair ruling from him. They asked him to judge between them with truth and justice, without any bias or transgression, and to guide them to the straight path of righteousness.
orig: إذ دخلوا على داوود ففزع منهم قالوا لا تخف خصمان بغى بعضنا على بعض فاحكم بيننا بالحق ولا تشطط واهدنا إلى سواء الصراط

translation: Indeed this brother of mine has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Hand it over to me, and he overpowered me in speech.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the injustice and oppression that can occur when someone with power and wealth demands more from someone weaker. The brother with many sheep insists on taking the one sheep of his weaker brother, overpowering him through his forceful speech and position of strength. It serves as a metaphor for the exploitation of the weak by the strong and powerful in society.
orig: إن هذا أخي له تسع وتسعون نعجة ولي نعجة واحدة فقال أكفلنيها وعزني في الخطاب

translation: He said, 'He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [to be added] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they?' And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance.
interpretation: This verse highlights the importance of justice and avoiding oppression, even among close associates. It teaches that true believers are those who not only have faith, but also perform righteous deeds. The story of Prophet David serves as a reminder that even great prophets can face trials, but repentance and turning to Allah is the key to overcoming them.
orig: قال لقد ظلمك بسؤال نعجتك إلى نعاجه وإن كثيرا من الخلطاء ليبغي بعضهم على بعض إلا الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وقليل ما هم وظن داوود أنما فتناه فاستغفر ربه وخر راكعا وأناب

translation: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
interpretation: Allah forgave Prophet Adam for his mistake of eating from the forbidden tree, because he repented sincerely. The verse indicates that Adam has a high rank and nearness to Allah, and he will return to a good place in the Hereafter due to his obedience after repentance.
orig: فغفرنا له ذلك وإن له عندنا لزلفى وحسن مآب

translation: O David! We have appointed you a vicegerent on earth, so judge between people with truth, and do not follow desire, for it will lead you astray from Allah's way. Surely those who go astray from Allah's way will have a severe punishment because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.
interpretation: This verse is a reminder to those in positions of authority to judge fairly and impartially, without being influenced by personal desires or biases. It emphasizes the importance of upholding justice and following the path of truth as ordained by Allah. Those who stray from this path and allow their desires to lead them astray will face severe consequences on the Day of Judgment, for they have forgotten the ultimate accountability before Allah.
orig: يا داوود إنا جعلناك خليفة في الأرض فاحكم بين الناس بالحق ولا تتبع الهوى فيضلك عن سبيل الله إن الذين يضلون عن سبيل الله لهم عذاب شديد بما نسوا يوم الحساب

translation: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between them in vain. That is the assumption of those who disbelieved, so woe to those who disbelieved from the Fire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the creation of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between is not without purpose or in vain. It refutes the assumption of the disbelievers who think that there is no wisdom or purpose behind creation. The verse warns those who disbelieve and reject the signs of Allah that they will face a terrible punishment in the Hellfire.
orig: وما خلقنا السماء والأرض وما بينهما باطلا ذلك ظن الذين كفروا فويل للذين كفروا من النار

translation: Or shall We treat those who believed and did righteous deeds like those who spread corruption on earth? Or shall We treat the pious like the wicked?
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question, emphasizing that Allah will never treat the believers who do good deeds the same as those who spread corruption and wickedness on earth. It highlights the principle of justice in Allah's judgment, where the righteous will be distinguished from the wicked and each will be treated according to their deeds.
orig: أم نجعل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات كالمفسدين في الأرض أم نجعل المتقين كالفجار

translation: This is a Book which We have revealed unto you, full of blessings, that they may ponder over its verses, and that men of understanding may remember.
interpretation: The Qur'an is a blessed Book revealed to the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to guide people to contemplate its verses and for those with sound intellect to take heed and be reminded of Allah's signs and wisdom.
orig: كتاب أنزلناه إليك مبارك ليدبروا آياته وليتذكر أولو الألباب

translation: And We bestowed upon David, Solomon. How excellent a servant! Verily, he was ever oft-returning in repentance (to Us)!
interpretation: This verse praises Prophet Solomon as an excellent servant of God who was constantly turning to Him in repentance. It highlights Solomon's piety and devotion to Allah, despite being a powerful king. The verse implies that true success lies in being a humble and obedient servant of God, constantly seeking His forgiveness and guidance.
orig: ووهبنا لداوود سليمان نعم العبد إنه أواب

translation: When there were displayed before him in the late afternoon the swift coursers,
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to Prophet Muhammad's (peace be upon him) love and appreciation for fine horses. The "swift coursers" mentioned are understood to be strong and beautiful horses that were presented to him in the evening. This could symbolize his admiration for strength, swiftness, and grace, qualities embodied by these noble animals.
orig: إذ عرض عليه بالعشي الصافنات الجياد

translation: He said: 'I did love the love of good things over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared behind the veil.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Solomon in the Qur'an. It suggests that Prophet Solomon became so engrossed in his love for material things like horses that he neglected to remember and worship Allah until the sun had set. The verse implies that one should not become overly attached to worldly possessions and pleasures at the expense of remembering Allah and fulfilling religious obligations.
orig: فقال إني أحببت حب الخير عن ذكر ربي حتى توارت بالحجاب

translation: And return it to Me, so he started wiping over the legs and necks
interpretation: This verse is referring to the incident when Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was commanded by Allah to perform the ritual of sacrificing an animal on the occasion of Eid al-Adha. The interpretation is that Allah instructed the Prophet to sacrifice the animal himself, and he obeyed by wiping the knife over the neck and legs of the animal, preparing it for the sacrifice.
orig: ردوها علي فطفق مسحا بالسوق والأعناق

translation: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed upon his throne a body, then he returned.
interpretation: This verse refers to a trial that Allah put Prophet Solomon through to test his faith and obedience. According to some interpretations, Allah placed a lifeless body on Solomon's throne, and he initially thought it was himself, causing him to reflect on the temporary nature of worldly possessions and authority. However, he eventually realized it was a test from Allah and repented, returning to the path of righteousness and gratitude.
orig: ولقد فتنا سليمان وألقينا على كرسيه جسدا ثم أناب

translation: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, it is You who is the Bestower."
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as Prophet Sulaiman's (peace be upon him) supplication to Allah, asking for forgiveness and a kingdom that is unparalleled and unmatched by anyone after him. He acknowledges that it is Allah alone who is the Bestower of all bounties and favors.
orig: قال رب اغفر لي وهب لي ملكا لا ينبغي لأحد من بعدي إنك أنت الوهاب

translation: So We subjected to him the wind, blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed.
interpretation: Allah facilitated for Prophet Sulayman the ability to control the winds, which would blow gently wherever he commanded, allowing him to travel great distances with ease. This was a manifestation of Allah's favor upon him and a sign of his prophethood.
orig: فسخرنا له الريح تجري بأمره رخاء حيث أصاب

translation: And the devils, every builder and diver,
interpretation: This verse refers to the jinns (supernatural beings) who assisted Prophet Sulaiman (Solomon) in various tasks like construction and diving for pearls and treasures from the sea. It highlights the power and authority bestowed upon him by Allah to command the jinns and utilize their abilities for beneficial purposes.
orig: والشياطين كل بناء وغواص

translation: And others bound together in shackles.
interpretation: This verse is referring to a group of disbelievers who will be bound together in chains or shackles on the Day of Judgment as a punishment for their rejection of faith and their evil deeds in this world. The interpretation highlights the severe consequences awaiting those who turn away from the truth and indulge in sin and disbelief.
orig: وآخرين مقرنين في الأصفاد

translation: This is Our bounty, so grant or withhold without account.
interpretation: "هذا عطاؤنا" يشير إلى النعم والأرزاق التي يمنحها الله للعباد من غير استحقاق منهم. "فامنن أو أمسك بغير حساب" تعني أن الله يعطي من يشاء ويمنع من يشاء من فضله وإحسانه دون أن يُسأل عن أفعاله، فهو المالك المتصرف في ملكه كيف يشاء.
orig: هذا عطاؤنا فامنن أو أمسك بغير حساب

translation: And verily, for him is a near access to Us, and a beautiful return.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the righteous person mentioned will be granted a high status and close proximity to Allah in the Hereafter, as well as an honorable and pleasant final destination in Paradise.
orig: وإن له عندنا لزلفى وحسن مآب

translation: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, 'Indeed, Satan has afflicted me with hardship and torment.'
interpretation: This verse reminds believers to be patient like the Prophet Job (peace be upon him), who endured great suffering and adversity with steadfastness and trust in Allah. Despite being afflicted by Satan with severe illness and pain, Job remained steadfast in his faith and called upon his Lord for relief. The verse highlights Job's unwavering belief in Allah's mercy and wisdom, even in the face of immense hardship. It serves as a lesson for believers to persevere through trials and difficulties, and to seek refuge in Allah during times of distress.
orig: واذكر عبدنا أيوب إذ نادى ربه أني مسني الشيطان بنصب وعذاب

translation: Run with your feet, this is a cool bath and a drink.
interpretation: This verse could be interpreted as an encouragement to take action and make an effort ("Run with your feet"), while also reminding us to seek refreshment and nourishment through spiritual purification ("this is a cool bath") and the guidance and wisdom found in divine revelation ("and a drink").
orig: اركض برجلك هذا مغتسل بارد وشراب

translation: And We granted him his family and a like number with them as a mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.
interpretation: Allah granted Prophet Ibrahim his wife Sarah and a son Isma'il, as well as other righteous people like Lut and his daughters, as a mercy and blessing from Him. This event serves as a reminder for those who possess sound intellect and wisdom to reflect upon Allah's power and mercy.
orig: ووهبنا له أهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة منا وذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: And take in your hand a bundle of thin grass and strike with it and do not break your oath. Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].
interpretation: This verse instructs Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to take a bundle of thin grass and strike his wife with it lightly as a symbolic punishment for her mistake, but without breaking his oath or causing her harm. It praises Prophet Muhammad's patience and obedience to Allah, describing him as "an excellent servant" who repeatedly turned to Allah in repentance and obedience.
orig: وخذ بيدك ضغثا فاضرب به ولا تحنث إنا وجدناه صابرا نعم العبد إنه أواب

translation: And mention Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and religious vision.
interpretation: This verse reminds us to reflect on the righteous lives of the Prophets Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, who were blessed with spiritual strength, determination, and insight. They serve as exemplary models of faith, obedience, and devotion to Allah. We are encouraged to draw lessons from their unwavering commitment and strive to emulate their virtues in our own lives.
orig: واذكر عبادنا إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب أولي الأيدي والأبصار

translation: Indeed, We have purified them with the pure quality of the remembrance of the abode [of the Hereafter].
interpretation: Allah purified the believers from sins and impurities through the remembrance of the everlasting abode in the Hereafter, which motivates them to perform righteous deeds and abstain from evil. This remembrance instills faith and God-consciousness in their hearts, purifying their souls.
orig: إنا أخلصناهم بخالصة ذكرى الدار

translation: And indeed, they are among the chosen and righteous with Us.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the people referred to are among the elite and virtuous ones in the sight of God. It suggests that they have been specially selected and favored by God due to their righteousness, piety, and noble qualities. The phrase "chosen and righteous" highlights their exalted status and the honor bestowed upon them by the Divine.
orig: وإنهم عندنا لمن المصطفين الأخيار

translation: And mention Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
interpretation: This verse reminds us to remember and reflect upon the lives of the righteous servants of God, such as Ishmael, Elisha, and Dhul-Kifl (believed to be the biblical prophet Ezekiel). They were among the chosen and outstanding individuals who dedicated their lives to the worship of God and the service of humanity. Their stories serve as inspiration and guidance for us to follow their example of piety, patience, and steadfastness in the face of adversity.
orig: واذكر إسماعيل واليسع وذا الكفل وكل من الأخيار

translation: This is a reminder, and indeed, for the righteous is a good final return
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a reminder for all people, particularly the righteous and God-fearing. It promises that those who lead a pious life and follow the guidance of Allah will have an excellent final destination in the Hereafter, where they will attain eternal bliss and reward.
orig: هذا ذكر وإن للمتقين لحسن مآب

translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, for them the doors will be opened.
interpretation: This verse refers to the reward of Paradise that awaits the righteous believers. The "Gardens of Eden" symbolize the eternal bliss and pleasure they will experience. The doors being "opened" for them signifies that they will be welcomed and granted unrestricted access to all the bounties and delights of Paradise as a result of their faith and good deeds in this world.
orig: جنات عدن مفتحة لهم الأبواب

translation: Reclining therein, they will call for abundant fruits and drink.
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings and comforts that the righteous believers will enjoy in Paradise. They will be reclining in a state of luxury and tranquility, and will be able to call for an abundance of delicious fruits and refreshing drinks whenever they desire, without any effort or limitation. This depicts the ultimate reward and eternal bliss that Allah has promised for those who lived a pious life and obeyed His commands.
orig: متكئين فيها يدعون فيها بفاكهة كثيرة وشراب

translation: And with them will be companions with beautiful, modest gazes, of equal age.
interpretation: This verse describes the pure and chaste companions who will be with the believers in Paradise. Their gazes will be modest, lowered and restrained, reflecting their chastity and dignity. They will be of equal age, referring to their youthful and ageless beauty, free from the effects of aging.
orig: وعندهم قاصرات الطرف أتراب

translation: This is what you were promised for the Day of Reckoning.
interpretation: This verse refers to the fulfillment of God's promise to hold all people accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. It implies that the realities witnessed on that day are what was foretold and warned about, emphasizing the certainty of divine reckoning and the gravity of being prepared for it.
orig: هذا ما توعدون ليوم الحساب

translation: Indeed, this is Our provision for which there is no depletion.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the provision and sustenance that Allah grants to His creation is inexhaustible and never-ending. It emphasizes Allah's infinite ability to provide for all of His creation without any limitation or depletion of resources. The verse instills a sense of security and trust in Allah's everlasting care and provision.
orig: إن هذا لرزقنا ما له من نفاد

translation: And indeed, for the transgressors there will be an evil destination
interpretation: This verse warns that those who rebel against God and transgress His limits will face a terrible fate in the Hereafter. It serves as a stern reminder of the consequences of disobedience and encourages people to remain steadfast on the path of righteousness.
orig: هذا وإن للطاغين لشر مآب

translation: The Fire, they will [enter to] burn therein - and wretched is the resting place.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands. The interpretation is: "The disbelievers will be admitted to the blazing Fire of Hell, which is a terrible place to dwell. The Fire is a miserable resting place and a horrific destination for those who turn away from the truth."
orig: جهنم يصلونها فبئس المهاد

translation: Then let them taste a scalding fluid and a punishment of intense cold.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits the disbelievers in the Hereafter. The "scalding fluid" refers to the boiling water or other torturous liquids that they will be made to drink, burning their insides. The "punishment of intense cold" suggests a freezing cold that will torment them in addition to the scorching heat. This imagery depicts the intense suffering and alternating extremes of pain that the disbelievers will face as a consequence of rejecting faith and committing sins in this world.
orig: هذا فليذوقوه حميم وغساق

translation: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the diversity of your tongues and colors. Surely in this are signs for those of knowledge.
interpretation: This verse highlights the diversity and differences among human beings as a sign of Allah's power and wisdom. The variations in languages and skin colors are evidence of Allah's creative ability. This diversity encourages people to get to know one another, appreciate their differences, and work together in harmony despite their outward distinctions.
orig: وآخر من شكله أزواج

translation: This is a transgressing host [of people] along with you. No welcome for them! Indeed, they will burn in the Fire.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelievers and wrongdoers who will be admitted to Hell on the Day of Judgment. It conveys the idea that they will not be welcomed or received with hospitality, but rather will be condemned to the punishment of the Fire. The interpretation emphasizes the severe consequences for those who reject faith and engage in transgression and disobedience towards Allah.
orig: هذا فوج مقتحم معكم لا مرحبا بهم إنهم صالو النار

translation: They will say, "Nay, you - not at all! You have not welcomed us, but you were it who brought this upon yourselves, and wretched is the place to settle in."
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers will be held accountable for their own actions and lack of faith on the Day of Judgment. They cannot blame others for their misery, as it was their own choice to reject the truth and embrace disbelief. The interpretation highlights the principle of individual responsibility and the grave consequences of rejecting divine guidance.
orig: قالوا بل أنتم لا مرحبا بكم أنتم قدمتموه لنا فبئس القرار

translation: They will say, 'Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers in the Hereafter who will blame and curse the leaders and instigators who misguided them and caused them to reject faith. They will ask Allah to double the punishment for those who led them astray, as they hold them responsible for their misguidance and subsequent suffering in Hell.
orig: قالوا ربنا من قدم لنا هذا فزده عذابا ضعفا في النار

translation: And they will say, 'What is the matter with us that we do not see men whom we used to count among the wicked?'
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers will be surprised not to see certain people whom they considered to be wicked and sinful in this world. They had assumed that these "wicked" individuals would be punished, but they do not see them among those being tormented. This could imply that those people had actually repented and reformed, or that the disbelievers' judgment of them was incorrect. It highlights the fact that true judgment belongs to Allah alone, and that human perceptions of wickedness can be flawed.
orig: وقالوا ما لنا لا نرى رجالا كنا نعدهم من الأشرار

translation: Have We treated them (falsely) in mockery, or have the eyes (of the beholders) missed seeing them?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers think that Allah has created them and the universe merely for amusement or mockery. It implies that the creation of the universe and all its wonders is not a vain act, but a manifestation of Allah's wisdom and power. The second part suggests that those who deny the signs of Allah have a deficiency in their perception or understanding.
orig: أتخذناهم سخريا أم زاغت عنهم الأبصار

translation: Indeed, that is the true reality - the mutual disagreement of the people of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse affirms the reality of the disagreements and disputes that will occur among the disbelievers in the Hellfire. Despite being together in punishment, they will blame and argue with one another, each denying responsibility and shifting blame to others for their predicament. This highlights the state of enmity, regret, and lack of unity that will prevail among them in the Hereafter.
orig: إن ذلك لحق تخاصم أهل النار

translation: Say, "I am only a warner, and there is no deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of Islam: the Oneness of God (Tawheed) and the role of the Prophet as a warner. The interpretation is: "The Prophet is instructed to declare that he is only a warner sent by Allah to guide people to the truth. There is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, Who is One and Unique, and Who has complete authority and power over all things."
orig: قل إنما أنا منذر وما من إله إلا الله الواحد القهار

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute Lordship and Sovereignty over the heavens, the earth, and all that exists between them. It highlights two of Allah's Names and Attributes: "Al-'Azeez" (the Exalted in Might) and "Al-Ghaffaar" (the Perpetual Forgiver). The former Name signifies Allah's Might, Power, and Dominance over all creation, while the latter emphasizes His immense Mercy and His readiness to forgive those who sincerely repent and turn to Him.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما العزيز الغفار

translation: Say, 'It is a great news,'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as Allah commanding the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to announce to people the great news of the Qur'an, which is a remarkable revelation containing guidance, wisdom, and the ultimate truth from the Creator.
orig: قل هو نبأ عظيم

translation: You are turning away from it.
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the disbelievers for turning away from and rejecting the message of the Qur'an and the teachings of Islam. It implies that they are arrogantly and stubbornly avoiding the truth that has been presented to them, despite the clear signs and evidence. The verse serves as a warning and an admonition for them to reflect upon their actions and reconsider their stance before it is too late.
orig: أنتم عنه معرضون

translation: I had no knowledge of the exalted chiefs when they were disputing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Prophet Muhammad's lack of knowledge about the discussions and disputes among the angels regarding the creation of man, as mentioned in other verses of the Qur'an. It emphasizes that the Prophet had no prior knowledge of such matters until they were revealed to him by Allah.
orig: ما كان لي من علم بالملإ الأعلى إذ يختصمون

translation: Nothing is revealed to me except that I am a clear warner.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is stating that his sole role and mission is to convey the message of Allah clearly and warn people against disbelief and disobedience. He does not receive any other revelation or knowledge except that which has been divinely revealed to him by Allah to warn and guide humanity. The Prophet is a "clear warner", meaning his warnings and message are evident, straightforward and unambiguous.
orig: إن يوحى إلي إلا أنما أنا نذير مبين

translation: When your Lord said to the angels, 'I am going to create a human being from clay.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of the first human being, Adam, by Allah from clay. It highlights the unique nature of human beings as physical and spiritual beings created by the Divine Will. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's power as the Creator and the special status of human beings among His creations.
orig: إذ قال ربك للملائكة إني خالق بشرا من طين

translation: So when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down to him in prostration.
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of Adam, the first human being. Allah states that after fashioning and perfecting Adam's physical form, He breathed into him from His spirit, giving him a soul and life. The angels were then commanded to prostrate before Adam as a sign of honor and respect for this new creation of Allah.
orig: فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين

translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.
interpretation: This verse indicates that all the angels obeyed Allah's command to prostrate before Adam without any hesitation or pride. It signifies the importance of obedience to Allah and humility before His commands, even if they may seem difficult to understand at first. The unconditional submission of the angels serves as a lesson for humanity to submit to Allah's will without questioning or arrogance.
orig: فسجد الملائكة كلهم أجمعون

translation: But Iblis refused and was arrogant: He was of the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse refers to Satan's refusal to obey Allah's command to prostrate before Adam. It highlights Satan's arrogance and disobedience, which led to his disbelief and expulsion from the mercy of Allah. The verse serves as a warning against pride, arrogance, and defiance of Allah's commands.
orig: إلا إبليس استكبر وكان من الكافرين

translation: He (Allah) said: 'O Iblis! What prevented you from prostrating to what I created with My Hands? Were you arrogant or were you among the high ones?'
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's questioning of Iblis (Satan) for his refusal to prostrate before Adam despite Allah's command. Allah is asking Iblis whether his refusal was due to arrogance and pride, or if he considered himself superior and among the "high ones" who should not prostrate to Adam. The verse highlights Iblis's sin of arrogance and disobedience towards Allah's command.
orig: قال يا إبليس ما منعك أن تسجد لما خلقت بيدي أستكبرت أم كنت من العالين

translation: He said, 'I am better than him. You created me from fire, and You created him from clay.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance of Iblis (Satan) when Allah commanded him to prostrate before Adam. Iblis considered himself superior to Adam because he was created from fire, while Adam was created from clay. This shows Iblis' pride and disobedience towards Allah's command, which ultimately led to his downfall and expulsion from Paradise. The interpretation highlights the danger of arrogance and the importance of submitting to Allah's commands with humility.
orig: قال أنا خير منه خلقتني من نار وخلقته من طين

translation: He (Allah) said: 'Then get out from here, for you are indeed outcast'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as Allah expelling and banishing Shaytan (Satan) from the heavens and the company of the angels due to his arrogance and refusal to prostrate to Adam. The term "rajim" means "outcast" or "accursed," indicating that Shaytan has been expelled from Allah's mercy and grace.
orig: قال فاخرج منها فإنك رجيم

translation: And verily, upon you is My Curse till the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: This verse is part of the dialogue between Allah and Iblis (Satan) after the latter refused to prostrate to Adam. It signifies that Allah has condemned and cursed Iblis for his arrogance and disobedience, and that this curse will remain upon him until the Day of Judgment. The interpretation highlights Allah's wrath towards those who defy His commands out of pride and arrogance.
orig: وإن عليك لعنتي إلى يوم الدين

translation: He said: 'O my Lord! Grant me respite till the Day they are raised up.'
interpretation: In this verse, Satan (Iblis) is asking Allah to delay his punishment until the Day of Resurrection when all people will be resurrected. He is requesting a respite, or postponement, of his punishment so that he can mislead and tempt people until that time. This shows Satan's arrogance and persistence in his disobedience to Allah.
orig: قال رب فأنظرني إلى يوم يبعثون

translation: He said, 'Indeed, you are of those who are reprieved.'
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being addressed has been granted a respite or delay in facing the consequences of their actions. It implies that they have been given an opportunity to reflect and rectify their ways before facing any punishment or reckoning.
orig: قال فإنك من المنظرين

translation: Until the Day of the Time Appointed
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection or Judgement, when all souls will be held accountable for their deeds. It implies that everything has an appointed time set by Allah, and that this worldly life is temporary, leading up to the eternal life in the Hereafter.
orig: إلى يوم الوقت المعلوم

translation: He said: 'Then by Your Might, I will surely mislead them all,
interpretation: This verse refers to Satan's arrogant declaration that he will mislead all of humanity, abusing the freedom of choice granted by Allah. Satan vows to use his influence to tempt people away from the straight path, exploiting their weaknesses and desires. However, this does not negate human responsibility, as each person has the free will to accept or reject Satan's temptations.
orig: قال فبعزتك لأغوينهم أجمعين

translation: Except Your sincere servants among them
interpretation: This verse implies that there is an exception to those who will be led astray by Satan - those who are sincere and devoted servants of Allah. They will be guided and protected from Satan's deception and misguidance. It highlights the importance of having sincere faith, devotion, and reliance on Allah to be saved from evil temptations and influences.
orig: إلا عبادك منهم المخلصين

translation: He said: 'The truth is, and the truth I speak.'
interpretation: This verse affirms the truthfulness and sincerity of the speaker, who is emphasizing that what they are saying is the absolute truth and nothing but the truth. It is a firm declaration of speaking the reality without any falsehood or deception.
orig: قال فالحق والحق أقول

translation: I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you, all together.
interpretation: This verse is a warning from Allah to Satan and his followers that they will be punished in Hell for their disobedience and leading others astray. It emphasizes that Satan and those who follow his path of misguidance will be gathered together and thrown into Hell as a consequence of their rejection of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: لأملأن جهنم منك وممن تبعك منهم أجمعين

translation: Say, "I do not ask you for any payment for this - nor am I one of those who make excessive claims."
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare that he does not seek any worldly reward or compensation for conveying the message of Islam. He is not among those who make false or exaggerated claims about their status or mission. The Prophet's motivation for preaching is purely for the sake of Allah and the guidance of humanity, without any personal gain or pretense.
orig: قل ما أسألكم عليه من أجر وما أنا من المتكلفين

translation: It is not but a reminder for the worlds
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a source of guidance and enlightenment for all of humanity, transcending any particular nation or group. It serves as a universal reminder of the truth, wisdom, and teachings that are essential for the spiritual and moral upliftment of all people, regardless of their backgrounds or circumstances.
orig: إن هو إلا ذكر للعالمين

translation: And you will surely know its news after a while.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the truth about the matter being discussed will become evident and known to everyone in due time. It implies that there is wisdom and a greater purpose behind the events unfolding, even if they are not immediately apparent. The verse encourages patience and trust in God's plan, as the complete reality will be revealed eventually.
orig: ولتعلمن نبأه بعد حين

translation: This is the revelation of the Book from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah, Who is Almighty and Perfect in Wisdom. It affirms the divine origin and authority of the Qur'an, as it has been sent down by the One Who is Exalted in Power and Wisdom. This establishes the Qur'an as a source of guidance and truth, worthy of being studied and followed.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book in truth; so worship Allah, being sincere to Him in religion.
interpretation: Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to worship Him sincerely and purely for His sake alone, without associating any partners with Him. This verse emphasizes the core message of Islam - the Oneness of God and the obligation to devote all acts of worship solely to Him. It affirms that the Qur'an has been revealed as a source of guidance from the Truth, and calls upon the Prophet and all believers to submit themselves wholeheartedly to Allah.
orig: إنا أنزلنا إليك الكتاب بالحق فاعبد الله مخلصا له الدين

translation: Unquestionably, for Allah is the pure religion. And those who take protectors besides Him [say], 'We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allah in position.' Indeed, Allah will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allah does not guide he who is a liar and an ingrate.
interpretation: هذه الآية توضح أن الدين الخالص والصافي هو دين الله وحده، وأن عبادة غير الله لا تجوز، حتى لو كانت بدعوى التقرب إلى الله. فالله سيحكم بين المؤمنين والمشركين في خلافهم حول هذه المسألة، وهو لن يهدي من كان كاذبًا وجاحدًا لنعمه.
orig: ألا لله الدين الخالص والذين اتخذوا من دونه أولياء ما نعبدهم إلا ليقربونا إلى الله زلفى إن الله يحكم بينهم في ما هم فيه يختلفون إن الله لا يهدي من هو كاذب كفار

translation: If Allah had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
interpretation: This verse refutes the pagan belief that Allah has a son or offspring. It affirms Allah's Oneness and states that if He had willed to have a son, He could have chosen whomever He desired from His creation. However, Allah is far above such human characteristics and is the One, the Irresistible and Prevailing over all things.
orig: لو أراد الله أن يتخذ ولدا لاصطفى مما يخلق ما يشاء سبحانه هو الله الواحد القهار

translation: He created the heavens and the earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in creating the universe with a precise order. The alternation of day and night, and the movements of the sun and moon, are signs of Allah's might and control over all creation. It reminds us of Allah's attributes of Might and Forgiveness, encouraging us to submit to Him and seek His pardon.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق يكور الليل على النهار ويكور النهار على الليل وسخر الشمس والقمر كل يجري لأجل مسمى ألا هو العزيز الغفار

translation: He created you from a single soul, then from it made its mate, and brought down for you eight mates of the cattle. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in three layers of darkness. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs the kingdom. There is no god except Him, so where are you headed?
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power as the sole Creator and Sustainer of all life. It describes the creation of humans from a single soul, and the subsequent creation of mates for procreation. It also mentions the creation of eight kinds of cattle for human benefit. The verse then describes the intricate process of human development in the womb, passing through three stages of darkness. This entire process is a testament to Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over all creation. The verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and questions where people are headed, implying that they should submit to their Creator and Lord.
orig: خلقكم من نفس واحدة ثم جعل منها زوجها وأنزل لكم من الأنعام ثمانية أزواج يخلقكم في بطون أمهاتكم خلقا من بعد خلق في ظلمات ثلاث ذلكم الله ربكم له الملك لا إله إلا هو فأنى تصرفون

translation: If you disbelieve, indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And He does not like disbelief for His servants. And if you are grateful, He likes it for you. No bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's independence from His creation and His dislike for disbelief. It states that if people disbelieve, Allah is not in need of their belief, as He is self-sufficient. However, He does not approve of disbelief for His servants, as it goes against their nature and purpose. On the other hand, if people are grateful and believe, Allah is pleased with them. The verse also highlights individual accountability, where no one can bear the burden of another's sins or deeds. Ultimately, everyone will return to Allah, who is fully aware of their innermost thoughts and intentions, and He will inform them of their actions.
orig: إن تكفروا فإن الله غني عنكم ولا يرضى لعباده الكفر وإن تشكروا يرضه لكم ولا تزر وازرة وزر أخرى ثم إلى ربكم مرجعكم فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him in repentance. Then when He bestows upon him a favor from Himself, he forgets the one whom he used to call upon before, and he sets up rivals to Allah to mislead others from His way. Say, 'Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the ungrateful and hypocritical attitude of some people. When afflicted with hardship, they turn to Allah sincerely, but once the hardship is removed and they receive blessings from Allah, they forget Him and associate partners with Him, thus going astray from the right path. The verse warns such people to enjoy their disbelief temporarily, as they will ultimately be among the dwellers of Hellfire.
orig: وإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعا ربه منيبا إليه ثم إذا خوله نعمة منه نسي ما كان يدعو إليه من قبل وجعل لله أندادا ليضل عن سبيله قل تمتع بكفرك قليلا إنك من أصحاب النار

translation: Is one who is devoutly obedient during the hours of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.
interpretation: Allâh compares between the believer who obeys Him by performing the night prayer with humility and sincerity, fearing the punishment of the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, and the disbeliever who is heedless of the Hereafter. He emphasizes that those who possess knowledge are not equal to the ignorant ones, for only people of sound intellect take heed and benefit from the signs of Allâh.
orig: أمن هو قانت آناء الليل ساجدا وقائما يحذر الآخرة ويرجو رحمة ربه قل هل يستوي الذين يعلمون والذين لا يعلمون إنما يتذكر أولو الألباب

translation: Say, "O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allah is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account."
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to have taqwa (fear and consciousness of Allah) and to do good deeds, promising that those who are patient and persevere in righteousness will be rewarded abundantly in the Hereafter, without any limits or restrictions. It highlights that the earth is vast, providing opportunities for those who seek goodness and want to migrate to places more conducive to practicing their faith. The interpretation emphasizes having trust in Allah, maintaining patience through difficulties, and striving for virtue, as these will ultimately lead to an immense and uncounted reward.
orig: قل يا عباد الذين آمنوا اتقوا ربكم للذين أحسنوا في هذه الدنيا حسنة وأرض الله واسعة إنما يوفى الصابرون أجرهم بغير حساب

translation: Say, 'Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allah, being sincere to Him in religion.'
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad to declare that he has been ordered by Allah to worship Him alone, devoting his religion sincerely and purely to Him, without associating any partners with Him.
orig: قل إني أمرت أن أعبد الله مخلصا له الدين

translation: And I have been commanded to be the first of the Muslims.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was commanded by Allah to be the first person to fully submit to Islam and its teachings. As the final messenger and the recipient of the Qur'an, he was to set an example for others to follow by being the first to embrace the religion completely and wholeheartedly. This signifies his pivotal role in establishing and spreading the message of Islam.
orig: وأمرت لأن أكون أول المسلمين

translation: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and the consequences of disobedience. The Prophet is instructed to say that he fears the punishment of a tremendous Day if he disobeys his Lord. This instills a sense of accountability and reverence for Allah's commands, as the punishment for disobedience is severe and overwhelming. It serves as a reminder for believers to remain steadfast in their faith and obedience to avoid the terrifying punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: قل إني أخاف إن عصيت ربي عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: Say, "It is Allah I worship, being sincere in my devotion to Him alone."
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to declare that he worships Allah alone with complete sincerity and devotion, associating no partners with Him. It emphasizes the fundamental principle of Islam, which is the pure monotheism (Tawheed) and the rejection of all forms of polytheism and idolatry.
orig: قل الله أعبد مخلصا له ديني

translation: So worship what you will besides Him. Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of worshipping anything other than Allah. It warns that those who turn away from the worship of the One True God will be the ultimate losers on the Day of Resurrection, losing not only themselves but also their families. This is described as a "manifest loss," indicating a clear and undeniable state of deprivation and ruin in the Hereafter.
orig: فاعبدوا ما شئتم من دونه قل إن الخاسرين الذين خسروا أنفسهم وأهليهم يوم القيامة ألا ذلك هو الخسران المبين

translation: For them are coverings of fire above them and coverings (of fire) beneath them; with that Allah frightens His servants: 'O My servants, then fear Me!'
interpretation: This verse serves as a stern warning from Allah to His servants about the terrifying punishment of Hell. The "coverings of fire" refer to the intense flames that will engulf the disbelievers from all sides, leaving no escape. This graphic description is meant to instill fear in the hearts of people and motivate them to obey Allah and avoid the dreadful fate of Hellfire. The verse emphasizes Allah's authority as the One who controls punishment, reminding us to have fear and reverence for Him.
orig: لهم من فوقهم ظلل من النار ومن تحتهم ظلل ذلك يخوف الله به عباده يا عباد فاتقون

translation: And those who avoid false deities, not worshipping them, and turn to Allah, for them are good tidings, so give good tidings to My servants
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of avoiding the worship of false gods or idols (Taghut), and turning wholeheartedly to Allah in submission. Those who do so are promised "good tidings," which refers to the glad tidings of forgiveness, guidance, and ultimate salvation in the Hereafter. The Prophet Muhammad is instructed to convey these glad tidings to the believers who have purified their faith and devoted themselves solely to Allah.
orig: والذين اجتنبوا الطاغوت أن يعبدوها وأنابوا إلى الله لهم البشرى فبشر عباد

translation: Those who listen to the Word and follow the best thereof, those are the ones whom Allah has guided, and those are the ones endowed with understanding.
interpretation: This verse praises those who listen attentively to the teachings of the Qur'an and other divine revelations, and then follow the best and most virtuous of what they have heard. It indicates that such people have been guided by Allah to the right path, and they are the truly intelligent ones who possess sound reasoning and wisdom.
orig: الذين يستمعون القول فيتبعون أحسنه أولئك الذين هداهم الله وأولئك هم أولو الألباب

translation: Is one against whom the sentence of punishment is due [to be raised], then will you save one who is in the Fire?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers who have earned the punishment of Hell can be saved from the Fire by anyone, including the Prophet Muhammad. It emphasizes that no one has the power to rescue those who have rejected faith and committed sins deserving of eternal punishment in the Hereafter. Their fate is sealed by Allah's judgment.
orig: أفمن حق عليه كلمة العذاب أفأنت تنقذ من في النار

translation: But for those who feared their Lord, they will have lofty chambers, one above another, built (for them), beneath which rivers flow. (This is) the Promise of Allah, and Allah does not fail in (His) Promise.
interpretation: This verse promises those who have taqwa (fear of Allah and consciousness of Him) that they will be rewarded with lofty dwellings in Paradise, built one above the other. These dwellings will have rivers flowing beneath them, indicating the immense bliss and pleasure that the believers will experience in the Hereafter. This is a Promise from Allah, and Allah never breaks His Promise.
orig: لكن الذين اتقوا ربهم لهم غرف من فوقها غرف مبنية تجري من تحتها الأنهار وعد الله لا يخلف الله الميعاد

translation: Have you not seen that Allah sends down water from the sky, and causes it to flow as springs in the earth; then with it He produces crops of varying colors; then they wither and you see them turn yellow; then He makes them dry and crumbling. Surely in this is a reminder for men of understanding.
interpretation: هذه الآية الكريمة تشير إلى قدرة الله تعالى وعظمة خلقه، حيث يبين كيف ينزل الماء من السماء ويجعله ينابيع في الأرض، ثم يخرج به النباتات المختلفة الألوان، ثم تذبل هذه النباتات وتصفر، ثم تجف وتتحطم. وفي هذه العملية الدقيقة والمعقدة لدورة الحياة والموت للنباتات دليل واضح على وجود الله وقدرته، وهذا يعتبر تذكيرًا لأولي الألباب والعقول الراجحة.
orig: ألم تر أن الله أنزل من السماء ماء فسلكه ينابيع في الأرض ثم يخرج به زرعا مختلفا ألوانه ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يجعله حطاما إن في ذلك لذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: Is one whose breast Allah has expanded to [accept] Islam so that he is upon a light from his Lord [like one obstructed]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah. Those are in manifest error.
interpretation: This verse contrasts between those whose hearts have been opened and enlightened by Allah to accept Islam, and those whose hearts have hardened and turned away from the remembrance of Allah. The former are guided by the light from their Lord, while the latter are in clear misguidance and error. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of having a receptive heart towards the truth and the dire consequences of hardening one's heart against Allah's remembrance and guidance.
orig: أفمن شرح الله صدره للإسلام فهو على نور من ربه فويل للقاسية قلوبهم من ذكر الله أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Allah has sent down the best statement, a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. And one for whom Allah does not guide - there is no guide at all for him.
interpretation: The Qur'an is described as the "best statement" because it is the word of God, free from any flaws or contradictions. Its consistent nature and reiteration of key themes and teachings make it a unique book that has a profound spiritual impact on believers. When the verses are recited, the believers feel a sense of awe and fear of God, causing their skins to shiver. However, this is followed by a sense of tranquility and softening of their hearts as they remember God and His guidance. The verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is a source of guidance from Allah, but only those whom He wills to be guided will truly benefit from it. Those who are not guided by Allah have no other means of finding the right path.
orig: الله نزل أحسن الحديث كتابا متشابها مثاني تقشعر منه جلود الذين يخشون ربهم ثم تلين جلودهم وقلوبهم إلى ذكر الله ذلك هدى الله يهدي به من يشاء ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: Is one who is saved from the awful doom on the Day of Resurrection by his face better, or he who is commanded: "Taste the punishment because of what you used to earn?"
interpretation: This verse contrasts the fate of the righteous believers who will be saved from punishment on the Day of Resurrection by the light on their faces, with the fate of the wrongdoers who will be commanded to taste the punishment they earned due to their disbelief and evil deeds. It emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous conduct to attain salvation and avoid the severe punishment on the Day of Judgment.
orig: أفمن يتقي بوجهه سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وقيل للظالمين ذوقوا ما كنتم تكسبون

translation: Those before them denied, and the punishment came upon them whence they perceived not.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and persist in disbelief that they will face a severe punishment, just like the previous nations who denied the truth and were consequently destroyed. The punishment will come unexpectedly, from a source they did not anticipate or realize. It serves as a reminder of the grave consequences of denying God's signs and messengers.
orig: كذب الذين من قبلهم فأتاهم العذاب من حيث لا يشعرون

translation: So Allah made them taste disgrace in the present life, and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if they only knew.
interpretation: Allah disgraced and humiliated the disbelievers in this worldly life as a consequence of their rejection of faith and righteous deeds. However, the punishment that awaits them in the Hereafter is far more severe and unbearable, if only they had realized and understood the gravity of their actions.
orig: فأذاقهم الله الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الآخرة أكبر لو كانوا يعلمون

translation: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.
interpretation: Allah has provided numerous examples, metaphors, and parables in the Qur'an to aid people's understanding and encourage them to reflect upon its teachings. These examples serve as reminders and illustrations to help people comprehend the profound truths and wisdom contained within the divine revelation.
orig: ولقد ضربنا للناس في هذا القرآن من كل مثل لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: An Arabic Qur'an, free from any deviance, that they may become righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an has been revealed in the clear and eloquent Arabic language, free from any crookedness, ambiguity or contradiction. Its purpose is to guide people towards righteousness and piety by following its teachings and commandments.
orig: قرآنا عربيا غير ذي عوج لعلهم يتقون

translation: Allah presents an example: a man enslaved by partners at odds, and another man belonging entirely to one man - are they equal in comparison? All praise is due to Allah; but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse uses an analogy to illustrate the concept of associating partners with Allah (shirk) versus pure monotheism (tawheed). The first man represents those who associate partners with Allah, like idols or other deities, leading to conflicts and disunity. The second man represents the one who worships Allah alone, with complete submission and harmony. The rhetorical question "Are they equal in comparison?" emphasizes that these two conditions are vastly different. The verse concludes by praising Allah and acknowledging that most people fail to recognize the truth of tawheed.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا رجلا فيه شركاء متشاكسون ورجلا سلما لرجل هل يستويان مثلا الحمد لله بل أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, you will die, and indeed, they will die.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death for all human beings, including the Prophet Muhammad and those who opposed him. It reminds us that death is a universal reality that no one can escape, regardless of their status or beliefs. The verse serves as a reminder of our mortality and the temporary nature of this worldly life, encouraging us to focus on the eternal life in the Hereafter.
orig: إنك ميت وإنهم ميتون

translation: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be disputing before your Lord.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, people will argue and dispute before Allah regarding their beliefs, actions, and the truth they rejected in this world. This verse highlights the futility of such disputes on that Day, as the truth will become evident, and everyone will be held accountable for their choices and deeds.
orig: ثم إنكم يوم القيامة عند ربكم تختصمون

translation: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allah and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?
interpretation: This verse condemns those who reject the truth and lie about Allah after being presented with clear evidence and guidance. It emphasizes the grave injustice of such an act and warns that the ultimate abode for such disbelievers is Hell. The verse highlights the severity of denying the truth and rejecting faith after receiving clear signs and proofs from Allah.
orig: فمن أظلم ممن كذب على الله وكذب بالصدق إذ جاءه أليس في جهنم مثوى للكافرين

translation: And he who has brought the truth and [they who] have believed in it - those are the righteous.
interpretation: This verse highlights the virtues of those who uphold the truth and have faith in it. It praises the "righteous" ones who embrace the truth wholeheartedly and live by its principles. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of sincerity, truthfulness, and righteousness in one's beliefs and actions.
orig: والذي جاء بالصدق وصدق به أولئك هم المتقون

translation: For them is whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward for the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse promises that the believers who do righteous deeds will attain whatever they desire in Paradise, by the grace and bounty of Allah. It highlights Allah's generous reward for those who lead a virtuous life and strive to please Him. The fulfillment of all their desires signifies the ultimate bliss and satisfaction they will experience in the Hereafter as a result of their good deeds in this world.
orig: لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ذلك جزاء المحسنين

translation: That Allah may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their reward for the best of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will forgive the believers for their worst sins and misdeeds, and reward them for the best of their deeds and actions. It highlights Allah's mercy and justice, where He pardons the believers' shortcomings while rewarding their righteous efforts.
orig: ليكفر الله عنهم أسوأ الذي عملوا ويجزيهم أجرهم بأحسن الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: Is not Allah sufficient for His servant? And they threaten you with those besides Him. And whoever Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.
interpretation: Allah is questioning whether He is not sufficient to protect and aid His servant (the Prophet Muhammad). The disbelievers are threatening the Prophet with their false deities besides Allah, but these deities have no power to harm or benefit anyone. Whoever Allah allows to deviate from the right path will have no guide to lead them to the truth.
orig: أليس الله بكاف عبده ويخوفونك بالذين من دونه ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And whoever Allah guides - there is none to misguide him. Is not Allah Exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and power. It states that whoever Allah guides to the right path, there is no one who can lead them astray or misguide them. This highlights Allah's perfect guidance and that true guidance comes only from Him. The verse then rhetorically asks: "Is not Allah Exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution?" This affirms Allah's might, glory, and ability to punish those who defy Him and reject His guidance. The verse serves as a reminder of Allah's authority and a warning against straying from His path.
orig: ومن يهد الله فما له من مضل أليس الله بعزيز ذي انتقام

translation: And if you asked them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' Say, 'Have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? If Allah intended me harm, could they remove His harm? Or if He intended me mercy, could they withhold His mercy?' Say, 'Sufficient for me is Allah; in Him the trusting put their trust.'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It challenges the idolaters to ponder upon their false deities and realize their utter inability to either cause harm or bestow mercy. The verse affirms that Allah alone has the power to decree harm or mercy, and no one else can alter His decree. It concludes by declaring that putting one's trust solely in Allah is the essence of faith and the key to contentment.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن الله قل أفرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله إن أرادني الله بضر هل هن كاشفات ضره أو أرادني برحمة هل هن ممسكات رحمته قل حسبي الله عليه يتوكل المتوكلون

translation: Say: O my people! Work according to your position; I too am working, and soon you will know
interpretation: This verse encourages the Prophet and his followers to persevere in their efforts to spread the message of Islam, despite facing opposition and rejection from the disbelievers. It suggests that they should continue working according to their capabilities and remain steadfast in their beliefs and actions, while the disbelievers should also continue with their ways. Eventually, the truth will become evident, and they will realize the consequences of their choices.
orig: قل يا قوم اعملوا على مكانتكم إني عامل فسوف تعلمون

translation: Whoever receives a punishment that will disgrace him, and upon whom an enduring punishment will settle
