interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment and humiliation that awaits those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands. The "disgraceful punishment" could refer to the shame and regret they will feel on the Day of Judgment, while the "enduring punishment" implies the eternal torment of Hellfire that will befall them.
orig: من يأتيه عذاب يخزيه ويحل عليه عذاب مقيم

translation: Verily, We have sent down to you (O Muhammad) the Book (this Qur'an) for mankind in truth. So, whosoever accepts the guidance, it is only for his own self; and whosoever goes astray, he goes astray only for his (own) loss. And you (O Muhammad) are not a dictator over them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an has been revealed as a guidance for all of humanity, but it is up to each individual to choose whether to accept and follow it or reject it. Those who accept it will benefit themselves, while those who reject it will only harm themselves. The Prophet Muhammad is not a dictator forcing people to believe; rather, he is a messenger conveying the truth, and people have the free will to make their own choices regarding faith.
orig: إنا أنزلنا عليك الكتاب للناس بالحق فمن اهتدى فلنفسه ومن ضل فإنما يضل عليها وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: It is Allah who takes away the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps the ones for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: This verse describes Allah's complete control over life and death. He takes the souls of those who die, and He also takes the souls of the living during sleep, which is a minor form of death. Upon waking up, He returns the souls. For those whose death He has decreed, He keeps their souls, but for others, He returns their souls until an appointed time. This demonstrates Allah's power and wisdom, which are signs for those who reflect.
orig: الله يتوفى الأنفس حين موتها والتي لم تمت في منامها فيمسك التي قضى عليها الموت ويرسل الأخرى إلى أجل مسمى إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Or have they taken besides Allah intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess anything, nor do they reason?"
interpretation: This verse is rejecting the pagan belief of taking intercessors besides Allah. It questions the logic of worshipping beings who have no power or understanding, as only Allah has absolute control over everything and is worthy of worship.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دون الله شفعاء قل أولو كانوا لا يملكون شيئا ولا يعقلون

translation: Say, 'To Allah belongs all intercession. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned.'
interpretation: This verse affirms that the power of intercession and mediation belongs solely to Allah. No one can intercede or mediate on behalf of another except by Allah's permission. It also emphasizes that Allah is the Sovereign and Absolute Ruler over the heavens and the earth, and that all creatures will ultimately return to Him for judgment and accountability.
orig: قل لله الشفاعة جميعا له ملك السماوات والأرض ثم إليه ترجعون

translation: And when Allah alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter are filled with disgust. But when those besides Him are mentioned, they rejoice.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrasting reactions of the disbelievers when Allah is mentioned alone versus when false deities are mentioned. Their hearts are filled with aversion and disgust when Allah, the One True God, is mentioned because they reject the belief in the Hereafter. However, they rejoice and feel delighted when false gods or idols are mentioned, as they have misplaced their faith and allegiance.
orig: وإذا ذكر الله وحده اشمأزت قلوب الذين لا يؤمنون بالآخرة وإذا ذكر الذين من دونه إذا هم يستبشرون

translation: Say, 'O Allah, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between Your servants concerning that over which they used to differ.'
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's sovereignty as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe, and His perfect knowledge of all things, seen and unseen. It emphasizes that Allah is the ultimate Judge who will settle all disputes and differences among His servants on the Day of Judgment, as He alone has complete knowledge of the truth.
orig: قل اللهم فاطر السماوات والأرض عالم الغيب والشهادة أنت تحكم بين عبادك في ما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: And if those who did wrong possessed all that is on earth, and the like of it with it, they would certainly offer it as a ransom from the evil chastisement on the day of resurrection; and what they never reckoned for shall become manifest to them from Allah.
interpretation: "This verse highlights the immense value of salvation from the punishment of Hell on the Day of Judgment. It states that even if the wrongdoers possessed all the riches of the earth and an equal amount with it, they would gladly offer it all as a ransom to save themselves from the severe torment. However, their ransom will not be accepted, and they will face the consequences of their actions, which they had never anticipated or accounted for from Allah."
orig: ولو أن للذين ظلموا ما في الأرض جميعا ومثله معه لافتدوا به من سوء العذاب يوم القيامة وبدا لهم من الله ما لم يكونوا يحتسبون

translation: And the evil results of their deeds became manifest to them, and they were surrounded by that which they used to mock.
interpretation: This verse warns of the consequences of rejecting faith and mocking the truth. When the disbelievers witnessed the punishment for their sins, the evil consequences of their misdeeds became clear to them. They were enveloped by the very thing they used to mock and make fun of, which was the divine punishment and the warnings of the messengers.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما كسبوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: But when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and arrogance of humans. When afflicted with hardship, they turn to Allah and implore Him for relief. However, when Allah bestows His favors upon them, they become arrogant and attribute these blessings to their own knowledge and efforts, rather than acknowledging Allah's grace. This is a trial from Allah to test people's faith and gratitude, yet most people fail to recognize it as such due to their ignorance.
orig: فإذا مس الإنسان ضر دعانا ثم إذا خولناه نعمة منا قال إنما أوتيته على علم بل هي فتنة ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Those before them have already said the same thing, but what they used to earn did not avail them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers of the Prophet Muhammad's time were repeating the same excuses and objections that were made by previous nations who rejected their prophets. Their wealth and worldly possessions did not benefit them or save them from Allah's punishment when they stubbornly denied the truth.
orig: قد قالها الذين من قبلهم فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Then they were afflicted by the evil consequences of what they earned, and those who did wrong from these [people] will be afflicted by the evil consequences of what they earned, and they will not cause failure.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of accountability and justice in Islam. It states that those who committed evil deeds will face the negative consequences of their actions, and the wrongdoers from among them will also be punished for their misdeeds. The verse emphasizes that no one can escape the consequences of their actions or "cause failure" to God's justice.
orig: فأصابهم سيئات ما كسبوا والذين ظلموا من هؤلاء سيصيبهم سيئات ما كسبوا وما هم بمعجزين

translation: Do they not know that it is Allah who extends provision for whom He wills and restricts it? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's complete control over sustenance and provision. He grants abundance to whomever He wills, and restricts it from whomever He wills, according to His infinite wisdom. This reality serves as a sign and reminder of Allah's power and sovereignty for those who truly believe and have faith.
orig: أولم يعلموا أن الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يؤمنون

translation: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Perpetual Forgiver, the Merciful."
interpretation: "Dieu demande à Son Prophète d'inviter Ses serviteurs qui ont commis des péchés et des transgressions à ne pas désespérer de Sa miséricorde. Car Dieu pardonne tous les péchés, si énormes soient-ils, à celui qui se repent sincèrement et revient à Lui. Dieu est Celui qui pardonne constamment et accorde Sa miséricorde à Ses serviteurs."
orig: قل يا عبادي الذين أسرفوا على أنفسهم لا تقنطوا من رحمة الله إن الله يغفر الذنوب جميعا إنه هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: And turn in repentance to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; and then you will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse is a call to repentance and submission to Allah before it is too late. It urges people to turn back to their Lord, obey His commands, and surrender themselves completely to Him. The verse warns that if they fail to do so before the punishment comes, they will have no one to help or support them at that time. It emphasizes the importance of taking heed and reforming oneself before facing the consequences of disobedience and disbelief.
orig: وأنيبوا إلى ربكم وأسلموا له من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب ثم لا تنصرون

translation: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive.
interpretation: This verse commands believers to follow the teachings and guidance revealed in the Qur'an, which is the best and most beneficial for them. It warns them to adhere to the right path before Allah's punishment suddenly strikes them while they are unaware and unprepared for it. The verse emphasizes the importance of being attentive, obedient, and ready to face the consequences of one's actions.
orig: واتبعوا أحسن ما أنزل إليكم من ربكم من قبل أن يأتيكم العذاب بغتة وأنتم لا تشعرون

translation: That the soul will say, 'Woe to me for what I neglected in regards to Allah and that I was indeed among the mockers.'
interpretation: This verse warns of the regret and remorse that the soul will feel on the Day of Judgment for neglecting the commands of Allah and mocking His religion during the worldly life. It highlights the grave consequences of disbelief and reminds us to take our faith seriously and strive to follow Allah's guidance.
orig: أن تقول نفس يا حسرتا على ما فرطت في جنب الله وإن كنت لمن الساخرين

translation: Or you say, 'If only Allah had guided me, I would have been among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse addresses those who reject faith and guidance, making excuses for their disbelief. It suggests that they claim that if Allah had guided them, they would have been among the righteous and God-fearing people. However, this is merely an excuse, as Allah has provided clear guidance through His revelations and messengers. The responsibility lies with individuals to accept or reject the guidance offered to them.
orig: أو تقول لو أن الله هداني لكنت من المتقين

translation: Or [lest] you say when you see the punishment, "If only I had another turn [at worldly life] so I could be among the doers of good."
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers against regretting their actions on the Day of Judgment when they witness the punishment. It suggests that they may wish for another chance at life to do good deeds, but it will be too late at that point. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of repenting and doing righteous deeds in this worldly life before it's too late.
orig: أو تقول حين ترى العذاب لو أن لي كرة فأكون من المحسنين

translation: Yes, verily, My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) did come to you, but you denied them and were arrogant and were among the disbelievers.
interpretation: This verse is a rebuke from Allah to those who rejected the clear signs and revelations that were sent to them. It highlights their arrogance and disbelief, despite being presented with undeniable proofs of the truth. The verse serves as a warning against denying Allah's signs and messages, and reminds us of the grave consequences of such arrogance and disbelief.
orig: بلى قد جاءتك آياتي فكذبت بها واستكبرت وكنت من الكافرين

translation: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied against Allah - their faces will be blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject the truth and attribute lies to Allah that on the Day of Judgment, their faces will be blackened with disgrace and humiliation. It implies that their arrogance and rejection of faith will lead them to the painful abode of Hell, which is the ultimate destination for the arrogant and haughty ones who denied the truth.
orig: ويوم القيامة ترى الذين كذبوا على الله وجوههم مسودة أليس في جهنم مثوى للمتكبرين

translation: And Allah will deliver those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse promises that Allah will save and deliver those who have Taqwa (piety and consciousness of Allah) from all harm and distress, both in this world and in the Hereafter. They will attain salvation and success due to their righteousness and obedience to Allah. No evil or harm will afflict them, and they will not experience grief or sorrow.
orig: وينجي الله الذين اتقوا بمفازتهم لا يمسهم السوء ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is a Wakil (Trustee, Disposer of affairs, Guardian) over all things.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute power and authority as the sole Creator and Sustainer of all that exists. It emphasizes that He is in complete control over all affairs and nothing happens without His knowledge and permission. The Arabic word "Wakil" implies that Allah is the ultimate Trustee, Disposer of affairs, and Guardian over His creation. This instills a sense of complete reliance and trust in Allah's wisdom and plans.
orig: الله خالق كل شيء وهو على كل شيء وكيل

translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah - it is they who are the losers.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and control over the entire universe. The "keys" symbolize authority and dominion. By stating that the keys of the heavens and the earth belong to Allah, it means that He alone has the power to control and regulate all affairs in the heavens and on earth. The verse then warns those who reject Allah's signs and revelations that they are the real losers, for they have turned away from the path of truth and guidance.
orig: له مقاليد السماوات والأرض والذين كفروا بآيات الله أولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: Say, "Shall I seek a lord other than Allah, O you ignorant ones?"
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and rejecting the worship of any other deity or object. It condemns the ignorance of those who encourage the worship of anything besides Allah, the One True God, and calls upon the believers to reject such misguided beliefs and practices.
orig: قل أفغير الله تأمروني أعبد أيها الجاهلون

translation: And it was certainly revealed to you and to those before you: If you should associate anything with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers.
interpretation: This verse warns against associating partners with Allah (shirk), as it nullifies all good deeds and causes one to be among the losers in the Hereafter. It emphasizes the importance of pure monotheism (tawheed) and rejecting polytheism or idolatry of any kind. The consequence of shirk is the failure of all one's efforts and deeds, leading to a great loss in the Hereafter.
orig: ولقد أوحي إليك وإلى الذين من قبلك لئن أشركت ليحبطن عملك ولتكونن من الخاسرين

translation: Rather, worship Allah and be among the grateful.
interpretation: This verse commands the believer to single out Allah alone for worship and devotion, and to be among those who are thankful and appreciative of Allah's blessings and favors. It emphasizes the importance of sincere worship and gratitude towards the One True God.
orig: بل الله فاعبد وكن من الشاكرين

translation: And they have not appraised Allah with true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be within His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the infinite might and greatness of Allah. It highlights that people have failed to truly comprehend Allah's absolute power and majesty. On the Day of Resurrection, the entire earth will be under His control, and the vast heavens will be folded by His right hand, a metaphor for His supreme authority. Allah is far exalted above any partners or associates that are wrongfully ascribed to Him.
orig: وما قدروا الله حق قدره والأرض جميعا قبضته يوم القيامة والسماوات مطويات بيمينه سبحانه وتعالى عما يشركون

translation: And the Trumpet will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown a second time, and at once they will be standing, looking on.
interpretation: "This verse describes the events of the Day of Resurrection. The first blowing of the Trumpet will cause all living beings in the heavens and the earth to die, except those whom Allah wills to exempt. The second blowing will resurrect all of them, and they will stand up, awaiting their judgment."
orig: ونفخ في الصور فصعق من في السماوات ومن في الأرض إلا من شاء الله ثم نفخ فيه أخرى فإذا هم قيام ينظرون

translation: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the Book will be placed, and the Prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and judgment will be passed between them with truth, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse describes the events on the Day of Resurrection. The "light of its Lord" refers to the manifestation of Allah's glory and majesty on that Day. The "Book" likely refers to the record of deeds of all people. The Prophets and witnesses will be summoned to testify, and Allah will judge everyone justly and with truth, without any injustice or wrongdoing.
orig: وأشرقت الأرض بنور ربها ووضع الكتاب وجيء بالنبيين والشهداء وقضي بينهم بالحق وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and He is fully aware of what they do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of individual accountability and divine justice. Each person will be fully recompensed for their deeds, whether good or bad, on the Day of Judgment. Nothing will be overlooked or left unaccounted for, as Allah is All-Knowing and fully aware of everyone's actions and intentions. This serves as a reminder to be mindful of our conduct and strive to do righteous deeds, as we will ultimately face the consequences.
orig: ووفيت كل نفس ما عملت وهو أعلم بما يفعلون

translation: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups till, when they arrive there, its gates will be opened and its keepers will say to them, 'Did there not come to you messengers from among yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?' They will say, 'Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers.'
interpretation: This verse describes the fate of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. They will be driven to Hell in groups, and when they arrive, the gates of Hell will open for them. The keepers of Hell will remind them that messengers from among themselves had come to recite the verses of Allah and warn them about this Day. The disbelievers will admit that messengers did come, but they will say that the punishment has become due upon them because of their disbelief.
orig: وسيق الذين كفروا إلى جهنم زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها فتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم رسل منكم يتلون عليكم آيات ربكم وينذرونكم لقاء يومكم هذا قالوا بلى ولكن حقت كلمة العذاب على الكافرين

translation: It will be said (to them): "Enter the gates of Hell to abide therein forever." How wretched is the residence of the arrogant!
interpretation: This verse warns against arrogance and pride, which lead to eternal damnation in Hellfire. It serves as a stern reminder that those who reject faith and exhibit arrogance towards God's commands will be condemned to a miserable and eternal abode in Hell. The verse emphasizes the grave consequences of arrogance and encourages humility, submission, and obedience to God.
orig: قيل ادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: And those who feared their Lord will be led to Paradise in crowds until, when they arrive at it while its gates have been opened and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally [therein]"
interpretation: This verse describes the honorable reception and eternal bliss that awaits the righteous believers in Paradise. Those who had consciousness of Allah and avoided disobeying Him will be ushered into Paradise in groups. When they arrive, the gates will be wide open to welcome them. The angelic gatekeepers will greet them with the blessed words "Peace be upon you," indicating the state of tranquility they will experience. They will be told that they have attained purity through their faith and righteous deeds, thus making them worthy of entering this everlasting abode of joy and serenity.
orig: وسيق الذين اتقوا ربهم إلى الجنة زمرا حتى إذا جاءوها وفتحت أبوابها وقال لهم خزنتها سلام عليكم طبتم فادخلوها خالدين

translation: And they will say, 'Praise be to Allah, who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us inherit the land, establishing ourselves in Paradise wherever we wish. So excellent is the reward of the workers.'
interpretation: This verse describes the grateful praise and joy of the believers when they enter Paradise. They acknowledge Allah's fulfillment of His promise to grant them Paradise and allow them to dwell wherever they desire as a reward for their righteous deeds and efforts in this world. It emphasizes the tremendous reward awaiting those who strive in obedience to Allah.
orig: وقالوا الحمد لله الذي صدقنا وعده وأورثنا الأرض نتبوأ من الجنة حيث نشاء فنعم أجر العاملين

translation: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, glorifying with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, 'Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when the angels will be surrounding the Throne of Allah, praising and glorifying Him. The judgment will be carried out with absolute justice and truth, and all will acknowledge and declare that all praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
orig: وترى الملائكة حافين من حول العرش يسبحون بحمد ربهم وقضي بينهم بالحق وقيل الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Ha Meem
interpretation: These two Arabic letters are among the mysterious letters that appear at the beginning of some chapters in the Qur'an. They are known as the "Muqatta'aat" or "Disconnected Letters." Their exact meaning is unknown to humans, but they are believed to be a sign of the divine origin of the Qur'an and a reminder of Allah's infinite knowledge and wisdom. Some scholars suggest they may represent divine names or concepts, or serve as an introductory oath, but their true significance is known only to Allah.
orig: حم

translation: This is the revelation of the Book from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah, Who is Almighty and Wise. It emphasizes the divine origin and authority of the Qur'an, and that it is a source of guidance from the One Who is Exalted in Power and Perfect in Wisdom.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز العليم

translation: The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance, the Severe in punishment, the Possessor of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the final return.
interpretation: This verse highlights four key attributes of Allah: His forgiveness towards those who sincerely repent, His acceptance of repentance, His stern punishment for those who persist in disbelief and sin, and His infinite bounties and blessings. It emphasizes the Oneness of God and that our ultimate return and accountability is to Him alone.
orig: غافر الذنب وقابل التوب شديد العقاب ذي الطول لا إله إلا هو إليه المصير

translation: None dispute the signs of Allah except those who disbelieve, so do not be deceived by their movements across the lands.
interpretation: This verse warns against being deceived by the apparent success or prosperity of the disbelievers. It states that those who reject the signs and revelations of Allah are the ones who argue and dispute them. Their temporary movements and activities in different lands should not mislead the believers, as their ultimate end will be unfavorable due to their disbelief.
orig: ما يجادل في آيات الله إلا الذين كفروا فلا يغررك تقلبهم في البلاد

translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and the confederates after them; and every nation purposed against their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by means of falsehood to rebut thereby the truth, therefore I seized them, so how was My punishment?
interpretation: Allah is saying that the disbelievers of Mecca are not the first to reject the truth and persecute the messengers. The people of Noah and the confederates (of disbelievers) after them also denied their messengers and tried to seize them unjustly. They argued falsely to suppress the truth. But Allah seized them with a severe punishment, as a warning to those who deny His messengers.
orig: كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح والأحزاب من بعدهم وهمت كل أمة برسولهم ليأخذوه وجادلوا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق فأخذتهم فكيف كان عقاب

translation: And thus the Word of your Lord is justified against those who disbelieved that they are the dwellers of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the punishment of Hell has become an inevitability for those who disbelieved in Allah and rejected His signs and messengers. Their disbelief and rejection of faith has sealed their fate, and they will be among the inhabitants of the Fire on the Day of Judgment. This is a fulfillment of Allah's warning and a manifestation of His justice.
orig: وكذلك حقت كلمت ربك على الذين كفروا أنهم أصحاب النار

translation: Those who bear the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse describes the angels who carry Allah's Throne, and those around it, glorifying and praising Allah, believing in Him, and seeking forgiveness for the believers. They acknowledge Allah's vast mercy and knowledge, and pray for those who have repented and followed the right path to be forgiven and saved from the punishment of Hell.
orig: الذين يحملون العرش ومن حوله يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويؤمنون به ويستغفرون للذين آمنوا ربنا وسعت كل شيء رحمة وعلما فاغفر للذين تابوا واتبعوا سبيلك وقهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication asking Allah to admit the believers and their righteous family members into the eternal gardens of Paradise, which He has promised them. It highlights Allah's attribute of being the Almighty and the Wise, whose promises are always fulfilled and whose judgments are based on complete wisdom and justice.
orig: ربنا وأدخلهم جنات عدن التي وعدتهم ومن صلح من آبائهم وأزواجهم وذرياتهم إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: And protect them from the evil consequences (of their deeds). And he who is protected from the evil consequences that Day - He has certainly attained mercy. And that is the great attainment.
interpretation: Allah instructs the believers to seek His protection from the evil consequences of their sins and misdeeds on the Day of Judgment. Whoever is saved from punishment on that Day has truly attained Allah's mercy and forgiveness, which is the greatest success and triumph one could ever achieve.
orig: وقهم السيئات ومن تق السيئات يومئذ فقد رحمته وذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved are called to [something] greater than their aversion to Allah. They used to deny the truth when it came to them, but there will be more denial.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers' rejection of faith is rooted in an aversion greater than their aversion to themselves. Their denial of the truth stems from a deep-seated opposition to Allah and His guidance, which exceeds even their self-interest. Despite being called to embrace faith, they persist in disbelief, compounding their denial with each new revelation that comes to them.
orig: إن الذين كفروا ينادون لمقت الله أكبر من مقتكم أنفسكم إذ تدعون إلى الإيمان فتكفرون

translation: They will say: 'Our Lord! You have made us die twice, and You have given us life twice, and we confess our sins. So is there any way out?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the state of people on the Day of Judgment. They will acknowledge that they were born into this world, lived their lives, and then died (the first death). Then they were resurrected for the final reckoning on the Day of Judgment (the second life). At that point, they will confess their sins and wrongdoings during their worldly lives. However, they will question if there is any way out or any chance for salvation after admitting their mistakes.
orig: قالوا ربنا أمتنا اثنتين وأحييتنا اثنتين فاعترفنا بذنوبنا فهل إلى خروج من سبيل

translation: That is because when Allah alone was invoked, you disbelieved; but if others were associated with Him, you believed. Judgment belongs only to Allah, the Most High, the Greatest.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the polytheists for their inconsistent beliefs. They rejected the message of worshipping Allah alone, but readily accepted associating partners with Him. The interpretation highlights that judgment and authority belong solely to Allah, Who is the Most High and Greatest, emphasizing His supremacy over all others.
orig: ذلكم بأنه إذا دعي الله وحده كفرتم وإن يشرك به تؤمنوا فالحكم لله العلي الكبير

translation: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down for you provision from the sky, but none will be reminded except those who turn back [to Allah].
interpretation: Allah is the One who reveals His signs and evidence of His existence and Oneness through the wonders of creation. He is the Provider who sends down sustenance from the sky in the form of rain, which enables the growth of crops and vegetation that nourish humans and animals. However, only those who turn to Allah in repentance, submission, and obedience will truly benefit from these signs and provisions by reflecting upon them and being guided to the truth.
orig: هو الذي يريكم آياته وينزل لكم من السماء رزقا وما يتذكر إلا من ينيب

translation: So call upon Allah, being sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to worship Allah alone with sincere devotion and dedication, setting aside any polytheistic beliefs or practices. It emphasizes that one should remain steadfast in their sincere worship of Allah, even if the disbelievers oppose or dislike this pure monotheistic belief and way of life.
orig: فادعوا الله مخلصين له الدين ولو كره الكافرون

translation: Exalted in ranks, Owner of the Throne, He casts the Spirit from His command upon whom He wills of His servants, to warn of the Day of Meeting.
interpretation: Allah is the Most High, the Owner of the mighty Throne. He sends down the revelation, which is the Holy Spirit, upon whomever He chooses from among His servants and messengers. This is to warn people about the Day of Resurrection, when all will be gathered before Allah.
orig: رفيع الدرجات ذو العرش يلقي الروح من أمره على من يشاء من عباده لينذر يوم التلاق

translation: On the Day when they will be exposed, nothing of them will be hidden from Allah. To whom belongs the kingdom this Day? To Allah, the One, the Irresistible.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when all human beings will stand before Allah, and nothing of their deeds, intentions or innermost thoughts will be hidden from Him. The rhetorical question "To whom belongs the kingdom this Day?" emphasizes that on that great Day, all sovereignty and absolute dominion will belong solely to Allah, the One and Only God, the Irresistible and Supreme over all His creation.
orig: يوم هم بارزون لا يخفى على الله منهم شيء لمن الملك اليوم لله الواحد القهار

translation: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice will there be today. Verily, Allah is Swift in reckoning.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, every person will be fully recompensed for their deeds in this world, whether good or evil. There will be no injustice or wrong judgment, as Allah's reckoning is perfect and swift. The consequences of one's actions will be manifested clearly, leaving no room for doubt or unfairness."
orig: اليوم تجزى كل نفس بما كسبت لا ظلم اليوم إن الله سريع الحساب

translation: And warn them of the Approaching Day, when hearts will be at the throats, choking. The wrongdoers will have no devoted friend nor any intercessor who is obeyed.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the terrifying Day of Resurrection, when hearts will be filled with extreme fear and anxiety, to the point that they will feel like they are choking in their throats. On that Day, the wrongdoers who rejected faith will have no close friend to support them, nor any intercessor whose intercession will be accepted, as they had rejected the truth in this worldly life.
orig: وأنذرهم يوم الآزفة إذ القلوب لدى الحناجر كاظمين ما للظالمين من حميم ولا شفيع يطاع

translation: He knows the treacherous looks and what the breasts conceal.
interpretation: Allah knows the intentions behind people's glances and what is hidden in their hearts, even if they try to conceal their true motives and feelings.
orig: يعلم خائنة الأعين وما تخفي الصدور

translation: And Allah judges with truth, while those they invoke besides Him cannot judge with anything. Indeed, it is Allah who is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute authority and sovereignty in judging and passing verdicts. It highlights that only Allah has the power to judge with truth and justice, while those who are worshipped besides Him, such as idols or false deities, have no ability to judge or make any decisions. The verse affirms that Allah is All-Hearing, being aware of all supplications and prayers, and All-Seeing, being fully cognizant of all actions and intentions. This underscores Allah's perfect knowledge and wisdom in rendering judgments fairly and equitably.
orig: والله يقضي بالحق والذين يدعون من دونه لا يقضون بشيء إن الله هو السميع البصير

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how the end was for those before them? They were greater than them in strength and left firmer traces in the land, but Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector from Allah.
interpretation: This verse is calling people to reflect on the fate of previous nations who were more powerful and left more impressive traces on earth than the present generation. However, due to their sins and disobedience to Allah, they were seized and punished by Him, and there was no one to protect them from Allah's punishment. The verse serves as a reminder that worldly power and achievements are temporary, and true success lies in obeying Allah and avoiding sins that incur His wrath.
orig: أولم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين كانوا من قبلهم كانوا هم أشد منهم قوة وآثارا في الأرض فأخذهم الله بذنوبهم وما كان لهم من الله من واق

translation: That is because their messengers came to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allah seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in penalty.
interpretation: The reason for their destruction was that the messengers came to them with clear signs and evidences, but they rejected the truth and disbelieved. Consequently, Allah punished them for their disbelief and disobedience, for He is truly Mighty and capable of inflicting a severe punishment on those who defy Him.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كانت تأتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فكفروا فأخذهم الله إنه قوي شديد العقاب

translation: And We certainly sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah sending Prophet Moses with clear miracles and undeniable proofs of his prophethood, granting him the authority and power to confront Pharaoh and deliver the message of Allah. The "clear authority" signifies the confidence, courage, and divine support given to Moses to fulfill his mission without fear or hesitation.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا وسلطان مبين

translation: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun, but they said: 'A lying sorcerer!'
interpretation: This verse refers to the rejection and disbelief of the powerful leaders like Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun towards the message brought by Prophet Moses. Despite the clear signs and miracles shown to them, they arrogantly dismissed Moses as a "lying sorcerer", refusing to accept the truth and submit to the One True God.
orig: إلى فرعون وهامان وقارون فقالوا ساحر كذاب

translation: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, 'Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive.' But the plot of the disbelievers is not except in error.
interpretation: This verse refers to the opposition and hostility faced by the believers from the disbelievers. When the truth of the divine message was presented to the disbelievers, instead of accepting it, they plotted to kill the sons of the believers and enslave their women. This cruel and unjust plan was a manifestation of their misguidance and deviation from the truth.
orig: فلما جاءهم بالحق من عندنا قالوا اقتلوا أبناء الذين آمنوا معه واستحيوا نساءهم وما كيد الكافرين إلا في ضلال

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'Leave me to kill Moses, and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption to appear in the land.'
interpretation: Pharaoh's statement reflects his arrogance, tyranny, and fear of losing power and control over the Israelites. He perceives Moses as a threat to his authority and the established order, fearing that Moses' message and call to worship the One True God will undermine the polytheistic beliefs prevalent in Egypt at the time. Pharaoh also accuses Moses of potentially causing "corruption" in the land, likely referring to social unrest or disruption of the status quo. His desire to kill Moses stems from his unwillingness to relinquish his oppressive rule and his rejection of the divine message brought by Moses.
orig: وقال فرعون ذروني أقتل موسى وليدع ربه إني أخاف أن يبدل دينكم أو أن يظهر في الأرض الفساد

translation: And Moses said: "I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."
interpretation: This verse refers to Moses seeking protection from Allah against arrogant disbelievers who deny the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes the importance of humility before God and belief in accountability on the Last Day.
orig: وقال موسى إني عذت بربي وربكم من كل متكبر لا يؤمن بيوم الحساب

translation: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, 'Would you kill a man because he says, 'My Lord is Allah' and he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.'
interpretation: This verse refers to a man from Pharaoh's household who secretly believed in Moses' message. He tried to reason with Pharaoh and his people, questioning why they would kill a man simply for professing faith in Allah and bringing clear signs from Him. He argued that if Moses was lying, the consequences would be upon Moses himself, but if he was truthful, they would face some of the punishments he warned them about. The man pointed out that Allah does not guide transgressors and liars like Pharaoh.
orig: وقال رجل مؤمن من آل فرعون يكتم إيمانه أتقتلون رجلا أن يقول ربي الله وقد جاءكم بالبينات من ربكم وإن يك كاذبا فعليه كذبه وإن يك صادقا يصبكم بعض الذي يعدكم إن الله لا يهدي من هو مسرف كذاب

translation: "O my people! Yours is the dominion today, you being dominant in the land. But who will help us against the Might of Allah, should it reach us?" Fir'aun said: "I did not show you but what I see myself and I do not guide you but to the Path of Right Policy."
interpretation: Fir'aun is boasting about his power and dominion over the land, and questioning who can help against Allah's punishment if it comes to them. He claims that he only shows them what he sees himself and guides them to the right path, which is a false claim as he was misguiding his people from the true path of worshipping Allah alone.
orig: يا قوم لكم الملك اليوم ظاهرين في الأرض فمن ينصرنا من بأس الله إن جاءنا قال فرعون ما أريكم إلا ما أرى وما أهديكم إلا سبيل الرشاد

translation: And the one who believed said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies,
interpretation: The interpretation is that the believer is warning his people about the severe punishment and fate that awaited the disbelieving nations before them, like the punishment that befell the confederates (al-Ahzab) who united against the Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims, but were ultimately defeated by Allah's help.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم إني أخاف عليكم مثل يوم الأحزاب

translation: Like the practice of the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them. And Allah does not intend any injustice for His servants.
interpretation: This verse draws a parallel between the persistent disbelief and rejection of the truth by the people being addressed, and the arrogant defiance of previous nations like the people of Noah, 'Aad, and Thamud, who were utterly destroyed for their obstinacy. It serves as a stern warning that if they persist in their ways, they may meet a similar fate. However, the verse also affirms that Allah does not desire to wrong or oppress anyone unjustly; rather, people bring punishment upon themselves through their own stubborn rejection of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: مثل دأب قوم نوح وعاد وثمود والذين من بعدهم وما الله يريد ظلما للعباد

translation: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Calling.
interpretation: "The verse warns the people about the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be called to account for their deeds. The prophet is expressing his concern for his people, fearing that they may face punishment on that Day due to their disbelief or wrongdoings. It serves as a reminder to heed the warnings and embrace faith and righteousness."
orig: ويا قوم إني أخاف عليكم يوم التناد

translation: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; no defender will you have from Allah, and whoever Allah sends astray - for him there is no guide.
interpretation: This verse warns of the dreadful state of those who turn away from the truth on the Day of Resurrection. They will flee in terror, with no one to protect or defend them from Allah's punishment. And those whom Allah allows to deviate from the straight path will have no one to guide them, for they had rejected true guidance in this world.
orig: يوم تولون مدبرين ما لكم من الله من عاصم ومن يضلل الله فما له من هاد

translation: And verily, there came to you Joseph before with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of that which he did bring to you, until when he died, you said: 'No messenger will Allâh send after him.' Thus Allâh leaves astray him who is a musrif (a polytheist, an opressor, a criminal, a sinner, etc.) and a murtâb (one who doubts Allâh's Warnings and His Oneness).
interpretation: This verse refers to the story of Prophet Joseph (Yusuf) and how the people doubted his message and clear signs, even after he had passed away. It serves as a reminder that Allah guides those who have faith and leaves astray those who are excessive in their disbelief, oppression, and doubts.
orig: ولقد جاءكم يوسف من قبل بالبينات فما زلتم في شك مما جاءكم به حتى إذا هلك قلتم لن يبعث الله من بعده رسولا كذلك يضل الله من هو مسرف مرتاب

translation: Those who argue about the signs of Allah without any authority having come to them, there is great hatred with Allah and with those who believe. Thus does Allah set a seal on every heart arrogant, tyrant.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who argue against the signs and revelations of Allah without any valid proof or authority. Their arrogance and rejection of faith earns them Allah's hatred and the hatred of the believers. Allah seals the hearts of those who are arrogant and oppressive, preventing them from accepting the truth.
orig: الذين يجادلون في آيات الله بغير سلطان أتاهم كبر مقتا عند الله وعند الذين آمنوا كذلك يطبع الله على كل قلب متكبر جبار

translation: And Pharaoh said, 'O Haman, build me a tower that I may reach the ways, the ways of the heavens, and look at the God of Moses, for indeed, I think he is a liar.'
interpretation: Pharaoh's arrogance and pride led him to order Haman to build a lofty tower, thinking that it would enable him to reach the heavens and see the God that Moses worshipped. This demonstrates Pharaoh's delusion, ignorance, and rejection of the truth brought by Moses, peace be upon him.
orig: وقال فرعون يا هامان ابن لي صرحا لعلي أبلغ الأسباب

translation: The (mind) aroused him to seek to frustrate the signs of Allah, but I will draw him on little by little (to ruin): for his arrogance carries him off wickedly.
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh's arrogance and disbelief in Allah's signs and messengers. His arrogance and evil deeds were made appealing to him, causing him to obstruct others from the right path. However, Allah promises to gradually lead Pharaoh to his downfall due to his wicked behavior and arrogance.
orig: أسباب السماوات فأطلع إلى إله موسى وإني لأظنه كاذبا وكذلك زين لفرعون سوء عمله وصد عن السبيل وما كيد فرعون إلا في تباب

translation: And the one who believed said, 'O my people, follow me; I will guide you to the way of right conduct.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the person who believed in the message of the Prophet Moses, addressing his people to follow the path of guidance and righteousness as instructed by Moses. The interpretation is that one should listen to the truth and follow the guidance of the messengers of God, abandoning falsehood and misguidance.
orig: وقال الذي آمن يا قوم اتبعون أهدكم سبيل الرشاد

translation: O my people, this worldly life is only a temporary enjoyment, and the Hereafter is the permanent abode.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the worldly life is temporary and fleeting, and that true happiness and eternal bliss can only be found in the Hereafter. It encourages believers to focus on the everlasting life to come rather than being consumed by the transient pleasures of this world, which are merely a "temporary enjoyment." The verse reminds us that the real and permanent abode is the Hereafter, where we will be held accountable for our deeds in this life.
orig: يا قوم إنما هذه الحياة الدنيا متاع وإن الآخرة هي دار القرار

translation: Whoever does a bad deed will be repaid only for the like of it, but whoever does righteous work, whether male or female, and is a believer - those will enter Paradise, being given provision therein without account.
interpretation: This verse establishes the principle of justice and fair recompense in the Hereafter. It states that those who commit evil deeds will be requited with a punishment equal to their misdeeds, without any injustice or oppression. However, those who perform righteous deeds, regardless of their gender, and have faith, will be admitted into Paradise. There, they will be granted unlimited and unaccounted provisions and blessings as a reward for their good deeds and belief.
orig: من عمل سيئة فلا يجزى إلا مثلها ومن عمل صالحا من ذكر أو أنثى وهو مؤمن فأولئك يدخلون الجنة يرزقون فيها بغير حساب

translation: And O my people, what is [the matter] with me that I invite you to salvation while you invite me to the Fire?
interpretation: In this verse, the Prophet is addressing his people, questioning their resistance to his call to salvation and their insistence on inviting him to the path of misguidance and destruction (the Fire). He expresses bewilderment at their rejection of the truth he is conveying, which is meant to guide them to salvation and eternal bliss.
orig: ويا قوم ما لي أدعوكم إلى النجاة وتدعونني إلى النار

translation: You invite me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the contrast between the caller to disbelief and the caller to faith in Allah. The disbeliever invites to associating partners with Allah without any knowledge or proof, while the believer calls to the worship of Allah alone, who is Exalted in Might and able to forgive sins.
orig: تدعونني لأكفر بالله وأشرك به ما ليس لي به علم وأنا أدعوكم إلى العزيز الغفار

translation: Truly, to what you invite me is not deserving of response in this world or in the Hereafter. And indeed, our return is to Allah, and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the futility of being called to false beliefs or practices, as they have no value or merit in this life or in the Hereafter. It affirms that our ultimate return and accountability is to Allah, and those who transgress His limits and indulge in excesses will be among the dwellers of Hellfire.
orig: لا جرم أنما تدعونني إليه ليس له دعوة في الدنيا ولا في الآخرة وأن مردنا إلى الله وأن المسرفين هم أصحاب النار

translation: But you will remember what I am telling you, and I entrust my affair to Allah. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Prophet Muhammad is warning the disbelievers that they will eventually remember his words and realize their truth. He places his trust in Allah, who is All-Aware of the actions and intentions of His servants.
orig: فستذكرون ما أقول لكم وأفوض أمري إلى الله إن الله بصير بالعباد

translation: So Allah saved him from the evils which they plotted, and a dreadful punishment encompassed Pharaoh's people.
interpretation: "Allah protected Moses from the evil plots of Pharaoh and his people, and instead inflicted a severe punishment upon Pharaoh's people for their disbelief, arrogance, and oppression towards the Children of Israel."
orig: فوقاه الله سيئات ما مكروا وحاق بآل فرعون سوء العذاب

translation: The Fire, they are exposed to it morning and evening. And on the Day when the Hour will be established (it will be said to the angels): 'Cause Fir'aun's (Pharaoh) people to enter the severest torment.'
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers will be presented before the Hellfire repeatedly, morning and evening, as a warning and a reminder of the punishment that awaits them in the Hereafter. On the Day of Resurrection, when the Hour is established, the angels will be commanded to subject the people of Pharaoh to the most severe and excruciating torment in Hell, as a recompense for their arrogance, disbelief, and oppression.
orig: النار يعرضون عليها غدوا وعشيا ويوم تقوم الساعة أدخلوا آل فرعون أشد العذاب

translation: And when they will dispute with one another in the Fire, the weak will say to those who were arrogant, 'We were indeed your followers, so will you then relieve us of a portion of the Fire?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the argument that will take place between the weak followers and the arrogant leaders in Hellfire on the Day of Judgment. The weak will blame the arrogant for misleading them, asking if they can spare them from a share of the punishment, since they followed their ways in the worldly life. This highlights the futility of blind obedience to misguided authority figures and the individual accountability of each person for their choices and actions.
orig: وإذ يتحاجون في النار فيقول الضعفاء للذين استكبروا إنا كنا لكم تبعا فهل أنتم مغنون عنا نصيبا من النار

translation: Those who were arrogant said, 'Indeed, we are disbelievers in that which you have believed.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant and proud people who rejected the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). They openly declared their disbelief in what the believers had accepted, demonstrating their arrogance and stubbornness in rejecting the truth. Their arrogance prevented them from recognizing the truth and submitting to God's guidance.
orig: قال الذين استكبروا إنا كل فيها إن الله قد حكم بين العباد

translation: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, 'Call upon your Lord to lighten for us a day of the punishment.'
interpretation: This verse serves as a reminder of the intense suffering and despair that the disbelievers will experience in Hellfire. They will plead with the angels guarding Hell to call upon Allah to alleviate their punishment, even if only for a single day. However, their pleas will be in vain, as the punishment of Hell is eternal for those who rejected faith and performed evil deeds in this world. It highlights the severity of the consequences of disbelief and the importance of embracing faith and righteous conduct in this temporary life.
orig: وقال الذين في النار لخزنة جهنم ادعوا ربكم يخفف عنا يوما من العذاب

translation: They will say, 'Did there not come to you messengers from among yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?' They will say, 'Yes, indeed.' It will be said, 'Then call, but the call of the disbelievers is only in error.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers will be questioned about the messengers who came to them with clear signs and warnings. They will admit that messengers did come to them, but it will be too late for them to benefit from their message. Their calls and pleas on that Day will be in vain, as the disbelievers have chosen to remain astray in this world.
orig: قالوا أولم تك تأتيكم رسلكم بالبينات قالوا بلى قالوا فادعوا وما دعاء الكافرين إلا في ضلال

translation: Verily, We will surely aid Our Messengers and those who believe in the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand forth.
interpretation: "Allah promises to support and grant victory to His Messengers and the believers who follow them, both in this worldly life and on the Day of Resurrection when all witnesses will testify to the truth."
orig: إنا لننصر رسلنا والذين آمنوا في الحياة الدنيا ويوم يقوم الأشهاد

translation: On the Day when no excuse of the wrongdoers will avail them, and they will have the curse and the worst abode.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the excuses and pleas of the wrongdoers and oppressors will be of no benefit to them. They will be condemned and cursed, and they will have the most terrible and miserable dwelling place in the Hellfire as a punishment for their wrongdoings and disbelief.
orig: يوم لا ينفع الظالمين معذرتهم ولهم اللعنة ولهم سوء الدار

translation: And We had certainly given Moses the guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah guided Prophet Moses with revelation and teachings, and after him, the Children of Israel inherited the Scripture, which refers to the Torah. It highlights Allah's favor upon the Israelites by guiding them through His messengers and bestowing upon them the divine scripture as an inheritance to guide their lives and beliefs.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الهدى وأورثنا بني إسرائيل الكتاب

translation: A guidance and a reminder for those of understanding.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a guide and a reminder for those who possess sound intellect and understanding. It is a source of guidance that directs people towards the right path, and a reminder that helps them stay conscious of Allah's teachings and their duties as believers. The phrase "those of understanding" refers to individuals who have the ability to reflect deeply, comprehend the profound wisdom in the Qur'an, and apply its teachings to their lives.
orig: هدى وذكرى لأولي الألباب

translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.
interpretation: This verse encourages patience and steadfastness in the face of difficulties, as the promise of Allah is true and will be fulfilled. It also instructs the believer to seek forgiveness for their sins and to glorify and praise Allah at the beginning and end of each day.
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق واستغفر لذنبك وسبح بحمد ربك بالعشي والإبكار

translation: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the verses of Allah without an authority having come to them - there is not within their breasts except pride, which they will never attain. So seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.
interpretation: "The verse warns against arrogantly disputing Allah's revelations without any valid proof or authority. Such behavior stems from pride and self-conceit. Those who engage in this practice will never achieve their goal of undermining the truth. The verse advises seeking refuge in Allah, who is All-Hearing and All-Seeing, to protect oneself from such arrogance and disbelief."
orig: إن الذين يجادلون في آيات الله بغير سلطان أتاهم إن في صدورهم إلا كبر ما هم ببالغيه فاستعذ بالله إنه هو السميع البصير

translation: The creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.
interpretation: This verse highlights the magnificence of Allah's creation of the vast universe, which is far greater and more wondrous than the creation of human beings. However, most people fail to recognize and appreciate this profound truth due to their lack of knowledge and understanding.
orig: لخلق السماوات والأرض أكبر من خلق الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: Not equal are the blind and the seeing, nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little is what you remember.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who are spiritually blind and those who can see the truth are not equal. Similarly, those who believe and do good deeds are not equal to those who commit evil. It encourages people to reflect and remember the teachings, as only a few take heed and benefit from the reminders.
orig: وما يستوي الأعمى والبصير والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ولا المسيء قليلا ما تتذكرون

translation: Verily, the Hour is coming - no doubt about it, yet most people do not believe.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Resurrection, which is referred to as "the Hour". It states that there is no doubt or ambiguity about its coming, as it is an inevitable event decreed by Allah. However, despite this certainty, most people do not believe in it or live their lives in accordance with this belief. The verse serves as a reminder to have faith in the Hereafter and to prepare for it through righteous deeds and obedience to Allah.
orig: إن الساعة لآتية لا ريب فيها ولكن أكثر الناس لا يؤمنون

translation: And your Lord has said, 'Call upon Me; I will respond to you.' Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of supplicating to Allah and seeking His assistance. It promises that Allah will respond favorably to those who call upon Him sincerely. However, it also warns those who arrogantly refuse to worship and submit to Allah that they will be disgraced and admitted into Hellfire.
orig: وقال ربكم ادعوني أستجب لكم إن الذين يستكبرون عن عبادتي سيدخلون جهنم داخرين

translation: It is Allah who has made the night for you, that you may rest therein, and the day as that which helps (you) to see. Truly, Allah is full of Bounty to mankind, yet most of mankind do not give thanks.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's immense favor upon humankind by creating the night for rest and the day for vision and productivity. It reminds us of Allah's boundless grace, yet laments that most people remain ungrateful and fail to appreciate His blessings.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الليل لتسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا إن الله لذو فضل على الناس ولكن أكثر الناس لا يشكرون

translation: That is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah as the sole Creator and Sustainer of all existence. It emphasizes that there is no other true deity worthy of worship besides Allah. The question "how are you deluded?" is a rhetorical rebuke to those who associate partners with Allah or worship other than Him, as this is a clear deviation from the truth.
orig: ذلكم الله ربكم خالق كل شيء لا إله إلا هو فأنى تؤفكون

translation: Thus are deluded those who used to reject the signs of Allah.
interpretation: This verse warns against denying or rejecting the signs and revelations of Allah. Those who stubbornly reject clear evidence and guidance from Allah become deluded and misguided. Their arrogance and disbelief lead them astray from the truth and straight path.
orig: كذلك يؤفك الذين كانوا بآيات الله يجحدون

translation: It is Allah who has made for you the earth a dwelling place and the sky a canopy, and has given you shape and made your shapes good, and has provided you with good things. That is Allah, your Lord. Then blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings upon humanity. He created the earth as a suitable dwelling place and the sky as a protective canopy. He fashioned humans in the best form and provided them with pure sustenance. This emphasizes Allah's power, mercy, and lordship over all creation. The verse concludes by praising and glorifying Allah as the Lord of all the worlds.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الأرض قرارا والسماء بناء وصوركم فأحسن صوركم ورزقكم من الطيبات ذلكم الله ربكم فتبارك الله رب العالمين

translation: He is the Ever Living, there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, being sincere to Him in religion. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah, Who is the Ever-Living, the Eternal Being upon Whom all creatures depend for their existence and sustenance. It commands worshipping Him alone with sincere devotion, associating no partners with Him. It also instructs praising and thanking Allah, Who is the Cherisher and Sustainer of all the worlds.
orig: هو الحي لا إله إلا هو فادعوه مخلصين له الدين الحمد لله رب العالمين

translation: Say, "I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah once the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the core message of Islam - the worship of the One True God alone, rejecting all forms of polytheism and idol worship. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad to declare that he has been prohibited from worshipping anything or anyone other than Allah, as the clear signs and revelations have come to him from his Lord. He is commanded to submit completely to Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds.
orig: قل إني نهيت أن أعبد الذين تدعون من دون الله لما جاءني البينات من ربي وأمرت أن أسلم لرب العالمين

translation: It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, then He brings you forth as a child, then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity, then [further] that you become elders. And among you is he who is taken in death before [that], so that you reach a specified term; and perhaps you will use reason.
interpretation: This verse beautifully describes the various stages of human development, from dust to a sperm-drop, to a clinging clot, to a child, to maturity, and finally old age. It emphasizes that human life goes through different phases determined by Allah, and that we should reflect on this miraculous process and use our reason to appreciate the wisdom behind it.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم يخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا أشدكم ثم لتكونوا شيوخا ومنكم من يتوفى من قبل ولتبلغوا أجلا مسمى ولعلكم تعقلون

translation: It is He who gives life and causes death. And when He decides upon an affair, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and authority over all creation. When Allah wills something to happen, it comes into existence merely by His command "Be," without any effort or difficulty on His part. This emphasizes Allah's transcendent nature and reinforces the core Islamic belief in His Oneness and Uniqueness as the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe.
orig: هو الذي يحيي ويميت فإذا قضى أمرا فإنما يقول له كن فيكون

translation: Have you not seen those who dispute concerning the verses of Allah - how are they averted?
interpretation: This verse refers to those who argue and debate against the clear signs and revelations from Allah, rejecting the truth and turning away from it. It highlights their stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the divine guidance, despite the clear proofs presented to them. Their rejection stems from their arrogance, prejudice, or vested interests, causing them to be "averted" or turned away from the path of righteousness.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين يجادلون في آيات الله أنى يصرفون

translation: Those who denied the Book and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know,
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject the divine scriptures, such as the Qur'an, and the messengers sent by God. It implies that they will eventually come to realize the truth and face the consequences of their denial and disbelief. The tone suggests a stern warning and a promise of accountability for those who stubbornly reject God's revelations and messengers.
orig: الذين كذبوا بالكتاب وبما أرسلنا به رسلنا فسوف يعلمون

translation: When there were shackles around their necks, and the chains, they were being dragged along.
interpretation: This verse paints a vivid and haunting image of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment, bound in shackles and chains, being forcibly dragged to their punishment. It symbolizes their spiritual bondage to disbelief and sins in this world, and the inescapable consequences they will face in the Hereafter for rejecting faith and guidance.
orig: إذ الأغلال في أعناقهم والسلاسل يسحبون

translation: Then they will be plunged into the Scorching Fire.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers and wrongdoers that they will face a severe punishment in the Hereafter. The phrase "al-Hamim" refers to boiling water or a scorching fluid, and "al-Nar" refers to the Hellfire itself. The interpretation is that after facing the torment of "al-Hamim," they will be thrown into the blazing Fire of Hell, where they will be subjected to an intense and everlasting punishment for their denial of faith and evil deeds in this world.
orig: في الحميم ثم في النار يسجرون

translation: Then it will be said to them, 'Where are those you used to associate [with Him in worship]?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the polytheists and idolaters will be questioned about their false deities and partners that they associated with Allah. It highlights the futility of their beliefs and practices, as their so-called partners will be unable to help or intercede for them on that Day. The verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and the falsehood of associating partners with Him.
orig: ثم قيل لهم أين ما كنتم تشركون

translation: They will say, 'We had not associated anything [with Allah].' Rather, they had not been calling upon anything before. Thus does Allah put the disbelievers into error.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment when they will falsely claim innocence and deny their past polytheism and worship of false deities besides Allah. However, Allah knows the truth and will expose their lies. He allows the disbelievers to stray into misguidance and falsehood as a result of their stubborn rejection of faith and the clear signs presented to them.
orig: من دون الله قالوا ضلوا عنا بل لم نكن ندعو من قبل شيئا كذلك يضل الله الكافرين

translation: That is because you rejoiced unjustly upon the earth, and you were exulting in pride.
interpretation: This verse is a rebuke to the disbelievers for their arrogance and exultation in the worldly life, as they rejoiced unjustly and took pride in their wealth, power, and disbelief. Their joy and pride were misplaced because they were based on falsehood and transgression against Allah's commands. The verse warns that their unjust rejoicing and exultation in this world will lead to a severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: ذلكم بما كنتم تفرحون في الأرض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تمرحون

translation: Enter the gates of Hell to dwell therein forever. Wretched is the residence of the arrogant.
interpretation: This verse warns the arrogant and haughty against their pride and self-conceit, which will ultimately lead them to the eternal punishment of Hell. It emphasizes that those who arrogantly reject faith and guidance will face a miserable and wretched fate in the Hereafter, dwelling forever in the torment of Hell. The verse serves as a stern warning against arrogance and encourages humility, submission, and obedience to Allah.
orig: ادخلوا أبواب جهنم خالدين فيها فبئس مثوى المتكبرين

translation: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We cause you to die - unto Us they will be returned.
interpretation: "This verse encourages patience and perseverance in the face of difficulties, as the promise of Allah is true and will be fulfilled. Whether the Prophet Muhammad sees the promised punishments inflicted upon the disbelievers in this life or not, their ultimate return is to Allah, who will hold them accountable."
orig: فاصبر إن وعد الله حق فإما نرينك بعض الذي نعدهم أو نتوفينك فإلينا يرجعون

translation: And We have certainly sent messengers before you. Among them are those about whom We have related to you, and among them are those about whom We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, it will be judged with truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon be losers.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah has sent many messengers throughout history, some of whose stories are mentioned in the Qur'an while others are not. It also emphasizes that no messenger can perform miracles or bring signs except by Allah's permission. When Allah's command arrives on the Day of Judgment, the truth will be established, and those who rejected faith and denied the signs of Allah will be the ultimate losers.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا رسلا من قبلك منهم من قصصنا عليك ومنهم من لم نقصص عليك وما كان لرسول أن يأتي بآية إلا بإذن الله فإذا جاء أمر الله قضي بالحق وخسر هنالك المبطلون

translation: It is Allah who made cattle for you, some of them to ride and some of them to eat.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's blessings upon humanity by providing cattle as a means of transportation and sustenance. It emphasizes Allah's wisdom in creating animals that serve multiple purposes for human benefit, reflecting His compassion and care for His creation.
orig: الله الذي جعل لكم الأنعام لتركبوا منها ومنها تأكلون

translation: And for you in them are benefits, and so that you may reach upon them a necessity carried in your breasts, and upon them and upon the ships you are carried.
interpretation: This verse highlights the benefits that humans derive from animals, such as riding them to transport goods and reach their destinations. It also alludes to the sustenance and provisions that animals provide, carried in their bodies. Additionally, it mentions the crucial role of ships in transportation, drawing a parallel between the usefulness of animals and ships for human needs and travel.
orig: ولكم فيها منافع ولتبلغوا عليها حاجة في صدوركم وعليها وعلى الفلك تحملون

translation: And He shows you His signs, so which of the signs of Allah will you deny?
interpretation: This verse reminds us that Allah has provided numerous signs and proofs of His existence and power throughout the universe. These signs are evident in the creation of the heavens and the earth, the alternation of night and day, and the various phenomena in nature. By asking "which of the signs of Allah will you deny?", the verse challenges us to reflect upon these signs and acknowledge the greatness and sovereignty of the Creator. It urges us not to turn away from the clear proofs that surround us, but rather to embrace faith and submit to Allah's will.
orig: ويريكم آياته فأي آيات الله تنكرون

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse encourages people to reflect on the fate of previous nations who were more powerful and prosperous, but were ultimately destroyed due to their disbelief and disobedience to Allah. It serves as a reminder that worldly strength and achievements are temporary, and that true success lies in faith and righteousness. The verse emphasizes the importance of learning from history and recognizing the consequences of rejecting divine guidance.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم كانوا أكثر منهم وأشد قوة وآثارا في الأرض فما أغنى عنهم ما كانوا يكسبون

translation: But when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they exulted in the knowledge they (themselves) possessed. And that which they used to mock befell them.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that when the messengers came with clear signs and evidence from Allah, the disbelievers arrogantly boasted about the knowledge they possessed, rejecting the truth. However, the very punishment that they used to mock and make fun of eventually overtook them as a result of their disbelief and arrogance.
orig: فلما جاءتهم رسلهم بالبينات فرحوا بما عندهم من العلم وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: But when they saw Our punishment, they said, 'We believe in Allah alone and reject whatever we used to associate with Him.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who, upon witnessing the punishment or torment of Allah, profess their belief in the Oneness of Allah and renounce their previous polytheistic beliefs. However, their declaration of faith at that point is too late and is rejected, as true faith should come from sincere conviction before witnessing the punishment. The verse serves as a warning that belief must be embraced before it is too late, and that associating partners with Allah is a grave sin that must be avoided.
orig: فلما رأوا بأسنا قالوا آمنا بالله وحده وكفرنا بما كنا به مشركين

translation: But their faith could not avail them when they saw Our punishment. [Such is] the way of Allah which has preceded among His servants. And the disbelievers therein [truly] lost.
interpretation: This verse implies that faith alone is not sufficient when the punishment of Allah descends. It refers to the eternal law of Allah that has been in effect for His servants throughout time. Those who disbelieved in Allah's signs and revelations were ultimately the losers, as their faith could not save them from the consequences of their disbelief when Allah's punishment was manifested before them.
orig: فلم يك ينفعهم إيمانهم لما رأوا بأسنا سنت الله التي قد خلت في عباده وخسر هنالك الكافرون

translation: Ha Mim.
interpretation: These are two of the separated or disjointed letters that appear at the beginning of some chapters of the Qur'an. Their exact meaning is known only to Allah. They may represent divine names or serve as symbols to draw attention to the subsequent message.
orig: حم

translation: A revelation from the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah, Who is the Most Merciful and the Most Compassionate. It affirms the divine origin of the Qur'an and highlights Allah's attributes of mercy and compassion towards His creation.
orig: تنزيل من الرحمن الرحيم

translation: A Book whose verses have been clearly explained, an Arabic Quran for a people who know.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a clear and eloquent Book revealed in the Arabic language, making it accessible and understandable for those who possess knowledge and understanding of the Arabic tongue. It highlights the Qur'an's clarity, eloquence, and its revelation in the language of the Arabs, enabling comprehension for those familiar with the Arabic language.
orig: كتاب فصلت آياته قرآنا عربيا لقوم يعلمون

translation: A bearer of good tidings and a warner, but most of them turn away, so they do not listen.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent as a bearer of glad tidings for those who believe and follow the guidance, and a warner for those who disbelieve and go astray. However, most people turn away from the truth and do not listen to the Prophet's message due to their arrogance, stubbornness, or lack of understanding.
orig: بشيرا ونذيرا فأعرض أكثرهم فهم لا يسمعون

translation: And they say, "Our hearts are wrapped in coverings from what you call us to, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a partition, so work; indeed, we are working."
interpretation: "This verse refers to the stubborn attitude of the disbelievers towards the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). They claimed that their hearts were covered, preventing them from understanding the truth, and their ears were deaf to the call of Islam. They perceived an invisible barrier between themselves and the Prophet, indicating their unwillingness to accept his message. The verse implies that they were determined to persist in their ways, just as the Prophet was determined to continue preaching the message of Islam."
orig: وقالوا قلوبنا في أكنة مما تدعونا إليه وفي آذاننا وقر ومن بيننا وبينك حجاب فاعمل إننا عاملون
