translation: Say, "I am but a human being like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the humanity of the Prophet Muhammad and his role as a messenger chosen by God to convey the message of monotheism (belief in one God). It instructs the Prophet to declare that he is a human being like others, but has been divinely inspired with the revelation that there is only one true God. The verse then exhorts people to remain steadfast in their belief in the one God, to do righteous deeds, and to avoid associating any partners with God in worship. It warns those who associate others with God in worship that they will face a terrible fate.
orig: قل إنما أنا بشر مثلكم يوحى إلي أنما إلهكم إله واحد فاستقيموا إليه واستغفروه وويل للمشركين

translation: Those who do not give zakah and they are disbelievers in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who refuse to pay the obligatory zakah (alms or charity tax) and reject the belief in the Hereafter or life after death. Their denial of the Hereafter leads them to withhold zakah, which is one of the pillars of Islam. Their disbelief is manifested through this action of not fulfilling this important religious obligation. The verse highlights the connection between faith and action, implying that true faith necessitates obedience to God's commands, including paying zakah.
orig: الذين لا يؤتون الزكاة وهم بالآخرة هم كافرون

translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is a reward uninterrupted
interpretation: This verse promises an everlasting and continuous reward for those who have faith and perform good deeds. The "reward uninterrupted" refers to the eternal bliss and favors that Allah will bestow upon the believers in the Hereafter, without any interruption or decrease. It emphasizes that the reward for righteousness is not temporary or limited, but rather a perpetual state of joy and contentment in Paradise.
orig: إن الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم أجر غير ممنون

translation: Say, "Is it you who deny He who created the earth in two days, and attribute equals to Him? That is the Lord of the worlds."
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' denial of Allah, the Creator of the earth in two days, and their association of partners with Him in worship. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds, and that attributing equals or partners to Him is an act of disbelief and ingratitude.
orig: قل أئنكم لتكفرون بالذي خلق الأرض في يومين وتجعلون له أندادا ذلك رب العالمين

translation: And He placed on the earth firmly set mountains from above it, and He blessed it and determined therein its sustenance in four periods, equal for those who ask.
interpretation: Allah mentions His great blessing upon the earth by placing firmly set mountains on it to stabilize it and prevent it from shaking. He also blessed the earth with abundant provisions and determined the means of sustenance for all its inhabitants over four seasons or periods of the year, so that their needs are met equally whether they ask for it or not.
orig: وجعل فيها رواسي من فوقها وبارك فيها وقدر فيها أقواتها في أربعة أيام سواء للسائلين

translation: Then He directed Himself towards the heaven when it was smoke, and said to it and to the earth, 'Come, both of you willingly or unwillingly.' They said, 'We come willingly.'
interpretation: This verse describes the creation of the heavens and the earth. God commanded the primordial smoke that would become the heavens and the earth to come into existence, willingly or unwillingly. Both the heavens and the earth responded that they come into existence willingly, in obedience to God's command. This shows God's absolute power and authority over all of creation.
orig: ثم استوى إلى السماء وهي دخان فقال لها وللأرض ائتيا طوعا أو كرها قالتا أتينا طائعين

translation: So He completed them as seven heavens in two days and inspired in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps and as protection. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse describes how Allah created the seven heavens in two days, and assigned a specific command or role to each heaven. The nearest heaven was adorned with lamps (stars) and protected from external influences. This creation process reflects Allah's Might and Knowledge as the Exalted and All-Knowing.
orig: فقضاهن سبع سماوات في يومين وأوحى في كل سماء أمرها وزينا السماء الدنيا بمصابيح وحفظا ذلك تقدير العزيز العليم

translation: But if they turn away, then say, 'I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] 'Aad and Thamud.'
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in rejecting the message of Islam, then warn them, O Prophet, that they will face a punishment similar to the one that destroyed the ancient tribes of 'Aad and Thamud for their defiance of Allah's messengers. The "thunderbolt" refers to a severe and destructive punishment from Allah.
orig: فإن أعرضوا فقل أنذرتكم صاعقة مثل صاعقة عاد وثمود

translation: When the messengers came to them, from before them and behind them, (saying) 'Worship not but Allah,' they said, 'If our Lord had so willed, He would have sent down angels. So indeed we are disbelievers in that with which you have been sent.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the stubbornness and rejection of the disbelievers when the messengers came to them from all directions, calling them to worship Allah alone. However, they arrogantly responded that if Allah had truly willed for them to worship Him, He would have sent angels instead of human messengers. Their statement, "So indeed we are disbelievers in that with which you have been sent," shows their outright rejection of the message brought by the messengers.
orig: إذ جاءتهم الرسل من بين أيديهم ومن خلفهم ألا تعبدوا إلا الله قالوا لو شاء ربنا لأنزل ملائكة فإنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: As for 'Aad, they were arrogant in the land without right, and they said, 'Who is mightier than us in strength?' Did they not see that Allah who created them was mightier than them in strength? But they went on rejecting Our signs.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and heedlessness of the people of 'Aad. Despite being created by Allah, they became arrogant and boastful about their strength, questioning who could be mightier than them. They failed to recognize the true might of their Creator, Allah, who is infinitely greater in power than they were. Their arrogance led them to reject Allah's signs and revelations, ultimately leading to their destruction.
orig: فأما عاد فاستكبروا في الأرض بغير الحق وقالوا من أشد منا قوة أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلقهم هو أشد منهم قوة وكانوا بآياتنا يجحدون

translation: So We sent upon them a screaming wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgracing, and they will not be helped.
interpretation: "This verse describes Allah's punishment for the disbelieving people through a violent, shrieking wind that brought misery and disgrace upon them in this worldly life. However, it warns that the punishment awaiting them in the Hereafter is even more humiliating, and they will have no one to help or protect them from Allah's wrath."
orig: فأرسلنا عليهم ريحا صرصرا في أيام نحسات لنذيقهم عذاب الخزي في الحياة الدنيا ولعذاب الآخرة أخزى وهم لا ينصرون

translation: As for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so they were seized by the thunderbolt of a humiliating punishment for what they used to earn.
interpretation: "The verse refers to the people of Thamud, an ancient Arab tribe that was given guidance by Allah but chose to reject it out of arrogance and stubbornness. As a result, they were punished with a mighty blast that destroyed them completely. This punishment was a "humiliating" one because it exposed their ingratitude and rebellion against Allah's signs and messengers. The verse serves as a warning against turning away from divine guidance and indulging in sinful behavior, as it inevitably leads to severe consequences."
orig: وأما ثمود فهديناهم فاستحبوا العمى على الهدى فأخذتهم صاعقة العذاب الهون بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: And We saved those who believed and were righteous.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah saves and grants salvation to those who have faith in Him and lead a righteous life, abstaining from sins and evil deeds. It emphasizes that belief and piety are the criteria for earning Allah's protection and deliverance from harm or punishment.
orig: ونجينا الذين آمنوا وكانوا يتقون

translation: And the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered to the Fire, and they will be set in rows.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when the disbelievers and enemies of Allah will be gathered and driven towards the Hellfire. They will be arranged in rows, with no one being overlooked or left behind. This emphasizes the certainty of punishment for those who rejected faith and disobeyed Allah's commands.
orig: ويوم يحشر أعداء الله إلى النار فهم يوزعون

translation: Until, when they come to it, their hearing, their eyes and their skins will testify against them as to what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the human faculties of hearing, sight, and even the skin will bear witness against the disbelievers regarding their misdeeds and rejection of faith. It emphasizes that every part of the human being will testify to the truth, leaving no room for denial or concealment of one's actions in this world. The verse serves as a warning that all our deeds are being recorded, and we will be held accountable for them on the final Day.
orig: حتى إذا ما جاءوها شهد عليهم سمعهم وأبصارهم وجلودهم بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And they will say to their skins, 'Why did you testify against us?' They will say, 'We were made to speak by Allah, who causes all things to speak, and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.'
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when people's skins will testify against them regarding their deeds in this world. It emphasizes that Allah has given the ability to speak to all things, including our skins, and that He is the Creator who will hold us accountable for our actions. The interpretation highlights Allah's power, knowledge, and justice.
orig: وقالوا لجلودهم لم شهدتم علينا قالوا أنطقنا الله الذي أنطق كل شيء وهو خلقكم أول مرة وإليه ترجعون

translation: And you were not covering yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you thought that Allah does not know much of what you do.
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, every part of the human body will bear witness against the person's actions and deeds in this world. It emphasizes that Allah is All-Knowing and nothing is hidden from Him, even if people think their misdeeds are concealed.
orig: وما كنتم تستترون أن يشهد عليكم سمعكم ولا أبصاركم ولا جلودكم ولكن ظننتم أن الله لا يعلم كثيرا مما تعملون

translation: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has ruined you, and you became among the losers.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who make false assumptions about Allah and His attributes. It warns that such baseless assumptions will lead to spiritual ruin and being among the losers on the Day of Judgment. The interpretation emphasizes the grave consequences of having incorrect beliefs about Allah based on mere conjecture and supposition.
orig: وذلكم ظنكم الذي ظننتم بربكم أرداكم فأصبحتم من الخاسرين

translation: But if they endure patiently, the Fire will be a home for them, and if they seek to appease, they are not of those who will be excused.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and persist in disbelief that if they remain patient upon their ways, then the Hellfire will be their ultimate abode and dwelling place. However, if they seek to make amends or repentance, it will not be accepted from them, for they are not among those whose repentance is accepted due to their stubborn rejection of faith.
orig: فإن يصبروا فالنار مثوى لهم وإن يستعتبوا فما هم من المعتبين

translation: And We have appointed for them companions who made alluring to them what was before them and what was behind them, and the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon them among nations that had previously passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن الله قيض للكفار قرناء من الشياطين يزينون لهم أعمالهم الباطلة، ويحسنون لهم ما قدموا وما أخروا من الأعمال الشريرة. وقد حق عليهم القول بالعذاب كما حق على الأمم السابقة من الجن والإنس الذين كانوا على ضلال مثلهم. فهم خاسرون في الدنيا والآخرة بسبب كفرهم وإتباعهم للشياطين.
orig: وقيضنا لهم قرناء فزينوا لهم ما بين أيديهم وما خلفهم وحق عليهم القول في أمم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والإنس إنهم كانوا خاسرين

translation: And those who disbelieved say, 'Do not listen to this Qur'an and make noise during its recitation so that you may overcome.'
interpretation: The disbelievers are instructing others not to listen attentively to the Qur'an, but rather to make noise and distractions during its recitation. Their aim is to prevent people from being influenced by the divine message, as they fear it may cause them to abandon their false beliefs and "overcome" their disbelief.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا لا تسمعوا لهذا القرآن والغوا فيه لعلكم تغلبون

translation: So We will surely make those who disbelieve taste a severe punishment, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that they will face a severe punishment from Allah for rejecting faith and engaging in evil deeds. It emphasizes that Allah will recompense them fully for the worst of their actions, leaving no evil deed unpunished. The interpretation highlights Allah's justice and the inevitable consequences of disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: فلنذيقن الذين كفروا عذابا شديدا ولنجزينهم أسوأ الذي كانوا يعملون

translation: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah - the Fire. For them will be the home of eternity as recompense for what they used to deny Our verses.
interpretation: This verse describes the ultimate punishment for those who reject Allah's signs and deny His revelations. The "recompense" or "reward" for being enemies of Allah is the eternal Fire of Hell. They will abide there forever as a fitting recompense for their disbelief and rejection of Allah's clear signs and revelations.
orig: ذلك جزاء أعداء الله النار لهم فيها دار الخلد جزاء بما كانوا بآياتنا يجحدون

translation: And those who disbelieved will say, 'Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men so we may put them under our feet that they will be among the lowest.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment who will blame those who misguided them, whether from among the jinn or humans. They will ask Allah to expose those who led them astray so that they can trample them underfoot and humiliate them, making them among the most disgraced and degraded beings.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا ربنا أرنا اللذين أضلانا من الجن والإنس نجعلهما تحت أقدامنا ليكونا من الأسفلين

translation: Indeed, those who have said, 'Our Lord is Allah' and then remained firm [on that path], the angels will descend upon them, [saying], 'Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.'
interpretation: This verse promises that those who sincerely believe in the Oneness of Allah and remain steadfast on the path of faith and righteousness, will receive the glad tidings from the angels that they should have no fear or grief, and that they will be rewarded with Paradise as promised by Allah.
orig: إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا تتنزل عليهم الملائكة ألا تخافوا ولا تحزنوا وأبشروا بالجنة التي كنتم توعدون

translation: We are your allies in the present life and in the Hereafter. You will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you call for.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that Allah is their protector and helper in this life and the next. In this world, they will be granted whatever their souls desire of permissible pleasures, and in the Hereafter, they will attain whatever they call for of eternal bliss and closeness to Allah.
orig: نحن أولياؤكم في الحياة الدنيا وفي الآخرة ولكم فيها ما تشتهي أنفسكم ولكم فيها ما تدعون

translation: It is a descent from the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah, who is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful. It highlights the divine origin and merciful nature of the Qur'anic teachings, emphasizing that they come from the source of infinite forgiveness and mercy.
orig: نزلا من غفور رحيم

translation: And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allah and does righteous deeds and says, 'Indeed, I am of the Muslims'?
interpretation: This verse highlights the virtues of those who call others to the path of Allah through their speech and actions. The best speech is that which invites people to submit to Allah's will and follow His guidance, accompanied by righteous deeds that serve as a practical example. Such individuals declare their sincere belief in Islam, aligning their words with their deeds. This verse encourages Muslims to be ambassadors of the faith through their words and conduct.
orig: ومن أحسن قولا ممن دعا إلى الله وعمل صالحا وقال إنني من المسلمين

translation: And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and between him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.
interpretation: This verse teaches us to respond to evil with good. When someone wrongs us, we should not retaliate with more evil, but rather respond with kindness and forgiveness. By doing so, we may transform enmity into friendship, as the verse states that the one who was an enemy will become "as though he was a devoted friend."
orig: ولا تستوي الحسنة ولا السيئة ادفع بالتي هي أحسن فإذا الذي بينك وبينه عداوة كأنه ولي حميم

translation: And none can receive it except those who are patient, and none can receive it except the one having a great portion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of patience and perseverance in order to attain the wisdom and guidance contained in the Qur'an. Only those who exercise patience and steadfastness can truly comprehend and benefit from its teachings. Additionally, it highlights that the ability to receive and understand the Qur'an is a great blessing bestowed upon the fortunate ones who have been granted a profound understanding by Allah.
orig: وما يلقاها إلا الذين صبروا وما يلقاها إلا ذو حظ عظيم

translation: And if an evil suggestion comes to you from Satan, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believer to seek refuge in Allah whenever an evil thought or whisper from Satan enters their mind. It reminds us that Allah is All-Hearing, aware of even our innermost thoughts, and All-Knowing, fully aware of Satan's plots and deceptions. By seeking Allah's protection, we can resist the temptations and doubts planted by Satan and remain steadfast in our faith and obedience to Allah.
orig: وإما ينزغنك من الشيطان نزغ فاستعذ بالله إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: And among His signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostrate to Allah, who created them, if it should be Him that you worship.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of worshipping Allah alone and not associating partners with Him. The night, day, sun, and moon are signs of Allah's power and greatness, but they are merely creations and should not be worshipped themselves. Instead, one should prostrate and submit to Allah, the Creator of all these signs and the One who deserves true worship and devotion.
orig: ومن آياته الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر لا تسجدوا للشمس ولا للقمر واسجدوا لله الذي خلقهن إن كنتم إياه تعبدون

translation: But if they are too arrogant, then those who are with your Lord glorify Him night and day, and never grow weary.
interpretation: If the disbelievers persist in their arrogance and refuse to believe, they should not think that their arrogance will prevent Allah's creation from worshipping and glorifying Him. There are countless beings in the heavens and on earth that glorify Allah day and night, without ever becoming tired or bored of doing so. Their constant praise and worship of Allah is a manifestation of His greatness and majesty, and a reminder that His glory is not diminished by the disbelief of those who are too arrogant to submit to Him.
orig: فإن استكبروا فالذين عند ربك يسبحون له بالليل والنهار وهم لا يسأمون

translation: And among His Signs is that you see the earth barren, but when We send down water upon it, it thrills and swells. Verily, He Who gives it life, surely is Able to give life to the dead. Indeed, He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's power and ability to give life. The barren and lifeless earth is used as an example to show how Allah can revive it by sending down rain, causing it to become fertile and lush with vegetation. Just as He brings life to the dead earth, He has the power to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment. This verse affirms Allah's complete control and capability over all things."
orig: ومن آياته أنك ترى الأرض خاشعة فإذا أنزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت إن الذي أحياها لمحيي الموتى إنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: Indeed, those who blaspheme against Our verses are not hidden from Us. So, for him who is cast into the Fire, or him who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: Allah warns those who deny or reject His revelations that they are not hidden from Him, and He will hold them accountable. The rhetorical question posed contrasts the miserable state of those cast into Hellfire with those who come securely on the Day of Resurrection due to their faith and righteous deeds. It emphasizes that one's ultimate outcome depends on one's choices and actions in this life, as Allah is fully Aware of what people do.
orig: إن الذين يلحدون في آياتنا لا يخفون علينا أفمن يلقى في النار خير أم من يأتي آمنا يوم القيامة اعملوا ما شئتم إنه بما تعملون بصير

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved in the Reminder after it had come to them... And indeed, it is a mighty Book.
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who reject the Qur'an, described as "the Reminder" or "the Message," after it has been revealed to them, are committing a grave error. The Qur'an is described as a "mighty Book," emphasizing its immense importance and inviolability.
orig: إن الذين كفروا بالذكر لما جاءهم وإنه لكتاب عزيز

translation: Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from after it; [it is] a revelation from a [Lord who is] Wise and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the authenticity and divine origin of the Qur'an. It states that falsehood cannot enter it from any direction, neither from the beginning nor the end. This affirms that the Qur'an is free from any contradictions or errors, as it is a revelation from Allah, Who is All-Wise and Worthy of all praise.
orig: لا يأتيه الباطل من بين يديه ولا من خلفه تنزيل من حكيم حميد

translation: Nothing is said to you except what was said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your Lord is a possessor of forgiveness and a possessor of painful penalty.
interpretation: This verse reassures the Prophet Muhammad that the opposition and rejection he faces from his people is not unique, but a common experience shared by previous prophets. It highlights two key attributes of God: His forgiveness for those who repent and believe, and His severe punishment for those who persist in disbelief and disobedience. The verse serves as a reminder of God's mercy and justice, encouraging the Prophet to remain patient and steadfast in conveying the divine message.
orig: ما يقال لك إلا ما قد قيل للرسل من قبلك إن ربك لذو مغفرة وذو عقاب أليم

translation: And if We had made it a non-Arabic Qur'an, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail? A non-Arabic and an Arab?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure. And those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place."
interpretation: The interpretation is that the Qur'an being revealed in Arabic is a mercy from Allah, as it was meant for the Arabs who would have rejected it if it was in a foreign language. For the believers, it is a guidance and cure for their spiritual ailments. But for the disbelievers, it is as if they are deaf and blind to its message, unable to comprehend it, as they are being called from a distant place, i.e. far from the truth.
orig: ولو جعلناه قرآنا أعجميا لقالوا لولا فصلت آياته أأعجمي وعربي قل هو للذين آمنوا هدى وشفاء والذين لا يؤمنون في آذانهم وقر وهو عليهم عمى أولئك ينادون من مكان بعيد

translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Book, but differences arose concerning it. And were it not for a Word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning it, in disquieting doubt.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah gave the Torah to Prophet Moses, but the people differed in their understanding and application of it. If it were not for Allah's prior decree to delay judgment until the Day of Resurrection, the matter would have been settled between them in this world. However, the disbelievers remain in disturbing doubt regarding the truth of the Torah.
orig: ولقد آتينا موسى الكتاب فاختلف فيه ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لقضي بينهم وإنهم لفي شك منه مريب

translation: Whoever does a good deed, it is for his own soul, and whoever does evil, it is against it, and your Lord is not unjust to (His) servants.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual responsibility and accountability. Each person is responsible for their own actions, whether good or bad. Good deeds benefit the doer, while evil actions harm the perpetrator. Allah is just and does not wrong anyone. The consequences of our actions are upon ourselves.
orig: من عمل صالحا فلنفسه ومن أساء فعليها وما ربك بظلام للعبيد

translation: To Him is referred the knowledge of the Hour. And fruits emerge not from their coverings, nor does a female conceive or deliver except with His knowledge. And on the Day when He will call to them, "Where are My 'partners'?" they will say, "We announce to You that there is none among us who can testify."
interpretation: Allah alone has the knowledge of when the Hour of Resurrection will come. Nothing happens in this universe without His knowledge and permission, not even the emergence of a fruit from its bud or the conception and delivery of a child. On the Day of Judgment, Allah will question the polytheists about the partners they associated with Him, and they will have no answer, admitting that none of their so-called partners can bear witness on their behalf.
orig: إليه يرد علم الساعة وما تخرج من ثمرات من أكمامها وما تحمل من أنثى ولا تضع إلا بعلمه ويوم يناديهم أين شركائي قالوا آذناك ما منا من شهيد

translation: And what they used to invoke before will be abandoned by them, and they will be certain that they have no refuge.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the false deities and idols that the disbelievers used to worship will abandon them, and they will realize that there is no way to escape from Allah's punishment for their polytheistic beliefs and actions.
orig: وضل عنهم ما كانوا يدعون من قبل وظنوا ما لهم من محيص

translation: Man does not get tired of supplicating for good, but when evil afflicts him, he becomes hopeless and despairing.
interpretation: This verse highlights the nature of human beings. They persistently ask for good things from Allah, but when faced with difficulties or hardships, they quickly lose hope and become despondent. It reminds us to have patience and trust in Allah during trying times, and not to give in to despair.
orig: لا يسأم الإنسان من دعاء الخير وإن مسه الشر فيئوس قنوط

translation: And if We give him a taste of mercy from Us after an adversity which has touched him, he will surely say, "This is due to me, and I do not think the Hour will occur. And if I am returned to my Lord, indeed, for me there will be with Him the best." But We will surely inform those who disbelieved about what they did, and We will surely make them taste a massive punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and ingratitude of disbelievers. If Allah bestows His mercy upon them after facing difficulties, they become arrogant and attribute this blessing to their own efforts, denying the coming of the Day of Resurrection. However, Allah warns that He will inform them of their misdeeds and make them taste a severe punishment for their disbelief and arrogance.
orig: ولئن أذقناه رحمة منا من بعد ضراء مسته ليقولن هذا لي وما أظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رجعت إلى ربي إن لي عنده للحسنى فلننبئن الذين كفروا بما عملوا ولنذيقنهم من عذاب غليظ

translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.
interpretation: This verse highlights the ingratitude and forgetfulness of human beings. When Allah bestows His blessings and favors upon them, they turn away arrogantly and become heedless of their Lord. However, when adversity strikes or they face hardship, they immediately turn to earnest supplication and prayer, seeking Allah's help and mercy.
orig: وإذا أنعمنا على الإنسان أعرض ونأى بجانبه وإذا مسه الشر فذو دعاء عريض

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if the Qur'an was from Allah and you disbelieved in it, who would be more astray than one who is in extreme dissension?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the grave consequences of rejecting the Qur'an if it is truly from Allah. It poses a rhetorical question, asking who could be more misguided than those who defy Allah's revelation while being fully aware of its divine origin. The verse warns against stubbornly persisting in disbelief and dissension, which leads to the utmost misguidance and distance from the truth.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن كان من عند الله ثم كفرتم به من أضل ممن هو في شقاق بعيد

translation: We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. But is it not sufficient concerning your Lord that He is, over all things, a Witness?
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will manifest clear signs and evidence of His existence, power, and oneness through the marvels of the universe and within the human being itself. These signs will become apparent to those who reflect, until the truth becomes evident to them. However, even if they fail to recognize these signs, it does not diminish Allah's status as the All-Witnessing over all things. His knowledge and wisdom encompass everything, even if some people remain heedless.
orig: سنريهم آياتنا في الآفاق وفي أنفسهم حتى يتبين لهم أنه الحق أولم يكف بربك أنه على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Unquestionably, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Unquestionably, He is encompassing all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who deny the Resurrection and the meeting with their Lord are in a state of doubt and confusion. However, it affirms that Allah encompasses all things with His knowledge and power, including the inevitable reality of the Resurrection and the accountability of all people before Him.
orig: ألا إنهم في مرية من لقاء ربهم ألا إنه بكل شيء محيط

translation: Ha Meem.
interpretation: These two Arabic letters "Ha" and "Meem" are among the Huroof Al-Muqatta'at (Disconnected Letters) which occur at the beginning of several chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah, but scholars suggest they could be abbreviations, symbols, or oaths used to draw attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an and its inimitable linguistic style.
orig: حم

translation: He loved excessively
interpretation: This verse refers to the excessive love or infatuation that one may feel towards something or someone. It warns against being consumed by worldly desires and attachments, as they can lead one astray from the path of righteousness and spiritual fulfillment. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of moderation and maintaining a balanced approach in one's emotions and attachments.
orig: عسق

translation: Thus has Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise, revealed to you as He revealed to those before you.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the revelation of the Qur'an to Prophet Muhammad is a continuation of the same divine guidance that was sent to previous prophets. It emphasizes the unity of the source, Allah the Almighty and All-Wise, and the universality of the message, despite being revealed at different times and places. The description of Allah as "al-'Azeez" (the Exalted in Might) and "al-Hakeem" (the Wise) highlights His power and wisdom in choosing His messengers and revealing His guidance.
orig: كذلك يوحي إليك وإلى الذين من قبلك الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute ownership and sovereignty over the entire universe and everything within it. It emphasizes His transcendent majesty and greatness, describing Him as "the Most High" and "the Most Great." The interpretation highlights Allah's supreme authority, power, and magnificence over all creation, instilling a sense of reverence and submission to the One who controls and sustains all existence.
orig: له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العلي العظيم

translation: The heavens are almost torn apart from above them, and the angels glorify the praises of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is Allah who is the Perpetual Forgiver, the Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights the immense glory and majesty of Allah, which is so great that even the heavens are almost torn apart in awe of it. The angels constantly glorify and praise their Lord, recognizing His perfection and absolute sovereignty. Additionally, they seek forgiveness on behalf of those on earth, acknowledging the weakness and shortcomings of human beings. However, the verse emphasizes that Allah is the Perpetual Forgiver and the Merciful, always ready to pardon those who turn to Him in repentance and seek His forgiveness.
orig: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن من فوقهن والملائكة يسبحون بحمد ربهم ويستغفرون لمن في الأرض ألا إن الله هو الغفور الرحيم

translation: But those who take protectors besides Him [say], 'We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allah in position.' Indeed, Allah will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allah does not guide he who is a liar and a disbeliever.
interpretation: This verse addresses those who associate partners with Allah in worship, claiming that they only worship idols, saints or other deities to bring them closer to Allah. However, Allah rejects this argument and states that He will judge between them regarding their differences. The verse emphasizes that Allah does not guide those who are liars and disbelievers in associating partners with Him.
orig: والذين اتخذوا من دونه أولياء الله حفيظ عليهم وما أنت عليهم بوكيل

translation: And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn the Mother of Cities and those around it, and warn of the Day of Assembling, about which there is no doubt - a party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universality of the Qur'an's message. It was revealed in Arabic, the language of the Prophet Muhammad's people, but its warning is meant for all of humanity, represented by "the Mother of Cities" (Mecca) and those around it. The "Day of Assembling" refers to the Day of Judgment, when all people will be gathered and divided into two groups: those destined for Paradise and those for Hell. The certainty of this event is emphasized, leaving no room for doubt.
orig: وكذلك أوحينا إليك قرآنا عربيا لتنذر أم القرى ومن حولها وتنذر يوم الجمع لا ريب فيه فريق في الجنة وفريق في السعير

translation: And if Allah had willed, He could have made them one community, but He admits whom He wills to His mercy. And the wrongdoers have no protector or helper.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty and wisdom. He has the power to make all people one united community, but He has chosen to create diversity among humankind, admitting whomever He wills into His mercy based on their faith and righteousness. The wrongdoers who persist in disbelief and transgression have no protector or helper to save them from Allah's punishment."
orig: ولو شاء الله لجعلهم أمة واحدة ولكن يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمون ما لهم من ولي ولا نصير

translation: Or have they taken protectors besides Him? But Allah is the Protector, and it is He Who gives life to the dead, and He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is questioning whether the disbelievers have taken other deities besides Him as protectors. He then affirms that He alone is the true Protector and the One Who gives life to the dead. Moreover, He has power over all things and nothing is impossible for Him.
orig: أم اتخذوا من دونه أولياء فالله هو الولي وهو يحيي الموتى وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: And whatever you disagree over, its ruling is for Allah. That is Allah, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that any matter of disagreement or dispute should be referred to Allah and His judgment, as He is the Supreme Authority and the One upon Whom we should rely and to Whom we should turn for guidance and forgiveness.
orig: وما اختلفتم فيه من شيء فحكمه إلى الله ذلكم الله ربي عليه توكلت وإليه أنيب

translation: The Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you mates from among yourselves, and for the cattle (also) mates, by means of which He multiplies you. There is nothing like Him, and He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer.
interpretation: This verse highlights the unique creative power of Allah, Who has created pairs or mates from among humans and animals for the purpose of procreation and multiplication. It emphasizes that Allah is absolutely unique and incomparable, and that He is All-Hearing and All-Seeing, aware of everything in His creation.
orig: فاطر السماوات والأرض جعل لكم من أنفسكم أزواجا ومن الأنعام أزواجا يذرؤكم فيه ليس كمثله شيء وهو السميع البصير

translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts it. Indeed, He is Ever All-Aware of everything.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and control over all creation. He alone possesses the "keys" or authority over the heavens and the earth, meaning He is the sole Sustainer and Provider. He bestows His provisions generously upon whomever He wills, and restricts it from whomever He wills, according to His perfect wisdom and knowledge. Allah is fully aware of all things, including the needs and circumstances of His servants. This verse instills trust in Allah as the Supreme Sustainer and Disposer of affairs.
orig: له مقاليد السماوات والأرض يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر إنه بكل شيء عليم

translation: He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].
interpretation: Allah has prescribed the same religion for all prophets - to worship Him alone and establish His religion. The followers of these prophets should not divide into sects. Associating partners with Allah is a grave matter which the polytheists are invited to abandon. Allah chooses whom He wills to guide to the right path, and guides those who turn to Him in repentance.
orig: شرع لكم من الدين ما وصى به نوحا والذي أوحينا إليك وما وصينا به إبراهيم وموسى وعيسى أن أقيموا الدين ولا تتفرقوا فيه كبر على المشركين ما تدعوهم إليه الله يجتبي إليه من يشاء ويهدي إليه من ينيب

translation: But they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them, through jealous oppression among themselves. And were it not for a Word that preceded from your Lord until an appointed term, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are surely in grave doubt concerning it.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن الناس لم يختلفوا ويتفرقوا في الدين إلا بعد أن جاءهم العلم والحقيقة، ولكن بغياً وحسداً بينهم. ولولا أن الله سبحانه وتعالى أمهلهم إلى أجل معين لحسم الخلاف بينهم. والذين ورثوا الكتاب المقدس من بعد الأنبياء هم في شك وريب من الحقيقة بسبب اختلافهم.
orig: وما تفرقوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك إلى أجل مسمى لقضي بينهم وإن الذين أورثوا الكتاب من بعدهم لفي شك منه مريب

translation: So for that reason, invite (people to God) and stand firm as you are commanded, and do not follow their desires. And say: 'I believe in the Book that God has sent down, and I am commanded to do justice among you. God is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. There is no argument between us and you. God will gather us together, and to Him is the final return.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to invite people to the truth and remain steadfast on the right path, without being influenced by the desires of the disbelievers. It affirms belief in the Qur'an as the revealed Book of God and the command to maintain justice. It emphasizes that each person is accountable for their own deeds and that there is no room for dispute between believers and disbelievers, as God will ultimately gather and judge all people.
orig: فلذلك فادع واستقم كما أمرت ولا تتبع أهواءهم وقل آمنت بما أنزل الله من كتاب وأمرت لأعدل بينكم الله ربنا وربكم لنا أعمالنا ولكم أعمالكم لا حجة بيننا وبينكم الله يجمع بيننا وإليه المصير

translation: And those who argue concerning Allah after He has been responded to, their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who stubbornly argue against the truth of Allah's religion after clear proofs have been presented to them. Their arguments are futile and have no substance in the sight of Allah. They have incurred Allah's anger and a severe punishment awaits them for their obstinacy and rejection of faith.
orig: والذين يحاجون في الله من بعد ما استجيب له حجتهم داحضة عند ربهم وعليهم غضب ولهم عذاب شديد

translation: It is Allah who has sent down the Book in truth and the balance. And what will make you know? Perhaps the Hour is near.
interpretation: Allah has revealed the Qur'an, which contains the truth and establishes justice and fairness. The "balance" refers to justice, equity, and the criterion to judge between right and wrong. This verse reminds us that the Day of Judgment may be near, so we should prepare for it by following the guidance of the Qur'an and living righteously.
orig: الله الذي أنزل الكتاب بالحق والميزان وما يدريك لعل الساعة قريب

translation: Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it, but those who believe are apprehensive from fear of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are far astray.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrasting attitudes towards the Day of Resurrection. The disbelievers mockingly seek to hasten its arrival, while the believers approach it with reverence and fear, fully aware of its reality. It emphasizes that those who deny or dispute the inevitability of the Hour are in grave misguidance, far removed from the truth.
orig: يستعجل بها الذين لا يؤمنون بها والذين آمنوا مشفقون منها ويعلمون أنها الحق ألا إن الذين يمارون في الساعة لفي ضلال بعيد

translation: Allah is Subtle with His servants. He gives provisions to whom He wills. And He is the All-Powerful, the Almighty.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's subtle and compassionate dealings with His servants. He bestows sustenance and provisions upon whomever He wills, according to His infinite wisdom and mercy. At the same time, Allah is the All-Powerful, the Almighty, emphasizing His absolute control and authority over all affairs. This verse reminds us of Allah's care and generosity towards His creation, while also affirming His supreme might and sovereignty.
orig: الله لطيف بعباده يرزق من يشاء وهو القوي العزيز

translation: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but he has no share in the Hereafter.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the Hereafter over the temporary pleasures of this worldly life. It promises an increase in spiritual rewards for those who strive for the Hereafter, while those who solely pursue worldly gains will receive a limited share in this life but have no portion in the everlasting bliss of the Hereafter. It encourages believers to have the right intentions and focus on pleasing Allah to attain eternal success.
orig: من كان يريد حرث الآخرة نزد له في حرثه ومن كان يريد حرث الدنيا نؤته منها وما له في الآخرة من نصيب

translation: Or have they partners with Allah who have instituted for them a religion which Allah has not allowed? And had it not been for a decisive word, it would have been judged between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is questioning whether the polytheists have any partners who have legislated religious laws for them that Allah has not permitted. This is a rhetorical question implying that their partners have no authority to legislate religious matters. It also warns that if it were not for Allah's wisdom and decree to delay the punishment, the polytheists would have been judged and punished immediately for their wrongdoing. The verse emphasizes that those who commit injustice by associating partners with Allah will face a severe and painful punishment.
orig: أم لهم شركاء شرعوا لهم من الدين ما لم يأذن به الله ولولا كلمة الفصل لقضي بينهم وإن الظالمين لهم عذاب أليم

translation: You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will befall them. But those who believe and do righteous deeds will be in the meadows of the Gardens. For them is whatever they will with their Lord. That is the great bounty.
interpretation: This verse contrasts the state of the wrongdoers and the believers on the Day of Judgment. The wrongdoers will be filled with fear and dread due to the recompense of their evil deeds which will inevitably befall them. On the other hand, the believers who performed righteous deeds will be in the lush gardens of Paradise, enjoying whatever blessings they desire from their Lord. This is the ultimate favor and great bounty from Allah for those who had faith and did good.
orig: ترى الظالمين مشفقين مما كسبوا وهو واقع بهم والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات في روضات الجنات لهم ما يشاءون عند ربهم ذلك هو الفضل الكبير

translation: It is He who gives glad tidings to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say: 'I ask of you no reward for it except the affection due to relatives.' And whoever earns a good deed, We shall add more good to it for him. Surely, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciative.
interpretation: This verse highlights the glad tidings of Allah for the believers who do good deeds. The Prophet is instructed to say that he does not seek any reward from the people except that they maintain good relations with their relatives. Additionally, Allah promises to increase the reward for those who do good deeds, as He is Most Forgiving and Most Appreciative of the good actions of His servants.
orig: ذلك الذي يبشر الله عباده الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات قل لا أسألكم عليه أجرا إلا المودة في القربى ومن يقترف حسنة نزد له فيها حسنا إن الله غفور شكور

translation: Or do they say, "He has fabricated a lie against Allah?" But if Allah wills, He can seal your heart. And Allah wills away falsehood and vindicates the truth by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah questions whether the disbelievers accuse the Prophet Muhammad of fabricating lies against Allah. If Allah wills, He can seal the heart of the Prophet against their accusations, making him impervious to their words. Allah eliminates falsehood and establishes the truth through His words and revelations. Allah is fully aware of what is in the hearts and minds of people.
orig: أم يقولون افترى على الله كذبا فإن يشإ الله يختم على قلبك ويمح الله الباطل ويحق الحق بكلماته إنه عليم بذات الصدور

translation: And He is the One who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons the evil deeds, and He knows what you do.
interpretation: Allah accepts the sincere repentance of His servants and forgives their sins and misdeeds. He is fully aware of all our actions, whether good or bad, and nothing is hidden from Him.
orig: وهو الذي يقبل التوبة عن عباده ويعفو عن السيئات ويعلم ما تفعلون

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - He will increase them from His bounty. But for the disbelievers there is a severe punishment.
interpretation: This verse highlights the contrasting outcomes for believers and disbelievers. For those who have faith and perform good deeds, Allah promises to increase them in His favors and blessings. However, for those who reject faith, a severe punishment awaits them.
orig: ويستجيب الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات ويزيدهم من فضله والكافرون لهم عذاب شديد

translation: And if Allah were to enlarge the provision for His servants, they would surely rebel in the earth, but He sends it down by measure as He wills. Surely He is All-Aware, All-Seer of His servants.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's wisdom and mercy in providing sustenance to His servants in a measured and controlled manner. If He were to provide unlimited provisions, people would become arrogant, rebellious, and transgress on earth. However, Allah sends down provisions according to His will and knowledge, as He is fully aware of the needs and circumstances of His servants. This measured provision serves as a test and a means to prevent rebellion and corruption on earth."
orig: ولو بسط الله الرزق لعباده لبغوا في الأرض ولكن ينزل بقدر ما يشاء إنه بعباده خبير بصير

translation: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's infinite mercy and power. After people lose hope in receiving rain, Allah sends it down as a sign of His grace and compassion. The rain symbolizes the reviving of the land and the renewal of life. Additionally, the verse emphasizes that Allah is the Protector who guards and sustains His creation, and the Praiseworthy, deserving of all praise for His bountiful blessings.
orig: وهو الذي ينزل الغيث من بعد ما قنطوا وينشر رحمته وهو الولي الحميد

translation: And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's immense power as the Creator of the heavens, the earth, and all living creatures that inhabit them. It emphasizes that just as Allah has the ability to create and scatter life throughout the universe, He also has the power to gather all creatures whenever He wills. This verse instills a sense of awe towards Allah's absolute control over His creation and reminds us of His might and omnipotence.
orig: ومن آياته خلق السماوات والأرض وما بث فيهما من دابة وهو على جمعهم إذا يشاء قدير

translation: And whatever misfortune befalls you, it is because of what your own hands have earned. And He pardons much.
interpretation: This verse indicates that any calamity or misfortune that befalls a person is a result of their own actions and sins. However, Allah is Merciful and pardons many of our sins and mistakes. It emphasizes the concept of individual responsibility for one's actions and the consequences they bring, while also highlighting Allah's forgiveness and mercy.
orig: وما أصابكم من مصيبة فبما كسبت أيديكم ويعفو عن كثير

translation: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth, and you have not besides Allah any guardian or helper
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that human beings do not have the power to escape or evade Allah's will and plan on earth. They have no protector or helper other than Allah who can aid them against His decree or provide them with safety and security apart from Him.
orig: وما أنتم بمعجزين في الأرض وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير

translation: And among His Signs are the ships sailing through the sea like mountains.
interpretation: This verse draws attention to the ships sailing on the sea as a sign of Allah's power and majesty. It likens the ships to mountains, highlighting their immense size and stability as they navigate the vast oceans. This serves as a reminder of Allah's ability to create and control the forces of nature, enabling these massive vessels to traverse the seas safely. It also alludes to the human ingenuity and technological advancements facilitated by Allah, allowing people to build ships capable of carrying heavy loads across great distances.
orig: ومن آياته الجوار في البحر كالأعلام

translation: If He wills, He can calm the wind, and they would remain motionless upon its surface. Surely in this are signs for everyone who is patient and grateful.
interpretation: Allah's power over the universe is evident in His ability to calm the winds and make ships remain motionless on the surface of the sea. This demonstrates His complete control and authority over all creation. For those who patiently observe and reflect on these signs with gratitude, they will find evidence of Allah's existence and greatness.
orig: إن يشأ يسكن الريح فيظللن رواكد على ظهره إن في ذلك لآيات لكل صبار شكور

translation: Or He will punish them for what they have earned, and pardon much.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has the power to either punish people for their misdeeds and sins, or to pardon them and forgive many of their wrongdoings out of His infinite mercy and grace. It implies that while people may deserve punishment for their actions, Allah's forgiveness and pardon are also vast and available to those who repent and seek His forgiveness.
orig: أو يوبقهن بما كسبوا ويعف عن كثير

translation: And those who dispute concerning Our verses - they will know that they have no refuge.
interpretation: This verse warns those who argue against and reject Allah's signs and revelations that they have no escape or refuge from His punishment on the Day of Judgment. Their arrogant denial of the truth will not save them from being held accountable for their disbelief and disobedience.
orig: ويعلم الذين يجادلون في آياتنا ما لهم من محيص

translation: Whatever you have been given is but a passing enjoyment of the present life, but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the pleasures, wealth, and possessions of this worldly life are temporary and fleeting. The true and everlasting bliss is with Allah, reserved for those who have faith and put their trust in Him. The believers who rely on Allah and follow His guidance will attain a far greater and eternal reward in the Hereafter.
orig: فما أوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وما عند الله خير وأبقى للذين آمنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون

translation: And those who avoid major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to refrain from committing grave sins and indecent acts, and to cultivate the noble quality of forgiveness. Even when provoked to anger, they are urged to respond with pardon and forbearance, rather than retaliation or holding grudges. This highlights the importance of self-control, restraint, and magnanimity in the face of adversity or wrongdoing by others.
orig: والذين يجتنبون كبائر الإثم والفواحش وإذا ما غضبوا هم يغفرون

translation: And those who have responded to their Lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend.
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have answered the call of Allah and established regular prayer. It also highlights the importance of mutual consultation (shura) in their affairs, indicating a participatory and consultative approach to decision-making. Additionally, it praises their willingness to spend from the provisions bestowed upon them by Allah, reflecting their generosity and commitment to charitable acts.
orig: والذين استجابوا لربهم وأقاموا الصلاة وأمرهم شورى بينهم ومما رزقناهم ينفقون

translation: And those who, when an oppressive wrong is done to them, they defend themselves.
interpretation: This verse refers to the principle of legitimate self-defense. It allows Muslims to defend themselves against oppression and transgression, but only to the extent necessary to repel the aggression and not exceed proper limits. The interpretation encourages a measured and proportionate response to injustice, without resorting to excessive retaliation or initiating hostilities. It upholds the right to self-preservation while emphasizing restraint and avoidance of escalating conflicts beyond what is required for protection.
orig: والذين إذا أصابهم البغي هم ينتصرون

translation: And the recompense for an evil is an evil like thereof; but whosoever pardons and makes reconciliation, his reward is with Allah. Verily, He loves not the wrongdoers.
interpretation: "The interpretation is that if someone harms you, you are permitted to retaliate in an equal manner. However, it is better to forgive and reconcile, as Allah loves those who pardon others and make peace. The reward for forgiveness is with Allah, as He does not love the wrongdoers who persist in harming others without repentance."
orig: وجزاء سيئة سيئة مثلها فمن عفا وأصلح فأجره على الله إنه لا يحب الظالمين

translation: And those who, after being oppressed, fought back - there is no way against them.
interpretation: This verse affirms that those who defend themselves after being wronged or oppressed are not to be blamed or considered transgressors. It justifies self-defense as a legitimate response to oppression and injustice. The interpretation implies that the use of force is permitted as a means of resistance against tyranny and aggression, but only as a reactive measure and not as an initiator of hostilities.
orig: ولمن انتصر بعد ظلمه فأولئك ما عليهم من سبيل

translation: The way is only against those who oppress people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن العقاب الشديد مقصور فقط على الذين يظلمون الناس ويتجاوزون حدودهم في الأرض بغير وجه حق. فالعذاب الأليم مخصص لهؤلاء الظالمين والمتجبرين الذين لا يلتزمون بالحق والعدل.
orig: إنما السبيل على الذين يظلمون الناس ويبغون في الأرض بغير الحق أولئك لهم عذاب أليم

translation: And for whoever perseveres and forgives, indeed that is from the firmness of affairs.
interpretation: This verse encourages patience and forgiveness, which are signs of a strong and resolute character. It suggests that being able to persevere through difficulties and forgive others' mistakes or offenses is a quality of those who are determined and firm in their affairs and decisions. The verse implies that exhibiting such virtues requires a strong will and steadfastness, which are essential for overcoming challenges and maintaining good relationships with others.
orig: ولمن صبر وغفر إن ذلك لمن عزم الأمور

translation: And whoever Allah sends astray, for him there is no protector beyond that. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they sight the punishment, saying, 'Is there any way to return?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those whom Allah allows to go astray will have no one to guide or protect them after that. It also depicts the regretful state of the wrongdoers when they witness the punishment, wishing for a chance to return and make amends, but it will be too late.
orig: ومن يضلل الله فما له من ولي من بعده وترى الظالمين لما رأوا العذاب يقولون هل إلى مرد من سبيل

translation: And you will see them being exposed to it, humbled from (extreme) humility, looking with a stealthy glance. And those who had believed will say, 'Indeed, the losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment.'
interpretation: This verse describes the humiliating scene that the disbelievers will face on the Day of Judgment when they are brought before the Hellfire. They will be utterly humbled, casting furtive glances out of fear and shame. The believers, on the other hand, will declare that the true losers are those who lost themselves and their families by denying the truth, for they will be condemned to an everlasting punishment as a consequence of their wrongdoing.
orig: وتراهم يعرضون عليها خاشعين من الذل ينظرون من طرف خفي وقال الذين آمنوا إن الخاسرين الذين خسروا أنفسهم وأهليهم يوم القيامة ألا إن الظالمين في عذاب مقيم

translation: And they had no allies to aid them other than Allah, and whoever Allah leads astray - for him there is no way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that disbelievers have no true protectors or helpers besides Allah. No one can guide those whom Allah allows to go astray, as they have deviated from the straight path and have no means to find guidance.
orig: وما كان لهم من أولياء ينصرونهم من دون الله ومن يضلل الله فما له من سبيل

translation: Respond to your Lord before there comes a Day which cannot be averted from Allah. You will have no refuge on that Day, nor any denial.
interpretation: This verse is a call to respond to Allah's commands and guidance before the Day of Resurrection arrives, when it will be too late and there will be no escape or denial of the truth. It emphasizes the urgency of heeding Allah's message and making the most of the opportunity in this worldly life before facing the inevitable reckoning.
orig: استجيبوا لربكم من قبل أن يأتي يوم لا مرد له من الله ما لكم من ملجإ يومئذ وما لكم من نكير

translation: But if they turn away, then We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [responsibility for] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.
interpretation: Si les mécréants se détournent de ton message, ne t'en afflige pas, car ta mission n'est que de transmettre le message de Dieu. Tu n'es pas responsable de les guider de force. Lorsque Dieu accorde Ses bienfaits à l'être humain, celui-ci se réjouit. Mais lorsqu'un malheur l'atteint à cause de ses propres péchés, il devient ingrat envers Dieu et oublie Ses faveurs antérieures.
orig: فإن أعرضوا فما أرسلناك عليهم حفيظا إن عليك إلا البلاغ وإنا إذا أذقنا الإنسان منا رحمة فرح بها وإن تصبهم سيئة بما قدمت أيديهم فإن الإنسان كفور

translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He wills. He bestows female [children] upon whom He wills, and bestows male [children] upon whom He wills.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and power as the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. He has the authority to create whatever He wills, including granting children, whether male or female, to whomever He chooses. This emphasizes that children are a gift from Allah, and that gender is determined solely by His will, not by human desire or intervention. The verse instills a sense of humility, acceptance, and gratitude towards Allah's wisdom and decree.
orig: لله ملك السماوات والأرض يخلق ما يشاء يهب لمن يشاء إناثا ويهب لمن يشاء الذكور

translation: Or He bestows both males and females, and He leaves barren whom He wills: for He is full of Knowledge and Power.
interpretation: Allah has complete power and control over His creation. He decides who will have children, whether males or females, and who will remain childless. This demonstrates Allah's infinite wisdom and ability to do as He pleases with His creation.
orig: أو يزوجهم ذكرانا وإناثا ويجعل من يشاء عقيما إنه عليم قدير

translation: And it is not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a veil or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the transcendent nature of Allah and the way He communicates with human beings. It states that no human can directly speak to Allah, except through revelation, from behind a veil, or through a messenger sent by Allah. This highlights the vast distance between the Creator and the created, and the need for divine guidance through chosen messengers. The verse also affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and wisdom in deciding what to reveal to humanity."
orig: وما كان لبشر أن يكلمه الله إلا وحيا أو من وراء حجاب أو يرسل رسولا فيوحي بإذنه ما يشاء إنه علي حكيم

translation: And thus We have sent to you (O Muhammad) a revelation of Our command. You did not know what is the Book or what is Faith, but We have made it a light wherewith We guide whosoever We will of Our slaves. And verily, you (O Muhammad) are indeed guiding mankind to the Straight Path.
interpretation: Allah is telling the Prophet Muhammad that He has revealed the Qur'an to him as a guidance and light. The Prophet did not know about the divine scripture or true faith before, but Allah made the Qur'an a source of guidance for whomever He wills from His servants. And indeed, the Prophet guides people to the straight and right path.
orig: وكذلك أوحينا إليك روحا من أمرنا ما كنت تدري ما الكتاب ولا الإيمان ولكن جعلناه نورا نهدي به من نشاء من عبادنا وإنك لتهدي إلى صراط مستقيم

translation: The path of Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah all matters are returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Oneness of Allah and His absolute sovereignty over the entire universe. It reminds us that Allah is the sole owner and controller of everything in the heavens and on earth, and that ultimately all affairs and matters will return to Him for judgment and accountability. The "path of Allah" refers to the straight path of faith, obedience, and submission to His commands and teachings. It is a call to recognize Allah's authority and to live according to His guidance, as all of our actions and deeds will be judged by Him in the end.
orig: صراط الله الذي له ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ألا إلى الله تصير الأمور

translation: Ha Meem.
interpretation: These two Arabic letters are among the "Muqatta'at" or "disjointed letters" that appear at the beginning of some chapters of the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah, but scholars have offered interpretations such as: "These letters are signs from Allah" or "They represent the perfect speech and words of Allah."
orig: حم

translation: And the Book that makes things clear
interpretation: This refers to the Qur'an, which is a clear and enlightening Book that guides humanity towards the truth and distinguishes between right and wrong. It is a source of guidance and a means to attain righteousness and salvation.
orig: والكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the divine wisdom behind revealing the Qur'an in the Arabic language. The Arabic language was chosen as it was the native tongue of the Arabs to whom the Qur'an was initially revealed. By being in a language they could comprehend without difficulty, the Arabs were given the opportunity to understand and reason with the profound teachings of the Qur'an. This highlights Allah's mercy and facilitation for humanity to grasp His message.
orig: إنا جعلناه قرآنا عربيا لعلكم تعقلون

translation: And indeed, it is in the Mother of the Book with Us, truly elevated and full of wisdom.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an has its origin in the "Mother of the Book" or "al-Lawh al-Mahfudh" which is the Preserved Tablet that contains the entire knowledge of the universe. This affirms that the Qur'an is from Allah, and it is lofty, wise, and free from any defect or contradiction.
orig: وإنه في أم الكتاب لدينا لعلي حكيم

translation: Shall We then turn away the Reminder from you, simply because you are a transgressing people?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, warning the disbelievers against rejecting the Qur'an and its teachings. It implies that they have become excessive in their disobedience and transgression, and questions whether the divine guidance and reminder should be taken away from them as a consequence of their actions. The verse serves as a stern admonition, urging the people to reflect upon their wrongdoings and return to the path of righteousness before it is too late.
orig: أفنضرب عنكم الذكر صفحا أن كنتم قوما مسرفين

translation: And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that Allah has sent numerous prophets to various nations throughout history before the advent of Prophet Muhammad. It emphasizes the continuity of Allah's guidance and mercy towards humanity by sending messengers to guide them towards the truth and the right path. The verse prompts reflection on the recurring pattern of Allah's prophets being sent to rectify people's beliefs and practices whenever they strayed from the right path.
orig: وكم أرسلنا من نبي في الأولين

translation: And no Prophet comes to them but that they used to ridicule him.
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of disbelievers throughout history, who mocked and ridiculed the Prophets sent to guide them. It serves as a reminder that rejection of the truth and mockery of God's messengers have been common patterns among those who refuse to accept guidance, despite the clear signs and proofs presented to them.
orig: وما يأتيهم من نبي إلا كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: So We destroyed those who were mightier in prowess than these, and the example of the former peoples has gone before.
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of His power and ability to destroy even the mightiest of nations who defied His commandments. The interpretation is that "no matter how powerful or strong a people may seem, if they persist in denial and disobedience towards Allah, He has the ability to utterly destroy them, just as He did with previous arrogant nations before them."
orig: فأهلكنا أشد منهم بطشا ومضى مثل الأولين

translation: And if you ask them, 'Who created the heavens and the earth?' they will surely say, 'The Exalted in Might, the Knowing, created them.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the innate belief in the existence of a Supreme Creator that is ingrained in human nature. Even those who associate partners with Allah or deny His existence, when asked about the origin of the heavens and the earth, their natural disposition will lead them to acknowledge that it is the work of the Almighty, the All-Knowing. This verse serves as a reminder of the clear signs and proofs of Allah's existence and power that are evident in the creation of the universe.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلق السماوات والأرض ليقولن خلقهن العزيز العليم

translation: It is He who has made the earth a resting place for you and has made pathways for you in it, that you may be guided.
interpretation: Allah has made the earth a suitable place for living, with its flat terrain and resources that facilitate human settlement. He has also created roads, paths, and means of transportation to help people travel and find their way. This is a sign of Allah's mercy and wisdom, guiding humanity towards the right path in their worldly affairs and spiritual journey.
orig: الذي جعل لكم الأرض مهدا وجعل لكم فيها سبلا لعلكم تهتدون

translation: And it is He who sends down rain from the sky in due measure, and We revive thereby a dead land. Thus will you be brought forth.
interpretation: Allah is the One who sends down rain in a measured amount, neither too little nor too much. With this rain, He revives dead lands that were barren and lifeless. Just as He revives the dead earth with rain, He will similarly bring you back to life after death on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: والذي نزل من السماء ماء بقدر فأنشرنا به بلدة ميتا كذلك تخرجون

translation: And it is He who created the pairs, all of them, and made for you ships and cattle on which you ride,
interpretation: Allah created all living beings in pairs, male and female, so that they can reproduce and multiply. He also provided means of transportation for humans, such as ships that sail through the seas and cattle like camels and horses that can be ridden on land. This verse highlights Allah's power as the Creator and His mercy in facilitating human life.
orig: والذي خلق الأزواج كلها وجعل لكم من الفلك والأنعام ما تركبون

translation: So that you may mount upon their backs, and then remember the favor of your Lord when you have mounted upon them, and say, 'Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have subdued it [by ourselves].'
interpretation: This verse highlights the blessings of Allah upon humanity by subjugating animals like camels and horses for our benefit. It encourages us to reflect upon and be grateful for Allah's favors when we ride these creatures, recognizing that we could not have tamed them without Allah's will and power. The verse instills a sense of humility and gratitude towards the Creator.
orig: لتستووا على ظهوره ثم تذكروا نعمة ربكم إذا استويتم عليه وتقولوا سبحان الذي سخر لنا هذا وما كنا له مقرنين

translation: And indeed, to our Lord we will return
interpretation: This verse reminds us that our existence in this world is temporary, and that we will ultimately return to our Creator, Allah. It encourages us to be mindful of our actions and to strive for righteousness, as we will be held accountable for our deeds on the Day of Judgment. The verse also instills a sense of hope and purpose, reminding us that our journey does not end with death, but rather continues in the Hereafter.
orig: وإنا إلى ربنا لمنقلبون

translation: Yet they assign to some of His servants a share with Him. Truly, man is clearly ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the polytheistic belief of associating partners with Allah in worship. It condemns the practice of assigning a portion of Allah's divinity to created beings, whether humans, angels, or idols. Such an act is a manifestation of ingratitude towards Allah, the sole Creator and Sustainer of all existence. The verse emphasizes that humans are evidently ungrateful when they engage in such polytheistic beliefs and practices.
orig: وجعلوا له من عباده جزءا إن الإنسان لكفور مبين

translation: Or has He taken, from what He creates, daughters, and chosen you with sons?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief of attributing daughters to Allah while preferring sons for themselves. It criticizes their illogical stance of ascribing to Allah what they themselves dislike, which contradicts the perfect attributes of Allah who is far above such inconsistencies.
orig: أم اتخذ مما يخلق بنات وأصفاكم بالبنين

translation: And when one of them is given good tidings of [the birth of] a female, his face remains darkened, and he suppresses grief.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the ignorant attitude of those who feel ashamed or distressed upon the birth of a daughter, considering it a disgrace. It condemns the practice of attributing imperfect qualities to Allah, the Most Merciful, by expressing displeasure at the creation He has brought into existence.
orig: وإذا بشر أحدهم بما ضرب للرحمن مثلا ظل وجهه مسودا وهو كظيم

translation: Or who originates creation, then repeats it, and who gives you sustenance from the heaven and the earth? Is there any deity with Allah? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."
interpretation: This verse questions the belief in deities other than Allah. It argues that only Allah has the power to create and sustain all of creation. The verse challenges the idolaters to provide evidence for their beliefs if they are truthful in their claims of other gods besides Allah.
orig: أومن ينشأ في الحلية وهو في الخصام غير مبين

translation: And they have made the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the pagan Arabs for their belief that angels, who are God's obedient servants, are females. It questions their logic by asking if they witnessed the creation of angels to make such a claim. It warns that their false testimony will be recorded, and they will be held accountable for it on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وجعلوا الملائكة الذين هم عباد الرحمن إناثا أشهدوا خلقهم ستكتب شهادتهم ويسألون

translation: And they say, 'If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them.' They have no knowledge of that. They are only conjecturing.
interpretation: The disbelievers claim that if Allah had willed, they would not have worshipped idols or false deities. However, their claim is baseless, as they have no knowledge or evidence to support it. They are merely making conjectures and guesses without any solid proof or divine guidance.
orig: وقالوا لو شاء الرحمن ما عبدناهم ما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يخرصون

translation: Or have We given them a Book before this to which they are holding fast?
interpretation: This verse questions whether the disbelievers were given a scripture from God before the Qur'an that justifies their rejection of the message brought by Prophet Muhammad. It implies that their denial has no valid basis and is merely a stubborn refusal to accept the truth.
orig: أم آتيناهم كتابا من قبله فهم به مستمسكون

translation: But they say: 'We found our fathers following a certain way and religion, and we guide ourselves by their footsteps.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes the blind following of ancestral traditions and customs without questioning or reasoning. It suggests that people often justify their beliefs and practices by claiming that their forefathers followed the same path, considering it a valid reason to continue those ways without reflecting on their validity or truth. The verse implies that such an attitude is misguided, as one should seek guidance through reason and contemplation rather than blindly adhering to inherited practices.
orig: بل قالوا إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مهتدون
