translation: And thus We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its wealthy ones said, 'Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of the wealthy and privileged class in rejecting the message of God's messengers. They cling to the traditions and beliefs of their forefathers, refusing to accept the truth brought by the prophets. Their attachment to the status quo and their unwillingness to change stems from their desire to preserve their wealth, power, and social standing. The verse serves as a reminder that blind adherence to inherited customs and rejection of divine guidance have been recurring patterns throughout history.
orig: وكذلك ما أرسلنا من قبلك في قرية من نذير إلا قال مترفوها إنا وجدنا آباءنا على أمة وإنا على آثارهم مقتدون

translation: Those who are endowed with knowledge say: 'If you were to bring them better guidance than what they found their forefathers following, they would still say: We reject the message you were sent with.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the obstinacy and stubbornness of those who blindly follow the traditions of their forefathers, rejecting any new guidance or truth that contradicts their inherited beliefs, even if it is better and more enlightened. It highlights the difficulty of changing deeply-rooted cultural and religious norms, as people often cling to their inherited ways out of arrogance, ignorance, or fear of change.
orig: قال أولو جئتكم بأهدى مما وجدتم عليه آباءكم قالوا إنا بما أرسلتم به كافرون

translation: So We took vengeance upon them; then see what was the end of the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe consequences that befall those who reject the truth and deny God's revelations. It implies that just as previous nations were punished for their disbelief and disobedience, those who deny the message of the Qur'an will also face a similar fate. The phrase "then see what was the end of the deniers" serves as a reminder to reflect on the ultimate outcome of those who persistently reject faith, which is often destruction and ruin.
orig: فانتقمنا منهم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المكذبين

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, 'Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship'
interpretation: Ibrahim (peace be upon him) declared his dissociation and freedom from the idolatrous beliefs and practices of his people. He rejected their worship of idols and false deities, establishing his firm belief in the Oneness of Allah.
orig: وإذ قال إبراهيم لأبيه وقومه إنني براء مما تعبدون

translation: Except for the One Who created me; and indeed, He will guide me.
interpretation: This verse indicates that true guidance comes only from Allah, the Creator. The speaker acknowledges that Allah alone has the power to guide him to the right path, and he places his trust in Allah to provide him with guidance and direction in life.
orig: إلا الذي فطرني فإنه سيهدين

translation: And He made it a Word to endure among his offspring that they might return [to Allah].
interpretation: Allah made the phrase "There is no deity but Allah" a lasting legacy among the descendants of Ibrahim (peace be upon him) so that they may return to the worship of the One True God and abandon polytheism and idol worship.
orig: وجعلها كلمة باقية في عقبه لعلهم يرجعون

translation: But We granted enjoyments to these and their forefathers until the truth came to them and a clear Messenger.
interpretation: The verse is indicating that Allah granted worldly pleasures and enjoyments to the disbelievers and their ancestors for a period of time, allowing them to indulge in their desires. However, this continued until the truth, in the form of the clear message of Islam brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, came to them. This suggests that their period of indulgence and heedlessness was temporary, and when the truth was revealed, they were held accountable for their actions.
orig: بل متعت هؤلاء وآباءهم حتى جاءهم الحق ورسول مبين

translation: And when the truth came to them, they said, 'This is magic, and indeed we are disbelievers in it.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers' rejection of the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They dismissed the Qur'an and the message of Islam as mere "magic" and declared their disbelief in it. This shows their stubbornness and unwillingness to accept the truth, even when it was presented to them clearly. They chose to remain in denial and cling to their false beliefs and practices.
orig: ولما جاءهم الحق قالوا هذا سحر وإنا به كافرون

translation: And they say, 'Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?'
interpretation: The disbelievers questioned why the Qur'an was revealed to Prophet Muhammad, who was not a man of high social standing or wealth, rather than to a prominent man from Mecca or Ta'if, the two major cities in the region. This shows their arrogance and rejection of the truth based on worldly standards rather than judging the message itself.
orig: وقالوا لولا نزل هذا القرآن على رجل من القريتين عظيم

translation: Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of your Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this world, and We raised some of them above others in ranks, so that some may employ others in their work. But the Mercy from your Lord is better than the wealth which they amass.
interpretation: هذا استفهام إنكاري، يُنكر على الكفار الذين يتصرفون كأنهم هم الذين يقسمون رحمة الله على عباده. فالله هو الذي يتفضل برحمته على من يشاء من عباده، ويقسم أرزاقهم في الدنيا حسب حكمته وتقديره، فرفع بعضهم على بعض في المنازل والأرزاق، ليتعاونوا ويستعين بعضهم بعضًا في المعاش. ولكن رحمة الله في الآخرة خير مما يجمعه الناس من متاع الدنيا الفاني.
orig: أهم يقسمون رحمت ربك نحن قسمنا بينهم معيشتهم في الحياة الدنيا ورفعنا بعضهم فوق بعض درجات ليتخذ بعضهم بعضا سخريا ورحمت ربك خير مما يجمعون

translation: And if it were not that the people would become one community, We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful - for their houses ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount
interpretation: Allah is saying that if He had not willed for people to remain as diverse nations and communities, with some believing and others disbelieving, He could have easily bestowed immense wealth and luxuries upon the disbelievers. However, this would remove the purpose of the test of faith and make everyone follow the same path without any choice or struggle. The diversity of beliefs and circumstances is a test and a means to distinguish the true believers from the disbelievers.
orig: ولولا أن يكون الناس أمة واحدة لجعلنا لمن يكفر بالرحمن لبيوتهم سقفا من فضة ومعارج عليها يظهرون

translation: And for their homes, they had doors and couches upon which they used to recline.
interpretation: This verse refers to the luxurious lifestyle enjoyed by the people of 'Ad, a powerful ancient Arab tribe. It suggests that their homes had doors, which was a sign of wealth and security, and they had couches or elevated platforms on which they would lean or recline comfortably. This portrays their affluence and indulgence in material comforts before their eventual destruction as a punishment for their arrogance and disbelief.
orig: ولبيوتهم أبوابا وسررا عليها يتكئون

translation: And ornaments of gold. But all this is only a passing enjoyment of the present life. The Hereafter with your Lord is for the God-fearing.
interpretation: The verse is reminding believers that worldly adornments and luxuries are temporary and fleeting. True and lasting bliss lies in the Hereafter, which is reserved for those who fear and obey Allah. It encourages focusing on the eternal rather than being consumed by transient worldly pleasures.
orig: وزخرفا وإن كل ذلك لما متاع الحياة الدنيا والآخرة عند ربك للمتقين

translation: And whoever is blind to the remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.
interpretation: This verse is a warning for those who turn away from remembering Allah and following His guidance. For such people, Allah assigns a devil (shaytan) who becomes their constant companion, leading them further astray and misguiding them from the straight path. The devil's role is to make evil appear appealing and to prevent the person from seeing the truth, keeping them in spiritual blindness and away from Allah's mercy and guidance.
orig: ومن يعش عن ذكر الرحمن نقيض له شيطانا فهو له قرين

translation: And indeed they do turn them away from the path, but they think that they are rightly guided.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mislead people away from the straight path of Islam by their words and actions. They think they are on the right guidance, but in reality, they are the ones who are misguided.
orig: وإنهم ليصدونهم عن السبيل ويحسبون أنهم مهتدون

translation: Until, when he came to Us [at the time of death], he said, 'Oh, I wish there was between me and you the distance between the two easts, for you were the worst of companions.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the regret and sorrow that the disbelievers will feel on the Day of Judgment when they realize the consequences of their rejection of faith and their companionship with Satan. The disbeliever will wish for the greatest possible distance between himself and Satan, whom he had taken as a close companion in the worldly life, as he now recognizes Satan as the 'worst of companions' who misguided him towards eternal punishment.
orig: حتى إذا جاءنا قال يا ليت بيني وبينك بعد المشرقين فبئس القرين

translation: And never will it benefit you that Day - when you have wronged - that you are partners in punishment.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, no partnership or relationship will benefit those who committed wrongdoings and injustices. They will all share in the punishment, regardless of their worldly ties or associations. It serves as a warning against oppression and injustice, as no one will be spared from the consequences of their misdeeds on that Day."
orig: ولن ينفعكم اليوم إذ ظلمتم أنكم في العذاب مشتركون

translation: So, would you make the deaf hear, or guide the blind and he who is in manifest error?
interpretation: This verse questions the ability of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to make those who are spiritually deaf and blind hear and see the truth. It implies that only Allah has the power to guide those who are lost in misguidance and error to the right path. The Prophet's role is to convey the message, but guidance ultimately comes from Allah.
orig: أفأنت تسمع الصم أو تهدي العمي ومن كان في ضلال مبين

translation: So either We will take you away [for death], and then indeed, We will take retribution upon them.
interpretation: إن لم نستجب لك يا محمد في دعوتك لهؤلاء القوم المشركين، فسوف نتوفاك ونميتك قبل أن ننتقم منهم بالعذاب والهلاك، لأنهم كذبوك وآذوك وآذوا المؤمنين معك.
orig: فإما نذهبن بك فإنا منهم منتقمون

translation: Or We show you that which We have promised them, for indeed We are perfect Disposers over them.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has complete power and authority over all beings and events. He can either fulfill the promised punishment for the disbelievers whenever He wills, or delay it according to His wisdom. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's absolute control and ability to carry out whatever He decrees.
orig: أو نرينك الذي وعدناهم فإنا عليهم مقتدرون

translation: So hold firmly to what has been revealed to you. Surely, you are on a straight path.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to adhere firmly to the divine revelation, the Qur'an, which was sent down to him from Allah. It affirms that he is on the right and straight path, guided by the truth from his Lord. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of following the guidance of the Qur'an steadfastly, as it leads to the straight path and the pleasure of Allah.
orig: فاستمسك بالذي أوحي إليك إنك على صراط مستقيم

translation: And indeed, it is a reminder for you and your people, and you are going to be questioned.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Qur'an is a reminder and guidance for the Prophet Muhammad and his people. It also implies that they will be held accountable and questioned about how they responded to this divine message on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وإنه لذكر لك ولقومك وسوف تسألون

translation: And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers - did We appoint besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the fundamental message of monotheism (Tawheed) that was brought by all the Prophets of Allah. It instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to inquire from the previous messengers if they ever taught their people to worship any deity besides the One True God, the Most Merciful. The rhetorical question highlights that the core principle advocated by all Prophets was the worship of Allah alone, rejecting the association of any partners with Him.
orig: واسأل من أرسلنا من قبلك من رسلنا أجعلنا من دون الرحمن آلهة يعبدون

translation: And We did send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: 'I am the Messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the mission of Prophet Moses when he was sent by Allah to Pharaoh and his people with clear signs and miracles. Moses declared that he is the Messenger of the Lord of all the Worlds, conveying the message of Tawheed (Oneness of God) and calling them to worship Allah alone and abandon their false deities and oppressive ways.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا موسى بآياتنا إلى فرعون وملئه فقال إني رسول رب العالمين

translation: But when Our clear signs came to them, they ridiculed them.
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the disbelievers who mocked and ridiculed the clear signs and revelations from Allah. It highlights their arrogance and rejection of the truth, as they found amusement in the divine messages instead of reflecting upon them with sincerity and humility.
orig: فلما جاءهم بآياتنا إذا هم منها يضحكون

translation: And We do not show them a sign except that it is greater than its sister, and We seize them with punishment so that they may return.
interpretation: Allah is saying that He sends clear signs and miracles to the disbelievers, each one greater and more convincing than the previous one. However, when they persist in denying the truth, He seizes them with punishment and afflictions in the hope that they may abandon their disbelief and return to faith in the Oneness of Allah.
orig: وما نريهم من آية إلا هي أكبر من أختها وأخذناهم بالعذاب لعلهم يرجعون

translation: And they said: 'O you sorcerer! Invoke for us your Lord according to what He has covenanted with you. Indeed, we will surely follow guidance.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant and obstinate attitude of Pharaoh and his people towards Prophet Moses. Despite witnessing clear signs and miracles, they mockingly called him a "sorcerer" and challenged him to invoke his Lord to fulfill the covenant or promise made to him. Their claim of being guided was insincere and derisive.
orig: وقالوا يا أيه الساحر ادع لنا ربك بما عهد عندك إننا لمهتدون

translation: But when We removed the punishment from them, at once they broke their word.
interpretation: The interpretation is that when Allah removed the punishment and hardship from the disbelieving people, instead of being grateful and fulfilling their promises to Allah, they went back on their word and continued in their disbelief and disobedience. This verse highlights the ungrateful and treacherous nature of the disbelievers.
orig: فلما كشفنا عنهم العذاب إذا هم ينكثون

translation: And Pharaoh called out among his people. He said, "O my people, do I not possess the kingdom of Egypt, and these rivers flowing beneath me? Then do you not see?"
interpretation: "Pharaoh arrogantly boasted about his possession of Egypt and the Nile river, which was the source of life and prosperity for the Egyptians. He used this as a way to assert his power and authority over his people, implying that they should be grateful to him and obedient, since he controlled the resources that sustained them. This verse highlights Pharaoh's egotistical and tyrannical nature, as he tried to portray himself as a god-like figure deserving of worship and obedience."
orig: ونادى فرعون في قومه قال يا قوم أليس لي ملك مصر وهذه الأنهار تجري من تحتي أفلا تبصرون

translation: Or am I better than this one who is insignificant and scarcely expresses himself?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in response to the mockery and disbelief of the Quraysh tribe. It suggests that the Prophet, as the recipient of divine revelation and guidance, is far superior to those who belittle him and struggle to articulate their thoughts coherently. The verse highlights the contrast between the Prophet's noble character and the pettiness of his detractors.
orig: أم أنا خير من هذا الذي هو مهين ولا يكاد يبين

translation: Why were not bracelets of gold bestowed on him, or angels sent along with him?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the disbelievers' rejection of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger of God. They demanded tangible signs like bracelets of gold or angels accompanying him as proof of his prophethood. However, the verse implies that such demands are unreasonable, as the true sign of prophethood is the divine message itself, not worldly adornments or supernatural phenomena.
orig: فلولا ألقي عليه أسورة من ذهب أو جاء معه الملائكة مقترنين

translation: But he persuaded his people, and they obeyed him. Truly, they were defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the person being referred to was able to convince his people to follow him, even though they were rebellious and disobedient towards God. It implies that he led them astray by exploiting their sinful tendencies and lack of faith.
orig: فاستخف قومه فأطاعوه إنهم كانوا قوما فاسقين

translation: But when they angered Us, We took vengeance upon them and drowned them all.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that Allah inflicted upon Pharaoh and his people for their arrogance, disbelief, and oppression of the Children of Israel. Despite witnessing numerous signs and miracles from Moses, they persisted in their rebellion against Allah. As a result, Allah drowned them all in the sea, leaving no survivors, as a manifestation of His justice and might against those who defy His commands and oppress others.
orig: فلما آسفونا انتقمنا منهم فأغرقناهم أجمعين

translation: So We made them a precedent and an example for those who came after them.
interpretation: Allah made the people who rejected the message and were destroyed a lesson and an example for future generations, so that they may learn from their mistakes and avoid the same fate by believing in Allah and obeying His commands.
orig: فجعلناهم سلفا ومثلا للآخرين

translation: And when the son of Mary is mentioned as an example, your people turn away from it in aversion.
interpretation: This verse refers to the rejection and denial of the Christians towards the teachings of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ regarding the status of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him). When the Qur'an presents Jesus as a human messenger of God and not as a divine being or the son of God, the Christians vehemently oppose and turn away from this truth, displaying their aversion and stubbornness.
orig: ولما ضرب ابن مريم مثلا إذا قومك منه يصدون

translation: And they say, "Are our gods better or is He [i.e., Allah]?" They do not cite it to you except for [mere] argumentation. Rather, they are a people prone to obstinacy.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the disbelievers are questioning whether their idols are better or Allah, but they do not pose this question sincerely seeking truth. Rather, they ask it out of stubbornness and argumentation, as they are a people inclined to dispute and resist the truth.
orig: وقالوا أآلهتنا خير أم هو ما ضربوه لك إلا جدلا بل هم قوم خصمون

translation: He was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.
interpretation: This verse is referring to Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him). It states that he was a servant of God who was honored and blessed by God. God made him an example and role model for the Children of Israel to follow in terms of his righteous conduct, sincerity, and devotion to the worship of the One True God.
orig: إن هو إلا عبد أنعمنا عليه وجعلناه مثلا لبني إسرائيل

translation: And if We willed, We could have made among you angels succeeding on the earth.
interpretation: If Allah had willed, He could have created beings other than humans to inhabit and rule the earth, such as angels who would succeed one another. However, Allah chose to create humans and grant them the honor of being His vicegerents on earth, with the responsibility of following His guidance and worshipping Him alone.
orig: ولو نشاء لجعلنا منكم ملائكة في الأرض يخلفون

translation: And verily, it (the Quran) is a knowledge of the Hour, so have no doubt about it, and follow me. This is the Straight Path.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an contains knowledge about the coming of the Hour (Day of Resurrection). It commands the believers to have firm faith in the Qur'an and its teachings about the Hereafter, and to follow the guidance of the Prophet Muhammad, which is the Straight Path leading to salvation.
orig: وإنه لعلم للساعة فلا تمترن بها واتبعون هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: And let not Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.
interpretation: This verse warns against allowing Satan to mislead or divert one from the path of righteousness. It emphasizes that Satan is an outright and evident enemy who seeks to lead people astray through his deception and temptations. The interpretation highlights the need to be vigilant against Satan's influence and firmly resist his attempts to lead one away from obedience to Allah.
orig: ولا يصدنكم الشيطان إنه لكم عدو مبين

translation: And when Jesus came with clear proofs, he said: 'I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of the matters over which you differ. So fear Allah and obey me.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the mission of Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him) as a messenger of God. He came with clear signs and proofs, guiding people to wisdom and resolving their differences. The key message is to have fear of God and obey the teachings brought by Jesus, which emphasize righteousness and submission to the divine will.
orig: ولما جاء عيسى بالبينات قال قد جئتكم بالحكمة ولأبين لكم بعض الذي تختلفون فيه فاتقوا الله وأطيعون

translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of God (Allah) as the sole object of worship for all humanity. It emphasizes that Allah is the Lord and Sustainer of the Prophet Muhammad and all people. Therefore, we must direct our worship solely to Allah, following the straight path that He has ordained, without deviating or associating partners with Him.
orig: إن الله هو ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم

translation: But the sects from among themselves differed. So woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful day.
interpretation: This verse warns against sectarianism and division among the believers. It implies that those who wrongfully create divisions and sects within the Muslim community will face a severe punishment on the Day of Judgment. The verse emphasizes the importance of unity, mutual understanding, and avoiding conflicts that lead to disunity among Muslims.
orig: فاختلف الأحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين ظلموا من عذاب يوم أليم

translation: Do they await except the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed to those who deny the truth and reject faith. It emphasizes that the disbelievers are heedless and unprepared for the inevitable arrival of the Day of Resurrection, which will come upon them unexpectedly, catching them unaware. The verse serves as a warning to those who remain oblivious to the signs of God and the reality of the Hereafter, urging them to reflect and embrace faith before it is too late.
orig: هل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون

translation: Friends on that Day will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous.
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, even close friends will turn against one another and become enemies, except for those who were righteous and God-fearing in their worldly lives. The bonds of friendship and affection that existed in this world will be severed, and only those who maintained faith and piety will remain allies on that tremendous Day.
orig: الأخلاء يومئذ بعضهم لبعض عدو إلا المتقين

translation: O My servants! No fear shall be on you today, nor shall you grieve.
interpretation: "This verse provides reassurance and comfort to the believers on the Day of Judgment. It is a promise from Allah that those who were obedient and righteous in their worldly life will have no fear or grief in the Hereafter. They will be saved from the punishment and distress that the disbelievers will face on that Day."
orig: يا عباد لا خوف عليكم اليوم ولا أنتم تحزنون

translation: Those who believe in Our signs and are Muslims
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who have faith in Allah's revelations and submit themselves fully to His commands. They are described as 'Muslims,' which means those who surrender themselves to the will of Allah. The interpretation highlights the importance of both belief and obedience in Islam, as true faith is demonstrated through submission to Allah's teachings and guidance.
orig: الذين آمنوا بآياتنا وكانوا مسلمين

translation: Enter Paradise, you and your spouses, delighted.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers entrance into Paradise along with their spouses, in a state of delight and honor. It emphasizes the reward of eternal bliss and companionship that awaits the righteous in the Hereafter.
orig: ادخلوا الجنة أنتم وأزواجكم تحبرون

translation: Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse describes the luxurious and delightful provisions that the inhabitants of Paradise will enjoy. They will be served with golden plates and cups containing whatever their souls desire and whatever pleases their eyes. This indicates the fulfillment of all their wishes and desires in Paradise, where they will dwell forever without any fear of deprivation or loss.
orig: يطاف عليهم بصحاف من ذهب وأكواب وفيها ما تشتهيه الأنفس وتلذ الأعين وأنتم فيها خالدون

translation: And that is the Paradise which you have been made to inherit for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the reward of Paradise that the believers will inherit as a result of their good deeds and righteous actions in this worldly life. It emphasizes that the attainment of Paradise is a direct consequence of one's faith and obedience to Allah's commands. The phrase "which you have been made to inherit" signifies that Paradise is bestowed upon the believers as an inheritance, not something they earned by their own efforts alone, but rather as a gift from Allah's mercy and grace.
orig: وتلك الجنة التي أورثتموها بما كنتم تعملون

translation: In it you will have abundant fruits from which you will eat.
interpretation: This verse refers to the bountiful provision of fruits that will be available for consumption in Paradise. It highlights the abundance and variety of fruits that the righteous will enjoy as a reward for their faith and good deeds in the Hereafter. The fruits mentioned symbolize the pleasures and delights awaiting the believers in the eternal gardens of Paradise.
orig: لكم فيها فاكهة كثيرة منها تأكلون

translation: Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the severe and eternal punishment awaiting the disbelievers and wrongdoers in the Hellfire. It serves as a warning against rejecting faith and committing sins, as their consequences are everlasting torment in the depths of Hell, from which there is no escape or reprieve. The verse underscores the gravity of one's deeds and the importance of seeking forgiveness and leading a righteous life to avoid such a dreadful fate.
orig: إن المجرمين في عذاب جهنم خالدون

translation: He does not utter any word of falsehood, while they are plunged into frivolity.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the truthfulness and infallibility of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It states that he does not speak any falsehood or lies, as he is divinely guided and protected from errors or fabrications. Meanwhile, the disbelievers are engrossed in frivolity, indulging in vain pursuits and distractions that prevent them from recognizing the truth.
orig: لا يفتر عنهم وهم فيه مبلسون

translation: And We wronged them not, but they were the wrongdoers.
interpretation: "Allah did not oppress or wrong them in any way. Rather, they wronged themselves by rejecting faith and committing sins. The punishment they received was a consequence of their own misdeeds."
orig: وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا هم الظالمين

translation: And they will call out, 'O Malik! Let your Lord put an end to us.' He will say, 'You are certainly going to remain.'
interpretation: This verse describes the desperate plea of the disbelievers in Hell, calling out to Malik, the keeper of Hell, to end their torment by having Allah destroy them. However, their request is denied, and they are told that they will remain in Hell forever, enduring its punishment without respite. The verse highlights the hopelessness and eternal nature of the punishment for those who rejected faith and disobeyed Allah's commands.
orig: ونادوا يا مالك ليقض علينا ربك قال إنكم ماكثون

translation: We have certainly brought you the truth, but most of you are averse to the truth.
interpretation: This verse is addressing those who reject the truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It highlights that although the truth has been presented to them clearly, most of them have an aversion towards it due to their stubbornness, arrogance, or attachment to their desires and false beliefs. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of accepting the truth with an open heart and mind, and not allowing one's prejudices or whims to prevent them from recognizing and embracing the truth.
orig: لقد جئناكم بالحق ولكن أكثركم للحق كارهون

translation: Or do they intend a plan? But We are planning as well.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a warning to those who plot against the believers or the message of Islam. It implies that if the disbelievers intend to devise a plan against the Prophet and the believers, Allah is also planning and His plan will ultimately prevail over theirs. It serves as a reassurance to the believers that Allah is aware of the plots of their enemies and will protect them.
orig: أم أبرموا أمرا فإنا مبرمون

translation: Or do they think that We cannot hear their secrets and private conversations? Yes, [We can], and Our messengers are with them recording.
interpretation: Allah is reminding the disbelievers that He is All-Aware of their secret plots and private conversations against the Prophet and the believers. He knows everything they say or do, even in private, for His angels are present recording all their words and deeds. This serves as a warning that nothing is hidden from Allah, and they will be held accountable for their intentions and actions.
orig: أم يحسبون أنا لا نسمع سرهم ونجواهم بلى ورسلنا لديهم يكتبون

translation: Say, 'If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of the worshippers.'
interpretation: This verse refutes the polytheistic belief of attributing offspring to God. It emphasizes the absolute oneness of God and rejects the notion of Him having a child, as this would contradict His transcendent and unique nature. The Prophet Muhammad is instructed to declare that if God had a son, he would be the first to worship and submit to Him, but the premise itself is false and impossible.
orig: قل إن كان للرحمن ولد فأنا أول العابدين

translation: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, above what they ascribe [to Him].
interpretation: This verse glorifies and praises Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth, and the Lord of the mighty Throne. It declares Him far above and free from any imperfections or attributes that the polytheists falsely ascribe to Him.
orig: سبحان رب السماوات والأرض رب العرش عما يصفون

translation: So leave them to indulge and play until they meet their Day which they are promised.
interpretation: "This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to disregard the disbelievers who mock and ridicule the message of Islam. They are heedlessly indulged in vain pursuits and amusements, unaware of the grave consequences awaiting them on the Day of Resurrection which has been promised to them. The believers are advised to be patient and steadfast, focusing on their faith rather than engaging with those who reject the truth."
orig: فذرهم يخوضوا ويلعبوا حتى يلاقوا يومهم الذي يوعدون

translation: And it is He who is God in the heaven, and God on the earth. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness and Sovereignty of God (Allah) over the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that there is no other deity worthy of worship besides Him, and that He is the sole Creator, Sustainer, and Ruler of the entire universe. The attributes "Al-Hakeem" (The Wise) and "Al-Aleem" (The All-Knowing) highlight God's perfect wisdom and absolute knowledge, which govern all aspects of His creation and decree.
orig: وهو الذي في السماء إله وفي الأرض إله وهو الحكيم العليم

translation: Blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is the knowledge of the Hour, and to Whom you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty over the heavens, the earth, and everything in between. It also highlights that He alone has knowledge of when the Hour (Day of Judgment) will occur, and that all creation will ultimately return to Him for accountability and recompense.
orig: وتبارك الذي له ملك السماوات والأرض وما بينهما وعنده علم الساعة وإليه ترجعون

translation: And those whom they invoke besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.
interpretation: This verse indicates that none can intercede with Allah except those who have His permission and who testify to the truth of Tawheed (Islamic monotheism). The intercessors must be truthful believers who recognize Allah's Oneness and affirm it. They cannot intercede except for those whom Allah allows, based on His knowledge and wisdom. Intercession is not a right, but rather a favor bestowed by Allah upon whomever He wills.
orig: ولا يملك الذين يدعون من دونه الشفاعة إلا من شهد بالحق وهم يعلمون

translation: And if you asked them, 'Who created them?' they would surely say, 'Allah.' So how are they deluded?
interpretation: This verse highlights the innate belief in the Oneness of God (Tawheed) that is ingrained in human nature (fitrah). Even those who associate partners with Allah in worship, if asked directly about the Creator, would acknowledge that it is Allah alone Who created them. Their deviation and false beliefs stem from being misguided, not from a lack of inherent recognition of the One True God.
orig: ولئن سألتهم من خلقهم ليقولن الله فأنى يؤفكون

translation: And say, 'O my Lord! Indeed these are a people who do not believe.'
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to turn to Allah and express his frustration with the disbelievers who refuse to accept the message of Islam. It highlights the stubbornness and rejection of the truth by those who deny the divine revelation, despite the clear proofs and signs presented to them. The interpretation encourages the Prophet to seek refuge and guidance from Allah in the face of such persistent disbelief.
orig: وقيله يا رب إن هؤلاء قوم لا يؤمنون

translation: So turn away from them and say, 'Peace.' They will soon come to know.
interpretation: This verse advises the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to respond with patience and gentleness to those who mock or insult him. He is instructed to simply say "Peace" and walk away from such situations, as those who oppose the truth will eventually realize their mistake and face the consequences of their actions.
orig: فاصفح عنهم وقل سلام فسوف يعلمون

translation: Ha Meem.
interpretation: These two Arabic letters "Ha" and "Meem" are among the "Muqatta'at" or disconnected letters that appear at the beginning of several chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah. However, scholars have suggested various interpretations, such as that they may be an abbreviation, an oath, or a way to draw attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an and its inimitable literary style.
orig: حم

translation: And the Enlightening Book
interpretation: This refers to the Qur'an, which is a clear and enlightening Book that provides guidance and wisdom. It removes doubts and illuminates the path to truth and righteousness. The Qur'an is described as "mubin" (enlightening) because it makes the truth evident and expounds on religious teachings and laws in a clear and unambiguous manner.
orig: والكتاب المبين

translation: Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night. Indeed, We were to warn.
interpretation: Allah revealed the Qur'an on a blessed night, the Night of Decree (Laylat al-Qadr), which is a night better than a thousand months. This night is a great blessing and mercy from Allah. The revelation of the Qur'an on this night is a warning from Allah to humanity, reminding them of His signs and guiding them to the straight path.
orig: إنا أنزلناه في ليلة مباركة إنا كنا منذرين

translation: In it every wise command is distinguished
interpretation: This verse suggests that within the Qur'an, every decree and commandment is made clearly distinct and explained in a wise manner, separating truth from falsehood and right from wrong. The Qur'an contains profound wisdom and guidance that distinguishes between what is virtuous and what is blameworthy.
orig: فيها يفرق كل أمر حكيم

translation: By a command from Us. Indeed, We are ever sending [messengers]
interpretation: This verse indicates that the sending of messengers and revelations is by the command and will of Allah. It affirms Allah's wisdom in communicating guidance to humanity through chosen individuals whom He selects as messengers. The phrase "Indeed, We are ever sending" suggests that this is an ongoing process, as Allah continues to guide people in every time and place through His messengers and revelations.
orig: أمرا من عندنا إنا كنا مرسلين

translation: It is a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
interpretation: This verse signifies that the revelation of the Qur'an and the guidance it provides is a great mercy and blessing from Allah to humanity. It highlights two of Allah's attributes: Al-Samee' (the All-Hearing) and Al-'Aleem (the All-Knowing). Allah hears all prayers and supplications, and has complete knowledge of everything, including the innermost thoughts and intentions of His creation. The Qur'an, being a divine revelation, is a manifestation of Allah's infinite mercy, wisdom, and knowledge.
orig: رحمة من ربك إنه هو السميع العليم

translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, if you should be certain.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of God as the Sole Creator, Sustainer and Master of the entire universe. It invites people to have firm faith and certainty in God's Lordship over all that exists, without any doubt or hesitation.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إن كنتم موقنين

translation: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His sole right to be worshipped. It negates the existence of any other true deity besides Him. It also highlights two of Allah's essential Attributes - giving life and causing death. This means that He alone is the Creator and Sustainer of all existence, and to Him belongs the ultimate control over life and death. The verse further emphasizes that Allah is not only our Lord, but also the Lord of all our ancestors, reminding us of His Eternal Lordship over all creation.
orig: لا إله إلا هو يحيي ويميت ربكم ورب آبائكم الأولين

translation: Nay, they are in doubt, playing a game of deception.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers are in a state of doubt and confusion, indulging in vain pursuits and deception instead of acknowledging the truth. They are engaging in frivolous activities and games, rather than reflecting upon the clear signs and guidance presented to them.
orig: بل هم في شك يلعبون

translation: Then wait for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a prophecy or warning about a future event that will occur before the Day of Resurrection. The "visible smoke" is seen as a sign or portent of the imminent coming of the Hour. It could be referring to environmental pollution, nuclear fallout, or a supernatural phenomenon that will engulf the sky. The verse urges people to be watchful and prepared for this momentous event.
orig: فارتقب يوم تأتي السماء بدخان مبين

translation: This is a painful torment covering the people.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as describing a severe punishment or affliction that overwhelms and envelops people, causing them great pain and suffering. It could refer to a physical calamity, a spiritual trial, or the torment of the Hereafter for those who disbelieved and rejected the truth.
orig: يغشى الناس هذا عذاب أليم

translation: Our Lord, remove the punishment from us; indeed, we are believers.
interpretation: This verse expresses the sincere plea of believers who find themselves in a state of difficulty or affliction. They humbly turn to Allah, acknowledging their faith and seeking relief from the hardship they are facing. It reflects their trust in Allah's mercy and their hope that by affirming their belief, the punishment or trial they are enduring will be lifted. The verse highlights the importance of maintaining faith and turning to Allah in times of adversity, seeking His forgiveness and aid.
orig: ربنا اكشف عنا العذاب إنا مؤمنون

translation: How can there be a reminder for them, when there has already come to them a clear Messenger?
interpretation: This verse questions how people can benefit from reminders and admonitions when a clear Messenger, Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), has already come to them with the complete message of Islam. It implies that after receiving clear guidance from the Prophet, no further excuses remain for not following the truth.
orig: أنى لهم الذكرى وقد جاءهم رسول مبين

translation: Then they turned away from him and said, 'A teacher, possessed!'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers' reaction to the Prophet Muhammad's teachings. Despite his clear and wise words, they accused him of being possessed or insane, rejecting his message out of arrogance and stubbornness. The interpretation highlights their rejection of the truth and their unwillingness to accept guidance, even when it was presented to them in a clear and rational manner.
orig: ثم تولوا عنه وقالوا معلم مجنون

translation: Verily, We shall remove the punishment for a little while. Indeed, you will revert [to disbelief].
interpretation: This verse is a warning from Allah to the disbelievers that although they may experience a temporary relief from punishment and difficulties in this world, they will ultimately return to their disbelieving ways and face the severe punishment of the Hereafter if they do not repent and embrace faith. It highlights the temporary nature of worldly pleasures and the consequences of persisting in disbelief and disobedience to Allah.
orig: إنا كاشفو العذاب قليلا إنكم عائدون

translation: The Day when We will strike with the greatest assault. Indeed, We will take retribution.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when Allah will seize the disbelievers with a tremendous punishment for their rejection of faith and their sins. It warns of Allah's ability to take vengeance on those who defied His commands and denied His revelations. The "greatest assault" signifies the ultimate reckoning and the severe retribution that awaits the unrepentant on that terrifying Day.
orig: يوم نبطش البطشة الكبرى إنا منتقمون

translation: And We had tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger.
interpretation: This verse refers to the trials and tests that Allah subjected the people of Pharaoh to before the time of Prophet Moses. Despite being sent a noble and respected messenger (Moses), they rejected the message and faced the consequences of their arrogance and disbelief. Allah uses this as an example to warn others against rejecting His messengers and teachings.
orig: ولقد فتنا قبلهم قوم فرعون وجاءهم رسول كريم

translation: That I should worship Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience
interpretation: This verse is an instruction from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to convey to the people that he is a trustworthy messenger sent to guide them to worship Allah alone, sincerely and obediently, without associating any partners with Him.
orig: أن أدوا إلي عباد الله إني لكم رسول أمين

translation: And not to exalt yourselves above Allah. Indeed, I have come to you with a clear authority.
interpretation: This verse instructs the people not to elevate themselves above Allah and His commands. It emphasizes that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) has brought a clear proof and authority from Allah, which should be accepted and obeyed. The verse warns against arrogance and self-glorification, as all power and authority ultimately belong to Allah alone.
orig: وأن لا تعلوا على الله إني آتيكم بسلطان مبين

translation: And indeed, I seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.
interpretation: The interpretation is that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is seeking protection from Allah, who is his Lord and the Lord of all people, from being harmed or persecuted by his people for preaching the message of Islam. He fears that they may stone him or inflict other forms of harm upon him for calling them to worship Allah alone and abandon their idolatrous practices.
orig: وإني عذت بربي وربكم أن ترجمون

translation: But if you do not believe me, then keep yourselves apart
interpretation: If the disbelievers do not accept the message brought by the Prophet, then they should separate themselves from him and not oppose him or persecute the believers. This verse teaches tolerance and non-compulsion in matters of faith.
orig: وإن لم تؤمنوا لي فاعتزلون

translation: Then he called upon his Lord, 'Indeed these are a people who are criminals.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that the Prophet was calling upon Allah to punish the disbelievers who were oppressing him and his followers, as they were committing crimes and injustices by persecuting the believers and rejecting the truth.
orig: فدعا ربه أن هؤلاء قوم مجرمون

translation: So travel with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.
interpretation: "Allah commands Prophet Moses to travel with the Children of Israel by night, leaving Egypt secretly, as Pharaoh and his army will pursue them. This verse indicates Allah's protection and guidance for the oppressed believers, and His plan to punish the arrogant transgressors."
orig: فأسر بعبادي ليلا إنكم متبعون

translation: And leave the sea as it is. Indeed, they are a host to be drowned.
interpretation: "This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to leave the sea as it is, without attempting to part it or perform a miracle. It assures him that the disbelieving army pursuing him will be drowned in the sea, as they are destined to be destroyed by Allah's decree."
orig: واترك البحر رهوا إنهم جند مغرقون

translation: How many gardens and springs they left behind,
interpretation: This verse highlights the fact that the disbelievers who were punished by Allah left behind their luxurious gardens and flowing springs, which were sources of wealth and enjoyment for them. It serves as a reminder of the temporary nature of worldly possessions and pleasures, and that true success lies in obeying Allah and preparing for the Hereafter.
orig: كم تركوا من جنات وعيون

translation: And crops and a noble place of residence.
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings of crops, which provide sustenance, and a noble place of residence, which signifies a comfortable and dignified dwelling. It highlights Allah's favor upon humanity by providing both material provisions and a suitable living environment. The "noble place of residence" could also metaphorically refer to Paradise, the ultimate abode promised to the righteous believers.
orig: وزروع ومقام كريم

translation: And [they had] a blessing wherein they were reveling.
interpretation: This verse refers to the abundant blessings that the disbelievers were enjoying in this worldly life, such as wealth, health, and pleasures. However, they were heedless and ungrateful for these favors from Allah, indulging in them excessively without acknowledging the One who provided them. The phrase "wherein they were reveling" indicates their state of being immersed in and delighting in these worldly pleasures, without any concern for the Hereafter or gratitude to their Lord.
orig: ونعمة كانوا فيها فاكهين

translation: Thus We caused it to be inherited by another people.
interpretation: This verse refers to how Allah transferred the blessings and favors that were previously given to a nation to another group of people. It suggests that when a community becomes ungrateful and neglects the favors bestowed upon them by Allah, He takes those blessings away and grants them to another people who are more deserving and appreciative of His bounties.
orig: كذلك وأورثناها قوما آخرين

translation: But neither the heaven nor the earth wept over them, nor were they given respite.
interpretation: Allah is saying that neither the heavens nor the earth wept or grieved over the destruction of these disbelievers, because their punishment was just and deserved. They were not given any respite or delay in their punishment, as it came swiftly upon them for their rejection of faith.
orig: فما بكت عليهم السماء والأرض وما كانوا منظرين

translation: And We did indeed save the Children of Israel from the humiliating punishment
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah saved the Children of Israel from a severe and humiliating punishment that they were facing. It refers to the time when they were oppressed by the Pharaoh and his people in Egypt. Allah rescued them from this oppression and humiliation by enabling them to escape from Egypt under the leadership of Prophet Moses. This deliverance was a manifestation of Allah's mercy and favor upon the Children of Israel.
orig: ولقد نجينا بني إسرائيل من العذاب المهين

translation: From Pharaoh, indeed he was a haughty one among the transgressors.
interpretation: This verse refers to Pharaoh's arrogance and transgression against Allah's commands. Despite being granted power and authority, he became excessively proud and oppressive, considering himself superior to others and denying the existence of the One True God. His arrogance led him to persist in his wrongdoings and tyranny, making him one of the worst transgressors against the limits set by Allah.
orig: من فرعون إنه كان عاليا من المسرفين

translation: And We have certainly chosen them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has chosen and preferred the believers over all other people in the world based on His perfect knowledge and wisdom. He has granted them guidance, faith, and understanding of the truth, making them superior to others who remain in disbelief or ignorance.
orig: ولقد اخترناهم على علم على العالمين

translation: And We gave them signs in which there was a clear trial.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miracles and signs that Allah sent to test the faith and resolve of the people. The "clear trial" mentioned could refer to the challenges, hardships, or calamities that were sent as a means of testing their belief and patience. The signs and trials were meant to distinguish between those who truly believed and those who did not.
orig: وآتيناهم من الآيات ما فيه بلاء مبين

translation: Indeed, they are saying
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers or opponents of the truth are uttering false statements or making baseless claims. It implies that their words carry no weight or substance, and they are merely engaging in idle talk or spreading misinformation.
orig: إن هؤلاء ليقولون

translation: It is only our first death, and we will not be resurrected.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelief of those who deny the resurrection and life after death. They think that death is the end and that there is no afterlife or accountability for one's actions. The interpretation is that they have a limited and materialistic view of existence, failing to recognize the greater reality and purpose beyond this temporary worldly life.
orig: إن هي إلا موتتنا الأولى وما نحن بمنشرين

translation: Then bring our forefathers back, if you are truthful.
interpretation: This verse is a challenge posed by the disbelievers to the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. They are mockingly asking him to bring back their deceased ancestors to life if he is truthful in his claim of prophethood and the message of resurrection. The interpretation is that the disbelievers are arrogantly denying the possibility of resurrection and demanding an impossible feat as proof, thus revealing their stubborn rejection of faith.
orig: فأتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Are the people of the towns more worthy of Our mercy than the people of Salih? But they rejected Salih, and We destroyed them.
interpretation: Allah is questioning whether the people who rejected the message deserve His mercy more than the people of Prophet Salih, who were destroyed for their disbelief and rejection of the truth. This verse emphasizes that no one is exempt from Allah's punishment if they persist in denial and disobedience.
orig: أهم خير أم قوم تبع والذين من قبلهم أهلكناهم إنهم كانوا مجرمين

translation: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them in play.
interpretation: Allah did not create the universe and all that exists without a wise and great purpose. The creation of the heavens, the earth, and everything in between is not a mere game or an act of amusement. Rather, it is a manifestation of Allah's power, wisdom, and divine plan.
orig: وما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما لاعبين

translation: We created them not except in truth, but most of them do not know.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى أن الله خلق الكون والإنسان بالحق والحكمة، وليس عبثًا أو لعبًا، ولكن معظم الناس لا يدركون هذه الحقيقة ويجهلون الغاية من خلقهم، فيعيشون حياتهم بعيدًا عن الهدى والحق الذي خلقوا من أجله.
orig: ما خلقناهما إلا بالحق ولكن أكثرهم لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time for them all.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Day of Resurrection is a fixed and inevitable event for all of humanity. It is a time when everyone will be gathered together and held accountable for their deeds and beliefs. The use of the word "miqa̲t" (appointed time) emphasizes the certainty and predetermined nature of this day, which no one can escape or avoid. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate reckoning and the importance of living a righteous life in preparation for that momentous occasion.
orig: إن يوم الفصل ميقاتهم أجمعين

translation: On a Day when no soul will avail another soul anything, and they will not be helped.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the Day of Judgment, when no one will be able to help or benefit another. Each person will be accountable for their own deeds, and no intercession or assistance will be accepted. It highlights the individual responsibility before God and the futility of relying on anyone or anything other than one's own faith and good actions.
orig: يوم لا يغني مولى عن مولى شيئا ولا هم ينصرون

translation: Except whom Allah has mercy upon. Indeed, it is He who is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute power and sovereignty. He alone decides whom to show mercy to, as He is Al-'Azeez (the Almighty) and Ar-Raheem (the Most Merciful). It reminds us to submit to His will and seek His mercy and forgiveness."
orig: إلا من رحم الله إنه هو العزيز الرحيم

translation: Indeed, the tree of Zaqqum
interpretation: The "tree of Zaqqum" is a metaphor for the severe punishment and torment that the disbelievers and sinners will face in Hell. It represents the bitter, putrid fruits that they will be forced to consume, which will scald their insides and cause them immense agony. This verse serves as a vivid warning about the dire consequences of rejecting faith and engaging in evil deeds.
orig: إن شجرت الزقوم

translation: The food of the sinful
interpretation: This verse refers to the unlawful and impure sustenance that sinful people consume. It warns against indulging in ill-gotten gains or anything that is forbidden in Islam, as it corrupts the soul and leads one astray from the path of righteousness.
orig: طعام الأثيم

translation: Like the boiling of scalding water.
interpretation: This verse is a metaphorical description of the intense punishment and suffering that the disbelievers will face in Hell. The boiling water is used as an analogy to convey the severity and unbearable nature of their torment, just as boiling water scalds and burns the skin.
orig: كالمهل يغلي في البطون

translation: Like the boiling of scalding water
interpretation: This verse is a metaphor describing the intense heat and torment of Hellfire. It compares the state of those in Hell to the violent boiling and scalding of intensely hot water, conveying the severity of the punishment and suffering they will endure.
orig: كغلي الحميم

translation: Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse is a command from Allah to the angels to seize and forcefully drag the disbeliever into the depths of Hellfire as a punishment for his rejection of faith and righteous deeds. It highlights the severe torment that awaits those who turn away from the truth and defy Allah's commandments.
orig: خذوه فاعتلوه إلى سواء الجحيم

translation: Then pour over his head the torment of boiling water.
interpretation: This verse refers to a severe punishment for the disbelievers in the Hereafter. The "boiling water" is a metaphor for an excruciating torment that will be poured over their heads as a form of retribution for their rejection of faith and their evil deeds in this world.
orig: ثم صبوا فوق رأسه من عذاب الحميم

translation: Taste [this], for indeed you are the honored, the noble.
interpretation: This verse is addressed to the disbelievers and arrogant ones who denied the truth. It is a sarcastic rebuke, telling them to taste the punishment and consequences of their arrogance and rejection of faith. The words "honored" and "noble" are used sarcastically, mocking their false sense of superiority and pride. The verse highlights that true honor and nobility come from submission to God and righteous conduct, not from worldly status or arrogance.
orig: ذق إنك أنت العزيز الكريم

translation: Indeed, this is what you used to doubt.
interpretation: This verse is reminding the disbelievers that what they are witnessing in the Hereafter is the reality that they used to deny and doubt in the worldly life. It serves as a rebuke and a confirmation that the warnings given to them about the Day of Resurrection have come true.
orig: إن هذا ما كنتم به تمترون

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who have attained piety and righteousness through their faith and good deeds will be in a secure and honored position in the Hereafter, free from any fear or distress. It promises a state of peace, safety, and contentment for the God-fearing believers as a reward for their virtuous lives.
orig: إن المتقين في مقام أمين

translation: In gardens and springs
interpretation: This verse refers to the eternal bliss and reward that awaits the righteous believers in Paradise. The "gardens" symbolize the lush, verdant surroundings and the "springs" represent the flowing rivers and sources of pure water, indicating an environment of beauty, tranquility, and abundance.
orig: في جنات وعيون

translation: They will wear garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, facing each other.
interpretation: This verse describes the attire and state of the believers in Paradise. The garments of "fine silk and heavy brocade" symbolize the luxury, beauty, and honor that the inhabitants of Paradise will enjoy. The phrase "facing each other" suggests a state of mutual companionship, closeness, and harmony among the believers, free from any discord or enmity.
orig: يلبسون من سندس وإستبرق متقابلين

translation: And We will marry them to fair maidens having gorgeous eyes.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that in Paradise, they will be wedded to pure and beautiful maidens with gorgeous eyes. It is a metaphorical description of the delights and pleasures that await the righteous in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: كذلك وزوجناهم بحور عين

translation: Therein they will call for every kind of fruit, secure.
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings and comforts that the righteous believers will enjoy in Paradise. They will be able to call for any kind of fruit they desire, and it will be provided to them in a state of complete security, peace, and tranquility, without any fear or harm.
orig: يدعون فيها بكل فاكهة آمنين

translation: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers in Paradise. It indicates that they will not experience death again after the first death in this worldly life. They will live eternally in Paradise, protected from the torment of Hellfire by Allah's mercy and grace.
orig: لا يذوقون فيها الموت إلا الموتة الأولى ووقاهم عذاب الجحيم

translation: That is the supreme success from your Lord.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the forgiveness, mercy, and eternal bliss in Paradise mentioned in the preceding verses are the ultimate triumph and greatest achievement one can attain. It is a supreme blessing bestowed by Allah upon the believers as a reward for their faith and righteous deeds.
orig: فضلا من ربك ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: So indeed, We have made it easy in your tongue, so that they may be mindful.
interpretation: Allah facilitated the Arabic language of the Qur'an for the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, so that the Arabs would understand it easily and reflect upon its teachings and guidance. This shows Allah's mercy in making the Qur'an accessible to the Arabs through their native language.
orig: فإنما يسرناه بلسانك لعلهم يتذكرون

translation: So wait, [O Muhammad]; indeed, they are waiting.
interpretation: "This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad to be patient and await the outcome, as the disbelievers are also waiting and watching. It implies that the truth will eventually prevail, and those who deny it will face the consequences. The interpretation encourages steadfastness in the face of opposition and trusting in Allah's plan."
orig: فارتقب إنهم مرتقبون

translation: Ha Meem.
interpretation: These two Arabic letters are among the "Muqatta'at" or disconnected letters that appear at the beginning of some chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah, but scholars have offered various interpretations. Some suggest they represent divine names or oaths, while others view them as symbols calling humanity to ponder the miraculous nature and profound wisdom of the Qur'an.
orig: حم

translation: A revelation of the Book from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an is a revelation from Allah, Who is Exalted in Might, meaning He is Supreme, Omnipotent, and nothing is impossible for Him. He is also the Wise, meaning He is Perfect in Knowledge and Wisdom, and everything He decrees is based on profound wisdom and perfect understanding.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: Verily, in the heavens and the earth are signs for the believers.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the universe and all of creation contain clear signs and proofs of Allah's existence, power, and wisdom for those who have faith and reflect upon them. The intricate designs, systems, and wonders found in the heavens (such as the stars, planets, and galaxies) and on Earth (such as the diverse forms of life, natural phenomena, and ecological balance) serve as evidence of the One Creator who brought them into being with purpose and wisdom. However, these signs are only perceived and appreciated by those who possess true faith and an open, contemplative mind.
orig: إن في السماوات والأرض لآيات للمؤمنين

translation: And in your creation and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for a people who are certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse highlights the signs of Allah's power and wisdom in the creation of human beings and all living creatures. It encourages people to reflect upon the intricate design and diversity of creation, which bears witness to the existence of the One True Creator. Those who have firm faith and certainty in their hearts will recognize these signs and be guided towards the truth.
orig: وفي خلقكم وما يبث من دابة آيات لقوم يوقنون

translation: And the alternation of night and day, and what Allah has sent down from the sky of provision and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness, and the directing of the winds, are signs for a people who reason.
interpretation: This verse highlights several signs of Allah's power and wisdom that should lead people to ponder and believe. The alternation of night and day, the rain that brings life to the barren earth, and the winds that carry clouds and scatter seeds are all evidence of Allah's precise control over the universe and His mercy towards His creation. These signs are meant for those who use their intellect and contemplate the marvels of creation.
orig: واختلاف الليل والنهار وما أنزل الله من السماء من رزق فأحيا به الأرض بعد موتها وتصريف الرياح آيات لقوم يعقلون

translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the truthfulness of the Quran and its divine origin. It poses the question that if people do not believe in Allah's words and revelations, what other statement or discourse would they believe in? The verse affirms that the Quran is the ultimate truth and guidance from Allah, and any rejection of it means rejecting the truth itself.
orig: تلك آيات الله نتلوها عليك بالحق فبأي حديث بعد الله وآياته يؤمنون

translation: Woe to every sinful liar
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who engage in lying and sinful behavior. It serves as a stern reminder of the grave consequences of dishonesty and immorality, emphasizing the importance of truthfulness and righteousness in one's conduct.
orig: ويل لكل أفاك أثيم

translation: He hears the verses of Allah being recited to him, yet he persists with arrogance as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who arrogantly reject the message of God, despite hearing and understanding it clearly. Their stubborn refusal to accept the truth and guidance from God stems from their pride and arrogance. The verse warns such individuals of a severe and painful punishment as a consequence of their arrogant rejection of God's signs and revelations.
orig: يسمع آيات الله تتلى عليه ثم يصر مستكبرا كأن لم يسمعها فبشره بعذاب أليم

translation: And when he learns something of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns against mocking or ridiculing the verses of the Qur'an. It refers to those who, when they learn or are exposed to the signs and revelations from Allah, treat them as a joke or take them lightly. Such an attitude of disrespect and ridicule towards the divine words is condemned, and those who engage in this behavior are threatened with a humiliating punishment in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the gravity of mocking Allah's revelations and highlights the need to approach the Qur'an with reverence, respect, and a sincere intention to understand and follow its guidance.
orig: وإذا علم من آياتنا شيئا اتخذها هزوا أولئك لهم عذاب مهين

translation: In front of them is Hell, and what they had earned will be of no benefit to them, nor what they had taken besides Allah as awliya' (protectors, helpers). And for them is a great punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers and wrongdoers that they will face a severe punishment in Hell on the Day of Judgment. Their wealth, status, or false deities they worshipped besides Allah will be of no avail to them. They will suffer a tremendous torment for rejecting the truth and associating partners with Allah.
orig: من ورائهم جهنم ولا يغني عنهم ما كسبوا شيئا ولا ما اتخذوا من دون الله أولياء ولهم عذاب عظيم

translation: This is a guidance. And those who disbelieve in the revelations of their Lord - for them there is a severe punishment of foul horrible torment.
interpretation: This Quran is a guidance from Allah that leads to the right path. Those who reject the clear signs and revelations from their Lord will face a severe, painful, and horrible punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: هذا هدى والذين كفروا بآيات ربهم لهم عذاب من رجز أليم

translation: It is Allah who has subjected the sea for you, so that ships may sail upon it by His command, and so that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may be thankful.
interpretation: Allah is the One who has subjugated the seas for human benefit, allowing ships to travel across them by His will and command. This is so that people may engage in maritime trade and commerce, seeking Allah's provisions and bounties. Ultimately, this should lead humans to express gratitude to Allah for the blessings He has bestowed upon them.
orig: الله الذي سخر لكم البحر لتجري الفلك فيه بأمره ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون

translation: And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.
interpretation: "This verse highlights Allah's immense favor upon humanity by subjecting everything in the heavens and the earth for our benefit and sustenance. It serves as a profound reminder that all the blessings we enjoy originate from Allah alone. The verse encourages us to ponder over these signs of Allah's power and wisdom, which are evident in the remarkable order and harmony of the universe. By reflecting upon these signs, we can deepen our faith and appreciate the countless bounties bestowed upon us by our Creator."
orig: وسخر لكم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض جميعا منه إن في ذلك لآيات لقوم يتفكرون

translation: Say to those who believe, that they should forgive those who do not look forward to the days of Allah, so that He may recompense people for what they used to earn.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to forgive those who do not believe in the Days of Allah, referring to the Day of Judgment and the accountability that will take place on that Day. It suggests that the believers should be forgiving and patient, as Allah will ultimately judge and recompense people according to their deeds.
orig: قل للذين آمنوا يغفروا للذين لا يرجون أيام الله ليجزي قوما بما كانوا يكسبون

translation: Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does so] against it. Then to your Lord you will be returned.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes individual accountability. Each person is responsible for their own actions, whether good or evil. The good deeds one performs will benefit their own soul, while the evil they commit will be held against them. Ultimately, everyone will return to God and be judged for their deeds.
orig: من عمل صالحا فلنفسه ومن أساء فعليها ثم إلى ربكم ترجعون

translation: And We certainly gave the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement and prophethood, and provided them with good things, and preferred them over the worlds.
interpretation: This verse highlights the favors and blessings that Allah bestowed upon the Children of Israel. He gave them the Scripture (Torah), which contained guidance and laws, as well as the ability to judge matters. He also sent them prophets to guide them. Additionally, He provided them with pure and lawful provisions. Furthermore, Allah preferred and honored them over the rest of the people during their time by selecting them as the recipients of these favors. However, this preference was conditional upon their obedience and gratitude to Allah.
orig: ولقد آتينا بني إسرائيل الكتاب والحكم والنبوة ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على العالمين

translation: And We had given them clear proofs of the command, but they differed not until after the knowledge had come to them, through hatred among themselves. Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they used to differ.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that God provided clear proofs and evidence to guide people, but they differed and disagreed after receiving this knowledge, due to envy, hatred, and personal interests among themselves. God states that He will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding the matters they differed in, and will hold them accountable for their disagreements and deviations from the truth."
orig: وآتيناهم بينات من الأمر فما اختلفوا إلا من بعد ما جاءهم العلم بغيا بينهم إن ربك يقضي بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون

translation: Then We put you, [O Muhammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.
interpretation: Allah instructed the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to follow the straight path of Islam that Allah has ordained for him. He should not follow the desires and whims of those who lack true knowledge about Allah's religion, as they will misguide him from the right path.
orig: ثم جعلناك على شريعة من الأمر فاتبعها ولا تتبع أهواء الذين لا يعلمون

translation: Indeed, they will never avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but Allah is the Ally of the righteous.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that those who disbelieve and commit wrongs can never protect or benefit one another against Allah's decree. While the wrongdoers may support each other, ultimately Allah is the only true Protector and Ally of those who are righteous and conscious of Him.
orig: إنهم لن يغنوا عنك من الله شيئا وإن الظالمين بعضهم أولياء بعض والله ولي المتقين

translation: This [Qur'an] is an insight for the people and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a source of profound understanding, guidance, and mercy for those who have firm belief and certainty in their faith. It highlights the Qur'an's role as a beacon of enlightenment, direction, and divine compassion for those whose hearts are filled with conviction and unwavering faith.
orig: هذا بصائر للناس وهدى ورحمة لقوم يوقنون

translation: Or do those who commit evil deeds think that We will make them like those who believe and do righteous deeds, equal in their life and their death? Evil is what they judge.
interpretation: This verse refutes the notion that those who commit sins and evil deeds will be treated equally to the believers who do righteous deeds. It emphasizes that Allah will not make the sinners and the righteous alike in their life and death. The sinners have made a grave misjudgment in thinking that their evil deeds will go unpunished and they will receive the same reward as the believers. Their judgment is severely flawed and misguided.
orig: أم حسب الذين اجترحوا السيئات أن نجعلهم كالذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات سواء محياهم ومماتهم ساء ما يحكمون

translation: And Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth, so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: Allah created the heavens and the earth with wisdom, justice and for a great purpose - which is to test human beings and hold them accountable for their deeds on the Day of Judgment. Every soul will be fully recompensed for its actions, whether good or evil, without any injustice or oppression. This verse affirms Allah's perfect justice and wisdom in creating the universe and human beings.
orig: وخلق الله السماوات والأرض بالحق ولتجزى كل نفس بما كسبت وهم لا يظلمون

translation: Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and Allah has sent him astray due to knowledge and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after Allah? Then will you not be reminded?
interpretation: This verse condemns those who make their desires and whims their god, following them blindly without guidance from Allah. It describes how Allah has allowed them to go astray due to their arrogance and lack of faith. Their hearts and minds are sealed from the truth, with a veil over their spiritual vision. The rhetorical question "So who will guide him after Allah?" emphasizes that once Allah has abandoned someone to misguidance due to their stubborn rejection, no one else can guide them. It serves as a warning to be mindful and not be led astray by one's desires and ego.
orig: أفرأيت من اتخذ إلهه هواه وأضله الله على علم وختم على سمعه وقلبه وجعل على بصره غشاوة فمن يهديه من بعد الله أفلا تذكرون

translation: And they say, "There is nothing but our worldly life; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have no knowledge of that; they are only guessing.
interpretation: This verse is criticizing the disbelievers who denied the concept of the Hereafter and Resurrection. They claimed that there is only this worldly life, and that death is the end, with no afterlife or accountability. They attributed the cause of death to merely the passage of time, denying the existence of a Supreme Creator who gives life and causes death.
