Their statement shows their ignorance and lack of knowledge, as they were merely guessing without any evidence or proof.
orig: وقالوا ما هي إلا حياتنا الدنيا نموت ونحيا وما يهلكنا إلا الدهر وما لهم بذلك من علم إن هم إلا يظنون

translation: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, their argument is nothing but that they say, 'Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful.'
interpretation: The interpretation is that when the clear and evident signs of Allah are recited to the disbelievers, their only argument against it is to demand that their deceased ancestors be brought back to life, as if to confirm the truth of the message. This shows their stubbornness and rejection of the truth, as they make an unreasonable demand instead of accepting the clear proofs presented to them.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات ما كان حجتهم إلا أن قالوا ائتوا بآبائنا إن كنتم صادقين

translation: Say, "Allah causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt." But most of the people do not know.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the absolute power of Allah over life and death, and His control over the resurrection on the Day of Judgment. It highlights that while the resurrection is an undeniable reality, most people remain ignorant or heedless of this truth."
orig: قل الله يحييكم ثم يميتكم ثم يجمعكم إلى يوم القيامة لا ريب فيه ولكن أكثر الناس لا يعلمون

translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and on the Day the Hour will be established - that Day the falsifiers will lose.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah alone is the true Sovereign and Ruler over the heavens and the earth. It also warns that on the Day of Resurrection, those who rejected faith and denied the truth "the falsifiers" will be the ultimate losers, as their denial and disbelief will lead them to a great loss in the Hereafter.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض ويوم تقوم الساعة يومئذ يخسر المبطلون

translation: And you will see every nation crouching. Every nation will be called to its record. Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when all nations and peoples will be gathered before Allah. Each nation will be in a humbled state, crouching in fear and anticipation. They will be summoned to account for their deeds, as each person's record of actions will be presented. On that Day, everyone will be judged and held accountable for their actions in this worldly life, receiving the appropriate recompense – reward or punishment – based on what they did.
orig: وترى كل أمة جاثية كل أمة تدعى إلى كتابها اليوم تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

translation: This is Our Book which speaks to you with the truth. Verily, We were recording what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is revealed by Allah and speaks the truth. It also implies that Allah has full knowledge of all human actions and deeds, which are being recorded and will be accounted for on the Day of Judgment.
orig: هذا كتابنا ينطق عليكم بالحق إنا كنا نستنسخ ما كنتم تعملون

translation: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the clear attainment.
interpretation: "This verse promises those who have faith in Allah and perform good deeds that they will be granted Allah's mercy and forgiveness on the Day of Judgment. This is described as a clear and manifest success, as it is the ultimate goal and achievement for the believers."
orig: فأما الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات فيدخلهم ربهم في رحمته ذلك هو الفوز المبين

translation: But as for those who disbelieved, [Allah will say], 'Were not My verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a people of criminals?'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and obstinacy of the disbelievers who rejected the divine revelations and clear signs presented to them. Despite the verses being recited to them, they remained arrogant and persisted in their disbelief, becoming a people engrossed in sin and disobedience to Allah.
orig: وأما الذين كفروا أفلم تكن آياتي تتلى عليكم فاستكبرتم وكنتم قوما مجرمين

translation: And when it is said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour is no doubt coming,' you say, 'We do not know what is the Hour. We only assume assumption, and we are not convinced.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who deny the inevitability of the Day of Resurrection and the fulfillment of Allah's promise. It highlights their lack of certainty and their reliance on mere assumptions rather than firm belief in the truth revealed by Allah and His Messenger.
orig: وإذا قيل إن وعد الله حق والساعة لا ريب فيها قلتم ما ندري ما الساعة إن نظن إلا ظنا وما نحن بمستيقنين

translation: And the evil results of the deeds which they did will become apparent to them, and that which they used to mock at will encircle them.
interpretation: This verse warns that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers will face the terrible consequences of their evil deeds and the falsehoods they mocked at in this world. Their sins and disbelief will become manifest to them, and they will be surrounded by the very things they ridiculed, such as the punishment of Hell and the reality of the Hereafter.
orig: وبدا لهم سيئات ما عملوا وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And it will be said, 'Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.'
interpretation: "This verse warns the disbelievers that on the Day of Judgment, they will be forgotten and neglected by Allah, just as they neglected and forgot their duty to worship Him in this life. Their ultimate abode will be the Hellfire, and they will have no one to help or save them from the punishment."
orig: وقيل اليوم ننساكم كما نسيتم لقاء يومكم هذا ومأواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين

translation: That is because you took the signs of Allah in ridicule and were deluded by the life of this world. So that Day, they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to repent.
interpretation: This verse explains the reason behind the punishment mentioned in the previous verses. It states that the disbelievers mocked and ridiculed Allah's signs and revelations, and were deceived by the temporary pleasures of this worldly life. As a result, on the Day of Judgment, they will not be taken out of the Hellfire, nor will they be given the opportunity to repent and make amends for their disbelief and sins.
orig: ذلكم بأنكم اتخذتم آيات الله هزوا وغرتكم الحياة الدنيا فاليوم لا يخرجون منها ولا هم يستعتبون

translation: So praise be to Allah, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.
interpretation: This verse glorifies Allah as the sole Lord, Creator and Sustainer of the entire universe, including the heavens, the earth, and all that exists. It reminds us to praise and thank Allah for His immense blessings and mercy upon us and all of creation.
orig: فلله الحمد رب السماوات ورب الأرض رب العالمين

translation: And to Him belongs majesty in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms the absolute majesty, power, and wisdom of Allah. It highlights that all grandeur and magnificence in the heavens and the earth belong solely to Him. He is the Mighty, who has complete authority and control over all creation, and the Wise, whose actions and decisions are based on perfect wisdom and knowledge. This verse instills a sense of awe and reverence towards the Almighty, reminding believers of His unparalleled greatness and encouraging them to submit to His will with humility.
orig: وله الكبرياء في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: Ha Mim.
interpretation: These two letters are among the "muqatta'aat" or disconnected letters which occur at the beginning of some chapters in the Qur'an. Their precise meaning is known only to Allah. However, they are believed to draw the reader's attention to the divine origin of the Qur'an and its inimitable language and style.
orig: حم

translation: A revelation of the Book from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an is a revelation sent down by Allah, Who is Almighty and Perfect in His Power, and All-Wise in His Legislation and Ordainments. This affirms the divine origin of the Qur'an and its authority as the Word of God.
orig: تنزيل الكتاب من الله العزيز الحكيم

translation: We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. But those who disbelieve turn away from what they are warned of.
interpretation: Allah created the universe with truth, wisdom and purpose, not in vain or for mere play. Everything has a determined life span and a specified term. However, the disbelievers turn away from the warnings and reminders about the Hereafter and accountability before Allah.
orig: ما خلقنا السماوات والأرض وما بينهما إلا بالحق وأجل مسمى والذين كفروا عما أنذروا معرضون

translation: Say, "Have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth, or did they have a share in [creating] the heavens? Bring me a scripture before this or a remnant of knowledge, if you are truthful."
interpretation: This verse challenges the idolaters to provide evidence for the divinity of their false gods. It asks them to show what these idols have created on earth or if they had any share in creating the heavens. It also demands them to produce a divine scripture or any remnant of true knowledge that supports their beliefs, if they are truthful in their claims of worshipping others besides Allah.
orig: قل أرأيتم ما تدعون من دون الله أروني ماذا خلقوا من الأرض أم لهم شرك في السماوات ائتوني بكتاب من قبل هذا أو أثارة من علم إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And who is more astray than one who invokes, besides Allah, those that will not answer him until the Day of Resurrection, and they are unaware of their invocation?
interpretation: This verse condemns the practice of idolatry and calling upon beings other than Allah for help or worship. It highlights the futility of such actions, as these false deities will never respond until the Day of Resurrection, and they are completely oblivious to the supplications made to them. The verse emphasizes that associating partners with Allah in worship is a grave misguidance and a manifestation of being deeply astray.
orig: ومن أضل ممن يدعو من دون الله من لا يستجيب له إلى يوم القيامة وهم عن دعائهم غافلون

translation: And when the people are gathered, they will be enemies to them, and they will deny their worship.
interpretation: This verse refers to the idols and false deities that people used to worship besides Allah. On the Day of Judgment, these idols will disown their former worshippers and become their enemies, denying that they were ever worshipped. It highlights the futility of worshipping anything other than the One True God, Allah.
orig: وإذا حشر الناس كانوا لهم أعداء وكانوا بعبادتهم كافرين

translation: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, those who disbelieved say to the truth when it came to them, "This is obvious magic."
interpretation: The disbelievers stubbornly rejected the clear signs and revelations from Allah, dismissing them as mere magic or sorcery when the truth became evident to them. Their denial stemmed from arrogance and a refusal to accept the divine guidance, despite its clarity and authenticity.
orig: وإذا تتلى عليهم آياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للحق لما جاءهم هذا سحر مبين

translation: Or do they say, 'He has invented it?' Say, 'If I have invented it, you will not have any power to help me against Allah. He knows best what you utter concerning it. He is enough as a Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse addresses those who accused the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ of inventing or forging the Qur'an. Allah instructs the Prophet to respond that if he had indeed fabricated it, they would have no power to protect him from Allah's punishment. Allah knows what they say about the Qur'an, and He is sufficient as a witness between the Prophet and the disbelievers. Allah is also the Forgiving and the Merciful, offering forgiveness to those who repent and believe.
orig: أم يقولون افتراه قل إن افتريته فلا تملكون لي من الله شيئا هو أعلم بما تفيضون فيه كفى به شهيدا بيني وبينكم وهو الغفور الرحيم

translation: Say, 'I am not a novelty among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me, and I am but a clear warner.'
interpretation: The Prophet Muhammad is instructed to declare that he is not the first messenger sent by God, nor does he know what will happen to him or his people. His role is simply to convey the divine revelation he receives without any alteration, acting as a clear warner to humanity.
orig: قل ما كنت بدعا من الرسل وما أدري ما يفعل بي ولا بكم إن أتبع إلا ما يوحى إلي وما أنا إلا نذير مبين

translation: Say, 'Have you considered: if it is from Allah and you disbelieved in it, and a witness from the Children of Israel testified to its like and believed while you were arrogant...?' Truly, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the Qur'an is indeed from Allah, and challenges the disbelievers to ponder over the fact that even a witness from the Children of Israel (a Jew) testified to the truth of a scripture similar to the Qur'an and believed in it, while the disbelievers arrogantly rejected it. It warns that Allah does not guide those who persist in wrongdoing and arrogance.
orig: قل أرأيتم إن كان من عند الله وكفرتم به وشهد شاهد من بني إسرائيل على مثله فآمن واستكبرتم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: And those who disbelieved say to those who believed, 'If it had been any good, they would not have preceded us to it.' And when they are not guided by it, they will say, 'This is an ancient falsehood.'
interpretation: This verse addresses the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers. They rejected the truth simply because it was not revealed to them first, and claimed that if it were really good, they would have been the first to receive it. Their pride and envy prevented them from accepting the guidance, and they dismissed it as an ancient lie or fabrication. This shows their closed-mindedness and unwillingness to consider the truth with an open heart.
orig: وقال الذين كفروا للذين آمنوا لو كان خيرا ما سبقونا إليه وإذ لم يهتدوا به فسيقولون هذا إفك قديم

translation: And before this, was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue, to warn those who do wrong, and as glad tidings to the good-doers.
interpretation: This verse affirms the divine origin and continuity of the revealed scriptures, linking the Qur'an to the previous revelation given to Moses. It highlights the Qur'an's role in warning the wrongdoers about the consequences of their actions and giving glad tidings to those who do good deeds, promising them reward and salvation. The verse also emphasizes the Arabic language of the Qur'an, making it accessible and understandable to the Arab people.
orig: ومن قبله كتاب موسى إماما ورحمة وهذا كتاب مصدق لسانا عربيا لينذر الذين ظلموا وبشرى للمحسنين

translation: Indeed, those who say, 'Our Lord is Allah,' and then remain firm [on that path], there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.
interpretation: This verse promises those who have sincerely accepted Islam and remain steadfast on its teachings that they will be free from fear and grief in this world and the Hereafter. By affirming their faith in the Oneness of God and following the guidance revealed to them, they attain inner peace and contentment, and are promised eternal bliss in the life to come.
orig: إن الذين قالوا ربنا الله ثم استقاموا فلا خوف عليهم ولا هم يحزنون

translation: Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the people who will enter Paradise and live there forever as a reward for their good deeds and righteous actions in this world. It highlights the eternal bliss and reward that awaits the believers who followed Allah's commands and lived according to His guidance.
orig: أولئك أصحاب الجنة خالدين فيها جزاء بما كانوا يعملون

translation: And We have enjoined upon man [to be dutiful and good] to his parents. His mother bore him in weakness and hardship upon weakness and hardship, and his weaning is in two years - give thanks to Me and to your parents, unto Me is the final destination.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of being dutiful and good to one's parents, especially the mother who endures great hardship in bearing and nursing her child. It encourages gratitude to Allah and parents, and seeking Allah's pleasure through righteous deeds. It also highlights the significance of repentance and submission to Allah.
orig: ووصينا الإنسان بوالديه إحسانا حملته أمه كرها ووضعته كرها وحمله وفصاله ثلاثون شهرا حتى إذا بلغ أشده وبلغ أربعين سنة قال رب أوزعني أن أشكر نعمتك التي أنعمت علي وعلى والدي وأن أعمل صالحا ترضاه وأصلح لي في ذريتي إني تبت إليك وإني من المسلمين

translation: Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds, [they being] among the companions of Paradise - [that is] the promise of truth which they had been promised.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's immense mercy and forgiveness towards the believers. He accepts their good deeds, even if they are few, and pardons their sins and shortcomings. Those who have faith and perform righteous actions will be rewarded with Paradise, which is a truthful promise from Allah.
orig: أولئك الذين نتقبل عنهم أحسن ما عملوا ونتجاوز عن سيئاتهم في أصحاب الجنة وعد الصدق الذي كانوا يوعدون

translation: And he who says to his parents, "Uff to you! Do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations have already passed on before me?" while they call to Allah for help [and to Him], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former peoples."
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who mocked the idea of resurrection and the life after death. They ridiculed their believing parents for having faith in Allah's promise of resurrection, considering it mere fables of ancient people. The interpretation highlights the arrogance and stubbornness of those who reject faith, even when their parents plead with them to believe in the truth of Allah's promise.
orig: والذي قال لوالديه أف لكما أتعدانني أن أخرج وقد خلت القرون من قبلي وهما يستغيثان الله ويلك آمن إن وعد الله حق فيقول ما هذا إلا أساطير الأولين

translation: Those are the ones against whom the word concerning nations that had passed away before them of jinn and humans has become due. Indeed, they were losers.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have rejected faith and followed disbelief. They are like the previous nations of jinn and humans who were destroyed for their rejection of Allah's messengers and signs. The "word" that became due upon them refers to Allah's punishment and torment in this world and the Hereafter for their persistent disbelief and disobedience. They are described as "losers" because they have lost the opportunity for salvation and eternal bliss by choosing the path of misguidance.
orig: أولئك الذين حق عليهم القول في أمم قد خلت من قبلهم من الجن والإنس إنهم كانوا خاسرين

translation: And for all there will be degrees [of reward and punishment] according to what they have done. And in order that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principle of justice and accountability in Islam. It states that every person will be rewarded or punished based on their deeds and actions in this world. The "degrees" mentioned refer to varying levels of reward or punishment proportionate to the good or bad deeds performed. Allah will fully recompense people for their actions, without any injustice or wrongdoing on His part. This verse highlights the importance of striving for righteous deeds and avoiding evil actions, as one's ultimate fate in the Hereafter depends on it.
orig: ولكل درجات مما عملوا وليوفيهم أعمالهم وهم لا يظلمون

translation: And on the Day when those who disbelieved will be exposed to the Fire [it will be said], 'You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you used to behave insolently.'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the punishment they will face on the Day of Judgment for indulging in worldly pleasures, being arrogant, and behaving rebelliously without any justification. They will be exposed to the Fire of Hell as a recompense for their arrogance, insolence, and rejection of faith during their worldly life. The verse emphasizes that their temporary enjoyment of pleasures in this life will be replaced by a humiliating and severe punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أذهبتم طيباتكم في حياتكم الدنيا واستمتعتم بها فاليوم تجزون عذاب الهون بما كنتم تستكبرون في الأرض بغير الحق وبما كنتم تفسقون

translation: And mention, [O Muhammad], the brother of Thamud - when he warned his people at al-Ahqaf - and there had already passed warners before him and after him, [saying], 'Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a tremendous Day.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the prophet Hud, who was sent to the tribe of Thamud to guide them to the worship of the One True God. He warned them of the severe punishment that would befall them if they continued in their idolatry and disobedience. Despite being preceded and succeeded by other prophets with the same message, the people of Thamud arrogantly rejected Hud's call to monotheism.
orig: واذكر أخا عاد إذ أنذر قومه بالأحقاف وقد خلت النذر من بين يديه ومن خلفه ألا تعبدوا إلا الله إني أخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم

translation: They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you threaten us with, if you are truthful."
interpretation: The disbelievers were mocking the Prophet and challenging him to bring upon them the punishment he warned them about if he was truthful in his message, as they were unwilling to abandon their false deities.
orig: قالوا أجئتنا لتأفكنا عن آلهتنا فأتنا بما تعدنا إن كنت من الصادقين

translation: He said: "Verily, the knowledge is with Allah alone, and I convey to you what I have been sent with, but I see that you are an ignorant people."
interpretation: This verse suggests that true knowledge belongs to Allah alone, and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was merely conveying the message he was entrusted with. However, he observed that the people he was addressing were ignorant and lacked understanding, implying that they were rejecting or failing to comprehend the divine message.
orig: قال إنما العلم عند الله وأبلغكم ما أرسلت به ولكني أراكم قوما تجهلون

translation: But when they saw it as a cloud heading towards their valleys, they said, 'This is a cloud bringing us rain!' Rather, it is what you were seeking to hasten - a wind, wherein is a painful punishment.
interpretation: The verse is referring to a punishment that was sent upon an ungrateful people who rejected the message of their prophet. When they saw a cloud approaching, they thought it would bring rain, but it was in fact a wind carrying a painful torment as a consequence for their disbelief and defiance of God's commands.
orig: فلما رأوه عارضا مستقبل أوديتهم قالوا هذا عارض ممطرنا بل هو ما استعجلتم به ريح فيها عذاب أليم

translation: It (the city) was utterly destroyed by the command of its Lord, so they became such that nothing could be seen except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the people who were guilty of crimes.
interpretation: This verse describes the complete destruction of a city as a punishment from Allah for the crimes of its people. It emphasizes that Allah's punishment is severe and leaves no trace except the empty dwellings. The verse serves as a warning against disobedience and wrongdoing, as Allah will hold accountable those who persist in sin and reject His guidance.
orig: تدمر كل شيء بأمر ربها فأصبحوا لا يرى إلا مساكنهم كذلك نجزي القوم المجرمين

translation: And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts. But their hearing, vision and hearts availed them not from anything when they used to deny the signs of Allah, and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who were granted blessings and faculties like hearing, sight, and intellect, but they failed to utilize them properly by denying Allah's signs. Instead of being grateful, they mocked and ridiculed the truth, which ultimately led to their downfall and the consequences of their mockery enveloping them.
orig: ولقد مكناهم فيما إن مكناكم فيه وجعلنا لهم سمعا وأبصارا وأفئدة فما أغنى عنهم سمعهم ولا أبصارهم ولا أفئدتهم من شيء إذ كانوا يجحدون بآيات الله وحاق بهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون

translation: And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs that perhaps they might return [to righteousness].
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has destroyed many nations and civilizations around the people being addressed, as a warning and a reminder for them to repent and return to the right path. The signs and lessons from the destruction of those communities were presented in various ways, so that they may take heed and reform themselves.
orig: ولقد أهلكنا ما حولكم من القرى وصرفنا الآيات لعلهم يرجعون

translation: Then why did those whom they had taken for gods besides Allah as a way of approach [to Him] not help them? But they strayed from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah is questioning why the false deities that the polytheists worshipped did not help them, since they claimed that these deities brought them closer to Allah. It shows that these deities were powerless and could not benefit their worshippers at all. The polytheists had gone astray from the truth by inventing lies about these false gods.
orig: فلولا نصرهم الذين اتخذوا من دون الله قربانا آلهة بل ضلوا عنهم وذلك إفكهم وما كانوا يفترون

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, 'Listen quietly.' And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where a group of jinn (unseen beings) came across the Prophet Muhammad while he was reciting the Qur'an. They listened attentively and were captivated by its beauty and wisdom. After hearing it, they returned to their people to warn them of the truth and guidance contained in the Qur'an.
orig: وإذ صرفنا إليك نفرا من الجن يستمعون القرآن فلما حضروه قالوا أنصتوا فلما قضي ولوا إلى قومهم منذرين

translation: They said, 'O our people, we have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it, guiding to the truth and to a straight path.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the believers who accepted the message of the Qur'an after hearing it. They recognized it as a divine revelation that confirms the previous scriptures, such as the Torah revealed to Moses, and guides humanity towards the truth and the straight path of righteousness and salvation. It highlights the Qur'an's role in affirming the continuity of divine guidance and its universal message of truth and moral rectitude.
orig: قالوا يا قومنا إنا سمعنا كتابا أنزل من بعد موسى مصدقا لما بين يديه يهدي إلى الحق وإلى طريق مستقيم

translation: O my people! Respond to Allah's caller and believe in him. He will forgive you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is an invitation to believe in Allah and His Messenger. It encourages people to respond positively to the call of faith, as doing so will lead to forgiveness of sins and salvation from a painful punishment in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the importance of heeding the divine call and embracing true belief as a means of attaining Allah's mercy and escaping His wrath.
orig: يا قومنا أجيبوا داعي الله وآمنوا به يغفر لكم من ذنوبكم ويجركم من عذاب أليم

translation: And whoever does not respond to Allah's caller, he cannot escape on earth, and there are no protectors for him besides Allah. Those are in manifest error.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of heeding the call of Allah and following His guidance. Those who reject or turn away from Allah's caller, which refers to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the message of Islam, will find no refuge or protection from Allah's decree anywhere on earth. They have no helpers or supporters besides Allah, and they are clearly misguided and in manifest error by rejecting the truth.
orig: ومن لا يجب داعي الله فليس بمعجز في الأرض وليس له من دونه أولياء أولئك في ضلال مبين

translation: Do they not see that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth and was not wearied by their creation, is Able to give life to the dead? Yes, He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's ability to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment. If He created the vast heavens and earth effortlessly, then reviving the dead is a simple matter for Him. It affirms Allah's absolute power over all things.
orig: أولم يروا أن الله الذي خلق السماوات والأرض ولم يعي بخلقهن بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى بلى إنه على كل شيء قدير

translation: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], 'Is this not the truth?' They will say, 'Yes, by our Lord,' He will say, 'Then taste the punishment for what you used to deny.'
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the punishment they will face on the Day of Resurrection. When they are brought before the Hellfire, they will be asked if this is not the truth that they had denied in the worldly life. They will be forced to admit that it is indeed the truth from their Lord. As a result, they will be commanded to taste the punishment for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: ويوم يعرض الذين كفروا على النار أليس هذا بالحق قالوا بلى وربنا قال فذوقوا العذاب بما كنتم تكفرون

translation: So be patient, as were those of determination among the messengers, and be not impatient for them. It will be as if they had remained but an hour of a day. This is a clear message: Shall any be destroyed except the transgressing people?
interpretation: "This verse encourages the Prophet Muhammad to persevere with patience and steadfastness in the face of adversity, just as the resolute messengers before him did. It assures him that the punishment promised to the disbelievers will seem insignificant in duration, like just an hour of a day. The verse conveys that only the wicked and disobedient people will be destroyed, while the believers will be saved."
orig: فاصبر كما صبر أولو العزم من الرسل ولا تستعجل لهم كأنهم يوم يرون ما يوعدون لم يلبثوا إلا ساعة من نهار بلاغ فهل يهلك إلا القوم الفاسقون

translation: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will have nullified for them their deeds.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who rejected faith and actively prevented others from following the path of Allah. It warns that Allah will render all of their deeds fruitless and worthless, as they have chosen disbelief and hindered others from guidance.
orig: الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله أضل أعمالهم

translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness and spiritual reform for those who sincerely believe in Islam, do good deeds, and accept the revelation given to Prophet Muhammad as the truth from God. It emphasizes that true faith is accompanied by righteous actions and belief in the divine origin of the Qur'an. For such believers, God will pardon their past sins and improve their spiritual state.
orig: والذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات وآمنوا بما نزل على محمد وهو الحق من ربهم كفر عنهم سيئاتهم وأصلح بالهم

translation: That is because those who disbelieved followed falsehood, and those who believed followed the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allah present to the people their comparisons.
interpretation: This verse explains that the reason for the difference between the believers and disbelievers is that the disbelievers followed falsehood and rejected the truth, while the believers followed the truth revealed by Allah. Allah presents these examples and comparisons to people so that they may understand and be guided.
orig: ذلك بأن الذين كفروا اتبعوا الباطل وأن الذين آمنوا اتبعوا الحق من ربهم كذلك يضرب الله للناس أمثالهم

translation: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allah - never will He waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse provides instructions on how to deal with disbelievers in battle. It permits striking their necks (i.e., killing them) until they are subdued, then taking them as captives. After that, the Muslims have the choice to either free them as a favor or ransom them until the war ends. The verse also states that if Allah willed, He could have punished the disbelievers directly, but He ordained armed struggle to test the believers' faith and steadfastness. It concludes by reassuring that those who are martyred in Allah's cause will have their deeds accepted and rewarded.
orig: فإذا لقيتم الذين كفروا فضرب الرقاب حتى إذا أثخنتموهم فشدوا الوثاق فإما منا بعد وإما فداء حتى تضع الحرب أوزارها ذلك ولو يشاء الله لانتصر منهم ولكن ليبلو بعضكم ببعض والذين قتلوا في سبيل الله فلن يضل أعمالهم

translation: He will guide them and amend their condition
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah will guide those who sincerely seek His guidance and rectify their spiritual state, bestowing upon them wisdom and inner peace.
orig: سيهديهم ويصلح بالهم

translation: And He will admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah will grant the believers entry into Paradise, which has been described to them through the revelation and teachings of the Qur'an and the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). The believers will be able to recognize and appreciate the beauty and bliss of Paradise because they have been informed about its delights and wonders through the divine guidance.
orig: ويدخلهم الجنة عرفها لهم

translation: O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to support the cause of Allah by obeying His commands and striving for His religion. If they do so, Allah promises to support them, strengthen their position, grant them victory over their enemies, and make their foothold firm and unshakable.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن تنصروا الله ينصركم ويثبت أقدامكم

translation: But those who disbelieved - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the severe consequences of rejecting faith. It states that they will face misery and distress in this life and the Hereafter. Additionally, their deeds and actions, no matter how great they may seem, will be rendered worthless and futile since they were not performed with sincere faith and for the sake of Allah.
orig: والذين كفروا فتعسا لهم وأضل أعمالهم

translation: That is because they disliked what Allah revealed, so He rendered their deeds worthless.
interpretation: This verse explains the reason behind the deeds of the disbelievers being rendered worthless and futile. It is because they harbored a deep dislike and aversion towards the revelation sent down by Allah, rejecting it out of arrogance and stubbornness. As a result, Allah nullified their deeds and they will receive no reward for them in the Hereafter.
orig: ذلك بأنهم كرهوا ما أنزل الله فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disbelievers is something similar.
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' failure to reflect on the fate of previous nations who denied the truth. It reminds them that Allah completely destroyed those nations for their disbelief, just as He will punish the present disbelievers in a similar manner if they persist in rejecting faith.
orig: أفلم يسيروا في الأرض فينظروا كيف كان عاقبة الذين من قبلهم دمر الله عليهم وللكافرين أمثالها

translation: That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe, and because the disbelievers have no protector.
interpretation: This verse highlights the fundamental difference between believers and disbelievers in terms of their relationship with Allah. Believers have Allah as their Protector, Guardian, and Helper, who guides and supports them in this life and the Hereafter. On the other hand, disbelievers have no true protector or helper, as they have rejected the guidance of Allah and severed their connection with Him. This underscores the importance of faith and the dire consequences of disbelief.
orig: ذلك بأن الله مولى الذين آمنوا وأن الكافرين لا مولى لهم

translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.
interpretation: This verse draws a contrast between the ultimate fate of the believers and disbelievers. The believers who have faith and perform good deeds will be admitted to the eternal Gardens of Paradise, with rivers flowing beneath them, as a reward for their righteousness. On the other hand, the disbelievers who reject faith may indulge in worldly pleasures temporarily, consuming and enjoying like cattle, but their final abode will be the Fire of Hell as a punishment for their disbelief and evil actions.
orig: إن الله يدخل الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار والذين كفروا يتمتعون ويأكلون كما تأكل الأنعام والنار مثوى لهم

translation: And how many a town was stronger than your town which has driven you out? We destroyed them, and there was no helper for them.
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers of Makkah who drove out the Prophet Muhammad and his companions from their hometown. Allah reminds them that He has destroyed many powerful nations in the past who were stronger than the Makkan disbelievers, and no one could help or save those nations from Allah's punishment when it came upon them for their disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: وكأين من قرية هي أشد قوة من قريتك التي أخرجتك أهلكناهم فلا ناصر لهم

translation: Is one who is on clear evidence from his Lord like one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive and they follow their desires?
interpretation: This verse contrasts the believer who follows clear guidance from Allah with the disbeliever who follows his desires. The believer has clear proof and evidence from his Lord, while the disbeliever is deceived by the attractive appearance of his evil deeds and follows his whims and desires instead of the truth.
orig: أفمن كان على بينة من ربه كمن زين له سوء عمله واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: The example of the Paradise which the pious have been promised: in it are rivers of pure water, and rivers of milk with unchanging taste, and rivers of wine, a delight to the drinkers, and rivers of strained honey. And therein they shall have all kinds of fruits, and forgiveness from their Lord. (Can this be compared to the state of) those who shall abide forever in the Fire and shall be given to drink boiling water that will cut up their entrails?
interpretation: This verse contrasts the bountiful blessings of Paradise, described in vivid detail with its rivers of pure water, milk, wine and honey, and abundant fruits and forgiveness from God, with the torment of Hellfire where the disbelievers will abide forever and be given boiling water that will tear apart their insides. It highlights the stark difference between the eternal reward for the righteous and the eternal punishment for the disbelievers.
orig: مثل الجنة التي وعد المتقون فيها أنهار من ماء غير آسن وأنهار من لبن لم يتغير طعمه وأنهار من خمر لذة للشاربين وأنهار من عسل مصفى ولهم فيها من كل الثمرات ومغفرة من ربهم كمن هو خالد في النار وسقوا ماء حميما فقطع أمعاءهم

translation: And among them are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, 'What has he said just now?' Those are the ones of whom Allah has sealed over their hearts and they have followed their own desires.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who pretended to listen to the Prophet but did not sincerely accept his teachings. When they left his company, they mocked and ridiculed what he had said to those who had knowledge and understanding of the Qur'an. Allah has sealed their hearts, preventing them from accepting guidance, and they follow their own whims and desires rather than the truth.
orig: ومنهم من يستمع إليك حتى إذا خرجوا من عندك قالوا للذين أوتوا العلم ماذا قال آنفا أولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم واتبعوا أهواءهم

translation: And those who were guided, He increased them in guidance and gave them their righteousness.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have accepted the guidance of Allah and followed the straight path. For such people, Allah increases their guidance, understanding, and insight into the religion. He also bestows upon them the quality of taqwa (righteousness, piety, and consciousness of Allah), which enables them to refrain from sins and engage in righteous deeds. This increase in guidance and taqwa is a reward and blessing from Allah for those who sincerely seek the truth and strive to follow it.
orig: والذين اهتدوا زادهم هدى وآتاهم تقواهم

translation: Do they await except the Hour to come upon them suddenly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then how will they have their reminder when it has come to them?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers who deny the coming of the Hour (Day of Resurrection). It states that they should not await anything except the sudden coming of the Hour, as its signs have already appeared. When it does come upon them, how will they benefit from being reminded then, when it will be too late?
orig: فهل ينظرون إلا الساعة أن تأتيهم بغتة فقد جاء أشراطها فأنى لهم إذا جاءتهم ذكراهم

translation: So know that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows your movement and your resting place.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and instructs the believers to seek forgiveness from Him for their sins as well as to pray for forgiveness for all believing men and women. It also reminds us that Allah is All-Aware of our actions and movements, whether we are active or at rest.
orig: فاعلم أنه لا إله إلا الله واستغفر لذنبك وللمؤمنين والمؤمنات والله يعلم متقلبكم ومثواكم

translation: And those who believe say, 'Why has a surah not been sent down?' But when a precise surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is disease looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. So woe to them!
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who questioned the revelation of the Qur'an and expressed doubt about its divine origin. When a decisive surah was revealed mentioning jihad and fighting against the disbelievers, those with sickness in their hearts - referring to the hypocrites - looked at the Prophet with fear and dread, as if they were about to faint from the prospect of fighting. The verse condemns their cowardice and lack of faith.
orig: ويقول الذين آمنوا لولا نزلت سورة فإذا أنزلت سورة محكمة وذكر فيها القتال رأيت الذين في قلوبهم مرض ينظرون إليك نظر المغشي عليه من الموت فأولى لهم

translation: Obedience and good words. But when the matter is resolved upon, if they were true to Allah, it would be better for them.
interpretation: The verse emphasizes the importance of obedience to Allah and using kind words. However, when a decision has been made, being truthful and sincere in one's faith in Allah would have been better for them than disobedience or insincerity.
orig: طاعة وقول معروف فإذا عزم الأمر فلو صدقوا الله لكان خيرا لهم

translation: Would you then, if you were given the authority, do mischief in the land and sever your ties of kinship?
interpretation: This verse is warning against the potential abuse of power and authority. It questions whether, if given control, people would spread corruption on earth and sever family ties and relationships. The verse cautions against using power for destructive purposes that harm society and disrupt social cohesion.
orig: فهل عسيتم إن توليتم أن تفسدوا في الأرض وتقطعوا أرحامكم

translation: Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their sight.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject faith and turn away from the guidance of Allah. As a consequence, Allah has cursed them, rendering them spiritually deaf and blind. Their hearts are sealed, preventing them from perceiving the truth and being guided. This is a metaphorical expression of their state of disbelief and obstinacy towards the divine message.
orig: أولئك الذين لعنهم الله فأصمهم وأعمى أبصارهم

translation: Will they not then ponder over the Qur'an, or are there locks upon their hearts?
interpretation: This verse questions the attitude of those who do not reflect upon the teachings of the Qur'an. It implies that their failure to contemplate the Qur'an stems from a lack of understanding or a hardening of their hearts, which prevents them from perceiving its profound wisdom and guidance. The verse encourages people to ponder over the Qur'an with an open mind and heart, rather than turning away from its message due to preconceived notions or spiritual blindness.
orig: أفلا يتدبرون القرآن أم على قلوب أقفالها

translation: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who turned away from faith and embraced disbelief after the truth had been made clear to them. Satan deceived them and made them have false hopes, leading them astray from the right path.
orig: إن الذين ارتدوا على أدبارهم من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى الشيطان سول لهم وأملى لهم

translation: That is because they say to those who dislike what Allah has revealed, "We will obey you in part of the matter," and Allah knows their secret conversation.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly professed Islam but inwardly harbored disbelief. They made a secret pact with those who openly disliked and opposed the revelations from Allah, promising to obey them in some matters. However, Allah knows their deceitful intentions and secret dealings, which they try to conceal.
orig: ذلك بأنهم قالوا للذين كرهوا ما نزل الله سنطيعكم في بعض الأمر والله يعلم إسرارهم

translation: So how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers about the punishment they will face at the time of death. The angels will strike their faces and backs as a form of humiliation and punishment for rejecting the truth and following falsehood. It serves as a reminder of the consequences of disbelief and emphasizes the importance of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: فكيف إذا توفتهم الملائكة يضربون وجوههم وأدبارهم

translation: That is because they followed what angered Allah and hated His pleasure, so He rendered their deeds worthless.
interpretation: This verse explains the reason why the deeds of certain people were rendered worthless. It is because they followed what angered Allah by disobeying His commands, and they hated His pleasure by rejecting His guidance. As a result, Allah nullified their deeds and they will not receive any reward for them in the Hereafter.
orig: ذلك بأنهم اتبعوا ما أسخط الله وكرهوا رضوانه فأحبط أعمالهم

translation: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah would never expose their resentments?
interpretation: This verse is referring to the hypocrites and those whose faith is weak. It warns them that Allah will expose their inner resentments, jealousies, and ill intentions towards the believers. They cannot hide their true feelings from Allah, who knows what is in their hearts.
orig: أم حسب الذين في قلوبهم مرض أن لن يخرج الله أضغانهم

translation: And if We willed, We could have shown them to you, and you would have known them by their marks. But you will surely know them by the tone of their speech. And Allah knows your deeds.
interpretation: The interpretation is that Allah has the power to reveal the hypocrites to the Prophet, but He chose not to do so. Instead, the hypocrites would be recognized by their tone and manner of speech, which would betray their true intentions and lack of faith. Ultimately, Allah knows everyone's deeds, whether they are sincere believers or hypocrites.
orig: ولو نشاء لأريناكهم فلعرفتهم بسيماهم ولتعرفنهم في لحن القول والله يعلم أعمالكم

translation: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you and those who are patient, and We will test your affairs.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah tests His servants with various trials and difficulties to distinguish those who strive in His cause with patience and perseverance from those who do not. Through these tests, the true believers are identified by their steadfastness and submission to Allah's decree, while the insincere are exposed by their lack of faith and impatience. It is a reminder that life is a test, and one's true character is revealed through the challenges faced and the manner in which they are endured.
orig: ولنبلونكم حتى نعلم المجاهدين منكم والصابرين ونبلو أخباركم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah and defy the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them - never will they harm Allah at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.
interpretation: This verse warns those who reject faith and try to prevent others from following Allah's path, as well as those who oppose the Messenger after being shown the truth. It emphasizes that their rejection and opposition can never harm Allah in any way, and that He will nullify all of their efforts and deeds, rendering them fruitless and worthless.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله وشاقوا الرسول من بعد ما تبين لهم الهدى لن يضروا الله شيئا وسيحبط أعمالهم

translation: O you who believe! Obey Allah and obey the Messenger, and do not render your deeds vain.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying Allah and His Messenger, as disobedience leads to the nullification of one's good deeds. It highlights the necessity of having faith and backing it up with righteous actions in accordance with the commands of Allah and the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. Obedience to Allah and His Messenger is the key to success in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا أطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول ولا تبطلوا أعمالكم

translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the way of Allah and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the grave consequence of disbelief and actively hindering others from the path of Allah. It states that those who reject faith, obstruct the way of Allah, and die in a state of disbelief will never be forgiven by Allah. Their rejection of guidance and opposition to the truth has sealed their fate, and they will not receive Allah's forgiveness or mercy.
orig: إن الذين كفروا وصدوا عن سبيل الله ثم ماتوا وهم كفار فلن يغفر الله لهم

translation: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allah is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to remain steadfast and not lose hope or surrender in the face of adversity. It reminds them that they are in a position of strength and superiority, and that Allah is with them, supporting and guiding them. It also assures them that their efforts and good deeds will not go unrewarded by Allah.
orig: فلا تهنوا وتدعوا إلى السلم وأنتم الأعلون والله معكم ولن يتركم أعمالكم

translation: The life of this world is but play and amusement. But if you believe and guard against evil, He will grant you your rewards, and will not ask you for your possessions.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the worldly life is temporary and fleeting, like a game or pastime. True happiness and success lie in having faith in Allah and being mindful of His commands. If we do so, Allah will reward us generously in the Hereafter without demanding our worldly wealth in return.
orig: إنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وإن تؤمنوا وتتقوا يؤتكم أجوركم ولا يسألكم أموالكم

translation: If He were to ask you for it and press you, you would covetously withhold and He would expose your resentment.
interpretation: This verse is warning believers against being stingy and miserly. It suggests that if Allah were to demand anything from people, even the most valuable possessions, they would become covetous and unwilling to give due to their love of wealth and worldly possessions. It exposes the deep-rooted greed and resentment that lies within the human soul when asked to part with material belongings.
orig: إن يسألكموها فيحفكم تبخلوا ويخرج أضغانكم

translation: Here you are; you are called to spend in the way of Allah, but among you are those who are stingy. And whoever is stingy is stingy only against himself. And Allah is the Rich, while you are the poor. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.
interpretation: This verse is an admonition to those who are stingy and unwilling to spend in the cause of Allah. It warns them that their miserliness only harms themselves, not Allah, who is Self-Sufficient and does not need their wealth. It also reminds them of their own poverty and need for Allah's bounties. Furthermore, it threatens that if they persist in their stinginess, Allah will replace them with a different people who are more obedient and willing to sacrifice for His cause.
orig: ها أنتم هؤلاء تدعون لتنفقوا في سبيل الله فمنكم من يبخل ومن يبخل فإنما يبخل عن نفسه والله الغني وأنتم الفقراء وإن تتولوا يستبدل قوما غيركم ثم لا يكونوا أمثالكم

translation: Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muhammad], a clear conquest
interpretation: "This verse refers to the conquest of Makkah by the Prophet Muhammad and his companions in 630 CE, which marked a major turning point in the spread of Islam. The 'clear conquest' signifies the peaceful entry into Makkah after years of persecution, allowing the Muslims to establish their religious practices freely in the holy city."
orig: إنا فتحنا لك فتحا مبينا

translation: That Allah may forgive for you what preceded of your sin and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: This verse is a promise from Allah to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) that his past and future sins will be forgiven, Allah's blessings upon him will be completed, and he will be guided to the straight path. It highlights Allah's mercy and forgiveness towards the Prophet and His intent to bestow favors upon him and guide him to the right way.
orig: ليغفر لك الله ما تقدم من ذنبك وما تأخر ويتم نعمته عليك ويهديك صراطا مستقيما

translation: And Allah will help you with a mighty help.
interpretation: This verse promises that Allah will grant the believers a great victory and support them against their enemies. It is a reassurance that despite the difficulties they may face, Allah's help and aid will ultimately prevail, and the believers will be victorious through His mighty assistance.
orig: وينصرك الله نصرا عزيزا

translation: It is He who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and wisdom in strengthening the faith of believers through tranquility. The "tranquility" refers to a sense of peace, reassurance, and certainty that Allah instills in the hearts of believers, allowing their faith to grow stronger. This divine support is a manifestation of Allah's control over all forces in the heavens and the earth, which belong to Him. The verse concludes by affirming Allah's perfect knowledge and wisdom in dealing with His creation.
orig: هو الذي أنزل السكينة في قلوب المؤمنين ليزدادوا إيمانا مع إيمانهم ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عليما حكيما

translation: That He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide eternally, and may remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers, both men and women, entry into Paradise where rivers flow beneath lush gardens. They will dwell there forever, and Allah will forgive their sins and misdeeds. This is described as a "great attainment" in the sight of Allah, indicating the immense reward and honor for those who have faith and do righteous deeds.
orig: ليدخل المؤمنين والمؤمنات جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ويكفر عنهم سيئاتهم وكان ذلك عند الله فوزا عظيما

translation: And He will punish the hypocritical men and hypocritical women, and the men and women who associate others with Allah - those who have an evil opinion of Allah. Upon them is a misfortune of evil. And Allah is angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell. And evil is the destination.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits the hypocrites - those who outwardly profess faith but inwardly harbor disbelief and ill intentions towards Allah and the believers. It also includes those who associate partners with Allah in worship. Their evil thoughts about Allah will only bring misfortune upon themselves. They have earned Allah's anger, curse, and the torment of Hell, which is the ultimate evil destination.
orig: ويعذب المنافقين والمنافقات والمشركين والمشركات الظانين بالله ظن السوء عليهم دائرة السوء وغضب الله عليهم ولعنهم وأعد لهم جهنم وساءت مصيرا

translation: And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and control over all the forces and creatures in the heavens and the earth. It emphasizes that everything obeys His commands and serves His purposes. The term "soldiers" refers to the angels, celestial bodies, natural phenomena, and all created beings that operate by Allah's will and follow His laws. This highlights Allah's might, wisdom, and perfect orchestration of the universe.
orig: ولله جنود السماوات والأرض وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness, a bringer of good tidings and a warner.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was sent by Allah as a witness to the truth, a bearer of glad tidings for those who believe and follow the divine guidance, and a warner for those who disbelieve and disobey. His role encompassed testifying to the Oneness of Allah, conveying the message of Islam, promising rewards for the believers, and cautioning against the consequences of disbelief and wrongdoing.
orig: إنا أرسلناك شاهدا ومبشرا ونذيرا

translation: So that you may believe in Allah and His Messenger, and honor and revere Him, and glorify Him morning and evening.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to have faith in Allah and His Messenger, to honor and revere them, and to glorify Allah by praising and worshipping Him at the beginning and end of each day. It emphasizes the importance of maintaining a strong connection with Allah through belief, respect, and constant remembrance.
orig: لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتعزروه وتوقروه وتسبحوه بكرة وأصيلا

translation: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allah - He will give him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse highlights the significance of pledging allegiance to the Prophet Muhammad, as it is considered a pledge to Allah Himself. The metaphor of Allah's hand being over their hands symbolizes His authority and acceptance of their pledge. Those who break their pledge harm only themselves, while those who fulfill their covenant with Allah will receive a great reward from Him.
orig: إن الذين يبايعونك إنما يبايعون الله يد الله فوق أيديهم فمن نكث فإنما ينكث على نفسه ومن أوفى بما عاهد عليه الله فسيؤتيه أجرا عظيما

translation: The bedouin Arabs who lagged behind will say to you: "Our possessions and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, "Then who could avail you against Allah at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted."
interpretation: This verse addresses the hypocrites who made excuses for not joining the battle by claiming they were preoccupied with their wealth and families. It exposes their insincerity by stating that their words do not reflect their true intentions. The verse emphasizes that no one can benefit or harm a person except by Allah's will, and that He is fully aware of their actions.
orig: سيقول لك المخلفون من الأعراب شغلتنا أموالنا وأهلونا فاستغفر لنا يقولون بألسنتهم ما ليس في قلوبهم قل فمن يملك لكم من الله شيئا إن أراد بكم ضرا أو أراد بكم نفعا بل كان الله بما تعملون خبيرا

translation: Nay, you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that was made pleasing in your hearts, and you entertained an evil thought and you became a people doomed to perish.
interpretation: This verse is rebuking the disbelievers for their arrogant assumption that the Muslims would never return victorious to their homes and families after their campaign. Their false sense of security and evil thoughts about the Muslims led them to underestimate the believers' strength and resolve, ultimately sealing their own doom.
orig: بل ظننتم أن لن ينقلب الرسول والمؤمنون إلى أهليهم أبدا وزين ذلك في قلوبكم وظننتم ظن السوء وكنتم قوما بورا

translation: And whoever does not believe in Allah and His Messenger - We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.
interpretation: This verse serves as a stern warning to those who reject faith in Allah and His Messenger. It indicates that for such disbelievers, a punishment of an intensely burning Fire (Sair) has been prepared in the Hereafter. The verse emphasizes the grave consequences of denying the truth and highlights the importance of accepting Allah's guidance through His Messengers.
orig: ومن لم يؤمن بالله ورسوله فإنا أعتدنا للكافرين سعيرا

translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty and authority over the entire universe. It emphasizes that He alone has the power to forgive sins or punish transgressors as He wills. However, it also reminds us of Allah's infinite mercy and forgiveness, as He is described as "Forgiving and Merciful." This verse encourages us to seek Allah's forgiveness while also instilling a sense of accountability for our actions.
orig: ولله ملك السماوات والأرض يغفر لمن يشاء ويعذب من يشاء وكان الله غفورا رحيما

translation: Those who lagged behind will say when you set out toward the spoils of war to take them, 'Let us follow you,' desiring to change the words of Allah. Say, 'You will not follow us; Allah has said this before.' Then they will say, 'Nay, you envy us.' Nay, they have not been comprehending except a little.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the hypocrites who wanted to join the believers in acquiring spoils of war after staying behind during the battle. It exposes their true intention of changing Allah's command and accuses them of envy when they are prevented from joining. The verse highlights their lack of true understanding of faith.
orig: سيقول المخلفون إذا انطلقتم إلى مغانم لتأخذوها ذرونا نتبعكم يريدون أن يبدلوا كلام الله قل لن تتبعونا كذلكم قال الله من قبل فسيقولون بل تحسدوننا بل كانوا لا يفقهون إلا قليلا

translation: Say to the desert Arabs who lagged behind: "You shall be called to [face] a people of great military prowess; you may fight them or they will submit. Then if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."
interpretation: This verse is addressing the desert Arabs who had refused to join the Muslim army in battle. It warns them that they will be called to fight against a powerful enemy, and they must either engage in battle or submit to Islam. If they obey Allah's command, they will be rewarded, but if they turn away as they had done before, they will face a painful punishment.
orig: قل للمخلفين من الأعراب ستدعون إلى قوم أولي بأس شديد تقاتلونهم أو يسلمون فإن تطيعوا يؤتكم الله أجرا حسنا وإن تتولوا كما توليتم من قبل يعذبكم عذابا أليما

translation: There is no blame upon the blind nor any blame upon the lame nor any blame upon the ill. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that there is no sin or blame on those with physical disabilities or illnesses if they are unable to fulfill certain religious obligations. However, those who have the ability to obey Allah and His Messenger will be rewarded with Paradise, while those who deliberately disobey will face a severe punishment.
orig: ليس على الأعمى حرج ولا على الأعرج حرج ولا على المريض حرج ومن يطع الله ورسوله يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ومن يتول يعذبه عذابا أليما

translation: Indeed, Allah was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest.
interpretation: Allah expresses His pleasure with the believers who pledged allegiance to the Prophet Muhammad under a tree before the conquest of Makkah. This pledge, known as the "Pledge of Ridwan" or "Pledge of the Tree," demonstrated their sincere faith and loyalty. Allah knew the truthfulness in their hearts and therefore bestowed tranquility and peace upon them. As a reward for their commitment, He granted them the imminent conquest of Makkah, a significant victory.
orig: لقد رضي الله عن المؤمنين إذ يبايعونك تحت الشجرة فعلم ما في قلوبهم فأنزل السكينة عليهم وأثابهم فتحا قريبا

translation: And many gains that they will acquire, and Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the spiritual and material gains that the believers will attain through their faith and obedience to Allah. It promises them abundant rewards, both in this life and the Hereafter. The phrase "Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise" emphasizes that these gains are bestowed by the Almighty, who is Powerful and acts with perfect wisdom and justice.
orig: ومغانم كثيرة يأخذونها وكان الله عزيزا حكيما

translation: Allah promised you abundant spoils that you will capture, and He hastened for you this [victory at Badr] and restrained the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers - and that He may guide you to a straight path.
interpretation: Allah promised the believers abundant spoils and victories in future battles. However, He hastened the spoils and victory at the Battle of Badr as a prelude to greater conquests, and as a sign of His support for the believers. He also restrained the disbelievers from harming the Muslims, guiding them to the straight path of His obedience and pleasure.
orig: وعدكم الله مغانم كثيرة تأخذونها فعجل لكم هذه وكف أيدي الناس عنكم ولتكون آية للمؤمنين ويهديكم صراطا مستقيما

translation: And other gains which are not within your power (to compass), but Allah has encompassed them, and Allah is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse indicates that there are some matters and gains that are beyond human ability and power to achieve or attain. However, Allah has encompassed and has full knowledge of all such matters. It emphasizes Allah's absolute power and ability over all things, even those that seem impossible or unattainable for human beings.
orig: وأخرى لم تقدروا عليها قد أحاط الله بها وكان الله على كل شيء قديرا

translation: And if those who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs and then found no protector or helper.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers that if they were to fight against the believers, they would be defeated and flee in retreat, unable to find any ally or supporter to aid them against the believers. It emphasizes the strength and divine assistance granted to the believers in their struggle against the disbelievers.
orig: ولو قاتلكم الذين كفروا لولوا الأدبار ثم لا يجدون وليا ولا نصيرا

translation: This is the Way of Allah which has indeed passed before, and you will never find any change in Allah's Way.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the unchanging nature of Allah's laws and principles, known as the "Sunnah" or Way of Allah. It states that the patterns and methods by which Allah deals with His creation have remained consistent throughout history and will never change. The consequences for obedience or disobedience, the rewards and punishments, and the divine wisdom behind Allah's decrees are immutable and will continue to operate in the same manner. This verse encourages believers to recognize the permanence of Allah's Way and to align themselves with it, as it cannot be altered or replaced.
orig: سنة الله التي قد خلت من قبل ولن تجد لسنة الله تبديلا

translation: And He it is Who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, after He had made you victors over them. And Allah is Ever All-Seer of what you do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah, where Allah prevented a battle from occurring between the Muslims and the Quraysh of Makkah. Despite the Muslims' military superiority, Allah restrained both parties from fighting each other, allowing them to make a peace treaty instead. This demonstrated Allah's wisdom and control over events, as He is All-Aware of the consequences of people's actions.
orig: وهو الذي كف أيديهم عنكم وأيديكم عنهم ببطن مكة من بعد أن أظفركم عليهم وكان الله بما تعملون بصيرا

translation: It is they who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram while the sacrificial animals were prevented from reaching their place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample them and there would afflict you because of them dishonor without knowledge - [it was so] that Allah might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart, We should have punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful punishment.
interpretation: هذه الآية تشير إلى الكفار الذين منعوا المسلمين من دخول المسجد الحرام ومنعوا الهدي من الوصول إلى مكانه. ولولا وجود مؤمنين ومؤمنات لا يعرفهم المسلمون في مكة، لكان من الممكن أن يصيبهم أذى بسبب ذلك. ولكن الله أدخل في رحمته من شاء من هؤلاء المؤمنين. ولو كان الكفار والمؤمنون منفصلين، لعذب الله الكفار بعذاب أليم.
orig: هم الذين كفروا وصدوكم عن المسجد الحرام والهدي معكوفا أن يبلغ محله ولولا رجال مؤمنون ونساء مؤمنات لم تعلموهم أن تطئوهم فتصيبكم منهم معرة بغير علم ليدخل الله في رحمته من يشاء لو تزيلوا لعذبنا الذين كفروا منهم عذابا أليما

translation: When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and made them abide by the word of righteousness, for they were most deserving and worthy of it. And Allah is Ever Aware of all things.
interpretation: This verse refers to the situation faced by the early Muslim community in Medina, when the disbelievers harbored feelings of arrogance and tribalism reminiscent of the pre-Islamic era of ignorance. However, Allah bestowed a sense of tranquility and reassurance upon the Prophet Muhammad and the believers, strengthening their resolve to uphold the word of righteousness and piety. The believers were deemed most worthy of this guidance, as Allah is All-Aware of all matters.
orig: إذ جعل الذين كفروا في قلوبهم الحمية حمية الجاهلية فأنزل الله سكينته على رسوله وعلى المؤمنين وألزمهم كلمة التقوى وكانوا أحق بها وأهلها وكان الله بكل شيء عليما

translation: Allah has indeed fulfilled the vision for His Messenger in truth. You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allah wills, in security, with your heads shaved and hair shortened, not fearing anyone. He knew what you did not know, and has granted besides that an imminent victory.
interpretation: This verse refers to the vision that the Prophet Muhammad had of entering the Sacred Mosque in Mecca. It affirms that Allah has fulfilled this vision in truth, and that the believers will enter the Sacred Mosque in security, with their heads shaved or hair shortened as a sign of completing the rituals of Hajj or Umrah, without any fear. It also indicates that Allah knew what the believers did not know, and that He has granted them an imminent victory besides the fulfillment of this vision.
orig: لقد صدق الله رسوله الرؤيا بالحق لتدخلن المسجد الحرام إن شاء الله آمنين محلقين رءوسكم ومقصرين لا تخافون فعلم ما لم تعلموا فجعل من دون ذلك فتحا قريبا

translation: It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, and sufficient is Allah as Witness.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah sent Prophet Muhammad with the guidance of Islam, the true religion, to make it prevail over all other religions and ways of life. Allah bears witness to the truth of this message and the prophethood of Muhammad, and His testimony is sufficient.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله وكفى بالله شهيدا

translation: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allah and [His] pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah and their description in the Gospel - like a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that Allah may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse describes the noble qualities of the Prophet Muhammad and his Companions. It praises their strength against the disbelievers while being merciful towards one another. Their humility in prayer and seeking Allah's pleasure is highlighted. It mentions that their description is found in previous scriptures, likening them to a fruitful plant that delights the farmers. This was a means for Allah to enrage the disbelievers. The verse concludes with Allah's promise of forgiveness and a great reward for the believers who do righteous deeds.
orig: محمد رسول الله والذين معه أشداء على الكفار رحماء بينهم تراهم ركعا سجدا يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا سيماهم في وجوههم من أثر السجود ذلك مثلهم في التوراة ومثلهم في الإنجيل كزرع أخرج شطأه فآزره فاستغلظ فاستوى على سوقه يعجب الزراع ليغيظ بهم الكفار وعد الله الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات منهم مغفرة وأجرا عظيما

translation: O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allah and His Messenger but fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.
interpretation: This verse instructs the believers not to precede Allah and His Messenger in matters of religion by making decisions or taking actions without their guidance. It emphasizes the importance of obedience, reverence, and submission to Allah and His Messenger. The reasons given are that Allah is All-Hearing, being aware of everything said and done, and All-Knowing, being fully aware of the intentions behind actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تقدموا بين يدي الله ورسوله واتقوا الله إن الله سميع عليم

translation: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
interpretation: "This verse instructs the believers to show utmost respect and humility towards the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It prohibits them from raising their voices above his voice or addressing him loudly and disrespectfully, as they might do when conversing with one another. Such behavior could nullify their good deeds without them realizing it, as it demonstrates a lack of reverence for the Prophet's exalted status."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا ترفعوا أصواتكم فوق صوت النبي ولا تجهروا له بالقول كجهر بعضكم لبعض أن تحبط أعمالكم وأنتم لا تشعرون

translation: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah - they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and a great reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of showing respect and humility towards the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Those who lower their voices in his presence and speak to him with reverence are the ones whose hearts have been purified by Allah and tested for piety. They will be rewarded with forgiveness for their sins and a great reward in the Hereafter for their righteous conduct.
orig: إن الذين يغضون أصواتهم عند رسول الله أولئك الذين امتحن الله قلوبهم للتقوى لهم مغفرة وأجر عظيم

translation: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muhammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the lack of understanding and proper manners exhibited by some of the Companions towards the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It criticizes those who would call out to him from behind closed chambers or partitions, without consideration for his privacy or respect for his position.
