translation: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin.
interpretation: In Paradise, the believers will not be exposed to any vain or sinful talk. The environment will be pure and free from any form of immorality or wrongdoing. This verse highlights the spiritual and moral perfection of the eternal abode promised to the righteous.
orig: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا تأثيما

translation: But [they uttered not] except the statement, 'Peace, Peace.'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the patience and non-violence shown by the Prophets when faced with rejection and hostility from their people. Despite the opposition they encountered, they responded with words of peace and did not resort to aggression or retaliation.
orig: إلا قيلا سلاما سلاما

translation: And the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who will be given their records in their right hands on the Day of Judgment. It implies that their good deeds will be rewarded, and they will be honored and favored, being placed on the right side which is a position of honor and felicity.
orig: وأصحاب اليمين ما أصحاب اليمين

translation: In lote trees clustered
interpretation: This verse refers to the lote tree (sidr) in the highest heaven where the Prophet Muhammad encountered the Divine during his miraculous Night Journey (Al-Isra' wal-Mi'raj). The lote tree is described as being "clustered" or "covered", indicating its grandeur and majesty. The interpretation suggests that the lote tree represents the boundary or veil between the created world and the realm of the Divine, which the Prophet was able to witness through God's grace and power.
orig: في سدر مخضود

translation: And clusters of banana-trees laden with fruit
interpretation: This verse describes the blessings of Paradise, including the presence of banana trees with clusters of ripe, hanging fruits. It symbolizes the abundance and nourishment that the believers will enjoy in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: وطلح منضود

translation: And an extended shade
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessing of shade that Allah provides for His creation on the Day of Resurrection. The "extended shade" is interpreted as a vast and extensive shade that will protect the believers from the intense heat and discomfort on that tremendous Day. It symbolizes the mercy, comfort, and protection that Allah will grant to those who believed and did righteous deeds.
orig: وظل ممدود

translation: And poured forth water
interpretation: This verse refers to the abundant water that Allah has poured forth on the earth, allowing life to flourish. It highlights Allah's mercy and provision for His creation, and serves as a reminder of the blessings we often take for granted.
orig: وماء مسكوب

translation: And abundant fruit
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings of Paradise, where the believers will enjoy an abundance of delicious fruits as a reward for their faith and good deeds. The mention of "abundant fruit" symbolizes the eternal bliss, nourishment, and satisfaction that Allah has prepared for the righteous in the Hereafter.
orig: وفاكهة كثيرة

translation: Neither severed nor forbidden
interpretation: This verse suggests that the blessings and mercy of Allah are continuous and unrestricted. It implies that Allah's favors upon His servants are uninterrupted and not withheld from anyone who seeks them with sincerity and righteousness.
orig: لا مقطوعة ولا ممنوعة

translation: And raised couches
interpretation: This verse refers to the luxurious furnishings and comforts that will be provided in Paradise for the believers. The "raised couches" symbolize a life of ease, comfort, and honor that awaits the righteous in the Hereafter as a reward for their good deeds and obedience to Allah.
orig: وفرش مرفوعة

translation: Indeed, We have created them a [new] creation
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has created the maidens of Paradise in a special and unique way, distinct from the creation of humans on Earth. Their creation is described as an "insha'" (a new creation), implying that they are beings of a different nature, created specifically for the eternal bliss of the believers in Paradise.
orig: إنا أنشأناهن إنشاء

translation: So We made them virgins
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as Allah restoring the virgins' virginity and purity, either physically or metaphorically, to reward them for their righteousness and faith in the Hereafter.
orig: فجعلناهن أبكارا

translation: Arab kindred
interpretation: This verse refers to the Arab tribes and their close kinship ties. It highlights the unity and brotherhood among the Arabs, who are considered as kindred or closely related people.
orig: عربا أترابا

translation: For the companions of the right
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who will be given their records in their right hands on the Day of Judgment. It signifies their successful attainment of Paradise and the blessings that await them for their faith and good deeds in this world.
orig: لأصحاب اليمين

translation: A group from the former peoples
interpretation: This verse refers to a group or community from among the earlier nations or generations that came before the time of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). It suggests that some individuals or peoples from the past had faith and followed the guidance sent to them by Allah. The interpretation highlights the continuity of divine revelation and the presence of believers in different eras of human history.
orig: ثلة من الأولين

translation: And a third group of others
interpretation: This verse refers to a third category of people besides the two mentioned previously (the believers and the disbelievers). It suggests that there is another group whose status is ambiguous or undecided. The interpretation implies that there are various spiritual states that people can be in, and not everyone falls strictly into the categories of belief or disbelief. It leaves room for a nuanced understanding of faith and human conditions.
orig: وثلة من الآخرين

translation: And the Companions of the Left - what are the Companions of the Left?
interpretation: This verse refers to a group of people who will be placed on the left side on the Day of Judgment, indicating their unfortunate fate. It raises the question of who these "Companions of the Left" are and what their condition will be, implying that they are those who have gone astray and rejected faith and good deeds in their worldly life.
orig: وأصحاب الشمال ما أصحاب الشمال

translation: In scorching wind and scalding water
interpretation: This verse describes the torment that the disbelievers will face in Hell. The "scorching wind" and "scalding water" represent the intense heat and suffering they will endure as punishment for rejecting faith and committing evil deeds in their worldly life.
orig: في سموم وحميم

translation: And a shade [of cloud] from a scorching wind
interpretation: This verse refers to the shade and protection provided by Allah to the believers in the form of a cloud that shielded them from the scorching heat of the desert sun and wind. It symbolizes Allah's mercy and care for those who have faith in Him, even in the midst of difficult circumstances.
orig: وظل من يحموم

translation: Neither cool nor generous
interpretation: This verse is criticizing those who lack both physical and moral virtues. It condemns individuals who are neither refreshing and pleasant in their demeanor ("cool"), nor generous and benevolent in their actions and character ("generous"). The verse highlights the importance of possessing positive qualities, both outwardly and inwardly, in order to be a praiseworthy person.
orig: لا بارد ولا كريم

translation: Indeed, they were before that indulged in affluence
interpretation: This verse implies that the people being referred to were previously living in luxury and indulgence, enjoying material comforts and pleasures without any regard for God's commands or accountability. Their state of affluence and extravagance led them to arrogance, ingratitude, and disobedience towards their Lord.
orig: إنهم كانوا قبل ذلك مترفين

translation: And they used to insist on the great violation (of oaths).
interpretation: This verse is referring to the persistent and deliberate violation of oaths and covenants by the disbelievers. It suggests that they would intentionally break their promises and commitments, showing a lack of integrity and disregard for the sanctity of oaths. The use of the phrase "great violation" highlights the severity and gravity of their actions.
orig: وكانوا يصرون على الحنث العظيم

translation: And they say, "When we have become bones and crumbled particles, will we really be resurrected as a new creation?"
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelief of the deniers of the Resurrection. They mocked the idea of being resurrected after death, considering it impossible for their decayed bones and dust to be brought back to life. The interpretation highlights their lack of faith in Allah's power to resurrect and re-create them on the Day of Judgment.
orig: وكانوا يقولون أئذا متنا وكنا ترابا وعظاما أإنا لمبعوثون

translation: Or our forefathers of old?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' stance of rejecting the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) by asking if they have more knowledge than their ancestors who lived before them. It implies that their rejection is based on blind adherence to tradition rather than reason or evidence.
orig: أوآباؤنا الأولون

translation: Say, 'Indeed, the former and the latter peoples,
interpretation: This verse suggests that all people, whether from the past or the present, will be gathered together on the Day of Judgment. It implies that no one will escape accountability for their deeds, regardless of when they lived or their status in life.
orig: قل إن الأولين والآخرين

translation: You will be gathered together for a Day which is well-known.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be gathered to account for their deeds. It emphasizes that this Day has a fixed and well-known time, known only to Allah. The interpretation highlights the certainty of the Resurrection and the need to prepare for it by living a righteous life.
orig: لمجموعون إلى ميقات يوم معلوم

translation: Then, you are the misguided deniers,
interpretation: This verse is addressing those who have gone astray and rejected the truth. It is a stern warning to those who deny the signs of Allah and persist in disbelief, reminding them that their actions have consequences and that they have deviated from the straight path.
orig: ثم إنكم أيها الضالون المكذبون

translation: They will eat from the tree of Zaqqum
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the disbelievers and sinners in Hell will be forced to eat from the tree of Zaqqum, which is a bitter and poisonous tree that grows in Hell. This serves as a punishment and torment for their disbelief and evil deeds in the worldly life. The consumption of this tree represents the severe pain and suffering they will endure in the Hellfire as a consequence of rejecting faith and committing sins.
orig: لآكلون من شجر من زقوم

translation: Then from it they fill their bellies
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah has provided sustenance and nourishment from the earth for human beings and animals to fulfill their hunger and satisfy their appetites. It highlights the blessings and provisions that Allah has bestowed upon His creation from the resources of the earth.
orig: فمالئون منها البطون

translation: So they will drink boiling water on top of it
interpretation: This verse describes the punishment for the disbelievers in the Hereafter. They will be forced to drink boiling water, which will scald their insides and cause them excruciating pain and suffering as a result of their rejection of faith and righteous deeds in this world.
orig: فشاربون عليه من الحميم

translation: So they will drink the drink of thirsty camels
interpretation: This verse is a metaphorical warning about the painful punishment that the disbelievers will face in the Hereafter. It compares their insatiable thirst for the truth to the extreme thirst of camels, which can drink large amounts of water at once. The disbelievers rejected the guidance and truth brought by the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and as a result, they will suffer a severe spiritual thirst and torment in the Hereafter, just like extremely thirsty camels desperately seeking water.
orig: فشاربون شرب الهيم

translation: This is what will cause them to stumble on the Day of Recompense.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers' rejection of faith and the revelations of God will lead to their downfall and punishment on the Day of Judgment. Their arrogance, stubbornness, and refusal to accept the truth will be the cause of their stumbling and failure on that decisive Day when they will be held accountable for their actions.
orig: هذا نزلهم يوم الدين

translation: We have created you, so why do you not believe?
interpretation: This verse is questioning the disbelief of people despite the clear evidence of Allah's creation of them. It implies that the very fact of their existence should lead them to believe in and submit to their Creator. The verse is calling upon people to ponder over their own creation and recognize the signs of Allah's power and existence, which should naturally lead them to faith.
orig: نحن خلقناكم فلولا تصدقون

translation: Have you then seen the semen that you emit?
interpretation: This verse questions whether human beings truly comprehend the miraculous process of reproduction and the creation of a new life from a mere drop of semen. It invites contemplation on the profound wisdom and power of Allah in fashioning a complete human being from such a humble and insignificant origin.
orig: أفرأيتم ما تمنون

translation: Is it you who create it, or are We the Creators?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief in their ability to create life. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the Creator of all things, and that human beings have no power to create or give life. The verse challenges the polytheists' worship of idols and false deities, reminding them that only Allah deserves to be worshipped as the sole Creator and Sustainer of the universe.
orig: أأنتم تخلقونه أم نحن الخالقون

translation: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outrun.
interpretation: Allah is stating that He has made death inevitable for all human beings, and no one can escape or outrun death. It is a reminder of the temporary nature of this worldly life and the certainty of the Hereafter. The interpretation emphasizes the wisdom and power of Allah in determining the lifespan of every individual and that death is a transition to the eternal life of the Hereafter, where everyone will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: نحن قدرنا بينكم الموت وما نحن بمسبوقين

translation: That We will change your likenesses and produce you in that which you know not.
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah has the power to recreate human beings in a form that they cannot comprehend or imagine in the Hereafter. It suggests that the bodies and forms we will have in the afterlife will be vastly different from our current physical existence, in ways that are beyond our current understanding.
orig: على أن نبدل أمثالكم وننشئكم في ما لا تعلمون

translation: And certainly you have known the first creation, so will you not remember?
interpretation: This verse reminds human beings of their initial creation from nothing, as an evidence of Allah's ability to resurrect them after death. It encourages them to ponder over their origins and the signs of Allah's power, so that they may be guided to belief in the Hereafter.
orig: ولقد علمتم النشأة الأولى فلولا تذكرون

translation: Have you considered what you sow?
interpretation: This verse prompts reflection on the sources of our sustenance and the blessings of Allah. It invites us to ponder the process of cultivation and growth, which ultimately comes from the grace of the Divine. The interpretation is that we should appreciate the provisions granted to us, recognize our dependence on the Creator, and be mindful of our role as stewards of the earth's resources.
orig: أفرأيتم ما تحرثون

translation: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?
interpretation: This verse questions whether it is human beings or Allah who causes plants and crops to grow. It implies that growth and sustenance come from Allah alone, and that human efforts are merely means, while the true Grower and Sustainer is Allah.
orig: أأنتم تزرعونه أم نحن الزارعون

translation: If We willed, We could have reduced it to fragments, then you would remain wondering,
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of His power and control over all things. He could have easily destroyed the Qur'an and left people in confusion and doubt, but He has preserved it as a guidance and mercy for humanity. This verse emphasizes the divine origin and protection of the Qur'an.
orig: لو نشاء لجعلناه حطاما فظلتم تفكهون

translation: Indeed, we are those who are indebted
interpretation: This verse suggests that human beings are indebted to Allah for the countless blessings and favors He has bestowed upon them. It reminds us of our state of neediness before our Creator and the importance of being thankful and obedient to Him.
orig: إنا لمغرمون

translation: Nay, we are deprived.
interpretation: This verse suggests a feeling of deprivation or being deprived of something essential. It could be interpreted as an expression of dissatisfaction with one's current state or circumstances, a sense of being denied or lacking something important in life.
orig: بل نحن محرومون

translation: Have you then seen the water that you drink?
interpretation: This verse invites the reader to ponder over the source and providence of the water we drink. It draws our attention to the remarkable cycle of water and the blessings it brings, prompting us to reflect on the wisdom and power of Allah, who has made water available for our sustenance and survival.
orig: أفرأيتم الماء الذي تشربون

translation: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds, or are We the Senders?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers about the source of rain. It implies that Allah is the One who sends down rain from the clouds, not any false deities that the disbelievers worship. The rain is a blessing from Allah and a sign of His power and mercy.
orig: أأنتم أنزلتموه من المزن أم نحن المنزلون

translation: If We willed, We could have made it salty and bitter. Will you not then give thanks?
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of His great favors upon us by providing fresh and drinkable water. He has the power to make all water salty and undrinkable, but He chose to give us this immense blessing out of His mercy. This verse encourages gratitude and appreciation for the countless favors that Allah has bestowed upon us.
orig: لو نشاء جعلناه أجاجا فلولا تشكرون

translation: Have you seen the Fire which you kindle?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers about the fire of Hell that they deny and mock. It implies that the fire they kindle on Earth is nothing compared to the intense and eternal Fire of Hell prepared for those who reject faith.
orig: أفرأيتم النار التي تورون

translation: Is it you who created its tree, or are We the Creators?
interpretation: This verse questions the polytheists' belief in associating partners with Allah in creation. It emphasizes that Allah alone is the Creator of all things, including trees, and that the polytheists have no role in creating anything. The rhetorical question highlights the absurdity of their beliefs and affirms Allah's absolute power and sovereignty over creation.
orig: أأنتم أنشأتم شجرتها أم نحن المنشئون

translation: We have made it a reminder and an enjoyment for those who would preserve.
interpretation: This verse suggests that the Qur'an has been revealed as a source of guidance and reflection for those who are mindful of Allah and seek to follow His commandments. It serves as a constant reminder of the truth and a means of spiritual nourishment and delight for the believers who strive to uphold its teachings and principles.
orig: نحن جعلناها تذكرة ومتاعا للمقوين

translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to glorify and praise Allah, the Lord who is the Greatest and Most Exalted, through his words and deeds. It encourages us to remember Allah constantly and express gratitude for His blessings and favors upon us.
orig: فسبح باسم ربك العظيم

translation: But nay, I swear by the setting of the stars.
interpretation: This verse is an oath sworn by Allah, emphasizing the certainty of the truth being conveyed. The "setting of the stars" refers to their positions or movements, which are precise and follow a divinely ordained pattern. The oath highlights the grandeur and majesty of Allah's creation and serves as a prelude to the profound message that follows.
orig: فلا أقسم بمواقع النجوم

translation: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - a tremendous oath.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the great importance and solemnity of the oath mentioned, which is the Qur'an itself. The phrase "if you could know" suggests that the true magnitude and significance of this oath is so immense that it is beyond human comprehension. The interpretation highlights the divine origin and profound impact of the Qur'anic revelations.
orig: وإنه لقسم لو تعلمون عظيم

translation: Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an
interpretation: This verse affirms the sublime and honorable nature of the Qur'an, emphasizing its lofty status and divine origin. It highlights the Qur'an's nobility, excellence, and greatness, which is a testament to its profound wisdom, guidance, and profound impact on the lives of those who embrace its teachings.
orig: إنه لقرآن كريم

translation: In a well-guarded Book.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Qur'an being preserved and protected by Allah in the al-Lawh al-Mahfudh (the Preserved Tablet). It indicates that the Qur'an is a sacred and inviolable scripture that has been divinely guarded against any corruption or alteration since its revelation.
orig: في كتاب مكنون

translation: Which none can touch but those purified.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the sanctity and purity of the Qur'an. It states that only those who are spiritually pure and free from impurities can touch or handle the sacred scripture. This highlights the need for reverence, respect, and a state of ritual purity when engaging with the Qur'an. The verse underscores the elevated status of the Qur'an and the importance of approaching it with utmost care and purification of the heart and soul.
orig: لا يمسه إلا المطهرون

translation: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds
interpretation: This verse affirms that the Qur'an is a divine revelation sent down by Allah, the Lord and Sustainer of all the worlds and creation. It emphasizes the sublime and transcendent source of the Qur'an, which originates from the One who has absolute authority and sovereignty over the entire universe.
orig: تنزيل من رب العالمين

translation: Is it then to this statement that you are disdainful?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' rejection and disdain for the message of the Qur'an, which is a clear and straightforward statement from God. It implies that their attitude towards the divine revelation is unreasonable and unjustified.
orig: أفبهذا الحديث أنتم مدهنون

translation: And you make your provision that you deny?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' ingratitude towards the blessings bestowed upon them by Allah. They deny the truth and the revelations from Allah, despite the fact that their sustenance and livelihood come from Him. Their denial of Allah's favors is seen as a grave sin and a form of ungratefulness.
orig: وتجعلون رزقكم أنكم تكذبون

translation: Then why, when it (the soul) reaches the throat,
interpretation: This verse poses a rhetorical question about the moment of death when the soul reaches the throat. It implies that at that critical juncture, one should reflect deeply on their ultimate return to Allah and the accountability for their deeds in this life.
orig: فلولا إذا بلغت الحلقوم

translation: And you at that time will be looking on
interpretation: This verse reminds us of the Day of Judgment when we will witness the consequences of our actions in this world. It emphasizes that we will be present and observing the events unfolding, unable to alter the outcome. The phrase "you will be looking on" suggests that we will be mere spectators, watching as justice is served and recompense is given. This should serve as a powerful reminder to live a righteous life and be accountable for our deeds.
orig: وأنتم حينئذ تنظرون

translation: And We are nearer to him than you, but you do not see
interpretation: Allah is closer to us than our own selves, but we fail to perceive His nearness due to our spiritual blindness and negligence. This verse emphasizes Allah's transcendent yet immanent nature, reminding us of His constant presence and knowledge of our innermost thoughts and feelings, even though we may not be aware of it.
orig: ونحن أقرب إليه منكم ولكن لا تبصرون

translation: So if you are not bound by any debt (or obligation)
interpretation: This verse is addressing the situation where one is not indebted or obligated to anyone. It implies that if one is free from any debt or obligation, then they should act accordingly and fulfill their duties towards Allah and others.
orig: فلولا إن كنتم غير مدينين

translation: If you are truthful, then bring it about.
interpretation: This verse challenges the disbelievers to bring about the resurrection or the end of the world if they are truthful in their claims that there is no afterlife. It implies that they do not have the power to do so, and that the resurrection is an event that only Allah can bring about, thus affirming the belief in the Hereafter.
orig: ترجعونها إن كنتم صادقين

translation: But if he is one of those brought near (to Allah),
interpretation: This verse is referring to the righteous people who are close to Allah and have attained a high spiritual rank. Their interpretation implies that they will receive a warm welcome and honorable treatment in the Hereafter for their good deeds and sincere faith.
orig: فأما إن كان من المقربين

translation: And (there will be) a soul (spiritual garden) and a fragrance, and a Garden of Delights.
interpretation: This verse refers to the spiritual and physical pleasures that await the believers in Paradise. The "soul" refers to the spiritual bliss and contentment one will experience. The "fragrance" symbolizes the pleasant scents and fragrances that will permeate the air of Paradise. The "Garden of Delights" represents the physical beauty and pleasures of the heavenly gardens promised to the righteous.
orig: فروح وريحان وجنت نعيم

translation: But if he is one of those on the Right Hand,
interpretation: This verse refers to the righteous believers who will be given their record of deeds in their right hand on the Day of Judgment. It indicates that those who lived a virtuous life and followed the commandments of Allah will be honored and rewarded in the Hereafter.
orig: وأما إن كان من أصحاب اليمين

translation: So peace be upon you from the companions of the right.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the righteous believers, granting them peace and blessings from the "companions of the right" - a reference to the angels or the blessed souls in Paradise. It signifies the honor and reward that awaits the pious in the Hereafter.
orig: فسلام لك من أصحاب اليمين

translation: But if he is one of the deniers who are astray,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who reject the truth and guidance, and instead choose to remain in misguidance and error. The interpretation is that if the person being addressed is one of those who denies the revelations and signs of Allah, and persists in straying from the straight path, then a particular course of action will follow (which is mentioned in the subsequent verses).
orig: وأما إن كان من المكذبين الضالين

translation: So pour upon him a punishment of boiling water.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a command to subject the disbelievers or wrongdoers to a severe punishment in the form of scorching hot water, symbolizing the intense torment they will face in the Hereafter for their rejection of faith and righteous conduct.
orig: فنزل من حميم

translation: And the scorching Fire
interpretation: This verse refers to the intense and severe punishment of Hellfire that awaits those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands. The word "jaheem" is derived from "jahamah," which means "to burn intensely." It highlights the excruciating torment and anguish that the disbelievers will experience in the Hereafter as a consequence of their denial and sinful actions.
orig: وتصلية جحيم

translation: Indeed, this is the very truth of certainty
interpretation: This verse affirms the truthfulness and certainty of the message being conveyed in the Qur'an. It emphasizes that what is being stated is the absolute truth, free from any doubt or ambiguity. The phrase "haqq al-yaqeen" (the very truth of certainty) is a strong affirmation, leaving no room for questioning the veracity of the divine revelation.
orig: إن هذا لهو حق اليقين

translation: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to glorify and praise Allah, the Almighty, the Greatest, the Most Exalted. It emphasizes the greatness of Allah and encourages us to exalt and venerate Him through our words, actions, and worship. The command to glorify Allah's name signifies acknowledging His perfection, majesty, and absolute sovereignty over all creation.
orig: فسبح باسم ربك العظيم

translation: Glorifies Allah whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the universal glorification of Allah by all of His creation in the heavens and the earth. It highlights Allah's attributes of being Al-Aziz (the Exalted in Might) and Al-Hakim (the Wise), indicating His supreme power and perfect wisdom. The verse invites us to recognize and submit to the majesty and wisdom of the Creator, who deserves to be glorified by all that exists.
orig: سبح لله ما في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute sovereignty and dominion over the entire universe. It states that He alone is the Owner and Ruler of the heavens and the earth, and that He has the power to grant life and cause death to all creatures. The verse also emphasizes Allah's infinite ability and competence over all things, indicating His supreme authority and control over all aspects of existence.
orig: له ملك السماوات والأرض يحيي ويميت وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is the Knower of every thing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's transcendent nature and His all-encompassing knowledge. "He is the First and the Last" signifies that He is the Origin of all existence and its Ultimate Reality, without beginning or end. "The Ascendant and the Intimate" means that He is both the Supreme, Exalted One and the Innermost, closest to all His creation. "He is the Knower of every thing" affirms that His knowledge encompasses all things, apparent and hidden, past, present, and future. This highlights Allah's absolute sovereignty, omniscience, and His intimate closeness to His creation.
orig: هو الأول والآخر والظاهر والباطن وهو بكل شيء عليم

translation: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what enters into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's omnipotence, omniscience, and omnipresence. It highlights that Allah created the heavens and the earth in six days, then established Himself above the Throne as the Supreme Sovereign. He has complete knowledge of everything that occurs in the universe, whether it enters or emerges from the earth, or descends or ascends to the heavens. Moreover, Allah is present everywhere, accompanying His creation wherever they may be. He is the All-Seeing, aware of every action and deed performed by His servants.
orig: هو الذي خلق السماوات والأرض في ستة أيام ثم استوى على العرش يعلم ما يلج في الأرض وما يخرج منها وما ينزل من السماء وما يعرج فيها وهو معكم أين ما كنتم والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah return all matters.
interpretation: This verse affirms that Allah alone is the Sovereign Lord and Master of the entire universe, including the heavens and the earth. All affairs, events, and matters ultimately return to Him for judgment and accountability. It emphasizes Allah's absolute sovereignty, authority, and control over all creation.
orig: له ملك السماوات والأرض وإلى الله ترجع الأمور

translation: He merges the night into the day, and He merges the day into the night, and He is All-Knowing of what is in the breasts.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's absolute power and knowledge. The merging of night and day is a metaphor for Allah's control over the universe and the alternation of times. Additionally, Allah knows the innermost thoughts and intentions of all beings, emphasizing His all-encompassing knowledge.
orig: يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وهو عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Believe in Allah and His Messenger, and spend from that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to have faith in Allah and His Messenger, and to spend from the wealth and resources that Allah has bestowed upon them as a trust. It promises a great reward for those who truly believe and spend in the way of Allah. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of faith, obedience to Allah and His Messenger, and using one's wealth for righteous purposes.
orig: آمنوا بالله ورسوله وأنفقوا مما جعلكم مستخلفين فيه فالذين آمنوا منكم وأنفقوا لهم أجر كبير

translation: And why should you not believe in Allah when the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has already taken your covenant, if you are believers?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' rejection of faith in Allah, despite the clear call of the Prophet to believe in the One True God, their Lord. It reminds them that they have already made a covenant with Allah to believe in Him, if they are indeed true believers.
orig: وما لكم لا تؤمنون بالله والرسول يدعوكم لتؤمنوا بربكم وقد أخذ ميثاقكم إن كنتم مؤمنين

translation: It is He who sends down upon His servant [Muhammad] clear verses to bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allah is to you Kind and Merciful.
interpretation: Allah is describing Himself as the One who revealed the clear and enlightening verses of the Qur'an to His Messenger Muhammad. The purpose of this revelation is to guide people out of the darkness of ignorance, misguidance, and disbelief into the light of faith, knowledge, and righteousness. Allah reminds us that He is truly Kind and Merciful towards His servants by providing this guidance.
orig: هو الذي ينزل على عبده آيات بينات ليخرجكم من الظلمات إلى النور وإن الله بكم لرءوف رحيم

translation: And what is [the matter] with you that you do not spend in the cause of Allah? And to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than those who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allah has promised the best [reward]. And Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted.
interpretation: هذه الآية تحث المسلمين على الإنفاق في سبيل الله، وتبين أن من أنفق وجاهد قبل فتح مكة أعظم درجة ممن أنفق وجاهد بعد ذلك، لكن الله وعد الجميع بالحسنى والثواب الجزيل، فهو عليم بأعمالهم جميعًا ولن يضيع أجر من أحسن عملًا.
orig: وما لكم ألا تنفقوا في سبيل الله ولله ميراث السماوات والأرض لا يستوي منكم من أنفق من قبل الفتح وقاتل أولئك أعظم درجة من الذين أنفقوا من بعد وقاتلوا وكلا وعد الله الحسنى والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: Who is it that will lend Allah a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him manifold and his will be a generous reward?
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to spend their wealth in the way of Allah and His cause, as an act of charity and loan to Allah. It promises that Allah will greatly multiply the reward for such charitable spending, and the person will receive a generous reward in the Hereafter.
orig: من ذا الذي يقرض الله قرضا حسنا فيضاعفه له وله أجر كريم

translation: On the Day you will see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and by their right hands, [it will be said], 'Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally.' That is what is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment for the believers. They will be walking with a light shining in front of them and by their right sides, guiding them. They will be given the glad tidings of entering Paradise, where gardens with rivers flow beneath them, and they will abide there forever. This is the ultimate success and the greatest attainment that a believer can aspire for.
orig: يوم ترى المؤمنين والمؤمنات يسعى نورهم بين أيديهم وبأيمانهم بشراكم اليوم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها ذلك هو الفوز العظيم

translation: The Day when the hypocrites, men and women, will say to the believers, "Wait for us, that we may borrow from your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be set up between them, with a gate in it, its interior comprising mercy, but outside it lies the punishment.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Judgment when the hypocrites, who outwardly professed faith but inwardly concealed disbelief, will seek light from the believers. However, they will be rejected and told to seek light elsewhere. A barrier will separate them from the believers, with the believers enjoying mercy on the inside, while the hypocrites face punishment on the outside. This symbolizes the clear distinction between true faith and hypocrisy, and the consequences each will face.
orig: يوم يقول المنافقون والمنافقات للذين آمنوا انظرونا نقتبس من نوركم قيل ارجعوا وراءكم فالتمسوا نورا فضرب بينهم بسور له باب باطنه فيه الرحمة وظاهره من قبله العذاب

translation: They will call out to them, 'Were we not with you?' They will reply, 'Yes, but you led yourselves into temptation, awaited [misfortune for us], doubted, and were deluded by vain desires until Allah's command came. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.'
interpretation: This verse describes a conversation between the disbelievers and those who misled them on the Day of Judgment. The misguided ones will try to shift the blame, claiming that they were with the disbelievers. However, the disbelievers will respond that it was their own weakness and desires that led them astray. They fell into temptation, doubted the truth, awaited misfortune for the believers, and were deluded by false hopes and desires until Allah's punishment came. The Deceiver, referring to Satan, deceived them about Allah and led them away from the truth.
orig: ينادونهم ألم نكن معكم قالوا بلى ولكنكم فتنتم أنفسكم وتربصتم وارتبتم وغرتكم الأماني حتى جاء أمر الله وغركم بالله الغرور

translation: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, no ransom or compensation will be accepted from the disbelievers to save them from the punishment of Hell. Their ultimate abode is the Fire of Hell, which is the most befitting place for them due to their rejection of faith and righteous deeds. The phrase "wretched is the destination" emphasizes the miserable and deplorable state they will find themselves in as a consequence of their disbelief.
orig: فاليوم لا يؤخذ منكم فدية ولا من الذين كفروا مأواكم النار هي مولاكم وبئس المصير

translation: Has not the time come for those who believe that their hearts should be humble for the remembrance of Allah and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse questions the believers on why their hearts do not feel humbled and softened when reminded of Allah and His revelations, unlike the previous nations who were given scriptures but became arrogant and disobedient after a long period, resulting in their hearts hardening. It urges the believers to avoid such a state and maintain a humble, softened heart towards the remembrance of Allah and His truth.
orig: ألم يأن للذين آمنوا أن تخشع قلوبهم لذكر الله وما نزل من الحق ولا يكونوا كالذين أوتوا الكتاب من قبل فطال عليهم الأمد فقست قلوبهم وكثير منهم فاسقون

translation: Know that Allah revives the earth after its death. We have indeed made the signs clear for you, so that you may understand.
interpretation: This verse reminds us of Allah's power to bring life back to the earth after it has become barren and lifeless. The revival of the earth after its death is a sign of Allah's ability to resurrect all creation on the Day of Judgment. The verse encourages us to reflect on the signs of Allah's power all around us, so that we may use our intellect and understand the truth.
orig: اعلموا أن الله يحيي الأرض بعد موتها قد بينا لكم الآيات لعلكم تعقلون

translation: Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned Allah a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the virtues of giving charity and lending to Allah's cause. It promises that those who give charitably or lend money for the sake of Allah will be greatly rewarded. Their charitable deeds will be multiplied manifold, and they will receive a noble and honorable reward from Allah in the Hereafter.
orig: إن المصدقين والمصدقات وأقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعف لهم ولهم أجر كريم

translation: And those who believe in Allah and His messengers - they are the truthful ones and the martyrs with their Lord. They will have their reward and their light. But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs - they are the companions of Hellfire.
interpretation: This verse distinguishes between believers and disbelievers. The believers who have faith in Allah and His messengers are described as "truthful ones" and "martyrs" who will receive their reward and light from Allah. On the other hand, those who disbelieve and reject Allah's signs are warned that they will be the "companions of Hellfire."
orig: والذين آمنوا بالله ورسله أولئك هم الصديقون والشهداء عند ربهم لهم أجرهم ونورهم والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب الجحيم

translation: Know that the life of this world is but play and amusement, pomp and mutual boasting among you, and rivalry in respect of wealth and children. (It is) as the likeness of vegetation after rain, thereof the growth is pleasing to the tillers; then it dries up and you see it turning yellow; then it becomes straw. But in the Hereafter (there is) a severe torment, and (there is) Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure, whereas the life of this world is only a deceiving enjoyment.
interpretation: This verse reminds us that the worldly life is temporary and fleeting, full of distractions and vain pursuits. It compares it to vegetation that sprouts after rain but quickly withers away. True success lies in seeking Allah's forgiveness and pleasure, for the Hereafter holds either severe punishment or eternal bliss.
orig: اعلموا أنما الحياة الدنيا لعب ولهو وزينة وتفاخر بينكم وتكاثر في الأموال والأولاد كمثل غيث أعجب الكفار نباته ثم يهيج فتراه مصفرا ثم يكون حطاما وفي الآخرة عذاب شديد ومغفرة من الله ورضوان وما الحياة الدنيا إلا متاع الغرور

translation: Race toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to strive and race towards attaining Allah's forgiveness and Paradise. It describes Paradise as being as vast as the heavens and the earth, prepared for those who have faith in Allah and His messengers. It emphasizes that attaining Paradise and Allah's forgiveness is a great bounty from Allah, which He bestows upon whomever He wills. This highlights Allah's immense grace and generosity towards His believing servants.
orig: سابقوا إلى مغفرة من ربكم وجنة عرضها كعرض السماء والأرض أعدت للذين آمنوا بالله ورسله ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: No calamity befalls on the earth or in yourselves but is inscribed in the Book of Decrees before We bring it into existence. Verily, that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: "This verse affirms Allah's complete knowledge and pre-ordainment of all events and occurrences, whether perceived as good or bad. It emphasizes that nothing happens by mere chance or accident, but rather everything is predetermined and recorded in the Preserved Tablet before it comes into existence. This divine decree does not negate human responsibility or free will, but serves as a reminder that Allah is the All-Knowing and All-Wise, and that His plans and wisdom transcend our limited understanding."
orig: ما أصاب من مصيبة في الأرض ولا في أنفسكم إلا في كتاب من قبل أن نبرأها إن ذلك على الله يسير

translation: So that you may not grieve over what has escaped you, nor exult because of what He has given you. And Allah does not love any arrogant boaster.
interpretation: This verse teaches humility and contentment. It advises against feeling regretful for missed opportunities or losses, as well as against excessive pride or arrogance over one's achievements or possessions. It reminds that both circumstances of gain and loss are temporary, and that one should maintain a balanced and grateful attitude, free from arrogance or self-praise. Allah dislikes those who are boastful and conceited, valuing instead humility and moderation.
orig: لكيلا تأسوا على ما فاتكم ولا تفرحوا بما آتاكم والله لا يحب كل مختال فخور

translation: Those who are miserly and enjoin upon people miserliness. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse condemns the trait of miserliness and warns against encouraging others to be miserly as well. It states that those who turn away from generosity and enjoin others to be stingy, Allah is self-sufficient and free of need for anyone's wealth or possessions. He is worthy of all praise for His bounties and generosity.
orig: الذين يبخلون ويأمرون الناس بالبخل ومن يتول فإن الله هو الغني الحميد

translation: Indeed, We have sent Our messengers with clear proofs, and We revealed with them the Scripture and the balance that mankind may maintain justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allah may make evident those who support Him and His messengers, though unseen. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in sending messengers with clear signs and scriptures to establish justice and provide guidance. It also mentions the revelation of iron, which has immense benefits for humanity, including its use in warfare to defend truth and justice. Ultimately, Allah tests people's faith by supporting His messengers, even though they cannot perceive the divine aid directly. This verse affirms Allah's power and might.
orig: لقد أرسلنا رسلنا بالبينات وأنزلنا معهم الكتاب والميزان ليقوم الناس بالقسط وأنزلنا الحديد فيه بأس شديد ومنافع للناس وليعلم الله من ينصره ورسله بالغيب إن الله قوي عزيز

translation: And We certainly sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture, and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the continuity of Allah's messengers and the divine guidance they brought. It affirms that Allah sent both Noah and Abraham as prophets, and that prophethood and scripture were bestowed upon their descendants as well. However, it also acknowledges that while some of their descendants were rightly guided, many others deviated from the truth and became disobedient to Allah's commands.
orig: ولقد أرسلنا نوحا وإبراهيم وجعلنا في ذريتهما النبوة والكتاب فمنهم مهتد وكثير منهم فاسقون

translation: Then, We sent Our messengers in their footsteps, and We sent 'Isa, son of Maryam, and gave him the Injeel, and instilled tenderness and mercy in the hearts of his followers. But they invented monasticism which We did not prescribe for them, seeking only Allah's pleasure. Even so, they did not observe it as it should have been observed. So We gave those of them who believed their reward, but many of them are rebellious.
interpretation: Allah sent messengers one after another to guide people. He sent 'Isa (Jesus) with the Gospel and filled the hearts of his followers with compassion and mercy. However, they introduced monasticism, which was not prescribed by Allah, seeking His pleasure. But they did not observe it properly. So Allah rewarded those among them who believed, but many of them became disobedient.
orig: ثم قفينا على آثارهم برسلنا وقفينا بعيسى ابن مريم وآتيناه الإنجيل وجعلنا في قلوب الذين اتبعوه رأفة ورحمة ورهبانية ابتدعوها ما كتبناها عليهم إلا ابتغاء رضوان الله فما رعوها حق رعايتها فآتينا الذين آمنوا منهم أجرهم وكثير منهم فاسقون

translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse encourages believers to have taqwa (consciousness of Allah) and to have faith in the Messenger. By doing so, Allah promises them a double share of His mercy, spiritual enlightenment to guide them, and forgiveness for their sins. It highlights Allah's attributes of being Forgiving and Merciful towards those who strive to obey Him."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله وآمنوا برسوله يؤتكم كفلين من رحمته ويجعل لكم نورا تمشون به ويغفر لكم والله غفور رحيم

translation: So that the People of the Book may not think that they have no share in God's grace, and that grace is entirely from God, which He bestows upon whomever He wills. For God is the Lord of infinite grace.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that God's grace and favor are not exclusive to any particular group, but are bestowed by Him upon whomever He wills. It serves as a reminder that the People of the Book (Jews and Christians) should not assume that they have a monopoly on God's grace or that it is solely reserved for them. Rather, God's grace is infinite and boundless, and He grants it to those He chooses, regardless of their religious affiliation or background.
orig: لئلا يعلم أهل الكتاب ألا يقدرون على شيء من فضل الله وأن الفضل بيد الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: Allah has certainly heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing. He hears the conversations and complaints of His servants, even the private disputes between spouses. It emphasizes Allah's knowledge of all affairs and encourages seeking His guidance and judgment in resolving conflicts."
orig: قد سمع الله قول التي تجادلك في زوجها وتشتكي إلى الله والله يسمع تحاوركما إن الله سميع بصير

translation: Those who pronounce zihar from among you to their wives, they are not their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they say an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse addresses the pre-Islamic Arab practice of zihar, where a man would say to his wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother," which was a way of divorcing her. The Qur'an clarifies that a wife cannot be equated to one's mother, as mothers are only those who gave birth. It denounces this statement as objectionable and false, while highlighting that Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving for those who repent from such practices.
orig: الذين يظاهرون منكم من نسائهم ما هن أمهاتهم إن أمهاتهم إلا اللائي ولدنهم وإنهم ليقولون منكرا من القول وزورا وإن الله لعفو غفور

translation: Those who denounce their wives by calling them mothers, then wish to go back on what they said, must free a slave before the couple may touch each other again. This is what you are enjoined to do; and God is fully aware of whatever you do.
interpretation: This verse refers to the pre-Islamic Arabian practice of "zihar," where a man would say to his wife "You are like my mother's back" as a way to divorce her. The Qur'an prohibits this practice and requires the man who does this to free a slave as an expiation before intimacy can resume with his wife. This ruling demonstrates God's wisdom in abolishing unjust customs and replacing them with just and merciful laws.
orig: والذين يظاهرون من نسائهم ثم يعودون لما قالوا فتحرير رقبة من قبل أن يتماسا ذلكم توعظون به والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: But if one cannot afford to free a slave, then one must fast for two successive months before they touch each other. And if one is unable, then feeding sixty needy people. That is so you may believe in Allah and His Messenger. These are the limits of Allah, and for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse outlines the expiation or penalty for breaking an oath of abstinence from intimacy with one's spouse. If one cannot afford to free a slave, then fasting for two consecutive months is prescribed before resuming intimacy. If one is unable to fast, then feeding sixty needy people is required. This expiation emphasizes belief in Allah and His Messenger, and reminds that these are Allah's limits which must be respected, or else face a painful punishment for disbelievers.
orig: فمن لم يجد فصيام شهرين متتابعين من قبل أن يتماسا فمن لم يستطع فإطعام ستين مسكينا ذلك لتؤمنوا بالله ورسوله وتلك حدود الله وللكافرين عذاب أليم

translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger will be humiliated, just as those before them were humiliated. We have sent down clear signs, and for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns those who defy Allah and reject His Messenger that they will face humiliation and disgrace, just as previous nations who opposed the truth were humbled. It emphasizes that Allah has revealed clear signs and evidence of the truth, and those who persist in disbelief will face a demeaning and painful punishment.
orig: إن الذين يحادون الله ورسوله كبتوا كما كبت الذين من قبلهم وقد أنزلنا آيات بينات وللكافرين عذاب مهين

translation: The Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah has kept account of it, while they forgot it. And Allah is, over all things, Witness.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when Allah will resurrect all human beings and inform them of their deeds, both good and bad, which He has meticulously recorded, even though they may have forgotten them. Allah is a Witness over all things, and nothing is hidden from Him. This emphasizes the accountability of human beings for their actions and the inevitability of facing the consequences on the Day of Judgment.
orig: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فينبئهم بما عملوا أحصاه الله ونسوه والله على كل شيء شهيد

translation: Have you not considered that Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth? There is no private conversation of three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Knowing.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge. He knows everything that happens in the heavens and the earth, including private conversations among people. No matter how few or many people are involved, Allah is present with them in knowledge. On the Day of Resurrection, He will inform them of all their deeds, as He has perfect knowledge of everything. This underscores Allah's omniscience and that nothing is hidden from Him.
orig: ألم تر أن الله يعلم ما في السماوات وما في الأرض ما يكون من نجوى ثلاثة إلا هو رابعهم ولا خمسة إلا هو سادسهم ولا أدنى من ذلك ولا أكثر إلا هو معهم أين ما كانوا ثم ينبئهم بما عملوا يوم القيامة إن الله بكل شيء عليم

translation: Have you not seen those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they revert to what they were forbidden and converse in sin, aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that which Allah has not greeted you, and they say within themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Hell will suffice them; they will burn therein, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: هذه الآية تنتقد المنافقين الذين كانوا يتناجون ويتحدثون سرًا بأشياء محرمة كالإثم والعدوان وعدم طاعة الرسول، ثم يأتون إلى النبي محمد ويحيونه بطريقة غير لائقة لم يأمر الله بها. ويتساءلون في أنفسهم لماذا لا يعاقبهم الله على ما يقولون من الكفر والنفاق. وتحذرهم الآية بأن جهنم كافية لهم عقابًا، حيث سيصلونها وتكون مصيرهم السيء.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين نهوا عن النجوى ثم يعودون لما نهوا عنه ويتناجون بالإثم والعدوان ومعصيت الرسول وإذا جاءوك حيوك بما لم يحيك به الله ويقولون في أنفسهم لولا يعذبنا الله بما نقول حسبهم جهنم يصلونها فبئس المصير

translation: O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and oppression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to whom you will be gathered.
interpretation: This verse instructs believers to engage in private conversations that promote righteousness, piety, and obedience to Allah and His Messenger. It prohibits them from conspiring in sin, oppression, or disobedience to the Messenger. The verse emphasizes the importance of fearing Allah, to whom all will ultimately return and be held accountable for their actions.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا تناجيتم فلا تتناجوا بالإثم والعدوان ومعصيت الرسول وتناجوا بالبر والتقوى واتقوا الله الذي إليه تحشرون

translation: Secret counsels are only from Shaytan, that he may cause grief to those who believe, though he cannot harm them in the least except by Allah's permission; and on Allah should the believers put their trust.
interpretation: The interpretation is that private conversations among the believers to conspire against or hurt other believers is a whisper from Satan, whose aim is to cause distress to the believers. However, Satan cannot actually harm the believers except by Allah's permission. Therefore, the believers should put their trust in Allah and avoid such secret counsels that may grieve others.
orig: إنما النجوى من الشيطان ليحزن الذين آمنوا وليس بضارهم شيئا إلا بإذن الله وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: O you who believe! When you are told to make room in the assemblies, make room. Allah will give you ample space. And when you are told to rise up, then rise up. Allah will exalt those of you who believe, and those who are given knowledge, in high degrees. And Allah is Well-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse encourages humility, respect for knowledge, and obedience to Allah and His Messenger. By making room for others and rising when commanded, believers demonstrate their submission to divine guidance. In return, Allah promises to elevate the status of the faithful and the knowledgeable. It highlights the importance of acquiring knowledge and acting upon it, as Allah is aware of all our deeds.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا قيل لكم تفسحوا في المجالس فافسحوا يفسح الله لكم وإذا قيل انشزوا فانشزوا يرفع الله الذين آمنوا منكم والذين أوتوا العلم درجات والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: O you who have believed, when you converse privately with the Messenger, present before your private conversation a charity - that is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: "This verse encourages believers to give charity before engaging in private conversations with the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). The act of giving charity purifies one's heart and intentions, making the conversation more blessed and sincere. However, if one cannot afford to give charity, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards those who are financially unable."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا ناجيتم الرسول فقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقة ذلك خير لكم وأطهر فإن لم تجدوا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Do you fear that you will not be able to give charities before your private counsel? But if you are unable to do so, and Allah has pardoned you, then establish the prayer and give the zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Well-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse addresses the believers, questioning their hesitation in giving charity before engaging in private conversations with the Prophet Muhammad. It encourages them to give charity if they can, but if they cannot, Allah has pardoned them. However, it emphasizes the importance of establishing prayer, paying the obligatory charity (zakah), and obeying Allah and His Messenger. The verse reminds them that Allah is fully aware of their actions.
orig: أأشفقتم أن تقدموا بين يدي نجواكم صدقات فإذ لم تفعلوا وتاب الله عليكم فأقيموا الصلاة وآتوا الزكاة وأطيعوا الله ورسوله والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Have you not seen those who make friends with a people with whom Allah is angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to falsehood while they know.
interpretation: This verse warns against allying with or befriending those who have earned Allah's anger, such as disbelievers or hypocrites. It criticizes those who claim to be believers yet ally themselves with Allah's enemies, swearing falsely to prove their loyalty while knowing the truth of their disloyalty.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين تولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم ما هم منكم ولا منهم ويحلفون على الكذب وهم يعلمون

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, they used to do evil deeds.
interpretation: This verse warns that those who persist in disbelief and commit evil deeds will face a severe punishment from Allah on the Day of Judgment. It emphasizes that their actions were deplorable and displeasing to Allah, and that they will be held accountable for their misdeeds.
orig: أعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: They took their oaths as a cover, and thus they turned others away from the path of Allah, so they will have a humiliating punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who swore false oaths and used them as an excuse or "cover" to mislead others from the path of Allah. They deliberately hindered people from following the truth. As a consequence, they will face a humiliating punishment for their deception and obstruction of Allah's way.
orig: اتخذوا أيمانهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله فلهم عذاب مهين

translation: Their wealth and their children will never benefit them against Allah. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that wealth and offspring, which are highly valued by people, will not benefit the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. Their material possessions and progeny will not protect them from Allah's punishment or save them from the Hellfire. Those who reject faith and lead an ungodly life will be the dwellers of Hell, where they will abide forever.
orig: لن تغني عنهم أموالهم ولا أولادهم من الله شيئا أولئك أصحاب النار هم فيها خالدون

translation: The Day when Allah will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you, thinking that they are upon something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
interpretation: This verse warns about the state of the disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. They will swear to Allah that they were not disbelievers, just as they swear to people in this world, thinking that their oaths will benefit them. However, their oaths will be false, and they are the true liars who denied the truth and the signs of Allah.
orig: يوم يبعثهم الله جميعا فيحلفون له كما يحلفون لكم ويحسبون أنهم على شيء ألا إنهم هم الكاذبون

translation: Satan has overwhelmed them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
interpretation: This verse warns against being overcome by Satan and forgetting the remembrance of Allah. It states that those who are in Satan's party and have forgotten Allah's remembrance will be the ultimate losers. The interpretation is that one should be vigilant against Satan's deceptions and temptations that lead one away from the remembrance of Allah, as that path leads to loss and ruin in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: استحوذ عليهم الشيطان فأنساهم ذكر الله أولئك حزب الشيطان ألا إن حزب الشيطان هم الخاسرون

translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger - those will be among the most humiliated.
interpretation: This verse warns against opposing or defying Allah and His Messenger. It states that those who challenge the commands of Allah and reject the teachings of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, will be utterly disgraced and humiliated in this world and the Hereafter. This is a stern warning against arrogance, disobedience, and rebellion against the divine guidance revealed through the Qur'an and the Messenger.
orig: إن الذين يحادون الله ورسوله أولئك في الأذلين

translation: Allah has written, 'I will surely prevail, I and My messengers.' Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's promise that He and His messengers will ultimately prevail and triumph over their opponents. It emphasizes Allah's might and power, reassuring the believers that truth and righteousness will be victorious despite any challenges or opposition they may face. The interpretation conveys that Allah's decree is final, and His support for His messengers and the cause of truth is unwavering and unconquerable.
orig: كتب الله لأغلبن أنا ورسلي إن الله قوي عزيز

translation: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. Those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of having no affection or loyalty towards those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they are one's closest relatives. True believers should have their faith firmly rooted in their hearts, supported by divine guidance. They will be rewarded with eternal bliss in Paradise, pleasing Allah and being pleased with Him. This is the party of Allah, the truly successful ones.
orig: لا تجد قوما يؤمنون بالله واليوم الآخر يوادون من حاد الله ورسوله ولو كانوا آباءهم أو أبناءهم أو إخوانهم أو عشيرتهم أولئك كتب في قلوبهم الإيمان وأيدهم بروح منه ويدخلهم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها رضي الله عنهم ورضوا عنه أولئك حزب الله ألا إن حزب الله هم المفلحون

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the glorification of Allah by all beings in the heavens and the earth, acknowledging His transcendent power and perfect wisdom. It reminds us that every creation, animate or inanimate, consciously or unconsciously, praises and glorifies its Creator through its very existence and submission to His divine laws. The attributes "al-'Azeez" (the Exalted in Might) and "al-Hakeem" (the Wise) highlight Allah's absolute sovereignty, invincible power, and perfect wisdom that governs the entire universe.
orig: سبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: It is He who expelled the disbelievers among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their homes by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
interpretation: This verse refers to the expulsion of the Jewish tribes of Banu Nadir and Banu Qurayzah from Medina by the Prophet Muhammad during his lifetime. Allah describes how He expelled these disbelieving Jews from their homes despite their fortresses and strongholds, as a punishment for their hostility towards the Muslims. The Jews had thought their fortresses would protect them, but Allah instilled fear in their hearts, causing them to destroy their own homes before being expelled. This event serves as a lesson and warning for those who have insight to heed.
orig: هو الذي أخرج الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب من ديارهم لأول الحشر ما ظننتم أن يخرجوا وظنوا أنهم مانعتهم حصونهم من الله فأتاهم الله من حيث لم يحتسبوا وقذف في قلوبهم الرعب يخربون بيوتهم بأيديهم وأيدي المؤمنين فاعتبروا يا أولي الأبصار

translation: And were it not that Allah had decreed upon them exile, He would have punished them in this world. And for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
interpretation: If Allah had not destined exile for the disbelievers who fought against the Prophet, He would have punished them with a severe punishment in this world. However, in the Hereafter, they will face the torment of Hellfire for their disbelief and opposition to the truth.
orig: ولولا أن كتب الله عليهم الجلاء لعذبهم في الدنيا ولهم في الآخرة عذاب النار

translation: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the reason for the punishment mentioned earlier is because those people defied and disobeyed Allah and His Messenger. It serves as a stern warning that whoever goes against the commands of Allah and opposes His Messenger will face a severe punishment from Allah, Who is strict in enforcing His laws and meting out penalties for disobedience.
orig: ذلك بأنهم شاقوا الله ورسوله ومن يشاق الله فإن الله شديد العقاب

translation: Whatever you cut down of the tender palm-trees, or left them standing upon their roots, it was by Allah's permission, and in order that He might humiliate the rebellious sinners.
interpretation: This verse refers to the incident when the Muslims cut down and burned the palm trees of the Jews in the battle of Banu Nadir. Allah permitted this as a punishment for the rebellious Jews who broke their covenant and plotted to kill the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It serves as a lesson that those who defy Allah's commands will be humiliated and disgraced.
orig: ما قطعتم من لينة أو تركتموها قائمة على أصولها فبإذن الله وليخزي الفاسقين

translation: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it any horses or camels, but Allah gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the conquests and victories achieved by the Muslims were not due to their own military might or resources, but rather a result of Allah's support and favor upon His Messenger and the believers. The phrase "you did not spur for it any horses or camels" implies that the Muslims did not expend significant effort or resources in obtaining these conquests. Instead, it was Allah who granted power and authority to His Messenger over those He willed, as He is Omnipotent over all things.
orig: وما أفاء الله على رسوله منهم فما أوجفتم عليه من خيل ولا ركاب ولكن الله يسلط رسله على من يشاء والله على كل شيء قدير

translation: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allah and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.
interpretation: Cette verse traite de la distribution du butin de guerre. Elle stipule que le butin appartient à Allah, au Prophète, à ses proches parents, aux orphelins, aux pauvres et aux voyageurs dans le besoin. Cela vise à empêcher que le butin ne soit accaparé par les riches. Les musulmans doivent obéir aux ordres du Prophète et s'abstenir de ce qu'il a interdit, par crainte d'Allah et de Son châtiment sévère.
orig: ما أفاء الله على رسوله من أهل القرى فلله وللرسول ولذي القربى واليتامى والمساكين وابن السبيل كي لا يكون دولة بين الأغنياء منكم وما آتاكم الرسول فخذوه وما نهاكم عنه فانتهوا واتقوا الله إن الله شديد العقاب

translation: For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allah and [His] approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger - those are the truthful.
interpretation: This verse refers to the poor Muhajirun (emigrants) who left their homes and wealth in Makkah for the sake of Allah and His religion. They sought Allah's pleasure and reward, and supported the Prophet Muhammad and the cause of Islam. These people are praised as being truthful and sincere in their faith and sacrifice.
orig: للفقراء المهاجرين الذين أخرجوا من ديارهم وأموالهم يبتغون فضلا من الله ورضوانا وينصرون الله ورسوله أولئك هم الصادقون

translation: And those who were settled in the home [in Medina] and [adopted] the faith before them love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but prefer [the emigrants] over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
interpretation: هذه الآية تُشيد بمواقف المهاجرين والأنصار في المدينة المنورة. فالأنصار الذين آووا المهاجرين وآمنوا بالإسلام قبلهم، يحبون المهاجرين ولا يحسدونهم على ما أُعطوا من غنائم، بل يفضلونهم على أنفسهم حتى لو كانوا في حاجة وفقر. ومن يُحفظ من شح نفسه ويتجاوز البخل والأنانية، فأولئك هم الفائزون الناجحون في الدنيا والآخرة.
orig: والذين تبوءوا الدار والإيمان من قبلهم يحبون من هاجر إليهم ولا يجدون في صدورهم حاجة مما أوتوا ويؤثرون على أنفسهم ولو كان بهم خصاصة ومن يوق شح نفسه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: And those who came after them say: 'Our Lord! Forgive us and our brethren who have preceded us in Faith, and put not in our hearts any hatred against those who have believed. Our Lord! You are indeed full of kindness, Most Merciful.'
interpretation: This verse teaches us to pray for forgiveness not only for ourselves, but also for those who came before us in faith. It encourages unity among believers and forbids harboring any ill feelings or hatred towards fellow Muslims. The verse highlights Allah's qualities of being Most Kind and Merciful, reminding us to seek His forgiveness and guidance.
orig: والذين جاءوا من بعدهم يقولون ربنا اغفر لنا ولإخواننا الذين سبقونا بالإيمان ولا تجعل في قلوبنا غلا للذين آمنوا ربنا إنك رءوف رحيم

translation: Have you not seen those who were hypocrites? They say to their brothers who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey anyone against you ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But Allah bears witness that they are liars.
interpretation: This verse exposes the hypocrisy of some Muslims who claimed to have faith but allied themselves with the disbelievers. They falsely promised their disbelieving brethren that if they were expelled from Medina, the hypocrites would leave with them, disobeying the Prophet. They also vowed to aid the disbelievers if they were attacked, even though aiding disbelievers against Muslims is a grave sin. Allah declares that these hypocrites are liars, as their actions contradict their claims of faith.
orig: ألم تر إلى الذين نافقوا يقولون لإخوانهم الذين كفروا من أهل الكتاب لئن أخرجتم لنخرجن معكم ولا نطيع فيكم أحدا أبدا وإن قوتلتم لننصرنكم والله يشهد إنهم لكاذبون

translation: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them. And if they are fought against, they will not aid them. And if they try to aid them, they will surely turn their backs and flee, then they will not be aided.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who outwardly claimed to be Muslims but inwardly harbored disbelief and enmity towards the believers. It warns that if the believers expel the hypocrites, the hypocrites will not actually leave with them, indicating their lack of true allegiance. If the believers are fought against, the hypocrites will not aid or support them in battle. And if the hypocrites try to aid the believers, they will quickly turn their backs and flee at the first sign of danger, abandoning the believers, and they themselves will not receive any aid or support.
orig: لئن أخرجوا لا يخرجون معهم ولئن قوتلوا لا ينصرونهم ولئن نصروهم ليولن الأدبار ثم لا ينصرون

translation: For you are more feared in their hearts than Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
interpretation: The interpretation of this verse is that the disbelievers fear the Muslims more than they fear Allah. This is because they lack understanding and true faith in Allah. Their fear of the Muslims stems from their lack of spiritual insight and comprehension of the truth.
orig: لأنتم أشد رهبة في صدورهم من الله ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يفقهون

translation: They will not fight you all except within fortified towns or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
interpretation: This verse describes the cowardly nature of the disbelievers. They lack true courage and unity, and only fight from fortified positions or behind walls.
