Despite appearing united, their hearts are divided due to their lack of faith and wisdom. Their violence towards each other is severe, reflecting their inner conflicts and lack of guidance. Ultimately, their inability to use reason and logic leads them to this state of disunity and cowardice.
orig: لا يقاتلونكم جميعا إلا في قرى محصنة أو من وراء جدر بأسهم بينهم شديد تحسبهم جميعا وقلوبهم شتى ذلك بأنهم قوم لا يعقلون

translation: Like those before them who recently tasted the evil consequences of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse is a warning to those who reject faith and persist in disbelief. It compares them to previous nations who suffered the consequences of their rejection of God's messengers and disobedience. Despite witnessing the destruction of these nations in the recent past, the disbelievers continue to mock and reject the truth, and thus they will face a painful punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: كمثل الذين من قبلهم قريبا ذاقوا وبال أمرهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: Like the example of Satan when he said to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieved, he said, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds."
interpretation: This verse is a metaphor that likens the situation of those who misguide others to disbelief and then abandon them to the actions of Satan. Satan initially tempts and encourages people to disbelieve, but when they follow his call, he disassociates himself from them, leaving them to face the consequences alone. This demonstrates Satan's deceitful nature and his lack of loyalty or concern for those he misleads. The verse serves as a warning against being misled by Satan and highlights the importance of fearing Allah, the Lord of all worlds, instead of succumbing to Satan's temptations.
orig: كمثل الشيطان إذ قال للإنسان اكفر فلما كفر قال إني بريء منك إني أخاف الله رب العالمين

translation: So the end result for both of them will be that they will abide in the Fire, dwelling therein forever. And that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who persist in wrongdoing and disbelief. It emphasizes that the ultimate consequence for such individuals will be eternal residence in Hellfire, which is a just recompense for their unjust actions and rejection of faith.
orig: فكان عاقبتهما أنهما في النار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء الظالمين

translation: O you who believe! Fear Allah and let every soul look to what (provision) it has sent forth for the morrow. Fear Allah, for Allah is Well-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: "This verse emphasizes the importance of having taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah) and being mindful of one's actions and their consequences. It encourages believers to reflect on their deeds and strive to do good works that will benefit them in the Hereafter. The verse reminds us that Allah is fully aware of all our actions, and we will be held accountable for them."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا اتقوا الله ولتنظر نفس ما قدمت لغد واتقوا الله إن الله خبير بما تعملون

translation: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
interpretation: This verse warns against becoming heedless of Allah and His commands, like those who forgot Allah and indulged in sinful ways. As a result, Allah made them forget their own selves and purpose in life. Such people are described as "al-fasiqun" - those who have deviated from the right path and defied Allah's laws.
orig: ولا تكونوا كالذين نسوا الله فأنساهم أنفسهم أولئك هم الفاسقون

translation: Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the clear distinction between the people of Hellfire and the people of Paradise. It states that those who enter Paradise are the true winners and have attained the ultimate success, while those in Hellfire have failed and lost everything. This highlights the vastly different outcomes awaiting the believers and disbelievers in the Hereafter, based on their choices and deeds in this worldly life.
orig: لا يستوي أصحاب النار وأصحاب الجنة أصحاب الجنة هم الفائزون

translation: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled, rent asunder by the fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
interpretation: The verse is highlighting the profound and transformative impact of the Qur'an. It uses a metaphorical example to convey that even an inanimate object like a mountain would be humbled and shattered by the awe-inspiring words of the Qur'an if it were sent down upon it. This illustrates the power and majesty of Allah's revelation. The verse then states that such examples are presented to encourage people to ponder, reflect, and be guided by the wisdom contained within the Qur'an.
orig: لو أنزلنا هذا القرآن على جبل لرأيته خاشعا متصدعا من خشية الله وتلك الأمثال نضربها للناس لعلهم يتفكرون

translation: He is Allah, besides Whom there is no deity, the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His unique attributes. It emphasizes that Allah alone is worthy of worship, as He is the only true God. He is the "Knower of the unseen and the witnessed," meaning He has perfect knowledge of everything, seen and unseen. The verse also highlights Allah's infinite mercy, describing Him as "the Entirely Merciful" and "the Especially Merciful," indicating that His mercy encompasses all of creation and is particularly bestowed upon the believers.
orig: هو الله الذي لا إله إلا هو عالم الغيب والشهادة هو الرحمن الرحيم

translation: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and His transcendent attributes. It declares that Allah alone is worthy of worship, and no partners should be associated with Him. The verse highlights Allah's sovereignty, purity, perfection, ability to bestow faith, watchfulness over all, might, compulsion, and superiority over all creation. It concludes by glorifying Allah and negating any partners or equals to Him.
orig: هو الله الذي لا إله إلا هو الملك القدوس السلام المؤمن المهيمن العزيز الجبار المتكبر سبحان الله عما يشركون

translation: It is Allah the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner. To Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness and Perfection of Allah. He is the sole Creator who brought everything into existence from nothing. He is the Inventor who originated all creation without any preceding model. He is the Fashioner who gave each creation its unique shape and form. All the beautiful names and attributes belong to Him alone. Everything in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him by submitting to His laws and evidencing His Wisdom and Power. He is the Exalted in Might, nothing can overpower Him. He is the Wise, whose actions are based on perfect knowledge and wisdom.
orig: هو الله الخالق البارئ المصور له الأسماء الحسنى يسبح له ما في السماوات والأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O you who believe! Do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending love towards them while they have rejected the truth that has come to you, expelling the Messenger and you because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have gone forth to strive in My cause and seek My pleasure, how can you extend love to them in secret? And I know well what you conceal and what you reveal. And whoever among you does this has certainly strayed from the right path.
interpretation: هذه الآية تحذر المؤمنين من اتخاذ أعداء الله وأعدائهم أولياء، وإظهار المودة لهم رغم كفرهم بالحق وإخراجهم للرسول والمؤمنين بسبب إيمانهم بالله. فكيف يمكن للمؤمنين أن يسرّوا المودة لأعداء الله بعد أن خرجوا للجهاد في سبيله وابتغاء مرضاته؟ الله يعلم ما يخفونه وما يعلنونه، ومن يفعل ذلك فقد ضل عن الصراط المستقيم.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتخذوا عدوي وعدوكم أولياء تلقون إليهم بالمودة وقد كفروا بما جاءكم من الحق يخرجون الرسول وإياكم أن تؤمنوا بالله ربكم إن كنتم خرجتم جهادا في سبيلي وابتغاء مرضاتي تسرون إليهم بالمودة وأنا أعلم بما أخفيتم وما أعلنتم ومن يفعله منكم فقد ضل سواء السبيل

translation: If they gain the upper hand over you, they will be your enemies, and will stretch forth their hands and their tongues towards you with evil, and they ardently desire that you should disbelieve.
interpretation: This verse warns the believers about the enmity and hostility of the disbelievers towards them. If the disbelievers gain power over the believers, they will treat them as enemies, using physical force and verbal abuse against them. The disbelievers deeply desire that the believers abandon their faith and return to disbelief.
orig: إن يثقفوكم يكونوا لكم أعداء ويبسطوا إليكم أيديهم وألسنتهم بالسوء وودوا لو تكفرون

translation: No relations nor wealth will benefit you on the Day of Resurrection. He will judge between you, and Allah is Well-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that on the Day of Judgment, no familial ties or material possessions will be of any benefit. Instead, each person will be judged solely based on their deeds and actions in this world. Allah is fully aware of everyone's actions and intentions, and He will judge fairly and justly on that Day.
orig: لن تنفعكم أرحامكم ولا أولادكم يوم القيامة يفصل بينكم والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: There has certainly been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, 'Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone' - except for the saying of Abraham to his father, 'I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.'
interpretation: This verse presents the example of Prophet Abraham and his followers as a model to be emulated. They openly disassociated themselves from their people who worshipped idols besides Allah, declaring their belief in the Oneness of Allah. However, Abraham made an exception for his father, saying he would seek forgiveness for him, but he had no power to guide him against Allah's will. The verse emphasizes complete reliance on Allah and submission to His will as the ultimate goal.
orig: قد كانت لكم أسوة حسنة في إبراهيم والذين معه إذ قالوا لقومهم إنا برآء منكم ومما تعبدون من دون الله كفرنا بكم وبدا بيننا وبينكم العداوة والبغضاء أبدا حتى تؤمنوا بالله وحده إلا قول إبراهيم لأبيه لأستغفرن لك وما أملك لك من الله من شيء ربنا عليك توكلنا وإليك أنبنا وإليك المصير

translation: Our Lord, make us not [objects of torment] for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse is a supplication to Allah, asking Him not to make the believers a means of trial or punishment for the disbelievers, as that would give the disbelievers a chance to mock and ridicule the believers. It also asks Allah to forgive the believers for any shortcomings or sins they may have committed. The verse acknowledges Allah's might and wisdom, affirming that He has the power to grant this supplication and that His decisions are based on perfect wisdom.
orig: ربنا لا تجعلنا فتنة للذين كفروا واغفر لنا ربنا إنك أنت العزيز الحكيم

translation: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for whoever has hoped in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse presents an excellent model of behavior for those who have faith in God and the Last Day. It encourages emulating the virtuous conduct of the individuals being referred to, as they exemplified true devotion to God and preparation for the Hereafter. However, for those who turn away from this righteous path, God is self-sufficient and worthy of all praise, not needing His creation's obedience.
orig: لقد كان لكم فيهم أسوة حسنة لمن كان يرجو الله واليوم الآخر ومن يتول فإن الله هو الغني الحميد

translation: It may be that Allah will grant love (and friendship) between you and those whom you hold as enemies. And Allah is Ever All-Powerful, and Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's power and mercy. It suggests that even with those who are currently enemies, Allah has the ability to create love and friendship if He wills. The verse encourages Muslims to have hope in Allah's power to transform difficult situations and to seek His forgiveness, as He is Most Merciful.
orig: عسى الله أن يجعل بينكم وبين الذين عاديتم منهم مودة والله قدير والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.
interpretation: This verse teaches Muslims to be kind, righteous, and just towards non-Muslims who do not fight against them or expel them from their homes because of religion. It promotes tolerance and fair treatment of peaceful non-Muslims, as Allah loves those who act with justice and equity towards others.
orig: لا ينهاكم الله عن الذين لم يقاتلوكم في الدين ولم يخرجوكم من دياركم أن تبروهم وتقسطوا إليهم إن الله يحب المقسطين

translation: Allah only forbids you from those who fought you because of religion and drove you out of your homes and supported in driving you out, that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse prohibits Muslims from taking the disbelievers who fought against them for their faith, expelled them from their homes, and assisted in expelling them, as allies or friends. Allying with such oppressive enemies is considered a wrongful act and a transgression against Allah's commands.
orig: إنما ينهاكم الله عن الذين قاتلوكم في الدين وأخرجوكم من دياركم وظاهروا على إخراجكم أن تولوهم ومن يتولهم فأولئك هم الظالمون

translation: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And do not hold on to marriage ties with disbelieving women. And ask for what you spent and let them ask for what they spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: Cette verse traite des femmes musulmanes qui ont émigré de leur pays vers la communauté musulmane. Elle donne des instructions sur la manière de traiter ces femmes, de vérifier leur foi et de ne pas les renvoyer chez les mécréants. Elle clarifie également les questions de mariage et de dot avec ces femmes émigrées. La verse souligne la sagesse et la justice divine dans ces jugements.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا جاءكم المؤمنات مهاجرات فامتحنوهن الله أعلم بإيمانهن فإن علمتموهن مؤمنات فلا ترجعوهن إلى الكفار لا هن حل لهم ولا هم يحلون لهن وآتوهم ما أنفقوا ولا جناح عليكم أن تنكحوهن إذا آتيتموهن أجورهن ولا تمسكوا بعصم الكوافر واسألوا ما أنفقتم وليسألوا ما أنفقوا ذلكم حكم الله يحكم بينكم والله عليم حكيم

translation: And if any of your wives have gone from you to the disbelievers, and you have an accession (by the coming over of a woman from the other side), then pay to those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah in Whom you are believers.
interpretation: This verse addresses the situation where Muslim women leave their husbands and join the disbelievers, and vice versa. It instructs that if Muslim men lose their wives to the disbelievers, but subsequently gain other women who come over from the disbelievers, they should compensate the men whose wives left by paying them an amount equivalent to what they had spent on their wives. This ruling promotes justice and maintains social harmony. It also reminds believers to fear Allah and remain steadfast in their faith.
orig: وإن فاتكم شيء من أزواجكم إلى الكفار فعاقبتم فآتوا الذين ذهبت أزواجهم مثل ما أنفقوا واتقوا الله الذي أنتم به مؤمنون

translation: O Prophet! When the believing women come to you to pledge allegiance to you, upon the condition that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor steal, nor commit adultery, nor kill their children, nor fabricate any falsehood, nor disobey you in any just matter, then accept their pledge and ask Allah for forgiveness for them. Indeed, Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful.
interpretation: This verse outlines the pledge of allegiance that the Prophet Muhammad was instructed to take from believing women. It establishes the conditions for their pledge, which include not associating partners with Allah, not stealing, not committing adultery, not killing their children, not falsely accusing others of immoral acts, and not disobeying the Prophet in any just matter. If they fulfill these conditions, the Prophet was to accept their pledge and seek forgiveness for them from Allah, who is Most Forgiving and Most Merciful.
orig: يا أيها النبي إذا جاءك المؤمنات يبايعنك على أن لا يشركن بالله شيئا ولا يسرقن ولا يزنين ولا يقتلن أولادهن ولا يأتين ببهتان يفترينه بين أيديهن وأرجلهن ولا يعصينك في معروف فبايعهن واستغفر لهن الله إن الله غفور رحيم

translation: O you who have believed, do not take as allies a people with whom Allah is angry. They have despaired of the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of those in the graves.
interpretation: "This verse warns the believers against allying with or taking as close friends those who have earned Allah's wrath by rejecting faith and persisting in disbelief. Such people have lost all hope in the Hereafter, just as the disbelievers have no hope of salvation for those buried in graves. Allying with them will only lead to spiritual harm and a loss of guidance."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تتولوا قوما غضب الله عليهم قد يئسوا من الآخرة كما يئس الكفار من أصحاب القبور

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse affirms the absolute sovereignty, might, and wisdom of Allah over all of creation. Everything in the heavens and on earth, whether animate or inanimate, consciously or unconsciously, glorifies and exalts Allah through its very existence and adherence to the natural laws set by the Creator. The description of Allah as "al-'Azeez" (the Exalted in Might) and "al-Hakeem" (the Wise) highlights His supreme power and perfect wisdom that governs the entire universe.
orig: سبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: O you who believe! Why do you say what you do not do?
interpretation: This verse is reprimanding the believers for the discrepancy between their words and actions. It criticizes hypocrisy and emphasizes the importance of practicing what one preaches. Merely professing faith through words is not enough; true faith must be reflected in one's deeds and actions. The verse calls upon the believers to align their speech with their conduct and live according to the principles they claim to uphold.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لم تقولون ما لا تفعلون

translation: Most hateful it is with Allah that you say that which you do not do.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of practicing what one preaches and aligning one's words with one's actions. It condemns hypocrisy and the act of making claims or giving instructions that contradict one's own behavior. The verse highlights that such inconsistency between words and deeds is greatly despised by Allah, as it represents insincerity and a lack of integrity.
orig: كبر مقتا عند الله أن تقولوا ما لا تفعلون

translation: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of unity, discipline, and steadfastness in fighting for the cause of Allah. It praises those who stand together as one solid and cohesive unit, firmly bonded like a well-constructed building. This metaphor highlights the strength and resilience that comes from being united in purpose and action, without any gaps or weaknesses. The interpretation encourages Muslims to be resolute and unwavering in their struggle for the sake of Allah, maintaining a unified front and supporting one another like the interlocked parts of a sturdy edifice.
orig: إن الله يحب الذين يقاتلون في سبيله صفا كأنهم بنيان مرصوص

translation: And [recall] when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: This verse refers to the ingratitude and disobedience of the Israelites towards Moses, despite knowing that he was a messenger sent by Allah. Their deviation from the truth caused Allah to let their hearts deviate further from guidance, as Allah does not guide those who persist in defiance and disobedience.
orig: وإذ قال موسى لقومه يا قوم لم تؤذونني وقد تعلمون أني رسول الله إليكم فلما زاغوا أزاغ الله قلوبهم والله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."
interpretation: This verse refers to Jesus, the son of Mary, who confirmed the truth of the Torah and gave glad tidings of the coming of Prophet Muhammad, whose name is Ahmad. However, when Prophet Muhammad came with clear signs and miracles, the disbelievers accused him of practicing magic, refusing to accept the truth.
orig: وإذ قال عيسى ابن مريم يا بني إسرائيل إني رسول الله إليكم مصدقا لما بين يدي من التوراة ومبشرا برسول يأتي من بعدي اسمه أحمد فلما جاءهم بالبينات قالوا هذا سحر مبين

translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah while he is being invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse condemns those who fabricate lies against Allah and attribute falsehoods to Him, especially when they are being called to embrace Islam. It emphasizes that such people are committing a grave injustice. The verse also states that Allah does not guide those who persist in wrongdoing and rejecting the truth, as they have chosen to turn away from His guidance.
orig: ومن أظلم ممن افترى على الله الكذب وهو يدعى إلى الإسلام والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.
interpretation: The disbelievers try to extinguish the truth of Islam and prevent its spread by their words and actions, but Allah will ensure that His religion prevails and spreads, despite the opposition and hatred of the disbelievers.
orig: يريدون ليطفئوا نور الله بأفواههم والله متم نوره ولو كره الكافرون

translation: It is He who has sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to make it prevail over all religions, even though the polytheists dislike it.
interpretation: Allah sent Prophet Muhammad with the guidance of Islam and the true religion to make it superior over all other religions and ways of life, despite the opposition and hatred of the polytheists and disbelievers.
orig: هو الذي أرسل رسوله بالهدى ودين الحق ليظهره على الدين كله ولو كره المشركون

translation: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
interpretation: This verse is calling upon the believers to engage in a profitable transaction that will save them from the painful punishment of Hell on the Day of Judgment. The "transaction" being referred to is faith in Allah and engaging in righteous deeds such as belief, obedience, jihad (struggle) with one's wealth and life for the sake of Allah, and other acts of worship and good deeds. By fulfilling this "transaction," the believers secure their salvation from the torment of the Hereafter.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا هل أدلكم على تجارة تنجيكم من عذاب أليم

translation: You believe in Allah and His Messenger, and you strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you should know.
interpretation: This verse encourages the believers to have sincere faith in Allah and His Messenger, and to make sacrifices and strive for the cause of Allah with their wealth and lives. It emphasizes that this is the best and most beneficial path for them, if they truly understand and appreciate the rewards and blessings that come with such faith and struggle.
orig: تؤمنون بالله ورسوله وتجاهدون في سبيل الله بأموالكم وأنفسكم ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence; that is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse promises forgiveness and entry into Paradise for the believers. The "great attainment" refers to the ultimate success of attaining Allah's pleasure and the eternal bliss of Paradise, which includes gardens with rivers flowing beneath them and pleasant dwellings. It highlights the immense reward awaiting those who have faith and do righteous deeds.
orig: يغفر لكم ذنوبكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار ومساكن طيبة في جنات عدن ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: And another blessing which you love: victory from Allah and a conquest that is near. And give good tidings to the believers.
interpretation: This verse refers to the promise of victory and conquest that Allah has destined for the believers. It encourages them to rejoice in the divine aid and imminent triumph that is to come, and to remain steadfast in their faith. The "victory from Allah" signifies the spiritual and moral support granted to the believers, while the "conquest that is near" likely refers to a specific military or political victory that was forthcoming at the time of revelation. The verse concludes by instructing the Prophet to convey glad tidings of this divine favor to those who have embraced faith.
orig: وأخرى تحبونها نصر من الله وفتح قريب وبشر المؤمنين

translation: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, 'Who are my supporters for Allah?' The disciples said, 'We are supporters of Allah.' And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.
interpretation: This verse calls upon the believers to be true supporters of Allah's cause, just as Jesus (peace be upon him) asked his disciples to support him in the way of Allah. Some believed, while others disbelieved. Allah then aided and granted victory to those who believed against their enemies. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of remaining steadfast in faith and supporting the truth, as Allah will ultimately grant victory to the believers over their adversaries.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا كونوا أنصار الله كما قال عيسى ابن مريم للحواريين من أنصاري إلى الله قال الحواريون نحن أنصار الله فآمنت طائفة من بني إسرائيل وكفرت طائفة فأيدنا الذين آمنوا على عدوهم فأصبحوا ظاهرين

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth glorifies Allah, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights the universal and constant praise of Allah by all of His creation. Everything in the heavens and on the earth, whether animate or inanimate, consciously or unconsciously, glorifies and exalts Allah through its very existence and submission to His laws. It affirms Allah's sovereignty, holiness, might, and wisdom as the Supreme Creator and Sustainer of the universe.
orig: يسبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض الملك القدوس العزيز الحكيم

translation: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from among themselves, reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom - although they were before in clear error
interpretation: Allah sent Prophet Muhammad, who was unlettered and from among the Arabs, as a Messenger to recite the Quranic verses to them. His mission was to purify them from polytheism, immorality and ignorance, and to teach them the Quran and wisdom. Before his advent, they were clearly misguided.
orig: هو الذي بعث في الأميين رسولا منهم يتلو عليهم آياته ويزكيهم ويعلمهم الكتاب والحكمة وإن كانوا من قبل لفي ضلال مبين

translation: And others among them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Almighty, the All-Wise.
interpretation: This verse refers to the future believers who will embrace Islam and join the Muslim community. It highlights Allah's infinite might and wisdom in guiding people towards the truth over time.
orig: وآخرين منهم لما يلحقوا بهم وهو العزيز الحكيم

translation: That is the Bounty of Allah, which He bestows on whom He wills. And Allah is the Lord of Mighty Grace.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the ability to receive guidance, knowledge, and blessings from Allah is a great favor that He bestows upon whomever He wills, according to His infinite wisdom and mercy. It reminds us that all favors and graces come from Allah alone, and He is the One who possesses immense and boundless grace and bounty.
orig: ذلك فضل الله يؤتيه من يشاء والله ذو الفضل العظيم

translation: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who denied the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who were given the Torah but failed to follow its teachings, comparing them to a donkey carrying books without understanding their content. It condemns their rejection of Allah's signs and warns that Allah does not guide the wrongdoers who knowingly defy His commands.
orig: مثل الذين حملوا التوراة ثم لم يحملوها كمثل الحمار يحمل أسفارا بئس مثل القوم الذين كذبوا بآيات الله والله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين

translation: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."
interpretation: This verse challenges the Jews who claimed to be the exclusive allies of Allah and denied the prophethood of Muhammad (peace be upon him). It calls them to wish for death if they are truthful in their claim, as death would bring them closer to Allah if they were truly His allies. However, their unwillingness to wish for death exposes the falsehood of their claim and their aversion to meeting Allah.
orig: قل يا أيها الذين هادوا إن زعمتم أنكم أولياء لله من دون الناس فتمنوا الموت إن كنتم صادقين

translation: And they will never wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have sent ahead. And Allah is Aware of the wrongdoers.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the disbelievers will never wish for death, no matter how severe their punishment becomes, because they know that it will only lead them to an even greater torment in the Hereafter due to their evil deeds. Allah is fully aware of those who commit injustice and wrong against themselves and others.
orig: ولا يتمنونه أبدا بما قدمت أيديهم والله عليم بالظالمين

translation: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - it will surely meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the inevitability of death and the accountability for one's deeds in the Hereafter. It advises people to not run away from death, as it is an inescapable reality that will catch up with everyone. After death, all souls will be returned to Allah, the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed realms. He will then inform each person about their actions and deeds in this world, holding them accountable for their choices and conduct.
orig: قل إن الموت الذي تفرون منه فإنه ملاقيكم ثم تردون إلى عالم الغيب والشهادة فينبئكم بما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, when the call is made for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.
interpretation: "The interpretation is that Muslims are commanded to hasten to the Friday congregational prayer and leave off their trade or business dealings when the call to prayer is made. This is better for them in this life and the Hereafter, if they truly understand the importance and virtues of the Friday prayer."
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إذا نودي للصلاة من يوم الجمعة فاسعوا إلى ذكر الله وذروا البيع ذلكم خير لكم إن كنتم تعلمون

translation: So when you have completed the prayer, then disperse throughout the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah much, that you may be successful.
interpretation: After performing the obligatory prayer, Muslims are instructed to engage in lawful work and business activities to earn a living and seek Allah's provisions. However, they should not become so preoccupied with worldly pursuits that they neglect the remembrance of Allah, which is the key to true success and prosperity in this life and the Hereafter.
orig: فإذا قضيت الصلاة فانتشروا في الأرض وابتغوا من فضل الله واذكروا الله كثيرا لعلكم تفلحون

translation: And when they see some transaction or some amusement, they disperse headlong towards it, and leave you standing. Say, 'That which Allah has is better than amusement and transactions, and Allah is the best of providers.'
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who are easily distracted from the remembrance of Allah and spiritual pursuits by worldly amusements and business transactions. It emphasizes that what Allah has to offer through faith and righteous deeds is far superior and more lasting than temporary pleasures and material gains. Allah is the ultimate provider of all sustenance, both spiritual and physical.
orig: وإذا رأوا تجارة أو لهوا انفضوا إليها وتركوك قائما قل ما عند الله خير من اللهو ومن التجارة والله خير الرازقين

translation: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, 'We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah.' Allah knows that you are truly His Messenger, and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.
interpretation: This verse exposes the hypocrisy of the Munafiqun (hypocrites) who outwardly professed faith in the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) but inwardly harbored disbelief and ill intentions. It highlights that although they claim to believe in the Prophethood, Allah knows the reality of their hearts and that they are indeed liars. The verse serves as a warning against such deceitful behavior and affirms Allah's knowledge of the true state of people's faith.
orig: إذا جاءك المنافقون قالوا نشهد إنك لرسول الله والله يعلم إنك لرسوله والله يشهد إن المنافقين لكاذبون

translation: They took their oaths as a cover, and thus they turned away from the path of Allah. Evil indeed was what they used to do.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who use oaths and vows as a means to deceive and mislead others, turning them away from the path of Allah. It condemns their actions as evil and warns against such behavior that leads people astray from the truth.
orig: اتخذوا أيمانهم جنة فصدوا عن سبيل الله إنهم ساء ما كانوا يعملون

translation: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so a seal was set upon their hearts, hence they do not understand.
interpretation: This verse explains the reason behind the disbelievers' inability to comprehend the truth. It states that they initially believed, but then rejected the faith, causing Allah to seal their hearts. As a result, they lost the ability to understand and accept guidance, rendering them spiritually blind and deaf to the truth.
orig: ذلك بأنهم آمنوا ثم كفروا فطبع على قلوبهم فهم لا يفقهون

translation: And when you see them, their forms impress you; and if they speak, you listen to their speech. They are as if they were propped up timbers. They think every cry is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah fight them! How are they perverted?
interpretation: This verse describes the hypocrites and their characteristics. It says that although they may appear physically impressive, when they speak, their words are hollow like propped up timbers with no substance. They are overly suspicious, thinking every call or cry is directed against them. They are portrayed as the enemy that the believers should be wary of. The verse condemns their perversity and twisting of the truth, and asks Allah to fight against them for their hypocrisy.
orig: وإذا رأيتهم تعجبك أجسامهم وإن يقولوا تسمع لقولهم كأنهم خشب مسندة يحسبون كل صيحة عليهم هم العدو فاحذرهم قاتلهم الله أنى يؤفكون

translation: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you," they twist their heads in arrogance and you see them evading while they are arrogant.
interpretation: This verse criticizes the arrogant behavior of some people who refused to seek forgiveness from the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It highlights their pride and rejection of the Prophet's offer to pray for their forgiveness, which they expressed by turning their heads away in disdain and evading the matter with arrogance.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم تعالوا يستغفر لكم رسول الله لووا رءوسهم ورأيتهم يصدون وهم مستكبرون

translation: It is the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; Allah will never forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that the disbelievers have reached such a state of obstinacy and rejection of faith that even the Prophet's intercession or seeking forgiveness for them will be of no avail. Allah will not forgive them because they have deliberately chosen the path of disobedience and defiance against His commands. Their hearts have become hardened, and they have deprived themselves of Allah's guidance."
orig: سواء عليهم أستغفرت لهم أم لم تستغفر لهم لن يغفر الله لهم إن الله لا يهدي القوم الفاسقين

translation: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband." But to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.
interpretation: This verse refers to the hypocrites who discouraged others from supporting the Prophet Muhammad and his companions financially. They falsely claimed that the Prophet's followers would eventually disperse, so there was no need to assist them. However, Allah reminds us that all provisions come from Him, and the hypocrites lack true understanding of this reality.
orig: هم الذين يقولون لا تنفقوا على من عند رسول الله حتى ينفضوا ولله خزائن السماوات والأرض ولكن المنافقين لا يفقهون

translation: They say, 'If we return to Medina, the more honoured will surely expel therefrom the meaner.' But honour belongs to Allah and His Messenger, and to the believers; but the hypocrites know not.
interpretation: The hypocrites were threatening that if they returned to Medina, they would expel the sincere believers who were weaker and less influential. But Allah reminds them that true honour belongs to Him, His Messenger, and the believers, not to the arrogant hypocrites. The hypocrites lacked true understanding of faith and honour.
orig: يقولون لئن رجعنا إلى المدينة ليخرجن الأعز منها الأذل ولله العزة ولرسوله وللمؤمنين ولكن المنافقين لا يعلمون

translation: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.
interpretation: Allah is instructing the believers not to become so preoccupied with their wealth and children that they neglect to remember and worship Him. Those who allow their wealth and offspring to distract them from fulfilling their obligations to Allah are the true losers, as they have squandered the purpose of their existence.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا لا تلهكم أموالكم ولا أولادكم عن ذكر الله ومن يفعل ذلك فأولئك هم الخاسرون

translation: And spend from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, 'My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term, then I would give charity and be among the righteous.'
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to spend in charity from the wealth that Allah has bestowed upon them before death approaches. It warns against procrastination and delaying good deeds until it is too late. The verse implies that one should not postpone acts of righteousness and charity, as death can come unexpectedly, leaving no opportunity for repentance or good works.
orig: وأنفقوا من ما رزقناكم من قبل أن يأتي أحدكم الموت فيقول رب لولا أخرتني إلى أجل قريب فأصدق وأكن من الصالحين

translation: And never will Allah delay a soul when its term has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: Allah décrétera la mort de chaque âme au moment fixé pour elle, sans aucun retard. Allah est Parfaitement Conscient de tout ce que vous faites, que ce soit manifeste ou caché, et Il vous rétribuera en conséquence.
orig: ولن يؤخر الله نفسا إذا جاء أجلها والله خبير بما تعملون

translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah; to Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.
interpretation: This verse affirms the glorification of Allah by all creatures in the heavens and the earth, acknowledging His absolute sovereignty, dominion, and worthiness of praise. It emphasizes Allah's omnipotence and ability to do all things. The interpretation highlights the unity of creation in praising and submitting to the Almighty Creator.
orig: يسبح لله ما في السماوات وما في الأرض له الملك وله الحمد وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's complete knowledge and awareness of the actions and beliefs of His creation. It highlights that among humanity, there are those who believe in Allah and those who disbelieve, and Allah is fully aware of their respective deeds and choices. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's perfect sight and understanding of the diverse paths people take regarding faith and righteous conduct.
orig: هو الذي خلقكم فمنكم كافر ومنكم مؤمن والله بما تعملون بصير

translation: He created the heavens and the earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the final destination.
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's perfect creation of the universe and human beings. The creation of the heavens and earth was done with truth and wisdom, not in vain. Allah also formed human beings and perfected their physical forms, indicating His precision and artistry in creation. Ultimately, all beings will return to Allah on the Day of Resurrection, when they will be held accountable for their deeds.
orig: خلق السماوات والأرض بالحق وصوركم فأحسن صوركم وإليه المصير

translation: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth, and He knows what you conceal and what you reveal. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes Allah's absolute and perfect knowledge of everything in the heavens and the earth, including the secrets and thoughts concealed within people's hearts and minds. It highlights Allah's omniscience and His awareness of our inward and outward states, reminding us that nothing is hidden from Him. This understanding should instill a sense of accountability, sincerity, and consciousness of Allah in our lives.
orig: يعلم ما في السماوات والأرض ويعلم ما تسرون وما تعلنون والله عليم بذات الصدور

translation: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they had a painful punishment.
interpretation: This verse refers to the punishment that befell past nations who rejected the messages of Allah's messengers. It serves as a warning to those who disbelieve, reminding them of the dire consequences of their denial and disobedience. The "bad consequence" mentioned refers to the destruction and torment they faced in this world, while the "painful punishment" alludes to the eternal punishment in the Hereafter for their persistent rejection of faith.
orig: ألم يأتكم نبأ الذين كفروا من قبل فذاقوا وبال أمرهم ولهم عذاب أليم

translation: That is because there came to them their messengers with clear proofs, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and they disbelieved and turned away. And Allah was not in need [of them]. And Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.
interpretation: This verse explains that the disbelievers rejected the messengers and their clear signs and proofs because of their arrogance and unwillingness to accept guidance from fellow human beings. They questioned how mere mortals could guide them, displaying their pride and stubbornness. As a result, they disbelieved and turned away from the truth. However, Allah is self-sufficient and has no need for their belief or obedience. He is worthy of all praise, regardless of their rejection.
orig: ذلك بأنه كانت تأتيهم رسلهم بالبينات فقالوا أبشر يهدوننا فكفروا وتولوا واستغنى الله والله غني حميد

translation: Those who disbelieved claim that they will never be resurrected. Say: Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that is easy for Allah.
interpretation: This verse refutes the claims of the disbelievers who denied the resurrection after death. It affirms with certainty that resurrection will take place, and that everyone will be held accountable for their deeds. The ease with which Allah can resurrect and recompense people is emphasized, indicating His absolute power and control over all affairs.
orig: زعم الذين كفروا أن لن يبعثوا قل بلى وربي لتبعثن ثم لتنبؤن بما عملتم وذلك على الله يسير

translation: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the light which We have sent down. And Allah is Ever Well-Acquainted with what you do.
interpretation: This verse exhorts believers to have faith in Allah, His Messenger Muhammad, and the divine light of guidance revealed in the form of the Qur'an. It emphasizes that Allah is fully aware of all our actions and deeds, reminding us to be mindful and accountable for our conduct.
orig: فآمنوا بالله ورسوله والنور الذي أنزلنا والله بما تعملون خبير

translation: That is the Day of Gathering, the Day when you will be gathered - that is the Day of mutual loss and gain. And whoever believes in Allah and does what is right, He will remove from him his misdeeds and admit him into gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. That is the great attainment.
interpretation: This verse speaks of the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be gathered together before Allah. It is called the "Day of mutual loss and gain" because on that Day, those who disbelieved and did evil deeds will lose everything, while those who believed and did righteous deeds will gain Paradise. The verse promises that whoever has faith in Allah and does good works, Allah will forgive their sins and admit them into the eternal Gardens of Paradise, with rivers flowing underneath. This is described as the "great attainment" or the ultimate success.
orig: يوم يجمعكم ليوم الجمع ذلك يوم التغابن ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يكفر عنه سيئاته ويدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا ذلك الفوز العظيم

translation: But those who disbelieved and denied Our signs - those are the companions of the Fire, abiding eternally therein, and wretched is the journey's end.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to those who reject faith and deny the signs and revelations of Allah. It states that such disbelievers will be condemned to the Hellfire, where they will remain eternally. Their ultimate destination and fate is described as "wretched," indicating the severe punishment and miserable end that awaits them for their disbelief and rejection of the truth.
orig: والذين كفروا وكذبوا بآياتنا أولئك أصحاب النار خالدين فيها وبئس المصير

translation: No calamity befalls except by Allah's permission, and whoever believes in Allah - He will guide his heart. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
interpretation: This verse teaches that all calamities and misfortunes that occur are by the permission and decree of Allah. However, those who have faith in Allah and trust in His wisdom, He will guide their hearts and give them patience and contentment. Allah has complete knowledge of all things, so we should submit to His decree with faith and trust in His plan.
orig: ما أصاب من مصيبة إلا بإذن الله ومن يؤمن بالله يهد قلبه والله بكل شيء عليم

translation: And obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon Our Messenger is only the clear conveyance [of the Message].
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of obeying God and the Messenger, Prophet Muhammad. It states that if people turn away from obedience, the responsibility of the Messenger is only to convey the message clearly, and the consequences of disobedience lie with the people themselves.
orig: وأطيعوا الله وأطيعوا الرسول فإن توليتم فإنما على رسولنا البلاغ المبين

translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, and upon Allah let the believers put their trust.
interpretation: This verse affirms the Oneness of Allah and instructs the believers to place their complete trust and reliance in Him alone. It emphasizes that Allah is the only true God worthy of worship, and that the believers should depend on Him in all their affairs, having faith in His power, wisdom, and mercy.
orig: الله لا إله إلا هو وعلى الله فليتوكل المؤمنون

translation: O you who have believed, indeed, among your wives and your children are enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon and overlook and forgive - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse warns believers that their spouses and children can potentially become enemies or sources of distraction from the path of Allah if they are not vigilant. It advises them to be cautious and guard against being misled by their close relationships. However, it also encourages forgiveness, overlooking faults, and pardoning as Allah is Most Forgiving and Merciful to those who repent and seek His forgiveness.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا إن من أزواجكم وأولادكم عدوا لكم فاحذروهم وإن تعفوا وتصفحوا وتغفروا فإن الله غفور رحيم

translation: Your wealth and your children are but a trial, and Allah has with Him a great reward.
interpretation: This verse reminds believers that their wealth and children, which they tend to be preoccupied with and attach great importance to, are a test from Allah to see how they respond to them. True success lies in being grateful for these blessings and using them in obedience to Allah, rather than letting them become a source of distraction or arrogance. The verse also reassures that those who pass this test will be rewarded greatly by Allah in the Hereafter.
orig: إنما أموالكم وأولادكم فتنة والله عنده أجر عظيم

translation: So fear Allah as much as you are able and listen and obey and spend in good; it is better for yourselves. And whoever is saved from the greediness of his soul - it is those who are the successful.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah) to the best of their abilities, to listen and obey Allah's commands, and to spend in charity for their own spiritual benefit. It also promises success to those who overcome selfishness and greed, as they will attain salvation and prosperity.
orig: فاتقوا الله ما استطعتم واسمعوا وأطيعوا وأنفقوا خيرا لأنفسكم ومن يوق شح نفسه فأولئك هم المفلحون

translation: If you loan Allah a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allah is Most Appreciative and Forbearing.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to spend in the way of Allah, which is considered as "lending a goodly loan" to Him. Allah promises to multiply the reward for such spending and forgive their sins. It highlights Allah's appreciation for those who spend for His cause and His forbearance towards His servants.
orig: إن تقرضوا الله قرضا حسنا يضاعفه لكم ويغفر لكم والله شكور حليم

translation: The Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse highlights two of Allah's Attributes: Al-'Azeez (the Exalted in Might) and Al-Hakeem (the Wise). It affirms that Allah is the only One who has complete knowledge of the unseen and the seen realms. He is Exalted in His Power, Might, and Dominance over all creation, and His rulings and actions are based on perfect wisdom and purpose.
orig: عالم الغيب والشهادة العزيز الحكيم

translation: O Prophet, when you [Muslims] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord. Do not turn them out of their [husbands'] houses, nor should they [themselves] leave [unless] they commit a clear immorality. And those are the limits [set by] Allah. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah has certainly wronged himself. You know not; perhaps Allah will bring about after that a [different] matter.
interpretation: Le Coran donne ici des instructions sur la façon correcte de divorcer. Les épouses doivent être répudiées au début de leur période de viduité, et cette période doit être calculée avec précision. Les maris ne doivent pas expulser leurs épouses de leurs maisons pendant cette période, sauf si elles commettent un acte immoral flagrant. Ces règles sont établies par Allah, et quiconque les enfreint se fait du tort à lui-même. Cependant, Allah pourrait décider d'une nouvelle situation après cela, que nous ne pouvons pas prévoir.
orig: يا أيها النبي إذا طلقتم النساء فطلقوهن لعدتهن وأحصوا العدة واتقوا الله ربكم لا تخرجوهن من بيوتهن ولا يخرجن إلا أن يأتين بفاحشة مبينة وتلك حدود الله ومن يتعد حدود الله فقد ظلم نفسه لا تدري لعل الله يحدث بعد ذلك أمرا

translation: And when they have [nearly] fulfilled their term, either retain them according to reasonable terms or part with them according to reasonable terms. And bring to witness two just men from among you and establish the testimony for [the acceptance of] Allah. That is instructed to whoever should believe in Allah and the Last day. And whoever fears Allah - He will make for him a way out
interpretation: This verse provides guidance on how to deal with women during the waiting period ('iddah) after divorce. It instructs men to either retain their wives honorably or separate from them honorably when their waiting period is over. It also emphasizes the importance of having two just witnesses present and establishing testimony for the sake of Allah. The verse concludes by reminding believers to fear Allah, as He will provide a way out of difficulties for those who have faith in Him and the Last Day.
orig: فإذا بلغن أجلهن فأمسكوهن بمعروف أو فارقوهن بمعروف وأشهدوا ذوي عدل منكم وأقيموا الشهادة لله ذلكم يوعظ به من كان يؤمن بالله واليوم الآخر ومن يتق الله يجعل له مخرجا

translation: And He will provide for him from sources he never could imagine. And if one puts his trust in Allah, He will be enough for him. Verily, Allah will accomplish His purpose. For all things has Allah appointed a due proportion.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of trusting in Allah and relying upon Him. It promises that Allah will provide sustenance from unexpected and unimaginable sources for those who put their trust in Him. It also states that for the one who truly relies on Allah, He alone is sufficient. The verse concludes by affirming that Allah has a plan and wisdom behind everything He does, and that He has determined a proper measure and proportion for all things.
orig: ويرزقه من حيث لا يحتسب ومن يتوكل على الله فهو حسبه إن الله بالغ أمره قد جعل الله لكل شيء قدرا

translation: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women - if you doubt, then their period is three months, and [also for] those who have not menstruated. And for those who are pregnant, their term is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allah - He will appoint for him relief from His command.
interpretation: This verse outlines the waiting period ('iddah) for different categories of women after divorce or death of their husbands. It gives guidance on the 'iddah for post-menopausal women, young girls who have not started menstruating, and pregnant women. The main purpose is to ensure clarity on the waiting periods and to emphasize that Allah will make matters easy for those who fear and obey Him.
orig: واللائي يئسن من المحيض من نسائكم إن ارتبتم فعدتهن ثلاثة أشهر واللائي لم يحضن وأولات الأحمال أجلهن أن يضعن حملهن ومن يتق الله يجعل له من أمره يسرا

translation: That is the Command of Allah which He has sent down to you. And whoever fears Allah, He will remove from him his evil deeds and magnify for him his reward.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that the commandments and laws mentioned in the Qur'an are from Allah Himself. It promises that those who have taqwa (consciousness and fear of Allah) will have their sins forgiven and their rewards multiplied by Allah. The interpretation highlights the importance of obedience to Allah's commands and the great rewards that come with piety and righteousness.
orig: ذلك أمر الله أنزله إليكم ومن يتق الله يكفر عنه سيئاته ويعظم له أجرا

translation: Lodge them [in a section] of where you dwell, out of your means, and do not harm them in order to oppress them. And if they should be pregnant, then spend on them until they give birth. And if they breastfeed for you, then give them their payment and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way; but if you disagree, then another woman may breastfeed [the child].
interpretation: This verse instructs men to provide suitable accommodation for their divorced wives during the waiting period ('iddah), without causing them harm or hardship. If the divorced wife is pregnant, the man must continue providing for her financial maintenance until she gives birth. If she breastfeeds the child, she must be compensated fairly. However, if there is a disagreement regarding breastfeeding, another woman may be hired to breastfeed the child.
orig: أسكنوهن من حيث سكنتم من وجدكم ولا تضاروهن لتضيقوا عليهن وإن كن أولات حمل فأنفقوا عليهن حتى يضعن حملهن فإن أرضعن لكم فآتوهن أجورهن وأتمروا بينكم بمعروف وإن تعاسرتم فسترضع له أخرى

translation: Let the man of wealth spend from his wealth, and he whose provision is restricted - let him spend from what Allah has given him. Allah does not charge a soul except [according to] what He has given it. Allah will bring about ease after hardship.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the principles of fairness and moderation in spending. Those who are wealthy should spend generously from their wealth, while those with limited means should spend within their capacity. Allah does not burden anyone beyond what they can bear. The verse also provides reassurance that after every difficulty, Allah will grant relief and ease.
orig: لينفق ذو سعة من سعته ومن قدر عليه رزقه فلينفق مما آتاه الله لا يكلف الله نفسا إلا ما آتاها سيجعل الله بعد عسر يسرا

translation: And how many a town rebelled against the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We called it to a severe account and punished it with a terrible punishment.
interpretation: This verse warns about the consequences of disobeying Allah and His messengers. It reminds people that many towns and civilizations before them rejected the message of Allah and defied His commands, so Allah held them accountable with a severe reckoning and inflicted upon them a terrible punishment as a result of their rebellion and disbelief.
orig: وكأين من قرية عتت عن أمر ربها ورسله فحاسبناها حسابا شديدا وعذبناها عذابا نكرا

translation: So she tasted the consequence of her affair, and the end of her affair was perdition.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the punishment and destruction that befell a particular person or group as a result of their misdeeds or disobedience. It serves as a warning against following one's desires and ignoring divine guidance, as it ultimately leads to ruin and loss in this life and the Hereafter. The "taste" of the consequence implies experiencing the severe and bitter outcome of one's wrongful actions.
orig: فذاقت وبال أمرها وكان عاقبة أمرها خسرا

translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. So fear Allah, O men of understanding who have believed. Allah has sent down to you a message.
interpretation: This verse warns those who have been blessed with understanding and faith to fear Allah and obey His commands, as He has prepared a severe punishment for those who disobey. It emphasizes the importance of heeding the message (the Qur'an) that Allah has revealed as a reminder and guidance for the believers.
orig: أعد الله لهم عذابا شديدا فاتقوا الله يا أولي الألباب الذين آمنوا قد أنزل الله إليكم ذكرا

translation: A Messenger who recites to you the clear verses of Allah so that he may bring out those who believe and do good deeds from darkness into light. And whoever believes in Allah and does good deeds, He will admit them into gardens under which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allah has certainly made an excellent provision for him.
interpretation: This verse refers to the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a messenger who recites and conveys the clear verses of the Qur'an. His mission is to guide those who believe and do righteous deeds out of the darkness of ignorance and disbelief into the light of faith and righteousness. It promises that those who believe in Allah and perform good deeds will be admitted into the eternal gardens of Paradise, where rivers flow beneath them. This is described as an excellent provision from Allah for those who follow the guidance of the Prophet.
orig: رسولا يتلو عليكم آيات الله مبينات ليخرج الذين آمنوا وعملوا الصالحات من الظلمات إلى النور ومن يؤمن بالله ويعمل صالحا يدخله جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار خالدين فيها أبدا قد أحسن الله له رزقا

translation: Allah is He Who created seven heavens, and of the earth the like thereof. The commandment comes down among them, that you may know that Allah is Able to do all things, and that Allah indeed surrounds all things in knowledge.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's absolute power and knowledge. He created the seven heavens and seven earths in perfect harmony, and His command flows between them effortlessly. This reminds us that Allah has complete ability over all things, and that His knowledge encompasses everything in existence. We should be in awe of His might and wisdom, and trust in His perfect governance of the universe.
orig: الله الذي خلق سبع سماوات ومن الأرض مثلهن يتنزل الأمر بينهن لتعلموا أن الله على كل شيء قدير وأن الله قد أحاط بكل شيء علما

translation: O Prophet, why do you prohibit [yourself from] what Allah has made lawful for you, seeking the approval of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
interpretation: This verse questions the Prophet Muhammad's decision to prohibit something that Allah had made lawful for him, out of consideration for his wives' feelings. It suggests that he should not deprive himself of what is permissible, as Allah is Forgiving and Merciful towards His servants.
orig: يا أيها النبي لم تحرم ما أحل الله لك تبتغي مرضات أزواجك والله غفور رحيم

translation: Allah has already ordained for you the dissolution of your oaths. And Allah is your protector, and He is the Knowing, the Wise.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has made a legal provision for the expiation or dissolution of oaths that a person may have taken, if they are unable to fulfill them or if doing so would cause them harm. It highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in providing a way out for believers who have sworn oaths they cannot uphold, as long as they make the prescribed expiation. The verse also reminds believers that Allah is their Guardian and Protector, and that He is the All-Knowing and All-Wise, so His commandments are based on profound knowledge and wisdom.
orig: قد فرض الله لكم تحلة أيمانكم والله مولاكم وهو العليم الحكيم

translation: And [remember, O Muhammad], when the Prophet confided to one of his wives a statement; and when she informed [another] of it and Allah showed it to him, he made known part of it and ignored a part. And when he informed her about it, she said, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the All-Knowing, the All-Aware."
interpretation: This verse refers to an incident where the Prophet Muhammad confided something to one of his wives, and she disclosed it to another wife. Allah then informed the Prophet of what had happened. The verse highlights the omniscience of Allah, who is aware of all secrets and private matters. It also emphasizes the importance of maintaining confidentiality and trust within relationships, even between spouses.
orig: وإذ أسر النبي إلى بعض أزواجه حديثا فلما نبأت به وأظهره الله عليه عرف بعضه وأعرض عن بعض فلما نبأها به قالت من أنبأك هذا قال نبأني العليم الخبير

translation: If you two turn in repentance to Allah, your hearts are indeed so inclined; but if you back up each other against him, truly Allah is his Protector, and Gabriel, and the righteous believers, and furthermore, the angels will back (him) up.
interpretation: This verse addresses the wives of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him. It states that if they repent to Allah and obey Him, their hearts will be guided aright. However, if they conspire against the Prophet, Allah will support him through the angels, the righteous believers, and the Archangel Gabriel. The verse emphasizes the unwavering divine support for the Prophet against any opposition or conspiracy, even from his own wives.
orig: إن تتوبا إلى الله فقد صغت قلوبكما وإن تظاهرا عليه فإن الله هو مولاه وجبريل وصالح المؤمنين والملائكة بعد ذلك ظهير

translation: It may be if he divorced you (all) that his Lord will give him instead, wives better than you - submissive (to Allah), believers, obedient, penitent, devout in worship, inclined to fasting, previously married and virgins.
interpretation: This verse suggests that if a man divorces his wives, Allah may bless him with better wives in the future - wives who are devoted, faithful, obedient to Allah, repentant for their sins, diligent in worship, observant of fasting, whether previously married or virgins. The verse highlights the virtues that a believing woman should possess.
orig: عسى ربه إن طلقكن أن يبدله أزواجا خيرا منكن مسلمات مؤمنات قانتات تائبات عابدات سائحات ثيبات وأبكارا

translation: O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is people and stones, over which are [appointed] angels, harsh and severe; they do not disobey Allah in what He commands them but do what they are commanded.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of protecting oneself and one's family from the punishment of Hellfire by obeying Allah's commands and avoiding sins. The fuel of this Fire is described as people and stones, indicating the severity of its punishment. The angels guarding it are harsh and strict, obeying Allah's commands without fail. The verse serves as a warning and motivation for believers to remain steadfast in their faith and righteous conduct.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا قوا أنفسكم وأهليكم نارا وقودها الناس والحجارة عليها ملائكة غلاظ شداد لا يعصون الله ما أمرهم ويفعلون ما يؤمرون

translation: O you who disbelieve, make no excuses this Day. You are only being recompensed for what you used to do.
interpretation: This verse is addressing the disbelievers on the Day of Judgment. It is telling them not to make any excuses or present any justifications for their disbelief and rejection of faith, because they will be judged and recompensed solely based on their actions and deeds in the worldly life. Their fate is a direct consequence of their own choices and actions during their time on earth.
orig: يا أيها الذين كفروا لا تعتذروا اليوم إنما تجزون ما كنتم تعملون

translation: O you who have believed, repent to Allah with sincere repentance. Perhaps your Lord will remove from you your misdeeds and admit you into gardens beneath which rivers flow [on] the Day when Allah will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will spread before them and on their right, they will say, 'Our Lord, perfect for us our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are over all things competent.'
interpretation: This verse is a call for sincere repentance to Allah from all sins and misdeeds. It promises that those who repent sincerely will have their sins forgiven and will be admitted to Paradise on the Day of Judgment. It also mentions that on that Day, the Prophet Muhammad and the believers will not be disgraced, and their light of faith will illuminate their way. They will ask Allah to perfect their light and forgive them, acknowledging Allah's power over all things.
orig: يا أيها الذين آمنوا توبوا إلى الله توبة نصوحا عسى ربكم أن يكفر عنكم سيئاتكم ويدخلكم جنات تجري من تحتها الأنهار يوم لا يخزي الله النبي والذين آمنوا معه نورهم يسعى بين أيديهم وبأيمانهم يقولون ربنا أتمم لنا نورنا واغفر لنا إنك على كل شيء قدير

translation: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh upon them. Their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse commands the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to strive against the disbelievers who reject the faith and the hypocrites who outwardly profess Islam but inwardly conceal disbelief. It instructs him to be firm and harsh with them, as their ultimate abode is Hell, which is a terrible destination and punishment for their rejection of faith and hypocrisy.
orig: يا أيها النبي جاهد الكفار والمنافقين واغلظ عليهم ومأواهم جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: Allah presents an example of those who disbelieved: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of Our righteous servants but betrayed them, so those servants could not avail them at all against Allah, and it was said, 'Enter the Fire with those who enter.'
interpretation: This verse presents the example of the wives of two prophets, Noah and Lot, who disbelieved despite being married to righteous men. Their close relationship to these noble prophets did not benefit them because they betrayed their husbands by disbelieving. Consequently, they were condemned to enter Hellfire along with the disbelievers. This verse serves as a warning that merely being associated with righteous people is not enough for one's salvation; rather, faith and obedience to Allah are essential.
orig: ضرب الله مثلا للذين كفروا امرأت نوح وامرأت لوط كانتا تحت عبدين من عبادنا صالحين فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيئا وقيل ادخلا النار مع الداخلين

translation: And Allah presents an example of those who believed: the wife of Pharaoh, when she said, 'My Lord, build for me near You a house in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his deeds and save me from the wrongdoing people.'
interpretation: The verse presents the wife of Pharaoh as an example of a believer who sought refuge in Allah from the oppression of her disbelieving husband and his people. Despite being surrounded by disbelief and tyranny, she maintained her faith and prayed to Allah to grant her a place in Paradise, away from the injustice she was facing. Her story serves as an inspiration for believers to remain steadfast in their faith, even in the face of adversity and oppression.
orig: وضرب الله مثلا للذين آمنوا امرأت فرعون إذ قالت رب ابن لي عندك بيتا في الجنة ونجني من فرعون وعمله ونجني من القوم الظالمين

translation: And [mention] Mary, the daughter of 'Imran, who guarded her chastity, so We blew into [her garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and she believed in the words of her Lord and His scriptures and was of the devoutly obedient.
interpretation: This verse highlights the virtues of Mary, the mother of Jesus. She guarded her chastity and remained pure, so Allah blessed her with a child miraculously, without a father, by breathing into her His spirit. Mary had unwavering faith in Allah's words and scriptures, and was among those who were obedient and devoted to Allah.
orig: ومريم ابنت عمران التي أحصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيه من روحنا وصدقت بكلمات ربها وكتبه وكانت من القانتين

translation: Blessed is He in Whose Hand is the dominion, and He is Able to do all things.
interpretation: This verse glorifies and praises Allah, the Almighty, Who possesses complete sovereignty, authority, and control over all that exists. It affirms that Allah alone holds supreme dominion and power over the entire universe and everything within it. He is "Able to do all things," indicating His absolute capability, omnipotence, and ability to accomplish whatever He wills without any limitations or constraints.
orig: تبارك الذي بيده الملك وهو على كل شيء قدير

translation: He Who created death and life to test you [as to] which of you is best in deed - and He is the Exalted in Might, the Forgiving.
interpretation: This verse suggests that God created life and death as a test for human beings, to see which of them will perform the best deeds and actions. It implies that our existence in this world is a trial, and how we conduct ourselves through our actions will determine our ultimate fate. The verse also highlights two of God's attributes - His Might and Power, as well as His quality of being the Forgiving and Pardoning towards those who repent and do good deeds.
orig: الذي خلق الموت والحياة ليبلوكم أيكم أحسن عملا وهو العزيز الغفور

translation: Who has created seven heavens in layers. You do not see any inconsistency in the creation of the Most Merciful. So keep looking again and again, can you see any flaw?
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the perfection and flawlessness of Allah's creation, particularly the seven heavens that He created in layers or strata. It invites the reader to contemplate and observe the creation carefully, looking for any imperfection or flaw, but they will not find any. The verse highlights Allah's attribute of being the Most Merciful (Ar-Rahman), whose creation is free from any defect or inconsistency. It encourages the reader to reflect deeply on the signs of Allah's power and wisdom manifested in the universe.
orig: الذي خلق سبع سماوات طباقا ما ترى في خلق الرحمن من تفاوت فارجع البصر هل ترى من فطور

translation: Then return the vision twice, the vision will come back to you humbled while it is fatigued.
interpretation: This verse implies that one should reflect deeply on the signs and creations of Allah. The phrase "return the vision twice" suggests looking again and again at Allah's creations with contemplation and appreciation. However, the human vision and intellect will ultimately be "humbled" and "fatigued" in comprehending the greatness of Allah's power and wisdom behind His creations.
orig: ثم ارجع البصر كرتين ينقلب إليك البصر خاسئا وهو حسير

translation: And We have certainly beautified the nearest heaven with stars and have made them what is thrown at the devils and prepared for them the punishment of the Blaze.
interpretation: This verse speaks of Allah's power and majesty in adorning the nearest heaven with stars, which serve as a means of repelling devils or evil forces. The stars are likened to missiles hurled at the devils, preventing them from eavesdropping on the higher realms. Additionally, Allah has prepared a severe punishment, described as the "punishment of the Blaze," for those devils who persist in their defiance and transgression.
orig: ولقد زينا السماء الدنيا بمصابيح وجعلناها رجوما للشياطين وأعتدنا لهم عذاب السعير

translation: But for those who disbelieved in their Lord is the punishment of Hell, and wretched is the destination.
interpretation: This verse warns of the grave consequence for those who reject faith in Allah. It states that for the disbelievers, there is the punishment of Hellfire awaiting them, which is described as an evil destination or end. This highlights the importance of belief in God and the severe penalty for denying Him, which is eternal torment in Hell.
orig: وللذين كفروا بربهم عذاب جهنم وبئس المصير

translation: When they are thrown into it, they will hear its raging and roaring.
interpretation: This verse describes the terrifying scene of the disbelievers being thrown into Hellfire. When they are cast into it, they will hear its furious, roaring sound as it rages and boils intensely. This depicts the horrific punishment that awaits those who rejected faith and disobeyed Allah's commands.
orig: إذا ألقوا فيها سمعوا لها شهيقا وهي تفور

translation: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a group is cast into it, its keepers ask them, 'Did there not come to you a warner?'
interpretation: This verse is describing the intense rage and fury of Hellfire. Whenever a new group of disbelievers is thrown into it, the angels guarding it taunt them, asking if they were not warned by messengers sent to guide them to the truth. Their rejection of the divine message has led them to this terrible punishment.
orig: تكاد تميز من الغيظ كلما ألقي فيها فوج سألهم خزنتها ألم يأتكم نذير

translation: They will say, 'Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied and said, 'Allah has not sent down anything. You are not but in great error.'
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers' admission on the Day of Judgment that a messenger was sent to warn them, but they rejected the message and accused the messenger of being misguided. It highlights their arrogance and stubbornness in denying the truth despite clear warning.
orig: قالوا بلى قد جاءنا نذير فكذبنا وقلنا ما نزل الله من شيء إن أنتم إلا في ضلال كبير

translation: And they will say, 'If only we had listened or used our intelligence, we would not have been among the companions of the Blaze.'
interpretation: This verse highlights the regret and remorse that the disbelievers will feel in the Hereafter when they realize the consequences of their actions. They will wish that they had listened to the teachings of the prophets and used their intellect to understand the truth, instead of blindly following their desires and rejecting faith. The 'companions of the Blaze' refers to the inhabitants of Hell, indicating that their failure to listen and reason led them to this terrible fate.
orig: وقالوا لو كنا نسمع أو نعقل ما كنا في أصحاب السعير

translation: So they confessed their sin. Utter ruin for the companions of the Blaze!
interpretation: The verse speaks of those who denied the truth and rejected faith, acknowledging their sins when it was too late to benefit them. It warns that such deniers will face utter destruction and ruin in the Hellfire, described as "companions of the Blaze".
