translation: Does man think that he will be left neglected?
interpretation: This verse questions the notion that human beings will be left without purpose or accountability. It suggests that there is a higher purpose and plan for humanity, and that our actions will not go unnoticed or without consequence. It serves as a reminder that we are responsible for our choices and deeds, and that there will be a reckoning or judgment.
orig: أيحسب الإنسان أن يترك سدى

translation: Was he not a drop of semen emitted?
interpretation: This verse is emphasizing the humble origins of human beings, reminding us that we were once a mere drop of semen. It serves as a reminder of our insignificance before God and encourages humility and gratitude for the gift of life bestowed upon us by the Divine Creator.
orig: ألم يك نطفة من مني يمنى

translation: Then he became a clot of congealed blood; then He created and fashioned [him]
interpretation: This verse describes the stages of human development in the womb. After the nutfah (drop of semen) stage, the embryo becomes a clot of congealed blood ('alaqah). Then Allah created and fashioned the embryo, giving it the perfect human form and features.
orig: ثم كان علقة فخلق فسوى

translation: And He made from it the two mates, the male and the female.
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's creation of the male and female genders from a single entity. It highlights the divine wisdom in creating the two complementary genders, allowing for procreation and the continuation of human life. This duality in creation also symbolizes the balance and harmony that exists in the universe.
orig: فجعل منه الزوجين الذكر والأنثى

translation: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to give life to the dead?
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's power to resurrect the dead on the Day of Judgment. It reminds us that the One who created the vast universe from nothing is certainly capable of bringing the dead back to life. This reinforces the Islamic belief in the afterlife and the accountability of our actions on that Day.
orig: أليس ذلك بقادر على أن يحيي الموتى

translation: Has there not been over man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
interpretation: This verse questions the deniers of resurrection, reminding them that before their creation, they were nothing and not even mentioned or known. It emphasizes the power of Allah in bringing humans into existence from non-existence, just as He will resurrect them after death. It highlights the insignificance of man before his creation, reminding him of Allah's ability to recreate him after death.
orig: هل أتى على الإنسان حين من الدهر لم يكن شيئا مذكورا

translation: Indeed, We have created man from a sperm-drop mixture so We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
interpretation: Allah created human beings from a mixture of male and female reproductive substances in order to test their faith and obedience. He blessed them with the faculties of hearing and sight so that they may perceive the signs of Allah's existence and follow His guidance.
orig: إنا خلقنا الإنسان من نطفة أمشاج نبتليه فجعلناه سميعا بصيرا

translation: Verily, We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has provided guidance and shown the straight path to human beings. However, it is up to each individual to choose whether to be grateful for this guidance by accepting and following it, or to be ungrateful by rejecting and turning away from it. The choice is ours, but the consequences of our choice will be faced in the Hereafter.
orig: إنا هديناه السبيل إما شاكرا وإما كفورا

translation: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blazing Fire.
interpretation: This verse warns the disbelievers of the severe punishment that Allah has prepared for them in the Hereafter. The "chains and shackles" symbolize the restraints and confinement they will face, while the "blazing Fire" represents the intense torment of Hellfire. It serves as a stern reminder of the grave consequences of rejecting faith and disobeying Allah's commands.
orig: إنا أعتدنا للكافرين سلاسل وأغلالا وسعيرا

translation: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur
interpretation: This verse describes the reward that the righteous believers will receive in Paradise. The "cup" mentioned refers to a drink of pure wine that is mixed with a fragrant plant called "Kafur." This symbolizes the utmost delight, pleasure, and joy that the righteous will experience in the Hereafter as a result of their faith and good deeds in this world. The verse highlights the concept of eternal bliss awaiting the pious in the Gardens of Paradise.
orig: إن الأبرار يشربون من كأس كان مزاجها كافورا

translation: A spring wherefrom the servants of Allah will drink, causing it to gush forth abundantly,
interpretation: This verse describes a spring in Paradise that will flow abundantly for the believers to drink from. It symbolizes the unlimited blessings and favors that Allah has prepared for His righteous servants in the Hereafter. The effortless gushing forth of the spring represents the ease with which these divine rewards will be bestowed upon the believers, without any toil or hardship on their part.
orig: عينا يشرب بها عباد الله يفجرونها تفجيرا

translation: They fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the importance of fulfilling one's promises and vows to Allah, as well as having a sense of accountability and fear of the Day of Judgment, when the consequences of one's actions will be far-reaching and severe. It highlights the qualities of true believers who not only make sincere pledges, but also follow through on them out of reverence for Allah and dread of the terrifying events that will unfold on the inevitable Day of Reckoning.
orig: يوفون بالنذر ويخافون يوما كان شره مستطيرا

translation: And they give food, in spite of their love for it, to the poor, the orphan and the captive
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the virtue of selflessness and charity. Despite their own attachment and desire for food, the believers are encouraged to share it with those in need, including the destitute, the orphaned, and the imprisoned. It highlights the importance of prioritizing the well-being of others over personal desires, and the act of giving is considered a praiseworthy quality that brings one closer to God.
orig: ويطعمون الطعام على حبه مسكينا ويتيما وأسيرا

translation: We feed you only for the sake of Allah. We desire no reward from you, nor thanks.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes selfless service and charity for the sake of pleasing Allah alone, without any expectation of worldly reward or gratitude from the recipients. It encourages doing good deeds purely for the pleasure of Allah, free from any ulterior motives or self-interest.
orig: إنما نطعمكم لوجه الله لا نريد منكم جزاء ولا شكورا

translation: Indeed, we fear from our Lord a frowning, distressful Day.
interpretation: This verse expresses the fear of the believers on the Day of Judgment, when they will stand before their Lord. The "frowning" and "distressful" descriptions convey the severity and difficulty of that Day, reminding us of the accountability we will face for our deeds in this life. The interpretation encourages us to live righteously and seek Allah's pleasure to be saved from the horrors of that tremendous Day.
orig: إنا نخاف من ربنا يوما عبوسا قمطريرا

translation: So Allah saved them from the evil of that Day, and gave them a light and a joy.
interpretation: Allah protected the believers from the horrors and punishment of that Day (the Day of Resurrection). He blessed them with radiant faces shining with the light of joy and contentment, reflecting their successful attainment of eternal bliss and salvation.
orig: فوقاهم الله شر ذلك اليوم ولقاهم نضرة وسرورا

translation: And their reward for what they patiently endured will be Paradise and silk.
interpretation: This verse promises those who endure trials and difficulties with patience and perseverance that their reward will be the eternal bliss of Paradise and the finest luxuries, symbolized by silk garments. It encourages believers to remain steadfast in the face of adversity, for their ultimate recompense will be far greater than any temporary hardship they may face.
orig: وجزاهم بما صبروا جنة وحريرا

translation: Reclining therein on thrones, they will see there neither the excessive heat nor the excessive bitter cold.
interpretation: This verse describes the blissful state of the believers in Paradise. They will be reclining comfortably on thrones, enjoying perfect ease and luxury, without experiencing any discomfort or hardship. The "excessive heat" and "excessive bitter cold" mentioned refer to the extreme temperatures that cause distress in this world. In Paradise, the environment will be perfectly temperate and pleasant, free from any unpleasant or harmful conditions.
orig: متكئين فيها على الأرائك لا يرون فيها شمسا ولا زمهريرا

translation: And its shades will be close upon them, and its clusters of fruit will hang low within easy reach.
interpretation: The interpretation is that in Paradise, the trees will provide abundant shade and their fruits will be easily accessible to the believers, indicating the ease, comfort, and blessings they will enjoy in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: ودانية عليهم ظلالها وذللت قطوفها تذليلا

translation: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been crystalline,
interpretation: This verse describes the luxurious setting of Paradise, where the inhabitants will be served drinks in exquisite vessels of silver and crystal-clear cups. It symbolizes the honor, purity, and delight that the believers will experience in the Hereafter as a reward for their righteousness.
orig: ويطاف عليهم بآنية من فضة وأكواب كانت قواريرا

translation: Glasses made of silver - they have measured and determined the measure thereof.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the delights and luxuries that will be available to the righteous believers in Paradise. The "glasses made of silver" symbolize the exquisite and precious vessels that will be used to serve pure drinks in the afterlife. The phrase "they have measured and determined the measure thereof" suggests that these delights have been carefully prepared and apportioned by Allah in precise measure, reflecting the perfect balance and moderation that exists in Paradise.
orig: قوارير من فضة قدروها تقديرا

translation: And they will be given a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
interpretation: This verse describes one of the pleasures that the righteous believers will enjoy in Paradise. They will be served a drink mixed with ginger, which was considered a delightful and refreshing beverage in ancient times. The ginger mixture symbolizes the pure and delightful drinks that await the believers in the eternal gardens of Paradise as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: ويسقون فيها كأسا كان مزاجها زنجبيلا

translation: In it is a spring called Salsabil.
interpretation: This verse refers to a spring in Paradise called "Salsabil". The name "Salsabil" is derived from the Arabic word meaning "gently flowing". It is one of the delights and blessings that the righteous will enjoy in the Gardens of Paradise. The flowing spring represents the pure and abundant provision that Allah will grant the believers in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: عينا فيها تسمى سلسبيلا

translation: And there will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think they were scattered pearls.
interpretation: This verse describes the servants in Paradise, who will be eternally youthful and radiant, resembling scattered pearls in their beauty and purity. It symbolizes the perfection and splendor that awaits the believers in the Hereafter.
orig: ويطوف عليهم ولدان مخلدون إذا رأيتهم حسبتهم لؤلؤا منثورا

translation: And when you see, you will see bliss and a great kingdom.
interpretation: This verse promises the believers that if they remain steadfast in their faith and obedience to Allah, they will be rewarded with an everlasting state of bliss and a great kingdom in the Hereafter. The "bliss" refers to the eternal pleasures and joys of Paradise, while the "great kingdom" symbolizes the honor, dignity, and sovereignty that the believers will attain in the Hereafter as a result of their righteous deeds in this world.
orig: وإذا رأيت ثم رأيت نعيما وملكا كبيرا

translation: Upon them will be green garments of fine silk and heavy silk, and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a pure drink.
interpretation: This verse describes the rewards awaiting the righteous believers in Paradise. The "green garments of fine silk and heavy silk" symbolize honor, beauty, and luxury. The "bracelets of silver" represent adornment and status. And the "pure drink" given by their Lord signifies spiritual nourishment, delight, and the removal of all impurities.
orig: عاليهم ثياب سندس خضر وإستبرق وحلوا أساور من فضة وسقاهم ربهم شرابا طهورا

translation: Indeed, this is a reward for you, and your effort has been appreciated.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the reward or recompense mentioned is a result of the good deeds and efforts made by the believers. It suggests that their hard work and striving in the path of righteousness has been acknowledged and rewarded by Allah. The interpretation emphasizes that one's sincere efforts are recognized and appreciated in the sight of God.
orig: إن هذا كان لكم جزاء وكان سعيكم مشكورا

translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Qur'an in successive revelations.
interpretation: "This verse indicates that the revelation of the Qur'an was a gradual process, sent down in portions over a period of time, rather than all at once. This allowed the Prophet Muhammad to properly understand, memorize, and convey the divine message to his followers. The gradual revelation also made it easier for the early Muslim community to study, comprehend, and implement the teachings of the Qur'an in their lives."
orig: إنا نحن نزلنا عليك القرآن تنزيلا

translation: So be patient for the decision of your Lord, and do not obey from among them a sinner or a disbeliever.
interpretation: This verse instructs the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to remain steadfast and patient in the face of opposition and rejection from the disbelievers. It advises him not to follow or obey those who are sinful or ungrateful towards Allah's favors and guidance. The interpretation emphasizes the importance of perseverance, faith, and obedience to Allah alone, despite the challenges and hostilities faced by the believers.
orig: فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تطع منهم آثما أو كفورا

translation: And glorify the name of your Lord morning and evening.
interpretation: This verse commands the believers to remember and praise Allah at the beginning and end of the day. It encourages us to start and end our days with the remembrance of Allah, acknowledging His greatness and expressing gratitude for His blessings. This practice helps us maintain a constant connection with our Creator and reminds us to live our lives according to His guidance.
orig: واذكر اسم ربك بكرة وأصيلا

translation: And during a part of the night, prostrate before Him and glorify Him through the long night.
interpretation: This verse encourages believers to spend a portion of the night in worship and glorification of Allah. It suggests performing the night prayer (Tahajjud) and engaging in prolonged remembrance and praise of the Divine. The night is a tranquil time conducive to spiritual reflection and connection with the Almighty. By prostrating and glorifying Allah during the night, one can attain inner peace, forgiveness, and elevation of spiritual ranks.
orig: ومن الليل فاسجد له وسبحه ليلا طويلا

translation: Indeed, these people love the present life and leave behind them a heavy Day.
interpretation: This verse criticizes those who are solely focused on the fleeting pleasures and material gains of this worldly life, while neglecting to prepare for the grave realities of the Hereafter, which will be an extremely difficult and burdensome Day for them.
orig: إن هؤلاء يحبون العاجلة ويذرون وراءهم يوما ثقيلا

translation: We have created them and strengthened their forms. And if We will, We can change their likenesses for a complete change.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has complete power and control over His creation. He created human beings and gave them their physical forms and strengths. If He wills, He can change their forms and appearances entirely into something completely different. This shows Allah's absolute authority and ability to transform His creation however He pleases.
orig: نحن خلقناهم وشددنا أسرهم وإذا شئنا بدلنا أمثالهم تبديلا

translation: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take a path to his Lord.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the Qur'an serves as a reminder and guidance from Allah. It is up to each individual to choose whether to accept the message and follow the path that leads to Allah, or to reject it. The choice is presented, but the responsibility lies with the person. Allah has provided the means for guidance, but it is humans who must make the conscious decision to follow it or not.
orig: إن هذه تذكرة فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه سبيلا

translation: But you cannot will unless Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the absolute sovereignty of Allah's will over the will of His creation. It states that human beings cannot truly desire or will anything unless Allah wills it first. This highlights Allah's complete knowledge and wisdom in determining what is best for His creation. The verse reminds us to submit to Allah's will, as He alone has perfect understanding and insight.
orig: وما تشاءون إلا أن يشاء الله إن الله كان عليما حكيما

translation: He admits whomever He wills into His mercy, and for the wrongdoers, He has prepared a painful punishment.
interpretation: Allah admits whomever He wills into His vast mercy based on His divine wisdom and justice. Those who persist in wrongdoing and disbelief, however, will face a severe and painful punishment as a consequence of their actions.
orig: يدخل من يشاء في رحمته والظالمين أعد لهم عذابا أليما

translation: By the winds sent forth one after another,
interpretation: This verse refers to the winds that Allah sends forth in succession, each following the other, carrying clouds that bring rain and scatter seeds. It indicates Allah's power and wisdom in the workings of the universe.
orig: والمرسلات عرفا

translation: By the winds that scatter dust,
interpretation: This verse refers to powerful winds that raise and scatter dust and debris, symbolizing the might and power of Allah. It could be interpreted as a reminder of Allah's ability to create and control natural phenomena that can appear overwhelming to humans.
orig: فالعاصفات عصفا

translation: By the (winds) that scatter clouds and dust dispersing (them)
interpretation: This verse refers to the winds that Allah has created to carry clouds and scatter them across the sky, bringing rain and sustenance to different parts of the world. It highlights Allah's power and wisdom in the natural phenomena that benefit all creation.
orig: والناشرات نشرا

translation: By the (Winds) that scatter clouds and dust dispersing (them)
interpretation: This verse refers to the winds that disperse clouds and dust in the atmosphere, which is a sign of Allah's power and wisdom in regulating the natural phenomena of the universe.
orig: فالفارقات فرقا

translation: So the Scatterers scattering,
interpretation: This verse refers to the winds that scatter and spread things like seeds, dust, and clouds. It highlights the power and wisdom of Allah in creating the winds that play a crucial role in various natural processes and the cycle of life on Earth.
orig: فالملقيات ذكرا

translation: An excuse or a vow
interpretation: This verse could be interpreted as referring to the choices people make in life. An "excuse" represents a lack of commitment or responsibility, while a "vow" signifies a solemn promise or dedication to a cause. The verse may be highlighting the contrast between these two paths and encouraging people to choose the path of dedication and purpose over that of excuses and avoidance of responsibility.
orig: عذرا أو نذرا

translation: Indeed, what you are promised is sure to occur.
interpretation: This verse affirms the certainty of the Day of Resurrection and the fulfillment of Allah's promises and warnings. It reassures the believers that the recompense they have been promised, whether reward or punishment, will undoubtedly come to pass. This emphasizes the importance of faith, righteous deeds, and preparing for the inevitable Day.
orig: إنما توعدون لواقع

translation: When the stars are extinguished,
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the end of the world and the destruction of the universe. The extinguishing of the stars symbolizes the collapse of the celestial bodies and the obliteration of the cosmic order as we know it. It signifies the complete annihilation of the physical world and the advent of a new, transcendent reality.
orig: فإذا النجوم طمست

translation: And when the sky is rent asunder,
interpretation: This verse refers to the great cosmic events that will occur on the Day of Resurrection, when the sky will split apart, signifying the end of this world as we know it and the beginning of a new reality in the Hereafter. It symbolizes the tremendous upheaval and transformation that will take place, shattering the existing order and ushering in a new phase of existence determined by God's ultimate judgment and justice.
orig: وإذا السماء فرجت

translation: And when the mountains are blown away,
interpretation: This verse refers to the cataclysmic events that will occur on the Day of Resurrection. The mighty mountains, which symbolize strength and permanence, will be utterly destroyed and "blown away" like scattered dust. This imagery conveys the overwhelming power of Allah and the impermanence of the physical world as we know it. It serves as a reminder of the transient nature of our existence and the insignificance of worldly attachments in the face of the ultimate reality of the Hereafter.
orig: وإذا الجبال نسفت

translation: And when the messengers are made to appear at an appointed time
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when all the messengers of God will be summoned to testify against those who rejected their message. It emphasizes the accountability of people for accepting or rejecting the guidance brought by the messengers, and the gravity of that judgment.
orig: وإذا الرسل أقتت

translation: For what Day is the delay?
interpretation: This verse questions the purpose and reason behind delaying or postponing a significant event or Day, which is understood to be referring to the Day of Judgment or Resurrection. It prompts reflection on the gravity and inevitability of that Day, and the futility of attempting to delay or avoid it.
orig: لأي يوم أجلت

translation: For the Day of Judgement
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection, when all people will be judged for their deeds and beliefs. It implies that there is an appointed time when the final judgment will take place, and everyone will be held accountable before God. This day is called "the Day of Judgement" or "the Day of Separation", as it will separate the believers from the disbelievers, and the righteous from the wicked.
orig: ليوم الفصل

translation: And what will make you understand what the Day of Separation is?
interpretation: This verse questions the listener's understanding of the immense gravity and significance of the Day of Judgment, when all matters will be decided and settled. It implies that the human mind cannot fully comprehend the magnitude of that Day, which will separate truth from falsehood, and the righteous from the wicked.
orig: وما أدراك ما يوم الفصل

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the terrible punishment that will befall those who denied the truth of Allah's revelations and the Day of Judgment. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief and rejection of faith, highlighting the grave consequences that await the deniers on the Day of Reckoning. The word "woe" expresses intense anguish and distress, indicating the severity of their plight on that fateful Day.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, reminding us of His power and ability to destroy nations that persisted in disbelief and wrongdoing. It serves as a warning and a lesson for those who reject the truth, that they may face a similar fate as those who came before them if they do not repent and mend their ways.
orig: ألم نهلك الأولين

translation: Then We will pursue the others.
interpretation: This verse suggests that after dealing with the initial group of disbelievers, Allah will turn His attention to the remaining ones who have not yet embraced faith. It implies that Allah's justice and reckoning will eventually reach all those who reject His guidance, one group after another. The interpretation emphasizes Allah's unwavering commitment to holding everyone accountable for their choices and actions.
orig: ثم نتبعهم الآخرين

translation: Thus do We deal with the criminals.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah deals strictly and justly with those who commit crimes or sins, meting out punishment or consequences befitting their misdeeds. It serves as a warning against transgression and a reminder of Allah's fairness in holding people accountable for their actions.
orig: كذلك نفعل بالمجرمين

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment that awaits those who denied the truth, the signs of Allah, and the message of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) on the Day of Judgment. The word "woe" expresses a state of utter distress and regret that the deniers will experience when they face the consequences of their disbelief and rejection of faith. It serves as a stern warning to take heed and embrace the truth before it is too late.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Did We not create you from a despicable fluid?
interpretation: This verse is a rhetorical question posed by Allah, reminding human beings of their humble origins from a despised fluid (semen). It serves as a reminder of human beings' initial lowly state and Allah's power in creating them from such an insignificant source. The verse encourages humility and gratitude towards the Creator who fashioned human beings from this humble beginning.
orig: ألم نخلقكم من ماء مهين

translation: So We placed him in a safe lodging.
interpretation: The verse refers to the safe place where Allah placed the infant Jesus and his mother Mary, protecting them from harm and providing them with sustenance and comfort. This interpretation highlights Allah's mercy and care for His chosen servants who faced difficulties and persecution.
orig: فجعلناه في قرار مكين

translation: To a known measure
interpretation: This verse indicates that everything in the universe, including the provisions and sustenance granted to all creatures, is determined and measured precisely by Allah according to a known and specific measure. It highlights Allah's absolute knowledge, wisdom, and control over all affairs. The "known measure" implies that nothing is left to chance, but rather everything is carefully calculated and apportioned by the Divine Will.
orig: إلى قدر معلوم

translation: So We determined, and excellent determiners are We.
interpretation: This verse affirms Allah's perfect ability to determine and ordain all things according to His infinite wisdom and power. It emphasizes that Allah is the Best of those who determine and decree matters, implying that His determination is flawless, wise, and just.
orig: فقدرنا فنعم القادرون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to those who deny the truth of Allah's revelations, the Day of Resurrection, and the accountability in the Hereafter. The word "woe" expresses a state of intense regret, sorrow, and punishment that will befall the deniers on the Day of Judgment for their rejection of faith and their disbelief in Allah's signs and messengers. It serves as a powerful reminder of the grave consequences of denying the truth and highlights the importance of embracing faith and living righteously in this world.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah has created the earth as a suitable place for living beings to dwell, rest, and find stability and sustenance. It highlights Allah's wisdom and mercy in providing a habitable environment for His creation.
orig: ألم نجعل الأرض كفاتا

translation: Alive and dead
interpretation: This verse implies that Allah has power over all beings, the living and the dead. It signifies that life and death are under His control, and He is the ultimate authority over the existence and cessation of all creation.
orig: أحياء وأمواتا

translation: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains and provided you with fresh water to drink.
interpretation: Allah mentions His blessings upon humanity by creating lofty mountains that stabilize the earth and provide fresh water springs. This verse highlights Allah's power, wisdom, and care for His creation by establishing a habitable environment with essential resources like mountains and water.
orig: وجعلنا فيها رواسي شامخات وأسقيناكم ماء فراتا

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the terrible punishment and doom that awaits those who reject the truth and deny the revelations of God on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief, highlighting the grave consequences that the deniers will face for their rejection of faith and divine guidance.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Depart to that which you used to deny.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning for the disbelievers, commanding them to proceed towards the punishment that they used to deny and reject in this world. It implies that their denial and mockery of the truth will lead them to the very reality they denied, which is the punishment and torment of the Hereafter.
orig: انطلقوا إلى ما كنتم به تكذبون

translation: Depart to the shade of three branches.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as an instruction to seek refuge and protection under the shade of three branches or sources. It could be a metaphorical reference to seeking guidance from the Quran, the Prophet's teachings, and righteous companions or scholars. The "three branches" symbolize the multiple sources of knowledge and wisdom that one should rely upon for spiritual nourishment and growth.
orig: انطلقوا إلى ظل ذي ثلاث شعب

translation: No shade, nor does it protect from the flame
interpretation: This verse describes the severe punishment of Hell, where there is no shade or relief from the intense heat and flames. It highlights the intensity of the torment that the disbelievers will face, with no means of protection or escape.
orig: لا ظليل ولا يغني من اللهب

translation: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress
interpretation: This verse is describing the intense and powerful nature of the Hellfire. The sparks it emits are likened to massive fortresses, illustrating the immense size and intensity of these sparks. This metaphor conveys the terrifying and overwhelming nature of the Hellfire, which serves as a warning and deterrent against disbelief and disobedience.
orig: إنها ترمي بشرر كالقصر

translation: As if they were yellow camels
interpretation: This verse uses a metaphor to describe the appearance of something, likening it to yellow camels. The interpretation could be that the object being described has a striking or unusual appearance, like the vivid color of yellow camels which would stand out in the desert environment.
orig: كأنه جمالت صفر

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers!
interpretation: This verse warns of a terrible fate that awaits the disbelievers and those who reject the truth on the Day of Judgment. The word "wail" or "woe" expresses intense sorrow, regret, and distress, indicating the severe punishment and torment they will face for denying the signs of Allah and the revelations brought by His messengers. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief and a reminder of the grave consequences of rejecting faith.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: This is a Day when they shall not speak
interpretation: On the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers and wrongdoers will be unable to offer any excuses or justifications for their actions. They will stand speechless before Allah, unable to defend themselves or argue against the evidence presented against them.
orig: هذا يوم لا ينطقون

translation: And they will not be permitted to make an excuse.
interpretation: This verse indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers and wrongdoers will not be given the opportunity to offer excuses or justifications for their actions. Their pleas and apologies will not be accepted, and they will be held accountable for their misdeeds without any chance of making amends or seeking forgiveness.
orig: ولا يؤذن لهم فيعتذرون

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the terrible consequences that will befall those who reject the truth and deny Allah's revelations and signs on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief and a reminder of the gravity of denying Allah's message and messengers.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: This is the Day of Judgement. We have gathered you and those who came before.
interpretation: Allah is speaking about the Day of Resurrection when all of humanity, from the first to the last, will be gathered together to account for their deeds. This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgement and Allah's power to resurrect and gather all people who have ever lived on that momentous Day. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate accountability before the Creator and the need to prepare for it through faith and righteous conduct in this life.
orig: هذا يوم الفصل جمعناكم والأولين

translation: So if you have a plan, then plan (your plan).
interpretation: This verse is a challenge from Allah to those who disbelieve and plot against the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) and the believers. It is telling them that if they have a plan to harm the believers, they should go ahead and execute their plan, but Allah will also plan against them and protect the believers. The verse implies that the disbelievers' plots will ultimately fail because Allah's plan and power are far greater than theirs.
orig: فإن كان لكم كيد فكيدون

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment and torment that awaits those who rejected the truth and denied the revelations of God on the Day of Judgment. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief and a reminder of the grave consequences of denying God's signs and revelations.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
interpretation: This verse promises that the pious and God-fearing people will be rewarded in the Hereafter with a life of bliss, where they will enjoy pleasant shades that protect them from heat and fatigue, as well as refreshing springs of water that quench their thirst and provide tranquility.
orig: إن المتقين في ظلال وعيون

translation: And fruit from what they desire.
interpretation: This verse indicates that in Paradise, the believers will have access to all kinds of fruits that they desire or crave, fulfilling their desires and providing them with ultimate pleasure and satisfaction. It highlights the abundance and variety of delights awaiting the righteous in the Hereafter.
orig: وفواكه مما يشتهون

translation: Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do
interpretation: This verse is an affirmation of the reward awaiting the righteous believers in Paradise. They will be able to enjoy the blessings and delights of Paradise as a recompense for their good deeds and obedience to Allah in their worldly life. The phrase "eat and drink in satisfaction" suggests a state of contentment, tranquility, and pleasure that the inhabitants of Paradise will experience without any fear, grief, or fatigue. It conveys the idea that their sustenance in Paradise will be pure, wholesome, and pleasurable, befitting their status as the honored residents of the eternal abode.
orig: كلوا واشربوا هنيئا بما كنتم تعملون

translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah rewards those who do righteous deeds and good actions with His grace and mercy. It serves as an encouragement for believers to strive to do good and be obedient to Allah, as their efforts will not go unrewarded. The verse highlights Allah's justice and promise to recompense the pious for their faith and good conduct.
orig: إنا كذلك نجزي المحسنين

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse is a stern warning to those who reject the truth and deny the revelations of Allah. It indicates that on the Day of Judgment, the disbelievers and those who mocked the divine signs will face a terrible punishment and suffer immense regret for their arrogant denial. The word "wail" or "woe" signifies the intense anguish and distress that awaits them on that fateful Day.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Eat and enjoy yourselves a little, indeed you are criminals.
interpretation: This verse is a sarcastic rebuke to the disbelievers and wrongdoers, mocking their indulgence in worldly pleasures while neglecting the Hereafter. It implies that their enjoyment in this life is fleeting and temporary, and they will ultimately be held accountable for their sins and misdeeds. The phrase "a little" highlights the transient nature of worldly pleasures compared to the everlasting reward or punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: كلوا وتمتعوا قليلا إنكم مجرمون

translation: Woe on that Day to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the severe punishment and torment that awaits those who rejected faith and denied the truth of Allah's revelations and messengers on the Day of Resurrection. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief and a reminder of the grave consequences one will face for stubbornly denying the truth after it has become evident to them.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: And when it is said to them, 'Bow down,' they do not bow down.
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogance and stubbornness of the disbelievers who refuse to submit to God and perform the act of bowing down in prayer, despite being commanded to do so. It highlights their rejection of faith and unwillingness to humble themselves before their Creator.
orig: وإذا قيل لهم اركعوا لا يركعون

translation: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
interpretation: This verse warns of the terrible consequences that will befall those who denied the truth, the revelations of God, and the Day of Judgment. It serves as a stern warning against disbelief, arrogance, and rejection of faith. The word "woe" expresses grief, distress, and an impending punishment for those who persisted in denying the signs of God and the inevitability of the Final Day.
orig: ويل يومئذ للمكذبين

translation: Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?
interpretation: This verse questions the disbelievers' rejection of the Qur'an, which is a clear statement and evidence from Allah. It implies that since they do not believe in the Qur'an, which is the word of Allah, then what other statement or revelation would they believe in? The verse highlights their stubborn disbelief and unwillingness to accept the truth, despite the clear proofs presented to them.
orig: فبأي حديث بعده يؤمنون

translation: They ask one another,
interpretation: This verse suggests that people are questioning or inquiring about something, perhaps seeking clarification or understanding regarding a particular matter or event.
orig: عم يتساءلون

translation: Concerning the great event.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Day of Resurrection, which is the greatest event that will occur in the Hereafter. It is described as "the great event" because of its tremendous significance and the profound impact it will have on all of creation. The interpretation emphasizes the magnitude and gravity of the Day of Resurrection, and serves as a reminder to prepare for it and strive to attain Allah's pleasure.
orig: عن النبإ العظيم

translation: That in which they differ
interpretation: This verse refers to the differences and disagreements among people regarding various matters, particularly religious beliefs and practices. It highlights the diversity of opinions and perspectives that exist within human societies. The interpretation emphasizes the need for mutual understanding, respect, and open-mindedness towards differing viewpoints, while seeking guidance from divine sources to resolve conflicts and reach a common ground.
orig: الذي هم فيه مختلفون

translation: Nay, they will come to know.
interpretation: This verse implies a warning or a threat to those who deny the truth or reject the message of Islam. It suggests that they will eventually come to realize the consequences of their disbelief and their rejection of the divine guidance. The verse conveys a sense of certainty that the truth will become evident to them, whether in this life or in the Hereafter. It serves as a reminder that their ignorance or arrogance will not last forever, and they will ultimately face the reality they have been denying.
orig: كلا سيعلمون

translation: Then, all of them will surely know.
interpretation: This verse implies that the truth will eventually become evident to everyone, regardless of their current state of ignorance or denial. It serves as a warning that the consequences of one's actions and beliefs will be made clear in due time, emphasizing the importance of seeking knowledge and guidance from the divine revelations.
orig: ثم كلا سيعلمون

translation: Have We not made the earth a resting place?
interpretation: This verse highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in making the earth a suitable dwelling place for humans and all living beings. It serves as a comfortable abode, providing sustenance and resources necessary for life. The earth's stability, fertile land, and balanced ecosystem are signs of Allah's meticulous design for the benefit of His creation.
orig: ألم نجعل الأرض مهادا

translation: And the mountains as pegs?
interpretation: This verse metaphorically compares mountains to pegs or stakes that are firmly fixed into the ground, suggesting that they serve as anchors or stabilizers for the earth. The interpretation is that mountains play a crucial role in maintaining the stability and balance of the earth, preventing it from shaking excessively. They act as weights or supports, grounding the earth and providing it with firmness and solidity.
orig: والجبال أوتادا

translation: And We have created you in pairs
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has created human beings in pairs, male and female, as spouses and partners for each other. It highlights the complementary nature of the two genders, designed to live together in harmony and fulfill various roles and responsibilities towards each other and society.
orig: وخلقناكم أزواجا

translation: And We made your sleep a period of rest.
interpretation: This verse indicates that sleep is a blessing from Allah, providing rest and rejuvenation for the body and mind. It suggests that sleep is a form of "death" in which the soul is temporarily separated from the body, allowing it to be refreshed before returning to the physical realm. The verse highlights the wisdom and mercy of Allah in creating this natural cycle of sleep and wakefulness for human beings.
orig: وجعلنا نومكم سباتا

translation: And We have made the night as a covering
interpretation: Allah has made the night like a garment that covers and protects us. It provides a period of rest and tranquility after the day's activities. The darkness of night conceals and veils the world, allowing for privacy and a sense of security.
orig: وجعلنا الليل لباسا

translation: And We have made the day for livelihood.
interpretation: Allah has made the day a time for people to work, earn a living, and engage in various activities and pursuits that sustain their lives. The daytime hours provide the opportunity for humans to be active, productive, and fulfill their worldly needs and responsibilities.
orig: وجعلنا النهار معاشا

translation: And We constructed above you seven strong [heavens].
interpretation: This verse refers to the creation of the seven heavens by Allah above the earth. The word "shidaad" (translated as "strong") indicates that the heavens are firm, sturdy, and powerful structures created by the Almighty. This verse highlights Allah's power and majesty in creating the vast universe and heavenly bodies.
orig: وبنينا فوقكم سبعا شدادا

translation: And We made a blazing lamp.
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the sun, which is described as a "blazing lamp" that illuminates the world and provides heat and light for all living beings. It is a sign of Allah's immense power and wisdom in creating this celestial body that sustains life on Earth.
orig: وجعلنا سراجا وهاجا

translation: And We sent down from the rain-clouds water pouring forth abundantly
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessing of rain, which Allah sends down from the clouds. The word "mu'siraat" (translated as "rain-clouds") suggests that the clouds are charged and filled with water. The word "thajjaajan" indicates that the water pours down abundantly and forcefully, providing nourishment for all living beings on Earth. This verse highlights Allah's power and mercy in sustaining life through the water cycle.
orig: وأنزلنا من المعصرات ماء ثجاجا

translation: That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation
interpretation: This verse implies that God sends down rain from the sky to produce grains, crops, and vegetation, which are essential for sustaining life on Earth. It highlights God's wisdom and mercy in providing nourishment for His creation through the cycle of rain and plant growth.
orig: لنخرج به حبا ونباتا

translation: And gardens of dense vines
interpretation: This verse refers to the lush, intertwined gardens that will be granted to the righteous in Paradise. The word "alfafan" denotes the dense clustering of vines and trees, creating a beautiful and shaded environment. It symbolizes the eternal bliss, comfort, and serenity that awaits the believers in the Hereafter as a reward for their faith and good deeds.
orig: وجنات ألفافا

translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the certainty of the Day of Judgement, which is a predetermined and fixed event that will occur at its appointed time. It serves as a reminder of the accountability that all human beings will face for their actions and beliefs on that momentous day.
orig: إن يوم الفصل كان ميقاتا

translation: The Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and you shall come forth in crowds.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection when the Trumpet will be blown, signaling the end of this world and the beginning of the Hereafter. All people will then come forth from their graves in successive groups or "crowds" to face judgment for their deeds in this life. The blowing of the Trumpet symbolizes the finality and certainty of the Hour, which no one can deny or escape.
orig: يوم ينفخ في الصور فتأتون أفواجا

translation: And the heaven was opened, so it was [a series of] gateways.
interpretation: This verse describes the opening of the gates of heaven on the Day of Judgment. It implies that the heaven will be accessible to the believers through these gateways, allowing them to enter Paradise. The imagery conveys the grandeur and vastness of heaven, with multiple gateways symbolizing the abundant rewards and bounties awaiting the righteous.
orig: وفتحت السماء فكانت أبوابا

translation: And the mountains will be set in motion, becoming a mirage.
interpretation: This verse describes the cataclysmic events that will occur on the Day of Judgment. The seemingly immovable and solid mountains will be set in motion and become like a mirage, an illusion that appears to be real but vanishes upon closer inspection. This portrayal emphasizes the temporary nature of this world and the overwhelming power of God, before whom even the mightiest structures will be rendered insignificant and transient.
orig: وسيرت الجبال فكانت سرابا

translation: Indeed, Hellfire has been lying in wait.
interpretation: This verse warns that Hell is ever ready to receive those who deserve its punishment due to their disbelief and evil deeds. It is lying in wait, prepared to engulf the unrepentant sinners who reject God's guidance and persist in wrongdoing. The imagery conveys the certainty and inevitability of the consequences for those who turn away from the straight path.
orig: إن جهنم كانت مرصادا

translation: For the transgressors there will be a return
interpretation: This verse implies that those who transgress the limits set by Allah and disobey His commands will ultimately face the consequences of their actions. It serves as a warning that their transgressions will not go unpunished, and they will be held accountable for their misdeeds. The "return" mentioned in the verse could refer to their ultimate destination in the Hereafter, where they will face the recompense for their wrongdoings.
orig: للطاغين مآبا

translation: Remaining therein for ages
interpretation: This verse suggests that those referred to will remain in the mentioned state or place for an extremely long period of time, described as "ages" or epochs. It conveys a sense of permanence or an indefinite duration.
orig: لابثين فيها أحقابا

translation: They will not taste therein coolness or drink
interpretation: This verse refers to the state of those in Hell, indicating that they will not experience any coolness or refreshing drink to alleviate their suffering and torment in the Hellfire. It emphasizes the severity of the punishment and the absence of any relief or respite for the disbelievers and wrongdoers in the Hereafter.
orig: لا يذوقون فيها بردا ولا شرابا

translation: Except the scorching fire and black smoke
interpretation: This verse is referring to the torment and punishment of Hell, which is described as a "scorching fire" that burns intensely, and "black smoke" that chokes and suffocates. It serves as a warning to those who reject faith and disobey Allah's commands, that they will face this severe punishment in the Hereafter if they do not repent and mend their ways.
orig: إلا حميما وغساقا

translation: A reward and a meeting
interpretation: This verse suggests that there will be a reward or recompense for one's deeds, and an encounter or meeting with God on the Day of Judgment.
orig: جزاء وفاقا

translation: Indeed, they were not expecting an account
interpretation: This verse suggests that the disbelievers did not believe in the accountability of their actions on the Day of Judgment. They lived their lives without any fear of being held responsible for their deeds and denied the concept of the Hereafter and reckoning.
orig: إنهم كانوا لا يرجون حسابا

translation: And they denied Our signs, denying.
interpretation: This verse implies that the disbelievers persistently rejected and denied the clear signs and revelations from Allah, stubbornly disbelieving in them despite the evident truth they conveyed.
orig: وكذبوا بآياتنا كذابا

translation: And everything We have enumerated in a book.
interpretation: This verse indicates that Allah has recorded and preserved all things in a clear record or book. It suggests that Allah's knowledge encompasses everything in the universe, and nothing is hidden from Him or left to chance. The "book" mentioned here symbolizes Allah's comprehensive knowledge and meticulous record-keeping of all creation and events.
orig: وكل شيء أحصيناه كتابا

translation: So taste the punishment, for We shall never increase you except in torment.
interpretation: "This verse serves as a warning to those who persist in disbelief and disobedience towards Allah. It indicates that they will face severe punishment and that the torment they experience will only intensify if they continue on their path of rejection. The phrase 'taste the punishment' is a metaphorical expression conveying the reality and severity of the impending punishment they will face. The verse emphasizes that their defiance will not be met with leniency or mercy, but rather an increase in the intensity of their suffering."
orig: فذوقوا فلن نزيدكم إلا عذابا

translation: Indeed, for the righteous there is attainment
interpretation: This verse indicates that those who are righteous and God-fearing will attain salvation, success, and a great reward in the Hereafter. It promises a favorable outcome and ultimate triumph for those who lead a pious life in accordance with God's commandments.
orig: إن للمتقين مفازا

translation: Gardens and grapevines
interpretation: This verse refers to the blessings of Paradise, which include lush gardens with various fruits and grapevines. It symbolizes the abundant delights and pleasures that await the righteous believers in the Hereafter.
orig: حدائق وأعنابا

translation: And young full-breasted maidens of equal age
interpretation: This verse is describing the maidens or companions that the believers will be granted in Paradise. The word "kawa'ib" refers to young women with full and firm breasts, indicating their youth and beauty. The phrase "atraban" means of equal age, suggesting that these maidens will be perfectly matched in age and beauty for the believers in Paradise. This description highlights the physical and sensual pleasures that await the righteous in the afterlife.
orig: وكواعب أترابا

translation: And a cup overflowing.
interpretation: This verse refers to the abundant blessings and delights that the righteous will enjoy in Paradise. The "overflowing cup" symbolizes the everlasting joy, contentment, and spiritual fulfillment they will experience without any limitations or scarcity.
orig: وكأسا دهاقا

translation: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin
interpretation: In Paradise, the dwellers will not hear any vain or useless speech, nor any falsehood or lies. This indicates the pure and perfect environment of Paradise, free from any impurity or evil.
orig: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا ولا كذابا

translation: The reward is from your Lord, a generous gift.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the reward or recompense that believers will receive on the Day of Judgment is from Allah alone, and it is a generous gift that is bestowed upon them without any account or measure. It highlights Allah's infinite grace and generosity towards His servants who believed and did righteous deeds.
orig: جزاء من ربك عطاء حسابا

translation: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful, none can have private audience with Him.
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the majesty, power, and transcendence of Allah. It affirms that Allah is the sole Lord and Sustainer of the heavens, the earth, and all that exists between them. He is the Most Merciful, but His mercy does not negate His absolute sovereignty and authority. No one can approach Him or speak to Him except with His permission and according to His will. This underscores the vast distance between the Creator and the created beings, and the need for utmost humility, reverence, and submission towards Allah.
orig: رب السماوات والأرض وما بينهما الرحمن لا يملكون منه خطابا

translation: The Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows, they shall not speak except him whom the Most Beneficent (Allah) allows, and he will speak what is right.
interpretation: This verse describes the scene on the Day of Resurrection when the Angel of Revelation (Jibreel) and all other angels will stand in rows, silently awaiting Allah's command. No one will dare speak on that Day except those permitted by Allah, and they will only speak the truth.
orig: يوم يقوم الروح والملائكة صفا لا يتكلمون إلا من أذن له الرحمن وقال صوابا

translation: That is a Day of Truth. So whoever wills, let him take a path to his Lord.
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment, which is the ultimate reality and truth. On that Day, everyone will be held accountable for their deeds and beliefs. The verse gives people the choice to take the path that leads to their Lord, which means embracing faith, doing good deeds, and seeking Allah's pleasure. It emphasizes the freedom of choice that Allah has given to humans, and the consequences of their choices on the Day of Judgment.
orig: ذلك اليوم الحق فمن شاء اتخذ إلى ربه مآبا

translation: Indeed, We have warned you of a near punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth and the disbeliever will say, 'Oh, I wish I were dust!'
interpretation: This verse serves as a warning to mankind about the approaching Day of Judgment, where every person will witness the consequences of their deeds. The disbelievers, upon realizing the gravity of their rejection of faith, will wish they were mere dust, regretting their choices and actions in this world. This interpretation highlights the inevitability of accountability and the importance of embracing faith and righteous conduct to avoid a sorrowful outcome.
orig: إنا أنذرناكم عذابا قريبا يوم ينظر المرء ما قدمت يداه ويقول الكافر يا ليتني كنت ترابا

translation: By those who tear out with violence,
interpretation: This verse refers to the angels who tear out the souls of the disbelievers with great force and violence at the time of death. It symbolizes the intensity and power with which the souls of the wicked will be extracted from their bodies on the Day of Resurrection.
orig: والنازعات غرقا

translation: And those who are ever active.
interpretation: This verse refers to those who strive and work hard in the cause of Allah and in obedience to Him. It praises the believers who are active, diligent, and persistent in their worship, good deeds, and efforts to spread the message of Islam. Their consistent and tireless efforts are commended and will be rewarded by Allah.
orig: والناشطات نشطا

translation: By those swimming with a free motion,
interpretation: This verse refers to the celestial bodies, such as stars and planets, that swim or move freely in their orbits as decreed by Allah. It alludes to the perfect order and harmony in the universe, which testifies to the greatness and might of the Creator.
orig: والسابحات سبحا

translation: So the foremost ones will be foremost,
interpretation: This verse suggests that those who strive hard in this life and excel in good deeds will attain a higher status and be rewarded accordingly in the Hereafter. The "foremost ones" refers to those who are ahead of others in faith, righteousness, and piety. Their efforts and sacrifices in the way of Allah will not go unrewarded, and they will be distinguished and honored for their virtuous actions.
orig: فالسابقات سبقا

translation: By the (Winds) that scatter particles of dust and debris,
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as referring to the winds that blow and scatter dust and particles in the air. It is seen as an oath sworn by Allah, calling attention to one of the signs and wonders of His creation - the winds that play a vital role in the environment and life on Earth.
orig: فالمدبرات أمرا

translation: The Day the Quaking One will quake,
interpretation: This verse refers to the terrifying events of the Day of Resurrection, when a great earthquake or quaking will take place, causing everything to tremble in fear and awe. It symbolizes the immense power of Allah and the upheaval that will occur when the world as we know it comes to an end.
orig: يوم ترجف الراجفة

translation: Followed by the subsequent [one].
interpretation: This verse refers to the succession of the Day of Resurrection after the current worldly life. It implies that the present world will be followed by the inevitable coming of the Hereafter, which will bring judgment and recompense for one's deeds.
orig: تتبعها الرادفة

translation: Some hearts on that Day will be trembling,
interpretation: This verse suggests that on the Day of Judgment, some people will be filled with fear and anxiety, their hearts trembling with dread and apprehension. It implies that the events and realities that will unfold on that Day will be so overwhelming and terrifying that even the bravest of souls will be shaken to the core.
orig: قلوب يومئذ واجفة

translation: Their eyes will be cast down
interpretation: This verse refers to the humility and modesty that believers will exhibit on the Day of Judgment. Their eyes will be lowered in awe and reverence before Allah, indicating a state of submission and self-restraint.
orig: أبصارها خاشعة

translation: They say, 'Shall we indeed be returned to the former state of life?'
interpretation: This verse expresses the disbelief of those who deny the possibility of resurrection and life after death. They question the idea of being brought back to life after their physical bodies have decayed and returned to the earth. It highlights the arrogance and limited understanding of those who reject the power of Allah to resurrect them for judgment and accountability.
orig: يقولون أإنا لمردودون في الحافرة

translation: When we are decayed bones?
interpretation: This verse questions the possibility of resurrection after death, when the human body has decayed into mere bones. It implies skepticism or doubt about the concept of being brought back to life after turning into decayed bones. The interpretation suggests that the verse is meant to challenge the disbelievers' doubts about resurrection by affirming Allah's power to resurrect humans, even after their bodies have decomposed into bones.
orig: أإذا كنا عظاما نخرة

translation: They say, 'That is a losing return.'
interpretation: This verse is interpreted as a response from the disbelievers who deny the concept of resurrection and accountability in the Hereafter. They mockingly claim that the idea of being resurrected and brought back to life after death is a losing proposition or a futile endeavor.
orig: قالوا تلك إذا كرة خاسرة

translation: It is not but one shout,
interpretation: The verse suggests that the end of the world and the resurrection will happen suddenly and unexpectedly, with just one mighty blast or cry from the angel Israfil. It emphasizes the abruptness and finality of that event, leaving no room for gradual change or further chances.
orig: فإنما هي زجرة واحدة

translation: Then when they are at the plain of resurrection,
interpretation: This verse is referring to the Day of Resurrection when all people will be gathered on a vast plain. The word "al-Sahirah" means "the plain" or "the open area," indicating the vastness of the gathering place where all of humanity will stand before God for judgment. The verse emphasizes the certainty and inevitability of this event, using the Arabic phrase "fa-iza hum" which means "then when they are" to convey the idea that this will undoubtedly occur.
orig: فإذا هم بالساهرة

translation: Has the story of Moses reached you?
interpretation: This verse is inquiring whether the listener has been informed about the story and experiences of the Prophet Moses, which are narrated in detail in the Qur'an. It serves as an introduction to recount the significant events and miracles associated with Moses' life, emphasizing the importance of reflecting upon the lessons and guidance contained within his story.
orig: هل أتاك حديث موسى

translation: When his Lord called him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,
interpretation: This verse refers to the divine call that Prophet Moses received from Allah in the sacred valley of Tuwa. It signifies the moment when Allah chose Moses for the great mission of prophethood and conveyed His message to him. The "sacred valley" indicates the sanctity and significance of the place where this profound event occurred.
orig: إذ ناداه ربه بالواد المقدس طوى

translation: Go to Pharaoh, indeed he has transgressed.
interpretation: This verse is an instruction from Allah to Prophet Moses to confront the tyrannical ruler Pharaoh, who had oppressed the Israelites and claimed to be a god. It implies that Pharaoh had exceeded all bounds in his arrogance, cruelty and disbelief, and that Moses should courageously deliver Allah's message to him.
orig: اذهب إلى فرعون إنه طغى

translation: Say, 'Is it other than Allah I should desire as a lord, while He is the Lord of all things?'
interpretation: This verse emphasizes the oneness of Allah and the futility of worshipping anyone or anything else besides Him. It asks the rhetorical question, "Is it other than Allah I should desire as a lord?" The implied answer is a resounding no, for Allah alone is the Lord and Sustainer of all creation. To worship or submit to any other being or entity would be an act of ingratitude and misguidance, as nothing else has the power, knowledge, or worthiness to be a true object of worship. This verse establishes the foundational principle of Islamic monotheism (Tawheed) and calls upon humanity to recognize and submit to the one true God, Allah.
orig: فقل هل لك إلى أن تزكى

translation: And I guide you to your Lord, so you would fear [Him]?
interpretation: This verse suggests that the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) was to guide people towards the worship and fear of Allah, the one true God. By conveying the message of Islam, the Prophet aimed to instill a sense of reverence and consciousness of Allah in people's hearts, encouraging them to submit to the divine will and avoid disobedience.
orig: وأهديك إلى ربك فتخشى

translation: Then I showed him the Greatest Sign.
interpretation: This verse refers to the miraculous event when Allah showed Prophet Moses (peace be upon him) a great sign or miracle. According to Islamic tradition, this "Greatest Sign" was when Moses witnessed the parting of the sea, allowing him and his followers to cross safely while Pharaoh and his army drowned when attempting to pursue them. The "Greatest Sign" demonstrated Allah's immense power and was a decisive moment in the struggle between Moses and Pharaoh.
orig: فأراه الآية الكبرى

translation: But he denied and disobeyed.
interpretation: This verse is referring to the disbelief and disobedience of a particular person or group towards the divine message and commandments. It highlights the rejection of truth and the conscious act of defiance against religious teachings or moral principles. The interpretation emphasizes the gravity of denying faith and willfully choosing the path of disobedience, which can lead to spiritual and moral consequences.
orig: فكذب وعصى

translation: Then he turned away, striving hard (against Allah's obedience)
interpretation: This verse refers to the disbelievers who turn away from the truth and strive hard in disobedience and opposition to Allah's commands after being presented with clear signs and evidence. It condemns their arrogance and stubborn rejection of faith.
orig: ثم أدبر يسعى

translation: So he gathered and called out
interpretation: This verse could be interpreted as referring to the Day of Judgment, when all of humanity will be gathered together and called to account for their deeds. The "he" in this verse refers to God Almighty, who will summon all people to stand before Him and face judgment. It serves as a reminder of the ultimate reckoning that awaits every soul and the importance of living a righteous life in preparation for that day.
orig: فحشر فنادى

translation: He said: 'I am your Lord, Most High'
interpretation: This verse refers to the arrogant claim made by Pharaoh when he declared himself to be the supreme lord and god over the Children of Israel. It highlights Pharaoh's extreme arrogance and rejection of God's message brought by Prophet Moses. The interpretation emphasizes Pharaoh's transgression by claiming divinity for himself and denying the Oneness of God.
orig: فقال أنا ربكم الأعلى

translation: Then Allah seized him for the punishment of the Hereafter and the former life.
interpretation: This verse suggests that Allah punished the person referred to in both this life and the Hereafter for their misdeeds or disbelief. The "punishment of the Hereafter" refers to the eternal punishment in the afterlife, while the "punishment of the former life" implies a worldly punishment or consequence for their actions in this life. The verse conveys the idea that Allah's justice encompasses both realms, and those who defy His commands will face consequences in both worlds.
orig: فأخذه الله نكال الآخرة والأولى

translation: Indeed, in that is a lesson for whoever would fear Allah.
interpretation: This verse highlights the profound wisdom and admonition that lies within the signs and events mentioned in the preceding verses. It serves as a reminder and lesson for those who possess a reverent consciousness of God and strive to live according to His guidance. The phrase "whoever would fear Allah" refers to individuals who have a profound sense of awe and respect for the Divine, leading them to be mindful of their actions and to seek knowledge and understanding from the signs around them.
orig: إن في ذلك لعبرة لمن يخشى

translation: Are you more difficult to create or the heaven? He constructed it.
interpretation: This verse questions whether human beings are a more difficult creation than the heavens. It implies that Allah's power to create the vast universe and heavens is far greater than creating human beings. The verse highlights Allah's immense might and ability as the Creator of all things, including the remarkable creation of human beings and the entire cosmos.
orig: أأنتم أشد خلقا أم السماء بناها

translation: He raised its canopy and leveled it,
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's creation of the heavens. The "canopy" or "ceiling" mentioned here is interpreted by scholars as the sky or celestial realm. Allah raised and elevated it, giving it its lofty position, and perfected its creation with precision and balance. This highlights Allah's power, wisdom, and meticulous design in fashioning the universe.
orig: رفع سمكها فسواها

translation: And the night, I have made it for you to rest, and the day, I have made it for you to go forth.
interpretation: Allah is reminding us of His immense favors upon us by making the night a time of rest and tranquility, and the day a time of activity and seeking sustenance. This demonstrates His wisdom, mercy and power over the universe. We should be grateful for these blessings and use our time wisely in obedience to Him.
orig: وأغطش ليلها وأخرج ضحاها

translation: And after that He spread out the earth.
interpretation: This verse suggests that after creating the heavens, Allah spread out the earth and made it suitable for habitation. It implies Allah's power and ability to create the universe and prepare the earth for sustaining life.
orig: والأرض بعد ذلك دحاها

translation: He brought forth from it its water and its pasture
interpretation: This verse refers to Allah's power and ability to bring forth water and vegetation from the earth, providing sustenance and nourishment for all living beings. It highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in creating a balanced ecosystem that supports life.
orig: أخرج منها ماءها ومرعاها

translation: And the mountains, He set them firmly.
interpretation: This verse refers to the stability and firmness of the mountains, which Allah has placed on the earth. The mountains serve as anchors and stabilizers, preventing the earth from shaking excessively. Their presence signifies Allah's wisdom and power in creating a well-balanced and secure environment for all living beings.
orig: والجبال أرساها

translation: A provision for you and your cattle
interpretation: This verse refers to the plants and vegetation that Allah has created as a sustenance and benefit for humans and their livestock. It highlights Allah's mercy and wisdom in providing for the needs of His creation.
orig: متاعا لكم ولأنعامكم

translation: So when the greatest catastrophe comes,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Resurrection or Judgment, which is described as the "greatest catastrophe" or "tremendous event." It signifies the arrival of that momentous occasion when all human beings will be held accountable for their deeds and face the ultimate consequence. The interpretation emphasizes the certainty and gravity of this impending event, urging people to be prepared and mindful of their actions in this world.
orig: فإذا جاءت الطامة الكبرى

translation: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
interpretation: This verse refers to the Day of Judgment when every human being will recall and be held accountable for all their deeds and efforts in the worldly life. It emphasizes the importance of being mindful of one's actions and striving for righteousness, as everything will be remembered and evaluated on that decisive Day.
orig: يوم يتذكر الإنسان ما سعى

translation: And Hell will be brought near on that Day for those who can see.
interpretation: This verse warns of the terrifying reality of Hell on the Day of Judgment. For those who have sight and awareness, Hell will be made manifest and inescapable. It serves as a stark reminder of the consequences of disbelief and disobedience to Allah, emphasizing the importance of faith and righteous conduct in this life to avoid eternal punishment in the Hereafter.
orig: وبرزت الجحيم لمن يرى

translation: As for him who transgressed
interpretation: This verse refers to those who exceeded the limits set by Allah, indulged in sins and disbelief, and rejected the truth. Their transgression and arrogance will lead them to a miserable end in the Hereafter.
orig: فأما من طغى

translation: And he preferred the life of this world
interpretation: This verse refers to those who prioritize the temporary pleasures and material gains of this worldly life over the eternal rewards of the Hereafter. It criticizes the misguided attitude of those who are consumed by worldly desires and neglect their spiritual obligations, valuing the fleeting over the everlasting.
orig: وآثر الحياة الدنيا

translation: So indeed, Hellfire will be the refuge.
interpretation: This verse warns that for those who reject faith and persist in disbelief and evil deeds, Hellfire will be their ultimate abode and permanent dwelling place, where they will suffer a painful punishment as a consequence of their choices and actions in this world.
orig: فإن الجحيم هي المأوى

translation: But as for him who feared the stance of his Lord and restrained the soul from vain desire,
interpretation: This verse refers to those who have a sense of reverence and fear of standing before Allah on the Day of Judgment. They strive to control their base desires and temptations, purifying their souls from vices and sins. It praises those who exercise self-restraint and discipline over their lower selves, prioritizing obedience to Allah over indulging in vain and fleeting pleasures.
orig: وأما من خاف مقام ربه ونهى النفس عن الهوى

translation: So indeed, Paradise is the refuge
interpretation: This verse emphasizes that Paradise is the ultimate and eternal abode for the believers. It is the place of security, peace, and everlasting bliss that Allah has promised to those who have faith and perform righteous deeds. The interpretation highlights the stark contrast between the temporary nature of this worldly life and the eternal reward of Paradise, which should motivate believers to strive for the pleasure of Allah and seek the highest abode in the Hereafter.
orig: فإن الجنة هي المأوى

translation: They ask you about the Hour, when will be its appointed time?
interpretation: This verse refers to the questioning of the disbelievers about the timing of the Day of Resurrection or the Hour. The interpretation is that people will continue to inquire about when the promised Hour will come, but the knowledge of its exact timing is only with Allah. This emphasizes the inevitability of the Hour and the need to be prepared for it at all times, rather than being preoccupied with its timing.
orig: يسألونك عن الساعة أيان مرساها

translation: What are you regarding the reminder?
interpretation: This verse questions the listener's attitude towards the Qur'an, which is referred to as "the reminder." It prompts the listener to reflect on their relationship with the divine message and whether they are truly heeding its guidance and reminders.
orig: فيم أنت من ذكراها

translation: To your Lord is its final return
interpretation: This verse indicates that the ultimate destination and purpose of all things is to return to Allah, the Creator and Sustainer of the universe. It suggests that the journey of life and existence has a final goal, which is to reach Allah and be accountable to Him. The interpretation emphasizes the concept of accountability and the idea that our actions and deeds in this world will be judged and evaluated by Allah on the Day of Judgment.
orig: إلى ربك منتهاها

translation: You are only a warner to whoever fears it.
interpretation: This verse indicates that the role of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) is to warn and convey the message of God to those who have a sense of fear and reverence towards God. His message is meant for those who are receptive and humble before their Creator, not for those who are arrogant or heedless.
orig: إنما أنت منذر من يخشاها

translation: As if, on the Day they see it, they had not remained but an evening or its morning.
interpretation: This verse describes the state of disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection. Despite living a long life in this world, it will seem to them as if they had lived only a short period, "an evening or its morning." This signifies the transient nature of this worldly life compared to the everlasting life of the Hereafter. It also highlights the shock and bewilderment they will experience when facing the reality of the Afterlife.
orig: كأنهم يوم يرونها لم يلبثوا إلا عشية أو ضحاها

translation: He frowned and turned away
interpretation: The verse is referring to the Prophet Muhammad's encounter with a blind man named Ibn Umm Maktum. The Prophet frowned and turned away from him, likely because he was preoccupied with attempting to preach to some influential leaders of Mecca at the time. The verse serves as a gentle rebuke, reminding the Prophet to be patient and treat all people with kindness and respect, regardless of their social status or disability.
orig: عبس وتولى

translation: When the blind man came to him,
interpretation: This verse is referring to an incident where a blind man approached the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) seeking knowledge and guidance.
